Reviews.Title: “Uncomfortable Beds, Noisy”
Reviews.Author: Justin J
Reviews.Content: NYNY used to be a mainstay for us. Things have been steadily going downhill our last few trips and hoping for it to get better was obviously a mistake. First of all. This hotel is EXTREMELY noisy! The clientele is loud, obnoxious, and crass. Afterall they are likely paying $40.00 a night. So while we get a comped suite, our neighbors are the polar opposite. Good luck trying to sleep. Second, the beds are perhaps the worst beds we have ever slept on. One would think their "suites" would be better outfitted. Nope. Oh I almost forgot. The roller-coaster. If hearing screaming every 3 mins from your room until 12am is your forte you will love the NY NY. Lastly the casino is tight, tight, tight. Slots payout nothing. Table limits are high for a hotel that charges $40.00 a night for their rooms. I would have given an extra star for the theme, but sadly they stripped the theme about 2 years ago and replaced it with a club scene. I guess 22 year old college kids spend more than someone who makes 120k a year. Look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “No pool...”
Reviews.Author: kimc1969
Reviews.Content: We booked with NYNY not knowing the pool was torn out. We wanted to go to Vegas for the fun of it but also wanted a day or two of sitting around the pool relaxing. We were told at check in that there was no pool, but to compensate for that they gave us a voucher for 2 free drinks. BUT there was still the 18.00 a day resort fee. Sorry but in my opinion a "resort" means ammenities other than really spotty WiFi...the 18.00 resort fee includes WiFi and their fitness center. We knew about the resort fee going in, but didnt know about the pool renos. They should have waived the fees during this time or offered some sort of other compensation other than "two free drinks". We were advised that we could use the pool at the Excalibur or MGM in place of their pool. Tried the pool at the Excalibur but when we got there, one of their pools was down as well , and they only had their small one up and running and it was packed with kids...no thanks. Did not feel like walking all over the strip to get into a pool to "relax"...just doesnt make sense. Other than that, the room was very clean...perfect location (they put us in a room that was situated so we didnt have any rooms on either side of us). Was worried after reading some of the reviews on here that the room would be old and worn but ours was quite lovely. Its an older hotel so you have to expect some wear and tear. The cleaning staff was awesome. Very friendly and always smiling. And our attendant took great care of us. Restaurants are very expensive but so is most of Vegas. You have to expect that when you go to eat. We did love the feel of this hotel but the pool not being there and the resort fee still being charge in full after this put a bad taste in our mouth about staying there again. We go to Vegas once or twice a year and always try a new hotel, yet still trying to find "our" hotel in the process. If this didnt happen, NYNY could have been "our" hotel but upon leaving this time, we were already discussing where else we were going to stay next time.

Reviews.Title: “Good centrally located hotel”
Reviews.Author: KateinOR
Reviews.Content: We stayed at NY NY as part of a package. It was a good deal and a good landing place for our short vacation in Las Vegas. The room was basic but clean. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “"Over priced room with few amenities"”
Reviews.Author: rndiver1
Reviews.Content: I reserved a Madison Ave. double queen room for 3 nights. It is a very large room, 450sq. ft. The beds were OK, a bit hard for me. The room was very clean but "tired". They need to spend some money updating the rooms, very dark room. We had a view of the rooftop and roller coaster. The roller coaster is loud and runs late at night. No coffee pot, no refrigerator and it is a long walk to get food and drinks. They do provide an iron and ironing board and hair dryer. They also included a $35 food credit with the room. The food and drinks in the hotel are good but pricey. We arrived around 8:30p.m. with no problems at check-in. There is no one to help you with luggage. There is a daily resort fee added to the price. It includes Wi-Fi, however, I could not get good reception in the room, had to go out into the hall. I saw other people having this problem of poor reception.

Reviews.Title: “Good rate for a family room”
Reviews.Author: Peada
Reviews.Content: We got a good rate on a family room which was pretty good for Vegas on a budget. Lots of piaces to eat and drink in the hotel. It took the us nearly 1 one hour our get our bags down from our room with the end result we missed our flight.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed NYNY!”
Reviews.Author: GregHowell
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3-24through 3-28 and overall we liked it. Pricing on the room was fair/moderate. We had a Park Avenue room with a view, looking out towards the Tropicana. I would consider myself frugal; normally would try to find the cheapest option available (without getting a roach motel or something). I spent some extra on NYNY mainly for location and with the deal we got on the in-house Cirque show it was worth it. We knew the location of things on the strip and NYNY offered a great central place to head out from. The free tram was at Monte Carlo just to the north; that tram runs to the center of the strip. Excaliber has the tram that runs to the south. It's Vegas; if you leave your hotel be prepared to walk...a lot (or pay for rides). We enjoyed the atmosphere of the casino and restaurants. People and staff were friendly. Really all we didn't care for was the bathroom as it was a bit small and the tub was really high to step into. We knew about the bathrooms ahead of time based on other reviews. Keep in mind, my wife and I wouldn't much enjoy an upscale resort. Too stuffy IMO; we walked through the Bellagio a lot because of the tram. It was beautiful, it smelled great from the flowers, but I would feel I would need to spend all day there to get my money's worth, lol. Bed was super soft, room was clean, fun view, service at the casino was solid, nothing really to complain about. We went to 6 shows in three days and NYNY gave us a couple hot showers a piece each day and a place to get a quick 4 hours sleep each night without issue As with anything, you will find complainers everywhere. Some people are just that way, and if they encounter something less than what's perfect in their minds, they will let everybody know. We liked it; would stay there again without even thinking twice.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel...decent prices..fantastic beds”
Reviews.Author: ThePriceFamily2010
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights. Not thrilled with late night food options for a 24 hour hotel & casino. Prices on the high side after the taxes & daily resort fee for basically a standard room but hotel is at a good location with easy access to MGM Grand.

Reviews.Title: “Viva Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Metch14
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here in October 2011. We had 7 nites at this hotel and loved it. Our room had a strip view which was lovely to see all the lights of a nite time. Our room was spacious had everything we needed and was cleaned daily. The Hotel staff were always very polite and helpful and the casino and restaurants and cafes were just great. We had a ball and would love to revisit hopefully soon. The only disappointment was the pool, I thought for the size of the Hotel the pool was quite small. We had friends staying at the Excalibur so we went and sat with them at their pool.

Reviews.Title: “Should have stayed at the Luxor for $6 cheaper...”
Reviews.Author: Teenyvikingchild
Reviews.Content: Let's just say that we spent more time at the Luxor than NY NY the whole time we were there. We noticed that New York New York was super smoky right when we walked in. The other casinos seemed much more ventilated. Our first experience at a table at the casino was stupid. The dealer was completely void of personality and actually found the need to complain to us about having to "deal with all sorts of people for minimum wage" and that her "job wasn't worth it". I am one to give people grace and assume maybe they were having a bad day but after just 5 minutes at her table and trying to converse, we had to go. She was just a negative person who hated her life. Sad actually. She literally sent us off to another casino. The room was small but cozy. No mini fridge tho. I had no place to put my Chardonnay. :( It was a decent place to stay if you only want a room...however, we won't be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Casino, but average Hotel room!”
Reviews.Author: rrod2782
Reviews.Content: I visited NY NY on 3/19 til 3/22. -Pulling up to free valet was great. Valet staff was average. Had to ask the agent to help me with the bags, but did it with a smile. -The reason for the average room rating is because of the bathroom. The bathroom did have mold on the ceiling. I failed to realize the mold until my second night, so did not call the front desk because we only had 1 night left and it was right before our show. We did advise our cleaning lady and hope they take care of it. Beds were comfortable and the samsung flat screen was cool. The view of the steal beams from the roller coaster was the worst. -Great location to staying in south Las Vegas. Easy access to other casinos. -Front desk staff are very friendly. -Casino was great. Made up for the room. Drinks were plentiful and so were the slot variety.

Reviews.Title: “Two nights”
Reviews.Author: sixshoots
Reviews.Content: Stayed in NY NY. Lobby, entrance area is fun. Looks like streets of NY. Cobblestones, some cafe/resturants/ice cream shops. Great ride on the rollercoaster. $20 cover for bar with live music. Rooms small and very much in need of updating. Carpeting in hallways of hotel in need of replacement. Horrible pool.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Good Location, & Great Price - You Get What You Pay For.”
Reviews.Author: afrikanmama
Reviews.Content: I read a fair number of reviews on hotels in Vegas before I decided to book the New York, New York Hotel. I finally decided on NY NY because of the deal we were getting, and the free show tickets. It was well worth it for us in the end. You get what you pay for, especially for a 3 star (sometimes it showed 4 stars depending on what site I looked at) hotel. It was clean, the casino was expansive, and there were a fair number of restaurants and attractions inside the hotel. We stayed pretty far from an elevator, and our room smelled a little bit like sewer after the second day - but Im not sure why or if that was a normal thing. Considering our room was under 300 for 3 nights in an upgraded suite I wasnt complaining. In the end, you get what you pay for I think. So, it's a decent hotel for sleeping and playing in Vegas :)

Reviews.Title: “If you get a good price.....”
Reviews.Author: mgkendra
Reviews.Content: *Mid-level hotel on the Vegas strip with nice, clean room *Room met my needs, but nothing really fancy. *Room size is small, but okay for 2 people. *Bathroom also is small with tub/shower combo. *Many food options in the Central Park theme area. *I enjoy the casino, good vibe and energy; dealers have personality *My most dislike is the fitness center. Has 10 cardio machines and some weight machines. But small room. But should have expected for a mid-level casino/hotel. *This fitness center is better than Mirage hotel/casino but not even close to Aria's fitness center. *If buffet is a must, no buffet at this property.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: DiveDivaDJ
Reviews.Content: I'm so glad we found this place. The ladies working here are so nice. What was included aromatherapy moisturized oxygen (AMAZING), a kava drink shot for relaxation, a whif of eucalyptus not the stinky kind, a head massage, a neck massage and then they put on a messager ( TENS ) LOVE IT!!! I was so excited that they sold these, I use mine all the time for my chronic neck pain. I also picked up an aromatherapy sleep inhaler and it works like a charm to help me go to sleep. I was impressed, I've been to a few oxygen bars before, the service was great. And we felt like new women afterwards, amped and ready to go. I would highly recommend going here if you have sinus problems from the smoke & dry air. I ALWAYS get bloody noses when I go to Vegas along with head aches, the oxygen bar helped me so much!!! This will be one of my first stops on my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Still a favorite!”
Reviews.Author: 4q2
Reviews.Content: I have been a "regular" visitor since this property was new. It remains one of my favorites nationally and particularly in Las Vegas. The location is convenient to other attractions and hotels and there is really no need to leave the hotel at all. The food is outstanding, the rooms are nice and roomy, the casino is fun, the shows and other entertainment are great, and the people act like they are glad to have you as guests.

Reviews.Title: “Hoped it would be good and it was!!”
Reviews.Author: Loobie06
Reviews.Content: Check-in was a breeze, we arrived at 4pm on a thursday and walked straight to the desk, plenty of staff on and very helpful. They weren't too pushy trying to sell upgrades as we had booked just a basic Park Avenue Deluxe, i asked if they had a quietish room (light sleeper!) and she gave us a lovely room in the Empire tower on the 36th floor. I didn't hear a soul the whole 7 nights! The room was plenty big enough with a King bed and lovely clean bathroom. Plenty of happy hours in NY NY Times Square 4-8pm Nine Fine Irishmen 2-5pm Coyote Ugly 6-9pm. We had breakfast in America the first morning and the eggs benedict was delicious, well priced for the amount you got. As we don't normally have a large breakfast everyday the rest of the holiday we had breakfast in the small Italian cafe where the pastries (cinnamon twist!!) were to die for, and again very well priced. All the staff we encountered were very polite and informative. We do not gamble other than the slot machines, and our time on them was not the best this year, but they weren't as tight as some of the others on the strip!! NY NY is well located for the Deuce bus or the free monorail Excaliber-Mandalay Bay or Monte Carlo- Belagio if you want to save your pennies and the crowded buses!! All in all a fab stay, I love Las Vegas!!

Reviews.Title: “Vegas”
Reviews.Author: dallasgirl1512
Reviews.Content: IT was a very good experience. Staff is great, rooms are clean.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms, nice casino.”
Reviews.Author: Wildkat520
Reviews.Content: Had the pleasure of staying at the NYNY for 2 (free) nights. Thank you MLife Players Club! The rooms were on the small end. Not much walk space with 2 queen beds. The rooms were clean and no complaints otherwise. The casino is good size and lots of eating places within. Good vibes at night with music playing throughout. MGM, Monte Carlo, Excalibur, Luxor and Tropicana are all nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Great atmosphere!”
Reviews.Author: wolfie23
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights at New York New York - check in for 12 people was admittedly very painful, but it would have been similar anywhere else I'm sure. The staff maintained a patient and pleasant manner throughout, which is to their credit! Room was clean and spacious, as was the bathroom. Bed were quite soft though, which didn't provide the best night's sleep, but this is Vegas! Sleep is overrated! One major downside was that the pool was shut, so we had to use the one at the MGM Grand, which was a bit of a walk. Restaurants were good - try Gallaghers for an incredible steak. Service is excellent and fully recommend. All in all, great location (nice and central ish), great atmosphere and an eye catching building on the strip. Go there and have lots of fun! We did! Oh and bet on number 23 on the roulette table - it worked well for me!

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced, old, and rude”
Reviews.Author: Bcity
Reviews.Content: Not happy with our stay here. The pool is bland with no cover feels like you're sitting in a carpark. The bar guy was rude. I was getting money out for a drink asking how much and he said 'if you have to ask you can't afford it'. Dude, you're working at new York new York! It isn't fancy. Go somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great Holiday”
Reviews.Author: Amber1998
Reviews.Content: Having read a lot of bad reviews of this hotel before we left home we were not sure if we had chosen the right place for our holiday. We were pleasantly surprised to find that most of them were not true. We stayed in a Spa suite, it was very clean and comfortable and very spacious. We found the staff to be pleasant and helpful. People say that the casino area is very dated but that is the Las Vegas style, all the casinos look the same, even the one in the Aria which is a brand new hotel. This hotel is in a good location for getting to other areas of the strip and Fremont street as there are bus stops close by. Most of the big hotels are walking distance anyway. We could not fault this hotel at all. People said that the roller coaster was noisy but we didn't find it a problem at all. Lots of places to eat, whether you want a big meal or just a snack. At the back of the casino there are lots of little restaurants or takeaways which is set out to look like New York streets, this looks really nice. There is a really nice fish and chip shop there which is actually cheaper than UK chip shop prices. The only down side that I can think of is that there are no coffee making facilities in the rooms but there are plenty places to buy coffee on site. Checking in and out was very quick and easy to do. We would definately stay at this hotel again if we go back to Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “A Terrorist-Inspired Cocktail Menu, How Very Modern...”
Reviews.Author: hypercritical
Reviews.Content: I was in Las Vegas last week for a fabulous stag weekend and we stayed at the Bellagio, which is a very good hotel. On Monday morning our group decided to go to New York, New York to ride the roller coaster, and then have brunch. And so we did. This is the first time I have reviewed a roller coaster, and I would give it 6.5 out of 10. Pretty good, though we felt there needed to be another swoop or bump towards the end. Then we decided to look for some brunch. We wandered around the fake streets of Manhattan under a painted sky looking for some breakfast. We passed Starbucks, a Tex Mex restaurant and a burger grill. We stopped and asked the receptionist at the Tex Mex diner if they had a buffet breakfast anywhere - after all Vegas is famous for its buffets - and she looked me dead in the eye and said, 'We have 17 restaurants here, we don't need a buffet.' Oh dear, I thought, well where can we get a traditional breakfast? Cafe of the Americas was the answer and so we went past the deli, the pub, and the Italian restaurant until we found the Americas. We queued briefly and then went inside and were seated under a magnificent model map of the USA. Then a charming hostess got me a spicy Bloody Mary, and coffees and Mimosas for the others. She was very polite and amusing and that was the only good experience. The food was below average, tasteless and served as though it was coming out of a military canteen. I had corned beef hash, one of my favourite brunch dishes, and it came alongside an identicallly-sized slab of hash brown. No garnish, no attempt at presentation, just two fat slabs of food dumped on the plate. Two of my friends ordered a 'Bagel Mania'. Dear God in Heaven, they couldn't even get the various bits of sausage and egg and bagel to stay together, the 'manias' had collapsed and looked dreadful and greasy. So, as I was finding the food so unpleasant to look at, my eyes started to wander and fell upon the cocktail specials menu left over from St Patrick's Day. I am scanning and attaching it to this review as I doubt many readers will believe what I am about to write. The special cocktails were, an Irish Mojito, and Irish Spring and... are you ready for this? An I.R.A. Yep, that's right, the special cocktail in the New York New York hotel for this year's St Patrick's Day is named after the organisation that murdered men women and children in the UK and Europe and played on the fringes of conflicts in Croatia and Colombia. How divine, how charming, I hear you say, now what was the recipe? Well should you wish to enjoy a terrorist-inspired cocktail it is made with, 'a chilled shot of Jameson Irish Whiskey, Apple Pucker, and a wee bit o'cranberry'. Maybe the cranberry is there to represent the blood spilled when the IRA bombed the Remembrance Day Parade at Enniskillen killing thirteen people and injuring 63? We had a discussion afterwards about it, and I also asked online what other cocktails this sick mixologist might like to add to the menu. A Flaming Osama was a popular choice, or maybe Laden Litchi Martini? I can assume a level of ignorance and stupidity led to this, and that it was a mistake, but just think of the outrage you'd get from an American tourist if a British hotel was selling Al Qaeda cocktails. It's not acceptable and demands a very public apology. I won't be going back. Oh, and one final note: the receptionist was wrong. They do need a buffet.

Reviews.Title: “New York, New York”
Reviews.Author: deejayjohnston
Reviews.Content: Our recent trip to Vegas included staying at New York New York. The room was great and the staff were all friendly. Our check in was the only bad spot in our trip. There was not enough staff on and it took over an hour. Even with everyone lined up to register they did not get more staff until 45 minutes after we first got there. The restaurants are very good and quite reasonably priced. The pools are all being torn out. This should have been advertized and we were never informed about the pools. We found out when we heard the jack hammers outside our window the first morning we were there. If the weather would have been nicer we would have been very disappointed. Overall, we would likely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Solid quality and value (even with the add-ons)”
Reviews.Author: grumpyoldulsterman
Reviews.Content: We got the cheapest room and it was still a good size and quality. Not luxury but a good 3 star and at $60 advertised price good value. Have to say the $18 they add on is naughty as it is not shown iin the advertised prices. However even at nearer $90 it is still value although coffee making facilities would be nice. However the general Vegas ethic seems to be to squeeze extra money from the punters at every opportunity, one wonders if in the long term this may backfire or indeed is already backfiring. Agree with earlier reviewer that feel of the public part of hotel is grungy rather than luxury and this may not be everybody's cup of tea. However the facades greatly add to the visual spectacle of Vegas. Finally I feel that the location is in the better end of The Strip.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: CanadianMystique
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at NYNY for 4 nights over February spring break. Check in was relatively quick, although we were disappointed that we had to choose from either a smoking room with a king bed or 2 queens for non smoking. When we booked on Vegas.com we had selected king bed, non smoking. The front desk agent advised us that is based on availability. I'll be sticking with Expedia for booking from now on, have never had any troubles with them. The rooms are okay, a little on the dated side and not as clean as I would have liked. I have to say out of the other hotels I've stayed at in Vegas the rooms were my least favorite (when comparing to Mandalay Bay, TI, PH Towers, Plant Hollywood and MGM Grand). That being said, I will say that the location is great and there is lots of variety for entertainment and dining in this hotel. We have some good meals and some good times at Il Fornaio, Coyote Ugly, America etc. Coyote Ugly is pretty entertaining- we got there during happy hour when drinks were cheap and ended up staying most of the evening. Even though my husband isn't really a big bar person and we didn't know anyone else there we had a great night! One bonus is that the Wi-Fi was included in the resort fee. If I recall correctly almost all of the other hotels we stayed at had the $14-15 resort fee PLUS charged anywhere from $10-$16 a day for internet. Overall we had a good stay here. I would recommend it based on the fact that the location is great and there is decent variety of things to do here. Our favorite spot on the strip is always going to be PH and PH Towers though!

Reviews.Title: “Nice atmosphere, great new York feel.”
Reviews.Author: elmoaf
Reviews.Content: This was a nice hotel, we ate hitdogs in the downtown are they were great. The bars where nice. The roller coaster was just a roller coaster. I read an earlier review about a food cart being in the hallway. I had the same thin we saw on for two days. But our too. Was clean the people where nice, but they had a wierd money thing that they tried to sell as a deal when all it was is debit.?? I might go back but maybe not to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: oggo o
Reviews.Content: I spent a few nights into New York New York and it was a pleasure. We almost won a lot :-) ... beautiful hotel, nice game hall, great variety of programs on site. I can only recommend the city and of course the hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!!”
Reviews.Author: Alison B
Reviews.Content: Check in was easy. Check out was easy. The room was clean!!! A smoking room and there was no smell. The safe worked great. The maids were in and out, perfectly picked up. The hotel staff was super, super, super friendly. The bell hops and maids all said hello in the hallways. The entertainment was amazing. Zumanity is well worth the price!!! The sushi was amazing. The pizza was great! The valet was quick for drop off and pick up. Overall, our stay was amazing. The gambling was great. Packed casino but always easy to get to a table. The waitresses were friendly and efficient. The pit bosses all responded quickly. The only problem we had was our bathroom had a slow drain in the shower and in the sink. Everything else about our stay was perfect. I will return. I've stayed at several other Vegas hotels. New York New York will have my business from now on.

Reviews.Title: “Not So Good...”
Reviews.Author: TampaLeon
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews on here I thought I would give this hotel a shot. We were able to find a deal that packaged the Zumanity Cirque Du Soleil show and a room here. Overall this hotel/casino could use a refreshing. I do not consider myself overly picky, but there definitely seemed to be a stale and grungy feeling to this hotel overall. The room was not much to speak of. It definitely did not give me that wow factor that made me feel as if I was in Vegas. Yes I know that it is Las Vegas, and you are supposed to be out and about. But you still like to come back to a room that adds to that experience(no matter how little you may be in there). My room's claim to fame was being in front of the roller coaster. I could have done without that. The food cart in the hallway and small section of the wallpaper falling down did not help either. If it was not for the show/hotel package, I would not have thought I got a decent value. The things that knocked down a star from what would have been an "average" rating is the service. This ranged from conflicting information from the front desk and the box office on how I was being billed, to just overall slow service(food, front desk, etc...). Unless I got a heck of a deal, I would probably not stay here again considering the many other choices in the area. I understand that this establishment has been around for a while and may not be as glamourous as some of the other newer properties in Vegas. However, there is no reason that you can't have outstanding customer service to balance that out(if not exceed it). I went in with an open mind, and wanted to like this hotel and utilize it for future trips to Vegas. Too bad the hotel did not hold up it's end of the bargain.

Reviews.Title: “Just ok - was expecting much more”
Reviews.Author: ElectricGal
Reviews.Content: Just got back from staying at the NYNY for Nascar races - we stayed in the "upgraded" Madison Room. The room was ok, clean....we had a corner room on the 43 floor, Empire Building. Room was spacious, bathroom was huge, but it was just ok, very expensive for just ok. Overall alright experience, but just another hotel room, didn't make me say wow, so we won't stay again. Nice beds (clean), comfy, lots of pillows Tips for people wanting to stay there, make sure you ask to be WAY above the roller coaster or on a side without the coaster, as it can be loud. We were ok on 43 floor, but friends of ours were closer and asked to be moved - don't forget the coaster runs all hours of the night. We ate at America inside the NYNY, the food was good....but the fun is always at the Irish pub. The dualing piano's and the atmosphere there is awesome!

Reviews.Title: “Worst room I have ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: Foodlover9
Reviews.Content: I have nothing good to say about this hotel with the exception that the beds were comfortable. We stayed here for a convention and we had our room and flight expensed. This was not our choice but I was still looking forward to it as I have never stayed at the NYNY. Check in was extremely frustrating. We were given 4 different sets of directions by 4 different workers to our elevators. The elevators are not clearly marked or distinguished from the other towers (there are several sets of elevators). Seriously awful planning on the hotels part. I think it took us 1/2 an hour to find the right set of elevators. The room was on the 33rd floor and when we arrived I noticed that there is a pink film on the window. It gives a weird red hue during the daytime and makes the room look even smaller and darker than it is at night. There is no source of natural lighting in the room what so ever. It's like a tiny batcave. For a woman, it is the most poorly lit room I have ever stayed in. I would actually have to get ready and then go downstairs to the casino bathrooms to check my makeup because I literally never knew what I actually looked like when I left my room. I was ready to leave the hotel by the first night but didn't want to insult the company I was travelling with. Let me also say, that ALL 3 MORNINGS of my stay, prior to 9am housekeeping would just walk right into our room totally unannouced. Of all of the hotels and times I have been to Vegas a maid has never even knocked at our door prior to 10am or just walked right in. Totally unacceptable! Stay anywhere but here.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant enough stay - until we found a "no-no"!”
Reviews.Author: VegasSusie
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in this hotel several times and everything was nice as usual until the 2nd day of this stay. In the morning, my husband happened to move the pillow on his side to find the sheet underneath that area had a used serviette and stains on the sheet - yuk! He phoned housekeeping and talked with "Monica", who apologized profusely and promised to fix the problem immediately. I mean, the bed was made up when we got there the day before, so it's not as if the maid "forgot" to change the sheets! When we got back to the room later, the bed was made up properly and the rest of the room was clean. We didn't leave a tip (gee, ya think?) We usually leave money for the maid every day. She had also not left us more toiletry items or small towels, so I had to go and find her and ask for them. Needless to say, she was not very friendly. I suspect she had gotten called on the carpet for not changing the bedsheets. Too bad for her. If I was the Housekeeping manager, she would have been fired on the spot. It spoiled an otherwise nice 2 days at NYNY. We tried Gonzales Y Gonzales, and found it very good and the service friendly and fast. On checkout, my spouse mentioned to the desk clerk about the soiled bedsheet and how disgusted we were, and she waived the "resort fee" for the stay. I should think so, considering said fee is a joke, anyway.

Reviews.Title: “nice place, good service”
Reviews.Author: ruthiecat
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were in Vegas for the rock and roll marathon in December. We chose this hotel because it was close to the race. The hotel was nice and clean, service was good in the resturant, and the casino was lively and clean. Loved the decor and the "street" look the hotel had. Had a good DJ a couple of nights which was fun. Not a big Vegas fan, but if I were to return, this hotel was good value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Great help from Security”
Reviews.Author: Curtis K
Reviews.Content: I loved the layout, found the rooms comfortable and found the food in the various in-house establishments great. It was a good place to take my 3-yr old. But most impressive was the good care I got from security after checking out and realizing I had lost my passport. Krystal Martin and Tom Miller went well out of their way to track it down and get it to me, so different from the customer care I have encountered in other casinos. I was so grateful.

Reviews.Title: “Great bed”
Reviews.Author: Diskid123
Reviews.Content: The only good thing I can say is the bed in the penthouse was great - one of the most comfortable hotel beds I have ever slept in! View was nice but not spectacular. Valet was the most pleaseant staff. Front desk clerk had to ask "manager" everything we asked questions about. Traveling for my birthday which was noted on reservation, didn't cost anyone to say happy birthday - yet no one did. Disappointed - stay elsewhere - like I said - nice bed, but who needs sleep on vacation

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, but not quite our style”
Reviews.Author: unalaska2
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here during our 3 day visit to Las Vegas. We found the hotel to be clean and comfortable. We stayed on the 29th floor and were pleased that it was nice and quiet up there, no matter the time of day or night. While we found the atmosphere on the casino level to be energetic and vibrant, it seemed like it had more of a "frat party" atmosphere than we were looking for. It was also difficult to get into the two main bars in the hotel, which meant we looked elsewhere for our evening entertainment. We made the reservations knowing we would be on one end of the strip, but after finding it hard to be entertained in the hotel, we were a bit disappointed at the amount of walking we had to do to get to restaurants and entertainment. This would be a good hotel for those looking for a party atmosphere who are willing to wait their turn to get into a bar.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced But Decent Stay”
Reviews.Author: WickedWahine
Reviews.Content: We stayed at NYNY for five nights from 3/07 - 3/12. The line to check-in was ridiculously long - it took us approximately 20 minutes of standing in line to get to a clerk. After spending several hours on a plane, it's very frustrating to wait so long in a line with so few clerks working. There's just no excuse for this! We were given a wonderful room on the 34th floor of the Chrysler Building which was a completely different experience than what my siblings encountered in the Century Building, where guests were making a ruckus at 4:00 AM and Security had to be called. Our room was very nice and the bed very comfortable, although there was a light out in the bathroom and the TV remote needed new batteries. The bathroom toiletries were of lower quality than one would expect given the hotel's overall rating and the shower pressure just awful - which in NYNY's defense is common in many hotels in Las Vegas and can't really be held against NYNY. Food and drink prices throughout the resort are extremely pricey, although the food quality was very good. Even with a "Buy One Get One 50% Off" coupon, 2 hot dogs, drinks, and french fries were over $16.00 at Nathans. We ate at America twice and although the prices were steep there as well, the food quality was really excellent - likewise with Il Fornaio, although my father ordered a martini at Il Fornaio and was handed a highball glass full of vodka and ice - what the heck? It took ten minutes for them to bring him what he ordered after the mistake was pointed out. Minor, but at those prices, excellent service is a MUST. All our meals at NYNY were delicious. We were not allowed to charge room service meals to our room however. Good thing we had cash on us that first morning when they arrived! We asked why, but the room service server was not able to explain, as her English was quite limited. She simply shrugged and gave us a receipt that she had written "Cash Only" on. We ended up paying cash for the three days that we ordered room service for breakfast. My sister however was allowed to charge her meals - an odd inconsistency that we found a little annoying. We tried to swing by the front desk to ask about this, but never saw any fewer than 5 or 6 people in line, and did not feel it was important enough to wait in line to determine why. The casino is quite nice, although a bit dark and the ventilation rather poor. We visited many casinos over the course of our visit and several members of our party agreed that NYNY was a lot more smoky than other casinos. The servers there were all very friendly and talkative. One of the video poker machines died while I was using it and the attendants were very quick to repair it. The main reason we would not return is in part due to the fact that the pool was closed for a remodel and we were not informed of this either when making our reservation or when we checked in. When we looked out the window and saw a land mover where the pool was, our hearts sank. We were told we could use the pool over at MGM Grand. For us, this was not a adequate substitute for an important amenity that we were not told beforehand would be unavailable during our stay. It would take 20 minutes of walking with our swim gear to reach their pool, and quick trips back to the room not possible. Had we known this, we would have made a reservation elsewhere, as a resort's pool is one of the main draws for us while vacationing. Additionally, the wifi was extremely poor, and did not work much of the time we were guests. To be charged $18.00 a day for poor quality wifi, a newspaper we had to go out of our way to locate, and a gym that we could not use due to a disability was extremely frustrating. People should be allowed to decide whether or not an amenity is worth paying extra for, and people with disabilities should not be forced to pay for amenities they can't even use. The entire "mandatory resort fee" issue is price gouging, plain and simple ... we will definitely vote with our dollars and choose a resort-fee-free facility the next time we travel to Las Vegas. NYNY is a really nice, big, full-feature resort. The rooms are comfortable, the food good, and the casino fun. But it is overpriced for the value you receive, the amenities provided are not worth the additional fee charged, and overall we just did not feel the love at this hotel. Next time - somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel when with Kids”
Reviews.Author: Holidayairlineman
Reviews.Content: I am responsible for conducting hotel inspections for airlines, hence, feel I will provide Trip Advisor readers with an unbiased feedback. I have returned from a family vacation in New York New York in December 11, just before Christmas for a week. I think 4 days is more than enough in Vegas. The previous reviews provide decent feedback of the hotel. It does cater for children more than some of the larger hotels, it has several fast food places within, including a fish and chip, Pizza (delicious) and Pasta restaurants, which was convenient, especially for children aged between 5 and 9 including a Ben and Jerry’s which we frequented often. I was at the Starbucks for my daily coffee. The Rok nightclub at the hotel looked good but with the kids, I was out like a light by 11 PM. The location is good at the top of the strip, close to MGM and Luxor. To get to the main part of the strip it is a good 10/15 minute walk, with a pharmacy and Walmart type shop, where we got most of our general food. There is a food court with all the fast food type restaurants approx. 5 to 7 minute walk over the bridge past MGM. The better, newer food court, at the other end of the strip, was opposite The Venetian on the top floor above the shopping mall. The main Walmarts are several miles off the main strip. We travelled most places by Taxi, averaging $15 to $20 per one way trip. We went to the Town Centre, a typical “American town” which was quite quaint with boutiques and an up market grocery store (quite expensive), We went to see Tin Tin (3D) movie at the cinema there, with great Cinema food available. I must admit, I am a fussy customer and would say the hotel is an upper 3 star hotel, possibly 4, which is reflected in the lower price in comparison to the Aria and Bellagio types of hotels of the world. After a long flight from London, you don’t need a long queue, but on Friday night there is a long wait when checking in and there are no free upgrades, eventhough the hotel were advised it was our wedding anniversary, having said that the rooms were ok, spacious, recently renovated, 2 comfortable queen sized beds with a large flat screen TV, but still a little worn in places, in need of extra lighting and dated. No coffee/tea making facilities, no fridge or bar in the room. We had adjoining rooms, so with the 5 of us, the 2 bathrooms came in useful. The bathrooms are dated too, in need of modernisation but the shower pressure was fine. Maid service was good but general service was mediocre. The wifi was intermittent but free. There is a charge to use the roller coaster at $18 per person (a bit expensive for one ride). The hotel has an Arcade on the first floor, with fun fair type games and activities. Children are not allowed to stand in the Casino area at any of the hotels, when they tried, as the adults played the slot machines, security were onto us in 2 minutes, asking for us to take the children off the casino area, apparently, if authorities see children in the casino area, the hotel could get fined $250K. Vegas itself, is becoming less kid friendly, but if you have them, it’s worth going to Circus Circus (great roller coasters at the adventure drome), Bellagio Fountain show, Mirage for the Dolphin show, the Shark reef at Mandalay Bay. The Hilton off the main strip does not have the Star Trek ride (which I went to in the late 90’s, that was brill). If I went back to Vegas, I may stay at New York New York again but might upgrade to Bellagio, Aria, Wynn or Planet Hollywood depending on the company.

Reviews.Title: “I like this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Olivia S
Reviews.Content: It officially took 5mins to get from the lift to my room but I'll over look that detail coz I really like this hotel. Not the best selection of bars and restaurants, it's mainly fast food stands but again I can over look that. Love the exterior, love the interior and the rooms are big and comfy. Best thing about this hotel, Bar at Times Square, SO much fun and those piano guys are AMAZING! Worst thing about this hotel, Coyote Ugly, full of dirty old men. I like Ny Ny, end of.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time On Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Linda B
Reviews.Content: My husband stayed at New york New York March 7-11, 2012. This is the 2nd time in 6 months we stayed there and will probably continue to stay here on our trips to Las Vegas. The rooms arre really nice. Beds are really comfy. Great pillows. Even though check in lines can be long they get you checked in quickly. We have stayed at other hotels where you get lost everytme you leave your room but do not have this problem at New York New York Teh piano bar in the food court is great entertainment. Starts at 3:00pm and goes on for hours. There are cafe tables just outside the bar so you can sit and realx and enjoy the music. Very easy getting on and off the strip if you rent a car because it is located on a corner. Really enjoy staying at New York New York,. Fun to watch the crazy people that go on the rollercoaster. Nice to have Starbucks so easy to find. Highly recommend the hotel. Bathrooms are nice but you have to be careful getting in and out because of the old style shower doors attached to top of the tub.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value and a Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Jo C
Reviews.Content: We stayed (group of 8 people) for 6 nights in February 2012 on holiday - first time to Vegas. Since we are from Australia, we did not understand the resort fees or taxes - however the price was still reasonable for the room and facilities (just ask at reception for the total charge for you understand the total at the end of your stay). Lovely room with twin queen beds. Bathroom was small, but clean. My only disappointment was the shower which had no water pressure and hard to get in and out over the bath. A little surpised at the cover charges for a couple of the bars for hotel guests. Hotel staff were friendly and helpful - well done. Food options are ok, nothing really outstanding - again a case of getting what you pay for. The Zumanity show was great and highly recommended. The smoke in the casino was not good for me as a non-smoker (but it's a casino!), overall we had a great time and would stay here again! My last comment is a general observation about the USA - very welcoming, friendly and polite - not a bad experience with even one person - thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Gamble paid off - nice stay!”
Reviews.Author: L0vinFlorida
Reviews.Content: Truly from check-in and throughout my stay the staff was friendly, helpful and very focused on ensuring my visit was a great experience. Park avenue room with 2 queen beds was quite spacious. Room was clean, mattress was comfortable, pillows were awesome (unsure what others disliked). Was not bothered by roller coaster noise, room 3219 was quiet and very comfortable. Business center made airline checkin and printing boarding passes a breeze. Essentials gift store had all sundry items. Did not miss coffee machine...Starbucks around every corner. Two drawbacks, both fairly minor for me, 1) wireless access was at times challenging to get connected, but I found by waiting 20 mins and retrying I was able to login easily and 2) would have appreciated the availability of water in the vending machine as it was always empty-not a huge deal...but it is dry in Vegas and you need to stay hydrated.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and the Kids LOVED it!”
Reviews.Author: Frances D
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here with our 3 kids (7, 5, and 4). We celebrated our oldest's birthday; they chose, not us. The hotel was actually the perfect place for the kids. It was still quite cold in Vegas and all the pools were understandably cold. In the summer I am sure Mandalay Bay would be the better choice because of its amazing pool but we were very happy with New York-New York. It is not centrally located on The Strip but it is close to many kids attractions, including The Rainforest Cafe, The Tournament of Kings, the aquarium at Mandalay Bay, and, of course, the roller coaster at New York-New York. The kids absolutely LOVED knowing that the roller coaster was located in their hotel. We did not make it to the arcade but we did eat at the America Cafe downstairs and it was a good place for the kids to eat at. The room itself was average but we fit very comfortably. Plus, there is a wonderful snack place downstairs with amazing strawberry cheese cake and other desserts. We stopped there more than once for their delicious snacks. Overall, we all had a blast here.

Reviews.Title: “Good services and location, rooms in need for update”
Reviews.Author: Jarimalla
Reviews.Content: As one of the most memorable hotels judged from the outside even by Las Vegas standards, the rooms are amazingly basic and old fashioned by room standards of this millennium. You'll miss some basic amenities, like coffee maker! The resort fee of $18 is collected as mandatory, so count that in when making comparisons between hotel room rates. Wifi worked fine. There are plenty of restaurants and bars to choose from right on the premises and a plethora of services within a walking distance. Access to the free guest parking is effortless and smooth. Make sure to get a view to the Strip, there's really not that much to see in any other direction.

Reviews.Title: “First time stay, and will return!!!”
Reviews.Author: christinelizabeth
Reviews.Content: Check - in was quick, under 15 minutes and we were 20th in line. Room was just fine. Yes there was no closet area like others mentioned, but there was an armoire for you to hang clothes, and there was an iron and ironing board, and a safe in there too. Loved the extra pillows that were stored in the drawers. We had the basic room. The view wasn't great (rooftop, and rollercoaster, which you couldn't hear.) But I am there to see the sights, shows, gamble, etc. Not sit in room and look out the window. The room was of decent size, 2 full beds, a desk, two chairs for lounging, armoire, and dresser, with a large tv, which had plenty of channels to choose from. There was no coffee maker in the room, but what I have been told, you won't find them in any rooms in Vegas, but there is a Starbucks on site. Our only complaint about the room was the water pressure in the shower was very weak. Also had to ask for another bath towel, as only 3 in the room, and we each use 2(hair&body), towel was delivered within 10 min, and never had to ask for another, as 4 were left on each remaining day. We stayed in the New Yorker Towers. Floor 11. Non smoking room which was an actual non smoking room. Beds were super comfy, with also a comfy padded headboard which made it nice to sit up and watch TV. Vending machines on floors run $2.00 for drinks(pepsi products), and $1-$2 for snacks (chips, candy bars, snack cakes, candy, etc.) 2 Ice machine/Vending locations on each floor. The vending machines are cheaper than buying sodas in the shops($3). Every restaurant we visited had great food, was not disappointed. We ate at The burger place, America's, Scirros(Pizza), the fish & chips place, Nathan's hot dogs, and chin chins. Note: we are huge Coca Cola fans, and it was inpossible to find Coca Cola anywhere, and were told you can not find coca-cola at any of the casinos right by NYNY. When you eat at any of the Fast Food Type places in NYNY, note they only have one size softdrinks which is equal to a McDonald's size medium for $2.95. It is the same everywhere. There is no Buffett, but if you are looking for something quick and close, the Excalibur had one that was quite good, great variety, and yummy deserts if you can get past the very outdated decor, which makes it seem dirty, but upon a second look, is quite clean. We went for lunch($16), but they offer an all day pass, which we didn't take, but thought was a great idea if you were going to stay there the whole day, you could come and go as you wish. There is a little shopping place next to MGM(which is across the street from NYNY). It is a convenient store with a Subway inside which had great Coca Cola fountain sodas. The store had 4/$4 sodas(20oz), Beers, and waters, and cheaper snacks. If you are driving in, do what I saw alot of people do, bring 12 packs of soda, and cases of water, and a cooler for ice. Will save you tons. The casino floor was very neat and clean, and the smoke wasn't bad at all. But The Casino was much to be desired!!! Very bad payouts, and alot of the Slot mchines were old, very few progressive games. The one table game we liked was open the first day we arrived and then never again, and we stayed 5 days. We gambled at a variety of places, and found the Excalibur to have the best payouts on slots. Ended up playing there strictly on the last 3 days. Did not frequent any of the nightclubs at NYNY, as that is not or thing, but loved the outdoor seating throughout the casino by all the restaurants. You could sit and people watch, or sit and listen to the entertainment from inside the sports bar. ( They have a singer/saxman at happyhour who is quite entertaining, and dueling pianos in the evening, which is so fun!!! All the staff was very friendly throughout NYNY. No complaints there, they also recommend using the business center(free and open 24 hours) to check in your flight and print your boarding pass, as we did and when we arrived at the airport, the line to check in with United(6am flight) was over 100 people deep, saw several people miss other flights due to lines. Saw Cirque du Soleil Love, and Elvis. Love was amazing, very entertaining, and if you are a Beatles fan you will Love it even more. Viva Elvis was good, the acrobats and stunts they did were great, but their basic dancing needed improvement. The NYNY is a quick walk to alot of things, makes it a great location!!! Make sure you realize if it is a windy day, you may not be able to do things like the Stratosphere, and The Eiffel Tower ( Note: Paris had an amazing french pastry shop which was to die for, a must do!!! Highly recommend the Napolean, and the Pistachio Mousse with Strawberries!!!) Loved just checking out all the different hotels, and their themes. But all in all loved the vibe at our hotel, which I would say is 60 and under, lotta younger people, and families(they also have a fun and big arcade on the 2nd floor which is great for the kids( you win tickets to redeem for prizes). They also have an old school diner up there whch was good, along with the rollercoaster entrance. Make sure you check weather daily(channel 6) as one day it said 78 sunny before bed, and ended up being 58 partly cloudy with 60 MPH winds by morning. Definetly stay here next time!!! BTW- we are a 40f & 39M.

Reviews.Title: “Over Priced”
Reviews.Author: Trash H
Reviews.Content: Our room (Rm 1446) had a sewer smell at the entrance and exposed wires in the desk outlet. The rooms were expensive for average value so I will probably never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Filthy room on arrival but outside the room nice”
Reviews.Author: monkeybradders
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Nyny last week and whilst the casino floor, bars and restaurants are good we would not stay here again. We had a standard room in the century tower when we opened the door all looked fine, or at least it seemed that way. I noticed the room was very dusty, I can live with this. However I went to the bathroom and noticed that someones (maybe the previous occupants) business hadn't been flushed away and, in general, the bathroom was unclean. We called reception who seemed totally unshocked by this and were unable to tell me when someone would come and clean it (immediately is surely the only answer?) Bear in mind we had just arrived from the UK and had hoped to be able to relax after nearly 24 hours travelling. However, we had to go down to the public bathrooms in the casino just to freshen up! As they say, first impressions count. We wont be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced at ~$350 a night”
Reviews.Author: BusinessTraveler90
Reviews.Content: We got the cheapest room at around $330 a night. We were charged an additional mandatory resort fee of 18 dollars. Pros - Most of the staff is really great - Rooms were very clean - ChinChin restaurant is pretty good. I had "max's noodles" and they were good. Cons - Check in was very slow. It took us 15-20 minutes and we were at the front of the line. - $18 mandatory resort fee gives you the internet, gym, and pool. The pool is a pile of rubble right now. I think it's a ripoff to have to pay the resort fee. There is no place to sit outside and still be on the property. - Basic room doesn't have a closet. No, really. No closet. So your luggage is going to have to be out in the room. - Basic room doesn't have a fridge nor does it have a coffee maker - TV channel selection is bad. On demand movies are $13. - Spa prices are pretty bad. I was quoted $60 for a 25 minute express pedicure. - If you're going to use the convenient bus system that takes you to the airport and all around the strip and to downtown, you have to walk to a pickup. The Tropicana is a stop on all bus routes and is much more convenient. - Night staff was really loud, hollering to each other in the hallways in the early morning (1 a.m. and 5 a.m.) - In room toiletries were cheap, cheap, cheap. Not a big deal EXCEPT that they insist on calling themselves a resort and charging a resort fee. If I'm gonna pay the fee, I'm going to expect the level of service that goes with it. - The shower in our bathroom had no head, just a tall spout that poured water. Overall, I would not stay here again unless I were paying $150 or less. I would go back to ChinChin though.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time in Faux NY on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: thobbes1
Reviews.Content: Loved it. Loved it. Loved it. Loved it.Loved it.Loved it. The bars, the west village, the and the casino. The bars, the west village, the and the casino. The bars, the west village, the and the casino. The bars, the west village, the and the casino.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: JLOMi
Reviews.Content: We were at the NYNY for 8 days in late February. Check in was a breeze and we asked for a room near the New Yorker elevator. They gave us the 32nd Floor with a beautiful view of the strip and a king sized bed. The room was quiet, clean and very comfortable. We never waited more than a minute for the express elevators. We enjoyed a few of the restaurants in this hotel such as Gallaghers, Nine Fine Irishmen, The Sporting House (every night that the hockey game was on) and the various smaller places (Nathans, New York Pretzel with coupons found online) http://www.vegas4locals.com/coupon5thavenue.html We will be back - hopefully very soon.

Reviews.Title: “NY NY Great Hotel, Bad Casino Cigarette Smoke”
Reviews.Author: lovinlife416
Reviews.Content: Love this hotel and stay there whenever we are in Vegas. The hotel is pretty central on the strip and the room are comfortable. However, the cigarette smoke in this casino is awful! We stayed there a week ago and were disappointed that we were not told the pool was closed, being renovated. However, we were still charged the crazy $18 a day "resort fee". Thinking of finding a new hotel with a better circulation system in the casino and one that doesn't charge that outragous fee.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay”
Reviews.Author: lozaman
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a long 4 day weekend recently and enjoyed this place as usual. For a small fee was able to upgrade to a larger corner room on a high-floor. Well worth it, the room was very comfortable and the floor was super quiet. We didn’t see another soul on our floor the entire weekend but there are only a few rooms on each floor of the Empire area anyway. Room service was fast and food was decent, table was removed promptly. Parking in the garage is super convenient and a short walk to the Empire elevators. It can‘t get any easier for a large hotel on the strip. Everything about the room was great except the bathroom. It was huge but form a design-standpoint it had inexplicable flaws. The sink was a tiny little thing, and it was jammed right against the wall so you’re literally rubbing elbows with the wall when you use the sink, with all this huge space to one side (why not center it a little more?). The plug for your blow dryer is right above the sink so your cord is dangling in the sink (dangerous!). The shower was also cramped. None of this made sense because the bathroom was HUGE and they could have easily made the sink and shower much bigger. I think it MAY have been a handicap-access design (?). The casino is great fun, not smoky, the arcade is way cool and huge. I was able to go old-school and play my wife in Ms. Pacman, taking it back to my childhood of the 70’s-80’s arcade days. The kids loved it too. My only complaint would be the waitresses didn’t come around often for drinks while you’re gambling and a couple times they flew by so fast and yelled “drinks?“ by the time I could even turn around they were GONE. I guess they are trying to cut back on the freebies. Overall a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “I think I got the real out of towner treatment...”
Reviews.Author: Ebazinam
Reviews.Content: Well it all started at check in. We reserved a room on a popular travel website and got a killer deal. I had read the reviews and asked for the "special" upgrade. No luck. I then got the "well you can upgrade to a room that is About 50 square feet larger for 15.00 per night" sales pitch. I did it, why not, you also got a Queen bed instead of two full size beds. I wasn't offered the strip view option. So I'm thinking, "well this is gonna be great". We get to the room, and I find out that the window is really a porthole, that, no kidding has a view of an outside wall no less than 2 feet from the outside of the building. So, I go back downstairs. Talk to the the desk manager and get my original room back. As it turns out, our "cheaper" room had a much larger bathroom than the more expensive room with the obstructed view. Of course, when it came time to check out, they had forgotten to remove the upgrade fees. No big deal, except that with all the initial check in problems, it made my hour long check in ordeal seem like time that was not very well spent. Other than the room incident, this is our second time to stay in this hotel. The remodel of the hotel is nice. The in casino restaurants are still very good, buffet is "meh". It's probably time to lose the coyote ugly theme though. The piano bar is still pretty nice, great players with nice talent. The gambling is "ok". The craps tables turn to $15 tables a little to early. Seems like there was a lot more smoke this time in the casino area than in our previous trips to this casino. I really wish they would get rid of the people trying to sell time shares every time you cross the sky bridge. Oh well, with the horrible check in staffing and overly cumbersome check in processing, this is probably our last trip to this casino. There are simply better lodging opportunities all over Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “So far my favorite weekend vegas hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kameidotraveler
Reviews.Content: Fun younger crowd vibe. My husband and I had a 10 night stay in Las Vegas. We stayed in 3 different hotels during our stay. First 2 nights we stayed at the MGM Grand (have stayed here over 5 times). Next 3 nights were at the New York New York Hotel (have stayed here over 5 times). Our last 5 nights were at the Encore (have stayed here 3 times). The encore has far nicer rooms than the MGM and New York New York. The Encore is at the complete opposite end of the strip from the first two hotels. We enjoy changing hotels and getting a different vibe from the different hotels. MGM has fairly large rooms but the views are always terrible. The casino is HUGE. The foodcourt is lively and very busy. There is a nice stroll to shopping facilities as well as many restaurants. When we checked out all we had to do was walk across the bridge to get to New York New York. New York has a younger crowd vibe (we are in our early 50's). The rooms are a little smaller than MGM however compared with other hotels in the U.S.A they would be classified as high end. We have always had good views from our stays at New York. Given a choice I would stay at the New York hotel over the MGM hotel. Casino is smaller and during our Friday Saturday night stay very lively. There is a dual ling piano bar that is very popular and fun. There is also a Irish Pub that is a great place to get a Guinness. Food is reasonably priced at the food court and very good. The deli sandwiches, fish and chips and deserts were particular favorites. We planned our trip that we would not walk any farther than halfway down the strip (we used the Flamingo as our stopping point. When we checked out of New York New York we decided to walk to the Encore (we have made this walk many times on previous holidays so we did know how long it was). Our intention originally was to take a cab but we were energized that day and had no problem pulling our 1 suitcase and carrying our 1 back pack. If you do decide to do this there are many places to stop and sit for a minute if your feet get tired. The vibe at the Encore is immediately so different from the first two hotels. Much more staff attends to you and they really do make checking in and checking out a delight. Much more efficient than the first two hotels. The grandeur of the encore immediately takes you aback. Beautiful, beautiful red decor. Rooms have floor to ceiling windows so views are great. We were on the 28th floor and were offered a upgrade to a higher floor for 20.00 more. We declined the offer and we were very satisfied with the view that came with our room. We ate at the Wynn buffet twice during our stay and upgraded the meal to 10.00 each for all you can drink champagne (there are some other drinks available at that price but we chose the champagne). Someone in another review stated that some of the food was not fresh. I would have to disagree with that statement. Everything was great and all was fresh. We intended to try some of the other restaurants at the Encore but it did not work out for us with the shows we were going to see. In this order my favorites are Encore - Classy New York - Fun MGM - Has everything I would stay at any of these properties again. Have fun in Vegas!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Unfortunately, I hate Vegas”
Reviews.Author: realCalifornia
Reviews.Content: Ok, I said it. Vegas is not my style or choice for relaxing or entertainment. I had to attend an important trade show so it couldn't be avoided. When I am on business, I certainly don't want to stay at a "themed" Hotel...but I've changed my mind! What a terrific stay I had at the New York, New York Casino and Hotel. Before you go further, please note that I do not drink, do not gamble and do not "party" (what a bore, right?). This Hotel was wonderful. The standard rooms are good sized, really clean and the non-smoking room was really non-smoking not masked by spray. Access to the rooms was not through a smoking noisy Casino. They have a very large Casino and very popular by my observation. The bed was very comfortable and the appointments just right. The bathroom was really a pleasure, very large and spacious. The decor was top notch and very appealing. And quiet! I felt like I was in a luxury Hotel at a very reasonable rate. Parking was free and plentiful with easy access to the Hotel registration. Anyone who has been to Vegas knows that parking can be quite a hike to the reception desk. The staff throughout the week were exactly what you would expect at a top tier hotel, where everyone greets you in the hallway, as well as at the front desk and in the lobby. The service was superb, even when we needed to make some changes on the spot with our reservation due to a mix up made by our corporate booking, not the Hotel's fault. They managed it with no issue whatsoever. I only had an opportunity to eat at one restaurant, but it was the best meal of the week at Il Fornaio. The price was modest by Vegas standard and moderate anywhere else. My guests had pastas but I went for the New York steak. Cooked perfectly and seasoned in the Tuscan style. I think the three of us polished of three baskets of the fresh bread and Olive oil. Now, I won't dread my stays in Vegas, so long as I can stay at the New York, New York Hotel. And I might even stop in for a quick getaway diversion when driving to visit my in-laws in Salt Lake. I couldn't have been more surprised at the impression this Hotel left with me.

Reviews.Title: “Great weekend getaway”
Reviews.Author: JessfromChicago
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a four night-five day weekend in Las Vegas and had a great time. At first I was a little skeptical about staying at the New York New York since there are so many newer properties in the area, but I did not regret it at all. The hotel staff were friendly, there were many choices for restaurants, and the hotel casino was always like a party. Club ROK at the hotel was also lots of fun.

Reviews.Title: “Very good Hotel for a very nice price”
Reviews.Author: EdwardMoses
Reviews.Content: We have stayed for 6 days at this hotel and I have nothing to complain. The people were very nice and helpful and our room was good and clean. The casino area was spacious and therefore it didn't felt like a dark gamble area. America and Chin chin, 2 restaurants were very good. Just for you to know: the swimming pool isn't open in February. I guess it will be till March before they open. The are renovating a part of the swimming pool. Furthermore did we like, that from this hotel a lot is easy accessible: left and right from the hotel is a tram that goes to other hotels, The bus to other destinations are close by( the express bus to downtown is on the other side of the road) and the metro stop is in MGM, which is on the opposite side of the road. I rally can recommend this hotel for people , that looks for a good hotel with a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Choose a Different Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SBreferee
Reviews.Content: I would never stay at this hotel again. Right from check in I had problems. I tried to call an outside line only to be connected to the switch board. It took three different persons before I was able to dial directly. I thought that this is what the Resort Fee was for. No one at the front desk seems to know what they are doing. Next, the hotel does not have a buffet like the others. The rooms are small compared to other Vegas hotels. If you want to purchase movies, be prepared to have a deposit charged to your credit card. I thought they already had my credit card on file, yet they still charge this additional deposit. I was so frustrated with the complete lack of customer service. Save your self some trouble and stay at another hotel...I was here in November 2011 and stayed at the Mandalay Bay which was very nice. The room sized start at 550sf.. I hope that this helps when it comes to making your hotel decisionin Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Just Right”
Reviews.Author: BrickZ28
Reviews.Content: Arriving on Presidents day 2012 around checkout time probably wasnt the best thing to do. Valet service was qucik but I had to drag my own bags after I was told someone was on the way. I dont mind dragging my bags but not when told someone is coming. This however didnt ruin the vacation. We dropped our bags as check in wast for a bit and headed to NYP. (review on that later as this is for the hotel itself.) About 20 mins prior to early checkin i went to the counter and was charged $20 for early checkin and then pressured to use a Credit card and not my Debt card. Ok I get it its comes from my account thats my issue not yours to push me, anyway we were in a Marquis suite on the 5th floor by the elevators room 554. Walking in its a nice long room and maybe a bit wider than a normal room. I got a good cyber Monday deal so it was worth the price, not sure if I would pay normal price but not a bad room. A nice hard floor in the entry way with a normal sized, standard bathroom to the left. King sized bed (that is soft and killed my back buts that me so I wont ding it for that)and jauzzi hottub that will fit 2 comfortably, A flat screen TV was the other highlight of the room. The view was of the roller coaster looking straight out to the MGM and the rooftop below. Room service was fast not overpriced and always delicious. Maid service was typical and they couldnt read the do not disturb sign the first day as always it seems with me and after answering the knocking door they go "Oh there's the sign". The Casino itself has alot to offer and good eats and drinks as with all the other hotels in Vegas I dont think its better or worse just has its own theme of the streets of NYC which makes it its own. I think that if you get a good deal and depending on your taste this could be a 5 rating but it does exceed a 3 by a long shot. Its no Bellagio or Venetian but its better than the CIrcus Circus The Imperial. I would say its right inline with tthe MGM and is a great place for the middle of the roaders. One note, if your driving be advised that if you leave toward the strip you have to head south and pull a U-Turn to head back north up the strip and if coming from I-15 southbound get off the exit toward Tropicana West and pull a U-Turn at the first stop light there to get back to the Hotel. Navigating can be a tricking to and from but not too bad.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: SnoopyManchester
Reviews.Content: Just spent a week here and i can honestly say the level of service and standard of the rooms was better than I expected. It was my first time in America and after booking the holiday I checked on here to see the ratings for the hotel. I was a bit concerned when I read some of the comments about the cleanliness of the rooms and the poor service but As per usual it would appear that some sad people here are just never happy about what they get regardless. I also noticed that the majority of the wingers writing bad reviews were American, just goes to show that they are never satisfied. Location was spot on, rooms were cleaned every day and the hotel staff were always helpful. This is probably due to the fact that you have to tip everyone all the time. To be honest I got fed up of giving a couple of dollars to the barman every time he got me a beer but this was throughout Vegas not just at the hotel. I will say that although I did enjoy staying at New York New York I didn't enjoy Vegas itself too much. It is seriously like Blackpool on speed during Scots week, especially at weekend when the thousands upon thousands of Americans suddenly turn up for 2 nights and completely swamp the place. Deinately recommend the trip to Grand Canyon and if you can afford it, do it on the helicopter ride it was fantastic. Prices range from £300 - £400 each but again, well worth it. Overall good holiday but wont be going back. You only need to do it the once.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: christianson5
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in February of 2011. It was a beautiful hotel, very clean and modern. Really enjoyed Coyote Ugly and looking at all the different things inside the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “OK, but one careless day with housekeeping”
Reviews.Author: AWisconsintravler
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the NY NY last week (March 1-5, 2012) and had only minor issues. Our room was $155 average per night for the 4 nights, and was nothing real special, but clean and well maintained. The living space in the room is a bit cramped, but we weren't in the room very much. We did have one morning after the room was cleaned and were left a dirty towel folded up nicely with the fresh towels. How this happened still escapes me, it had makeup smeared all over it and a few short hairs, pretty gross, but it was tossed aside and we forgot about it. Parking is very convenient, especially from our elevators (Century). It was almost as easy to go to the parking garage as the taxi stand. Overall the property was well maintained, no rough edges, but I would have liked to see a cheaper price especially since nothing was going on in Vegas of any significance and the rooms are just OK. Check-in was slow (7:00 p.m.), only two people working the desk and it only takes one person with a lot of questions to bring the whole process to a halt. I stood for about 20 minutes waiting for 3 others ahead of me to check-in. No pool, but we hadn't intended to use it. It was being taken out with dozers and jack hammers. What will replace it is a good question but it won't be any time soon I would guess. Like every other casino, prices were ridiculous. A can of beer, $6.00, a soda from the convenience store, $3.00, a bag with 6 mini doughnuts for breakfast, $3.59. Go across the street and for $4.00 you can get 4 Miller tall boys, Miller lite 6 pack around 8 bucks. Of course if your in the casino find a bar girl and get your drinks free if your playing, of course a tip of a buck or two is appropriate. Saw David Copperfield, how does he do it? KA, the wife and my daughter said it was good, Zumanity, funny, a bit raunchy but nothing to get uptight about, and Jubilee (topless) was very well done. Register for the M-life card before you buy tickets, we saved over 30% on all tickets and not just back row, we were front row for Jubilee. Our room faced away from the strip with a view of the parking ramp and Monte Carlo resort. Not a problem! Bed quality was great, very comfortable. My son was Staying at Luxor and didn't get a single good night's sleep. Bed quality there was horrible he said. Our safe did not work when we arrived and it took getting security twice before they got the locksmith who had it fixed in under a minute. We were close to the elevators and didn't notice any noise. I can only take Vegas for a few days at a time so if, or when I return I will probably look elsewhere since there are so many places to see. I would recommend NY NY if you get a decent price.

Reviews.Title: “Good Time”
Reviews.Author: j_to_the_l_o
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 4 nights to celebrate our first anniversary. We checked in using the early check-in, and were told that there were no "high floor" Zigguraut suites available. I had asked several times before checking in, but I knew that nothing is guaranteed. We ended up settling for a suite on the 5th floor that wasn't too bad! Wallpaper is peeling in places, and the whirlpool jets didn't work in our room spa, but all in all, we had a blast. Housekeeping and room service were excellent, and the only complaint I had outside of not getting a high floor room, was the resort fee. Our reservation email stated it would be $15 a night, but when we got there, it was $18 a night. No big whoop. We paid it. The food at the hotel was excellent! Gonzalez y Gonzalez is a gem of a restaurant. Never any wait, EXCELLENT chips and salsa, and the best chicken fajitas my wife and I have ever had. Prices were reasonable for Las Vegas and MUCH better than the trendier looking "Diablos Cantina" that was on the strip near the Monte Carlo. All in all, this casino is fun and is located in a great area. I would have liked more quick breakfast choices (Starbucks was the only thing open every morning outside of sit down meals), and a coffee maker in the room, but all in all - a great hotel and a great time! - One word on the roller coaster. Every review on here seems to mention it, and it is a big part of the outside casino. We were right smack in the middle of coaster, on the 5th floor, but had no issues with it. It actually was kinda fun watching people scream and yell as they went around. Saturday night they kept it going until around midnight, but after a day of feasting and drinking, my wife and I both slept like babies.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, fun for the children”
Reviews.Author: Hectorshouse09
Reviews.Content: We stayed here and had a good time - the facilities are great for families - we enjoyed the America restaurant, although the staff could have been a bit more cheerful.
