We met "Vinny" in the checkin queue and got a half price roller coaster ride - and we upgraded to a strip view room which was worth it. Overall the room was clean and in good condition and I was not disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre Hotel Rooms, Cool Casino and Restaurants”
Reviews.Author: CarmenSandiego83
Reviews.Content: I was debating whether to give this hotel three or four stars but decided to be generous and give it a four because it is conveniently on the Strip near city transportation and the airport and has a nice lobby area with a casino, roller coaster around the hotel, and its faux Greenwich village is cool with good and affordable restaurants. There was a short line for check-in but we stood in line for close to 10 minutes. We were charged a $18 resort fee for internet, newspaper, and other crap we didn't need. I asked if we could opt out of the resort fee if we didn't use the wifi and were told we couldn't. Don't know if that was true or not. Also, our magnet key card malfunctioned twice. The cheapest room (Park Avenue Deluxe) is very, very basic. I was surprised that the room did not include much amenities. There was no fridge, no water (H2O in the vending machine was available on my floor for $2), no kettle with coffee or tea like in most hotels I've stayed in around the world. I guess this is common for Vegas but it made me regret choosing New York New York on my first night. I ended up liking the hotel more once I found the faux Greenwich Village (stop by at the Fulton Fish Frye for cheap fish n' chips) and compared its casinos with other hotels on the Strip which didn't seem as chic and inviting. In short, it is a good place to play and an average place to stay for Vegas standards. I think if I return to Vegas for business or a romantic stay, I'd check out the Cosmopolitan or Mandarin Oriental for better hotel amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Special”
Reviews.Author: Nicole D
Reviews.Content: It's a decent hotel. The rooms are kind of small. The dealers are alright. I know they have to be up at odd hours, but more enthusiasm would be great. The beds in the room though are super comfy!! The maids did a good job, too. It's just nothing stood out compared to other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “In need of an upgrade”
Reviews.Author: KeenTraveller1983
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in April/May 2011. The rooms are in desperate need of an upgrade. Rooms are old and still have the ancient box TV's. Now I can see why the rates were relatively cheap. Rooms are very clean though and there wasn't any bed bugs. The hotel itself offers great food outlets and bars. The hotel offers a rollercoaster however, it was shut down for maintenance/repairs on the last day that we went to use it. If you are just after a cheap room for the night, this is the place to go.

Reviews.Title: “Overall good stay but beware at check in.”
Reviews.Author: Saskratchurass
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for three nights. We booked 3 rooms for two other couples under a free buffet promotion. At check in I was informed that we were not getting the two free buffets per room because she could not find the promotion code in our reservation. I had the ny ny app on my iPhone and told her I could bring up the promotion that I booked. The person checking us in said she couldn't give us the buffet because we booked during a blackout period but she could take off the resort fees. This was a negative start to our stay but with some explaining and persistence, we were able to walk away satisfied. The hotel rooms were great with comfortable beds. The view from the room was limited but it didn't bother us because we were never in our rooms anyway. Had a great burger at the American. The hot dogs at the hot dog stand were awesome. The casino was not busy the whole time we were there so it was easy to find a table or slot machine. Overall this a good hotel in decent location. I would personally not stay in this hotel again. The hotels resort fees are going up to $18 per night and there are many other hotels las Vegas to try out.

Reviews.Title: “Ok Hotel- probably worth an upgrade”
Reviews.Author: NSteach
Reviews.Content: We stayed here this past August on our honeymoon. When we got there around 4pm there was about 1/2 hour long line up to check in but staff were friendly. When we got to our room I was surprised- it looked nothing like the pictures on their website- it was very small and their were cigarette butts on the bedside table and beside the bed- not a great start. Our view was of a cement wall so that sucked too. But the location was great and the casino was nice- I don't think we'd stay at this hotel again with so many great hotels in the same area. But if you're booked here before you read this- I would probably just spring for an upgrade at check-in because I'm pretty sure this hotel does have some nice rooms- we just didn't see them on our honeymoon.

Reviews.Title: “Did not like it”
Reviews.Author: Cathy c
Reviews.Content: I expected this hotel to very nice but the moment I walked in the lobby I was disappointed . It was very dark and dingy looking. The room we got was horrible , when I called the front desk and complained I was told I could try another room but they are all the same . There was wallpaper coming off around the window ..the room was more like a one star. They took off the upgrade fee ... I thought if this room was an upgradre I would hate to see what the standard room looks like . I would never go back to New York New York

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: FoodAddictPEI
Reviews.Content: I had low expectations based on the low rate we paid, but was pleasantly surprised. The rooms were spacious and nicely decorated, the beds were comfortable, and everything was clean and quiet. It wouldn't be my first choice for Vegas because it's a bit too far from centre-strip, but if you're on a budget, you can't go wrong with NY,NY. Don't stay in a dive like Circus, Circus or Excalibur when you could stay here for not much more.The pool area was also good - a bit small, but adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Steveic
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the NY NY hotel in Las Vegas in late Feb.2012. Had a great room with a view of the strip. Everything was very clean and well managed. Hotel staff was friendly and helpful. We have stayed at other MGM properties before and we are NEVER disappointed. TOP of line!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Room, Great View”
Reviews.Author: CanalKat
Reviews.Content: Traveled with my Mom and my Aunt. Because they stayed there last year, we were upgraded to a Madison Room. We also requested a room for disabled because my Mom needs the bars in the bathroom. We were given a room on the 38th floor, Wow, what a beautiful view! We faced southwest with a view of the mountains. Our room was clean, comfortable and large enough for the 3 of us. We were also close to the elevator which was great for my Mom. We ate at several of the restaurants, and they were all good and easy on the wallet. Only reason they didn't get excellent is because their gaming choices are limited and they have no poker room. Their Sports book is excellent though.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay at New York New York again”
Reviews.Author: Deb B
Reviews.Content: This was our first time in Vegas. We stayed at the New York New York for 7 days. The check in was quick. No line up like what I saw at many of the other hotels that we went into during our stay. The staff was very helpful every time I asked a question. I agree with the lady who in an earlier review addressed those complaining about the resort fee. When I was decided where to go all the strip casinos indicated they charge this. If you don't want to pay, DON'T STAY ON THE STRIP. We were able to catch our tour bus to the Grand Canyon right at the hotel which was very convenient. Just one caution, if you want to use the Deuce on the weekend nights (Fri & Sat.) don't expect to get anywhere quick. We found out the last day there that we could have taken the other bus (I think it was called SDX which doesn't stop at every hotel but would have got us to our destination quicker - we will know for next time). We were on the 23rd Floor of the Century tower with a corner room that had an awesome view of the strip and the Excalibur to the South. Ask for the upgrade. It was worth the money. As well we did hear the roller coaster but I think we were up high enough that the noise was not too bad. We will stay at this hotel again when we go back to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Best bed ever!”
Reviews.Author: concerned011
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights in Vegas and chose NYNY due to proximity to main places of interest on the Strip. Very pleasantly surprised! Bars and food outlets were among the best priced in Vegas. Staff were extremely efficient and courteous. We stayed in the Marquis Suite which was huge, with a 4 person spa and the most comfortable bed I have EVER slept in. Overlooked the Strip and the rollercoaster. Although you could just hear the rollercoaster when you concentrated, it certainly wasn't loud enough to prevent or disturb sleep. My only real complaint, like everywhere in Vegas, is the cigarette smoke. I had to take antihistamines everyday to survive... The room was definitely smoke free however, and this pleased me greatly. I'm not sure if I'd return to Vegas...feel like I have "been there, done that", and it's not exactly my sort of place (don't gamble, don't drink much, early to bed, HATE smoking)...but if I did, would definitely stay at NYNY. Oh, and make sure you go on the rollercoaster.....not a gentle ride for the faint hearted however!

Reviews.Title: “Why I Stay At New York New York”
Reviews.Author: Mark S
Reviews.Content: There are many reasons why I chose to stay at the NYNY: 1. Have stayed there before and all stays could be rated a excellent. 2. No-hassle check-in. After the hassles of flying, it is a welcome relief to be greeted by professionals, from the bell-hop to those at the front desk. 3. Food is outstanding. Great for entertaining business clients or for just having a good time. 4. Rooms are spacious and very clean. 5. Able to handle special requests. The list could go on. Without reservation, I highly recommend the New York New York for anyone staying in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Location is key for a place that requires so much walking.”
Reviews.Author: Leong167
Reviews.Content: Ive been to New York New York twice and been to Vegas twice, but I travel a lot and I think this place is great. Due to all the walking, MGM would wear you out, and so would some of the others. For Vegas this place is closely linked.

Reviews.Title: “As good as New York itself......almost!”
Reviews.Author: Alice3
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in December 2011 for 3 nights, in a Park Avenue Deluxe room, overlooking the strip and roller coaster! We stayed here mainly to visit the Grand Canyon and as a convenient stop over point on our way to Hawaii, from the UK. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay here-our room had 2 queen beds which were extremely comfortable and the room and bathroom were very clean and both were generous in size. We ate in the hotels Italian restaurant one evening and it was very good. As the hotel is on the strip, everything is easily accessible and we used the mono rail to travel between the sights. Wish we could've stayed for longer as 3 nights just wasn't long enough to fully experience all that this crazy, one of a kind city, has to offer!

Reviews.Title: “Smooth sailing for 7 nights at NYNY”
Reviews.Author: bsannich
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 7 nights for a class that I took for my job that was being held in Vegas. All in all, it was a very comfortable and very easy stay. I stayed in a "Park Avenue Deluxe" room facing the mountains (not the strip) with two queen beds. The room itself was just what I needed - a very comfortable bed, large bathroom with plenty of counter room, and a comfortable desk (needed to do a lot of work while there). Everything was very clean. Some oddities about the room: I was literally right next to the vending and ice machines, however, I don't think I heard either of them once in the 7 nights I was there. The downhill part of the roller coaster was right outside my widow - so I constantly heard the rumble of the roller coaster and the screams of the people on it - BUT - it honestly didn't concern me. It wasn't loud enough to be a bother (I actually thought it was kind of cool). My only complaints/annoyances are as follows: the TV/entertainment system could use an upgrade/modernization, there are almost no extra plugs available (I had to unplug the alarm clock to plug my laptop in), the bathroom fogged up like crazy after every shower, and the wifi was a pain because i had to sign in every time i used it. There were a number of times every night where people would be screaming and yelling in the hallway. No biggie though - I mean, this IS Vegas after all. I'm not a gambler, but the casino was pretty nice. I ate at a number of the restaurants downstairs - they were all very good, had great service, and were actually pretty cheap. There are also a couple stores that have all of the necessities if you need them. The location of the hotel is pretty good - it's right in the middle of things. MGM is a two minute walk across the street, Aria/City Center is like 10 minutes, Venetian/Palazzo are like 30 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Update the rooms, Plenty to do”
Reviews.Author: Zags333
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were very disappointed in the room. It needed to be updated and a little larger. The workers were very nice and very helpful. Next trip we will pay a little more and stay somewhere else. 4 star Hotel it was not.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay!”
Reviews.Author: quiche84
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here from 3-7 Jan and my Father also joined us on our trip. We had connecting rooms which was great, we still had our privacy as did my Father. We stayed in a Madison Avenue suite. The rooms were clean and tidy with plenty of room. I really have no complaints about our stay at the New York New York Hotel and Casino. This was the first hotel we stayed at on our 7 week holiday around the world and coming back home and reflecting on each hotel we stayed at, this hotel was awesome value for money, and made our stay in Las Vegas that little bit more enjoyable. The New York New York was in a great location, had plenty of restaurants, attractions other than just the Casino. It has it's own night club inside the building, pubs, games arcade, roller coster, ice cream shops, cafés, Sushi, Starbucks, the list is endless. Everything is really handy and it's all under the one roof. We did get to have a look around and walk through other Hotel/Casinos but if we ever go back to Las Vegas I will definatly stay at the New York New York again! If I had to complain about anything and this is being really picky for our whole stay one of our table lamps wasn't working and was sitting on an angle, which no cleaning staff noticed. But like I said thats being really picky. Overall they have great facilities, friendly and helpful staff and clean and modern rooms, plenty of space everything you want in a hotel room. I did a lot of research before booking this hotel room but I'm glad I made the decision to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Fine stay for an older casino hotel in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Rusttribe
Reviews.Content: I recently completed a stay at the New York - New York Casino in Las Vegas. I booked one of their mid-level "Madison Ave" rooms. Overall I was pleased with the stay, especially considering this is one of the older properties on the strip, and especially considering many of the people I was with stayed at Luxor and hated it. First, my check in was quick and friendly. I did arrive late, so that might be why there was no line, but overall check-in was great. I was also able to reserve a late check out of 6pm (for a cost of $40) which was excellent. The room was a short walk through the casino and I was given a room on the 16th floor with a view of the Roller Coaster and the mountains. You do not hear the noise at all from the coaster, so do not worry about that. The room itself was spacious and clean, but not the most modern or updated I've been in. Thankfully there was good hi-speed internet access and a nice workdesk. (As an aside...will people stop complaining about the $18 "Resort Fee". Every casino has it, and you are made CLEARLY aware of this fee when you book your room online. It covers a lot of amenities you probably will not use, but tough. If you don't want to pay it, stay off the strip at a chain hotel!) The room had plenty of free cable TV channels, a free in-room safe, which was very easy to sue. The bed was clean, and very comfortable. The bathroom, while showing a little age, was clean, and had a great shower. (Although a very high step-in height, so be careful!!) I had a very nice breakfast one morning at Il Fornaio in the hotel, and lunch one day at the Broadway Burger Bar. Both were reasonable priced (for Vegas) and quite good, so give them a shot. Overall this casino still has a young energetic vibe, and quite good in-hotel nightlife, especially the Dueling Piano bar. I think this was a very good choice for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dutchrob01
Reviews.Content: My son and I had been here several times, but never stayed here.Since this hotel is recommended, also by professional reviewers, we decided to stay here part of our 2012 Las Vegas vacation. Easy acces by car. Reception was friendly. We booked a Park Avenue Premium View room.The room was on the 26th floor on the corner of the LV boulevard and Tropicana.See the photo. Th room was ok, though I didn't like the connecting door to the next room, because of the sounds coming through. Fortunately we had quiet neighbours from the UK.That much I was able to establish without any effort.They should assign rooms like that to (large) families.Otherwise no complaints.House keeping was fine.The atmosphere in the hotel was pleasent and sort of intimate.It was nice having breakfast on the patio of Il Fornaio and also Cinchin was a nice restaurant.The service in the casino was fine. Cocktails were offered nonstop.The express checkout was easy and convenient.All in all a nice stay

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: gsuzuki
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the NYNY hotel during a guys weekend trip and my friends and I was very pleased with the hotel. Here are some additional details: Checking In: We arrived at the hotel at about 11:00 pm on a Wednesday night, so there was a very minimal wait. When checking in, the person showed us a picture of our room (same picture as on the website). The room that we had was the "Park Avenue" room which is the smallest. Considering there was three of us sharing the room, we almost decided to upgrade, but good thing we didn't because the room was very big. Since my other friend wanted his own room, I called to request an adjoining room. Unfortunately they could not accomindate us, however my friend had the room right across the one we had, so this was no problem. After checking us in, the person directed us towards the elevators (watch out there are at least two sets of elevators, make sure you choose the correct one). Room: As I mentioned above, we was almost going to request a bigger room, but the one we was assigned was very spacious. Even for three grown men, the room was very accomidating. There was a desk and the closet with the television in the middle of the closet. There was no refrigerator (I think there is a extra charge for this) and the internet was included with the resort fee. The bathroom had adequate space. We had the farthest room from the elevator so noise was not a problem, however getting to the room from the elevator was like walking in a little maze. The view we had was of the M&M store across the street, since we was on the 7th floor, we did not have much of a view. Location: The NYNY hotel was in a great location. Across the street was the MGM and from the MGM you can catch the monorail to the other hotels. Also across the street was the Excalibur hotel. Roller Coaster: The room we had did not have the roller coaster right outside the room so it did not bother us. Negatives: -The negatives we had, was right outside the window was a light shining from the roof below up on the side of the hotel. This meant if we did not close the shade, the light would be shining into the room. This was not a problem for us, but others might have a problem. -The resort fee ($18 per night) was a minor negative. Even though we knew about it and we did use the internet access, I wish the newspaper would be dropped off or you can not receive it and get a little credit. Same thing for the fitness center. Either you use it or if you don't, get a little credit. -This is not a negative, but make sure if you don't want to walk far from the elevator, please make sure to tell the front desk person. We had the last room on the one side and the walk was couple minutes to get to the elevator. Overall: The NYNY hotel was excellent. The room was very spacious and it had the amenities we needed. I would definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “It's all here”
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at New York New York, Las Vegas several times. It has always been a pleasant stay. There is so much to do at this location from gambling, eating, drinking, dancing, and even riding on a roller coaster. You can stay a few days, and do not have to leave the property to find something fun to do. They have several different room types because of the lay out of the hotel. Check for promotions often, as they usually offer upgrades online. If you want a great steak house, make sure and try Gallagher's. If you love Mexican food or a margarita, make sure and visit Gonzalez Y Gonzalez, and hope Jennifer is your server, she was fantastic! The Bar at Times Square is always a blast and don't miss the dueling piano show. Nine Fine Irishmen continuously has fantastic meals, and the New York Pizzeria offers great New York style pizza slices. If you are in the mood for a sensual Cirque du Soleil show, don’t miss Zumanity. I think you will enjoy this location!

Reviews.Title: “New York, New York ... kinda”
Reviews.Author: MNEAustin
Reviews.Content: Checked into New York, New York after 10 minute wait in line. Usual 18% "resort facilities" fee added to the rate. It's obviously a casino resort why do we all continue to have to pay these ridiculous add on fees??? Room is ok ... no more no less. No coffee pot, no refrigerator. Bed like sleeping in a hammock. For those who like no support wonderful. For those who like some or lots of support .... too bad. But I thought the pillows were great ... my wife not so much, but then pillows are always the hardest items for hotels to satisfy across the board. Bkfst in Il Fornia (?spelling) was good according to all in our party of six. But they wouldn't split the bill three ways, or even two ways. And then after 15 minutes of trying to get our waitress to pick up our payment we finally got up and went to the front with bill and payment in hand and asked the maitre de if he'd take the payment. Poor finish for a good start. Parking is free! Casino is average although about 50% of the skimpily dressed dancers on the bar tops should NEVER put on a bikini. I guess in Sin City it's not easy to find a comely lass for this job when the best are probably in the strip clubs. Total hotel experience .... very average. And in Vegas that ain't good!

Reviews.Title: “One of our Favorites”
Reviews.Author: edsgirlAustin
Reviews.Content: This was our 3rd stay at NYNY and it is a sentimental favorite . We spent our honeymoon at this hotel in 2005 and stayed again in November 2010. We were able to upgrade our comped Park Avenue room to a Marquis Suite for a very nominal fee. This room was fantastic! 700 sq ft. with a 4 person hot tub and a very comfortable bed. We had plenty of room to enjoy room service breakfast, although it was late by 30 minutes. My only complaint about this room was the bathroom is the same too small bathroom as the Park Avenue room. It would have been nice to have a bigger bathroom considering it is a "suite". Every staff member that we encountered was pleasant and helpful!

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: kt_lou78
Reviews.Content: Hotel was friendly even though it is is huge. The room was small but sufficient for our needs. We had a room far away from the lift so it was a trek to get anywhere. We had a view of Monte Carlo Hotel and the rollercoaster. The bars are great and the staff knowledgable and made you feel welcome. We ate in the Italian restaurant which was nice but the air conditioning was so cold in the whole hotel it was uncomfortable. Taxi to a from the airport varied greatly.$28 there and $14 back! Easy to get a taxi from right outside and bus stop outside Excalibur hotel next door and right opposite at MGM Grand.

Reviews.Title: “Great atmosphere with friendly helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: ciswim
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visit Vegas frequently. We both agree New York New York is at the top of our list of hotels to visit again. All staff members were friendly and helpful. The dealers even remembered us and our bet preferences from one night to the next. The steakhouse had the best steak my husband has ever eaten and the staff there was exceptional as well.

Reviews.Title: “New York New York a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Cassandra M
Reviews.Content: The casino has the atmosphere for fun. There is always lots of laughter and music coming out of the Irish Pub. The eating places are plentiful with many choices we like the pizza and pastries. My Mom and I travel to Vegas once or twice a year and have stayed many places. New York New york has comfortable rooms that are quiet. The rooms are nicely decorated but to tell the truth we don't spend much time in our room we are out gambling and seeing the sights.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed and nickel and dimed”
Reviews.Author: Geordie_calgarian
Reviews.Content: First time in Vegas for me and I was really looking forward to this stay. Reception was very pleasant but due to the huge size of the hotel it was difficult finding the correct elevator to the room. In fact, even the bellman was challenged as we wandered around with him. Room was very basic, no life to it at all, couldn't get cheaper on the amenities - felt like an airport hotel room. The real kicker came when we called down for wine glasses and a corkscrew to enjoy a bottle of wine we had bought at a local winery - $10 charge for delivery!!! We offered to pick them up but were told that was not possible. Had fun at the piano bar until a drunk started in on me and hubbie had to deal with it - despite it being quite a rucus no security in sight. Tried a lox bagel one morning - salmon was obviously off. Took it back and was told that this is what smoked salmon tastes like! Um - no. Attempted to go for breakfast at a place which stated breakfast was served until 11am. Showed up at 10:50 and they were turning away a considerable amount of people "as they had to get ready for lunch". I did follow up with the hotel to let them know of our issues and got a bored response with the offer of an upgrade next time we stayed but only if it was in the next six months - NOT. Did get a great rate which included tickets for Cirque de Soleil which made the hotel about $30 a night, I don't think that was even worth that though.

Reviews.Title: “las vagas”
Reviews.Author: tamistilu
Reviews.Content: what a good time, have to go back much more to see.. the bus rides were way to long (double duce) 45 minute from freemont street to new york,new york hotel.. did not try the monorail. hotel room was great ask for rooms 30 and up, you will be above the rollercoster.it runs till 11.00-12.00.. roomservice was also very good.. can"t wait to go back

Reviews.Title: “Authentic experience w/o leaving Vegas.”
Reviews.Author: Pdones31
Reviews.Content: This hotel offered great service, excellent dinning, and an authentic New York feel without leaving the strip. Hotel staff were very friendly and accommodating. Room was very comfortable and clean. The casino treated us great as well. We will definitely return to this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Your usual Vegas Hotel, but nice and central.”
Reviews.Author: LoveYourLibrary
Reviews.Content: I stayed there as much for the exterior as the interior, previously stayed in Luxor but found it a bit 'far' of the beaten track, although good. The thing in Vegas that gets me is no coffee in the rooms, you have to get up and go out, this isn't a 'faul't of this hotel alone, it's more of a 'Vegas policy i think: ie keep them out of their rooms and down at the casino for as much time as you can. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Best on the Strip!”
Reviews.Author: GregC858
Reviews.Content: I stayed at NYNY for four days and visited numerous other properties during my stay. The atmosphere and staff at NYNY are by far the best on the Strip. Every employee is friendly and helpful. The casino is spotlessly clean, and the vibe is unbelievable. This is the only place I will stay!

Reviews.Title: “NY-NY Superbowl Weekend or Anytime!”
Reviews.Author: Robert W
Reviews.Content: Usually stay at the MGM Grand but NYNY offered such a great deal for Superbowl weekend we couldn't turn it down. We visit Vegas 3-4 times a year and will definitely stay at NYNY from now on. We actually received everything we were promised and MORE! What a great time! Super friendly, efficient staff, clean & comfortable room, and great variety of on-site food & entertainment. The location on the Strip made everything easy walking distance. If we wanted to travel farther, grabbing a cab was easy and the quick access to the highway made travel around Vegas fast and convenient. If you're looking for a resort casino with variety, excitement and atmosphere, this is the place!

Reviews.Title: “A Big Howdy from the Lone Star State!”
Reviews.Author: Bunnie58
Reviews.Content: My daughter & I try to get to Vegas at least once a year and the New York-New York is our first choice. Rooms are great, clean, comfortable and the service is A1. I am a Slot Player and love the NY NY Casino. I win, I lose, I laugh, I cry. But I keep coming back for more. My daughter, my son-in-law, my grandson & his fiance, all came together from TX and met my son & his wife from Steamboat Springs CO. We all styed at the NY NY & loved it !!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for the $$, won't wow you”
Reviews.Author: BMac2005
Reviews.Content: I typically like to review the standard room to give an apples to apples comparison for most. I splurged a bit this time and went with the Ziggarat suite at the NYNY. So yes, it had some great amenities, but you paid quite a bit for them. These included wet bar, fridge, large couch, dining table, two seating areas, two TVs, surround sound, bathrobes / slippers, whirlpool tub, separate seating/vanity area in bathroom, dual sinks, nice shower, lots of closet space, DVD player, etc. So very nice but the price averaged about $300 per nite. Several of the items in the room were not working and a couple of them still weren't fixed by the time I left despite a request on my first day. Service was 'fair'. Took a while to check in and they didn't call me on my cell when my room was ready as promised. Staff overall was fairly friendly. Restaurants were just 'okay', nothing spectacular. Al Fornaio was a bit over-rated. Also, I think so called 'resort fees' are borderline criminal and should be discontinued everywhere. MGM properties should really re-consider this. Bally's properties do not charge resort fees (Paris, Bally's, Planet Hollywood, Flamingo, Harrah's). Resort fees charge guests ($80 total in my case) for something they never use or are standard at other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “We Love staying at the New New York”
Reviews.Author: DAWN W
Reviews.Content: My husband and i go to vegas at least once a year we always look forward to staying at the New York New York the rooms are always clean and the staff is alway excellent the casino is always fun with newest and best slots that we love to play The restaurants are also very good we never waited in line and the food was delicious hopefully we will going back in a few months

Reviews.Title: “Cal49er”
Reviews.Author: Jesse E
Reviews.Content: Had a GREAT time, and fun at the hotel, and I won. The rooms were like home, with the nicest linens and cleanliness. The rates were fabulous, as well as all the helpful employees. Check in and out was fast and easy. The food was great, as well as the bars and entertainment. I would reccommend for any traveler to stay at the New York New York..and I know I will on all of my visits to Las Vegas. I bought tickets for shows, and the seats, and prices were great..Have a GOOD TIME..

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Vickicjd
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at New York New York. We enjoyed the room service which had a very nice choice of items and the prices were very affordable food was very good and hot. The room was quite nice, very cozy beds. We would definitely recommend to our friends and family. Thank you to all who assisted us!

Reviews.Title: “New York - New York .. so good they named it twice!”
Reviews.Author: Mat C
Reviews.Content: The hotel is ideally situated for those that like to explore. Clean, fun and great decor. Ample facilities such as dining and entertainment for all. Restaurants and bar selections were nice. The hotel rooms were clean and spacious, and the staff attentive and friendly. Book in, and out, was easy and efficient. The MyLife card is a must, although we are still a little unclear as to who does and does not use or accept it. We got to walk from one hotel to the next, and were pleased, for the price, with the New York. We missed the in hotel show ( due to SuperBowl ) but had heard, how great it was, from other visitors that had managed to catch it. Maybe next time. Overall, I would happily stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Spend a little more for the upgraded rooms...”
Reviews.Author: cya-bya
Reviews.Content: I really enjoy this hotel, and that is the only reason I will forgive them for the older rooms that we stayed in. I've been in the updated/refurbished rooms before...they are much nicer and cleaner feeling than the older room we had this time in the New Yorker Tower. That being said, the layout of our "old" room was great--ask for a corner room if you want lots of natural light--and the beds were comfortable. Apart from the room, I enjoy the gaming area; it is small enough to find your way but big enough to offer lots of options. The center bar was a fun place to play video poker and listen to some great tunes (be prepared for loudness though). I love the restaurant choices (9 Fine Irishmen is a must) and the overall atmosphere of the casino. Don't go for the pool (too small and boring) or the roller coaster (painful!) but do go for a fun, New York themed casino with lots of food choices, bars, gaming, decent rooms (go for the refurbished if possible) and a great location on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “RESORT FEE CASH GRAB”
Reviews.Author: MajorGee
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel for 3 nights - February 18 2012. We enjoyed our stay with no complaints, except one - the additional compulsory Resort Fee of $18 per day (payable on check out). The fee included, High Speed Internet (we did not have a laptop with us), Fitness Centre Access (we did not use), Daily newspaper (which you had to collect, so did not bother), Local and 800 calls (did not use), Domestic Long Distance Phone Call Rates of 10c per Minute (did not use). The only thing we did use was Boarding Pass Printing. So why do you have to pay for all this stuff you do not use? We did not get a reasonable answer from the Hotel...so not too sure we will stay here again but will definitely warn our friends!

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: enicolegillenwater
Reviews.Content: Nice rooms, reasonable prices. The lobby/casino/entertainment area has a cool vibe and a good atmosphere. The hotel mis-booked us, and we had to switch rooms after the first night (of 3), but were upgraded to a nicer suite, so I really didn't mind too much. I will stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good value, good bars, not so good clientele”
Reviews.Author: Dalsemer
Reviews.Content: A friend and I picked NY NY due to its central location, good bars (dueling pianos, and coyote ugly) and reasonable price. We were happy with our choice, but did notice the clientele was definitely a little less classy than even the middle tier hotels like The Mirage, or Caesars. The bars were great, including ROK, and we had a fun time. We ate at Aria and Encore, and both of those hotels were both several notches nicer than NYNY. I did use the nicely equipped fitness center,and the wifi internet, both included in the resort fee.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of hidden "hotel fees"”
Reviews.Author: Bill G
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the New York New York, Feb 13th-17th which we booked through Alligiant Air for a flight and hotel package, upon arrival we were told checkin is at 3pm (not a big deal) I understand that some hotels are strick about checkin times but I have worked for Radisson hotel in SD (now the Adoba) for 10 yrs and we always get you in early if rooms are ready. We checked our bags at the bell desk and went out sight seeing for a few hours, we came back and went to the desk to check in and were informed of a $15 a night "mandatory hotel fee" which was not mentioned anywhere when we booked the package, the fee gave you access to some gym (I dont work out at home why would I here?) a daily newspaper, (which i wasn't informed you have to come down to get, wireless internet, (we didn't bring a single item that had wi-fi and free local calls or something like that (Um..... dosen't like 85% of Americans have a cell phone now?) so I asked the lady checking us in, if we dont use it do we get a refund? "No its a mandatory fee" we were not pleased with this shady way of business. In the end, i've stayed at the Hilton (now LVH) and the Paris and both are great places and would recomend them for their honesty alone, We will not be returning to NY NY in the future, if you do good luck to you.

Reviews.Title: “Not 4 Stars”
Reviews.Author: katrohrs
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not a four star quality hotel. The room was nice enough and comfortable, but that was about all. There is a $15 a day resort fee that I objected to paying, but was told it was not optional. The fee was supposed to cover the pool (closed), a daily paper (did not arrive), WiFi (spotty), work out room and business center (did not use either). I would rather they just include this in the room rate. We were not able to resolve a billing matter at check out because the clerk was too confused about our charges. This is still unresolved. Restaurants in the hotel were good. We ate at the Italian and Irish restaurant. The stay was not unpleasant, it just doesn't rate 4 stars in my book.

Reviews.Title: “New York, New York Below Average”
Reviews.Author: SpendMoney2MakeMoney
Reviews.Content: Long story short, I spent 4 nights at this location and I was very unimpressed. I will go through all the good things first however because there were things that some departments did do well tho. Lets begin: House keeping, they were nice and prompt, everytime I asked for something ( twice ) they were able to get back to me pronto or was able to immediately assist me. Gym, was clean and organized. Wasn't as well equiped as one would have liked but it clean enough and organized enough to be satisfactory. Now for the not so impressive parts: POOL WAS CLOSED!!!!!!! I had found hair in my tub when I drew water! That's just disgusting! I realize other people were in the room before me but I don't want evidence of it... The room was not equipped with coffee machine and no mini fridge. I couldn't keep the things I purchased cool or fresh in the fridge because I was lacking one. Next thing is the oh so lovely RESORT FEES. When the pools down and out. The bathroom in the room was on the aged side but thats no excuse for the shower heads looking like Jack Frost was there the night before. There was calcium and lime scale all over it. I decided to just clean a bit of it off before I got any real shower pressure. Wind noise was something too, not a huge deal for me but it is there. I have to say tho, this hotel is rated at 4 stars. I can't say it feels like it by any means tho. Not to be rude, but its more like 3 ish. With all this being said, I guess I'm just a little irate because this was my birthday trip and I was told this place would've been a great choice. If you dont plan on spending much time at all than this could be an option for you. But for someone like my self who likes to get dressed as I go out, sleep a little bit and be able to enjoy amenities like the pool and have things like a bar fridge availble to me, this was more than a little bit disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Winith
Reviews.Content: Nice place, great area, good servicem superb room and excellent cuisine!!!

Reviews.Title: “Cowboy's in December”
Reviews.Author: Beauman1955
Reviews.Content: I stayed at New York New York between December 2 - 7th. During a huge international Rodeo contest. Never in my life have I've seen so many black stetson hats in one place. The custom made saddle's were the best. The Cowboy's/Cowgirl's are the best kind of people. Some had never been more than 20 miles away from home and here they are in Vegas. I bet they all had enjoyable memories of it all. The Hotel however was going through the process of changing out all the mattresses in all the rooms, so sometimes the hallways were a little crowded. By now everything should be changed out.

Reviews.Title: “Son's 21st Birthday”
Reviews.Author: Wooly1017
Reviews.Content: While we have been to Las Vegas several times we had never stayed at NYNY. We were meeting several family members and with everyones budget in mind we chose NYNY. The hotel was delightfully easy to get around with all of the Vegas life within easy distance. The rooms were an excellent value and the staff was super. We ate at all of the restaurants in the hotel and each one was very good. I would return to this hotel because everything in it was easy to access and didn't seem like it took forever to get from one place to another. The casino seemed smaller compared to other LV hotels, it was easy to navigate and didn't feel like a "maze" of gaming. We will be back to enjoy again!

Reviews.Title: “No Pool, No Hot Tub, No Microwave, No Refrigerator, No In-room Coffee”
Reviews.Author: PattiEAZ
Reviews.Content: I guess i just don't buy into the "Vegas" idea of "hoteling it". They don't want you to stay in your room, so they don't provide ammenities that are helpful while traveling. and even though the early February weather allowed for using a hot tub and sitting poolside, both were closed. I wouldn't stay here when it gets hot because there was just one little A/C vent way over on one side of the room way up high on the wall. We don't gamble, so we see things from a different perpective. The complex has several opportunities for "entertainment" if you're into drinking. We went to Rok(only open Thurs.-Sat.), a dance club meant more for the under 30 crowd, but early on, this late 50's couple was wowing the crowd with real dancing. A young gal grabbed my husband and I had to finally force myself away from a guy 20 years my junior after "dirty dancing" for 20 minutes non-stop! So everyone was accepting of our presense. and there were other older people there. The Irish Pub had the best food. The real homemade sausage made me break my mostly No Meat rule. Very good. We found a buffet in a hotel adjoining ours (by a connecting walkway) most to our liking. The Piano Bar looked boring(unless you drink). The Oxygen Bar was OK and included a mini back message. Coyote Ugly has no dance floor for patrons, just floor space for oggling the 2 female dancers on the bar at any given time. The dancers were repetitive. which got boring in one song. because nobody else was dancing. Too bad. because they do play good music of all genres, not just Country Western. If they had a big dance floor for everyone else, it would have been fun. NYNY is big and it takes up a lot of time going from your room (in one of the "towers") to one place to another, lots of walking. Bring everything you want in your room for your stay all at once because it is A LONG WAY back to the parking garage. We found the best afternoon entertainment in Paris before we went up to the top of the "Eiffel Tower". NYNY is Nothing great for shopping. We're going to consider just staying in a regular Travelodge or something next time, that has better ammenities. There's one right on the strip right in the middle of everything, walking distance to the Bellagio fountains and the MGM Grand David Copperfield show. don't buy drinks at the show. not even water. They'll charge you $12. extra!

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough stay in a sea of people and slots......”
Reviews.Author: RUMRZ_TRU
Reviews.Content: A bit more on the south end of the strip but nicely located. Clean, a bit dated yet good service. Anything along the 23rd level, you will surely hear the roller coaster rider's screams thru the night on the weekends. Beds are nice and the linens soft but the airflow wasn't so great. Choice of foods are abundant and priced the same as anywhere along the strip. The shops are more towards tourist trinketry. Easy access to the Deuce or taxis. Poor lighting in the suites.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: someone18
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week. Rooms were clean, but nothing spectacular. Dissappointing that a fridge costs $25 a night and no coffee machine in the rooms, but I guess they want us to spend more money downstairs!!

Reviews.Title: “Horsing around in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Red_and_Whiskey
Reviews.Content: Hola, me and my good friend Whiskey, would like to share our experiences of the wonderful Las Vegas. We stayed at the hotel New York, New York for four nights. It would have been 5 but we missed check in at JFK by 2 mins, so make sure you are on time ! Hotel room good size for us. Two queen beds - wow. Casino a lot of fun, very user friendly compared to some of the other ones on the strip. Piano bar duel was great the first night but got repetitive. Fish & chip shop great. Watch the calories though as you can really pile the weight on. You must go to the Grand Canyon by helicopter. Try and sit at the front on the way there. We flew with Maverick and it was such a laugh. Pilot is your tour guide. We went for a sunrise flight so landed and had a champagne ( sparkling wine!) breakfast. Friends got married at the Elvis Chapel while we were there - must admit I was impressed. Just make sure you get the tall Elvis and not the little chubby one. Hired a limo to take us to the chapel, then for another two hours run around. Quite expensive and would only have done it because it was a wedding. We bought a two day bus tour ticket. Automated tape which took away the spark of having a real live tour guide. We used the bus as our transport up and down the strip. Went to the Stratosphere and bought an all day band for $25. The staff were not the most friendly and didn't really expect us Brits to stay for the day and get our monies worth. Must admit not too impressed at all. Better places to see. If you want a bit of bling and sparkle then try Las Vegas, 5 days is enough. You must go down town and sample life there. Not as up market and showy but a lot cheaper and a real laugh. Freemont street is fun fun fun and live music on street corners. The New York New York is a safe and sound hotel. Try to avoid weekends as the price can easily treble. Breakfast is good there but not cheap. Go across the link bridge to MGM and order one breakfast to share - more than enough ! One piece of advice the hotels are very much the same inside so don't waste your time going round as it will take up the majority of your holiday. If you want the real architecture go to the real places - this is vegas ! They are set out as a shopping centre - the Venetian was a massive let down. Take photos of the outside, then do the casinos and the shows. In Vegas they know how to put on a show ! Everyone has to do Vegas at some time and you will have fun ! Have a look at our video to get even more info - Horsing around in Vegas !

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at the NYNY”
Reviews.Author: PLM2534
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from an 8 night stay at this hotel. We booked a Park Avenue Deluxe Room with a View during the Cyber Monday Sale. Overall it was a great hotel. Following are a few things we noticed: - Noreen Stewart was great to us and ensured we had a King Bed upon Check In. We didn’t get in until 10pm so we were a little worried, but we were in good hands. She gets a gold star for helping us out - The parking garage is really easy to park in (easier then the Valet in my opinion). Park on the 3rd floor near the cross over - The pretzel shop is the best place in the hotel for a snack. We stopped at Wal Mart on Tropicana for little snacks, soda and water. If you don’t have a car like we did, you should walk to Walgreen’s which is about a block away - There is a resort fee. We didn't mind the fee as most hotels in downtown areas or vacation destinations charge one. We used the internet each day and got a couple newspapers so it was fine with me. We suggest using the wired connection in the room as the wireless was hit and miss and much slower. - Food could be expensive so we ate elsewhere being as cheap as we are. Ate mainly with restaurant.com gift certificates or off strip. This is the best hotel for eating at In and Out Burger as it is right down the block off of Tropicana. Overall a great stay and I would stay here again. If you are wanting pure unadulterated luxury then pay triple the price and stay at a hotel that specializes in that. If you want a smoke free hotel, then book one. If you don’t want a resort fee, the book a hotel that doesn’t charge one. If you want a hotel in center strip, then book one. I guess what I am saying is do a little research in order to ensure you are booking what you want. We wanted a very nice hotel for the best value we could find and that is exactly what we got at a great price

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay with kids”
Reviews.Author: BarbaraB1961
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 4 nights with our 3 teenage boys (2 rooms) In January and we all loved it. The rooms were great and we had no problems with housekeeping not maintaining them during our stay. There is a wide range of restaurants in the hotel and the boys loved the roller coaster. The resort fees are a bit of a pain but we they are clearly shown on their website so we knew they were coming when we checked out! NYNY is in a great location on the strip and we all would recommend it as a great place to stay in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Weekend in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: Jason G
Reviews.Content: We booked New York New York based on an amazing deal they ran back in November for Cyber Monday. We had been to Vegas before so we were aware that NYNY was at the end of the strip which was alright and the only thing that could be considered a negative for this place. As we were checking in we asked if there were any upgrades available, they had a Players Suite available all weekend long as they upgraded us. We were amazed at the size of the room! 2 rooms with 2 queen beds a tv in each room, a two person hot tub in our room and one of the best views we could ask for! Our room over looked MGM Grand, the Roller Coaster and the strip! The casino was just what we were looking for during this weekend, there was action everywhere at all times however once you boarded the elevators you could not even tell it was so quiet! Alot of people wrote in reviews how you could hear the roller coaster from their room, as our suite faced the roller coaster we only faintly heard the coaster but it wasn't a problem at all considering most days it didn't start running until 11am. Overall this is a great stay in Vegas! You get what you pay for and NYNY is a great value. The rooms as spacious the casino is nice and you are still very close to some casinos (MGM Grand, Luxor, Excaliber and Mandalay Bay).

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: xtreme42
Reviews.Content: Stayed at New York New York Super Bowl Weekend and again Feb. 12-15. Both times there check was quick and painless. The rooms were comped both times. I asked for a upgrade the second time there( willing to pay) and was told that all the rooms were booked because of valentines day. Ok no problem, got a smoking room as I am a smoker. I usallly don't notice the smell because I am a smoker, but this time i did. My wife being a non smoker even found it more smelly. I went to the front desk the next morning too see if possibly was a different room that may be available and was told sure. We were able to upgrade to a nice newly renovated room with a great strip view. This was non smoking room which was ok. The girl working the desk was awesome and was unsure why we were told there was nothing available the night before when we checked in. I was very pleased with the service she gave us. I love the feel of the Hotel, it easy to get around , good mix of age groups and good service from all the floor staff. We will fefinetly be going back and recommend to anyone visiting Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Good value fun right on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: sleeplessUk
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for six nights for a family wedding. Rooms are reasonably sized, although our north facing one was quite dark. The casino and restaurants on the ground floor are much nicer than nearby Monte Carlo and Excalibur - not as dark and smoky and you don't have to walk right through the middle to get anywhere. Il Fornaio italian restaurant serves delicious food. Really good position on the south end of the Strip for access to all the major hotels and attractions and opposite end to the seedy bit at the north end. Rollercoaster is a lot of fun! Some housekeeping issues eg not collecting trays but the rooms are quiet at night and cleaned when you want them to be. Also, there is no buffet at NYNY so eating out can be more expensive - just go to one of the other hotels. Beware the resort fee of $15 a day however this does include free wifi access which a lot of the other hotels do not provide. All in all I was very happy with our choice within this price range, definitely gives you an authentic Vegas experience for those that cannot afford the Bellagio!

Reviews.Title: “Great Time in NY NY”
Reviews.Author: frankieb6024
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were there for a week. It was an awesome time. The check in was very quick and we were able to get into our rooms right away. The rooms were perfect for what we needed them for. MUST DO: Eat at Gonzalez and Gonzalez and try any margarita. Whenever we are in Vegas, we always go here for dinner and drinks. Their salsa and chips are great. Go to the Dueling Piano's in the Times Square Bar. Great entertainment and the beer pitchers specials were great. Being from NY, we felt right at home. The pool was great too. I just wish it was'nt stuck between the building and parking garage, but, what are you gonna do. The drink service by the bar was great, and you can also refill your margaritas from gonzalez for a decent price. Nine Fine Irishmen is a great place for a drink and to hang out in. Overall, I would not hesitate to go back to NY-NY on our next visit to Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Clean place, too bad about resort fees”
Reviews.Author: Maria P
Reviews.Content: Our hotel room was clean and had everything that we needed, The lobby is quite dark and uninviting. The biggest problem that I have with this place is their resort fees. There are other hotels on the strip that don't charge these and are just as good. The rollercoaster sounds can be heard from your room. Other than that, NY NY is an interesting place to visit/stay.

Reviews.Title: “Vegas virgins!”
Reviews.Author: kirstykirsty169
Reviews.Content: We visited last December for my husbands 40th birthday. We had never been before. We loved everything about the hotel and would recommend it to anyone. The room was kept clean, the restaurant staff were all amazing. Only complaint- we didn't win big! However we are coming back for my 40th birthday in October.

Reviews.Title: “great place, great rates, great staff”
Reviews.Author: superleeds14
Reviews.Content: For the price of this hotel, you simply cannot do better in las vegas. The rooms are excellent, the location outstanding, the staff so helpful and the ammenities second to none.... It is the best value for money on the strip and i highly reccomend it to anyone. Upon checking, i was unaware of the daily fee and the girl simply said, i should havbeen told but as i had not, she would waive the charge, she then give me a free breakfast at one of their hotel buffets ( we took the MGM grand and it was superb ) The concierge staff were wonderful and helped arrange many show tickets.. The place is all you could wish for and suits couples and or a guys/girls trip...

Reviews.Title: “It's about gambling not hotels”
Reviews.Author: AtlantaBusTravel
Reviews.Content: If you are in Vegas you may be there mostly for the gambling/entertainment. If you want to know about the hotel aspect here goes: The rooms are mostly larger than most hotels. The rates are attractive. At check-in they offered me a bigger room for less than the website rate. So if you go mid-week or think the hotel will not be full you may want to book a lesser room and hope for an offer for the room you want at a better rate. For me the upgrade was half what the website promotion was a few hours before check-in but some classes of rooms were full. Other points: -No coffee maker in the room -Only one type of pillow and it was too thick for me -$15 resort fee -Free paper if you pick it up at the gift shop -not delivered to room. -Free water in the exercise room (which is in the spa) so don't buy it in the hotel -You can hear to roller coaster if your room is on the front side of the hotel -The food was good -Heavy charge if you use the ATM in the casino -Exercise room is small and 2 of 5 treadmills broken, about 15 cybex machines, the tv on the treadmill did not work. It was full at 7 AM. No true elliptical machine. But I guess not a lot of people use the exercise room.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap stay, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: quintenhig
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at New York, New York, and it was pleasant. I was able to book my room for $69 a night, plus the $10 or so miscellaneous charge. The rooms were large and comfortable. It was at the end of the new strip, so it's a pretty good walk to the larger new casinos. I'll probably stay there again on my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “VERY Impressed with NY-NY • Highly recommend it!”
Reviews.Author: TD2000
Reviews.Content: I recently attended a Vegas bachelor party for my nephew. It was attended by a dozen guys mostly in their 30s, along with the groom's 2 uncles and his dad. We had a great time and no we didn't see any tigers in our bathroom! I always thought of NY-NY as a hotel for the younger set. The best man selected this hotel and this 64-year-old went along. I was very impressed with the friendliness and professionalism of the staff and enjoyed the over all ambiance of the hotel. I didn't find one staff member who didn't say "Hello. How are you?" They went out of their way to make you feel welcome. Every portion of my stay was first class! Check-in was smooth. My room was clean and spacious. All the other guests were warm and welcoming. (Did it rub off from the staff?) Being an ex-Long Islander, who now calls the Sunshine State home, I miss New York food. Boy! Did I enjoy the many restaurants and shops in NY-NY! I especially enjoyed the New York deli and so did my brothers-in-law. We stopped in their a couple of days and each time I had a Rubin- stacked with corned beef. It was GREAT! One section of the main floor- just off the casino- is decorated like a little old New York. There are "streets" that you walk along past a variety of shop and stores all decorated like the Big Apple. They even have parking meters outside of the shops. Very cool! I stayed an extra day, so I could bet on the NFL's AFC & NFC Championship games. I'm a non-smoker and didn't enjoy hanging around the Sports Book inhaling everyone's cigarette smoke. Instead, I watched the games in the nearby Sports Bar in NY-NY, Since they serve food it's a non-smoking establishment. You also can't beat the hotel's placement on the strip. Its right on a street corner, so you don't have to walk way out of your way to cross the street. And right across the street is a liquor store, so we got a little break on the price of our beer and booze. We consumed our adult beverages in a suite in NY-NY, where the groom, best man and a few other guys slept. Every night we went up to the suite and had a pre-party before heading out for the night (I won't tell you where, in case the wives are hip to this website.) I highly recommend New York-New York. I will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great casino, good rooms, great experience!”
Reviews.Author: osucaglehead
Reviews.Content: I made yet another Superbowl weekend trip to Las Vegas and stayed at New York New York. I've stayed here many times in the past and know that while the rooms aren't "top of the line," I would have a great experience. Check in went very smoothly, and I had originally requested a room that was "higher than the 8th floor." I was pleasantly surprised when the man checking us in told us we would be on the 28th floor. The gentleman was very nice and explained everything we would need to do to call and get our room number a few hours later. For some unknown reason, we also received two free rollercoaster tickets (a very nice suprise as I've never once been on the rollercoaster in the 6 years I've been staying at NYNY). Once in our room, we were elated!! It was another corner room just off the elevator (the hallways at NYNY are very long, and you can end up walking an eternity to get to your room) and it had a spectacular view of both the strip and the western mountains. The room itself was incredible; new and very comfortable mattress on the bed; nice soft pillows; clean hot tub. The bathroom, however, needed some serious updating. The whole bathroom needed gutted. The shower needed new tiles and caulking, and the counters and mirrors needed replaced. I figured this would be the case so I was not disappointed. We ate two meals at Gonzalez y Gonzalez restaurant, and were very pleased both times. The casino was great as always, except they replaced my favorite 3-card poker table with two black jack tables. These black jack tables, however, were always a 5 dollar minimum, and I quickly learned to love them!!!! The two dealers we had on the last day, Sonny (from Laos) and Geraldine (from England) were absolutely fantastic and an asset to the casino. They had great personalities and made us want to stay and gamble our money away!!!!! We wandered around to many of the mlife affiliated casinos, and I can say without a doubt that I will continue to stay at New York New York.

Reviews.Title: “New York in Vegas is pretty sweet.”
Reviews.Author: denisenah
Reviews.Content: As with all things in Vegas, New York New York was an escape to one of my most favourite cities in the world; and lived up to it too. The staff were efficient and helpful. Check-in was fuss free. I stayed in the Century Tower, where the most basic rooms are, I believe. Because of the structure of the hotel, it's a long winding walk to your room. You could try requesting for a room near the lift if you hate walking after a long day of sightseeing and shopping. As with most hotels in Vegas, the ground floor had a casino. There's never a dull moment on the floor. Plus, the streets made to look like real New York City added a really fun touch to the hotel. There's always something to do, eat, go to a piano bar, watch a Cirque show, play some slots and of course, take the rollercoaster. If you are looking for a great night view of Vegas and are game for some action, take the rollercoaster! Remember to take the hotel coupon booklet which gives you half off your 2nd ride on the rollercoaster, along with other great deals. Room-wise, it was spacious with the most comfortable bed I've slept in ever. I believe the Century Tower is newly renovated. The air-con is a little erratic/extreme though. I believe it operates according to motion sensors so it turns off automatically if it doesn't sense any movement in the room. Just set the temperature a little colder before you sleep so you don't wake up perspiring. All in all, great fun hotel on the quieter side of the strip. But with the 24hr shuttle bus a 5 minute walk away, it doesn't really matter. (:

Reviews.Title: “poor cust. service - they hung up on me”
Reviews.Author: jason s
Reviews.Content: Got my credit card statement after a 3 day stay and noticed a $70.00 resort fee. Called to find out what that fee was for and all they could tell me was that it was a resort fee. I asked what the resort fee got me and they could not tell me and then just hung up. I called the next day and talked with someone else and they too just hung up on me. I called my credit card company and got the fee reversed but this was a inconvenience for me. I have stayed at many hotels in Vegas and would never go back to this one. If you stay here make sure you check your credit card statement.

Reviews.Title: “Bang for your buck!”
Reviews.Author: R_CubedTexas
Reviews.Content: Stayed here to celebrate our 10th wedding anniversary. We have visited Vegas many times and was married there. Front desk personnel was fantastic. When I asked if there was any upgrades available, she went to speak to a manager an ended up giving us a zuigat suite for just a little more. It went very quickley. The room was fabulous! 1200 square feet of luxury. We loved the spaciousness and cleanliness. The bed was very comfy and the ammenities where suffice. Downsides? Room did have some wear and tear. Towel holder coming out and wall paper pealing on the corners. TV's where still CRT. Did have Bose stereo though. It was very clean and neat. Did not use the jacuzzi tub, but would have loved too. Just ran out of time. Saw Zumanity there and had a great time. Very funny and entertaining. Heed all warnings! Not for kids or the prude. Tried a couple of the restaraunts. The burger bar was good but overpriced. The staff was great. Al Fornios was great and so was staff. Food was good quality, a little dissapointed in the calamari. Sevice was excellent. Nathans hot dogs upstairs was.....well a hot dog. No complaints. Had a late night steak dinner at Americas and the food and service where great despite it being 2 am. The breakfast buffet (which is the only buffet offered) was good, a little overpriced. The only thing I was really dissapointed in at NYNY was the casino staff. They seemed very cold and bored. Not very helpfull or willing to assist. Believe it or not the best "casino" time we had was at Imperial Palace. The dealers where very fun and helpfull. We went there every day. Dont reccomend staying there though.I will stay at NYNY again, just not gamble there.

Reviews.Title: “low quality hotel”
Reviews.Author: larry j
Reviews.Content: the room decor has low taste. heating system is poor. whether too hot or too cold. restaurant is small. sports betting room is small and not inviting. lobby small stores were gear to children. dancing girls behind the black jack tables were very attractive and professional.

Reviews.Title: “NY”
Reviews.Author: jsrelkford
Reviews.Content: Very clean. Check in staff very efficient. Good choice for price.

Reviews.Title: “Our family's favorite hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Joyce S
Reviews.Content: Check-in was a breeze, thanks to our lovely receptionist (I do not know her name but she has long, fabulous nails and blonde hair--thank you!). She told us she would match our preferences as best she could and we were happy to be granted two rooms facing each other (one with a king and the other with two queen beds). We were on a smoking floor, but it did not smell! Our rooms were spacious (madison ave. deluxe rooms) and well kept. We did not hear the roller coaster at all. There were so many restaurants and diners to choose from, and there's a food court (which I think is 24hrs) right across the street. We like to walk so we did not mind walking to each hotel which is like 3 min. between each one. It took about 10 min. to walk to Planet Hollywood; 15 min. to Bellagio, and 25 min. to the Venetian. The thing that set it apart from the other hotels was free wireless internet in our rooms :) It is really difficult for me to think of something to complain about. :) It was a wonderful experience and my family always says it was our favorite of the 3 hotels we stayed at.

Reviews.Title: “New York New York in Vega”
Reviews.Author: PimentoQueen
Reviews.Content: Very nice room and very good service. I would definitely stay there again. The restaurants and amenities were also nice. Hotel food is always overpriced but New York New York was not out of line for Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “New York New York”
Reviews.Author: bracoman
Reviews.Content: Just back from 5 nights at New York New York, location great. Chin chin in the casino area was very good and reasonably priced. Room overlooked Monte Carlo, not thr best view but we chooses a lower rate. Overall pleased with our selection

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: laur3njayn3
Reviews.Content: Loved NYNY. Lovely rooms and we had a great price using our MGM reward card. We had a park avenue deluxe room and were lucky to get a strip view. Pool area was ok, bit shady in the afternoon and like most places in Vegas on the weekend - it was packed. Great location and nice casino area. Would definately go back!!

Reviews.Title: “Good clean hotel and awesome location!!”
Reviews.Author: Shelly S
Reviews.Content: Our friend recommended this hotel to us, since she has stayed all over the strip even in some of the fancier hotels, and preferred The New York New York over the rest. Check in was fast and easy, we went with our friends and realized upon check in that we were 10 floors apart, so we just asked if it was possible to be placed closer.. no problems at all. The receptionest moved our room to the same floor as our friends no questions asked which was really nice. The room was clean and the bed and pillows were super comfy!! One thing we noticed right away was that this casino was also way less smokey than all the others we had been in which was a huge plus!! Really liked that there were a lot of places to choose from to eat, depending on what you wanted... from fast and simple meals to fancy big meals. Loved the location of this hotel. We really liked that you could walk across the bridge to the MGM and have access to lots of things right close!! Would absolutely recommend this hotel and when we make another trip to Vegas we will definately be staying at the New York New York again!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Experience”
Reviews.Author: Brad G
Reviews.Content: Our group of 11 for our wedding stayed here in January. We had 3 teenagers with us and selected the NYNY because of the roller coaster and arcade. We were all very pleased with the hotel and experience. The kids had enough to do to stay busy, casino and bars were good, food was nice. Very pleased with the service people gave....all quick to serve and friendly. Our first room had a musky smell and they quickly moved us to another room with no questions...only apologies. Nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “This is Vegas”
Reviews.Author: PeterSOnHoliday
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last summer after having a good look at trip advisor and really enjoyed our stay, we short listed 3 hotels and just rolled up and priced all 3 on the day of arrival and NYNY turned out best value, the hotel is everything you expect about Las Vegas in your face, it has everything you could wish for on site and you can enjoy a great night out without leaving the hotel, the location is good, well placed on the strip if you fancy a stroll to see the sights and who wouldn't. Our room was really nice and had a great hot tub just as you entered which the kids found fantastic, the roller coaster passed the window was also quite different. We only stayed 3 nights before moving on but it was good value. Only one down side was the rather brusque attitude of the croupiers towards our children when they stopped to watch a spin of the roulette wheel when we were walking through the gaming area to the exit - what are you supposed to do, put a bag on their heads?? I guess some people love Vegas and some hate it, but I thought 3 nights was great, just enough time before moving on to other great attractions on the West side.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, smelly, do not stay here”
Reviews.Author: love2travel253
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at NYNY for a conference and was incredibly underwhelmed by both their service and their facilities. We arrived at around 11 am, there was a very long line to check in and only one person working at the desk. ONE person! We waited in line at least 30 minutes and were very annoyed by the time we got to the desk. Our room was not available for a few more hours so we decided to look around in the casino for a few minutes. Everything smelled of smoke and looked like it hadn't been cleaned in quite a while. The same was true when we went to our room. Everyday the only thing that changed when the room was cleaned is the bed was made and we got fresh towels. Nothing was wiped down, swept, trash was not thrown away, and dirty dishes were not taken. We will definitely never stay here again and I would not recommend it to anyone. There are many other places on the strip that looked much nicer and were not that much more money.

Reviews.Title: “always good,always clean”
Reviews.Author: BRIAN D
Reviews.Content: have stayed at new york new york for the last 4 years and we have always had clean rooms with a good view, check in is always quick and friendly, not many kids like some of the others on the strip.great location and close to the other mgm properties. no buffet but all you have to do is take the walkway to mgm

Reviews.Title: “New York in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: buzzboles
Reviews.Content: I love New York New York because all of the entertainment, shopping, gaming, and restaurants are all in one place. Most all casino's that I go to have gaming in an area and the other areas are on a another floor or area. New York New York is so great that we only left it one time to go to the Mirage to see Terry Fador. GREAT SHOW. The ticket office at New York New York was really great to get me great same day tickets to the show. The lady at the window was so very helpful and courteous. Got a great deal on a spa tub room and that is really a treat to relax in. I have stayed in other Casino Hotels but New York New York is my favorite.

Reviews.Title: “Not a great place to gamble.”
Reviews.Author: Danyelle135
Reviews.Content: The hotel it's self was fine. Simple clean rooms and good food. As for the service in the casino - TERRIBLE. In four days of playing the casino, I was only offered a drink twice. I was offered drinks at even the crappy casinos down the strip. I'd like a drink while blowing my money. Will not be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Good”
Reviews.Author: janfouroneone
Reviews.Content: Everything at NYNY is perfectly good. Good price, easy check-in & check-out, nice room, comfy bed, lots of dining choices, fun casino & Zumanity was great. The pool was closed for the time of year we went, but the fitness & spa rooms were well equipped.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Traveler_S44_12
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a 3 night stay. I stayed in the basic (Park deluxe?) room in the New Yorker building, and it was a good sized room. While the hallway was musty and dated looking, the room itself was very clean, with a comfortable bed, and lots of hot water with good pressure (this is important to me). Hallway noise could be readily heard from inside the room; otherwise it was relatively quiet.The elevator wait was always short- a minute or less. The staff itself was very friendly- the front desk, housekeeping, store and kiosk salespeople, etc.. We ate at 3 of the restaurants, and the waitstaff was always very good, especially the sommelier at the Il Forno. The roller coaster and pool were closed- this may be standard in the winter. The location is quite central to the Strip- good for those who like to explore by walking.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Paul'sTravels
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 6 nights and enjoyed the visit. The hotel is ideally located at the south end of the strip next to the best casinos (avoid all hotels north of Wynns, they are all run down). The room was large, clean and had a great view away from the strip to the amazing landscape surrounding Vegas. The casino is relatively small and doesn't have the best atmosphere. But the restaurants are good, with a good range for all budgets. I'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: han-pan89
Reviews.Content: I've been to Vegas before, so I knew what the casino was like for NY, NY, I enjoyed staying at this hotel, staff were helpful and friendly, they didn't seem to rush with check in which was all we wanted them to do as we'd been travelling for over 24 hours. I asked for an upgrade but all the king size rooms were taken so we went for another one, we had a strip view without having to pay anything extra which was good! Make sure you go and watch the duelling pianos! The two things I didn't like was the bedding- we had rashes! and the resort fee, next time I'll be staying in one of the many hotels that don't charge you. I still love Vegas and can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “We will be back”
Reviews.Author: Alanna S
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel - great for families. We were suppose to stay 3 nights but extended for another 3. Two negatives - actual checkin and extension with receptionist was very slow and the smoking throughout the hotel. Ask for a nonsmoking room. Sometimes had to leave the casino/lobby area due to the smoke. Room was clean and spacious not that we spent much time in the room. Great atmosphere throughout the hotel. Our daughter LOVED the roller coaster which is incorporated into the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL, GOOD PRICE”
Reviews.Author: lkhappytraveller
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here in April 2011. We had previously done a walk-through, and really liked the atmosphere. We booked a Spa Suite, and were very surprised by how nice it was, and roomy. We were here for a family wedding, and our family couldn't believe how nice our room was, or how great the hotel was.
