(They were all next door at Monte Carlo-YECH!)Room service was on-time when we had it, or we just trekked downstairs and went for coffee and some sort of breakfast pastry. Our room was spotless, and we used the jacuzzi every day. We loved the wandering of New York "streets", and found the food good wherever we ate. The piano bar was fabulous in the evenings, and we found that this hotel attracted young to middle-aged people. (Just our type!!) We discovered when we checked out that we got comped for our most expensive night, and had an extra $50. + bucks to use in any restaurant. We have since booked here again for this April, and received 3 free nights. We've googled and seen in person about 70% of the hotels in Vegas, and this one impressed us the most. All in all, very clean, good service, helpful staff and good prices. We give this place a 4.5 star for the average person (not rich!!) staying here

Reviews.Title: “That's really cool place”
Reviews.Author: Tyrone B
Reviews.Content: i really suggested at my homies to take a look at this place, we payed a lot, but hey, you gotta have cash for the best!

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs”
Reviews.Author: Sue G
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel on Jan 7th. I was really excited and the whole stay was a really special one on a super long road trip. We had a great time and despite a very long wait on check in though there were not many people in the queue we had a great night. However, I woke up the next morning with around 30 bites. We told the receptionist and filled out a form, went with security to the room and helped with the report, which all took about 45 minutes in total. We then left. I do not normally make a fuss about things and am very understanding so it was not until we left when I was itching and itching, I could not take off my coat as it looked awful, it kept me awake all the next night and I just felt pretty gross. I have since tried to contact the hotel and have had no response which I find absolutely disgusting. I was told someone would be in touch. We have not even had a refund on the one night we stayed. Really unimpressed.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic from start to finish !!”
Reviews.Author: natalien
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the Hotel New York New York after a short taxi ride transfer, i couldnt believe the size of the hotel, speedy check-in with friendly staff. Room was very clean,spacious and comfortable.we was on the 24th floor and had no problems waiting for lifts.Vast amount of restaurants and bars in the hotel with a selection of different prices.Huge casino with waitress service for your drinks. This is the only hotel i have stayed in Las Vegas and had a great party atmosphere, we looked around all the hotels and with a lot you didnt get that vibe like you do with this hotel. Great postion after reading some of the reviews about food/plates been left in the corridors ,yes this did happen over the weekends but they are soon cleared away and its because Vegas is a none stop party place which is open 24 hours a day.

Reviews.Title: “An OK Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Daba2010
Reviews.Content: The good: - It's on the strip - Weekday rates are very low - Easy parking - Rooms and bathrooms were clean - Front desk were helpful, fast and courteous The bad: - It's an old hotel (don't expect the "wow" factor) - In need of some upgrading - Gonzales & Gonzales Mexican Restaurant, the worse Mexican food I've ever eaten! Save your money! Overall, NYNY is an OK hotel if you are not expecting too much. If you don't plan to stay in your room the whole day (or in the same casino area) it's a good deal. Since it's on the strip, you can easily walk down to other interesting hotels. But Vegas is Vegas!! You go to have a good time regardless of where you stay at!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: Ron M
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights in July 2011. To get a room in 34th floor, we had to wait until 4:00PM, but it was worth the stunning views. The room is quite big and the 2 queen beds were great! A lack of a minibar and a place to put our hand washed laundry is the only thing I can think of that was missing in the room. The pool is nice but for fun only - after all, you're not comming to Vegas for swimming... The rollercoaster on the hotel's roof is nice but overpriced (14$ for a ride). There are plenty of stores and restaurants in the hotel, it is almost like a maze. It is close to the main attractions of the strip, so walking is recommended...

Reviews.Title: “Nice Time”
Reviews.Author: Colo01
Reviews.Content: Recieved two free night as part of my M-Life card. Arrived early and checked my bags in with the Bell desk. Checked into my room about 1:00 pm They will check you in early if the room are ready. If rooms are not ready regular check is 3:00 pm. There was a small line at check-in and took about 20 minutes to get to the counter. Asked me if I would like to upgrade to a bigger room I declined. I was thinking since my room was free I would probaly get the airport view. Told about the resort fee of $15.00 a day. (You really don't get much use of the resort fee items in the winter time since the pool was close and I don't work out. Roller coaster was closed also. Don't know why.) But you get free wi-fi and a news paper if you want to pick it up. I knew of the fee before I arrived so no big deal. Stay in room #1980 Good size room and to my surprise a partial view of the strip.Window looking out was skinny and tall and at night darkens so outside lights don't shine so bright. View was of the front of the hotel and the MGM across the street. Overall room was clean and in good condtion. Bathroom was in good shape and clean. There was one item with the hot water, It took about 10 minutes for the hot water to reach the room. And twice I was in the shower enjoying the hot water when it went cold.That woke me up. Took a few minutes to go hot again. Not sure if every room had this issue. Bed was good for sleeping. Pillows were large. If you need skinny pillows you have to ask. Could hear the people next to us on my last morning. They have a door connection the room if needed. Hotel room safe didn't work But I didn't need it anyway. Location of this hotel can't be beat. All major hotels are withing wakling distance. Plenty of places to eat on site with all price ranges. Try the fish and chips place in the village $18.95 for the family meal. Can feed at least four people. All hotel staff was friendy and cocktail waitress were plenty depending on your location. They do need to vaccum the halls better, but overall a good stay and would stay again. Join the M-Life players club if you plan on going a few times a year. There comps are good and worth the time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place Great Atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: Traval2
Reviews.Content: Stayed at New York-New York Hotel with my husband and early 20's son and daughter in early January. We all loved the great atmosphere of the hotel and casino with lots of different restaurants and bars which had entertainment. The restaurants at which we ate were very good and we enjoyed some nice meals there, including Mexican and Italian. After visiting other hotels on "The Strip", our son & daughter thought I had chosen well and NYNY appealed to them more than the others. We all enjoyed how the hotel was set up as if it were the streets of New York. We stayed in a room overlooking the roller coaster but did not hear any noise from it. However we spent little time in our rooms. We had two rooms and both were very roomy, clean and serviced well. We all thought the beds were very comfortable. Check in was quick and the hotel staff were very helpful. There were some good places for breakfast in the hotel. One was an all you can eat buffet very reasonably priced (possibly $14, but not sure) and there was a great selection of food both hot and cold. Another was the All American restaurant where we enjoyed a hot breakfast at a great price. We also used the room service for breakfast one morning as we had an early pick up for a tour and again it was very good and arrived on time as requested. I thought the price of $61 per room which included taxes but not the resort tax was very good. I did not see the pool as it was winter and of no use to us. I would certainly recommend this hotel for its value and atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “We had a great time”
Reviews.Author: Eli C
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel 4 nights in Dec,rooms were big and clean, very good restaurants in the hotel premises.Staff was professional and helpful. Good job,thanks.

Reviews.Title: “Vegas Run”
Reviews.Author: ges757
Reviews.Content: On december 1st my husband and I went to LV to run the Santa's race, a mere 5k instead of the Marathon this year. We always try to stay at different places on the strip as we visit at least twice a year. We often found ourselves in NY NY for the bars and entertainment, so we decided to try the hotel. Our room was adequate for our stay. Really who stays in Vegas for the room? The bars are fun and the restaurants were very good and moderately priced. The one drawback was an inexpensive place for breakfast. We would have to leave the hotel to find one. Again no big deal. We have no rwal complaints about anything or anyone at the hotel. Everyone was pleasant and helpful . We would stay again and recommend the hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Cameron F
Reviews.Content: I don't gamble but I was in Las Vegas for a convention and we stayed at this hotel. It was a decent hotel!

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay!!”
Reviews.Author: travelisor
Reviews.Content: It was mine and my husband's first time to Vegas, so we took extra care to research and book a hotel. New york, New york was our choice, and we loved our stay there! Its right on the strip, so close to all the attractions. I loved the roller coaster ride! One gets to see the entire hotel exterior on the ride, plus the usual adrenaline rush! The casino is great and so are the restaurants. The room service is a bit slow. The spa is nice and relaxing (especially after an all night out party!). We stayed in the Empire state building wing, and the room was good and comfortable. The views from the window were amazing!! I loved the overall feel of the place. For anyone looking for a real flavor of New York city in Vegas, this is the place to be...

Reviews.Title: “Lots of fun!”
Reviews.Author: LoMohr
Reviews.Content: Great atmosphere, fun people, good variety of restaurants & games in the casino! Zumanity by Cirque Du Soleil is here as well & that was a fabulous show! Would definitely go again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: housunny
Reviews.Content: Great hotel to stay in Las Vegas. Definitely worth for the money.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel great value for money”
Reviews.Author: 513IslandGirl
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located on strip and is well near to the action of Las Vegas, The Rooms are beautiful and the service is excellent. The spa is great too. Highly Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “awesome trip”
Reviews.Author: kegs605
Reviews.Content: nice room with a jazcuzzi tubs, we had a nice view of the strip, the rooms are clean, everyone is helpful and nice.

Reviews.Title: “What a pit”
Reviews.Author: Monarch B
Reviews.Content: Dirty, threadbare and garish. There are so many nicer places to spend your time in Vegas. We couldn't get out of there fast enough. It's head-poundingly loud, the wait staff are rude and the whole place needs a good cleaning. Just.. don't.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for first timers!”
Reviews.Author: MrsKSmith1010
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at New York New York for our first time ever in Las Vegas. The room we had was great and the casino was just the right size for us. The staff was very pleasant and we had no issues with anything. It was a little far from the middle of the strip, so we would probably stay in a different hotel on our next trip. One thing we did not realize before going was the $15 resort fee that is added to every day, therefore instead of paying $80/night (or whatever it was supposed to be), we paid $95. We didn't remember seeing that information on the website. All in all, we would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Wildchild2538
Reviews.Content: Located on the Strip and close to the action. Affordable, clean hotel with good restaurants. Only downside is, once you're in your room you can hear the hotel roller-coaster, over and over... but it's bearable. Been there twice and love it!

Reviews.Title: “Travelled in July”
Reviews.Author: caroline7444
Reviews.Content: If your in a budget then I say. Go stay at New York Hotel & Casino.. but if you want a nice ambiance and feel the luxury of Las Vegas then dont stay here. The service was very average, its just like staying at a MOTEL. But it is a great location, the view was awesome!.. I suggest it to the Party Goers who will not use the room but to sleep and shower....

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: JSchawl
Reviews.Content: This was my seventh trip to Las Vegas and second time staying at New York-New York. The hotel/casino provides a fun atmosphere with lots of shops, bars, and restaurants to choose from. The Piano Bar is a complete blast and the sports themed restaurant is a great place to catch a game and a beer. Their food was also very good. NY-NY is located in a great area on the strip with easy access to other fun casinos. However, this part of the strip can be a little bit more expensive than other areas. If you're looking for cheap drinks, you won't find any in this area. Walk a few blocks to Hooters for cheap bottles, or make your way to the middle of the strip to the smaller casinos for deals on drafts and mixers.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, with some upgrade options”
Reviews.Author: MrsSmirnoff95
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 3 nights during the month of May, 2011 for my husband’s B-Day. Bell service was polite, but it took forever to check- in. Our room was on the 31th floor, so the view was unbelievable. Nice view of the Strip, and the mountains. The room service was good, same with customer service. Have to say, HATED their shampoo and conditioner we had to go to the local store and get better quality products, but it was not a big deal. I would go back there at any time.

Reviews.Title: “Casino Fun!”
Reviews.Author: sushifarmer
Reviews.Content: We had a ball! Won $2,700 at the New York , New York Casino! We had been at the Ugly Coyote bar and had margaritas, and needed to go to the bathroom. So, on the way back, we saw that big giant slot machine called New York Diamonds. There was a lady in front of us, said I am going to go down to $50 and then you can have it. So, she did and we spun it about 6 times. It didn't make any noise and I was clowning around when I pulled the lever, and we had a crowd around us clapping when we would hit $15. It was a $1, $3 max machine. When it come up with 2 NEWYORK DIAMOND BARS, and one red 7 Diamond, the machine stopped working, and we thought we broke it! LOL Looked at the message and it said ATTENDANT on the the way. So, .............I said, Dave I think maybe we won something. and yep.......I put my glasses on and read the fine print and it was 9 times the red 7, which was worth $300.. WHOOPEE! The people around was clapping and hooting for us! lol.............Never had that happen in our life! lol They counted out 27 $100 bills. Too much fun. We never bring back money! lol

Reviews.Title: “truly disappointing”
Reviews.Author: vantravler
Reviews.Content: We did not stay at NY NY but rather went there one night wanting to find some fun and perhaps some music, good food, a lounge to relax etc. There was an Irish pub that had duelling pianos but they wanted $15 pp to just sit and get a table. Way too expensive for a mediocre pub style atmosphere, and it wasnt even busy! So we found a round bar in the centre and had a couple drinks, they had some DJ music that was lively and there was good people watching... The servers were lethargic though, it was very strange...hard to get them to notice us (and we sat right in front of them at the bar) Then I overheard them talking that some hookers were on the other side of the bar and what to do, we watched the situation unfold...pretty funny but I found it odd that was so difficult for them to overcome, it was Vegas! I'm sure thats not unusual for them to have THAT situation. Don't work as a bartender if you dont LOVE it!

Reviews.Title: “Really good hotel”
Reviews.Author: DreamsTapatio
Reviews.Content: I was here with my family for a two nights stay (Jan 1- Jan 3) we have really quick check in, just have to wait 15 minutes to get our rooms at 1pm the check in is at 3 pm. Awesome, clean and spacious rooms, nice views to las Vegas strip, excellent staff, everybody was kind and helpful, nice casino area with a really good aroma. we definitely stay here in our next stay in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Fine hotel, but not special”
Reviews.Author: KWCRB
Reviews.Content: First, I think choosing a casino/hotel in Vegas is a matter of personal taste. After visiting a lot of casinos for meetings as part of CES, I wish I had booked at the Wynn (quieter, brighter, new, elegant, windows to the outside, great restaurant selection). NYNY was fine - fine service, fine room, comfortable bed, decent room service (that was pretty speedy actually, but then they never came to retrieve the cart - the whole night and next day - even though I called to tell them it was in the hall), but there was nothing special. The casino floor is loud and dark with high black ceilings. The shops and restaurants that are located on the ground level are fun in that they recreate the smaller streets of Little Italy and other neighborhoods south of Houston. The shops and food located upstairs are trashy. My room, while fine, could not have been located further away - it was almost comical how many turns I needed to take every time I exited the elevator to get back to my room. On the plus side, it was an end unit, so no neighbors to one side.

Reviews.Title: “They walk into your room”
Reviews.Author: K M
Reviews.Content: I am staying in this hotel now. I spilled something on my shirt and was in the process of undress when the housekeeping person knocked and walked in!!! He said they do a room check to make sure the room was done, I have never been so embarassed. I asked management, they said that this their policy all hotels do this. I have never had someone walk in like that. so just make sure your door is locked AT ALL TIMES!!

Reviews.Title: “No”
Reviews.Author: Michel2011
Reviews.Content: Just for the fun of it, two friends and I went to NY NY 1/14-1/16/12. Used research from tripadvisor to make the decision to stay there, and was not disappointed, but....a few things that may help someone else. 1. This is not a four star hotel. More a three, three in a half. What's the difference? Linens, pillows, towels, soaps (cheap), hair products (cheap), bathroom size, faucet, shower head which was corroded, thermostat, room furniture outdated, dings and dents through out, etc. -stayed in room 1228, which is the most basic room. Four star should start at the most basic room to the nicest. 2. Great location! Walk over a bridge to MGM. Within five minute walk of at least 10 other resorts. 3. If given a complimentary buffet...Go to Aria's!!! Wow! Too much to choose from. Well prepared, delicious. Prime rib alone was worth it. $6.00 unlimited mimosa's! What!!! 4. Casino....needs more black jack tables. Every one was full most of the time. Center Bar in the middle of the casino could've been cleaner ie..ashes and sticky. Yuck. Terrible Kettle One and tonic. Much better at MGM's Centrifuge bar. Must've been the tonic... -Gamble at Centrifuge rather than, Center Bar. For .25 cents a hand vs $1; they're free, you get better drinks, better service, cleaner, prettier people, and the drinks are free! 5. Get a Mlife Card if you don't have one, and charge everything to your room. We did and stayed for free! First time ever did that, and it really paid off... 6. Chin Chin restaurant was great! Had a spicy black bean seafood noodle dish. Off the chain! -wanted to charge to our room, but couldn't because check-in was at 3:00. Told to call a 1-800 number to have added, but M-F and business hours. We checked in on a Sat... 7. Pizza place down stairs was aweful! Don't go. It's all about the sauce! and theirs tasted cheap. NY style pizza wasn't cooked properly. Gooie crust. Told the manager. She didn't care. Go to the one upstairs, I think NY Pizzaria. Great! 8. If a beer fan, go upstairs to 24 I think it was called and get a flight of draft beers. 6oz glass of 6 beers of your choosing for $19. Get them one at time or they will get luke warm. 9. Pretezels upstairs were the best I've ever had. 10. Rok is the smallest most expensive club in the world. Seriously I thought I was on an episode of House Wives of Orange County. Random, I know but bare with me. They hand out cards with discounted admission written on them. Wait in line.....to pay $20, regularly $30 for maybe a 1300 sq ft club, which most is roped off for VIP (what a joke), which leaves a small dance floor of couples and 40 somethings. Spend your money at another club no matter your age or marrital status. 11. Roller coaster looked cool, but ran out of time. Overall this is a beautiful, cool, fun, money making machine. If your looking for a three star hotel with four star fun, in short walking distance to everything, I highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT”
Reviews.Author: ABusinessGuy
Reviews.Content: Got a suite for our one night Honeymoon.. Couldn't ask for more....

Reviews.Title: “LOVED EVERY MINUTE OF OUR VISIT.”
Reviews.Author: mammacol71
Reviews.Content: You really wouldnt have to leave the hotel, its amazing. 9 fine irish men, what a pub. great atmosphere, lovely food ( not much choice, but still yummy) theres a lovely pizza place down stairs + nathans hot dogs + burgers are lovely too . we did an awful lot of walking and had blisters on my blisters lol. so take comfy shoes. theres a few trams in near by hotels, use them :) we saw cirque de soleil "Elvis" was fab if u like trapese and dancing, we loved it. you really have to go to every hotel, as they all have some thing special to offer. we went to see bodies (not for the faint hearted tho) human bodies with the skin off, bit gorey. that was in luxor. the excalibour did a lovely buffet, not the prettiest place but lovely food. we had a lovely one in ceasars place, very fishy (lots of fish dishes and fancy dishes.) didnt like alot really as my hubby and me are more plain eaters. lush desserts tho. theres so much i could go on and on, free if any one wants to ask questions. have a great time, we did :))

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good”
Reviews.Author: enoeno
Reviews.Content: Hi, I was at NYNY in October 2011 and I think, as far as Casinos go, it was fairly nice. I'm not a big gambler so I don't focus on that kind of thing, but the steakhouse was great and the adult themed Cirque show was great (cozy and funny). The hotel is at the far end of the strip so it is a bit of a hike, but it would be a bit of a hike to walk all of the strip regardless of where you started. The pool was closed in November, so you had to walk across the street to a sister resort to swim, not really a big deal. You're permitted to smoke in Las Vegas casinos. I never knew that, kinda gross, but not really NYNY's fault. I'd stay again but probably won't because of the many places I haven't stayed that I would like to try. I'd say go for it. Remember that you have a roller coaster around the whole casino, out side your window, regardless of your room. It wasn't a problem for me though.

Reviews.Title: “Love NYNY!”
Reviews.Author: Adriansmum
Reviews.Content: We stayed at NYNY from Jan 8/12 to Jan 13/12. We traditionally stay at the Excalibur and are thoroughly satisfied with them, but the offer my husband received from NYNY was just too good to turn down, so to mark my 50th birthday we gave them a try. I LOVE NYNY! Our plane arrived in Las Vegas at 9:30 am and there was a limosine waiting for us at the baggage claim. We reached the hotel at about 10:30 and managed to check into our room immediately in the VIP lounge. We were given the Roosevelt suite on the 43rd floor of the Empire Tower. Gorgeous! This suite actually has its own doorbell! Ensuite bathroom has a large jacuzzi tub and separate shower, and two vanity sinks. In the bedroom, a very comfortable king size bed, big poofy pillows, comfy large chair, flat screen tv, blueray player and drapes that were operated by a switch on the wall as well as large armoire closet space, robes, slippers and a safe. In the livingroom, we had a bigger flat screen tv, blueray player, sofa, wing chairs, dining table with 4 chairs, desk area, wet bar that was stocked with soft drinks and water daily, and another half bathroom. There were 5 telephones in this suite, including one in the bathroom! The only amenity missing was a microwave which would have been nice to have since the food portions are so large here that you often come away with doggie bags. The view from the livingroom overlooked the MGM Grand, Excalibur and out to the airport. The view from the bedroom looked up the strip towards Paris. I could have lived in this suite for the rest of my life! After checking in and getting settled we met with friends for my birthday lunch at the MGM Rainforest Cafe. After lunch we returned to our suite to find a room service tray just inside our door with a bottle of champagne and a cheese/fruit/nut platter from our hostess, What a nice touch that was. Our first meal here was at America. We liked the food so much, that we had many more meals here. I believe it is open 24 hours also, which most of the eating establishments are not, many closing at around 10 pm. We also ate at Fulton's Original Fish Frye, Nathan's Hot Dogs and Ben & Jerry's. No complaints at all, and there are so many other choices, surely something for every taste. The casino was good to us too. Nice variety of slots and not so big that you spend all your time walking around aimlessly searching for your spouse. The only thing I might mention is that in the early morning hours, about 3 a.m., it took 20 minutes for a slot attendant to notice the service light on my broken machine. Not a lot of floor staff on at that time I guess. The location of this hotel is nice. We took the free tram from Monte Carlo next door up to the Bellagio to save a lot of walking and by doing this we managed to cover quite a few casinos on the way back to NYNY. We were given a late check out on our final day and kept the room until 5 pm. Upon checkout we had a zero balance thanks to the fantastic comps. Not even the dreaded resort fee that everyone here complains about. The limosine appeared on time to take us back to the airport and so ends our time in paradise. The NYNY hotel will definitely see us again, hopefully sooner rather than later. I'm keeping an eye on our mLife account for the next great offer!

Reviews.Title: “New York in Vegas great : )”
Reviews.Author: mummykt
Reviews.Content: On arrival at the hotel the entrance and lobby blew us away. Check in was quick and the staff were friendly and welcoming. Our room was clean and nicely furnished the bed was huge ( defo bigger than a uk kingsize) we had paid extra for a strip view and that's what we got. The hotel is situated at the south end of the strip so you need to be prepared to walk to get to some of the landmark hotels, but having said that the bus services down the strip are cheap and very efficient. Our only complaint is that our room cleaner seemed not to have a good relationship with her duster so our room was left undusted for our week stay. To sum up a lovely hotel in a good location would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic christmas!!!”
Reviews.Author: Louise A
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the New York New York hotel for 9 days over the christmas period with my boyfriend and we thought it was brilliant. Check in was fast and we was only on the 5th floor which was a bonus. The hotel I thought was fab, loved the theme and thought it had a great atmosphere. We didnt really eat in many of the restaurants within the hotel as we wanted to explore the strip. We did eat breakfast and dinner in America though and I thought the food was average and the service very slow. We are not big gamblers so cannot comment that but the casino I thought had a great vibe. We would sit at the central bar and have a drink and just people watch. Our room was lovely, think we stayed in a Madison room. Big King size bed which was very comfy. Nice big flat screen and all the wardrobe space you could want. The view from the window was of a wall but you could see the roller coaster as it was about to drop which was good but we wasnt really bothered about the view as we didnt really spend alot of time in the room! Thought the location of the hotel was good, was close to everything. Yes its at the bottom of the strip but easy access via monorail to all the other hotels or the bus, we sometimes even just walked as the weather was very pleasent for December. The monorail I think was $12 for a 24 hour pass which I thought was very reasonable and I think $7 for a 2 hour pass. We didnt do many tours but we did do the coach trip to the Hoover Dam which was amazing to see. It was $63 each for a 5 hour day. Well worth the money if thats something that interests you. We also caught the bus to freemont street which is well worth the trip. You can get a Corona for $2 in any casino, plus the light show when it gets dark is great. We ate in a lot of restuarants on the strip. Didnt have one bad meal except at Circus Circus. We stopped here for lunch one day, big mistake! Our favourite meal was christmas eve, we went to the stratasphere "top of the world" and it was an amazing experience. Quite expensive but the food and the views were worth every penny!!! We didnt really try out any clubs as walking around all day we got very tired plus dont want to waste time in my hotel with a hangover in a place like vegas so we cant comment. We did go to coyote ugly in our hotel on our last night. At first I thought it was a bit cheesy but after a few beers it really is a lot of fun. They really get the crowd going. All in all I absolutely loved this hotel and loved my holiday and would definately stay here again!!!

Reviews.Title: “dated, comfortable, good restaurants”
Reviews.Author: msdowl
Reviews.Content: In Vegas for a conference. I chose NYNY because I'd heard it was one of the nicer hotels. The bathrooms were just okay. Shower doors (yuck) with aged caulking around the tub. Toiletries are brutal. Bring your own! Light switch was filthy. I had to use a Kleenex to switch it on and off. The beds are comfortable and we had two closets - a plus - both with full-length mirrors. Free wifi, nice. Gallaghers, their steak house, was excellent. I was not enchanted by the stores in the casino and I love to shop. It's close to everything so that's a plus.

Reviews.Title: “My Favorite Place to Stay in Vegas!!”
Reviews.Author: dhdcf
Reviews.Content: My husband and I frequent Vegas anytime from once to three times a year. In the past we used to stay at the MGM Grand due to the free comps and size of the casino. In 2008 we decided to head over to the NYNY due to a large event at MGM. We've been loyal ever since. The Rooms: We've received comp'd rooms since 2009 and typically try to obtain a Spa Suite but have stayed in everything from Park Avenue room to the Marquis Suite. The Spa Suite is my favorite and has a large spa tub in the room. The Tub fills up quickly but drains slowly. In the past the room always had a ton of soaps and personal items but on our last trip (December 2011), there was only a bar of soap on the tub. They've definitely scaled down on the little things. The rooms are always clean. The beds are okay but not as comfortable as the beds at the MGM. The Casino: We always play at the Let it Ride table. The dealers are typically fantastic and have a great upbeat attitude. The cocktail waitresses are very sweet and very efficient but be careful during shift change--you may have to wait a bit. The Restaurants: We really don't come to Vegas to eat so have only tried two of their restaurants at NYNY. We've had breakfast at the Chin Chin and it was very gross. The food had a strange taste to it and the buffet was lacking. The America restaurant is always delish! The burgers are great and you can't go wrong with anything on the breakfast menu. Their Mac N Cheese is to die for! Also, I've ordered room service many times and it's always hot, fresh, and delish. As long as I continue to receive comps from this casino, I'll continue to stay and play here.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: MLinMA
Reviews.Content: I usually try to get a good deal on a 4-1/2 or 5-star hotel in Vegas, but since I was visiting during the Consumer Electronics Show I had to "settle" for New York, New York. I really like the character of this hotel, outside and inside. It's within reasonable walking distance to other resorts on the strip for dinners, shopping, etc. My room was the perfect size and nicely appointed. I'm always worried about noise in Las Vegas, but the room and halls were very quiet. I really like that the food venues are reasonably priced. You probably pay $2-3 less for a latte here than at the more highly rated establishments. I also try to do a little bit of recreational gambling and feared a 4-star hotel would have higher table minimums than I'm willing to pay. Much to my surprise, there was a $5 blackjack table for me to play at. Check out was very easy. All in all, I was very pleased with my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: teddybearelspeth
Reviews.Content: The room was a bit dark but clean and fresh so overall great place to stay - wifi a bonus and views from 32nd floor towards airport and over the strip and rollercoaster were stunning. All staff, including in the restaurants(plenty of choice)and shops were friendlyand helpful.. This hotel is within walking distance of most things though the bus down the Strip is also useful. It is also near the airport and we found it cheaper to take a taxi than the airport shuttle bus

Reviews.Title: “Good Location for Strip”
Reviews.Author: Brins9
Reviews.Content: Went for one week. Had Room with two singles. Good in house entertainment. Gallaghers Steak House Excellent. Pool very small but did find it helped to meet people and chat. Busy restaurants but breakfast was excellent. Overall good value if you just want a room to crash down in. Great position on strip joins MGM by walkway. Roller Coaster bit noisy at times but did not interfere with sleep. Rooms kept clean

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: 979paul
Reviews.Content: Our first time in NY NY Hotel & would stay there again. The rooms were very comfortable & we did upgrade to one with a jucuzzi which was a nice touch. We ate in several of the restaurants within the hotel & all were to a very high standard. We could not fault any thing.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel for kids”
Reviews.Author: CaribbeanCanadaQueen
Reviews.Content: this is a nice hotel..when i stayed here i found that it was out of the way from all the action. and the smell of perfume/cleaner was so strong in hotel to try to cover up smoke i think. gave me a major headache. its a nice resort but its more geared to children and families...i would have to get an amazing deal to go back. dont worry if you have already booked..you will love it

Reviews.Title: “Make sure you get what you booked”
Reviews.Author: VDL_10
Reviews.Content: We booked a king bed, non-smoking room for four nights at New York New York over New Year's. We paid extra for a "view" room on top of the incredibly high New Year's room rates. When we checked in, we were given a smoking room with two queen beds and a view of a parking lot. When we went to the concierge, we were told that we would have to come down the next morning and wait in line to request a room change. To their credit, they were incredibly busy and we did get a room change the next day, but I was very disappointed about the lack of non-smoking rooms. Once we had the room mix up resolved, the rest of the stay was quite nice. I recommend the burgers at Broadway Burger bar, but if you are Canadian, you may want to split a burger as the portions are quite large.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for the price”
Reviews.Author: snuffycats
Reviews.Content: The rooms are clean, the internet works. The place is not worn out. Excellent value for $45. Don't forget that there is a $16.80 resort fee on top but still a great deal. I enjoyed being near and within walking distance of everything I wanted to see. The airport is a few minutes away and very easy to get to. The roller coaster was neat to watch outside my room but some people with young children might find it a bit noisy.

Reviews.Title: “central location and great facilities”
Reviews.Author: Yorke M
Reviews.Content: Our family (2 adults and 2 children - 20&15) stayed 2 nights. Hotel had everything onsite that you needed including complimentary parking. Room was a good size but did not have a small bar fridge. We like having a fridge to put stuff like water and fruit in to snack on. Wi fi was great. Our room overlooked the rollercoaster but noise was never an issue.

Reviews.Title: “New Years Eve Bridge Bash”
Reviews.Author: perrygrin
Reviews.Content: Went over to Las Vegas for my daughters wedding on New Years Eve.We had done a bit of research before about NYE and realised that its much better to plan ahead what to do on NYE because all the hotels seem to charge to get in for their celebrations and ticket prices increase the nearer you get to the event.we took the plunge and opted for the New York New York Bridge Bash. It cost about 150 dollars each but boy was it worth it.NYE is a really big deal in Las Vegas with hundreds of thousands filling the streets on the night. At the Bridge bash you have exclusive access to the Nine Fine Irishmen pub which has a live band playing all night and this leads you out to the replica Manhatton Bridge which is elevated and overlooks the Strip.This means that all the crowds in the street are watching you partying and they are dancing to your DJs while you are out of the crush enjoying a four hour free bar in a fantastic atmosphere.You definately feel your where its at and the atmosphere is fantastic with go go dancers and bead throwing staff adding to proceedings whilst you wait for the midnight fireworks spectacular which again you are in prime position to see.you dont have to worry about the cold either as ther are an abundance of heaters on the bridge.All in all the best NYE ive ever had.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: Shirtgirl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a conference the first week of January. Very good price for the room. Not crowded this time of year. The check in was quick and courteous. The room was large and appeared to be newly refurbished. The bed was very comfortable. The flat screen TV was nice. Wireless internet available. Lots of restaurants to choose from in the hotel. Can't comment on the casino, since we are not gamblers. It was a short walk to the tram to take us to the hotel where the conference was being held. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Love this Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: tuffy26l
Reviews.Content: I really like staying here. I knew this was where I wanted to be after I ran my half marathon. The beds are comfortable and clean and I love the casino area as well. The restaurants are great at the NY, NY. I love everything about it!

Reviews.Title: “Loved New York New York”
Reviews.Author: sanjnik
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 days , the room was small but adequate. Plenty food options, loved Chin Chin for vegetarians. You can substitute tofu for all entries. The staff was always friendly, specially the dealers in the roulette tables. Always had a waitress taking drink orders near the slots or the tables. It is well connected to MGM and Excalibur, we saw 2 shows in MGM. Will go back.

Reviews.Title: “Average is spot on.”
Reviews.Author: TriNurse
Reviews.Content: I booked NY NY as our hotel for a little getaway in early December, I was running the Rock'n'Roll Half Mary, my better half wanted to squeeze in 2 new golf courses (Cascata, Shadow Creek) before the end of the year and oh yea we were getting hitched! Oh BTW, Vegas is down right cold (30-40's) in early Dec. Our flight was delayed and we did not arrive at the hotel until 8PM, we had been traveling all day and just wanted to check in and relax. There was only one couple ahead of us but we waited in line a long time, as there was only one person checking in customers. We waited patiently only to find they did not have any of the rooms we booked available, so we both thought ok then upgrade us. We are then told they will upgrade us but they only have smoking rooms. There was not a single non-smoking room available for us that night. I told the front desk that it was crazy to think I booked this hotel based on a trip arranged around me running the Vegas strip and they could only offer me a smoking room! The room was ok, not horrible due to the smoking but not in my comfort zone. We only received clean towels/room cleaned when we saw the cleaning lady (who was very nice, but still) and asked. The restaurants were very crowded and they needed a few more Starbucks on site - the line was always at least a 20 min wait. This was my first trip to Vegas and we has a jam packed 4 day stay so we did not spend much time in the room. When we return next year, we will stay at another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very central location”
Reviews.Author: CotsCouple
Reviews.Content: We visited Las Vegas for a family birthday celebration and none of us had ever been before so were unsure of where to book. Luckily we booked New York, New York on the recommendation of our travel agent. It was the perfect setting, central location. Las Vegas entails enough walking and so I am so glad we were close to everything. The piano bar is great, although seems to play the same songs every night) but still great fun and great way to finish off an evening in your own hotel! If I was to go to Las Vegas again, this would definitely be my first choice of where to stay!

Reviews.Title: “as good as always”
Reviews.Author: gscullyf
Reviews.Content: La mejor relacion costo/calidad/Beneficio de todo Las Vegas

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms for the price!”
Reviews.Author: mildtowild2009
Reviews.Content: This was our first time staying at the New York New York. There were some issues upon check in. But the room was nice, clean and with a good view, Food and gaming choices were good. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “So very comfortable!”
Reviews.Author: mariejason
Reviews.Content: After transfrerring from Circus CIrcus as this was not my ideal stay. I was so pleasantly surprised by this hotel. The new York theme was carried throughout and we felt like we were in manhattan! Rooms were so clean and perfect for our little family, beds were amazing and restaurants were great. I am so glad I picked this hotel as there are so many and it was so overwhelming. The roulette table is a must hahaha!

Reviews.Title: “Good priced hotel for the location”
Reviews.Author: shesi
Reviews.Content: The New york new york hotel was nicely positioned on the strip. There were walk ways directly into the MGM Grand, Excaliber & from there a monorail into Luxor & Mandalay bay. We decided this hotel was right for us based on cost & we were not disappointed. The room itself was a nice size, with an amazingly comfortable huge sized bed. Arm chair, dressing table & an adequate wardrobe space, large flat screened tv (with minimal tv channel options, but you don't go to Vegas to watch tv!!) A dated but workable bathroom & a big walkway area. The rooms are fairly dated but very clean. Our room was 836 situated at the back of the hotel & although it did look out at the MGM Grand we also had quite loud generators that generated all night! We also had the roller coaster that went whooshing past from 9am! (which is fine when you haven't just got in! lol) The hotel has a nice size casino. The bars in new york that we used were "Coyote ugly", "The Nine Irishman" & "Times square bar" Coyote is fun but messy, The irish bar was real fun with an amazing Irish band & dancer & the times square bar had dueling piano's which again was quite a novelty. The lovely Italian restaurant closed at 11pm, The pizza place closed at 4am, but there was a 24 hour restaurant in the hotel so you could get anything you wanted at any time. Check in & out were painless. It really was a great hotel that met all our needs.

Reviews.Title: “A great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Blue629444
Reviews.Content: Overall New York New York is a great Hotel. Here is the breakdown of my trip........ PROS -Great Casino with a great selection of games and slot machines. One of the best parts of the Casino is the Pit Bosses. For dedicated gamblers out there this is a big plus. They know what they are doing, and how to treat the gamblers with respect. -An amazing selection of bars to choose from in the hotel. I must recommend Coyote Ugly. I consider that to be one of the best bars in town. The girls dancing on the bar work very hard to makes sure everyone feels welcome. -The quality of the rooms is great. They are very well furnished, and all the rooms come in room safes. A big plus for anyone bringing valuables to Vegas. Also the free bars of soap and shampoo that come with the room have funny jokes on them which is a nice touch. Very nicely done bathroom, and nice beds. -The overall decor of the hotel they really nailed down the New York theme. -Great Location, very close to many other famous properties like MGM, Excalibur, Monte Carlo, Luxor, Mandalay Bay, and City Center. -A large arcade on the property for the kids. In fact its one of the largest arcades in Vegas. -A must is the roller coaster. If its your first time in Vegas its well worth the 14 bucks to ride it at least once. CONS -The pool at NYNY is below standard by Vegas standards. -No Buffet -No Food-court, all they have are overprice eateries in the Midway area. -No Poker room

Reviews.Title: “Watch those hidden charges”
Reviews.Author: John W
Reviews.Content: We stayed at New York New York in Las Vegas. We did not charge anything to the room so we just left the key. On our next credit card bill we were charged $15 plus $1.80 tax per day per room. The airlines promo page stated in the hotel area: Hotel accomidations (including taxes). New York New York said it's a resort fee. TAX??????? SCAM????? By the way, the room was OK. I did not feel very welcome there. The food especially at an Asian restaurant was C ap! I do go to Vegas several times a year and am very happy with the hotels in the Harrah's partnership.

Reviews.Title: “Like the city...New York New York has it all!”
Reviews.Author: Tony R
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a deluxe Park Ave. room...was very spacious, clean, and had decent views of the strip. Check in was easy, but checked in with the Mlife card at the vip check in. Casino has all of the gaming choices you'd expect with the exception of poker. There is no poker room but easy access to MGM which has a very good poker room. Could usually find $5 games in the am and they would grandfather you in if the table min went up. It did get to be rather chilly in the casino, so suggest you wear something warm if you intend to be at the tables a while. Cocktail service was fast and friendly. NYNY has many dining options sure to meet everyones needs. Easy access to MGM, Tropicana, Excalibur, Luxor , Mandaly bay. Rates can vary so shop wisely, join the players club for reduced rates, comps. Overall a great choice in hotel with a nice vibe and plenty to do..check their website for all they have to offer!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay for the price.”
Reviews.Author: brijul329
Reviews.Content: My wife and i have stayed at New York New York twice in the last year, the latest for a Jimmy Buffett concert and have enjoyed both trips. The rooms have been good and we found the food at the various restaurants very good. The dueling piano bar is awesome and we had a great time in the casino, meeting people from all over the world. Definitely will stay there again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelnJoanna
Reviews.Content: By far this is one of our favorite places to stay in Las Vegas. How is very nice and the rooms are great. Decor was very nice and recently updated. We had the Park avenue room, but have also stayed in the Players suite and it was awesome and had lots of rroom to entertain friends. The choices in fun and dining are numerous. We were drawn each evening to the Times Square bar for the dueling pianos. We love the 9 fine Irishmens pub and the eatery America. The food court is awsome so many choices, burgers, dogs, pizza(our favorite)mexican food, bagels and I could go on and on. So much more than a hotel and casino. It is like you really have been to the big apple. So much excitement, you won't want to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for New Years”
Reviews.Author: Billie8086
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the New Yorl New York over the new years weekend and had a great time. The rooms could use some updating but the beds and pillows were very comfortable. The Bridge Baahd they through for New Years Eve is a blast! Plan to go back again next year!

Reviews.Title: “No Running Water!!!”
Reviews.Author: Mark K
Reviews.Content: I'm a frequent visitor of Vegas being from Southern California and have stayed at New York New York on several occasions. For the most part they have all been worthy of the price I have paid and the stars they are rated. To be honest, I'm not one to write reviews for things that are anywhere near satisfactory, only exceptionally good or exceptionally terrible. So, take this review as you will... My wife and I checked in on 12/21/11 and where checking out the next morning at 4 am for a 6am flight out of Vegas. Upon waking up we came to realize that we had no running water. After calling the front desk we were told that a letter was left in our room warning us of this scheduled maintenance (11pm-6am, almost the entire time we were in the room) and they would be "happy" to bring bottled water to our room. As polite as they seemed at first, I almost said thanks, until realizing that they knowingly sold us a room that didn't have running water without warning us of this fact at check-in. I then asked for a refund and they said no. After a couple minutes of me explaining my situation and asking to use another room that had running water to shower in they said they would refund my $15 resort fee, but "that is all we (they) could do". The whole resort fee is also BS when the pool is closed in the winter anyway, which I also explained (Normally I'm not one to complain about that due to the reasonably low room prices in the winter, but while I was on a roll I figured why not). I have had better service, more reliable basic utilities, and had more honest hosts everywhere from hostiles in SE Asia to truck stops in Mexico for <5% of the cost. In a lesson of fairness, I should note; they did return the resort fee, as promised. And to those NYNY hotel staff whom I spoke with that morning and the manager who thought leaving a letter without requiring notification at check-in was a good idea... I didn't have to add this relatively small detail; I just did because it is the right thing to do. With that said, We will not be staying at NYNY again and will sincerely consider not staying at any other MGM owned properties (google M-life for the list) in Vegas again. I also apologize to all that had to smell me on the airplanes during my travels! In fact, they probably won't be frequenting the NYNY either anytime soon!

Reviews.Title: “rok las vegas”
Reviews.Author: asaindoll
Reviews.Content: i went to this place on friday december 30,2011 around 2am the security checked my id and i thought i put my purse into my bigger bag but i didn't. turned out it fell according to some guy that he says he saw the security take my purse, since i noticed my smaller purse was missing 30seconds after they checked my id, i noticed my purse was missing while i was still in front of the security...which makes me to believe that they picked pocketed me if anything. its not about the money but my id, they took away my chance to show my friends a nice holiday in vegas and at my fave spot out of all of vegas for that matter even, new york new york, i just feel very disappointed by my most fave hotel in vegas

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: 4scoobyscoobydoo
Reviews.Content: We were in Vegas for Christmas and stayed at NYNY. We got a very good deal for 3 nights stay and were booked for a non-smoking 2 queens room. When we got there, it was not available. But they gave us a king non-smoking room with an additional rolled-bed. It worked out good for our family. The bed arrived in minutes, was very quick and the guy the came with the bed was very friendly. Mattresses were firm. The air quality was better than other hotels that we stayed. Overall, the room was very spacious and clean. The staff were very friendly and courteous. Nice small shops We're coming back in May and thinking about staying here again. We usually stay in a different hotel every time we come but this time, we might break the "rule" :-)

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: AlanandTracey
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a great 4 days in Las Vegas staying at this hotel. It is in a good location and is very clean. Beds are the comfiest ever. Bedrooms are a little dark and bathrooms are small but overall no complaints. Overlooked roller coaster but it did not keep us awake. Ate breakfast every day in Excalibur hotel next door as all you could eat and drink buffet is only 15 dollars and was good value for money. Had nice evening meals in Denny's and in Freemont Street and had fantastic meal in Outback Steakhouse opposite hotel. Bought 24 hour ticket for Deuce bus which was a bit of waste of money as buses were crowded and we could not get on. Took the Westcliff Airport bus to North Premium Outlet direct and only cost 2 dollars each way. Fantastic bargains there. Went to Cirque de Soleil Michael Jackson which was out of this world and also did David Copperfield which was good but drinks prices at MGM Hollywood Theatre are extreme-11 dollars for a water!! If you get the time, visit Big Elvis at Bill's Gambling Casino. He is on infrequently but is very good and it's free. We went to the Ri Ra pub in the walkway between Mandalay Bay and Luxor and was completely ripped off. Charged over 7 dollars for a pint which actually came in a half pint tumbler and also charged 2 taxes plus an entertainment tax cos someone was singing at the back of the pub. Do not go here- there are far nicer and cheaper places to go for a drink. The upstairs bar in the Venetain does Happy Hours every day from 3-9 and beers are only 3 dollars and wine 5 dollars and it has a lovely atmosphere. I will not waste space or time writing a review about the appalling flights with Virgin as I will be taking this matter up with them direct, just be aware it is the worst plane and journey I have ever been on and I have visited lots of cities worldwide over the last 2 years and used various airlines. Try to get to Las Vegas by any other means or else just don't go!

Reviews.Title: “A surprisingly nice hotel for Vegas's South Strip”
Reviews.Author: CharityK13
Reviews.Content: My family met in Vegas for Christmas and made the South Strip the first part of our stay choosing the NY, NY based on its reasonable pricing and interior decor. The rooms were nicely appointed with comfortable beds and clean bathrooms. Rooms are conveniently located right in the heart of the hotel unlike other resorts where rooms are segregated away from the casino and food options. We enjoyed overlooking the casino floor from the bar near Coyote Ugly and found the location perfect for enjoying the roller coaster and hotels on the South Strip.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: MathewLovestheSea
Reviews.Content: Great sleep quality-mattress were very firm as I needed. The room service was great too. Was living on a non-smoking level and there was really no traces of smoke smell unlike other hotels on the strip. The air quality in the casino is also better compared to TI. THe hotel is also located very centrally on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel”
Reviews.Author: jadecallisto
Reviews.Content: We were able to check into our room straight away which was great considering how busy it appeared to be that day. There was a small wait to be seen at the counter but that was OK. I did not like the fact that the lobby and restaurants are "smoking". By the time we got to the lifts we stunk of cigarette smoke. It was also due to this fact that we ate room service most nights. The room service menu was varied and reasonably priced and the food was fantastic! I liked the process of picking up the dirty trays - you just simply ring the number specified, give them your room number and within 10 minutes your dishes were gone! I think its a great service that other hotels need to adopt! Our room was very large, clean and comfortable. Didn't like the fact that there was no fridge. Bathroom was also spacious, clean and well maintained with a large supply of toiletries and towels. We had a problem one night where we had no hot water. Maintenance came up quickly but simply told us "you need to run the water for longer". I had already run it for over 5 minutes. Subsequently that night as we had tickets to go and see"O" we had to have a cold shower. The problem seemed to have resolved by the following night. Great location. Easy enough to walk to the strip. Shame we did not have time to ride the roller coaster! they did have internet available but very very expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Great Attractions on Site, Good Rooms!”
Reviews.Author: riva9129
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights right before New Years Eve 2011. We were on the 3rd floor in the Chrysler Tower. Room was good, not great, no complaints(except for no exhaust fan in bathroom). Only small downfall was we had a view of a wall, but it wasn't a big deal because we were barely in the room. Oh yead nice big flat screen in room, huge closets, ironing board, nice big bed. The hotel has a GREAT RollerCoaster on top which is perfect for adults or kids. It was $24 for an all day pass which is a good deal, lines go by very fast. The numerous restaurants inside of the NY Hotel were great Chin Chin (great chinese/sushi), the Americana (great all around food open 24 hours which was impressive plus very nice bar), NY Pizza was great for grabbing something quick. There was a nice Italian place and Gallagher's steakhouse which looked really nice. Upstairs they had a Coyote Ugly bar which opens a 6pm, they have a Ben & Jerry's, a massage place, the pool was relatively small for vegas but clean and it was open even thou it was between 50 - 65 degrees daily. TIP walk directly across the street to ABC Store for BEER, soda, water, they also have just about everything u can think of for very cheap. Big 24ounce Miller Lite, Coors Lite, Bud products for $2.99 each. Can't beat it beers are $7.50 for 12 ounce Miller lites at the bars. I WOULD RECOMMEND STAYING ON THE HIGHEST FLOOR POSSIBLE. I heard that the roller coaster keeps you up. This is not true it closes at 11:30pm and starts back up at 10:30am. You won't even hear it. GREAT HOTEL...also go to MGM Centrifuge bar very fun

Reviews.Title: “Should have been better”
Reviews.Author: VangeInternational
Reviews.Content: This MGM chain resort is relatively new, but I have stay in motels with bigger rooms and bathrooms. Check in after waiting in a long line meant still waiting till the room was ready, there's no bar fridge, so no where to keep your own things cool like insuline. Toilet paper is like single leaf rough, and the towels average size no bath towels for this grand resort. We paid extra to be on the strip side and even though on level 32 you'll hear screams every 3 minutes of people on the roller coaster. The " high speed wifi" cuts out more often than not and the exhaust system is audible all night as was the baby crying next door for its feed around 3 and 5.30 am so walls thin, very poor design and build. Doors are thin as you can hear people's conversations, laughing and carry on in the halls. There idea of gym work out is one set of lifts and many rooms feel like a mile from them, so get ready to walk. I disliked this hotel and I wouldn't recommend it unless your a large family, good for kids. Be prepared to not be known as a individual but as a number, room service tray stay 48 hours in the hall and there's a generic check out message on the phone each day as they just couldn't be bothered to only send to actual rooms checking out. Service poor

Reviews.Title: “Go somewhere else!”
Reviews.Author: travelfam61873
Reviews.Content: I rarely post a bad review, however this is an exception. The rooms are not clean, over-priced and not Vegas-worthy. The New York New York charges for EVERYTHING and surprised they don't slap and charge for entry down each hallway! The rooms are in bad need of a good cleaning and updates. Save yourselft and book somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but confusing with all its elevators”
Reviews.Author: ciaocat
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during Christmas weekend. My parents stayed here as well because we got a really good deal. With our hotel stay we got a coupon book of restaurants deal within the hotel. Il Fornaio is the best in term of breakfast in my opinion but lots of great food shops. The room was nice and nothing fancy. The only thing I hated was how many elevators in different areas. It was so confusing because my parents had to go to the Empire elevators and I was in another elevator on the other side. I guess once I understood how it work it was fine but I wasn't a fan of the setup. Overall, I would probably stay here again if I got another deal but I guess I wouldn't be loyal to this hotel since there are so many other great hotels on the Strip.

Reviews.Title: “Low end Vegas-suite 2234”
Reviews.Author: barcodeVegas
Reviews.Content: Granted the hotel is popular and I am sure it has amenities we missed. We stayed here on Christmas day, a tradition we started years ago. The room was clean and quite large but old and in need of an update. None of the Bose radios (3) in the room could access a radio signal so the music we listened to was via the old school CRT televisions. I thought this odd, why have these superior sound systems in the room if they are useless except for CD's.(who has those any longer) The TV's were CRT (old) the remotes had "sleep" buttons but pushing them did nothing. The TV in the bedroom was a 19", very small by today's standards. Other non-working appliances, the lights on either side of the bed did not turn off. There was no wall switch to control them (tried them all) and the switch on the base did not work either. I unscrewed the bulb in one and unplugged the other one. There was a Jacuzzi tub in the room, another perk gone wrong. It was hard to get in and out of the Jacuzzi tub. There was a three-foot high wall with no step up to it. The rest of the room was okay and the living room was large and comfortable. The windows were tinted green making picture taking virtually impossible and one window, dual pane was fogged on the inside. We had a view of the roller coaster, part of the strip and the roof of the casino. One good thing was that the room was soundproofed and the coaster could not be heard. The bed was comfortable but we have had that at a motel 6. This room in my opinion should be upgraded to the standards we like to tout here in Vegas. I took some pictures but did not get all that I wanted to display here. We had a discounted room I would hate to see what they would charge full price, for something like this to tourists.

Reviews.Title: “I'm Not Queen of the Hill....But I Love New York New York”
Reviews.Author: 492HappyTraveler
Reviews.Content: Every December I love to drive to Vegas from L.A. for my birthday and although I've stayed in a lot of Vegas hotels over the years---from the Mirage and the Monte Carlo to the MGM Grand---I still keeping coming back to New York New York. I just like the vibe here and its location on the Strip (plus the fact that it's super close to the freeway off Tropicana Ave) makes it the perfect vacation spot for me. This year I went with my boyfriend and we had a blast at the poker tables. (I even won a little bit on one of the slot machines and gambling isn't really my thing.) I've seen some of the reviews knocking NYNY and if it's luxury you're looking for, this probably wouldn't be the spot for you. But at the end of the day, it's all about who you're with and your "glass half full/glass half empty" perspective on life. I really like this hotel because it's in our price range and I always feel comfortable there. Okay, okay... maybe the fact that I always have fun when I go to Vegas has had little to do with NYNY, but I don't mind giving them some of the credit. When I become a high-roller--or Queen of the hill-- I might broaden my horizons, but for the forseeable future NYNY is my favorite Vegas hotel!

Reviews.Title: “What a Cheat!”
Reviews.Author: leo72976
Reviews.Content: I have previously written a review about New York, New York that was less than favorable. I was pleasantly suprised to be contacted by the hotel staff directly after my review was posted here on Trip Advisor. The rep I spoke with did take the time to listen to my list of complaints and appologized. We were offered a 2 night stay to come and try the hotel again. Shortly after speaking with the rep I received an email as promised explaining exactly what I would be getting, a 2 night stay and there were no restrictions except that it had to be used within 1 year from the date of issue which was June 8, 2011. My wife and I just deceided that we wanted to go to Las Vegas for a quick getaway. I went to the hotels website to check availability and there are rooms available for over $250 a night but they are available. I pulled my email back up and called the number on the email as instructed and as soon as I mentioned the email I was told the hotel was completly sold out. I inquired how the hotel could be sold out when there are still rooms to book online. I quickly as I asked my question I quickly got the reply back that I could not use my voucher on the dates requested because it was restricted and I should read my voucher. I pointed out to the rep that I did read my voucher/email and nowhere did it mention anything about a restriction except for the 1 year time limit. I was informed it must be on there somewhere. I have read the email sveral times and nowhere is there any restriction. The rep said I should send the voucher/email back to guest relations and they would look into it further. I did send the email as requested back to the hotel and have not heard back from them. I would highly discourage anyone from staying at New York, New York. I truely felt when I was contacted by them that I would be taken care of and they were doing the right thing. I now realize all they provided was window dressing. Sure they sent me a voucher and I was happy with their offer. What I truely have is a worthless piece of paper. What good is a voucher if they will not let you use it and they enforce rules not listed and are made up as you go along? Save yourself the hastle and aggrivation and stay somewhere other than New York, New York. If you feel you must go to New York, New York and get ripped off then go to the real New York, NY and you will have a lot less stressful time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Scott R
Reviews.Content: We were unsure where to stay on our visit to Vegas, a few friends had recommended the Luxor or the Excalibur but we ended up going for the New York, New York based on the value for money and what the hotel offered. Going on other ratings, I'd say that Vegas pulls in all sorts of visitors so I'd definitely pick a hotel that offers what you are looking for and don’t go just on the reviews, in saying that, now that I have been, if I was to go to Vegas again, I would stay in the Excalibur for a great value for money holiday or Caesars if money wasn’t an issue. New York, New York was a great hotel for us, it was located pretty much at the start of the strip which meant we seen lots on our travels to explore the rest of the strip. The hotel itself is one of the smaller hotels on the strip but for us, it was great, it had restaurants with good food at reasonable prices and best of all, the bars were normal, go have a drink and hang with friends type bars, you didn’t feel out of place anywhere in this hotel. If you have never been to Vegas before, the hotels are just a short cab ride from the airport, it cost about $15 including tip. Our room was in the Chrysler Tower, it was a good sized room with pretty much everything we needed. The room and bathroom was clean and tidy, we didn’t spend much time in the room so I don’t have much to comment on, the only thing I was a bit surprised about was the size of the safe, it was about the width and height of a normal hotel safe but it was only about 10cm deep, thankfully my laptop is really small! Our room was at the back of the hotel looking onto the parking lot, it would be worthwhile asking for a room at the front to get some view of the strip if you can get it. The hotel check in and staff were very helpful and friendly as were all the staff we encountered. The staff at the Time Square Bar were great and there was live music there every night which was great. The exterior of the hotel it brilliant, it looks really cool and attracted lots of attention. I wasn’t brave enough to try the roller coaster but my friends said it was great. We didn’t hear the coaster in our room like some other reviewers mentioned.

Reviews.Title: “New York New York”
Reviews.Author: Laura-Louise1986
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband travelled here for one part of our honeymoon in September 2011. We booked through First Choice as part of a twin centre holiday later travelling to Cancun, Mexico. We had an amazing time in the New York New York hotel, especially for the price we paid! We thought it was a fab hotel and the location was fantastic. The hotel rooms are basic, but then we hardly used it. The hotel casino had a great atmosphere and the hotel sweet shop and snack bars were fab. (Try a pretzel dog from the pretzel stand upstairs - yum)! Whilst there we visited the Coyote Ugly nightclub within the hotel which we were thoroughly disappointed with! Nothing like the film and no girls dancing on the bar as we expected. Some tips - Fat Burger sell the yummiest burgers and milkshakes and is open 24 hours! Use the booths on the strip (one located near the giant Coca Cola Bottle) for half price theatre tickets. For fantastic views take a trip up the Eiffle Tower and watch the Belagio Fountains from up there - so romantic. For a photo with the famous 'Welcome to Fabulous Las Vegas' sign, go to the very top of the strip - past Mandalay Bay and be prepared to walk. There are no shops on the way so if the weather is hot - take water! Carnival Court @ Harrahs have live bands throughout the day with free admission - a great afternoon. Overall if you're looking for total luxury then visit the Venecian which was just beautiful! New York New York is reasonably priced and is a lot of fun. It has a great atmosphere and we would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “What's with all the bad reviews?!”
Reviews.Author: JLI323
Reviews.Content: We stayed at NYNY for 6 nights in December. We stayed in the cheapest room there was, and were really impressed. We didn't have a strip view, but there was a nice view of the roller coaster incline and the mountains etc. The room was massive, with a huge king size bed and really big plazma tv. Extra pillows etc were provided in the drawers, and there was also a free safe.The bathroom was nothing special, but clean and a good size. Our room was cleaned every day and was of a high standard. We also got room service on the first day which was not that expensive and food was fine. With regards to the comments about the rollercoaster, we did not hear it at all (we were jetlagged and awake a lot during the night) and it was right outside our window! As a hotel, the interior of the casino may be a little bit dated, but there are far more dated casinos along the strip. There are a few restaurants at the hotel, the only one we really liked was the Italian and the American restaurant which did good breakfast. But there is so much choice in hotels nearby that you are bound to find something you like within a 5min walk! NYNY is at the south end of the strip,and it is a little bit of a hike to the north end of the strip where Wynn etc are, but there is so much to see enroute! Although there are other hotels further south than NYNY, e.g. the Luxor, Mandalay and Excalibur which I would feel are a little too far out. We also discovered the monorail which runs the length of the strip, it leaves from MGM which is just across the road from NYNY and goes as far along as Wynn. The day ticket was $12. Also we did have to pay the resort fee, but if you do your research before you go you shouldnt be too shocked at this. Plus most of the hotels on the strip charge it. A few of the reviews mentioned the pool being closed - the pools are closed at all the hotels in December, so it doesnt matter where you stay! We really enjoyed our stay at NYNY. It is a younger crowd at the hotel. Zumanity wasnt showing when we were there, but I suppose it was a bad time of the year with Xmas. NYNY is definitely a gimic hotel, the casino is one of the smaller ones on the strip, but we really liked it anyway. Would probably try a different hotel next time we visit just for the experience, but would recommend NYNY to anyone going to Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “New York Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Stunner81
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife stayed here in October 2010. We only stayed for 3 days but we really enjoyed our stay. Right outside our window was a great view of the rollercoaster and we also had a view of the MGM Grand right across the street. Room was very clean and bed was very comfortable. Our only problem was the location of the hotel. It was almost at the end of the Vegas strip so it was a lot of walkingn or a long cab ride to see a lot of the attractions. We would consider staying here again when we decided to visit Las Vegas again.

Reviews.Title: “No place for kids”
Reviews.Author: tricia c
Reviews.Content: The outside of the hotel is amazing, with its New York skyline but once inside it is a bid worn and faded. The check in was fast enough and the room ok. Tea lovers, make sure you take your own kettle, otherwise you will be reliant on the franchises and their charges. The breakfast buffet is definately one to miss, very little choice and not a vegetable in sight. we were here for my duaghters wedding so were travelling with an 11 year old. This hotel was recommended for kids but the only pace for them is one arcade on mezzanine, which is very limited and reliant upon deep pockets. The food outlets in Grenwich village did offer a fairly good choce and we can recommend the fish bar, the 9 Irishmen bar and Coyote Ugly were both fun places to go but a babysitting service is very expensive. Children are not allowed on the casino floor but there is nowhere for them to go as the pool closed for the winter. On our last day we were only allowed to sit somewhere if we bought food or a drink. If you have a late flight and have children or dont want to gamble or eat and drink the day away we recommend holding on to your room for a few hours.

Reviews.Title: “Meh - I expected more, but I WAS a Vegas Virgin”
Reviews.Author: Cincycaddy
Reviews.Content: First Time in Vegas and as with anywhere you need to stay in an area at least once to learn where to stay and what to do. I booked the hotel on a promo "Vegas Party Scape Package" which includes 'free' cover to four bars/clubs and some other minor 'perks' Well Rok, one of the bars was closed, Coyote Ugly was handing out free cover vouchers and the other two bars I believe didn't have a cover. Only thing we benefited from was a 15% reduced room rate of $68. Some promotion. Our room has a stunning view of a wall and the backside of the roller coaster. I tried to get them to bump me to a Strip View room for free, which they would do, FOR $15. Oh well I tried. Maybe since I had the "Vegas Party Scape Package" they felt I was already getting a deal. $15 resort fee blows. Sort of like getting a haircut for $10 and then paying a mandatory $5 fee to sit in the chair. No way around the fee, outside of staying at a 'resort fee free' hotel. But let's be honest - if they aren't out right charging it to you, it is most likely packaged into the price somewhere. I was less than blown away from this hotel/casino. The location is on the South end of the strip. My wife was less than thrilled after the 1.5 hike down to the Venetian Casino. If I had to do it over I'd stay at a more centrally located hotel along the strip, then you can walk North or South and check things out. This is really my fault for not knowing the area. Lesson learned. Rooms are meh, ok, I guess. Only two pillows on the bed. Their upgraded strip view rooms get more pillows...seriously? Has the feel of a worn Westin Hotel room. Decent but not what I expected for "Vegas Baby". I'm cheap, so paying a premium wasn't a priority for a premium room, but IF I ever come back I'm looking elsewhere. We didn't spend much time in the room anyway, but do want to feel that you are getting the most BANG for your buck. I'd take a 'gamble' on another Casino/Hotel if I was doing this again, took a gamble on New York New York and lost. Oh well that is Vegas and we all know the house always wins.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: Frank_Slegers
Reviews.Content: The Park Avenue Deluxe room we stayed at was on the small side compaired to other Strip resorts. The room was very clean and had all the amenities needed. The staff was friendly and we simply love the casino. Best vide (at least for us) in Vegas. We alsoo love the cocktails at Coyote Ugly. We will be back for sure!!!

Reviews.Title: “3 star by Vegas standards - Okay but nothing to rave about”
Reviews.Author: travelboundsandiego
Reviews.Content: Not my favorite for Vegas. Not a 4 star in my books. Pros: good location, free parking, free wi-fi, rooms are satisfactory Cons: compulsory additional resort fee of $15.90 /nt covers parking, pool, wi-fi and fitness room Fitness room closes at 8 pm. Pool and pool area is not ver appealing. Roller coaster can be seen from most rooms and if you are a light sleeper, it may disturb you. Complimentary buffet tickets come up abou $10/pp short. It is fine if you get it for a discounted price.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel ,Great time, one mix up”
Reviews.Author: allsteel
