Reviews.Content: Checked in late, the next morning we went out for the day. On our return around 6pm there was a letter in the room stating, water would be turned off to that wing of the hotel. On our way to dinner I stopped at the front desk and they gladly move us to a lower rated room but we had to move our items right then. The staff was friendly and helpful but I was upset that on check in, I requested an upgraded room (additional charge) and was placed in a room with a scheduled maintenance shutdown. The rooms were clean, the location is good cost around $39 plus an undisclosed non-optional $15 a day fee. No complaints with the room or staff other than being placed in a room with no water.

Reviews.Title: “Close to everything and great restaurant choice inside.”
Reviews.Author: Julia B
Reviews.Content: Las Vegas is such a buzz that it's nice to have a place to relax after the frenzy of crowded streets, shopping and sightseeing. We got upgraded to a room that overlooked the Strip. It was quiet and the beds were comfy.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing from start to end.”
Reviews.Author: janeybaby298
Reviews.Content: I had a brilliant stay here in March 2011 for Spring Break. Upon arrival we got a free upgrade to the Broadway Suites which i would certainly recommend. Although at this time the pool was not open, we were instructed that we could use the pool at Luxor and Excalibur free of charge so this wasn't an issue. The staff were friendly and efficient with excellent rooms with a brilliant nights sleep. Our room overlooked the strip and the roller-coaster- admittedly the roller-coaster was noisy BUT it wasn't too bad and it stops at about 10 or 11 i believe, it really wasn't a massive issue at all. The location on the strip was fantastic as previously i stayed down at Treasure Island (nothing wrong with TI) but i found what i wanted to do the most was towards the other end of the strip, hence the NYNY stay. There is a monorail (free of charge) to Excalibur, Luxor and Mandalay Bay also. I would most definitely stay here again. In fact i can't wait to stay here again. Also won money on the Godfather slot machine so give that a go :) Enjoy Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “"When will I get my money back"”
Reviews.Author: benice2290
Reviews.Content: Stayed at NYNY Nov 19 to 23 check in used my visa debit card to secure the room, they held extra 200 dollars which was fine. Room and location was great for me going solo. When it was time to check out the customer service person said the card would be reversed the 237 dollars., but never was. 10 days later called the NYNY hotel customer service to find out what happen they replied it was done already and check my with my bank. 29 days later call back again the NYNY customer service and they transfer me to credit cards issues, after waiting on the phone for 20 minutes finally someone answered. Told them that they had charge my card 312 dollars on the Nov 21 and my account never was reverse back to my card $237. Gave them my conf# then she asked do i have an mastercard "no i used a visa" ,the person said Sorry we put it on someone eles's card. I said "WHAT THE HELL SOMEONE ELSE'S CARD".

Reviews.Title: “Fun hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: Dan7667
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed this hotel. The decor was fun, rooms were comfy, and at the price of $60/night, it is a real value. We have stayed at the Venetian before and enjoyed this hotel just as much. Especially considering the price.

Reviews.Title: “Fun place, young crowd, cheap rooms, nice views.”
Reviews.Author: yvrtravelguy
Reviews.Content: Clearly aimed at the younger crowd (Coyote Ugly, Dualing pianos, roller coaster) I always wanted to stay here because of the skyline that the hotel provides. Basic room overlooked the Strip facing southeast to the airport. (Why are all windows in Vegas always so dirty?). Bed was fantastic. Mattress had to be a pillow top or had that addition on top of it. Be aware of the roller coaster sounds going to 1am if you are a light sleeper. Bathroom is just average. Resort fee applies for this and all other MGM Resort hotels. Not a fan of resort fees. Location is nice being beside Monte Carlo (and the tram to Aria and City Center), MGM, Excalibur, Luxor, Tropicana etc. If you get a good rate and don't mind an average room, I would recommend NYNY. I would not stay here again as there are too many other fine choices and I don't believe any hotel should charge a resort fee.

Reviews.Title: “For the Price Paid and Location, I Really Shouldn't be Too Picky...”
Reviews.Author: AKo75
Reviews.Content: Overall: The location of this hotel is great and love the restaurants that they have in here. Although the hotel states that it has recently been upgraded, I think that is a bit misleading for the room that we stayed. Overall value, was probably on par as to what we got. Check in: Checked in on a Thursday night around 10:00 PM. Maybe I’m used to the expedited check in of the MGM or other Vegas hotels that seems to have people appear from the back room to assist when the line gets over 4 deep. Not so much here. We waited probably around 20 – 25 minutes, it seemed that everyone had issues before us. When we finally checked in, it took us about 5 minutes. Rates: Since this is an annual for fun trip, we look for the best rates months in advance. I reserved this hotel room 3 months in advance with the following rates (not including tax or resort fees): Thursday ($56), Friday ($76), Saturday ($85), and Sunday ($59). Resort Fee: $15.00. Includes internet access, fitness center, daily newspaper (but you need to show your key at the gift shop to get one), domestic long distance phone call rates if $0.10 per minute, unlimited local and 800 calls, boarding pass printing, notary services, faxes. Internet Service: WiFi worked fine. Room: Stayed in 2673 taking the Chrysler elevators. 450 square feet, Madison Avenue Room. I am not sure if the square feet is a new selling/marketing point, but in this case it shouldn’t be. The room was an odd “L” shape, with a ton of wasted space (i.e. a small alcove with nothing in it – probably a kid’s dream for hide and seek!). Definitely not for business travelers, the desk and chair are uncomfortable (good for quick checks of email) and lacks enough plugs around the desk space (finally found one on the side of the desk). On the plus side, it had two wall mirrors (a bit odd since they were almost side by side) and in the armoire there was a full length mirror. Did have a nice TV and iPod docking station. However, no mini fridge or microwave (and trust me, there was plenty of space for such amenities). Temperature control in the room was decent. Shower: Low volume, high pressure. Not my favorite, but workable. Also the shower had a shower door. I only took notice because I had to step just a bit higher to get into the shower/tub. The majority of the rooms that I have stayed in the past have had shower curtains. Toiletries: Basics: shampoo, conditioner, lotion, hand soap, body soap. The brand was: Revitalize – perhaps from their spa collection? I’m not sure. For our annual trip next year, I may not be as price conscious and stay at a hotel that is newer with nicer amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Average stay at the NYNY Hotel and Casino”
Reviews.Author: illinigrl311
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4 night stay at NYNY in a Park Avenue room. Pros: -Upgraded to a higher floor (24th) with a nice strip view -Food choices are excellent in the hotel -Hotel stay was very reasonable ($400 total for 4 nights) through MLife -Location on the strip is very good for walking in the winter months -Beds were comfortable Cons: -The bathroom was very disappointing compared to other hotels. There was a single sink, slightly dirty tub, shower door wouldn't close all the way and just overall small and outdated. -Cleaning service did not come twice - had to call for service The check-in was a smooth process and overall the hotel has good amenities but I have enjoyed my stays at other hotels of similar price (namely, Luxor) much more. I would likely to return to NYNY for dinner and drinks but would probably not stay again unless the deal was significantly better than other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “LAS VEGAS - New York, New York”
Reviews.Author: chrishaydnharris
Reviews.Content: Well where to start. Essentially the hotel was of a very good standard, cleaned daily. As the hotel is so big its not for the kind of persons that want to quickly pop up to their room from the street or the CASINO. Luggage service to our room was offered but most of our party wanted a fresh change of clothes and time to room couldn't be guaranteed. The hotel seemed to offer a wide variety of fare from its traditional restaurant with reasonably priced buffet to other delights that you would probably see in New York (themed restaurants) these offered snacks like fish and chips to slices of pizza. A crowd draw and pleaser were at the Piano bar - 6 Budweisers cost me $40 but I won this back later at the roulette wheels (AWESOME). If you are like me and dont understand gambling games then the polite staff will help you and drinks are provided free by some of the most glamorous waitresses on the strip as long as you are gambling either on the slots or on the tables. There was a nightclub in the hotel but this didnt seem to be open. :( There was also a cabaret "COYOTE UGLY" and although the other guys were impressed by the sexy dancers all I was thinking was it cost me $30 to get in to pay for more expensive rounds of bud!!. Still it was very commercial. We also had a little bit of a setback during our stay and the staff at reception were really helpful when we asked for help providing the numbers for Police, hospitals and bail-bondsmen. If we hadn't of had some of the drama we all planned to go on the roller-coaster which runs through the hotel. The stay was thoroughly enjoyable but I was glad to go back home as VEGAS takes too much out of you! BE WARE - A polite note always tip waitresses a book is available from the reception free for this. Dont get involved with street vendors as everyone with an upturned hat, rusty can or overworked smile "works on a minimum $10 tip" I suppose theyre only making a living but that $10 is your breakfast! Seriously there are some great artists on the strip but try to enjoy from a distance. The minimum bail for jaywalking (crossing a road without a walk signal) is $2000 there are better ways to spend your hard earned green!!! Enjoy VEGAS but dont become a victim if you get scammed dont complain as your drink may get spiked! (TRUE STORY) in some clubs!

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort for the young crowd!”
Reviews.Author: Flyguy05
Reviews.Content: Just got back from the NYNY and I absolutely loved it! This is my first time staying here (have primarily stayed at the Luxor, Excalibur and one time at Tropicana) and I really enjoyed staying here. Never really stayed here before because it was a bit over my budget (college student with school loans you know...) but I got a really great deal with Mlife Players club. I spent about $179 for two nights (Friday and Saturday) with a high Strip View (25th floor). Check in was a breeze - - I cannot remember the girls name at check-in but she was great, took my remaining balance and sent me off on my way (no more than 10min for the check-in process). Rooms... well these are the standard rooms I would say. I got the Park Avenue Strip View, I believe the Luxor Tower Rooms are a bit bigger than these but well let's just say the Luxor isn't really at a prime location(don't get me wrong I really like the Luxor especially because I always get a free upgrade from the Pyramid to the Tower Rooms (Thank you Mlife)). The bathrooms were small, Excalibur and Tropicana bathrooms are bigger, BUT the Excalibur does NOT have a tub though. The New York New York do have a tub so great for bubble baths. New York New York's casino area is not the biggest but it's great because of the bar at the center of the area (great music!) I didn't play much on the slots because they have never payed well (a bit tight). Played $10 Craps and Pai Gow, with all the time I spent gambling I got upgrade to the next Mlife tier (so if you stay at any of the MGM Resorts I highly recommend you get the Mlife card. It's free and you get soo many great things with it (Casino Rated rooms and Comps)). Coyote Ugly is always bumping and always a good young fun crowd there. Nothing bad to say about the NYNY Resort (aside from small bathrooms). I will definitely stay here again once I work myself on all the MGM Resorts on the south end of the Strip (next one Hotel/Casino I will stay at is the Monte Carlo). Oh and before I forget, this location is Kid FRIENDLY (like the Excalibur). There is an arcade area for the kids to stay while one goes and plays at the casino. Roller coaster single ride costs $14.00, but if you are staying just get your kid(s) the all the pass for $25.00 (you're able to charge that to your room account if you please).

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Option For Us”
Reviews.Author: Nedflanders4
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights from 4 to 8 Dec 2011 & thoroughly enjoyed our stay. Arrived by car (Aussies doing the road trip from LA) at the wrong time on the Sunday evening - the strip was closed to traffic because of a marathon race! Valet parking (Eric) was super efficient & our bags were delivered within minutes of us getting our room keys. We paid $10 per night to upgrade to a Park Ave room with a Strip view from the Chrysler Tower. From the 33rd floor, the view was spectacular & well worth it. Room was comfy enough & reasonably spacious. No tea or coffee making facilities, or even a mini-bar, which are both big minuses. We loved the dining options at the hotel, so much variety & all reasonanly priced, although we didn't dine at Gallaghers which was upmarket. A special mention for Gonzales Y Gonzales, which was a great experience for both the food & the cocktails. And the ladies serving in the downstairs Starbucks are the friendliest crew you could wish for serving you coffee & tea first thing in the morning. Lots of smiles & happy faces! Weren't offered the coupon book that others have mentioned - why don't they include this automtically for every guest? The pool was closed throughout our stay, presumably because it mustn't be heated. If so, that's a negative as we love to use the pools wherever we stay. We were very happy with the hotel's location near the top of the strip & the monorail from MGM was a great way to get to the further points along the Strip. New York New York is upmarket - you'll not see an Armani store here, but that's the way we like it & it suited us just fine. Would we stay here again next time we're in Vegas? We sure would!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but nothing special. Missing the "little things"”
Reviews.Author: RPV238
Reviews.Content: I stayed at NYNY for almost a week recently. I visit Las Vegas once or twice a year, but this was my first time staying at NYNY. When we first arrived, we declined the bellboy's offer to help with our bags since we only had 3 bags between the two of us, BUT it would've helped if the doors/entrance had rotating or automatic doors, like most of the other hotels do. Check-in took a VERY LONG time and it wasn't even the weekend. They only had two people working the front desk and we were in line a good half hour. When we finally checked in, we were only given the option of double beds since king beds weren't available at the time. We didn't want to have an even longer wait so we agreed. Our high floor "strip view" consisted of the Tropicana, MGM and the airport. Technically, the strip, but not exactly what I had in mind. The room was clean and neat and I have no qualms with the housekeeping in the room, but the hallways were littered with dirty dishes and linen, sometimes all day long! Disgusting. Disappointed to find no shower caps as a regular bathroom staple. Water wouldn't drain in shower so if you like long showers like I do, you'll be standing in a pool of water before you get out. Also, the room next store was being used as mattress/furniture storage and employees were moving things in and out of there first thing in the morning. Lots of noise coming from there and throughout the hallway as they worked in/out of the room. The little shops throughout the hotel and casino were cute and reasonably priced and were staffed with very nice people, esp SoHo shop. All in all, it was an okay place to leave our suitcases and sleep, but besides that, we were out at other hotels/casinos. Resort fees didn't come with any amenities, like free newspaper, bottles of water, etc. like other hotels. The beds were comfy and room was clean, but I would not consider staying here again and probably would not recommend to friends since for the same price there are other hotels which do and offer more.

Reviews.Title: “Fun hotel at the end of the strip”
Reviews.Author: DutchieGirl
Reviews.Content: I stayed at NYNY on the recommendation of a work colleague and I was not disappointed. I really loved this hotel. It is at the end of the strip - close to the airport, but if you want to see any hotels on the strip you are going to have to walk or take the bus anyway. There are plenty of places to eat at the hotel - "America" was my fave - the mac n cheese was great! The hotel is huge, but I never had any problems getting around and I never got lost. I arrived just after 1pm and I was checked in right away (with no extra fee charged). I had asked for a quiet, non smoking room. I received that. My room was about as far from the lift as you could be on my floor, but it only took 2 minutes to walk there, and it was clearly marked. The rollercoaster was near my window - I had a partial view of the strip, but it wasn;t even running all the time, and it didn't really bother me when it was running. Sure, I could sometimes hear the screams from people on the rollercoaster, but I never heard them after 10:30pm and they never started before 10am. The aircon/heater was quite loud if you turned the fan on medium or high but I didn't have a problem with it as I'm used to "white noise" (bonus, it kinda drowns out the screams on the rollercoaster if you want it to). My room had 2 queen beds. They had three pillows each. The pillows were not the best. They seemed a little old, but they were comfortable enough, and the bed was also confortable. Housekeeping seems to ignore any "do not disturb" signs unless you actually call the housekeeping number and ask them to not come into your room, which was one negative. The hotel thankfully didn't smell like smoke - I had been worried about that after reading some reviews, but it was fine. I mean OK if you were playing the slots next to a smoker, then yeah you're gonna smell the smoke, but in general it was fine - as were most hotel/casino's on the strip (and this from someone who is very sensitive to the smell of cigarette smoke). As I mentioned before, I ate a few times at "America" - a diner type restaurant at the hotel. I really enjoyed it. Service was always fast and the staff were friendly, and didn't mind having a chat as they generally weren't too busy when I was in there. I really enjoyed my stay at the hotel and I would stay there again. It was a good price and it was easy to get to everywhere I wanted to go by either walking or taking the "deuce" bus that runs up and down the strip to freemont st.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: StacyRW79
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took a quick, one night vacation to Las Vegas and stayed at the New York New York hotel. We had to go on busy Memorial Day weekend as it fit with his schedule better. However, we really over payed for this room. We had a king bed with great views of the roller coaster and the strip. The king bed room was so small. Plus, there was no fan in the bathroom so unfortunately, any sounds that were made in the bathroom were too noticeable. The great thing about this hotel was the location. I loved that we could travel to the Excalibur hotel by the skyways and then into the Luxor without having to go down to the street. I would recommend this hotel but not for what we paid for it.

Reviews.Title: “Good option on the Strip!”
Reviews.Author: Erika20
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights in December, 2011. This was my husbands choice and after a lot of research, multiple changes to our reservation to accomodate new specials and a final Facebook offer, we booked two nights at $40 each (Sun and Monday). This was a steal, even when the $15 per night madatory resort fee was added! We were in a Park Avenue Room, Strip View. The view was nice, but we were upgraded for free thanks to our deal, and I would not have paid for it - we weren't in the room enough to enjoy it. Pros Room was very large by Vegas standards. Good size bathroom. Updated decor and soft goods. It didn't look as cheesy as I remember from years ago - I felt like I was in a Hyatt or equivalent. Casino is a lot of fun. There are a ton of cheap slot machines and $5 tables every day. Restaurants in the casino are good (we especially like Gonzalez and Gonzalez) and reasonably priced! Everyone receives a coupon book (ask for it if you don't.) While we didn't use many of the coupons, the ones we did saved us some money. We used a buy one/get one for a beer at the bar; a free margarita with $15 in food at Gonzalez and Gonzalez, free salad at the pizza place and 20% off at America. In total, we probably saved $40 or so using the coupons. Cons There aren't many, but NY NY is on the far end of the Strip - it is a FAR walk to everything else. But, the monorail is available across the street at MGM Grand - it's probably a 15 minute walk to get the monorail stop in the hotel. The linens and towels weren't great - the ones at Embassy Suites had them beat hands down. The bed was not terribly comfortable. They do not let you check in until 1pm, but you can pay $20 to check in earlier. If you're looking for a cheap location on the Strip, I would definitely recommend NYNY. And I'd definitely suggest following their Facebook page - that is where their best deals are!

Reviews.Title: “Two Star Hotel at best”
Reviews.Author: Chickenlittle48
Reviews.Content: The only thing I can say good about this hotel is that is has great mattresses on the beds. Pillows are a 2/5 at best. We had and upgraded room which was o.k. Quiet and clean on 21st floor. Charged are resort fee and received nothing for it. Totally unacceptable. Left items in safe keys which I desperately need, called security and they gave me the # for Lost and Found. After 10 repeat calls, still have not been successful in talking to anyone at New York New York, lost and found Would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: FamilyfromMaryland
Reviews.Content: The rooms were large and clean. The location was perfect for the strip. You could walk to almost everything. The number of amenities inside the hotel was more than adequate. Lots of choices. If you like to gamble there are plenty of opportunities. Little too cold to use the roller coaster.

Reviews.Title: “The casino floor is great.. the room is OK”
Reviews.Author: justjayce
Reviews.Content: I checked in early and the lines were light. Check-in was quick and I was assessed a $15.50 resort fee for internet access, use of the fitness center and phone calls. I was assigned a park tower room. Thank goodness they give you a map to find your tower. The casino floor is fun to walk around, but it is hard to find your tower. My room was simple but adequate. The furniture is showing its age. The bathroom was small and the shower is in the standard sized tub which includes a sliding glass door that I guarantee you would stub your toe on. The water was hard. On the outside wall of the bathroom was a small table and chair where I did some work. There was a power outlet in the lamp on the desk. The desk also had a wired connection to the internet which did not work – but the wireless did just fine. The room had one king bed with three pillows. The comforter must have been in that room since the grand opening of the hotel. In front of the bed was the dresser/armoire. There is barely enough room for one person to navigate between the bed and the dresser to the other side of the room to the window. Above the dresser was the large flat screen TV which did have plenty to watch. There were two chairs and small table next to the window. Opening the blinds leaves you with an interesting view of the outside as the window is tinted purple. The window gives you a nice view of the first hill of the roller coaster and the parking lot. You can hear the screams and the noise of the roller coaster from the room, but when I went to bed the coaster was no longer running. The bed was comfortable, which is the most important thing to me. I do like the look of this property and the casino floor is a lot of fun. The rooms are decent and the price for my one night stay was right.

Reviews.Title: “What a GREAT place!!!”
Reviews.Author: have_it_all
Reviews.Content: My Fiance and I stayed here in November, it was AMAZING... The staff were very helpful, the hotel itself was spacious and the casino was very grand. We had dinner one night at Il Fornaio and the food was magnificant. We also had lunch at the Nine Fine Irishman Restaurant and that was good as well. The service was great, i locked myself out and security came straight up to help me out. The little diners are great for early morning (1am) snacks. The rollercoaster was WONDERFUL, so much fun and so convenient. We also went to see Zumanity and WHAT A SHOW, words cant explain how much fun it was, recommended... We went walking down the strip and went into other Casinos, they were all lovely but i HIGHLY reccomend this Hotel & Casino to couples and families, EVERYBODY!!! A++++++++++

Reviews.Title: “NY NY Las Vegas was great!”
Reviews.Author: EMD1022
Reviews.Content: We paid for an early check-in, since we arrived in Vegas at 8:00 a.m. The check-in was a breeze, and we were settled in our room, ready to explore the Strip by 9:00 a.m. No lines, friendly people....you can go to their business center and print your boarding passes for free. Our room was a suite, very clean, and we had a view of the strip looking towards the airport. It was very quiet in the hotel, and my husband and I slept very well during the entire stay. I learned that sodas and other amenities you may want to consume in your room, are just as "expensive" to obtain in the hotel soda machine, as they are in the stores, only much more convenient. We rarely heard the roller coaster, and the casino itself was easy to navigate. We ran into a cranky bartender at their circle bar in the middle of the casino, but that was our only "issue" during the stay. I would stay there again, as it is a good location for the southern portion of the strip...MGM, Luxor, Mandalay Bay and Excalibur. We plan in the future to stay in the center strip, (Bally's, Treasure Island, or another central location) to be able to explore that part of the strip. It is so far to walk between hotels, that you tend to gravitate towards where your room is.

Reviews.Title: “Served its purpose.”
Reviews.Author: katieandpat
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the New York - New York Hotel and Casino at the end of November 2011. Check in was very quick when we arrived at around 3pm Sunday. The front desk clerk was friendly and efficient. She did offer the typical upgrades but we declined as I had already booked a Park Avenue Deluxe Room. Our room was located on the 14th floor. We overlooked the pool, some air conditioning units and the roller coaster. Going during the off-season we rarely heard the roller coaster and even if it was running it was very faint. Our room (with a king sized bed) was very spacious. We had plenty of room to manoeuvre. Both the bathroom and the room were very clean and the housekeeping staff always greeted us with a smile when we saw them. The casino is a bit on the small side but we always found a slot machine. There is a great variety if restaurants both "fast food" and "sit down" available. We had great pizza from both "Il Fornaio" (which has a great happy hour deal) and New York Pizzeria (stick with the Brooklyn style, the Sicilian is really really doughy). We had Starbucks every morning, the service was okay but the did get our orders correct and that is all that matters. Check out was longer than Check in, but staff were once again friendly and efficient. I found that the crowd at New York - New York Hotel and Casino were mostly individuals in their 20s, it is definitely appealing to the younger generation. Would I return? Tough question, as I like to try new hotels, but if the price was right, I would return.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special”
Reviews.Author: McCready82
Reviews.Content: Title says it all! I wouldn't go back there. The windows where so dirty I could barely see out and it wasn't the cleanest hotel I've been to. The room was a good size and location wise I guess it could be a lot worse, the choice of restauranrs inside was pretty poor and the service was ok at best. I guess in these huge hotels you have to expect this but the desk staff were pretty cheerful considering the huge numers of queuing people!

Reviews.Title: “Rodeo Finals in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: MountainmanTJ
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at New York New York Hotel & Casino for the National Rodeo Finals 2011. Our room was clean and spacious, check in and out was easy and quick. Fun ride on coaster, and Dueling Pianos at bar provided a good time . Easy access to Strip and other places of interest. No problems for us enjoyed the week and the weather. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great as Usual”
Reviews.Author: Skygem
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at New York New York for the past 8 years and never had a bad experience. The service was great, the room very comfortable and clean. The staff is Outstanding. Check-in and Check-out was very easy. If you check-in right at 3pm you will probably have a wait. If you gamble there, always charge the food to your room and see the M Club people before you check out. Will definitely stay there again. TIP::: We took the Monorail from the MGM to the Mirage. The cost was $5 per person. It was a 15 minute walk from NYNY and once you got to Harrahs another 10 minute walk to the Mirage. It was cold outside so we took a taxi back to NYNY and that was only $9.70 plus tip. Next time we will forget the Monorail and take a taxi. Cheaper and more convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Third visit, and we'll go back”
Reviews.Author: LesTexans
Reviews.Content: We came for a quick vacation, a little gambling, a little loafing, and no need to go elsewhere. NYNY is a good choice--nice variety in eating choices, and our Spa Suite was roomy (500 sq. ft.) and well-appointed. Great beds--they were replacing all of the bedding during our stay--what got replaced was absolutely fine, as was the replacement material. We needed a reading light on the desk, though, and our room was 200 paces from the elevator--a long way for old folks to schlep their belongings. Next time, we'll make a point of asking for something a bit closer. Lovely bonus: all the employees we dealt with were super-friendly and helpful. Made a pleasant stay even better.

Reviews.Title: “Good for first trip in a while”
Reviews.Author: amidnightraider
Reviews.Content: Check in was smooth and quick. Room was clean, spacious and pretty quiet even though start of roller coaster seen from window. Bed comfortable and we slept well. We had adjoining room but don't think anyone was in room next to us. Bathroom small and really needs an upgrade. Tub is deep and hard to step into. We liked and used room safe. Property is large and we could have used a map to find everything that the hotel had to offer. Ate at two restaurants and really enjoyed steak restaurant but found it a little expensive. Fire alarm went off and even though it was a false alarm, it went on and on. Surely they could have turned announcement off a litte quicker. We would have enjoyed a quiet lounge to have a drink--but could not find one. Smoke in casino was a bit of a pain but tried not to spend much time there. Lots of people everywhere and Las Vegas Blvd. very crowded but pleasantly surprised by courteous nature of majority of people. Will give NY Ny another try on our next trip in the spring.

Reviews.Title: “Great theme hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rigobluenose
Reviews.Content: After a business trip a couple of us moved here to be at the MGM end of the Strip. Great hotel!! When you pull up in a cab it's like entering the Empire state!! High ceilings inside on the gaming floor means its not stale smelling inside!! There's a good mix of Irish bars, restaurants and attractions inside!! Our room was on 6th floor Maddison Avenue room. Not as modern as I like but very clean and large. We rode the roller coaster $14 which was loads of fun. Theres a bridge to MGM and your next to Excalibur, Luxor and Mandalay Bay. Well worth a visit!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, would stay there again”
Reviews.Author: wildbillisback
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at New York New York for our staycation honeymoon. It was a nice room, and what we expected. There was nothing that really stood out that made us say "WOW!" about the room, but nothing that made us complain either! We did appreciate that we were able to go downstairs to the main hotel area for very late-night eating, without having to walk too far. The place we ate in (I can't remember the name, but it had the map of the country above the dining tables) had very marginal food but like I said- we were just thankful to have the option for quick food in the wee hours of the morning! Overall clean, nice and a comfortable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for the money”
Reviews.Author: TP9614332YU6
Reviews.Content: The great view was not so great with the roller coaster dark at night. The rooms were ok and clean. The hotel rooms are hard to find (in which tower) initially but you get used to it pretty quickly. Valet service was excellent as were the restaurants. A good value for $45 per night.

Reviews.Title: “A truly great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Happy-Traveller7645
Reviews.Content: Our family of two adults and two kids on holiday from Australia stayed for 6 nights in October 2011. We stayed in two Park Avenue deluxe rooms that were adjoined to get a break from the kids having recently shared a room for 3 nights in San Francisco. Both rooms were great and had everything we needed including free internet for the kids. The rooms were cleaned every day and the staff were always very accommodating. We were worried about the roller coaster keeping us awake but by the time we got to bed every night it wasn't a problem. Not loud in any event from our room on level 14. Great location and fantastic value. Plenty to do and see in the hotel and casino and the restaurants weren't bad either. Overall an excellent holiday, could not fault it and hope to come back soon. Thanks everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Not my 1st choice but it works”
Reviews.Author: snorris98
Reviews.Content: Travel with 3yr old son and mother and this worked out because the property is not huge, so after a long day of site seeing the walk to the room was not bad and the food court is right down stairs to grab a quick something to eat. Will stay here again when we bring the family otherwise will be staying across the street (MGM). The beds was comfortable and rooms were clean and my son loved the view, we would come back and he would watch the rollercoster for hours. We paid nothing for our room and got a good price on my mothers room all by signing up for the Players club and gambling in the group of casinos. No charge to sign up so would highly recommed doing so when you check in.

Reviews.Title: “kinda yucky”
Reviews.Author: irishsiren74
Reviews.Content: Our hotel room, particularily the bathroom, kind of icky.... it is in need of a GOOD cleaning not just a wipe and blow off the dust. I would not stay there again. The casino was average, smokey and the sad looking female dancers at the party pits did not impress me - mostly because I am married and don't go for that kind of a show. Fill your boots if you like "dancers". There was also a restaurant in the base of the hotel that was like a diner, our server was nice but terribly slow and the food was okay if you had to satisfy a large family with small kids included. I would never eat there again. I a can not recall what it was called but the menu was huge and there is a LARGE map of USA hanging fromt he ceiling. We only ate there b/c friends wanted to.

Reviews.Title: “"May not be No. 1 but they try hard."”
Reviews.Author: CanuckRedDeer_AB
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the New York New York Hotel and Casino from Sunday November 20 to Friday 25, 2011. It was our second stay at the establishment. That and the fact that we got 2 comp buffet tickets per day were the reasons we selected to stay at NYNY. The buffet tickets were a nice touch. Although NYNY does not have a buffet, we had a choice from seven MGM Entertainment Casinos that we could go to for lunch. As well, the tickets were supposedly worth up to a maximum of $20.00, but we went to the Thanksgiving champagne brunch at the Aria, worth $30.00, and were not charged extra for it. We also sampled the MGM, (2 times), Monte Carlo and Mandalay Bay buffets. Check in was smooth and quick. The registration desk personnel we friendly and helpful. Our check out was 11:00am on Friday but it was extended to 2:00pm on Friday so that we could take advantage of our free Friday lunch buffet. The information desk was also very helpful and provided us with good, friendly service. Housekeeping also was frendly and accommodating. We had booked the King Park Avenue room. We were on the 4th floor and we had a great viiew of the roller coaster. We could have upgraded to a Strip View room but we felt the extra $ wasn't worth it. We were also offered to upgrade to a newer and larger room for $15.00/night more which we also declined. Our King Park Avenue room was spacious enough and clean but I must say that this class of rooms are begining to show some wear. Our floor had a large stain next to the bed that had been cleaned but the process caused a bleaching of the rug. The King bed was comfortable. For the most part the hallways were quite and safety was not an issue for us. The NYNY is not a large property so it seems like there are always a lot of people and action. There are a number of on site restaurants which provide guests with a variety of menus and price ranges. There are actually two Starbucks on site. We recommend the Nine Fine Irishmen Pub for a change of paced and a pint or two of Guinness. They serve a very good homemade seafood chowder. The faux New York city streets makes for interesting browsing. We also like NYNY because it's centrally located on the south end of the strip and is close to many of the south strip casinos. By utilizing the South tram from Excaliber you can get to Mandalay Bay or utilizing the north tram from Monte Carlo you can travel as far as Aria, City Centre and Vdara. Further locations can be reached by the Duece bus of regular public transportation. The airport is a short $15.00 ride. My wife and I were very pleased with our stay at NYNY and would stay there again. We feel they try hard to please. However, I still have an issue with the large resorts charging the resort fee. For $15.00 at the NYNY we got a newspaper, which turned out to be the US News and World Report which one can get from the gift shop. However, I observed that anyone can walk in and get a copy free! At least a couple bottles of water a day would be nice! By explanation I'm told that the resorts charge the fee "because they can!"

Reviews.Title: “Would return anytime”
Reviews.Author: Philippe G
Reviews.Content: The hotel is clean, nice and full of people there to have a great time. The pool setup is good, you can also bring beer cans if you do not want to purchase them at the pool bar. Restaurants inside the hotel offer a very faire quality-price ratio. The clubs inside the NewYork NewYork are ok, but you should really try out newer hotel clubs.

Reviews.Title: “Fun and cheap without being tacky”
Reviews.Author: Ruby807
Reviews.Content: We had a ball here wished we had of stayed longer. We went to all the bars the irish ones were probably the best. If you stay here you must do the roller-coaster its quiet scary. you cant really hear it while your in the rooms though. Our stay was very cheap for the quality we got. Fantastic room and didnt have any problems with the staff. Your not charged for parking either which was good. The only thing I regret about staying here is not staying longer.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: Wmacetheace
Reviews.Content: I booked this room via the hotel's website for a Monday through Friday stay at the end of November/first of December. There was a Winter Special which included two free show tickets (we choose Elivs at Aria-great show). I was attending a conference at MGM, so figured it was a good location hotel. I arrived in the evening on Monday, check-in line was long, but moved fairly quickly. I booked two-queen, non-smoking room on high floor in Park Avenue Deluxe room, which is what I was given. Room was in the Chrysler Building on the 34th floor. There were only six rooms on this floor in this tower, which was odd. Room was decent size, flat screen TV, wireless internet, marble tile bathroom. Many food options in this resort. Location was great for south strip. I've definately stayed in nicer rooms in Vegas, but these rooms were good, no real complaints. I would stay here again for the price and specials.

Reviews.Title: “Average for Vegas, better than most for the money elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: Chewywashere
Reviews.Content: My wife booked us in for a surprise trip to celebrate my 40th birthday (thanks honey!). Was very excited about the trip & had always thought of the NYNY as an interesting place based on its exterior. Had a couple of nasty surprises at check in - a really long wait (nearly 30 minutes despite it being a thursday early afternoon - certainly not peak!) and then the $15 resort fee - which would have been fine had it covered anything we either wanted or could have taken advantage of - I protested quite loudly about it until my better half put the brakes on me. My point was, and remains - the resort fee was not disclosed when she booked and pre-paid her trip, is NOT universal for all resorts in Vegas and offered us no value - so, in our eyes, they gouged us for an extra $50. Now, considering that there are a number of other properties in teh same price range that do not charge this fee - we'd have done just as well to spend an extra $50 on an upgraded room somewhere else and not feel gouged. We wont EVER stay at another MGM resort for THIS very reason. Actually, the resort fee made us angry enough, with the exception of the cirque shows we couldnt see anywhere else, we took our money elsewhere every chance we got. Second problem, despite my wife's booking information clearly showing a single king bed and, it being confirmed when we checked in, our room was two twins. Nu-uh. Back down to the lobby & back through the 30 minute line. They made a big deal about putting us into an "upgraded" room at no additional charge - except, when we actually got there, it looked pretty much exactly like the room we'd just seen, save the bed difference. Hmm! Anyway, rest of the stay was uneventful enough (as far as NYNY goes). Had fun at the casino & was glad they had a couple of $5 blackjack tables (now, all they need is to pay out at 3:2 on blacjack instead of 6:5 and we'd have actually stayed to play there! instead we shlepped up the strip and spent a lot of time playing $10 blackjack at 3:2 quite happily).

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE Customer Service.”
Reviews.Author: Janette32655
Reviews.Content: When I checked in employee at front desk didnt give me back my drivers license. When I noticed it a day later, as I was at a corporate business meeting all day and night I went to the front desk as that is the only time I used it. The front desked blamed security for not notifying me . I had to wait 20 minutes for them to go downstairs and take out of a vault. When I confronted the hotel manager , he had a really poor , condescending attitude. I asked him why the employee did not leave me a message on my roomphone alerting me to the problem with my card, he said that was security issue. Secuirty said it was the front desks problem. I spent 35 minutes waiting for eggs and pancakes in the coffee shop for $14.00 , at least this person apologized for the delay. When I left to go to the airport , the valet shoved my suitcase right next to me and another person in the taxi cab, citing that there was not enough room , he miscalculated and we would have to get going, he was very busy. Cab driver apologized for the mistreatment . WOULD NEVER stay at this place again, after the way I was treated and the fact that I said something and they did nothing about the problems.

Reviews.Title: “Very Average”
Reviews.Author: Lana R
Reviews.Content: I didn't think the beds were made as there was a sheet on top instead of a bed spread. No coffee pot or mini-frig. We did get the room for $85ish a night but the rate went up to $250 for the weekend. I wonder what makes it better for those rates?

Reviews.Title: “Rollercoaster of Fun!”
Reviews.Author: RoseyPosey93
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the New York New York hotel on the Vegas leg of my trip. I have three younger sisters, so going to Vegas with kids under 13 can sometimes be difficult- Never fear this hotel suits all needs. At one point, our travel agent had screwed us around with a tour and basically had only booked 4 people when she should have booked 6 long story short Mum left myself and the next oldest in the hotel- Which was fine because there is a massive games arcade, a rollercoaster and a killer pool throughout the hotel (im not even kidding, there is literally a rollercoaster directly through the middle of the hotel) So for families looking for a bit of fancyness on your vegas getaway- that will entertain all members of the family dont look any further. Location location location! I honestly can say we caught a cab ONCE and that was to the airport. We walked everywhere! Downstairs, is the most amazing display of eateries ive ever seen. Its set out as if you are walking through the streets of New York, including fun hot dog stands and Ben & Jerrys! Wooh. Now dont get to ahead of yourselves and let the kids run wild, but thats an obvious statement. The staff at the New York hotel are extremely professional. Plus its Vegas baby who knows what could happen.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel good price”
Reviews.Author: Lara8526
Reviews.Content: This hotel offered plenty of facilities and is very well positioned on the strip. Food was excellent perfect average hotel. If you travel to this hotel beware there is a resort fee added on at the end of your stay which seemed to be compulsory. This was my first trip to Vegas and the hotel certainly gave the wow factor. Staff were very helpful, please note as this hotel is room only we felt we were having to pay out for things all the time. This is not a complaint if you go to vegas this is an expensive state and a great deal of spending money is needed. I do plan to come back to this hotel and visit the grand canyon in the future. I am a travel agent and love holidays. I would personally recommend visiting the hotels they are amazing. Also the hotel treasure island has a great show in the eve 100s turn up to watch it. No cost for this either.

Reviews.Title: “Run of the Mill Vegas Hotel”
Reviews.Author: traveljunkieab
Reviews.Content: I headed down to Vegas for a very last minute trip with a couple of my friends in late September, and booked the NYNY as many other hotels were reserved due to the fight that was taking place that weekend. I wasn't thrilled to be staying at the NYNY, but I at least was looking forward to checking out another Vegas hotel. The location is definitely the hotel's main point as it is fairly well situated on the strip and has easy entrance and exit points. Check in was fast, and efficient and the elevators weren't too far away. The room itself was average. It was reasonably clean, but I did find the room to be a bit dim lit, but for a lot of people they don't spend much time in their hotel rooms, and it's decent enough. We did use the pool, but just be aware that around 3 p.m. the sun gets blocked out by other buildings, so if you are looking to use the pool try and get down there earlier in the day. Overall it was an ordinary hotel that I most likely won't return to, as there are many more hotels I prefer.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: tonitone
Reviews.Content: We were staying here midweek so got a great deal for 3 nights. We knew that it was not going to be like one of the new high tech hotels like Aria or Wyn, but the price and location was great, so decided to chance it. We have stayed at many of the strip hotels in LV, but this one is now one of our favorites. Location is great, rooms are large and clean and the price is right. What we liked the most though is the size of the hotel - not at all like MGM or Mandalay Bay, much more manageable size and lots of great eating options. And Zumanity is a riot. Really liked this place, we shall be back.

Reviews.Title: “No winning's at newyork newyork”
Reviews.Author: Sonyacm
Reviews.Content: Rooms were nice ad the staff were friendly! We were there a week to celebrate r 1st wedding anniversary and hasve been to vegas many times but just didnt feel it ,in this hotel !! Alot of young 21 yr olds there because of coyote ugly club Alot of them ! lots of food choices in the hotel but we didnt win anything and spent alot of money and i never saw anyone hit anything not a slot or table, first time we have been any where to gamble and didnt hit anything !!!!!! loosen up NY NY

Reviews.Title: “Bad Service, Dated suite”
Reviews.Author: barcelo_maya
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Ziggurat Suite over Thanksgiving. Very slow check-in although many front desk personnel seemed to be unoccupied. The unit is very old and in need of remodeling and upgrades: worn out bedspreads, curtains... very old bathrooms. Only shampoo, conditioner and lotion provided. Old, bulky TV's that are taking a lot of room. SLOW elevators...15 min wait if you venture out at 11am ( check-out time). Not the central location either.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay!”
Reviews.Author: MTL-GUY
Reviews.Content: Loved this Hotel Casino. The only thing I was not used to was to be beat down by the smell of cigarettes in the lobby/Casino. It hit me like a ton of bricks, but it's a Vegas thing. The anti-smoking law hasn't seemed to have reached government ears yet. Our room was nice and huge and very luxurious. the beds were great and comfortable. We were adjoining with another room. Our neighbor hired a working girl (don't fret, they're everywhere you go) and wouldn't stop yelling at her and threatening her. I almost called security as it was getting a bit tedious to have to listen to all the shouting.Regardless of this minor incident, the rest of our stay went without any more trauma. Staying at the New York, New York got us 1/2 price tickets to Cirque Du Soleil's "Zumanity". A great show, for adults only. There is a panoply of restaurants to choose from in the resort/casino. We tried Chin Chin Café & Sushi bar the first night (our waiter was obstinate enough to argue that a spring roll was fried and an Imperial was fesh... - go figure). So I made it clear to never believe a waiter called Pablo in an Asian restaurant. The second night, we were at the Italian restaurant, IL FORNAIO. A noticeably different category. I had the homemade pizza and our server (I forget her name, tall blonde lady with straight hair) was the most exquisite when it came to service. Very attentive, professional and caring. New York New York is at the beginning of the Vegas Strip (after Luxor, Manadaly Bay, and Excalibur) but it's not too far from the highway. Would stay there again if their slot machines could give me back the money I lost....LOL

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in vegas”
Reviews.Author: pdaly05
Reviews.Content: We travelled as a group of 6 (25s-30s)and were very impressed with the new york new york hotel. Casino was great, the little mini new york steets inside it were cool, food was nice in all the restaurants we ate in and free drink while using the casino is always a plus! We checked out a few of the other hotel casinos and they were definitely bigger and more luxurious although the MGM seemed a bit on the older crowd side but I think the new york new york is a funkier younger hotel, it had everything we needed and the rooms were nice and clean. The rollercoaster went right by our window but you could only hear faint screams nothing that would disturb you. Reception staff were all nice as were bar and lounge staff. I would definitely stay again. Seemed reasonably priced and a good location,

Reviews.Title: “Always good”
Reviews.Author: MargK2
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel twice now and I enjoyed it both times. The restaurants are all great. The dueling pianos was a fun place. The staff are always helpful and I would stay here again. Very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, bars and food”
Reviews.Author: yvontario
Reviews.Content: Average small rooms...casino was a perfect size...plenty of places to eat quickly...would stay again....too cold to go in pool stayed may, 2011, pool was quite small also..close to the airport nice location on the strip...had the best waitress at the casino glass was never empty!

Reviews.Title: “Come join the Empire(state that is )”
Reviews.Author: Captain_Qwark
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the New York on the last trip I made to Vegas. The best thing about the hotel I think is the location. You are in a perfect spot on the strip to get anywhere, right across from the MGM and close to get to some of the trams that go between hotels. The room we got was nice but not anything to brag about. That being said there was nothing wrong with it either. The lobby and food court is good and there is a little pizza shop where you can get pizza by the slice that is awesome and cheap. The atmosphere inside the hotel is really nice. I have been to New York City and times square and the hotel is decently close in feel to the real place. No one bumped into me and exclaimed " I'm walking here" though. There is a pool charge that is mandatory even if the pool isn't open which is stupid but the staff was nice and the service was good. Parking is decent as well lots of space and located within a close Vegas walking distance near to the front check in desk. I liked this hotel and would stay there again, the lobby is the focal point of this hotel and the rooms are just average but overall a pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and nice place for money”
Reviews.Author: jknisley23
Reviews.Content: With a lot of choices to stay in las Vegas we have stayed at ny ny 4 times! Its a great location and always enjoy going back! It would be better if slots were looser though lol

Reviews.Title: “Great food and location”
Reviews.Author: Eric_S_Phoenix
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel in a prime location on the strip. If you enjoy a nice variety of pretty good food, this is the hotel for you. The rooms are pretty good although the bed and pillows could definetly be upgraded. The mattresses are hard and the pillows we had were well past their prime. The radio in the room didn't work but after we called maintenance someone came up within 5 minutes and swapped it out for one that did work. The front desk staff were average but didn't show much enthusiam for their job. Something to be expected in all but the nicest hotels in Vegas. The club "Rok" played a very good club mix of music. We went on a Friday night and had a good time. The place had an average crowd and it was probably a little older (though still only probably 30 years old average) than most of the swankier clubs but the bartenders gave very good pours and it was nice to be able to move around. I much prefer this to the "notice me" clubs as I was there with my wife and another couple. All in our early 30's (30-33). I will definetly be back to this hotel if the price is right.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: JoanButler
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for five nights and hotel very quiet and clean. Rooms are a decent size and beds are comfortable. The New York themed amenities - bars, restaurants, and shops - were good, although paying $2.95 for a Starbucks coffee wasn't impressive. We now know why there are no coffee makers in the rooms, or at least in ours. Hotel is located across from MGM which is the last stop on the monorail, and there is plenty of shopping in area -drug stores, liquor store, Ross, etc.

Reviews.Title: “New york New york”
Reviews.Author: palmanova1
Reviews.Content: Had a good week staying at the New York New York. There are a lot of bar's restaurants etc to keep you going with a lot of variety. Two bad points were firstly the show Zumanity (worst show I have ever seen) second complaint would be the America restaurant where the service is poor and waiting time is ridiculous, I even left before the main course arrived as I had been waiting over an hour.

Reviews.Title: “New York - New York so good they named it twice”
Reviews.Author: kkplc
Reviews.Content: First time in Vegas and was not disappointed. After booking we discovered that New York - New York was the party hotel of the strip so we were a bit concerned about how noisy it was going to be. We shouldn’t have worried; our room was spacious with a luxurious king-size bed, spotlessly clean and best of all quiet. The exterior of the hotel (a scaled replica of the New York skyline with a roller coaster running round it) made us smile every time we saw it. New York – New York has something for everyone. In the evening the Bar at Times Square is great fun with rock n roll pianos. The food in the Irish Pub was good value and they serve Magners. There is a restaurant in the hotel to suite all tastes and pockets. The casino staff were friendly and even gave us a lesson on the roulette table. Five night was not enough time in Vegas so we will definitely go back and when we do it will be to NEW YORK – NEW YORK.

Reviews.Title: “VERY affordable place on the strip”
Reviews.Author: mannibalignasay
Reviews.Content: New York New York has pretty much all the basics that you need for a hotel in Vegas. Rooms were clean and spacious for the money. The only downfall really was no fridge in the level of room that we had and that the layout of the buildings is quite confusing. Our room was in a maze of hallways and it was a bit of a walk from the elevators. NYNY has a lot of great places to eat. I would recommend Gallaghers if you are looking for some place nice with great steaks or try the Broadway Burger place for a tasty burger. Both offered great service! Be sure to join the M Life and charge everything to your room to earn comps faster. Gym was clean and had all the basics.

Reviews.Title: “BEST BARS ON THE STRIP”
Reviews.Author: tinavegas
Reviews.Content: been to vegas over 20 times now and this is still best hotel for the bars. the bar at times square with the great barman Tony and his team are the best in vegas.Been to many other bars and always end up going back. well done Gary &Tina

Reviews.Title: “Honest rooms, easy internet access”
Reviews.Author: rcassano
Reviews.Content: I travel to Vegas for conferences, so internet is important to me. NYNY provides free cable/wifi on the rooms, with good performance. I was able to make videocalls using Skype. The hotel is just average. Planet Holywood - in the same category - has more restaurant and shopping options. The Casino is quite small, but I'm no gambler so it is not important to me. My room have view to a wall, it was a bit claustrophobic.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice if want the feel of new york in vegas”
Reviews.Author: don733
Reviews.Content: 1st trip to vegas im from England and wanted to go to new york first but flight was long so opted for 2nd best choice and glad we did great hotel different dining choices sit in Gallaghers Steak house for intermate dining was great $200 for meal for 2 also ate at fish & chip shop in the new york street located in the hotel $16 for 2 again great location is good not in the middle but not out of the was either i would return and recommend this hotel. Room was clean, Bed was the most comfy bed ever check in and out simple and quick overall excelent

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay :D”
Reviews.Author: kimini_krikket
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Vegas as adults and we weren't disappointed with the hotel. Unlike the earlier review, someone DIDN'T die on our sheets and we were generally satisfied with housekeeping. We were impressed by the atmosphere in the hotel and the little New York was wonderfully created and had a buzz throughout the night. We'd recommend the fish and chips! (Not bad for 7.95!) The resort fees are a big chunk, although we didn't have to pay them as we travelled on a package with a tour operator and they were included in our price. I would recommend checking this with your tour operator if you are unsure, as 7 days at NYNY could cost $117 in fees. Staff are very helpful, a clock radio alarm was going off in the room next to us in the middle of the night and front desk were very quick to respond to our call :) Please note: If you're heading to Vegas to play poker, don't stay here - there's no poker room! The pool wasn't open due to time of year and there wasn't much to do for free in Vegas! We would recommend visiting the Coney Island Arcade on the second floor, it was a cheap and fun way to loose a couple of hours. Great trip for us! Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Blowed Away!”
Reviews.Author: tabathacruse
Reviews.Content: Me and my girlfriend's took our 1st Diva's trip out of Texas to Vegas and stayed and Ny, Ny, and I must say I was in AWE!!!! From the lobby, to the room, to the ROK club, the different restaurants....the saga continued until we checked out Sunday. There was so much to do in Vegas I never had a change to gamble! I mean, who goes to Vegas, and don't gamble?! The check-in went very smooth, and the beds slept heavenly. Only downside was at Americas' restaurant. We got there, ordered our breakfast, received it an hour later, it was ice cold. We refused to return it, for it would have taken another hour to eat. In the ROK club, the DJ jammed ALL night!!! To top it off, the Jabbawockeez show at the Monte Carlo was the BOMB!!!!!!!!! Worth every penny. Will definitely be back soon with my husband for his 1st experience in Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “50th birthday done right”
Reviews.Author: aceofdelts
Reviews.Content: Reception in penthouse - they made it easy to mix room service with "outside" booze etc. Main party was in back room of Il Fornaio with a/v setup (for a slide show "roast"). VIP made sure the limited access elevator was open to all at the hours we requested (for penthouse access). Overall it was a great time and our host (Barbara) made sure that everything was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Pricey but nice”
Reviews.Author: Nasuvichi
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here in December 2010. The room was comfortable, clean, bed was cozy and it had a good view of the strip. I would have given it 4 stars if not for the price these rooms come with. It was quite pricey. It came with good amenities but given that you are in Las Vegas, you wouldn't want to spend more time inside the room. Otherwise good place. It has a casino at the lower level which is convenient if that's how you plan to spend your time in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time”
Reviews.Author: Mark D
Reviews.Content: We had a pretty sweet deal to stay in NY NY. The hotel was excellent. Check in was efficient and polite. We upgraded our room to a strip view. We had a park ave deluxe room. Room was large, clean and for the most part quiet. Mattress was super comfy. I think the location is excellent. No matter where you stay in Vegas you will be walking a lot. Just across from MGM Grand, where there is a monorail up the strip, and across from Excalibur where there is a monorail to Mandalay Bay and Luxor. Casino area was smaller than the other Casino's, but had everything you want.. and lots of waitresses offering free drinks. We went to ROK (nightclub within NYNY).. it was OK at $10 for guys and free for women.. but very small - not much dancing room. All in all we had a great trip and would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Very exciting atmosphere!”
Reviews.Author: mobrice
Reviews.Content: Traveled to Vegas on a girls trip over spring break. The hotel is fabulous! THe atmosphere was so exciting. There is so much to do within the hotel you would never need to leave. Once you step outside, the action is immediate. Be sure to check out the piano bar located inside the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “ok but nothing more.”
Reviews.Author: nathan b
Reviews.Content: 3rd time in vegas. Stayed 3 nights middle of november. Check-in was fast and the room was ok and clean. I paid more for a strip view... From the corner of my left eye i could see i think, i little of the strip, Tropicana hotel and Escalibur! What was in front of the room was the noisy roller coaster! I paid more as well for a party package with free entrance at night clubs! I went one night at coyote ugly with my girlfriend. I show them the card saying admission were free, that reception gave me at check-in, but the big guys at the door tell me it's a special night and i had to pay the cover charge anyways! Arguing is futile with low brain bouncers...! We went to studio 54 at MGM right in front, paid the cover, and had a very good night. The inside of the casino is beautiful with lots of restaurants, bars, coffee shop. I nice place to walk around and stop for a drink or a piece of pizza on a terrasse in the newyork streets areas. So if you want to fully enjoy your stay at this hotel, here's a few tips and things you should know: Get a good deal on room, and figure16.80$ additionnal per night for resort fees (many hotels dont charge fees at all), dont pay for a better view, it's a rip-off. There is no balcony, small windows, and the room is more noisy with the sound of roller coaster and ambulances. Dont eat pasta at the America restaurant. Too expensive and not very good. This hotel is on the strip and not too far from action and other big hotels. Take the shuttle dayly pass for 7$ to move from on place to another. Zumanity is excellent. No kids allowed, thank god! In Vegas: Dont miss any of Cirque du soleil show or Phantom at venitian. Skip cheasy magic show unless your right there and get in free. Dont get caught with the timeshare scam, they're everywhere on the street offering free tickets for show that are already free, and 75$ free money to spent on casino, or cheap entry at shark reef. To get this you have to take a shuttle and spend 3 hours of your precious time in a hotel south of vegas listening their selling speech. If you pass the offer, they start being rude and you dont get nothing! Enjoy your stay in vegas

Reviews.Title: “Fun and affordable”
Reviews.Author: live4advenure
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights in mid November for my bday. Checkin line looked long, but moved quickly. I stayed in a Park Avenue room facing the strip. Nice pillow top mattress too, all for$ 48 a night. Included was a funbook, but alot of the coupons were 2 for 1 or buy 2 entrees and get 2 free appetizers, or were limited on time of day, so I wasn't able to actually use many. The New York theme was a fun atmosphere, not overly crowded since it was during the week. Like any hotel in Vegas, you can get a bit lost. They have some really fun bars and clubs too. The one sore spot would be wireless internet. It was so spotty. I even called on it. It came and went. Had better luck with wired internet, but on a very short cord. Overall the hotel was clean and the room very comfortable. I'd recommend staying here, maybe more for a younger crowd. It won't be where I stay next, as I like try a new place every time.

Reviews.Title: “Fair deal for your money”
Reviews.Author: bl00
Reviews.Content: Stayed at NYNY from Nov 12-15 and for the most part it was just ok. Nothing terrible to complain about however nothing special to rave about as well. When we arrived the front desk staff were pleasant however it did take quite a while to get checked in. As noted in a previous review, it felt understaffed (especially on a day with heavy check-ins. In any case, we requested a rollaway bed and the bed was in the room in less than 10 minutes which was fantastic. The beds in the room were ok - I've had much better beds at MGM and even Planet Hollywood. It might be time for new mattresses. The room was comfortable however the HVAC system was a little off. It was either too hot or too cold. We could never seem to get the room temperature just right. The location was great. We were there for the Pacquaio/Marquez fight and it was just a hop/skip and a jump away to MGM. Also relatively easy to get to the rest of the hotels on the strip. The casino was fine and I am totally appreciative of lower limit tables - it allows money to last :) One suggestion (and I guess this is the same across the strip) - many of the dealers need to go through soft-skill training. I'm sorry but when your job is to deal with tourists, it doesn't hurt to be nice every now and then! I got yelled at by a dealer for not recognizing the hand that I had (despite the fact that it was 2:30 in the morning). Funny yes, but still uncomfortable. Overall, its an ok hotel but probably wouldn't stay there again. I guess in this case, you really do get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Someone died on our sheets”
Reviews.Author: CZLAW
Reviews.Content: OK, we might have been able to overlook the fact that our room had a view of a brick wall three feet away BUT when we turned back our bedding the first night and literally saw the outlive of a body in greasy black stains from top to bottom of one side of our bed, well...that was cause for pause. We called housekeeping, who sent up two housekeepers to change our sheets at 1 a.m. The two housekeepers couldn't believe that another housekeeper had put sheets like that on a bed. That made us feel better...but then they unrolled the first replacement set of sheets, which also had noticable stains. They apologized, rolled out the second set of replacement sheets which also had noticeable stains. The third set of replacement sheets were stain free. We put the "no service" sign on our door for the rest of our stay as we figured odds were we'd end up with other stained sheets. We have always enjoyed the atmospehere in the NY NY casino - lots of fun, lively atmosphere, laid back. That's why we decided to stay here this trip instead of elsewhere. Unfortunately, after our brick wall view, stained sheets, and furniture in the room showing definite wear, we'll probably stay elsewhere next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Good functional hotel”
Reviews.Author: Phil S
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights in November. Rooms decent size, clean with very comfortable beds. Check in/out was quick and friendly. Nothing in this hotel is cheap but that is in line with all Vegas hotels. We were there for business and the location is pretty central and within easy walking distance of most other goods hotels and attractions. I've stayed here 5 or 6 times before and although it doesn't have the wow factor it enjoyed when it first opened it's still very good value and is functional for business or leisure. For the casino floor we found the tables to be limited and crowded and visited a different hotel for our second night which was far more enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: LHTravels
Reviews.Content: We have recently returned from a 5 night stay in New York New York and were very disappointed with the service we received there. It is very understaffed and the staff who were available were quite frankly unfriendly and unhelpful. One gave us wrong directions spoiling our plans for that day and just about every other person was standoffish. There were long ques to for checking in/out and even just to ask a basic enquiry - which was then insufficently answered. We had to wait 15-20 mins to retreve our bags from storage and the bell boy stood there expectantly counting his tips while I had to unload the suitcases. The housemaids did the bare minimum each day, just remaking the bed and hanging towels, no additional tidying- and trays of food from room serivce would be left in the corridors for days. Hotels in Vegas obviously milk guests for all they are worth but this is the worst I have every come across. Resort fees - ridiculous! $15 a day for internet apparently, though there are no free computers for you to use this on- you have to pay $1 a MINUTE to use one. A pathetic fitness centre and newspapers we never received. Having stayed in many hotels across the world, this has to be the worst. You get what you pay for - cheap but not worth the terrible service.

Reviews.Title: “third time going”
Reviews.Author: dmc
Reviews.Content: this the third year we have stayed at New York New York- has always been a great time - love the location-- the casino is nice - plenty of waitresses for drinks -- pleasant at check in-efficient - room was clean-we were near the elevator this time which we enjoyed--will definitely return there for a fourth time

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tupperconnie
Reviews.Content: New York New York was a nice hotel, especially for the price! The beds were comfortable, the rooms were quiet and clean! Make sure you eat the pizza while you are there, too, it is the best!!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, couldn't ask for anything more”
Reviews.Author: Finnegan83
Reviews.Content: We landed back yesterday morning after having one of the best weeks of my life, the room was very clean the beds where perfect for a great nights sleep. We read alot of strange comments putting the hotel down for different things I think these people just need to get a life! If people are looking to book trips I would use booking.com we went to the grand canyon and I would give this trip 11/10

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: hiw05
Reviews.Content: The hotel is OK it's just not Great. The rooms are getting a little tired as is the theme of the hotel. The restaurants are not that good and ther is no shopping to speak of. The best thing it has going for it is the access to the rest of the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Can't fault it!”
Reviews.Author: Jayne38
Reviews.Content: We have literally just returned from our trip to Las Vegas! As usual we were a bit wary of the hotel due to some of the reviews but have been pleasantly surprised. Check in was a breeze, and after 16 hours of travelling just what we needed. We were asked whether we would prefer a non-smoking or smoking room. The desk clerk was polite and efficient and within about 10 minutes we were on our way to our room. We had a Park Avenue Deluxe and were not disappointed. The room was spacious, with two Queen beds, HUGE TV, and most importantly (for me at least) a pristine bathroom. The room had a view of the MGM Grand, Tropicana and the rollercoaster. We had read that some people who had rooms near the rollercoaster had said that the noise had disturbed them, but we can honestly say that we were not in anyway disturbed by the noise, yes we could hear it running and yes we could hear people screaming but it was a muffled sound and didn't spoil any time we spent in the room. We can recommend the Pizza place within the casino (sorry the name escapes me) and the 24hr Starbucks was a godsend especially when we were waking up a silly o clock due to the time difference. If you want to see any of the exhibits or attractions we found that we could purchase 3 of these for $54 (we got the tickets in the MGM Grand). Given that most of them are $20 per person its a great saving. We went to the Titanic exhibition in the Luxor - absolutely brilliant and very humbling to see the possessions of the people aboard the ship, there is also a large section of the ship itself in the exhibit; Shark Reef at the Mandalay Bay - very good and The Secret Garden at The Mirage - very good. The other must is the fountain display at The Bellagio, this is on the hour and is amazing. We used the Deuce bus as well to get up and down the Strip. Its $5 for a 2 hour ticket, $7 for a 24 hour ticket and $20 for a 3 day ticket. You can hop on and off and it takes you from one end to the other. You can also use it to visit Fremont Street which is the downtown area of LV. It is a totally different experience and you can see "old Las Vegas". You will certainly see some characters there that's for sure. We also went to Town Square shopping area. This was not what we expected at all and we found it a bit strange - to put it into context think of The Truman Show and you will understand!! We stayed about 30 minutes. If you want some shopping we can recommend taking the Deuce bus to one of the premium outlet malls. Any questions please feel free to contact me via TA

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel on the strip”
Reviews.Author: Kimber0320
Reviews.Content: I staythere for a work conference in November 2011. The front desk told me there was no reservation in my name. They said the reservation was in someone elses name and that I had already checked in. They then gave me the names of two men that I supposedly checked in with and was rooming with. Two men I don't know, who do not work for my company, that I never heard of! I asked them to recheck several times and the lady, getting frustrated, said to me with a hint of an attitude "I can only tell you what I see on the screen." With much attitude I said to her "well you need to tell me somthing else. I just got here. I don't know those two men. My company booked everyone their own room, we do not have roomates." I then suggested that perhaps there another person with the same name as meand asked if she had made a copy of the ID (thinking perhaps I could prove I did not already check in because that persons ID would have a different picture and address, even if our names were the same). I was advised they ask for ID but don't make a copy of it. Finally she went in the back to consult someone else. When she returned she explained that my reservation had accidentally been combined with the reservation for those two men. I finally got a room. Room very small, no coffee pot, windows extremely small. I did have a view of the roller coaster bt it felt like jail. Now I know its Vegas, but my room and the foor where the conference rooms are smelled HEAVILY of smoke. I and several of my co-workers complained of the air being extremely dry. My nose, eyes and mouth felt like cotton the whole time I was there. In the evening I went to the Venetian and made note that not only was the air not dry there, but even IN the casino area the smell of smoke was not that heavy.
