There was also a hint of a light pleasant fragrance in the air. My conclusion is that New York New York Hotel must have a cheap ventiliation system. The casino is right on top of the lobby. There is not the huge expanse of lobby/front desk area like most Vegas hotels, with the casino being a ways away. There is nothing about this hotel that I enjoyed. I had just been to Vegas one month before this trip (personal vacation) and stayed at the Bellagio which was fabulous...so this was a HUGE let down.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Nice Casino & Facilities, Average Rooms.”
Reviews.Author: FiverACT
Reviews.Content: We were in town for a conference and chose the New York New York Hotel and Casino for no reason other than it looked like an interesting place to stay and explore a little. The Complex is right in the heart of the action in the middle of the newer part of the Vegas strip, with easy access to the various other casino and resort complexes. There's also plenty to do within the NY NY complex itself. The room itself was fairly average, with a view over the air conditioning unit. My colleagues who had other rooms on the same booking had views of the roller coaster, all of the rooms were fairly noisy, due to either the roller coaster or the air con unit being so close, I'd suggest asking for a higher floor if you're a light sleeper - it wasn't a huge problem for us, but worth mentioning. The cleaning and maintenance of the rooms was carried out to an exceptionally high standard which was great. There was a lack of refrigerator or mini bar in the room, this also meant no coffee plunger, or cold milk, although you could hire a mini fridge for about $20 a night. Again this wasn't a huge problem for us. Overall a nice stay, but there are better choices nearby for the same (or in some cases less) money, the biggest downer on the NY NY was the check in staff - we were pre booked and had all of the relevant paperwork and identification and it took us around 40 minutes per room to check in!

Reviews.Title: “Good property and price”
Reviews.Author: TexasLuv2Golf
Reviews.Content: Excellent value from a special rate offer. Clean, comfortable room. Close to everything. Would recommend

Reviews.Title: “Quite a surprise - very enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: magicmoments
Reviews.Content: We have a houseboat on Lake Mead so although we don't have extended stays, we monthly spend 1 to 2 evenings in a Strip hotel for ease of catching flights or with visitors. We booked our stay at New York-New York as a quick evening with no plan to partake of any amenities due to an early flight. Our room was very nice - large and with a fabulous view of the mountains and part of Las Vegas Blvd. The furnishings were new and contemporary with plenty of plugs at bedside tables and the desk for all of our business devices. The bathroom was very nice and this room provided a great place to relax and enjoy an evening in. Due to changing flight arrangements, I stayed over the next morning until check-out time. Not only was the staff very accommodating, they were friendly and professional, as well. The dining in the Il Fornaio restaurant for breakfast was delicious with an exceptional atmosphere for a casino hotel and probably the best seated breakfast value on the Strip.

Reviews.Title: “NYNY Hotel: Nothing bad, lots of fun, Awesome Upgrade.”
Reviews.Author: NautilusJoie
Reviews.Content: We purchased Airfare and Hotel through Southwest Airlines Vacations for a 4 night stay at the NYNY in the Park Ave. room. We got there at the precise check-in Time (1pm) and we asked for a room upgrade. For only $10 per night we were given a strip view and let me tell you this was a fantastic view. We were on the 34th(of 36) floor on the corner of the Chrysler Tower. We could see Monte Carlo, PH, City Center, Orleans, Palms, Rio, and even the HIlton way off in the distance. it was pretty amazing. The room seemed a bit small but we did have two beds. the Bathroom was marble tiled and very large. Our Maid was very nice. The beds were comfortable. We liked the NYNY because at about 10pm the restaurants and casino really start to get hopping. on friday and sat. nights it is Packed with people and really allot of fun. the casino is much smaller than most places, but the MGM is right across the street and the tram to Mandalay bay is also across the street. Other reviewers on TA here said we should ask for breakfast vouchers but this is not an option at the NYNY and we were not given any. The NYNY has lots of places to eat and drink, including two Starbuck's and two pizza places. It is very kid friendly but I would advise parents to take their kids to some place OTher than Las vegas for vacation. I heard they are trying to get away from Vegas being a "Family Destination" (Family's simply do not spend the $$$$) Players Club Cards: the M-Life card works for ALL the MGM properties and we were able to get more than $100 comp'ed off of our room charges. They allow you to "Link" Cards if you are married and have the same mailing address. also, when you sign up for your card, make sure to get some extra ones. This is handy if your friends do not have m-life cards, they can play with yours and the points can seriously add up. Getting to NYNY: If you are driving on I15 take the Tropicana Exit of course. There are Two entrances to the hotel; one from Tropicana Ave. and one from LV Blvd. The East bound Trop. entrance is a little tricky because it is a super long Left turn lane so after you take the Eastbound Trop. exit, make sure to cut all the way over to the left very quickly otherwise you will miss it. (if you do miss it, just take a left on LV blvd. then the next left into the hotel, only problem with going this way is the nearly 45 different speed bumps, lol.) If you find this information helpful, please don't forget to give me a vote, thanks!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best stays in a hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pilbarette
Reviews.Content: Arrived after traveling from Santa Cruz during our 6 week holiday in the US. Check in was fast and easy. The Park Ave deluxe room was fantastic with a view to die for. Looking over the strip for 3 days and nights never got boring. Even the helicopters that flew by every so often was fun to watch. The location is brilliant if you don't need to go up and down the strip, with 4 casinos (New York, New York - Excaliber - Tropicana - MGM) all linked by overpasses and the Excaliber linked to the Luxor by a rail system. Once you're there you don't need your car. Heaps to do within walking distance of the hotel and in the hotel itself. My 19 year old son hung around the video game room and my husband went on the roller coaster. The only down fall was having to pay for the ride even though we were hotel guests. There is no buffet, but plenty of restaurants and little places to eat. If you feel classy for one night, go to Gallaghers Steak House for some excellent steak and the sticky toffee pudding is orgasmic!

Reviews.Title: “First time @ NYNY...won't be the last!”
Reviews.Author: christib1975
Reviews.Content: Checked in Thursday night...Invited Guest line, only waited 5 minutes tops. Had a great room in the Century tower, Room 3125 with great views of Monte Carlo, Cosmo, Mandarin Oriental, Aria, the mountains and Rio in the distance. Room was a standard but very nice King, smoking...flat screen Samsung TV in built-in armoir...safe was standard key pad safe. Small chair and ottoman by the window with a table. Nice for watching the lights. The bathroom was a good size with nice marble, large sink/vanity, and shower only. Staff in all areas of the hotel were super friendly...cocktail service was amazing (especially in our area by the sportsbook and piano bar) and the desk staff and player club area was very friendly. Ate at the American for breakfast for two days...used express comps and the food was okay, not spectacular. Had drinks at Sporting House to watch the first half of the Chiefs game, very pricy for tall drafts. Had Starbucks, really fast service and always packed. Housekeeping was efficient and did a very good job cleaning the room... Overall this was an amazing trip and a very nice hotel...location was good and I enjoyed it immensely!

Reviews.Title: “25$/night to rent a mini-bar!!!”
Reviews.Author: Delevanti
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a 6 day golf trip and stayed in the New York - New York Hotel and Casino with the golf buddies. Positives: The hotel is in a good location, close to the other "big" hotels of the strip. The room was decent, but nothing special. The restaurants in the hotel were good, especially the hamburger joint. Zumanity is not the best Cirque du Soleil show, but worth it for 100$/2 pp Negatives: There were no mini bars, so staying sober wasn't an issue, we called the front desk and at 25$/night to rent a mini-bar, well we didn't drink much in the rooms. There were a couple of issues with the room, but they were fixed very quickly. To all poker players, they're no poker rooms at the Ny Ny, but you're 5 minutes away from the MGM where we played every night. Overall a nice stay, but there are far better choices on the Strip for the same $$$

Reviews.Title: “Cool hotel idea - average rooms”
Reviews.Author: Lexis042
Reviews.Content: I stayed at New York, New York in November. The interior decorations in the casino and restaurant areas are neat, but the rooms are the same old hotel rooms you will find anywhere in the states. The hotel is about 10 minutes from the airport, super convenient and right across the street from the MGM. We stayed here during the week (Mon- Fri) and found that it was not too loud. We requested a higher room to avoid the sound of the roller coaster. We could still hear it a bit in our room, but not as bad as the lower level rooms. I'm not sure whose idea it was to put a roller coaster so close the bedroom windows... but that's just the way it is. The service was great, everything we requested was delivered. The room was clean and tidy. The halls has storage units in them which I found a bit weird. I think they were used to store sheets and glasses for the rooms. They looked like large Tupperware containers on wheels just sitting in the hall. We also noticed that someone had vomited in the hall and it had not been cleaned up. Super gross. We had breakfast at Chin Chin's restaurant in the hotel - not bad, but not great for the price either. It was too cold to use the pool while we were there so I can't comment on that.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: samaija
Reviews.Content: stayed for 5 nights for anniversary. We paid for a park view rm.But was told that we were in the old rm and not newer rm everything was out dated as if we was staying at the days inn. Hotel doesn't have a monorail so u have to walk to mgm. Eaterys close @11 that's crazy cause Vegas never sleeps! Compared to other hotels we looked at this visit this hotel is the days inn. Never cleaned our rm the last day either this hotel SUCKS! .

Reviews.Title: “" location "”
Reviews.Author: shelly3
Reviews.Content: I love Theme hotels, so this is perfect. My husband and I had a wonderful time. The only issue is early check in fee. Plus no Coffee Maker in the room. The room is cleam, the staff helpful and nice.

Reviews.Title: “great for the price”
Reviews.Author: alisdair t
Reviews.Content: Although I hated Las Vegas itself, it was such an experience, and would not have missed it out on my road trip, the hotel was excellent. Good location to explore the strip. Easy to find and park, although directions from the car park to main booking in were a little confusing. Staff very helpful on the desks, and in restaurants, room was good, clean, well furnished, good decor, on 34th floor of empire building, over looking the strip (well worth the upgrade), great choice of places to eat and drink, all tastes catered for. Great pool area, although i did not use it, roller coaster was very expensive, so did not go on that. I suppose it all depends what you want out of a hotel here, as you have so many to choose from, I would easy recommend new york new york.

Reviews.Title: “Location means a lot”
Reviews.Author: donotcomplain
Reviews.Content: The staff on all accounts was wonderful and the location of NY NY is great, short walkway over to mgm, excalibur and next door to monte carlo which takes you to aria, etc.., etc... The room is a little dated and the beds definitely need an up-date (too hard,) pillows were horrible (cheap foam,) we called and asked for softer pillows and were told they do not have any soft pillows only foam and feather pillows. I requested some feather pillows which were brought promptly and they were the hardest feather pillows I have ever experienced, they really should invest in some softer pillows and newer mattresses, i have stayed in much cheaper hotels with newer beds. I like the choice of the restaurants and the fact that they have reasonably priced opptions for lunch and late night snacks, love the deli and the pizza. The music from the dueling pianos is so much fun, the slot options were ok. Out of all the casinos I visited on this trip the drink service was the worst at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “New York New York”
Reviews.Author: sharonf27
Reviews.Content: We stayed here when many conventions were on in LV, and paid a very high price for a very poor quality room. It has been the worst accommodation of our overall trip to the US. We asked for a non-smoking room, and were given one, but it reeked of smoke. The response from staff was to to get housekeeping to spray airfreshener. The room and decor were so dated. Facilities at the hotel are good for families, but the room was not at all pleasing. We would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “clean and affordable”
Reviews.Author: JM34
Reviews.Content: great hotel if visiting vegas. Good price, great location, variety of choices for eating. Great shows and good variety of slots. M&M and Coke store across the strip. Coyote Ugly on a Tuesday night was packed. Good size rooms and if you request a strip view, well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “very good”
Reviews.Author: bigrick0068
Reviews.Content: Wifey and I went to meet up with the family for a nice first time visit to vegas. Amazing pace..vegas is disneyworld for adults. We went into hotel with lower expectations given the price we paid for the hotel but we were pleasantly surprised and happy on all accounts. nice environment, shops and restaraunts of all type. vegas is not cheap. Even Fremont street was not that cheap but well worth the trip. Weather was cool so pools were opened by no one was using them. The being said vegas was busy even with cool weather. saw Ka..it was fine but could have used a bit more action..there were quiet times and I saw many people nodding off during these times. overall great experience and we will be back...when it is warmer so we can experience some vegas pools.

Reviews.Title: “First timers”
Reviews.Author: Loll73
Reviews.Content: First trip to Vegas and friends recommended this hotel . Definitely not my style or scene . Checking in was efficient , room was a decent size but the bathroom was like a horror movie from the 80's . The vanity top was chipped , the basin was cracked , the toilet bowl was cracked , the towel rail was hanging off the wall and the shower screen was something to be seen.I did check another larger room with a spa but apart from the spa the bathroom itself was identical to ours.The hotel does have some good spots , the Italian restaurant great food , the steak house great food (a little pricey) and the Irish bar good fun.As soon as you walk into the hotel it stinks of smoke and is very dark . Maybe if you are a gambler you can overlook the hotels misfortunes. Also don't forget the resort fee - what a load of rubbish , just incorporable your fee structure in your room rates - a joke

Reviews.Title: “NY-NY Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Roosterwp
Reviews.Content: Nice place. Clean rooms. Lots to do within Casino/Hotel. Good food available. Within walking distance of MGM, Luxor, Excalibur. I would recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “New York - New York”
Reviews.Author: mdhokenson
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for business October 24-28 and found the hotel to be a little above average. The rooms were decent, but definately needed some renovation work. The casino area was good and the restaurants were above average especially the Broadway Burger Bar. Lots of things to see and do in the hotel and it is close to lots of other attractions.

Reviews.Title: “A week in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: shellyskygirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a week last year and loved it. The spa was absolutely amazing, the only issue I had with is was the way the reservations were handled (e-mail with questions). The view from the room (strip view) was awesome and I liked the location of the hotel. The bed was super comfortable. The restaurants were good but tended to be expensive. We saw 3 shows while we were there. Zoomanity, Crazy Horse and a hypnotist. All of these shows were good but Zoomanity was the best by far. Feel free to contact with any questions or for photos.

Reviews.Title: “Good time - DO NOT CHOOSE PARKAVE ROOM - ONLY MADISON AND UP”
Reviews.Author: Karen B
Reviews.Content: Pros - Location is good, monorail is close, bus stop is close, lots of great food in your hotel, good size of hotel not too big not too small, zumanity was great, Madison Ave room was great (after we upgraded too it), comfortable beds, best pizza, staff was friendly, view was good (after we upgraded too madison suite) Cons - We orginally got the 'parkave' suite, when going to shower at 5am there was no hot water, literally nothing would come out of tap, we called down and were told that in the park ave suites you have to run the water for 10 min before getting hot water to come out, they said this as if that is totally normal! Nevada! In a state of water emergency and they want you to run the bath tub for 10min before going into the shower! UNREAL! we tried and that did not work. So we got a differnt room, we moved to madison suites which had hot water when you turn on the tap. So be warned that if you stay in the park suites i had two staff members tell me as if no big deal that they don't get good hot water and you need to run it first. That was just about the only con, the mgm resorts are very good with thier customers, the room service was quick and maids kept it clean. I would choose NY NY again but only Madison Suites or better, NEVER PARK AVE.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of fun!”
Reviews.Author: meliza89
Reviews.Content: Great rooms, great location and great staff! My boyfriend and I were very happy with this hotel. We came in the middle of winter, therefore didn't use the pool, however it looks quite small compared to many other pools along the strip.

Reviews.Title: “great experience”
Reviews.Author: carmen c
Reviews.Content: we stayed at this casino from the 25/10/11-2/11/11 and found everyone to be helpful and courteous. We had a broadway deluxe room and it was larger than i expected so i was pleasantly suprised. The room was recently refurbished to look like new and were very clean. My favourite food outlet was the New York New York pizza, they were absolutely delicious and such value for money. Overall my stay was great and can not fault this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Another wonderful trip!”
Reviews.Author: Koei-Seun
Reviews.Content: Been staying here a couple of times a year since the week it opened! Love the location! The rooms are great and have always found the staff to be friendly and helpful!! Upgrade to a king, spa suite...it's worth every penny!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great and comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: facls
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 3 days in October, our first time in Vegas. Check in took about 10 minutes. It took much longer for us to get our luggage into the room using the bell service, since we arrived at check-in time. If you are not carrying a lot of luggage, I suggest you take them to the room yourself. Room was quite good, we had a Park Avenue room facing the Strip. Plenty of space and great bathroom. Location is very good, a bit of a walk to the Bellagio, around 20 minutes, but close enough. We didn't try much of the hotel restaurants, since we were out most of the time, but there were plenty of options. The rollercoaster was a bit more "agressive" than I thought, it left some marks on my shoulders! Overall a good choice for Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “it captures the essence of vegas”
Reviews.Author: CorkTed
Reviews.Content: When one drives in and sees the place, you ask: is this real? this is even if you have missed the Statue of Liberty and the section of Brooklyn Bridge which are both close-by. At reception, you are likely to be met with personnel who are pleased to see you and are very polite- feel free to ask any question. The size of the hotel is hard to take but the quality is of an even high standard throughout -my only quibble was that the bath was very slippery- really. Food, well this is Vegas and this item does not rate highly with most people- I cannot say about food in the hotel. The casinos are near to hand so go for it!! Location is excellent and you can see the airport from your front window. New York New Your is the kind of place where one feels safe, contented and happy.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for kids !”
Reviews.Author: LeoOlgaAna
Reviews.Content: We were 5 families (my parents in law, my sister in law and her husband and their child 2 years old, my husband and my daughter, and 2 families of friends, with 5 kids !!!). The staff was helpful - they put us in the same floor, and it was perfect to meet grandparents and their grandchildren. The rollercoast was our "nanny". The piano bar was our point. Everything was adorable ! We loved it !

Reviews.Title: “Spacious Rooms, Comfortable Bed, Clean”
Reviews.Author: Kathleen H
Reviews.Content: Stayed at NYNY for 2 nights, the first time we have stayed there. I liked the spacious rooms, nice decor, clean and comfortable beds. We would definately stay again. I would have enjoyed a coffee maker in the room, but thinking back I think most Vegas hotels don't. Did have Wifi, which is a part of the Resort Fee.

Reviews.Title: “Had a blast at NYNY!!”
Reviews.Author: Metalhead55
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 4 night stay at NYNY. Check in was a breeze and we were not charged an early check in fee. We got into our room about 1pm. The room itself was clean, tidy and spacious. We were on the 28th floor, room 2823 to be exact. We had a good view of the parking lot-to keep an eye on my car, the roller coaster and a bit of the strip. In previous reviews, many people complained of the noise from the coaster but it was never a bother to us. It was great to see all the people having fun while on the ride. We didn't get a chance to eat at any of the food venues but everything looked great! We didn't win anything in the casino but still had fun playing the slots. We did not use valet we just used self parking. Our walk from the lot was not far at all. The bed was comfortable and teh room was always clean when we returned. We would definately stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Ok”
Reviews.Author: Puff1997
Reviews.Content: It took approximately 30 mins to get me checked wish I believe was due to human error. My expenses were paid in advance by a third party but not sure if this contributed to the problem. Hotel was very clean. Upon arriving home there was a $100 fee charged to my credit card for Internet fees. I was not aware of any such fees and called the hotel. They advised me that those fees were waived when trip was paid for by Southwest Vacations and they were showing no such charges in their computer system. I have yet to find out what and where this charge came from but it is still on there. The first two nights I was unable to get an Internet connection and was transferred numerous time before I could get assistance with that. The problem taken care of...however I had to call the following night with the same issue. The message on my IPad read "my name e.didn't match the hotel records......no fault of min

Reviews.Title: “Good choice if travelling on a budget”
Reviews.Author: Frankfurt2011
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights ande were quite sceptical about the place. But we had a quite good experience with almost everything. The check-in was fast and we got our keys within minutes. The room was clean and not too small.We had an "Park Avenue" room with 2 Queensize beds at the 29th floor and a view on the Excalibur, the MGM Grand and the Airport. The roller-coaster was'nt any noisy but we could hear the Helicopters flying in and out the airport. This was a little annoying. During our stay everything was fine with the room and the service. On checkout I was astonished abouthow quick they proceeded the checkout. It was 5 minutes and were were out. The location of the hotel is about 25min walking distance from the Bellagio and 10minutes from the monorail stain at the MGM Grand. This was quite convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Great value...fab hotel”
Reviews.Author: PODGE19
Reviews.Content: Recently returned from the NYNY. Very impressed for the money. Super room, very large and kept clean...toiletries replenished daily without delay...really comfy beds. Hotel generally has a super atmosphere, they've tried really hard to capture the essence of Greenwich Village NY and I think thye've pretty much done it (as much as you can in the environment). The restaurants in the hotel are good quality and value, in particular the steak house (Gallaghers), genuinely the best steak I have ever had and the service is superb, it's not cheap but neither is the quality of the food...most impressed. If we were ever to return to LV we'd definitely consider stopping at the NYNY, we weren't disappointed

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: ganative
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Vegas and we got a great deal at NYNY for 3 nights. The room was clean and it was very convenient to walk from there to lots of things to do. We enjoyed the Mexican restaurant and the frozen margaritas when we first got there. Lots of other restaurants to choose from that were also good for breakfast. The casino was fun, too. I would definitely recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “We loved staying at NYNY!”
Reviews.Author: GlobalSmurfs
Reviews.Content: We had a great time and loved staying at NYNY, which is an amazing hotel that comes with everything you expect from a Las Vegas hotel. Even if the hotel is colossal with a lot of people coming through, we found it very clean, tidy and well-maintained. The check in was quick and efficient. There are lots of excellent restaurants downstairs as well as entertainment. The room was spacious, beautifully decorated and we were surprised how quiet the room was considering the hotel itself is loud and hectic. The hotel location is good and much of the action is within close walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended hotel/casino”
Reviews.Author: detcastle
Reviews.Content: My husband and I (early 40s) stayed at NYNY for three nights in October. We had a great time and enjoyed the hotel. For us it was a good fit - great price, fun NY atmosphere and details, not too big, good food choices, fun slots. We had a particularly good time at Nine Irishmen watching first baseball then football while sitting at the bar. I would recommend this hotel to friends and family. (no review of pool as it was too cold that weekend) But if you are looking for a mega resort or swank environs or the best pool, this is probably not for you.

Reviews.Title: “Great holiday at New York New York.......Vegas.”
Reviews.Author: eastcoastkev
Reviews.Content: 1st November 2011. Hi we have returned home today from a fantastic 7 day stay at The New York New York Hotel in Las Vegas,our first visit to Vegas could'nt have been any better,we found the hotel really was good value,everything about it was good,it was very very busy as it was Halloween weekend,you;ve got to remember that people go there to enjoy themselves,i have no doubt about recommending this hotel,weather was fantastic,we only had one dissapointment that was out trip to the Grand Canyon,we booked the coach trip to the south rim,it took four and three quarter hours each way,and only two hours at the canyon,so pay the extra and get the helicopter tour its far to far to travel in one day by coach.If you've not been........go...go...go.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Nerissa C
Reviews.Content: Great spot on the Strip. Clean and tidy, nice rooms. Friendly staff. Great choice of restaurants downstairs. Nice pool area although not enough chairs. One downfall was the really long walk once I got out of elevator to my room right at the other end. Surprisingly quiet considering roller coaster just outside window. Not real happy about resort fees though. Internet should be in package total. Overall great time in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Too much and too busy”
Reviews.Author: KathyZanoff
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended by friends and We were sorry we listened. It was busy, noisy, and the service was not so great. The service at the front desk was non extstant and we felt the they were rushing us when ever we ate at the resturants. Gallegars Steak hose was great. It was loud with lots of kids running smoking, and skate boarding ine the casino. We will not be going back there

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Krizo
Reviews.Content: I've been to Vegas 7 times and this was our first time at NYNY. I've always wanted to stay there and can honestly say it's one of the better places I've stayed. I was impressed with how quiet the rooms were despite the fact that there's a roller coaster just outside the window. The rooms were nice and clean, and our maintenance issue was handled within hours of reporting. Staff was friendly, food outlets were really good - we ate at the pizza place and the fish & Chips place as well as Chin Chin's for breakfast. The buffet was a really good value but the quality of the ingredients was not the greatest. Still very convenient though. The casino and hotel main floor ambiance are great and the pool is pretty good as well. The value for what you get at NYNY is excellent compared with the high prices other comparable hotels charge and I will definitely be staying at NYNY again in the future. **Be aware that the use of the business centre is only free if you're printing boarding passes and not for other computer/internet/printing. They don't fully disclose this when you check in.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & top hotel”
Reviews.Author: brooksie0_0
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 7 nights, the hotel was fantastic, perfect location for the strip along with the mono rail & deuce/rta bus pick ups. Hotel was always clean, plenty of staff on hand, friendly & helpful. Lots of food outlets to choose from as well as shops and bars! Hotel were very helpful with our request for a fridge to store medicines (would cost $30 per day otherwise) free if for medical reasons although no proof was required. Our resort fee $15 per day was included in the cost of our holiday so make sure you checked this out before going, the wifi was probably the most used feature in this, although it did cover the pool and gym too. Definitely recommend picking up the coupon book 'Vegas 2 go' which you get on check in, however they r readily available throughout all the hotels. Lots of info & some useful coupons too. Overall a great stay and would definitely return & recommend :)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MAK911
Reviews.Content: Went to Vegas for a family wedding with my 19-year-old daughter. LOVED New York, New York. Enough variety of restaurants for everyone. The food we had there was great and the casino is friendly. Rooms were very comfortable and very clean. Would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Fun atmosphere, friendly service.”
Reviews.Author: 2MITravelers
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 6 nights in one of the Marquis Suites for a business/leisure trip. The room was very spacious - king size bed, couch, loveseat, 2 arm chairs, 2 tv's, table w/4 chairs, desk, refrigerator, and large armoire. We found the bed to be very comfortable. Housekeeping was very efficient. Our room was cleaned every morning while we were at breakfast. Wonderful restaurants with plenty of options. Gallaghers Steakhouse was expensive, but excellent. Il Fornaio served some of the best Italian food we'd ever had, and Gonzalez y Gonzalez is a great little Mexican restaurant. There were lots of other reasonably priced options and some great drink specials at the bars. The casino was a little small, as was the pool area, but both were always hopping with people. The roller coaster looked fun, although it was annoying having it race over our heads constantly when we were laying by the pool. All in all it was a great trip, and we will definitely stay here again. The only reason we gave 4 instead of 5 stars is because check out was a mess. At 9:30am there were 12 people in line ahead of us waiting to check out and there was only 1 person checking people out. After about 15 minutes of waiting and no sign of the line moving at all, people were getting upset about possibly missing their flights home. I have no idea why there was only 1 person working checkouts in the morning when checkout time was 11am, yet there were 2 or 3 people working in the checkin side when checkin isn't until 3pm. The checkin people were not taking anyone from the checkout line which was very frustrating.

Reviews.Title: “good price, great location”
Reviews.Author: shanim_nim
Reviews.Content: stayed 3 nights, did'nt eat in the resturants and did'nt use the pool. clean and nice room, no noise from the outside. free parking and close to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Large, very nice room”
Reviews.Author: Checkbook
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel after reading tons of reviews. The room was huge and very nice although it is a maze trying to get to some of the rooms but that is pretty common in the big hotels in Vegas.The hotel in general is very nice with great restaurants and bars. It definitely has a nicer feel than most of the other casinos in Vegas. We stayed in the New Yorker tower and were upgraded for free to a corner room. Beautiful view, even with the roller coaster. No problems with the coaster as far as noise goes either. No complaints and would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Better than i thought.”
Reviews.Author: FraserB
Reviews.Content: I only stayed at New York, Ne York for one night. I must admit i had been put off by others. Quite a few people had complained about the noise from the rollercoaster. It was never a problem, but then me and my room mate Mark Smith were out till 5am. Overall very good, quick check in, slightly confusing layout, but good sized rooms, very clean. Nice tv with a good sound system. Casino is well laid out, the beer is cold and the waitresses are pretty quick if you are playing the tables. Staff were friendly. The guy in the cigar shop was a bit clueless though. Overall pretty good, I slightly regretted having to check out for Trump. I would have stayed longer.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: sayitloudmn
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my friend in January 2011. We were upgraded to the deluxe room - but it seems like all promotions get an "upgraded" room so I'm not sure if there are regular rooms! It was a clean and spacious room. The nightclub was fun and we got on the list to get in free before midnight. The front desk staff was nice and the cleaning service was great. It is a good location for south strip and I would happily stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “This is a great place to stay on the strip!”
Reviews.Author: glittermomma8
Reviews.Content: We had a great time and loved staying at NYNY! Please keep in mind that I am a rather picky traveler. I was worried at first after reading some of the reviews of NYNY Las Vegas but we were extremely pleased. We stayed in the newly renovated Madison Avenue rooms. It was a LOT nicer than the regular rooms there that we looked at on their website. We asked them for an upgrade when we arrived, which we they let us have free of charge since it was my birthday and first time in Vegas. The King size bed was super comfy and we had a large flat screen TV. Our room was very comfortable. NYNY may not be the fanciest place to stay compared to extravagance of Bellagio and Venetian but it really was awesome for us...we loved it. The location on the strip is right in the middle of everything. There are plenty of restaurants and places to grab a bite to eat in the casino and a few gift shops. Starbucks, Nathan's Hotdogs, NY Pretzels, a steakhouse, an asian bistro, a Mexican restaurant, Irish Pub, 2 Pizza Places and a Burger place. We ate at the Mexican restaurant which was VERY good. I had a watermelon margarita and fresh guacamole...both delish! We also ate at one of the pizza places for a quick bite....it was pretty much like Sbarro and I loved the pretzels from the pretzel stand..yum! It was an easy walk to MGM Grand (across the pedestrian bridge). We could hear barely the roller coaster from our room---which was right outside our window---but if I paid VERY close attention I could hear it....and there were times when I could hear music from our room....but it wasn't loud or annoying. The only complaint that I have is that the entire hotel was smokey and stuffy. It wasn't unbearably smokey, but I'm just not used to that and I do realize that anywhere you stay in Vegas will be smokey if it's in a casino. ANYWAY....we had a great time and loved where we stayed!

Reviews.Title: “Ride the rollercoaster on the strip”
Reviews.Author: Fire_fly0414
Reviews.Content: We stayed in one of the suites. Very comfortable and clean and the service was friendly. The staff was attentive and accomidating to our needs. Of course, it's Vegas so most service staff is that way. However, it's got a good balance for what most go there for. So just enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to begin our honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: julioc86
Reviews.Content: We got married at the Luxor Hotel on 17th Oct and decided to stay at the New York New York Hotel for the first 4 nights of our honeymoon, I'm so glad we did. Check in was nice and easy, only took about 20 minutes even with a queue of around 10 people in front of us. We were in a Park Avenue Deluxe room on the 10th floor of the new yorker building, the decor was fine and there was a huge TV. An added bonus was a lovely bathroom and a free in room safe. The casino was our favourite out of all of the hotel casinos we visited, as there was such a friendly atmosphere. We were a bit disappointed that there was no free upgrade for our wedding night (we would have had to pay $64) but our room was perfect anyway. There are some lovely looking restaurants in the hotel but we only ate at the America once and the Italian cafe (not restaurant) once. This is because we didn't come to Vegas to only eat at the same hotel in which we stayed! There were so many fantastic places to eat in other hotels along the strip so we did that mostly. We did enjoy having a starbucks open at 6am though! Our room had the rollercoaster right outside but we could barely hear it and certainly it didn't bother us in the slightest, I don't see how it can have been that noisy for anyone unless they were just holed up in their rooms and not out enjoying vegas in the evening! We had 4 nights at this hotel before upgrading to the 5* Trump International at the other end of the strip, and we were actually upset to be leaving such a brilliant hotel and moving halfway through our holiday. Overall our time at this hotel was amazing, the staff are so friendly and it was a fantastic start to our married life together.

Reviews.Title: “new york in vegas”
Reviews.Author: genny r
Reviews.Content: new new york is an amazing hotel in vegas.Is right on the strip,close to mgm,luxor,montecarlo..The check in was really fast and we had a great room with view on the strip,the bathroom really astonishing. Many restaurants in the hotel with excellent food, and the casino was huge.It was like a small new york...ah las vegas is unique,everybody should go there sometimes!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, fantastic location!”
Reviews.Author: lu123442
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights at New York New York and thoroughly enjoyed our stay there. Check in and check out were quick and efficient. I really enjoyed the New York theme as well as the roller coaster outside the hotel (although I was too chicken to go on it). The hotel is located opposite the M&M's store, food court, Ross (for bargain shopping ladies) as well as a Tix for Tonight. Our room was very spacious with 2 double beds, an armoire with flat screen TV and a great size bathroom. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “one full week at NY-NY”
Reviews.Author: TonyaW60471
Reviews.Content: I don't know where to start we had such a great time. Check -in was quick and easy clerk was friendly and welcoming. Our room was huge and clean beds were comfy and had a nice variety of pillows. We stayed in a Broadway deluxe room which had a nice flat screen t.v. We stayed on 5th floor and the roller coaster noise did not bother us at all. Had a large variety of restaurants, food court Starbucks, Ben and Jerry's and a great Italian restaurant. Staff and service in restaurants was excellent as well. Room was cleaned everyday after we left. Housekeeping did not bother us if we had sign on door. The casino had a great atmosphere, nice variety of machines and the cocktail service here was the best we encountered anywhere in Vegas. 3rd day at the NY-NY was our anniversary and when we put our card in the machine it flashed "happy anniversary" for the whole day! That was a nice gesture and just another way to show the great customer service you get at the NY-NY. Great location Luxor, Excalibur, Mgm Grand and Tropicana were all just a hop across the bridge away.I read some reviews that said this hotel caters to a younger crowd.. not true I am 40 years old and had just great time as the twenty somethings do. I think no matter your age you will have a great time here! Check-out was a breeze and they offered us some great comps for playing here. Will definatly be returning to this hotel and would recommend to family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “just ok”
Reviews.Author: mawenzi
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this property mid October on a Thursday and Friday night in a Park Avenue Strip view room. On the plus the parking garage is located in a very convenient area to get in and out of Las Vegas Blvd. and there is a variety of restaurants to choose from as well as a fun atmosphere to stroll around in. The room itself is pretty average and compared to other similar priced hotels on the strip-- more basic. The carpet and furniture were worn and the wallpaper was peeling in several areas. My biggest dissappontment was the bathroom--plastic tub and shower door with faux marble. There was a long counter with one sink but the toilet was up against part of it so only one person could stand at the counter at a time. Small soap, shampoo/conditioner and lotion--no shower cap so I used the liner of the ice bucket for my hair. If I was staying at a budget motel this would have been fine but my expectations were higher for a known hotel on the strip. There is also a resort fee (which really gets you nothing extra other than wi-fi)--when booking, I just assumed that was standard practice for all of the big resorts. However, I noticed some resorts such as the Paris were advertising that they did not charge a fee so it would be worth it to do some price comparisons before booking. My last comment--staff needs to smile more and be more welcoming at check-in.

Reviews.Title: “Really good hotel, so much to do”
Reviews.Author: Globetrotter Q
Reviews.Content: I loved it at this hotel, the room, the huge casino, the restaurants and shops available, and the location. And the price!! Really good value for money for a middle of the range hotel. The New York theme is fantastic and I just wish I'd been brave enough to ride the coaster!! I've stayed at Circus Circus and at MGM Grand before and this one is by far my favourite of those three. Of course, I might re-think if I got a chance to stay at one of the high-end hotels lol, but until then, New York is highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: paul j
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is literally a stone's throw from Times Square and Broadway. The Hotel is art deco and has a wonderful ambience. All staff are polite, courteous and eager to assist with anything to do with your stay in New York City.

Reviews.Title: “anniversary”
Reviews.Author: Marig4
Reviews.Content: very nice hotel just what we expected, even got room upgrade offer with minimal charge, good room service/great casino/assistance for tourings/restaurants/swimming pool/bars and shows with all attractions close by.

Reviews.Title: “cheap and nice”
Reviews.Author: linatoday
Reviews.Content: went with friends and family and everything inside just like the other hotels, walking distance to other hotels. 4 star and cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Another Enjoyable Stay At NYNY.”
Reviews.Author: Rising14
Reviews.Content: My eighth year in a row to Vegas and 5th on the bounce at NYNY. We checked in around 4.30pm local time and even though I had a Players Card and could have used the VIP Check-In Lounge the main desk was clear so I went straight ahead and got our group of 4 checked-in quickly and efficiently by a very helpful young lady at main reception. I have to say wondering around the hotel later in the week at various times throughout the day the lines were LONG! We asked well before departure from the UK for the same room as last year and Chase my casino host ensured this was fulfilled as it is a corner room and has great space and equally good views up and down the strip. The room was always immaculately cleaned whilst we were there and if we had a lie in the Housekeepers Office would call to confirm they would clean the room later when we had left for the day. We visited all the bars with Nine Fine Irishmen yet again doing the trick for good food, drink and evening entertainment. The Bar At Times Square with the dualing pianos is also a must and never fails to draw a good evening crowd intent on fun and laughter and the piano players ensure everyone leaves happy and more than a little hoarse after all the singing. A new thing this year was the introduction of a crooner in the afternoons so if you want to stroll in grab a table and a beer and be entertained for an hour or two then this now an option. And in less crowded conditions as the evenings. Whilst there we ate at Il Fornaio the Italian Restaurant which is always a nice relaxing experience with high quality food and service. You can people watch from an outside table as the patio faces onto the casino floor. Gallaghers Steakhouse was once again visited and we have learnt that no matter how hungry you may be it is best to order a main course only, with one of the various steak options a must, with vegetables and potatoes or fries and leave off the side dishes. This is if you want to be able to move around freely again within two hours as the portions and quality of the food can render you no more than a beached whale when washed down with a bottle or two of a good red. In other words a top drawer place with good food and service. It can run a bit pricey but you are on vacation and it is Vegas. America is one of the best 24 hour food places you could ask for. It's like a good friend who is always there when needed. We used it at all hours of the day and night and I mean all hours and we always enjoyed value for money and have no complaints. Whilst snacking between gambling and partying in the later hours Sirricos Pizza and I must admit the other fast food outlets served us up tasty, warm food at a very reasonable price. The general bars (Centre Bar & Pour 24) offer a different kind of a place to enjoy a relaxing drink as one is a circular bar bang in the centre of the casino and the other, Pour 24, looks down onto the casino from a busy thoroughfare. Both are great for people watching though on occasions I found the music down at the Centre Bar a little hard to take as the volume was just a little too loud but only on certain occasions - can't remember but it may have been at the weekend. Heather at the Centre Bar has become a good friend due to my regular visits and once more Heather was there on the 'graveyard shift' to serve us and newcomers with her usual smile and friendly chat and banter. In the early hours it's nice to have a place to go to get a second or third wind and to relax over a beer or cocktail whilst having a nice chat. One of the things we found again to be a bit of a negative is the happy hour/early entrance to Rok the hotels nightclub. You can be given tickets and told happy hour is on and that it is a top class place to get into. It probably is but at between the hours of 5pm and 6pm it is nothing more than an empty room with never more than 5 people in not including we 4 and the drinks prices didn't make me happy. The lights are pretty much on full so as stated it turns out to be nothing more than an average, overpriced bar we have fallen for it twice now but not next year. At proper nightclub hours it is a bustling atmospheric place with great lighting and visuals and it should probably try to remain just that and not try and contend with the proper daytime bars. We checked out via the Players Club Lounge which was once again fast and efficient though I have to say I felt the comps were not as good as last year. I feel I gambled more yet received less comped back but that could just be me. Although the casinos have been struggling in recent years so maybe it's a tightening of belts even further. In saying that I still recommend the M Life Players Card. I am already planning my trip to NYNY for October 2012 so you can say I have once more enjoyed myself enough to head back. As I stated in last years review head to Vegas with an open mind but with the intention of enjoying yourself. It has a bit for everyone and the trick is to find the bits you like and move on from the parts you don't then sit back and enjoy the ride. Finally when booking a show pre-departure we went for the biggest name available and managed to get tickets for Elton John and believe me he was outstanding. What a show, what a showman, what an entertainer and what a pro. I liked his 70's and 80's stuff way back but lost him late 80's onwards but this show covers the whole career with some of his original band and with a fabulous set and back drop. A must see!! Anyway here's to Vegas 2012.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not great.”
Reviews.Author: raesive
Reviews.Content: Booked through priceline, and very glad we didn't pay the full price. Check in took a long time, and there wasn't even a line. There was a lot of confusion trying to get two rooms on the same floor, which ended up not happening anyhow. Had to pay a resort fee, which was annoying and we never even got the "free" newspaper. Casino area was typical of the the high end Vegas casinos. It was at least interesting wandering around and taking in the New York theme. We ate at two of the restaurants and they were good though not anything special. Navigating the hallways to get to our room took quite while, we were amazed at how far you had to walk to get to where are room was in relation to the elevator. Glad we don't have any issues getting around.

Reviews.Title: “Good location!”
Reviews.Author: Chenchy
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay here and really only had a couple surprises - no coffee maker, very unreliable Internet & no vent fan in the bathroom. Next trip I'll stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Recent vacation stay & review”
Reviews.Author: newadventure53
Reviews.Content: Spent the week of Oct 17th at the New York, New York Hotel in Las Vegas. We enjoy staying there for the location to other places to see and eat + the many food options within the New York facility itself. Upon checking in around noon we found out that a fee of $20 would be charged if you check in before 3 pm. That seems fair considering all the people that come in on early flights like we did. We choose not to check in early and left our bags at the baggage holding area and went off to have lunch and walk around a bit. We did do a check in where we were registered, but could not use the room. So between 2 & 3 pm we called and was told our room was now ready and gathered our baggage and went to our room. This informal check in worked out very nice for our needs and for what the hotel staff needs to get done as others are checking out of their rooms. When we did initially check in the hotel upgraded us to the next size up room without us asking which I thought was very nice of them. Our only complaint was the beds were not very comfortable. Too hard and both my wife and I woke up during the night with sore hips from the hardness of the bed. Besides that I strongly recommend this hotel for the price, location to other things to do and see on the strip, and for the gambling / food / pool options available.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special...”
Reviews.Author: Madjude
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights on the 18 th floor of the century building. Room had a clover shaped spa which was a nice attraction but I had difficulty getting in and out of the spa. There is no step up into the spa and being short meant it was not easy to access. Ended up with a huge bruise on my inner leg. There was a horrible smell in the room coming from the drain. Each time we used the spa or shower the smell was over powering. We reported this to front desk and they waivered the resort fee. Check in and out was slow but I guess this is normal for a big hotel on the strip. No coffee maker or fridge in room. Apparently if we upgraded to the next room level for an extra $20 per night we would get a fridge. The location on the strip was good.

Reviews.Title: “Great atmosphere & all round experience”
Reviews.Author: Vansportsfan
Reviews.Content: I give NYNY top marks for the all round fun factor. The ambiance, layout and excellent variety of bars and restaurants make it a total package. I found the staff to be friendly and helpful. The rooms themselves are nice enough but the mismatch of patterns & colours leave you wondering what effect they are going for. My son & I had reserved a Broadway deluxe room, so I was a bit dissappointed when we checked in on Tuesday night and they informed us that they had run out, but they gave us a Park Ave deluxe strip view on the 21st floor and waived the resort fee...so that was fair and we were happy with our room, good size and comfortable. I try to always book at least one category up at hotels, especially if there is only a few dollars difference, since that can sometimes make a huge difference. Going from the other reviews here, that seems to be the case at NYNY as well. The cab from the airport to the hotel was $22 there and $18 back, with traffic making the difference. Our first time to Vegas was a lot of fun, we both found so many things to do. The wax museum is worth the $25 or prebuy for discount. Look for drink & food deals especially 2-5 o'clock happy hours, you can save a lot. A pint of beer & a hot dog for $2 on Freemont Street. Do you really need a souvenier cup with your drink for $14-$17? You can find other slushy drinks with plain plastic cups to go for $3. The NYNY hit the mark for us (50 yr woman & 22 yr son) it's comfortable middle class - great for the young and young at heart. If you're looking for quality and higher class than you might not appreciate the personality here. We were looking for a hotel that really said "Las Vegas" and wasn't just the same as anywhere else and we found it here.

Reviews.Title: “What can you say”
Reviews.Author: nialltruan
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights, which was plenty. The hotel is amazing and with all Vegas hotels, it's noisy and hectic. we had a lovely room with 2 queen beds and it was quiet, but there is no coffee maker, so you have to buy drinks. Thought the hotel restaurants were comparable with other hotels along the strip for prices, which were pretty expensive. Check in took some time as it was mid afternoon, but everyone was very helpful. The only real disapointment was the size of the pool for the number of rooms. We only found 1 pool and it was busy.

Reviews.Title: “Tired hotel now...”
Reviews.Author: JuneMcL
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here in April 2011 with another couple who were getting married. We had been to LV in 2006 and had fond memories of this hotel when we were here last. We hadn't stayed here previously but thought it was a quirky fun hotel. When we arrived in April, we were pretty disappointed with the room. Don't get me wrong, it was spacious enough and clean but really needs updating now. The other couple we stayed with were upgraded to a "spa room" but this simply meant a slightly bigger room with a hot tub in the bedroom - which again, was very drab and aged. The decor is quite depressing. I suppose if you are just looking for somewhere to lay your head, then this is fine but there are plenty of other really nice hotels which give you a bit more for your money. The casino in the hotel was fine and we still love the Irish bar but if we go back to LV, we wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very very poor service, dirty room and really smelly”
Reviews.Author: garyinternational
Reviews.Content: As a person who stays about 200 nights per year in hotels on all 5 continents, I have to state that this is by far one of the 2 worst! 1. Check in process - 45 min (with only 2 people in front of me) 2. I arrived at the hotel at 10am after flying for 24 hours and my room was ready (lovely surprise) - BUT, in order to get it, I had to pay an extra $20! 3. In the evening there was no internet - I called the Cox service that they used, but they could not do anything except send a technician to check up (oh, by the way, he never arrived)! 4. There was a horrendous smell on the 16th floor - really really bad. 5. On day 2, they finally cleaned my room after 7pm after I requested at 1 pm and 4pm. In short DONT EVER stay at this hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mjollnir58801
Reviews.Content: NYNY is an awesome hotel and casino. Well apportioned with restaurants and entertainment, we had a blast. Great room with a great view of the city, and lots of access to shops and bars right down the street.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Steve E
Reviews.Content: We arrived on Friday afternoon at 3pm, the check in was quick and efficient, they even upgraded our room free of charge. The restaurants in the Hotel that we tried were relatively cheap for Vegas. The Il Fornaio was superb, with great service as well, we ate there for breakfast twice and had the pancakes(delicious) also for dinner once (pizza and angel pasta) fantastic, also tried Chin Chin cafe and ate the Sushi there which was fantastic, the hot and sour soup was really good too! Room in the Hotel was not massive, but clean and tidy, and lets be honest you are in Vegas and do not spend much time in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Coopergreg
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel for the first five nights of an 11 night stay (2 nights Death Valley, 2 nights Stratosphere, 2 nights Monte Carlo). Check in was quick, and the staff were polite and helpful. We'd booked a Broadway Deluxe Strip View room, and weren't disappointed. It was in the Empire Tower on the 36th floor with express elevators that didn't stop below about floor 26, so we never had to wait long for one. The room was large and clean, with windows along two sides of the room looking out over great the MGM Grand, Tropicana, airport and Excaliber down to Mandalay Bay and the mountains beyond. The only downside of our stay was the pillows 'sweaty' we asked for replacements at reception (which were prompty delivered), and although better, still were a little stale. There are plenty of places to eat. We ate a breakfast and a dinner at the America diner which were ok. The Mexican restaurant was nice, and Galaghers Steakhouse served the best steak I've ever had! It was reasonably pricey restaurant (approx $50 for a steak and sides) but it was worth it, and the servers were great. The guests were a mix of ages, but probably most in their 20's to 40's which is our age bracket, so this was ok. We would recommend staying here, and it's in a great spot on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “There are nicer ones”
Reviews.Author: jinty00
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights in October with my husband. Nothing really WRONG with the hotel, but there are nicer ones further up the Strip. Because of the theme the hotel was very dark. It was cheaper for accommodation but we discovered the other hotels were actually cheaper to eat and drink in. My husband preferred the Casino in Planet Hollywood - croupiers were much friendlier. The room was a good size but no fridge although there are ice and drinks machines on certain floors. Hair dryer, and iron in room. The roller coaster is right outside most rooms. But didn't disturb us. Our room was a long way from the lift.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: rondi3
Reviews.Content: We had one of their smaller (cheaper) rooms; it was OK, but slightly worn. The hotel's corridors and open spaces have nice Art Deco touches, which add to the NY theme. Check-in can be slow, but we got there at a time when the line was short. I recommend the Italian restaurant, Il Fornaio, which has good food with main courses at $20-25. There is also a cafe of the same name nearby which has good breakfast items and real espresso. The casino is roomy and has several new slot games that are more complex to play and entertaining. It is fairly simple to find your way around the hotel, and you are close to the MGM Grand via a ped bridge. NY-NY is close to the south end of the Strip, so it is easy to reach the airport or the car rental complex.

Reviews.Title: “small room but clean”
Reviews.Author: ckrystek
Reviews.Content: Arrived around 1 pm, before the 3 pm check in, was able to check in within 5 minutes. however took our luggage about 30 minutes to finally make it up to our room. Room was clean, but felt very small. online says only 400 sq feet, but big tv stand and desk take up a lot of space. NYNY is does have a good location. Easy walking to many casino's. Sports book is a little lame, nowhere to sit, and lines go all the way up to ceiling. Serious neck cramp if you sat there all day. Only plus side to sports book is no lines, because everyone goes somewhere else. Pool was freezing, too cold to even get in, one jacuzzi was broken, but two others were working. For the right price I would stay again, but that price is under $60, resort fee of $15 is lame too.

Reviews.Title: “OK but nothing special - good luck checking in”
Reviews.Author: Stubbsyt
Reviews.Content: Arrived in late afternoon (4.30pm) after long drive from Disneyland to be greated with a 45 minute wait at check-in. Finally got the room key (no upgrade available which I was happy to pay for - on a Tuesday??). Went to our alotted room and the key did not work but was answered by an understandably agitated guest who had just checked in. Left the family upstairs and went back down to the customer service / information desk (another 20 minute wait) to find out that we had been given the wrong room number and were meant to be next door. Room was larger than a normal hotel room (Broadway Premium View) with decent view on 16th floor. Next problem was the in room safe did not work. Called downstairs and a service man came up but could not fix it so he called another man who could not fix it either so they both disappeared saying they would be back. Rang reception after 15 minutes to be told that they were looking in to it whilst my wife and kids (11+8) who had been ready to go out for half an hour waited impatiently. After another 15 minutes reception rang back to tell me that the safe could not be fixed and that they would therefore be upgrading me to another room. All well and good but by this time it was 7.30 (3 hours after we arrived) and we were also moved into the room that i had initially tried to pay to upgrade to. We were told the keys would automatically change over but I was not surprised when i had to make another trip downstairs to get new keys, AGAIN!! So by 8pm we had a room with working safe and took 2 very tired kids out for dinner. Now that i have stopped ranting..... The new room was great, a funny square shape but still heaps of room with great views up and down the strip. The many choices of food were great for the family. The duelling piano's bar looked great at night and was always full even though it was mid-week Location was OK but you would not want to be any further south on the strip Pool shut ay 6pm which was disappointing for the kids

Reviews.Title: “A great time”
Reviews.Author: keevs84
Reviews.Content: We had a great time here. We got upgraded to a strip facing view which we were happy about tho the view itself wasn't great but since it was an extra we didn't really care, we weren't there for the views. Hotel was clean and we where amazed at how quiet it was a night/morning time. We never once heard people coming and going so that was an added bonus for us! Did feel a bit miffed about the resort fee at the time, prob even more so when I realized most of the offers u can get in the hotel anyway without your coupon book but it wudnt be enough to keep me from going back there. All in all a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Ok Rooms, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: etan92612
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located at the intersection of Tropicana and The Strip. Much of the action is within close walking distance. We stayed in a Broadway Deluxe Room with a view of The Strip. The room was a nice and clean ordinary room. The bathroom was exceptionally small. All the staff was really friendly. We were greeted by everyone with a smile from housekeeping to the spa. It seemed like the whole hotel was smokier than the average Vegas hotel. There is a wonderful variety of restaurants all conveniently located...not all spread out like at many of the other Vegas resorts. There are so many great hotels that I might look for one with better rooms and less smoke.

Reviews.Title: “Great Las Vegas experience”
Reviews.Author: noghri
Reviews.Content: Superb hotel, perfect room with jacuzzi and great view : an ideal start for our first-time discovery of Las Vegas. Room was spotless clean and very big. The main attractions on the Vegas Strip are nearby, along with plenty of restaurants and food shops. Highly recommended !

Reviews.Title: “Big, Bright, Loud Hotel”
Reviews.Author: julie1675
Reviews.Content: Our trip was not what we where expecting so my review maybe slightly different than others!! Our check in was ok, not much of a queue, receptionist was ok not overly helplful. We had 2 park lane rooms in the new york tower, one was a corner room and much larger. Both rooms where of a good standard and very comfortable. Bathroom was very nice. Both had strip views and could see the airport. The rollercoaster was beneath our rooms but did not disturb us. Our Father was taken ill on our first full day there, the front desk where very helpful and assisted us in extending our stay at reduced prices, we did have trouble using the buisness centre when we needed to fax insurance papers home. We found that the overnight workers on the front desk where much more helpful and didn't charges to fax and use the internet. Our maid was very good and kept our rooms very clean always had fresh linen and towels. We all agreed the beds where very comfortable. Our favorite place in the hotel was pour24 bar in the lobby, the jello shots where amazing!!! It is next to coyote ugly so we got to listen to the music without the crush. The frozen cocktails at coyote ugly are to die for we loved them!!! We did not eat in any of the resturant due to our circumstances but we did eat a lot of the fast food, which was good food at resonable prices. The valets at the taxi rank where very helpful and made sure we had a taxi quickly when we needed to get to the hospital in a hurry, even remembering it was our Dad that was ill and asked how he was each day. The hotel is very large and I did at times get a little lost, the casino is loud and smokey but not so much that it was offensive. I'm not sure any of us would return to vegas but if we did we would return to new york new york.

Reviews.Title: “Travel Agent - Disapproved”
Reviews.Author: Agent21409
Reviews.Content: As a travel agent enjoying my personal time in Vegas this week, NYNY did not meet the standards for me or my patrons. The service at checkin was disastrous taking almost 45 minutes to check in. My confirmed early checkin was not accommodated and the room was not ready until well after 4:30pm (regular checkin is 3pm). Erroneous charges and pending transactions on my credit card resulted in over $2300 worth of charges for a room that should have cost $900. It has taken 5 employees to correct the reservation and credit card charges while at the hotel and 2 more once I returned home. Custoemr Service is terrible and I suggest you watch your credit card charges daily as the staff makes charges without your knowledge. On a great note, the Marquis Suite was absolutely beautiful with a wonderful view of the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: Kerryos1
Reviews.Content: Requested my party be allowed to check in before me was told yes by a customer service rep. When they arrived they were not allowed to check in, had to pay again & get another room, mass confusion trying to get their card reversed of charges because I booked through priceline. Poor customer service, poor communication, staff does not tell the truth Mandalay, monte carlo are much better hotels

Reviews.Title: “Watch your CC statements”
Reviews.Author: Tara R
Reviews.Content: We stayed 10/11/11 thru 10/14/11. We had reserved 3 rooms for early check-in and upon arriving at the hotel (Tuesday @ 1pm) we were told that our rooms were not ready because the person staying in one of our rooms had a late checkout and the other wasn't clean yet, so our rooms wouldn't be ready until 4:30. It took us almost an hour to check for 3 rooms (1 of which was actually ready). The room was beautiful (Marquis Suite). Our 2nd day (Wednesday) my sister and I realized that we had large "pending" charges on our room ($2200 on rooms that should have cost $1100). When we went down the front desk we were told that they were pending and would be released at check out. The next day (Thursday) my sister had another charge of $80 from this hotel. When we returned to the front desk to say wtf?? the front desk staff were very confused for what the charge was for. At that point they called our credit card companies to release all the pending payments and we paid in full for our rooms. Upon arriving home I checked my statement to make sure that the pending charges were released and what do I find? ANOTHER charge for $50.40 charged to my card. When I called the front desk I spoke to Larissa (no clue) and then Deana (mgr), I was told that they "accidentally" charged my credit card but refunded it back right away, I thought it was nice that Deana threw her co-worker under the bus by saying it was someone else and not her (Deana) who made the charge. As a manager I think that Deana needs more customer service training and that the front desk as a whole need more training, there is total pilot error in that place. The worst part was that upon check-in we wanted to pay in full for our rooms & they could use the CC as a hold for "incidentals" and we were told "NO, that they didn't do that"...of course they don't because why pay the actual price when they can jerk you for double?? My conversation ended with Deana telling me that "I am helping you even though you are whispering how ridiculous this problem is"....really?? In my book, three strikes and you are out. Gird your CC's in this place people...

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous First Time In Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Karen B
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 8 nights at New York New York. We arrived at the hotel at noon and the young gentleman serving us at check in could not have been more accommodating. We were able to check in early and he also provided us with an upgrade free of charge. We also received our requested non-smoking room. We stayed in a Broadway Deluxe room in the New Yorker Tower. We had a corner room with the view of the Monte Carlo as well as the back of the hotel. Not great but we were not there to spend too much time in our room. Beds were comfortable. My only complaint is the pillows (but thats a personal preference). Housekeeping did a great job every day. Not once were we woken up if the do not disturb sign was on the door and the room was always clean. The food and service in every restaurant we tried was very good. The staff at the front desk, the information desk, as well as the ticket and tours desk were very professional and could not have been more helpful. We did not find the casino to be smokey at all. The ceilings are extremely high and the ventilation system is very good. We found this to be the case in many of the better hotels on the strip. The cocktail waitresses were very attentive and we never had to wait very long for a drink. Although we did visit most other resorts on the strip, we personally prefer New York New York. Although a large enough resort, after the first day it is easy to find your way around, unlike some of the other massive resorts on the strip. We will definitely be back and recommend this hotel to all our friends. P.S. If you are not already an mlife member, sign-up and make sure you use your card all the time. We are by no means high rollers, but we did get some great comps from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid the One Bedroom "Penthouse" , The Pierre Rm 4411”
Reviews.Author: p3mikey
Reviews.Content: This is not the property I normally stay at when in Las Vegas, but here for a conference so I booked the "best" room they had. The Pierre, Rm 4411 is wholly disappointing. It's supposed to have a dining room table for four. It has a small table with two chairs and the table wobbles. Little to no view of the Strip--I guess if I lean way over I can see a little. And the windows are tiny. Most of the chairs and sofas have noticeably visible stains. The room safe wouldn't hold anything bigger than maybe an iPad and certainly not my laptop. Torn room carpet. The bed is adequate but with only two pillows--WTF? The website shows a big wet bar with chairs running along it. I have a very small wet bar with no chairs. The shower looks like it came from a one-star Howard Johnson's. And upon check-in, they charged the total for the four nights. So I can't escape. If you want a real suite, go anyplace else.

Reviews.Title: “Uninspired”
Reviews.Author: Tesnus
Reviews.Content: Housekeeping staff must be understaffed or there are issues. Room service leftovers in hallways for 3/4 of the day. Misc trash in hallways. Room was marginally clean. Room had view of roller coaster = LOUD screams every few minutes. Check in was neither welcoming nor friendly. Casino looks like every other casino in LV. Not on monorail which makes it less convenient to get around- not that the monorail is set up for convience since you have to traverse a maze within each hotel to get to it! Mattress belonged in a low budget motel and bedding was thin and old looking, broken drawer and ragged carpet in the room. The toilet made weird air noises, the shower was cool water only for the first 10 minutes. Be aware they tack on a fee for spa & gym whether you use them or not. They said you get a newspaper each morning but failed to say not at your door but you have to go to the giftshop to pick it up. They explained "we have too many rooms to deliver it to you". We would never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Better than I expected- good value”
Reviews.Author: bccrab
Reviews.Content: Stayed mid-week at NY-NY and got a very reasonable rate. I wasn't expecting this to be all that great , just a place to crash for 1 night. It turned out to be a very nice experience. Room was large and clean, check-in efficient. The hotel has some really great restaurants. There is a nice Italian bakery/coffee shop for breakfast in the morning. I didn't use the pool or spa so I can't comment on those. There's a fun Irish Pub with live music at night. Overall I enjoyed NY-NY more than I expected to and wound up spending most of my night there. I would go back,

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at New York, New York”
Reviews.Author: CanadaMaggie
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 3 night stay at the New York, New York, and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. We stayed in the standard Skyline Room and found it very spacious, clean, updated and comfortable. Our room faced the roller coaster, but you could hardly hear it during the day, and it does not operate through the night, so no problem at all. Bed was very comfortable; nice big flat screen TV and nice bathroom. There is no coffee maker in the room. There is a wide choice of restaurants in the resort - we enjoyed the Irishmen Pub and the fast food mexican restaurant. The italian cafe is great for a light breakfast. The pool is quite ordinary, but nice - the loungers fill up quickly. The dueling pianos at the Times Square bar was excellent. Service was friendly and efficient overall throughout the hotel and casino. The location is excellent - on the strip and easy access to adjacent hotels. We would recommend this hotel for a stay in Vegas, and found the standard room more than acceptable.

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: PeterW1967
Reviews.Content: Check-in was fast and smooth Room was great clean,had nice stripview but I was only there to sleep. Great place to eat & drink and there's always something open. Casino was great like the high ceilings Huge parking garage Would I stay there again? Yes,I liked it

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: cheermom81
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here in the Spa Suite for 4 nights and had a good experience. The room was clean and even though I think the furniture was a little worn, it was still in pretty good shape. The bed to me was very uncomfortable and I woke up every morning with back pain. I must say that the beds at TI are way better. The spa in the room was a great feature however a little odd in shape and the way you sit....if you book this room, you'll understand. The stand up shower in the bathroom was a little old with pieces of the tile falling off of the walls. However, I must say that I did enjoy all the restaurants and food eateries that this casino had to offer. The coupon book they give you upon checking in has great discounts and we used a lot of the coupons at different locations. All in all we had a great experience, but not sure if we'd stay here again.
