NY NY is just so far down the strip where we prefer to be, but was a nice enough hotel to come back to if the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “Really Enjoyed Our Stay”
Reviews.Author: keyjacks
Reviews.Content: I booked NYNY but after reading the reviews i considered cancelling but couldnt lucky for me as it really isnt bad!!! Arrived in las vegas in sep 2011 to get married and have our honeymoon and chose NYNY as last time i came to vegas stay at the other end of the strip in TI. First impressions were good and they upgraded our room for free. Chose to move rooms in the end as it was noisy due to the air conditioning for the whole hotel being outside our window. Had breakfast in America and the both italian places both excellent also the deli is amazing and i would highly recommend! Staff were excellent and always helpful, room was lovely and clean not huge but didnt spend too much time in there anyway! Went to the Rok the hotels club and that was good also. Pool was nice always got a bed but sun doesnt come round till around 10ish. Casino was good and there was always somewhere open to eat and drink!!! Hotel is a good price and clean so thats all that mattered to me really dont know why so many people complain. If you want to spend lots go cosmo or venetain as they are stunning but if you want a good price hotel with lots too offer go here!

Reviews.Title: “New York New York”
Reviews.Author: Glen G
Reviews.Content: Very reasonably priced Hotel, however check in staff were unhelpful, and couldn't be asked! croupiers in the main were also miserable. Service in the restaurants wasn't to the standard of other Las Vegas hotels I've stayed at, served you when they feel like it (you can wait till I've finished talking to my friend) type of attitude. Q. would I stay there again? A. Probably not. Las Vegas generally a Fantastic place.

Reviews.Title: “New York, New York.”
Reviews.Author: angelina1997
Reviews.Content: I was not happy about upgrading my room to a stripview and not being able to see the main strip. I also got kicked out of the gift shop. I had just walked in. We spend A LOT of money on gaming and the waitress wouldn't show up for a long time. I did email the hotel when I got home about all the bad things that happened to us. The sad thing was I never got a response of sorry or anything. I guess that didn't care because the bill was paid. I will not be staying at this hotel again. But the overall is very beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “New York New York”
Reviews.Author: 77Emma
Reviews.Content: As with most of the hotels in Vegas it is huge & easy to get lost! The check in host was miserable & snooty which was a shame as they should represent the hotel! Despite Mr Misery on reception the hotel was clean & the restaurants were top class. Again though the head staff in the restaurants were snooty & looked truly miserable. I would recommend the hotel to some extent but with the amount of hotels available in Vegas for cheaper I woul shop around!

Reviews.AuthorLocation: White Bear Lake, Minnesota, United States
Reviews.Title: “Great Anniversary Trip”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer F
Reviews.Content: We LOVED New York New York! This casino seemed to have everything that we needed! Casual to dressy! The drinks at the Center bar are comp'd if you gamble at the quarter video poker, and that means you don't have to wait for a waitress to find you and come back! The restaurants are all great! We had a great anniversary dinner at Gallaghers, and spent a ton of time at the Bar at Times Square with the dueling pianos. This place gave off a much better vibe than Luxor, or MGM. Much more friendly. You could be at home in jeans, shorts, or dressed to the nines. Luxor seemed cool, and too shiny, no fun! Excalibur seemed tired. Only con, All the MGM properties allow the Time Share sales people to hawk at EVERY entrance, since they own the Grand Vacations and Tahiti Village. Otherwise - fun players club, and great place to stay! We got our Spa Suite for just $120/night!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for price.”
Reviews.Author: AdamK72
Reviews.Content: On arriving at the New York New York we were amazed how huge it looked from the outside. Great location only 5 minutes from the airport, upon check in we asked if we could upgrade from a Park Avenue deluxe room to a Spa suite. The lady told us there werent any available but could upgrade us to a slighlty bigger room for $190, we decided not to bother as it didnt have the jacuzzi tub we wanted. The room was a decent size and we had a view of the airport, MGM and Excalibur which we were happy with, you can also see the rollercoaster but cant really hear it which was good. If being honest the room was a little dated but it did a job for just sleeping and getting ready in. Downstairs the hotel is vibrant and has a great atmosphere, the casino was superb and had a good variety of bars, restaurants and shops. The ninemen fishermen bar is a must, great food and the staff are really friendly. The bar at New York looked great with live piano/singing dual but was always full so get there early. The only real dissapointment was the pool area, very small considering the size of the hotel. Overall a great experience and loved Vegas in general, i think next time we will pay a little more and stay at the Venetian or Caesars Palace.

Reviews.Title: “Asked to stay and then treated poorly”
Reviews.Author: Lisa H
Reviews.Content: I received and accepted offer to stay at their hotel. I was very disappointed. The hallways smelled as did the rooms. The room was run down and very dirty. There was mold in the showers and around the baseboards, the water in the sink had a bad odor (I used bottled water to wash my hands and brush my teeth), and the blinds never stayed fully closed (was awakened every morning at sunrise). Linens were old and needing replacement. The front desk staff was very rude and unaccommodating. Upon check out, they had someone else’s credit card assigned to my room and needed to check to make sure mine was not assigned to another room. As for the Casino, the smell of cigarette smoke was unbearable. I know people will smoke, but the smoke was on my clothes and hair if in their casino for only couple of minutes. Other 4 star casinos, like MGM for example, do not have that problem. Will never stay here again. NOT a 4 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great nightlife and restaurant, but rooms are rundown”
Reviews.Author: Mnree7
Reviews.Content: We paid a little bit more for our "Broadway deluxe" room at New York New York and it was definitely an older one and needed some updating. The room itself was big but there was not a lot of furniture. Instead of a desk there was a small round table with two chairs. We were facing the roller coaster but thankfully had a much higher floor so we didn't hear that much noise. The restaurants and nightlife at the hotel are great though. They have opened up an Asian restaurant called Chin Chin since I last visited, which had good food. Gallagher's is a must if you are looking for a great steak. Beware that the a slice of pizza at any of those pizza places will cost you around 5 bucks. Overall, we wouldn't stay there again but will be back for the Casino and nightlife

Reviews.Title: “NY NY...... Better than the real thing?”
Reviews.Author: WorldTraveller947
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights after an expo.. Strip view room was clean and well appointed, but was poorly lit. Adjoining room door provided unrestricted volume to our unknown neighbors... Not a good option ! Overall casino ambience was ok, with plenty of open tables and slots. It was good, but not great....

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: stotd
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at NYNY the weekend of Oct 1. The experience was great right from the beginning. We arrived early Friday morning (10am) and they got us in to a king room right away (what we had requested). We did not have any issues with our room. Nice flat screen tv that worked great and clean room. Housekeeping was excellent. The casino itself is one of our favorites. It has a great energy to it and was well maintained. We were a group of 6 on this trip and we all had a great experience....All of the employees were friendly and responsive. They do a great job!

Reviews.Title: “disappointing”
Reviews.Author: toothfairyklw
Reviews.Content: We checked into this hotel for our first night in Las Vegas and were very disappointed with the room. It was poorly lit and the decor was 'dated ' and 'tired' looking. In need of refurbishment . The bathroom was particularly poor and had mould around the shower . We ate at the Irish Bar. Food was slow in arriving ,and then cold .Waitress was rude and lacking in service skills.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: Di W
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this motel from 22nd August to 26th August and had a wonderful stay. Clean, comfortable rooms, only downfall was no tea/coffee, fridge facilities in your room. The staff were friendly and helpful at all times, nothing was ever too much for them - always willing to give directions to anywhere we needed to go. The complex itself was amazing!! Restaurants, cafes and pubs to suit everyone. You could actually stay in this hotel and not leave for the duration of your stay if you wished.. I would stay here again if I ever returned to Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “love vegas/ love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: wella99
Reviews.Content: Visited this hotel for 4 nights/5 days between 16.09/2001 - 20/09/2011 what a fantastic hotel. Nothing was ever to much and the staff were fantastic. The hotel wasn't as grand as alot of the newer hotels (e.g the wynn/ encore etc) but i actually loved the way the hotel kept with the new york theme the whole way through. There were so many bars and restraunt inside the hotel you could never get bored. The rollercoaster was amazing and an extra facility that makes it stand out from the rest. Was in a great position although walking from one hotel to the next on the strip took about half an hour so we got a cab most of the time. Alot of young people at this hotel not really aimed at children to be honest. The pool was amazing with a dj on the desks pumping the music all day it just had an amazing vibe and atmosphere. The rooms were huge and that was for a standard nothing speciasl room. If your coming to vegas for the first like we were you honestly will not be disappointed with what you find here and if your thinking about visiting vegas then dont!!!!! just book it because it will seriously change your life. roll on next year when i come back.

Reviews.Title: “Good variety of entertainment, food, drink, people”
Reviews.Author: mcqker
Reviews.Content: My husband and I normally stay at the Monte Carlo when we go to Vegas, but this time the NYNY was cheaper and we know that we like that area of the strip, so we gave it a shot. A lot more activity in general at the NYNY than at the Monte Carlo, but if lots of people, food, drink, and variety is what you're looking for, then NYNY is perfect and reasonably priced for Vegas. The NYNY room was larger than we expected and had a HUGE TV in the room. The pool was also bigger than we expected. Self-parking was easy and plenty of space - even on a fight-night across the street at the MGM. 2-for-1 tickets to Zumanity for hotel guests. Our only complaint was the alarm clock in the next (empty) room going off in the middle of the night - two nights in a row. The noise of people walking through the halls was not well-insulated, either. It wasn't the best sleep we've had in Vegas (though not the worse either!).

Reviews.Title: “You don't have to love gambling to love Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: sandyman57
Reviews.Content: Well, you expect Las Vegas to be big, brash and in your face and that is exactly how we found it - but not intimidating in any way and if you have planned a trip, great. If you thinking about it then just get on get booked! The New York, New York is very well positioned on the strip and actually is not as big as you perhaps would think it is. For Las Vegas a couple of thousand bedrooms in a hotel is small! We found the reception staff very friendly and the room we had was absolutely fine (Park Avenue double). Clean, plenty big enough with plenty of hot water and shower facility over the bath which worked particularly well. As you would expect the bedroom is air conditioned and considering there is a casino below you, when you closed your bedroom door you couldn't hear a thing! One minor detail for a major coffee drinker - I would have appreciated coffee making facilities in the room, but no big deal. More restaurants in the hotel than you can shake a stick at plus of course you can walk into any other hotel and use any of their restaurants, so no shortage of food. Prices for meals are literally from inexpensive to wow that's a lot! So you can enjoy a meal to suit your budget. Hotels close by include the MGM Grand, Excalibur, Luxor and Mandalay Bay, but really any hotel is easily accessible by a short taxi ride (There are plenty of taxi's in Vegas!) Shows to see - many and I recommend you use the ticket kiosks on the strip as they do offer cheaper theatre tickets plus cut price entry into exhibitions. For example we went to the Cirque du soleil show in MGM Grand - Ka. The production is brilliantly done and I have never seen a stage that has been able to move to a totally vertical position before! A masterful performance to go and see. We also went to the Titanic exhibition in the Luxor which is really interesting and so it goes on... We did have a little flutter on the tables, but I have to say that this appears to be an incredibly serious pastime and the croupier's seem to have no sense of humour whatsoever, but I guess this is how they are supposed to be?! One of your night's should be allocated to a trip up to Freemont Street. Here are shops, bars, casinos all along a street which has a roof - not just any old roof but one with millions of lights in it which are used every hour for a very effective show to music. There are live bands on stages in different parts of the street and the atmosphere is just wonderful - get down there! Finally, one of the greatest highlights for us (we were a group of 6) was to fly out to the Grand Canyon in a helcopter. We did this with Maverick helicopters and were collected from the hotel, down to the airport and set off in a 7 seater helicopter. Good views from wherever you sit in it and once everybody settled down for a few minutes, it really was a thrilling experience. You fly over the Hoover dam, then land in the Canyon, glass of champers and a small bite to eat, before setting off again. Everybody has earphones so you can chat to each other and the pilot talks you through the scenery. Great trip and really worth doing... So with so much happening and so many things to do, you can see why my heading is 'you don't have to love gambling to love Vegas!' Enjoy...

Reviews.Title: “So good they named it twice”
Reviews.Author: boo1066
Reviews.Content: This was my second visit to Las Vegas in a year and also the second time that NYNY was chosen as a hotel. I was in LV to celebrate turning 40 so it was the perfect choice for location, fun, atmosphere, good food, relaxation, and gaming. Having stayed before we knew it was cheaper to book the upgrade room before arriving and also to look out for the sale offers and compare offers, as at the same time the sale was on the hotel were also offering a Facebook Friends discount but the sale price available to all was still cheaper! I've seen some of the prices other people quote as paying and am quite shocked as I wouldnt have paid that rate. Think it averaged about $80 a night for our 8 night stay. Stayed in a Broadway Deluxe room on the 22nd floor, didnt bother with Strip View, I'm not there to look out the window at it, so had a pool view and got to see the evening sun sets over the mountains instead. There is a faint noise from the coaster, but certainly not enough to disturb sleep! Rooms are huge (when you are used to UK and European Hotels!) with two beds, a double closet, plenty of drawer space. Only thing I did remember to do from my previous visit was to pack some spare coat hangers, hotels rarely have enough. Bathrooms are a good size, with plenty of towels and room for toiletries etc. (a girls must have!) Though the shower heads are located a little low for anyone taller than about 6 feet!! One thing I would change and that to have a coffee machine in the room. I do miss having any coffee/tea making facility in a room, but it seems that this isnt as common in the USA as elsewhere and NYNY like to make the profits from their coffee bars on the casino floor! They certainly did from us tea drinking Brits!! Outside the room, the pool area is pretty small for the size of the hotel, and you have to be queued when the pool opens or certainly within 30 minutes to get a lounger but as early birds with jet lag it suited us! Also the sun doesnt hit the whole pool area until after midday, so plan for that if you only want a few hours morning sun. Restaurants we frequented around the hotel casino floor were all really good with excellent service and good food. I've now been to Las Vegas a few times and would say as value for money the NYNY is a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of Amenities”
Reviews.Author: AlissaJayne
Reviews.Content: The room was nice, quite quiet. The casino was a lot of fun and had good service. I absolutely recommend joining the players' club - it saved us $300 off our food and beverage bill during a six day stay. The restaurants are all quite good except for the pizza place on the mezzanine level; the service time was dreadfully slow and the staff was exceptionally rude.

Reviews.Title: “Thanks a lot New York!”
Reviews.Author: niceguymiss
Reviews.Content: I went with my family to NYNY to celebrate a couple of birthdays, and the rooms looked like the super 8. I had to go down and get upgraded because I did not feel the value for the money was worth it. They were nice enough to upgrade the room but for the $616.00 for 3 nights my room was definetly lacking! To top off our great weekend they refunded the deposit to wrong account, so now I have to wait 5 days for my money to be unfrozen because they are always quick to take out money but never quick to return when they made a mistake. Then they didn't even offer any kind of apologie or accomidation for there mistakes. Not very good customer service! Good pizza though!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, average value”
Reviews.Author: TravellerN0tT0urist
Reviews.Content: Situated towards the MGM end of the strip,this medium size casino offers nice rooms, a good gym, and an okay range of restaurants. The relative smaller size makes it easy to navigate. A bit hard to get to/from if you're using the Deuce. Friendly staff. The daily resort fee is a joke, however. Rates could have been lower.

Reviews.Title: “FUN STAY”
Reviews.Author: George J
Reviews.Content: WE,Stayed here sept.19-24-2011...everything you ever will need is under one roof from Gamleing ,food ,entertainment,lots of deals in the shop ,a fantastic arcade that will keep you amused for days,everything from pizza to fine dining ,the staff is very friendly,easy access to the strip ,drugstore just a short walk away ,ton of souvenair shops ,i reccomend the grand cayom experience souvenair shop on the strip a 5 min walk from the hotel...we danced all night at coyote ugly and the ROK,,PLENTY OF PENNY SLOTS ALONG WITH ANY OTHER GAMES YOU CAN THINK OF .had a great view of the strip and the roller coaster,rooms clean and very quiet,I read alot of reviews on this hotel ,i can only say from our experience we had a great time ..the America restruarant in the hotel was a very good value for the dollar we ate there every day for breakfast ,dinner ,,sometimes lunch.

Reviews.Title: “Well worth the price for location and atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: Andys89
Reviews.Content: A friend and I traveled to Vegas earlier this year, we chose to stay at NYNY and it was definitely the right choice! Hotel staff were friendly and helpful and we were very pleased with our room ( Park Avenue Deluxe - 2 queen). Room was pretty sound proof so we didnt hear the roller coaster outside and we stayed in a Non-Smoking room. Beds were really comfortable! Restaurants were fantastic, we tried a different place each day and were really happy with the service and food quality. Casino floor was what you'd expect from a Vegas Casino, big, loud and fun. With the "Little New York" Theme really making this different from the other Casinos. It's a bit of a walk from the Hotel to the big named Casino's (Bellagio, Caesars, etc) - about 20-30 minutes depending on how quickly you walk but it gives you a chance to sightsee. We enjoyed NYNY so much I'm bringing a couple of friends back over early next year!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SK241
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights from 12th Sept. The hotel is great, rooms very clean and check in was quick and you can check out using the TV in the room. We asked for a upgrade was offered one free of charge. Plenty of places to eat in the hotel (Pizza, Chinese, fish&chips). The only negative point i have is the pool area is rather small, it could be better compared to the other hotels. Went to all the other hotels on the strip and thought this was the best one! Didn't smell of cigarettes either and people were very friendly. Defiantly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was okay, casino was decent but Gallaghers was amazing.”
Reviews.Author: Lisa N
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just stayed at the hotel, 9/23/11 - 9/25/11. Upon arrival at 3:00 AM, we inquired about getting a room early, as we had originally only booked Saturday the 24th. We were accomodated and put in a room on the 23rd floor which was horrible (2308 to be exact). The room was dirty, incredibly smoke-filled and the drapes, linens and carpet had been permeated tremendously. Also, most of the channels on our television did not work and kept showing "weak signal - check cable". Also, the bathroom floor was extremely dirty and quite frankly, a bit scary. My husband went downstairs the next morning and voiced his concerns and they happily upgraded us to another room for $100.00, which was amazing (room 1954). My husband is a high stakes gambler who enjoys throwing down $500 chips on roulette games, crap tables, etc. After spending all day gambling Saturday, we asked for a recommendation for dinner and Gallaghers was suggested. Although we had no reservation, the hostess took our name and we were seated within 20 minutes. Our waiter Norman was amazing and recommended the steak & lobster dinner, paired it with wine, suggested the shrimp cocktails, spinach salad and creme brulee. Both my husband and I maintain it was the best dinner, steak & lobster, shrimp cocktail we have ever had. In fact, we enjoyed it so much, we went back yesterday again (2 days in a row) and repeated what we had the night before. Although it was pricey ($600), it is our new "go to" restaurant when we get to Vegas again. I must say, when we go back, we will only ask for Norman. The difference in the service on Saturday night with Norman versus the service we got yesterday (not sure of his name) was night and day. I'm not sure I would stay in the rooms again, however, the Casino was fine (a bit loud) and the restaurant was fabulous. In lieu of the money we dropped, it didn't seem like our Players Club card did any good. If it did, I never saw any of the benefits. All in all, I'm not sure the hotel went out of its way to make us feel appreciated. Very hard to give an overall rating on this, however, because of Gallaghers, I upgraded to "very good" instead of average.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon to remember, superb hotel and amazing room!”
Reviews.Author: CXJ
Reviews.Content: New York New York was a really great hotel. Our room on the 15th Floor has a Jacuzzi, which was great before/after a long walk on the strip or after a few cheeky drinks. Room was pretty cheap and resturants in the hotel provided decent food. Excellent happy hours, try the frozen cocktails, very refreshing. Would definately visit again if i come to Vegas. Strip location very good, not completely central, however for what we wanted, it was pretty much spot on for us. Would recommend highly.

Reviews.Title: “Will be going back!!”
Reviews.Author: MissP_8
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the New York New York for our honeymoon July 2010 and just getting round to writing this review. Loved this hotel. Its was our 1st time to Vegas my 1st time to America. Checked in really quick, although realised when we got to our room it was a smoking room, went to recepition and asked to change to a non smoking room they did not have a standard non smoking room left so quickly upgraded us to a larger room free of charge. Room was very big, 2 massive big beds and a view of the strip. Loads to do in this hotel, loved the Irish pub for food and a drinks. My husband went on the rollercoaster he loved that aswel. The hotel is in a good position on the strip, so we did alot of walking about!! Would advise a visit to the Ice Bar in the Mandalay. We are going back to Vegas in Oct 2012 and have booked to stay at the New York New York as we enjoyed it so much!!!

Reviews.Title: “nice view room:S”
Reviews.Author: peterpatel
Reviews.Content: hi, this is nice place to stay with family.we enjot lots,i came every year and stay hear.

Reviews.Title: “Viva Las Vegas!!”
Reviews.Author: milotu
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel! We stayed here a week into a road trip where we stayed in a lot of basic motels, so the New York New York was our luxury on the holiday! We upgraded to a deluxe strip view room and was amazed at the size and extras in the room. Our windows went across two walls and we had views of the MGM and Excalibur, we was on the 9th floor as this was all they had and the view was obstructed by the rollercoaster which ruined the view quite a bit. The bathroom was very large and everything was in good order. The room was a good size and we had good access to the internet, the television had lots of channels and we had an iPhone/iPod docking station which was useful. The hotel is just like any in Vegas and is full of restaurants and bars which are well worth the money. I would definitely stay at this hotel again, but would think twice about upgrading the rooms

Reviews.Title: “Fun hotel with lots of personality and great location”
Reviews.Author: SMack048
Reviews.Content: We really liked this hotel, the room was clean, the spa is great and there's a fantastic selection of restaurants and bars downstairs. It's not one of the biggest hotels but it's nice to visit the bigger ones and then come back to NY-NY. Hint: the coupon book you get on check-in includes two for one Cirque du Soleil Zumanity tickets, it's not sold out every night so you might be able to save $100 this way.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Special”
Reviews.Author: kayaker5629
Reviews.Content: My friends recommended that I stay at this hotel to get a feel for Vegas since I was only going to be there for a night. The room was nothing to write home about. I have actually stayed in much nice hotel rooms in Massachusetts, New Hampshire and Rhode Island. After walking around in the other hotels I wished that I had stayed in the Bellagio. I didn't find the casino floor all that appealing and the two restaurants that I ate at were nothing special. The staff also wasn't that helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good.”
Reviews.Author: baymontinntupelo
Reviews.Content: Good casino. Perfect location. Rooms need updating.

Reviews.Title: “A truly awesome Hotel in LV”
Reviews.Author: Nellym
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in mid August. I'd been to Vegas before and remembered the New York New York so this time round wanted to stay here. We were not disappointed, everything about the hotel was magnificent - the rooms, the service, the amenities, the entertainment...pretty much everything except the pool which compared to the rest of the hotel is a bit of a letdown. Obviously the Bellagio and Caesers are better than the New York New York but for the mid price range traveller you will not find a better hotel. When booking, the Excalibur was available at 5GB Pounds less a night but that place was totally run down compared to New York New York where everything looked as if it was brand new. The Greenwich style food village is highly recommended and we enjoyed getting breakfast every morning from there. The games arcade is a must see for kids too. I had a car and the car parking (free) was just behind the hotel and less than 5 minutes walk to reception - the same cannot be said of other Vegas hotels that's for sure. Location wise, you cannot go wrong - its the perfect location for the Southern end of the Strip (Excalibur, MGM Grand, Tropicana, Luxor and Mandalay Bay, Coke World and M&M World nearby) and if you wanted to, you can walk to the Bellagio fountains in about 15 minutes. We'll definitely visit Vegas again and when booking I will be looking to go back to the New York New York. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Let's hear it for New York”
Reviews.Author: msjkayj
Reviews.Content: Two of my sorority sisters and I stayed at this hotel for our birthday trip to Vegas for three nights in June. The staff was extremely helpful and friendly. The sushi restaurant was delicious; we ate there twice. I didn't particularly enjoy the pizza parlor. We saw Zumanity at our hotel. It was a wonderful show that I definitely recommend, but brace yourself. We went to the bar and the club in the hotel, and had a good experience at both.Our room was very spacious and clean. Although I am not sure if this had to do with the location of our room, we did not have any issues with the noise of the roller coaster. Overall, I had a great experience, and I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at New York, New York Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Soundtech36277
Reviews.Content: A great experience from check in till check out. All the staff from the front desk to housekeeping to employees in all the resturants and bars were friendly and helpful. Check in was very quick and painless despite the fact so much was going on in town, like the Championship Fight across the road at MGM Grand. Our room was well furnished, clean, and a great value for what we paid. It had very comfortable bedding and plenty of lighting. It was pretty hot ( 95 degrees + ) the whole time of our 4 day stay and the A/C could freeze you out of the room. We were fairly close to the roller coaster, but there was very little noise and it did not impact us at all. Great food at America, Gallaghers, and NY Pizza. We love the location and we're already looking forward to our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “"Fun place for all"”
Reviews.Author: Timeseeker
Reviews.Content: Good location, clean comfortable rooms with good views of the strip. Very friendly helpful staff. Plenty of fun, good food, games and shows. Great place for kids too.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Loch Lomond and The Trossachs National Park, United Kingdom
Reviews.Title: “great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Sylvaw
Reviews.Content: the hotel is located right on the strip. easy access to mgm just across bridge. big big rooms.........highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NewEnglandGal_11
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. The exterior was great with the bridge (even the patchwork pavement looks like it's authentic), the roller coaster, the skyline view, etc. Inside, after you get through the main lobby (and if you can resist the one-armed bandits!), you actually feel a bit like you're walking through NYC neighborhoods - with stoops, balconies, and exterior facades. There's a fabulous full-serivce restaurant called America that has an awesome breakfast menu - all the food is terrific and the service is top notch - there's a giant map of the U.S. hanging from the ceiling, all the states sectioned and decorated with things that are native to that state - fun to look at. The dueling piano bar is not to be missed and do yourself a favor, pay for the reserved tables near the piano ... it's the best! The common areas are clean and well maintained. The guest room was roomy enough for 4 women although the bathroom counter could have been bigger - LOL! The room was quiet - we were on the strip side; nary a sound from neighboring rooms - amazing; and the beds were the BEST!! And the location was pretty good - near MGM, Luxor, Excelsior, Mandalay Bay; and a not too tough walk to Belagio, Cesaers, etc. Also, nice to have a CVS close by.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: ArizDuo
Reviews.Content: We stayed in NY NY for 2 nites on our way home to Az. from Zion Natl. Park. We wanted to see the show, Zumanity and I got a good rate for the room/show. We thought it might be kind of hokey, the whole NY thing, but it was very nice and we had a good time at the restaurants and the dueling piano bar. We upgraded our room to a Marquis Suite on the 30th floor and had a great view and very nice room. As for Zumanity, we loved it, but it is not for everyone due to language and is sexually provacative. However, the cast is great and put on a great show with that Cirque du Soleil flair and showmanship!

Reviews.Title: “Happy Camper”
Reviews.Author: Tracy B
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay at NYNY and I enjoyed it very much! We arrived at approx 3pm so we did not have to wait for a room, ours was ready. While checking in the guy was very friendly and full of info which made me feel welcome. Once entering the room is was very clean. The bathroom was updated in marble with plenty of room to get ready etc and the shower was to die for! Huge flat screen TV! The beds were very comfy with plenty of pillows to choose from, even a body pillow. We were on the 28th floor with a good view of the roller coaster and no coaster noise. The room was very quiet. Only downfall, no mini fridge and no coffee maker =( NYNY is not glitzy or glamerous, but its an excellent value for your money! I would recommend it

Reviews.Title: “SUPER HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: sashokchat
Reviews.Content: The hotel is really nice with a coaster around it. Definitely resembles Manhattan and inside great attractions for kids, restaurants and much much fun.

Reviews.Title: “Overnight in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: FloridaSunBum
Reviews.Content: Before going to Las Vegas, where we hadn't been for 20 years, I reviewed the New York - New York Hotel for it was in a convenient location close to the airport and within walking distance of many of the major hotels. NY-NY had a fairly high rating and was moderately priced, so we booked based on the reviews. Based on our reading alot of the reviews, when checking in we requested a non-smoking room, close to the elevators and asked for a complimentary upgrade, all of which we were accommodated with (we, of course, mentioned reading the reviews on Trip Advisor, so maybe that helped). We found the negative comments in the reviews about the roller coaster noise to be unfounded. This was right outside our room on the 24th floor and we could barely hear the noise, plus it stops at midnight and doesn't start up again until 10 am. Also comments about the rooms needing updating, especially with flat screen TV's was not the case for our room was very modern and had a very large flat screen TV. Another negative comment was about the long wait to check in--we were about a half hour early for the 3 pm check in and the line was very long, but our wait was only about 15 minutes, check in went very quickly and we were in our room by 3 pm. We found the comments about the smoke smell in the casino were correct, but that was pretty much the case in all the casinos--wish Las Vegas would join in the 21st century push to eliminate smoking inside public buildings. The village was a fun place for food and entertainment . . . but warning, prices are very high all over Las Vegas--no more $10 lobster and steak dinners! A Manhattan at the casino bar cost $14! We missed having a mini refrigerator in our room. All in all, the NY-NY seemed comparable to most of the other hotels and we would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “we were happy with NY/NY and the value....”
Reviews.Author: historymajor
Reviews.Content: no one would ever accuse NY/NY of being elegant or sophisticated but it is a very good value for your dollar. we paid $60/night plus the horrid $15/night resort fee.....why don't they just say $75/night since the resort fee is not optional? our room was clean, beds were very comfortable and it was quiet. we have stayed at ny/ny about 7 times and have really never had a serious complaint. one thing that worries me...there are no safety bars in the bathrooms and the bottom on the tub is quite slippery. stepping out onto the marble bathroom floor was very slippery also so i caution everyone to take that into account. i guess the biggest negative for us was the price of food in the hotel....$5. for a pretzel, seriously? there are plenty of bargains to be had on the strip in the food area though. if price is a consideration, i highly recommend you consider a stay at ny/ny.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal hotel for simplicity and not being overwhelmed”
Reviews.Author: McKib
Reviews.Content: My fiancee and I stayed for a week at NYNY last September on recommendation of 2 pairs of friends who had also done so and I would have to say WHEN we return we will definitely look here for availability and price first. We were worried about being overwhelmed by the size of Vegas hotels and while this is still a big joint, we were able to move about it quite freely without too much hassle. The one thing we were worried about was having to walk about 10 minutes from reception to a room but everything on the main floor is closely situated to elevators so after entering hotel, we were generally in our room within 2 mins :) The room was spacious enough with 2 double beds, a clean bathroomand a lovely corner view of both MGM Grand and Excalibur. Although the likes of Caesars, Bellagio and Venetian are lovely to visit and wonder in the decor, we were a lot happier staying in a smaller atmosphere that just as much character, if on a slightly tackier level... but hey, its Vegas, you go expecting the tack and end up loving it even more. We dined in Gallaghers steak house one night which was beautiful and big portions, but probably not the best idea to go there straight after a ride on the hotel roller coaster!!! We also ate in Chin Chin oriental restaurant and this was definitely our nicest meal on site, a lot more affordable than Gallaghers and I can HIGHLY recommend the tangerine peel beef. The pool facilities were great and we spent a few afternoons making the most of the sun there... as well as the huge frozen cocktails available at the bar :) In room breakfast delivered was a treat and more than filled us both up for a day to Las Vegas Outler Centre. Location wise, we were able to walk pretty much everywhere to the famous hotels within 15 mins, but on a sunny day, it might be best recommended to take a cab if you want to go as far downtown as Fremont St. All in all, we loved this hotel and would highly recommend it to people who prefer a smaller more accessible spot to the grandeur of Mandalay Bay or Bellagio.

Reviews.Title: “A Weekend Getaway for my daughter and me”
Reviews.Author: melfurino
Reviews.Content: I booked NY,NY through AA Vacations (hotel and airfare) and must admit this hotel was not my first choice. I started with the Palazzo and 5 choices later ended with NY,NY. My daughter was elated as NY is one of her favorite destinations. I read the reviews here on trip advisor and was nervous with the mixed reviews. Our plane arrived at 8:30 in the morning so checking in was out of the question. We left our bags with the bellman and off we went. The hotel offers early check-in (based on availability) at 1:00 p.m. We got in line and waited only a short time before we were checking in. We had booked a Skyline room and were told that for $10 more, we could check in early and be upgraded to a Park Avenue room. Totally worth it. The room was nice and clean. No problems with noise like others have posted. The pool area is small, many have noted that it gets shady fast - not our experience. We tried to move our chairs into the shade, but it was hard to find. They had a DJ spinning - my 22 year old daughter loved it. Overall a great trip for a girl's weekend. We would stay at NY,NY again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Good Service, Good location!”
Reviews.Author: SaoireSaoirse
Reviews.Content: I was in Vegas for a week with my partner. We stayed in this hotel on the 14th floor. Casino: as standard across the board in Vegas! Room: We got an upgrade to the room with the jacuzzi - totally worth doing. We had a view of the back of the hotel, out to the mountains and there was a bit of the rollar coster that went by our window (about 200 feet away) but we found it hilarious to occasionally have people fly by screaming while we were in the tub! Entertainment/Food: Loads of choice / good taste. The Irish Bar was great but we didnt stay too long but it was always hopping. I really wanted to see Zumanity but didnt get time. Location: it's right on the strip and connected to all the other hotels, just as convenient as anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Will not stay here again”
Reviews.Author: TXtravelbug05
Reviews.Content: After considering MANY of the Strip hotels, we chose New York, New York because of location and decent reviews. We checked in around 11:00 PM. We booked a spa suite and we were very unimpressed with the room. The bathroom was grimy and moldy. We contemplated showering in flip flops so our feet didn't have to touch the shower floor. There was an old washcloth on top of the space where you hang your clothes that was there throughout our stay. There was no soap in our room. My husband went to the store and bought us a bar of soap. On the third day of our stay, housekeeping was generous enough to leave soap for us. As I said, we checked in around 11:00 PM. After dropping off bags in our room, we went to check out the hotel and strip area. When we returned to our room (about 1:00 AM), the alarm clock in the room next door was going off. We thought we would just drown it out with the television......We discovered we didn't have a remote control and the TV had no external way to operate it. About this same time, my husband realizes that we did not receive the rate we booked online (through the hotel's own website) or the package that came with it (i.e. tickets for rollercoaster, drink vouchers ect.). He called the front desk for assistance and to their credit they had someone at our door in about 30 minutes (1:30 AM) with a remote control. They also went in the room next door to turn off the alarm (YES, it was still going off.) The alarm next door went off every night, in the middle of the night, but at least now we could drown out the sound! My husband was told he would have to come to the front desk in the morning and show proof of the rate and package that we booked online. The next morning after a "discussion" with a superviser, we finally got everything we booked. A couple of positives: monorail access across the street through MGM and tram to Luxor and Mandalay Bay.

Reviews.Title: “Right in the middle”
Reviews.Author: FierceTraveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 3 nights at this place, on business. I did not have high expectations of this place since I know there are at least 10 hotels that will offer you basically the same for about the same price. I would rate this hotel among: Treasure Island, Paris, Luxor, MGM and maybe Mirage and MGM a little bit higher up. But if you don´t want to stay on the strip would definelitely recommend the M Resort or Red Rock Casino or the Palms as suitable options. Check in took around 30 min even though we arrived late (around 11:30pm) rooms are dark and small, just like a regular Holiday Inn. Decor is not impressive and it is showing its wear. The casino is dark and the theme hotels are not in anymore, so you feel enclosed and with a lot of smoke. Gambling is OK with a bunch of options. Not many restaurants that will close late. But somo decent Pizza and Meat restaurant (pricey for the location) Overall I would recommend this hotel if you get a better deal than the others, or if you don´t see yourself in the room or casino during your visit for a long time. But there are better options for you money

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel, its location, its atmosphere, EVERYTHING!”
Reviews.Author: PassportUK
Reviews.Content: We had a hire car and drove from Los Angeles to Las Vegas. We did have a TomTom SatNav on us so found the hotel very easily. On arrival we parked at the front door and our luggage was soon taken from us. If you have a car you can opt to 'self park' or have 'valet parking'. Both are FREE but obviously the valet parkers will wanting tipping. We opted to self park purely because we wanted to keep going out in it and wanted full access to the car keys and the car. On arrival at reception it was extremely busy, this is a large hotel. There were just 2 receptionists working and we waited approx 15mins before being served. It was not the best start as I was a bit annoyed at this stage HOWEVER the receptionist who served us was excellent. She apologised, and checked us in. We requested an upgrade to a 'Strip View' and were quoted $15 per night, per room plus tax. I was very happy to pay this amount as the rooms are more modern, more spacious, and the view was amazing. She did not rush us and explained everything about the hotels, the facilities and the local area. Very good. Our room was very modern, with a king size bed, large flat screen TV, iron and board, safe etc. As per most of America there were no tea/coffee making facilities but we had packed our own kettle, and cups etc. The bathroom was spacious, clean and the toilettries were lovely, particularly the soap. My parents who were also staying were delighted as this hotel offers 'smoking' rooms. They also upgraded to a 'Strip View'. The hotel has the casino, which offers a huge choice, and it also has countless bars and restaurants. There is also a pool however we did not use this as we did not have time. There is also the famous rollercoaster on the roof for those that want a thrill. This hotel does charge a 'resort fee' which it says is for the Wi-Fi, swimming pool etc. We did know about this before we went. The Wi-Fi worked fine on my I-Pad with no issues. The hotel is situated in a superb place. You can just walk out the hotel and you are right on the strip. You can get your hire car (or book a trip) and within an hour we were at Hoover Dam, and within 3.5 hours we were at the West Rim of the Grand Canyon. SO much to see and do from this location. There is a bus that runs up and down the strip so you can visit the old Vegas and Fremont Street and some of the other places. The MGM Grand hotel is straight opposite, and the famous fountains at the Bellagio is less than a 10 min walk. There are plenty of places to eat on the strip if you don't want to eat in the hotel. You can virtually walk from the airport to the hotel it is that close! Check out was very quick at 5am! Our bill was correct and no issues. I loved this hotel. It was modern, fun, different, and for its size very friendly. I will definitely be going back here again

Reviews.Title: “Good value and location”
Reviews.Author: Cosmoss
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well located, good value and rooms are OK. Not the most modern but more than acceptable for the price. The casino and food courts have an excellent vibe and there is plenty to do in the actual hotel. Pool is a disappointment. Just a pity we did not figure out the buses across the road from the MGM earlier - that makes it really easy to move about the strip. I would definitely stay there again at the mid price range

Reviews.Title: “New York New York - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: jelyca
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a 4 day stay at the New York New York. This place is great, there is plenty to do. Rooms are clean and well maintained. Plenty of good restaurants to choose from. Not in the center of the strip - but just jump on a bus and you are there in a few minutes. This city is very busy - cannot believe how many people are there! 4 days is enough for me. Shows to see "Jersey Boys" and "O" and "Beatles" by Cirque du Soleil, Freemont Street. Restaurants to eat at "Mon ami Gabi" and the "Eiffel Tower" at the Paris Hotel. The Americana at the New York New York is great also. Attractions to see "Hoover Dam", "Valley of Fire" and "Red Rock Canyon" - we rented a car and was able to see these three attractions. Hope this review will encourage you to spend time there.

Reviews.Title: “Nice to pass by but not to book for the stay!”
Reviews.Author: Tell8like8is
Reviews.Content: I honestly think the casino is beautiful, the restaurants are great and an awesome taste of REAL New York. An absolute must see when PASSING THROUGH yet when it comes to staying in the rooms... Wasnt really pleased. The rooms were quite SMALL! We asked for a non smoking room but our sheets had a very strong odor of cigarettes, yuk! I did complain but wasnt offered anything except a coupon book. Lol. We ended up paying to change rooms and had to wait for the keys a few hours but luckily when we came back we got a different person... Big Difference in customer service! Upon RECHECKING IN....Again, the new clerk noticed we "accidentally" got booked into ANOTHER SMOKING room, BUT he quickly upgraded and offered us a suite for only $20 more a night instead of $90 and made sure it wasnt a stinky room! Im sorry but I dont think I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough, but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: StuTO
Reviews.Content: OK, so I admit that neither my wife or I enjoy casino life nor the city of Las Vegas. We had gone overseas earlier in the year to celebrate our 40 anniversary year together, but now it was the actual weekend of our anniversary, and we wanted to see Lion King before it shut down. So I arranged for a short weekend stay at the New York, New York. Our check-in was a bit confusing. We arrived around 4pm ready to check in, grab an early dinner, and attend one of the Circus de Soleil shows. We were told that the room configuration we had reserved (king, non-smoking, view) was not ready, and that we'd need to wait perhaps two hours before one would be ready. They were willing to downgrade (at a savings) or upgrade (at a cost) to a different room configuration. We protested, and after about 10 minutes of standing firm that NY, NY make appropriate accommodations, a room in our reserved configuration magically became available. We're not sure what was up with that. The room itself was not very spacious, nor had anything special in amenities. And the "view" that came at a premium cost, was mostly of the roof of the neighboring building. Frankly, I've always received better service and a much better room at Marriott. Parking at the New York, New York was like what we experienced at other hotels along the strip... easy and convenient enough. Memo to self... next time you visit Las Vegas, stay at a hotel off the strip. It's easy enough to drive to and park at casino hotels on the strip for the shows and other activities. And you'll get a much better deal for the cost.

Reviews.Title: “Musty and needing an update”
Reviews.Author: Tazkaz
Reviews.Content: Sister-in-law and I had just spent 7 nights in a 2 bed aptm at the Hollywood Towers Westgate property and though we would experience our last night across the road at New York New York in Vegas - bad move!. The room was tired and needed an update - the bathroom was ridiculously old and also needed a refurbishment but the musty smell was out in the halls and in the room constantly. The view was of the roller-coaster ride and that was OK - not noisy at all, just disappointment with the smell. We paid AUS $250 and seriously, for that money we could have gone back to the Venetian or stayed where we were. Tip - gamble and eat there, just don't stay there :(

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Atmospheres”
Reviews.Author: Nico A
Reviews.Content: Had a Jacuzzi, 2 tvs, 2 beds couch table and bathroom in the hotel room I stayed in....very relaxing and nice view of Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent customer service, amazing rooms, awesome trip!”
Reviews.Author: themysteryunfolds
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed here in July for (originally) 2 nights. Unfortunately, our car broke down on our last night and so we had to extend our trip! The staff were very helpful and gave us a discounted rate on our room for a 3rd night, and also allowed us to check out late in the evening for no extra charge. We booked a deluxe double room - it was beautiful! We had amazing views over the strip and the room was HUGE and spotlessly clean and very modern. Could not fault this hotel at all. We had wandered around Vegas one night and gone into a couple of other hotels; none which even compared to the standard of this one. Would gladly stay here again, as there were so many special offers that made our stay pretty cheap. The only bad thing I have to say, is the night club 'Rok' is TERRIBLE! (not rock music at all, and the security staff were very sleazy) But as I am not usually a clubbing type of person, it would not bother me in the slightest for my next Vegas trip. If you are going to this hotel, make sure you check out Times Square Bar and the duelling piano's. Honestly hands down the best night we had! The pianists were outstanding!

Reviews.Title: “Ok to Stay in NY NY”
Reviews.Author: SirRobertToronto
Reviews.Content: Hotel and room was clean, we had a non - smoking, staff were friendly, mentioned it was our anniversary and was given a free upgrade. A bit slow to get a drink once or twice but once server knew where you were and you tipped (couple bucks) the drinks came very regularly. Breakfast OK at Americas, ate there every morning, convenient, staff very nice. Got late checkout at hotel paid $30. Kept room until 4pm. I was a bit disappointed in the overall grandeur of the hotel compared to some of the other larger hotels, but since you spend more time in the others than at your own doesn’t matter that much. Went to see "Love" great show but does not beat "KA", which we saw on last visit. Went to Minus5 ice bar, it was fun, a cool experience (literally) but I'm from Canada wasn't all that cold, we stayed in the freezer for a good 45min) a bit pricey, no cameras allowed, you can buy a picture package that includes drinks (they do give you nice large drinks, I had Johnny Walker Black). We got a good deal (price) so deal-makers step up’ don't just except the listed prices. We did Grand Cannon West rim with Avatar tours, $99. each, 10 of us in a van, we had a great time with the small group.. No ropes or fences on the west rim, don't fall in.. Save your money and don't do the glass bottom look out, no cameras allowed so what's the point. You will get lots of amazing pictures and views standing on the edge at the second cannon stop. This is where the lunch is served, not too bad (chicken or beef, corn on cob, small salad, yellow beans, brownie, coffee and water), a nice hardy meal. All better than expected. Got great airport Limo service from/to airport from Presidential Limousine, these guys treat you good and confirm every pick up. Tip for Vegas Strip buyers: Beware of the cheapie custom t-shirt stores/mini-mall (I don't know the store names so just be aware), make sure price is established/agreed before they make it (press on slogan) or you will pay double the regular price.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good”
Reviews.Author: Heather L
Reviews.Content: For the cost, this hotel is pretty good. It's relatively clean and the rooms are quite spacious. The actual hotel is a lot of fun with plenty of things to do and eat. It's located on the south end of the strip with a lot of the older hotels (Luxor, Excalibur, etc), as the action is more on the north end of the strip, the walk from this hotel (in extremely hot weather) is a bit daunting. The staff at the hotel are extremely friendly and helpful so that is a major bonus. The one thing I would say is that the walls are very thin. We could hear full conversations happening in the rooms that were on either side of us. At 8am, after a late night out, this was not exactly pleasant. We probably wouldn't stay here again, but it definitely wasn't bad at all.

Reviews.Title: “Fun trip”
Reviews.Author: lalady02
Reviews.Content: I stayed at New York New York Hotel for three nights in June. I really like this hotel. There is so much to do and many restaurants to choose from. The waitress' were always offering drinks on the casino floor. I loved the Piano Bar. We ate at Gallagar's Steakhouse and Broadway Burger. It was the best burger I have ever eaten. Our room was clean and spacious.

Reviews.Title: “xmas shopping”
Reviews.Author: anne_oDerryCity
Reviews.Content: a group of us stayed here last year brilliant hotel when you arrive sign up for the card on arrival ,i didnt know what it was about till our departure. it seems they give you a card on arrival an for every purchase you make you hand the card in they give you points ,so throughout your trip every time you pay money out you get poin ts just like your tesco card so at end of trip when paying your bill .give in your card an you get discount remember even in casinosan restaruants put the card into the machine you play because points mean discount at the end

Reviews.Title: “Don`t stay at this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: CorrineNewportGwent
Reviews.Content: I was with a group of women who had saved for 2 years as a special combined birthday treat and decided to pick this hotel thinking it had everything we needed. We were that dissapointed it ruined our holiday. The rooms were very basic not special at all. Also we were disgusted to find out we had to pay at least $10 each to get in the irish bar and piano bar and Ugly coyote even though we were residents of the hotel! This may not seem like a lot of money but when there are 9 people and we were actually staying there quite frankly was taking the ****! we were told it`s because they are a private franscise. The resturants were ok but the steakhouse was rediculously overpriced. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone, there are far nicer hotels in Las Vegas and wished we`d stayed in the centre of the strip as were seemed to be walking or getting taxis everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “New York New York Las Vegas superb service.”
Reviews.Author: Rodfern
Reviews.Content: We had an excellent stay. Upgraded room, nice places to eat, on the strip. Delightful room. Overall an excellent experience staying at this hotel. The staff was very friendly. We enjoyed everything a lot.

Reviews.Title: “New York New York Nevada-A mixed blessing”
Reviews.Author: JKiteNewHampshire
Reviews.Content: New York New York was a mixed bag of highs and lows. Greatest hits. Flops and Near Misses. I bought the room on Priceline for about $280 for four nights. Tax included. Mind you, this was in August when Las Vegas is like a mini bake oven. The heat hits like a wall but in LV you move from hyper-heat to AC. No one walks more than a quarter mile at a time. Pack water, use sunscreen, have sunglasses and venture forth. We arrived at the hotel to find, at 11 pm on a Tuesday, 1 clerk and a line of 25. Message received. 'We are not a hotel. We are a Casino. Deal with it. Wait in line for forty minutes to get your room key.' Not the message I wanted to hear after 13 hours of travel from New Hampshire. Not a great start. The room was fine. You are in Las Vegas. A bed, a and a bathroom are what is required. We had a view of the roller-coaster from our window. The Spa at the hotel is not to be missed. Sauna, steam bath, hot tub in a calming atmosphere. That was superb even though it does cost $10 above the $15 'resort fee' that the hotel charges for each day of your stay. I complained about the check-in wait and the resort fee was waived. The lobby floor of the hotel was filled with the casino and surrounded by New York type bars and restaurants. If Fornaio was excellent. Go there.The breakfast is worth twice the price. Avoid Gonzales Gonzales. Taco Bell quality in a sea of noise. The Nine Fine Irishmen was a profound disappointment. I have returned 2 meals in my life. The bucket of hamburger and potato at the 9 Fine was one of them. My dining partner had a gristly cut of steak. Stick to the Guiness and the HD sports. The food truly does what the wind does. (I can't say blows). But it did. The Deli was great. The burger place was average. The breakfast buffet, also average. Visit other hotels and casinos there are better buffets elsewhere.... If you are going to gamble; the best odds are the craps table. Bet the pass line or the Don't pass line. Avoid the other sucker bets. The house has only a 1.4% advantage on the pass line. Know that however you gamble, the odds are ALWAYS against you. Figure what you can happily lose, bet that and walk away if it's gone. I budgeted about $50 per night for gambling. In the end, I made about $40 but I had a good time and walked away happy. The hotel is at the base of 'the strip' which is aptly named. The Strip is about 4 miles of hotels/casinos that have been beamed down into the middle of the desert. It is an oasis of faux in the middle of heated sand. It is a place for those who believe in luck more than in math. It is the devil's dream: Garish, Obscene, Fun, A return to the playpen, a hard lesson, and a place that is willing to have you let your wild side take a walk at your expense. Las Vegas is an act. Put on your costume and roll them bones..... Indeed, Why not. New York New York was a workable place to stay. The rooms were, uh, hotel rooms. I had a low-end room but it was fine. I slept well. The bathroom was done in marble.... Best of all, I walked outside and the rest of the strip extended further than I could see. Get the Deuce bus ticket for 24 hours of travel along the strip. The half-off shows booth is across the street. Save some $ and buy show tickets there. I really liked the old casinos on Freemont Street. It is where the locals go. Las Vegas offers gambling, food and shows. I don't care about people prancing around on a stage. I saw Andrew Cools, an amazingly rauchy hypnotist perform at the Paris. I was very happy that I did not volunteer...... Vinny Favorito at the Flamingo was an excellent comedy show. Definitely worth seeing. The best thing that I did in Las Vegas was to take the GC Flight Hoover Dam tour. A 9 hour day which included the dam, a buffet, and a tour of a chocolate factory/desert botanical garden where I took some nice photos. Don't miss this. Call the company and the rate should be about $70. The tour also included free show tickets which more than covered the cost of an amazing day. The New York New York was a fine base for the Las Vegas experience. If you get a good price on the room, go for it.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for the position on the strip.”
Reviews.Author: Mungus1
Reviews.Content: Nice clean rooms, new Samsung flat screen tv, great service from all staff - would definitely recommend for great budget hotel. You can walk to everywhere on the strip and it's even nice to come back and get away from some of the crowds. The staff were really awesome at responding to our requests and were super helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Good and Bad service”
Reviews.Author: Kahanadog
Reviews.Content: We were a group of 10 guys. We flew into town and then rented a van to look around. We pulled into the check-in area and sent half the guys to check in. Some of the guys grabbed luggage carts since it was busy. The bell man started screaming red faced at us saying "customers can't touch those!". A simple "can I help guys" would have gotten him about a $200 tip hauling our bags. His out of control rant aimed at group of guys just arriving set the tone for our stay. A rude front desk girl followed. On a positive note, Nine Fine Irishmen was fantastic and the steaks at Gallaghers were described as "a religious experience" by some of our group. At checkout the Bell Desk once again showed that their rude behavior was not a fluke. The woman working the desk must have another job because she made it quite clear she was too busy to do this one. Again we carried our own bags.... Eat and drink at NYNY but gamble and stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't stay but NEXT time we will!!!”
Reviews.Author: Chefcarla
Reviews.Content: We stayed next door at the Monte Carlo but next time we travel to Vegas, we will stay at NY-NY! I had to write a review because we traveled over there every day of our trip! And there is so much here to rave about! There are tons of little eateries in NYNY that I cannot fi on TA such as Fulton's Fried Fish, Siccilo, NYP, New York Pretzel & a great little pastry place. The breakfast pastry place had a donut my husband enjoyed that was the size of his head! The did the roller coaster at night & enjoyed every minute! Its located at the corner of Tropicana & Las vegas Blvd & has walkways to Excalibur & MGM. Can't wait to stay here!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not bang for buck”
Reviews.Author: AnilK
Reviews.Content: Not bang for buck. The rooms are smaller when compared to the money I spent. Did not like the touch of the towels and the soap. I liked Bally's better even though it was much cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “LOve old new york, but this new york has no snow”
Reviews.Author: chrisk1323
Reviews.Content: Great value for the dollar, food is outstanding in green burges deli, galligers an d the village pizza place. casino is fun, slots with good pay outs,

Reviews.Title: “Not Impressive, but Served its Purpose”
Reviews.Author: nativenicole
Reviews.Content: I spent Labor Day weekend with friends in Vegas and NYNY served as our homebase. The hotel itself is clean and well-attended with a nice variety of eateries, games, bars, and other standard casino fare. The burger joint, steakhouse, and Italian restaurant were particularly delicious with excellent service and the Irish pub and center bar were fun and lively spots. The pool is nothing special, though cabanas are available to rent and I had the pleasure of relaxing by one. A flatscreen TV, fridge, outdoor fan, and plenty of lounge furniture made it an enjoyable intermission to the trip. Our room was situated in the New Yorker B tower, which overlooked the parking garage, roller coaster, and pool. The windows in this tower (and possibly others, too?) are quite small, allowing very little light into the room during the day. Lighting in the bathroom was also dim and water pressure somewhat weak. Our room had no fridge, but offered a safe and clock radio with iPod dock and a 40" flatscreen TV. Beds were moderately comfortable and extra pillows were provided. The connecting bridge to Imperial Palace is handy as it leads to the free tram travelling to Mandalay Bay, home to House of Blues. Overall, this hotel is fine in terms of cleanliness and convenience. I'd stay here again, but if you're looking for Vegas extravagance where you're immersed in the hotel theme down to the detail, look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Polly0328
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a bit of a maze, but clean and comfortable. The check-in line was long, but moved suprisingly fast. We loved the choice of restaurants and shops that are decorated as if you were truly in New York. If we had one complaint it would be the entrance where shuttles drop you off needs better ventilation. If you are not a smoker, the smoke from the casino will just about knock you out. Overall, very good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!!”
Reviews.Author: hlr1112
Reviews.Content: The NY NY Las Vegas is a beautiful hotel. We enjoyed our stay very much. The hotel has at least 7 (but I think more) restaurants inside the hotel to eat at, as well as 3-4 bars, a night club, a spa, an arcade and a roller coaster all in one spot. It is everything you might want in a Vegas hotel. It is located right on the Vegas strip across from the MGM. It was convenient to walk to most things on the Strip from the hotel. The only thing I didn't care for, and the reason I only gave it "Very Good" instead of "Excellent," was the pool. The pool itself was large pool, but it was shallow. I am 5'1" and the pool barely came up to my waist. If I'm going to bother putting on my bathing suit in public, it'd be nice to actually be able to swim. Also, there were never enough lounge chairs and what chairs were there, were way too crowded for my comfort.

Reviews.Title: “What's sleep & money?”
Reviews.Author: Lou143
Reviews.Content: OMG....Loved the hotel we acted like little children.. we road the roller coster for hours..lol so much fine eating and entertainment all in one place. Close to soooo much. I think we slept maybe 4 hrs a day. live bands, beautiful people, and of course tons of gambling.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JDMICRO
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel. Lots to do, great clubs and restaurants. Nice central location on the strip. Would definitely go back. The only downside was the pool area. I found it a bit small and the sun is blocked half of the day from the skyscrapers.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jamierye
Reviews.Content: Overall, we enjoyed this hotel. It did have some pros and cons. Pros: We arrived Friday night around 7, and were able to check in immediately. We got a Park Avenue room with a view, and we were very happy with it. Room was clean and nice. We were never woken up by noise. Good selection of cheap, quick food available. We really enjoyed the food at 9 Fine Irishmen. Cons: Pretty far south. It took a long time to get to the other end of the strip if you didn't take a taxi. Tram at Monte Carlo was helpful, but really didn't didn't help a lot time wise. Pool was closed our last day, which was the only day we were going to use it. However, they have the option to use the pool at Luxor, MGM, Monte Carlo or Excalibur. I have heard not great things about NY NY pool, so ended up not being a big deal. We did not enjoy the Italian restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “very good”
Reviews.Author: avish63
Reviews.Content: the rooms are very clean many good restorants and pubs in the lobby near all the attractions

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel, read why..”
Reviews.Author: Hurleyd
Reviews.Content: Everybody would say Ceasars or Bellagio are the best hotels, and granted they are.. But to stay in a hotel, NYNY is much better, because it's not TOO big. In Vegas, you could end up anywhere after a few bevvies, and coming back to NYNY you'll know your way back to your room without getting lost. The casino itself is magnificent, there are streets inside the hotel that resemble NY and Times Square/Broadway. Very impressive, loved every minute of this hotel. I visited all hotels/casinos, this was my favourite.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: zazzle22
Reviews.Content: We found a great deal on this hotel on smartervegas. We booked the standard room (350 sq ft) and upon check-in we were asked if we wanted to upgrade to a larger room (450 sq ft) for $10/night. We declined as we knew we would most likely spend very little time in our room. The standard room was absolutely fine and definitely spacious enough. We went on the roller coaster and although my husband really enjoyed it, I found it a bit scary. The dualing piano bar is a must. We only ate at the America restaurant and Il Fornaio - both for breakfast and both were very good. We went to the pool every morning for a couple hours and enjoyed that also (pool isn't huge but it's okay). All in all, a good stay. Found the staff polite, the hotel was very clean and the location was pretty good too.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but not great.”
Reviews.Author: SMAUSTIN1
Reviews.Content: This hotel was clean and the staff friendly. Our room was not very spacious and had no view however we stayed in the Skyline room. Therefore I would suggest you pay the extra money and get upgraded to one of the superior rooms. The hotel is for a young crowd (25-35). If you are going for the pool this is not the hotel for you as the pool is farily basic for Las Vegas hotel standards. We tried 4 restaurants in the hotel and we were very happy with 3 out of the 4. Bring sweaters as the hotel is very cool despite the weather outside. All in all it was a good stay, but not great.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Stay”
Reviews.Author: travelgal084
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed my stay at NY NY in Vegas. The hotel has everything from lots of food and beverage options to shops. The hotel rooms are spacious and clean, though I was facing the strip and the rollercoaster my room was quiet. The staff was friendly and helpful. Only issue is the $15 resort fee, otherwise known as a money grab.

Reviews.Title: “I would never leave from there...”
Reviews.Author: andrea r
Reviews.Content: wow. A wonderful hotel on the strip of Las Vegas. It's comfortable, the room was big as well as the bathroom; the service is a high level one. It's full of restaurants of good quality and of a wide range of prices, pubs with live music, fast foods, shops. The atmosphere is comfortable and pleasant, the slot machine room is very big and nice to be seen. There is an amazing roller coaster. I think the price matches the quality they give you. The valet parking is very efficent.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, but those 15.00 Dlls.”
Reviews.Author: salvador55786
Reviews.Content: We stayed there the last week of August. We did a late check in and we didn´t have any problem. There was this lovely girl that up graded our rooms (no extra charge). The rooms were large and very clean and no problem with the noise of the roller coaster. The only thing I didn´t like it´s the 15.00 Dlls daily quote for each room (this quote is obligatory wheter you use the spa and intenet or not) , so why they don´t just put in the price. The hotel has a great location. I recommend the water pool. We enjoy 2 shows and had a great week. If you are thinking to go to the Zumanity show try to buy your tickets in advance

Reviews.Title: “Okay, but won't stay again!”
Reviews.Author: MandyGandy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a recent trip to Las Vegas. We had a Park Avenue Deluxe suite, it was was clean with comfortable beds. We enjoyed our room, we even had a pretty good view. The staff were all very friendly and helpful. The price of the room was fair for the quality, but be aware of the $15 a night resort fee. It is supposed to cover "high speed" internet, local calls, a daily newspaper and fax services. The internet was not at all high speed, it was very very slow. We never received a newspaper and had no need for the other services the resort fee covers. The biggest problem we had while at the hotel was the noise level in the casino area. There were two nights when we retired to our room early because we couldn't stand the noise level in the casino. Loud music blaring from the bars on the casino floor and the piano bar where the performers were more annoying than entertaining. It's Vegas, I don't expect peace and quite, but if I want to feel like I am in the middle of a dance club that is where you will find me. We couldn't even have a conversation over the music. Very annoying! We ended up at other casinos on most nights. That is enough to make us not want to stay at this property again.

Reviews.Title: “Fun hotel - Good stay”
Reviews.Author: fltam
Reviews.Content: This was a fun hotel to stay in. From the minute you arrived you felt like you were in New York city. The lobby was full of slot machines (which I didn't really care for). I prefer a more elegant lobby but I got use to it. Check in was very slow. I waited probably 20 minutes with only two people in front of me. The front desk clerk was very helpful and quick checking me in when it was finally my turn. I stayed in the Park Avenue room. Decor was so-so but the bed was really comfortable. I have a bad back so that was great!! Lighting throughout the room including bathroom was low/dim. The AC was not the strongest/coolest but doable. I enjoyed strolling through the miniature replica of New York City that surround the casino. It was fun and the little cafes/bars/restaurants made you feel like you were walking in the city. It was too smoky for me - since I don't smoke. Pizza was so-so and the other fast food was just okay. The Italian restaurant IIFornaio was very good. Good food and service. I loved the quick checkout via television....Overall I had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Theme Hotel, Average Stay”
Reviews.Author: farrlynn
Reviews.Content: I moved here after spending two nights at the Venetian. We had to move because of a flight cancellation (hurricane Irene in NYC) and wanted a cheaper room rate. I currently live in New York, and think they have done a pretty decent job of replicating some of the NYC highlights in the theme without being too cheesy. There are a fair amount of restaurant options that appealed to a range of budgets, however late night dining options are lacking (only pizza and a lackluster diner). Our room was spacious and completely adequate, it was the lowest room category and was really not anything special (which was expected). I found it a big strange that some of the furniture was bolted down including a table and a lamp. We had a view of the rollercoaster and a little bit of the pool area. One huge negative was that although we were in a non smoking room there was a very strong smell of smoke in the room, it seemed to come in from the bathroom vents (huge negative) I did not visit the pool so I cannot comment on that. We didn't have any luck in the casino at New York New York but were pretty successful at MGM Grand which is conveniently located across the street. Would not be my first choice, but I would stay here again if the price was right...

Reviews.Title: “OKAY HOTEL FOR WHAT PAID FOR”
Reviews.Author: mariesantos1976
Reviews.Content: We had stayed at the Venetian and due to Hurricane, flight was canceled and had to stay 3 more nights- Venetian was too expensive per night because we had booked on special- so we checked reviews on TripAdvisor and seemed okay- so we stayed at New York for 3 nights. We had booked through Expedia and said that there was 2 free buffets every day max $20 per person which was a good deal at $62.00 per nt. We requested early check in and they said that none of the room we booked was ready but for $10.00 extra per night we can upgrade from Skyline (basic room) to Park Ave room and no early check in fees. When we got there, the room looked renovated, but in a cheap way- there were cigarette holes in the sheets, and stains, and hair. The shower head had lime rust and some yellow goo- we asked to change rooms, and the conditions were slightly better. There was also layers of dust in corners. I felt the need to disinfect room surfaces and shower head with sanitizer just in case. The pool was not efficient- because of the tall buildings around- sun hits the pool at 11:30am only and height only 3.5 -4ft. Crammed sun chairs no cushion provided. *** Buffets were a good deal except beware: they explained that the buffets would charge to our room and in the end hotel will credit us back at checkout.
