The catch was that the normal prices of the buffets of breakfast/lunch were $15-$17 but they charged us $19-$20. When we checked out they deducted $20 per person but kept the tax on- there was nowhere on the voucher that says excludes tax but they have space to write in bold that tip is not included! We had to speak to a manager to get the taxes removed (total $45.00 approx). Buffet choices were good (I recommend Mirage and Mandalay Bay- NOT Circus Circus and MGM). Like all other Las Vegas hotels, this was a maze to find our way and we could have used a small fridge in our room. Good location, soundproof- could not hear roller coaster from hotel room. All in all, worth what we paid for if you're not too picky for cleanliness- but I would have paid more to stay at another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “fun time”
Reviews.Author: Joe_petr
Reviews.Content: this hotel is fine bit older but it was fun stayed for four days. Rooms were a bit old for my liking. I like the fact that they made the inside look like the outside streets of a city that was pretty cool good restaurants right in the middle of the strip its not bad i dont think i would go back

Reviews.Title: “Teenager Review- More than enough for me to do :)”
Reviews.Author: teenagedream
Reviews.Content: My mom (38) and I (15) stayed at New York, New York for 5 days.' We checked in at 11, (check in is at 3) and had to pay a $20 fee for early check in, which was slightly ridiculous - but whatever. They only had 3 people at the desks with a line of about 15, so we ended up standing there for maybe 30-35 minutes waiting. We were on the 10th floor, New Yorker Tower and had a park avenue suite. Our view was facing the excalibur but we mainly saw the rollercoaster. The screaming at 11pm didn't affect me, but possibly if I was a light sleeper. We had MORE than enough room for the both of us. It was 400sq ft with two queen beds, we could have had 2 more people with us and still been comfortable. The internet was definitly hi-speed and great for me when my mom was at the casino at night. The plasma tv had a variety of channels that kept both of us happy. There was an iPod dock but I couldnt figure out how to use it. I wasn't fond of the shower pressure, I felt like I was getting hit by a garden hose on full blast, I tried to adjust the setting but apparently that was the only one. The arcade on the second floor is AMAZING. I spent hours there while my mom was in the casino. The workers there were very helpful if I had a problem. We never visited the pool, way too hot for us, we live on an island- we didnt need it. The resturants on the groundfloor opposite the casino are great and there is plenty of variety. We had sushi one night, pizza the other and also ate at the irish pub. It has a very intimate feel to it with all the restuarants together, with the cobblestone streets. Also there is a live band (2 guys) who performed every night I was there, which gave a very nice atmosphere.I have asthma and found unlike MGM Grand I could breathe much better at this hotel. They do have express check out, make sure to ask for the card at the desk. Even though I'm not of age I had plenty to do at this hotel. Definitley coming back.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel looked great and the restuarants were tasty!”
Reviews.Author: ajzluvspjz5
Reviews.Content: We arrived a little early around 2pm and they went ahead and let us check in early. We reserved the spa suite and we upgraded to the marquis suite for an extra $40 a night. We got up to our room and the location was nice and really close to the elevators. The room was nice and clean. The only thing I noticed was there was no coffee maker in the room which I thought was weird. They forgot to stock our shower with shampoo and conditioner. The room was nicely set up. The vanity area in the bathroom was nice for doing my makeup. The description of the room on the website said that it was a tub/shower combo and ours was only a shower which was fine but they need to describe thing accurate on there website.They definitely need to do some up keeps on some of there rooms. I don't think we got the best marquis suite. All around good room and great stay. My only advice is don't use your debit card booking your room. Always use a credit card to do everything, it was a night mare getting all my money back on the account. We wanted to pay cash for our room at check out and we took the girl that and we thought she understood that but she didn't . She charged our room to our debit card. We brought it to there attention at check out and they told us that you can't pay cash for a suite which I don't know why, but they made it right in the end letting us pay cash, but it caused me a lot of headaches just getting everything back to normal. I don't know why they want all the money up front because when you book the room you pay for the first night and they do take your credit card to hold. I'm just so use to paying for my stay at the end of the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't want to leave!”
Reviews.Author: SlikChik101
Reviews.Content: We had a blast at the NYNY. The service was great (from valets to dealers etc.) We didn't even want to go explore the strip, everything we needed was right there for us! We stayed in the park ave rooms and had a great view of the strip from our room! Plus our elevators were NEVER crowed like the other ones! Huge plus for just a few dollars more!

Reviews.Title: “We had a blast!!!!”
Reviews.Author: anthonyntinaj
Reviews.Content: We really didn't have a great view. But we didn't care because we were not in the room long enough to look out. We were so tired that when we hit the bed we were out. The beds were very comfortable and the pillows were great. I wanted to buy one to take home but opted out on that. The hotel is nice and everyone there was friendly. Not once did we have a complaint about anything. Overall I think most of the hotels over there would be great considering you are not in the room that much to start off with.

Reviews.Title: “Mary & Front Desk was excellent.”
Reviews.Author: nwprincess337
Reviews.Content: Stayed only 1 night due to illness but Mary let us check in early because Orbitz hadn't sent over our booking yet. She was so warm & friendly and really was patient with all of our questions. We were in room 3240 and it was very sufficient. iPod dock didn't work, TV remote was hit-or-miss with changing channels but I wasn't worried about it being it was only $68 a night (30Aug). We got the promo of 1 buffet per person/day n went to MGM Grand Buffet. It was nice and staff very attentive. Only real complaint was that the walls are paper thin so when the neighbors came back- you could hear every word. Our room was 1 of those adjoining rooms/door so that might be why it was so noisy. I liked the hotel overall and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great times had all round”
Reviews.Author: KO2500
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week and had the best time. We got a spa suite and whilst the room felt run down, we did only pay about $115 a night, so pretty good value. That being said, the smell of smoke (in a non smoking room) was pretty hideous. The hotel itself is located, i feel, more on the end of the strip rather than being in the hustle and bustle of it all. So the walk into all the other happening places did seem like to take forever. So if you want to be near the famous places like Bellagio, don't stay here. Although the room wasn't great, the hotel facilities were. There was 9 bars and we spent many a night in there. We absolutly loved times square bar with the dueling pianos and would recommend you to go there - even if you are not staying at the hotel. I lost 12hrs of my life at these bars and only have the photos as memories - a bit hangover-esk. The hotel doesn't have any mini mart which is a bit painful, but there is a chemist (CVS) near by that you can buy anything you need from - prob a 5 min walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good rooms”
Reviews.Author: Adrian C
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at The New York New York several times before but this was the first for a while. We were allocated a room in the Chrysler Tower which was large and had all the amenities. The hotel is a good location for the south strip but in the heat of summer can be a long way from the casinos further up the strip (use the Monorail) I would recommend this hotel for a good quality stay in Las Vegas

Reviews.Title: “ABSOLUTELY LOVED IT”
Reviews.Author: Taniqua_Sasha
Reviews.Content: Perfect Location, great price for a great hotel. Rooms are very spacious and very clean!! I would definitely recommend this to anyone who is look for a great location hotel, cheap, and amazing service! Thanks NYNY for making my holiday that much better...!!! :-)

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel For Price”
Reviews.Author: woolwool
Reviews.Content: Hotel is a reasonable hotel at a reasonable price. Rooms are of good size, clean and comfortable. Las Vegas attractions easy to get to. Only negative is sound of machines at breakfast. You have to like gambling. Gallaghers Restaurant was excellent although expensive. The sporting house was very good and more reasonably priced. We would be happy to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful rooms in mad Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Ailso5
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay here for 3 nights with our teenage girls. The rooms were lovely - clean and spacious and were interconnecting. Despite the location which is close to the airport and overlooking the strip, there was little noise. We liked the night time atmosphere of the main hotel - a lot of the other hotels try to make it seem like sunset which doesn't quite work. Recommend Il Fornaio Restaurant for breakfast and Chin Chin for dinner.

Reviews.Title: “NY-NY vs Mirage”
Reviews.Author: TravlinSaz
Reviews.Content: For our second trip to Vegas, my husband and I were looking at either the Luxor or NYNY after admiring them both first time around when we were staying at the Mirage. Unlike the Mirage, NYNY is at the 'right' end of the strip for most of the big hotel attractions we were interested in, whereas when we staying in the Mirage it seemed like we spent our days walking miles in the blazing heat to get anywhere. NYNY has a good choice of on site restaurants with reasonably priced food (try the fish in Nine Fine Irishmen - delicious!). We stayed in a Park Avenue room which was modern, clean and spacious (read a few reviews before we went that said it was dirty but found no evidence of this where we were). The roller coaster screams were a bit annoying but didn't spend too much time in the room and it stops running well before we thought about bedtime. Free parking and internet which is always a bonus, price was a bit steep but that's just my gripe about Vegas mega-hotels in general. Rollercoaster was fun although a bit ricketty - make sure you use the guest coupons for half price discount. Stayed there for two nights and was expecting a clean, energetic atmosphere with loads to do on site or nearby, and was not disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Insulted by the $20 "Early Check-in" SCAM”
Reviews.Author: Jeff K
Reviews.Content: Booked mid week (Wednesday) on Expedia for $50 -Arrived at the Hotel at 1130am, checked in........ -I was told that if I wanted an 'early' check in, it would cost an additional $20 -I was provided 2 room keys, programmed with the room number at that time, but was instructed to call the front desk after 130pm to 'see if a room is available'. Keep in mind I already have keys in hand, with a room already assigned to them!! Front desk was just keeping the room number a secret, unless I were to pay $20. Everyone knows the hotels in Vegas aren't anywhere close to full on a Wednesday morning, that's why it only cost $50 on Expedia! So I played along with the foolishness...I called the front desk after 130pm from the house phone to receive my 'secret' room number. At that time I was given my room number by voice over the phone. I then attended my room that had actually been assigned 2 hours earlier, and entered with my card key that had been programmed 2 hours earlier. Just as I had suspected, the room sat empty until I called to get the room number....had I paid the $20, I would have been given the room number at 1130am, as it WAS available, sort of like extortion huh? My wife and I travel to Vegas twice per month, and stay at the North end of the strip...Wynn, Palazzo, Venetian, Caesars, and TI......we thought we'd give the South end a try. We generally arrive on the same flight every time we come, and arrive at our booked hotels usually around 11am. We have NEVER been asked to pay an early Check-in fee.....and have ALWAYS received an early check-in!! Because of this SCAM, I have chosen not to stay at MGM properties in the future. PROS: The hotel is a good solid 4*, lots of food options.....fun environment. CONS: Bathroom was small, sliding shower doors are dingy, and have a bit of mold growing in the corners...pretty much turned off by that too!

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the money”
Reviews.Author: suziq2Texas
Reviews.Content: Wer stayed at NY NY for 3 nights. Our room was very clean and modern. We stayed in one of the updated rooms. The only negative was that its a big hotel and it was a long walk from the elevatot to our room but we needed the exercise. Wait service at the pool was nice. Staff was overall very friendly and helpful. We loved the Bar at Times Square. Roller coaster noise did not bother us as others have complained. Overall it was a very good experience. I would return

Reviews.Title: “A nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: onecreativejen
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed here for our anniversary the past 3 years. Overall, I enjoy this hotel. Reasonably priced, and when I have had complaints about service they have been resolved (mostly) satisfactorily. On this recent trip, I stopped at the desk the morning after I checked in to make sure that I was in the correct room type because it was so much smaller than the room's the previous years. I was assured that I was in the correct room but that sometimes the room size varies because of the building architecture. The desk clerk offered to move me to another "building" without my asking and the room we were moved to was much more what we were accustomed to. However, one evening I slipped and fell in the Village Eateries area, and was informed that the hotel can't be held responsible for people spilling drinks. Ummm? Do you serve bleach water now? Because that's what the puddle I slipped in was. The coffee shop that has some desserts available was awesome. The desserts are delicious and they are reasonably priced. However, they aren't open very late, so if you want a post-show treat you're going to need to get it in advance and put it in your room on ice. Zumanity is a great show, and there are frequently deals on tickets.

Reviews.Title: “third time to stay here”
Reviews.Author: eugenemcmanus
Reviews.Content: this is our 3rd time to stay in NYNY. we enjoyed our stay, hotel room was very good with jacuzzi. the 'nine fine irish men bar' was where we ended up each evening, brill irish band and fab young lady dancing on stage which is actually a corner of the bar, no mean feast dancing on very limited area. great crack was had by all, only complaint was the $5 cover charge to gain admittance for the lads , ladies free.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive hotel”
Reviews.Author: tromanCardiff
Reviews.Content: On a tour of California and Vegas, I was very much looking forward to spending a few days in Vegas and this hotel. I was not disappointed. The moment I got there I was impressed by the whole layout of the hotel and it's casino. At reception, I was told I could upgrade to a better room for only $15!!! I did this and had a bigger room but unfortunately was not overlooking the strip. The bathrooms were also very big and spacious. I saw that there was an ipod dock in my room, but this is the case with any room. There is also free wifi in rooms, which is great, because I hate paying or having to go to the lobby area. If you've been on a long flight, you'll be glad to know that the hotel is close to the airport and should NEVER cost more than $25 to get here from the main terminal. During the day, you can really see the impressive hotel structure of buildings in New York, and inside is just as impressive, with a Times Square bit right in the middle of the hotel. From the poolside, you can also see the exterior from a better angle. At night though, the hotel really stands out on the strip. The hotel is linked by bridges over the strip to get to the MGM and Excalibur. (Both these hotels have trams/monorails to other parts of the strip). You can also walk to the Monte Carlo and get a tram from there to CityCenter. My very few issues with this place, is that the rooms do need vacuuming and windowsills need dusting. Also the rollercoaster, which was one of the main reasons I choose this hotel, is a complete rip off, charging one person $14 for one ride around the coaster, with no discount for being a guest either.

Reviews.Title: “It's all about New York!”
Reviews.Author: mirsini80
Reviews.Content: Amazing hotel, it's like you have "At your foot" all New York! From Empire, to Statue of Liberty to Manhattan Bridge! You have to know which elevator takes you to your room (because there are many building all in one). The excecutive double room with strip view is huge and all the room in front has windows so you can see everything! Clean, big room and with view in the super rollercoaster which is in front of the hotel! The yellow cab rollercoaster. One of the best hotels in Vegas! Definitely recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Love this place”
Reviews.Author: Xomex
Reviews.Content: Had a massive room for $80 midweek in the Century Tower. Loev the atmosphere at NYNY as it seems a little more "upmarket" that some of the others on the strip. Plenty of things to do without going outside of the hotel: Bar at Times Square and Nine Fine Irishmen recommended. Good shops, good food, good entertainment. A large well-run hotel in typical Vegas style.

Reviews.Title: “Read Fine Print”
Reviews.Author: John R
Reviews.Content: Received a promotion from MGM properties. "Stay three nights free at any MGM property" stay at 5 star (Bellagio, Mandalay Bay etc. get regular rack room) stay at NY NY, Monte Carlo ect. get suite upgrade. We selected NY NY...reserved a suite on June 26th for weekend of Aug. 20th. And I called to verify my arrangements the week before. NOT SO FAST! Got to hotel on Friday afternoon...."sorry no suites" ...."we are sold out" based on availability....when I made the reservation it was "Available"...they could have cared less! Casino host was no help either. When I asked if I could transfer to the Bellagio or Mandalay...they said I could do it myself..they would / could not help. Thanks Barbara. "Not enough play" to give a crap! Well, guess Harras properties might treat players better. Spent most of my time and $$$ else where, guess my "play" for this weekend might not meet your requirements again. You send out a promotion....my wife and I fly out to take you up on your word / offer and you crap on it. Stick your "resort fees" also, Harras properties do not charge. Oh....yeah...that $ 100 food credit I was also supposed to get....find out after I spent $ 175 at Gallagers steak house....they won't honor that either...still wroking on that....can't find the "fine print" for that deal yet.

Reviews.Title: “Almost Disney in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: 2xelmundo
Reviews.Content: The hotel facade is the city of New York and in the interior you will find like little streets of nyc (as a film stage). It is ok... but rather dark for me. The room was OK but old. The swimming pool area is just fine. The hotel is an average hotel and the restaurant options quite standard.

Reviews.Title: “It's ok”
Reviews.Author: Sweetlu4
Reviews.Content: Location isn't the greatest. Rooms and casino were clean. The casino itself is kind of small. Overall it's an average place to stay. I think other casinos offer more for roughly the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Fun hotel with soul!!!!”
Reviews.Author: bellaboo175
Reviews.Content: You can't fault NYNY. It has everything you need. Great atmosphere unlike the new souless City Centre hotels. The choice of food is outstanding, we loved the takeaway pizza. Everything is so clean. Room are lovely and my bathroom was massive. The gold buses that go from one end of the strip to the other stop near to the hotel so if oyu don't want to do alot of walking you don't have to. All in all Laz Veags is amazing no matter what your interests. Can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Had a good stay here and good for the money spent”
Reviews.Author: CityGalIL
Reviews.Content: Pros: On the strip, close to MGM, Monarail to go to other hotels. Conveniently located to the MGM Grand hotel that actually had better eating venues if you're looking for a sit down type of dinner. Cons: Very long wait at check in. More fast food type of places on the property. I would say it is geared to the younger crowd for sure. Night life was totally an item in the forefront. Probably will try other places before going here again, just for comparison. Not a bad stay at all.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: bubbleso0o
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a group of single friends, I have stayed in other hotels in Vegas, and in my opinion New York, is the best hotel for value for money, location and bars/casinos. The rooms are amazing, make sure you get a high floor as the views are fantastic. The only down fall is the helicopters fly past your room, but that is a small downfall.

Reviews.Title: “not to bad at all”
Reviews.Author: Kaindec1
Reviews.Content: stayed at the hotel during the hot season and found it to be quite nice given it is a casino first and a hotel second. Good themes and close to MGM so basically 2 casino's/hotels in one. Rooms were ok but we got to look over the carpark but still you get what you pay for. Food wasnt that great, seemed to be more fast food focused than nice sit down. However across the bridge the MGM has nicer eateries. All in all it was a pleasant stay and would go back without a doubt but may try something different next time just for the sake of it.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AnnieL79
Reviews.Content: Good Hotel with a lot of eating and drinking choices and nice pool. Located at one end of the trip but depending on time of year not far to walk to the middle of the strip. I may stay more centrally next time. Did a helicopter trip to the Grand Canyon which is definately recommended

Reviews.Title: “Mainly for young people”
Reviews.Author: sdvaltx
Reviews.Content: I let a friend book this, as it turned out, thru a discount website. When I checked in they told me a room with 2 queens was not avaialable (there were 3 of us) and I could upgrade for $15 a night. I balked, after some wait she upgraded me for "free" (to Park Avenue) Then she said there would be a $15 "resort fee" which turned out to be $15 a night plus tax for a total of $50 for 3 nights. The beds & pillows were not comfortable. The room was clean, no compliants there. And there were plenty of good restaurants, good casino. I found out the last day we were supposed to get coupons for discounts in the restaurants, inlcuding a 2 for 1 breakfast. We never recieved that and we found out the day we were checking out. We had no problems with noise, we were on the 15th floor and one end of the roller coaster was nearby but we never had problems with noise. There were a LOT of 20-ish guests and I think this is a good hotel for them but not for 60-ish, if you want a comfortable bed. I think there are better deals out there,

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time but not because of the hotel”
Reviews.Author: journeygo
Reviews.Content: We had a great time in Vegas! I mean it was the best 4 days ever! The hotel was good, everything's there for you, but they don't necessarily go out of their way to please! Some parts of the lobby/casino smelt really bad and did so for the whole time we were there. There was a fight in the casino were one guy got pummeled and my friend left his ipod in our room after we left and when he tried to ring them to get it back they said they couldn't find it. This all sounds like it could dampen anyone's holiday but not ours. Probably because we weren't in it for the service etc. We were just there to have a good time which we would have had even if we stayed in a motel. I would recommend this hotel to younger people going to Vegas with friends to party. It's not really the place for families or couples.

Reviews.Title: “Best wedding gift ever!!”
Reviews.Author: lovingpismodise
Reviews.Content: We booked a room for my daughters wedding night, and boy were we ever impressed. Once they got to see it, they didnt want to leave the room! It was fabulous, they loved it so much! It was so beautifully decorated, on the 28th floor if I remember correctly with a great view of the strip. My son in law couldnt believe how nice it was, he said"they do love me dont they !" Well next time my husband and I will have to spoil ourselves instead!, booked through Priceline... but the hotel upgraded when we got there! what a nice surprise!! I dont know how to describe other than it was Dope! !!

Reviews.Title: “We Love NYNY and we look forward to coming back”
Reviews.Author: Edwina7
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved staying at the New York New York hotel. From the outside appearance to the indoor lobby we were very pleased with what we saw. We checked in relatively quickly and when we got to the room I had no complaints (I always do a full inspection of any hotel room I sleep in). It was spotless and appealing and the bed and pillows were just the right firmness without being too hard or too soft. The staff was always so friendly and helpful and I loved the fact that the hotel was a big hotel but not overwhelmingly huge where u just felt lost. We felt very comfortable in NYNY and every night after an evening of shows and/ activities we looked forwarded to coming back and being in our hotel. We do plan on coming back to Vegas in another year and definitely would love to stay in the NY NY hotel and casino again. Thank you New York New York for helping to make our first trip to Vegas a memorable one; We only have good things to say about your hotel and staff with regards to the high quality service you provided to us this August.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: guil46
Reviews.Content: Because we had a pre check-in, the official check-in went fast. Otherwise, large line-up. Check-out was quick and efficient! The hotel is close to the airport, our taxidriver made a long detour because there were construction... yeah right! None of them! What should cost 15 ... cost finally 40$... nice scam! The room was large! Clean! Comfortable beds! Quiet in the room with the A/C that was more than needed considering the outside temperature!!! The hotel was perfect for an hotel but nothing very special considering you'Re in Vegas. I would have give an Excellent rate if the hotel was everywhere else. The hotel had everything we needed. We were not disturbed by the rollercoster as some reviewed. Small pool considering the quantity of rooms. In my opinion, the pool access closed too early (7 pm). We were disappointed that they were not able to set an early check-in while the hotel was not full. We stored our luggage but when the guy came back... one bag was missing! Be careful on that! He finally found it. Exchange rate at the hotel is not very good, bring your own currency. We had a promotion which allows us one buffet / day in other hotels. We took advantage of that and they honoured it at check-out. Nice set-up on first floor with the new york style streets. Zumanity; show is bad, too much interaction with the public!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rachub
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my family (2 adults 3 teenagers) in July. Hotel was excellent, plenty of places to eat and drink, prices average for the area. Vegas is like nowhere else on earth, you either love it or hate it i suppose, but i love it. Thought it might be awkward with teenagers but there was plenty to see and do, everyone enjoyed themselves. Rooms were large and comfortable, with connecting doors. Hotel corridors were freezing! But everywhere else was fine. Pool was a bit small, but ok not too crowded when we went one afternoon. Roller coaster was amazing according to my husband and daughter! Always something to see and do in Vegas any time of day or night. Location of hotel was fine, you could walk to many casinos, but we took the monorail to Harrah's and back as it was so hot. We saw the tribute show in Harrah's which was really good, i actually thought at one time during the show that i was seeing Elvis in vegas, he was so good. All in all would stay at this hotel again, prices were ok, and really we only used the rooms for sleeping so no point paying excessive amounts for the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great”
Reviews.Author: abbbb
Reviews.Content: v good location. near to anything else on the strip we wanted to do. would stay in again.

Reviews.Title: “Breath of Fresh Air”
Reviews.Author: S B
Reviews.Content: My female friend and I arrived at NY NY after two horrific days at the Golden Nugget. The first positive thing was that the room had two double beds in it. (We stayed in two different rooms at the GN and each had one king sized bed which we shared.) The room was clean, pleasant smelling, unstained and modern looking. We ate at Gallagher's Steakhouse--yummy! We rode the roller coaster, toured the hotel (and others around it) and gambled a bit. Enjoyable experience! If NY NY could have the same comfortable beds as Golden Nugget, a coffee maker and a refrigerator in the room, it would've been PERFECT. But I'm still pleased with what NY NY did have to offer. Thank you NY NY!

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: browneyez255
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled to Vegas in August for our 10 yr. wedding anniversary! We ended up booking and staying the rest of our stay at New York-New York, after leaving our originally booked room at another hotel in Las Vegas because it was just dirty! We had gone out originally for 8 nights, and ended up staying the last 4 of those nights at this hotel. I must say that this was such a good decision. We had always wanted to stay here, and so when things didn't work out at our first hotel, we decided to switch. The rooms were very clean! We stayed in a standard deluxe room. The bathrooms were nice and clean. It also had a ice machine in the bathroom. The room also had a walk-in closet, which was a nice size, to put your clothes in and it also had a safe to use! I also like this hotel, because in order to get onto any of the hotel floors where we were, you needed your hotel key or the elevator wouldn't move. I liked this, because it meant that not just anybody could come venturing around the halls of hotel rooms. A downfall to the hotel was that upon check-in, we were not told that the pool was closed down. We ended up seeing the sign on the way to the elevator. We were kind of bummed about that, because it was the middle of summer. Although we were told that we were allowed to use other "sister property" hotel pools, we chose not too. It was kind of inconvenient! Other than that, we had a terrific stay, the staff was very nice, and we will definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Nice and affordable strip location.”
Reviews.Author: herbert_eins
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice, it was not pricy. The rooms were clean and middle sized. It was nothing special, but the staff was quite friendly and the hotel seemed in a good shape. I stayed in the Riviera before - payed a little less - but it was worth to spend a few more dollars for the NYNY. No inconvinience except that the pool was closed in the first days (guests were sent to neighbor hotels to use their pool) - I would have appreciated if the hotel would have offered anything to make this up - thats why they don't get a higher rating from me - but I guess this won't happen often.

Reviews.Title: “Very good Value for money . . .”
Reviews.Author: JJno41
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a park avenue deluxe room for 8 nights. The casino's decor was great with various bars, resturants and fast food fixes to be had. I didnt do much gambling there so I can't comment on that side of things. Room wasn't the biggest in Vegas, but was clean and had all of the ammenties you would expect. The coaster came outside my window and this didn't bother me at all. Cost of items like the room phone breakfast etc can be huge, although there is a fab fair priced pizza joint in the casino.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for value but Rollercoaster could be annoying”
Reviews.Author: lovesholidays2009
Reviews.Content: This hotel HUGE, there are loads of of bars and restaurants in the hotel and part of it is set around cobbled alleyways - an outside inside look which was great we thought. most types of food available, we ate at a few of the restaurants and all the food was good, in the Irish pub and sports bar the portions are huge, so beware. We didnt get to use the pool area but all looked nice. We had a standard room which was really large, the room i thought was a little tired looking however it was clean and the bathroom was a nice size. We asked for a room away from the rollercoaster like the guidebooks say, but we were given an unhelpful look and told the roller coaster goes past everwhere in the hotel, which isnt true if you look at building there are plenty of rooms higher up with no roller coaster tracks around the windows, however it didnt bother us in the end as we were up early to explore every morning, however if you are going to Vegas party til the early hours, the rollercoaster started going around the window at 8 am ish every morning with no one on it, so its not ideal. Across the walkway in MGM was the rainforest cafe, we loved breakfast in there, also great for kids. Best show we saw was the Blue Man group which was great. If your on a budget check out the happy hours at various places, makes it a bit easier on the wallet, as drinks arent cheap. All in all we'd stay there again as it was good value and plenty of choice for eating/drinking, it looked much better than nearby Luxor and the excalibur hotel, which we'd looked at booking

Reviews.Title: “Mixed”
Reviews.Author: SBW2009
Reviews.Content: Lovely room - we had the park ones. However no coffee machine / kettle or fridge which was really disappointing. Noisy with the rollercoaster and it could be a bit difficult to sleep if you needed an early night. Location was good, free parking was great, the restaurants downstairs were expensive and not worth the money however the starbucks staff were excellent as i like just boilung water in the morning and they gave me a cup every day for free (we were buying other products at the same time). Very disappointed at the lack of acknowldegment about our honeymoon - nothing at all even after saying twice.

Reviews.Title: “entertainment around the clock”
Reviews.Author: samuelsson
Reviews.Content: We stayed at New York New York three nights and enjoyed every moment we where in the Hotel. The check in at the reception was very fast and they explained us the important details detailed. The room we slept in was a Standart size and nevertheless more than enough from it's size. The room and the bathroom were very clean. Wireless worked easily and fast. The pool outside of the Hotel is big enough to hang out there for a few hours and getting fried from the sun of Nevada. The Casinopart of the Hotel is huge and worth spending some time in the labirint of Slots and Pokertables. The town of New York City is rebuilt sensationell and it's fun to explore the streets of "Manhattan" with all the Restaurants and Shops. From the Eastexit you hit the Strip as soon you step out of the Hotel. The car park is huge as well and can be reaches easily. We really enjoyed the time at NY NY and recomend the Hotel to everyone between 0 - 120 years old.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Mid range hotel”
Reviews.Author: lorna2011
Reviews.Content: Casino decor was brilliant really fun with roller coasters bars and restaurants throughout. Room was lovely, very clean (park avenue room) Maybe a little small but hey your in New York what do you expect? Swimming pool was too packed, could never get a seat, not even on the floor! Only real issue was with the charge I incurred from using the phone in my room. My call wasn't even answered and it cost me $20. I understand I was stupid for using the phone, but this is crazy extortionate considering the amount of money I spent in the casino and room. Felt just a little disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Supposed to be family friendly but not - Do not recommend for families”
Reviews.Author: jonathan l
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended for families. We are a family of five from Toronto. We booked a suite and room on a 'non-smoking' floor. The suite smelled like an ash tray. Management was extremely unhelpful and unresponsive. The Hotel manager said that we should have checked their web-site to 'see what we were getting into, that's what I always do". All in all a completely inhospitable experience. I would definitely not recommend this for families.

Reviews.Title: “It's cheap and clean, but annoying in many ways”
Reviews.Author: BernieD_Chicago_IL
Reviews.Content: So, the rooms in this hotel and nice enough (ask for the upgraded Park Avenue rooms, the others are kind of old and gross). And the restaurants by and large are actually very tasty. The Italian place off the casino floor is great, as is the hamburger joint. The startling thing about this place is the complete ineptitude of seemingly every employee. From the front desk, the the spa attendants to housekeeping staff, everyone seems to not really give a darn about customer service, efficiency, or speed. Check in took over an hour. Another big negative for me was the casino. Although I did win $1,000 in a $1 slot machine, the overall atmosphere in the casino is loud and somewhat raucous. The music is deafening from the various bars along the casino floor. Having said all of this, I must concede I only paid about $50 per night on average for my stay. For that kind of money, how much can I really complain? The rooms are clean and comfortable, no frills rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but hectic”
Reviews.Author: L2Connelly
Reviews.Content: My family got a great deal on a airfare/hotel package here and no wonder, it was July. (Wow. Was it hot!) The rooms at NY NY are really nice. Comfortable beds and very spacious. This seems like a great hotel to be at if you have kids because there is so much for them to do. The roller coaster is a great ride, but it's an older coaster-- so a bit rickety and you may feel it later...but really fun. I found the food in the hotel limiting. Not many healthy options. Lots of hot dogs, burgers, pizza, bar food, etc... This is a very nice hotel, but for me it was a bit loud and chaotic, even for Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Casino”
Reviews.Author: luis084
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at New York, NY many times over the years. As a sports fan and New Yorker, I alsways feel comfortable and liked being able to go to ESPN Zone to watch the games. When ESPN Zone went out of business, I stopped staying at New York, NY in favor of other properties. Now that they have reopened the former ESPN Zone (the name has changed but the venue is almost exactly the same), I can one again stay in my favortite resort.

Reviews.Title: “Had a Great Trip!”
Reviews.Author: MJU63
Reviews.Content: New York - New York is an excellent place to stay! The rooms are very clean and the beds are sooo comfortable! The hotel is located on the strip and has a great variety of places to eat and things to do!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but crappy room”
Reviews.Author: pictoumelly
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the NY NY hotel last week for our honeymoon. The hotel and casino were quite nice- but our room was awful. The pool was closed for most of our trip - but we still had to pay a resort fee. We stayed in a smoking room and when we first got there our room was pretty dirty. Our floor by the night table had ashes everywhere and there was a sticky puddle of something on the bathroom floor. The decor also seemed outdated. When we opened the draps we were shocked to see concrete walls instead of any view :-( On the positive side, after the first night, housekeeping did a good job of cleaning (we stayed a week and they were very good at meeting our requests). I have two pieces of advice: 1. Be aware that there is a 20 dollar resort per day but you can't beat the location and 2. Spend a little extra and avoid the "Broadway suite" to avoid disappointment. I peaked into other rooms and they seemed quite nice so perhaps we were just unlucky that week .

Reviews.Title: “eh.. not impressed”
Reviews.Author: Olivia E
Reviews.Content: I expected more from New York New York. The rooms are average. The pool area is too small, and pretty lame compared to many other Vegas hotel pools. For some reason the room kept making my nose bleed. I know it wasn't just me, because two of my friends were also having nasal problems. Every time I blew my nose blood came out. Since I have been to Vegas about 10 times, and never had this problem, I know it wasn't just allergies or Vegas in general. It was our room and the air circulation. You can't open the windows even an inch, so maybe it had to do with the air filters or air conditioner. Anyways, I was expecting more for the price. It wasn't a terrible stay, just an average one. The plus side is that it is conveniently connected to MGM Grand, the food court it ok, the Italian Food restaurant by the roller coaster was very good, we ate there several times. I also wouldn't recommend their club Rok Vegas. It's too small and the floors get wet and dirty. The roller coaster is fun, but not for the price. It's pretty bumpy, and my shoulders were bruised for about 2 weeks after I rode the ride. The overall casino and hotel area is nice/average, It didn't wow me or even impress me. Was an ok stay, but if you are paying a lot I'd recommend going for The Mirage instead. I will not be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice deal using MLife”
Reviews.Author: DeanOC99
Reviews.Content: We visit Vegas every year and try to stay in different hotels each time. I've been a member of the MGM/Mirage Player's Club (now MLife) and was sent a deal for NYNY for $29/night+$25 free slot play. We enjoyed the casino in the past so thought we'd try to stay there for cheap. We were upgraded to a Park Ave room and the room size is about avg, not huge but OK. We were on 15th floor furthest north tower. We didn't have a view of the coaster track (it was more south than where we were) so no noise from that. The casino is nice and has the super high ceilings that most casinos don't have so it feels more open. We enjoyed the new automated video Craps game they have there. Only $1 minumum, and it has real live jumbo dice that you press a button to roll. I was sad to learn ESPNZone closed, but it has been replaced by Sporting House who kept all the old ESPN seating with all the big screens and booths, etc. It seems half the games at Sporting House upstairs are gone, but still some to play using their game card. We also liked the crowd energy and participation at the piano bar they have with live entertainment each night. NYNY does have a resort fee to cover Internet, Pool, workout room at the Spa...though we ended up using none of those.

Reviews.Title: “Nickel and dimmed to death”
Reviews.Author: seaexplorer
Reviews.Content: Nice scenery, lots to do, but be prepared to dip into your wallet often and for amounts that quickly add up. The casino is very tight and I didn't see anybody winning. There were three of us and all of us lost quickly. Everything is very expensive. If your loaded and have lots to spend, then this will be a fun place for you.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hote”
Reviews.Author: char4
Reviews.Content: i have just returned from 5 nihts in the new york new yrok hoel wth my husband, brother and sister in law for y 30th birthday and i could definatley recommend it we went into many of the hotels in vegas and from what i could see i think we stayed in the best hotel as far as restaurants, bars amd casion there were endless restaurants all in the style of new york along with mny bars. the casino itself was huge- we certainly enjoyed our time in the hotl the room was a good size with a bath withshower over it which was nice to have a bath. the only down side was there was no tea/coffee in the room but with endless places in the hotel it didnt really matter our room was in the new york block on the 15th floor which had vnding machines and a ice machine which was very handy the pool was a realy good size with plenty of loungers and towels available for use the bar waswel sockedif a little pricey but othig yo wouldnt expect in vegas- the pink lemondae is well worth a try! all in all the hotel was great, the staff were ll vr helpul ad frendlly

Reviews.Title: “ok but nothing special.”
Reviews.Author: debs163
Reviews.Content: paid for upgrade for deluxe room......There was nothing deluxe about it. It would've be ok if we had just paid a basic price. Overall wasn't keen but stayed in worse this holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: papa84
Reviews.Content: A great place to stay and eat food is good and rooms are not bad but rooms are almost the same at all the casino hotels. The rooms are clean.

Reviews.Title: “Poor man's hotel -- CHEAP, ECONO LODGE-STYLE”
Reviews.Author: PokerAK
Reviews.Content: We thought that we would try something new this time in Las Vegas -- like try a "theme resort/casino". Based on TripAdvisor reviews, New York-New York was rated better (#60) than the RIO (#108). I figured I could play some poker, while wifey plays the slots. Big mistake. The room is your basic ECONO-LODGE style hotel. Carpet was dirty and worn. Bathroom is small, with worn-out towels and very basic shampoo-soap combination. The mattress is tolerable. I'm just glad we paid for 2 nights only. It became obvious that other NY-NY hotel guests are used to "poor-man accommodation". The restaurant food was also "fast-food quality". After trying 1 restaurant, we promptly went elsewhere. Didn't even play poker or the slots. For $30/night, plus resort fee, this was your EXTREMELY BASIC hotel room. Sad to say, but I got what I paid for: CHEAP. Frankly, I made a mistake. I'm not coming back to this hotel. Sorry.

Reviews.Title: “Decent LV hotel”
Reviews.Author: nitework
Reviews.Content: A decent Las Vegas Hotel, maybe a little bit dated in comparison to the newest ones, but great location, quiet rooms and good selection of restaurants. Pro: + 2-for-1 Buffet for $20 + 2-for-1 Breakfast + The Roller Coaster Contra: To get from the elevator to our room, we had to walk 178 metres (yes, we counted the steps :) - that is quite a long hallway!

Reviews.Title: “Easy access to cheapish food, good for college age.”
Reviews.Author: pookiegalore
Reviews.Content: The interior of the hotel is very stylish, but the rooms have thin walls. If you are on the third floor, you have no outside light what so ever, blocked by the facade. The value for the money was good, but I would recommend it more for college party people than anyone over 30. It was a quick walk from the room to food places, which were all good.

Reviews.Title: “Fine for the right price”
Reviews.Author: Michael255093
Reviews.Content: I was offered a $10 a night upgrade to a Park Avenue room upon check-in, which I took. I do not know what the cheaper rooms are like, so I'll have to defer to some of the other reviews posted here. I found the Park Avenue room very spacious and clean. There was a good selection of TV channels available. The king-sized bed was very comfortable. My room was well-insulated against noise, except for through the connecting door to the room next to mine. The elevators were quick and efficient. I could recommend the NYNY if you get a good rate for your room. While there was nothing wrong with the room or service I received during my stay, if I was returning to Las Vegas I would personally chose to stay further north on the Strip - simply because there is more to see and do there.

Reviews.Title: “Fun Place”
Reviews.Author: TRINA32752
Reviews.Content: NY-NY hotel/casino is fun and reasonably priced. It is in a good location with many other casinos close enough to walk to. Our corner room was on the 18th floor with a fabulous view of the strip. Several very good restaurants within the hotel. Don't miss the Bar @ Times square with dueling piano... so much fun!

Reviews.Title: “Was a pleasant stay and staff was very nice!”
Reviews.Author: TikiTravels
Reviews.Content: I had a good experience staying at the New York New York hotel. The rate was a bit high for the stay due ot demand howevver the property was nice. I stayed on the 19th floor and had a view of the rollercoaster from one window and another view of the part of the strip. The room was clean and well maintained. I ordred room service and it was very prompt. Food was very good as well. The check in process did not take long and I was able to check out quickly via tv menu to avoid check out lines. My only gripe was the lack of staff at the pool. While the pool is not huge, there was only one server for all the food orders and two servers for beverages. There are also several fast food restaurants in the hotel that actually serve good food like New York Pizza, Sandwiches etc. We also ate at the Irish Pub in the hotel and had a good meal for the price. There are lots of options in the hotel and it is also convenient to many of the hotels like the MGM, Monte Carlo and Tropicana. Overall it was a nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great price, very decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: goldengoddess_76
Reviews.Content: I was hesitant to stay at this hotel because there is usually a college crowed of young twenty somethings. It was quite nice and the crowds varied. It was very affordable. Had great restaurants and service. The room was very nice, bathroom was roomy. Easy to get to other hotels. Would definitely stay at this hotel again due to he great price and cleanliness.

Reviews.Title: “Not for Families - Bait and Switch Price”
Reviews.Author: Jaswin
Reviews.Content: They advertise a great rate on one of the well-known travel sites, BUT they hide the face that they charge $30 extra per night PER NIGHT / PER CHILD. Are we suppose to book an extra room for children under 10... in Las Vegas of all places? My little town shoes are never setting foot in this place.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay!”
Reviews.Author: BURGESS-IN-VA
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the New York, New York. We have no complaints at all. (Make sure you stay in a Park Avenue room. These rooms were renovated and are extremely nice.) The staff is very accommodating and friendly. It is a great location. It is a great value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for exploring South Strip”
Reviews.Author: upnorth98
Reviews.Content: We arrived at 12:45 PM and saw we could check-in at 1 PM but with an extra fee. So we grabbed lunch at Broadway Burgers and then checked in. It wasn't 3 PM yet, but the 'fee' sign was no longer up. We asked if we could get a complimentary upgrade, and were upgraded from a standard room to a standard room with a strip view. It was a $15/night per room value. We were given rooms on the 28th floor. Our room was in the tower with the pink windows and looked at the airport and Tropicana. The pillows were great and the bed was fine. Sheet weren't luxurious by any means, but they did stay put. The bathroom was adequate and the amenities were fine. The pool closed at 7 PM which blows my mind. It was 116 degrees outside at 7 PM -- why not stay open when so many people were in the pool trying to stay cool. I just don't understand it! Check-out was a breeze on the phone, and I went to the front desk to get a copy of my receipt without a problem. The rate was good, the room was good -- just the place to rest your head!

Reviews.Title: “Bland.”
Reviews.Author: regina_98227
Reviews.Content: Rooms need updating. Ethernet cable didn't work. Average low end hotel room. Way overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel and great deal”
Reviews.Author: fuertea
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with another person from july 18th- 21st and I must say it exceeded my expectations. I read several reviews that bashed this hotel and saw many people complained about its location and the pool and what not...but this is VEGAS. This hotel did its job and more. The rooms were all upgraded with modern finishes and were furnished very well. This hotel does a great job of replicating new york city. The restaurant, American, though it had a cool theme and design, was disappointing. The food was blah, nothing to be excited about, but the prices were fantastic for Vegas. The locaton is a bit south but everything is still attainable and its not as far as Mandalay Bay. The customer service was fantastic, everyone is there for the customer which is refreshing. Everything was very clean and maintained and the employees seem to know what needs to be done to assist in their guests vacation pleasure. The pool is small yes but my friend and I never had problems getting a beach chair and we went everyday around noon-1. I would say the pool could be deeper but lets face it, most people dont "swim" hungover. Just a nice oasis to get some hydration into your skin after 20 beers the night before. This hotel hit its mark, 5 out of 5 stars and two thumbs up. Everything is reasonably priced, staff is great and the casino is very well organized. Definetely will be staying here again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Would not re-book”
Reviews.Author: tortitabby
Reviews.Content: We didn't like staying here. Room while clean, was dark, with a very small window and felt small. Ammenities were poor. The pool did not have great sun exposure and I didn't like the roller coaster going by so close. However, the location is decent, near the heart of the strip.

Reviews.Title: “"GREAT TIME,AWESOME SERVICE AND STAFF"”
Reviews.Author: coco7272
Reviews.Content: My Wife And I As Well As Another Couple Visited In March 2011. Our Third Time At NYNY And Our First Time In A Spa Suite. Quite A Pleasant Surprise. Check-In Was A Breeze And The Room Rocked. As Usual We Had AN AWESOME TIME! We Are Returning In The Fall. A Special Thanks To Our Host Johnny Kincaid For All His Extra Care And Effort. He Really Deserves A "Pat On The Back" From Management For A Job Well Done.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel but beware of using phone in room”
Reviews.Author: carolinemc94
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was amazing. found the bars and restaurants in the hotel a bit expensive. We went to 9 fine irish men had 1 course which was quiet small and 2 beers each. cost was 75 dollars which i felt was quiet expensive. i won 200 dollars in the casino which was quickly taken back off me upon check out when i found that a phone call to dublin for 13 minutes cost me 93 dollars and another call for 7 minutes cost me 44 dollars. extorcian in my opinion. Room was a little dissapointing to, we booked the second best type of room which was very basic and also the sink was in the bedroom which i dont like at all.

Reviews.Title: “Making Use Of Our Players Card”
Reviews.Author: Conejojoe
Reviews.Content: We left the Conejo at 6:15 on July 17th and were merrily sipping champagne at Bellagio at 10:45. After brunch we checked into our Room at NYNY and were upgraded to a larger room on the 29th floor over looking Tropicana and Las Vegas Blvd. We took advantage of a players club offer that included free play, dining discounts and upgraded room from te standard for $29 a night plus the now becoming standard resort fee. The room was clean with a great Samsung LCD tv. Service was outstanding during our two day stay with the room cleaned up everyday before we returned from our mid-morning forays into the heat. We are frequent visitors to Vegas and long time members of the MGM Mirage players club. Stay at any of their properties and you can charge dining or events at their other properties to your room. Join the palyers club to receive special offers every month if you like their properities.

Reviews.Title: “Great place ... but”
Reviews.Author: drbross
Reviews.Content: Our check-in and out went very fast. The rooms were very nice and comfortable. The food was good as were the drinks, espcially the bloody mary's. Gambling was pretty good too...we even came back with a little more than what we went there with, which is a miracle in itself. The staff were very personable. The only draw back was the restaurants all closed way too early. WE wanted top catch a bite to eat after midnight and they were all closed...that part was very disappointing. The hotel does not provide a shuttle to and from the airport, but the taxi ride was ok. All in all we had a great time. Would we stay there again...maybe? Although I think that the next time we go to Vegas we might stay downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the NYNY!”
Reviews.Author: GregnJen123
Reviews.Content: After reading many tripadvisor reviews, we chose the New York New York. We had a wonderful stay. There was no wait for check in and the desk person was so helpful, explaining everything to us. Our room was not ready but was ready early at 1pm. Our room (Broadway Deluxe) was a good size, very clean and quiet. The bed was very hard making it difficult for me to sleep but I am used to a soft bed. Our room was cleaned daily and always looked great. We used the bell service and they were very quick and friendly. We also left our bags with them upon checkout and were helped very quickly. The hotel is very nice with lots of restaurants and fun things to do. The casino is not huge but has lots of fun slots and tables. I found that this casino felt less smoky than some of the others. We ate at the Italian restaurant and the Burger Bar and loved them both. The hotel is on the south end of the strip but very convenient to many other hotels and there is a monorail next door at the Monte Carlo that will bring you to other places for free. We would definitely stay at New York, New York again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Not so good hospitality”
Reviews.Author: Vaibhav237
Reviews.Content: NYNY is located at the best possible loctation at Vegas, just at the start of the main Strip, the rooms are large and can accomodate 4 people at 1 time, and reasonably priced. The Casino is one of the best in Vegas with variety of gambling options. However, the hospitality is just not upto the mark. The refused to check us in before 3pm even when the rooms were available. They asked for USD 30 for early check in or upgrade the room. The room service is very slow and they dont even have electric kettle in the room and charge $10 just for hot water. All in all a good hotel, but due to heavy rush, they are just not bothered about the convenience of the guests.

Reviews.Title: “Boys holiday - what a blast!”
Reviews.Author: CheckenT
Reviews.Content: Spent 5 days and nights at this hotel - incredible. Las Vegas is everything good and bad about USA. This hotel and casino go 24/7. A must is a night in the piano bar downstairs - one of the funniest and fun nights ever had. Also recommend the buffet breakfast /lunch at the Belagio - best value and quality on the strip. Stay away from "Sports" Bars - nothing good happens there!

Reviews.Title: “Live from Los Vegas”
Reviews.Author: letzteach
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the New York New York on the strip in Las Vegas. We asked for and received an upgrade at check-in to a larger suite, away from the roller coaster. So glad we did! It was a great room with a view and lots to do there. Wonderful restaurants and fantastic entertainment all in one spot. The only thing I didn't enjoy was the heavy smoke on the casino floor. We enjoyed the Zumanity Show, the sensual side of Cirque Du Soleil, also conveniently in our hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Had an awesome time without the kids!”
Reviews.Author: Metallicamom
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our first time. I enjoyed the rooms and the resturants. We went and say Zumanity right there in the building and had a wonderful time. Can't wait to visit again... If I can find a babysitter! LOL

Reviews.Title: “Did not disappoint.”
Reviews.Author: mwfloral
Reviews.Content: We received a comp suite and loved every minute of this trip. We were there for an invited slot tournament and were kind of restricted to stay in the hotel, but that was no problem. The cocktail service at the slot machines by "one/won" (seriously, her name is pronounced "WON", not sure if it is spelled that way).

Reviews.Title: “Second time in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: uncwmel10
Reviews.Content: The best thing about New York, New York is its location. It's one of the "cheaper", larger hotels that are REALLY on the strip. And... it is pretty much in the center. The lobby area, which is designed to look like old school new york city is really a site to see. It's a more modern approach to the hotels. It's a really cool place. We went to the Coyote Ugly bar (pretty fun and free admission before 9), Rox (don't waste your money), and a few good quick eats. The casino is nice, but they all are. We also rented a car and it was easy (and free) to park. The rooms, however, are okay. I stayed at Harrah's last time and it was a much nicer room. We stayed in the room that I think was named central park suite? There was absolutely nothing wrong with the room, but there wasn't anything special either. A minor note is that the shampoo/contioner/llotion/linens they give youare very poor quality. The beds weren't that comfortable either. My MAIN COMPLAINT is the hall leading up to our room. It winds around those buildings you see from the street and it's ridiculous. We thought we were going up/down the wrong elevator because it was such a long walk (and yes we had one of the last rooms). .. But this would be a real concern for older or drunk guests. Don't get me wrong, we enjoyed it, but I probably wouldn't stay there again. FYI there is a 10$/day hidden fee to stay in NY NY.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: pa_uthe
Reviews.Content: This place is now our hotel of choice. Stayed 3 nights in a strip view room. Housekeeping was great, check in fast and smooth. The fish and chip place was really good as was the cheesecake place. Will stay again and hopefully often.

Reviews.Title: “NICE PLACE-GREAT STAFF”
Reviews.Author: crazyfrper
Reviews.Content: We had a 3 day vacation and stayed at the New York New York as it was one of the hotels we couled choose from our package deal. Rooms were nice enough altho we did have a big fancy one, it was very adequate. All the staff we encountered were very helpful and accomodating. Loved having choices of all the small resturants and none were overcrowded. Enjoyed the entertainement such as the Dueling Pianos and The Irish Pub singers. Overall a great place to stay and would recommened.

Reviews.Title: “Cool hotel, service not so cool.”
Reviews.Author: corf717
Reviews.Content: This was my first time going to Las Vegas and while we were only going to be there for a few days, I thought that would be enough time to do everything I wanted. While this might have been slightly naive on my part, the fact that our first day was practically wasted waiting to check in certainly didn't help. Although this was a discouraging process that lasted hours, I still tried to keep an open mind. The location wasn't as bad as I thought it was going to be, not centrally located but not off the beaten path either. The rooms were nice and comfortable and having a strip view was definitely worth the small extra charge per day. So overall, New York New York was a fun and interesting place which included everything you needed to survive in Las Vegas: 24 hr/day restaurants, bars and clubs, a great casino, nice rooms, and a great decor that kept your eyes wandering. It seemed to be a good value but after the service we received with check-in, I think I would try another hotel next time I visit Sin City.

Reviews.Title: “We were pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: jadapa
Reviews.Content: From the check in process to the room, we were surprised as to how nice the hotel and staff were. We had a different impression of the resort when we only visited during the day, but staying there was nice and pleasing. The effect of being on the streets of New York was very realistic, and the little shops and eateries were great. Nice choice of restaurants, but missed the buffett as they did not have one.

Reviews.Title: “SUPERB!!!”
Reviews.Author: gillainanderson
Reviews.Content: Truly fantastic Hotel. lovely staff, and the roller-coaster is a must. nothing else to say, this hotel is a must. Highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Dusty048
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have been to Las Vegas several times in the last 17 years. This was the first time we stayed at the New York, New York. We stayed for 1 week. We absolutely loved it. Hotel staff were friendly and gave us a free upgraded room (I asked...). We wanted non-smoking, which they didn't have the first night, so they moved us the next day into a non-smoking room. The room was clean, basic, but nice. We enjoyed going down to the casino level and eating at the restaurants. Gonzolez Y Gonzolez is an excellent Mexican restaurant...they make fresh guacamole at your table...delicious! Also "Chin Chin" has amazing sushi and sweet and sour soup! MMMM.....Also try the pizza at the pizza place....very very yummy!! Didn't have alot of "luck" at the Casino, but I sure enjoyed playing the "Sex and the City" slot machine...very fun and played for hours. The location of this hotel is excellent! We would totally stay here again, but will probably try another hotel next time for variety. Not a big fan of the resort fees. 15 bucks per day. My husband used the fitness facility daily and we used the wi-fi which is included in the resort fee. Really, they should just include it in the price, and honestly, I think we might choose a hotel without resort fees next time. The fitness center should be included at all hotels...really, why not? I enjoyed a pedicure and a shrink wrap at the spa...very nice spa...steam room, sauna, hydrotherapy tubs...relaxing...prices kind of high, but that's a Vegas Hotel Spa. All in all, a great holiday! Oh, they also extended our check out time to noon instead of 11 am which was nice....no charge....the roller coaster is a BLAST!

Reviews.Title: “Fun Stay at NY NY”
Reviews.Author: Bulldozer22
Reviews.Content: My wife and I traveled here July 11th-14th. This was our second trip to LV this year and my second time at time at NY NY. We chose to stay at this hotel because of the vibe and the great selection of food. We also got a great deal through M life so we were able to stay in one of their Marque Suites. Check in was a little longer than expected. I think they were having some staffing issues because there was only one person checking people in and the people in front of the business center were helping out. But all things considered we didn’t have to wait that long and check in went smooth and the room was as requested. The walk to the elevators was not far and the room was exactly what we had expected. Good size with a nice spa tub and a view of the roller coaster/strip. We really enjoyed the room, the bed was very comfy and when we did sleep we were never bothered by any noise and I know the first night we were there the hotel was almost 100% occupied. We ate at several of the restaurants while we were there. The first night we ate at the sports bar (old ESPN Zone) and had great service and the food was good. It certainly served the purpose of grabbing something quick before we started our gambling and drinking. The next night we ate at Gallagher’s, which is fantastic. I do not know how they get their steaks to tender and tasty. If you want a great meal and great service stop by here. This was our second time eating here and it just gets better. Our third bigger meal during our trip was at the Nine Fine Irish Men pub. We sat at the bar and had a great service and really enjoyed our beers, fish and chips, and Sheppard’s pie. We also grabbed a few late night snacks at the pizza place buy the piano bar. Highly recommend the deep dish pizza and the garlic bread. Definitely helps soak up some of the booze before bedtime…LOL We hung out at Coyote Ugly one night. Both my wife and I enjoyed the show put on by the happy people on stage and on the dance floor  Also had a few drinks at the lobby bar. This place is seems to be a nice quite spot to hang out with good bartenders. Now the only bad thing I have to say is about the Center Bar. I sat down here and several of the bartenders walked past me and did not acknowledge me. I had to get up and move to the opposite side before anyone would ask me if I needed something. This is the only poor service at a VP bar I encountered during our entire trip. Gambling at the NY NY was disappointing. Didn’t seem like anyone was winning so we spent most of our time gambling elsewhere. The cocktail service there was also slow. The cocktail service didn’t bother me so much because I usually sit at the nearest VP bar and like I stated earlier I usually have great service except at the Center Bar. But it does annoy my wife who likes to play that slots but can’t get a drink or even a glass of water. Slow cocktail service seemed to be a common theme and we always tip $2-$3 per drink. The only decent cocktail service was at Mandalay Bay. Overall NY NY met our expectations and we would not hesitate to stay here again. Oh, and we had no problem with our maid service except we ran out of wash clothes one night and we called and they never brought any up. The next day a caught a maid in the hall and requested more, when we returned to our room later in the day we had lots of them. Let me know if you have any questions.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel, casino and location”
Reviews.Author: vegasvisit
Reviews.Content: Stayed at NYNY for three days in July and loved everything about it. Check-in was speedy, very pleasant receptionist, elevators close to registration desk. The room was very clean and spacious. No need to upgrade this room was perfect. The casino is a bit smaller than others but it has a very nice vibe. Lots of restaurants and all of the employees seemed very helpful. Some reviewers have mentioned that the pool is small. I never saw it when it was full and there is a ton of lounge chairs. Would definitely stay at NYNY again.... no complaints at all.

Reviews.Title: “Good Locaction, Good Hotel & Fantastic Irish Pub!”
Reviews.Author: Monique02
Reviews.Content: We stayed for the second time in New York New York and loved it all over again. We stayed here for 2 nights in a Park Avenue room. It was on the 27th floor and faced MGM, Tropicana, Excalibur and ofcourse The Rollercoaster! The rooms are quite spacious and very clean. The bathroom is fully stocked and very nice. The room is also very quiet, which is very, very nice as in Vegas people are coming and going at all hours of the day. The hotel has numerous restaurants. For breakfast we went to Il Fornaio (not the restaurant, but the bakery). They have delicious orange juice, freshly baked croissants, great pastries, good coffee and so on. A very good way to start your day :-) For dinner we went to The Irish Pub, the Nine Fine Irish Men, and it is our favourite! Meals are good and the beer is even better! Next time when we are in Las Vegas, we will defenitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Fun and good location”
Reviews.Author: SimplyGirlie
Reviews.Content: Booked into the room with 4 friends, good for the location and very hand it connects to the other hotels, has good food venues all night long. rooms are on the older side but still very nice and clean. check in was easy and hasslefree

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!!!”
Reviews.Author: itzchristined
Reviews.Content: We booked our room thru the MLife Players Club so we pretty much got a good deal on our 5 days 4 nights stay and when I say good deal, I REALLY MEAN GOOD DEAL. I love the hotel, the atmosphere and the vibe. The room was very clean, we stayed on the 33rd floor and had a great view of the MGM Grand, Tropicana and Excalibur, housekeeping was awesome, room service was fast and efficient. The staff was helpful, check in was smooth. We ate at Nathans for a quick bite, their chili cheese fries are so delish... We ate at CHIN CHIN, the staff was great and food was great! Over all I loved my stay here and will stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Easy to Navigate and affordable”
Reviews.Author: tjmedic
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd stay at the New York New York, we chose this casino and hotel again because of the friendly nature and ease of navigation around the facility. We traveled with 3 teenagers who loved the rollercoaster and arcade provided at the Hotel. The food was great and offered multiple cuisines to choose from. It is in a great location for visiting other Casinos and shows there is a crosswalk to the MGM Grand and to the Excalibur where you can catch a (FREE) tram to Mandalay Bay and the Luxor and can take it back as well. I would reccommend this hotel to anyone the rooms were nice and cleaned daily, the staff was friendly and accommodating to our requests.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: dave_chrisjohnson
Reviews.Content: had a lovely room over looking strip . really helpfull staff lovely clean hotel . breakfast in the america was really good value for money .

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, fun hotel”
Reviews.Author: Debs280684
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week for my partners 30th birthday trip to Vegas!! We loved the hotel!!! We have stayed in several luxury hotels before but wanted something typically "Vegas like" so wanted a theme hotel that was lots of fun. Hotel did not dissapoint at all. Was definetly our favourite hotel for the themed element and also the buzzing vibe inside the hotel. The Greenwich cafe is fantastic for breakfast with lots of choice and great value, Il Fornaio is a nice italian restaurant which is ideal if you want a late evening meal!! (share a starter there huge!). Never had any trouble at all getting drinks whilst gambline, always fast and friendly service. No long queue at check in and room was ready when we arrived at around 12:30 lunchtime! Room was large with a great bed and tv and very clean. Never heard any noise at all from rollercoaster (it stops running at 11pm anyway) Location is fantastic, for us we would always want to stay down the southern end as its just much nicer! Would agree with the comments about the pool - we were so busy at it was our first trip to Vegas that we didnt want to use the pool, however if you want a good pool, and wehn we go back we probarbly would stay somewhere else just because it was way too small and crowded. Fantastic hotel, no problems at all, would definetly recoomend to people that want a good time in a gret atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “great time great hotel”
Reviews.Author: julieallison
Reviews.Content: The New York New York Las Vagas good location on the strp. Rooms clean and comfortable you have to pay extra for a view. The check in quick and easy. plenty of good restaurants you have to try the pizzas huge and value for money. There are some good bars in the hotel but you have to pay to get in after a certain time which I felt was a bit of a rip off has we where staying at the hotel. The pool on the small size for the amount of guests staying at the hotel. We did a Helicopter ride over the grand canyon worth doing we went with Adventure Photo Tours our guide Tim had good knowladge of the area and made the long trip to the canyon interesting. We also went on the coast trip to LA disappointed Santa Monica Beach needed a face lift a bit tatty Hollywood Blvd didn't fair any better but glad we went just for the experience. The guides on the trip expect a tip and tell you has you board the bus which is a bit of a put off as they go on to tell you about there family and how your tip will help maintain there life style. All in all enjoyed Las Vagas and the New York New York better then most on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Not Worth”
Reviews.Author: LaxiiDubai
Reviews.Content: Room as such is okay, but it takes long to reach that place. No special entrance from the reception desk to the hotel room; all you have to do is walk through the Casino filled with smoke and booze. With kids it is difficult. There was no boilers in the room for making coffee and Strbucks in the hotel closes at 10 PM I believe; opens only at 6 AM. So if you want a coffee, walk across the road to a food court !! Though we stayed in 14th florr (non smoking), the carpet and the rooms were stinking of nicotine. It was okay as a sleeping place, nothing more.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Good hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Lira99
Reviews.Content: I arrived on 4th of July at 7pm and check in was quick. I stayed in room 739 and it was clean and spacious. I loved the location since it is at the begining of the strip which made walking around easily. The circ o soleil Zumanity show is in the hotel and its A+. The roller coaster is cool. I would stay there again

Reviews.Title: “It's okay”
Reviews.Author: myfavouritescar
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from the 7-10th of July 2011. It was okay. Our room still wasn't ready at 3pm and the check in process was quite long including a lot of upselling for us to upgrade to a more expensive room. The room itself was very spacious and comfortable although it took a good 5 minutes to reach it through a series of winding corridors once getting off the elevator on our floor. We found a used towel in our room upon check in and contacted the front desk who told us it must have been missed, no apology, nothing. I wasn't impressed with having to pay the resort fee for the amount/quality of amenities that we got in return. Went to the business center to find that using the internet there would incur a large charge (larger than anywhere else we stayed). Overall I found the experience to be okay, not bad but not really good either. I would not return. For the price we paid I feel we could have stayed elsewhere and had a better experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay, Great Place”
Reviews.Author: WVClairenmaddy
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at the NY, Ny during our recent vacation July 10-14. My daughter wanted to stay here because we celebrated her 10th birthday in Vegas. A few things, the location is great. The check in process, not so good. We stayed at the Luxor, Venetian and Mirage during our 10 day trip and walked up, checked in, and actually rec'd an upgrade on our rooms at the Luxor and Venetian at no extra charge. The check in at NY NY is very slow. The girl that checked us in was terrible, didn't know what she was doing and room still wasn't ready at 3 PM! Our rooms were ready before 3 at the other places.
