Now I do realize that hotels are full and they sometimes run behind but we had tickets to an early show at 7 and needed to get our luggage, get unpacked and ready for our evening. After a few phone calls we were able to get into the room. We had a Broaday Premium room with Strip view-could see the MGM and the roller coaster out of window. Our room was big and very spacious. We dined at the America restaurant downstairs several times and it was very good. Overall, this resort is kid friendly with an arcade and the roller coaster. The cost to ride is $14 so get an all day Scream pass if you want to ride multiple times like my kids did. I think we did it 10 times!! The resort fee was $15, I didn't have a resort fee at the other properties. We never picked up a paper daily but we did use the internet. Overall, great stay and nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a family to visit Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Theo1965
Reviews.Content: For Las Vegas probably one of the best places to stay, when you travel with kids. Not to fancy, not to common, just right in between. With a nice pool and of course the roller coaster for the kids. And enough entertainment and bars and restaurants to help you through the day. When you book via their website you are asked for how many people you book, but that is no guarantee you get a room suitable for that number of people. We thought we booked a room for four people, but found out it was a room for two. But that was no problem at all. They immediately booked us over to an other room, the bell boy took care of our luggage and they didn't charge us the price-difference between the rooms. Super! Also everything else was great, neat and nice. The casino wasn't to big and busy, and there was lots of entertainment. When we go back to Las Vegas with the family, we would surely stay here again. It is also right at the beginning of the Strip, which makes it a good place to start your exploration tour through Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Vegas Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Travelling_Carlos
Reviews.Content: I really like the New York, New York hotel, location wise I found it very central and close to the centre of the strip. The rooms had recently been refurbished (in our section) and I thought they were nicely decorated too. Whenever I go to Vegas I find it hard to comment too much on the hotel room as you don’t really tend to spend much time in it. The lobby area is really cool and the exterior famously decorated, one thing that I did think was very useful about this hotel is that behind MGM Grand it’s the second drop off hotel from the airport shuttle, this is very useful after a long flight as the strip is unexpectedly long. Overall I think this is a great mid-range hotel, highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Safe, clean, and priced right.”
Reviews.Author: Ecolearner
Reviews.Content: My husband and I felt like we got a lot for our money at New York New York. We stayed five days and found the hotel room to be quiet, clean, and spacious. We were especially pleased with the furnishings provided for us to stow our clothing. The bed was very comfortable and welcoming after long days around town. We thought the location was perfect for our agenda since we were seeing a shows directly across the street at the MGM Grand (directly accessible via over-street walkway) and at the Cosmopolitan. We rented a car one day, making arrangements right inside the hotel and accessing the car in the attached parking area. We highly recommend stopping in the "Nine Fine Irishmen" for live music. We would definitely stay in this hotel again. At this time there is a $15/day resort fee that includes Internet access. We left our laptop out on the table every day with no problem. Another plus: we checked in to our return flight and printed our boarding passes in the room provided next to the registration area.

Reviews.Title: “We went, we stayed, we baked!”
Reviews.Author: Placestogo7
Reviews.Content: The service was friendly and welcoming. Front desk staff were friendly and accommodating. Don't forget your coupon book. The room we stayed in was on the 9th Floor and I must say the rooms are well kept and CLEAN. Any staff we encountered were pleasant and very helpful with any questions we had. The location was central to everything and convenient for access to the other hotels beside, in front and diagonal to it. Bus stops were close by and the bus ticket dispenser was across the street. Gallagher restaurant was superb! The salmon I had melted in your mouth and the steak my husband ate, he said was "the BEST he had ever had". We ate breakfast at the italian restaurant, 4 of the 5 days we were there and each time we loved it. Servers there are well trained. Enjoyed a quick breakfast sandwich at the bakery the morning we arrived. We did eat once for breakfast at the Chin Chin but we would never return again, buffet style and not very much to choose from. I would definitely stay here again! Thank you Vegas for the good time we had! =-)

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: AussieTravelAddict8
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at the New York New York and it was perfect. Our room was more than big enough and had obviously been re-fitted fairly recently and our bed was extremely comfy! We didn't have the buffet brekky but instead had a bagle and coffee each morning from the Greenwich Cafe down in the casino which is a great area, set up to replicate NY City. Location of the hotel is really good, close to other big hotels/casinos like MGM & Luxor. We would have no hesitations recommending this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Cool Hotel But The Staff Are Terrible!”
Reviews.Author: Day_tripper1234
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel at just before 9pm on the 4th of july with plenty of time to see the firework show at 9:30 but the hotel staff had other plans for us. There was a short que for check in which went down fast but when we got to the desk the women took 45 minutes to check us in so we missed the fireworks which was really disappointing! she was very rude and i asked her four questions directly about the hotel and the buffet and she completly ignored me on all these occasions. This was the worst member of staff i have ever come across and she had an attitude problem for no reason. When we finally getting to our room we found the room was massive with plenty of space! and the bathroom was a decent size too which was great. The room was clean and light with a tv, iron and ironing board. The beds werent very comfy and the AC was terrible as it wasnt cold enough and the room was always hot! The hotel itself is really cool with a casino, arcade, shops and restaurants all inside the building! so there was always something to do! On the last night of our stay we were woken up around 1am by a detective knocking on our door asking us if we'd seen an incident around noon the same day in the elevators near our room, but we hadnt seen or heard anything, but judging by the amount of police and security presence whatever had happened must of been fatal which is not a good thing to happen! Be advised that the hotel charges $15 a day for use of the internet and pool but it works out around $17 with tax and even if you dont use the pool or internet they're gonna charge you anyway so be aware! all in all they need to re-evaluate there customer services and maybe we'd stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Okay, but probably won't go back.”
Reviews.Author: teamtinkerbell
Reviews.Content: The rooms look pretty rough. We were in room 826. The lamp in our room had a busted lamp shade and a chunk missing out of the base. The room was very clean but just looked worn. The hallway carpet needed to be stretched and was loose enough to almost trip over in places. I know they are going for an Art Deco look, but it just looks cheap instead. On the positive, staff was very nice and we had some amazing steak at Gallagher's on the main floor. This place seems to cater more towards families because there were kids everywhere. I know all casinos allow smoking on the floors, but I would be willing to pay decent money for one that at least had a non smoking section to play in. Over all, staff was very nice, but better looking places are available for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Too many little things went wrong and we won't be back.”
Reviews.Author: dcmrkelly
Reviews.Content: In the first room we stayed in, the air conditioner just would not cool it. Maintenance promptly responded and replaced the fan, which did nothing. So, we sweated it out the first night and changed rooms the next day. The temperature in that room was fine. Another problem we had occur (more than once) was that our room keys (newly issued) did not work on at least 4 or 5 occasions. We had enough of going back and forth to the front desk so we had security come and let us in, but not before we sweated our heads off in the halls. The temperature in that hotel varied from floor to floor and hour to hour. We were disappointed there was no buffet, but did have a couple of good meals at the steak house and burger bar. Not impressed with the fact that minors were allowed to roam the casino floor. Plus, even if you were a guest at the hotel, you had to pay $20 to ride the rollercoaster. Staff was polite, but did not acknowledge that we had experienced numerous problems while there. They could have offered some vouchers to comp part of the room or something, anything, and we probably would not have taken it. It is just the principle of the matter that they did not document or care enough about all the problems we had to acknowledge them in some way. We will not recommend to our friends or anyone else for that matter.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and Clean, Good Value”
Reviews.Author: zerokarma
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in late June as sort of summer getaway/be-lated birthday present. When looking for a place to stay it was mainly between NYNY, Monte Carlo, Paris and Planet Hollywood. We ended up choosing NYNY because at the time they had a really good Summer sale and we got the Spa suite for an extremely good price plus some other freebies, overall the room deal was better than the other places so we went with it. The Spa suite we had was very clean and updated looking, room air was a little stale but did not smell of smoke. Most if not all of the Spa suites are corner rooms I believe, the view was fairly decent and quite, you do not hear any noise from the rollercoaster. Keep in mind the rollarcoaster goes around the entire resort so it will be seen from most every room. The Spa/hot tub worked great and was nice to relax in. The maid service was excellent while we were there. The NYNY hotel in general is very clean, the ceiling in the casino area is high so it doesn't feel as claustrophobic as other hotels, feels more open in there which is nice. The restaurants are sort of expensive in there, but we did have breakfast every day there at the italian place as we had a 2-for-1 deal. The pool area is small and pretty sub-par compared to other hotels in Vegas, if a pool is important to you I would stay elsewhere. Overall I had a pleasant experience with NYNY however next time I would probably try staying at a different place not because there was anything wrong with the place but rather I think next time I want to be further up the strip near the Bellagio/Paris area. For the money though NYNY was an excellent deal and we enjoyed our time there. The hotel staff were always helpful and even the rental car people there helped us find a car when they had none left which was above and beyond I think.

Reviews.Title: “A LAST MINUTE DETOUR FROM A CROSS COUNTRY ROADTRIP”
Reviews.Author: phillyshopgirl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were traveling from Arizona to Denver on a cross country trip and decided to stop in Las Vegas for 2 days/ 1 night. We booked our room through hotwire and were skeptical. let me tell you what a great time we had! Was the line to checkin long,absolutely! But the front desk upgraded our room to a suite w/o being asked! We had a jacuzzi in our room next to the king size bed! The room was absolutely beautiful! Very modern, art deco. The restaurants were open late, free parking for guests, beautiful pool and a coyote ugly bar! I wanted to stay longer. I know everyone wants to stay @ the Bellagio & Wynn, but do yourself a favor and stay here! Use the extra $$ and buy yourself a CHANEL bag @ Fashion Show Mall :)

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel great room - Strip View!”
Reviews.Author: Sweet412
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a little bit confusing with the many entrances but after a few times you will know your way. We got a free upgrade of a room with a strip view the view was amazing. The room was contemporary and very nice with a flat screen tv. We didnt try any food at the hotel just had starbucks a few times. We liked the hotel and its proximity to the other hotels. We also got a discount for KA and david cooperfield for staying at this hotel 30% off. Regarding the resort fee it is $15 a night but most las vegas hotels have a resort fee and even more expensive than this hotel, so we didnt mind it. Room service was great, they would call us toward the end of the day if we had a do not disturb sign to make sure if we needed room service. The roller coaster sound wasnt as bad as another review just request to have a room closer to the elevator, you will hardly hear the sound. plus its better closer to the elevator so you dont have to walk too long to get to it. We didnt hear anyone else in the other rooms. Defintely recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting”
Reviews.Author: jetta8puma
Reviews.Content: Dirty is the one word to describe this hotel. The rooms look designed to be taken apart and reassembled to cover up crime scenes. Walking through the hallway to our room we could hear people having sex in other rooms. While waiting for my husband outside a restroom in the casino, a man approached me from behind and felt me up from thighs to chest and ran away. Drinks were too expensive. Hotel design was hard to navigate.

Reviews.Title: “A brilliant base for exploring Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: Lisa_Lollipop
Reviews.Content: As a first timer in Vegas I found New York New York to be a brlliant base to explore everything that this amazing city has to offer. The hotel is big but not too daunting and we found our way around very quickly. It has a great range of food and drink outlets and we loved the New York style pizzaria for grabbing a quick bite! The rooms were of a very high standard and despite the hustle and bustle of the place we slept soundly every night! The rollercoaster is a great touch and a must for all visitors to the hotel... just try to keep your eyes open as the view is spectacular! Despite the many many hotels on offer in Vegas I would return to New York New York next time... it has everything!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel fine but pool an after thought!”
Reviews.Author: Backpackernomore
Reviews.Content: I have visited Vegas many times and this was my second time at NYNY, mainly due to an amazing price, including free daily buffet. We stayed in an upgraded room and it was of a good standard and a surprise bonus was we had a strip view. We had a problem with the in room safe when we arrived but this was fixed very promptly. The few staff we did encounter were always polite and courteous. Vegas is a party place and at this time of year over at 110+ degrees it would have been nice to have used the pool. However the pool here as others have said is very basic and very small. Every time we tried to use it, it was full and not that surprising as the hotel may have 2023 guest rooms but only a 100 or so sunbeds. I normally go to Vegas in the winter so I never looked at the pools. Every pool in Vegas does play loud pumping music (we had lunch outside by the Monte Carlo pool and it was very loud) so its never a place to read and listen to your Ipod, however it would have been nice to at least give it a try and cool off. I would stay here again but not in summer as the pool is completely inadequate for such a large hotel

Reviews.Title: “For the money a very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: rattlin
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a week in June in a Park Avenue room. Was given a room on the 36th floor and had a view of Tropicana, Excalibur and the airport (which I found interesting watching planes take off and land - how sad). No complaints on the room - was clean - everything worked. Couldn't hear the roller coaster (helicopters yes) and no bed bugs lol. The maid also did an excellent job cleaning every day never bothered me even though I kept strange hours. In room internet was okay but only item in $15 resort fee that I used. Found hotel to be lively, lots of bars, didn't gamble here but thought casino was of a good size though. Also easy to find way around. Ate in a few of restaurants and no complaints. In fact found the Steak and Eggs in America to be a daily meal for breakfast. In terms of location it is exactly where it says. South strip. 20 minute walk though and you are centre so no problems. This is why I imagine I got such a good deal for the hotel. Only complaints would be the hassle from pros whenever I drank in the bars on the casino floor (and a few of them had hygiene problems) but I imagine this to be common in other hotels too. Also the $15 resort fee is a bit strong. Would recommend and would stay in again (although next time will go centre strip I think)

Reviews.Title: “Bad experience at NY NY”
Reviews.Author: L-R-Chase
Reviews.Content: My family booked a vacation through Southwest Vacations to stay at NY NY. Arrived on 6/26 and the problems started. At check in I was informed that I had to pay an extra $15 per room (2 rooms) per day for a "resort fee". This resort fee allows me to use the pool and their high speed internet and some other "amenities". So this cost me an extra $16.80 per day for four days (times 2 rooms) for a grand total of $134.40. The pool was ok, but the "high speed" internet was pathetic. If you are planning on doing some remote office work during your stay, plan on doing a lot of waiting. The extra $134.40 resort fee surprise you will get at check-in is the kind of shady practice you expect from a low end car dealership. The second problem is two persons per room gets a free breakfast or lunch buffet each day. The first morning my entire family went to the breakfast buffet at Chin Chin's. They have a big sign that exclaims "BREAKFAST BUFFET". But guess what, this particular breakfast buffet isn't eligible for the free breakfast. You have to walk across the street over to MGM or one of their other properties to get a free buffet. So back to Chin Chin's - the breakfast buffet at this restaurant is terrible. They use mirrors to make it look larger than it is, but it consists of some eggs, breakfast meat and some dried out pastries. Needless to say, we walked over to the MGM for the breakfast buffet the remainder of the vacation. So Chin Chin's hideous buffet cost me $69.95 ($14 per person) because I evidently missed some fine print on some document they gave me at check in. My third complaint is the casino itself. The slot machines at NY NY are so tight that you would be better off using your money for toilet paper. If you stay here, take a cab, the bus or high-speed monorail and head north. You will pay for transportation, but you will be money ahead. And if you want a "free" drink, plan or waiting a long time at NY NY. The cocktail waitresses are few and far between. The closer to downtown you go, you will actually have a chance to win some money and get a few free drinks. The first day, I ordered two domestic beers at the circular bar at NY NY and the tab was $14. Ridculous. The next problem is NY NY has a roller coaster wrapping around the hotel. So all night long you hear people screaming riding this thing. It is hard to enjoy LV and the surrounding attractions when you can't get any sleep because of people screaming on a roller coaster. So to wrap up, while checking out I stated my dissatisfaction with the charge for the Chin Chin's restaurant. I informed the person conducting the check-out process that nobody in my family were aware this "restaurant" wasn't included in the free buffet. So she takes out an adjustment form and lays it on the counter, and then proceeds to talk to what appeared to be a manager. She comes back and tells me again that Chin Chin's isn't eligible for the free breakfast buffet. I guess that manager didn't think that waiving a retail charge of $70 (about $5 wholesale) was the right thing to do.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel to experience 'The Strip'”
Reviews.Author: TravelTheRock
Reviews.Content: I had a 3 night stay en route to the east coast to experience The Strip. The hotel is large and overwhelming but check-in is fast and friendly. I had a 'Broadway deluxe' room with a view of the strip but upon arriving in my room it didn't overlook the strip and I contacted Reception and was immediately shifted. NOTE - Do not pay the difference for a 'Strip view' room as the hotel orientation does not allow a full strip view. It only has a mild oblique view and not worth the price difference. The room is spotless, spacious and bathroom well set out. The gym, pool, restaurants, shops and concierge are very good and the location is ideal for hitting the strip and attractions is perfect. All I would expect and hope for in a 4 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good property, a bit far down the South end...”
Reviews.Author: Osdanuwati
Reviews.Content: Pretty nice property, which has been undergoing a steady spate of small changes to the casino and trimmings. Good sized and fairly well-appointed rooms. Not as convenient to the rest of the Strip as say... Planet Hollywood, Bellagio, Paris, City Center, but a pretty good value because of it.

Reviews.Title: “Great party scene”
Reviews.Author: gastrotraveling
Reviews.Content: New York New York Hotel on the Vegas strip is designed to showcase some of the best that the real NYC has to offer. It’s readily apparent outside with replicas of the Empire State building, a mini Brooklyn Bridge and once inside, a lobby is festooned with art deco metal trim and colorful murals fashioned after classic street life. Shops and restaurants reside in blocks that look as if they were airlifted from somewhere in Greenwich Village and plunked down inside a gigantic mall/casino/night spot. And then there’s Vinny, the property’s bombastic ambassador who’s quick to point out, “New York New York may not be a good match for those requiring the utmost in pampering or the highest sheet thread count on the strip. But if you’re looking for a bartender who remembers your name and a gigantic party scene once shows like the provocative Cirque Zumanity let out, then this is the place.”

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: uscmike1
Reviews.Content: I went with a friend to Vegas and had a WONDERFUL time! New York New York has an excellent location right on the strip. It is convenient because it is right across the street from MGM Grand, Excalibur, Luxor, and others. It is a short walk to Mandalay Bay, the Bellagio, and many many others. The hotel has a WONDERFUL casino, multiple night clubs, good food, and top notch service- even a roller coaster!!! I enjoyed my once in a lifetime trip to Vegas and I feel like I got the best value available by staying in New York New York and visiting all the other places. The rooms at NY-NY were just as nice as the overpriced 5 star hotels and convenient to any other place I wanted to visit. In fact, I'd say that NY-NY had a better atmosphere and was just as clean and fun as any other place I visited while at Vegas. I hope this helps! Enjoy your travels!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: heltsley
Reviews.Content: This is a nice place to stay on the Vegas Strip and the staff was very accomodating. We have stayed here several times, because we like this area of the strip and it is easy to get to several casinos in the area. The standard rooms are just that standard, but they are clean and nice enough. The suites are nice though if you are looking for a larger room. We also enjoy eating at Nine Fine Irishmen restaurant and really like snacking on the fresh homemade pretzels and dipped apples at the upper level store.

Reviews.Title: “Fun decor”
Reviews.Author: luvstotravel321
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a few nights during a Las Vegas vacation. I loved the decor, the hotel did a great job recreating NY. The pool wasn't anything special and our room was modern but also on the basic side. If you can get a good deal, I'd recommend staying here. They do have a great variety of restaurants in the hotel and it's in a great location if you want to wonder around the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay!”
Reviews.Author: jensen14
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a trip with another couple in May 2011. We stayed in the skyline room (bottom of the line), but had a fantastic view of the strip! The room itself wasn't bad at all. It reminded me of a Hampton Inn (not luxurious by any means, but it got the job done). It was relatively clean, save the three really long strands of black hair in the bathroom (but that was cleaned up after the first time the cleaning crew came around). The casino itself seemed more smokey than most, but it wasn't anything that really got to me (and I typically can't stand much smoke). We ate breakfast at America which was really good (basic diner food, but hot and fresh). We also grabbed pizza at the New York Pizzeria a couple nights when we came back after drinking entirely too much. We thought it was a perfect (but like I said, we had been drinking, so I wouldn't want to promise anything). One morning we checked out the arcade upstairs which wasn't anything impressive, but I actually lost my wedding ring in the skeeball machine, and the people working there were very quick to help! New York New York's pool isn't anything to be wowed by, but it's ok. I would say to avoid the gift shop at all costs, as the prices are laughable. I thought the location of our hotel was pretty decent. We did end up taking a cab any time we wanted to go to the North End of the Strip, but other than that we were able to walk around with ease. I'm not sure if we'll be back to Las Vegas anytime soon, but I wouldn't hesitate to stay at New York New York again if the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “Started rocky ended great”
Reviews.Author: wheelersmom
Reviews.Content: Asked for upgrade and strip side when we checked in. Charged us an extra 15.00 per day for "resort" fee and another 15.00 per day for strip side view.Pre- charged our debit card 400.00 because we didn't have a credit card. The room was AWFUL. It was dirty and smelled and looked like it had not been cleaned since the last people left. Called and complained and they moved us around the corner on the same floor. Still cheesey bedspread but quite a bit larger. Better view as well. Hotel had a lot to offer except free buffet as promised. Had to walk across the street to eat at the MGM and it was terrible! Asked for late check out and they were pretty nice about it gave us 3 more hours for 30.00. All in all would not stay there again. Too much hassle and it really wasn't worth it.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay! Lots to do in the hotel itself, rooms are nice.”
Reviews.Author: ScottJM
Reviews.Content: I'd stay here again - the deal we got was great and the hotel room was nice, a tiny bit tired but still clean and furnished well. The main attraction for this hotel has got to be the amount of stuff there is inside to do, many casual restaurants and an arcade/rollercoaster for kids. A great choice in Las Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: whan
Reviews.Content: We loved this resort. The theme is done so well. We had a wonderful stay. Room was clean , nice sized & comfortable. The only thing I had missed was that I like to have a coffee pot in my room. These rooms do not have them. I'm not sure if the hotel would've provided them had we asked or not. We had a nice view from our room also. We went into a lot of other resorts but liked the theme and ambiance of the New York New York the best.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is ok, food is pretty good, pool is nothing special”
Reviews.Author: Jules72873
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with some girlfriends. The hotel is ok overall...check in was pretty quick, rooms are decent, lots to do and places to eat. Had pretty good luck on the slots. We had stayed at Mandalay Bay before coming to this hotel. If the pool at Mandalay Bay is a 10, the pool at NY NY would be a 5. If you don't care about the pool, you'll be fine with this place. If you do, don't stay here.

Reviews.Title: “awesome holiday”
Reviews.Author: rikkiandleah
Reviews.Content: Me and my friend stayed here for my 30th birthday weekend and loved it! My 30th birthday was the same day as the superbowl so it was a great weekend fantastic atmosphere and buzz to the hotel. Very friendly casino staff and I won a little! Room was great as was the service for our stay. The coaster was fun too highly recomended!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Peri
Reviews.Content: Stayed at The NYNY This weekend and had a great time. Pulled up for Valet parking and the Valet Gentleman was very nice and professional, went to check in and it took less that 10 minutes to have our room. The woman at check in gave us a room close to the elevator as requested. The room was normal size with a flat screen TV, blow dryer, and soaps and shampoos available. I did not hear any noise from any other guests while in the room. The Location of NYNY is great, it is easy access to many of the other casinos and has a tram just across the walkway at Excalibur to go to many other casinos. I had a fear of check out on Sunday Morning with the mass of people leaving but checked out on the television and then we were able to get straight on the elevator, and were off the property in less than 10 minutes. Plus we did win some money at the Casino so it was a great weekend trip for us!

Reviews.Title: “very disappointed at check in.”
Reviews.Author: Aberdeenlassie
Reviews.Content: I arrived at 12pm on June 13th, 8 friends arrived at 1pm June 13th. I paid $20 US to get into my ready made up room when we arrived. My friends arrived an hour later and were told their rooms would be ready by 6pm...but if they wanted to pay the $20 the rooms would be ready !!!!! how does that work. A money grab ! So your first day is a wash out waiting for your room to be ready? We asked in March when we booked it on the phone if we could pre book 5 rooms in a row or same floor and told NO. We arrived and asked to put a hold on 4 rooms + mine for a hour till my family arrived and told NO....geeeee have fun and spend $ in our hotel...never again. !!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location on the strip but I wouldn't pay full price”
Reviews.Author: lrp124
Reviews.Content: We got our room on Priceline for $45/night for weekday nights, by bidding on a four star, south strip location. At check in we ended up upgrading our room for $15/night for a nicer room with a strip view. Also they charge a mandatory $15/day resort fee... so it actually ended up costing $75/night total. The accommodations were clean and well maintained but nothing special. We enjoyed the location on the strip, very easy to walk or get on a tram to many casinos. You can hear the people screaming on the roller coaster outside. I would prefer to stay somewhere with less outside noise next time. Ask the front desk for as many coupons as possible, we got one for 2-for-1 rides on the rollercoaster and discounts at most of the restaurants. We also paid $30 extra for a late check out at 4PM which was very helpful since our flight left so late that evening, I think $20 for 2PM is also an option.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel - great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: gayleen63
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in May 2011 and found the hotel clean and updated. The restaurants were great, especially the ''Fish and Chip' shop, good food and great prices. You could always grab a bite to eat or something to drink late at night in the 'America' restaurant, which served great steaks after 11.30pm. The casino is nice and clean and there is no smokey or cover up spray like other hotels. The rooms were nice and big, we had the Broadview Deluxe strip view room which overlooked the MGM, it was fantastic view. The hotel staff very friendly and always willing to assist us with anything we needed. We had no hassle checking in or out, it ran smoothly. The location was great too, I would recommend this hotel to anyone wishing to stay in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “We loved this place and would go back!”
Reviews.Author: peace97
Reviews.Content: The NY NY had great service, good food, free upgrade on our room with an excellent view and it was very clean and quiet! Ride the rollercoaster- they give you a 2 for one if you ask! We had a great time and would definately go back to this place or recommend it to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “great rooms!”
Reviews.Author: Kitje71
Reviews.Content: Nice clean hotel, with great rooms (had a big jacuzzi in the middle of the room). View on the rollercoaster.

Reviews.Title: “Nice But Overshadowed”
Reviews.Author: jol20
Reviews.Content: Came across an excellent deal on a JetBlue vacation package to Vegas and decided to give NY NY a try. I tend to go through Priceline for my hotel bookings, so it was nice to actually pick a place on my own for once. I am not too fussy about hotel accomodations, but I wanted to splurge a bit this time since it was Vegas and there are many great hotel resorts throughout the city. Check-in is probably the hardest thing to do when you are staying a Vegas hotel. The lines tend to be very long. NY NY is a good hotel, but not one with the best profile so the line was not too bad here. Checkout is super easy though. You can even checkout using the TV! I checked in at around noon so the room I wanted (king bed/non-smoking) was not available. Rather than wait for a room, I checked into a 2 queen bed/smoking Park Avenue Deluxe room for my first night. However, I was able to change over to my desired room on the following day. I just called reception to request the change. Once the new room is ready, you will get a message from them about where to move. No need to go downstairs to change your key card though. Just use your current card to enter the new room. I have to say that staff was very professional and handled my request with grace and patience. The rooms here are stylish. The marble tiles in the bathroom are classy. It really does have a New Yorker cosmopolitan vibe to them. The Park Ave rooms are quite spacey at 400 sq ft. and are located on a high floor. Because of that, you take a different elevator to get to your room than guests staying in a Skyline room. The room amenities are kind of basic though. Expect the usual of fragrant toiletries. But no coffeemakers or mini fridges. There is wi-fi access here and it is included as part of the $15 a night plus tax resort fee. That resort fee gets you a daily newspaper and access to the pool and gym. As for hotel attractons, the casino here is okay. The slots are kind of stingy. Knew I did not like Monopoly's Mr. Moneybags. Restaurant selection here appeals to a general audience and priced moderately. There are a quite a few cheap/affordable fast food options here too. And they have serval places here like Nathan's in which you can try NY food fare as well. Location is on the south end of the Strip. I would have liked to stayed closer to the middle so I did not have to walk so much. There is a free tram at the Monte Carlo next door that you can take to the Bellagio if you want to rest your feet a bit and the Monorail is across the street at MGM. Overall, I liked NY NY and enjoyed my stay. Though I think that I would stay a little closer to the middle of the Strip next time.

Reviews.Title: “Deluxe room with strip view? Yea right!”
Reviews.Author: lonliesoul
Reviews.Content: I booked this room when they had a 72 hour sale. Since I've never gotten a room with a strip view before I figured why not, the price is pretty decent and the kids could look out the window when they wanted to. When we checked in, I was so excited to show the Vegas strip to my 5 and 2 year old. I opened it and the view was not what I expected at all! They gave me a room with a view of the back of the Monte Carlo hotel, the beginning of the roller coaster ride, and the freeway. WTH?? I wanted to complain, but my kids were excited watching that coaster go up and then whirling away, so I just kept it. It was a BIG disappointment though. Needless to say I will not be booking at New York New York anymore.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms and atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: turnnburn
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay on our first trip to Vegas at the NYNY. The room was clean, quiet, and nice. Had a little trouble getting customer service to understand which credit card to bill the room to (reserved on one, billed to another). They still never did get it right, but that was our only hitch in our stay.

Reviews.Title: “One of my favorite hotels in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: alisha1980
Reviews.Content: My fiancee and I went to Vegas to celebrate our 3rd anniversary (almost a year ago now, sorry for the late review). We had both been to Vegas before but not together so, this was a great trip! I had found on my previous visits I always ended up around New York New York, so I thought it made sense to stay here. The room we got was unbelievable for the price, the view was amazing, the bed was a dream and we could walk everywhere. I would stay here again, no question.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, good value for the money”
Reviews.Author: bkl0irnnk
Reviews.Content: New York New York is a decent hotel. It's a little gimmicky, but maybe I just feel that way because I live in NJ. It's a good hotel for the money. Not in the best location on the strip as it's on one end, but there is a tram that leaves from MGM across the street. The breakfast at the cafe was decent. The pool isn't anything special, but we didn't spend any time at the pool. Most of our days were spent walking the strip and checking out all the other hotels. If you plan to spend a lot of time at the hotel and the pool, stay somewhere else. If you're looking to save a few bucks and will not be at your hotel much, NY NY is just fine.

Reviews.Title: “Loved New York - New York!!!”
Reviews.Author: Cindy241
Reviews.Content: My sisters and I stayed at New York - New York for a girls weekend in May and we absolutely LOVED it!!! The atmosphere is hip and fun. There are plenty of places to eat, and if you are in a hurry you can get a quick meal at the deli or the pizza place - everything that we had was delicious. The hotel staff was always pleasant and helpful. The room were VERY clean. We do thorough "bed bug checks" whenever we stay at hotels now, so we checked everywhere (even under the mattresses), and it was absolutely SPOTLESS! We were very impressed with how clean it was. The pool and jacuzzis were really nice, and Coyote Ugly and the piano bar were lots of fun. Another nice thing about New York - New York is that it is not ridiculously huge. If you want to go somewhere you don't have to walk a mile through the casino trying to find the exit. We had a blast and will definitely stay there again!!! :)

Reviews.Title: “ONE OF THE BEST!”
Reviews.Author: cmason54
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel at 11AM, 4 hours before check-in, and they gave us a room! That's a first. That NEVER happens...The check in was fast, no line, minimal wait, nice staff. I asked for a room facing the strip since my husband had never been to Vegas. The roller coaster is on that same side but I didn't think it was unbearable noise. We were on the 21st floor in the Century Tower so it may be noisier at a lower level but it wasn't bad at all. The room was nice, the bathroom was large and clean. They gave us a coupon book for the hotel when we checked in and it was actually useful! I've gotten them at other hotels with the dumbest coupons that I would never use but these were for food, drinks and shops so we used them quite a bit. We ate in several of the restaurants and we were never disappointed with the service or the food. We always thought we got our money's worth. The waitresses on the floor took good care of us when we were gambling. All and all is was great and I would highly recommend New York New York! They did charge a $15.00 resort fee (plus about $1.90 a night tax). I don't know what that was for but I wasn't going to complain. The room was compted from other MGM hotels visits and gambling so I wasn't going to complain about $17.00 a night to stay there. I know some people have complained about the fee. The pool was nice, nothing fancy but at least it was operational and clean, I've been to some of those hotel pools and they are just scary.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, great service, nice pool...”
Reviews.Author: julefit
Reviews.Content: I was happy with my stay at New York New York. The front desk was very helpful and upbeat! I thought the room was very clean, safe, and quiet. The pool area was nice, great bar area and plenty of towels and chairs. Great 3 night stay overall, I would recommend this hotel as it was close to other hotels and right on the Strip.

Reviews.Title: “Eh- it is okay, but you can do better for the price.”
Reviews.Author: Momof3letmebee
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a trip to Vegas and a stay at New York New York. The hotel was okay. It was basically a gigantic holiday inn. Nothing special. For the price ($230 for Friday night and $260 for Saturday night plus resort fee of $15/day that only gets you a free newspaper you have to go get yourself at one of the shops) it really wasn't impressive. You can do better on the strip in Vegas so I wouldn't stay here unless you get a SERIOUSLY low price... like $89 a night or something. OK- the room: We paid a little extra for a "Broadway strip view" room which was a little bigger, had two queen beds and had a view." The view was NOTHING. It looked out over the roof toward the NYNY roller coaster and Statue of Liberty. Pretty much all we could see of the "strip" was the MGM grand across the steet and the Tropicana across from that. I guess rooms on the other side of the all looked away from the strip so was this better than that...? I dunno, it sure wasn't much of a "view." The room itself was fine... it was a decent size, not cramped. The bathroom was small... one sink. The tub was super deep and hard to step in with a gross sliding glass door that showed its age. The room wasn't super outdated but was definitely aged in appearance. The carpet was clean so that was good. The ice machine on our floor was broken, that was not convenient. The pool at this hotel is pathetic... small and jammed in with lots of shade (meaning ice cold water) for most of the day. The roller coaster goes over the pool... it isn't really all that relaxing there and you can' swim and party because it is shaded and the water is freezing cold. The service was holiday inn quality- it was fine, but nothing that would grab your attention at all. The air in the main casino area of this hotel has the smell of cigarrette smoke hanging in it... which isn't uncommon except that we did notice the other casnios seemed to have better air filtration systems (Bellagio or Monte Carlo) and the air smelled a lot better over there than at NYNY. (Maybe it is supposed to smell like New York... I don't know!) Anyway- We stayed here with a larger group but next time I'd choose the Monte Carlo or Bellagio (which are much nicer with nicer pools) over the NYNY any day of the week.

Reviews.Title: “Time for an update”
Reviews.Author: Agent5
Reviews.Content: This hotel is inexpensive for a reason - the rooms need major upgrading, the pool area sucks, the restaurant selection is poor and the casino is tight and cramped. The roller coaster is the best thing about this place! Besides the rooms being completely outdate, they are also a bit noisy due to the constant hum and screams associated with the rollercoaster ride.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK !”
Reviews.Author: helenbrown911
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in Vegas before at Luxor and so was expecting the same standards that I had previously experienced there. Unfortunately not so, upon arrival we found the reception area and casino to be really dark and dingy. Check in was fast (full points there) and then we went to our room. We stayed in the Empire State building which was 'just OK'...and lets face it who wants 'just OK' when in Vegas !? There was nothing about this hotel that blew me away. Also quite worryingly there was NO security on the lifts..which meant anyone could be roaming around on your floor. The pool area was tiny for such a big hotel, and only got the sun from about midday onwards. There was a severe lack of places to sit and relax with a drink - and when I say relax I mean comfortable chairs not stools at a bar ! The one bar that had comfy chairs restricted you to sitting there with a minimum of two drinks !!! Their excuse for a buffet was absolutely awful, and buffet wise I fully recomment MGM as it's only a stones throw away and well worth the walk ! The Irish pub inside the hotel was always packed to the rafters and usually standing room only - which isn't my idea of fun ! Dont get me wrong, the hotel was adequate as a base for a holiday, but with so many others to choose from - with much better facilities, I think NYNY has had it's day...it's tired and run down and can't compete with the newer hotels on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “New York New York has it all”
Reviews.Author: Tiny_Chablis
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights in late May and cannot fault New York New York. Although there was a small line at check in, we were greeted with a pleasant staff member and the process was done quickly and efficiently. We were in a Park Ave room, with plenty of room and a big comfortable king size bed. You need to walk through the gaming area to get to the room which was a very eye opening experience, one of the many in Vegas. The hotel is located at the southern end of the strip across although this casino has everything and you could get by without have to go too far. There is only a quick walk across the road to the RTC transit bus stop. $20 for 3 days of unlimited bus travel in Vegas so anything is easily accessible. Inside the hotel there are many bars, plenty of food options and don't miss duelling pianos at the Times Square Bar each night, a great night! Overall I could not fault the New York New York and would definately stay here again and look forward to doing just that.

Reviews.Title: “Run down, spend the same amout of money and stay at a differnt Vegas hotel.”
Reviews.Author: wwrrkd
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at NYNY many times since it opened years ago, and this time I noticed how truly run-down and in need of an update it is. Our room smelled so moldy that it was difficult to sleep in. We were afraid our clothes would pick up the smell from the room. However, the staff is very nice and as helpful as they can be. If you are going to spend the money, they have rooms at other newer places like Aria and Cosmopolitan that are far nicer and closer to everything on the strip. Even some older hotels like the Venetian and MGM are better that the NYNY. Also, it probably has the worst hotel pool in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Great Night life, grubby hotel!”
Reviews.Author: VegasK1NG
Reviews.Content: Having been to vegas with friends in 2009 we spent alot of time eating, drinking and gambling in NYNY even though we were staying at the excalibur over the road. When organising this trip I thought it made sense to stay there. Having researched the reviews etc i realised that the accomodation side of things were slightly dated and the pool was one of the poorer in the area in terms of size and events organised. Even so decided to book as the bars/restaurants were so good in 09. Having a delayed flights we finally checked in to nyny at 1230am, entering the room i quickly realised there was no cleaning or prep carried out it was a real mess. one thing i will say in its defence it was a big room. Tired from nearly 25 hours of travelling i just wanted to sleep but couldnt as the sheets where a disgrace. I called the front desk to rectify this and they said they'd send a cleaner straight up. An hour and half later no sign of anyone. We decided to leave the room to give them chance to clean and to take my mind off the situation. The bars here are as I remembered, brilliant! Finally at 4 am the rooms had been cleaned however they were still tired, dated decor and warn furnishings. All very 1990's, given that the competition has moved on why havent they, even a CRT tv! We had intended staying here for 13 nights. We checked out after 2 having heard the tropicana had just been renovated. The tropican was beautiful in every way! Nikki Beach during the day was glorious. To summise I would still visit NYNY for the facilities but the rooms and service are pretty appalling especially given what they charge! The excalibur is nicer and much cheaper! The tropicana is well worth a look, the brand new pool, decor and show our A1!

Reviews.Title: “Good value and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: geezerokManchesteruk
Reviews.Content: Good value and friendly staff,the room was clean and tidy but the wardrobe space is a bit limited. the TV has seen better days but we weren't there to watch TV. The pool area is to small for the size of the hotel,not enough sunbeds! Over all an enjoyable stay and would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: TLMacc
Reviews.Content: My Girlfriend and I stayed at the NY NY for 7 nights.We were upgraded to a Park Avenue room on check-in which was clean and roomy and was serviced daily. We both found the hotel to be perfect for us providing good all round entertainment, good bars, the dueling pianos at the 'Bar at time square' were fantastic and really got the crowd going.... what a great atmosphere. The Rollercoaster was fun and not as noisy as some posts had suggested and there were plenty of places to grab a snack/meal. The steak restaurant 'Gallagher's Steakhouse' is well worth a visit. The position of the hotel allows easy access to all of the main attractions of Las Vegas. In my opinion, after visiting (although not staying) most of the hotels on the 'strip', the NY NY is the best of the themed hotels in Vegas.... if you are looking for 5 star elegance, then the NY NY is probably not for you. If you are looking for a good standard hotel with clean rooms, good service and entertainment then I would definatley recommend this hotel as a place to stay

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel but will try somewhee different next time”
Reviews.Author: AndrewN259
Reviews.Content: I have to say that there was not much to complain about. We found tha gaming floor very noisey but there are plenty of thoses to choose from in Vegas. I have read some of the reviews about this hotel and find those people that say it is not in a good location rather weird. It is at one end of the strip, but unless you have something against a walk, I am not sure why you would complain! Overall it was a nice hotel, we found the staff nice, but then I find most people that complain about staff, are only getting back what they give out! I say if its in your budget then you will get good value for money, give it a go!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel never sleeps”
Reviews.Author: kkwalia
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay with. every facility available. Great Casino. Great Roller Coaster. Theme Hotel full of activities. handy coupons booklet. Food courts are awesome. Great place for Shopping. Nice sports bar. Excellent zumanity show. cool lounge bar

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Will stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: Yonkers_au
Reviews.Content: I found New York - New York to be one of the better priced hotels on Las Vegas Blvd. As soon as I arrived at the hotel, I was greeted by the bellman who stored my luggage until I could check in at 3pm. The check-in staff were friendly and helpful. The room was a good size for a solo traveler and was cleaned daily. As soon as I checked in, I called the bellman to deliver my luggage and it was done within 10 mins. The staff were more than helpful, the rooms were clean and the service was prompt. What more could you ask for in a large hotel. I'd definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Love it, will be back”
Reviews.Author: JennyC29
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel. Rooms lovely. Casino great. Lovely staff. Couldnt say enough good things about it. First time in Vegas and would only stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Amazing property to be enjoyed in the spirit of the city.”
Reviews.Author: Alimmin
Reviews.Content: Since its our first time in town it was recommended to choose a hotel on the strip and since we are here for a casual holiday we decided to try a midprice range property. Las Vegas and this hotel exceeded our expectation in many respect and after touring the other hotel property on the strip we felt this property is fresh and was of good value. There is no minibar fridge in the room but there is good variety of restaurant and bars. A resort city armed to the tooth with a bombardment of entertainment offerings, you'll find something.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and great location but watch for hidden fees”
Reviews.Author: MEJDoane
Reviews.Content: We booked through priceline. Note, most of the hotels in Las Vegas charge a $7-25 dollar a day "resort fee". This is on top of any rate you may land when booking. Otherwise, great location. Beautiful scenery. Kids loved the roller coaster in site. Pool was too cold to swim. We were unprepared for the smokiness of LV, too. Virtually surrounded by cigarette smoke at every turn. Room was smoke free though.

Reviews.Title: “A top hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sarah197923
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the New York New York hotel in vegas for 4 nights in the "Park Avenue, Empire Building" room and it was fantastic! The room is beautiful, a high standard room as good as the Hilton if not better. What a room for the price! So cheap. It had a small view of the strip but it had a great view overall. We were on the 34th floor! A large ensuite, 2 queen beds, a beautiful room. Free wifi as well which was great. The room service was quick and really cheap food for the standard and the employees were helpful and wonderful, the best we have ever experienced! The casino is awesome and lots to do (food, rollercoaster etc). Overall I highly recommend this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Like a Cattle herding Enterprise..Front Desk Staff unqualified and unfriendly”
Reviews.Author: Maxi_15
Reviews.Content: Some of the rooms are very outdated and nothing like the website...Food Places are about the worst on the strip..This hotel needs good management to get it out of this mess....Even if they advertise $55.- rooms I would not recommend it.Never again !! one of the worst run hotels in Vegas some rooms are good but some staff (for example andrew from front desk) need training in customer relations. It seems they forgot they are in the hospitality business and not in the cattle herding business. There are great hotels in the city center why stay here ? I wish I had known.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the money, however location is not prime to northern end.”
Reviews.Author: Tripthug
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the New York New York hotel and casino for 2 nights. As we checked in I asked if there were any room comps for the night, they told me yes, and gave me a free room upgrade. The room was excellent, no HD TV like the pictures depicted on their website, however the bathroom was good, nice floors and a great shower. Our view wasn't amazing however we did have a nice view of the roller coaster and the back of the parking garage. Our room was at the very end of the hall way, and we had to pass through 11 hallways to get to our room which was a problem. The hotel was at times confusing, however the fine dining they provided made up for it. The Chin Chin has an excellent breakfast buffet, and would definitely go back. The America restaurant kind of has slow service but what I order turned out good. The amenities this hotel offered were good, the High Speed Internet was lighting fast and the Roller Coaster was incredible. Would probably not stay again, try and book a hotel in the middle of the strip.

Reviews.Title: “We'll stay again next time in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: travelbobKalamazoo
Reviews.Content: We hit Vegas for the first time and gave new York, New York a try. We were happy with the result. The room was nice and the staff very helpful. The room had a nice view of the south end of the strip. We tried a couple of the restaurants on site. Nine Fine Irishmen and Chin Chin's were both very good, although we thought Chin Chin's was better. They also had two ice cream outfits on site. The location was great, because it is a short walk to the majority of the strip. We weren't trilled by the casino. Since it was rare to find a $5 minimum table (they were almost always $10 or $15 minimums), we rarely played there. MGM Grand and the Monte Carlo are very close, and they do have $5 tables, so it's a short walk to find games for those on a budget. We will definately be back in Vegas at some point, and we will stay at New York, New York again.

Reviews.Title: “We wont be back”
Reviews.Author: gbrewer
Reviews.Content: The following review is being posted after already allowing the New York New York staff an opportunity to respond to the issues we had during our visit. I wrote an email to their customer service department about the results of our trip and also completed their online survey. Both times I have requested contact. Nobody from the hotel chose to respond. My Wife and I booked this trip online and it was paid in advance. This trip was a Birthday celebration for me and she wanted it to be perfect. She was disappointed from the moment we arrived. We had requested a Park Avenue Deluxe room with one king bed. After all, we are married. She had called prior to our arrival to confirm and was informed that even though this room was already paid for, the king bed rooms are provided based on availability upon arrival. Our flight didn't arrive until 7pm so we were initially unable to get a room with a king bed. We were provided a room with two queen beds. When we entered the room, we noticed the comforters were both wrinkled and it appeared as if someone had rested on top of both queen beds. We called down to the front desk to speak to a customer service rep about our room and were informed that they could put us on the "king bed" list for the following day and that they would call us if a "king bed" room became available. Later that night, my wife needed some hand lotion. The small bottle of hand lotion had already been used and appeared dirty. We stayed out until around 4am to mostly gamble in their casino. When we returned to our room, we noticed that we did not have a "do not disturb" sign for our door. We went to bed and were awoke by house keeping numerous times that morning. The following afternoon we contacted the front desk and were informed we were still on the list for a "King Bed" room. Since I did not want to spend another night on a queen bed, I asked to upgrade to another room. They had a special to upgrade to a spa suite for around $30 extra dollars a night. It did have a king bed so we took the offer. The room was much nicer. The room appeared to be clean, the television was modern, and most of all it had a King Bed. We stayed out that morning until around 4 am again. We returned to our room and hung the "DO NOT DISTURB" sign on the door. We were woken up about every hour after 9am by house keeping who would try their key card to the room followed by an attempt to turn the door handle. At around 11:30 am, house keeping actually called into our room waking us both up asking if we wanted our room cleaned. This defeats the reason for placing the "DO NOT DISTURB" sign on the door. We again gambled the next morning until around 4am. We again placed the same "DO NOT DISTURB" sign on our door and were waken every hour after 9am by house keeping. I can appreciate them wanting to get your room clean but I did not chose to stay in Vegas to receive an early bird cleaning special. The same house keeping activity took place on the next morning as well. Cocktail service - Cocktail service the first night we stayed was positive. The waitress came around to check on us frequently and was speedy with the drinks. We always tip our waitress well and usually play in the same slot machine areas for a fairly long period of time. The next three nights, drink service was terrible. They didn't appear to have near enough cocktail waitresses. If you could find one, service was very slow. We were gambling a considerable amount and should not have had slow service. (We gambled at numerous other casinos on this trip and New York New York had the worst cocktail service) (MGM Grand had the best and was very busy at the time) Our last night in the hotel we had received a message on our hotel phone talking about fast checkout. The message stated we could check out of the hotel the next morning via the television or the telephone and simply leave the card key in a drop box near the elevator. We chose to checkout the next morning via the television. We selected the checkout feature on the television which prompted us to wait a few moments while our final bill was prepared. After waiting well over ten minutes, we decided this option was not working properly. We checked out via telephone which only took a few minutes. Our experience with bell service the morning of checkout was positive. They were very friendly and quick. I would have notified the front desk of the issues we had during our stay, however, the lines for service were exceptionally long and they appeared short staffed. I was already frustrated with this hotel and chose to not wait any longer.

Reviews.Title: “so much under one roof”
Reviews.Author: jepoyzia
Reviews.Content: Booked one of the rooms with a view, well worth it. The rooms were very clean and spacious. Bed was oh so comfy did not want to move on some days. Service was very good. We got married in Vegas and our friends back home had arranged for a cake and champagne to be delivered to our room, it was brilliant. Our friends booked for the upgrade which was a larger room but on their arrival they were told it was over booked so had to down grade, I thought they may have offered an upgrade due to their error but no. Loved the casino, one issue was the later it got the less servers there was and even to the point where we could not see any. There was a point when we ordered drinks and no one returned after 30 minutes so we left. The Irish pub was fun, went their late on our wedding day night. the band was great so much fun, have great memories. Also went in coyote ugly, the bouncer’s was very nice and let us in for free because it was our wedding day. I was not overly keen as was not completely hammered but was still entertained for a short period. The pool was clean hired one of the cabanas which was nice as it is so hot and you do need to spend time in the shade. It was expensive but worth it for the one day. One issue was that this hotel is at one end of the strip although it is not far when you are tired you cannot be bothered walking. Lots of choices for food in the hotel or over the road is a food court. If you like roller coasters you need to go one this, I did not but my husband did and loved it. We wanted to see a show and when staying you get a discount on the Zumanity. I would not recommend this as I felt very uncomfortable watching it at times a bit like soft porn. Would recommend this hotel but I think I may try a different one next time a bit further down the strip.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Deep in the hot of Texas
Reviews.Title: “Ups and downs but I do love the place”
Reviews.Author: SpinyNorma
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at NYNY. My package was supposed to include an upgrade to a Park Avenue room but I got the smaller Broadway room instead. In fairness, I checked in early and didn't want to wait several hours to get my room. I do like this hotel a lot. The room was small but comfortable. I love their bathrooms and showers. No tub but the shower is good, with nice water pressure and places to put your stuff. Pretty good counter space too. My main disappointment was the temperature. I like my rooms really cool, almost cold, and the room was a little warm for my tastes. The thermometer wouldn't let me set it lower but once I closed the drapes, it was fine. I usually like to leave them open so I can look out but my view was of a rooftop so I didn't miss much really. A huge plus is the availability of places to eat that are reasonably priced, at least by Vegas starndards. America is a good place to find a meal in the $20 range and the service was much improved over my last visit. My favorites, however, are the Greenwich Village eateries. There's a large variety of types of food to choose from. My favorite is the deli. There's a place with pretty little desserts too. I like to get one to take back to the room and indulge myself while recuperating. Its location is on the south end of the strip but you have fairly easy access to the bus by crossing over to MGM. There's also a free tram to Luxor and Mandelay Bay at Excalibur, which is easy to access from NYNY. NYNY is the only MGM hotel I stay in. MGM is pretty stingy with comps for the low rollers but they'll give you a discount on your room. While Harrah's properties will let you book comped or discounted rooms online, MGM makes you call, which can be a pain. They also have a resort fee, something else I don't care for. Most of it covers things I don't use (and I doubt most people would either) but the free internet is nice. My internet connection was fast and I had no problems with connecting and staying connected.

Reviews.Title: “casino is super loud playing tacky club songs over and over and over”
Reviews.Author: texasreviewer2011
Reviews.Content: when we checked in we were upgraded for no apparent reason so that was great. friendly employee checked us in and gave us a room on the 22 floor. hallway was dark and needed some cleaning but the room was decent and clean with comfortable beds. at night the casino gets so loud you can not stand it. they play this really tacky booming club music. same crappy songs over and over and over again. pounding in your head and making you really uptight while you are trying to enjoy gambling. there are some girls dancing on the bar which is where the music is coming from but they blast the music so loud it goes throughout most of the casino except for a small section near the registration desk. then add the piano bar and the band in the irish pub and you get a hot mess of music. we signed up for the mlife card and didn't find out until after we checked out that they could take off $177 off our bill. she didn't really want to do it but finally said she would try and take if off. we asked her if she had a brochure to give us info about the program and she said no. so not sure how they think people know to check the players desk before you check out. MAKE SURE YOU CHECK THE PLAYER DESK BEFORE YOU CHECK OUT SO YOU CAN GET SOME MONEY OFF YOUR BILL AND she also gave us money to spend at the restaurants. if we had known that we would have used it for our $20 fish and chips (way too much money for that) had to pay 3.75 for a cup of coffee every morning (not a fancy coffee) not happy about that.

Reviews.Title: “Start speading the news...This hotel is a cheat!!!!”
Reviews.Author: leo72976
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were looking forward to a nice relaxing 3 day stay at this hotel. We usually stay across the street at Excalibur but decided to change things up a little and stay at a little nicer place this time. We booked our reservation online on the hotels website and received a rate of $44 a night plus tax and that included 2 complimentary drink vouchers and 2 complimentary roller coaster passes. We later decided to stay an extra night so we booked a second reservation to stay an additional night. A week before we checked in our rate went down. I contacted the 800 number on our confirmation and the representative and supervisor were both rude. They advised me that we would not be receiving the drinks or passes that we had been offered when we booked our room. Since it was more than 48 hours prior to our arrival I decided to cancel the reservation. The more I thought about it the more mad I became. I found a phone number for the hotel directly and spoke to a nice gentleman who said he was the manager. The manager sided with me and reinstated our reservation and the lower rate, noted our record that we should receive the free drinks and passes and also waived the $16 resort fees for our stay. I will admit that I was impressed with this manager and I did feel he was very genuine and sincere. We arrived at the hotel on Tuesday May 24th and that is where things really started to go wrong. I advised the front desk clerk that we had 2 reservations back to back and asked if we would have to check in again when our first reservation was over or if we could link the 2 reservations together. The clerk advised me there was no need to come back down after our first reservation as he would tie everything together . When we checked in I was given a piece of paper to sign that confirmed the per night rate and that would be charged to my credit card. Usually I do not pay much attention and sign whatever is presented to me but something told me to read what I was signing this time. The paper showed that our room rate was now $96 a night. I quickly pointed this out to the front desk clerk and he called a manager over. The manager said I was wrong and that our rate was $96 a night. Lucky for me I was traveling with my iPad and I pulled it out and quickly pulled up my confirmation email showing the lower rate. The manager relented and said he would change the rate to reflect what I had a confirmation for. The front desk clerk then attempted to collect the resort fees from me, again the manager was called over and again put up a slight disagreement but after again reading our reservation decided that we should not be charged the fees as promised earlier. The rest of the check-in seemed to go smoothly and we were presented our room keys and a map and pointed on our way to our room. I inquired about our drinks and passes and again I got the deer in the headlight look. Back to the reservation they went and a few minutes later we received our 4 vouchers and were on our way to our room finally. The room itself was pleasant. Nothing overly fancy or tacky. We were on the 36th floor and had a nice view of some of the other hotels on the strip and the beautiful mountains to the west. We requested a king sized bed but instead received 2 queens, not a big deal or disappointment. The beds themselves were horrible! The mattress varied depending where you laid on them. On one side it was as hard as a rock, on the other side all you felt were the springs. We tried both beds and found both to be similar in comfort. Our room did have an ice maker but it did not work. I did report this to the front desk manager and she said that maintenance would come up and fix it, they never showed. The ice maker was in the weirdest place I have ever seen, in the bathroom almost up against the toilet and under the sink. I am not a germaphobe but I will say that this did weird me out a bit. If you opened the ice maker door it slammed right into the toilet. When you sat on the toilet your leg hit the ice maker. In all of my travels all over the world I have never seen anything like this. The only reason I can come up with for having the ice maker in the bathroom is for a water line and in case it leaked. I would much rather have walked down the hall and gotten my ice from a machine, it just mentally seems more sanitary to me. We did spend 2 days laying by the pool. The pool is nice but a little small. There were average lounge chairs but you did have to get there early to claim one. It was hard later in the day to find a place to lay as the deck area is not very wide and can only hold 2 rows of chairs. The pool is in shade until about 1200 and then the sun comes out over the entire area. There are also 3 hot tubs located a few steps above the pool area. The hot tubs are nice size and it was never a problem getting a seat in one. The one big disadvantage to the pool is that there is a volleyball net across the middle. It is almost impossible to swim from one end to the other as there was always a game going on. There are plenty of options for night life. We went to the Times Square dualing piano bar. If you decide to go make sure you go on Wednesday nights as there is no cover charge that night otherwise you will be paying $15 a person just to walk in the door. The crowd was nice sized and it was a fun atmosphere. The two piano players that were playing the night we were there were good. They knew almost every song requested and they interacted well with the audience. My only complaint would be for them to turn the sound down a bit. The club itself is not very large. There are several speakers mounted all over the bar. They had the sound up so loud that it distorted the music and made it hard to sometimes understand what was being said or what song was playing, I have been to this club on previous trips and have never heard the sound turned up as high as it was this time. Overall, the piano bar is a great place to have some drinks and listen to some good music. Our original 2 day reservation ended and our single night was supposed to begin on the 3rd day. As I mentioned earlier we were informed that we didn't need to do anything as our reservations were tied together. We went and had brunch at MGM Grand and returned to our room around 1230pm to find we were locked out. We tried both of our keys and found neither one worked. We went down to the front desk and stood in line for 30 minutes and were informed that our keys did work. Wrong! Once again my temper boiled. The new manager was again called over and very coldly and rudely inquired about the problem. By this time I had had enough. I respectfully and professionally spoke my opinion of the hotel to the female manager. She wanted to argue every point I made. She made it seem like there were no problems at all. We were offered a further $50 credit toward food purchase, new room keys, and were assured that our ice maker would be fixed. The ice maker was never fixed. We decided to use our food credit the last night at the America restaurant in the hotel. They have a late night special of ribeye starting at midnight. I would recommend America as a place to eat. The restaurant is large and open. Our food was good. The cut of and quality of meat were excellent. Since it was late there were not too many people in there so the service was quick and attentive. We checked out on our last morning around 1030am. The line was long but did go quickly. We were given our bill and at the bottom it should in bold faced type that there was an amount of approx $156 due. I questioned this amount and the clerk made it seem like I was asking her too many questions. I told her I didn't think the amount was correct and she kept insisting that it was and if I had any questions to call back later to dispute it. We had to get to the airport for our flight home so I decided to take the bill and leave. As we were leaving we were greeted by the female manger from the previous day. She did thank us for staying there and I informed her we would never stay there again. Once we arrived at the airport and I reviewed the bill I was still baffled at the amount charged. I called the hotel and spoke to a representative would kept insisting that it was correct that we were charged $156. I had the representative go over the numbers I was looking at and she could not come up with how they were charging $156 either once I pointed everything out to her. I was once again connected to the female manager who went over the bill. Guess what? I was actually entitled to a refund of $142. The accounting at NYNY is horrible! They use a system that even their own employees can not understand. In closing let me say that I would not recommend this hotel to anyone. We will never stay there again. Their customer service is the worst I have ever seen. I was not looking to get anything extra or for free, I only wanted what I was entitled to and promised. In my opinion the hotel is very deceitful. I do understand that mistakes happen but too many happened to us for me not to think that some of it was on purpose. I will be contacting the NV Better Business Bureau on Tuesday morning and filing a complaint. I feel this hotel does try to cheat people out of what they deserve whether it be a free drink or a room rate. My best advice to you would be to read everything before you sign and know what you are entitled to. Next time we go to Las Vegas we will be staying across the street at Excalibur where the rates are lower, the poo is larger, and the customer service soars above it's sister casino across the street. Good luck to you if you stay at NYNY.

Reviews.Title: “viva las vegas”
Reviews.Author: rguthmil
Reviews.Content: decent rooms, friendly staff, tons of restaurants inside hotel on the strip close to everything. Roller coaster is worth one ride...just one.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay”
Reviews.Author: papa84759
Reviews.Content: We went to have are Toyota serveced where we bought it from and stayed here we have stayed here before and it is great. Good parking, great food places and some nice clean rooms not sure how to rate the value of the rooms so just put it as 3 maybe should have been a 4 maybe.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: john S
Reviews.Content: Most employees we delt with were polite and helpful. Room was nice - just an average room - nothing speical. Our view was of the roller coaster and the strip. There was little coaster noise. The casino was a little loud at night (spring break?).

Reviews.Title: “"Outstanding"”
Reviews.Author: unlimitedtravels
Reviews.Content: I travel to Las Vegas at least three times a year, I normally go for the more luxury type hotels like Venetian, Mirage, etc. However I booked a group package for me and three buddies, included in the package was New York hotel, I was not really sure about this hotel, I thought it was geared more to travelrs with kids, but I must say I was highly impressed with my recent stay, it was so much fun, lots of music, always had something going on, the rooms were a little small, but very clean, and I am sure I could have upgraded. I would definitely stay here again, very very clean in the rooms, casino, bathrooms. Highly impressed.

Reviews.Title: “If you like Blackpool you will probably like this!”
Reviews.Author: emmieBournemouth
Reviews.Content: Arrived at this hotel after a week in Los Angeles. This hotel was recommended by Virgin, but we found it very brash and noisy.
