If I was going back to Vegas (which I am not) I would book the Venetian which has a much calmer atmosphere. The room we were allocated was on the 5th floor and it was dark, dreary and dirty! I went to the reception and spoke to a very nice receptionist called Jaz who was very understanding and moved us to the 24th floor - a larger brighter room with excellent views (also very clean). It is certainly worth doing a helicopter trip to the Grand Canyon - we found it awesome and landed in the canyon for a champagne picnic.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome.”
Reviews.Author: feddy42
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from our stay and we have nothing but wonderful things to say. From the cleanliness to the friendliness of the staff. Ashton, a hostess in the America restaurant who asked us everytime she seated us how our vacation was going, to the the housekeeping staff who work so hard to keep the appearance of the hotel beautiful. We will most certainly recommend this hotel to all!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, happening and excellent value for money with good location”
Reviews.Author: johal789
Reviews.Content: We booked a basic room and after reading the tripadvisor forums, thought of the $20 trick. I asked for an upgrade and she did upgrade us. Whenw e went to teh room, it was dirty and the cleaner had just entered. I told my wife to wait there while I went to the reception (bit of a walk). After waiting for 15 minutes, I met a manager aand. They apologised and without any questions upgraded me again. the room was pretty good, though facing the statue of liberty, the roller coaster. The hotel was really good and we had an anjoyable 2nights. We never ate there, went for the $45 buffet of buffet option. I would definitely recommend this hotel and it is really good compared to ther nearby hotels liek flamingo, luxor, mirage etc.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED the NYNY hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: mlindsey5
Reviews.Content: I decided to take my husband to Vegas for his 40th Bday and it was a surprise. 16 of us went and we all LOVED the NYNY hotel. The hotel was clean and modern. The rooms were tastefully done and we had a wonderful view of the Vegas. The staff was friendly. Several cons: 1. Beware they put a hold on your credit card of $50.00 PER DAY for incidentals. Granted you get it back but this is something they should make you aware of. 2. If you are a big gambler this is NOT the hotel for you. They do NOT have poker tables!!!! 3. If you are not a kid person stay away….there kids all around. 4. Gonzales Y Gonzales was not GREAT at all! Now for the Pros: 1. the roller coaster was AWESOME!!!! 2. The fish place was GREAT and they gave us so much me and my husband shared. 3. The ROC club was fun! Overall we would stay here again but only if we brought the kids.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent organisation and a fabulous venue for 55 colleagues from the UK”
Reviews.Author: k9todd
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a corporate trip to Las Vegas and chose to stay at the New York New York hotel for its range of night life, choice of restaurants and location on the strip. We we not disappointed. In fact we were extremely impressed with the overall organisation, the quality and cleanliness of the bedrooms, the high level of customer service (with the possible exception of a few surly bar staff). The night life, especially the piano bar was outstanding. A special word of thanks must go to our waiter Willy on a couple of nights at Il Fornaio. Great customer service. We also had a great corporate night on the terrace of the Nine Fine Irishman. Most of our group were in their 20's and 30s' and this hotel was perfect for them. Not the most exclusive but a great atmosphere. Would definitely recommend for group bookings, the early check in and ability to give us the room cards for 55 guests was a great help. Thank you

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed our stay at NY NY.”
Reviews.Author: MaryGayle
Reviews.Content: When we made our reservation we requested a non-smoking room with a king-size bed, but when checking in, we were told there were no king-size bed, non-smoking rooms available in the Park Avenue Deluxe catagory. I found this hard to believe, since this was a Tuesday, and the hotel didn't seem very busy, considering there are 2,023 rooms. We simply accepted a room with two queen-size beds, rather than paying more for an upgraded room. The room was clean and comfortable. There was a handy, full-size mirror, and a cabinet with several drawers, a large shelf, and a small closet for hanging clothes. There was also a safe, ironing board, iron, and hair dryer included in the room. Fortunately, we couldn't hear the roller coaster from our room. The swimming pool was a good size and there were three hot-tubs. We had sun at the pool until about 5:30 p.m., when the sun went behind a building. The pool was open until 6:00 p.m. There are several good restaurants located in the NY NY complex. We liked the breakfasts at the "Il Fornaio" restaurant. We used the "Buy-one-get-one free breakfast" coupon in the NY NY coupon booklet for breakfasts at "Il Fornaio". We also used the 20% off NY NY coupon and ate a few good meals at the "America" restaurant where we had a delicious dinner that included an 8-ounce steak, crab legs, baked potato, mixed vegetables, and rolls for $14.95, which was an amazing price for Las Vegas. We also ate a good meal at "Nine Fine Irishmen" restaurant. We used the coupon that was in the NY NY coupon booklet for a free appetizer which was enough for four people. I'd suggest sharing entrees, since the servings were very large. The ceiling of NY NY is painted black, so the inside of the entire complex is very dark and depressing. I would prefer seeing a ceiling painted blue with while clouds or another light color. On Friday evening the casino area was very noisy due to the band playing. We had to go to a different casino due to the loud noise. The economy has surely not affected Las Vegas. The pedestrian and motorized traffic was sometimes overwhelming. Thank goodness for the upper level pedestrian walkways above the streets. We were amazed by the number of trucks that traveled up and down the strip carrying large, flat-panel advertisements for various shows, casinos, etc. I would think the high price of gas would curtail this activity. We purchased a 24-hour bus pass for $7.00 and went downtown to the "Fremont Street Experience," which consisted of four blocks of Fremont Street that were covered with a 90-foot tall metal structure. A sound and light show takes place each hour starting at about 8:00 p.m. and lasts less than 10 minutes. It was quite entertaining. There were also a couple of bands playing for the crowds, and a zip line that you can ride above Fremont Street.

Reviews.Title: “Just Ok”
Reviews.Author: jonojemma
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a week stay in vegas...NY NY Hotel has great places to eat, hmmm thats about it...I spend over $100 a night for a thurs frid night stay..Ok I get it frid is busy, our room was so FAR from the elevator it was a joke..I counted, it was 163 strides from the elevator to our room..Are you kidding me! The pool is very old and tacky, with no room..The bed was old and not comfortable...I just didnt like the layout of the hotel..(especially compared to other hotels on the strip)...location is not the best on the strip, but the bus is convenient..the front dest staff very unfriendly, however the bellhops and staff in the front of the hotel were great..I find out when I get home i could have saved 25% if i had signed up on their email list??? wow why was this hidden from me? Do yourself a favor, stay at the Golden Nugget on freemont st..we stayed there for the first 2 days....what a difference..amazing pool, cheap food, freemont exper is fun, and you can take the shuttle back and forth to the strip..Final insult NY NY they charged my debit card $50 buck to rent a movie, they said they would refund my card in 7-10 business days!!!! thanks..never again..

Reviews.Title: “Inexpensive hotel in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: MelloNello60
Reviews.Content: Had family get-together in New York-New York Hotel in Vegas. We had five rooms at the hotel and it was nice that they were all close together. Bathrooms and pool area not as fancy as say, the Wynn, but hotel is reasonably priced and was perfect for a family reunion. Some rooms offerd better views than others because the hotel is oddly shaped. Room 801 has a better view than 803. Room 802 and 810 have very good views. I was highly impressed with the steak at the Nine Fine Irishmen pub, at the hotel. Breakfasts at the Italian restaurant were very good, as well. Good coffee.

Reviews.Title: “Happy to accept my money, did nothing to help when my purse was stolen.”
Reviews.Author: RoBo503
Reviews.Content: First I would like to clarify that I did not stay at the hotel. My purse was stolen while my friends and I were gaming at the hotel. I also understand that purse theft is very common in Las Vegas and you must be vigilant. I realized my purse was gone within 3-5 minutes of it being stolen and I was sitting right under a security camera. I immediately reported the theft to NYNY security and asked them to look at the tape from the camera in hopes that this would help reunite me with my stolen property. The man who took my report was polite and he did call "upstairs" to ask if they could do this. After "upstairs" learned I was not staying at the hotel, they refused to assist me. It was really frustrating to know that they reserve customer service only for people who are hotel guests. My friends and I made up a large group, celebrating a birthday. We were in town for 5 days. We ate in the hotel several times, rode the rollercoaster, saw Zumanity, and gambled there. We spent more there than it would cost for a room. My purse was stolen the day we were leaving, and getting home was a huge hassle due to having no ID, which was also stolen. When I got back home, I thought the hotel should at least have an opportunity to make amends. I wrote them a letter telling them that I was disappointed with how I was treated. I was very surprised to receive a message from NYNY within 2 weeks of mailing the letter. I returned the call and left a voice mail, and called back one other time, but never heard another word. I won't stay there, after this.

Reviews.Title: “Our First Stay was so IMPRESSIVE; We Plan on Staying again on Future Las Vegas Visits”
Reviews.Author: MOJO329
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at NYNY & we were so impressed that we plan on staying here again when visiting Las Vegas in the future. We upgraded our Park Avenue room to a Park Avenue room with a view. Our room was located on the 32nd floor overlooing the strip. After reading some reviews about the noise of the rollercoaster, we were pleasantly surprised at how quiet our room was. Suppose if you have a room on a lower floor this may contribute to the rollercoaster noise. Unfortunately, we had to spend longer than expected in our room with our children, as we experienced a sudden sickness. The houskeeping service was great .... our room was cleaned in a prompt & efficient manner which was greatly appreciated when having a sick child. Our room was clean, bathroom clean, our two queen beds made for a good night's rest. Check In/Check out service was efficient despite checking in at a busy time of day. Staff was great, and processed us very efficiently. We spent most of our days out at the pool & we were very impressed with the way the hotel allows ONLY the pool guests into the pool area unlike other strip hotels. Again, another plus .... hotel guests could only save their pool lounges for other guests for a period of 30 minutes (signs posted & enforced) unlike other strip hotels where guests come into the pool area, leave towels & belongings on the lounges, then leave the pool area and do not return until later in the day. This way everyone gets the use of a pool lounge. There IS a RESORT FEE, you are advised of this when making your reservations online .... so don't be surprised with the fee when it comes time to checkin or checkout ... its the joys of staying on the strip. Overall, we were impressed with our stay and shall return in the future.

Reviews.Title: “love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: seowchun
Reviews.Content: room's great,food's great in the deli and america felt like NY city. lots of variety of slot machines,staff all very friendly and welcoming,will definately return.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot to stay”
Reviews.Author: SLW23
Reviews.Content: My husband and I initially booked the cheapest room available, and were happy with this as we just saw our hotel room as a place to crash in between doing crazy Las Vegas things. We had also signed up to receive the hotel e-mails, as once you did you got 25% off accommodation, so overall we got a great deal! However, upon check-in we were asked if we wanted to upgrade to a spa suite, for $75 extra one night (Sat), and $25 the next (Sun). When we worked it out, it was still extremely affordable, and chose to do so. We were VERY glad we did! The suite was huge, well appointed, and we did make use of the spa after a long day walking up and down the strip! The hotel is in a good location to see all the other major hotels, although we chose only to go as far as Treasure Island, as we walked to whole time. It has a great vibe, and we were happy that we came out winners on the gaming floors!

Reviews.Title: “Wow, what a place.....”
Reviews.Author: scottdon99
Reviews.Content: What can I say, it's Vegas!!!!!! New York New York is by far the best looking hotel from the outside. So much colour and detail. The rooms were great, comfortable and clean. Shower could have been a little better. And a mini bar and fridge would have been good too. The casino is awesome, and there is just so much to see in the main area of the hotel. Also the roller coaster is fantastic.......great location and great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “NOT WORTH THE MONEY STAY ELSEWHERE”
Reviews.Author: honestmum
Reviews.Content: 2nd trip to Vegas...last visit was 2 years ago we stayed center strip this was near manadlay bay which is a bit further down, this hotel was not what i expected it to be it was a bit outdated reception staff were not welcoming,(but I didnt have to deal with them for long so didnt bother me much) Rooms were small compared to Planet Hollywood, where we stayed last time, that is centre strip opp Bellagio fountains we didnt eat at any of the restaurants didnt appeal to us..quite expensive as well. we walked outside, ordered coffee once at starbucks and it cost me bucks £4 we ate outside in the food court and at the mexican restaurants and dennys...cheaper ! Casino is very smoky...gets worse by the eve...the casino has no poker room...my husband went across to mgm to play...mgm is cleaner has a food court with mcds, plush restaurants & buffet NY NY has no shopping area....planet hollywood is good for this with loads of shops...so is the venetian and ceasars this has cheesecake factory great food swimming pool in NYNY was very crowded and small in my opnion stay center strip as walking to the other casinos from this end is too far...and this hotel is more 2* and not worth the money they charge...you get value for money at the others weather in vegas end april was hot hot hot

Reviews.Title: “Rooms awkward and location not ideal”
Reviews.Author: AC_A340
Reviews.Content: It's pretty much right at the South end of the strip, we found ourselves more towards mid-strip every day, so it was sort of a pain to be having to walk so far all the time. We were hardly ever at the hotel because we were so far away from it throughout the day. Because of the unique shape of the hotel, there are really no straight hallways, you're always turning corners. It also made for an awkward room shape when your room was close to one of the corners. About half the square footage of our room was in the bathroom. Friends of ours had more of a normal room though. There are also hidden elevators, meaning an elevator that has no access to your floor, but runs right beside your room. This caused some sleep disruptions, as did the roller coaster. We never had much interaction with hotel staff, but they were pleasant when we did.

Reviews.Title: “Will Stay Here Again”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaNik
Reviews.Content: We will definitely stay here again. The room was clean and spacious. The bed was comfortable enough, it definitely wasn't as hard as many other hotel beds. We ordered room service for breakfast on two mornings and enjoyed both meals. On the second morning my husband ordered the ham with his eggs and the slab of ham was the biggest I have ever seen, it covered the entire plate and it was delicious. We had a great view of the strip and overall enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: gib7
Reviews.Content: We stayed at NY NY as part of our honeymoon and paid extra for a broadway deluxe room.The room was not worth the extra we paid for it, the hotel is very dated and dingy and in desperate need of refurbishment. The hotel is towards the very end of the strip, at the south, so not the best location on the strip. On the plus side the room was very large with good views, it was clean and if booking a standard room good value for money for a strip hotel. However not recommended for a honeymoon, a poor four star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “good value”
Reviews.Author: hofbrau123
Reviews.Content: Check in was pretty fast, alot faster than at other hotels in L.V., got the zigarat suite, (spelling?) was very nice except t.v.s were not greatest picture and still tube t.v.s Did notice they were in process of changing them out. Room was obviously not brand new, but was in good condition, very large, and clean. M life players club personel were friendly and helpful. actually almost everyone was friendly except dealers at tables. I dont mean they were UNfriendly, but were not as cheerful and friendly as should have been. overall I would rate NYNY at a 7 or 8 overall

Reviews.Title: “More than expected”
Reviews.Author: anniet15
Reviews.Content: Husband and I never been to Vegas-read many reviews and found New York reviews better than average. We got a good deal with hotel and airfare. Room was average,very clean and quiet. We were on the 30th floor and had a great view of the strip. We had dinner at Nine Irishman-WAS GREAT! felt like we were in Ireland again. Staff were polite and helpful-I loved the "streets" of NY and the Brooklyn Bridge. We spent some time at the pool-adequate, but disappointed that the highest water level was 3.5 feet.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay - good comps!”
Reviews.Author: alyshiab
Reviews.Content: We stayed at NYNY from April 20-24. We stayed in a Park Avenue Room - which is the second cheapest room. It was fine. Our room was well equppied and clean. Bed was comfortable. Pillows were fine. I needed a blanket (instead of the down duvet) and one was brought to our room by housekeeping within minutes of me calling to request one. We had no issues with our room. The wireless internet worked well on our Iphone during our stay. Our room faced the Monte Carlo hotel and we used the Chrystler elevators just off the food area. It was a good "ward" of the hotel; close the food and not a far walk to the casino floor. We looked at the pool but did not swim. We did not try the rollercoaster. We did not visit the clubs. We saw Zumanity, the show showing at NYNY previously so we did not see it again. We ate at the pizza place. broadway burger; which was good (onion rings not so good), breakfast at Il Fornaio twice (it was yummy, good service on the patio). We enjoyed walking to the nearby hotels and visiting those casinos too. We went to the Luxor two mornings to play in the "cheap" ($35) poker tournament and one morning to the Monte Carlo to play theirs. NYNY does NOT have a poker room but the hotels around it do so no biggie. You do not get MLife points (or whatever they're called) for playing poker (excpt at Aria, so we're told), so it didn't matter where we played poker. At NYNY the casino area was VERY loud at night (until about 2 or 3am) with all the bars in the hotel with their different kinds of music playing loudly. But during the day, or quieter times, it's a very enjoyable casino to play in, high ceilings so the smoke doesn't bother you too much. Servers offering drinks on a regular basis (tipped $1 each time). The "rapid roulette" is fun (and pretty cheap at $2.50 min a go). We got very fair comps from NYNY (at least we thought they were) for the amount of time we felt we played with the MLife card at the various MGM family hotels. We got all of our food comp'ed (including a meal we ate at Monte Carlo) and our resort fees so we only ended up paying for our hotel nights, which was fine b/c we had planned to pay for those anyway. We then moved to the Golden Nugget for 3 nights and had a great time there too (even better comps!). Overall, NYNY was good and we'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: JLOMi
Reviews.Content: Check in was smooth, got a free upgrade since our rooms were not ready (asked for non-smoking, only smoking available). 5th floor adjoining rooms not too far from elevators. A view of the Coaster which we didn't mind. Room was clean and very comfortable. Valet service was top notch. Had a massage in the Spa, which topped off my trip. Did not use the pool, it was average, but not the dive some reviewers make it out to be. The high ceilings in the casino make it more tolerable from a non-smokers point of view. The one thing I would like to add to this hotel would be a non-smoking section for slot players. A lot of value for the money. Loved the NY theme and the great restaurants. They offer decent coupons at check in. If you are a sports fan, don't miss the Sporting House. Good food and a great view of the games. We will definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good big room, very friendly management staff”
Reviews.Author: UKTraveller2000
Reviews.Content: Good hotel, check location on strip to make sure it's okay for you, as it is on the end. We were upgraded on arrival as no suitable room was available for us which we booked. Staff were hesitant at first but manager was able to help. Large clean room, big and very clean bathroom with good amenities. Casino is okay. Dollar car rental is great, fab service. Food court and New Yodk themed area is great, so much choice and nice likely atmosphere in the day. ESP with 2 pubs and the duelling pianos!! Be aware of long check in queues but you get that anywhere in Vegas, as is the long walk to your room. Both standard for Vegas even the Bellagio has a queue and long walks. My advice is to hire a car in Vegas, see what you can do!!

Reviews.Title: “So Good they named it twice!”
Reviews.Author: KaizerSoze43
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife decided to go to Las Vegas for her 30th birthday. With so many hotels to chose from we used Trip Advisor to find the one best suited to us. In the end we ended up choosing between three middle of the range hotels. The New York New York, Planet Hollywood and the Golden Nugget. In the end we chose the New York New York. We flew from Dublin to Chicago and then from Chicago to Las Vegas. We got a taxi from the airport to our hotel for less than $20.00. It takes less than ten minutes to get to the strip from the airport too which is great. We arrived at the New York New York and walked across the casino to the check in counter. We were in our room and all with 5 minutes. We booked a package trip with a local tour operator and so our room was pre selected. We had a Broadway Deluxe room. It was pretty basic and a little dated. There were no upgrades available and so we didn't end up with a good view (some of these rooms have a view of the strip). To be honest we were not that bothered as we didn't plan on spending much time in the room. The hotel itself is amazing. The sheer size of all of the hotels on the strip takes some getting use to. Each one seems to try and out do the next which is great for the visitor! We were four days in Vegas and we were still only getting use to our hotel. The ground floor consists of the casino, a good nightclub, replica New York streets and multiple quality restaurants. The upper floor has shops and a disco bar (Coyote Ugly). The top level is where you get the roller coaster which you have to do if you are staying here. The pool area is small enough but well kept and a nice place to relax for a bit. The place is spotless and all the staff are very helpful and friendly. The hotel is ideally located at the southern end of the strip. There's the Mandalay Bay, then Luxor and then the New York New York. Directly opposite is the MGM Grand. As you walk north you come across the rest of the famous hotels, such as the Bellagio, Caesars Palace, The Venetian etc. Bring good walking shoes as there is so much to see and do here. The weather as you would expect was lovely and fresh in the day (not too hot) and nice and cool at night. A trip to downtown Vegas is highly recommended. It takes about ten minutes in a taxi and costs about $15 - $20. This is where the Golden Nugget hotel and the famous Fremont Street are located. Its much smaller than the strip and easier to get around, but there is still a lot to see and do here. Its also much better value for money. Two beers in most places on the strip were costing us between $12 - $14 which is not cheep. The food is a little pricey on the strip too, but they way we were looking at it was they put so much effort into the premises and service you don't mind paying a bit extra. The way they light up Fremont Street at night is also work a look. The hotel and everything about Vegas exceeded our expectations. The whole place is so clean, friendly and trouble free. Despite it being a 24 hour non stop city we never seen any hint of excessive drinking or trouble of any sort. You could easily bring kids here and have a good time (as long as they could manage the long flights). When I booked this I said it would be a once in a lifetime holiday, after this holiday I can definitely say that I will be back in Vegas sooner rather than later. P.S A visit to any of the Cirque du Soleil shows is a must while in Vegas. They make all other shows look amateurish. Viva Elvis in the Aria hotel is recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Good Value for Money, Very Nice Vibe”
Reviews.Author: Aussie_Travel_Writer
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the NYNY in Vegas in March 2011 after a road trip through Arizona. We booked the hotel over the phone a few days before the time, while in USA, and everything was done smoothly, efficiently and when we arrived at the hotel, our booking was in order and our room ready. The hotel clerk offered us various upgrade options which we declined (we were just going to sleep there afterall) but then he still upgraded us from a Standard Room to a Park View Room (not sure what the difference is...) which was nice of him. It was on the 16th floor which was a bit of a bummer as the free wifi signal was slow and intermittend - we got a much better signal on the ground level. Also, the "park view" was a view over a parking lot at the back of the hotel. It was a bit of a drag having to queue up to book in - there was quite a queue and after 1000's of km's on the road we were just wanting to get to our room, take a shower and veg out. This was not the situation only at NYNY though - we previously stayed at Excalibur and the same thing there. Queue and wait your turn... The room was spacious and clean. The furnishings and linen was in an almost new condition. The King size bed was HUGE! The bathroom was a bit cramped, but it had a bathtub as well as a shower, which was welcome. Our handcreams and goodies were replenished every day and our room cleaned to look like new again. We had more than enough towels, although they were quite small. In spite of the lack of a view, we had no complaints about the room. Although it lacked personal service, the hotel is well maintained and staff responded very quickly en efficiently to any requests. (One late night when we returned to our room, someone was sick in the hallway and hubby called the reception desk to let them know. Within 10 minutes, they were up there, washing the carpet). I guess it is difficult to get that personal touch in Vegas with so many thousands of people in the various hotels at any one time, but we still felt very well looked after. The NYNY is good value for money, although not the cheapest of the hotels. The Americana restaurant is open 24/7 and serve good meals at good prices, and always with a smile. Very few hotels actually offer free wifi internet (free internet does not equal free wifi internet - most of them are dial up for which you need a cable linked to a laptop). The free internet at NYNY is wifi and although we had a dodgy connection most of the time, we could go down to the ground floor, have a drink and surf the net. It was not super-fast, but not too bad either. When you stay at the NYNY you almost would not need to leave your hotel (if it was not for so many other attractions outside the doors!) The Bar at Times Square has a lively vibe for old & young alike. At some of the places in Vegas, you tend to feel a bit out of place if you're on the wrong side of 40, but this pub was just lovely. At the one night we were there, they had two guys playing pianos (two pianos head to head) and would play & sing any requests, obvisouly, like everything else in Vegas, at a generous tip - the higher your tip, the more likely they'd get to your request and the highest tip wins the closing song. After a few too many, someone paid $60 for the closing song which I can not even remember the name of. Between songs, the two guys would do a few comedy stints and even made fun of the songs they were signing. It was great entertainment, and everyone joined in the singing -even got up dancing! We did not want to leave, but had a show to go to. I'm not even going to try and comment on the decor - it was just brilliant (like all the resort hotels on the strip). It literally feels like you're walking down a street in New York. So much effort went into it. All in all, I would definitely go back to the NYNY - it was a very pleasant experience and right in the middle of the action.

Reviews.Title: “Watch out for hidden fees”
Reviews.Author: Vicki78232
Reviews.Content: I booked a package through Soutwest Vacations that included the airfair and hotel accomodations. Once I was checking in, I was notified that there would be a "resort fee" that I would have to pay per night. Even though I expressed that I was not interested in their Spa or business services, I still had to pay. I feel that this information should have been disclosed at the time I booked my reservation or else I would have selected another hotel without such hidden costs. Rooms were also outdated and needs a major renovation.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Lovetravcl
Reviews.Content: we had a enjoyable stay here ...although we upgraded our room for a small fee so that we could get a bit of the strip view and also a newer room ....overall the room was clean which is what matters and location wise perfect......i do think upon check in just have a look at the pics of the room at reception and see what they can do for you in terms of upgrades.....overall its a well maintained hotel....and do try their pizza

Reviews.Title: “Good - Not Phenomenal”
Reviews.Author: JA312
Reviews.Content: I've only been to Vegas once before and the last time I was there, I had stayed at Mandalay Bay. I booked this hotel b/c the price difference was significantly lower than MB and I had a large number of family members meeting us out there. I have to say that I was not entirely impressed with the hotel. Just be prepared - this hotel is noisy. If you book a room at this hotel, you need to decide what type of background noise you prefer - rollercoaster and screaming or a helicopter flying extremely close to your window. The NyNy hotel is quite impressive so there are constant helicopter tours flying close to and around the entire resort. The roller coaster is constantly going so you have to combine the noise of the actual rollercoaster plus the noise of the passengers screaming. Needless to say, we stayed on the 29th floor in NYA and ended up with the pleasure of both noises. I'm not a fussy traveler and I'm from NJ so it really didn't bother me but it did upset a lot of my other travelers who were not used to hustle and bustle. That being said, the pool has both so there is no relaxing poolside. The restaurants/bars at NyNy were FANTASTIC. The NY pizza restaurant was fabulous and not overpriced. The Japanese buffet had one of the best breakfast buffets I had ever eaten with an odd combination of egg foo young and fresh fruit. Il Fornio was a little fancier but the menu was a typical menu of an Italian Ny bistro. The Irish Pub was fantastic and has an outdoor eating area where you can still hear the live music. The only complaint I had with regards to any of the restaurants/bars was the atrocious sound of the singer at the dueling piano bar. I don't know what favor this hotels owes him in order for him to stay employed. I couldn't drink enough for him to sound decent. Nonetheless, it added another memory to the trip! :) Rok was also a very good nightclub and is highly recommended. NyNy is centrally located and is in walking distance to almost everything. ***Very Important - do not buy anything from NyNy's concierge desk!!!!! We wanted to go see Cirque du soleil's KA. We went to the concierge and they told us that it was $ 170.00 pp for these not so great seats. My husband whipped out his iPad and the tickets were $ 60 online and also available at the MGM concierge. For better seats, we bought the tickets for $ 60. Sidenote - 'KA' IS A MUST SEE!!! If you do anything in Vegas, see this show! Another Side note: I was planning this trip for a large family vacation and was very excited to see this hotel listed for $65pn. I booked a large amount of rooms and upon arrival, I learned that the hotel charges a 'resort fee' of $15 per room per night. This is a mandatory fee so make sure you are aware of this. It was my own fault that I did not read the fine print but ended up dropping an unexpected additional $ 60 for a 4 night package upon arrival.

Reviews.Title: “Typical Las Vegas Hotel”
Reviews.Author: smonroe13
Reviews.Content: I came to New York New York for my Wedding/Honeymoon We have reserved a Spa Suite about 4 months before our trip. When we arrived we had early check-in but there was not smoking room avaible, even asking if I came back at normal check-in would there be a smoking room avaible and still they said no. After a long discussing and expressing how displeased I was, the manager order 3 ashtrays to my room and allowed us to smoke on a non-smoking floor, which is great for us, but the people that want a non-smoking room after us probably won't like the smell. After our little problem with check-in everything else was perfect. Besides my loud neighbors but that is typical Las Vegas. The spa was wonderful after walking miles in Las Vegas. NOTE: All Spa Suites have a veiw of the moutains not the strip but still beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special”
Reviews.Author: Lounim
Reviews.Content: Nothing special here. It has an old tired Vegas look and furnishings to match. Wi-fi is free via the $15 per room resort fee. No real closets in our rooms, which was strange, only armoires. No coffee makers in the rooms, which can be extremely frustrating when waking up after staying out too late in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Holiday!”
Reviews.Author: Jenna89
Reviews.Content: we visitied the NYNY hotel in las vegas in june 2010, for 1 week. my partner emailed the hotel asking could they do anything for my birthday as it was my 21st, they upgraded our room free of charge for the whole stay and also gave us free vouchers to use in the hotel including credit, drinks, show tickets etc... We had a spa suite which was a lovley room, with a huge hottub to one side of the room, over looking vegas and the hotel rollercoaster and pool. which was lovley! The room was also Very large, with celing to floor windows and a huge comfy bed! The pool area was very very nice with alot of sunbeds a big pool and seperate spa area, also a bar at the side of the pool but they had waiters walkign around, also towels on entrance to pool. I cannot give a positive comment on the food in the hotel as i thought it was abit rubbish, also there is no buffet which i was surprised about! but with so much choice in vegas doubt you would stay in your hotel for food! The casino is huge and was cool and didnt smell of smoke like most of them! the hotel at the time had cirque de soile show on the sensual side of it, but i thought it was too sensual!!! and some times didnt know where to look!!! The hotel is a few mins taxi away from the airport, and you can see the airport from some angles of the hotel. the hotel has a huge feature of a roller coaster runing through and around the inside and outside of the hotel! also with the hotel having features inside such as times square! and a brilliant bar with duelling pianos! The hotel has a number of bars init such as coyote ugly! It also has a walk way direct into excalibour and MGM! Fab! Vegas its self is unbelievable and i will definatly visit again in a few years when even more has been developed! vegas has fab sun around 40-45 degrees in june when we was there, amazing shops! id recomend the outlet centre past downtown vegas its the best!, amazing food (rio and harrahs buffets best) , great people, amazing shows!

Reviews.Title: “Huge Rooms and great price”
Reviews.Author: uncommon-wanderer
Reviews.Content: Booked this through our Travel Agent who got us a great deal. Easy walking distance to both monorails. When we checked in the girl at the front desk upgraded our room and it was HUGE couldn't believed how much space there was. The hotel itself had lots of shops, bars and places to eat so that was really convenient and the pool area was nice with 3 spa's.

Reviews.Title: “Spa-Mania!”
Reviews.Author: Spa-Mainia
Reviews.Content: SPA-MANIA! Ok, so I'm a dinosaur...I have grown out of the gambling craze and usually go to Vegas with my wife or family just to get out of town and take a break. But I am one of those people who like to "watch people" more than spend money. I do not get as much thrill out of gambling these days as I do in watching other people go by or try their luck at the tables, slots or other diversion to be enjoyed. It's true that if you don't play you can't win. But it is just a certain that if you don't play you can't loose! I accompany my wife during her winning trips or dues paying trips to "sin city" as a reward for still working so hard during every other day or hours to make a living and I enjoy spending my time contemplating everyone that passes by. I am fascinated by all the various nationalities, sizes, actions, interactions, looks, interest, characteristics, attitudes and on and on. So what do I do for fun in Vegas, for relaxation and to come home with a pleasant memory? I go to the spas at each and every hotel that we stay in. And , for an hour or two I experience from beginning to end the wonder of being treated very well…VERY WELL…for very little cost. At having my own private or semi-private Steam Room, Dry Sauna, Jacuzzi, Shower, and special place to relax and ponder life or just unwind. All while getting some health benefits out of it and simply relaxing my cares and troubles away. Since I found this holistic therapeutic nirvana, this great tension reliever…and "happy place" and since I made the decision that I was going to take mental notes, absorb, evaluate and review each one. I have visited three in the Vegas area. Oh, sure I have gone to others in the past in Reno, Tahoe and elsewhere and probably even in Vegas. But that was some time ago and this is a new venture and a new enterprise and with the scarcity of visitors I have encounter at these wonderful places. I feel someone should reintroduce people to them and/or spread the great news about them. One has to begin somewhere so I am starting with my last three, most recent, visits. I believe in the KISS principle of Keep It Simple Stupid...so I will use these evaluation tools. 1- Great 2- Very Good 3- Good STAR POWER ** Places Visited to Date: Orleans MGM Grand New York, New York New York, New York SPA – Positives – All Spas are great places – but here are a few Pros & Cons Pros: Easy access, 1 $10.00 to use if you are staying at the casino 1 Located near the pool 1 Located off the gym 1 Service 1 Locking System Digital Snacks & Amenities 1 Sandals 1 Towels 1 Showers 1 Cons: Size 3 Feeling of Privacy (your happy place) 3 Floor Plan 3 Storage for gear 2 Attitude of Staff 2 Dry Sauna 2 Wet Sauna 2 Evaluation – For the price you cannot beat this one…it is as with “every spa experience” I have had over the last year or so...a good one overall…and a great way to pamper yourself for an hour or so. After you follow the signs to the Spa you enter the office, are greeted, sign in, pay, walk through another door, turn left through a small portion of the gym facility turn another corner and enter the Spa area, were you are greeted by someone who will take your receipt, give you a pair of sandals, show you the lockers and how to work the locking mechanism and explain the facility. After that you are free to roam and enjoy as long as you like and return if you so desire or if you have the inclination. The floor plan here is pretty simple and smaller than the other two i have visited. The dry sauna, wet sauna, restrooms and showers are right next to the entry and attendants desk (which is why a # 3 for floor plan) which does not give you that inner or personal sense of being in “your” private space but more like being exposed to him/them and other entering new visitors, during most of your Spa experience. I would put that reception area out in the weightroom to provide the autonomy most people like if it were me. Further back are the lockers, mirrors, TV area and snacks and furthest back still is the Jacuzzi; which do offer more autonomy to the spa-surfers. All the other amenities for hygienic issues are there for use in the showers, changing and sink areas. The dry sauna was not quite hot enough as when you are in there you want to have it rolling off you body, but it was clean and acceptable. The wet sauna automatically regenerated itself but the benches/seats were lower than usual and kept you beneath the real wet heat that is most people want when using a sauna. All in all however, as I said earlier, all spa experiences are something to be enjoyed and savored and I certainly enjoyed this one and highly recommend its use. Yet in the big picture evaluation of the three I have enjoyed so far this New York, New York experience would fall 3rd or 3. The Spa Dude…Jim Ledbetter Sr.

Reviews.Title: “Pool was above garbage tunnel..stunk!”
Reviews.Author: FLAbchgirl
Reviews.Content: We had a jacuzzi in the room which was great (paid alot extra for it), but it was situated outside the peak of the rollercoaster. Then out at pool it stunk so bad we didnt stay out long. The lifeguard told us it was because the garbage for the entire hotel was tunneled and stored under the pool deck. BAD choice. will not stay again. Mirage is where we would stay next time. Better location. You get what you pay for...even in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back (booked for October)”
Reviews.Author: West_coast_wanderer0
Reviews.Content: I did not spend nearly enough time at the hotel. My schedule was booked solid all over town. But I really like this place and have already made my return reservations. When I arrive on a Sunday at about 2PM I was expecting a lineup. Only 3 people and I was at the desk in minutes. The clerk was very friendly and answered all my questions with a smile. I asked how much to upgrade from a spa suite to the Marquis and it was $20 a night. Big deal. The same room I had here would cost me $500 a night at home in Vancouver. A bargain. Great room. clean colorful huge comfortable and quiet. The hotel itself is a good location to explore the south end of the strip. Good overpasses and some trams at neighbouring hotels which make it quite easy to get around. As mentioned I did not spend a lot of time here but I did try the Black and Blue burger at Broadway shortly after arriving and it was delicious. I am going to have another. I did not go to the pool. I can do that anytime anyplace so it is not a big attraction for me. And why go to a crowded hot tub when you have one in your living room? I am 50 and did not really want to spend a bunch of time with the 20 somethings. My only complaint - and it is a minor one - is one night after lots of walking I was looking for a quiet place to unwind and spend a few bucks on the slots. I could not find an empty bar seat anywhere. It was spring break so I guess that was to be expected. Busy all over town. Anyways, I was very happy with my choice of hotels. I have stayed at Monte Carlo and Treasure Island before but much prefer this hotel. Great service and lots of character.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: Tooshkin30
Reviews.Content: Great Location and Quite clean A bit on the pricey side, but worth it Heaps of entertainment downstairs but don't try the cincin restaurant! Totally disgusting and a waste of money for breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “eat,drink at Nine Fine Irishmen pub”
Reviews.Author: cidertom
Reviews.Content: Staff remember you. Good Food, better drink. Great place

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: JamesandSam
Reviews.Content: Having read some of the reviews - we were a bit concerned. But as usual, it was a complete waste of energy - the hotel was great. First of all the location is spot on. The Hotel is pretty much in the main area of the strip, its linked by a footbridge across to the MGM and also straight down on to the other side of the strip. Secondly the facilities are also perfect. People have complained that there are no tea and coffee making facilities - but why do you need them when there is a Costa IN THE HOTEL. Every morning, my husband would pop down and get a coffee and Earl Grey Tea - perfect. The room was lovely and we were on the 34th floor. Did not have a strip view but that was not a problem because you have a fantastic view as far as the eye can see. The room was kept spotless. The Casino, and the New York street effect are just fab. Yes, the Casino looks dated but I think its trying to be that 'seedy New York' style and worked well. The restaurants and bars are fab too. Neither of us smoke and I thought that this would be a problem - but because the ceilings in the Casino's etc are so high, and the air conditioning is so good you did not even notice. We requested a non-smoking room and that is what we got. No problems checking in or out. We were offered an upgrade to Broadway Delux for an extra £10 per night which we took. Easy to get around once you know where your lift is. All the staff were helpful, and its great that you have Dollar Car Hire right in the hotel. This was our first time in Las Vegas and was just amazing. The whole place is just great! Had a fantastic time - helped by having a fabby hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Themed Hotel just Outside the Centre”
Reviews.Author: Benjamin_S
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 5 nights as our friends were getting married nearby. We wanted a reasonably priced themed hotel on the strip. Arrival We took a taxi from the airport, plenty waiting outside. It cost $14 (without tip) and took about 5-10 minutes. We asked him to go via Tropicana Avenue as we heard they try to go via the tunnel which costs more. Location The location of the hotel is not right in the centre, probably about a 15/20 minute walk to Caesars Palace. It’s opposite the MGM Grand, M&M World, Coca Cola shop and The Hard Rock Cafe. Hotel The hotel is huge, lots of bars and restaurants, casino, amusements, shops, swimming pool, events desk. It was a very clean hotel and even though smoking is permitted inside it didn’t really smell of smoke. There is a resort fee of about $13 a day, apparently this is for use of the swimming pool and internet of which we used neither. We knew this before we went so were expecting it but I still think it’s a con as not all hotels charge it. Room Our room (2262) had a view of the strip to the left and the MGM to the front. It was a nice sized room with 2 very comfortable queen beds. There was a television, safe, ironing board, iron, hair dryer and alarm clock. A downside was there were no tea & coffee facilities or a fridge/mini bar in the room, however there were vending machines just down the hall. There was an adequate amount of storage space. There were a few toiletries provided in the bathroom. The room had climate controls which were easy to use and efficient. Food & Drink There’s a New York pizza place upstairs, ideal for a snack after coming back from a night out. Plenty of other places to eat, all looked pretty good. Drinks inside aren’t cheap, same as the other hotels. Little kiosks outside the hotel sell ice cold beers for $5 each which you can take inside. Staff The staff at the reception desk were very welcoming and polite as were most of the hotel staff. Some of the croupiers and bar staff could be a bit rude but again this was typical of most of the hotels on the strip. Miscellaneous - The roller coaster in the hotel was excellent, $14 each but well worth it. - Bellagio fountain show was excellent, starts after 3pm. - We watched the volcano show at the Mirage at 11pm then went next door to Treasure Island, their show starts soon after at 11.30pm. - We went to The Wynn for a champagne buffet after our friends wedding. It was about $65 each but was excellent quality. - The “welcome to fabulous Las Vegas” sign is about a 25 minute walk down the strip from the hotel. Overall We had an excellent time in Las Vegas and glad we chose New York New York as our Hotel. I would definitely recommend staying here but just be aware of the compulsory resort fee and its location of about 15/20 minutes walk from the centre.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and recommended!”
Reviews.Author: Poochifur
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights - our first trip to Vegas. Location is fab, right on the strip opposite MGM and just down from Caesars etc. Room was clean, spacious and quiet (no view of the strip) with all amenities you'd need. Reception were helpful and courteous, staff friendly. We didn't gamble but there was plenty of other stuff to do in Vegas :) Very much recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel..Great Time”
Reviews.Author: evolzam
Reviews.Content: We just got back from LV and NYNY...we Loved the hotel...we had a players suite in the new yorker towers (2755) check in was a breeze, the room was huge,and clean. We had great service throughout our stay. The maids always had the room spottless, lots of towels and toiletries on hand. The pool was open and we used it every day, it doesnt get full sun until about 12:30pm, and it does get noisy with the roller coaster, but I didnt mind as my other option was to be at home in the cold and working!!! We ate in the hotel quite a bit, and never had a bad meal there. We ate at America.Chin Chin,Sirricos Pizza (many times...loved it)and broadway burgers (fantastic) every morning we had coffee and coissants (cant remember the name of the coffee place) it was great coffee. We loved this hotel, and after seeing the other hotels on the strip, were very happy we had stayed here, as the other hotels were too big and you felt lost, where as in NYNY you feel more cozy and welcomed. Lots of stores to shop in, and souvenirs were not badly priced (although we didnt purchase any in the hotel...right across the street are many souvenir shops) Didnt go into any of the clubs or bars, as our kids came with us, but the bar at Times Square was always buzzing with people and looked like a lot of fun. All staff we came into contact with (bellboy,maids,waiters,waitresses, etc) were absolutely wonderful. It is in a perfect location on the strip, and close to lots of shopping, souvenir shops,tram and other hotels We cant say enough good things about this hotel , and will definetly be back!!

Reviews.Title: “Met all expectations”
Reviews.Author: Toowoombatourist
Reviews.Content: My husband & I travelled to USA for my son's wedding in Las Vegas. We stayed Feb 7th - 11th 2011 at New York, New York in a spa suite. We had stayed in Vegas five years ago, so we had an idea where we wanted to stay, position - wise on The Strip. Both check-in and check-out were smooth (though the resort fee covered things that we did not need or want).The actual room was a pleasant surprise - quite spacious, tastefully decorated and well situated in the complex as a whole. The Hotel is positioned almost perfectly - everything is within an easy walk even late at night. Aside from the wedding, our stay included some sightseeing out to Hoover Dam, a little shopping in the new centres on The Strip and at the outlet malls and taking in some of the wonderful shows at the other Hotels - all of these were easily achievable from the central location. The room itself included a king size bed, ample cupboards, a well appointed bathroom and a nice sized spa in the bedroom space. The room we had didn't have a great view but we spent very little time there, so that wasn't a deal breaker for us. We ate at both resaurants in the complex and in nearby Hotels and enjoyed having such variety at our fingertips. Gambling wasn't high on our list of things to do, but the casino itself didn't appear overly busy whenever we passed through. All in all we had a very enjoyable stay.....I would recommend this hotel as great value for money if you are looking for a tasteful, well positioned property in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Average Stay”
Reviews.Author: heidiho
Reviews.Content: Early check-in was no problem. Greeted with shooters while in line, which wasn't too long at all. Stayed in Empire tower, which was excellent. Right next to desk, pool and entrances. Room was big, but a little dated, especially the bedding and the TV, but clean and really nothing wrong wit it. It was like an average canadian hotal room, just a little bigger. Every now and then you could hear the roller coaster, but really wasn't an issue. THe pool is nice, but doesn't get sun until around one, which was a bit of a drag. Great location. Bus stop across the road at MGM, tram across the street at excalibur and on main drag if you were to rent a car. If your not looking for anything fancy - good place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Tattoos, Limos, VIP Champagne Service, Zipline experience..AMAZING!”
Reviews.Author: armeegurl
Reviews.Content: This was my 6th trip to Vegas. I have stayed at MGM, Orleans, Treasure Island and Excalibur. We travelled with a bunch of 30 somethings for a 30th Bday and the bday girl was set on staying at NYNY. Check-in was smooth and we were given a connecting room to our friends and our other friends were given a room next to ours..so it was appreciated that they kept us in the same area. PROS: Rollercoaster was a blast, there was a really cute employee of the ROK Nightclub who hung out at the slush bar that gave out free bracelets to get into Coyote Ugly and ROK - CU was a really small and kind of annoying. ROK was a great club with great music, free champagne (although not tasty)..but we had a great time dancing the night away. The BEDS! OHHH they are SO comfy - it was the first time in Vegas I ever slept in, we all agreed they were great. The restaurant America was awesome, we drank momosa's in the morning with eggs benedict - delicious!! And failry priced. The pizza joint is also great and quick. CONS: Security is at a minimum. In all the other hotels I have stayed in, you needed to show a card to get to the elevator - there was no security on any of the nights we went out and came back and I ran into two young girls on our floor who had got out of the elevator and been followed by some guy who tried to follow them to their room. Another CON, the room was not clean - our room was at the part where the rollercoaster goes up the hill and we could barely see it because the windows were filthy, the edges of the room were filthy with dust build up and on day two I had to chase down house cleaning to give us clean cups and towels - they seemed annoyed. The staff tried to upcharge the last group that came in and when they declined, they gave it to them for free anyways - nice jesture but just a note to take if you are going out there. The bathrooms are not the 'Vegas' bathrooms I have seen at the other hotels I have stayed at. We took the deuce down to Freemont, then realized on our way back that it was cheaper to take a limo back with our group. HIGHLY recommend ziplining through Freemont - what an amazing experience for under twenty bucks. It was my first evening experience on Freemont and I would not recommend going by yourself - it is very entertaining, but a little shadey. We celebrated the bday dinner at Houe of Blues and enjoyed great food, great service and awesome blues music. We were sad that we missed them singing Happy Bday as we had to leave to get to the next event. There are SO many things to do in Vegas and NYNY was a great location, especially for first timers as it was on the four corners of Tropicana, Excalibur and MGM. I don't think I would go back to NYNY as I did not find there was anything really special about it that made me feel like my stay was appreciated. The security and cleanliness was an issue for me too...had I been looking for a romantic weekend away, I would suggest MGM. I did use the gym and it served its purpose. It overlooked the pool, which was empty, so I assume work was being done on it (resort fee was charged).

Reviews.Title: “The Kids were entertained at the Huge Arcade while we gambled”
Reviews.Author: tripmakerNtaker
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed everything at this hotel from the choice of restaurants to the entertainment for kids. We have a teen and a tween and our 11 year old said this was the best arcade ever! We looked for a place to keep our boys entertained while we played. There is also a little bridge walkway to MGM and close to other major casinos. The room was pretty clean, but thought the bathroom sink could of been cleaner. Room did not smell of smoke and air worked ok. The only complaint I would really have is the front desk check in where we did not encounter a very friendly and welcoming person. Overall, we enjoyed New York and the rest of the staff were helpful.

Reviews.Title: “not a bad place to stay.... l"”
Reviews.Author: BROOKLYNLIZZIE
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at New York, NY..... would I come back?? Not sure yet.. I will say that the Staff was great and the restaurants are top notch. Gallaghars steak house is not to be missed. My complaints... the bedding was really dated and worn out. For such a beautiful room, this is not acceptable. The hotel really needs to invest money in new bedding. I also asked for a room far away from the roller coaster..... they said just ask for that upon arrival. WELL....... as far as I can see.... no such room exists. The dANG roller coaster surrounds the entire hotel. Would have like to have been infomred about this. In the Casino..... my complaint was the Roulette table..... its run by a computer instead of a real wheel and a ball. Thats just terrible.. Pretty low rent. But overall... not the worst hotel I've ever stayed at. Just not the best.

Reviews.Title: “Very responsive to my forgetfulness”
Reviews.Author: Rarm13
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my three day stay at this hotel. I had dinner at one of their restaurants and walked out leaving my credit card on the table. I did not realize it until I returned home to Ohio. I called the hotel and they promptly confirmed that they had my card and mailed it to my home. I was very pleased with this service as I did not have to go thru the aggravation of canceling my card.

Reviews.Title: “gorgeous”
Reviews.Author: h-inaba
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very gorgeous. Given us good service.

Reviews.Title: “WHAT A TRIP!!!”
Reviews.Author: bigdaddyj73
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed and had ALOT of fun at NYNY for our anniversary. Right from our plane we checked into the hotel and straight down to the spa for a couples massage and sit in the steam room for a bit. It was a great experience all on it's own. We both thought the spa and the people who worked there top notch. My wife came back down the next morning to have a mani/pedi done by Annie at the spa and thought she was FANTASTIC. We ate breakfast at America inside the hotel two days for breakfast, the food is very good but not compared to Gallagher's... We at Gallagher's Steak House inside the hotel on our anniversary... the staff and food were amazing. You can't go wrong staying at this place.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!!”
Reviews.Author: Dayna75_11
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights last week (incl Fri & Sat nights), really friendly staff, upgraded our room upon arrival and allowed us an early check-in with no extra fee. Room was great - awesome view.....comfy comfy bed!! Everything is in this hotel......gaming, restaurants(1 open 24hrs!!!!), cafe's, bars, kids entertainment area, roller coaster, valet parking and has connecting walkways to Excalibur & MGM Grand. Did I mention I'm not a gambler?? My husband is though & we would stay here again and I would be happy to take our daughter - there is so much to see & do - M&M World is across the road (4 floors of everything/anything M&M - YUMMO!)......Lions at MGM Grand.....walk to the Bellagio Fountain show at night. And I never felt unsafe - awesome.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, great staff,great holiday!”
Reviews.Author: patphil71
Reviews.Content: just returned from the new york new york,my wife and i could not really fault this hotel.we arrived after the 10 hour flight a little weary, but the check -in was really fast and efficient,we asked for a strip view, this was no problem. we stayed in the new yorker tower,the room was very clean and overlooked the strip and part of the roller coaster,we had no real noise from the ride,we think it stopped at 11pm anyway! all the staff right up from bell boys,reception,security,bars and shop staff could not have been more helpful and friendly(british hotels could learn a thing or two from this hotel!!) situated up one of the strip opposite the MGM grand, a lot of walking is required to see the rest of the sights,but the bus service (which actually stops opposite the hotel) is good and frequent, you can buy tickets for 2 hours or 24 hours . all in all an excellent hotel at a good price. one thing to keep in mind is there is no tea or coffee making facilities in the rooms, we think this is fairly general in most other vegas hotels.

Reviews.Title: “staff went above and beyond for us”
Reviews.Author: teacherpat56
Reviews.Content: We were a group of six ladies on vacation mainly to sightsee and enjoy the shows. The rooms we had in Century Tower were spacious, clean and comfortable. Noise was never a problem. We enjoyed having so many reataurants close by and all we tried were good. We bought all our show and tour tickets from the hotel. The lady who waited on us was very patient and helpful. Show prices were comparable to those I had found on the internet but the tour tickets were quite a bit more. We were very glad we had bought them from the hotel, however, when one of our party got sick and ended up in hospital. The tour and business staff went above and beyond to get refunds for our sick friend on non-refundable tickets trhat saved her hundreds of dollars. They also paid for taxis for us back and forth to the hospital for two days. They could not have been more helpful. We were very impressed! Although this hotel is at the end of the strip, taxis and buses are reasonble. I would avoid the Deuce at night -to say it's crowded is an understatement. All in all, we had a great time and everyone at this hotel was wonderful.( ALL the hotels that charge the resort fee really need to re-think it. It is rediculous.)

Reviews.Title: “Loved staying at NY NY”
Reviews.Author: oodee
Reviews.Content: We came mid week so the price was great. Loved all the options to eat at the casino. Fun atmosphere the Times Square Bar was great even on a Monday night, felt like the weekend. Stopped by for a Craps lesson during the day, played that night and had a great time. We'll definatley be back.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings. Started off rocky but got better.”
Reviews.Author: jlk813
Reviews.Content: Booked 2 non-smoking rooms 8 months in advance and paid the $20.00 for early check in. When we arrived they could not accommodate our room requests, stating they didn't have 2 N/S rooms near each other. So we took one smoking room. Big mistake. The smell was horrible and after insisting on speaking with the manager, our request for a N/S room was accommodated with an upgrade. So, I was able to see both Park Avenue and Broadway rooms in Empire and Century towers. Empire tower is small so not a lot of walking to your room. Century is very nice as well. Both rooms were clean and nicely decorated. Size was only difference. The extra space in the Broadway room was nice. All staff were helpful and friendly. Dealers were awful. Not friendly at all. Hotel was small so it was easy to get around and didn't have to walk for miles. I was worried about the coaster outside the room but you can't hear it at all. If you take a cab from the airport, don't use the interstate. Go the back road. It is cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great staff and great resturants”
Reviews.Author: usahal
Reviews.Content: My wife and spent the New Years weekend, we had a wonderful time. The staff made sure our New Year started off great. We are coming back to NY NY in April, 2011, we truly enjoy this hotel and have recommended it to many of our friends and associates, who have also enjoyed their stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Not a good enough NY feel for the hefty NY price!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Brandon1523
Reviews.Content: Fourth time in Las Vegas was the charm I guess! I stayed at NYNY ready to experience the hype of a rollercoaster going around the hotel! The lights and NY pizza the city that never sleeps! Failed! This hotel was very outdated and very dim and gloomy I loved the food but as far as hotel not so much. Let start with service it was ok at best room service stole my iPod touch they where often late and they weren't thorough! Check in took 30 min and then we were told we had to pay 20+ dollars for wifi and bottled water! WOW.... Night clubs were ok in this hotel nothing I would visit more then once but they where ok the most fun we had was hanging outside the bar in the middle of the casino. The hotel is at the end of the strip so with the downside of the hotel and then the poor location when comparison to all other hotels this was not a great stay and wouldn't be one of my first 5 choices going back!

Reviews.Title: “Run down and needs renewal”
Reviews.Author: Bagley27
Reviews.Content: My four day tradeshow stay at NYNY revealed dirty linens, hallways that reeked of B.O. and stale cigarettes. No coffee pot in rooms, Spartan amenities for $225/nite. This hotel is a tired, sore corner of the strip. The casino area is rank, and leaves me feeling unclean. Yuck.

Reviews.Title: “The State that never Sleep's”
Reviews.Author: MelanieS125
Reviews.Content: Loved all the sites and the roller coster they have it is one of the fastest in the world.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT STAY AT NYNY”
Reviews.Author: jbjgroupie4
Reviews.Content: Reserved a Park Avenue room for $166 on Saturday 3/19/11. In town for the Bon Jovi concert at MGM, so we were only there for one night. We go to Vegas once a year, but have never stayed at this property before. Needless to say, we were pleasantly surprised. Check in was quick and easy and the rooms were clean, spacious, with modern/relaxing decor. Lots of restaurants/bars to choose from and found some reasonably priced souveniers in the gift shop. It was an easy walk over to MGM for the concert. Did the express check out (super easy!) & only paid $11 (plus tip) for our taxi ride back to the airport. We had some friends staying at Excalibur & boy, what a difference between the two properties! Their decor was dark, outdated, shabby, dingy.....kind of depressing! Not to mention, our friends were acosted by time share people every time they walked through the lobby. NYNY was a great choice for us and we look forward to staying here again next time we're in town.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: os6742
Reviews.Content: Went with a few college friends that hadn’t gotten together in a while. We were in two separate rooms (one was upgraded, one wasn’t) but I didn’t really notice a significant difference other than a few extra feet of space. Overall the hotel was very nice and clean – the only issue we had the room was with the water pressure, but otherwise we were pleasantly surprised by the comfort of the room in generally (especially the beds). The casino itself was one of my favorites on the strip, and has a great selection of games to play. We were there on the weekend and were readily able to find a place to sit down at any hour of the night. As far as night life goes, I would suggest avoiding NY NY’s ‘Rok Vegas.’ If you are under the age of 30, head to Hard Rock or the Palms if you are looking for a club – best part is you could split about 20 cabs for the amount of money you save by staying at NY NY instead of one of those places. Overall, would definitely go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!! Would definitely recommend!!”
Reviews.Author: Azeret
Reviews.Content: Overall I was pretty impressed with this hotel! We arrived late in the evening and had no problems at all checking-in. The front desk staff were extremely helpful. We were a group of 6 and they had already allocated everyone (except me & my husband to the same floor). Right away they said they would move us and even upgraded us to a Park Ave room when the type we had booked wasn’t available on that floor. The room itself was pretty much as depicted on their website, so no surprises. It was clean and bright and I had no complaints at all. To be honest I hardly spend any time in my room at all. We had a view of the Exaclibur, part of the MGM and the rollercoaster. It was fun watching people scream as the rollercoaster went by, but it was never disturbing as they stopped it around 11pm each night and it didn’t start again until around 10am. The pool was closed during my stay, but we were allowed access to the pools at the Excalibur and the Monte Carlo. It was convenient having a variety of restaurants/food court within the hotel to suit all needs – i.e if you want a quick bite to eat you can grab a slice of pizza, or hit up the deli…but there are sit-down restaurants as well if you prefer (we tried Gonzales y Gonzales which was pretty good! - great margaritas!). The casino always seemed to be lively and had a good atmosphere – I even won some $$ at the slots. CHA-CHING!!! Overall 2 thumbs up!

Reviews.Title: “This time the service was disappointing.”
Reviews.Author: missedme
Reviews.Content: This was the third time I have stayed at the New York New York and I was very disappointed by the service this time. First off when I first booked my room I did so online and then less than a day later I received a M-life players club email with a better deal. I phoned the customer service desk to ask about changing my reservation and they told me over the phone that that particular deal was already sold out due to room availability. I didn't believe that so my husband called back with his own offer number and booked the room without any issues whatsoever. I immediately called back and cancelled my original reservation. Second, when we arrived they charged us an extra $20 for arriving early. We were 15 minutes before 12pm and they went through the entire booking before they told us they were charging us the extra money. Apparently 12pm is check in time without getting charged. Thirdly, we asked for two queen beds in our room. When we got to our room it was a single king. Not a huge deal but a little annoying after the two previous incidents. Fourth thing was we had called down to guest services the afternoon before to get a late check out. Of course that was another $20. Then the last day as we were getting ready in our room the cleaning ladies came into our room! Aside from the "pleas don't disturb" on the outside of door shouldnt guest services had let them know about late check outs? It was real disappointing for this trip because I loved this hotel so much on previous visits and much preferred this place over other hotels on the strip. This last visit isn't enough for me not to come back here. One last disappointment was the Burger Bar and Grill is changed to a fancier burger place. It is nowhere near as good as it was. And way over priced!

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back!!”
Reviews.Author: emmastudentnurse
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the NY NY for a week at the beginning of march with 6 friends and have to say i loved every minute of our stay there. When we arrived we found check-in very quick and hassle free, and the staff were very friendly and helpful. I really liked the layout of the hotel's casino with the central bar smack in the middle of the casino this would be our groups meeting point ready for a night out. We ate at the hotel most evenings and although a little expensive at some places the quality of food was very good, and if your looking to save money just accross the road there are loads of fast food places such as Mcdonalds, burger king, subway etc... The pubs and clubs at the hotel are also really good only downside to the coyote ugly bar was there was no toilet inside the club and you would have to venture downstairs to the casino for this and if your like me when you've had a few beers this turns into a frequent occurrence and kind of spoils the night. The nine fine irishman well what can i say a truly good pub with an amazing atmosphere, they had a fundraising event while i was there to raise money for childrens cancer (St Baldricks day) and this just showed the hotel's spirit and generosity. I had never even been inside a casino untill going to Vegas and the staff are more than happy to teach you how to play the games, i've got quite good at playing black jack now after the staff teaching me how to play at 6am on my way back from a night out LOL (and i won a few quid!!). The location of this hotel couldn't be better, your linked to the MGM via a walkway over the road, and taxi's were cheap and available at all hours of the day from just outside the main reception $18 from the NY NY to the statosphere which is at the other end of the strip so not bad! If you want to hire a limo don't go to reception to enquire they are expensive, i stopped to talk to the driver of one in the srip one afternoon and hired his 20 seater hummer limo for an hour that evening this cost us $170 between us all, his nane is john and if you want the number then get in touch (he also drives Tom Jones around when he's in town!). All in all we had a fantastic time here and cant wait to go back! would i stay here again? YES! would i recommend to a friend? most definatley. Only critisism is............. BEWARE of all the prostitutes roaming around the casino they are everywhere!!

Reviews.Title: “Waste of Money for What you get - Even with upgrades”
Reviews.Author: ArizonaEddie1982
Reviews.Content: My Partner and I went to LV and stayed at the NY NY Hotel & Casino, now we went March 5-6 which was during Nascar Weekend, so it was a busy weekend, because we are M Life Members we actually got a nice deal, $54.00 for SATURDAY NIGHT and FREE for SUNDAY NIGHT with $50 cash back in bonus play (NOT BAD!!) plus the $15.00 per night resort fee. I have never stayed nor has he stayed at the NY NY Hotel before, but being frequent visitors to the Las Vegas area we decided why not. When we got there, the self parking is adequate, very quick walk to the hotel and registration. They didn't have a room for us, so they bumped us up from the Park Avenue Room to what they call an upgraded room to a Broadway Room. There was no difference between the two other than the decor. Well we got to our room, it was okay in size, very drafy, the bathroom was something out of the 1980s, brass EVERYWHERE. We called to complain that the shower was a little small (being tall and all) and they said that for an additional $78.00 per night we can upgrade, well we decided not to, because that was more than what our deal was and wasnt worth it. All in all, when taking a shower it filled the bathtub up, i felt like i was in a swimming pool, for whatever reason it did not want to go down and i even tried to fix it and called to have it fix, but same problem. The toilet backsplashes you when you flush (GROSS) . I would recommend this hotel to anyone. Since it is part of the MGM network i expected a little more. While we were in the casino, on Sunday night/Monday morning (now slower than Saturday) the Fire Alarm went off 3 separate times... VERY ANNOYING. The service sucked, the cocktail waitresses took 20 minutes to get to us and I did have to hit "service" on one of the slots because it was not accepting my "$50 bonus play" .. it took the attendant just as long as the cocktail waitress.. ridiclous. Now i have stayed at MGM resorts before, I would recommend if your going to spend the money, this NY NY Room goes for about $129 regularly (not with the deal i got) so i'd spend it at the Mirage (center strip) or the Luxor (tower room only) you will get your money's worth, otherwise I do not recommend gambling, or even eating or staying at the NY NY ** by the way we did e-mail the hotel and M Life Players Club and they wound up sending us a coupon for a "FREE NIGHT" in the Park Avenue Deluxe .. (the same room we had originally wanted, and didn't get)... Not good enough for me if you want me back.

Reviews.Title: “You DON'T get what you ask for, or anything EXTRA!”
Reviews.Author: MScholle
Reviews.Content: We arrived at New York New York excited about our vacation in Las Vegas. When we approached the desk to check in we were ready for a QUICK and EASY check in and to get our room keys. We booked the trip with another couple and had requested 2 months before the trip to be on the same floor with king beds in both rooms. Upon making the request we were told that it would work out just fine and that we would get EVERYTHING taken care of at check in. We then called New York New York two days before our flight to double check that we were going to be able to be on the same floor as our friends and we were told that all was taken care of and that everything would be ready for us upon check in. When we arrived NONE of our requests were met. The people were extremely rude and had a take it or leave it attitude. ROBERT, a customer service rep, was very rude and seemed put off by our requests.
