He treated us like children, even though we are in are late 20's. He brought ROSIE over, the front desk manager who was equally as rude and tried to appease us by giving us drink coupons. Her exact words were "Here are 4 drink coupons PER ROOM for the ROK club" and then she waived our resort fee. However, after waiving the fee she took our resort coupon book back that had coupons for restaurants and shops and only gave us 4 drink coupons total and not 4 per room. We were told we would have to wait until the next day to get room changes. We then asked to speak to the General Manager, his name was CHARLES. Charles tried to make it right, but after the HOUR we spent checking in, it was too little too late. The first impression left a horrible taste in our mouths and even when we tried to switch rooms the next day they tried to give us double beds and give us the lowest quality they had, instead of meeting our requests. It was a horrible experience, ROBERT and ROSIE we completely unprofessional and WE WILL NEVER GO BACK!

Reviews.Title: “Fun Hotel & Casino”
Reviews.Author: jennewby71
Reviews.Content: This was my first time at this hotel. The room was very clean, decent size and comfortable. The only complaint I had about the room was that the walls are very thin. So much so, that in the middle of the night when the next door neighbors were talking, It woke me up out of a dead sleep because I thought they were in our room! The people next to us weren't loud in any way, just talking with one another, so it startled me. I didn't stroll into our room until the wee hours of the night, so the neighbors being up at a normal hour, forced me to wake up earlier that I would have liked. But the room was very nice other than that and the casino was a lot of fun. We ate at some of the small restaurants there in the hotel and all of those were good. Overall I really enjoyed our stay here, just wish the walls were a bit thicker in the rooms. I was traveling with a friend so we were there to party so it wasn't too bad. If I was to return to Vegas with my husband, I'd stay at Venetian, not here. But this is a great place for a fun time with friends.

Reviews.Title: “Dont like it!!!”
Reviews.Author: alexzhdanov
Reviews.Content: Extremelly need rlbe renovated hotel with rude staff and lines. Be ready wait check-in for 1 hour and have no your room type, upgradd for charge.))) totally disappoitment.

Reviews.Title: “Fairly nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: likes2garden
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and two teenagers just got back from a 4 night stay in a Broadway room. It was not a bad room and the hotel has several things to do (like the roller coster) and several places to eat. The beds were queen size and fairly comfortable. We got a better deal later after we had already booked the room so we were able to save about $150 off the original price-it helps to join their club group online. The things we didn't like about the room was that the only sink was inside the bathroom so you couldn't brush your teeth, or put on make up while someone else was in the bathroom. Also, there is no vent in the bathroom so it can get pretty steamy after a couple of showers. If you don't mind driving and parking for the day at another hotel (usually free) -you could stay at the Orleans instead-they have a nice breakfast buffet and it is cheaper to stay at and not a bad room. The Mirage is very nice and centrally located and has a very good buffet-it is more expensive but you could walk to alot ot the major hotels without having to drive much. All in all we enjoyed it but just would have been nice to be more toward the center of the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Loved NYNY!”
Reviews.Author: Linz_191
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with 2 friends for 7 nights and loved it. Check in and Check out were easy. The location on the strip is great. We loved the amount of places in the hotel to eat and used them a lot as the prices were reasonable. Roller coaster was awesome. Rooms are basic but clean. Pool was small for the size of the hotel but we were able to use the pool at Monte Carlo too which was great. Also loved the Bar at Times Square! Will definitely return to this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “A great experience”
Reviews.Author: JanetLJ
Reviews.Content: We were booked for two nights at New York-New York by my husband's daughter, as an anniversary gift and we loved it. The driving access is easy, on Tropicana and right off I-15. Our room was in the Park Avenue section, which is very easy access off the main lobby by the casino section. We liked that the casino is there, but you aren't forced into it at every turn as in some Vegas hotels. What we loved best was the "Village Street" section, which is really the food court but laid out as a street scape (a bit like Main Street at Disneyland - but all indoors!). There are "sidewalk" tables everywhere so you get what you want and find a table that suits you. We tended to sit near the Times Square piano bar in the evening because you could hear the music. The piano bar itself is half seating --which must be reserved and paid for -- and half standing. Standing is free, and actually the better spot if you get into the music and want to dance. Starting at 8pm, pairs of players/singers switch off regularly in what is supposed to be a sing-along atmosphere, but we found some pairs more entertaining than others. (So if you don't like what you're hearing, wander back later -- it may be different!) The "street" area is also a fun place to people watch for the crowds going to/leaving from the "Zumanity" show. New York-New York also has sit-down restaurants. We had dinner at Gallagher's. Filet mignon was $40, so comparable to a good steakhouse price where we come from (Phoenix). The place is much bigger than it looks, fortunately, because the front rooms were very noisy but we were seated in a quieter back room. We also had breakfast at America, which we really liked. The food was good at a fair price and the service was good and personable as well. This too is a much bigger room than you would guess from the lobby. The hotel is well-located for accessing the other hotels at the south end of the Strip. We walked to the Monte Carlo across the street to get the free monorail to the Bellagio. This isn't well-publicized and is a bit of a walk through the Monte Carlo, but was easy access at the Bellagio. New York-New York does seem to have "room" issues. After reading things here, I called the night before to be sure we had a nonsmoking, one king (vs two queens) room, but when we checked in it was as if I hadn't called. We wound up with a nonsmoking two queen on the 34th floor, which we were happy with. We hadn't been to Vegas in several years, but on the strength of our good experience at New York - New York, we hope to go again soon and stay at New York-New York.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: mark589
Reviews.Content: Stayed in New York New York for 1 week from 28 Feb 2011 to 08 March 2011. Great hotel. Rooms were clean and we only stayed in them to sleep so great for us. Casino and central bar was great. Good location to get to other hotels and clubs. Close to Hooters for cheap bottles of bud. Short walk accross the bridge and your in MGM grand. My missus lost her hand bag on first night with digital camera in it. Got a phone call from security next morning saying they had her bag. Great service. People complaining about the hotel expect to much. Don't be so tight and book the Bellagio if you want a 5 star hotel. If your going for a week of partying i would recommend this hotel highly. 7 of us thought it was amazing. Only downside i can think of (this is general to whole of Las Vegas) is the creepy old american men that think its ok to sleeze over any young woman who is own there own. If your taking your missus on holiday there be prepared for this!

Reviews.Title: “Stay was OK”
Reviews.Author: CharlotteTravel11
Reviews.Content: Stay was ok. The hotel was crowded . The view from our room was great. The room didn't have microwave. Restaurants are nearby . The roller coaster ride was great. The checkout was simle and express .. The rock nightlife was good.

Reviews.Title: “A few bumps, but overall a good time”
Reviews.Author: SweetMelissa222
Reviews.Content: I was very excited about staying at NY NY, the price we got was great and the pictures looked amazing. When we got there we found out they had an early check in option which was a huge plus and they also have free luggage storage which we used. (this service was wonderful but the person taking the luggage was a rather unpleasant man) When we did go to check in the woman at the counter gave us a paper to sign for resort fees, she did not disclose how much they were or what the covered and when we asked she said it is $15 a day and if you don't sign it you aren't staying here, I was pretty offended by her attitude since I never said that we would not pay it or made any commentary about it, I simply asked how much it was and what the fee was for. We signed the paper and got our room but I was rather annoyed both by the fact that there was such a large fee added to our stay that was not disclosed to us prior to arriving and also by her nasty attitude. we requested adjoining rooms and did not receive them though it might be because we checked in early, we were able to get rooms across the hall from one another so in the end it worked out ok. The pool was closed unfortunately and trying to find the fitness center became a running joke, we never did locate it though by the second night we weren't trying very hard. Those things aside our stay was pretty great. There is a lot to do in the hotel, the view from our room and our friends' room was spectacular and the room was clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel lots to see and do”
Reviews.Author: N80
Reviews.Content: Large hotel with lots to see and do. Fantastic staff,very helpful and good sized rooms. Easy access internet and a comfortable desk. We were upgraded at the time of booking so that was a nice bonus and the first room we had was lovely but was next to the air con system and kept my fellow traveller awake so we asked for another room which was no problem at all for the staff. Easy access to other hotels and casinos and close to the monorail at mgm which we used a lot This was my favourite hotel of the 3 I stayed at during my holiday and I would highly recommend it Swimming pool was closed due to renovations but we were allowed access to pools in 2 other hotels instead.....I ran out of time to go swimming anyway as there is so much to see and do in Vegas

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: Canada95
Reviews.Content: We recently visited Las Vegas. We had a excellent stay at New York New York! Check in and out was a breeze, our room was very clean and cleaned every day. The food in the hotel is also really good, and at pretty good prices. The casino was nice, really smokey but what casino in Las Vegas isn`t. Overall a really great stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Still On The Fence ~Not Sure How I Feel...”
Reviews.Author: sk8tergurl
Reviews.Content: Traveled to Vegas for a wedding which required me to reserve 12 rooms with varied night stays (3 nights for some and 2 nights for others). Not our first choice, however, they were able to accommodate and location was good. Found out after the fact, rooms not reserved as requested correctly and not processed by Group Reservations which made it a nightmare to correct. Luckily, had a supervisor willing to work with me but still had some issues upon Check-In. Convenient. However, Groom and Bride to be's room was not as requested. Wanted Non-Smoking Spa Suite with Strip View. Didn't find out until they were in room that was given Spa Suite Smoking with view of back lot. Room did get fixed but moved down to 6th floor - where's the strip view in that? Of all rooms to be wrong! Our room was a Park Ave Premium with strip view. Left do not disturb sign on for only first full day. Came back early evening to find housekeeping did not clean room. Too late and too tired to deal with it. Next day was wedding, no sign of housekeeping again. Come to find out they left messages for us in our room... who does that? Due back in Vegas December for the RNR. Not sure if we'd give NY NY another go...

Reviews.Title: “Great Las Vegas Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tonytigerjaz
Reviews.Content: Another great Las Vegas hotel and casino located on Las Vegas Strip on the corner directly accross from the MGM Grand Hotel and Casino. My check-in and check-out went without a hitch. The hotel is well maintained, has alot to offer and is centrally located. The pool areea is small, but, quite nice. I ate at the hotel's Gallaghers and the Nine Irish Men, which were great restaurants. I would rate this on a par with Planet Hollywood, which is also within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: vacationgirl22
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really big, there's lots of restaurant, shops, rides... The rooms are nice, we hadone at the 7th floor that was ok and after we were upgraded to the 36th floor, thoses rooms are really nice and a lot more quieter. It's a good hotel for the price we paid. The only down side was that the pool was closed when we were there.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED THIS HOTEL - will be my hotel of choice next time in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: nikkivn
Reviews.Content: Loved it here! Having stayed at MGM, Luxor & Stratosphere, this is the best one yet! Loved the atmosphere in the main hall; duelling pianos were immense, the italian deli was yummy, and we didn't even get to half of the other places! The room was fine; nothing special but comfortable, warm, spacious, great smellies, mega comfy beds. The pool was closed, it was February after all so not surprising. We were allowed to use the facilities at Excalibur, so my husband and son had good fun at the heated pool there. Negs; Rok Vegas was disappointing, the smoke sucks, casino is noisy, and there is no childcare facilities (love the childcare facilities at the Orleans are amazing!) NYNY - love it!

Reviews.Title: “Spotless Room and Excellent Houskeeping.”
Reviews.Author: Sales25
Reviews.Content: Excellent value for the money. Room was spotless when we arrived and housekeeping kept it that way for our entire 5 day stay. Bed was very comfortable. Restaurants were good and moderately priced. Had a Park Avenue Room. No coffee pot in room.

Reviews.Title: “Clean but unfriendly staff”
Reviews.Author: thorough
Reviews.Content: This hotel had a nice clean feeling. The rooms were quiet, comfortable and very afoordable. My biggest gripe about this hotel was the entire staff seemed as though they had to be there and didn't want to be. They were very detatched. They weren't rude but didn't go out of their way to help you. The only place we got good service was the pool. If you are gambling at the machines, don't expect a drink to come to you. The tables had a little better drink service but not by much and the dealers were somewhat cold and had more of a business feel than a friend feel that other hotels had. I would stay here again for the price but wouldn't spend much time there. Probably just spend the night there for sleep and escape as soon as I could during the day for a hotel that actually enjoyed your presence.

Reviews.Title: “Bad time of year to go”
Reviews.Author: sliceablemango55
Reviews.Content: A girlfriend and I travelled to Vegas in early September 2010 and stayed at New York New York. It wasn't the best deal as we waited until last minute to book (which turns out is not the way to go). It was too far from the centre of the strip. We walked down the strip one day and took us an hour to get to Caesars Palace and by that time we were tired and drunk from drinking while walking in the blaring heat and just headed back. We paid quite a bit in cab fares heading out to clubs at night because cabs won't stop on the strip and insist on taking back roads which takes longer. LOOOVED the roller coaster at the hotel however, and even left the club one night to ride it (they let us do it drunk which was a blast). Also, we lived off of room service which was actually really good food and reasonably priced. We would just leave our food cart in the hallway when we were done and it would be gone in no time! The hotel wasn't bad, there was definitely a lot to see, but it was too far from the centre of the action. I tried asking for an upgrade when we checked in and she said they were full and we would have to pay more for the upgrade. We did, and got a pretty nice room, but would've liked to see what we would have gotten had we not paid extra as the one we got was not that extravagant. I have booked Caesar's palace for June (for much less than NewYorkNewYork was since we booked in advance this time) and this time I think I will try the $20 sandwhich trick, I hear that works well for room upgrades. If you are going shopping sign up for Premium Outlets coupons online before you go. You can pick up a coupon booklet when you get to vegas for sweet deals! I do not reccommend early September for Vegas. The dry air in the hotel and the hothot heat gave me horrible nose bleeds and by the 3rd day I couldn't walk outside in the heat without my nose starting to bleed! Vegas isn't so fun when you can't go outside.

Reviews.Title: “Cool hotel, in a crazy fun city”
Reviews.Author: Peterh82
Reviews.Content: As with most hotels in Vegas this is a huge hotel, with a huge smokey casino. As you would expect with a hotel that has hundreds and hundreds or rooms, comes with thousands and thousands of guest. Luckily there is a HUGE reception desk that was fully manned, which suprisengly made the check in process very quick. However the staff are not very friendly or helpful for that matter. To me, it seemed as though they all had somewhere else they would rather be. When checking in, they will as if you want an "upgrade" to a room with a view for only an extra $15/night. Stupidly we fell for it. Wasn't till later I realized we were in a high-rise building, Ummm ALL THE ROOMS HAVE A VIEW! So just say no thank you. They will also offer "high-speed Internet" access, again for only $15.....DON'T FALL FOR IT, they also have FREE wi-fi, that was very fast too. As far as the room goes, decent size with a confutable bed, was clean, neat and tidy. However, I am a smoker and asked for a smoking room, but my advise to all those smokers out there, get a non smoking room (and DON'T smoke in there) as there was absolutely NO ventilation and the room literally fills with smoke within Minutes. The hotel is in a great location on the strip, and has everything you would want or expect form a Vegas hotel. All in all was a fun place to stay, and probably WOULD stay there again if we come back to Vegas. Oh yeah, the roller coaster that goes around the hotel looks like fun, but we didn't go on it because he hotel charges $15 a ride (a bit of a rip off, if you ask me) Good value for money we stayed for 5 nights and only paid $492 over the valentines weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, look out for hidden fees.”
Reviews.Author: JimmyBrules
Reviews.Content: There is a resort fee charged for each day. 15.00 per room. We had to have 2 rooms because there was 6 of us. We were charged this fee for both rooms for all three days that we were there. We did not use any of the features that were included in this resort fee and were told it was mandatory. This added over 100.00 to our bill for no good reason. It is one thing to pay a resort fee if you use the features included but to charge this fee just because they can is underhanded. The hotel itself was nice and the amenities were good. We stayed at a low traffic time in Vegas so there is no reason to charge extra fees. The pool was closed for maintenance to get refinished and since it is winter it probably would have been closed anyway. But thanks for charging us to use it anyway.

Reviews.Title: “not what picture was like”
Reviews.Author: cosmogrl
Reviews.Content: We booked through allegiant air for our feb 28th trip and the first 3 nights we stayed at the golden nugget in the rush tower those rooms were beautiful. Then we went to newyork newyork for our remainder of our stay we checked in and went to our park ave room which was dirty and very small and the bathroom was moldy and stains on the furniture and bed was that of a motel 6. talked to front desk and mgr finally we deceided to leave and book at a diffrent hotel which was too bad cause my room was not refundable but, we were not staying there the extra 500 was spent at a better cleaner place, very dissapointed we learned our lesson.,

Reviews.Title: “Kind of shabby and poor customer service”
Reviews.Author: DanielDP
Reviews.Content: The title says it all: the rooms are very old, they don't smell fresh at all, the check-in/check-out experience impersonal on the verge of rude, the lobby is awful: you step right into the casino, which I guess it is what MGM wants. Not a touch of luxury in this cheap hotel.. I would not stay again unless everything else was booked. I asked for a toothbrush, and sure thing it came, but no tooth paste: I guess next time I will be more careful on what I request. They have their own shuttle service ($6/person) which is probably the only good thing about this hotel. You definitely get what you pay for. Thumb down, my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money hotel in the centre of Vegas”
Reviews.Author: TheShape82
Reviews.Content: Perfect for the cheap Las Vegas getaway, location as with any hotel on the main strip is perfect. A great choice for breakfast, main meal and deserts. Loved the duelling pianos in the times square bar, (even though they played 'don't stop, believing' about a billion times). If you love New York you will love this hotel, the only downside is the sport television area is weak compared to most other themed hotels. Definately would go back to thi hotel again

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Feelings Could Have Done Better”
Reviews.Author: robo44
Reviews.Content: My second stay at NY/NY Las Vegas and mainly for the proximity and price. However this time I leave with mixed emotions. The Bad: Start off by stating that my days of travel were Tues/Wed and not the peak Fri/Sat. Made reservations weeks in advance for a King Room, Non-Smoking & received confirmation. Our flight arrived early and we had hoped to check in early. The check in staff upon arrival stated that our “Double bed smoking room” was available. I politely informed that that my reservations were for a King Non-Smoking. They proceeded to tell me that the reservation did not guarantee the room I paid for, but for an additional $45 dollars a night I could upgrade to a suite. I was shocked and stated that I understand my room may not be ready now (at 1pm) so I will come back at 3pm when my reservation should be ready. They stated that even at 3pm my room is not guaranteed. It took 35 minutes and threatening to walk out before BOOM a “miracle located” a King Room non-smoking. I was left with a very unfavorable feeling about NYNY upon my arrival due to this and how they can casually state that I can UPGRADE when I had a reservation, and the fact that I had to threaten to walk out before the found a room. More: Maid Service never showed up to clean the room even after 2 calls to housekeeping. Leftover food in the hallways, and the shower was pretty dirty for a hotel of this kind. The Good: 9 Irishman food was awesome and Hotel Security is on the ball. We accidently left a bad at a slot machine and it was promptly picked up in less than 20 seconds by security that held it for us. Eye in the sky was pretty nice to have. Overall – Probably wont stay there again solely because the check in and rudeness of one individual. It was more than company policy it felt like a bait and switch. Plus with the abundance of Hotels on the strip it makes my decision easier NOT to stay at NYNY again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay & good value”
Reviews.Author: lozaman
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights with my family for a cheerleading convention over the holiday weekend. Despite the holiday crowds, check-in was fast and easy, and I was upgraded to a roomy corner suite for $15 per night more than the basic room I had booked. The room overlooked the top of the rollercoaster drop, which was fun to sit and watch the people scream as they went by. Be advised the screaming can be obtrusive if you are heading to bed early, but the coaster stops by midnight on weekends. The casino is a bit small, but it's more than made up for by other amenities, such as several excellent restaurants, a live piano bar, a great nightclub, the Zumanity show, and other amenities such as Crispy Creme, Starbucks, Il Fornaio cafe & restaurant, etc. It's a 5 minute walk next door to Monte Carlo where you can catch the free tram to City Center hotels or Bellagio. We also spotted Bill and Giuliana Rancic walking by while we ate dinner at Gallagher's, so "celebrities" apparently frequent this place as well. My only complaint is a minor one, which was a room service table with half-eaten food left outside our door for 2 days, but they promptly discounted my room for the inconvenience. I would highly recommend NY NY as a nice, comfortable, fun place to stay for a reasonbale price.

Reviews.Title: “Would Definitely Come Again”
Reviews.Author: tinkz1
Reviews.Content: Amazing hotel, room on the 28th floor Park Avenue, all amenities you require, no noise from rollercoaster or helicopters., room clean and tidy no problems with security. Great location on the strip, bus stop across near the MGM will take you to premium outlets - bus far $7.50 dollars for 24 hours, hop on and off at your leisure. Would definitely recommend the Grand Canyon West Rim Bus Tour booked with concierge at the hotel, whole trip (11 hours) was mind blowing, pick up at hotel, helipcopter trip to the floor of the canyon, boat trip on the colorado, stop at Joshua Tree Forest also saw the hoover dam, breakfast and lunch included.

Reviews.Title: “Great Three night get away”
Reviews.Author: NHFamof4
Reviews.Content: Loved the hotel. Was perfect for all age groups. We were a group of six ranging in age from 22-50 and all had fun. located on the end of the strip (would have been better if it was more north) but it was fine. we walked A LOT. Rooms were very comfortable. The rest. were good. The staff were all friendly. We used the spa for a massage in the middle of the craziness and it was really good. there were much fancier hotels and many that were worse. We walked through plenty of the them and liked our choice. Loved the Piano bar in the hotel. A lot of fun. The pool was good. under shade til at least noon though. Overall it was a great trip. I would stay again. The price was great I thought. could hear the coaster which seems to be an issue with some people but it wasn't too bad. The deli was great in hotel. Definately split a sandwich and take it out to the pool. The pool food was expensive and not good. We would get a great sandwich from the Deli and split it outside at the pool.

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: lolatheslush
Reviews.Content: We will NEVER stay at this hotel. Our hotel room was dirty, trash cans full and trash under the chair in the room, tv didnt work and they didn't have any extras to switch out, door lock was broken and we weren't moved rooms (appearently hotel doesn't care about guest safety) the hotel staff lied to us saying they couldn't switch us rooms because they were sold out, yet i was able to make a reservation for that night when i called the 800 number. Staff is unprofessional and when i called to complain i was told by the manager that i would get my room the next time i stayed and when i tried to redeem it, the hotel staff informed that they dont' do that. i recommend you stay somewhere else unless you want to the headaches of having to deal with incompetent people.

Reviews.Title: “I love this hotel when visiting Vegas!!!”
Reviews.Author: missedme
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel at the south end of the strip. We have stayed there two times now. Love the rooms, love the casino, and I love the restaurants in this place. I also loved New York Apple too!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay for First time in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Mrs_infinity
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 3 day stay in Vegas. Everything was perfect! The hotel room was clean in the park avenue suite, we stayed on the 32nd floor and did not have any issues with hearing music all night or the roller coater at 5 am as read in reviews. If your anything like me, I checked back here everyday for a month before my trip looking for new hotel reviews. As we arrived at 10pm, we ate pizza inside the hotel upstair across from pour24, not the best pizza I have had(greasy) and we paid about 4 dollars for a drink. the first full day we went across the street to ABC store and bought alot of water and gatorades for so much cheaper, there is also a food court across from the hotel with subway, manchu wok and some other fast food selections. Between myself and my boyfriend, we spent about 100 CND on food/drinks and coffee for the day, which we were both feeling crappy about eating fast food all day. On the second day, we decided to go over to Excalibur for their Buffet (Roundtable Buffet -$25 for the whole day), we went over there at about 7am and they gave us a wristband and we kept coming back all day, it was well worth it and the food exceeded my expectations. We ended up going back on our last day as well! Another thing I looked at was the age group of the people writing the reviews, so Im 27, I dont Party or Gamble. This hotel has something for everyone. Keep in mind that the hotel you stay at will be the one you spend the least at. Viva Elvis - Circque de cule(sp) is a MUST SEE! Loved it! ( a free show was included in our trip package with westjet)

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but Customer Service needs work”
Reviews.Author: Lsale
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Park Avenue room for 5 days, this was my first time staying on the Strip in Vegas. First of all when I booked the room I asked for a (non-smoking) King bedroom for me and my GF, but when we got there they told me they only had 2double rooms left. I let the check-in guy know that I had booked a king bed almost 2 months ahead of time, and he actually got annoyed with me and went on a spiel about how they don't guarantee anything when I book. After I started getting annoyed myself he finally told us we could have the wheelchair accessible room, which had a King sized bed, and the only difference was it had railings in the bathtub. Fine. Also, 2 nights in a row around 6pm, we had hotel staff walk right into our room without knocking. Even though the room was already clean. We went straight down to the front desk and he let us know that sometimes management comes to inspect the rooms to ensure they've been cleaning properly. Thankfully it never happened again after that. Pros Very Cheap to Stay in Nice sized room, very clean and big Great View Very comfy beds Roller coaster didn't bother us with noise Good selection of fast/cheap food in the lobby Fun but expensive piano bar in the lobby Cons They Don't Guarantee the Room you Book! Sometimes Rude and Disorganized Staff Ancient TV, with bad reception $15/day Resort fee, which gives you Internet and a coupon book.. total rip off. Only one pool in a poor location. Conclusion: I enjoyed my stay, the room was nice, but next time I go to Vegas I will try my luck with a different hotel. Especially one that guarantees the room I book months in advance.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, but the staff were out to lunch”
Reviews.Author: ylc25
Reviews.Content: We stayed there Feb 10-13. The room was nice, clean, no problems there. The problem was with the staff. They seemed nice, but they don't really know what they are doing. Firstly, we asked the guy at information about the bus to the Premium Outlet Mall. He told us that it would take 2 hours to get there and we should take the taxi. Well we did, and guess what, it was only 10 minutes away. That made me so mad, either he has some scam going with the taxi company or he really has to clue. Secondly, I wanted to pay the resort charges on a different credit card than the one I used at the beginning of the stay. Easy enough, credit the old card, and charge the new card. Well, she managed to screw that up as well. Just check you bill carefully before you leave!

Reviews.Title: “Great bars, fun arcades and a roller coaster”
Reviews.Author: meljw98
Reviews.Content: The hotel is huge. The parking is free but remember where you parked. On parking up we couldn't find where to check in straight away as there are so many entrances. There was a big queue at checking in and checking out too. Beware of the compulsory daily fee per day per room (around 12 USD). But this applies to most hotels in Vegas. Supposedly covers the wi-fi, which is handy. The room is spacious, could easily fit a third double bed. The room did smell a bit smokey though and you can hear the roller coaster until it shuts at 11pm. The casinos are much of a muchness compared with all the other hotels. The spa facilities looked nice but unfortunately the jacuzzi was only available for the males to use??!! They also cost extra so better to use the other nearby hotel's facilities - similar price but better than NYNY. I recommend that you plan which shows you want to see before you decide which hotel to stay in as Vegas is so big, that we only saw half of it in 4 days. So make sure you can get to the show easily. Hotels normally have discounted tickets for their guests. The roller coaster is good but is 14 USD per person per ride. The arcades nearby are also fun and we did manage to win an ipod. If you like shopping, stay in the Venetian or Caesars. Not really close to NYNY. But the out of town shopping is better and is a short cab ride away. Great choice of restaurants for snacks/dinner but not if you want a breakfast buffet. The Coyote Ugly bar and the clubs are definitely worth a visit. Free champagne for ladies from 10 to midnight :) There are excursions to the Grand Canyon although they are not cheap. Approx 350 GBP for a helicopter ride, 250GBP for light aircraft/helicopter. Less for coach/helicopter but takes a lot longer. Can use their internet cafe for online check in before arriving at the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Regina1055
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel mostly because of its location, but it turned out to be a great hotel on other points as well. We really enjoyed the wide selection of (not too expensive) restaurants. The rooms were supercomfortable and clean, though we did have trouble regulating the airconditioning system. The room was freezing cold.... All in all, a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Spa suite was excellent, great location on strip”
Reviews.Author: danandhails
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a spa suite for 2 nights. Room was spacious with a hot tub in the corner. Very clean and decorated nice. Good service - staff brought up robes as soon as i requested them. Enjoyed the hotel bars casino, and restaurants. Great location on the strip, walking distance from almost everything! And the rollercoaster was fun and went right past are room! We would stay here again if visiting vegas 100%

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Good location!”
Reviews.Author: TheLottie25
Reviews.Content: I went to the New York New York hotel & Casino from Oct 16 - 20th 2010, and loved staying there. It is located near the beginning of the strip, close to the Luxor and Escaliber. Buying drinks and food at the hotels can be quite expensive ($5 for water!) but right accross the street from the the NYNY hotel, there is a small ABC store that sells big bottles of water for .99$! and you can get pop there too, there is also a Deny's near by and a food court ( pizza, subway) to eat cheap. The hotel itself was clean,with lots of little restaurent, it is designed inside to look like the streets of NY city, i found there to be alot of younger people there as opposed to the MGM (right next door), which was nice for us, our room was spotless, and we never had any problems with noise whatsoever. they do have a pool, which is really small, we didnt use is however (busy sightseeing). we took the $20 bus pass that enabled us to go all the way down the strip and to the malls cheaply and conviently, so theres no need to pay more and stay in the middle of the strip. I will be staying there again next fall for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with a few flaws”
Reviews.Author: psallan
Reviews.Content: Ny Ny is fun and located in one of the best areas of ``the strip``. The hotel has great restaurants and bars which make the whole experience exciting. Our room was modern and nicely decorated but very small and we could hear everything next door through the walls. Wasn`t a big concern as we were only in our room to sleep for a few hours before heading back out. The only complaint about this hotel is the varying levels of service. Sometimes the service was excellent and other times it was poor. The odd thing is the busier the hotel seemed to be, the better the service was. The hotel is fun and we would stay there again if the price was right!

Reviews.Title: “My favorite place to stay in LV!”
Reviews.Author: SDTravelerGirl
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here more times than I can count. I love the rooms, value, bars, parking, location...everything! A very diverse crowd, but always a great time. Everything I enjoy is within a 10 minute walk. I always request a certain tower due to the location of the elevators, and I've never been turned down.

Reviews.Title: “Casino is great.....”
Reviews.Author: osucaglehead
Reviews.Content: I spent three nights here over the Superbowl weekend. I've stayed here several times, and have NEVER been charged for early check in.....imagine my suprise when I was told if I wanted my room early, I would be charged an extra 20 dollars!!! I agreed to it, and was excited to see what high floor I would be on!! Not. 8th floor. I had a great view of the parking garage though, and the supports for the roller coaster!!! I thought the coaster noise would be bad, but it was never a problem. I also had huge spotlights a few floors down that lit up my room at night!! Didn't have to worry about having the curtains open, though, because I wasn't really into my parking garage view. As far as cleanliness, it wasn't bad except for the fact there were men's hairs around the back of the sink. It looked like he had been shaving and the maids never cleaned it properly. There was also a cigarette burn in the comforter (in a non smoking room), but I will admit there was NO cigarette smell in the room OR on the 8th floor!! On my 3rd day there, I had forgotten to put my diamond stud earrings in. I returned to the room between gambling and the Superbowl, only to find that the glass they had been placed in, was GONE. I had specifically placed the glass with my other (cheap) jewelry on the side of the bathroom counter, with the necklace draped around the glass. I freaked out and ran out to find the maid, who was down the hall. She played stupid for awhile and showed me a cart full of dirty glasses, and pointed to all the "dirty" ones to show that my earrings weren't there. After about 5 minutes, I made her show me the glasses in her cleaning cart (where she already looked) and I found them still in the glass. I visited the spa and had a facial (traffic stopper) and massage (pure bliss). The facial was WONDERFUL, but the massage was nothing to write home about. There was also a steam room, dry sauna, showers, and beverages available. I absolutely LOVE the casino and that is the reason why I will stay there again! There is a good variety of slots, and the tables are WONDERFUL. All of the dealers were wonderful (minus one). It's nice to go to a casino year after year and see the same dealers, and have those same dealers remember you. There seems to be a lot of loyalty to that casino with the dealers. Many of them have told me they have been there since day one, and intend on staying there until they retire. Pit bosses are great as well (especially John, Oliver and Jackie) and do their job well. I visited many of the MGM-linked casinos on this trip (and prior trips) and this casino was by far the best. I also didn't mind getting to watch the Buckeyes game while playing poker! Was given free admission to Rok and Coyote Ugly. Never cared for CU and this trip was no different. This was my first time in Rok and it was very small, but had decent music. I'm not into rap, hip hop, techno or r&b so I guess that's why the music didn't much bother me. There was some of that mixed in, but there was a lot of rock/old school stuff also. Not a bad club if you aren't really the "club" type, but unless you are in a VIP there is no place to sit. If you're looking for luxury, this probably isn't the place for you. Try Aria. If you're looking for a good room and a great casino, book it!!

Reviews.Title: “So glad we picked New York New York”
Reviews.Author: jxe47
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Las Vegas. We were celebrating my brother-in-law's 60th birthday. We read a lot of reviews and couldn't decide where to stay. We are so glad we chose NYNY. This hotel was so easy to navigate inside, we found the larger hotels beautiful but too big and hard to find your way around. We ate several meals at various restaurants in NYNY and thought they were all great. The Staff was courteous at the front desk. The cleaning staff kept our rooms well stock with amenities and always had a cheerful greeting when passing in the halls. Our rooms were great, beds comfortable and very clean. We would definitely stay at NYNY should we travel to Las Vegas again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, great value with online booking, average room.”
Reviews.Author: TwofromBC
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel was its location for the price. At the south end of the strip, it was close to the airport (reduced our shuttle time) but also situated between two free trams in either direction and across from the MGM Grand. I booked winter rates online and got an additional 25 percent off that by signing up for their online newsletter. The only drawback was at check-out when they tried to tack on the $15 plus tax resort fee despite my online confirmation of a total booking amount. After asking to speak to a supervisor it was removed. This fee is a total rip-off - the pool was closed, and so was the alternate location at the Monte Carlo, there is no whirlpool in the ladies part of the spa, they charge to use the internet as the business centre, etc. Our Park Avenue room was relatively large, comfortable king bed, etc but nothing special. Because this hotel is largely angled to the south east, a "strip view" room looks mostly toward the airport. We had a great dinner and service at the America restaurant ($14.95 crab and steak dinner) and absolutely loved the huge corned beef sandwiches at Greenberg's Deli. Under ten dollars and enough to share. It would have been nice if there had been coffeemakers in the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but surprised by lack of room amenities”
Reviews.Author: Megpuente
Reviews.Content: Beautiful room, nicely appointed, on the small side, but plenty of electrical outlets conveniently placed. Very clean. In the Century tower. Perhaps because of the package we bought with Priceline,, but we were surprised that there was no refrigerator, microwave or coffee machine. A refrigerator could be provided at a cost of $30 for the duration of our stay. (also $30 a night for a cot...my granson waned to spend the night). We were told no coffee machine because they want us to go downstairs and patronize the restaurants in the lobby/casino area. We requested that the closed caption be fixed on the TV, and it never was, but when we requested extra towels, they were provided in less than 15 mins. We had asked at the desk if we could get a room with a view of the strip, which was not part of the package, but luckily, there was one available...the only catch was that it was near the end of a very, very, long hallway! Quite a hike! The frront desk was wonderful at check in and every time we needed something. Room and bathroom llighting left a bit to be desired, and the lighted vanity mirror in the bathroom tho' very attractive was practically useless. Wi-fi is now free, kudos for the hotel! Not the hotel's fault, but on the 3rd night, someone very rowdy checked in next to us, and was playing very loud music. We called security and it stopped within 20 minutes. The lobby was fun, and we found the hotel to be conveniently located.

Reviews.Title: “Meh...”
Reviews.Author: red0725
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a weekend stay with girlfriends. First of all, our room description said 2 queen beds - they were full beds, not queen. No big deal. There was no refrigerator in our room, so we put beer on ice in our sink. The hotel was clean & the staff was friendly, but I won't stay here again. It's a little out-dated. Coyote Ugly is just awful. Very crowded & there were some fat, 50 year old ladies dancing on the bar.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing Stay”
Reviews.Author: GBB015
Reviews.Content: I have just spent 5 nights at the Hotel New York New York and I was very disappointed with the hotel and the Manhattan Deluxe room that I had booked. The standard of accommodation was very ordinary and is not worthy of the 4 star rating. When I checked in I phoned and complained about the room and housekeeping did arrange for an armchair in the room however this was not satisfactory as I was travelling with my husband and sitting on the bed or hard chair was not very comfortable for our stay. I was so sure that I had been allocated the wrong type of room that I asked reception and they did confirm that the room type was Broadway Deluxe. When I expressed my disappointment with the room, I was told that I should have booked the Park Avenue rooms, these had recently been refurbishment and the quality was much better. I was obviously very unhappy with this response as the Broadway Deluxe rooms were more expensive than the Park Avenue rooms. All in my experience at the New York New York was very disappointing and I would advise people to avoid this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “GROSS-But fun atmosphere downstairs”
Reviews.Author: lovintraveling3
Reviews.Content: I would like to recommend any other place to sleep besides the New York New York. Upon arriving and checking in to our rooms, we saw our towels in the bathroom had some kind of dark, short hairs on it. Very dirty and unsanitary. So i called down to the front desk and told them that I don't want to complain on my first day checking in, so please bring me clean towels. I hate complaining because I feel like people think I'm trying to get free stuff. But I really am scared of sleeping in dirty places. So They brought me new towels while my family and I were walking around the hotel. I have to admit that the atmosphere downstairs in the casino area and the arcade is really fun. I think its one of the hotels that stands out the most for all the activities they have going on that is kid friendly as well as entertaining for adults. However, when we returned to our rooms later that night, I saw that the towels were replace. I checked the towels and notice that there was a large crusty area on the towel which was still folded (it was basically on the portion showing even though the towel was folded). It was very easy to see that this is most likely from human bodily fluids. I think it's disgusting and once again called down and told them it was the 2nd time that I want new towels. They brought them to me right away. I can say that I will never sleep at that hotel ever again. I love to gamble there, but other than that, You won't see me back. GROSS the perfect 1 word adjective for the cleanliness and sanitation condition for those rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: BenDover2u
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed 2 nights and had a great time. The room was clean and comfortable. Yes, the dressing mirror lighting was a bit dim and the TV needs to be upgraded, but all in all it was okay with us. The casino is fun, and a wide variety of eating venues. Never had a problem with the roller coaster and as far as I know it doesn't run in the middle of the night. We will go back.

Reviews.Title: “Still Waiting a Reply from Risk Management”
Reviews.Author: lindam123
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at NYNY before and enjoyed are stay. We had a very nice room with great view close to elevator which is always a plus. We were staying for a conference at the convention center which we do every year. We had left the room when I remembered I left a ring on bathroom counter but decided not to go back up to get it thought it would be okay. We have left things in our room before with no problem. When we arrived back to room it was gone. Contacted front desk security took an incident report and I have had to call daily to risk management. No none ever answere so you have to leave a message after about 10 messages someone called me back left me a message which I have returned call now 3 times no response back. I also filled out a survey on line about my stay and what happened asking to be contacted no response. The TV in our room did not work right from the start we only got certain channels called has maintenance come it but nothing changed still only got a couple channels. The front desk personel were wonderful when we checked and checked out and they gave great customer service. The ring was mother's who is deceased so had sentimental value also. The fact no one has contacted me makes it 10 times worse. As much as we have enjoyed staying here in the past and have recommended NYNY to others I will make sure to not recommend or stay again. I really have an issue with customer service I have recieved from this and lack of follow-up.

Reviews.Title: “It was ok”
Reviews.Author: OutlawOrlandPark
Reviews.Content: Four star rating really should have only been three. Room was a little beat up. Food at a room in our hallway was there a whole day on the floor. The bathroom lighting was not sufficient. Beds were hard. The room was clean though.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Tennis850
Reviews.Content: There was a great variety of slots and they were fun. People staying there seemed friendly. I also loved the piano bar. All in all it was It was a great location and the room was comfortable stylish and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay”
Reviews.Author: Gavleng
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a weeks stay at this hotel and loved everything about it. We paid an extra £12 per night and upgraded to a larger room with a great view of the strip and the vegas mountains. The hotel was very clean and well maintained, reception / check in staff were very helpful and efficient, casino is great with very attentive cocktail waitresses and the bars / restauraunts were all of a pretty decent standard. The room was large, light and airy with large windows overlooking the strip. We were on the 35th floor and did not suffer from any noise problems from traffic, clubs, neighbours or the hotels roller coaster as some guests have mentioned. The maid was fantastic and left our room immaculately clean and smelling fresh every day, with plenty of clean towels / toiletries. The 2 queen size beds were very comfortable with great pillows and good quality sheets. I can't find any negatives with the place and would like to thank the staff for a memorable stay.

Reviews.Title: “I do not recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bruno80799
Reviews.Content: The New York New York hotel offers a nice Casino and great location but the rooms are old and not nice. We had a supreior room (I had to check twice to make it sure...), the view was wonderfull but the room was very smelly. I asked the front desk for a non smoking room but the answer was: we don't have non smoking rooms! No flat screen TV! no Tv in the bath room either... Las Vegas is supposed to offer the best and most modern hotels in the world.... not this one!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but the roaler coaster running at 5am could wake you up!”
Reviews.Author: marciopin
Reviews.Content: This nice casino has a good hotel. Prices are good, but the noise of the roaler coaster is loud and wake us many nights. We are at tower B, room 610 and at 5 am, after a greate day at Vegas, we want to sleep! Besides that, everything is ok. Huge self parking lot, no problem parking, but you have to walk down the escalators with luggage to check-in. Oh, restaurants are very nice.

Reviews.Title: “awesome”
Reviews.Author: coco7272
Reviews.Content: overall,a great time. my wife and i have been to vegas numerous times and we love the atmosphere here. the rooms are not the best, yet considering the obvious about vegas(very little time sleeping) this place is great. compared to the 11 other vegas properties we have stayed at,this place has a good combination of class, relaxation and excitement that seems to be undervalued. we are loyal return guests because we feel so much more relaxed here compared to the "stuffy" atmosphere of places like the bellagio and wynn.

Reviews.Title: “great stay right on the strip.”
Reviews.Author: imagesofwildlife
Reviews.Content: This is at the southern end of the strip - easy walking to nearby hotels and events. Casino part of hotel, great mexican food with other places to eat and great shows all in one building. The rooms were quite - did not hear any noise from the casino. Free parking as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, great location, but the Techno Beat was too much!”
Reviews.Author: kimly55
Reviews.Content: The great...... This was a great hotel for many things-- Location was perfect, close to everything we wanted to do and see on our first trip to Vegas. Room was delightful, the beds were comfortable, the towels were big and thirsty. Great amenities in the room, and a great view of the strip from the Park Avenue room. The good (and not so good) ... restaurants were hit and miss. Burger place had one of the best burgers I've had in a long time, and terrific onion rings, but service was lackluster. The restaurant "America" was expensive, with a lousy breakfast and worse service. Bagel was cold and hard, hash browns were cold, burned on one side, raw on the other. Italian deli (not the full restaurant) had spectacular pastries and fabulous coffee. On the other hand, the coffee at both Starbucks was only warm and definetly old. Like I said, hit or miss. Cocktail service at the slot machines was pretty much non existent, but spot on at the lobby bar. The really bad.......at night it was just waaaaay too overwhelming. The sound of the Techno beat throughout the public areas was deafening, and there was no way to escape it between any entrance and the elevators. Casino could use better smoke control...it wasn't the worst casino for smoke, but it wasn't the best. We got hit with a "Resort Fee" of $15/day -- I didn't see anything about it on their website (I may have missed it, so I wasn't going to argue), and it really didn't cover anything besides internet service and a business center to print a boarding pass. The pool was closed for maintenance. It was a hefty fee on top of an average $85/night room rate. Overall, it was a nice property, and we really enjoyed it during the day, and in our own room. We're in our mid fifties, and we may just be a little old for their demographic. I do prefer a little more Rat Pack to Brat Pack.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: LisaWilliams82
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a wonderful 3 week holiday travelling the west coast in June 2010 Vegas was our last stop. We were staying in Vegas for 10 nights spliting this between 2 hotels 1st being a high end 5 star hotel and the 2nd being NYNY......I was so upset when we checked in we chose this hotel at the request of someone else so they could keep the price of their trip down and you really notice it, the rooms are in desperate need of re-decorating the beds were uncomfortable, the TV ancient, I could hear the nightclub, the pool was small and freezing! for the 1st 2 day the pool was closed because someone had smashed a glass in there but thankdully we were able to use MGM pools (although some of the staff were not aware of this) and they were brilliant. I wouldn't recommend staying here at all the only saving grace was the starbucks!

Reviews.Title: “superb service, spotless room, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: ccsixpack
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in a Broadway view room, 28th floor, overlooking mountains, part of strip and all of airport - loved listening to roller coaster riders - queen beds were beautiful, spotless room, all restaurants excellent, especially il Forniao - go there for dinner and their 2 for 1 breakfasts. Don't bother with Gonzales y Gonzales - too greasy and just not good mexican food. TV didn't work, someone there within 3 minutes and gave us a new t.v. Pool was under construction, used Excalibur pool - best pools on the strip - three of them! - I'd stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great time at NY NY”
Reviews.Author: H.Fitz
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 7 nights as part of our honeymoon and we had a fantastic time. We upgraded ourselves to a gorgeous suite with a beautiful view. The staff at the hotel were very friendly and helpful and there are loads of good places to eat here. It also has a good atmosphere and is in a good spot on the strip. The only downside was the noise of the roller coaster but we got used to it.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed.”
Reviews.Author: cheri822
Reviews.Content: We've been to Vegas a couple of times but never stayed at the NY NY this time we decided to stay here since the last couple times we liked their casino & overall atmosphere. We called and made reservations for Saturday-Wednesday with 1 king bed non-smoking. Upon check in at the hotel they said they didn't have any king beds and they only had smoking rooms. Now both my boyfriend and I have asthma and have never smoked in our lives I told the lady checking us in this but it didn't matter. So we took the room anyways - they ended up having a king bed but in a smoking room. The first day it was fine - no smells no smoke no problems. Sunday night it started smelling like cigarettes pretty bad even though we have not smoked in the room at all. I couldn't sleep Sunday night due to the smoke - I couldn't breathe and the smell was awful. We spent most of our day out on Monday at various other hotels on the Strip come back to the room & it smells worse than before and I'm instantly having problems breathing. My boyfriend calls down to the front desk to see if they can give us a different room being that I cannot breathe in this room and they say they don't have anything. I'm really disappointed in this hotel - I thought they would be more accommodating being that this is NOT the room I booked. We are still here now and I'm pretty pissed about all of this but have nowhere else to say. Anyways - we will not be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay Overall”
Reviews.Author: jsccofc
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went to Vegas last weekend and had a great time at NY NY. Seeing that it was our first time in Las Vegas, we were a bit overwhelmed when making our decision on where to stay. I think that we made a really good choice. The staff was very helpful and courteous. They were upfront about their resort fees when we checked in and gave us great directions to help us find our way to our room. The room itself was clean and good sized. The shower was great in terms of water pressure. The view of the roller coaster was really unique as well. The casino was a typical casino. It was a bit smokey and loud, but what casino isn't? Some of the extras in the casino were really fun. Obviously, the roller coaster was a blast and the Irish Bar was pretty unique for Vegas. It was small, reasonably priced, and had really good music at night. The hotel did come with a couple of negatives. Check-In took a bit of time because of the line. We got there just as the early bird check-in began and the staff seemed a bit overwhelmed by the crowd. To the staffs credit, they didn't seem to get flustered and stayed professional. The sportsbook was terrible. If you are looking to throw a little money at a game or two, go across the street to the MGM Grand. Other than that, I had no real issues with NY NY and would go back in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel for the budget we had.”
Reviews.Author: babybird1977
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the New York New York hotel from the 3rd - 7th Jan. There was a big convention going on at the convention centre which meant the hotel was quite busy. We arrived at about 4pm in the afternoon and found the check in to be very quick and efficient, we were hoping to upgrade to a strip view room (we had booked a park avenue room) but as the hotel was busy due to convention this wasn't possible. We did however still have a good view looking across to the MGM, Tropicana and Excalibur, the room was very clean and the maid service good. The bathroom was probably a bit smaller than we would have expected but was still nice. The hotel itself is in a great location, as you are close by to walk to quite a few other hotels and enjoy the experience there too. However we have to say that we loved the choice of eateries at the New York New York, as you could get anything you wanted from a slice of pizza up to a full blown steak dinner, you are really spoilt for choice. The casino is probably one of the smaller ones on the strip, but the atmosphere was always buzzing. The only small criticism we have of the whole trip was the noise in our room, it wasn't such a big problem after midnight as everything was a bit quieter, but the noise from the airport with all the planes, the helicopters going and coming back from the canyon tours, and the rollercoaster outside meant that it was far from quiet in the day, so if you wanted to catch a few zzz's in the afternoon it was a bit difficult. But apart from that we loved our trip, and would certainly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Not perfect, but good stay!”
Reviews.Author: ForrestHarper
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed for two nights in a spa suite. Since this is a more expensive room, I was expecting something a bit better than what we got. The pillows were very thin and flimsy and the jacuzzi's stopped didn't fully work, so we had to refill the tub up once in awhile. Our room overlooked the first drop of the rollercoaster, which you could hear the muffled sounds of screaming people, but this wasn't a huge deal because they stop the roller coaster at a certain point and lets face it, you're probably out and about on the strip. Despite those problems, the rest of the room was fine. The theme is done really well. Everywhere you go there is some kind of New York New York decoration or vibe to it. Great for people that like to stay at the themed hotels in Vegas. Although the room wasn't great, the casino was. We saw Zumanity and got a deal because we were staying at NYNY, which was cool. Nine Fine Irishmen was a cool place, plus they had a happy hour! Happy hour at a popular casino on the strip is pretty rare. Pour 24 is great for beer lovers too. The bar at Times Square had a really fun dueling piano bar. All the dealers were nice and helpful. A hidden tip! Get the passport! You spend $25 and you get like 5 drinks at different bars around the casino, a ride on the rollercoaster and admission to Rok, NYNY's club. If you add up the price of all those things, it'd come out to well over $25. This was a great place to stay, for the money we spent on the room I was expecting a bit more, but overall I liked it.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay for the price!”
Reviews.Author: CKHalifax
Reviews.Content: Loved the hotel and the rooms were very clean and recently renovated. This was my second time in Las Vegas and I really enjoyed our stay at New York New York Hotel and Casino. Don't fool yourself, make sure you read and check the pictures here, a lot of the "NICE" hotels still have some old and stinky rooms out there, only the lobby are nice, like Excalibur and some rooms at Caesar's Palace.

Reviews.Title: “For the price and location, would definitely stay again!”
Reviews.Author: 911_Mommy
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at the New York New York June 21st - 25th, 2010. Upon check-in they upgraded us for free from the Skyline to the Park Avenue Deluxe room. The room was decent besides the tiny windows, view of the garage and rollercoaster (surprisingly not loud), and the constant pot smell. The smell was the worst at night, but figured it was coming from another room and wouldn't last the entire trip. After 4 nights we were fed up with the smell. There was a large mirror near the front door which helped since we had two girls doing hair and make-up at once. The bathroom was just big enough, clean and nice decor. As for the hotel itself, it was wonderful! We loved the ambiance! New York everywhere! The location is at the end of the strip, but still in the heart of everything. Due to being at the end of the strip, I would definitely bring tennis shoes next time instead of just flip flops for walking around in. The restaurants were decent and we loved watching the casino floor from Pour 24 bar. Coyote Ugly slushy drinks were a daily stop, multiple times per day. YUM! We didn't enjoy Rok Nightclub at all though. Don't go unless they offer free admission (which is how we got in). Although we never rode it, the Roller Coaster looked like a ton of fun. The hotel is kitty corner to Denny's which will save you a ton of money on breakfast. The pool was ok, but definitely not the best I've seen in Vegas, it's adjacent to highways and the roller coaster goes right over the top. I would stay here again for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: hmoney
Reviews.Content: Booked NYNY for my BF's birthday via NYNY's website using their "1st time email offer". Eventhough the hotel was overpriced for the month of stay (however the CES & AVN conventions were on that weekend), I would stay here again. I posted an upgrade request on NYNY's Facebook page. I received a call from a staff member asking if I wanted to upgrade to a Spa Suite for an additional cost. Eventhough I declined that I was upgraded from a Skyline to a Park Avenue Suite at no charge. Upon arrival we used the valet service, which was great! Unfortunately the hotel has a $14/night resort fee & the pool is closed for the season. There should be a discounted resort fee as some of the amentities are unusable. However, we were happy to find out that we had a strip view corner room on the 38th floor (also happened to be my BF's 38th birthday LOL) Our room faced the MGM Grand. We also had views of the Excalibur, Tropicana. And out of the side windows we could see Monte Carlo & City Center. Security staff came to our room promptly when the safe couldn't open. He asked for ID to make sure it was our room (which we were appreciative of). I forgot a razor & toothbrush, called Housekeeping & they promptly brought complimentary supplies :-) The walk up massage service on the top floor by the Starbucks & Coyote Ugly is highly recommended. The girl working there was better than any massage therapist I've ever been to! I would stay here again & highly recommend it to anyone! :-)

Reviews.Title: “Great time, fun casino, good dining options”
Reviews.Author: StayToday
Reviews.Content: Had a great time, room did the job, dined at steakhouse in casino, pretty good quality, was kinda tight on space though. Piano par fun as well. Room was pretty standard, when requested service was very solid (things like towels, etc) I would say here again, I think the most attractive part was the decor/theme of the little shops and restaurants near the casino floor. not the biggest casino, but plenty big for my needs.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel!”
Reviews.Author: tales84
Reviews.Content: After missing out flight and arriving at Vegas one day late, New York New York upgraded our room to make up for the missed night. The room was lovely...not sure what room it was but it had a nice big spa! Room service was reasonable and prompt. The room was clean and spacious and the bed was super comfortable! The atmosphere is fun and laid back and there are lots of cheap, yummy places to eat! Make sure you do the roller coaster! It's a little more of a walk than other hotels but is nice to stay at for a couple of nights. Our only regret was that we were only able to stay one night!!!! Might not be as fancy as other hotels on the strip, but definately a great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great NYE experience, with one exception”
Reviews.Author: denisezucc1957
Reviews.Content: Although we live in California, we have an apartment in Henderson for work reasons. We decided to see Zumanity on NYE. Trying to figure out where to eat came next. Concerned about the crowds, we decided to eat at NYNY and made reservations a few weeks in advance for Il Fornaio. When we found out about the road closures in & out of the Strip, we went to the reservation desk the day before to see if we could get a room for just the one night. There was no way to get one night on line, but we were told we could by calling. We paid a fortune for one night, $295 plus tax, etc for a Broadway room. It was so worth it for the one time we will do NYE in Vegas. Our view was of the Statue of Liberty, Mandalay Bay, the Luxor and Excalibur. The room was small, as was the bath counter for makeup, etc, but I managed. We were able to go back and forth to the room several times during the day and evening for changing clothes, etc. Also, noise free zone! We heard one person's voice from the hallway, one time, the entire time we were in the room! Zumanity was incredible! Very baudy, adult entertainment, and just loved it! Dinner at Il Fornaio was a terrible disappointment. We ate on the patio and that was nice. Our waiter could have cared less about making our dinner enjoyable. When our salads came, he put mine in front of me, and handed my husband's salad to him. There was no offer of cracked pepper, although we saw him offer it to other diners. He also didn't offer it with the entree, and he saw my husband struggling with the pepper shaker. When he brought the olive oil for the bread, he did not include the vinegar, but he did at other tables. The menu was limited for the evening, not the normal menu. The prices were also higher than normal. We were in and out in 28 minutes, feeling very rushed. $97 for 2 salads, 1 glass of wine, 1 bourbon and 2 entrees. Having had a bad experience at the Sacramento location a couple of years ago, we will not go back to any of their locations. Too many other choices for our money! Midnight on the Strip was fun, crowded and memorable! Everyone had a great time, except for the ones who had started drinking when they woke up on the 31st! We are in our 50's, so we felt a little old out there, but we got lots of hugs and best wishes from lots of strangers. I think everyone was happy to see the end of 2010! We went back into the casino until 2 am, where we were thrilled that all we had to do was jump on the elevator, go to the 27th floor, and fall into that fabulous king sized bed! We didn't have to check out unitl 11, so sleeping until 9 was a luxury. We packed, checked out, and drove the 9 miles home. Every single worker at NYNY was friendly, helpful, happy and seemed like they were enjoying the excitement of the the new year, along with everyone else. The security guards checking for glass couldn't have been nicer, it was just so much fun! To spend as much money as we did for 13 hours of entertainment and 7 hours of sleep, I am so happy we had such a terrific time. Cudos to the hotel and casino for making our stay so enjoyable!

Reviews.Title: “NY, NY Las Vegas is a Fun place to stay”
Reviews.Author: nrf
Reviews.Content: Most of the hotels in Vegas aren't famous for their rooms. It seems that all the hype is about the casino or roller coaster or other exciting amenities that the hotel has. Same for NY NY. The room (1 upgrade from the Skyline room) was "OK". As we were in the Empire State Building, the windows were small and it was a long trek to the room from the elevator (took us about 8 turns of hallways to get there!). The inside of the hotel itself was exciting. Not overly luxurious (like a Bellagio or Venetian) but had an exciting feel - perfect for families. I would definitely stay there again, especially since you can get much better rates at the NY NY. We rode the roller coaster, of course. What fun!

Reviews.Title: “Had a wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: BURGESS-IN-VA
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay. The room was very clean and comfortable. We loved the bed....very plush. We only stayed one night but will definitely choose New York New York on our return visit to Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Home Away From Home”
Reviews.Author: Kel1013
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here the last few trips I have made to Vegas. I have only stayed in the park avenue and broadway rooms so those are the only rooms I can recommend. I have never had any problems with any of the rooms including distance from elevator/check-in desk, cleanliness, comfort, or view. My bf and I always stay here together and most of our time is spent at the hotel. We are mid to late 20's, regarding age. We have stayed at Bally's and MGM but always found ourselves hanging out at NYNY. We sit at bars and play video poker while sipping comped drinks, the pizza is great, steak nachos at Gonzalez/Gonzalez are delicious! Also, MGM is across the bridge so we take the monorail to get further down the strip or just walk. Overall, we love this place!

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: OceanLove3
Reviews.Content: Man, I'm really slacking with this year's reviews, can't believe I haven't reviewed them yet! Since we are such a short flight away, we go to Vegas several times a year. If you look, you can get flights for as low us $29 each way (that's how much we paid) and hotel deals are always out there. We paid $40/night for this place, can't complain! Every time we go to Vegas, we rent a car. Parking is free at every single hotel, and many have free valet as well. Cabs to and from the airport will run you around $20 each way, and the car rental we got was $6/day on Priceline so a much better deal! We also drove to Valley of Fire and Fremont street, so having a car proved to be helpful. The pool at this hotel is tiny, unlike some of the other places, but given that it was November, it was too cold to be in there any way so we didn't mind. The staff is nice, it's in a great location and for that price, you really can't go wrong. I highly recommend staying here if you can get a good deal. Just avoid their night club, it's quite pathetic!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Time!!!! Going back in Feb”
Reviews.Author: tds2005
Reviews.Content: Pros: Comfortable Bed Clean Room Good location Plenty of choices for food Lively Nice bath area Large room Always could find room to sit at a table and most of the time a slot machine Fun Pit Boss at 3 card was so fun to be around The GoGo girls were entertaining and interacted with guest. They had the men drooling. The Gaming area is very nicely laid out. Did not feel like I was lost the whole time I was there. Cons: Felt like it took an hour to walk to the room Escalator was under construction Very crowded (but what do you expect...its Vegas) Dealers where not that friendly (quite a few of them looked like they HATED their job) Took forever to get a drink (maybe 1 every 45 mins- 1 hr maybe) High Roller area staff was not friendly Tips: Seemed to take a while to get a taxi and it took you all the way around the casino to get to the street. Go to the right side of the Hotel to get a taxi. You will save $5.00 just by by-passing the front of the lobby. Not that it is a bunch of money but it adds up if you are taking a taxi many times. Get a slice of pizza on way to room. It was WONDERFUL (every time) and I am not a fan of pizza. I tipped our waitress $20.00 the first time and $10.00 the next and she still took forever to bring back a glass of wine. When you find a waitress do not leave the area.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: petetailor
Reviews.Content: Checked into this hotel monday 20th real nice place, free parking easy access to lobby from third floor. check in was fast, i went for the upsale room top floor to admire the view it was well worth it. the hotel it self does not have shows taking place so you will have to go to other hotels to watch em. get your tickets to show before you leave home the most popular shows are already sold out i.e lion king. rooms were clean maid service everyday were great for sure would stay there again. Outside my room was the roller-a-costa did NOT hear it a bit. be sure to flash your room key around to get discounts at the shop within your hotel resort. the hotel is on the stip and waling distance to any resort. have fun gamble gamble

Reviews.Title: “Nice but not the best location”
Reviews.Author: Adpentinc
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice and affordable but it did not offer anything special to make me want to come back. First of, it took us almost 1 hr upon our arrival to get checked in. There were some confusions with a couple of guests in front of us that it really threw their staffs into a frenzy. I didn't drop-in to listen so i don't know what it was about. The staff seems agitated after that. Not much of a smile so feeling welcomed was not there for me. Whatever it was it shouldn't have affected us, but it did. The room was nice and the bed was very comfortable. The noises were minimal but you can hear the roller coaster riders screaming. If you need peace and quiet make sure you ask for room opposite the roller coaster track. The food offers inside the hotel were not terrible. We ate at Chin Chin & American and the food was average. Don't listen to other posters, the restaurants was "NOT" great or awesome. You can this type of food at any decent Chinese/Japanese restaurant. The price was kind of high for what you get, but it was expected since you are paying for convenience. the hotel location was on the opposite end of the "hot spots" so getting there took awhile. We enjoyed walking so it wasn't too bad. I must warn you though, if you don't like to walk do not stay at New York New York. YOU ARE THE OPPOSITE END OF ALL THE SITE SEEING HOTELS and shows. Casino ~ since we are not avid gambler I can't really offer any advice. Next time I would stay some place closer toward the middle of the strip instead of the end. Bellagio's perhaps? No matter, LV is a fun place to be so can't really go wrong being there.

Reviews.Title: “They don't honor their offers.”
Reviews.Author: RonMc1958
Reviews.Content: Don't trust any offer you book under at this hotel. They will change the terms at check-in knowing you are not going to walk away and try to find a room at the last minute. My offer stated that it included free food, but at check-in they told me that wasn't correct it would be based on my casino play. The also failed to tell me about the resort fees which they added to my credit card after I checked out.
