When I checked out I had a zero balance, but by the time I got back home I discovered they added $50 in food and $30 in resort fees to my credit card. I guess they figure if they wait until you leave you won't complain. I tried to complain after I discovered the charges and got nothing but a run around. I would not trust any offer you get from this place and I would watch for added charges after you check out.

Reviews.Title: “We keep coming back for good reason!”
Reviews.Author: lucindalyne
Reviews.Content: This is our third stay at the NYNY and we haven't been disappointed at any time. We have upgraded to the Penthouse for a very reasonable extra cost which has been worth every penny. Every room we have stayed in (Broadway, Ziggurat Suite and Penthouse) has always been clean with functioning bathrooms and appliances. The queues for check in never take long and the staff at the desk are always helpful and polite. On our last trip the hotel helped out with providing wheelchair assistance and an extra bed brought up to the room. It is great to come back in and see the beds had been turned down whilst we were out enjoying the evening. There are great views (from every room) overlooking the MGM Grand and the Excalibur. The hotel is well positioned and all I can say to those people who want to be on top of the Bellagio and TI is 'stay there then!'. Car valet service is also top notch! Must see Zumanity which the hotel offers good package deals on. All round good experiences. See you another time NYNY!

Reviews.Title: “worst hotel experience ever”
Reviews.Author: JohnnyAnnie
Reviews.Content: We arrived in LAs Vegas on Friday to celebreate my 50 th Birthday for a short 2 night stay at the New York/New York. We booked the trip through Expedia.ca. However we were particular about the room and went on thehotel's website to select the room we wanted and paid accordingly. We wanted a good midlevel room with a king size bed. The first thing we noticed when we walked into our room was that it was NOT the room we ordered, in fact it was a dirty, double queen sized bed room. I called reception and they could not care less. I asked for the manager to complain and she told me she started to blame Expedia. I could not believe she did not care that she shafted us on the room. All she offered was a smoking room with a king size bed. Both my wife and I are non smokers. I told her I was pissed off, but she continued to blame Expedia. What Expedia has to do with New York/ New York has to do with falsely representing their rooms on their own website is beyond me. So we were forced to stay put. Next the internet did not work althought this is advertised. The TV was from the nineties and the Ipod player did not work either. As we walked outside our room to go for dinner we noticed a cart with dirty dishes and half eaten food. Believe it or not that cart and other trays on our floor were left there till Sunday night and in fact were never removed during our 48 hr stay. On Sunday I went to ask a question at the reception desk regarding a shuttle, the girl working there despite not having any customers in front of her ordered me to stay in line until she calls me, despite the fact that there were NO other customers. When someone else answered my question in 2 seconds, I went back to her and thanked her for nothing. She just simply rolled her eyes. New York/New York is to be avoided unless you want to be treated like cattle.

Reviews.Title: “Don"t Go To Gallaghers”
Reviews.Author: spanky11
Reviews.Content: My husband and friends visited Las Vegas to run the Marathon and Half. The day of the race we were all very tired but hungry and we all decided we wanted a good Steak. So we thought Gallaghers would be a good choice. Well we thought wrong!! We were in the restaurant for 33/4 hours not because we wanted to but it took so long to get our meals. Then when we recieved them they were either luk warm or cold. We sent back one meal. The waiiter didn't apoligize. He hardly came around to take drink orders. "Brutal" The meals didn't even taste that good!! He came around and gave everyone there bill and charged us 18%. He did't even ask if we wanted coffee and dessert. In most restaurants because of the service they would have given us all free desserts. All I have to say is we will never go back again. We did not stay at New York New York we stayed at Mandyla Bay.

Reviews.Title: “Wrong end of the strip!”
Reviews.Author: trailblazer_uk2000
Reviews.Content: Just to start off, when I say wrong end of the strip, I'm referring to the distance from Bellagio, Treasure Island, etc.. and not in any way to the location being seedy or rundown. After all this is opposite the MGM Grand. We got a good price, so shouldn't complain too much, but it was a pain that many if not all of the esculators were out of commission and you wre left with stair or finding (if you could) a suitable lift to your desired location. I didn't find the casino very smoky, and as a non-smoker of 20+ years, I can be accutely affected by smoking. The restaurants were ok, but we chose to use just the coffee shops and snackbars, and visit other hotels for dinner and lunch. The room was nice and although it was warmish (70's) could sometimes be a little too cool and the fan control was rather limited!

Reviews.Title: “An Early Christmas Cracker.”
Reviews.Author: Rising14
Reviews.Content: Eighth year in a row to Vegas and fourth time in a row at NYNY. This time with 3 friends, one of which celebrated his big 40 on the Saturday of our stay. Once again NYNY did the business so I have stayed loyal to them and already booked flights and hotel for October 2011 with the same group of guys. I do believe us Brits in the most part set our sights slightly lower in regards to their expectancies for 4 and 5 star hotels in comparison to our U.S. friends but for my stay I am sure the most critical of traveller would have had no complaints about our treatment and service from the hotel and all its staff. Room was superb with great views and cleaned daily with no intrusion from the staff at any time and as usual if you do have a lie in they call to confirm you want the room cleaning when you head off for the day. We once more enjoyed all the hotel has to offer. The 40th celebration dinner was in Chin-Chin and we enjoyed great, friendly service which was matched by the quality of the food. Later we had a table booked at The Bar At Times Square for a good old knees up and the musicians/singers ensured the 40th birthday boy had a night to remember. It costs $25 each for a table but you do get waitress service and sit right next to the pianos and see close up the talents of the musicians. They did a 'job' on the birthday boy which was great fun. Everytime I have visited this bar it has always been full of people determined to have a real go and let their hair down with nothing but fun in the air. We ate at the new Sporting House Sports Bar, Gallaghers, Nine Fine Irishmen during our stay as well as the other fast food areas and I have to say all were excelllent value. My favourite bar in the world is the Nine Fine Irishmen and many a good night has been had here with great food and drink and a live band to match. The hotel has definetly livened up its casino floor in recent years with the Centre Bar and louder music and this year included dancers over some of the tables. This to me is targeting a younger more vibrant crowd and although not a teenager anymore I still like a bit of life in a place and for the more reserved there is still plenty of choices down the strip for the cocktails and piano lounge folk. One piece of advice to newbies is definetly take out a Players Club Membership if you are doing any gambling at all. If not you miss out on some very generous comps. I didn't bother with this for my first 4 trips but believe me it is worth it. I have a Casino Host (Chase) who has been brilliant in taking care of my rooms for the last 4 trips and is always there if needed during your stay or if you have any questions or requirements prior to leaving for Vegas. You also have a dedicated check-in/out area. Finally I must mention the bar Pour 24. Through my regular visits I have got to know the staff quite well and I recommend this bar for a chilled out drink at anytime of the day and night. It looks down on the casino and I have spent many happy hour talking with Heather the night shift bar maid who always makes me feel like a returning long term friend when I arrive each year. Which indeed she has now become. To me Vegas opens its arms and doors to every traveller and it's upto that traveller to embrace that and dive in. It has something for everyone and on all my trips nowhere captures this better than NYNY. Long may it continue!

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay at New York New York Hotel & Casino in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: iloveitaly1006
Reviews.Content: This November my family and I stayed at the New York New York Hotel. It was my daughter's wedding and we had family and friends come in from out-of-town. The Hotel smelled like smoke (worse than other hotels that we have stayed in) even on the non-smoking floors (where we requested our rooms). There were people smoking in elevators and in the halls of our so called non-smoking floor. We had dinner reservations for the wedding night at Gallagher's restaurant. The food was lousy and 4 of my guests got food poisoning. My husband spent 24 hours throwing up and we paid $650.00 to get sick. I reported this to the hotel and filed a claim. The hotel, the restaurant and their insurance company refused to reimburse us. Typical - they make millions of dollars a year and would not reimburse us for my guests getting sick. Clearly they don't care about their guests or customer service. Additionally, We also requested a king size bed and got 2 queens.

Reviews.Title: “Great party hotel”
Reviews.Author: BootsUK
Reviews.Content: A group of 5 of us stayed for 3 nights in October Friday to Monday and had a great time. For us Brits the rooms were big and spacious - also very clean (something I'm particular about). We had a Park View room on the Vinny Package -so one up from the basic. It overlooked the rollercoaster and airport (incl a sort of strip view). I never heard the roller coaster (which is fun by the way, but not as good as some rides I've been on in the past). Check in was smooth -we did valet parking which was easy and checked in quickly as well - the queue wasn't too big. We ate in the Italian which was fine and the Italian deli which was nice. The Irish pub does a good breakfast as well. The pool is fine in terms of its size, but definitely smaller than most of the pools on the strip, and it doesn't get much in the way of sunshine. We had one night at the Bellagio and the pool was much better there. Overall we thought the hotel was great, certainly our favourite in that price range, the atmosphere was excellent with everyone just wanting to have fun, a few drinks and party. I would highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “New York New York - Great Allrounder”
Reviews.Author: Looubylou
Reviews.Content: Good hotel at reasonable prices for vegas. Not too glam not too glum a great all rounder. Steak restaurant was amazing a must try for all. However if you haven't got the biggest appetites order 1 steak for 2 as they are huge. Had a night in the rock bar was good they played pop music though so check what type of night you are going to if you are wanting to go head banging, you maybe a little disappointed. Pool amenities was good get up early as poolside fills up pretty quick and I didn't go at peak season. Decor is brilliant you feel like you should be standing in a real street not in a hotel. Overall recommended for all types. Didn't get to spend a night in the piano bar as had other places to visit but on passing looked a great night with plenty happening. It caters for couples, families, groups etc. A real mix of people. Vegas is crazy and is not for the lighthearted. Just sit back and enjoy the ride because there is no place like it. Would definitely go back again and again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Great time, dont know why we waited so long to go!”
Reviews.Author: brandi0825
Reviews.Content: Upon entering the NYNY through the parking garage we had a bad feeling, seemed all of the escalators are under construction. that wasnt a good start, HOWEVER after we found our way to the front desk, there was quite a line (at noon). wait time was less than 10 mins, the front desk clerk was overly nice and made sure we got what what we wanted. asked about upgrade and i said sure if it is free, and she said let me see what i can do, she upgraded us to a corner strip view room. it was #2 in comparison to the rooms at the MGM. we cant wait to go back to the NYNY, after the 2nd night there i said to my husband, you know this is the only hotel that we have stayed in in las vegas that ALL of the maids say HI to you no matter what time of the day it is. it was nothing really too big, but i thought it was pretty cool. we ate at the america restaurant, food was ok. fish and chips seemed to be hand made and was a little dissapointed that it came with jo-jo's (who serves jo-jo's with fish??). service was pretty slow, waitress was unattentive and we waited about 15 minutes after our meal to get the bill. would go back, it is open 24 hours. stopped at the pizza joint there (scirroccos) and grabbed a slice, it was really good, but crust was a tad thick for our likings. best meal we ate there is at the chin chin chinese, we had the best martini's (asian pear and carmel apple), food we had the szechuan beef and general tso. both were amazing, added in chicken fried rice which i also might add was the moistest rice ever!! over all we would go back in a heart beat. we have stayed at many other places (mgm, monte carlo, tropicana, excalibur) but this one hands down has the best over all atmosphere! also hubby won $5000.00 on $1.00 slot machine! so that was the best part!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Basic Rooms, Nice Place All in All”
Reviews.Author: beckibeetle
Reviews.Content: This was our 4th time staying here - my hubby really likes it. Notably the pool has been closed every time - November twice, May and February. We had a Very basic room. The TV was old and pretty bad - we tried to watch the Thanksgiving Day parade and that channel actually had SNOW which we hadn't seen in years but it was almost appropriate for the holiday. We opted to redeem our free drink coupons we were given at check-in at the lobby bar and the bartender seemed very put out by us even though hubby tipped him generously as always. I believe his exact words were: "Do you want salt? It'll take longer and I'm trying to clean up." (I guess we really WERE in New York!) At the Chill bar a different day got a slurpee-style drink and was having trouble getting it through the straw - later I discovered a partial large thin PLASTIC BAG in my drink...I felt it was God personally chastising me about drinking so I'm not sure I can blame that on quality control. We didn't have any blankets on our bed and hubby asked Housekeeping about it - they said that's standard, three sheets on the bed instead of blankets. (!?) That was not comfy, it was only 45 degrees out and personally we felt some blankets would have been in order. Had to turn up the heat full blast. We enjoyed the food at Chin Chin, Greenberg's and America. At America hubby requested his French toast with no powdered sugar but it arrived with sugar. The waitress came over and said "I ordered it without sugar, I swear to God!" But did not offer to remedy the situation. (He has diabetes) Aside from those oddities, the hotel was clean, the internet worked and the restaurants were excellent as usual.

Reviews.Title: “Great Themed hotel”
Reviews.Author: Losangeles2010
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the New York New York for my husbands birthday celebration with 2 other friends. We upgraded to the Park avenue rooms which were very nicely decorated and the beds were very comfortable. The only downside was that the room did not have a fridge but ice was available on each floor. We selected this hotel as it had a great theme and most certainly lived up to it. The inside of the hotel is like mini new york street with restaurants and bars set within the streets. We ate a lovely meal in the Italian restaurant and also had a graet afternoon snack at the restaurant bar that has fridges of aging beef in it - cant remember the name but you can't miss it. We visited the Coyote Ugly bar which was a bit hen and stag party so we headed to the Irish pub which had a great band on so drank and danced the night away. The staff were very nice and were quick to sort out any problems. One other thing the roller coaster wrapped around the hotel is a must but not for the fainthearted!

Reviews.Title: “small rooms but great location, clean. Staff helpful”
Reviews.Author: easterngirl2010
Reviews.Content: Great location, decent rooms. Clean well maintained

Reviews.Title: “We got what we paid for!”
Reviews.Author: Bighide
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a hotel at a reasonable rate centrally located on the strip and we got what we paid for. If you're looking for a new, updated hotel room with all the amenities, this is not the place for you. However, the casino/lobby/restaurant parts of the hotel are nice, airy, less smoky than some and very clean. Not to say the room wasn't clean - just outdated. We were disappointed with the new "Sporting House" sports bar which replaced the ESPN sports bar recently. They charge a minimum per hour per person to eat and watch a sporting event on their TVs. Will choose a different hotel/casino next time.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: momto3boys
Reviews.Content: Had never stayed at NYNY, but they sent a special deal and boy, are we glad they did!!! Hotel is located on the corner of the Strip and Tropicana Blvd., great location for lots of stuff going on. We booked the Marquis Suite, 700 sq. ft.! Terrific views of the Strip, MGM Grand, and Excalibur across the street, in addition to the Tropicana and the airport beyond. Mountains were also visible from our spacious room. We had windows on two walls, which I think made the room spectacular. We were on the 30th floor, had a practically private elevator, and just loved everything about the hotel. Only thing that could have made the room any better would have been a balcony! One note: NYNY has yet to upgrade its TVs to flat screen HD, but we didn't spend much time in the room anyway, so it wasn't a huge issue.

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel is on a shoestring budget.”
Reviews.Author: Tripping222
Reviews.Content: Check-in took 45 minutes, there were 30 people in line and "I'm sorry our computers are down". They overbooked the room I ordered so I was "upgraded" from a king bed to two queens. I lugged my laptop here to take care of some business but this hotel definately does not have business travelers in mind. The high speed internet at this hotel is an oximoron. It's low speed, low capacity. Try at 3:00 am when nobody else is online and it might work out for you. The room is fair, although the two arm chairs are so worn in insides can be seen. My shower towel was hanging nice, but it was nearly torn in two with strngs hanging down. Food is very expensive and low quality so far. Small bag of popcorn is $4.50 US. Expect to spend $15+ for any meal here. There's very little fresh food here. It's mostly made elsewhere then heated up or deep fried for serving. Stay here if you want a cheap place to flop, but don't expect to do work here, and find elsewhere to eat.

Reviews.Title: “SECOND TIME AND STILL LOVE IT”
Reviews.Author: murphygreen
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three night and four days and were not disappointed! It is a very lively and fun place to stay! We had a Park Avenue room and it was well furnished and very clean, We ate at Nine Fine Irishman, Gonzalez (great mexican) , America and llFornio. All restaurants were good and service great. We try to get to Las Vegas once a year and would recommend this hotel to all that want a lively Vegas experience! For the best Prawns ever go to Pearl at the MGM Grand and order the Spider Prawn Dumplings. You will thank me for this tip!! Loved the hotel, service and would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: ilikevacations07
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel using priceline with the name it your own price so of course was worried that I would get stuck with a horrible hotel. Well the hotel was a big surprise and I was very happy with my stay. We stayed in the skyline room, which is basic, but it was very nice and the beds were great. The bathroom was nice.... Had a cool view of the roller coaster.......but no coffe pot... To some thats no big deal but its a nice feature anyway but was not offered... Great nightlife and let me tell you the show ZUMANITY was just freaking awesome.... WOW.... The roller coaster was awesome to.....If you want a hotel that offers a fun nightlife and good music this woul be a great choice... One important thing for me was location... It was towards the end but had walkways and bridges to other hotels so walking for us was a breeze and when you want to go to the other end we just got in our car and went... Great hotel for the price and I would stay again..... We also met chumley from Pawn Stars.... What a riot...

Reviews.Title: “Stay at New York New York just OK”
Reviews.Author: tommyt1869
Reviews.Content: Arrived Wednesday night only one other person in line. The clerk asked about an upgrade and I declined. We got to our room and it was tiny. Called back down and asked if upgraded room would be larger and the clerk couldn't promise it would be larger but she said if we didn't like it we could keep trying. After checking out the new room it was a little larger and with the upgraded cost ($15.00 per day) we had a great view. The room was clean and modern looking except for the television. As mentioned by others a flat screen would be nice. I don't spend a lot of time watching t.v. in Vegas but I am one of those people that like to fall asleep to the t.v. The room was quite and we could barely hear the roller coaster. The cleaning staff did a great job for us. The valets also did a great job as far as getting our car in a timely manner and giving directions. Both were tipped well for the service. The only restaurant we ate at in the hotel was America. They had a nice midnight special steak dinner for around $12.00 I think. The dueling pianos at the bar at times square was fun, also had some drinks at Pour 24. We did the roller coaster and had a blast. The casino was just alright to us. All in all I would put NY NY at the high end average. Last year we stayed at TI and like the rooms and location much better. I would say the service at booth were about the same. Not the worst hotel you could stay at but I probably won't opt. to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “nice, value option”
Reviews.Author: bran99
Reviews.Content: we couldnt beat the price which is why we stayed there, i liked the fact that there was a starbucks on site, i didnt like the casino at all, this is the first time we have stayed on that end of the strip, i much prefer the mirage, venitian, wynn portion of the strip, rooms were clean, they still used the old school big tv's which was a little silly, its 2010 and they are running out tv's from the early 90's. So if you want to watch a game from your room its not really a option

Reviews.Title: “Great starter hotel if it's your first time to Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: kws79
Reviews.Content: My dad and I travelled this past week to Las Vegas, it was my first time down there, and I have to say it was everything that I expected, and then some. We chose New York New Yorkas our hotel because we wanted to stay in someplace that is upscale and chic, but without having to break the bank per night. We could have easily booked Imperial Palace, but because this was my first time in Vegas, I wanted to arrive and leave with a good first impression, so I suggested that we find someplace that's a little more modern and not so run down. We booked the hotel room online directly through the website, because we were able to get an online promotion code where for an additional $5, we were able to get an upgrade to the Premium view, where we could see the Las Vegas strip. We came in on Monday, during the week of Remembrance/Veterans Day, so it wasn't too busy nor did it take too long to wait in line to check in, albeit with only two check in clerks working at the desk. Nevertheless, the staff at the front desk and bell hops were very friendly and helpful and accommodating to make our check in process as smooth as possible, and they were also very flexible to allow us to check out of our room at 11am and still able to leave our bags with the bell hop so that we could enjoy our last full day in Vegas and still get our bags later when it was time to head to the airport. We also got a free coupon book for a complimentary cocktail per person and a free newspaper, and for a discount on shopping. The coupon book is the one area that they can improve on, as in the past I've received well over $200 worth of coupons when i stayed at the Rio Hotel and Casino in Macau over two years ago. My breakfasts were well covered for 4 days and I also received about $50 to $100 worth of gambling coupons for the tables and the slots. However that was when I got a double upgrade from economy to super deluxe at that hotel. The room we stayed in was the Park Avenue Premium suite, with two queen sized beds. I recommend booking it online directly through the website, (there is a resort fee, but you do get some amenities such as high speed internet and using the hotel fitness centre) and if you sign onto New York New York's email list, you can get your online promo codes that you can use to get your room discounts and special upgrades for your room. We had a direct view of the MGM Grand across the street and also down below where M&M's World and the Coke store is, but as far as the rest of the strip, because NYNY is on the south end of the strip, most of the view you can see however, is only to the south towards the Tropicana and McCarran International Airport. The room is clean and neat in appearance, it has a closet for your jackets, ironing board, electronic safe for your valuables, an iPod clock radio (I had issues at first trying to shut off the alarm at 1:30 am, but figured it out), and the TV was also in the same pantry as the closet. Not much for TV channel selection, other than just what we needed for catching the weather, the local news, and the events channel on what to do and where to go in Vegas, and the in room pay per view movies. But then again, we did not come out to Las Vegas just to watch TV either when there was lots of things to do out in town. The bathroom floor and tiles have a nice, light glossy marble grey finish, and the bathroom sink counter has a beige white matte finish on the surface, with stainless steel faucets in the sink and shower, a low consumption flush toilet, and with energy saving compact fluorescent light bulbs (health hazard or not, is still debatable in my book). All the soaps, shampoos and lotions have a nice, ginger orange scent to them, and the bar of shower soap has some nice massaging beads on the surface. The queen size bed was comfortable, although it did have the slight sag on the edge where it feels like your going to roll onto the floor, but otherwise very comfy and cozy. The room temperature controls were a bit finicky to adjust to the happy medium between warm and cool, as it was only seasonal to slightly below average for Las Vegas weather, but otherwise sunny throughout the week. The only other one complaint on my first night stay other than the unexpected alarm clock going off at 1:30 am was being awakened at 2:30 am an hour later by the night construction crew doing a building implosion of an old section of the Tropicana across the street. This is no fault of NYNY by any means, nor is this anything they can control, but to the construction crew across the street, PLEASE, please save that for the daytime. Not everyone in Vegas is always away partying onto the wee hours of the morning, especially for those who have travelled far and wide to Las Vegas. Outside of that, however, the next two nights, I've slept like a baby. The location of New York New York is essential and convenient as well for shopping and transit. The MGM Grand was right across the street from us from where we stayed, as well we had close proximity to M&M's World and the Coca-Cola store, and also to easily catch The Deuce transit bus and to buy half priced tickets for oncoming shows for the day or evening. For the casino, the whole Times Square theme and every other New York themed aspect was nailed down to a T, from the mock manholes to the Chrysler tower elevators that took us to our room. For restaurants, I highly recommend Gonzalez Y Gonzalez and their chicken fajita burrito. It will fill you up like it's nobody's business. Plus they give you plenty of tortilla nacho chips and two bowls of mild or medium salsa. And for drinks, I recommend the Coco Loco Margarita. The other restaurant that's good and is open 24 hours is America, where we ate the first night. They have Coors drafts on for $3.00 (if you really want the same beer for a steal of a price, check out O'Shea's near Bally's and the Flamingo, they have drafts for 99 cents a glass) and because it was late and it was after we just checked in, I had the Philly Cheese steak with Idaho grown potato wedges. They also had all you can eat pancakes during the morning, but I think we just missed it after 11. Most of the breakfast entrees came to about $7 to $8. For a really economical breakfast, I recommend La Salsa Cantina across the street near M&M's world for $3.95 till 11am. Other restaurants that are in New York New York, that are available but haven't tried because of shortage of time, are Chin-Chin, an all you can eat Chinese buffet and Asian dining, Gallagher's Steakhouse (a bit pricey), Il Fornaio Italian restaurant, and The Sporting House Bar and Grill. For bars, there's Nine Fine Irishmen, The Bar at Times Square and the Centre Bar. We tried getting into Nine Fine Irishmen, but it was a bit crowded so we went to the Centre Bar, which is located, of course in the center of the casino. For night clubs, there's ROK Bar Vegas and Coyote Ugly. Even though clubs are not quite my thing, I'd sooner go to ROK over Coyote Ugly because I read in another review that you have to pay a $10 cover charge just to get in. As for the casino itself, it may be a bit spread out, and scattered, but if you can find the right slot machine or table that you wish to play at, it'll be there. We were hoping to find more penny slots but whatever ones we could come across were close by the 50 cent Corvette slots. That was was the very first thing that greeted us when we got into the hotel. And if you sign up for the MGM Players Club card, you can collect points as you play either the slots or the tables, and use it towards any possible discounts off of your hotel bill, and can used at any MGM owned resort property. It'd be nice to have a universal setup to use your point collector's card at all casinos, since all the others are using the point system anyways. And as long as you're constantly still gambling at the tables or slots, all drinks are complimentary, All in all, if it's your first time to Vegas, and if you want to get the best bang for your buck without the sacrifice of luxury or extra cash, and for the closest proximity to get where you need to go, and to have the best experience and leave with a great first impression, New York New York is the place for you. The only improvements and suggestions to make it better, offer more perks with your coupons when your guests choose an upgrade package, have your housekeepers take that one extra step of double checking the alarm clocks to ensure the alarms are disabled, and to streamline the arrangement of your slot machines and offer more penny slots. For my next return trip to Las Vegas and to my next choice of hotel accommodations, to coin Ace Frehley's lyric in his song......."I'm back....back in the New York Groove." I will return. And hopefully I'll finally get to meet "Vinny" up close and personal during my next stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Enough, But...”
Reviews.Author: gofastguy
Reviews.Content: Our stay was nice and pleasant enough, but I have to say that I was expecting a little more based upon the cost and what I had heard on the street. We had no real problems of any kind, but I have to say that everthing seemed just a bit too "average" for the amount we were spending. The pool area was especially under-whelming.

Reviews.Title: “Gambling trip - 4 nights - 1st stay @ NYNY”
Reviews.Author: Richtree7
Reviews.Content: Check in was at the VIP desk because NYNY offered me 2 nights free based on my previous play at the MGM. I am primarily a craps player and am not a 'high roller' by any standard, though at the end of my stay they comped everything. I had charged only 2 breakfasts at the America restaurant and a burger at 9 Fine Irishmen to my room tab. It pays to inquire about comp's at the Players Club before check-out if you gamble in the casino. Stayed in the Century Tower, 27th floor. Room was nice, clean, large enough. Nothing elaborate or fancy but comfortable. The staff I encountered were all very nice. I will return.

Reviews.Title: “Skyline Room is the Red Roof Inn of Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Cheesehead7
Reviews.Content: As I gazed upon no fewer than 25 people standing in the registration line, I thought, "Why can't these smart people come up with a better way to check in than to suffer through a 25 minute wait in line?" Apparently they need the opportunity to attempt to upgrade you to a better room, because the Skyline room I secured on Priceline for just over $100 a night was positively ridiculous. Yes, it seemed mostly clean; yes, it was quite roomy, but no desk / workspace? A 19" TV? No in-room coffeemaker? While some seek to savor the 'Las Vegas experience,' I was on a business trip; all I hoped for was business-level treatment. No such luck at NYNY. Next time, I'll book Aria in advance for $149 a night... at least they have rooms that are worth the Las Vegas experience.

Reviews.Title: “COMFORTABLE ACCOMMODATION”
Reviews.Author: Alidah
Reviews.Content: Rooms very clean and comfortable. Casino itself very noisy and had trouble dealing with cigarette smoke. Smoking is banned here in clubs and hotels, etc within Australia, so this was difficult to handle. Glad we got to experience Las Vegas though.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic time at the NYNY”
Reviews.Author: ece
Reviews.Content: This was my first time in Vegas and we had a great time. Our check in was quick and the staff served us with smiles and kindness. Our room was a non smoking room and was what you needed in a room. It didn't smell of smoke (like others expereinced) the bed was comfy, good view of the MGM. No mini fridge though, so kept our drinks in the sink filled with ice. Very clean. WiFi was slow, and sometimes couldn't get on at all. Front desk said this was a typical complaint. Food court street area was fantastic. Lots of choices and not crazy expensive. Pizza slice $4.95, Ruebun sandwhich with side $9.95. Casino area fun, lots of machines and some tables. Lots more across the way at the MGM which is where we gambled (poker tournments) Went to see Zumanity on the 2 for 1 deal they hand out. Lots of fun, cirque show about sensuality. Also saw the Rat Pack is Back at the Plaza. Went to the tickets for less kiosk under the Coke billboard by the MGM and got dinner and the show for $58. It was fun and the food was fantastic. When we got there we paid an extra $10 pp to get a booth. Went to the premimun outlet mall and found few deals, no more then any other high end outlet mall by us. $300 purses down to $200. For $5 you can buy a coupon book that gets you a discount at 99% of the stores. If taking the bus around the strip you can buy a day pass for $5 on the duece, but $7/day gets you on the gold line and it is way faster as it doesn't stop at all the hotels and gets you on the duece if you want. It took us over an hour on the deuce to get from NYNY to the Plaza downtown on freemont st! One tip to save money- play games you know how to. Don't waste your money trying to figure out how the different machines work. It is helpful to know the max bet and the pay out. Most 0.01 machines had a 200 credit max and often paid out .60. So even when you won you still lost.

Reviews.Title: “Average at best - horrible service though”
Reviews.Author: sjwhaley
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the NYNY with family for my husband's birthday party. We have stayed at the MGM previously and really enjoyed it but figured we'd try somewhere else. At check in, we waited in line and once a check in desk was open, I walked up there and the lady didn't even look up at me for a few minutes, then said "can I help you" in a completely rude tone. I said "we'd like to check in" and she said "usually people wait until they are called first". Huh? That was just a sign of things to come (with a few exceptions). Our room was large but was mostly open space without furniture. The casino was dark and dirty feeling and reeked of smoke (most of the other casinos didn't smell 1/2 as bad), and the place just needed a facelift in general. We were told to go 3 different places to purchase a spa gift card - the staff just was uninterested in helping us and borderline rude. We bought breakfast at the Il Fornaio bakery and had to pay with a $100 bill (which is what the ATM gives you) and the woman said to us after a long sigh with a nasty tone "oh, you people with your hundreds". I had confirmed and reconfirmed a dinner party for 14 people at Il Fornaio (both on the phone and in person) and when we got to the restaurant, they had no reservation for us. Luckily they were able to scramble and push a bunch of tables together for us. I would definitely NOT stay there again and would NOT recommend to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the resort, disappointed with the room.”
Reviews.Author: johnnyhotcakes
Reviews.Content: New York, New York is a fun mega casino resort. It well located on the southern end of the strip, has great parking, an We loved the people watching in te Center Bar. The Soho Shopping District was fun and the on-site restaurants were great. My disappointment with the stay was with the room. I booked a Broadway Deluxe which I thought would give an upper floor witha strip view and I got a an 8th floor view of the parking garage. There was no point in upgrading the room as it had little in the way of furniture, it was just a big room with alot of empty space. Overall we had a great time but I felt that there was no need to purchase an upgraded room.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing - Would recommend - absoultely HUGE”
Reviews.Author: Keely0207
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, fab location. When I first arrived I was absoultely amazed by the sheer size of the lobby area downstairs of this hotel. You could get lost its that big. The whole design is fab - everything about this hotel was Good. Forgot our room number a few times and got completely lost as the hotel is so big. Swimming pool is good - with 3 hot tubs ... could have done with being open a little later though. It would have been nice to cool down at the end of the day - however it closed at 6. Close to some of the shopping outlets and was only about a 5 min drive from the airport - infact could see the airport from our hotel. Perfect location - and I think is situated along the better part of the strip. A fab hotel with every feature of New York taken into consideration. The design is perfect. Plenty of restuarants and places to eat downstairs in the lobby. There is a LOVELY Italian place as you walk in - quite expensive - but definetely worth it. The rollercoaster was pretty expensive and I think it would have been good to give a complimentary ride to all hotel stayers.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: RickyBobbie
Reviews.Content: I stayed here as part of a business trip, then extended the stay for weekend leisure. The service at the front desk was friendly and accommodating, and the lines were not long at all. Rooms are modern and clean. The casino floor was noisy and smoky and while the smell of cigarettes was evident on my non-smoking floor, it was quiet. The resort fee is less than most casinos and includes internet, gym and business center. The health club is small for a hotel this size but has modern equipment and wasn't too crowded. The hours are the same as the spa (6:30am to 7pm) and 24/7 access would have been nice. Food options are abundant in the casino as it has a "streets of NY" theme and it's a good location on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back”
Reviews.Author: betty_tours
Reviews.Content: Six of us travelled to Las Vegas for our Wedding Vow Renewal and found New York New York to be a brilliant hotel to stay at. We booked through Travelbag and the daily resort fee was included so there were no hidden extras. The location was superb and we were able to walk easily to all of the other strip hotels. We were on a room only basis but each morning went down to one of the coffee shops and collected coffee and brekkie. We ate in the Italian restaurant which was very good. Te roller coaster ride is a must as is chill ot time by the pool. We will all definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “This is not a 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: NevermindCA
Reviews.Content: With a 4 star hotel, I expect a certain level of service, amenities, and cleanliness. New York-New York does not measure up to my expectations. When we arrived we were told that the non-smoking room with a king-size bed that we had reserved was not available. We were given the option of a king bed in a smoking room or two queens in a non-smoking room. Being non-smokers we opted for the non-smoking room with two queens. The room was somewhat tatty and not very clean. The lighting was dim. There were toothpicks left in the bathroom trash can and litter on the floor beneath the luggage rack. Despite the fact it was a non-smoking room, it had the lingering smell of stale smoke. The worst, however, was the absolutely filthy air vent in the bathroom. It had a huge layer of dust and grime on it. On the bright side, the room was fairly large with comfy beds and a couple of nice, comfortable chairs. The casino itself appears to cater to a younger crowd. It is loud and smoky, with dancing girls and plenty of bars offering expensive drinks. There are lots of options for eating and shopping. Unfortunately several of the escalators were not operating, making for a long trek up the stairs or a search for the appropriate elevator to get to another level. We did not particularly enjoy our stay at New York - New York, and will not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Be aware!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: muzzy1970
Reviews.Content: Very poor room service, rubbish every where in the hotel waiting to be pick up days. Resort fee, 12.95 + tax. PER DAY, which nobody told us. They charge you $200 on your credit card when you check in ( which they dont tell you, and you dont know what they charge till you come back home) then they say they put that money back within 5-7 working days in the account, which I did not received it yet. Food expensive at the hotel restaurants. We stayed in room 901 ( new yorker tower ) when you come off from the lift you have to walk about 5 minutes to get in to your room!!! Unhelpfull staff, no smile, they just don't want to be there. Stayed a few different hotels in vegas in the past, but NY NY is the worst one. If its your first time in vegas you might not see the difference. I can go on and on and on but i dont want to waste may time for this resort. Friendly advice, for the same price, go and stay else where, because Vegas hotel prices not much different then each other.

Reviews.Title: “The NYNY is an excellent Hotel / Resort that's not too expensive.”
Reviews.Author: ncb59
Reviews.Content: This is a lively Hotel in the City that never sleeps, even when busy over the Haloween Weekend it was never over crowded at the bars and resturants as it so big inside. Much better than the Monte Carlo where I stayed last time I visited Vegas. Clean and tidy rooms, with seperate lifts to each tower no long waits to get to your room. The only negative is that the walls between the rooms are a bit thin and its noisy if the guests next door are having a loud chat.

Reviews.Title: “a great place to stay - again!”
Reviews.Author: thecatsmother
Reviews.Content: having stayed at NY NY some years ago I stayed there again recently. Pleased to say it hasn't changed. Service in Restaurants and bars was excellent, rooms comfortable and clean and entertainment fab! It is at one end of the strip but near to the monorail (At MGM grand) and within easy walking distance of all majpr attractions. Would definitely recommend it. Rooms are could do with a bit of updating but given the current concerns about bed bugs in the USA it was spotlessly clean with fresh towels and linens daily. whether you stay here or anywhere else in Vegas you must visit the Bar in Times Square in NY NY. Yes It's loud but it is by far the best atmosphere of any of the piano bars and we should know - we tried them all!

Reviews.Title: “Las Vegas $$$$$$$$$$$$$”
Reviews.Author: releasethehounds
Reviews.Content: We did our first trip to Vegas.Booked a flight with 3 nights at New York/New York plus their Zumanity show($1200)and yes they charge over $40 with tax for wi/fi. The room was nice and roomy,but our view was a roof top cubby hole,all you could see was blue sky when you looked up. The Zumanity show was awfull(should have asked for my $272 back!),they really need to get another show worth seeing. Everything on the strip is pricy!$3.88 for a small bottle of water at MGM(and don't waste your time and money on their CSI display) And while waiting for the Cher show,3 drinks each,$75! The only highlights of the trip was "Cher" and "Fremont St.", Las Vegas is there to suck every dollar they can out of you for what? Fancy building with lots of lights? With a total cost of $2300 for 3 nights,we could have gone to a tropical 5-star hotel for a week!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, great location, good food”
Reviews.Author: Honest_Aidy
Reviews.Content: A holiday is what you make of it, if you have fun everything's good, but if not then everything can seem a disaster. This was a nice, friendly hotel with plenty of places to eat, tables were not too expensive. The sports bar was my place to eat as it had nice portions and was not expensive, as I went to what was a cheap downtown place to eat and it was the same price with poor quality food. Staff were friendly, and I asked about the resort fee at reception, he said do u need internet or a paper, "no", well you need not pay the fee. The dealers were friendly, especially one of the managers who worked the night shift. I did get a poor view i.e. the roller coaster, the poker guy said get it changed as we were there for 10 days but I didnt want the fuss as their was no noise. Ok, this hotel is not top of the range, but then that's why the price is right. Enjoy your holiday if you choose here.

Reviews.Title: “Worst experience ever!!”
Reviews.Author: jadestarlyn23
Reviews.Content: I would not reccomend my worst enemy stay at this hotel! On our first night we were robbed by a housekeeper! I witnessed the woman leaving our room, got up and noticed my purse, my wallet, my cell phone our camera and several personal items were missing! New York New York staff were less then helpful, they offered to pay for our food for the remainder of the trip (which was a hastle everytime we would try to do so) and upgraded our room. Since my ID along with all my credit cards were stolen all we could do is sit in our half way decent hotel room and eat! It was absolutely ridiculous, they wouldnt even give us two $14 tickets to ride their roller coaster! I couldnt believe how rude they were. Almost every person working at the hotel and casino had absoulutely no customer service skills to top it off. We were robbed on saturday and told they were going to start the investigation immediately, I got a call today (Monday) and the manager of the risk management department let me know she JUST recieved my case and was starting the process of the investigation. Not only were we robbed, but they continued to let the woman work through the weekend! If I can offer ANY advice DO NOT STAY AT THE NEW YORK NEW YORK!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at NYNY”
Reviews.Author: gmataffy
Reviews.Content: Our flight got in early at 11:00 am we thought we'd try to check in expecting to have to go back later, but it wasn't a problem, we waited 2 minutes in line and were able to check into a strip view non smoking king room on the 25th floor right away. The room was clean and appeared to have been updated comfortable bed, room was a bit small with a large bathroom. We could hear the rollercoster but it wasn't a problem. we never heard any neighbors. Room service was reasonable and fast. Lots of restraunt choices my husband liked the pizza place,Nine Fine Irishman was good, and we had a nice lunch at Gonzales Y Gonzales. We enjoyed the show zumanity it was funny and entertaining and the tickets were reasonable. NYNY was a good location we had tickets to Jimmy Buffett so we just walked across the overhead walkway to the show. Checking out of the hotel was also about 2 minutes and went smoothly we weren't overcharged for anything. Played the slots didn't loose alot and cocktail service was frequent. Didn't do any shopping. My husband was bothered by the smoke in the Casino,so we walked to the pharmacy next door to the Monte Carlo for allergy medicine. No complaints nice stay, next time I'd take allergy medicine and ride the rollercoaster .

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: merylstreep
Reviews.Content: Good value for money. One of the most vibrant of the casinos we visited. Times Square Hotel has live music in the evenings. Easy access to other casinos.

Reviews.Title: “great view of the strip”
Reviews.Author: 93Wanderlust_93
Reviews.Content: Stayed here a few nights and saw Le Reve at the Wynn. New York New York was perfect for our first time in Vegas. Teenage daughter loved the roller coaster and the arcade. Service at the restaurants was pretty good overall. We had a Broadway Deluxe room with a fabulous view of the strip. Don't like the "resort fees" but it seems most hotels have them. We would come back-pretty good hotel for families with older kids.

Reviews.Title: “okay stay”
Reviews.Author: snu70
Reviews.Content: -Check in/out was VERY quick -Lots of places to eat! -The steak restuaraunt is a MUST- GREAT food!! HUGE HUGE steaks -close to the strip, MGM, Exalibur, Luxor and Mandalay Bay! -Room was okay, clean, lots of towels, no concerns! The only thing was that the pool was really small.. if you want a good pool scene don't go here! it's so small and sunny only on one side until 12pm.

Reviews.Title: “We Loved NYNY...will stay here again!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Rhonda777
Reviews.Content: My husband, parents and I stayed at New York New York last week. I did do my research on trip advisor and was on the look out for any negatives on this hotel. We loved the hotel. My husband and I had a strip view room, which was gorgeous. My only complaint would be the television which we only turned on in the mornings for news, so it was no big deal, it is totally outdated. Everyone is now up to date with flat screen televisions. We did have a king bed that was like sleeping on a cloud. The room also had a safe to store valuables. My parents had a non-smoking room and didn't have any complaints either. We did request a small refridgerator for their room because my father travels with medication that must stay cold. After we checked in the fridge was delivered right away (within 15 minutes) and was not charged for it!!! We all enjoyed the hotel and casino very much. My husband and I have been to Vegas several times and have stayed at Treasure Island, Excaliber, Stratosphere, Monte Carlo and Circus Circus. We would only put NYNY ahead of Treasure Island because of the location. When we go back, we will be staying at NYNY. All the employees that we encountered were very nice. America cafe is a very good place to eat, reasonable prices (on Vegas standards) and is open 24/7.....would highly recommend everyone give them a try. Happy Gambling my friends!!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome time!”
Reviews.Author: alvysinger1980
Reviews.Content: After reading some pretty scathing reviews, I was a little concerned about our six night stay, but my only regret is that we had to leave at all. We got there quite late, so there was no problem with check-in queues, it was really quick. When we got to the room we found that it wasn't the no-smoking king-size we had booked, but was smoking queen-size, but there was only the slightest trace of a smoke smell and the room was enormous with great views on two sides (it was on a corner, not technically strip-facing but we could see quite a lot of the strip anyway), so we stayed put. Breakfasts at America were amazing, especially the Steak n Eggs and the French Toast, and we also loved the pretzels, hot dogs and pizza slices available around the hotel. Everyone we spoke to in the staff was really friendly, despite what has been written here. Transport-wise, it's really easy to get the Deuce bus up the Strip from over the road at the MGM Grand, or get the tram from there or the shorter (free) one from The Monte Carlo to the Bellagio. We also did excursions like horse riding, the Grand Canyon and a helicopter flight as well as seeing LOVE at the Mirage. Overall, it was an amazing holiday and NYNY was the perfect place to stay for us.

Reviews.Title: “Big Disappointment, should be a 2 star!”
Reviews.Author: kamikaze99
Reviews.Content: This hotel looks great online but don't let it fool you. The hotel treats you like a number, no personal service. I felt like they could care less if I ever stayed there again (don't worry, I wont be back). The place does have everything you could possibly want in Vegas: a show, food, drinks, casino... but they forget to tell you that if they weren't in vegas the hotel would be a 2 star..if that! They might as well call this place the super 8 of vegas. The rooms are old, dirty, smelly, dusty, smoky... absoulutely no where near the quality I have recieved at any other 4-5 star hotel across the country. Very noisy at night (yes i know the "city never sleeps" but i need to sleep every once in a while..). Lucky us, we had a roller coaster plowing past our window all day. The screams got old. The pool was nice. I thought there would be plenty of shopping in the hotel..but its just junk (except the Harley Davidson shop :) ). Think souveniers...don't expect to buy anything you actually need. I was expecting a sort of mall in the hotel but it doesn't exist. I will def. be staying at one of the MANY other options in vegas next time. This is not the place to go if you are looking for an unforgettable stay...it will be unforgettable for all the wrong reasons. Nothing fancy about this place.

Reviews.Title: “I really like this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sola61
Reviews.Content: I just got back and i would be going back again, this hotel was very nice i told all my friends at work to stay at the newyork newyork hotel the clubs were nice, very nice close to all the action on the strip and right across from MGM you will love vegas i ate alot and walk and i love that the set up at the hotel was nice

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: chezmiddlesex
Reviews.Content: I have read good and bad reviews of this hotel, and it does have some good and bad points. I'll start with the bad: There is a very horrid smell of sweets and preztels that after a while starts to get worse the longer you stay There is a smell of tabacco but you get used to this, but i do think this is the worst hotel for it. There isn't the choice of a buffet like everyother hotel The good The service was really good, plenty of free drinks being served while gambling Zumanity was really good. Location was good. Regarding Las Vegas it'self , don't me conned into buying drinks in the hotles as tehy charges a fortune, there are stallas and shops that are much much cheaper. Food is just as expensive as anywhere else too. Over this was my 2nd time and i think 7 days is too long but it was really good fun anyway!

Reviews.Title: “Location Service Price. And gaming. All great at NY NY”
Reviews.Author: Mario2k4
Reviews.Content: < 15.00 cab ride to airport ! very comfortable king size beds !! Great service. From bell, front D, house k,s. Bar n Casino servers!!! 2nd Visit. N comming back in 01/11. NY NY, Las Vegas. !!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not Impressed”
Reviews.Author: LPDS14
Reviews.Content: We've been to Vegas four times now and we've stayed at Balley's once and the MGM Grande twice and then just recently stayed at the NY NY. We were not impressed with the NY NY hotel at all. We asked for a king size bed and thought that's what we were getting until we got to the room and it was two queen beds but we were too tired to go back down and change it. The TV was a 15 inch tube TV - and hard to see from bed. The beds weren't that comfortable either. Oh and there was a $12.95 resort fee that surprised us at check in that gets you internet, a newspaper, and two free cheap drinks. Not sure if it's a daily fee or one time fee as we were only there one night. Overall, not that impressed with the hotel and thankful we were only there once night. The only good thing about the hotel is the food. The Nine Fine Guys Irish Pub and the Italian Restaurant IL Fornaio has great food and great service.

Reviews.Title: “really enjoyed NYNY”
Reviews.Author: rollotomasi
Reviews.Content: friends and I travel every year around this time to Vegas. Previously stayed at TI and Mirage. Last year we wandered into NYNY and decided to cool off and play the slots. Since I am an MGM players club member I have been receiving offers to stay at NYNY for 3 comp nights. Decided to go for it and try something new. I like that it is right on the strip and is not too too big and I do not have to spend too much time getting to my room. We were in the Century Tower B with the elevators starting I believe on the 30th floor so it was always a quick ride. Our room was basic and I think really needs some updating. Was clean except my friend found something gross in his bed the next morning that can only be described and a giant scab. I could not look at it or I would not be able to eat breakfast. I left housekeeping a note to change the sheets ASAP and it was done but no apology or anything from them. This was the only negative for the entire trip and it did not ruin it for us. Ate at America for breakfast every morning and tried something new everyday. Also ate and Gonsalves Y Gonsalves, the sandwich place(cannot remember the name) and Nine Fine Irishman. I loved NFI since my background is Irish and I could listen to the live band all night. I had the sheppards pie and it was pretty close to what mom used to make. We saw Zumanity ..... Pretty much a burleque show and I have seen other Cirque shows in past years and I have to say this is my least favourite. The casino was fun and had many slots games I enjoyed. Did not win big money but made enough to keep me playing without losing too much. Went on a bus trip to an outlet mall near the stateline with California. Took about 1/2 hour to get there and did alot of Christmas shopping, I was a nice scenic drive thru the desert. Planning on staying at NYNY again next year and bringing more friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation - Great Place to stay in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: twinsmom1397
Reviews.Content: New York New York is not only a great place with fantastice service and things to do, but has great rooms and you could enjoy yourself without ever leaving the hotel!! Add to that the great prices and location and it is a place I will return to again! Definitly go to the Piano bar and Coyote Ugly!

Reviews.Title: “Good location - average experience..hate resort fee idea”
Reviews.Author: MarinaWinnipeg
Reviews.Content: Got a resonable price for one night $155.00 pluis taxes, when we got there surprise...more up charges...beware of resort fee you have to pay - for me...for nothing...no use for what I got... The casino itself is good - gambling okay, good only average..meh...it was okay...

Reviews.Title: “Lots to do, Lots to see!”
Reviews.Author: Iris981
Reviews.Content: At first, I wasn't happy- At check-in they told me we would be on a different floor from the other couple we traveled with even though we had booked together and received confirmation that our rooms would be side by side. But, after telling them I was not okay with that we received a room upgrade for free and were just a few doors down from our friends. When you book the rooms please note that even though it says the basic room is available as a Two Queen or Single King bed room- it's Not. That rooms has two Queen's only as we were told at check-in. Otherwise it was a great experience! Lots of options for food/drinks and the bed was comfy. At check-in we were given coupons for free drinks, which was nice. Two things you Have To Do are eat at CHIN CHINS (once for breakfast and once again for dinner) and ride the roller coaster! If you're craving a LATE NIGHT meal, go to AMERICA. They have great prices, great food, and a heck of a deal on a surprisingly delicious Rib-Eye steak from 12am to 5am. Someone told me this hotel was a bit "Far down the strip", but I thought it was a great location. Right across from MGM and Excalibur. When you look at the maps it looks like the hotel is not even touching the strip, but in fact it's right on it- It's just that the entrance is on a different road (not a problem at all considering the traffic ON the strip!) The Deuce/Gold Line Bus will take you anywhere else you need to go on the strip for a very reasonable price! I marked "Sleep Quality" as a 3 only because every time the roller coaster went by I could hear the people screaming and it made it impossible to take a much-needed nap in the middle of the day. "Service" I marked at a 3 because I asked the housekeepers for two safety pins and was told they didn't offer things like that and even though we put the do-not-disturb sign on our door and they attempted to come in anyway.

Reviews.Title: “New York New York has a great casino and great location - rooms are OK”
Reviews.Author: DeedsInc
Reviews.Content: Whenever we go to Las Vegas we normally spend the majority of nights at the New York New York. The rooms are nothing extravagant. They have the usual - the TVs seem a little outdated to me but in Vegas, you don't spend much time watching them....nothing in the room is something you would "ooh" and "ahh" over but they are average rooms. The casino and area is great. It looks like New York and they have many restaurants and fast food places that can cater to whatever you want to eat. Overall a great place to stay if you can get a good rate...I wouldn't pay too much to stay here but a good hotel for a decent price if you can get it.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and lots to see.”
Reviews.Author: Tigers98
Reviews.Content: Stayed 10/8-10/11. Found the hotel staff to be average in terms of friendliness, but hey that's what you get in this price range I guess. Room was clean and housekeeping was perfect. We got our requested king size bed in a non-smoking room. Food options to fit about any budget. Pizza place by the casino was delicious. Didn't try any of the sit down places. Casino had a good vibe and was rocking at night. Good place for the younger crowd. Only complaint is the smoke smell is pretty bad. I know the higher end casinos do a better job of filtering out the smoke so once again you get what you pay for. Overall NYNY is a good value for sure. All you need in one place. Being on the south end of the strip you are close to MGM, Monte Carlo, Etc... If you want to see places like Wynn, Strat be prepared to walk. I suggest getting a bus pass for the Deuce, it saved our feet a few times.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but could be better”
Reviews.Author: nicolinka
Reviews.Content: We checked in to a "non-smoking" room and when we got to it it REEKED. We called the front desk and they immediately gave us a different room number and changed our key remotely so we didn't have to go back downstairs for a new key - NICE! The second room smelled clean. The mandatory $14.50 (includes tax) resort fee is a rip off. One reason I chose this hotel over other cheaper ones was that the room photo on their website made the comforters look like real comforters (the down style). They're not. They're the cheap motel style comforters. I wished we had just gotten a room at the Excalibur, because it was much cheaper and probably the same inside. Also, consider staying at a hotel closer to the center of the strip. It's a long way to walk to the end. We did it four times and it got tiring with a 2 1/2 year old.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing place to stay”
Reviews.Author: DawnMarieBrandon_Ms
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled to Las Vegas to get married. This hotel was great. The staff was very helpful in everything we needed. There is a salon on site and was able to see me with very short notice (our flight was very late). The hotel roller coaster was a thrill ride. We were within walking distance of everything we wanted to visit. We will be staying here when we celebrate our anniversary.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay lots of attractions and great prices”
Reviews.Author: graysmomma
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last year for a vegas trip with family and friends. We had a great time because the kids were able to play in the arcade and it had a good sized casino and plenty of restaurants to choose from. We will probably end up staying here again if we get another great deal. Usually around this time there are great deals because it's near Thanksgiving and people usually stay home or do family things instead of coming to Vegas. Our room was actually a handicap room so it was extra spacious and we had a super large bathroom. It was nice because the kids had room to run around unlike the standard rooms. I would definitely recommend this for a family stay.

Reviews.Title: “Vegas In September”
Reviews.Author: LynchTrip
Reviews.Content: Hotel was located in a good location and priced at a reasonable rate. The rooms were clean and the buffet was excellent in the morning at a price of around $12.50 per person. The one item lacking was an in-room coffee pot which I usually like but coffee could be purchased on the ground level. Walking to other hotels was okay but you should probably bring sneakers to ensure comfort. For the elderly, I would recommend taxis. The garage did have a car rental dropoff which I found convenient. Traveled via car to a near-by canyon and took in a magic show at the Luxor. I did use their internet and found their business center to be very responsive in printing out my airline boarding passes.

Reviews.Title: “Getting a bit tired”
Reviews.Author: CKE80Y
Reviews.Content: The hotel in clean and neat, but the decore is really old. The walk to our room was absurd. other than that if you can get it cheap enough go for it! good pool and gambling.

Reviews.Title: “not all that great...”
Reviews.Author: yatrikheidi
Reviews.Content: check in was smooth (i got to the hotel mid afternoonish)....my room number was 2407 - HUGE room, corner windows, very bright, and facing the outdoor portion of the rollercoaster. we heard the screaming and the rollercoaster noise when we were in the room, not a big deal. the pool looked dirty and uninviting from above...but i never actually made it down there. there was a VERY loud and annoying [construction?] noise that awoke me at 6:30 a.m. on october 6 - it was so loud, the walls were vibrating. i opened the curtains but couldn't see anything...called front desk - they weren't aware of any construction project. i did see a pool cleaning machine but am not sure if that was the source of the noise....it doesn't really matter at this point. noise went on for about 45 mins....i was unable to get back to sleep :( nevertheless i'm giving a 3-star rating for sleep quality as i really liked the firmness of the mattress. i would have expected nicer sheets at a four-star hotel (we also stayed two nights at the golden nugget where we had down comforters and very nice pillows and high thread-count linens). starbucks at the hotel is overcrowded and overpriced, the buffet is 12.99 and mediocre at best (no cold cuts, no cheese). the one and only GREAT thing about the hotel was the spa treatment i got - if you do decide to stay at the NYNY, make sure you see JEN. GREAT massage, very relaxing and worth every $. the casino area is filled with smoke (i realize this is vegas, and i'm not anti smoking - but other casinos seem to be doing a better job in handling the smoke situation). the area seemed clean but i had no desire to sit down and play blackjack or spend a lot of money in there. the casino just doesn't have a fun vibe like others do in my opinion. for the price i paid i could have stayed at the TI (they had a 2 for 1 special going on for the time frame i was in vegas). i didn't spend all that much time in the room and i had a fantastic time in vegas, but i'm not reviewing my vacation but the HOTEL, and in closing i'd have to say that the NYNY was mediocre at best - definitely not a four star "resort" (oh yeah, and the resort fee is ridiculous!). i had so much fun with my lady friends and will definitely return to vegas next year! just not to the NYNY....sorry!

Reviews.Title: “stay elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: chicagotoots
Reviews.Content: Stayed there on a promotional rate of 79/night but they added the "resort fees" which still brought the price up to around $100 per night. Room was clean, view was so-so (part building, part rollercoaster), bed comfy, tv worked, swimming pool was small and shaded in the morning and we didn't use it. The restaurants were not cheap (LV Strip prices) and the "coupon book" at checkin was for two free drinks, one newspaper where you had to go somewhere to get (we never did find it... the hotel/casino is huge), and 20% off on shops. Since we had just come from a 14 day tour of China and were very tired, we slept a lot and the rooms were very quiet. Won't do a hotel in Vegas with "resort fees" tacked on ... think the next LV trip we will stay around Fremont Street which is more the "old Las Vegas". This part of the strip was too hard to get around with sidewalks, pedestrian overpasses, and construction. The 24 hour bus pass for $7 was a good deal to get to/front Fremont Street and the stop was across the street from NY, NY.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, room and service yuck.”
Reviews.Author: terrin22
Reviews.Content: NYNY is conveniently located and the casino area was fine, but we were surprised by the poor quality of service and rooms. Our hallway stank like urine/mildew, and trays and trash were left out for more than 24 hrs. and they did not appear to be vacuumed once. We were there 5 days. The room, although billed as "upgraded" and strip view had no closet, a very old tv, occluded windows (by large advertising stickers), mildewy grout in the bathroom, heavy chairs blocked access to the windows/view. The room was never vacuumed. They missed cleaning our room one day, and then acted put out when we asked that it be done in the evening. Mgmt. said they would remove all "resort fees" (!), but then only removed one day's fees. The newspaper had to be retrieved from a gift shop. Internet access was splotchy, often disconnecting. The pool was small, no frills. Of course, we didn't spend a lot of time in the room, and we are generally easy to please, but we were disappointed overall. This was our first stay here, and we chose it over Excalibur (where we had a special rate 1/2 the price of NYNY), because we thought it would be a "notch above", after reading the room descriptions. We were not expecting the Bellagio. Also, we called 1 hour before leaving home on the 10 hr drive to ask if a king size bed was available and they assured us it would "not be a problem" (another reason why we choose this hotel), but when we arrived said "no way". We didn't appreciate the dishonesty. The 2 other places we called were honest and said that a king bed would be iffy. With so many choices in Las Vegas, we would not stay here again. We did enjoy the NY pizza place downstairs.

Reviews.Title: “Stay somewhere else!”
Reviews.Author: dartagnan
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in many of the major hotels on the strip, and I have to say, New York New York is the least impressive. We chose NY NY because they had a good rate and some of our friends had limited budgets. We upgraded our room to the Broadway Deluxe room and it wasn't worth it! The rooms are very outdated. The bathrooms are worse! Our bathroom was poorly lit, the make-up mirror was about to fall off the wall, and the ceiling appeared to have water damage. Our TV didn't work with the remote (we thought the batteries were dead, but after calling to have it replaced, it still didn't work. The room decor was hideous! The windows were very short and narrow offering very little view. The service was horrible and not friendly. Everyone (including management) seemed to hate their jobs. The casino reeked of smoke. We looked forward to every opportunity to leave the hotel and dreaded our return. We hated it! The only thing positive about this hotel is that it is near the center of the strip. Please stay somewhere else and enjoy your time in Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “house keeping needs to flush the toilet!”
Reviews.Author: reno21
Reviews.Content: My husband & I recently stayed at the New York New York for our anniversary. We had stayed at various hotels in Vegas & decided to give this a try. We arrived in the evening. After traveling all day the first thing I did when I got in my room was go to the bathroom. Only to find that there was pee in the toilet & someone forgot to flush! Gross. I had to pee & couldn't wait. I called the desk & they offered to come & clean the toilet but I said I already flushed. By that time we were already settled in our room & didn't want to be disturbed by housekeeping. The front desk didn't seem to think it was a big deal. I thought it was disgusting. We did enjoy our trip & all in all it was a nice place to stay but didn't make a very good first impression. I feel like the desk could have compensated us a little better than offer to come & flush our toilet!

Reviews.Title: “Better Than Expected and I Expected it to be Great!”
Reviews.Author: samsfromcali
Reviews.Content: Due to an irresistible deal, we decided to stay at New York-New York instead of MGM Grand this time. The rooms were recently renovated and our deal included a strip view. The line at check-in was long, as expected, but the line moved fast and our guy was efficient. Our room blew us away! It was on a high floor with a gorgeous view of the southern strip and the roller coaster. The room was spacious, clean, and had windows that practically covered two entire walls. We were adjacent to a room with the ice and soda machines and we didn't hear a peep from the neighbors. The casino is good, but smoky and louder than many others we visited. There are lots of restaurants to choose from, from fast-food to casual to fine-dining and everything isn't so incredibly spread out like MGM Grand is. We used the room service a couple times and it arrived quickly and was reasonably priced (for the Vegas Strip, anyway). I think we have a new favorite place to stay in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “We has a great trip, and walked a gazillion miles”
Reviews.Author: ramar81
Reviews.Content: This was our first time staying at the New York, New York. We were always treated very nicely, the room was clean, the bed was comfortable, and the service was great. The hotel is alitle over welming a first, but once you could navigate your way around, it as good. They had a great place for pizza and beer, and the Time Square Piano bar was alot of fun...we didn get to ride the coaster, it was 12 dollars a person, that we choze to do the free stuff that Vegas has to offer. We would stay there again..

Reviews.Title: “A decent choice if you get a good rate.”
Reviews.Author: DCEllenH
Reviews.Content: Just spent 3 nights at NYNY for a "girl's weekend" Vegas trip. I snagged a good internet rate but wouldn't have wanted to pay rack rates. Room size was fine, decor a bit blah, but was comfortable & clean. Spa was lovely but pool was tiny, overcrowded, and had nothing on it compared to some of the other pools I saw around town (Venetian, Bellagio etc). Dining & nightlife felt exactly like a mall food-court - not what I was hoping for. Basically, this place is a fine utilitarian choice, but next time I'll treat myself to an upgrade at one of the fancier properties on the Strip.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: Blake99
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at NY NY 3 or 4 times now and have never been disappointed. Clean rooms at a great price. The casino has a high ceiling so it is very well ventilated and not too smokey. The games are well spread out so you don't feel cramped. Very good food at reasonable prices. The dueling piano bar is a hoot! The inside decor is very cool as it looks like a New York city block with store fronts and mock apartments. The only downside is the pool. The sun does not start hitting it until around 11 - 11:30 am as it is surrounded by tall building on most sides. People end up fighting for chairs just to get the ones in the most sun. It's a no-frills pool but a fair size.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, cheap, no frills”
Reviews.Author: cavecv
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in September 2010. Our room was clean and quiet. We had a Park Avenue room, later learned that it is well worth the 30.00 to upgrade to a better room. The casino is great, lots of action. We would stay here again if we had a great rate promotion, otherwise we would go back to the Tropicana. The rooms there are new and gorgeous and you are in the same convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “Tired hotel surviving on it's location”
Reviews.Author: duncan_kirk
Reviews.Content: Third trip to Las Vegas and a different hotel every time. The check in process was poor - the hotel didn't have a non-smoking suite available despite being booked 6 months earlier and insisted I take a smoking room (which they described as a smoking / non-smoking room) or paid for a further upgrade. I refused to pay for a further upgrade and so they then insisted I would have to change room after the first night. Again, I said that wasn't acceptable and eventually, they found an appropriate room. Great - a waste of our forst hour in Las Vegas. The rooms are large, as are most rooms in Las Vegas, but they are tired. There is no minibar, the TV was old, and none of the lamps could be switched off without unplugging them at the mains.
