This explained why all the bulbs in the lamps were loose when we tried to switch them on - the previous guest had obviously had the same experience. We were woken on the first monring by housekeeping trying to clean the room at 8.45 in the morning. How many people are up at that time in Las Vegas? Subsequently, we remembered to stick the 'Do Not Disturb' sign on the door each night. Check out was slow (again, not dissimilar to all Las Vegas hotels) but the valet was very quick in delivering our car, and with no charge. And the resort fee of $12.50 - that is a con, especially considering it is supposed to include WiFi access aqnd yet when you enter the details, it eventually responds with your name not matching what their staff has entered into their computers. Next time, we'll look to stay in The Venetian I think.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for a Las Vegas experience”
Reviews.Author: Jenshall
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a good location for the value. Recommended if you don't want to spend to much on the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place in the amazing Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Giovanni_Benassi
Reviews.Content: The Hotel, placed on the famous Strip, is beautiful with all the New York features. The roller coaster is an incredible experience. The room was big, clean and well furnished. All you have to do is enjoy the fabulous las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Dont waste your money, time or energy.”
Reviews.Author: DustyLylac
Reviews.Content: What a horrible hotel! The Luxor was even better! Dirty rooms, dirty towels, horrible service; rude. Didn't even recognize our $50s worth of chips comped for booking on Expedia. Worst experience I have ever had in Vegas. Will never stay again. FYI, check your sheets before going to bed!

Reviews.Title: “Fun place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Juls101
Reviews.Content: Arrived 4 and half hours late due to plane delay and were the only ones checking in. Very helpful lady behind the desk - she apologised to us immediately that we couldnt have an upgrade as there was a convention in town for the next few days but if we would like to check back on the weekend she would see if she could move us. (we didnt enquire as once we were settled we didnt want to have to move). We had booked 'Vinnys package' direct with the hotel and they gave us a great booklet with offers for Nathans the hotdag place (never got used) and lots of 2 -4-1's at Central bar and the roller coaster. We had a lovely room, 2 queen beds, non smoking as requested. Room service was every day and very good. All hand soap/gels etc were replaced if used and room left clean and tidy. We overlooked the Excalibur, MGM and had the main part of the roller coaster outside of our window (we were on the 26 floor) I was a bit worried about this initally but only heard the odd low level rumble every now and then and it never woke us up. Did have LOTS of helicopters going over as the airport was just up the road but again it wasnt a loud noise. The resturants were good - Americas had excellant service, food palatable, failry good prices. Pizza place was open til late and had huge slices Italian was great for breakfast (croissants etc) Chinese - friends ate there and said it was good. Bars Dueling piano bar was always very full but great fun 9 Fine Irishmen - great happy hour which was free $5 entry was later in the evening which I wasnt willing to pay being a resident in the hotel Central bar was where we spent most of our time and always stopped off there for a night cap. Very friendly, lots of people came in after midnight from other hotels. Great during the week BUT change in atmosphere on Friday and Saturday. Rowdy, pushy, very smoky. Room service was reasonable and we used it on one occasion - very fresh, hot food. Good selection of condiments, ice bucket etc. The pool was small but ok. Only went and sat in the shade by it once but my friend did swim one morning and said it was a great temperature etc. Was very full of people putting towels out in the morning she said. Overall it was a great place to stay. Not sure I would stay there again as it is slightly towards the end of the strip but was perfect for us as we had friends staying in the Excalibur so we were joined by a overpass. The holiday was great and the hotel was perfect - hope anyone who goes enjoys it as much as we did

Reviews.Title: “decent choice for vegas”
Reviews.Author: intsik
Reviews.Content: thought the hotel is not new, the rooms were surprisingly well kept and pretty clean. and for the amount of noise and goings-on downstairs, i got a pretty quiet stay there. staff were friendly and nice. location wise, it is kind of the southern end of the strip, but the bus stops in front of it, so no worries really. the game floor and commons areas were too busy for me. a lot of students/younger twenty-somethings stay and play here, so it got a bit annoying and obnoxious on saturday night. would stay here again, but maybe not on the weekends.

Reviews.Title: “Las Vegas is a mad, crazy, fantastic place - you must visit!”
Reviews.Author: Stroudiepuss
Reviews.Content: The hotel is great, check in/out was a breeze, as with all hotels in LV it is huge and we constantly got lost, there is on site car hire via Dollar, and a business centre where you can get free access to book in for your flights (if necessary.) The 'America' restaurant is great, as is the breakfast buffett at Win Chin (?) Chinese restaurant. I cannot recommend "Nine Fine Irish Men" Iris pub highly enough, although you do have to pay $5 each to get in, and the drinks are very pricey, but we had a great night, and sang ourselves hoarse.

Reviews.Title: “" WOW " What a great experience”
Reviews.Author: LuLuEdinburgh_10
Reviews.Content: This hotel has everything you could ever want pubs, cabaret,sing alongs, great food.excellent staff, nightclubs, irish bar and a fantastic atmosphere. Check in was fast and friendly we had already been upgraded by our holiday company free , the girl at check out asked if we would like a second one to a strip view but as it was going to eat into our spending money and the fact we hoped not to spend a lot of time in our room we said no, she upgraded us anyway, our room was big and clean with floor to ceiling windows fab. The one downfall is the pool the sun does not come round until 12.30pm and leaves again around 5.00pm but the time we had at the pool was great fun. I went on Holiday with my 23 year old daughter and was made to feel her age at all the clubs we went to this hotel knows how to make you feel welcome (the Scottish accent helped a lot they loved it ) My daughter is going back next year with a crowd of her girl pals and will of course be staying at the New York. Thanks to all the staff

Reviews.Title: “Fun Place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: Scotty61_10
Reviews.Content: We arrived early Sunday around noon. Took the upgrade with strip view, room was ready. Had a very good lunch at Il Forniaio then explored the hotel. Lots of good restaurants and bars. Had breakfast at "America" every morning and didn't get tired of it. Great Mexican food and staff at Gonzalez. Some nice shops with 20% guest discount. Our room on the 22nd floor of the Century Towers was very comfortable and clean. We slept very well here. Close to everything. We did not rent a car, cut through MGM across the street to get to the Monorail for complete strip access, fast and no crowds. Took Taxi at NYNY to Fremont Street. We enjoyed our stay here and would return.

Reviews.Title: “Just got back and LOVED IT!!”
Reviews.Author: angelwinks_ca
Reviews.Content: Before we booked, i wanted to make sure I did as much research as possible. We wanted location, cleanliness, great price, convenience to rooms (i.e. not having a hike through the casino to get to the room), great food and definitely on the strip! I went through all the comments on Trip Advisor, talked to friends and checked the bed bug registry and narrowed it down to a few hotels. I searched for promo codes and joined any newsletters I could find on these hotels. You can usually find these on the hotel website. Whenever I'd find a promo code, I'd plug it into the site to see the deal. Once we found a great deal we liked, we booked online. It says they cannot guarantee a non smoking room so my hubby called to be sure since i have asthma. We ended up paying $110 for the Saturday night and $55.00 for Sunday-Wed night for the Park Avenue Deluxe room this September 2010. When we checked in, I inquired about an emailed deal I received right before I left about an upgrade to a spa room. She said there were no spa rooms for the Saturday night but I can check on Sunday. She said she either has the room we booked (a king size bed) or a room with two queen beds with an amazing room of the strip. She said this was a great room that is usually an upgrade. When we seen the room, we knew we wouldn't inquire about the Spa Room. It was a corner room with a full view of the strip and roller coaster out the side window and a partial view of the strip out the front window. We had tons of windows and it felt very spacious! We were near the end of the hallway on the 24th floor. I think the room number was 2470. We had a bit of a hike from the elevator but not too bad. It was nice to be near the end because we heard absolutely no noise from the hallway. We worried that the roller coaster would be noisy but we didn't hear it at all. Overall, we were extremely impressed with the room. The shampoo, condition, etc was replaced daily and the towels and beds were great! Free internet hookup which aloud us to keep in touch with the kids back home. All those windows and tons of light BUT with great curtains which blacked it out make for a perfect room! The checkin desk is conveniently located and close to the elevator to the rooms. You don't have a huge hike through the casino to check in or to get to the elevators. We didn't eat a lot at our hotel, but did enjoy the coffee and muffins at the little cafe in the "streetscape". We did enjoy pizza the first night at New York Pizza. It was really good! We are not into the bar scene and prefer shows which we seen three. One night we did stop and sit outside the bar in the "street" and enjoy the piano playing while having a drink. i cannot comment on the casino as we only played a few dollars at each hotel just to say we played. We actually spent about $40 and won $70! The stores were great and we found lots of neat New York items! I wanted a plane pillow with New York on it. i seen other hotel ones and though I would find one at my own hotel the last night, but was disappointed i couldn't find one. All they had was Las Vegas ones. Not a huge deal, but really the only UGH moment at this hotel. We went to the pool one morning and thought it was great! Its in shade in the AM and full sun in the afternnoon. The pool was a bit cold since we were there in the AM. I'm sure its refreshing in the hot PM sun but I thought it was too cold in the AM. We stuck to the hot tub. There are 3 hot tubs. The lounge chairs seem a bit dirty but I think they were just stained. Not attractive but there are nicer chairs that can be rented. Not a great view of the parking garage and the roller coaster runs over top. If you are going to relax, maybe not a great spot for it. There is a walkway over the Excalibur which also has a FREE tram to the Mandalay Bay! There is also a walkway over the MGM Grand which was awesome! That's 4 hotels all connected! Anyway to save on walking is a bonus! We would DEFINATELY stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Staff, Restaurants, and Valet”
Reviews.Author: Stangman93
Reviews.Content: I have never stayed at NYNY, but wanted to try something different from my usual MGM or Paris hotels. Very easy access from Tropicana, and great ability to drive off property without hitting the traffic from the Strip. I arrived and the valets were so quick to greet me and help me. Check-in was a breeze and finding my elevators were easy as well. I was on the 21 floor, at the furthest room to the north (2183). From the elevator to my room, it was approximately 200 yards and involved taking almost 20 turns. The room was okay, large but stained carpet and old school tv. The bathroom was nice, but had this horrible blue/gray marble throughout. I was disappointed in the main casino area, my last visit it was still designed to look like Central Park. It has been renovated and looks very modern/contemporary. Best advice, tip the valet when you drop off your car, they will leave it up front so you don't have to wait for it when you need it. The pool area is extremely small considering how huge the hotel is and was always crowded. Overall it was a nice stay, but I would try some of the other large Hotel and Casino's first. You will be charged a daily resort fee, which isn't bad because it covers high speed internet plus other amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place!!”
Reviews.Author: redjet
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed at NYNY with friends towards the end of July. We were pleasantly suprised with the cleanliness and affordability of this hotel. The pool was great for us 40-somethings, nice music, no crazy 20-somethings getting waisted at 10am, really great place for R/R. The only drawback was the $11 resort fee, which is a scam. We tried to get it waived as we didn't use the wireless internet or free paper, but no luck. Would stay here again, expecially if they reduce that rediculous fee!!

Reviews.Title: “Average place but good for ticking a "Vegas" theme hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: TravelTiger2010
Reviews.Content: We knew it would be average but we wanted to stay in a themed hotel while in Las Vegas. Rooms felt dated and so did the casino. Having said that, it's not a bad place for a one-nighter. Roller coaster is good for a laugh. I can see families enjoying this one.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing room!”
Reviews.Author: angiebeno
Reviews.Content: I pre-booked a basic room for two nights and on arrival requested a room with a strip view - this cost $15 a night - Hands down the best $30 i ever spent! We got a corner room in the new yorker A tower on the 32nd floor with views of the strip on two walls - it was the best room i have ever stayed in. The room was clean, spacious, comfortable and there was no noise to be heard from next door, the rollercoaster or the corridor so i slept soundly on a Saturday night in Vegas (Unheard of!) If i had to make one complaint its that the check in desk was slow - too many customers and not enough desk staff - but this in no way spoiled my enjoyment and i will definately stay here on my next visit to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: KiwiUKtraveller
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at New York New York. On check in we were asked if we wanted to pay extra to upgrade our room (think it was 10-15 dollars a night). We said no. We then asked for a non-smoking room and as they didn't have any left they had to upgrade us for free ! The pool was smallish for such a large hotel, but fine for our purposes. The food at the Italian restaurant and the Mexican restaurant were both fantastic. The breakfast buffet however was a bit average so we opted for just a bagel the remaining days. We hired a car from the hotel - the lady at the desk was unbelievably helpful. She gave us great tips and was a perfect example of amazing service. We drove to the grand canyon for a few nights (5 hours each way). It's an easy drive and well worth it. NY NY seems to have a younger crowd than some other hotels, but we would def'ly recommend. We took the free craps lesson at the hotel (well worth it to those like us who have no idea how the game works) and then enjoyed many sessions thereafter. The casino itself is smaller than some of the others on the strip, but friendly enough and had everything we wanted. The rooms were more than big enough, and to anyone used to europe sized hotel rooms they're enormous. Tried the rollercoaster - half price to anyone staying at the hotel between 11am-12. Well worth $7 each, but I was covered in bruises afterwards. Don't be put off by some of the other reviews on this site - the hotel is great and if I get the chance to go back to vegas, I'll def'ly stay there again. One tip to pass on - the taxi to the airport from NYNY is cheaper than two people in a shuttle. (The hotel is down towards the end of the strip closest to the airport). cost of taxi should be $10-12ish. After our flight we had to wait about 15 mins before the shuttle left the airport, if we'd known the taxi was so cheap we never would have waited for the shuttle !!

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: chriselk1n
Reviews.Content: We managed to get a premium view room which was in the Century Tower on the 2nd highest floor - it was an amazing view - best I've ever seen in a room in Vegas anyway. Although the room itself was quite basic, the view more than made up for this. I ordered room service one morning which although was prompt, the quality of it was average at best. However, there is a pizza place in the hotel which does amazing pizza! Can't remember what it was called though. All in all a very good hotel and not given enough credit. Would stay there again if I could get the same kind of view!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful anniversary at New York New York”
Reviews.Author: txmimi
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at New York New York to celebrate our 35th wedding anniversary. We had the most wonderful time here. The staff was very friendly and helpful, room was a little dated but very clean, housekeeping was excellent. We enjoyed the casino (loved the Deal or No Deal slots) and the food choices. Our room was on the 10th floor facing the roller coaster but only heard it one time during our whole stay. Would highly recommend New York New York and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: LindaB047
Reviews.Content: I stayed at New York last September while their pool was out of service. We were able to use adjacent hotel pool but since sun and pool was what I was there for I was displeased. I voiced my displeasure and they said I would be contacted. Sure enough I recieved an email for a free night stay, I was skeptical that I would ever see that complimentary stay but I called the other day, told Donna the night I would I would be there and she said no problem. I am ending up staying at NY my entire trip because I am very impressed. Linda B.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot!!”
Reviews.Author: Nicolas_Simard
Reviews.Content: Nice spot, right on the Strip. A lot of restaurant and bars. Less expensive than the majority of the hotel on the strip. Don't miss the Gran Canyon and the Death Valley... these are the two greatest National Park i've ever visited. Only bad thing I have to say is that the pool close at 6 pm.

Reviews.Title: “Fun Place, good location”
Reviews.Author: lestafan
Reviews.Content: First impression of this hotel were not good – The front desk staff were not particularly welcoming and only two of the three rooms I had reserved were available for immediate occupation, despite the fact that it was well past the earliest check in time. I passed this off as due to the fact that check in was busy with large queues. I was given a hotel extension number to ring the front desk for the room number of the third room to check when it would be ready and the woman who answered was downright rude with no customer service attitude – there is no excuse for this. The second thing that annoyed me was that despite the fact that I had booked and paid for the room in advance I was then told that there would be an additional ‘resort charge’ of $12.95 per room per night, which was a total charge of $155 that I had not been expecting, as there had been no mention of this previously. No one could tell me what this charge was for – why not just add it on to the room rate at the reservation stage? Anyway, the, rooms were large, clean and quite well appointed, with a good view of the strip and the housekeeping staff were friendly and cheerful. NYNY is quite a lively hotel and very noisy in the area of the bars and shops, so suitable for those that want a bit of fun. Breakfast in the ‘America’ restaurant was good value (for the strip) and service was quick. However, we ate there on two evenings and found the service painfully slow and even had difficulty in getting someone to take our money! The food was also nothing to get excited over, although again reasonably priced. In contrast, we also ate one evening at the Il Fornaio Italian restaurant within the hotel and found both the service and the food to be excellent. Previous reviews mentioned the smell of cigarette smoke in the casino and public areas but I have to say that this is not something I noticed, even though I am a non smoker. The hotel is easy to find your way around as it is more compact that most of the large hotels on the strip and has every thing you are likely to need. It also connects by footbridge to MGM Grand and Excaliber / Luxor / Mandalay Bay, so you do not have to venture too far outside if it is hot. All in all, we enjoyed our stay here and the fact that room rates were reasonable for our mid-week stay offset the irritation of the ‘resort charge’.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for first time visit to Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Goomjella
Reviews.Content: Myself and partner stayed here whilst traveling around the states and we stayed for 3 nights. We thought the hotel was nice, the room comfy and clean, and very good for the price. The only downside points were that the staff weren't very friendly, nor did they try and help when we asked them anything, we kept on getting a call on our room phone at 9am everyday waking us up for no reason and the casino and restaurants are quite overpriced. The hotel is at the top end of the strip so a bit of a walk to get to ceasers or bellagio, but its quicker then catching the bus.

Reviews.Title: “So great!”
Reviews.Author: sumackc
Reviews.Content: I have to say, I was confused by the some good/some bad comments here, but we had a blast. From when I first made our reservations to the end of our stay, the employees there were so nice and accommodating. The food everywhere in the hotel was great and the prices were very moderate for Vegas. We had nine of us there to celebrate our son's college graduation with friends and family. All of us had a great time. The pool is a little small, but lots of fun. Good music pipped in everywhere, clean, comfortable and again, moderately priced. I would definitely go again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!!!”
Reviews.Author: npma
Reviews.Content: I went to Las Vegas in April for 3 days w/my Mom. We loved it @ New York New York! Even though we showed up @ 2 before check in, we went and asked if any rooms were ready yet, the lady was super friendly, and checked her computer and allowed us to check in an hour early. We asked for an upgrade to a Park Avenue room w/a strip view and she said for an extra $15 per night it was no problem.Our tower was easy to find, I can't remember what tower we were in the first night, but the 2nd night our tower was the New Yorker and we didn't ever wait more than 1 minute for an elevator. We got up to our room, and found that it wasn't a strip view, we had only a view of the airport. We called front desk right away and they said they could move us in the morning and refund us $15. After we checked in and got settled we went downstairs to eat @ Sirrico's pizza, and they have the best pizza I've ever tried. It's great, I go there everytime I go to Vegas. The next morning we went downstairs to see if they could move us to our strip view that we paid for and the lady said "well according to our computer you do have a strip view." and was kinda rude about it so I said "Well has your computer been up to the room to see the view? It's of the airport." and that made her laugh a little and she wasn't so rude anymore, and gave us keys to our new room, which was 2853 and we walked in and it was waaay better! We had an amazing view of the strip and more than half of our room was a giant window. We were much happier w/that. The beds were super comfortable, and housekeeping was always so nice. The Ice Machine didn't work on our floor and neither did the pop machine. The casino is great, me and my mom never lost each other, if we went our seperate ways. It got super busy over the weekend, but it was great. We ate at Il fornio (if that's what its called) an Italian restaurant, and it was great, our server was super friendly and I don't remember his name, but he worked @ Americas the next morning and was our server there too for breakfast! Breakfast @ America's was always great, the staff was all very friendly and happy all the time, food was great and in huge portions (which my mom and I would share, after we seen how big the portions were.) Food was quick and they kept on top of the coffee (which my mom liked!) I don't think I had any complaints about New York New York, i'd love to stay here again! I'm kind of wishing I booked here for next month instead of Planet Hollywood Towers. Definately will be back to New York New York! Usually make it out to Las Vegas 4+ times a year!

Reviews.Title: “Restaurants close too early...”
Reviews.Author: kimba_01
Reviews.Content: I love the NYNY, but usually it is a bit overpriced so I was happy to get a good price this time. Beds were comfy. I did check for bedbugs and saw none, whew! They upgraded us to the next level room but I didn't think it was that great, about the same. Said she gave us a great view, well, not really, but I wasn't worried about the view as I have seen it all before and I live there. The biggest disappointment was that on my BD we stayed up late and wanted to eat. The only place open was America, which has got to be the worst restaurant I have been too. Denny's does it better! Service is horrendous, food is so so, overpriced (normal on the Strip though) and it takes forever to get to you. I probably will not stay here again, because there are just too many other choices and it was basically just average. Personally, I liked the Orleans better!

Reviews.Title: “Felt like we were slumming after staying at the Bellagio on previous visits”
Reviews.Author: pommytsmommy
Reviews.Content: Hotel is not well maintained. Lack of proper maintenance is obvious. Hotel employees seem disinterested at best. There is no security person to check for room keys at the elevators going to the rooms. Resort fees are a turn off and are taxed.

Reviews.Title: “Not our style”
Reviews.Author: SnowbirdAkron_OH
Reviews.Content: This stop was part of a month long car trip. We should have known better than to stay at a large hotel since we usually stay at smaller places but thought we'd try this for a change. We had a corner room on the 34th floor and the view was spectacular. The room was large and comfortable. We ate breakfast in the hotel and the first day the service was really bad. We went back the second day and another waiter was just fine. The smoke in the casino was overpowering so we left after a sort time. Of course everything was overpriced. If you love Las Vegas, this would be a nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fun hotel, great location!”
Reviews.Author: lowercase02
Reviews.Content: The location for this hotel is perfect because it's connected via walking overpass to MGM, which is connected to the Monorail System that takes you up the whole strip, and it's connected via peoplemover to Excalibur, which is connected to Mandalay Bay and Luxor. So staying here is the perfect "hub" in Vegas! The pool is nothing special; because of the tall buildings (part of the new york skyline theme) there is only sun for a small portion mid-day. Otherwise, it's still hot but shady (aka muggy). Also, food places here close down too early. Besides a sit down restaurant, there's no place to get a snack in the middle of the night (like there are other hotel/casinos in vegas).

Reviews.Title: “OK Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LabelleLondon
Reviews.Content: We stayed at New York New York for 3 nights in June at the end of a 2 week road trip in California. It was our first time in Vegas and I don't think anything prepares you for it! We did enjoy our stay but really hated the fact that people are still allowed to smoke indoors. It meant that everywhere was incredibly smoky and we stank of smoke every time we went back to our room which was revolting. The hotel is OK, it's all perfectly functional but nothing special. We spent a bit of time by the pool which was OK but very crowded with all the sun loungers right next to each other. We ventured into the casino a few times but after an hour or so the smoke would get too much. Our room was fine although we had no view whatsoever and just looked at another wall, but the room itself was clean and comfortable and had a nice bathroom. Any staff we encountered seemed really friendly and the restaurants we tried were good. The location is OK although it takes ages to get anywhere if you try to walk up the Strip, we got on the monorail at the MGM Grand and went up to the Venetian which was lovely, but once again all of these hotels were really smoky which slightly ruined things. We took a trip out to the Grand Canyon which was great and then renewed our vows with Elvis which was hilarious, so all in all we had a good time in Vegas but we won't go back until they ban smoking indoors!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: summerfunOhio
Reviews.Content: NY NY is right in the middle of the Vegas Strip. You can walk nearly everywhere from this hotel. The rooms are clean. There are not many extras, but the price is right. I was worried we would hear the roller coaster noise - but did not. We were on the 26th floor - the higher you are, the less noise from the coaster. The pool is a little small, but never seemed to be crowded. Good deal for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Huge rooms, great attractions in the party city of America”
Reviews.Author: matt303939
Reviews.Content: Check in staff are quick and efficient cosidering the amount of people that stay in this hotel. It is enormous just like all of the hotels in Vegas. The rooms are huge with big, comfy beds and are very clean. The are plenty of attractions at the hotel including the rollercoaster, Irish bar, Coyote Ugly bar and of course the casino itself. It is next to MGM Grand and Monte Carlo, but the only downside is a bit of a trek to the likes of Bellagio and Caesars Palace in 45 degree heat, but would not stop me from staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SAMLisbon
Reviews.Content: I went to the New York New York Las Vegas Hotel in my honeymoon because I wanted to give a surprise to my wife (she loves New York) and I must say that everything went good. It's not a fantastic hotel but it’s a good Hotel for a fair price. I wasn’t expecting much and I didn’t got it. Instead, It was 3 nights in a nice room, very good sleep, nice restaurants and animation. The only thing that I didn’t like was that the corridors were a little bit messy, even after the housekeepers passed by.

Reviews.Title: “Great time at NYNY”
Reviews.Author: CarlaS23
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in August with 3 friends for 6 nights. We had a brilliant time. NYNY had everything we needed and sometimes we had to force ourselves to go out and explore Las Vegas. Most nights we would end up coming back to Times Square Bar because it was so much fun. Our check in/check out was quick and service was good at all times throughout our stay. We were sad to leave by the end of our trip. I definately rate NYNY highly.

Reviews.Title: “Almost ruined my birthday weekend.”
Reviews.Author: Gryz
Reviews.Content: We went to this hotel for my birthday in April and it almost ruined the weekend. Upon check-in the clerk asked me for the credit card I booked the room with I gave her a visa and she said that was the wrong one. I handed her my Visa Debit card thinking I stupidly booked the room with my debit card. She said it was the correct one. Since our flight was about 5 hours late and it was midnight by the time we checked in we just went to bed. The next day we found out they had put a hold on my card for a $300 room of nearly $1000 all the money I had planned for the weekend. When i went to complain they offered me a room upgrade... to a smoking room that stunk didn't look clean and the shower didn't drain. And it get's worse! Yes it does. My wife had $300 in a different account which we took out in the hotel ATM which spit out 3 $100 bills. We took 1 to the nightclub in NYNY and were told it was a counterfit and they wouldn't take it. Fortunatly their machines I guess didn't get the same memo as the bouncer since I promptly put it into a video craps machine and won $30 then requested to be paid out in $20s (the only highlight of the hotel). Zumanity was also an awesome show my wife and I enjoyed.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the stay”
Reviews.Author: dnbalchandani
Reviews.Content: Had nice view of strip from the room, has luvly roller-coaster, casino was good too. Just one issue was that its just in the beginning of the strip, so if you don't have car, you need to catch a bus or rent one - coz its difficult to go to other good hotels of the strip from this one.

Reviews.Title: “New York, New York gets an A plus”
Reviews.Author: marsa18
Reviews.Content: I stayed at New York on August 1, 2, and 3 , 2010 and had a pleasant stay at this hotel. I paid $69 per night and was extremely satisfied about this hotel. I will definitely stay at this hotel next time I am in Vegas. I had previously cancelled my reservations in Excalibur after reading some reviews in bedbugregistry.com. The receptionist at New York was friendly and upgraded my room at no additional charge. The room we stayed was in the NewYorker Tower, 6th floor. It was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: wadsyquokka
Reviews.Content: Had no problems at all with this hotel. Got a great deal off facebook for New York New York that beat any other deal they offered or any other deal on the internet. Forget expedia etc etc for booking a hotel in Vegas. Go straight to the hotel website or become a fan of the hotel on facebook and get offered a good deal there. My deal included a free upgrade to a Park Avenue deluxe room with a view of the strip. Was on the 27th floor and may have heard the roller coaster once or twice in the whole week I was there. Hotel was clean and my room looked exactly like it did on the New York New York website. Great location as well. There is a resort fee for New York New York but that includes free use of their health club and internet access. Check out was oh so easy just done on the television, no need to wait in line downstairs. I'm really not sure what people expect from a hotel and I think so many must just look for something to complain about. For the price I paid this hotel definitely deserves all five stars. Just one thing though, if you are looking for a great pool scene you would probably want to go somewhere else. It's not bad just not great.

Reviews.Title: “Great Reunion at New York, New York”
Reviews.Author: Chinchuwan
Reviews.Content: We spent a few days at the New York, New York for a class reunion. Check in was a breeze thanks to Liza, she managed to find us rooms only 3 doors down from each other, even though we had a spa suite and a park ave room. We enjoyed all the food choices - especially the Fulton Fish Co. - great clams. Had breakfast at the America Restaurant one morning and the two of us had enough food to feed five people. Great location - walkways to the MGM and Excalibur. Housekeeping was in and out and our room was always ready when we returned in the afternoon to get ready for the evening events. Rooms were pretty large and we had a great view of the coaster, which i was too chicken to ride. Saw Zumanity and highly recommend that.

Reviews.Title: “Fun and easy for a night with kids - just passing through town”
Reviews.Author: forensiclisa
Reviews.Content: Clean and fun, kids weren't running everywhere while we were there as other reviewers have complained about. Staff very nice and accomodating even GIVING my daughter the pillow she slept on because she loved it so much. Pool closed at 7pm on a Wednesday night which was a little annoying. Right across the street from a mall like food court that's open 24 hours along with a Denney's - very convenient with kids. Arcade and roller coaster was a hit with the older kids, of course. Just a great overnight stay with a glimpse of Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Whirlwind in 5 days”
Reviews.Author: WineandYoga
Reviews.Content: Treated my daughter for her 21st birthday! Hotel room was spacious, clean and very comfortable. Roller coaster drop was just outside our room and we didn't hear it at all. Would highly recommend the pizza at Siricco's (not sure of the spelling) and also the Mexican restaurant had the best food and margarita's. As a perk the hotel offers complimentary drinks, newspaper and also a 20% discount at their shops. The casino wasn't at all smokey and the waitresses were always nearby for a free drink. Their pool is not so hot....all shallow water and it looked like March break with all the young folks, drinking and carousing. Although the DJ was pretty good. The front desk and cashier desk were very helpful and polite. My daughter went on the roller coaster and absolutely loved it...worth the $14.00. All in all our stay was fantastic, would defintely do it again!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Just above OK”
Reviews.Author: yoyomom
Reviews.Content: We visited LAS in our teen some 5 years ago (not) and did not think the city is family friendly. But, LAS advertise itself as a family destination so, we decided to give it a try. Well, let's start with the Hotel. New, NY is a great base. ROOM is nice. Love the eatery downstairs. POOL-not great at all. Basically, it's really freezing before 1pm because the pool was in deep shade. After 1pm of course it is unbearably hot. BUT, you have SWIMMING PRIVILEDGE at MonteCarlo. They have lazy river, wave pool, etc. We visited their pool twice. LAS is too hot in the morning for us, San Franciscan. But, will stay here again after we tried MonteCarlo and MGM. LAS is not a family destination! Non smokers in California are spoiled. I feel my lung was working really hard in the last 5 days. But, I guess that is LAS. My daughter had her first encounter with those lovely drunk not so gentelmen and ladies. A great teaching moment about Alcohol! My husband take away from the trip? He said, "Lotsa boobies" Very surprising, since my husband is a mellow guy. Again, a great teaching tools about modesty. Dont take trams. The location of the terminal is soooooo far away from the strip. Not worth it. Take bus instead. It will take you in front of wherever you want to go.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Experience”
Reviews.Author: RogerF23
Reviews.Content: This was the first time I stayed on this hotel and I gotta say this was the funniest, wonderful, and most exciting experience. If you are traveling with friends and what you are looking for fun this is the right place. It is full of different places according to your needs. Also, the rooms are enormous. (mine was Broadway deluxe). Maybe the only thing is that you don't get a flat screen TV, you get a normal one. This hotel could be the best if they did some updates on it.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed my experience at the New York, New York Casino”
Reviews.Author: karoleigh
Reviews.Content: I reserved this casino for my last two nights of a Western trip that concluded in Nevada. Although I have stayed in several hotels on the strip, this was my first stay in this hotel. I had always passed up the opportunity to stay here in the past, becuase I feared that the roller coaster noise would bother me. When I checked in, the check-in staff member informed me that I was going to receive an upgrade. After check-in, we went up to our room up on one of the high floors. Upon entering the room, I was greatly impressed by the view and the gorgeous decor of the room. This WAS definitely an upgrade from their sister hotel next door, the Monte Carlo. We looked out and saw the roller coaster. I will have to say that the noise from the roller coaster could be heard, although it wasn't bothersome. I do not recommend this hotel to families with children. The pool is good enough for many adults, and was certainly adequate for our needs. There were three hot tubs next to the pool. I really liked it that the hot tubs were in the shade. The pool was in the shade throughout the morning, although if you are a sun seeker, you can still get some sun on the pool deck if you want to. If you have children, I would recommend the Monte Carlo, since they have more pool activites than this hotel (lazy river, wave pool, hot tub, regular pool). If you are an adult who would like to avoid noisy children and splashing, the New York, New York hotel is for you. The pool area is much quieter, and we saw very few children. One of the good features of this hotel is the food court. If you aren't into buffets, you have the convenience of having some casual food court choices on the ground floor of the casino. The casino has a game room for the children. I would definitely stay at this hotel again and would ask for the upgrade. It doesn't cost that much more. I will also say that as an adult without children, I would stay here instead of the Monte Carlo. If you are interested in having the all-day buffet, you can walk over to the Monte Carlo and get that. They do not have a buffet at the New York, New York. The hotel is located on the south end of the strip, which is the closest place to the airport. That will cut down on your cab fare and also make a quicker trip to and from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Cool and Fun”
Reviews.Author: LauraN6
Reviews.Content: It's was just right to new york if haven't been there like I have

Reviews.Title: “New York in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: LE_FTL
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a true classic - seen in many movies, post cards and everybody is talking about the spectacular roller coaster. As a European, I like the kinda old school feeling of the typically American rooms. Breakfast is OK, very sweet stuff and light coffee, but that's, again, the US ;-) Location is great, walking distance to many attractions and shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Bed bugs”
Reviews.Author: pepsi36
Reviews.Content: Myself and my friend were bitten by bed bugs. Hotel moved us to another room and i was bitten again. Basic rooms without fridges. Small area around swimming pool. Very cramped

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - great prices”
Reviews.Author: ILLV
Reviews.Content: This hotel has great deals. If you need a deal, this is the hotel we recommend. This is one hotel where they have a ton of casual restaurants so you don't have to go far to eat. ESPN Zone, Chin Chin, slices of pizza, Nine Fine Irishmen Pub, Gonzalez y Gonzalez, Nathan's Hot Dogs, TCBY, etc. etc. etc. Probably great if you have kids with the Coney Island casino and roller coaster as well as easily obtained cheap eats. Our room was very pretty and not noisy as a lot of people say. Our room was not near the roller coaster. You have pedestrian bridges to MGM and to Excalibur, with a free tram to Luxor and Mandalay Bay. The casino has a lot of Wheel of Fortune slots, which are the most fun. Recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Not a family atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: ddo21122
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here with our two teenage daughters (18 & 15) for three nights and I was horrified at the sights. New York New York itself was okay. We stayed in the broadway deluxe rooms on the 18th floor in the Century building. The bathroom was outdated and had mold in the shower. The beds were okay, not great. The roller coaster was right outside our window and you could hear everything. There was a helicopter landing site close by too so you could hear those flying over all evening. We were probably the only family running for the safety of our hotel at sunset. The pool was small and closed at 7pm. Don't fall for the "great prices" the hotels charge you $30 extra for each child and then resort fees of $15 a day on top of the tax. It's not a great deal. The streets are loaded with people giving out cards with naked girls on them and they are littered all over the street. There are scantly dressed women everywhere. The hotel is VERY smokey and alcohol is everywhere with people falling all over themselves. All of the casino's are very confusing with poor directions to get places. They make you walk through the casio floor to get anywhere. We did see Mac King the magician at Harrah's (day show) and he was wonderful. We also saw Viva Elvis at the Aria and that was great as well. Everything was overpriced. We traveled to the Hoover Dam and the Grand Canyon and I would recommend those places over Las Vegas anyday. I have no desire to return.

Reviews.Title: “A good time at the New York New York”
Reviews.Author: Manitobacaps
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the New York New York from July 18th-23rd. We had a Spa Suite which we found to be extremely nice........ Check-In , as others have stated, was long, but once we got to the front of the line was quick and painless..... My only concern regarding check-in was that it was never explained to us about the resort fee and what you got for the $ 12.95/ night.... Found out three days into our stay that we were supposed to receive two bottles of water/ day and a daily newspaper.... Also was never told that if you shop at Soho Village , you get 20% your purchases.... A kind lady that works there told us after we had already spent close to $200.00 the day before.... Oh well no big deal...... Pool wasn't as bad as others have stated in our opinion..... Restaurants were ok and the cleaning staff was excellent.... We will be staying there next year!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “always a good time”
Reviews.Author: kaiandjacksmom
Reviews.Content: we stay at NY NY a couple of times a year, it is making efforts to become a bit hipper! but it has all that we need close to the freeway for Shopping sprees and totally manageable in size. Avoid the 17th floor if possible ( simply because it was one floor short of the express elevator) and the last stop...many stops up and down...

Reviews.Title: “Great for families with teenagers”
Reviews.Author: arizona71
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel for start and end of touring holiday around Nevada and California. Easy to park car in Hotel as on corner of main highway from airport. Great arcade for younger son who was 13, pool area , shops and plenty of places to eat and of course the roller coaster ! Great steak restaurant and fast food if you like it. A Cirque d'soleil show in Hotel but adults only! Easy to walk out and see the strip, opposite MGM and Excalibur. We did have the roller coaster outside our room window on one stay but the screaming stops at midnight! To be a touch negative a long walk back to your room if you forget anything, and no tea or coffee in the rooms but Starbucks next to the elevators!

Reviews.Title: “Good if you're not loooking for "glam".”
Reviews.Author: withdubi
Reviews.Content: Overall the hotel really lacks visual appeal if you compare to other strip hotels. Check in was very slow. If you're just looking for a reasonably priced place to stay while you're in town, you'll be okay. If you're hoping for luxury, glamorous people, or superb service --- stay somewhere else! The restaurants were nothing special and pretty pricey. There's a walkway connecting NYNY to MGM which is nice. The pool area was clean and maintained well although there are no umbrellas at all and very little shady space. The nightlife seemed to be best suited to older crowd (40's and up), the DJ was playing old stuff and I'd say the average age around the center bar was 40-ish.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: Tempty1965
Reviews.Content: NY NY Hotel was wonderful, the staff was great, the restaurant's were reasonable, We had a wonderful 6 night 7 day stay. If there are more than 4 in a room I would say upgrade but if there are only 2 to 4 in your party, the Century Rooms are perfect. You don't get much of a view, but we were only in the room to sleep, The Rollercoaster was never an issue, the only time I ever heard it was in the front part of the casino, not in the room. I will be going back to Vegas next year and NY NY is on my list. There were some disappoints but none at NY NY.

Reviews.Title: “Heard Roller Coaster screams past midnight, horrible stay!”
Reviews.Author: hhcanes
Reviews.Content: We checked into the NY NY hotel with 2 kids (6 and 7) for a 2 night get away on our road trip west. We had a pleasant check in, but were disappointed in the first room. It was over the roller-coaster and parking lot. The AC was noisy, and the room was next to a housekeeping closet. The 2nd room, was a bit better. The view of the strip was nice, however, the roller coaster kept us up all night. The temperature in Vegas was 107 today, yet they told us that it would take 10 minutes for the hot water to heat up for my kids bath tonight. The housekeeping service was pleasant and brought us extra towels and pillows. At dinner, in the Can Can, the Chinese restaurant, my son poured a fly out of the soy sauce container, and the manager did nothing to accommodate or alleviate our concerns where the fly came from, the sushi, or the soy sauce. The hotel is loud and not maintained well. The marble tiles are cracked, the shower was dirty, and we found articles from the prior guest in the room. Not a great hotel, and would not recommend it. It was cheap, however!

Reviews.Title: “Good rooms, great rates, nice pool, okay location”
Reviews.Author: WhitbyTerry
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located near the end of the "strip" so there is a long walk to get to some of the other hotels. However, as the strip expands, this one might end up being in the middle. The room we had was HUGE, for a great price. We initially booked for one night and then decided to extend for two more nights. We got our 2nd and 3rd nights for less than half of our first night. The pool is not heated and closes at 7pm. So in the hot summer when you want to have an evening swim, you are out of luck. They also told us the pool shuts down in the fall and does not open again until April. There is no buffet restaurant here so you must go elsewhere if you want that. Meals are not cheap and if you decide to go fast food, the choices are close by but their prices are highly inflated. Even the Starbucks coffee, in the hotel, is way over priced (a regular coffee was almost double the price of a normal Starbucks). Getting to and from your room is a long process due to the size of the hotel. Don't bring a lot of luggage because, unless you want bell hop service, there are no carts available. The Roller Coaster, the prime attraction, costs $14 per ride. Often, the cars were empty or mostly empty. I can see why, at that price. We would stay again, just because of the size of the room and the price of the room.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - good location - good service”
Reviews.Author: dkcsp
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the south end of the strip - but close enough to be with in walking distance of other strip hotels and attractions. We were walk-ins and were offered 2 large rooms at a very reasonable rates. We received good service all the way - not much waiting time anywhere - a nice smallish pool and some decent restaurants. It was a nice place for children as well.

Reviews.Title: “New York New York”
Reviews.Author: Scottb30488
Reviews.Content: This hotel was ok just your average hotel everything you need is in the hotel but all and all its average not really worth the money. if your going with some friends to party i would suggest staying downtown the hotels are about the same but the price is way cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: prettyboi
Reviews.Content: My wife and I celebrated our anniversary at NYNY on our first trip to Vegas. The property is huge with a lot of action going on all over the place! There are so many places to eat and they all are reasonably priced. Another great thing is that you can get to the hotel easily from the street. Many of the other resorts are so pushed back from the Strip that it takes forever to get to them. We ordered room service very late and it still got to the room in about 15 minutes! The pool isn't where the action is, but if you stay at NYNY you can go to the Monte Carlo (right next door) pool party for free! And the Zumanity show was great too! An overall great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great, But don't touch the phone!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: scooter9
Reviews.Content: Trip and Hotel was all good. After getting home and seeing our ebill we were in shock. We made 5 collect calls from the room and the Phone Fees added up to $125.00 ( this was for reverse charge calls) Can't help but wonder what they would be on a direct call.

Reviews.Title: “Save your money - don't stay here!”
Reviews.Author: Waterpark8
Reviews.Content: The hotel rooms are beyond needing updating. Our room had wallpaper falling off the wall. The carpet was dirty and the furniture needed to be updated. The linens on the bed were threadworn. Pool is to small for a hotel of it's size. Save your money and stay somewhere else. Ask for extra towels at check-in and received them, but when maid clean room the next day they did not leave any extras. Left three towels for four people. This could be a nice hotel with they would reinvest some money and update their staff.

Reviews.Title: “cool location, huge, good standard”
Reviews.Author: rukola1
Reviews.Content: Cool location, right at the strip and other big hotels/casinos just in walking distance. Maybe not the newest and brigthest anymore but I liked the atmosphere. Rooms were big enough, service was ok and rooms were kept clean. Gambling was ok, jst as much as with the other casinos. The rollercoaster to me is a rip-off and definetely not worth the money. Go to Disneyland etc. if you seek that thrill.

Reviews.Title: “Fun hotel - not so fun pool”
Reviews.Author: jesshotch
Reviews.Content: Everything about the NYNY is fun, but if you're going to vegas for a nice, luxurious or famcy pool NYNY is not the place. The pool area is noce and clean but very small, covered by shade most of the day and really just a family pool. Love the variety of resturants and the Piano Bar is the best! Best family hotel on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice, Depending on What You're in Vegas For”
Reviews.Author: MoseyOn
Reviews.Content: Four of us (two parents, two grown children) stayed in two adjoining rooms for one night while in Las Vegas for a concert at the Hard Rock. We got what we felt was a very good price via the internet (I wouldn't book any other way in Vegas). The mandatory $12.95 "resort fee" is a bit of a pain, but it really depends on what you are going to be doing at the hotel. If you are going to use the internet and the fitness center, and if you are going to send/receive faxes and local calls, then you can probably live with it. We only used the internet, and while $12.95 is probably not a lot more than other hotels that do not provide free access, it is still annoying not to have the choice. Still, if $12.95 is going to wreck your trip to Vegas, you should probably consider another city. Isn't this place all about making money? You know that going in, right? And speaking of going in, I noted that several reviewers commented on the uncomfortably warm rooms. We found the same thing in one of our rooms (the other was fine). I called Guest Services, and a few minutes later a technician arrived. He changed the filter, flushed the system, and by the time we came back that night the temperature was very comfortable. The rooms themselves were a bit cramped (we were in "Park Avenue" rooms), but we didn't actually spend much time in them. Beds were comfortable, bathrooms were fine. All in all, we were satisfied. Nothing we experienced would keep us from staying here again if we found a good price. But the place has a gazillion rooms and everyone goes to Las Vegas for a different reason, so another person's experience could easily be different from ours.

Reviews.Title: “Room with NO view”
Reviews.Author: purpleponyMT
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights including the week-end. We took an up-grade to a Spa Suite for extra money. Excited for the jacuzzi and the room was spacious. Then we opened the curtains to find......nothing! The window was painted over to hide the cement wall it looked at. Really! No view. Called down to inquire why we were not told about the lack of view and were told all rooms on third floor were like that. So stay away from the third floor if you like to see sunlight or Vegas. The air conditioner was on high but the room was somewhat warm. We never heard anything from neighboring rooms, which was a nice surprise. Loved The Nine Fine Irishmen Restaurant, great food and great fun! Overall, would not come back to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: DLions2015
Reviews.Content: Room- Stayed in a skyline room, it had a nice modern looking decor. The view was "okay" it was facing the Luxor and Excalibur not down the rest of the strip. Bed was good bathroom okay kind of hotel standard. Location - Good location directly on the strip so you can easily walk out stop at a party store across the street for some traveling beverages and take a fun filled stroll down the strip. Atmosphere- The overall atmosphere of this place was what really set it apart. The rooms, the restaurants, the dueling piano bar especially, it all went together really well and just created a really great experience. PS- The beds are great for those that sleep. I only rated the sleep quality 1 cause who sleeps in Vegas anyway!

Reviews.Title: “What a trip!”
Reviews.Author: Been_seen_done_it_al
Reviews.Content: This stay was one of the best holidays of my life! New York New York is perfectly situated, about a quarter of the way down the strip, really close to everywhere and everything. It was good value for money too - with 3 of us lads in one room for less than $30 a night each. The Casino is not the best in Vegas - but it is good if you are a beginner! There are some good bars incl Coyote Ugly in the hotel which was fun for a laugh - if not really EXPENSIVE. But hey its Vegas... Would recommend

Reviews.Title: “Penthouse Suites Have No Laptop Safes and Extremely Hot”
Reviews.Author: shj1010
Reviews.Content: Had to wait two hours past check in for room to be ready. Guess the previous guests got a late check out and I had to be inconvienced. The first time I tried to get in the room the key wouldn't work. For my inconvienece they gave me a book of coupons. Coupons are you kidding me? This was my last night in Vegas and wanted to blow it. I looked everywhere for a laptop safe and could only find a small jewelry safe. No safe for my laptop meant no gambling or eating out. The A/C was cranked up the entire time and it was like a sauna. Even the sheets were too much. Luckily I managed to fall asleep around 3 am and get a few hours sleep before heading to the airport. Def wouldn't reccomend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Vinny Package”
Reviews.Author: CrockettTraveler
Reviews.Content: Made reservations with the "Vinny Package" offered this summer. Had a free upgrade to a larger room on the 24th floor overlooking Las Vegas Blvd. Received coupons for 2 for 1 offers and free drinks. We had no complaints for our 3 night stay. Room was cleaned perfectly everyday. Bed was comfortable. Internet connection was good. Good variety of restaurants. We ate at 3 of them and at some of the fast food takeouts at the hotel. Quiet neighbors. Checkin and checkout fast and without any problems. It was a good stay. I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Fun times at NYNY”
Reviews.Author: VicGirl
Reviews.Content: We went to Vegas at the beginning of July and stayed at the NYNY. We got a deal with the players club that we just couldn't pass up. The room was great, very spacious and clean. A bit of a walk from the elevator, but nothing crazy. The centre bar was good, Robert is a great bartender. For us the hotel is in a great location. We would stay there again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “4 Day Getaway - Great Time”
Reviews.Author: tsl52
Reviews.Content: Whenever we go to Las Vegas we try to find the best package deal (flight/hotel/other) and usually stay at different hotels, so we've tried a few places over the years. This was our first time staying at New York New York. It's near the end of the Strip, but it is part of the MGM Mirage group of hotels and has easy access (via bridges or free trams) to the MGM Grand, Monte Carlo, Aria/City Center Complex, Bellagio, Excalibur, Luxor and Mandelay Bay. There are lots of restaurants to choose from at NY NY (the American is open 24 hours and has tasty food at reasonable prices), as well as little eateries in the section of the hotel made to look like Greenwich Village. NY NY is kind of like the city it's named for - it has pockets of activity that are quite different from one another and its different areas appeal to different types of people, so that most people can find something that they will enjoy. Our room was an average size, but it was very clean, the bed was very comfortable, and the bathroom was large enough and well lit. We thought it was a little strange that a room that had a king-size bed and was obviously for two people would only have one arm chair. There was a hassock-type of bench that could also be used for seating, but at the end of the day, two arm chairs would have been better. That was really our only complaint. They, like most of the hotels in Las Vegas, charge a daily resort fee, but as well as fitness center access, it includes free internet access in your room and free access to the business center where you can check in and print your airline boarding passes for free. We could see the roller coaster from our window but were not disturbed by any noise from it - they did a very good job of sound proofing the rooms. The package priced included two tickets to a show of our choice at one of the MGM Mirage hotels, so we saw the Lion King. If you haven't seen it yet - go. We were both really glad we chose it as the show we went to see. Check-in and check-out were both quick and easy. The casino was noisy, as one would expect, but the noise stayed in the casino. The hotel hallways and room were very quiet.

Reviews.Title: “not a 4 star hotel.....”
Reviews.Author: kezzie30
Reviews.Content: The New York needs updating and a reality check! The pool is small but the pool surounding is smaller. If you want a chair forget it! If you want a lot of drunk underage kids you got it! The best part about the new york was the Zuminty Show if your open minded check this out,but don't forget to mention you are staying at the hotel you get a great deal on the tickets. They didn't tell us this after 10 mins we asked if we could put the tickets on our room and then she said oh yeah if you are staying here you can get a better deal a 80.00 savings. The service is awful,from check in to cleaning to general knowledge. The rooms small the showers even smaller. We asked for the next room up sold out all the way up to the point we would have to pay 150 a night extra....resturants closed like espen zone the pizza place. will not ever stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Loud drunken party atmosphere with no touch of customer service.”
Reviews.Author: BVGinPSC
Reviews.Content: We booked this stay as Invited Guests through the Players Club. When we arrived, the invited Guests check-in was closed and we spent twenty minutes waiting in the general line. Our room type we'd reserved through our Player's Club invite was not available (we weren't told this however, we got to "discover" it when we walked into our room.) No accomodation was made for this (an upgrade? something to indicate that the property was sorry?), and although we were moved to the room type we'd reserved the following day; we had a beautiful view of a wall and a sliver of skyline. Poor form. Additionally, this property now seems to be overrun by the "Jersey Shore" crowd. Tons of drunken "Situations" wearing their Ed Hardey and pumping their fists while preying on the stumbling "Snookies" who are too drunk to walk in their ridiculous heels.

Reviews.Title: “Fun, fun, fun!!”
Reviews.Author: LondonReena
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Ny Ny for 4 nights for my 30th birthday. The hotel is just massive, we actually got lost getting to our rooms! The hotel room was enormous...we had 2 king size beds and plenty of space. All very clean! The hotel had a great vibe to it....it just was just so much fun staying here! I would def recommend the bar downstairs (the bar at times Sq) were they have the dualling piano's - it's just so much fun - esp if they find out it's your b'day....they'll have the whole bar singing happy birthday to you!! The rollercoaster rider looked like fun, but it was closed on the day we wanted to go on it due to strong winds. Def try out the Oxygen Bar upstairs (on the same level as the walkway to MGM) you'll feel like a new person after the session has finished!!!The hotel isn't situated in the middle of the strip, so be prepared for a bit of walking...but other than that i have nothing negative to say. Def consider this hotel when visiting Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time at NYNY”
Reviews.Author: dora_an_explorer
Reviews.Content: I was recommended this hotel by my travel agent who had stayed there himself. I found the hotel a great place to stay, the room and corridors were clean/quiet/nicely decorated, a great view of the MGM grand from the window and very little noise from the rollercoaster. I was slightly apprehensive after reading some of the reviews on here, but on the whole I was really pleased with the location of the hotel and the hotel itself. The only slightly annoying thing was the check-in. After a 24hour travel time from the UK and the 2 hours it took to get from Macarran to the hotel, the last thing I really wanted to do was stand in line to check in for 45 mins.

Reviews.Title: “One of the underrated values on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: texigator
Reviews.Content: Our stay at New York-New York was a very pleasant experience. I was offered an upgrade to a suite for $40 and I was extremely happy that I accepted. The room was very nice with an in-room jacuzzi that was great. We had a nice view of the Strip and the hotel location on the south Strip was convenient to alot of the Strip action. The valet parking was prompt and efficient. The casino was good, but the food court was somewhat disappointing (Chin Chin's was horrible and the Nathan's hot dog place was not very good, either). There was a long wait at the Italian place, so maybe that was their strong suit. But we were very happy with everything else and would stay there again on a return visit.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Ever”
Reviews.Author: Spedcops
Reviews.Content: We flew to LV for the 4th of July weekend. I pre booked a room with the strip view. After arriving I stood in line at the hotel to check in for 30 minutes. The wait was due to only four check in agents. I was convinced by the hotel agent to change my room to a different room because of the size. I asked several times if there was a view and he would only say he was putting me on the highest floor. I should have known. We get to the room and we have a view of the parking lot. The room was very dated and looked like it had the original furniture and carpet. The shower sliding door would only open one way and when my daughter tried to get out the door fell off the track. We ended up leaving the next day and checking into a real 4 star hotel not a 2 star.

Reviews.Title: “This is a fantastic hotel, when we...”
Reviews.Author: SamHubb
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic hotel, when we arrived we requested a king size as we were a couple & it was no problem, we also said that we didn't want to pay the resort fee & that was ok to, the reception staff were very helpful. Our room was nice but I was expecting a bigger more grander room just from what everyone told me but it was cleaned daily & we were always left water. Do not tip the cleaners with change, as ours only took notes. Also in the room if u have any electrical appliances & am from the uk, they will not work properly as the voltage is a lot lower but there was a hairdryer in the bathroom so it was ok just couldn't use my curling tongs! We were not in the room that much so it served it's purpose but I think next time I would want something a bit more luxurious so prob stop at Caesars palace or belagio. The pizza place in the hotel is great, we had a slice for supper nearly every night! I wasn't impressed with chin chins for the breakfast buffet though, not much variety. If u want a good buffet I recommend treasure island of Excalibur. Also nathans in the hotel was very nice, lovely Philly steaks. We went to rok nightclub one night but we aware the drinks are very pricey and it's quite small but we had a good time. We also went to the irish bar which had good live music but found the bar staff a little rude, also they don't serve halves! The roller coaster was brilliant, such a rush but bangs your head around a bit! I was disappointed that we had to pay for this as thought it would have been free for guests. Pool was ok just a little bit small and cold! They have lovely hot tubs though which are nice to warm up in when you come out the cold pool! All in all we had a lovely stay there & I would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in the middle of everything.”
Reviews.Author: KLEwing
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here 2 nights on our honeymoon. We booked our room through an email offer I'd received. Our room for a Monday/Tuesday stay was $50 per night and we got some discount coupons as well. One of the coupons was 2 for 1 for Frank Callendo. That alone was worth $60. Also, I found that the restaurants here were reasonably priced for Vegas. We especially liked the deli for huge sandwiches. And my husband loved getting his boozy slushies at Coyote Ugly. Second, I like the location. Its across from the MGM and Excalibur and next to Monte Carlo. For us, there were plenty of things to do and see within a 15 minute walk. They charge a $13 per day resort fee which gets you "free" wifi internet. We didn't have a laptop with us, so didn't use it. We went to the pool, but found that it was pretty small and not very special.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel for kids - lots to do”
Reviews.Author: thefunfive
Reviews.Content: hotel had big rooms, lots of choices for meals in the village down stairs but also good high end restraunts as well. close to monrailt o mandaly and enough within walking distance to all major resort casinos. it has a plus that its got a great pool ( without to many bigtime party goers) and rollercoaster ( lots of fast fun) / arcade. in visiting a lot of the other hotel/casinos they were either very old ( circus circus for eample) or too exepnsive ( venetion/bellagio) for kids. a good pick for kids and once you get used to walking past 100's of poker machines ( cant do this in australia with kids- they just dont let you in) you get used too it. a classic example of being able to enjoy vegas for 5 days and only spend $1 on the 'slots' and have a great time doing theatre ( lion king, jersey boys and beatles 'love' ) and grand canyon tour plus circus circus adventuredome too!

Reviews.Title: “a taste of New York out in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: UmassHotelier05
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel on January for a bachelor party. We had booked the players suite and were please with the accomodations. There was a big jacuzzi in the room.. (we did not get a chance to use it, but would have loved to) Had 2 spacious beds, and an alarm clock that had speakers to connect to our IPOD. All and all it was a positive experience. The location was perfect and i would return there again if given the opportunity. Check in was smooth and efficient, no bad things to report.. although i wish the weather was nicer that day.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Ally456
Reviews.Content: My family stayed here in June 2010 and loved it! Excellent spot for us, just opposite MGM. Bridges to cross to MGM and Excalibur really close, and also near Deuce/Ace bus stop. Hotel had a great vibe - very exciting and different. Rooms were spacious and clean, and very quiet (the Roller coaster could be seen from the window but the noise did not disturb us at all, you could barely hear it). Really good choice of restaurants and fast food outlets and all staff we encountered were polite, friendly and professional. I am very glad we chose this hotel for our holiday!

Reviews.Title: “Beyond the call of duty.....”
Reviews.Author: nmccain
Reviews.Content: We are a retired Massachusetts couple who came to Las Vegas to see the Grand Canyon and Hoover Dam. A day and a half into our vacation, my husband suffered a mild stroke and was hospitalized for 2 days. I can not say enough about the thoughtfulness of the New York New York staff, particularly Margaret Chan. Not only did Margaret and the hotel provide free taxi service for me to the hospital and back, but on the day my husband was released, the hotel picked us up in a limousine and brought us back to our room. They also sent beautiful yellow roses to my husband while he was in the hospital. Such thoughtfulness and generosity meant the world to us and helped bring a little "family" to us when ours was so far away. The room was very clean and maintained very well. We probably won't be returning to Las Vegas, but if we did, my hotel of choice will definitely be New York New York. Thank you

Reviews.Title: “great themed hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jon169
Reviews.Content: its just like being in new york when you're on the casino floor walking through the streets and all the restaurants and bars. we recommend nine fine irishmen and rok (the nightclub). the rooms were excellent, we were in the century tower on 25th floor (furthest away from the elevators, however) corridors are dated but rooms are fine, one of our rooms had a strip view but the others had poor views of the car parks which was a shame. although the beds were very comfortable we all had trouble getting a good sleep, guess thats vegas for you, never sleeping. room service was excellent with a wide menu with great prices. the pool area is poor although the hot tubs are decent. we went to monte carlo next door for the pool as its free entry with your NYNY card. the rollercoaster is excellent

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: RLS1
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a Park Avenue room in the Century Tower for a week. This was my second trip to Vegas, having stayed in Planet Hollywood the first time around. Pros: Room was nice with plenty of space and was quiet. We had no trouble sleeping and never heard our neighbours or the roller coaster which went right by our window. The wireless internet included in the resort fee was great. I was very lucky in the slots in the casino and won over $1,000 off a 75 cent bet! Cons: Corridors and lifts were pretty dated. The pool was very crowded and there was NO shade whatsoever which was poor, in my opinion. Rather than providing parasols, they had just crammed as many sunbeds into the poolside area as possible. On balance, I would recommend Planet Hollywood over the New York New York, mostly because it is a lot more modern with a younger crowd and very few children (I love kids but not on holiday in Vegas!), plus it is in a better location on the strip with better poolside facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and casino at a reasonable cost”
Reviews.Author: Misanthrope060
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a Park Avenue room with a view of the trip and were both extremely happy with the room. The casino is really cool, with various New York style restaurants (Steakhouse, Kosher deli and pizza parlor). If you can get it for a good price, I'd definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed by the Park Avenue room - But a great casino!”
Reviews.Author: Paris12
Reviews.Content: It was my third trip to Las Vegas and I previously visited the Treasure Island and the Mirage. Based on those previous experiences, I was quite disappointed by the room I got at the New York-New York. It's mostly a matter of small details. Let's face it, NY is still an awesome place to sleep. But little things annoyed me, for example the worn furniture, no minibar, internet cable not working, sub-quality bed sheets & pillows (synthetic pillows, not the comfy feather ones!), no hotel/services directory book available in the room, very small safe, etc. I liked, however, the casino section and the inside decoration on the New York theme. Total rate: $241.78 for 2 nights (2 queen beds) in a Park Avenue room on Memorial Day weekend. Still an enjoyable stay, but not the best palace in Las Vegas I guess.

Reviews.Title: “Listen to your neighbours word for word... without trying”
Reviews.Author: emagreen
Reviews.Content: On check-in, we were informed that the king-bed we had requested was not available. We would be put in a room with two queens and we could phone down the next day to be changed. We figured it wasn't a big deal- we got to our room and it was too small for the furniture- the chairs were up against the bed, so if you sat in them, there was no place for your legs. Within minutes we realized that we could hear the neighbours word for word through the wall and the adjoining door. We agreed we would call first thing in the morning for a room change. In the morning we phoned and were informed that they would call us when a new room was ready. Then the waiting began- we weren't given a new room until 4 pm, so it was a lot of going out of the hotel then coming back to check on the status. This was a huge disruption to our first day. We got to our new room and were surprised it was smaller, but because of the one bed, everything fit better. We noted it was hot and now know that even with the curtains completely closed all day, the air conditioner cannot keep up. We thought that our last room was so loud because of the adjoining door, so had specifically requested not to have one. But this new room (without an adjoining door) still enables you to hear your neighbours word for word, and that is how we woke up this morning. The staff we have encountered are nice and helpful, but nothing makes up for the paper-thin walls of both rooms we've been in. The restaurants and in-room dining, however, are fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Small quiet room”
Reviews.Author: macnife
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a basic room in the Century tower. The room scheme is very dark, Blacks and grays. The room was clean, didn't smell of smoke and the bed was comfy. The bathroom is extremely small, you can not stand at the sink and open the door without the door hitting you! The room was very quiet. I never heard any door open or close in the hallways while inside our room. I also never heard the water run through the walls or toilets flushing. The resort fee is $12.95 a day. If you use the internet, I guess it is worth it. We received 2 mini bottles of water each day, could of grabbed a newspaper each day if we wanted it, and received 2 free cocktails.
