The cocktails that you can get are the cheapy well, wine or draft beer. Definately not worth $12.95! Got better drinks free while we gambled!

Reviews.Title: “Great Until We Got Ripped Off at the End”
Reviews.Author: karnevore
Reviews.Content: Check-in was very friendly, the housekeeping staff was fantastic, the room was generously proportioned and the location is roughly as good as you'd like it to be. The whole experience only really got tainted when we checked out. There were three nights when we did not use an extra bed in our room but were charged $100.80 - which is the full charge for three nights worth of use - anyway. This happened even when the extra bed was brought out of our room for the three nights that we did not use it as agreed upon with the hotel staff. We called the hotel immediately after we noticed the overcharge (about an hour after checking out) and explained to them what had happened. The hotel assured us that they would remove the charges but a recent credit card statement shows that we were still charged. You'd think they would fix such a simple, no-brainer mistake. Such a shame that the actions of a couple of people wasted the hard work of the rest of the staff to make us feel at home.

Reviews.Title: “Fun Packed and a Great Value”
Reviews.Author: DiabloDeb
Reviews.Content: I've been to Las Vegas many times and have stayed all over the strip but had never stayed at this hotel before. We booked the New York-New York because we were offered a great rate. The hotel hotel valet, bell desk and check-in were efficient and friendly. The casino was remarkably clean and most of the staff working in the casino were friendly as well. I was surprised to see that the majority of the slot machines were 1 cent to 5 cent machines, which I guess is indicative to the current economy. They did get cheaper about the house drinks, there are limits on what sort of drink you can order for free now and it never use to be that way. We had connecting rooms, both with a nice view. The rooms were good size, very modern and clean. Wireless internet was provided for free. Only down side was that it was quite a hike from the elevator to our room. Did not use room service but did call ahead prior to our stay to order a birthday cake. The cake was perfect, better than I thought it would look it was a master piece and was delivered right on time as I requested. The have an arcade, the Coney Island Emporium which is huge and has many great games to play and also games the reward tickets to purchase small toys. There are even some carnival games as well with prizes. There's also the Manhattan Express which is their roller coaster. The Village Eateries have many little restaurants for food on the go. We tried both Nathan's which was good and Sirrico's Pizza which not only had pizza by the slice but lasagna and garlic bread too. There are many upscale nice restaurants, all New York themed and some nice bar/pubs as well as the ESPN Zone for sports fanatics. The location is great, not quite center strip but MGM is across the street as well as Tropicana, Excalibur, Luxor and Mandalay bay just to name a few.

Reviews.Title: “Wide variety of restaurants/bars”
Reviews.Author: TASMAN078
Reviews.Content: This is a clean reasonably priced hotel with a lot of different bars and restaurants that are of pretty good quality. Is it Ceasars or Wynn? No, but you won't spend a fortune while at NYNY. Drinks were expensive so we went across the street next to MGM to buy some 24 oz beers for $2.79. Overall the service was good and you didn't have to walk a long distance to grab something to eat within the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I would do it Again”
Reviews.Author: JANETH2320
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Spa suite, it was wonderful. The suite was the same as the picture they show in the website. We stayed in the highest floor (17th) we had a view of the pool and the roller coaster. Whoever said that the roller coaster wouldn't let them sleep is a liar because you can barely hear it and they stop running the roller coaster around 11pm and you shouldn't be trying to go to sleep at the time.Your in VEGAS!!! I went to sleep at 5am and it was peaceful. The whirlpool tub was amazing had a lot of fun in their. The only thing I did not like was that you have to walk pretty far to get to the hottest casinos like Bellagio, Paris and Ceasars Palace but I can say that I kind of liked how quiet the hotel was as u pose to the other busy hotels. Another thing I don't recommend is drinking or gambling their its too expensive and you don't win. LOVED IT!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: skitter_10
Reviews.Content: we loved the hotel, got there really early our room wouldnt be ready til 3 pm. but they gave us another room, oh my its was huge, great view, at the end of the all so it was very quite. Had a great view. Were going back. Americana was a very nice place to eat, Room was very clean. Yes you had to walk to get down the strip but after visting them we decided we had made the right choice. All the casinos were loud but hey you get use to it.

Reviews.Title: “Eye opener, however rooms could have been a little airy”
Reviews.Author: Yippies02
Reviews.Content: We landed in vegas with great hopes and it was every penny worth it. Our entry in New York New York was easy and we checked in about 15 minutes given the long queue because of the hotel's popularity. We just have one suggestion that can be bettered, which is the rooms to be a little more airy and lighted.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel for the younger generation!”
Reviews.Author: sar2036
Reviews.Content: We stayed at New York New York in April 2010 and although we found the hotel a great place to visit because of the restaurants, we wouldn't stay there again. This is because the walls of the rooms were very thin and we could literally hear every word the man next door was saying at 4AM and also hear him being sick etc! The rooms were clean, however, although the bed wasn't overly comfortable. Having travelled to Vegas before, we feel that 'New York New York' is a perfect hotel if you are young people, on holiday, who like to party and aren't bothered about having your sleep disturbed night after night, however, if like us, you prefer to have a good night's sleep, I would recommend paying a little more and staying at the Bellagio or Caesar's Palace! To be fair, hotels in Vegas are relatively cheap and you can get a far nicer hotel for not too much extra!

Reviews.Title: “Good location but terrible service and communication”
Reviews.Author: Ipoxy
Reviews.Content: I made a reservation at New York New York via phone booking, and kind of a last minute booking. The woman i was talking to was apperantly not familiar enough with english, and the communication between us was terrible. When we arrived at this hotel we were met by a long line waiting for check in. There where only 2 people handling the line. Others popped their head out in between but none seemed to be bother enough to handle the line. When we finaly reach the desk it turned out that the woman i had talked to on the phone had made my reservation wrong. I got the wrong room, for the wrong price, reserved under the wrong name, with wrong e-mail address so it was pretty hard to find the reservation. I was told that the room reserved was the only type availible and it was not offered to the price agreed on the phone. I recieved no appoligies or benefits for all this mess. Anyway. Finaly arriving at the room, the room was in a very good contion and was clean and good in size. We had pretty fun in dining, in the casino and on show so the entertainmant is very good, and the party factor is high. Location on Las Vegas strip is also pretty good, a bit in the south end. In the end my stay was affected by the bad communication and lack of service.

Reviews.Title: “Great for first Vegas trip”
Reviews.Author: hipevangeline
Reviews.Content: I recently took my first trip to Vegas with a friend. We had found a great deal online for a package with accommodations at NYNY and decided to book. We checked in late (11:30 PM) with no problems. In fact, we even received a free room upgrade when I told the gentleman it was my first trip to the city! Our room had a great view over the strip and MGM Grand. A downside was it was at the very end of the hall from the elevators, but that can't be helped too much. For my first trip, I very much enjoyed the fact that it is a bit smaller than other hotels. The layout is simple and difficult to get really lost in, which I especially appreciated after losing my way in hotels such as the Mirage on the way to shows! The general location is a bit of a disadvantage, though, as it is a bit far too walk to the north end of the strip so we didn't get a chance to see much there. America (the restaurant) was good cheap food and open 24hrs. Il Fornaio had the best tiramisu! Rok was a great place to spend our first evening dancing the night away. Some of the take-out restaurants (pizza, wing stands) were very passable, however. We are definitely considering staying here on our next trip, which we are already planning.

Reviews.Title: “If you are looking of fun...this hotel was the most happening.... more than once.”
Reviews.Author: Bunnylou
Reviews.Content: Three of us stayed at NYNY for 4 nights...rates were great, was not excited about the resort fee of $12 for thing we did not even need. Although the staff was not overly friendly, they were helpful, I was still impressed with the staff there, I am sure they see people and loud all the time, just as they did with us, but they never seemed to get mad or untolerate of our behavior. The staf was very prompt in their service, if we called for extra towels, they were there within 10 minutes....great service for such a huge hotel..... Loved having more than one pillow for each person, did not like the long walk to the room itself (we were in the Century building), that is until I had to the walk to the end of the towers... The air worked great throughout the hotel (was the coolest spot on the strip) Nightlife through the week...kind of slow, but picks up alot for the weekend. We talked to the taxi driver and he informed us that tourism is still way down for them..and it is not usually like that... Loved the roller coaster...just know it does jerk your head quite a bit...but is AWESOME.. I will definitely be going back and staying there again..:)

Reviews.Title: “Will not stay again”
Reviews.Author: JMOrlando
Reviews.Content: Stayed May 30th-June 3rd. We made reservations three months ago for two adjoining rooms with King beds since we have adult son with special needs. Room selection was not available eventhough we were able to check in prior to the 3:00 time. Rooms were located on 3rd floor - view from one room was a dumpster blocking the window and the other a wall five feet away and side view of the same dumpster. No apology from staff. Club music radiated till all hours of the night. The second morning we were there - no hot water for showers. We were informed that maintenace had been performed on floors 3-15 and someone forgot to turn the hot water valve back on. The only thing going for this hotel was the Casino - We both hit a jackpot on the quarter slots.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Deep in the hot of Texas
Reviews.Title: “One of my new favorites”
Reviews.Author: SpinyNorma
Reviews.Content: I've been a fan of NYNY for years but never stayed there. I'm a budget traveler and their prices were more than I wanted to pay. When I got an offer to stay there for just under $40 a night, I decided to give it a try. I was in the Empire Tower. I've heard the rooms were really small but I didn't find mine to be overly small. It wasn't large but I didn't think it was as tiny as I'd heard either. I found the room to be very comfortable. One thing I like about MGM properties is that they put spare pillows in the closet. I like a lot of pillows so this was a big plus. There was a big stand alone shower (no tub) that I liked a lot. I was on a high floor and the water pressure was fine. There was a nice assortment of lotions and such as well. The towels were soft and absorbent. One odd thing: there was what I thought was a mini fridge under the bathroom cabinet. After putting a couple of cokes in to cool, I discovered that it was actually a tiny freezer. One of the great things about NYNY is the food court. It's my favorite in all of Vegas and can't be topped for the variety available. I especially like the deli but every place I've tried was good. I also like their souvenir shops better than any other I've been in. I do wish they hadn't toned down the New York theme of the casino and food court. The only quibble I had with the food was at America. The food itself was fine but the waiter was only minimally attentive. I don't want them hovering over me or expect pampering but it would be nice to have him check to see if I need a drink refill or anything else. I suspect he thought that, as a single female diner, I wouldn't be tipping. (I did but less than I would have if he'd put more effort into it.) I say this because he did seem to be more attentive to his other tables. I was also not pleased with the addition of a resort fee. Most of the things it was supposed to cover were useless/unnecessary to me and, I think, to the average tourist. I'd have been more put out with it but it did cover internet fees. It was around $11 a day, which isn't bad (grading on the Vegas curve) for internet. Despite these minor complaints, I really enjoyed my stay and hope to be able to stay there again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Very good for the price”
Reviews.Author: katrin3112
Reviews.Content: We booked the New York New York because we got a great deal through a last minute offer online 3 weeks in advance. Since we had never been to Vegas before we didn't know anything about the hotels there. First - all the hotels are HUGE. so is the NewYorkNewYork. Hard not to get lost on the first day. Second - the strip is endlessly long for walking. The NYNY is almost at the south end, so most other attractions a quite a walk away (4 stars for location) Third - Vegas is loud - very loud on a friday night (glad we didn't stay saturday). Our room had a view of the strip so we felt a little bit like right in the action, even after midnight. Soem rooms have the rollercoaster right in front of the window, this adds even more noise. Fourth - Vegas is expensive. If we hadn't had that great deal on the hotel, i would have felt ripped off - why does the NYNY need a resort fee? ca. 13 USD per room/night extra. Over all, we really enjoyed our stay at the NewYorkNewYork. The room was nice and very very clean. Check-in service could have been nicer but check-out was quick and easy. When booking, make sure to which side your room is located and how far away from the rollercoaster you are - this will help to have a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great time had”
Reviews.Author: ozzie82
Reviews.Content: It was our first time in vegas and we had a ball. NY NY is a great hotel. When we arrived we were offered an upgrade to a spa suite for not much extra which was great. The price we paid for the size room was fantastic value for money. The internet was not much, very slow to the point of timing out alot. It was a bit of a walk to the other casinos as NY NY seems to be towards the end of the strip, but given that all casinos are pretty much the same, we very rarely ventured out of NY NY and MGM and Excalabur. I would recommend not bothering with the asian resturaunt, instead if your after asian head to Changs. You should stay here, you'll have a BALL. Just dont lose to much money!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: mole007
Reviews.Content: First timers in Vegas and what a great time we had. The NY NY hotel was great and had everything we wanted, high speed internet (inc in the additional resort fee), free parking, and some good value coupons to use within the resort. We visited other resorts which were on par with this hotel. Location and price was good compared to other resorts, such as The Venetian which is a lot plusher but obviously more expensive! Overall, this hotel had everything we needed on site. We had a great view too! Would recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Crazy, busy introduction to Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: SandieFoster
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited Las Vegas for the first time and stayed at the New York, New York hotel. Everything we read about this hotel is true! Beginning with the roller coaster that wraps itself around the building (and which is audible in the rooms), to the rambunctious atmosphere of the restaurants in the main area of the hotel/casino, and finishing with the loud casino noise it is overwhelming. The staff at the hotel were pleasant and accommodating, and several of the restaurants inside the hotel complex were great. The breakfast buffet was v. good (around $12 per person, but filled with fresh fruit, breads, and the usual breakfast fixings); the italian restaurant served delicious pizza, and the bakery, although pricey, had delicious breads and treats. The very best was the Irish pub, which served huge helpings of fish & chips. The night we visited there was an Irish band with a step dancer, and the celtic rock kept the place hopping. If you are looking for a quiet elegant get-away this isn't the place, but it was quite the busy place every day we were there. Also, the tram line is close by, that will take visitors to either MGM (just across the street) or to the Luxor and Mandalay Bay.

Reviews.Title: “Fun place to celebrate special occasions!”
Reviews.Author: LoveLifeTraveling
Reviews.Content: Fun place to celebrate special occasions! At New York-New York, The Bar at Times Square dualing pianos show was a lively, entertaining, bawdy fun way to celebrate my mom's 70th on our lady's night out. We went during the afternoon show on a Friday, and it had plenty of people without being packed. Several groups were celebrating special occasions there: a wedding reception, bachelorette party, and a stag party in addition to our birthday celebration. In spite of the loud music, our group (mostly older women) loved the entertainment. After I requested a song with a $5 tip (common practice for the dualing pianos show), the performer called my mom up and proceeded to sing a very funny, upbeat song and make a big deal out of her birthday; he really went out of his way to make her feel special, and she loved every minute of it! Our cocktail server was so efficient and sweet; in spite of being so busy, she never appeared rushed when interacting with us; she made eye contact, listened, and was happy to accommodate every request, even very agreeably taking our group photo. I recommend the afternoon (3-7 pm) show, as there is no cover charge, and it was busy enough. The night show might be too busy and loud for us, although a younger crowd would love it.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, fun time”
Reviews.Author: mcjmn
Reviews.Content: This is a nice moderate hotel. I got a great deal for the time I went. It is not the nicest on the strip, but then again, it's way cheaper too. I found the location good, but not great. The hotels a bit to the North on the strip have the very best location. The casual street scape restaurants just off the casino are a great place to get a snack. Our room was somewhat modern, but not totally top notch. Based on pics of some other hotels, I'd say the rooms are still much nicer than some places priced about the same. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to Las Vegas travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Quiet on the South Side of the strip”
Reviews.Author: pkphilip
Reviews.Content: We got this hotel by bidding at Priceline in Jan. The hotel overall exceeded my expectation in many ways. First, they honored my request to have a non-smoking and room away from the roller coaster. Second, upgrading from the base room to the next one only cost $10 a night. Final but least, they gave us a 34th floor room in the Chrysler Tower (top floor is 36th). Our room is on the far side of the hotel, but that's great because it is away from the casino and people noise from the food stands down stair. The hotel generally is on the quiet side compare to othr near by casinos (MGM and Excalibur). Our room is the Park Ave room, it's big and new. We are at Vegas to play, not to sleep, we just wanted a comfortable place that we can sleep in after a full day of activities. The mattress is firm, pillows are soft and the room service is fast and efficient. The daily $12.95 resort fee now include in-room wifi!! The best would be the hotel interior, it does have the feel of New York, the food stands are just typical North American style (Pizza, wings, ice-cream, hot dogs...). The "American Restaurant" is running a promo - $14.99 steak, crab and potatoes! If you are into shows, Zumanity at NYNY is now offered 2 for $99 for hotel guest. We were offered upgraded seats for free! During the time I am in NYNY, I have not encountered any Timeshare salesman. We've met a few in Excalibur and Luxor, they simply grabbed you as you walk towards them. If you wanted some peace and personal time in Vegas. NYNY offer excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “Fun times at NYNY”
Reviews.Author: mfred907
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the NYNY from May 8th to May 12th 2010 and it was our first time in Vegas. The hotel looks great and has a lot to offer in terms of entertainment and food. The only restaurant I would advise against is Gonzalez Y Gonzalez. My wife was sick just a few hours after eating there. The rest of us were fine but the food wasn't all that good anyway. The other restaurants were fine. They had a deal on the show Zumanity from Cirque du soleil. It's a good deal if you compare with the other show in Vegas. Now be warned, it is a show about sex so if that bothers you don't go. If you don't care about that, you will like, it's a good show. All in all, we liked the hotel and would recommend it to anyone. Next time we go to Vegas we'll probably stay somewhere around the Mirage based only on location. If you have been to Vegas before you know this but if you haven't here is a little tip for you. The drinks are really expensive if order at any bar (12.00$/cocktail and 8.00$/beer) so pick a 1C slot machine near the bar and play 1 credit at a time and order from the waitress, drinks are free when you gamble. Don't forget to tip. Don't forget to check out Freemont in the old Vegas. It's awesome we had the best time of the whole trip there. You can order drinks for 99C there. While you are there have a bite at the Firefly restaurant which specializes in Tapas. Best meal we had in Vegas

Reviews.Title: “A fun resort but there are better hotels in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Rob7005b
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to Vegas and once there the size of the place is almost overwhelming. Our first experience of the hotel wasn't positive with a massive slow moving queue for check in. 40 minutes later we got to the front and were informed that they only had smoking or twin rooms available in our booked room type however we could upgrade for a small fee. I in no way believed this given that we checked in at 3pm but had no choice but to upgrade. This was a terrible way to treat a customer at the first point of contact - make them feel ripped off. The room itself was unremarkable, large but uninspiring with no real view. It was clean but whoever serviced the room had no idea how to make a bed. The bathroom was showing signs of age but had no real faults. To be honest no one spends much time in their hotel in Vegas so it's not the key thing when you mark a hotel here. Check out was as fraught as check in with disintrested staff working slowly and showing a lack of customer focus. It at least confirmed that first impressions were right about the staff. The casino/resort itself is a good one. It aims for a fun party atmosphere and achieves it. This place knows where it is and doesn't take itself too seriously. The restaurants are excellent with Gallaghers serving some of the biggest steaks I've ever seen. The casino is on the small size with medium to high staked tables, go elsewhere for low stakes tables. I'd recommend anyone to visit the resort (especially on a night out), it's a good location on the strip linked to MGM and Excalibur but I'd tell them to stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!!!!”
Reviews.Author: cnaki78
Reviews.Content: NYNY was awesome!! They have everything you need and want. The Room was beautiful with a great view. They just opened their "Party Pit" where they have music pumping and girls dancing while you gamble. It isn't like stripper dancing, just girls dancing to the music. Would reccomend anyone to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “A good stay on the Strip in Vegas.”
Reviews.Author: SouthAussieTraveller
Reviews.Content: The tenth hotel of our 4 week trip in Southwest USA. We spent two nights here at New York New York, to explore Las Vegas. Our large comfortable 2 queen bed room had a Strip view and seemed reasonable value at a nightly rate of US$139 including tax. There is however a US$12 (before tax) daily resort fee, that is additional and payable on check in. This fee does include free wireless internet, but we didn’t find it to be particularly good or fast. The room consisted of comfortable beds with 1 bedside table with lamp, table with 2 chairs, tv with limited cable channels and large wardrobe/drawer unit. No fridge in room, but there was an ice machine located opposite our room. No coffee maker in room, so either room service or get dressed and drop into Starbucks downstairs. Good size bathroom with basin in bench, toilet and shower over bath. Free self parking in multi storey garage or paid valet parking. Friendly check in, but being in the casino area, it is a bit crowded dragging your suitcase through and then onto the elevators. Selection of on site restaurants are located in the hotel. We tried Gonzalez Y Gonzalez which was just okay, so didn’t bother trying it again or any others in the hotel. If I was staying on the Strip again, I’d be happy with New York New York as the spacious room helped and quiet enough. Although during it’s opening hours, the rumble of the roller coaster can be heard easily.

Reviews.Title: “A place to sleep.”
Reviews.Author: travo2010
Reviews.Content: This was the second stay at NYNY Vegas – last time was 9 years ago – have stayed in several different properties, some have been star rated on the same level, others were rated higher. Checked in at 8:30pm on a Wednesday night. Very friendly staff – overheard that no king beds would be available until the next day, if at all, which left the rooms with two queen beds. Also, very few non-smoking rooms were available – was able to get one, though. I’m fine with the smoke in the casinos, just prefer not to have it lingering in the hotel room. Woke up at 6am the following day – no hot water for about two hours (called front desk, they were aware of the problem). Message light was blinking, called automated phone system, message said that there was a message waiting at the front desk. Got connected to the front desk, staff had to call back in a few minutes to access a different computer. Found out that message was that there were coupons waiting for me at the front desk. Went to the front desk the same day, and found out that the coupons were for free drinks and a few other retail/restaurant related items. Repeated the same message process on the second day – they were calling to see if I’d picked up the coupons. Air conditioning was mediocre during the first night (had it set to on/coolest level/fan set to high– room bordered on clammy – temps were in the upper 50’s outside at night. Room was able to maintain comfortable temperature beginning mid-way through the second morning, and continued to be comfortable through check-out. Room was clean (Park Avenue Deluxe), bed was relatively comfortable – was able to get decent amount of sleep on the second night, pillows were supportive enough. Internet connection was decent – paid for by the daily resort fee. Able to check-out through the TV menu. For a quick breakfast (at a place that opens before 10am), Il Fornaio has a small shop next to the full restaurant – pastries, fruit, croissant sandwiches, etc. - pre-made salads are available here, as well as at the Deli. The overall experience was average – between the temporary lack of hot water, funky air conditioning issue on the first night, and odd way of getting phone messages to guests – it’s not exactly a thumbs-down experience, but not a thumbs-up one either.

Reviews.Title: “Thought we'd try...wish we didn't!”
Reviews.Author: CBCreative
Reviews.Content: My sister and I come to Vegas for a some girls time every couple of years.... We normally stay around the middle of the strip... We thought we'd give NY NY a try because we got "such a good deal".... well... not so much.... First, be prepared to pay a daily "resort" fee of $12.95! Not sure where the "resort" came in....The hotel as a whole is pretty tired and needs a face lift. The casino is nice, but VERY smoky and a good portion of the dealers aren't friendly! The variety of food isn't up to par with the other hotels. Over all it is very clear the design of this hotel is for visual not function...certain things aren't in logical places. The spa is on the 3rd Floor of the tallest towers and there are only 2 elevators for that tower. We waited close to 10 minutes every time... the two didn't work quite right. Our room was located farther down the hall, therefore it took 15 - 20 minutes to get hot water. Not a joke....guest services said sadly it's because how the building was designed. Nice! Of course the A/C didn't really work too well and the very old TV wasn't clear. There isn't really anything I can say that would shine favorably on New York New York... BIG disappointment. We won't ever stay here again... stick with whatcha know!

Reviews.Title: “Good But..................”
Reviews.Author: LissyL0u
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the New York New York casino, I had business to deal with and also my partner and small son came too. We organised a suite which was a great size (Zigaruat) so similar sounding, but really is a little on the tired side. Liked the dining area, lounge area, bathroom appeared updated, just the general over all look had had its day. We only got the 4th floor and you over look the tin roof of the casino which really looks rather average to say the least. We went two years ago to Las Vegas and stayed at the Venetian and probably would next time again. The staff were "there" but not overly helpful, but being fair were not bad either. The "resort" fee what ever that is that you pay daily is just ridiculous. I cannot say that we would not go back again, but it is more likely that we would try somewhere else for the sake of it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel & Casino for first time visit”
Reviews.Author: Cryjam
Reviews.Content: Las Vegas is the party city of the USA and NYNY is a great place to learn the ropes. It was our first time to Las Vegas but the hotel, casino and restaurants at NYNY made the stay very easy and enjoyable. The strip and all the other major attractions are very close. We got a standard room which was very large with two queen size beds. The room had all the features travellers expect. We eat all of our meals in the hotel and tired many of the takeaways and restaurants with no complaints. The ESPN Zone was great and my wife loved Ben & Jerry's being downstairs. The only negative was that we saw the Zuminty show which is at NYNY - do yourself a favour and walk up the strip to another show because this is terrible and expensive. Very good hotel would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the price!”
Reviews.Author: VTer24
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a nine day stay at NYNY. Check-in was very quick. Corner room was clean, comfortable and quiet, with a nice view of roller coaster and the Orleans. Bathroom fairly small with the standard shower/tub combo. Housekeeping did a good job keeping the room clean, but could not read English. Asked to have the clock reset, extra copy of LV magazine and extra laundry bag. Took 4 days to get the laundry bag only after asking an employee in the hallway. Price was reasonable as we got comped 3 nights free. Casino fee of $11.99/day is ridiculous. Used the business office once to get our boarding passes and got 2 newspapers. Why don't all casino charge this? Employees were helpful and friendly and we would stay here again. The room was very quiet. Only once did I see room service things left in the hallway.

Reviews.Title: “The bad, the Good, The Volcano”
Reviews.Author: gavin1972
Reviews.Content: Stayed from 8th April 2010 till 14th April 2010 for the wife's 30th Birthday party, well I think we did, the hotel thought we should of been there from the 1 April 2010 till 8th April, explained that why would we book a flight for the 8th April if were staying a week earlier, don't even think BA can fly back in time. The Staff at the front desk were helpful, well it was 8pm and very quiet, we were told they would sort the problem out in the morning, so we went to our room, well we tried, they gave us the wrong directions, finally found the lift, on the 18th floor, must of upset them at the desk as our room was right at the end of the corridor, it was like a pac-man maze, room was nice, 2 beds, bathroom was dark, shower leaked a little but not too bad, small safe and limited tv channels, nice view of the mountains and rollercoaster though. Well day 2 was fun, had an argument with the hotel and travel company in America, there about as useful as a fart in the wind, think the wife mentally scared some of them, she even scared me and I've seen her in a bad mood, think of the exorcist (they basically told us that it was our fault and our hotel voucher was worthless). Anyway it took 2 days to sort out a simple wrong booking (would like to thank North American Travel and Chris Mcfadden Travel, who were excellent back home during our whole stay, without them we would of really got in a mess). The hotel then moved us to a lovely corner room, good size and very comfortable, same dim light in the bathroom though (so remember if you want a good room, wind your wife up and withold chocolate for 24 hours then send her down to reception). The casino is nice, smaller then a lot of the other ones, but has a good selection of 1 cent machines, yes I'm cheap. Watch out for electric static shocks, I got loads in each casino. The food options were very dear for the quality, we often ate out or bought food back to the hotel, Ben and Jerry's was excellent though, not cheap but you got a good filling. Went on the rollercoaster, expensive but gives you a rush. The hotel is a little out of the way, flamingo or Planet Hollywood is more a central location, the Vegas Outlet Centre just passed Mandalay bay is excellent and good value, well not if you take your wife. Ask a taxi driver for the direct route to where ever your going, don't say the fastest or you'll pay more. Went to see Zumanity on the last night (or that's what we thought), the show is brillant, yes they show skin but the skill behind the show is amazing and the comedy was excellent, just don't sit near the front or you'll be sorry. Now this is when it went wrong and my reason for giving this hotel an average rating, we got stranded for an extra week because of Icelands attempt to sink there island so they dont have to pay us British back the money they owe us, this gave us a chance to see what other hotels offer and compare against New York New York. We then had to stay in 3 different hotels until we left, 1st was South Point, hmmmm yee harrr I think is the right words for this place, cowboys need only apply, next was the Royal Resort, north end of the strip near Denny's, very small and was very nice, small pool but very private, only stayed there 1 night, last was The Orleans, stayed there 3 nights and it blew the New York New York away, the price was good, the staff was on a different level and it had amenities that kept you interested all hours of the day, the wife would like to apologise for the dent in the bowling alley though, don't try lane 26, come to think about that don't try lane 25 either, she bounced it well (got stuck on my thumb, yeah right, more like a fast bowler in cricket). Try Fuddrockers, amazing!!!, they also have a free shuttle to the strip as your slightly off it, comes every 20 to 30 minutes, if I go back then I'm picking this hotel and making sure there are no live volcano's. Must See's: Bellagio Fountains, Miracle Mile, MGM Lions, Venetian, Volcano (the fake one), Zumanity. Don't Bothers: Sirens at Treasure Island, they just didn't seem bothered, 15 minutes of my life that I'll never get back.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect short getaway”
Reviews.Author: Erica_C_J
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Las Vegas for a long weekend with a group of friends. Most people stayed in the MGM Grand, but my husband and I chose to stay in the NYNY due to a great internet deal. And I'm thrilled that we did. There's a walkway that attaches MGM to NYNY, so from the moment we got there some friends were able to dash over while we checked in. Our room was a good size and very clean. A basic hotel room at the end of the day, but the decor was a little flashier since we were in Vegas afterall. The view from our window looked out over the pool, parking garage and some of the city. At night it was lovely. By day it was OK. When we met our friends we headed straight to the roller coaster. There was a deal going on while we were there where, for $54, you could get three tickets to any of 5 local attractions. We chose the roller coaster at NYNY, Titanic exhibit at Luxor, and Shark Reef at Mandalay Bay. The roller coaster was cool! It went so fast that my eyes were watering and I ended up shutting them for most of the ride since I couldn't see. Therefore I was surprised later when I discovered that the coaster actually went back through the hotel! Must have missed that part. But what fun. Then we all ate at the little Mexican place inside NYNY, and headed to the dueling piano bar where the rest of our group met us. That was a fun place, but we were there early enough that it really wasn't very crowded. That night my husband and I met up with some friends who are locals and they took us to some great spots around town that most tourists never get to see. Very fun. Next day we had breakfast at the Italian place in NYNY (fantastic bread and latte's!). Then we went and looked around Monte Carlo next door. Very nice! Afterwards we went out to the pool at the NYNY. This is where the hotel is lacking. The pool is a grand total of 4 ft. deep and it's really not very big. There's no outdoor food area, so you have to wait for the waitresses to come by and take your order. Oh well, it's not like either of us went to Vegas to spend the whole day at the pool. Later we went to Shark Reef. That was a cool exhibit. Having sharks swimming over your head, and a glass wall that you could walk right up to to see them. Everyone had cameras out the place was so neat. Afterwards we got a drink at Areole (sp?) in Mandalay Bay. This is the place where the girl is raised and lowered with pulleys to get your bottle of wine. The guys at the bar were fantastic! We were wishing we'd planned to spend more time there and are seriously considering staying at Mandalay Bay next time we go just because of the atmosphere there. When we met our friends at MGM that night it turned into a long evening. The guys went and played poker, and the wives wandered off to have drinks and late dinner. Even though one of the wives was staying at MGM we had a hard time trying to figure out our way around the place. It's enormous! It made me really appreciate the NYNY more since it's easy to navigate and there's plenty of good restaurants and gaming tables. The next day we spent the day at the MGM pool (which is fabulous!), then I went back to NYNY to get a massage and facial. Great spa, very relaxing, experience people, worth every penny! The only downside is that the room I was in for my facial is right next to the weight room/fitness center, and some musclehead was in there lifting weights that were too heavy for him so he was dropping them to the ground every time and I could hear the crash in my spa room. By the way, the Titanic exhibit in Luxor is great. Very powerful, but incredibly interesting! Not sure I'd want to stay in Luxor, but that exhibit is well worth a walk through. Overall, I'm thrilled we stayed at the NYNY. The size of the hotel was good for me being smaller but having the feel of a larger hotel. If you're the type of person that values a pool then MGM or Mandalay Bay might be more your speed. And if you're a big poker player NYNY doesn't have a poker room. But if you just like to gamble a bit, have a few drinks, and eat at really good restuarants, this place is perfect! And being in the middle of a popular area means that it's just a short stroll to visit other poker rooms, fancy bars and other exhibits if you don't like what's offered around you.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, friendly staff, nice room - definately coming back”
Reviews.Author: nannybailey
Reviews.Content: I have just come back from a 7 day trip to this hotel and before we went I was slightly concerned about some of the comments I'd read but loved the hotel the moment we set foot in it. The atmosphere was great, a quick check in, all the staff we encountered were extremely friendly and our room was kept very clean with a constant supply of towels and toiletries. We had a room on the 18th floor with a strip view, overlooking the MGM Grand, and the room had 2 queen size beds, the room was ample in size and kept extremely clean as were the corridors and lift areas. 4 lifts served our tower and we never had to wait long either up or down. We could hear the rollercoaster faintly but it was never a problem. The many restaurants and diners offer a great assortment of food ranging from below $10 to over $60 dollars per person so there is lots of choice and we really liked the way the inside had been built to look exactly like the streets of New York , great ambience! I have stayed at the Luxor previously and the New York New York hotel is much, much better. All in all, a great holiday and I am already planning a return trip.

Reviews.Title: “NYNY-a pleasant surprise!”
Reviews.Author: Boodashark
Reviews.Content: I think Vegas is trying harder and harder to keep their customers! This hotel received some poor reviews in the past, but our visit this past weekend proved all those reviews wrong. The service (housekeeping, Players Club personnel (especially Trina and Shawn), food servers, cocktail waitresses, and front desk staff) were gracious and very helpful. The room was clean all four days and the equipment (slots, elevators, hairdryer, etc.) all worked well. Though the pool is small, it's intimate (and was still freezing at this time of the year!) and clean. It's easy to find your way around this casino, so we felt at home almost immediately. We were happy we chose this hotel and would go back in a NY minute!

Reviews.Title: “clean, friendly and convenient”
Reviews.Author: pdx2vegas
Reviews.Content: I go to Vegas 2 or 3 times a year and try to stay at a different hotel each time. NYNY is a very pleasant hotel and is one that I would definitely recommend to others . I was slightly nervous about NYNY after I read some of the reviews about the roller coaster noise. I saw the roller coaster right outside our window, but to my surprise, did not hear it at all. The room was very clean and the service staff was very friendly. I was happy that we were able to print our boarding passes in their business center quickly. We've stayed in other hotels where it took so long to log on to print the boarding passes that we just gave up. If you're a poker player, the walk to the MGM poker room is about a 3 minute walk from the NYNY lobby. Overall, I would describe the hotel as being clean, friendly and convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay”
Reviews.Author: mezzonhols
Reviews.Content: My husband, myself and 2 teens (15 & 12) stayed for 5 nights and loved the hotel as a place to base yourself. As the whole casino is made up to look like New York streets with restaurants, cafe's, bars and take away including Starbucks and Ben and Jerry's. Great Bars - Coyote Ugly and the bar with dualling pianos is a lot of fun. Heaps of places to eat and drink. Kids loved the arcade and roller coaster. Lots for everyone to do. The room was nice - we had the Park Avenue Strip View room which looked out over the MGM and Excalibur. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing Stay Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A trip advisor from California
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in Vegas at the Luxor the previous year and having been very disappointed with that hotel I decided to book the New York New York hotel this year. This has a more open atmosphere with many good restaurants. I upgraded from the basic Skyline Room and had a room overlooking the strip for only $15 more a day. Beautiful sunrises over the MGM Grand in the morning. Chin Chin's restaurant is great and they also do a good breakfast for around $12.50 per person buffet style. I will be definately booking this hotel again next year as it is more than adequate for our requirements. One word of caution. Even though you book your hotel online be aware that you will be charged a resort fee of around $11 per day per room on top of your booking cost. This is not made clear when you make the booking. This also happens at other hotels so not just the New York New York.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for Money Hotel on South Strip”
Reviews.Author: DalissMelbourne
Reviews.Content: The aesthetic of the hotel with its recreation of NYC skyline outside and NYC streets inside is fantastic, attention to detail is incredible. We stayed in a Park Avenue room which was a little motel-like. The room itself was far smaller than it looked like in the photos but there was a large and very comfortable king size bed. Bathroom was small but adequate. Overall the rooms were not luxurious but good value for money. You should be aware: this hotel, whilst on the strip is a long walk from the centre of the strip (Bellagio and Caesers Palace). The hotel may look like it is a short stroll from the centre of the strip but it is not. There is a regular bus service in Las Vegas called the Deuce which you can ride for $7 all day and there is a stop right outside this hotel BUT the bus is pretty much useless for the following reasons: 1) The traffic on the strip is bumper to bumper eg it took us 90 mins to travel 5 miles 2) The buses are always so full of people that unless you get on and one of the first stops, the buses will drive right past you at the bus stop as they can't fit any more passengers on the bus. So, if you want to be doing things in the centre strip and you cannot walk very far or very well then pay the extra money to stay in a centre strip hotel. NYNY will simply be too far away for you. Some good eateries in the hotel, loved Nathan's Hot Dogs and New York Pretzel. Also Gonzales y Gonzales, they have the best chicken tamales and all you can eat tortilla chips and dips.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel..We'd Go Again”
Reviews.Author: twicemice2
Reviews.Content: Our stay at NY NY Hotel in March, 2010 was just fine for us..We were attending a wedding at MGM , just across the street, (!!). We'd read some complaints about it being small. It is somewhat smaller than others but do you want to walk a mile just to get out of your hotel every single time you leave? There's plenty of walking to be done in Vegas so this place is just the right size. We had friends staying further up the strip, we recommend using The Deuce (bus) $7 to ride all day..Also read about unattentive, uncaring employees. Not that we ever met. All were very helpful and polite. The restaurants were great and the bars, esp. the piano bar and America bar and rest. Pool was lovely, (We didn't use the fitness center, but saw there was a fee to use...odd). Our room was nice, kept very clean. We upgraded to a strip view upon arrival but felt that was not necessary as we were outside "viewing" it several times a day anyway. Our first time in Vegas, and we would certainly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Average stay”
Reviews.Author: shuribob
Reviews.Content: Just wanted to say that we had an average stay at the New York New York. The location is really good if you don't plan on leaving that area as its towards the far end of the strip. The hotel doesn't have a buffet which was an inconvenience but not anything we couldn't deal with. We did find that some room service trays stayed out in the hallway for most of a day which was unsightly but again nothing horrible. The room was sufficient and clean however, it overlooked the rollarcoaster and the noise did penetrate some into our room. If the price is right this place will do just fine but there are other values that should be explored first.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay as usual”
Reviews.Author: VegasSusie
Reviews.Content: This is our 4th or 5th visit to NY NY. We have been comped for all our past visits, but paid a minimal fee of $19 per night this time. The surprise, however, was the $13/day resort fee which they tacked on this trip. It seems a lot of hotels are charging this now. We stayed at Monte Carlo next door in November 2009 and they also charged a resort fee of $9/day, which was also new. So beware. Other than that, the stay was as per usual, friendly check-in/out staff, the room was clean and well appointed, albeit getting a bit worn, and the housekeeping was excellent as always. Will stay again if the price is right.

Reviews.Title: “Worse hotel experience ever”
Reviews.Author: pier-vegas
Reviews.Content: Staying at NY-NY for a convention. Bad idea. What's the problem? Beside the facts that this hotel has lived, looks old, outdated and dusty, a simple problem was imposssible to solve: the magnetic key (all the 30 keys I was given) weren't working and there was nothing to do about it. So each time I had to enter my room, I had to find a house phone, call security, wait 10 minutes, identify myself, and finally have access to the room. Each time, each day. And the manager of housekeeping couldn't care less. No attempts to solve the problem or compensate the hassle. Just unacceptable. There are so many great hotels in Vegas. I couldn't think of one single reason why staying at the NY-NY, knowing what's going on there.

Reviews.Title: “We'll Be Back...”
Reviews.Author: vegas_gurl
Reviews.Content: We were lucky enough to recieve an awesome offer from NYNY on our Player's Card (if you have one - log in online to check offers; don't just wait for emails). Upon arrival we got to use the Invited Guests check-in (avoiding the line at the general registration). I kindly asked the gentleman if there were any complimentary upgrades - he had a stripview room on the top floor - but it was smoking (we'd asked for non). But, definatley took the room. Gave him a tip for his help and went on our merry way. We ended up in room 1726 and the view was beautiful... some people have complained of the zig-zag hallways and I think they just need something to complain about. I've also herd reports of small bathrooms but found the entire room adequate for my spouse and myself. We didn't win big in the casino, but didn't loose big either. The one complaint I could have is the lack of Cocktail Waitresses. It was rather tough to get a drink, nomatter the time of day. The elevators were nice and never had to wait long for one up, or down. They moved pretty rapidly. Chin-Chin had a nice breakfast buffet but not much variety for the price - service there was awesome. Maid service was excellent and seemed to predict any needs we may have. Kept our room nice and tidy. Ran into one issue with the "resort fee" - upon arriving to our room we tried to get online with our laptop only to be notified there would be a $14.99/day fee. After discussing with front desk found that the access is already rolled into the resort fee and even though you must accept the daily fee you will not be charged for it on top of the resort fee. All-in-all it was a beautiful hotel with an interesting theme. We loved our room and will definatley plan a return visit.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome week long stay at the new york new york!”
Reviews.Author: kevinthecheesehead
Reviews.Content: Cant say enough good things about the new york new york, got a great price on it while booking so my expectations were lowered a bit but i was extremely wrong after being there for about 5 minutes. Check in went really quick and everyone seemed friendly. Rooms were super nice, i have stayed many places in vegas and these rooms were up there with rooms you would get at the top hotel's in vegas. First thing i noticed was the room was extemely clean and kept clean every day. Our room was by the roller coaster and the noise was very little if any really. Beds were extremely comfortable to sleep in after a night of heavy drinking. Casino was alright but there are so many casino's in vegas if you dont like one just goto another. Lots of food and entertainment options in the new york new york.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay, Location, and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: 1177KeeKee
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband stayed at NYNY to celebrate his birthday in Vegas as we normaly do just about every year. This is actually the 2nd time we stayed NYNY. We were in the Park Ave room on the 26th floor with a view of the strip and the rollercoaster was near by, but not annoying or overly loud. We called for room service to get extra towels and they were up to our room within five minutes. We really like this hotel because it is within walking distance of other main hotels on the strip. The monorail is across the way at MGM. Zumanity is a great show to see which is also in this hotel and the rollercoaster which is inside of this hotel is a good one to ride without having to wait so long in the lines. We hang out out Pour 24 bar which is a GREAT spot to people watch while hanging out and having a few drinks. There are also good shops at NYNY to purchase souvenirs at a reasonable price for family/friends. One particualr desk personnell was very nice (cant remember her name but she is from Mississippi and was working the late night shift) and gave us good advice for future booking to get the best deal, we even ended up earning so many points from playing that we were comped one of the nights we stayed. The slot machines we played majority of them we won atleast 3 times what we played. It was a great stay and we will definitely stay at this hotel for future visits. Next time we look forward to trying out the spa too.

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel was VERY NICE”
Reviews.Author: miracleblake
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my family at the New York, New York for Valentine's Day. I was unsure about this hotel since I had read previous reviews about the noise from the roller coaster. I did not experience this problem. You could hear it just a little from time to time. I did enjoy that they provided their guest with the option of riding the roller coaster 2-for-1, so I think we paid $14. I never ordered any room service. There was no food trays with food sitting out in the hallways for days, which I have experienced with the Luxor. The hotel room was clean, a nice size to accomodate my family of 5, and was my stay was excellent. The pizza from the pizza shop downstairs was very good, as well. There was a $12 resort charge per day. What they did not tell me until after I checked out was that the resort fee covered the high speed internet. They say you will be charged for it, but they will take it off. Also, self-parking was free.

Reviews.Title: “new york new york”
Reviews.Author: singleaz
Reviews.Content: we stayed here and wished we didnt! there beds are like sleeping on a rock! the maid service does not leave soap and shampoo everyday. you have to ask! i asked for an extra pillows because theres are like really flat! then the maid them back! they also let someone party in there room for over two hours! at 2:00 in the morning! and there was no HOT WATER IN THE HOTEL! and it took 45 mins. to check in! and also the elevator to the pool does not work to well! we were told the would refund the daily resort fees which were 12.00 a day! they didnt! we will never stay here again! ever!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Suites!”
Reviews.Author: ledzep1061
Reviews.Content: We stayed a couple of nights at the Stratosphere and relocated to New York New York. We tried to check-in at 2 and we told the room wasn't ready. We were given two coupons for a free drink, so we used them to pass time. At 3 we asked for our suite number, but again were told the room wasn't ready! Finaaly at 3:30 the room was ready. Not a good start considering the hotel want you out at 11, or charge an extra fee! I hadn't told my fiance that I had booked a suite and she was surprised at the Ziggurat Suite! The suite was actually better than the pictures! But we had a problem with the suite and were switched to another suite that had the same problem! The hotel at firat wanted to downgrade our suite! That was unacceptable, so I asked for the Penthoude suite! After a couple of minutes we were on our way to the Penthouse Suite. The Penthouse Suite we recieved was on the 44th floor! the entrance had double doors which lead to a more wonderful suite than the Ziggurat Suite!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT TIME AT NY NY”
Reviews.Author: lovesthebeach032
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4 night stay at NYNY and really enjoyed all the hotel had to offer. We arrived at the hotel around 10:30am and check in was very smooth and our room was ready, even though check in is not until 3pm. It was nice to be able to get in our room early. I requested a "strip" view and had to pay extra $10 per night, but we were put in the New Yorker Tower in a corner room. We had views of the Las Vegas strip out the front of the room and a view of the southern end of the strip from the side windows. Worth the extra $$ to have the views. Loved the casino area, it was very easy to manage our way around. The food court has some pretty good choices. We had the pizza the first night. We also ate at the deli and it was very good. We had the turkey sandwich and the homemade chicken noodle soup. Excellent. We also loved the location of the hotel on the strip. Close to other major hotels/casinos. I would highly recommend staying here over the other higher priced hotels and you can just walk your way to whichever casino you want . The only downside for us is the extra "resort fee" of $11.99 per day. Other than that we would definately stay here again. Also took a day trip to the Grand Canyon. We booked with Airbridge tours and for $130 per person, we really had a great time. Took around 3 hours to get to the canyon. We had approx. 4 hours on our own at canyon. Lunch was included in the price. If you have the time, I highly recommed you take a tour to the canyon. You won't regret it!

Reviews.Title: “Entertainment was great but I'll sleep somewhere else next time”
Reviews.Author: krisnyo
Reviews.Content: 2 nd half of our stay in Vegas for our honeymoon, 1st half was spent @ Treasure Island. Althougth I really liked the entertainment offered, roller coaster, piano bar etc. as far the hotel room I wasnt all that impressed. We booked the Marquis Suite and it was decent but not a s nice as I was hoping for. It was nice, just seemed slightly outdated for the price, and there was the most annoying buzzing sound from somewhere (and I'm not usually bugged by noises) bed paled in comparison to the bed at Treasure Island. I think a lot of it was that I really liked the other side of the strip more then this NY NY end. A lot of our view was taken up by the Airport =( Decent but I think I'd rather visit NY NY for entertainment but sleep somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: CecilieW
Reviews.Content: I traveled across the States with three of my friends last summer. We stayed in Vegas 3 nights, all of them in NYNY. It was great! The rooms are classy, the hotel is "NY like" and the service fabulous. We saw the show Zumanity and went to the club Rok. Amazing. New York is the best city in Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Satisfactory”
Reviews.Author: EBella
Reviews.Content: This was me and boyfriend's 3rd time in Vegas. We wanted to try something a little fancier than what we've normally stayed at. The room was quite nice - inside. It has ovbiously been reno'd lately. Nice furniture, gorgeous bath. But our view was of the back of a building, looking down at a roof vent. But hey....we didn't spend much time in the room anyway. We're not bit gamblers and this casino didn't inspire us to do to any there. It's so dark and depressing I find. The front desk staff on check in were not so nice. Check out very nice. I would probably stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Average.......casino has tvs”
Reviews.Author: ufrc75
Reviews.Content: Ok....Just to give you some background. I am a gambler that travels to Vegas a few times a year. This hotel is very average. It is a great deal if all you are looking for is a place to lay your head. They just redid the casino floor. It has plasma tvs throughout. A good location to watch some sports games while you gamble. The dealers, pit bosses, and overall service at the hotels is VERY underwhelming. It took us 45 minutes to check in....and there wasn't a huge line (maybe 10 people), there was just one guy doing the check in for the entire hotel. This was pretty ridculous since we were on a comped stay and it was only 8PM not 1am. The room we got was huge. Lots of room but pretty sparcely decorated and furnished. basic 2 beds, small table, chairs, etc. Will someone please tell them it is 2010 and bedspreads just make you go ick! I want a duvet that is washed more often than I come to vegas. The bathroom is decent. Again, the entire room reminds me of like a Hampton Inn....maybe a little bigger. but the furnishings, cheap carpet, etc. is about on that level. i didn't eat anywhere on property besides the pizze place. A good 3AM snack after a long night. Didnt go to the pool. Overall, this is a very "ok" spot. If you are on a budget, this maybe where you should stay, but there are so many deals in vegas. I think you can do better.....but again, you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Great time;”
Reviews.Author: padddie333
Reviews.Content: The wife and I stayed at NewYork New York for three nights in the end of March. We stayed here last year and were given a great casino host at VIP check-in named Barbara.From the time we checked in she was right there waiting for us to take care of all our needs. Upon arriving this year, Barbara was waiting for us at VIP check-in, she provideded us with a Marquise suite and tickets to Zumanity. We got into our room immediately even though it was only noon. This is the kind of service you look for in a good casino host. Our stay was great, the cocktail waitress staff was the best on the strip. The food and entertainment was first class. We went to Zumanity that night, show was excellent, highly recommend it to any one over the age of 18. When we got ready to check out after the 3rd day, our host meet us down at the high roller lounge, and gave us a big hug and comped all of our meals and entertainment. We both highly recommend New York New York.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Nothing Spectacular.”
Reviews.Author: bonleeballerina
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at NY, NY for three days over spring break. We really enjoyed our stay and would recommend it to others who aren't expecting a luxury vacation. The Room: We stayed in a Park Avenue Deluxe room (the second cheapest). The room was adequate. It was pretty small, but we didn't spend much time in it, so it really didn't matter to us. The room wasn't as clean as it could have been. There was an empty water bottle by the window and a long hair in the bath tub when we arrived. There was also a really large stain on the bench/luggage stand. A lot of the fixtures were obviously worn. The room was pretty nice if you just didn't look too close. The bed was very comfortable. There was no coffee maker or mini fridge, both of which seemed oddly out of place for a hotel of this level (four star). The bathroom was fine, although it didn't have a fan which made it pretty stuffy when I showered. Also, the shower head was very low. I'm about 5'8" and had to really bend down to get my hair wet. I can't imagine how hard it was for my husband who is 6'3". The water pressue was fine, though. Our room had a view of the roller coaster which was pretty loud, but stopped running by 11pm, so it didn't bother us at all. The hotel itself: The casino was nice enough, but we didn't have much luck there. We had a much better time at the Monte Carlo and Bally's down the strip. The inside of the hotel is very cool. It's modeled to look like the streets of New York, but kind of old fashioned. There are lots of little shops and restaurants. There is small-medium arcade upstairs which was kind of fun to goof off at. We also rode on the roller coaster, and at $14/person I would suggest you skip it. It's very rough - I was not impressed. There is a shop that has a lot of generic gift shop stuff like purses, watches, and scarves and everything is $10. The resort fee of something like $10/night was annoying but expected. Be warned, it is in addition to the room rate. Parking was free and convenient. We didn't use the pool because it was too cold outside, but it looked fine. Food: Dining at the hotel was pretty good. We only ate at one of the sit down restuarants at the hotel (Gonzalez y Gonzalez) and it was very good. The prices seemed pretty average; I think it was about $45 total (with tax and tip) for two average priced entrees and one giant margaria (the kind that comes in the two foot long plastic cup that you can get refilled all over the strip for about $10). We also ate at a counter service burger restaurant in the Village Shops within the hotel, and it was average in both price and food quality. If you are trying to save money I would strongly recommend going right accross the street to the "food court". It has a Subway, Panda Express, Wendys, and several other places to eat and the prices aren't much higher than you'd pay at those restaurents at home. We also ordered room service one night and it took about 45 minutes to get our food. The food was pretty average. I woudn't suggest it. Service: The front desk was very nice, although a little too friendly, when checking in. What I mean is, the person who helped us kept getting off on tangent conversations while a line was building up behind us. The housekeeping was consistent and adequate. Location: New York, New York is located at one end of the strip right accross the street from the MGM. It was a good location for us because we didn't mind walking all the way to the other end of the strip for things like the Bellagio fountains and Madame Tousauds, but if you don't want to walk a lot you might want to stay at the other end of the strip or more in the middle. One final note about generaly travel to and from Las Vegas: if you are coming from the South and plan to go over the Hoover dam, be warned that traffic can be horrible. The traffic was so bad it added 2 1/2 hours to our drive there (we took a different way back).

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but not worth four stars”
Reviews.Author: mmb616
Reviews.Content: We booked this trip after staying at the MGM in January. Overall, I have to say that that the NYNY is more of a 3 star than a 4 star hotel. Let's start with the good: Check in was fast and easy. Generally, the hotel was easy to navigate with an array of dining options. No buffet, but we ate at the America restaurant, which was good and affordable. The hotel is REALLY neat from the outside. Our room was near the rollercoaster, but that didn't bother us. At check in, we asked if we could have a king size bed, which they quickly said they could accomodate. The staff was nice and friendly. The not so good: We had a deluxe Park Avenue room. The photo on the website is inaccurate to say the least. The photo shows a modern room with rich earthy tones. What we got were cheap linens and a scratchy bed spread with green leaves all over it. The bed was okay. I have slept in worse, but after MGM's bed, this one was a downgrade. The walls are very thin. The people next to us were awake until around 7am with yelling and raucous laughter. I know this is Vegas, but the walls did not seem to muffle the sound at all! We could literally hear their toilet flushing. Overall, I was a bit disappointed with what this hotel claims to be. This would be a fantastic 3 star hotel, but as a 4 star, it falls short!

Reviews.Title: “not great, just ok”
Reviews.Author: Dar9
Reviews.Content: very surprised with my stay here as i was expecting so much more from this hotel We had split our 5 night stay between here and the excalibur, hate to say it but the ex definately gets the vote when it comes to the room quality. Stayed in a park avenue deluxe room, found it to be vey old style and the corridors had a horrible musty burning smell (very hard to describe). Could not get over how small the pool was compared to other hotels on the strip, id hate to be staying there on a busy weekend as you'd never get a bed if you arrived anytime late in the morning but forget about the rooms for a second and head downstairs and its a differnet story, great bars and good food, probably the best hotel for entertainment although id avoid the rok nightclub as its about the smae size as my sitting room! Not a bad stay over all except for the rooms themsleves and in my opinion the very small pool!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel for its price”
Reviews.Author: djmumbles
Reviews.Content: New York New York is a pretty good hotel and is located right on the Las Vegas Strip. The hotel is located in a good area, other hotels are you are Excalibur, Luxor, Monte Carlo and Tropicana. It is also not too bad of a walk to the middle of the strip where the nicer hotels are located such as Bellagio and Cesar's Palace. What I really liked about New York New York was there was a huge food court with a nice variety of different restaurant and eateries and at decent prices. I've been to Vegas many times and sometimes my friends and I have problems finding food at decent prices. So if you are concerned about that, then this hotel would be a good fit for you. Our hotel room was pretty clean and the service at the hotel was excellent. Beds were comfortable and overall don't really have much complaints about this hotel. As for the entertainment and nightlife, there is a rollercoaster in this hotel and few bars/clubs like Rok and Coyote Ugly. I didn't go to those spots, the better nightclubs are at other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Ok Hotel, but Service was Terrible, and Pool was closed.”
Reviews.Author: IrishDave2005
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel on the basis of its location and in house entertainment, i.e bars, restaurants, roller coaster etc. The location is good, but not as central as we thought, in my opinion a small bit futher North on the strip is better, i.e Bellagio, Ceasers Palace etc. The Hotel itself is full of charachter, does in fairness have lots of choice for bars and restaurants. The in house nightclub is ROK, and is a complete let down and full of men to be honest. The club is tiny too. Check in was very straight forward, we seeemd to arrive at a quiet time as i did the see the check in lines beeing very long over our 5 day stay. We are based on the 8th floor of the Park Avenue tower, rooms were very well equipped and spacious. BUT..........and there is a big but, why do we go to Las Vegas? to Gamble is the answer, and so a Hotel must be judged as a priority on its Casino. The Casino physcially is ok, lots of tables etc, but the service for a drink is by far the worst i or any of my friends have or had experienced, its a DISGRACE!!!!!!! In Fairness, we had read about this on the TA forums but havening stayed in Vegas twice before, brushed it off as people having a bad experience, well they were all right. At times inless you got up off your table to go look for a waitress, you will be left waiting and thirsty, so what i recommend is this, if you are goig to Vegas to gamble YOUR MONEY and in return want decent drinks service to YOUR table, for which YOU will tip YOUR own money, avoid this hotel at all costs. Finally, the weather was very hot (by irish standards) at this time of year and the NY NY outdoor pool was CLOSED, so people, give this hotel a kick up the back side and stay somewhere else. Thanks, Dave.

Reviews.Title: “Trip to NYNY for our Honeymoon, LOVED THIS Hotel! DEF. going back”
Reviews.Author: MrsTiffanyRoberts
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I just got married on April 18, 2009 and since we live in FL we decided the ideal honeymoon location for us would be VEGAS! This was our first trip to Vegas and we booked our hotel and flight for a great price on Expedia.com, the person booking our trip recommended NY NY and we booked it. I have to admit when we arrived I was a little apprehensive as this was also my first time on a plane so I was exhausted and the wait at check in was a little longer than I had expected and when we arrived our room was not ready yet as we were early for check in. Went to lunch at the America restaurant and had a WONDERFUL patty melt and awesome fries. When our room was ready (we had a park avenue room) we walked in and my jaw dropped! I looked out from our window on the 24th floor and I could see the mountains, the roller coaster, the airport and the Excalibur hotel. I LOVED the view. The noise from the roller coaster didn't bother us as we are night owl and we are in our 20's. Casino was nice. Zumanity was great and we got a 2 for 1 special for staying at NY NY. COMPLAINTS: Ice machines were very slow and looked ragged, snack machine didn't work on multiple floors, hubby had to go three floors up to get something. as soon as we got to the counter to check in the lady left to go take her lunch and we had to wait longer. INTERNET FEES AND CHARGES TO PRINT YOUR BOARDING PASSES! NO FRIDGE! charged a $3 per day PHONE FEE which Expedia had informed us about ahead of time and then hotel forgot to activate our phone, paid for two days we didn't get. I recommend that you stop at Walgreens like we did and buy a foam cooler to put beverages in, worked for us. All in all NY NY made our Honeymoon memorable in so many great ways and we have already booked another vacation here for our anniversary in April 2010!

Reviews.Title: “Start spreading the news....New York, New York is great for families!”
Reviews.Author: dfwcanuck
Reviews.Content: Spent 5 nights with hubby & 2 teens over Spring Break. Rooms ok - fairly large for a std. room but no in room coffee pot :( Staff very responsive to all requests. Kids and hubby loved the roller coaster. Nice variety of places to eat (although somewhat expensive) - Greenbergs Deli, Pizza Restaurant and Chin Chins were favorites. Loved the location, walk or take the free tram to Mandalay Bay, Luxor, Treasure Island and MGM. Huge arcade across the street called Gameworks with a reasonably priced food court next door to it. Only negative for us was the pool hours - only open from 10am to 5pm. We were usually out all day, would like to have gone swimming or soaked in the hot tub after a busy day of sight seeing. But would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Cool Hotel with alot of Character....”
Reviews.Author: hulagirl98
Reviews.Content: Overall opinion is that this was a good choice for a first time stay in Vegas... Check in: Many people have commented that check in was a nightmare. We arrived on a sunday just before 4 pm and waited no more than 5 minutes to be helped. The desk clerk was very nice and proficeint. However, he indicated that the hotel fee was 11.99 per day. I told him expedia stated only 8.99 and proceded to pull out my computer print out indicating this. He immediately changed it to the lower price, but stated that i wouldn't have access to internet, which was just fine as I didn't even have my computer... Room: Very basic, but fine for our purpose. Great view (2235). Beds were comfortable and there was plenty of storage. room had a hairdryer and an iron and ironing board which was nice as I actually needed it one day. It would have been nice to have a mini fridge to store leftovers. The coaster did run by our room, but we were not bothered at all by it. Casino: Not a large as others, but had all the same stuff. Easy to navigate. Noticed not all the table games were open at one time. Saw waitresses who provided drinks to gamblers, but we were not once approaced while we were playing. Restaurants: Fine selections, some priced well - a few were overpriced in my opinion. the mexican was good and a great value (see my reviews on all restaurants we ate at under my name). Bars: Several to choose from. Pour 24, the only bar we actually went to in the hotel, had a really neat bar top. Coaster: not worth the 14 dollars, but glad i did it. Hotel itself was very easy to navigate compared to other hotels we wandered through. Everything was kept very clean and I was never overwhealmed by smoke. Pool: nice, but still cold when we were there, the hot tubs (3 total, only 2 were open) were great though. Pool provided towels, but you can't take them back to your room, so I had to dry off completely prior to leaving the area. Location: Not bad for a first choice. Monorail station is right across the street at the MGM. If I go back I would put myself a bit more centered on the strip. Value: I thought the hotel/airfair combo was very very good compared to some of the other places I looked at prior to booking. Other thoughts from a first time visitor We wandered many of the other hotels while there. Many were very very cool and I would love to stay in them. However, 2 hotels we wandered through I was very glad we did not stay in. Excaliber- was cool to look at, especially at night but seemed cramped and dirty to me when we went in. Tropicana- very dated looking and smelled like perfume everywhere. this was especially bad as I am highly allergic to strong perfumes... Day trips.. definately do one. we did a grand canyon tour (see my review under my name about the trip). Shows: see a show. there are 100's to pick from. we saw KA over at the MGM. see my review. Thats about all.....

Reviews.Title: “Great time at NY NY”
Reviews.Author: chariz808
Reviews.Content: We booked our room through US Airways Vacations and when we showed up to check in at about 9pm, they only had 2 bed queen rooms available. Granted it was Friday night and maybe booking it through US Airways had something to do with it, we accepted it. The receptionist told us to call in the morning and they could switch us into a King Bed. The boyfriend and I were also a little too nervous to try the $20 trick, so we were happy with what we got. We got a 6th floor room through the New Yorker elevators, all the way at the end of the hallway. Room was decent, no complaints. View was of the MGM sign, couldn't see much being so low.
