We called first thing in the morning and they told us that they couldn't do room changes until 1-2pm in the afternoon and that we should go out and explore and check back. We were OK with that. But then 5 minutes after we hung up, they called right back and said they had a room ready for us. Same floor, just all the way on the opposite side. And that trek to the elevator was LONG. But we're pretty easy going people, so we didn't mind too much. Better room with a King Bed. The side of the room with the TV Cabinet was ALL WINDOWS, with a view of the Roller Coaster. And the other wall had another window with a view of Excalibur. Clean room, no problems. Didn't hear the coaster at all, and it was literally right outside our room. Internet says there is a fee, but with the new resort fee, they waive the internet fee on your bill at the end of your stay. LOVED the casino. Small in comparison to the rest of the hotels on the strip, but I loved that it had an open design and wasn't your typical Vegas decorated casino, with gold and cheesy chandeliers everywhere. Very modern and "hip" LOVED the food court/New York Village. Reasonably priced food and Greenberg's Deli had THE BEST sandwiches. We didn't try any of the restaurants because we were on somewhat of a budget. Bars were a lot of fun. The piano bar was always busy, and I loved that the music carried into the casino. Coyote Ugly and Rok were also favorites. Overall, I loved staying here. The location was fine, although on the south strip, exercise is always a good thing.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value for money”
Reviews.Author: shayde08
Reviews.Content: Our stay here was great! We had a room with a decent view of the strip, although the windows were a little grimy! The room was lovely, easy to get to, and the hotel had loads of great restaurants and bars on site. Our room was just above the rollercoaster which was quite loud, but thankfully it stopped at around 11pm each night. We were in Vegas to have fun so we didn't spend loads of time in our room, so it wasn't too bad, but I'd try and get a room away from the rollercoaster next time!

Reviews.Title: “Fun hotel, clean and comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: UKJoΦl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the NYNY in the first week of March for my husband's 40th birthday with a couple of friends. We found the hotel to be clean and comfortable, relaxed with a good range of facilities and food options and fairly well located on the Strip. We stayed in a Park Avenue Deluxe Strip View room, and it was a really good sized room with two Queen Beds and a view across to the MGM Grand, Excalibur & the airport with the mountains beyond. No problems with noise from the airport and not too much noise from the strip or roller coaster! We weren't keen on the reception area being right beside the casino, but that was the only negative. The restaurants were good, we had breakfast in the American cafe and a dinner in Il Fornaio which was delicious. Also enjoyed pizza and lovely fish & chips from the smaller food counters. We saw three shows over the week and all were easy to get to from the NYNY either walking or by taxi, and the monorail from the MGM was great when we went all the way down to Stratosphere. Particularly convenient was Zumanity in the hotel, and all four of us loved it! We weren't sure whether such big hotels would offer a good service, but we are pleased to say that we really enjoyed our week at the hotel and would be happy to recommend it to other travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: newcastlebell
Reviews.Content: Great stay at the New York New York. Good location at the south end of the Strip within easy walking distance of lots of other hotels on the Strip. Our room was massive with 2 queen beds and spotlessly clean. The hotel has a really good friendly, casual atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: terribluefire
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at this hotel. We arrived 3 hours before check in, but had no problem checking in - and in fact was upgraded to a larger room with a king size bed. The hotel provides all the amenities that we could expect...only disappointment was the bathroom. Expected a little better than was was there, but nothing unreasonable. The room was very large and the bed was comfy. Zero problems sleeping. Our room was non-smoking, which it was, however, everytime we walked outside the room we were hit by the smell of smoke. Don't know if it was a mixed floor or the ventilation was carrying it from other parts of the hotel. Was not unbearable. The staff was all very friendly and our room was cleaned to wonderful standards on a daily basis. The eateries were varying in quality of food - the pizza left alot to be desired, but the fine dining was excellent. We found quite a bit of our interests within this hotel, including a Starbucks, Ben & Jerry's and a Harley shop! Also, for sports fans, there is an ESPNZone inside. Really, a little bit of everything for everyone. A quaint Italian cafe provides fantastic pasteries and coffee for breakfast. We attended the in-hotel show, "Zumanity". No recommended for the prude at heart, but great humor and fantastic acrobatics that will amuse and amaze! Very enjoyable and worth the ticket price. Only other problem is location of this hotel. Everything else we wanted to see and do was on the opposite ends of the strip...thus requiring LONG walks or a taxi. Be aware, though (which we were not at first) - there is a metro rail in the MGM across the street that travels down the strip for a reasonable price from what we are told. Overall, we would stay at this hotel again and do recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, location and value for money.....”
Reviews.Author: Emmk
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from staying at the NYNY for 7 night stay, at a busy period over the Nascar weekend. We found the hotel to be very good, only two people in the queue on arrival and the receptionist was extremely helpful. We stayed in a Park Avenue room which was fine for our needs – we had a strip view and although we could see the roller coaster it didn’t bother us at all. The hotel itself has a good atmosphere and lots of shops and restaurants and bars. We also thought the location was great within easy reach of all the best parts of the strip – we would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Caribe704
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, What could be bad, staff cant try hard enoughto make you return!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Lots of Atmosphere and 5-Star Service”
Reviews.Author: ColoradoGuy31
Reviews.Content: Stayed at NYNY in Vegas from 2/26/10 to 3/1/10. Extended weekend vacation with family and friends. Overall, the hotel/casino met my expectations and I would stay at this property again. Although the rooms and casino and a little smaller than other resorts on the strip, I would rate the overall atmosphere higher than average at NYNY. Lots of fun. A few quick notes: 1) The food court is a nice surprise with reasonably priced meals. They have a wide variety of quick choices at low prices. 2) We had an early flight on this trip and were pleasantly surprised when they allowed us to check-in at 8:00 a.m. 3) Check-out was fast with no line. 4) Only major complaints about the room: The shower pressure was horrible and the tub did not drain quickly. 5) Housekeeping and other services were top-notch. The housekeeping manager even called to ask when we would like our room serviced. At other properties, I have had to call several times to get them to cleaned. This was a nice touch. 6) Couldn't really complain about the property fee as the rooms were fully comped. 7) Ordered a very late-night meal via room service and the food was great and arrived within minutes (comparably priced to other room service at other hotels). Had a great time at New York New York and I highly recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “This big apple bites the big one...”
Reviews.Author: Travelicious55
Reviews.Content: Not too impressed, looked good on the net though (don't they all!!). Stinky, smokey and sticky. To get to reception have to walk through smoke filled casino. Then feel like you need a shower, that is if you can get to your room without the drunks slobbering on you on your way. Room itself was average. Can tell these rooms have been 'well used' and need a good steam cleaning. I'd never take my shoes off in this place, the carpet felt 'sticky'. No room coffee maker or fridge so definitely no frills. My husband had an ingenious idea and used a zip lock baggie over the TV remote that looked like it hadn't been cleaned...ever....and was all 'gunked up'. At least with the plastic baggie you could use it without feeling like you'd catch something. Hairs in shower and toilet, not the best cleaning job. Bed was very hard and old and needs replacing. Lots of noise from hallway and the boozers. Stay somewhere else - pay a bit more and get a better hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Opinions, opinions, opinions”
Reviews.Author: mosstavernblue
Reviews.Content: People will always have them. I first stayed ay NYNY in September 2008, for 5 nights. I had a wonderful time there, but did not see everything, so vowed to visit again. Being from the UK, it is not a place that you can "pop" to every 5 minutes, but I travelled again in May 2009. I stayed for 7 nights....okay the room I had 1st night had AC problems, but they moved me the following day without any quibbles. Every person who writes a review on here will have their own opinion, whether it be NYNY, or The Palazzo etc. You pay your money, and you take your chance. Me? I love the NYNY. Okay, it is brash, it is noisy. Some people also think that the pool is not big enough (I think it is fine), and there's not so much in the way of shopping. Some people also think that you don't get a great view from your room (well, if you want to spend time in your room, what are you doing holidaying in Vegas?). But because the NYNY is brash and noisy, it has character. and when I travel to Vegas again (hopefully September 2010), I fully intend to stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Perfect getaway!!!”
Reviews.Author: hecalekat03
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a little getaway to Las Vegas and I must say that we loved the NY NY hotel. We booked the hotel thru ivegas.com and got the 3rd night free. We stayed at a Broadway deluxe room and it was huge.Check in was smooth and the staff was very friendly. The location is great and the food was good as well ,especially the Mexican restaurant Gonzalez and Gonzalez (the best carnitas tacos and frozen margaritas). On our next trip to Las Vegas we will be staying at NY NY hotel and casino again.

Reviews.Title: “Fun”
Reviews.Author: LeahH1
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel, casino, food, entertainment. Would stay there anytime we could.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: untidytowns
Reviews.Content: At the time of our visit to Vegas I was only 17, but it was still so much fun. We saw tons of shows and ate great food. The New York New York was incredible. All the hustle and bustle of a big city inside one building. Tha spa is fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Shot show 2010”
Reviews.Author: Patz45
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was a long way from show. Had to walk way too far just to get to room. Food was very expensive

Reviews.Title: “Fun”
Reviews.Author: RichelD
Reviews.Content: The room was great and we got in our rooms earlier than expected, they let us in our rooms two hours before the check-in time. I wasn't about to bring my bags everywhere with me!

Reviews.Title: “Great time at Vegas' Big Apple”
Reviews.Author: PaulTheTravelGuy
Reviews.Content: This is one of my favority Las Vegas Hotels. The restaurants, bar and casino area have a lot of character, which I often find is missing in some other hotels. Rooms are art deco style, very comfortable, and perfect. Some great deals to be had for room rates right now. My only complaint is their new 'resort fee' which is mandatory, although it does cover internet and boarding pass printing (which I think should be free anyway . . .). Other than that, I had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Super hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kenua
Reviews.Content: Have stayed in the hotels a few times when I have been doing business in the Nevada. I simply love the hotel and the pianobar is the perfect place to meet new people and party all night long. I am planning my next trip to Vegas and for sure I will be staying at the New York New York

Reviews.Title: “NYNY”
Reviews.Author: caddmax
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay. Its right in the middle of the action and the rooms were nice. All for a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME experience!”
Reviews.Author: dewitthm
Reviews.Content: Very clean, great atmosphere, FANTASTIC food. It really felt like we were in New York. SUPER fun experience! Nice rooms, great service. HIGHLY reccommended.

Reviews.Title: “Not Customer Oriented”
Reviews.Author: Don075
Reviews.Content: e recently stayed at NYNY Hotel and Casino. and unfortunately one of our travelers got sick and needed a wheel chair. The hassel that we had each time we needed the chair was very upsetting and hostile. The service at the check-in/out desk was slow and the clerks seemed oblivious to guests waiting in line. The corridors to the rooms are so long so that rooms are so far away from the elevators. They banked six elevators in the center instead of locating three each in two more convenient locations. We tried to dine in the Nine Irishmans Restaurant at night but the music was so loud even in the most distant table that we had to leave because we couldn't hear the waitress or hear each other talk. We did go there for lunch and it was fine, in fact I had a great Shepards Pie.

Reviews.Title: “NYNY Doesn't care about you. Allows prostitutes to assault guests.”
Reviews.Author: NYNYMAYNOTSUCK
Reviews.Content: November 2009 my wife and I and also one of our travelling companions were assulted physically and verbally by a pair of prostitutes in the casino. This was early on a Saturday morning. The assaults were reported to management who have repeatedly refused to acknowledge the incidents or to respond to emails regarding their actions. The place is a disgusting dive anyway, the casino is dark and dirty, the rooms are not well appointed and small and NOISY. The most important thing about Vegas (I've been dozens of times) is the service at the hotels. Nothing else matters since most places are of a fairly high caliber. Not so at New York New York. I would be incensed if I was a New Yorker going here, it is an insult to New Yorkers. The management at this hotel need a wake up call.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - A little small compared to the others.”
Reviews.Author: Teazme29
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great. It was very comfortable. The only drawback was that it was a little small comparatively to the others. I was there for the Redken Symposium which was held at Mandalay Bay which was like a whole other country compared to the size of the New York. The roller coaster in our hotel was awesome. The inside of the hotel where the casino is was neat. Very outdoor central park like. There are some great restaurants in this hotel we ate at just about all of them. My overall thought on this hotel was that it was very cool, but when compared to most of the other establishments on the strip it did lack some in size and creativity.

Reviews.Title: “Fun Hotel”
Reviews.Author: snugglesscotland
Reviews.Content: First time in vegas NY Ny hotel was clean although a little dated. Staff friendly and nothing was too much trouble. Lots to do in hotel, restaurants, shopping, roller coaster and plenty of slot machines, had fun till 4am most mornings. Nice hotel for the money although at one end of the strip so did loads of walking. Pool Ok but you could use the one next door at the Monte Carlo, which was fab.

Reviews.Title: “Gross. Go anywhere But here.”
Reviews.Author: audacious1989
Reviews.Content: This place is disgusting. I dont know if all the rooms are like this but not impressed. I got a broadway suite. Do NOT recomend it. Plus the concierge put us in a room next to the staff room so I got to listen to housekeeping the whole stay. Young drunk people are everywhere, and families with screaming children everywhere. ughh serious lack of class.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tedelman
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel and very clean room with a view, The people working there were all very nice, restaurant food was very good, one problem was the toilet didn't work the morning we were leaving. We had to use the public restroom. No comp given

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay and great customer service.”
Reviews.Author: Zac1mac1
Reviews.Content: Check in was extremely easy and took less than 10 minutes. Was upgraded to a beautiful room that looked right out over the statue and onto the 4 corners. Room was very nice and housekeeping was very efficient and accommondating. Was very pleased with all aspects of our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Adult fun to kid fun, New York New york has it all!”
Reviews.Author: dforthun
Reviews.Content: Its fun to walk the recreated feel of a New York city street. All the reasons people love it, food, people, shops, building and so on!

Reviews.Title: “nice room, great atomsphere”
Reviews.Author: JohnL29
Reviews.Content: very friendly, and would recommend to anyone.the staff was good, choice of resturants was good. there is shopping on property, and the new nightclub rocks!!

Reviews.Title: “NY NY”
Reviews.Author: ScottE09
Reviews.Content: Great deal and nice rooms very happy....ps make sure you go on the roller coster!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fun Times at New York New York”
Reviews.Author: NortherngirlCanada
Reviews.Content: We stayed at New York New York from February 7 to 11. We found it to be a wonderful hotel. It is in the center of the action which was nice. It certainly is the place to stay for a good party. You can party at Coyote Ugly or watch the action from the quieter Pour 21 lounge beside it. Our room was pleasant and faced the mountains and gave us a beautiful view. Combine this with a wonderful pina colada from the slushie bar and it doesn't get any better. It is a pain that the internet is so expensive, The service and food at New York New York was good. The food in the small eateries was great as was the Italian restaurant. The sandwiches at the deli are excellent. We had an amazing dinner at the new Mastro's Ocean Club at City Center. We would highly recommend it. We did not win at all in the casino ever but such is life. We had some troube with our players club card because it would not work consistently. However, this is not a complaint as the entire stay was fun and relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “PRetty good hotel”
Reviews.Author: ibdatgirl
Reviews.Content: Pretty good hotel try to stay in the upgraded rooms away from the roller coaster

Reviews.Title: “First timers: Great locale to experience the Strip”
Reviews.Author: InMetrospect
Reviews.Content: As first-time Vegas goers, the hotel was perfect. Good location to experience the Strip. Our booking came with the Park Avenue Deluxe room (one up from the standard). At check-in my husband and I were told that there were no more King-sized beds so we had to settle for two Queens, which led to us being "upgraded" to a Strip view. Although we didn't spend a lot of time in it, I was thankful that the room was very clean. Several good restaurants/pubs to choose from ($$$). Home of Cirque's "Zumanity", which was a hillarious (adults-only) cabaret show. Received a discount on show tickets as guests of the hotel, which was appreciated. What we liked best? Great location to experience the best of the Strip including some restaurants in NY NY. What we liked least? You get nickle and dimed for everything at this hotel so have your wallet or credit card ready. Other than souvenirs, there's no good shopping here. We recommend taking a cab to Prime Outlets where we found some fabulous deals. And, with no sound of jackpots ringing or cheers from players winning, we found the casino floor to be very...boring and didn't feel too excited about gambling here.

Reviews.Title: “Spendin money on a lay over....”
Reviews.Author: DakotaF
Reviews.Content: Hotel is nice in the strip so it is super convenient - if ur intent is more quiet and serenuty I would choose either end of the strip or a couple miles away you can find some spa like hotels....good luck and great travels...ONE LOVE Dakota

Reviews.Title: “OVerall, a good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Googin
Reviews.Content: I think they got most things right at this property. Check-in was fast and good enough (if not overly friendly.) Lots of elevator banks and the elevators moved quickly. Lots of room choices, price depending on size and location. I was here for a busines meeting and the catering staff did a nice job. Most food was very good. And the meeting rooms are good, too. My room on the 30th floor was modern and clean. I had a nice view of the strip and rollar coaster (you can here the coaster at times as a periodic "zoom" outside the window, but I sleep well and it didn't bother me at all. I did not here the Las Vegas Blvd noise either.) The casino has lots of gaming options and I found the dealers to be above average on friendliness. Location is great because there are a lot of other casinos within walking distance. Very easy to get a taxi as well, and it's a short ride from the airport. The pool was closed for winter. The resort fee is annoying, but at least I got a couple of drinks out of it and a daily newspaper.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: HGD30277
Reviews.Content: Went with a buddy for Superbowl weekend and stayed here because of the rate offered through MGM Players Club ($129 F/S, $89 Su). NYNY is not the Wynn, but it is a nice, middle of the pack, Vegas resort. PROS: I have stayed here a couple of times before and was surprised to see some changes to the main floor, all for the better. Casino is lively with beautiful ladies dancing in "The Pit" area. Gallagher's has one of the best steaks you'll find and Times Square bar is fun. We are not high rollers, but our host Colleen took care of us (Play at ALL MGM Restorts properties counts!) with partial room, food Comps (ask about it before checking out). Room was comfortable larger than in previous visits. CONS: The spa is small, but adequate. "Resort Fee" daily and taxes will sneak up on you, Lots of families with kids.

Reviews.Title: “Our 10th Anniversary”
Reviews.Author: scifixtion
Reviews.Content: Nice price!! The hotel was very clean, the resturants were Good, great drinks, every kind of gambling you can think of. Best part right across the street (the MGM) you can hop on the tram/rail-way system it can take you to a lot of hotel on the strip, no need to walk. We visited every big name casino on the strip by ridding the tram/rail and didn't have to walk in the heat.

Reviews.Title: “Family friendly”
Reviews.Author: wired163
Reviews.Content: -This was actually Feb 2006- Had a blast. Me and my twin brother were both underage at the time, so having massive 2 story arcade off the casino floor was a plus. From our right on the stip we naturally were in walking distance to everything, which in our case was the movies, not being able to gamble. The highlight of this hotel has to be the roller coster that is on top of the hotel, but runs almost right through it!

Reviews.Title: “Helped make our first Vegas trip a great one”
Reviews.Author: DiscoStu4761
Reviews.Content: My wife and I traveled to Las Vegas for the first time to celebrate her mother's birthday. We decided to stay at New York - New York mainly because her parents were staying there and we wanted to stay at the same hotel; we knew very little about the property beyond what their website had to say. We left very impressed with NYNY and with the intention of staying there the next time we come to Vegas. We booked a prepaid room through Expedia and got the 3rd night of our 3-night stay for free; this was especially valuable because the 3rd night was a Saturday and thus the most expensive (the promotion was for the 3rd night regardless of which was more expensive). So we paid under $300 for our Thurs-Sat stay, including taxes and resort fee, which is apparently a significantly lower than average price. I would consider our price to be a very excellent value, but even the standard price would be acceptable to me. We had a Broadway Deluxe room (3rd tier from the bottom) on the 27th floor, facing away from the Strip; we still had a nice view of the Monte Carlo and the mountains, though, and I wouldn't have wanted to pay extra just for a better view. The casino was excellent; we visited many of the Strip casinos and liked the one at NYNY the best, which worked out since we gambled late into the night every night. They had a good selection of slot machines and I liked the layout of the casino. Drink service was a little spotty, but not notably worse than at other casinos. We also liked our room. I'm not sure what other people were expecting in terms of amenities, but ours was comparable to a good Holiday Inn or Hilton Garden Inn room. It was clean and everything worked. The TV wasn't the newest or fanciest model, but who comes to Las Vegas to watch TV in their hotel room anyway? We were also not too far from the roller coaster but had no noise complaints. You could hear riders screaming if you were paying attention, but I don't think it would have kept us awake. I can't say for sure because we were out late every night. Again, it's Vegas...I wasn't exactly planning to go to bed early anyway. They had a good selection of restaurants, too; we ate at America and Nine Fine Irishmen and liked the food at both. We felt we got great service, too. We were able to check in at 11am even though their check-in time is officially 3pm (and I'm surprised to hear that someone in a previous review expected a guaranteed room by 11am; 3pm seems to be a very standard check-in time even if some hotels will accommodate earlier check-in). In any case, the bellman checked in our bags as we arrived and would have been able to store them for us even if we couldn't get into our room until 3. I wasn't expecting anything beyond having our bags stored, so it was a welcome surprise to get into the room early. Additionally, there was an option to check out via the television and have a bellman come up to the room and take our bags down to storage (since our flight didn't leave until the evening). We opted to do this to avoid standing in line and would do so again. In general, we found the service to be excellent. We loved the NY theme and thought this was one of the coolest looking hotels on the Strip. The location was good, too, since it was very convenient to check out a few other casinos nearby without having to walk too far (though we also chose to walk way up the Strip). To sum it up, we were impressed with NYNY and based on the rooms, the theme, the location, and the casino, we expect we'll stay there again on our next Las Vegas trip. The price we paid this time was a great deal, but even at $120-$140 a night I would consider it a very good value.

Reviews.Title: “It served it's purpose”
Reviews.Author: byost1717
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the New York New York in October 2009. First, the negatives. If you are a light sleeper, the roller coaster can be a bit of an annoyance, but it didn't really affect us after tiring days of walking. The room was decent and nice sized. Now the positives. Location: It is nearer the south end of the strip, but actually near the center of the "main" casinos, being between the Luxor and Mandalay Bay on the south, and the Bellagio to the north. It was about a 40 minute round trip walk up to the Bellagio and perhaps 30 minute round trip to Mandalay Bay, but you can do part of this on the tram. The casino is nice, but not extravagant. We saw Cirque de Soliel's Zumanity here and really enjoyed it, but don't bring your Bible along... We did not eat at the New York, New York, but enjoyed Buffets at the Bellagio (9/10 rating by us), Mandalay Bay (6/10) and at the Spice Market Buffet at Planet Hollywood (8/10). The sushi at any buffet is not worth your time, as it gets dried out sitting around for who knows how long. Parking is free and easy, once you figure out how to get to it. When coming north on Las Vegas Blvd, you'll see the NYNY on your left. Just as you pass it, there is a left turn lane with a stoplight that you use to get to the parking. It is quite a walk across a walkway to the casino and eventually to your room, but who cares when parking is free and right at the resort. Make sure you go enjoy the fountain show at the Bellagio and the Volcano show at the Mirage. The outdoor sound system with the fountain show at the Bellagio is very nice. We basically used a Vegas resort as a base (cheap vacation package) to make our way with our rental car up to Zion National Park in Utah...2:45 drive from Las Vegas and well worth your time if you like to hike and enjoy "non-urban" scenery. Also, Mt. Charleston is about 30-45 minutes west of Las Vegas, with other short hikes around there for day hiking.

Reviews.Title: “a little bit old style but comfortable and clean”
Reviews.Author: gidu81
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for two nights in mid-December, I had a nice room, quite clean and comfortable, a little noisy due to the closeness to the roaller coaster (not 24h a day but continuously in the day). Service was good, everyday clean, and staff at the reception was very pleasant and helpful. Valet parking has a cost (29 dollars per day last month) and from December you have a strange "resort fee" of 4-5 dollars per day that I can't understand... Besides, the wi-fi access was not free! If you hate smoke, then run from the elevator to the exit because if you get through the casino, which is on the lobby, you for sure will breath some. Great location for all the strip, you can walk in a few minutes to all main casinos in Vegas and you can drink and eat at one of the restaurants and cafes in the hotel. Have fun!

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointing but ok for the cost”
Reviews.Author: boombalada
Reviews.Content: The actual hotel is pretty nice - the atmosphere is great at night. Theres a few proper restaurants and quite a few smaller places to grab something easy. The rooms are a dissapointment though - pretty dated, the bed covers had ciggarette burns and stains, vents were comming of the walls and we were kept up at night by the sound of the ventilation system right outside our window. We were also dissapointed when we arrived that the rollercoaster was closed for maintenance - but then again we were relieved it was off as it turned out it was was right outside our window also (can only imagine how noisy it would have been!). I would not be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “I've stayed in better hotels for that price”
Reviews.Author: Ranger344
Reviews.Content: For our first time in LV, we had booked a room 45 days in advance at $199 a night, but we got an inferior room. The front desk told us that it was all they had available, and could not cut the price! The room was poorly furnished, bed, small table, two old chairs and small TV, and the carpet with big spots. We couldn't get good rest because the roller-coaster was too noisy and still running at 1:00 AM. We will never go back to NYNY.

Reviews.Title: “Ny Ny hotel never disappoints!!!! Great hotel on the strip!!”
Reviews.Author: ajzluvspjz5
Reviews.Content: I really liked the staff when we arrived for check in. We didn't have a reservations, but they still mananged to find us a room on short notice, and it was a saturday. They even gave us a discount on our room for booking the ziggaurat room. WAY BETTER THAN THE LUXOR, WHICH WE WERE AT THE NIGHT BEFORE. The hotel was very clean, it didn't have such a smokey smell on the casino floor. There is great places to eat on every budget. They don't have a regular buffet, but I think that's minor when picking a hotel. We got to our room and it was fantastic, the room was nice and clean. Every attention to detail was great. The Ziggaurat room is a little pricey but I think we would have gotten cheaper if we booked it in advance. I couldn't say anything bad about the room. Gallaher's steakhouse is a must when visiting the hotel, it's the best steak I have ever had, I had my reception dinner there in 2007 and we just came back in jan 2009, the food was even better. That's another review. All walks of life would have fun at the hotel, people with kids, single people,married couples. Great hotel hands down, I can't really say anything bad about it. Just that we wish we could have stayed longer.

Reviews.Title: “excellent service and very memorable”
Reviews.Author: johnleicester007
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in january and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. the hotel was friendly, comfortable, clean and a happy place. we loved, the rooms, the views , the staff, the bars, the casino, the eating places and the venue. If your looking for a nice place to stay and you cant afford the expensive hotels then this hotel is ideal. everything is local to the hotel and the times square bar is buzzing. the irish bar was friendly and coyote ugly bar was fun. I would recommend this hotel to anyone

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION FOR US!”
Reviews.Author: JJVADorset
Reviews.Content: My partner and I travelled to Las Vegas on the 26th December 2009 for 6 nights with Virgin holidays. Loved the look of the outside of the hotel with the statue of liberty and the location at the south end of the strip, easy walking distance to several other themed hotels. Check in only took around 5-10 mins, we had a park avenue deluxe room and we asked for a king bed which was no problem. Our room was on the 22nd floor in the Century Tower, the lifts were very quick, we had a view of the roller coster, MGM and Tropicana hotel and although you could hear the roller coster it was not loud enough to cause a problem for us, in fact the people in the next rooms children were much louder, luckily they were only there 2 nights. The room was clean, there was plenty of toiletries, and we found the bed very comfortable. The day before checking out we asked if we could stay in the room an extra couple of hours until 1.00pm, this was agreed with no extra charge. For breakfast, my partner has to have cereal nothing else will do, we did ask at the breakfast buffet, but were told this was not available and did not see this on other breakfast menus within the hotel so had breakfast at the MGM, luxor and the excaliber, but not at the NY NY. Loved the cobblestone street village within the hotel with the many food outlets. My partner went on the roller coaster ($14) not cheap, but you can purchase an all day ticket if you were going to use this several times for $25. We ate in the America resturant, which we enjoyed and was reasonable in price. The pool was closed, so cannot comment on this. We were also not asked to pay a resort fee which many people have mentioned in previous posts. We used the Deuce bus to go to freemount street which stopped opposite outside the MGM, this was $7 for a 24 hour pass, it is very slow though when travelling along the main strip . It also goes to the shopping outlet pass the Mandalin Bay hotel. Overall we enjoyed out stay and would have no problem staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing to brag about”
Reviews.Author: MassChris
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Vegas. I was traveling with my folks, twin brothers and grandfather. My step-dad had booked everything and my grandfather paid, so I got no say in where we were staying, which was fine. New York, New York has a great location, at an intersection with 3 other major casinos. Also, it’s not too far from places like Bellagio and Paris. That’s really only the big plus. The food was average, at best. The wait to check in was extremely long, and even worse to check out. Imagine arriving late at night and standing in line for over an hour holding your luggage. The pool was nice, though extremely crowed, and it was very hard to get a chair to lie in. They have a big rollercoaster, but the cost is outrageous, I think it was over $10 for one ride. Though, in general, everything in Vegas is a bit more expensive. If you just want a place to crash at the end of the night, then this would be fine. If you want amenities, excellent service and more options with gaming, I would recommend someplace else.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: daxter8
Reviews.Content: We stayed at New York New York for 3 nights from 6th - 9th Jan 2010 in the Empire Tower on the 30th floor. We had a wonderful view of the strip and the room was comfortable and quiet. At check in the receptionist was friendly, efficient and helpful, gave me a lot of print outs on places to go and information on Las Vegas and the hotel itself. The hotel has great restaurants and shops, loved Chin Chin and we ate breakfast at America twice. The price was reasonable compared to other hotels, NY NY did not increase the price on the Friday night whereas others they went up considerably. I thoroughly enjoyed staying here and would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Review of weekend stay at NY,NY”
Reviews.Author: northsideirish2
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel recently for 2 nights over a weekend. The weekend started off great and when we checked in the front desk upgraded is to a very nice room with a King bed. The housekeeping was also very nice and gave us some extra soap. The hotel was nice and we had a lot of fun, but I was disappointed with a series of events that occurred during our stay. On Saturday morning at 8 AM (very early by LV standards) my husband and I were woken up by a constant noise. It sounded like a hammer hitting a pipe every 10 seconds repeatedly - the sound radiated through our room. After 15 minutes of being awake and hoping that it would subside my exhausted husband called down to reception. The receptionist said she would call down to engineering to place a request and after the call was placed we never heard the sound again. But the damage was done as my husband was unable to get back to sleep after being awake for 20+ minutes On Sunday we woke up to the same noise. We were so frustrated and just eager to check out. I just can't believe that we paid $363.85 for 2 nights of hotel, taxes, and those resort fees) just to get woken up after a few hours of sleep! We stayed in the New York Tower, Floor 6 in Room 636.

Reviews.Title: “Great amenities”
Reviews.Author: SarahR6
Reviews.Content: I have been out to Vegas about 7 times so far, and have always stayed in different places. I would go back to NY, NY in a heartbeat! The hotel room was modern and chic, the restaurants were all so good, and it wasn't a ridiculous walk through the property to get to the Strip! We didn't get a chance to use the pool due to the limited hours the sunw as shining in that area, but next time we will!

Reviews.Title: “Chad's Birthday”
Reviews.Author: MelissaKK
Reviews.Content: Hotel was awesome, 2 out of 4 of us won at that hotel, food was good, we loved this little bar, had live music, fun people! Roller coaster was really fun, we could see the tallest peak from our room window. Def go try the New York pizza!! yum I miss that! Coyote Ugly is a must, really fun bar! Awesome trip!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place, especially for the price!”
Reviews.Author: NashvilleTNGuy
Reviews.Content: I stayed in room 2821 from January 9-January 12. The Good: With the down economy, the price was great. The room was clean and even on the backside of the hotel, the view of the mountains, Monte Carlo and new City Center was great. Sunset is beautiful. The casino is not that big, but that's OK. Easy to find your way around. Check in was pretty simple and check out was too. Elevators are fast. Zumanity is a fun show for lovers with an open mind. Tickets are 2 for $99 if you are a guest. The Bad: While the room is cheap, they do add a $10 "resort fee" onto the price. It is for phone, newspaper (which is not delivered to your door, you have to go pick it up) and other things that I never really saw. The hotel is on the south end of the strip, so walking to the other casinos is a long way. Take the monorail over at the MGM. The "sports book" is really just a place to put down your bet. They want you to go into the ESPN zone and spend more money on food instead of sitting around being served drinks. Overall, this is a great property with fun people and atmosphere. I like it here and will go back.

Reviews.Title: “Start Spreading the News!”
Reviews.Author: LL1011
Reviews.Content: For the price it was excellent. Love the friendly dealers, the bars (Nine Fine Irishmen especially, check out their house band) and location. Room was nice, not fantastic, but I didn't spend a fortune either. Bed was comfy and room clean. It was close to the casino so I didn't have to walk too far like some of the larger hotels and it was easy to navigate. Believe me a lot of them are not. The roller coaster went by the room but was not annoying or disruptive in any way. Would definitely stay here next trip and plan to do so.

Reviews.Title: “NewYork New York? I've had better.”
Reviews.Author: Gulia9
Reviews.Content: For New Year's my friend and I decided to go to Las Vegas for the ultimate party. I was planning on relaxing a bit each day to prepare for the insane NYE that would occur on the Strip, however my trip was far from relaxing due mostly to our hotel. Last time I was in Vegas, I stayed at the MGMGrand and loved it, I can't say the same for the NewYork New York. My biggest pet peeve was the fact that check in wasn't until 3PM, so for people like us, who caught an early flight into Vegas, the hope of being able to check in early like the traditional time ( which usually is 11AM for most hotels, or the majority of hotels I have stayed in since my birth), we had to kill the better part of 6 HOURS. Not fun and not cool. After that long wait, the room wasn't even that great! Compared to other places, the beds were not very comfortable, there were holes in the blankets, the bathroom was fairly small, and at least where our room was located, right by the escalating roller coaster, we heard faint screams & whooping any time we were in our room. The other half of my pet peeve came from the fact that check-out was 11AM. I don't have a problem checking out at that time, but there are always people checking our earlier so why can't check-IN be the same time? I'm sure one day someone will explain that one to me. The perk of staying there was we got a great deal on Cirque du Soleil ZUMANITY tickets (2 for $99, instead of 1 for $130) and if you are a girl who likes to dance, you can usually get on the guest list for the Rok Nightclub (which is fairly decent). Oh, and the elevators were pretty fast most of the time, even during high traffic hours. Given the choice, I wouldn't stay at the NY NY Hotel again. I just know there are other hotels out there at comparable prices, where you can get more bang for your buck.

Reviews.Title: “Visit NY while in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: EmilyBeth
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. We loved the shopping and the restaurants. We loved that a restaurant was open anytime of the night or day we were hungry. America was our favorite! Loved the Harley Davidson shop! We saw the Statue of Liberty, Times Square, and Staton Island....it was just like visiting NY! The only negative thing was that the elevators were bogged down with people leaving on Sunday about 10Am other than that, no problems.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Resort”
Reviews.Author: Superfly76
Reviews.Content: First time to Vegas and wow this resort was amazing. Execellent quality at a resonable price. No complaints about this resort. I recommed it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “New york new york hotel and casino”
Reviews.Author: Tnewmark73
Reviews.Content: room service is the best I have ever had!!! Fun hotel nice staff rooms a little small but nice. Great mid priced food inside hotels

Reviews.Title: “Could almost not be Better”
Reviews.Author: dennfo
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic stay at NYNY - turned up as walk ins - Receptionist couldn't have been more friendliy or helpful - sorted us a brilliant room with a great view, went out of her way to get us a good deal - couldn't have been better - and found us an available room at 08:30am. The room was perfect - really clean, very comfortable, really good quality - location was great for us as well and facilities were brilliant. We couldn't have been happier - turned what was looking like a distaster Vegas trip into one not to be forgotten - very happy and would book again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with Great Prices”
Reviews.Author: basketkase999
Reviews.Content: As one final "horrah" after graduating college, my friends and I decided to stay at the NYNY. We were incredibly satisfied with the accommodations, and the food selection. Though on the southern end of the strip, the Vegas tram stop was just across the street at the MGM, which made moving between casinos easy. The only downside is that the Casino itself was smaller than most.

Reviews.Title: “Slowly Going Downhill”
Reviews.Author: writerguy33304
Reviews.Content: I've been staying at New York, NY for several years now; about twice per year. Generally, I get very good rates from Casino Marketing. Unfortunately, the property seems to be going downhill. This past stay (Dec 27-29) was disappointing. I was put in a Skyline room (the "lowest" room type) with a bad view. Views aren't important to me, so I just stayed put. The room, however, wasn't fully clean. I found hair in the bathroom in two different locations. I also discovered a Christmas card left by a previous guest that was missed by Housekeeping. Also, I had no "Privacy" sign to put out. When my remote for the TV died, it took two calls to get a new one. When I checked in, I received a few discount coupons. I tried to use on for Zumanity tickets; but, the woman didn't know how to calculate what 35% off would be. She said, "I think it's $80". (It actually was over $90.) These are just a few of the small disappointments. When they start adding up, it gets tiresome. Add the state of the economy plus the glut of hotel rooms and you'd think that employees would be going out of their way to wow guests. Unfortunately, that's not what's happening at New York, NY.

Reviews.Title: “Big Flop at the Big Apple”
Reviews.Author: RoxyGirl3525
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a stay at NY/NY from 12/26/09 to 12/30/09. They need to do something about their check in process and customer service skills. I see other travel reviews carry this same theme. The front desk clerk (for which there was one on-duty and a long line of guests) was not helpful or friendly. Our room was the Broadway deluxe and had a delightful view of the Heating/AC Unit. The room was dumpy. The remote control was broken, the shower sliding door was broken, the Internet costs about $15 a day, and the room was missing the room service menu/Welcome book. We called for extra pillows and are still waiting for them to be delivered. Some of these things seem trivial, but when you add them up you start to feel like these people running the place have no clue what they are doing. They charge a "fee" for $10 a day - I am not sure if this is customary at all of the hotels. For your troubles, you will get 2 free drinks at one of the bars, a newspaper, and access to a computer to print your boarding passes. Don't try to use the computer for anything other than that....You can hear the swooping of the rollar coaster from your room. Coyete Ugly was a disaster - save your time/money and go to the Times Square Bar with the Dueling Piano Bar people. That was a ton of fun, no cover charge, and no sloppy bartenders being obnoxious spraying things all over you and tiliting your head back to pour shots in your mouth. C. Ugly was like being at a College frat party, only the frat parties I went to were much more fun. The eateries that make up the NYC Village with the cobblestone street vendors feeling were all very cute and tasty. Bottom line: I would stay somewhere else as a place to rest my head, but return to NY/NY to go to some of the restaurants/bars that were cute and entertaining - minus C. Ugly.

Reviews.Title: “Really is Just Average”
Reviews.Author: alhambramd
Reviews.Content: THE PROS: Got really great rates for a hotel along the strip, very convenient location. Rooms and bathrooms were very clean. Very convenient checkout. Management/front desk quick to respond to questions/issues. THE CONS: Interior hallways needs some serious remodelling. The pools were closed (but they said we could use the pool at Excalibur across the street. Are you kidding me?!)The mattresses were a little worn, and the linens are not the best. Interior decor of the rooms looked like they were fairly new. Didn't appreciate the rooms not having a coffeemaker nor a refrigerator. Hate the whole nickel and dime thing with the expensive internet service and the entrance fees for the fitness centers. I also hated how they charge "Resort Fees" that go towards "Unlimited local and 800-number calls; domestic long distance phone call rates of $0.10 per minute; boarding pass printing, notary services, and incoming/outgoing faxes - limit 5 pages; two welcome cocktails per room per stay; 20% discount on select retail merchandise one per room per stay and daily newspaper", neither of which we really needed. And take note-- the fees were around $8.99 per night. In addition, they were charging us $30 for each additional person in the room above 2 (we were planning on getting 2 queen beds so 4 of us can share). Thankfully they didn't make such a big deal out of that. THE VERDICT: Would stay again if couldnt find another hotel on the Strip offering rooms for less than 70 bucks per night. But only for the prices... otherwise, I'd go elsewhere (that didnt have resort fees, or one that quotes the actual price i'd pay up front).

Reviews.Title: “Fun casino, great restaurants, rooms need improvement”
Reviews.Author: GSMarinemom
Reviews.Content: I stayed 3 nights. The room, Park Avenue, looked great, and was comfortable, however the bathroom seemed as though it had been recently updated....but the tub/shower combo was old-ish. They charge $14.95 for 24 hrs. of internet service. High speed, it was not. I had better luck accessing e-mail from my cell phone. They did remove the charges from the bill. You could hear the roller coaster outside the window, which was a little loud at times. Even though I was not near the elevators, you could hear some sort of noise all night long. I thought it was the roller coaster, but was told that the coaster stopped running at midnight. There are a few great places to eat, Nine Fine Irishmen had great food, Gallaghers Steak House was great for Christmas dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay @ The NY NY Hotel & Casino”
Reviews.Author: camoking
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 5 nights Dec 20-25 2009, at the NY NY Hotel & Casino, and I must say that we had a great stay. We booked a Broadway Deluxe View room through Expedia, and the room was great we were on the 15th floor of the New Yorker Tower right on the corner of the building so we had a great view of the MGM Grand, Tropicanna, Excailibur and the mountains on the outskirts of town. The room was very clean, and big too at least 500 sqf. We arrived about 7 pm and check in was super quick & easy. The casino and public areas were all very neat and tidy and all of the hotel employees were very friendly. We only dined a few times at the NY NY, Chin Chin has a decent Breakfast Buffet, and the Coffee at the little bakery near Time Square had good coffee much better and cheaper then the Starbucks. This was our first stay at the NY NY and we would definitely stay there again, and wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great Upgrade, Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: sonnyjane
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a three night stay at NYNY. I had originally booked a Spa Suite with the special three-nights-for-the-price-of-two promotion, so it was already a great value. When I checked in, the woman at the front desk told me that for just $30 more a night, I could upgrade to an 1100 sq. ft. Ziggurat Suite, a room that would have cost us roughly $900 during the dates of our stay, but because of the 3-for-2 promotion and the $30 special upgrade, we got the great suite for about $300 total, that's $100 a NIGHT! It was a pleasant surprise. I especially enjoyed the spa tub, robe, slippers, and all the extra toiletries offered in the suite (I've stayed in a regular room at NYNY before). The casino robbed us pretty clean (as casinos often do), so I really appreciated the low-cost options for food in the hotel. We ate at the pizza place almost every day (great value!) and my husband enjoyed the fish and chips place. We easily could feed the two of us (with a soft drink) for under $20, which is rare in Vegas. We also love the hot pretzels. I ordered room service two nights in a row because I'd read good reviews on here, and it was delicious! The breakfast buffet at Chin Chin is definitely a pass. There were not enough options (not even toast!). You're better off ordering room service or eating at America (the 24 hour restaurant). It was cheaper than the $12.99 buffet and had a much better selection. The one thing I will add that didn't really affect our stay, but may affect the stays of others, is that because of the atmosphere at NYNY, this hotel probably gets the most children out of any of The Strip resorts. The arcades, roller coaster, and cheap food makes this place a big draw for families, so be forewarned, but it really didn't affect us at all, as they aren't allowed on the casino floor, just in the lobby areas. Overall I've read a lot of bad reviews on here about this resort but I really enjoy it and this was my second visit. The value can't be beat, and I'd definitely recommend it to friends. It's not a lavish, romantic getaway spot, but it is a great place for a fun weekend.

Reviews.Title: “very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: caskev
Reviews.Content: check in was quick we were offered a up grade for an extra $15 a night we which we accepted,also requested a refridgerator which they comped, the room was verygood,good size, & very clean we stayed a total 12 nights & have no complaints at all. when we arrived we applied for a players card & was very happy at the comps we recieved at checkout, to us the location is verygood with mgm & mandalay bay all nearby, to summarise exellent hotel & staff can recommend with total confidence, we will back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and amenities”
Reviews.Author: slipstatic77
Reviews.Content: This is my favourite part of the strip to be located, close to most things. I have no complaints about anything, other than a strange sound that we would hear every once in a while (it wasn't the roller coaster, we could only chalk it up to wind). Love the pizza place. Wish hotels would not charge $15 for 24 hrs of internet use (ripoff). Glad I brought my portable internet stick.

Reviews.Title: “DIRTY ROOM”
Reviews.Author: lola29palms
Reviews.Content: found personal lubricant underneath the bed amongst other items that previous guests had left behind. I'm not one to bash hotels for minor issues but that was really nasty.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and nice place but a couple small issues”
Reviews.Author: kendergirl
Reviews.Content: This ended up being our favourite hotel of the three we stayed at, despite some problems. We loved that the casino was easy to navigate, it was easy to get out and across the street to Excalibur, MGM Grand, and Tropicana, and that the décor was fun but not overly cheesy with painted blue skies with puffy clouds. Our room was very nice with sort of somber décor and our view out on the strip beautiful. We were on the 18th floor in a Park Ave Strip View. It was a lot of turns from the elevator but didn’t mind that too much. What I did mind was the huge smear of what appeared to be pink nail polish on the bedside table which appeared to chip of quite easily and yellow stains on the corner of the bed linens by my head. I called and asked housekeeping to rectify these things in the morning and instead they just made the bed. I had to call again in the evening before we went out to dinner and they finally cleaned things up. After I filled out a post-trip survey, at their request, someone did contact me and offer me an upgrade to s spa suite room if I stay with them again within the next year. While I might stay there again if I got a 2 star hotel rate, I certainly would not pay full price, which has an additional resort fee of $10.07 slapped on top of it. They rationalize the resort fee by giving you a couple coupons for two free cocktails, a news paper, and a discount on souvenirs but don’t give you anything of worth that you may actually want such as a day pass to the spa. If I return to Vegas, I will be looking at Harrah’s properties instead of those owned by MGM, as they do not yet charge a “resort fee.”

Reviews.Title: “Much better Than Expected”
Reviews.Author: mcstix
Reviews.Content: Though I'm writing this (finally) in December, I actually stayed there for five nights in late Septebmer, 2009. Was my first stay there. Check in was a breeze, but noticed that at times the lines can get pretty long. I only waited about five minutes. I checked in at around 3;30 on a Wednesday. Some of the front desk staff that had been there for years REALLY knew the layout of the place and could tell you, in detail, what type of view each room had. I was in one of the Park Avenue Premium View rooms. Total room rate was about $380, though two of the weeknights were "comped." My room was on the 28th floor and had a straight-on view of the Strip, looking directly across at the MGM Grand. The roller coaster could barely be heard and didn't bother me at all. Window has a "vent" you can open for fresh air, but doesn't really "open" the window itself at all. Good air flow though. AC worked great, and didn't blow directly on the bed as some do in other hotels. Some rooms have connecting doors to the rooms next door, and you can hear what's going on if your neighbor is loud. I had a quiet neighbor most nights. Used room service three times, mostly at night or in late afternoon. Each time it was just great. Food was hot, good, well-presented, and never took more than 20 minutes. Also ate at the Chinese restaurant one night, just off the casino floor. A bit noisy, but food was real good. The "American" cafe food was okay, but not fantastic. A lot quieter though, as it's off the casino floor. The pizza place was also good, as others have reported. I really liked the "Times Square" recreation, just off the casino floor. Lots of activity, and the bars are hopping after 9:00 every night. Good for people watching if you can handle the noisy atmosphere. Hotel had a decent selection of shops for clothes. A Harley store is also on premises. It was bigger than most I've seen and had TONS of biker t-shirts and other clothing. Didn't go to the Irish pub, but it looked like fun. There's also some other bars there as well that I didn't go to. Drink service on casino floor was pretty good. You could order doubles as well, which was nice. Went to see Zumanity as well. It was a great show, though not for kids. It's an adult show, with both guys and girls in it. Live band (though sort of "hidden") at the show was GREAT, as were the singers. Not like any other Cirque show I've seen. I like the Cirque shows for the most part...except perhaps "O" which is "pretty" but "slow"; and actually it's just "pretty slow" I guess. More for the synchronized swimming crowd in my opinion. Zumanity was much livelier. Sit in the center rows if you can as you will see more. On weekends the show will sell out to get your tickets prior to arrival to Las Vegas if you want a good seat. Dollar rent-a-car is right in the lobby off the front desk. Had a good experience with them. Parking garage is less than five minutes from the Dollar office and front desk. Noticed that returning the car at the hotel is much cheaper than returning it up at the airport. Casino is pretty lively. Had a good run at the craps table. Craps dealers were friendly. One of the BJ dealers was not so nice though. I guess she was having a bad day. I still remember HER after three months. That's not a good thing! Never smiled at ALL. Overall had a good stay. I'd stay there again if I'm in the mood for a lively and noisy experience. The location on the south end of the Strip is a plus as well.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Ignis123
Reviews.Content: After 10 minutes or so to sort the check-in, we arrived pretty much energy deprived after camping in death valley during the week, so we were pretty tired and dusty. We upgraded to the Ziggurat Suite, as we were only staying for 2 nights, and our energy and excitement was soon revitalised after seeing the room! It was HUGE; ~1,100 sq ft. There was a HotTube/Jacuzzi, King Bed, seperate vanity area, a nice bathroom with one of the most powerful showers i have used (!), a dining/lounge/kitchenette open plan room. There were several large wardrobes and the added touch of having our own robes and chocolates on the bed was priceless! Other complimentary items included bath crystals, hand brushes, flannels, shampoos, shower gels, shaving cream and razors and liquid and solid soaps. There were several tvs and little extras like surround sound which made it that much better. There is a minibar too - with complimentary pepsis...7ups etc. One of the best bits was the view - we had a strip view as standard and the only very slight down side was that the windows were emerald green, although you would only notice in the morning and the rollercoaster noise was barely noticeable! You wouldnt really eat at this hotel, it really only has a handful of coffee bars and some buffet restaurants but I thoroughly recommend the Bellagio all-you-can-eat buffet for ~30 dollars. Nevertheless, the facilities at this hotel were immense and the casino was very modern looking. Perfect position on the strip, although it is worth spending 7 dollars on an unlimited use deuce bus (24 hour period, 24/7) and the bus stop is less than 100 metres from the hotel. When we were about to check out, the bags were pulled by the bellman, again, another great extra (you dont get that in the UK). Check out was very easy and left extremely satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Value”
Reviews.Author: parkssv
Reviews.Content: SInce joining the Players Club two years ago, I have continued to get my rooms comped at NYNY. Please keep in mind that I am not a big gambler so many others are getting the same offers. The rooms are small, even the upgraded ones. The walks from the elvevator to your room can be lengthy depending on where you are. THe location is unbeatable at the four corners and most everything is within walking distance. The restaurants are good but a bit pricey. Il Fornaio has one of their satelites here and the ESPN Zone is good for small plates and beers.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: ccjohn
Reviews.Content: My first trip to Vegas and I was not disappointed! I travelled with my mom as a mother/daughter vacation. We upgraded to the Ziggarut suite. HUGE room. We didn't spend much time in the room but it was great to come back to a comfortable room. The couch was super comfortable and I had a great sleep on it. We could hear the roller coaster but seriously you are Vegas, your ears are probably still ringing from the casino. We got pizza at the pizzeria several times THE BEST PIZZA I HAVE EVER HAD IN MY LIFE and I LOVE pizza. The lady at the front desk was great and very cheerful. We had a wonderful stay and would completely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “website misleading”
Reviews.Author: dinkydog99
Reviews.Content: I signed up for a web promotion and selected a room described a newly renovated. Unfortunately, their idea of newly renovated isn't what most people would think of. The room was clean, adequate, but looked very tired and worn. When I questioned a clerk about it, I was told that it had been renovated but it had been some years ago. Overall the hotel was comfortable, the staff friendly and helpful, and it served my needs. I just didn't appreciate a room advertised as something that it obviously wasn't.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend Stay”
Reviews.Author: SteveG4
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. Like all Vegas hotels everything extra and something like 13 USD for internet access. Good situation but not as lively as the Luxor.Helpful staff and good value during the week days

Reviews.Title: “Average stay”
Reviews.Author: theresoonSydney
Reviews.Content: Stayed Sunday through Wednesday, just after Thanksgiving. As far as strip hotels go, this is average. We stayed here with 3 young children after reading other reviews. * Check-in quick and easy. Nice staff. * Room was clean and well presented. However was staying on non-smoking floor, and could still smell stale smoke. All our clothes smelled after the trip. But I guess that's Nevada! * Room was very quiet, had a strip view room. * Plenty of dining options downstairs, especially with the children. * Carpark was about 2 minute walk from lobby. * Reasonable atmosphere, however nothing on the higher end hotels down the strip. * Check out very quick, at 9.30am. Again, staff very helpful. * Charged over $12 per day for internet. Was not impressed at all. * I was charged $6 for having a personal package sent to the hotel. * Didn't try room service. * Not overly impressed with the hotel/casino. * Met our needs, however in retrospect would not have gone to Vegas with the kids. Virtually nothing for them to do. But that's our problem.

Reviews.Title: “Keeps The Vegas Dream Alive”
Reviews.Author: SMiles87
Reviews.Content: The room I stayed in was in the Chrysler Building section- great, but not overly spacious, room - 2 massive queen-sized beds (which is probably why it didn't feel spacious), a large bathroom with shower, a safe, big TV...posh Bose iPod alarm clock, and average cupboard space. Clean and comfy...with a nice view from the South end of the strip. The hotel/casino it self is simply awesome- I love New York, and it was amazing to walk the streets of New York, but in Vegas! Great little places to eat (pizza places, Ben & Jerry's, coffee shops...bars ahoy!)

Reviews.Title: “There for short stay”
Reviews.Author: tomtyler
Reviews.Content: The staff were helpful and always friendly. The hotel is great to walk into, others around the strip were either dark or claustrophobic. New York New York was a great place to stay, at the upper end of the strip, but central to the MGM, Excelsior and walking distance to the Bellagio... Try the roller coaster!!!!

Reviews.Title: “I dont recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: ValentinaB1
Reviews.Content: We have been in New York New York on Saturday, hotel was very full. Dirty room and towels. I dont recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Ok if you dont expect to spend anytime in the room.”
Reviews.Author: iwaswayoff
Reviews.Content: I think NY NY is still living in the 90's (When it first opened). The casino is a very happening floor and the Times Square bar still pulls a crowd. My biggest gripe is that there is nothing great about the room. No mini bar, no coffee machine, no channels on the tv except sport and news. This tactic is supposed to get you out gambling. But if you intend to spend more than 2 days in Vegas you WILL need some downtime. I'd suggest finding a casino that at least has a coffee machine and decent cable tv. For those going in summer, the pool isnt the best I've seen either.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at Ny NY”
Reviews.Author: Tonyrosenalex
Reviews.Content: From check in to check out we had a fab time at Ny Ny - the location is not as central as some of the hotels we've stayed at but we new this before we booked. We had a great room (newly refurbished) on a relatively low floor but the view was unimportant and the casino and bars were all great fun. There is a lovely little coffee shop which we used for bagel and coffees for breakfast just round past starbucks and the piano bar. The place is buzzing 24hours and we know as we didn't sleep the 4 days of our visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great casino with great people - but, don't stay at the hotel”
Reviews.Author: Trigirl92014
Reviews.Content: I arrived Thanksgiving day from San Diego, needed a family getaway (or should I say get away from family :-) I booked on priceline and put in $90 for a four star or better hotel, so I didn't have a lot of choice on which hotel, when the price came back as NY NY. I had read the previous reviews online, but wanted to come here with an open mind, prepare for the worst and hope for the best! Arriving at the hotel, the front desk was extremely nice. There wasn't a long line and it was relatively painless. Because I had read previous reviews on the rooms, I opted to upgrade to a nicer room for only $10 per night which was said to be remodeled. When I entered the room, I was like, there is no way this is a 4star hotel and thank goodness I upgraded. However, the room was very noisy, every thirty seconds I thought I was hearing the roller coaster. Imagine hearing the coaster at Space Mountain pulling in, that is the exact sound. So I called down to the front desk and asked them what time the roller coaster stops running and they told me at 11pm. So I was fine with it because I wasn't planning on being in the room during the day, just wanted to make sure I would be able to sleep. However, while I was on the phone, my bags arrived from the bellman and he informed me that was not the roller coaster I was hearing, it was the elevator shaft. So I asked to be moved. They were very accomodating. The room I am not in (at this very moment as I write this). The room is quieter, but you can still hear the elevator shaft. In speaking with people that work at the hotel, they tell me they wouldn't stay in one of the rooms either and "what were they thinking when they designed the hotel and the rooms". As for the aestetecs (sp?), they did attempt to remodel or better stated, update the rooms. For a four star hotel on the Las Vegas strip - they missed the boat. With all the new hotels going up, getting completely revamped, I am afraid the NY NY rooms look and feel about as old as the Statue of Liberty. Popcorn ceilings, parquet paneled armoire (really, who would have thought?) and hideous bedspreads that look very worn. Sorry for the long write-up on the room, just want to let you know what to expect if you do stay here. If you can live with the forementioned, you will be in good shape. The staff is very very friendly throughout the hotel, casino and restaurants. Absolutely would recommend gambling hear if you want to play craps or blackjack. The table limits in the morning are $5 and by 11am move to $10, depending on how busy they are. Compared to many of the other 4 star hotels, this is great if you want to play low limits. The other hotel minimums I experienced were $15 and not as friendly. Huge shout out to Calvin at the Craps table, he never missed a bet and chatted everyone up. The nightclub is ok, no line. I think this is more an indication of the economy and the location. The club at the Encore is the hot spot in Vegas at this time. And the NY NY hotel is at the end of the strip, down by Excalibur, which is not an ideal location for me. And, I can't forget, LOVE LOVE LOVE the Dueling Piano Bar. Went there all three nights and always had fun! Always met fun people and really enjoyed the variety of music. BTW- I'm not a huge roller coaster fan, but got talked into going on it. It is SOOOOO much fun. However, everyone in lined agreed that it wasn't worth the $14 per person. Which if you are traveling with a family, can add up quickly. In summary, recommend coming down to NyNy for a little gambling and the Dueling Piano bars. But, with so many GREAT deals on the strip, stay at another hotel if you want a peaceful night sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, okay price, no in-room coffee maker”
Reviews.Author: Missbecca00
Reviews.Content: We stayed at NYNY, Las Vegas on Halloween and 3 nights following. We were very excited to be on the 25th floor and the view did not diappoint. The room itself was clean and very modern, however the beds were very uncomfortable.The air conditing and heat were very quick to adjust to your comfort level but the worst part of the room and probabaly the only reason I will not stay here when I return to Vegas is there was no in room coffee maker. I called to request one and was told they were not available. (of course I could have purchased a pot of coffee through room service for $9 plus a $3 service fee). Pool and hot tub area was clean as was the entire casino. Lots of amenities on site and the italian restaurant in the hotel was excellent!!

Reviews.Title: “An OK hotel at a good price”
Reviews.Author: eastmidwest
Reviews.Content: We stayed at NY, NY as part of a package deal with Allegiant Air. For the price we paid, it was a satisfactory place to stay. Check-in was quick and friendly at 2 pm on a Sunday. Our first room was on the 7th floor and the roller coaster plus other strange noises kept us awake. The next day we were moved to a room on the 26th floor with a great view of the mountains at no extra charge. It was very quiet and fairly spacious. Things I didn't like about this hotel included the extremely noisy lobby and the fact that there was no coffee maker in the room. Also, we were charged $3.00 per day for the telephone, even though we never used it. The restaurants were ok, but pricey. Fish and chops at the Irish pub was exorbitantly priced at $20-later found we could have had about the same meal from one of the small village restaurants for much less. We ate one breakfast and one dinner at the Italian restaurant and one dinner at the Mexican place and enjoyed them all. The location was a little farther south than I would have liked. If we return to Vegas, we would probably choose a slightly quieter place more towards the middle of the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Average, we stayed there to take advantage of the 2 for $99 Zumanity coupon.”
Reviews.Author: Aconcagua
Reviews.Content: First-time visit to Vegas, so we didn't know what to expect other than the photo on the hotel site. We were in a 28th floor Park Avenue room that had lovely distant views of the mountains near the city. Being so high up gave us a grandiose view of the western part of Vegas and the roller coaster far below us. It also kept the city noises down. Check in was quick and friendly and the room was clean and roomy. Location on the strip is convenient. My beefs: No free wi-fi internet. Unacceptable. No coffee machine in the room. Unacceptable. Noise: poor sound insulation between the room and hallway. Unacceptable. Il Fornaio restaurant: We ate there twice, once at dinner and one breakfast. The dinner seafood pasta dish is so-so, bland and over priced. On the other hand, the granola in the breakfast menu was outstanding and made up for weak coffee. Service was very average and nowhere as good as the service we got on the second morning at the breakfast buffet at Chin-Chin. That really surprised me. Gambling: Way too smoky, if you're a non-smoker prepare to be inconvenienced by the smoke in the casino area in the mid-afternoons into the late night. Gross. *cough, cough*. Improved ventilation would be appreciated, or seperate smoking/non smoking areas. Better yet, make it non smoking all over. I actually gambled LESS because of the smoke. Hey, saved me some bucks! Would I stay there again? Probably not...we went there to save money on the Zumanity show (good fun, btw) with a 2 for $99 special. Next time, we'd go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Fun Casino but don't stay at New York, New York”
Reviews.Author: ski6973
Reviews.Content: This was the smallest hotel room I have ever seen in a luxury hotel. It's like a Microtel motel! What's worse is that we had an "upgraded" Park Avenue room (I even verified this with two people on the phone). Are there smaller rooms?? To be fair however, this is a hotel with a very unusual design because of the spectacular facade. I guess not all the rooms are like this. We had a king too so the rooms with two beds have to be larger. BUT MUCH WORSE: YOU CAN HEAR THE ROLLER COASTER IN YOUR ROOM! We were on the 14th fl but at regular intervals heard the coaster--really annoying. This is a fun casino but you might want to stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “annoying hotel which charges you for everything”
Reviews.Author: OlafB
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in Vegas a few times and stayed at the NYNY hotel before. I picked this hotel because it was the cheaper than many others and is conveniently located. The hotel is just the same as the big hotels on the strip. While it is okay it has some really annoying things which infuriated me. In fact, I was totally fed up with it to be honest. First, while there is free parking, to get to your room is an arduous task with suitcases. You park in the self park area; then you lug your cases out of your car; then you get the elevator to the walkway; then you walk the walkway; then you get the esculator; then you fight through the floor of slot machines and poker tables; then you get in line for check in; then you lug your cases back through the casino and get one of the elevators up to the floors of your room (anything from 20+; then you walk corridor after corridor to get to your room. Then you find there are no coffee making facilities; I am addicted to coffee; I find it outrageous that you can check into a Best Western motel and have microwaves; coffee machines; fridges etc and pay a reasonable rate yet in this much more expensive hotel you don't get a coffee maker forcing you to have to leave your room, back down the elevator; through the casino to one of the coffee shops for which a medium coffee can cost about $5 - ridiculous. i noticed that at Wallgreens across the strip they were selling coffee makers for $18 - if I would have found that the first day I would have just bought a coffee maker. Then, no free wi-fi. Instead you have to pay $15 for 24hours. Again, in comparison with Best Western this stinks. Hey, the hotel has a roller coaster which is great. But, $14 for one ride is simply outrageous. It's ridiculous. What makes it worse is that as a guest at the hotel you don't get any sort of discount for it. I hate the money grabbing 'trap' that you fall into when on the strip. I won't stay here again or, if I do, I'll make sure I get the best value by insisting on better facilities (and I'll get them).

Reviews.Title: “New York New York”
Reviews.Author: Millie222
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful. We really enjoyed everything from the roller coaster to the dining...Gallagher's Steakhouse was incredible!! We would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't like the hidden resort fees.”
Reviews.Author: Ferntree1
Reviews.Content: When you register when first arriving at New York, New York, they make you sign a paper so they can charge you a $10.00 "resort fee". What a rip off.
