When I tried to refuse it, they said all the other casinos are charging it. That still doesn't make it o.k. They also said it was mentioned on line where I booked..but it is hidden. They said the fee is for ammenities that would not otherwise be available. Why not give me that choice. It gives you a couple free drinks, a newspaper, 20% off ice cream, ability to print boarding pass, and maybe a couple other miner things. And the gambling machines are too tight.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and even greater with a players club card!!!”
Reviews.Author: hrderthnu
Reviews.Content: I have been to Vegas many times and this time I took my wife. We checked in around midnight so check in was fast. They didn't have the room we requested at the time of check in but i called down in the morning and we were upgraded that afternoon to a room on the 21st floor. It faced the MGM and was great. We heard nothing at all even with the people next door living it up!! so I am not to sure what people are saying abou the thin walls. This was the 5th time I have stayed at the NYNY as with the players club card that give me great rates weekdays and weekends. The one thing I am dissapointed about is no buffett BUT a short walk over to the monte carlo and the buffett there is GREAT!!! I have stayed at many a hotel buy NYNY has earned my loyalty. The pool was not to bad but when we went down around 1-2 it was pretty busy but hey it is a 2-3000 room hotel so it was expected.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay - forget the casino floor.”
Reviews.Author: Expat_American
Reviews.Content: We came in for an overnight stay before continuing on to the next location on our trip. Pulled up into main entry and a bell person met us straight away and managed to pile all our bags on his cart. Check in was easy and then we grabbed a bite to eat and headed out for the night tour of the strip and Fremont Street. We booked a couples package here (on promotion at the time of the trip) and got quite a few things at 2 for 1 in a coupon book. We had breakfast at Il Fornaio restaurant. Great place to eat first thing in the morning!!! Retail area is kind of the same ole same ole. It is also very dark in the lobby area which takes away from the uniqueness of the look of the lobby. Room was nice, we got the Park Avenue Deluxe room as part of the upgrade. Bell service was very helpful in all their duties. Baggage delivery was very prompt even at 11pm at night. The one bellman in the morning helped us weigh or bags at the business center and then get them out to the bus shuttle stop location. Drapes really block out the light and the noise from the street and airport. Forget using the PC's there as they are really expensive. You are charged $3 for the phone connection even if you don't use it. Internet access is extra on top of that. Book this hotel direct and not via priceline if you want to get some good deals.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel- nice experience”
Reviews.Author: dmc
Reviews.Content: the new york,new york is very nice - the registration woman was very pleasant - there was no wait ( we arrived on a Tuesday at 2p)--we had reserved a basic room and when we arrived we upgraded for $10/night extra - we had a view of the main street/the room was nice /very clean - big bathroom- we were very pleased with it --will definitely stay here again-----we ate at the Irish Pub downstairs one nite - food was very good-----and if you get a chance to see the Jersey Boys ,it is a great show

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel for the younger crowd”
Reviews.Author: alanzeb
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week at the end of June (24th-01st July) with my girlfriend. it was my 4th trip to vegas and her first so wanted to make sure she had a hotel that would be a great base and with alright location. The room was thouroughly cleaned daily, and was a good size. we stayed in a park avenue deluxe room and had a view of MGM grand, the rollercoaster, and Tropicana. We were on the 17th floor and rarely struggled to get an elevator/lift quickly. Another nice thing about the room was the Bose Ipod dock. would have liked a flat screen TV but not really fussed since we spent very little time in there. It's true the decor could be better but its hardly outdated/run down. Bed was comfy and never noticed noise coming from any of the rooms near us (contrary to peoples comments about thing walls). Shower pressure was great. Other thing to note on the room was that we never heard the lift or rollercoaster - probably because we were on such a high floor and at the opposite end of the hotel to the lifts so not really in a position to comment on peoples complaints about them. Check in was very fast (wednesday afternoon at 2pm) and the woman was very helpful and friendly. The staff in general in the hotel were excellent and more than willing to help you out if you need anything the casino was great and a nice way to finish the night off after a night out. the slots were fairly generous (i won $150 of a $1 bet!). the cocktail waitresses come round very often ifyou tip them a dollar a drink and even faster if you tip more (generally i tipped $5 for two drinks). me and my partner are by no means high rollers but we did get a $75 room service bill comped from the players club even though we didnt really gamble much money. You can spend hours in the casino on $20 drinking as much as you like. the trick for us was to stick to the low end slots and bet minumum. we never expected to win anything so to walk away with more than you put in was always an unexpected (and very welcome) bonus. mixed feelings about the poor. on the good side it has an atmosphere, good bar, nice jacuzzi, and lots of sun loungers. on the down side, it doesnt get any sun till about 11 and by which time it gets very busy. also the music they play is a bit repetitve. overall i liked it because i was able to plug in the Ipod, sip on a cocktail, close my eyes, and recover from the constant hangovers in peace. Food at the hotel is a mixed bag too. the steak house (gallaghers) is truly excellent and good value. never ate at ESPN as its not my kinda place. the village eateries are great too - especially the Deli and the 50's style diner burger place (near the rollercoaster) and they are a cheap and easy quick fill if you dont want to bother with a restaurant. I must be the only person who thought the pizza place was overrated since it always had a huge queue. also, avoid the buffet place in the morning as it just reminded me of left over chinese food. Nightlife at the hotel is among the best in Vegas. Cayotes is great, and Nine Fine Irishmen is my favourate bar in Vegas.The live band they have there are very entertaining (listen out for them playing 'seven drunken nights', or find the clips on youtube). didnt bother with the bar at times square so cant offer an opinion on that, and the same applies for Rok nightclub. the 24 hour bar overlooking the casino has a great view but watch out for the drinks prices! Overall, i love this hotel. it always has an atmosphere and its perfect for younger couples, lads, and girls holidays. if you want a quiet place in vegas, stay elsewhere as this place is full of life. the location isnt great but its opposite MGM grand which has a monorail stop for easy access to the rest of the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Themed Hotel right in the action in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: bryanuk72
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel a few times over the years and it is a great base for exploring the Las Vegas strip. If you go between Sunday - Thursday you can get some great deals (keep away from the weekend when the Angilinos arrive!!). I paid about $60/night for a strip view room Sunday to Thursday inc. The hotel is much like all the othe Strip hotels, excellent facilities but a bit clinical, although the check in girl was very pleasant. No breakfast included, the hotel restaurants are a bit expensive, but we ate at either Einstiens Bagels, or Denny's over the road. Rooms are a good size and very clean. The hotel is situated right on the best part of the Strip, so a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing value on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: eljay78
Reviews.Content: Some friends recommended NY NY as being a good hotel on the Strip, and this certainly rang true for us. On researching for a hotel to stay at in Vegas we wanted something comfortable in a good location so we could see as much of Vegas as possible in the short 2 night stopover we had. We booked on their own website and discovered that their "Couples Package" was the same price as their cheapest room (Skyline I think), but included a free upgrade to a Strip View room, 2 free drinks, 2 for 1 breakfasts at one of the cafes, 2 for 1 rollercoaster voucher (which is a pretty good rollercoaster that goes around the hotel and costs $14 per person normally), $25 retail credit to use and a 2 for 1 Spa voucher (that we didn't get time to use). It also promoted a cheap price on a tour of Vegas sights but we didn't really see the need and it is definitely not essential to use to get this deal. Looking at the map the hotel may appear to be at one end and thus away from the most concentrated spots on the Strip, but we found it was definitely close enough to be in walking distance of most attractions. On check-in the guy was great - he was very polite and professional, went through each of the vouchers we had included and how we were to use them, and gave us detailed directions on how to get to our hotel room which was essential with 4 towers and slot machines everywhere blocking any signs they may have. A great first impression. Whilst it may not be the flashiest of hotels in Vegas the rooms are fine as are the casino, bars and dining. When you consider it was half the price of most other hotels around NY NY is definitely worth considering next time you go to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Right on the strip, nice big rooms”
Reviews.Author: goodtimes75
Reviews.Content: Good hotel right on the strip, everything you could wish for on your doorstep, all the hotels are massive and this is no exception. I suppose this one has the added benefit of having a roller coaster running through and around it (on in vegas eh), Personal highlights for me was the pool with its bar serving alcoholic slushes, be prepared for brain freeze.... oh and another thing, if youre going to get married in vegas, do it for the right reasons!, this review might have been better if it wasnt for the fact Vegas holds some strange memories for me!!!

Reviews.Title: “Breathe Oxygen Bar a Scam”
Reviews.Author: wendygib
Reviews.Content: Please beware of the oxygen bars in Vegas, they really are only trying to sell you a massager that they will not return your money on if you try to take it back even the same day! I was not told of the return policy until I purchased the unit then they said no returns and they don't even sell anything else to get with store credit. You will be stuck witt a stupid little hand held massager that does not work!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel-one of the easiest to navigate on the strip”
Reviews.Author: ricecakes87
Reviews.Content: We had a short 2 night stay which usually isn't long enough to even find your way around the mega hotels on the strip but New York, New York was designed in a way that all of the room elevators were in the casino so you weren't winding down long, unending hallways to find the casino like others have been. All of staff was very nice and helpful. Machines were a little tight but it seemed to be like that all over the strip. It was obvious that the economy has affected the hotels on the strip. Not nearly as much traffic as usual and almost every hotel had a broken escalator. Room was very comfortable and spacious. TV lineup was a little short but who goes to Vegas to watch TV anyway?? HIghly recommend the Zumanity show! I made my reservations online with a buy one, get the next for $25 and thought that was a great deal but hotel guests get 2 for $99 so before ordering tickets to any show, I would call hotels directly to see if there might be a better rate. I asked them for difference but they said I had already purchased them at a discount so they wouldn't do anything- it was only about $15 difference but still a little annoying.

Reviews.Title: “Loved NYNY”
Reviews.Author: MarkDC-Travel
Reviews.Content: Needed a break from my work so I took off for a few days during the week to NYNY. This is the smallest of the MGM/Mirage properties and you can tell. I never hit any real crowd. No waiting to check in at 11:30 AM and checking out was done over the TV and dropping the "keys" into a drop box. I had reserved a Spa Suite and it was wonderful. Lots of room to move about and everything was in great shape. No smoke residue, no cigarette burns, room was very clean and the view was great. I ran into no problems whatsoever. Everyday the room was picked up and stocks were replenished. Did not spend any time at the pool since I heard that it is so small. I did venture down and it is really small so I didn't spend time there. The gaming situation was fine. Although the dealers were very cold to me, the slots were very generous. Choices for dining were good as well. I loved the fish & chips for about $10. The food in the food court was very good and reasonably priced. My only real regret is that there was no coffeemaker in the room, but most of the other hotels do not have them either. All in all, this is a very good hotel. If you're looking for affordable, but not cheap, close to the action, but not overwhelmed in it, something clean but not dated, you should be happy with this hotel. I liked it so much, I have booked the same room for December 22 - 25.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at New York New York”
Reviews.Author: eddieOhio
Reviews.Content: Our last visit to Vegas was very nice. It was the first visit for us to stay at New York New York. We found the hotel very comfortable. These were 2 free nights. Check-in was very smooth & fast & the employees were very friendly & helpful. The room was a typical hotel room, nothing fancy but comfortable & all that we needed. The only thing we would have liked to have was a coffee maker so we did'nt have to go out or order in for our usual cup of morning coffee. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “It's no Venetian”
Reviews.Author: Lisa18
Reviews.Content: Well... when you go from staying at the Venetian for two nights to the NYNY you are bound to be disappointed but we got a GREAT deal on a room so we switched hotels for the remainder of our stay. We were upgraded to a 'suite' but I'm not sure why it was called that. The room was tiny but the bed was comfortable. We were on the 32nd floor and could still hear the roller coaster, airplanes, and traffic noise (not impressed). The room was dated. But we loved all the restaurants the NY had to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel!”
Reviews.Author: aleeca17
Reviews.Content: We got a free upgrade to the Spa Suite and it was amazing. Everything was very clean and well kept. This hotel is right across the street from MGM and Excalibur and there are pedestrian bridges linking NY NY to these hotels. This makes it easy for walking to and from the different hotels. this is definitely worth the money...we stayed at Excalibur for one night and it was definitely subpar for the price. Definitely recommend this hotel and will not stay at anything less in Vegas anymore! Only downfall was that internet costs $14/day.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay, Pool Broke”
Reviews.Author: akaygirl
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay here the room was clean, the atmosphere was good. The only complaint is the pool was brok the whole time of our stay. We enjoyed this hotel and will go again.

Reviews.Title: “A nice place to stay and play”
Reviews.Author: Home!isAdelaide!
Reviews.Content: This hotel was actually much better than I expected. The room was clean, the walls were thick, and the bathroom was maintained. What I like about this hotel is the convenience of check in/out and the fact that the elevators are fast and efficient. They move a lot of people up and down and get you to where you're going quickly. The pool looked nice enough but was not nearly as large as some other Vegas pools. The interior of the hotel is quite interesting as it was made to replicate New York City: you can walk through what look to be alleyways, and narrow streets. The location of the hotel speaks for itself: across the street is MGM Grand, to the South is Excalibur, and to the North is Monte Carlo. I find the casino very accessible and lively. It's layout is pretty good in my opinion. The cocktail waitresses are plenty and are really quick at getting you what you order. I would definitely stay here again, because of my comfortable stay, and because of the location.

Reviews.Title: “Nice atmosphere about this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gorcat
Reviews.Content: We stayed in NYNY for our third visit - this time in a hot tub suite, and enjoyed every minute of our stay. Nice atmosphere, especially in the 'streets' around where the duelling pianos are.

Reviews.Title: “Great!!”
Reviews.Author: Cherryelle
Reviews.Content: We loved it, they have everything you could want right there in the hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: mariuccias
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the NYNY in Las Vegas for a "girls weekend". It was clean and comfortable. The location was was more towards the end of the strip but it was not difficult getting around. Rooms are smaller than others, but for the price it could not be beat. Great gaming tables. The dueling pianos are worth seeing. Great entertainment.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: SarrahL
Reviews.Content: We had a better view from our room than any of the other couples who traveled with us and stayed in other hotels. We also payed a lot less. Location is wonderful, shops/ restaurants were great, and the casino was fabulous! We will be staying there if and when we go back out there!

Reviews.Title: “Beyond our expectations”
Reviews.Author: melann78
Reviews.Content: I have to say, I was nervous about this hotel. Having never been to Vegas I wasn't quite sure what to expect but when we walked into the room I was pleansantly surprised. It was quite large, great view of the strip and was very clean. Nice decor and while it didn't have a flat screen TV or anything particularly fancy, the bed was comfy and the bathroom was a good size for a hotel (with marble flooring). The hotels New York theme was kinda neat, the roller coaster was fun to ride (though ridiculously overpriced, but as I found out, most things in Vegas are) but I think next time I'd stay more center strip as it is quite a walk from "the action". Try and stay in a room above the 10th floor as apparently there is quite a bit of noise from the roller coaster below that. What was totally ridiculous and I'm sure is standard at other hotels in Vegas also is the $3/day charge for the phone. We didn't even USE the phone and were charged. Also, there is no free internet here, it's $15 per 24 hrs. which I think in this day is absurd. But really, this is a fine hotel to stay in, so long as you aren't looking for luxury. If not for the location, I'd stay here again for sure. Pj

Reviews.Title: “I would stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: colette424
Reviews.Content: My mom and I stayed at New York New York for 3 nights. The room was small, but clean and comfortable. We loved the atmosphere-it was more laid back than other hotel/casinos, but had plenty to do. The pool was closed on our last day due to a water problem, but they arranged for us to be able to use the pools at 3 nearby casinos. Our wake-up call was late-luckily we were already up. The rooms were super quiet-we had a strip view with the roller coaster outside our window and we hardly heard the noise.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: Jeff2817
Reviews.Content: Stayed at New York New York for 3 nights in July 2009. Could not have asked for a more convenient location on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel/casino has a wide variety of entertainment and eating venues.”
Reviews.Author: radams78101
Reviews.Content: New York New York was a great experience. It is located near the monorail (in the MGM Grand), and has a lot of choices for dining, entertainment, and relaxation. The service was good, and we particularly loved Il Fornao - a wonderful Italian restaurant centrally located in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loads of fun!”
Reviews.Author: Distra
Reviews.Content: This was a really fun hotel to stay at. Our room was very and quiet at night. We liked the big selection of places to eat at, and all the neat places to shop. The New York theme was really neat, I've never been there but sort of know what it must be like in New York! My husband liked the roller coaster, it was expensive but he thought it was worth it. We can't wait to come back some day!

Reviews.Title: “great stay!”
Reviews.Author: stephen42mo
Reviews.Content: this place was fantastic, i had a room in the century tower over looking the 4 corners, what a veiw! staff was freindly room was clean very nice, and houekeeping will leave u lots of goodies if u leave a small tip! me $2 sign up or their email deals, which includes alll mgm, mirage properties, and you will get great email deals. i paid $29 per night !

Reviews.Title: “Fun place with lots to do!”
Reviews.Author: stv8r
Reviews.Content: I took a trip here with some friends for a friend's 40th birthday bash. We had a great time! This was our 2nd time here, and we were not disappointed. Room was very nice, with a great view of the strip. The only drawback was it was a bit of a hike from the elevator. Very nice casino, and some great restaurants and bars in house. Coyote Ugly was a blast!! It was a great choice for a "homebase" for our Las Vegas stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: EG2007
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I've stayed at the NYNY and have been pleased both times. The hotel was full because of the fight at the MGM that weekend, but it was still an enjoyable stay and the staff quickly took care of everything.

Reviews.Title: “NewYork NewYork Hotel”
Reviews.Author: onewildchild
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at this hotel in Las Vegas in June with 9 other friends. The service there was outstanding and we ate at several restaurants/food stands in the hotel and had great food every time... from the fancy restaurants all the way to the Nathan's mini corn dogs! We didn't win any money in the casino there, but sure had a lot of fun. It was a great location too. The only downside was the freeway ran rather close to the pool and it got a bit noisy and stinky at certain times. Otherwise we really liked the pool atmosphere :)

Reviews.Title: “Faultless.”
Reviews.Author: the_savman
Reviews.Content: Could not find fault with NYNY, last time we stayed in the MGM Grand and suffice to say we felt NYNY was a far better hotel. We were in the Century building and the rooms were spotless, beds very comfortable and all appliances etc in working order (including the very handy ipod docking station). We had a breathtaking view of the south Strip, the pool was small but once you found a space it was very nice indeed. NYNY hads tons of on site dining options, all you could ever need for a good stay and overall it's a very moderately priced hotel with a great location and atmosphere. Excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Great view. Room was okay...”
Reviews.Author: ChavSanti
Reviews.Content: HOTEL ROOM: We stayed at the NY, NY hotel on the strip. We reserved a 2 night stay for $109/night. Check in was smooth with no problem except that our room was not ready. It was an early check-in so it wasn't their fault. However, they still offered us a free upgrade to a bigger room on the 34th floor with a view. The room had a long hallway before getting into the sleeping area which they justified as more square footage. Though the hallway was georgous, it had no function. The actual location of the sleeping area and sitting area was quite small. The TV was <26" and was located way across from the bed. So watching TV from bed was difficult. The bathroom was a good size with a walk-in shower, no tub. The showerhead was an older type and didn't spray out so well. There was what looked like a fridge under the sink area. It was actually just an ice maker. It didn't make any ice but made a loud humming sound every 10 minutes. The best thing about the room was the view. Their were 4 large windows facing West. There was a backdrop of a mountain range, the Orleans casino and what seems like a residential community. During the day it wasn't much but the sunset and night view was well worth it. FITNESS CENTER: The fitness area was one the other side of the property on the 3rd floor. It cost $25 to get in. The provided free bottled water, fruit and towels. The lounge area was clean and nicely decorated. Had about 6 treamills, 2 ellipticles and 2 stationary bikes. All with individual TV monitors. Also, had Olympic freeweights. Staff at the fitness center was friendly and helpful. FOOD AND BARS: Many of restaraunts at the hotel. Food was good. "The America Grill" charged your for every little item. Can you believe... $1.50 for a side of ranch? Otherwise food was good. The bar at the "Dueling Pianos" is a major rip off. Charged us $9 for a domestic draft beer in a plastic cup. Better place to drink is back at the "America Grill". BEST THING: Best thing I liked about NY, NY was the location on the strip. You are across MGM, Tropicana and Excaliber. All connected via a pedestrian bridge. WORST THING: The thing I hated about the hotel was the front desk reps. You always get a different answer from them. We were trying to stay an extra night. The night before, a rep said it would be the same rate as we paid for the previous nights ($109). Then when we came down to book the extra night, a differenct rep said it would be $149 and wouldn't budge. Then that night, we decided to take the $149 and they said it was gone. So we figured we were SOL. That morning another rep said, "Oh, no problem you can stay another night for $79." So frustrating. No one could get their stories straight. Bottom line... Don't try to modify your reservation. They'll just get confused.

Reviews.Title: “New York New York Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: NorthWhiteGreat1
Reviews.Content: Great trip to Las Vegas but was disappointed with New York New York. We liked the location, food okay, small pool, gambling okay and over all we did enjoy the trip. We probably will not stay at NYNY again, to many really other hotels that are bigger and nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel and friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: shan3422
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I were coming through Vegas for the day and booked a Park Avenue room with a view of the Strip. We had really high hopes for NYNY because we had a bad experience at the Stratosphere earlier in our trip. Upon our arrival, we were informed that the room was not available. We stated that we would take the 2 Queen beds once we were told all King beds were taken for the Park Avenue rooms. We didn't get angry and just went along with it. I don't know if it was our calm demeanor, but the desk attendant decided to upgrade us to the Ziggurat Suite!! We were so excited. The room was amazing and were able to have our King bed after all. It just shows that being courteous when things don't go as planned can go a long way!! Thanks NYNY!!

Reviews.Title: “Used to be good”
Reviews.Author: Nickoct19
Reviews.Content: Dirtier than average. Charges for internet use approx $18 per 24 hr. Even airports have wireless access nowadays. The offer coupons for breakfast, betting, spa, etc which are difficult to cash in. We ended up eating at the MGM which is next to it.

Reviews.Title: “Fun hotel amongst the Vegas glitz”
Reviews.Author: OzTraveller33
Reviews.Content: This was my second trip to Las Vegas and I chose the New York New York for its mid price range and fun facade. I was very happy with my choice - the four nights I spent there were very comfortable and entertaining. I have seen a few reviews that complain about long check-in lines - since I arrived at 1:30AM I didn't have this trouble. I think the receptionist could tell I was very jet-lagged and ready to drop so he just quickly confirmed everything, showed me a map of the hotel (my hotel needs its own MAP?!) and pointed me in the direction of the correct elevator. My room was on the fifteenth floor of the New Yorker tower and had a view over the roller coaster to the Monte Carlo and some parking lots behind. With two queen beds and a whole lot of extra space it was very comfortable. The air conditioner was a bit noisy but I ended up turning it off - the room kept its cool quite well overnight if the air con was run during the day. I did hear a little "noise" from the room next door one morning but it was faint and I say good luck to them. ;-) The marble bathroom was really nice, with a good bath and shower. I was a little bemused though that despite all the signs asking for the conservation of water through reusing towels, the maid changed my towels every day no matter where I hung them. As someone from a dry climate I was really trying to be environmentally friendly but the maid service wasn't cooperating. Perhaps it was because I went in the late afternoon or perhaps it was because it was outside main holiday season, but I didn't think the pool was small and crowded like some other reviewers. I would have liked it to have a deep section (it is 3 feet for most of the pool and 4 in one small area) and perhaps to be a bit cooler given the hot outside temperatures but it was lovely to be able to kick back with a margarita in the pool or on a sun lounge in the late afternoon. I didn't go to Vegas to sit beside a hotel pool all day! Perhaps my one criticism would be of a hot dog place I tried late one evening - it had to be the most pathetic and revolting hot dog I have ever had, coupled with burned fries and a "root beer" that tasted like cough medicine. My bad for going down to the lobby half asleep and choosing the first hot dog stand I saw - I think the better one may have been near the bar! I also tried to get room service breakfast on my final morning but on my first two attempts got no answer at all and on the third attempt gave up after waiting on hold for 5 minutes. New York New York is a fun hotel to stay in. It's convenient to the rest of the Strip (although not central - if you don't want to walk, catch the bus or monorail), the casino section is reasonable but not so enormous you get lost and it has great facilities. You could stay there a week and eat at a different outlet/restaurant every night and still not cover them all I suspect.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon in vegas”
Reviews.Author: DancinJRL
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for our honeymoon and it was our first time in Las Vegas. The location of the hotel is great. Our corner room was very spacious and had the most amazing views of the strip and the mountains. Nothing luxurious about the room but nothing to complain. We did hear the roller coaster but only if you really listened for it. We ate at many restaurants. Nine Fine Irishmen was my favorite. Nice atmosphere and great food. Chin Chin Café was overpriced and nothing more than you could get from an everyday takeout restaurant. Il Fornaio was good but not a great value. America had large portions so we split the food since we did not have a fridge in our room. One thing we soon discovered about Las Vegas is there isn't much open before 8am. Being from the East Coast we were up and ready at 6 or 7am Vegas time and had to walk across the street to McDonalds. We went to Zoomanity and had a wonderful time. Beware if you intend to sit in the first few rows and aren't interested in being interactive. We visited many of the other hotels and shows. Plan on walking a lot and keep traffic in mind when taxiing to a show at another hotel. Great trip. Will likely try other hotels for future trips as there are so many to choose from.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Very Expensive Phone Charges”
Reviews.Author: bigandblack
Reviews.Content: Great hotel to stay in, rooms dark. We made a ten minute call to Las Angeles, and the phone bill came out more expensive than the room cost. Don't use their phones at all. Pool only has limited hours. No fridge in room's. Close to all the fun and activity of Vegas, and well worth the stay.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME AWESOME AWESOME”
Reviews.Author: psnz
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 6 days and still could have stayed longer ! Fab place, Neat and tidy well equimpt rooms. Excellent room service and cleaning. If you get the chance to treat yourself at "the Spa" I would highly recomend. Staff super friendly . the casino down stairs has several top class restaurants, and a fab little french cafe for great fresh fruit breakfasts. Nightlife is excellent with the piano bar and "the Rok" nightclub. The roller coaster is a must, cause where else in the world can you "coast " around your hotel ! Really you don't even need to leave this hotel to get the best of vegas !! Cant wait to go again

Reviews.Title: “Good value on the strip”
Reviews.Author: onered66
Reviews.Content: Had to cut my trip short, but what I saw was pretty good. Hotel was decent, Nine fine Irishmen had good food quality. Didnt gamble all that much but comped half of our final bill including food and hotel. Staff were friendly, would stay here again although i am going to try a downtown hotel next trip.

Reviews.Title: “DISAPPOINTING”
Reviews.Author: snowbunnyMichigan
Reviews.Content: The trip was disappointing. I'm from Michigan and have 20 casinos to pick from here,and they do pay off better than Las Vegas. This was our third year of going out to Vegas and our last. We are better off staying home. Each one of us came home with the flu. Our room was nice at the NYNY and so was our service except we had to fight to get our $25 freeplay. The payoffs are terrible. Didn't win anything until we left the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, would definately return!”
Reviews.Author: Travel1England
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week in September, and the hotel was absolutely fantastic with plenty to offer. Our favourite bar was the one at Times Square, definitely recommended! We had a Park Avenue Deluxe room which had either 2 queen size beds or a king. They were very well equipped, spacious and cleaned every day. The only thing that could be missed by some is tea and coffee making facilities. Our room also looked out towards the roller coaster - the noise really isn't that bad!! and it also seemed to finish running at around 11pm everynight. The location of the hotel was great for us. Directly opposite was the MGM Grand which has its own monorail station. This was handy because for approx $13 you could ride unlimited times for 24hours and this takes you all the way up the strip, the last stop being close to the Stratosphere. During our stay we used the pool numerous times, generally the sun didn't get to the pool until midday but staff at the New York did advise you can use the pool at the Monte Carlo hotel also. Over all I would highly recommend this hotel and would definitely return again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SpecialK0900
Reviews.Content: I am posting this review almost two years having stayed at this hotel, so a lot could have changed in that time. I am new to this site and wanted to share my experience of staying at the New York, New York. For what we payed at the time of our stay, this hotel was worth the money. Our room was clean and the bed was comfortable. Those are the two things that we were looking for in our stay (most people visiting Vegas don't spend a lot of time in their room). The location was nice and we pretty much walked down the strip during the day. I loved all the food options in the different parts of New York in the hotel. One of the few negative things I could say about this hotel was the fact that our room was pretty much at the opposite side of the hotel and it took a few minutes to walk to our room. I'm not sure if that happens in a lot of other hotels but you pretty much needed to make sure you had everything when you left the hotel room for the day. The pool was also closed when we went (last week of February) and opened the day we left. There was only one pool and it was pretty small, too. I have seen other hotels that have several pools that are open for most of the year. We had problems checking in (the computer said we didn't have a reservation upon check-in), but I don't blame the hotel, that was the fault of the travel site we booked our trip through. The front desk and manager promptly and politely helped us figure things out. I would probably stay somewhere else on our next trip to Vegas, but only because we want to see what the other hotels are like on the strip. This is a good hotel for families with children - big arcade/games and a fun roller coaster. We ended up getting a room that overlooked the roller coaster but there wasn't much noise since the roller coaster closed at 11 p.m. This hotel is great for anyone who wants to stay on the South end of the strip. We found the staff great and never had any problems. The casino was really nice, too and there was lots of room to walk around.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money at New York New York”
Reviews.Author: Furny
Reviews.Content: We had a Park Avenue Deluxe room on the 27th floor which was spacious and cleaned daily. I wouldn't describe this hotel as a 5 star as stated on some web sites but it was comfortable and more than adequate if you don't spend much time in your room like us! There are plenty of places to eat and drink within the hotel, but we preferred to venture out to eat the majority of the time. Nothing is a short walk away in Vegas as everything is so huge but the location is excellent with all the best hotels on The Strip within a reasonable walking distance so I would recommend this hotel for location. The best thing about this hotel is the location and price, the worst is if you want to stay in a "grand" hotel this isn't as impressive as some of the others on The Strip - depends what you like to spend your money on!!

Reviews.Title: “Ok but not amazing”
Reviews.Author: katwilbo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at New York New York for 7 nights in Sept 2009. Check in - Possibly the slowest check in I've experienced ever! We arrived about lunch time to a check in queue of about 10 couples and it took 20 mins, simply as they only had 2 receptionists on! Customer service not particularly good, they were definitely just going through the motions. We were asked if we wanted a room with a view for $15 a night more, which we declined as we had not come to vegas to look out the window! When we got to the room we had the best view ever, which made us think we were going to get that room anyway - sneaky! Room - We stayed in room 2480 in the Century Tower on the 24th floor, with a view straight onto the strip facing MGM Grand across the road - amazing view! Bed was very comfortable and very big. Room was a decent size, clean, with a decent bathroom too. The only issue we had with the room is that it has an inter-connecting door with the room next door. This means you can hear everything from the room next door through the door frame! Our first night involved hearing a screaming match between two women for 30 mins at 2.30am! Called security who promptly came up and told them to keep it down. Luckily they left 2 days after and we got a quiet couple next door! Location - New York New York is south strip and a little out of all the action. We constantly used The Deuce buses (stops across the road and outside Monte Carlo next door). Everything looks close, but believe me it isn't! It's just everything is so big! Plus it was 100 degrees constantly, so not good for lots of walking. When I go back to Vegas I will be staying mid strip around Bellagio/ Paris. Pool - It is tiny in relation to the size of the hotel and it was dirty! Loads of bits floating in it, including birds feathers! I didn't even see a single bird in Vegas! Needless to say we only used it once! Restaurants - There is lots of places to eat at New York New York but no buffet restaurant. We ate in America and El Fornaio - both meals fine, but again not fantastic. However the bakery does amazing chocolate croissants! There is plenty of bars at this hotel and places for snacks - there is a frozen daquiri bar that do fab daquiris! Tip - The check out queue was always very long, so I would reccomend express check out through your TV! Vegas was absolutley fantastic, but New York New York was just... ok! Nothing special - I would only go back there if I got a really cheap deal there.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Fun”
Reviews.Author: sresendez07
Reviews.Content: Clean, no problems with maid service, comfortable pillows and mattress, updated furnishings. We were on the 29th floor, good view, quiet. Room was given to us at checkin 1pm thursday no wait. Restaurants at hotel with comfort food, pizza, hot dogs, coffee, no frills, just average. Average Gambling, payout below average. Easy access to MGM Grand, Excalibur, Tropicana. Try MGM Grand Buffet, wide variety of food. Excalibur Buffet NO. Try Deuce all day pass to all other mid strip casinos. Don't miss Freemont Street Experience. Take Monorail to Sahara then take a bus or a cab to Freemont Street, it won't dissapoint, alot of fun for all. Prime Rib 9.99 buy one get one free at Four Queens Casino, plenty of cocktails. Don't Miss this place. Do not go to Coyote Ugly at NYNY if you are over 23 years old or sober. It is a sardine packed room. There is luxourious pools, hotel rooms and casinos in Vegas. Great Restaurants and celebrated chefs in Vegas. If this is what your looking for, this is not the hotel/casino for you ...do not stay here. Fun and young at heart, go for it, you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Not all its made out to be.”
Reviews.Author: sheriffs
Reviews.Content: We made our way to this hotel having book approx 9 months earlier, on arrivals we were given our room which was based on the 25th floor a good way from the escalators, on first looks the room was clean and tidy, like most people you fancy a cup of coffee/ tea either late at night or like us early morning but I am afraid this was not possible as there was no coffee maker/ kettle in the room. This is only a minor point but the other is not so, this is that the Noise which was coming from not only the roller coaster which runs around the outside of the hotel, this did at least stop running around 22:00 hrs, but the other rumblings which seems to occur every 6 to 7 minutes this was put down to the monorail which operates from the Excalibur hotel across the road, somehow this monorail manages to transmit its noise across the road and up to the 25 floor of this hotel and i must admit it did cause me to have at least 2 nights poor sleep, (not going to bed until the early hours of the morning did help a little on the other nights) Otherwise the hotel was average the staff were all friendly and helpful. Another small gripe you did not get free wireless internet it cost 14dollars per 24 hours even at some of the cheaper hotels in which we stopped during our trip wireless internet was free.

Reviews.Title: “Great trip, but a few issues”
Reviews.Author: hideo81
Reviews.Content: Stayed for four nights in a Park Avenue Deluxe room on the 19th floor of the Century Tower. First the good points: Fairly good location - We could walk across the pedestrian bridges to MGM Grand and Excalibur. The MGM Grand is a Monorail location while there is a tram at the Excalibur to get to Luxor and Mandalay Bay. Cheap eats - First time eating a Nathan's hot dog. Very good pizza place in the Village as well. Nicely appointed room - Very comfortable room and stylishly decorated. Now for the not so good points: Paper thin walls - We thought someone was trying to open our door. Come to find out it was our neighbors just opening their doors. Could also hear the roller coaster till about 1 am. 25 cent machines - After visiting other hotels on the strip, we were least satisfied by the NYNY's selection of 25 cent slot machines. It seemed to cater more towards dollar machines and pennies. We would very likely stay here again, but would probably gamble in the nearby hotels. Had luck at Excalibur and Bellagio.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Oilersfan1
Reviews.Content: Check in was ok, upgraded room. Room was very clean and quiet and had strip view. Casino was slow but friendly. Lots of options for food but no buffet. Food was good and reasonably priced. Good location. Would return in future.

Reviews.Title: “I absolutely Loved this place! couldn't have chosen better!”
Reviews.Author: mrsniccooper
Reviews.Content: Being the Vegas virgins that we were I found the choice of hotels very daunting when i booked this trip. My husband is a theme park fanatic and said he'd only take me to Vegas if I booked a hotel with decent attractions! I origionally booked the Strat but was put off when they didn't reply to any of my e-mails and when I got a letter from my tour company saying that some of the facilities were closed at the strat and the area is a bit run-down. I chose NYNY as my friends were in Vegas at the same time on their honeymoon in the MGM Grand and I wanted something that was sligtly more up-market than the Strat but not as prices as the MGM. The upgrade I was charged was the best £100 - odd, that I've ever spent! We spent the week going in and out of most of the hotels on the strip and I actually felt a bit smug as we kept saying that we preferred nearly every aspect of our hotel than the others and we were glad we didn't splash the cash on the MGM as it was very, very, crowded and far too big for us although lovely just to visit for a few hours. (Having said that, had a great night in the West Wing Bar there) We had a Park Avenue Deluxe Room and even though it was a smoking room it was still big, comfortable and well equipt. Didn't expect I-pod dock! & we had a great side strip View of the Monte Carlo and even with the Rollercoaster going past all the time, we couln't hear it at all. All the hotel facilities were great and good value too. We hired a cabana on one day and found it to be great value for money. We were also given a list of promotions on at the NYNY & Monte Carlo that helped a lot money-wise with Discount on the Restaurants and bars and also show tickets & Rides etc. There are some great places to eat and drink at NYNY too which was part of the attraction for us. and we ate at the America restaurant on a few ocassions as the food was excellent quality and value in great surroundings ($17.95 for a 2 course steak dinner and a beer in a strip hotel is a bargain!) I also can't fault the service in any of the establishments, the staff in America, The front desk and by the pool were efficient, smart, knowledgeable and attentive, there was one exception to that on the casino floor, but he was just my bad luck charm and a cue to stop gambling away my holiday spends! I loved Vegas, and i will be back when I can afford it and would reccomend NYNY to anyone, we are glad we splashed out but decided that when we go again and the budget might not stretch that far, we liked the south side of the strip and would also consider Excalibur and Tropicana as cheaper options.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel good, would probably stay elsewhere next time”
Reviews.Author: lyndseyEK
Reviews.Content: My partner and I were in Las Vegas to get married. I emailed hotel in advance to find out if there was a possibility of complimentary or reduced rate upgrades given that we were celebrating a special occassion. I was told that they would make a note on the system but they could not guarantee upgrades. I asked at check in and the girl who was working was very rude. She barely looked at us and said no free upgrades, it would be $40 per night during week and more at weekend. Americans checking in at the desk next to us were offered the same upgrades for $10 per night! Not good start. Park Avenue Room was small but nice. We had view of back of side of MGM and rollercoster. Rest of hotel was fun. Food places were good. We ate at America, Sirroccos and Chin Chin. Drinks were expensive in hotel and bar staff rude yet they expect a tip. If you are looking for cheaper drinks then Casino Royal further up the strip has $1 beers and cocktails. Casino was airier than most and was nice. Pool was ok. Overall the hotel was good although I would probably stay somewhere closer to the centre of the strip next time.

Reviews.Title: “it did the job for our stay. but not luxury”
Reviews.Author: dianegeorge
Reviews.Content: very pleasant check in staff. although we enquired about upgrading our room were told there was no rooms available even though we were going to be paying for an upgrade. we had an 8th floor room in the new yorker tower with an "excellent" view of a roof and the end of the rollercoaster. Only good thing was we never heard the coaster from our room. the room was nicely decorated and very clean with a very good housekeeping service. would have liked some coffee making facilities in the room but starbucks was just outside the entrance to our tower. Dined in Gallaghers and the Italian restaurant both were really good. The pool area was really busy and very cramped with NO space between loungers. Most of the pool area is shaded until at least 12 noon. But once the sun hits there is no sun brolleys for shade. Good waitress service for food and drink at the pool. Another good thing is that if the pool loungers are unattended for more than 30mins the lifeguards remove the towels and allow others to use,So it stops people "reserving beds early in the morning and not showing up till lunchtime" All in all this hotel is ok for a few nights stay but if you are expecting 5 star luxury go somewhere else. Oh also the spa is great for a bit of pampering I recommend the hot stone massage and pedicure. Look out for coupons in the rooms we got a good deal for the spa and also got 2 tickets for zumanity show for 100bucks we thought for the price we would get rubbish seats but we got 2nd row front.

Reviews.Title: “I loved every minute of my hoiday and to stay in this hotel was superb!”
Reviews.Author: elissa_321
Reviews.Content: Pro's Plently of places to eat within the hotel Plenty of shops within the hotel Bank within the hotel Casino & Slots on your doorstep, free inductions on how to play on tables rollercoaster &acrcades in your hotel!! theater for cirque due solei in hotel room service daily free ice machine on every floor we stayed for 2 weeks and none of our facitities broke ie televion air con which I think is a great bonus Free drinks if you gamble on slot machines (just tip your waitress!!) Free towels at the pool Bar & waitress at the pool Ny Ny was very central of the strip Amazing thing about vegas is most of the hotels are themed, you have ny ny, mandalay bay, luxor , Ceasers Palace, planet hollywood, paris ect ect Con's Pool was lovely would have been better if it was bigger - most of loungers were gone by the time we got to the pool. Would recommend anyone this hotel!!! xxxx

Reviews.Title: “Good Location & Variety of Places to eat”
Reviews.Author: TravelersFromIA
Reviews.Content: This was my first time staying at the NY NY but have visted this casino on several occasions. Typically we stay at the Golden Nugget b/c we enjoy the atmosphere there much better. But, the NY NY was running a Summer Special that we could not pass up. SUMMER BREAK ESCAPE : $65 per night Tues-Thurs - 35% off Zumanity™ tickets at NYNY - 2-for-1 Drinks at BRAND Steakhouse at Monte Carlo - 2-for-1 Roller Coaster passes at NYNY - 2-for-1 Buffet at Monte Carlo - 2-for-1 ROK Vegas™ Nightclub Admission at NYNY - 2-for-1 II Fornaio Breakfast at NYNY - 2-for-1 Lance Burton tickets at Monte Carlo - 2-for-1 Spa admission at Monte Carlo Service: The hotel service was okay. The staff was friendly but not overly friendly. I was offered an upgrade to a suite for an extra $90/night. Ummm, no thanks! Room: The room was a decent size. We were located in the New Yorker Tower and had some strange noise throughout the entire stay. At first I thought it was the roller coaster but when the noice belted out I ran to the window to see if the coaster was rolling by but no such luck. It wasn't too annoying but did wake me up several times throughout the night. Places to Eat: There are several choices for food at this hotel. We ate at Chin Chin ($12-15pp) which was good, fresh Chinese cuisine. We also grabbed a couple of slices of pizza at Sirraros ($4 slice $15 whole pie). Gonzalez y Gonzalez was pretty good and quite resonably priced ($10-$15pp). There are several other places to eat such as ESPN Zone, and tons of places to snack... Ben n Jerry's, Starbucks... Location: The location of the hotel is great for strolling the south end of the Las Vegas Strip. Some of the close hotels are the Luxor, MGM, Monte Carlo (We ate their buffett as part of the 2-1 deal and it was GREAT. Loved the made to order Philly Cheesesteak sandwich.) Overall we had a positive experience. But given the choice, we will stay downtown at the Golden Nuggett. If you want to experience the Strip, this would be a good choice given the right deal.

Reviews.Title: “I enjoyed this place”
Reviews.Author: MrHawk_1101
Reviews.Content: We had stayed from Aug.29 to Sept.4.09. We booked the Summer Escape package that got us a Park Avenue Room with a few extras (2 for 1 on many coupons). Upon arrival, we were greeted by a warm front desk attendant Jessica. She had upgraded us to the Broadway Room on the 17th floor in the New Yorker Tower. There are many towers to the hotel, as it's designed like NY Skyscrapers. Broadway Room: The room was very spacious and had a great view of MGM, and the hotels around it (Hooters, Excalibur, Luxor, Tropican, Mandalay) and the roller coaster. Bed was firm and the sheets were alright. I think I found a cigarette burn, but I didn't pay too much attention to it (Noticed it on the last day). The bathroom was marbled floor and counter with a sliding shower door. An Armoire with coat hangers. My complaint was with the 25" tv approx 15-20 ft from the bed on an angle. Nothing major, since we didn't go to Vegas to spend time in our hotel room :). The room is about 450sq.ft about a bit bigger than the base room at MGM (Grand Tower). Food: We ate at the following places in NYNY Hotel. Il Fornaio (Breakfast) - Service was fairly fast. Had the Corned Beef Hash with poached eggs, while my gf had a veggie omelet. Both were excellent and very fresh. This was part of our deal and we got it at 2/1 deal. Sirrocos (Snack) - Typical pizza place, nothing special. Loaded pizza with toppings, wasn't as thin/crispy as I would like it to be. Ate here twice, was fairly satisfied. Greenbergs Deli - Rueben with Matzoh Ball Soup. Both meals were a great way to end my trip and left me mighty full for the day. America's - If you order the turkey burger here, please ensure it is fully cooked. I had to return mine once as it was still a bit red inside. However, the waitress was more than accommodating and offered us a bowl of Chicken Noodle Soup (very filling). If you are there and looking to eat on the cheap, take advantage of their cheap eats (AYCE Pancakes, 11.99 16oz Ribeye, 14.95 Ribeye/crab legs). I had the Ribeye and it was one of the better steaks I've had. The nachos as well are filling and loaded with your typical toppings. Casino: Always a machine available, casino seemed to be quite slow at times. A fair bit of tables ranging from $10 and up including a rapid roulette table that takes your credit card. Daily slot/blackjack tournaments if you are a players card member (Free to sign up). Drink service is fairly decent for a casino of that size (I've seen worse at MGM or Mandalay) and there's a cigarette lady walking around as well. Nightlife: Bar at Time's Square has dueling pianos which they take requests (for a tip) and will play your favourite songs. LOTS of fun and a group can have a great time. Did not check out the clubs as that's not my scene. Also if you are a beer lover, check out Pour 24. An amazing selection of beers from all over America. My favs are Alaskan Amber Ale and Black Butte. From what we were told, Zumanity is an "Erotic" show, so if this is not your type, look into Love or Ka or O. All of which you can get for a good deal at Tix At Half, located by Planet Hollywood. Overall I did enjoy my stay here at the hotel, more than I did at MGM. A lot less walking, more style and appeal to it for me. Pictures will be up soon, if you have any further questions, shoot me a line.

Reviews.Title: “This is not a "Four Star Hotel"”
Reviews.Author: JuniorTexas
Reviews.Content: This is not a "Four Star Hotel and these are the facts: 1. During registration the attendant failed to welcome us to the hotel, never addressed me as Sir or Mr., and did not take the time to answer my concerns or questions. Requested a single bed room when reservation was made, got a double bed. 2. Room: Room was spacious, with good storage. Mattress was comfortable, however, the bedspread on both beds had large cigarrette burns (in a non smoking room). Called housekeeping to have them replaced and it took two phone calls and over two hours to send an attendant. Desk chair seat had a soiled spot. All the furniture in the room looked old and scratched. The room did not smell clean. Carpet looked and felt dirty. 3. Bathroom: Found towels with holes. The towels were not neatly displayed or organized like you normally see in hotel rooms upon arrival. 4. Computer / Telephone Charges: Internet access $14.99 daily. Telephone charge $3.00 daily. Use of the computer at the business center to print boarding pass $5.00 minimum charge. Late check out $50.00 charge. No check out line available in the afternoon--I was sent to the back of the check-in line with about 20 people waiting to check-in. 5. Common areas (hallways and elevators): The up keep of the common areas was below average. Hallways were not vaccumed & full of debris, ashtrays not clean or empty by the elevators, and elevators were not clean. 6. Hotel Staff: The hotel staff was rude and unprofessional. They go to great lengths to make excuses instead of finding or offering solutions to the problems. This hotel is overrated and not a good value for the money. Other than good location, there is little to commend this hotel. I will not return to this hotel on my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad - better than expected”
Reviews.Author: charlie1213
Reviews.Content: Traveled over the Labor Day weekend- LOTS of people, but hotel was nice. Invited Casino Guest Check in which went very quickly. Friendly Staff. Room was on the 34th floor - if your scared of heights, I suggest not so high - kind of an uneasy feeling being so high in the air, but great view of the mountains. Room as nice, clean - larger than expected but bathroom was very small in comparison to the room. Could not sit on the toilet and close the door. Shower pressure was good and bathroom was clean. Bed was so-so, more on the harder side - windows were clean and the room was generally clean. Maid service did a nice job every day. Woud stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place, but ventilaiton needs improvement”
Reviews.Author: roadwarrior2000
Reviews.Content: First off, I should mention that the NYNY, Las Vegas is one of the nicer MGM Grand properties. The design and layout of the facility is much more convenient than the massive hotels like The Venetian where we stayed on our last trip. We arrived on Saturday evening of Labor Day weekend and upon check in were told that the non-smoking Park Avenue Deluxe room was unavailable, however they would upgrade us to a Broadway room - but would have to take smoking. This normally doesn't bug me too much, so agreed. However, the room really smelled bad, as did the whole casino. It was kind of a dank ashtray odor that permeated everything. Someone might say: "this is a casino, and you had a smoking room - what do you expect". My response would be that NYNY was a bit over the top. This is the first time I can remember being so affected by residual smoke, and ended up having sinus congestion, coughing, and other minor respiratory issues while trying to sleep. These issues would clear up as soon as I walked out of the building. The engineering department needs to work on the ventilation. I can't end this review without mentioning some of the nice positive things. The breakfast buffet at Chin-Chins was really good. The Chinese style eggs, fruits, meats, etc. were excellent. I also loved the foot long hotdogs, and authentic pastrami on rye at the Greenburgs Deli - just like it was made in New York City. I also should mention that the staff of the hotel were very helpful, courteous, and went out of their way to treat the customers with a personal touch.

Reviews.Title: “I Love This Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: KISHMOO
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located right in the heart of all of the happening hotels. Check in was very quick. Bed was very comfy and we had a view of the srip with no noise from the roller coaster. This was our second trip to Vegas and once again we had a blast. The first time we came to get married and party and we did just that. This time around we came for our one year anniversary and we got a great deal on our room. The room was on a very quiet floor with a ice maker in the room and the room was very clean. We got 20% off at four of the great restaurants inside the hotel and 25 dollars of free slot play. I especially love this hotel because it's not so big to where you get lost when you walk around. Pool is small, but you can go next door to the Monte Carlo where there is four pools including a lazy river. At check out use your T.V. instead of standing in line, it's fast and easy! As long as this hotel treat my husband and I like a King & Queen, we'll be back everytime!

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: iltje
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really average, there is nothing to be highly enthousiastic about. I have stayed in the Stratosphere before and this is pretty much like it. The rooms are fine, but make sure you book a park avenue room and not a skyline room since the skyline rooms were last remodeled in the iron age. We had a spacious room with a giant bathroom, but (although lovely decorated) very uncomfortable bed, the matress was way too firm. The pool is (as said before) too small, another downside is that is located between buildings what makes it impossible to get a little breeze. Being European, I dont really like big portions and lots of meat, but the restaurants in the nyny only provide food like that. To get some decent healthy food you will have to go to the MGM on the other side of the road. At checking in, the woman at the desk will probably ask you to provide a second credit card, but make sure to provide only 1. I made the mistake to give her 2 and a couple of days later i found out that they were both charged to the max. The hotel charged it back but i really didn't appreciate this 'measure against fraud' as the hotel calls it. People should stop complaining about the rollercoaster: it only runs from 10.00am till 00.00am and who goes to sleep before 00.00am in Las Vegas?! And you don't even here the coaster. But to be honest: it's better to spend a little more money and stay in a much better hotel like MGM/Bellagio or the Mirage. You will not regret this!

Reviews.Title: “OK Place”
Reviews.Author: rsolcz
Reviews.Content: We came to this hotel as a first-time experience, and we were a bit disappointed. You get a cheap room rate, but nothing is free: you have no mini fridge in a basic room; there are charges to use internet and the gym. The pool is rediculous. It's extremely small, looks like it was added last minute between the parking garage and the hotel. There are minimal lounge chairs, and most of them are reserved as part of the cabanas or special loungers for those who want to pay a fee. Plus, there was a smell of sewage that stuck around the pool. I wouldn't stay at this hotel unless you intend on gambling all the time. There is no way to relax here, and the hotel does everything possible to get you to spend money...If you want a nicer spot that allows you to relax,

Reviews.Title: “Great Place, Great Time, Good value!”
Reviews.Author: dnvrtrvlr
Reviews.Content: Pros: Clean room, comfortable beds, easy access to the strip, great staff Cons: Long walk to room, Long walk to the monorail. We went to New York New York after spending a night in Downtown at the Plaza. We arrived, checked in, and was immediately asked if we needed anything else. My friend and I wanted to see the Lion King at Mandalay Bay. We asked the front desk about it, and they found us seats at a great price and got us all setup. The walk to the elevators was pretty short as we used the Century ones to get to our room. We were on the 19th floor. The room was on the far end of the building, so the walk was a little far. When we got to the room (Park Ave Premium View), we were amazed. Nice amount of space, great view of MGM Grand, Tropicana, Planet Hollywood, and the coaster. The bathroom was nice, great space, marble flooring. We had 2 queen beds (very comfortable), a desk, 2 chairs, and a nice wall unit for a dresser and tv cabinet. Contrary to other reviews i've read, we didn't really hear the coaster much. could barely head people screaming when it was running. We didn't eat onsite except to grab a cinnamon pretzle from a kiosk near the sky bridges to MGM and Excalibur. It was great. My friend did fairly well on the slots. Checkout was a breeze. I did it on the TV. No issues at all. The roller coaster was amazingly fun, just be warned that you have to go through a long arcade to get to it.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great price, great location”
Reviews.Author: nicyontherun
Reviews.Content: The NY NY hotel is very nice. Rooms are very clean, modern and stylish. As it was our honeymoon we asked for a nice room and got on in the "Empire State Building" overlooking the Strip which was amazing. The furnitures were very comfortable, the bathroom small but modern and clean. We had a TV, a fridge, air-condition. Internet access was available but you have to pay for it. They also chare your 3$ per day for the phone even if you dont use it. The shampoos, body lotion, soaps of the hotel were very nice and the towels clean and nice. Great things were: the location: you are in the middle of the Strip but you dont hear the noise at night in your hotel room. There is a nice restaurant area in the hotel where you can find all sort of restaurants in a nice Greenwich village atmosphere. Fish at the fish and chips shop was just great and so fresh... :-) Prices are ok, you can eat cheap or very expensive it is up to you. There is a pool but it looks pretty small, didnt go there. Staff at the hotel was very nice and we felt welcomed. Next time we will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: hoosiermom65
Reviews.Content: This place is really nice... And for the money it was great.. We took our parents with us and it was really affordable. Make sure you check for discounts. Can't wait to go back again... The only thing is we told them it was our honeymoon and they didn't have anything in our room like champagne or some candy, flowers. Just something!!!! But over all it was a wonderful trip for all of us. None of us won any money but we had a great time... Love the Zumanity Show. Great time...

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: CharChar69
Reviews.Content: We stayed at New York New York Hotel and Casino on August 20-24/09. We arrived in Las Vegas at 9 am local time, and we were unable to check in until 3 pm. We left our luggage at the Bell Hop Desk, and it was perfect. We toured around Las Vegas for a few hours, and when we returned we checked in with ease, and picked up our luggage in minutes. The Hotel was nice, millions spent on the interior to make it resemble New York. The night club ROK was ok alot of younger people, but that is to be expected i guess. They were running a promotion while we were there, that gave us free entry to the night club and free drinks for the ladies. I think the guys had to pay a $25.00 cover charge to get in. We only ate one meal in the hotel itself, and it was extremely disappointing. We ordered burgers from the "American Diner" in the hotel and it was disgusting!!!! It was very obvious that they did not make it fresh to order, as it was so dry and you could barely choke it down. We demanded a refund, and they reluctantly gave it to us. Only big complaint about the hotel is that there is no buffet. A number of different restaurants, but no buffet. So we only ate one meal there. Our room was clean and comfortable. We had an ice maker right in our room, no coffee maker though. I suppose it is because they want you to go downstairs to star bucks and pay $5.00 for a coffee. A coffee and a muffin was almost $9.00. Casino is huge, we didn't check out the pool at all, as there were too many things to see, in such a short time. Our room was cleaned everyday. FYI, don't leave your change on the night stand, the cleaning lady might think it is a tip!!! I left about $10.00 in change on the night stand, and the cleaning lady took it. It was no big deal. Just a little surprising. LOL Check out was smooth, and again we left our luggage with the Concierge, as we had to check out at 1 pm and our flight wasn't leaving until 6. A tip for you, you can get a late check out for free.......check out is 11 and just for asking they gave us a late check out at 1 pm.

Reviews.Title: “Tight Slots but good service & food!”
Reviews.Author: Lucky854
Reviews.Content: Hi, We just came back from Las Vegas, our stay was at NYNY, had rental car so we were able to drive to all the different hotels and play there too. Everything was great at NYNY, however we were disappointed with the choices of slot machines. Our favorite is Wheel of Fortune, which we found at other hotels. Slots at NYNY we found were very tight, not to many of our favorites there, like the quarter Top Dollar, they had dollars which is 3.00 a pull, some spin and win, really didn't find any favorite to play . MGM has the wheel of Gold, which is like WOF. It would be great if they brought the Wheel of Fortune back, I'm sure it hurts them. In the other hotels you have to wait for people to get off, they are the most popular slot. Restaurants were great! Accomodations were great!

Reviews.Title: “Fab hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ccjsw
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights on the 28th floor of the "Century" block. Biggest room of whole holiday (there were 5 of us), clean and fantastic views from our double aspect room. Location of New York, New York was great and the Boys enjoyed the roller coaster ride on the outside of the building (this was half price to residents between 11am and 12pm.) Only negative comment is that there was no information book for visitors in the room with details of where to eat or which floor the pool was on etc

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: frome99
Reviews.Content: A very friendly front desk attendant upgraded us to a beautiful room with an extremely spacious bathroom on a high floor, which gave us fantastic views over Las Vegas. Having spent the next night at the much more expensive Venetian Hotel, I can honestly affirm that what you get at the New York New York is excellent value for money, no big difference with higher class hotels that cost three times as much. Would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Good Budget Fun Place to stay in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: WorldRoamer59
Reviews.Content: My niece & I stayed her for three nights about 2 weeks ago. We were on the 10th floor in the New Yorker tower and as we had booked this trip through United Airlines Vacations we were upgraded to a Park Avenue room. The room was very clean & spacious with two double beds, room safe, TV, MP3 player plug-in and a view overlooking the MGM Grand and part of The Strip. The bathroom had a bath with shower attachment and solid sliding shower doors on the bath - pressure to the shower was very good and all the usual toiletries were provided as well as ample towels & face cloth. There was a vending macine and ice point on our floor and an ice bucket was provided in our room. Wi-fi and hard wired internet was available although you didi have t o pay for this. No complaints about the room at all - we were very comfortable during our stay although we did not spend too much time in it - just showering between various tourist visits and for sleeping. The rest of the hotel was a real WOW factor for us - being our first time in Las Vegas we were absolutely gobsmacked with the entrance, the casino and the decor throughout. We really felt as if we were part of the gambling capital of the world and it exceeded all our expectations. The choice of dining within was very good - posh or fast food - make your choice and the prices were very reasonable. The Italian restaurant IL FORNAIO was so good that we ate there for two evenings - the second time after we had been through the Excelsior and Luxor looking for something to eat but nothing appealed. The food and service was exceptional and although there was a queue on both nights to get in - this moved very fast. The pool area was well kept and big enough. The casino had a good variety of slots and other gambling available and was very lively. Our check-in went very smoothly and we did not have to wait long at all (it was a Monday that we checked-in) and the reception staff were always very helpful when we asked any questions. We used the ground transport service (SHOWTIME) which you will see as soon as you go out of the arrivals door onto the airport concourse - there are several ground transport companies there. We booked a return ticket with them as it was slightly cheaper to do so - you call them back when you check in to your hotel to arrange your return pick-up time; we had trouble getting through to them because they had a fault on their phones but eventually we did get through and the chap I spoke to was very curtious and booked our return with no problems at all. I beleive that if there are more than 2 of you travelling it is cheaper to get a taxi - we paid about USD 15 each for our return fare. I cannot think of anything negative to say about New York New York - the location is very good, rooms are clean and staff very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel & Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Rocky_Mountain069
Reviews.Content: We stayed at New York New York - and were pretty much impressed by everything. Unfortunately, they couldn't accommodate our entire stay - which forced us to move across the street to The Excalibur (which is about as opposite from New York New York as you can get - see our review). - The check in queue, while long, went reasonably quick. - Our room was spacious, clean, modern, and quite honestly more than we expected. We overlooked the pool area and the roller coaster. - The hotel is a smoking establishment (like all the casinos on the strip). So, if you have sensitivities to the smell of smoke, Las Vegas might not be a place you should consider. - The pool was spacious, clean, and guarded. Plus, you get access to the Monte Carlo pool as well (must be owned by the same group). - The restaurants, pubs, bars, and other eating establishments in the hotel are a bit pricey (but it's that way it is in any of the hotels). - Parking was ample, covered, and free with quick access to the hotel. - It was reasonably central - next to The Monte Carlo, across the street from MGM Grand, and The Excalibur. - The roller coaster is pretty crazy. And, as a guest of the hotel, you can get a 2 for 1 ride (which saves you about $15). Overall, I'd recommend New York New York as a fine place to stay on the Las Vegas Strip.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here. Go elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: Todders728
Reviews.Content: I stayed two nights previously at the Bellagio for business, and extended my stay to see Zumanity which is why we stayed at New York New York. Checkout at NYNY is 11AM. Our flight was at 2. We inquired at checkin about checking out 1 hour late and told it shouldn't be an issue to call the day of. We were also offered an upgrade for $55 of a room with a hot tub. The room was OK. Since we had just been at Bellagio, it was a let down, but that was to be expected. When we called down the next morning to request a 1 hour late checkout we were told no. I went to the front desk to checkout at 11am and was told by Deanna, the manager that, "I obviously didn't understand her housekeeping issues." She further explained that they had an expected arrival for the next guest of 12PM and the room would not be ready for them. I asked what check-in time was for the hotel and she stated 3PM. Bottom line is the priority was to get the next guest in before the check in time rather than giving me a late check out. I have traveled quite a bit and often request a late check out. I have never been denied a late checkout when it was requested for a single hour. Additionally, the elevators are painfully slow and the food is not great.

Reviews.Title: “Very good memories”
Reviews.Author: Rodukas
Reviews.Content: Spent a nice moment in this hotel. The pool is a bit small compared to Mandalay Bay; but we were completely swallowed by NY mood.

Reviews.Title: “Does what it says on the tin.”
Reviews.Author: MalyManchester
Reviews.Content: Arrived after a trans Atlantic flight - check in really smooth and fast (Saturday evening). Hotel fulfilled our expectations of a Las Vegas resort - although no tea or coffee making facilities in the room was rather dissapointing (especially as the coffee we could get in the hotel was poor). Did have a fantastic Turkey Club Sandwich from Greenburgs (?) Deli. Room on the third floor round the corner from the lift - no issues with noise at any time. Got to the pool early, so no issue with loungers - pool was in shade for a good two hours (which is nice when it is roasting) Didn't gamble (I know, strange!) so couldn't comment on the tables.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: cycobomber
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 weeks in Vegas which was no where near long enough. People said we were mad for going for so long but already in process of returning in 2010. 1st 5 nights was at stratosphere, the last 8 nights were at NYNY. Can not find any faults with this place. The room was nice with a strip/rollercoaster view. Staff were friendly rooms well serviced. Toilet was blocked when we arrived at the room but was fixed within minutes of calling the front desk. Awesome location in relation to the strip. Loved Coyote Ugly and the Piano bar, and sampled some of the food. Had breakfast a few times at (name escapes me) the place with the giant map on the roof. Awesom food and service. Thank you to staff at NYNY for assisting in a great stay on our Honeymoon and first trip out of Australia. Willl deffinatly be back

Reviews.Title: “First time - not last”
Reviews.Author: bossladyTexas
