Reviews.Content: People, people, why in the world would anyone take small children to LV??? Please look at the faces of these small creatures at 1am while you are dragging them thru a casino. If they look bored, then you should have taken them to Disneyworld. Save LV for an adult weekend and leave the kids with grandma. Traveled midweek with 5 others. first time at NYNY - wonderful room - don't remember the tower. view of a roof and roller coaster. roller coaster sounded like thunder at night or maybe an airplane taking off from airport - no big problem. halls quiet and no noise from other rooms. elevator wait was minimal. tables were wonderful - won big on 2 different ones. all dealers were friendly and helpful. drink service was good - after you tip $5 the first time, they come back often for another big tip. tip $1 then another 5 - still cheaper than buying the bar drinks. Rooms cleaned very well each day, leaving $10 tip for maid. i sunburn easily, so i don't do pools. ate at nine fine irishmen - wonderful food all around. tried itilian/french - too foo foo for me but others enjoyed it. chin chin buffet - very good, great price but limited selection. Charged food to room and was comped. They don’t comp the tip on your tabs, so that was charged to credit card. They also don’t comp gift shop purchases. Ask first if you’re not sure. stay away from the criss angel show at luxor at any cost. we had free tickets and they still weren't worth it. cheesy at best. easy access to MGM and Excalibur. both casinos good and you can find $5 tables at almost all the casinos on the strip early or very late. It is a far walk to any other casinos, but it doesn’t matter where you stay, it’s just a far walk especially in 105 degree heat. Timeshare people only approach couples, if you see them, separate and they will leave you alone. Wonderful first stay and definitely will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Best Casino in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: ekuhns
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. Very quiet upstairs but so much going on downstairs!

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as previous reviews, but not great”
Reviews.Author: Paul113
Reviews.Content: They seriously need to recruit some check-in staff. Huge queues to check in and when we got there and eventhough we booked a non smoking room 4 months ago and it was a Monday, there was apparently not a no smoking room available in the whole hotel! In the end we got a smoking room which didnt actually smell of smoke, but bad impression made. Rest of stay uneventful. Needless to say, we used the TV online check out to get out. Good 2 for 1 on the rollercoaster for guests. Pool OK.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: davidjoe
Reviews.Content: the hotel was amazing the rooms were very clean , you have a great variety of food from all over the world , didnt hear the casino in the room , very clean lift's ect , very helpful staff , good value for money .

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel with a perfect location, value for money!”
Reviews.Author: HolidayQueen82
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to go for a 5 night break to Las Vegas and wasn't sure where to stay as this was the first time we were visitng sin city. I definetly made the right decision in choosing this hotel and bagged a bargain booking directly with the hotel. When we arrived we were welcomed with smiles at reception and as it was our anniversary the hotel kindly gave us a room that was spacious and on level 26 giving us views to admire of Las Vegas. Our rooms were cleaned daily by the maid and beds were made up to, the only thing that lacked in the Broadway Room was there were no Tea/Coffee Facilities or a Mini Bar to get a quick drink or snack to eat. The bathroom was nice and clean and also had a powerful hairdryer that I didnt need to take with me. Also you can use the room telephone to ring local numbers and will not be charged any extra as you already pay $3.00 per night compulsory. The food at the hotel was awesome, one of the nights we had an italian and I have not tasted anything like it before, we also ate at a burger place and enjoyed the amazing food - if you want something cheap and cheerful then there is a place within the hotel that is open till 3am it does the biggest, freshest and cheapest pizza's ever. So thumbs up to the food in the hotel too. The location was perfect for my husand and I as we were at the top end of the main Strip and had the MGM Grand Hotel, The Excalibur, Luxor and Mandaly Bay around us and then each evening we use to walk down the strip to get to Ceasers Palace, Bellagio, Venetian Hotels and many more. The New York New York Hotel is breathtaking itself as it has tall buildings and so much to do just inside as well as outside, the casino is really big inside and they have several bars, shops, and clubs. The pool is fairly busy but in July its too hot to sunbathe so many people do find themselves under some shade or in the pool. We both enjoyed the roller coaster at the hotel so make sure you definetly do this during your stay and visit the Ben and Jerrys own store to enjoy a lovely ice cream. I would advise to take light clothing in July, plenty of Suncream and sunglasses, it is very hot, the tempertaures were around 46 degrees each day. Also you can make Las Vegas as cheap as you want or expensive as you want so just spend with your means and you will still have a fatastic time. You won't make a mistake booking this hotel as my husband and I enjoyed our stay and would definetly go back.

Reviews.Title: “15 Year Anniversary Celebration”
Reviews.Author: MAMMAOF5
Reviews.Content: NEW YORK NEW YORK was a fun place to stay. The location was good if you plan on walking the strip. The set up is lively with plenty of restuarants & gift shops. Downside was the pool closing at 7:00pm. Guess they prefer you spend your time in the casino. This was disappointing since even tho we live in Tampa, Fl with a beach 10 miles away, we wanted to enjoy the pool in the evening & just relax with some drinks & no worries. Checking in was nerve-racking due to the fact that we arrived at 11:00pm, there were about 20 people in line to check in & only 2 people at the front desk! Our reservation was made a month in advance but we ended up in a room with 2 queen beds instead of 1 king. The room was very cramped. We finally got a different room the next day, which was a little better. Our stay was good once we got settled. We had a view of the strip, which was quite a beautiful sight at night. Overall, we enjoyed our 4 day stay, renewing our vows, celebrating 15 yrs.of marriage.

Reviews.Title: “Nonexistent customer service at check in/front desk Nightshift”
Reviews.Author: nuclearsun
Reviews.Content: Arrived at 1am, 1 desk clerk working, she was busy "texting" behind the counter....after being given an occupied room, opted to stay at MGM even with my room paid for at NY NY. Manager stated no rooms available at NY NY with the exception of the occupied one...no thanks. MGM was great, hated to drop the extra $100, but had to sleep. Summary, had reservation and confirmation #, yet still ended up with no room. Had to drop an extra $100 at MGM to sleep there... Once back at NY NY the following day, had great service and decent room thanks to dayshift front desk clerk named "MARY" she is the only reason we even stayed.

Reviews.Title: “Above average is expected”
Reviews.Author: GatsbysOdyssey
Reviews.Content: The New York New York in my opinion is an average hotel in Vegas. I've stayed at quite a few of them and it doesn't really merit writing an exceptional review. We were on a lengthy road trip, extremely tired, and in the mood for cheap food. We got our room for $99/night, and slept for 17 hours when we first arrived. We spent two nights here, the hotel in general is typical in my opinion. Nothing stands out. I would suggest staying here for the cheap(er) food & having a roller coaster outside isn't all that bad either.

Reviews.Title: “A fun place to stay.... so Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: jac2028
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for four nights in September of 08. The place was what one expects from Vegas; fun, lively, entertaining. If I was paying it probably would have been a little expensive but luckily I was there on business. The hotel is great for pretty much anyone but more oriented towards familities. The pool is a little small for Vegas standards and the bar scene wasn't great. Also as is typicaly for a casino the pool and fitness rooms close early (around 6pm I think). The casino floor is great and there are lots of cute little shops and fun things to do inside of the casino (like a roller coaster=$15/ride). But this hotel is a little far up the strip - close to the Excalibur and MGM Grande also a but of a hike from the closest train stop as well. If I was going back I'd probably try to go for one of the other casinos like the Palms or even Caesars as they have better shopping, are mid-strip, and have cooler bars.

Reviews.Title: “A fun hotel and casino with great food options."”
Reviews.Author: Crash412
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at NYNY and I really enjoyed it. I'd previously stayed at MGM Grand and TI (Treasure Island), and NYNY was equal to or better than those two (and I have nothing bad to say about either one!). We came for a wedding of 2 friends, and many of their other friends also stayed at NYNY, and this is how it really shined. It's many restaurants and bars offered us ample meeting places. ESPNZone became our de facto headquarters, and I enjoyed great food and drink at Nine Fine Irishmen. 24 Pour offered a good beer selection 24 hours a day, and the Bar at Times Square was a fun piano bar to hang out at.. Even the pizza we grabbed from a stand on the casino floor was excellent and we enjoyed a great late-night meal at "America", its 24-hour restaurant. (I highly recommend the Mac & Cheese) The casino staff seemed very friendly, particularly at the sports book, where they took the time to explain to us how the odds worked and to bet against the spread. Our room was attractive but unspectacular, but was comfortable and very clean. We had a view of the roller coaster and worried about noise. It was not an issue for us, though I speculate it may have been noisy for patrons further down our floor. The casino has a very nice fitness center attached to its spa. It's $20/day to use, comparable to or cheaper than the gyms at the other Vegas hotels I've been to. Discounted multi-day passes are available, and I believe it's included if you purchase spa treatments. Selection of fitness/weightlifting equipment was very good and the treadmill I used was nice. Temperature of the fitness center was a bit high for my personal comfort level. NY NY's only real drawback, in my opinion, is its location near far south end of the Strip. If you plan to spend most of your time at NY NY, Excalibur, MGM Grand, Luxor, Monte Carlo, and Mandalay Bay, it's perfect. Be prepared to hike or take cabs or the monorail from MGM if you prefer things in the middle or north end of the strip. Overall, we had a great experience with this hotel and casino, and I would definately consider it for future Vegas trips, especially if going as part of a larger group.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but at a price”
Reviews.Author: appleton1909
Reviews.Content: Stayed here about 5 nights. Hard to fault it really - it has similar weaknesses to other resorts on the Strip I think. The room was well furnished with quality furniture and a nice comfy yet contemporary theme to it. The bathroom was decorated nicely. Housekeeping did a good job keeping the room clean. I did order room service a few times. The pricing is a little steep (no suprise there) but I guess my complaint would be the portions were too large. I'd have been happier if they charged me less and got less as a result. The two things I really didn't like though: Long queues at reception to either check in or out (although from what I hear this is common at most resorts on the Strip). No self-service laundry on site No good coffee to go (Starbucks is not good enough even with double shots of espresso!) The staff at the counter and the porters were professional - some more friendly than others. I regret not giving a bigger tip to the bellhop who helped me, had I known he was the exception. Sorry!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: krissiejade
Reviews.Content: Stayed at New York New York with a friend and loved it. The rooms are very big. modern and exceptionally clean. Towels, sheets and amenities were all replaced daily. There are plenty of places to eat in the hotel but it's always best to venture out and try other hotels. Location wise, it is toward to south end of the strip but within easy walking distance of everything. The monorail also goes from MGM which is across the road. Can't wait to go back for another trip soon....

Reviews.Title: “Great theming, good room, over crowded public areas of hotel”
Reviews.Author: Joliet_Scooter
Reviews.Content: Decided to stay at the New York New York due to the interesting architecture, ambiance of the casino, and theme of the hotel. Further it was a reasonable price for the room (mid-pricing level for the strip). We stayed for 7 nights so I our experience was a bit longer than most. So first the good: Whoever said the walk from the parking deck was long must have been 90 and carrying an oxygen bottle. It was EXACTLY 100 paces from the vestibule of the parking deck (entrance to ENCLOSED walkway is on 3rd floor of parking deck) to the actual hotel and another 30 paces to the escalator which drops you right next to the registration desk. Registration was quick (Friday afternoon, approx. 3PM PST) and effortless. They had all the right information, including the rate and gave us a room on the 20th floor of the Century Tower (closest tower to the registration desk, I might add). Room 2077 was a bit far from the elevators, but they'd asked us what we wanted and I chose to be farther away from the noise of the elevators. And it was QUIET! The room (Park Avenue room) was no better/bigger than you would get at a Courtyard, but we also didn't pay more than you would at a Courtyard. Room was clean, smoke free (requested), appointments were appropriate and comfortable, and maid service was EXCELLENT! Despite not getting enough shampoo towards the end of my stay, they were quick, polite, and very courteous. We called for a 2nd blanket the first day and it was delivered within 10 minutes. I'd say that the "hotel" part of the property is fabulous! As for two restaurants worth mentioning, Greenberg's deli was great for lunch and Scirraco's pizza was awesome (even for a Chicagoan who loves his deep dish!). Dueling Pianos at Times Square was fun! Rollicking good time! I'd suggest paying the extra $$ to get preferred seating if you plan on being there a long time. Now for the bad: The other restaurants are overrated and have very odd hours (can't get a donut at Stadium Snacks until after 11AM??!?!?). Hotdog stand not open late to get a quick dog, nachos, or pretzel. The breakfast buffet at Chin Chin's was very VERY disappointing! Very small selections, no omelet bar, pastries were VERY stale; not a deal at $16 per. Il Fornaio (shop, not restaurant) was okay for something quick (bagel, croissant) but not great. ESPN Zone was terrible. No other way to describe it (if I wanted a microwaved hamburger, I'd have done it myself!). Chin Chin's (dinner) was a glorified (and expensive) Panda Express, and the waiter could have cared less whether we were there or not. America is adequate for breakfast, but pass for all other meals (soup was COLD!). The pool is SMALL!!! I MEAN SMALL!!! DID I MENTION THE POOL IS VERY SMALL???Other than the hottub, no other amenities at the pool except for a volleyball net spanning the middle, making it difficult for anyone to do laps. It's also mostly shaded, not much sun hitting the pool area. Note that they post that no outside food/beverages will be allowed, however I brought (4) small bottles of water in with us and nobody gave me any grief. The casino has nice atmosphere (open, high ceilings so you don't feel claustrophobic) and unique design. Sports TV's over each table is nice touch. Cocktail waitresses come by often when playing at the tables (not so much at the machines). Dealers, however, were quite rude, not caring whether you were there or not. Not fun (Excalibur Blackjack dealer-Jimmy....HE was fun!!!). Didn't tip too often (despite playing Pai Gow for about 6 hours one night). Shopping stinks unless you want Harley gear or cheap Vegas souvineirs One word sums up the NYNY, however: CROWDED! "Streets"/aisles are too narrow to get around without bumping into EVERYONE! By day 5, couldn't take it anymore. (Why would you put a post for the roller coaster right in the middle of two popular food stands and on the way to the main bathrooms?!!??) Way too many people crowding into that place. Need to figure out some crowd control/traffic control. Overall: Hotel good. Casino: Overcrowded Restaurants: Poor

Reviews.Title: “Hotel in good location on strip with Great Rooms and facilities”
Reviews.Author: SAKT
Reviews.Content: We had a whole group of people stay here in April 09. While we did not get rooms near each other and some were on different floors. We soon organised a central meeting place for when we were hanging out together. The rooms are fantastic!! Large, with everything you need. Every room seems to have a different view. We used the Deuce bus a lot for getting down the strip. While it was slow, we found that was sometimes helpful as we got talking with people and they gave us tips on what they liked and did not. Recommend - Sunset helicopter flight over Grand Canyon. Quicky Wedding Ceremony under Las Vegas sign. (was quick and painless)

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: wonderwomanEssex
Reviews.Content: Fab hotel - must go on the roller coaster.central hotel on the main strip visit the piano bar inside the hotel.Pay 1 dollar and the guy will play anything you want to listen to( drinks can be expensive but they do great cocktails).The apple bar is a great bar to visit inside the hotel with a live band playing..

Reviews.Title: “new york new york hotel las vegas”
Reviews.Author: claireeponting
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the hotel for 3 nights and initially disappointed with the quietness down the bottom end of the strip, however, the hotel itself was full of fun loving happy people who were there to have a good time! Four of us travelled to Vegas and stayed in one room, which was big enough for all four girlies to get ready! The American Bar/Diner serves good food and is pretty cheap for beer compared to other places and has a happy hour. The Irish Bar inside was very quiet, expensive and even though most of the tables were empty we were told we couldn't sit down and had to stand at the bar with our drink! Apparently the tables are for diners only!! We went to the Grand Canyon for one night and then came back to Vegas and had 3 nights in the Bellagio, which I must say was in an excellent position in the middle of the strip but it lacked the fun of the New York New York and we all wished that we had stayed there!!!! Vegas is a must do trip but it's all hotel based and can get tedious walking from each of them. The roller coaster ride at the New York New York is expensive both you have to do it.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Reviews. Casino Atmosphere A+ , Rooms Subpar”
Reviews.Author: vegasfanNj
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this Hotel twice. Both times they offered from upgrade to Park Avenue room. For some reason I always wound up with SMALLEST room on floor. Due to the shape of the facade on the outside the hotel has a weird shape inside. Also of note is that some rooms have a pink covering over the windows to distort your view. This to make the exterior look nice but not from the inside. Had to change my room twice because of issues. Overcharged my credit card and could not refund my money. Had to wait nearly a week before charge came off. Very small rooms. On the plus side the casino is very nice. Has a nice atmosphere and usally the play is very good. Nice places to eat such as Gonzalez Y Gonzalez and Nine Fine Irishman. You will be HARRASSED by Consolidated Resorts trying to sell you a time share at Tahiti Village. There freebies are bogus and they are relentless. They are all over NYNY, Monte Carlo and Tropicana. DO NOT GET SUCKERED in. I made that unfortunate error on my first visit to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “worst hotel ever never stay here”
Reviews.Author: starheaven808
Reviews.Content: Hi I just thought everyone should know never to stay at this hotel. It was the worst service I have ever experienced. We booked 3 rooms total. The first thing that happened was the quote that we booked this hotel at was wrong and it took forever to figure out so the first hour of our trip was spent at the front desk. When we finally got the keys the room that one of us went to was in the basement! All the windows were blacked out and it felt like a prison. So we went back up to trade rooms they gave us another room but when we got there it was dirty! So we went back down and they said that they would clean it but that it would take 2 hours. So we waited 2 hours and when we went back up it was still dirty! They did upgrade the room but we basically wasted a good amount of time dealing with this. The second thing that happened was in our room. We had gone to bed late but were awakened at 8am by drilling and hammering above our room. We tried to sleep through it but it was ridiculous so I called the front desk to ask them to stop because we were sleeping she told us she would take care of it. It stops and then starts again after 5 minutes. They didn't even give us a call to let us know what was happening! Long story short we got compensated one day and moved rooms. This would've been good but when we went down to pay for the rooms they charged us more for the rooms then they quoted like $30 more per day per room because they average the room rates. Also the third room we got did not lock properly and we also passed people in the hall whose room keys did not work and had to go down to front desk to have it fixed. If you want a comfortable relaxing vacation DO NOT STAY HERE!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: kimberlee44us
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the New York New York for 3 nights and I was very impressed with the service and the room. We were given an upgrade (even though they 'don't give complimentary upgrades') because one of my friends was celebrating her new singlehood and the room was great. I was not pleased, however, with the lack of a coffee maker in the room. I have never heard of a hotel room without a coffee maker, but I guess the hotel wanted us to shell out $3 for a cup of coffee in the casino food court area. The location was perfect, and the club in the casino (Rok) put us on the list and gave us wrist bands for free drinks until 12:30 because we were celebrating. The hotel and its employees were not pretentious and overall we had a great time. However, the drink service in the casion was awful. We had to wave down a waitress every time, and they only came over to us 1 out of 5 times. One round of drinnks was great, but the second time our gin and tonics were pure tonic and were not worth the $4 tip we gave our waitress.

Reviews.Title: “New York was great for us!”
Reviews.Author: 2vaca
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I spent three nights at New York New York. We had a Park Avenue room on the 31st floor of the Century Tower. Our room was clean and bathroom was spotless. Each day our room was cleaned perfectly...they even arranged the shoes I had left on the floor in a nice row. We could hear the rollercoaster in the distance, but it stopped at midnight. It never bothered us at all. We ate Il Fornaio for breakfast two mornings...once at the restaurant and once at the take out. Both were great experiences. The coffee was strong and delicious. The service was excellent. We found the location to be handy. The Deuce bus stopped very nearby, and we used it quite a bit. We would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Will Not stay again”
Reviews.Author: leahy_wi
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed there on our first ever trip to Las Vegas. Our room was $114.00 a night for small room and small/UNCLEAN bathroom. The towels were like sand paper. We had to pay a $3.00 a day phone charge for a phone I did not use one time I was there. So, for $114.00 a night we got a room and all there "accomodations". Accomodations being this, a small pool, only 4 feet deep, just in the middle where there was a Volleyball game going on all the time so you could not get to it. So I had to swim in the 3 feet deep part of the pool. The pool and hot tubs were dirty. There were leaves in all of the hot tubs. The pool is only open from 9a.m. to 7 p.m. in June and July, only open to 7pm. Other accommodations, a work out room that you had to pay $25.00 a day to use or go with out. A casino, I would not call that accommodation. A Roller Coaster that is $14.00 a person for one 3 min ride. $14.00 a day to use the high speed internet in your room or go with out. There are no accommodations at the New York New York. You pay $114 a night for a small dirty room and a small dirty pool. We had drinks at the over priest casino bar, the bar stuff was very rude. They were not the only people of stuff there that were rude. I will never stay there again. There are so many nicer hotels on the strip to stay at in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel prices, average accomodations”
Reviews.Author: mrstarheel
Reviews.Content: I can honestly say that this hotel is average. I would mirror the room accomodations as ones that you'd get at a Holiday Inn. The bath towels were like sandpaper; the shower products were cheap, the shower/bathtub needs to be updated (we had water squirting on the ceiling from the head). Check-in consisted of at least 1 person working the desk and at best 3 people...it took longer than your average hotel check-in. We stayed in the Park Avenue Stripview room (and upgrade from the Skyline). Our view was of the roller coaster, Tropicana, and Excalibur. The last time we visited we stayed at the MGM Grand so I think that set the bar pretty high. The tenders at the bar on the floor of the casino were rude; I can't come up with a justification for them being that way...they weren't really busy. Dining this time was like eating at McDonalds versus The Ivy....spend the extra money....when it comes to food cheaper isn't always better. The next time we come we won't stay here; it's not our style.

Reviews.Title: “Would Definitely Stay Here Again!”
Reviews.Author: Windsurfer27
Reviews.Content: My family and I just returned from a 2 week long road trip vacation to California from Alberta. Our first stop was Pocatello and our next stay was New York New York in Las Vegas. We got a great deal on this hotel and didn’t have to pay extra person charges for our daughters which was a real bonus. Our check in was quick and easy and our room was very good. It was quite large in that we could lay out all our stuff and still move around comfortably. Liked the theme and feel of the casino and the look of it especially as we had our daughters (17 and 14) with us. We have no complaints and would definitely stay there again-especially if they continue to waive the extra person fees

Reviews.Title: “Not a hotel I'd stay at again!”
Reviews.Author: Tripgoer101
Reviews.Content: Last year we went to the NY NY hotel casino for a week. This was strictly for leisure and fun. The good part about the hotel is the location is on the strip. The bad part is you have a noisy roller coaster going for hours and hours. Let me walk you through our stay... we arrive and ask for a nice room. We are given one but the walls are so thin that I hear the squeaking of the elevator all night. We ask to be moved and I still hear an elevator in another room. Then, I try to upgrade and get a better room hoping the room problem will be solved....nope! The guy at the front desk tells us no need to go look at the room that we will like it. WELL, nice enough he gives us a room RIGHT next to the roller coaster and the lights to light up the hotel are outside our window. So, we spent a bunch of extra money to see a concrete slab and bright lights. I spent the next half hour crying. I've been to Vegas 3 times and this was the worst experience I've ever had. On my other trips I was easily given a wonderful view of the strip at both Treasure Island and Mandalay bay. Also, the room smelled like Eucalyptus or something. I started having major allergy issues that week and after reading another review on here about the carpet stuff they use that caused that person allergy issues, well, I'm not sure I'll ever set foot in that hotel ever again. I laid sick all week in the hotel listening to a roller coaster and people screaming on it. Annoyingly enough, one of the doors that leads to and from the strip have solicitors trying to sell you things. We had a couples massage, but the lady had to lead me in a robe through the workout area, which I didn't care for. Also, there should be a no cell phone policy in the spa. As soon as I started to relax another client walked in and started talking on her cell phone so loud she could have woke the dead. Not my idea of a great stay! In the future I hope that when they tell someone at the front desk that they will like the room....they won't be lying! This was the worst view he could have given us, but we were tired of changing rooms and being unhappy. I try to erase this stay in Vegas from my memory.

Reviews.Title: “good location exciting for young adults good value”
Reviews.Author: kayc63
Reviews.Content: Had a pleasant stay, young adults in the family loved the hotel theme and its location. Plenty of food to choose from on site, easy walking to MGM, LUXOR,. Had Booked 2 rooms, requiring one room to have 2 doubles. This was not available at check in, and we were checking in an hour or 2 early and they gave us a free upgrade for this room. It was huge. Good value and location. Pleasant staff at check in. Kayc63

Reviews.Title: “Plenty to eat, drink and Gamble on, but No Poker room”
Reviews.Author: YorkyPudd
Reviews.Content: My wife and I, along with my youngest son (24) stayed at NY NY between 17th June - 1st July 2009. We asked if we could have a free upgrade and was told it would cost $15 dollars a day, no joy there then. Asking for a quiet room we got room 603 in the New Yorker Tower. This room was at the back of the hotel, and when I say at the back, I mean at the back. Clean tidy, with a safe but no fridge and views of the Roller Coaster and Car Park. The walk from the Lifts to the room was a seemingly endless slalom through the winding corridor, I read about the Roller Coaster before we booked, people said it was reasonably quiet ... they lied, or were not in or near our room. The Pool area seemed to be in the shade when we wanted to be there, however they have a reciprical agreement with the Monte Carlo and we spent our Pool time there. I wanted to play Poker and could not believe I had booked into a Hotel with no live Poker Room. so once again the benefit was to the Monte Carlo , or across the Skywalk to the MGM Grand. Food was good and varied, didn't gamble much as we found we did that elsewhere after playing Poker. Only for the reasons of no Poker room, and the Roller Coaster I feel I could not wholeheartedly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Value not worth the dirt”
Reviews.Author: decemberlady
Reviews.Content: Our experience started off at this hotel at check in. The line was winding, and their computer system was down. The wait to check in was 45 minutes. The room was on the small side. Entering the small bathroom we found a dried up lime on the floor from whoever stayed prior to us.The floor was dirty, visable dirt in all the corners. Some of the grout on the tiled floor was white, while most was black with dirt. One day the maid left her pink duster on our bed. Was that a hint for us to clean. The temperature in the room was hard to regulate, it was either to hot or to cold. The pool is small and shaded by the buidling, making the pool very cool in the morning. The whirlpools were nice, except they were not working all the time. For the first two days of our stay, there were still having problems with their computer system.So if you just happened to get lucky and win on a slot, the ticket cahs out machines were not working.You had to take the ticket to the cashier, whom complained she had to take care of these. Would we stay here again, NO.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel, but could be better”
Reviews.Author: DanielJW
Reviews.Content: This was my third trip to Las Vegas and I wanted something a little different from the same old, same old hotel, mainly because I was taking a friend who had never been to Vegas before. So, of all the hotel/casino's on the strip, the only one that really stands out is NY-NY! Check in was relatively painless, but then I had already booked one of the best rooms in advanced. The room was fantastic, with a large LCD TV, two huge queen sized beds, a large bathroom with shower, safe and limited cupboard space. The room was attractively decorated in neutral colours and the beds comfortable. The hotel/casino it self is amazing, with a cut down version of New York, with loads of fast food outlets, a few bars (Time Sq is probably the best) and restaurants. However, as the ceiling is painted black, the lighting low and with crazy coloured carpet, it can feel a bit depressing and will make you want to get out and go to another casino after a short time. As NY-NY is at the southern edge of the strip, it is a bit of a walk to get to places such as the Bellagio, but fairly easy at the right time of year. All in all it's not a bad hotel, would recommend it, but don't ask the desk to do anything more than just checking in or checking out, especially if you lose something.

Reviews.Title: “My money was stolen!”
Reviews.Author: Chiquitita-Texas
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked a room at NY NY in Las Vegas and decided to change rooms. The room was tiny and we heard the roller coaster constantly. We called the front desk and were given another room. When we left, we forgot our items (jewlery, camera and $600) in the room safe. We remembered 5 minutes after we left and notified the front desk. They told us we had to go down and get a temporary key since our keys would no longer work. My husband went down and they kept him waiting for 30 minutes. They finally told him that they had already checked out the room to someone else and we could not enter the room without the new occupants permission. (no one was answering in the old room). I finally asked to speak to a manager and she told me security would meet me at the room to open the safe. When I got to the room, a desk clerk came running to tell me that security had already opened the safe and my items were at security. When I went to claim them they told me there was no cash, only jewlery and my camera. I complained to everybody but no one listened. I told them security should not have opened the safe without me present, but they said another security person was present. They would not give me any names or explain anything to me. They treated me like a liar and told me they had no liability. They never returned my money. I will never go to this horrible hotel again. The only ones that could have accessed the safe was security since no one else knew the code I had put. Their customer service is awful!

Reviews.Title: “I had a great time!”
Reviews.Author: Shy2Fly
Reviews.Content: Arrived at NYNY in the evening. Check in was very straight forward, we were upgraded without asking and at no extra cost which was a nice surprise. Our room had a view of the MGM with the mountains in the background - lovely. The TV was very old, and the selection of channels limited however we weren't there to watch TV so this was a minor comment. The bathroom was clean, large, the shower was ideal (not the pathetic trickle I've experienced in some hotels), and there was plenty of shelf space to store our toiletries. The service at the hotel was great. We had difficulty operating the safe (those who had vacated the room before us had not left it unlocked). We called reception and within 10 minutes someone was up to fix it, including joking with us that we could split the contents (there was nothing in it though!). My bag was delayed and I received a voice message (as I was out of the room at the time of the call) to say that my bag had arrived. I called the baggage desk and again within 10 minutes my bag was delivered to the room. Room service was another pleasant experience (although the charges added were very high - as is the case with most places in fairness). Food was lovely, large portions, and was delivered within 40 minutes (we were advised of this when we ordered). One thing to note is that the hotel is the $21 phone charge that was applied ($3 per day for a 7 day stay). I used the phone three times (to check up on my bag), and obviously there would be a charge for that but it appears this charge applies regardless. $21 is not a big deal, however when you are in Vegas you may have gambled all your money away before checkout! The location of this hotel is not perfect, but its not awful either. There is a bit of walking involved if you want to go to the Mirgage/Ceasers etc (about 30 minutes, but the heat is impactful). There are plenty of air conditioned casinos along the way that you can pop into to cool down. Overall I think this hotel is great, although I would be tempted to stay further down the strip next time. For tourists please note: I looked online into buying tickets for a few shows and the prices were very high. There are numerous "Tickets for Less" booths along the strip that offer great deals. Of the two shows we attended we had great seats.

Reviews.Title: “Turn back time”
Reviews.Author: KTVirginia
Reviews.Content: I usually don't write Trip Advisor reviews for chain or generally well-known hotels since I doubt I can contribute much that hasn't been said, but am reviewing the NY NY in order to note that it appears to have gone slightly downhill in the last few years. I stayed in the NY NY once in 2003 and it was great - exactly on par with the Paris - one of Vegas's really fun "theme" hotel/casinos. I stayed again in 2009 only to find best part of the casino area had been completely ripped out (the Central Park themed bridge and trees) and replaced with abstract gaudy neon swirls and a pit of slot machines. The New York theme was pretty much lost as a result (though once you venture out of the casino area into the restaurant section, the theme becomes evident again with the tenement style buildings, delis, pizzarias, etc.). The rooms are spotless but haven't been updated (e.g., projection TVs). However, the price did reflect this decline (at $79, the room was about $40 cheaper per night than the Paris). As an aside, it seems like Vegas, generally, is moving away from theme hotels/casinos like the NY NY, Paris, Venetian, etc. to just super-luxury (the Wynn, etc) and the action is moving further north on the Strip. The bottom line is the NY NY was a great value (very clean with good location and fair pricing), but it's a bit disappointing to see it starting to decline, even if the price has been adjusted accordingly. By all means, stay there for the value and gamble elsewhere in a more fun/luxurious environment.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but not awesome”
Reviews.Author: Philipgk
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at 8 or 9 mega casinos over the past couple years I'd have to say NY NY was middle of the pack. Overall clean and comfortable but nothing special. I didn't wait long to check in or out, the people were all reasonbly nice, the casino and bars were fine (though Coyote Ugly was obnoxiously loud and crowded. The free pass to get in was nice.) There just wasn't anything to make me say wow I need to go back. I thought Ghallagars steakhouse was going to be it but it too was just OK. Not terrible but nowhere near Delmonicos at Alladin. The pool is small and noisy with the roller coaster but the wait staff there are nice and prompt. I just wish something made me say WOW!!

Reviews.Title: “No complaints, good value”
Reviews.Author: Diana5241
Reviews.Content: Our stay at NYNY was very pleasant. We booked through MGM Vacations which included a complementary upgrade to a Park Avenue room (didn't try the $20 trick - from reviews I read online they haven't accepted it in 2009). We were offered to upgrade to a Spa Suite for $50/night extra but declined. The room was sufficient but on the smaller side... can't imagine what their "basic" room is like! I will say the bathroom was amazing. The shower had PERFECT water pressure and a huge sink to spread out all our "stuff". That was probably the best part of the room! We did mention on our reservation that we were celebrating our 1-year anniversary and without asking received a beautiful south-looking strip view.... basically looking out over the statue of liberty's head. That was a very nice gift from the hotel! We did use the pool one afternoon and had a great time. It's smaller, but not as "basic" as some reviewers make it out to be. I've stayed at the Flamingo two other times, so I can say this is not the best pool, but we were able to get chairs (we went out about 2:30pm...after we'd lost our money for the day!) and were even talked into a game of pool volleyball. Drinks are expensive, but as to be expected (we brought waterbottles of our own mixes, but those ran out before we left). We didn't try the Monte Carlo pool, but overall the area at NYNY exceeded my expectations. We ate three times at the hotel - Americana for breakfast which had good food but was a bit too expensive for our taste (about $40 for two pancakes and two coffees), the Hot Dog shop which was quick and tasty, and the pizza joint, Sirrico's Pizza. This was the BEST value! $17 for a large, doughy pizza which served as dinner one night and breakfast the next (hey! we're young). OH- we also had ice cream scoops at Ben & Jerry's which were huge and a nice splurge to end our vacation. The location of NYNY was just "ok" for us. We spent some time at MGM and Planet Hollywood, which are a quick walk, but the majority of our visit we were farther north (Bellagio, Ceasers, Venetian) and up to Fremont St. Next time we'll stay higher up the strip so we're not spending 40 min walking every time we leave the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel casino”
Reviews.Author: tasmaniabula
Reviews.Content: before we went read some bad reviews about thishotel casino,my wife and myself and freinds thought it was great,staff were freindly rooms clean,every thing you needed was there if you did leave the casino afoot bridge took you to the mandalay bay excalibur luxor casinos,some people must be very hard to please we loved it and would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “We were disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: chuckg2
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the NY-NY Hotel after receiving an internet offer for an upgraded room at a rate lower than the rates offered at our favorite hotels (Paris, Plazzo, and The Hard Rock). Check-in took about 30 minutes due to only one counter being open. There were approx. 20 people in line when we arrived at 2:00pm, but when the line increased to about 40 people they opened 6 more counters. The room on the 25th floor overlooking the pool was clean, the bed was very comfortable and had a partial view of the Las Vegas Strip. The room could only be described as average, however, being very small with a small bathroom. We could observe the roller coaster from our window, passing by every few minutes, but could not hear it so it was not a problem at night. We also didn't hear any noise from the adjoining rooms that previous reviewers had complained about. We did have a problem both nights with the DRUNKS in the hallways returning to their rooms around 3:00am yelling, laughing, singing, trying to open our door with their cardkeys, slamming doors, and anything else they could do to make sure everyone was awake. Our major complaint about the hotel was the casino. This hotel, as well as several others seems to have removed the traditional types of slot machines (with bars, cherries, jackpots, etc.) and replaced them with newer video game types of machines. Even if we could figure out how to play these new video machines they require larger bets, so instead of losing 1-3 credits each time, you now can lose 15-375 credits each time. (The casinos switched over their slot machines a few years ago to accepting only currency and not accepting coins). Our second complaint was the old style television in the room. Also the selection of channels was very limited. (We didn't go to Las Vegas to watch TV, but it would have been nice to have FOX News, and HBO/Showtime movie channels like the hotels provide). All these changes in the casino caused us to do our gambling at other casinos, thereby causing the NY-NY to lose our business at their restaurants, souvenier shops, shows, etc. We highly recommend the Mon Ami Gabi restaurant at the Paris Hotel. The prices are very reasonable by Las Vegas standards, the food is great, and if you request a table outside on the patio (go after dark, because of the summer heat) you get a great view of the water fountain show across the street at the Bellagio Hotel). One major improvement at the NY-NY (as well as the Paris and the Rio) was that they seem to have gotten rid of the annoying "Time Share" sales people that endlessly harrassed the hotel guests and visitors. We keep hearing how the bad economy is hurting Las Vegas, but the crowds on the sidewalks at night are still there (even during mid-week). Maybe the visitors are staying outside enjoying the free sights, rathering than venturing inside the casinos to try and figure out the new confusing slot machines.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the NYNY”
Reviews.Author: happy_honeymooners09
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the NYNY for 4 days and had a great time. Check-in was efficient and the staff was very friendly. We had a Park Avenue room on the 26th floor of the New Yorker tower and it was very clean and quiet. The towels were a bit old, but they were clean. We didn't spend a lot of time gambling in the casino - the space was small compared to some of the others on the strip. The location on the strip is not optimal - you have to walk through a construction zone and past some small seedy strip malls to get to the action in the middle of the strip. We enjoyed the atmosphere of the Times square food court area. We ate at Fornaio and Gonzalez Y Gonzalez - both were good. The Chin Chin breakfast buffet was not bad, but could have had more choices (and the coffee was awful compared to the Fornaio). We checked out the pool one morning - unfortunately it doesn't get the sun until later in the day so we didn't stay there long. There was also a strange sewer smell sometimes (maybe it's near their garbage?), but we seemed to be the only people bothered by this so maybe it depends on which pool chairs you pick. We didn't check out the nightlife there as we tended to be out in the evenings, but the piano bar seemed to be very popular. All-in-all it was a nice hotel and we would probably stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed NYNY, but not entirely convinced to come back.”
Reviews.Author: lisaq42
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Luxor in February and on that trip checked out NYNY and liked its atmosphere so much that we decided to stay there instead of Luxor again in June. Likes: *Lots of places to eat in the NY "streets" *Speed that the elevators came, as compared to Luxor *Flat screen tvs at the bar showing sports, also if you play the video poker at the bar, the bartenders are loose with the comped drinks *Easy access to all major casinos via monorail at MGM (it's not necessary to take a cab to say, Flamingo if you just take the Monorail) *Good drink service most of the time at the gaming tables and slots *Good players card rewards- one room was comped for 7 hours of table play! *Room quality was fine, it faced the roller coaster and it was fine, the noise wasn't bad at all *Room service was extraordinarily quick, came in 10 mins on Sunday AM *Easy access to airport since it is on the corner of Las Vegas Blvd and Tropicana Dislikes: *Bathtub was too high, made getting in and out for a shower difficult and no vent or fan in the bathroom *TV was 19" and closed captioning button was stuck so it was always on *Rips on both bed spreads (we had booked a king room and checked in at 3:30 and they were sold out so we got 2 Queens instead) *Make up mirror was falling off the wall in sink vanity area *Dealers were almost 100% unfriendly and not talkative with the exception of one or two who were immediately rotated out for breaks *Nine Fine Irishman pub had a nice atmosphere but charged $7.50 for less than a full pint *Pillows were terrible in the room- they were feather pillows and one was over stuffed and the other totally flat, and the bed sheet was too short for the bed, very strange. We would stay at NYNY again over Luxor but next trip we will stay center strip at another MGM property.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad...fun time”
Reviews.Author: kakabrasil
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fine for the price. Check-in process was average. Room was clean. We had a smoking room...and it definitely smelled like it. No windows for ventilation but being a smoker, we would have to accept that. Used the room only to sleep so didnt need extravagance - it served its purpose. Check out was super easy. Only bad thing i hated was that the doors are loud! you can hear other people's door closing and opening. EVen the bathroom door was loud. The hotel had lost of restaurants and amentities. Pool was small but its Vegas - i did not expect sprawling beaches or huge pool. It was crowded but we never had a problem finding a couple of lounge chairs -just had to look and drag one to the other. Food was good. Again, its vegas so dont expect anything cheap. Casino is FABULOUS. Its the whole reason of going to vegas right? I liked it better than MGM. overall, great time. TIP: get players card if you plan on gambling. You can get good comps like a free meal, free cigarettes, etc. But you have to ask.

Reviews.Title: “overpriced,poor security,loud mouthed guests and over rated!”
Reviews.Author: dolphinboy1
Reviews.Content: we stayed at new york new york for 6 nights (after a week down town) we had booked a "marquise "suite and had paid over a $1100 for the 6 nights. we checked in at about 3pm and were given our key and told where to find the suite. when we got there and went into it there was still someones possesions totaly lalid out all over the place, including some valuble items. we locked the door and went back down to reception to complain. they then after a heated discussion with a very rude male receptionist about security.(apparently the guys in the suite we had just been in were 5pm checkout) when we finally got back upstairs, the "suite" was nothing more than a large room, it had the basics in it and bar the jaccuzzi, nothing else, not even a mini bar. the view was over the roof facing the strip. on the thursday in the suite next to us we had a load of loud women who were shouting and screaming at 4 am, someone had already called security up and they had been warned but to no avail, and the friday night it happened all over again. the saturday morning we were due to fly out so, we were up early and really gave it some, we deliberatly had the tv on as loud as poss and banged drawers and cupboards loud too! hope next door enjoyed the return favour. i would not go again, if you were in suite 2354 on june 07th (sunday) then, we were in your suite, courstesy of extremely poor security. if you were in suite 1953 then you have the biggest mouths ive ever heard and tape(pref over the mouth) would be good for you!

Reviews.Title: “Penthouse Suite”
Reviews.Author: Mishka
Reviews.Content: Stayed here, with my wife, the first week of January. We had booked this, about 11 months in advance. We reserved one of the Penthouse Suites (NOT the Ziggurat Suites). We stayed on the 33rd floor. Our penthouse unit, was in the shape, of, an upside down "U". Upon entering the foyer, there is a guest bathroom, off to the right (simply a toilet, and sink). Continuing forward, there is a bar/kitchenette area, and, a sofa to the right. Making a left turn, there is the living room/dining room. Nothing spectacular. Proceeding through a door, and to the left, is the bedroom. In the bedroom, is a jacuzzi tub. Then, there is the master bathroom, which is actually divided into 2 rooms. The shower is amazing. The water pressure on that high a floor, is usually like turning on a kitchen faucet. This shower had NO trouble. Then, there are his/her sinks. Finally, in it's own little separate room, is the toilet and bidet. One of the bonuses to staying in a Penthouse Suite, is the VIP check-in & lounge. Seeing as it was our honeymoon, and, first time to Vegas, the concierges in that lounge were very helpful in getting us limos, tickets to all the Cirque shows, helicopter tours, etc. Plus, since our "VIP Host" made the reservations, we were always allowed on the "VIP" lines, at the other hotels. You can read about the casino in all the other reviews. I'd probably stay here again, but, I doubt I could get another Penthouse Suite (they seem to have withdrawn them, as an option on the reservation site).

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: zebellajolie
Reviews.Content: I had been hesitant to stay at this hotel because I thought because of the reasonable prices they may cut back on accomadations. I was so wrong! It was a wonderful experience from check-in, to accommadations, restaurants, entertainment and the rooms. The pricing was great, customer service was excellent, the bars (Nine Fine Irishman highly recommended!) was great. We are going back again in two weeks and have booked with them again!

Reviews.Title: “What a fun hotel!”
Reviews.Author: jrenville
Reviews.Content: This hotel was really great! The casino has a really fun atmosphere. There are tons of cute little shops, and resturants that are built around a New York neighborhood theme, I am a very visual person, and this was just candy to my eyes, all the little nooks and crannies, and things to look at. They also have an arcade upstairs that was really fun. Our room was right by the rollercoaster and we did not have any problem what so ever with the noise. I believe it stops around midnight anyway, and we weren't really in our room before that. The room was nice, we got a complimentary upgrade. It was really big, and the bed was king size. Everything was very clean. The staff was great. I really don't have anything negative to say about the hotel. It is not as big as some of the others (MGM, Ceasars), but it was just right. I never once felt lost. Once you get the layout of the casino, you are good. Now, I have been to Vegas before and stayed at the Mandalay Bay (that hotel was awesome too), but for this price this hotel is one of my favorites. The location on the strip was pretty good too. I would definitely stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: elys79
Reviews.Content: It's not the best hotel in Las Vegas, but it's got a huge charm. Some of the rooms look oldy, but I switched the room after first night into better one... Casino is not the huge one, but it's nice and you can have fun pretty much. Bakeries and bars are just fine...We liked our stay there very much. But, if you are looking for some kind of luxury and have a good deal there, go to Wynn or Encore... Roller coaster, pretzels and cinnemon rolls are great...

Reviews.Title: “Best BDAY PLACE”
Reviews.Author: b4west
Reviews.Content: I booked two rooms for 2 nights at the NY NY hotel and casino. It was the perfect place to celebrate my 25 bday. The front desk was very nice, we had to wait for the rooms to be cleaned - but they offered us drink vouchers and upgraded our rooms. The best part was that we didnt need to leave the casino - we were 8 of us - and everybody wanted different things/bars/clubs/slot machines - all located under the same roof. NYNY is the perfect place for Las Vegas style partying!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: jperri1
Reviews.Content: So I stayed at NY NY May 31st to June 4 and I have to say that this place was awesome. Customer Service was OK, Ive had better. Check- In took about 10min and the front desk clerk was very helpful and efficiant. She gave us a map and told us where everything was. This was my 3rd trip to Las Vegas and I have stayed at Bellagio and Ceasars Palace so I know luxury. I stayed in a Park Avenue Deluxe Strip View room and It was just like the pictures. Very updated and just enough space. We did have a mini fridge in the bathroom and that is one thing that most people said this hotel did not have. The bed was very comfortable and the room was very clean. The casino area is very large and there is so much to see and it can get a bit confusing. But if you follow the signs you will always find what you need. The few places that we did eat were very good. Drinks come very slow when your gambling, I was only asked if I wanted a drink about 3 times my entire stay. The pool is small but there was an abundance of lounge chairs, and if you get out there early enough and try and get a spot on the side of pool opposite of the bar you get great sun around 11am while many other areas get little to no sun. All in all I would highly recommend this hotel. Im planning on staying here again in the next few months. It was completly worth the money that I spent. I hope this is helpful to anybody looking for a cheap, but nice and fun place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “what a pathetic place”
Reviews.Author: girlsfromVancouver
Reviews.Content: This was our girl /Birthday's 2nd stay at the hotel, the 1st time we stayed there we got a update room to die for, it was huge! All we asked for was a update and we got it. This time a whole different story, the cleark told us that half the floors were closed due to the economy yet she still would't update us to a nicer room go figure you would think they would be doing whatever it took to keep their guest happy so we would return! She put us in a room so far away from the elevators it took 5 mins to get to your room!! We will never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Well, we're booked to stay again in 2 weeks...”
Reviews.Author: AmyJoDetroit
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very nice. Last year when we were there, they had a little bit of construction going on but it was really no bother. The ground floor was rockin the sound of those one arm bandit armies but the rooms were extra quiet. The steak house at NYNY is AMAZING! If you eat there, they will offer to take your picture (self, significant other, family, friends, whatever) - they probably charged us an arm & a leg for the picture but it was and is the one purchase from that trip I wouldn't take back for anything. I don't know if it's still there but Nathan's Hot Dogs was there by the arcade - we went every night. The arcade is cool if you've reached your $ limit but still can't sleep. Good slots 2!

Reviews.Title: “What a dump!”
Reviews.Author: puzzler50
Reviews.Content: Halls were dirty, furnishings and carpet need to be replaced. No coffeemaker in the room. Tray from room service sat in the hall for over 24 hours before being picked up. The blanket on the bed needed to be replaced or at least cleaned-it gave me the creeps. Bathroom was fine but towels were thin. The casino was the most unappealing of all we went into and we visited many. Would never stay here again and do not recommend.

Reviews.Title: “It's a Casino...with a hotel”
Reviews.Author: DEK2000
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 3 nights during a mid-week business trip in early May. I'm not going to get into reviewing the casino aspect of the hotel because I'm sure most people are familiar with Vegas and all that casino's have to offer. Upon entering the hotel for the first time I was somewhat confused where the check-in was as all I could see were slot machines. After wandering around for a few minutes, I found it. The check-in staff was quick and friendly and gave me a map of the casino/hotel and pointed me in the direction of the elevators. There are several towers in this hotel so it was a little confusing at first which set of elevators to take. The room was pretty standard, but at the mid-week rate of $79 it was a steal. No coffee maker in the room, but other than that I had no complaints. It was clean and the shower had excellent water pressure. The hotel offers wireless internet for $14.99 per day which I had to use for my business. The meeting room area was very nice and wi-fi did work in the rooms, which was nice. I've stayed in some hotels before where the hotel wi-fi does not work in the meeting rooms Depending on what tower you are staying in, the meeting rooms can be a hike to get to. During 15 minute breaks you have to move quickly if you want to get to your room and back. Although this is nothing new as my experience staying in the Rio was similar. Overall, the hotel was great, the casino offered a ton of different restaurants to choose from and staff was helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, convenient location, would stay again”
Reviews.Author: polarbear123
Reviews.Content: Got a great rate on the hotel through my Players Club card. Check in was a breeze. Rooms: Upside: Great View. Stayed in a Park Ave Room. We overlooked MGM, Excalibur, Tropicana and the airport no extra charge. Room was very comfortable. The bed was nice and the room was clean. It was a handicap room, so there wasn't a bath tub but the shower was nice and newly renovated. Close to the elevator. Downsides: I had asked for a smoking room and got a non smoking one. My boyfriend, the smoker, said he didn't care because of the great view. In the bathroom the marble floors got a little slick when wet though and the grout lines were deep and hurt a little to stand on. The safe was locked when we checked into the room so we needed to call maintenance to open it up. That took at most 10 minutes and the man was very pleasant. You could hear the hallway noise but it was not overly loud or disturbing. Actually reminded me of hotels in "real" NY. Casino: NYNY had a nice fun atmosphere. The casino wasn't too big or too small. The dealers were friendly and the minimums were reasonable even on the weekends. Slots seemed to be paying off. We didn't win much but we saw quite a few hit when we were going around. Pool: The pool was on the small side and didn't get sun until around noon. During the week it was fairly empty. But all in all it was nice enough. 3 hot tubs were nice as well. Could have gone to Monte Carlo to use their pool as they are partnering up for the summer, but didn't make it over there. Food and Drink: We ate at America and Nine Fine Irishmen. America was average but the service was friendly. I would compare it to any casual dining restaurant. Nine Fine Irishment was a cute pub and the burgers were good. We also went to the dueling piano bar to watch the game and then stuck around for the entertainment. Drinks were regular Vegas prices. Pizza place was good for a late bite to eat as well. Next time we definitely want to try Gallaghers. Location: One of the best locations I've stayed at. The walkway connects with MGM where you can take the monorail to the North end of the strip. The other walkway connects to Excalibur and you can take the tram down to Mandalay Bay. Definitely would stay here again. Ride the Roller Coaster. Get a coupon online for a discount.

Reviews.Title: “Endless Fun!”
Reviews.Author: global_traveler0924
Reviews.Content: Arriving at the NY NY is an experience in itself, the outside of the hotel is incredible with all of the realistic New York buildings, especially with the roller coaster (which was one of the main reasons I chose to stay there) winding itself through the faux skyscrapers! My stay was outstanding, I printed off some coupons off of www.destinationcoupons.com for the roller coaster, and got $4.00 off my ticket. That wasn't enough for me though, so I printed off another coupon for 4 passes and 2 photos for only $56.00. The service was great, there is non-stop action all around, and for so little money! Through that same website, I found a promotional offer and ended up staying for around $ 85.00 a night! Not to mention the impressive, gigantic casino! I would reccommend this hotel to anyone, I'd definitely even say that it's family friendly.

Reviews.Title: “VEGAS BABY!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: eddie14418
Reviews.Content: Vegas speaks for itself! We have gone during the week and also during the weekends. We stayed at the Stratosphere and New York New York. I HIGHLY recommend New York New York. Its a very nice hotel, very central to everything, and it has some really great restaurants and the pub "Nine Fine Irishmen" is outstanding! I would recommend visiting during the middle or early week. The weekend brings a ton of visitors, and it becomes more difficult to enjoy many of the attractions Vegas has to offer, not to mention gambling minimums go up. Look for deals on food and entertainment. They're out there, you just have to look. You may want to ask the hotel you are staying at if they have anything. One little tid-bit is for a really good deal, go to the pool at the Hard Rock Hotel. You don't have to be a guest to use it, just pay the $25 and you can stay there all day! Its a really nice place. Also a great place to gamble.

Reviews.Title: “Fun and convenient location. Good value for the money.”
Reviews.Author: WWGB
Reviews.Content: We got a good price on an airfare/hotel package for our second trip to Las Vegas. The check-in line was short on a Thursday night. Our first room was noisy due to being near an elevator. The next day we moved to a quieter room on a higher floor with no problems or additional charge. Both rooms were clean and comfortable. My wife enjoyed using the spa. We both enjoyed the roller coaster ride. Neither of us checked out the pool. Food and service were great at Il Fornaio. Service was slow at Pour 24 and the Players Club desk. There were two Starbucks plus a counter that sold Krispy Kreme donuts. There were many other counter service and sit-down restaurants that we didn't have a chance to try. All of the bars seemed busy Thursday through Saturday nights. The location is great with walkways across the street to MGM Grand and Excalibur. The NYNY was a fun hotel with clean, comfortable rooms, and we would consider staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Not staying here again...”
Reviews.Author: orkoapprentice
Reviews.Content: Nor will I be staying at any other associated property. It took them 5 hours to clean up feces (you read that right) from just outside of my room. I had to call the front desk twice to deal with the issue, as the first time housekeeping couldn't find it, so they just sprayed air freshener. I had to find the source of the odor myself and tell them where it was. And joy of joys, it was on a trash can next to the pool elevator. While waiting for them to finally get rid of it, a homeless man came in, stole food from my neighbor's room service cart, and then proceeded to attack the ice machine. I had to call security 2 times, and had to wait 10 hours to be moved to another room. Bonus here, they still didn't catch the guy. After I told them I didn't want to stay another night, they offered me a $20 credit. I'm glad that my personal security and smelling someone's feces for 5 hours is only worth $20 to them. For the minor stuff, the shower head was broken, I called maintenance and they completely replaced it. There was white crap all over the floor, which housekeeping took care of well after I had checked in, and only because the maintenance guy called them. Do yourself a favor, and find something cheaper. Preferably someone who cleans up feces immediately.

Reviews.Title: “Overall Average, coffee in the room would've been nice...read on...”
Reviews.Author: Heather-Ford
Reviews.Content: We were not in our room long enough to really criticize it. But I do have 2 disappointing things to say about it. If you wake up early like myself and enjoy a morning coffee – you have 2 choices….you can either go to the star bucks downstairs and pay $4.00 a coffee for a small, or you can walk 2 blocks to McDonalds and get a coffee. Having no coffee maker in your room in my opinion is bad. Even budget hotels have mini coffee makers in the room. Is the hotel that hard up for money that they can’t give their customers a small perk like that? My other beef was no fridge in the room. As hot as it is in Vegas, getting back to your room to have a cold bottle of water or beer is nice. We bought a case of beer for the room, and had to put it on ice every day. Good thing we brought a soft cooler. We used it at the pool every day. The pool, good luck getting a chair. If your lucky, and get one, good for you. We filled the cooler with booze every day (no glass aloud), and made our own drinks at the pool. On our 4th day there, we were told we were not suppose to do that as it took business away from the pool bar (8 beers in a bucket of ice was 30 bucks….come on, I can buy 2 cases of beer for that price). I said we had been doing this for 4 days and you’re just telling us now that we can’t bring our own booze down to the pool. Needless to say, we finished what was in our cooler, and left. They told me it was a min of one drink per person at a time for personal booze to be brought down to the pool. Like I’m going to go up to my room on the 30th floor just to refill my cup…NOT! We did eat at a couple of great restaurants while in Vegas. Wolf Gang Puck’s in the MGM Grande. – 5 ***** stars The Buffett at Planet Hollywood on weekends has a great buffet, all you can eat seafood (including Alaskan king crab legs) get them steamed for you as they are cold. The Monte Carlo’s buffet was poor.  The ESPN restaurant in NY NY is great. Try the smokehouse burger. I swear it is worth every penny for it. My husband ate 3 of them during the 4 days were stayed. Wear your running shoes a lot for just walking the strip. Your feet will thank you. If you are staying more than 2 days, get a bus pass. It will cost you 15 dollars for 3 days worth. This way you can go downtown to Fremont Street, or go to the outlet mall, or just take the bus ½ way down the strip and walk back to your hotel. (or 7 dollars for 24hour pass) We saw “BELIEVE” ~ Chris Angel ~ It was great. This plays at the luxor hotel. He is hot in person. !!! Other than that, enjoy your trip to Vegas, The city that never sleeps  Oh, I forgot to mention, our room was so far from the elevator, I would suggest asking for a room somewhat close….you’ll be sorry if your stuck at least a 5 minute walk from your room to it. Our friends couldn’t believe how far away our room was. The hotel is deceiving…

Reviews.Title: “Only Had One Night”
Reviews.Author: PhoenixTravelJunky
Reviews.Content: We only had one night in Vegas and we stayed at the New York New York. We had a room near the the top of the Chrysler Tower. $200 for a Saturday night. It was very nice. We were very happy with the location on the strip and the hotel was very accommodating to us. It's just a fun place to be. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Some things are perfect and some things got renovated”
Reviews.Author: wardlec
Reviews.Content: We went during a time that they were renovating the casino. I was a little sad about that since the reason I keep coming back to stay there is the NY city theme. The old casino used to have central park trees and times square lights. Now they have removed all this to give way to the new modern flair. While the gaming is still excellent and the restaurants and bars still have the same great feel, I can't help but miss that roulette in central park.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Place to Stay & Play”
Reviews.Author: Carol07
Reviews.Content: Visited 5-14-09 thru 5-18-09; girl's weekend to celebrate my daughter's 21st birthday. I have been to Las Vegas 3 times in the past 8 years and this was the first time I stayed at the NY NY. A family member had recommeded it. I booked three rooms back in February for this weekend. I had signed up on their website to receive email specials and booked at a very good rate. Our rooms ranged from $65 on Thursday to $149 for Saturday. Of course you always pay more on the weekends. We checked in around 7:30pm; had to wait about 25minutes. Not sure why they didn't have more staff on hand but it wasn't too bad. The staff were quick and friendly. We had a Park Avenue room, a step up from their standard Skyline room. The room was non-smoking with 2 queen beds which were very comfortable. Plenty of room for two people. The bathroom was also large, all marble with a shower and tub. The vanity is in the bathroom. My only complaint about the bathroom is that the tub did not have a safety bar, the tub was a bit high and slippery. I would recommend if you travel with an elder, you ask for a tub mat. I agree with other reviews, all the rooms should have a coffee pot. I did request a room away from the elevator and roller coaster. We were on the back side of the building, two small windows overlooked the parking garage. It was quite a walk to and from the elevator but pretty quiet. I never heard the roller coaster at all. It is only supposed to run from 11am to 11pm. The rooms were clean and maid service prompt. No complaints there. In other reviews, I noticed people stating how big this hotel/casino is. As far as Vegas hotels go, this one is average. I think the casino floor is smaller than many others. The atmosphere is very cute. The shops & restaurants do resemble the streets of NY. Greenberg's Deli is a must if you like good ole fashion sandwiches. I prefer the hot corn beef on rye. For $8.00 you get a huge sandwich and they have a great potato salad. Plenty of food for two to split. The French bakery is to die for. Wonderful pasteries and sandwiches & soups. And of course, there is a Starbucks on the "street" corner. We ate the American a few times. $3.50 for a coffe was a bit much, but the food was very good as well as the service. Breakfasts run around $10.00. From the outside it looks small, but the restaurant opens up and is very large. A must see is the US map on the ceiling. Another must is the dualing piano bar. There is a cover charge and drinks are bit pricey also but alot of fun. If you call ahead and reserve a table, the cover charge is $25.00pp, but for special occasions it is woth it. Of course, be prepared; they will only honor your song request if it is attached to a $20 or better..! Several of the bars do have happy hour specials. Be sure to check those out at the NY Ny. We actually visited the Mandalay Bay hotel and went to the Rum Jungle for a happy hour. Their jungle juice was very tasty..!! The Monte Carlo Brew House Pub has a good happy hour also. You can choose from a list of $5 beverages and appetizers. We ordered all five appetizers and fed 5 people. Very good food and portions. I had 4 sky vodka cosmos and for $20.00..!! This bar has several big screen tvs to kick back and watch the games. A good place to visit. The pool is not one of top rated in Vegas. Be prepared, it is on the back side of the hotel and at this time of year, the sun hit the pool area around 11:00am. But to get a chair, you must be down there at 9:00 when they open. The Monte Carlo is an affilate with NY NY, and your room key will work in their pool also. The Monte Carlo is across the street and does have 3 pools, not real big ones, but a bigger area. Again, get there right when the pool opens for a chair. The NY NY is a good place to stay. I would recommend it. The staff was pleasant, the rooms clean and had alot of fun ammendities. I would stay here again only if the price was right. I agree with other reviews, it is at the south end of the strip.

Reviews.Title: “What a Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bandit1969
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the New York New York for six nights in the middle of May 2009. Managed to get an upgrade for the Hotel Room. 28th floor overlooking the Strip, which was a good size and kept very clean. The Art Deco look was excellent throughout. Casino are was one of the best out of all the ones seen mainly due to the very high ceilings allowing the Air Conditioning to work correctly not directly in your face. Pool was ok if not a little crowded causing a lack of sun loungers. All restaurants were good. Avoid ROK nightclub - Rip off on entry and very disappointing once inside. Bar at Times Square is a must with dueling Piano's great entertainment. Nine Fine Irishmen pub is good if not a little repetitive on the fiddly dee music. Careful on prices for drinks especialy Vodka and Red Bull. Coyote Ugly is ok but you will only need to visit the once. Manhatton Express Rollercoaster is a must. Overall would not hesitate to recommend and would re-book on a return to the mad world of Vegas.....

Reviews.Title: “Average stay in a huge hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rupak
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located right on the famed Las Vegas strip and it takes just around 7-8 mins from the airport. Each way taxi would cost around $ 10 excluding tips. The hotel is located at the southern part of the strip and is just across MGM Grand hotel. The hotel is a huge structure in itself and the facade is a replica of New York Skyline right with the Statue of Liberty in front! Being right on the strip, transportation is not an issue at all. The Deuce Shuttle stop is just in front of the hotel and the monorail stop is just a short distance walk on the backside of MGM Grand hotel. The area around the hotel is quite safe and is teeming with people even late into the night. Centre of the strip hotels like Bellagio and Ballys are around .75 miles. The rooms are very average in size (I would say smaller than all the other hotels I have stayed in the US) and are functional in nature with all the basic amenities. However I was quite surprised to find that inspite of booking a deluxe room, there was no refrigerator/ mini bar or coffee machine in the room. The lobby of the hotel comprises of a huge casino with some 2400 slot machines besides a huge array of table game. A section of the lobby is designed to look like a typical NY street and has a large number of restaurants and food joints including a Starbucks outlet. One of the key attractions of the hotel is the roller coaster which goes all around the hotel. The Cirque du Soleil production "Zumanity" is one of the more popular shows in the strip though I was quite surprised to find that the hotel did not offer any special discounts/ schemes to in-house guests. Next time I would probably go for a hotel which is towards the centre of the strip. Overall it’s a magnificent hotel with all the associated glamour but wanting as far as warmth of stay is concerned.

Reviews.Title: “NY NY, I'll be back next year!!!”
Reviews.Author: dbgreenvegas
Reviews.Content: Hiya All, Stayed in NY NY Las Vegas April/May. My third trip to Vegas having stayed at Golden Nugget and TI before.
