I had a Park Avenue room and asked for a strip view for which I was happy to pay the extra $15 a day (but was never charged!). The room was fine.. clean and quiet and with a view of MGM and rollercoaster below. Room was a bit smaller than TI room I had last year. The best thing about NY NY is it’s a resort in its own right. There is so much to do and the atmosphere in the casino, bars and restaurants is great fun. I also found the gaming and slots to be better payouts than some of the others (won $500 on ‘wheel of fortune’ slot). I just love Vegas and my stay at this hotel made me want to book again as soon as I got back. Any criticisms? …not really… the breakfast buffet was Ok on quality but lacking in choice (no bread or toast, just basic hot buffet and pastries) and the Breakfast at Il Fornaio was pricey ($24 for eggs, bacon coffee and juice) but not much else to gripe about. A great place to stay, it would be OK for singles, couples or families… a special mention goes to Gallaghers Steak house – fantastic dry aged steaks, and also a mention for the Crazy Horse Paris show (Wow!...better than Zumanity) and ‘KA’ both at MGM across the way, KA just blew me away… Overall a great stay and a great hotel …can’t wait for next year…!!

Reviews.Title: “Didn't stay here-- thouroughly enjoyed the apmsosphere-- Breakfast buffet was delicious!”
Reviews.Author: dkscribe2003
Reviews.Content: We walked over from the Flamingo looking for a different buffet to try. We stumbled across the breakfast buffet here at a Chinese themed restaurant (not sure of the name), it was $15 which seemed a bit pricey. I am not rating this buffet on it's size and variety, but how amazing everything tasted. The small amount of food options assisted me in not over-eating but, to really ENJOY eveything I put on my plate. Don't expect to get an omlette or have your eggs cooked how you like them. Do expect a variety of items you wouldn't ordinarally (no spell check--lol) eat for breakfast, such as fried rice with extra scrambled eggs-- a little odd, but delicious!! Our waiter was really cool too!

Reviews.Title: “Ok Hotel”
Reviews.Author: heather11_13
Reviews.Content: After researching for a few months I chose this hotel. NYNY is a neat place, I just wouldn't stay here again. It's not a bad hotel but I would rather stay a little further in the middle of the strip. We stayed Monday - Thursday and on Wednesday we hopped over to the Monte Carlo pool (which NYNY guest can be admitted to for free). The NYNY pool is small but it's fun. I would definitely suggest going to Monte Carlo pool, it's REALLY fun and it has a regular pool, wave pool and lazy river- it's a much younger crowd! We hit the piano bar-which is fun and we went to Coyote Ugly- it's ok but one night is enough. Also, the roller coaster is 2 for 1 from 11a-noon, if you tell ppl that you stayed here they always ask if you rode it- just go ahead and ride, it's only $14. Don't be discouraged if you have already booked here, it's a good place!

Reviews.Title: “Rooms need updating...!”
Reviews.Author: heraldboy
Reviews.Content: Good location. Easy access from all directions; very close to airport and freeways. Rooms need updating. A little dated. VERY small TV; no refrigerator or coffee maker in room. Plenty of drawer/closet space. In-room safe convenient and easy to use. (free) Lots of free parking...easy to access. Long walk from garage to registration area. Pool hours are terrible! Only open until 6:00pm!?!?!? Get a room away from the roller coaster otherwise you will hear screaming every night until midnite! (Expensive to ride: $14)

Reviews.Title: “This place is awesome!”
Reviews.Author: wiscbadger84
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Broadway Suite...the room was spacious and had a great view of the strip! Didn't play any table games, but the slots were great!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but showing some signs of age”
Reviews.Author: HemisphereRambler
Reviews.Content: Parking and check in were great. Usually I have a hard time getting multiple rooms taken care of, but not here. Front desk was very friendly, much better than what I usually get in Vegas. You will get nickel and dimed however - $3 for unlimited local calls? Don't people have mobile phones for this? But not too bad as far as additional charges go in Vegas. Also paid a whopping $30 for a roll away bed. Most of the rooms were upgraded a no charge because there were no more "standard" rooms. Views were terrible. Mine was of a strut on the roller coaster and the parking garage. Still had hair in the shower when I went into my room, also the art in the elevators were ripped off, and the wood veneer on my door was falling apart. Not too bad, good safe location.

Reviews.Title: “A good value and reliable”
Reviews.Author: Andrew H
Reviews.Content: If you're looking to stay in 5-star luxury, this isn't it. But I say NYNY is the Las Vegas equivalent of a Honda Accord. Not too stylish, nothing too fancy, but a few perks, some nice features, and very reliable and worth the value. I have only stayed here once compared to many other times at similar value-style resorts in Vegas, but I was impressed with the overall cleanliness of the property. The rooms are in good shape, have everything in order, and nothing in my room was breaking. The furniture is decent, offers a few clever features for storing clothes and making your life easy when coming in late at night, and the TV was a decent one. The bathroom is well kept, decent size for this type of property, and has everything you need. The housekeeping service was prompt and attentive; the front desk was packed as usual and not too helpful. The good news is that once you figure out the lobby, it's an easy hotel to navigate, unlike some of the monsters in town. NYNY may not have the best location, but if you're looking for relatively nice places without wasting money, you're still right across the pedestrian walk from MGM Grand, and next door to MGM Grand. Excalibur is the other direction for good value, so there are places to go to get out. The vibe at NYNY is changing, so it may not be your type of place now, but if you just want a place to sleep but don't want to be grossed out or surprised, this is a reliable hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, nothing special”
Reviews.Author: texanitalian
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the New Yorker Tower, Park Avenue Room type on the 12 floor. Great view of sunset of the mountains; our room did not face the strip. Nice large window overlooking the pool at the back side of the hotel, but we didn't mind. After staying 4 nights, toileteries were only replenished one time. Don't expect personal items to be returned; we found some socks under the bed! There is only one set of elevators and our room was quite a walk from them. There are lots of places to eat near this hotel, such as Chin/Chin breakfast buffet, Fornaio, America, and Gonzalez gonzalez --we got sick eating here. This is just an average hotel, nothing to brag about.

Reviews.Title: “Totally blah - wouldn't stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Ms_Miltown
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at the recommendation of my friend - we were arriving Vegas mid-evening, planned to have dinner and hang on the strip, then one friend flew out early the next a.m. and two of us wanted to hang by a pool before our evening flights. We had a Park Avenue deluxe room - which was large, but definitely felt old and used. I was really disappointed in complete lack of amenities for a deluxe room - no water bottles in the room to purchase, no fridge, nothing. The rooms were also VERY loud with hallway noise, and even though we were supposed to be a non-smoking floor, the entire casino had a pervasive smoke smell. Check-in was horribly slow. The pool area seemed an afterthought - crowded, loud music blaring all day, and a rollercoaster flying overhead. I guess it does have the noise and bustle of New York!

Reviews.Title: “Bit Of A Let Down”
Reviews.Author: bakpas
Reviews.Content: We were very much looking forward to staying here as we had heard/read good things about it. When we turned up after an 8 hour drive from Reno we were a bit tired and probably our tolerance was running low but we had to wait about twenty minutes at reception despite seeing alot of staff behind the counter talking to each other, when we did get served the lady was very rude no smile or anything, anyway we got our keys and headed to our room which was difficult to find as there are many wings and different lifts. When we got to our room I was a bit repulsed to see a hairball(quite large) on the floor but too tired to worry about it, as our room was being serviced I thought we will just leave it there for the cleaners to vacuum up the next day-no still there when we got back from a day of activity. Finally I went downstairs to tell a man on reception who was quite nice but pretty blase about it. Now I know it's just a hairball and we could've just picked it up and put it in the bin but for the price you pay to stay here the cleaniness should be better. Anyway I feel this was an over-priced hotel and wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Ok if you like poorly lit rooms, dirty furniture and a small pool”
Reviews.Author: murdock110
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel for business as it was comparable with others (Monte Carlo, Excalibur) in the same price range. Would have preferred Bellagio/Caesar's but they were all over $300 a night. This location was just ok. Rooms and hallways were dark, the furniture in my room was stained and dirty, and the bathrooms were outdated - when was the last time you stayed in a hotel/resort with a sliding shower door? On one visit to the pool found it to be uninviting and crowded. Basically, a slab of concrete filled with water. There were no open chairs, and no easy access to the pool as all the chairs surrounded the edges. Talk to anyone in the know, this is one of the worst pools in Vegas. I would not recommend this location to anyone, there are much better options on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, nothing special.”
Reviews.Author: texastraveler0621
Reviews.Content: Typical vegas, strip hotel. Nothing special, but it was nice. Great location, very few $5 tables (like most big hotels) so if you're cheap like me when you gamble you'll have to go somewhere else. Only ate at one restaurant, it was the breakfast buffet and it was pretty good and a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Vacation”
Reviews.Author: jasper235
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the NY NY for 7 nights and had a blast. Check-in was a little slow due to computer problems, but the desk clerk was very professional and accomodated our room request. I tippped him a $20 for his profficiency. For the second time in 15 years we came home with more gambling money than we went with. I would reccomend this hotel to anyone staying on the strip in Vegas. The hotel staff were very friendly and accomodating.

Reviews.Title: “Good value option on the strip”
Reviews.Author: KarenandRick
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night in Vegas as part of a 10 day trip in the US, and picked this hotel for value, location, and for being New York! We were not disappointed. We booked a Park Avenue Deluxe room with strip view as a upgrade from a skyline room for $15 extra, which seemed excellent value. Room was spacious and spotless, on the 30th floor with a nice view over the MGM Grand and airport. We also dined in the Hotel/Casino at Il Fornaio which was lovely and good value. Suspend belief for a while and you could think you were genuinely in a NY Italian restaurant! The 'Il Fornaio Panetteria' is a great option for a breakfast pastry also.

Reviews.Title: “Nice. Great Value for the Money.”
Reviews.Author: SpathicRugger
Reviews.Content: This is not the nicest place on the strip, but it is top 5. For the price, I highly recommend it. The rooms were clean, the people friendly. It is awfully crowded, though. Still, the Nine Fine Irishmen is the best place to grab a brew on the strip. I and my group had a couple of beers on the patio overlooking the strip (get there early and camp, or that space will be gone). Also, there is an In-N- Out Burger behind NY NY, which is great for curing hangovers.

Reviews.Title: “reasonable strip hotel.....”
Reviews.Author: Never_om
Reviews.Content: First time in Vegas and stayed here - good price and room was spacious. Hotel looks dated and tired in sections - everything needs a update. (some rooms had been updated)Room had view over coaster which even though could be heard was not an issue as the screams made us laugh. Room was not up to our expectations and not cleanest we had stayed in. This did not bother us as only slept very little in there. The restaurants in the hotel were terrible - mexican was basic and the Il Forniao was far too expensive for the quality of food and service (the food was tasteless). Better off in the MGM or Mandalay Bay if you want decent food. (PF changs and the Outback are also good food and you can get view across down the strip.) Belagio buffet is the best! The bars were OK, Nine fine Irishmen had a freindly atmosphere and the Time square was great fun. Casino was great and unlike some hotels the waitress service was always around when you wanted a drink. We would probably not go back to the NYNY, as we would like to stay somewhere else, but there is nothing major wrong with the hotel, for the right price!

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay on a budget”
Reviews.Author: Shelley P
Reviews.Content: Great themed hotel and generally good for people who want a nice place for a decent price. We booked a skyline room and were upgraded to a better room (Park Avenue I believe). Standard room, very spacious. The only bad thing was that it was a smoking room when we are non-smokers. There are many restaurants at the hotel, something for everyone. Tip: the Excalibur is next door and has an all day, all you can eat buffet with in and out privileges for $25. The nightclub at NY, NY is Rok, if you look around during the day/night you can find someone handing out passes to skip the line or for reduced cover. The show is Zumanity. Be sure to get tickets early. Coyote Ugly is also at NY, NY. No cover before 10:30. Initially it seems pretty weak and almost embaressing, but if you stick around the show is entertaining (dancing like in the movie). There is a large arcade at the top level with a fun rollercoaster. $14 for one ride. The pool isn't huge, but it's cute and good enough for the trip. The casino itself is a fair size. As long as you're gambling (doesn't matter how much) they serve you free beverages. NY, NY is on the south side of the strip so a far walk to the Wynn, Fashion Show Mall, Venetian, etc - but definitely doable. The hotel is also attached to the MGM Hotel through and an over the street walkway . There is apparently a mandatory $3/night phone charge which gives you local calls free using the phone in your room. This was advertised in our travel voucher and posted at registration but we were never charged for this.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: walexander28
Reviews.Content: My husband I and just returned from a long weekend in Vegas, we booked at New York because of the price through Southwest Vacations..We did upgrade to a Marquis suite and this room was large and clean, however it was old appearing..We have been to Vegas several times and usually the rooms are new looking or refurbished..this room like I said was clean, but the bedspread , the carpet, the bathroom let alot to be desired...We did enjoy the large jetted tub, felt good on the legs after walking all day...The rest of the hotel and casino were fine, not too smoking and we ate the pizza place, (good but way greasy) and we ate at the American restaurant because the were open 24 hours..the meals here were very good, ..The casino was small enough I learned my way around the first night.. All in all we had a great stay..Would I go back to New York--probably not..I like a more modern room...But the people who worked here were super nice...and this is a big plus.. Oh we also went to Anthony Cools at Paris, I don't think I have ever laughed so hard..I recommed this show.. The Serendipity restaurant was also very good with huge portions and too die for mojito's ...and I love the twisted sister drink at Diablo's yum yum..

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay - free upgrade”
Reviews.Author: nyjets24
Reviews.Content: My wife & I went to Vegas because Southwest had 50% off flight specials and she had never been. I did a lot of research of trying to find the best place to stay for us. I have been to Vegas 3x before and have stayed at NY, NY once. I kept that in mind when I was looking, but open to other options. The bottom line though was through the NY, NY website they had a free room upgrade offer which would allow us to overlook the strip. I couldn't pass on this, for the price and the location of the hotel along the strip. The MGM Grand is across the street, as is a place to buy cheaper day off show tickets, which we took advantage off our final night there. We saw Beatles LOVE, Elton John & Blue Man Group in 3 days in Vegas. All tremendous shows. We did alot of walking, but the 3rd day there took advantage of the bus. The roller coaster at NY, NY was not running most of the time we were there due to the high winds. But, overall, we had a great stay at NY, NY and will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “good location, enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: jemimajem
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel from 3/4-8/4/09. Check in didnt take too long - booked a broadway ave deluxe room - room was spacious (think this block had recently been refurbished) and clean, as was the bathroom, with a good, powerful shower. The view was the brick wall of the next tower - i called to reception about an upgrade to a room with a view but this would have been at least $15 per night so we decided not to as would be out on the strip for most of the stay - it just meant that the room was quite dark with no natural sunlight, so it was always nice to get outside! We stayed on the 6th floor, and only comment would be that you constantly hear the lift going up and down, even though we were not that close. Ordered room service one night, reasonable prices and you get lots for your money! The rollercoaster is worth doing, we also did the rides at the stratosphere which were brilliant, and you see some great views from the tower there. The hotel was in a good location, opposite the MGM and the facilities within the hotel were very good with lots to see and do. We went to see Zumanity, the Cirque de Soleil show based at our hotel (guests of NYNY get 2 for 1), and that was excellent. We also made use of the Deuce bus to get up and down the strip, but most of the big hotels are within walking distance (tip - take comfy shoes and a refreshing foot spray - i could have done with this after a long day walking up and down!). Would definately go back, although might also try another hotel just for some different scenery - the MGM, Mirage and the Venetian were my favourite.

Reviews.Title: “Don't use their website to book room”
Reviews.Author: TrekieIreland
Reviews.Content: Booked hotel after recommendation only to find out I could have booked same room thru discount site for $40 a night cheaper, it even linked me to new york's own reservations page. Rang the hotel to find out if the room I had booked (with a view) could be guaranteed (e-mail confirmation of booking pointed out that my room with a view might not be available, even though I had booked it four months in advance) as it was a birthday gift for my wife, only to be told that my room might not be available on the day I check in. I cancelled my room there and then, why pay the extra $40 for a room you might not even get . I e-mailed the hotel in the hope that I might get an answer as to why if I was willing to pay the extra $200 for my weeks stay could they not guarantee my room with a view. Guess what still waiting, so folks spend your money elsewhere because if they are that stupid as to give up $200 (lady on phone told me to book discounted room) God knows what the hotel service is like. My big tip is book thru discount websites as they all link you to hotels own reservation pages and there are some greats deals to be had.

Reviews.Title: “Stay was nearly flawless”
Reviews.Author: lextrav
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights on a busy weekend (Spring Break / CMA Awards / Final Four) in a Broadway Deluxe room. Second trip to Vegas (last time was Monte Carlo). The room was large and had two enormous banks of windows. Great views to the east/south - MGM Grand and Excalibur. Also, the coaster was right outside the window - some noise but never a problem. We loved the view day and night. The room was significantly larger than a friends Parkway Deluxe (which had 1 small window). We ate at America (L and B), Gallagher's (D), and Il Fornaio (B) inside the hotel. All were very good with great service. Avoid Coyote Ugly unless you like cattle conditions - crowded, no chairs, very loud music. The dueling piano bar is great - always packed. We did not try Rok Vegas, ESPN Zone, or the Irish Bar. The pool complex is good. Hot tubs are very good, but sporadic drink service. The gift shop/convenience store was great - reasonable prices on champaigne, etc. to take up to your room. The only small issue we had was checkin - lines were long (10 minute wait) and our room was not ready until about 3:30pm. The casino is good - above many. Hard to find $5 tables anytime on weekends - but I was told that completely depends on the crowds - you might on slow weekends. The spa is small but nice. The overall resort is very large, but they pack so much into every space that it gets very crowded - like all of the resoirts strip. After a while I was pretty tired of dodging people everywhere you try to walk. But, that is the nature of the Vegas beast unless you find a slow weekend or mid-week trip.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Tidy and well located”
Reviews.Author: awinsawin
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in July '08. Would recommend. It was clean tidy and very safe. The room was of a very high quality. Perhaps not the most expensive hotel on the strip but we weren't looking for that and we got more in the room then we were expecting. The staff were extremely helpful especially the front desk who provided us with anything we need.

Reviews.Title: “NY NY Las Vegas is a good fit for us”
Reviews.Author: twistnrev
Reviews.Content: My wife, son (age 17), and I stayed 3/31 to 4/03. This was our second stay at NY NY in 6 months. Don't be afraid to ask the desk for your needs. There is an attendant posted at the far right side of the registration desk who helped us with hotel information and even printed out map blast directions to a local business for us. My wife and I used our MGM players cards at the tables and slot machines. We have had good gaming luck at NY NY. The black jack tables have $10 minimums. We ate at the Asian buffet, the patio restaurant, and the fish and chips stand. All are good. Many reviews have mentioned the comfortable beds. Ours were fine as they were last visit. The nightlife is fun. Grab a drink and have a walk from bar front to bar front and enjoy the variety. There are a few nearby hotels which offer slightly better rates. We have stayed at these and found they are not worth it. We plan on returning this Summer on a midweek special.

Reviews.Title: “Great, but no wow”
Reviews.Author: Dara58
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our usa trip. New York New York Hotel Las Vegas, Great hotel. Check in was very quick, no lines. We had a Park Ave, deluxe room. The room was spacious and clean, as was the bathroom. Our view was of the Monte Carlo Hotel and the swimming pool. We could also see the roller coaster, but could not hear it, which was good. Only 2 negatives, of this hotel was that the walls are PAPER THIN we could hear everything. And I mean everything that the couple next door were up to.................................... Our 2nd negative was that there was not enough people serving in the food areas which caused long lines, but apart from that everything else was good,

Reviews.Title: “Great Room, good fun had fun!”
Reviews.Author: Downtown48
Reviews.Content: We were able to check in at about noon and we upgraded to a marquis suite which was well worth the extra $55 per night. Couple of huge positives about this room: 1. It had a hot tub that could fit three people in it if you wanted which was almost a must after long days of walking all over the strip. 2. It was on the 32nd floor with a great view and the top floors had their own elevator which skipped the first 20 to 25 floors which was awesome! The room was very clean and they did a nice job fixing the room everyday while we were out. There was a great Bose sound system with a DVD played that I wish we would would have known about because it would have been cool to watch a movie on that system. We also had a fridge that we stocked with pop and water from the CVS down the street. Wireless internet was available for 14.99 per day which was a bit steep.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay for the money”
Reviews.Author: plev
Reviews.Content: I've played at NY NY many times but never stayed there so when I got a discounted room I figured I'd give it a shot. While overall I don't like the facility as much as MGM, it was certainly a good hotel. Check in was very quick and we were given our room upon check in at 11am. We asked for a room at the end of a corridor to keep noise to a minimum and this was accomodated. The room itself was decent, not over the top luxurious by any means, but quite comfortable and certainly very clean. It was also the quietest Vegas room I've ever stayed in. I heard no outside noise (helicopters, sirens etc.) and very little inside noise---nothing more than you get at any hotel. I did find the bartenders, dealers, waiters etc. etc. to be VERY accomodating. NY NY like most places lately has had layoffs so the folks who are left are those who have seniority and are good at their jobs. I found the service everywhere excellent. while here we ate at America twice. One dinner and one lunch. Both meals were excellent. We also tried 9 fine irishman for lunch and that was good also but not as stand out as America. If you're going here for the pool scene, don't. It's that simple. One of the smaller hotel pools on the Strip. Certainly acceptable for a quick dip or to lay in the sun but don't expect much if any action here.

Reviews.Title: “Park Ave Deluxe room not so deluxe.”
Reviews.Author: JLANDCOWBOY
Reviews.Content: Stayed at NY,NY March 25th-28th and had booked an air and hotel package through Airtran Vacations. The package included the Park Ave Deluxe room, but it did not meet our expectations from the website description. It said it was 400 sq ft, but the bathroom door almost hit the toilet and you could barely walk between the bed and the combination entertainment center/wardrobe (there was no closet). We were on the 15th floor and had a view of the parking garage, a roof and the pool of you pressed your face against the window all the way to the left. Good view of the people in the roller coaster as they went whizzing by though. It was very clean and the furniture was nice, but I shudder to think what size the standard Skyline room was. Also, they did not ask if I would be interested in an upgrade, or ask our preferences, except for smoking or not, when we checked in. Also, the booking included 20% discounts at a couple of the bars and the NIne Five Irishmen Restaurant and $20 Free Play, but they couldn't find this info with my reservation. Luckily I had my itinerary and managed to get the Free Play, and they said when I charged the food and beverages to my room the discount would reflect on my final bill...nope. Had a hassle over that too. They were very nice and helpful in working it out, but I didn't expect all this time wasted on my trip. Also, I know it's Vegas, but food and drink is expensive. There aren't any deals for restaurants in NY,NY. Your best bet is to go next door to Excalibur and have the buffet. (You can buy an all day pass for $25.) Drinks cost $6 for a bottle of beer and $7 for a Bloody Mary. Went to Coyote Ugly and it was Happy Hour, 2 beers and 2 shots of Jack came to $20!!! It's legal to drink on the sidewalk, so we went down about 3 blocks to the mini mart and bought 24 oz cans for $3 each and walked the strip. (If we had a mini fridge in our room we would have stocked up.) When we were hanging out at NY, NY we played the penny machines and took every advantage of the free cocktails. We're not poor or cheap and understand the cost of living in other cities, but the prices in casinos are outrageous. We got married there 5 years ago and they were nothing like this.

Reviews.Title: “A superb stay”
Reviews.Author: Rob-the-Traveller
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Las Vegas, so we wanted a hotel on "The Strip" that be comfortable but without breaking the Bank. After a long flight from LGW we got a taxi straight from the airport to the hotel. On arrival someone took our baggage and said that they would send them up to or room once we had checked in. The Check in desk was busy but it did not take long for us to get checked in, Check in staff were very friendly and helpful. Our room was a "Broadway Room" on the 25th Floor with a superb view of the southern end of The Strip. The room was large with two comfortable double beds and plenty of space. The bathroom, although not large was well equiped with soap, shampoo etc. The room was very clean and tidy. Internet access was availalble either by Wi-Fi or cable but there is a charge. The hotel has everything you could want, the Casino, shops and plenty of places to eat and drink. We used the Casino most evenings and although it was busy we never had any problems in finding something that suited us. We ate in the Irish Bar and also in the ESPN Zone bar on several occasions and the food was very good. The hotel is a short walk to the bus stop on The Strip and the "Deuce" service will take you anywhere along The Strip for $3 or $7 buys you an all day ticket. In summary, we had a relaxing stay in this superb hotel complex.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonably priced, great location for seeing the sights”
Reviews.Author: rachelopps
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for New Year's Eve with a group of friends. We booked the room online and took advantage of an extra night promotion advertised on their website. The rates were reasonable for a week's stay, considering it was New Year's Eve. The actual nightly rate for New Year's Eve was very steep (as pwere all the hotels in Las Vegas) but the free night promotion and the other night's rates averaged it out. There were four of us sharing our room. We opted for a Broadway Suite which was the 4th largest out of 7 rooms. The room was ok but pretty small for 4 people. We requested a rollaway bed for one of our party, twice before arriving. We then asked upon check in and they still did not bring it up until we called Reception yet again to remind them. The room was clean and basic, we did not spend a lot of time there so this was all we needed. Breakfast was not included but you can eat fantastic all-you-can eat buffets at most of the hotels in Vegas (we had a great champagne brunch buffet at the Flamingo and the best buffet in town, without a doubt was at the Rio....we'd never before seen so many varieties of food available!) There are plenty of restaurants, cages and fast food chains within the hotel itself. It's easy to pop downstairs for a quick bite to eat, an ice cream or even for a drink in one of the many bars. The hotel has loads to see and do. In Vegas each hotel is like a resort in itself. New York New York is really well themed and there are so many little details which really add to the feel of being in New York at the same time. The interior of the hotel is really well designed and replicates streets and monuments in New York. Each building which is part of the hotel is a replica of a famous building...the Chrysler Building, Statue of Liberty, Empire State, and so on. Having visited most of the main hotels in Vegas, I thought that theming-wise, New York New York was one of the most effective along with Paris and The Venetian. New York New York is a great base for sightseeing and has everything you could need to explore the Strip. It's within walking distance of the Mandalay Bay, Luxor and Excalibur at one end of the Strip (and even the famous Vegas Sign nearby) and then in the other direction is in walking distance of many more hotels including Paris, the Bellagio, Planet Hollywood, Caesars Palace, and more. The MGM Grand, directly opposite to New York New York, is linked by a walkway andcontains a monorail stop within the hotel. So it is very easy to get around from the hotel. I would recommend this hotel if you are looking for a reasonably priced hotel that is quite centrally located on the Strip. Great place to explore Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: lillau81
Reviews.Content: I had called ahead of time to let them know an extra person was staying in the room, but once we arrived they had not prepared the room for that person. Once I called housekeeping, they were very friendly and quick to give us towels etc. There are some good restaurants at the bottom of the hotel, with a few open 24 hours, which is great when you are coming back late from a night out and you have the munchies! The bars are fun expecially when there were live bands playing. Convenient coffee shops, souvenir stores etc. The location is a little a way from the centre of the strip, but is still surrounded by other fun hotels with lots to do. Jumping in a taxi was the best way to get around as the buses were extremely slow. Overall, a great and very comfy stay!

Reviews.Title: “Our room had been renovated”
Reviews.Author: Lindyf
Reviews.Content: Stayed last night at New York, New York. Wanted to stay at Venetian or Mandolay Bay but read on Trip Advisor about the smell. We walked over to those two hotels and the reviewers were correct, it made me sick from the pumped in smell. It is to hide the cigarette smoke I think. How can people stay there? We were on the 26th floor of New York, New York and our room had new carpet, bedspreads and very nice sheets. The bathroom was nice. The room was very dark. Forget about reading in your room. It is like a cave due to only a couple of lights with energy saving bulbs. They do not want you in your room anyway, you are supposed to be gambling. The pool was open and it was fine. Plenty of room for everyone. I checked out on the TV in my room--two seconds. Why are people standing in line checking out?? There was one person in line in front of me during check-in. I will stay there again. PLEASE give us Wi-Fi in our rooms for Free. In the year 2009--to have to pay for that connection is absurd.

Reviews.Title: “I Loved the Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ddavis7769
Reviews.Content: The hotel was amazing. Our first room didn't have any sort of view (parking lot) and they moved us to a great room the next day. Would have moved us right away but we wanted to stay on same floor as our friends. Staff were wonderful - especially front desk. When I asked about hours for a pharmacy , front desk person called them to determine their hours. 100% for me.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK.”
Reviews.Author: sparkle_gurrl
Reviews.Content: The outside of the hotel is gorgeous, with the NYC skyline, and it continues its looks on the inside. We travelled during March Break, which might have been part of the problems we had. Our room (which they upgraded since they ran out of the one we booked), was right next to a bunch of college guys and they were annoying! Granted, I can't blame the hotel for my nrighbours, however the walls were so thin. Not only could we hear their conversations, but we could hear their phone ringing. Also, we were annoyed to realise the mornig we were checking out, that hotel guests got 10% off meals at a couple of the restaurants inside the hotel. We ate at those restaurants 3 times, at it was neevr mentioned! Overall, its a nice hotel, but I didn't like the service we received, or the really thin walls. However, I will give credit where credit is due, and the interior at the back of the hotel is amazing! Its like they rebuilt NYC inside the hotel with all the little shops and stores. That blew me away!

Reviews.Title: “Staying further down the strip next time”
Reviews.Author: jenluvstravelin
Reviews.Content: This was the first time in Vegas for me and I was completely amazed! The NY,NY is almost to the end of the strip, it's a lot of walking but right across the street is the MGM and they havea monorail stop (ride it, trust me). The hotel itself was huge as is most of the other hotels but as a small town girl, I was a little overwhelmed. The room was nice sized but I do believe it was decorated either in the dark or by a blind person. Not to sound picky or anything but it was loud! But then again, it's Vegas and who spends that much time in the room? We had an awesome view of the mountains. You have to pay extra for a strip view but really, like I said, who spends that much time in the room? The check in was brief, didn't take long at all. People in the casino are nice it is so busy though, if you order a drink, be prepared to wait a LONG time to get it! We went to the America restaurant one night, not the best but was a decent meal, and we went at 11pm so... The layout of the hotel is pretty easy to negoitiate after a little bit of time! it is on the corner w/ Excalibur on one side and MGM on the other. Overall, we had a good time. Would I stay here again? Yes but want to experience further down the strip first. TIP: when you are in Vegas go see Blue Man Group at the Venetian...well worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, Comfy beds, Great Service!”
Reviews.Author: Courtney2210
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our Trip to Vegas March 9-13th. My boyfriend and I had never been to Vegas so we weren't really sure where to stay. We booked our vacation with WestJet vacations and they did a great job of giving us lots of different hotel options for a great price. We chose the New York New York because it looked hip, fun, and was decently priced. We arrived in Vegas at 10:00pm and had about a 10 minute wait at check-in. The check-in lady was VERY nice and got us checked in promptly. She even upgraded us to a Park Avenue Deluxe room for free. (We had booked a Skyline room) We got just what we had asked for-a non-smoking room with a King size bed. We stayed in the NyNy Tower room 1110 and the view was amazing. If you are older or have kids I wouldn't suggest asking how far of a walk the room is from the elevator, because my boyfriend and I are both physically able to walk perfectly fine and found it to be a very long walk to the elevator from our room. Our room was great. VERY clean, shower worked well (good pressure) and the bed was EXTREMELY comfortable. I haven't slept that well in a while. The mandatory $3 a night fee for the telephone came in handy because we made many phone calls to get show tickets/times/reservations. When we couldn't find any extra pillows we called down to housekeeping and they brought us up some extra ones along with extra towels within 5 minutes of me making the call. GREAT service! There were only two things we didn't like about the room. 1. The shower doesn't drain very well. It wasn't until we got back to Ottawa that we realized that they actually do this on purpose to try to get you to conserve the water. (You end up soaking your feet while you're showering basically) 2. Our room was overlooking the rollercoaster so you would hear a lot of rattling from the metal and some yelling from the riders. It wasn't unbareable by any means, but it may be a nuisance for some people. The hotel itself has lots of great food options and they really try to keep with the NY theme. Casinos are all really smokey and the hotel always seemed really busy. The night before we checked out we called down to the desk to see if a late check-out would be a possibility. They allowed us to check-out at twelve noon even though check-out was supposed to be at 11am. Our flight only left at 11:30pm that night so we had a long day and wanted to check out as late as possible. Upon check out, we had some luggage we needed to put aside so we brought it to the Bell Desk and they dealt with it very quickly and stored it away safely. It was fast and friendly. Upon check-out we only waited about 3 minutes and the lady at the check-out counter simply asked for our names and then told us we could keep the key as a souvenir, and thanked us for staying there. That was it. Simple and fast. My boyfriend and I are not fussy travelers and we are satisfied if our bed is comfortable enough to fall asleep in, the room is clean and that we feel safe throughout our stay. We were very pleased with our stay at the New York New York

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value. Rooms are questionable.”
Reviews.Author: cdemmitt
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the spa suite. The bed was very uncomfortable and we could hear everything going on around us. The huge tub with surrounding mirrors was great, but that was the ONLY highlight.

Reviews.Title: “Outdated Rooms”
Reviews.Author: vacationer123103
Reviews.Content: We went to Vegas last June and stayed at MGM. This trip we decided we wanted to stay somewhere different, and went with New York New York because it was the best rate we received. I didn't expect New York New York to be as nice as MGM, yet we were still disappointed in general. Check-in was long and drawn out, it seemed as if the person helping us had no clue what she was doing. We were upgraded to a Park Avenue with a "deluxe strip view," and I am so grateful we were, because based on our "upgrade," I NEVER would have wanted to see a Skyline Room. The Park Avenue was set up in a very strange manner. The armoire seemed way too big for the room and was oddly placed. Also, there was no closet. The bathroom was tiny. The beds were incredibly uncomfortable, and the linens were something you might expect to find in a rundown motel. I don't understand what was done when the rooms were renovated because it seemed very outdated. My biggest complaint was the fact that housekeeping did not show up until around 3pm each day. Everyone in my party is an early-riser, so our room was always vacated early, yet we would come back around 3pm to find housekeeping just coming in to fix the room. I am just glad that it wasn't warm enough to sit by the pool because the pool area looked very disappointing, especially when compared to others on the strip. There were some positives about the hotel - the 24 hour essentials shop was a great place to get everything you need. The hotel overall was incredibly clean and well-maintained, and the restaurant Chin Chin was very good. Basically, if you have kids I would recommend the hotel for the family friendly vibe, but if you are looking for a decent hotel at a good price, I would definitely suggest going to MGM instead.

Reviews.Title: “NOT a 4 Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LindaLouColumbus_OH
Reviews.Content: Cleanliness: Average Service: I give this an average review due to one issue. I received free Zumanity tickets with my room, but I was then charged for them. I had to wait in line to have the charge removed, even though they were supposed to be comped automatically. I had the feeling that the "automatically" never happened and that the whole thing was kind of a scam. Otherwise, everyone was helpful and friendly. Also, the $3 per day phone charge was a joke. Location: Not bad...it's kind of at the end of the strip. Value: Average. Rooms: This was my biggest complaint. The decor was very dated. There was no fan in the bathroom, and there was no vanity outside the room. My iron and the makeup mirror lights did not work. The bedspreads were visibly worn and threadbare. The pillows and bedding in general were of a very low quality. Also, while being near the elevator was nice, I could hear it all night long. The restaurants and casino overall are pretty good. It is a fun place to hang out, but I would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Big Changes at New York New York”
Reviews.Author: sdhman
Reviews.Content: We always seemed to end up at the New York New York when going to Vegas in the evenings because of the atmosphere, Live bands in the Big Apple pumping out Rock and Roll, The look of walking down thru Central park and a fun place to party. We started staying at the hotel when going to Vegas. Big shock in Novenber of 2008 for my wifes birthday, The Big Apple was gone, The Central Park was gone and replaced by machines and what was booming out all over the casino in the evening- full blown rap music from a new club that had just opened. We will be staying some place else from now on.

Reviews.Title: “Follow up to”
Reviews.Author: tigger4ever
Reviews.Content: A very nice rep from New York New York read my review and took the time to find me. I received a email so I called. She was very sorry this happened and said she would make sure that the clerk and Manager would be address and this would be brought up in meeting to work on Customer Service. She offered a comp room for my next trip and asked that it be offer to a guess at random. I just wanted to be heard. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Good for its location and restaurant choices”
Reviews.Author: globetrtr21
Reviews.Content: Rooms are OK. Staff are reasonably friendly. Travellers should be aware of the room rates as they change daily. You might have booked it more expensively than what it is when you arrive. I find this kind of pricing policy annoying, to say the least. How about introducing a lowest rate guarantee?? The casino was OK, but most dealers were not exceedingly friendly. You might do better elsewhere, e.g. at the Bellagio, etc. The reason I chose this hotel was for its access to the Cirque du Soleil shows (i.e. Ka, Zoomanity), which you can easily reach on foot or take the bus to the Bellagio (for O). There are also lots of eateries downstairs and at the other hotels nearby. My favourite was the Mexican place 'Gonzales Gonzales' for the food, not for the service however. Another plus point for this hotel is the relatively clean air. Some hotels, such as the Venitian or Mandalay Bay, seem to have the idea that an attack of chemical smells throughout their premises will increase guest comfort or make them spend more at the games. Sorry to the psychologists who thought this up, but it just induces feelings of nausea and puts people through an olfactory stress test. In summary, this is a good place to base yourself for visiting the major attractions this town has to offer. Definitely go and see the shows! They are world class.

Reviews.Title: “No coffee pots in the rooms!”
Reviews.Author: leighlea
Reviews.Content: The hotel and casino are darker than most of the others with everything crowded together. We were told upon check in that the pool was closed only to discover as we checked out that it was open. The rooms were small to average in size and dimly lit. The water pressure in the shower was great but I bruised and almost cut my leg on the shower slide getting in. Beds were comfortable but linens were well worn. Housekeeping was wonderful and always had our room ready regardless of what time we left or came back. The restaurants that we ate in were average in quality but not price. My number one complaint was there was no coffee pot in our room and I had to go down 24 flights and stand in line each morning for about 10 to 15 minutes to get a cup or call and wait for a little longer for room service to deliver. I didn't ask about the coffee por because it has been years since I have stayed in a hotel regardless of how nice it was that it did not provide a coffee pot in the room. The casino was small and low payouts on their slots - we didn't try any of their tables. It took about 30 to 45 minutes to walk to the middle of the strip. Would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “NYNY is good but not great”
Reviews.Author: ktscott01
Reviews.Content: It is not a bad hotel at all and since you try to spend as little time in the room as possible its OK. I got annoyed at them the 1st day when we got to the room the safe was locked so I called house keeping and they said 15-20 minutes. 30 minutes laster I called again, he was on his way. 10 more minutes I call again and was told he knocked but no one answered. BS unless he knocked with a feather. Annoyed but not pissed. Checkin No problem and fast around 430pm on a Thursday. I asked and we were upgraded to Broadway room becasue it was my birthday. Beds We had a Broadway room with 2 double beds. They were OK. TV Small. Why do you have a "newer" room with a 19" TV? (We did get free porn) Safe They had a small wall safe in the room and it worked just fine. Bathroom Very clean. It annoyed me that they replaced all the soap each day. What a waste. No problem with the hot water in the morning, afternoon or evening. Internet Was $15 a day I think. I didnt get it. Food There are a lot of choices in the hotel which is nice. The prices are really $10+ for lunch and up from there for dinner. Even a hot dog, fries and a pepsi costs $8. But that is to be expected in all hotels on the strip. Casino I like the casino and it always seems to be lively. Like everywhere else its a maze. I think this place gets me more confused then most. Checkout No problem ad quick at 1030 on Sunday. I really expected a long line but there wasn't anyone. Overall its not a bad place. it is on the far end of the strip. I'd be happy to stay here again if I get a killer rate like I did this last time with player club.

Reviews.Title: “New York - New York Hotel and Casino”
Reviews.Author: lithlith
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights (Fri., Sat., Sun.,) over Valentine's Day weekend in 2009. We waited about 5 minutes in line to check in. It took us a while to find the check in counter. We had taken on of the mini-buses from the airport that drops off people at any casino and they had dropped us off at a weird deserted entrance. We looked for signs to the check in counter, but there were none, we ended up having to ask twice to find it. We had room 777. We thought that they would have said something being a lucky number, but nothing was mentioned. The room was a standard hotel room with a king size bed. The view from the window was of wall. There was nothing to be seen. The bathroom was average size and the water pressure was strong. We put our our "do not disturb sign" and did not have maid service during our stay. We saw the housekeeper every day on our way out, and she always asked if we wanted service or not, as well, we had our sign out. There is a small restaurant that has a breakfast buffet in the morning, but the buffet is extremely small with very few choices - you are better off walking next door to the Excalibur or Luxor for a "real" Las Vegas buffet. There were several other restaurants and bars within the New York -New York, including numerous quick food choices. We did not eat at any of these. There is an outside walk way/ bridge from the New York -New York to the Excalibur hotel/casino, and then the Excalibur has inside walking to the Luxor and then inside walking from the Luxor to the Mandalay Bay. There is also an above the street level walkway to cross Las Vegas Blvd to the MGM from the New York -New York. The casino floor in the New York -New York is small compared to other casinos on the strip. There were lots of slot machines crammed closely together and not as many table games as other casinos. Upstairs there is a large area with games for kids and access to the roller coaster. We didn't ride it because we thought it was too expensive (it was either $12-14 a piece). The show at the New York -New York is Zumanity, which is an adult cirque soleil. We saw the 7:30 show. Get there when the doors open, as there is entertainment from the moment you walk in. We sat in the balcony. The theater is relatively small, so I don't think there are any bad seats. I wouldn't sit on the couches in the front row, unless you want to be part of the show. Overall, it was a great show! We took a cab to the airport when we left - the cab ride was $10.50 before tip.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: russtduck
Reviews.Content: We booked online through their website and got a upgraded room with a strip view for the same price as a regular room. The room was clean and in good shape. We were on the 18th floor acording to the elevator, did not seem that high. The view was nice, we were able to see the sun rise over the mountains. The roller coaster could be heard. It was not an obnoxious noise, more like a loud ocean sound. the room was close to the elevator. Other rooms are a long walk from it as there is only one set of elevators and they were at the one end. We only stayed there 1 night and went to the Paris Las Vegas for the rest of our stay. I think the comfort was the same at both places. I was expecting more from Paris and they didn't deliver. I would definately stay at NY, NY again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Bang for the Buck”
Reviews.Author: SavannahLynn
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to travel to Las Vegas for a last minute getaway to meet up with a group of friends. They were staying at the MGM so we wanted to be close to them without paying the MGM pricetag. As soon as we arrived we were able to check in very quickly (although, we arrived late at night and I noticed during the day long lines). They gave us a room with a great view of the strip. It was decorated very nicely, it really looked like a hotel you would stay in New York City. The bed was good, not great. The 1st night we ate at the Italian Restuarant, Il Fornaio and we weren't impressed. Although the next day we had italian speciality sandwhiches at the cafe and they were very delicious. We used the gym, while a little on the small side we were able to get in a good workout. I got a polish change on my fingers/toes and it was VERY pricey. One thing that really annoyed me was that I recieved 10 VIP bracelets for the club ROK so our group decided to go there so we wouldn't have to pay a cover charge. Well, they don't tell you that it only applies before 10 pm and we arrived later so we ended up having to pay $25 each and it wasn't a great club. There are so many great clubs in Vegas I wouldn't reccomend this one. All in all, we had a great trip and would def. stay at the NYNY again.

Reviews.Title: “Smaller and cozy awesome rooms”
Reviews.Author: addis13
Reviews.Content: Ok, It is a very nice hotel. It is very suitable for crowds between 21-50. There are many places to go out in there and its not so "Overwhelming" that you just give up. It is has a very good location. You can see the MGM, Excalibur, Luxor and the Monte Carlo. The pizza is cheap and good. Everything is so expensive in Vegas. I loved our room. We were on the 26th floor. The maid came everyday and cleaned great. Very clean and had a reasonable price. I heard the rollar coaster was awesome. Our trip was so rushed. Plan on having at least 3 full days in Vegas to get the full effect. Its so romantic..

Reviews.Title: “Atmosphere Lacking - Some Nice Rooms”
Reviews.Author: SJaneSeattle_WA
Reviews.Content: Business trip with colleagues to NY NY as the hotel prices were very competitive for the location, amenities, and meetings. Staff was very cordial and welcoming. Rooms are refurbished but not to my liking due to being somewhat dated - low ceilings, pretty typical Vegas hotel type rooms. The Park Avenue Deluxe was very clean but dark with poor reading light . The bathroom was also dimly lit which was annoying. I requested a new room with better light for my second night stay and was accommodated on the third try. They really don't want you changing rooms without a good reason. My final room was a Broadway Deluxe and well worth a bit extra per night. Beds were comfortable in each room. Food was good at 9 Fine Irishmen, Il Fornaio, and Gallagher's. Business meetings had catered food and it was great. Great room service also.

Reviews.Title: “Oh my god..”
Reviews.Author: Us2dogo
Reviews.Content: This place is fantastic.. an adults play ground. The hotel was great a bit blackpoolie with the carpets but oh my god how big is the hotel.. The food amazing a piece of pizza for £2 and is huge and so yummy. Am Irish piano bar that is packed every night and the americana restaurant that is open all night if you get the munchies at 4am!! There are loads of shops inside including two Häagen-Dazs, A Houdini shop, Coyote Ugly bar and nightclub upstairs, various clothes shops and of course about 1,000 slot machines, poker & roulette tables. Not forgetting the awsome roller coaster ride that goes from inside the hotel out of about the 7th floor (I think) and loop the loops all around the outside. We where here as we got married in the Tropicana Hotel across the road, what a day they where great and it was well worth the money. This hotel is in a prime loaction on the strip and a little walk will take you to all the other well known hotels, all of which will blow you away. I could quite easily say we are addicted to Las Vegas and could easliy go back every year. We also did the Grand Canyon with Maverick helicopters booked before we went out. It is a little expensive but if you do the Sunset or sunrise is amazing.

Reviews.Title: “enjoyed the hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ian M
Reviews.Content: Stayed down the other end of the strip this time, Think we'll head back to the middle. Got to check into our room even though we arrived before 11 am. No smoke smell, but cost us $10 extra for a strip view, more like an airport view. Lots to do in the hotel and ate, at America, the pastry shop for coffee and muffins in the morning, Gonzolez & Gonzolez, and 9 fine irishmen. Very busy told 96% booked. Nice having a car rental agency in the lobby. Rooms well appointed and cleaned properly each day. no noise from hallways or roller coaster.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel I have stayed at yet.”
Reviews.Author: nyrock
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at numerous hotels from New York to Europe to San Francisco to Disney world as well as many other locations. Up until this stay I have been happy with all the hotels I have stayed at except this one. Our room seemed like a closet that they threw a king bed and some furniture into. It was so tight if you opened the armoire door you couldnt get pass the bed until you closed it. The luggage bench or ottoman was stained with God only knows what (needless to say we didn't place anything on it or even touch it). The shower had horrible pressure as well as those stupid sliding doors. I have never seen a four star (make me laugh) hotel with sliding doors on their tubs. The room couldn't seem to stay at one temperature too hot, Lower the unit, whoa look out now to cold, guess what ? Thats right raise the unit. We must have played with that thermostat a minimum of 4 times a day over a 4 day stay. The way I figure it with my wife agreeing "We must have gotten the hooker 1 night special room". As far as the casino if thats all you care about then no problems there. The restaurants were good.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Hotel, not much to offer”
Reviews.Author: Rachel422
Reviews.Content: 1. The pool is shaded by the building for all but aut 3 hours out of the day. Because of this people start to save seats and crowd the pool early, but unless you're interested in getting up early an laying in the shade it is NOT fun. The pool is also very small and was overrun by kids. 2. It is a pretty good walk away from most everything else. This is fine during the day, but after a nice dinner or going to clubs you will not want to make the walk back. And YES you will have to leave NYNY to find a good place to eat, or a good club. Most of the food is pizza, sandwhiches, or hot dogs. There is a good piano bar but because it is really the only decent bar it also gets very crowded very early. 3. It was too much money, the rooms at MGM were the same price and lower for a MUCH better hotel. It was also very loud with the rollercoaster going by the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with great atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: whodeytoronto
Reviews.Content: This was my sixth trip to Las Vegas and stayed at New York New York. The following review will give you a good idea if this is the place to lose your money!! Location on Strip (7 out of 10) Not a bad location just not great. The location is good because it is connected to MGM which has a lot of action, gambling and otherwise but with Ceasars, Bellagio, Paris and Venitien located more north on the strip, your walks could get very tiresome. BUT this is very minor. Show (2 out of 10) Zumanity is the show that is at New York New York. Not a good show at all!!! Very amateurish and a waste of money. Spend the extra dough and go see Love at Mirage or KA. Gambling ( 7 out of 10) If you are a poker player, this is not the place for you. There is no poker room. But the MGM has a good room and the hotels are very close so not a big deal. The other aspects of the gambling floor were good. Restaurants (8 out of 10) Good food at good price. Atmosphere (10 out of 10) This is where New York New York excels. There always seems to be an upbeat, party atmosphere at any hour of the day or night. You will have people singing in the Piano bars, through the streets of "soho" and people yelling from the roller Coaster (which is a great ride) Overall (8 out of 10) If you avoid Zumanity, this is a great hotel that provides great value. I would recommend it for your bank withdrawal trip.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: sbercher
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the New York New York for 2 nights at the end of our USA trip. We had stayed in Vegas at the beginning of our journey, at the Luxor, but we wanted a better location. The NY NY is located within easy walking distance to the middle of the Strip. It is right accross from the MGM and from M&M's world and the Coca-Cola store. We arrived by car and parked at the free hotel parking located at the back of the main building. It was just 5 minutes from parking the car to checkin. We were offered a 15$ upgrade to a better room (from a Skyline room to a Chrysler room) and accepted it as we would be on the 34th floor with a Strip view. The hotel is made of about 5 or 6 different towers, each with its own elevator from the casino. Our room was wonderful. It was large, extremely clean, with plenty of storage. The furniture was in excellent condition and the decoration was beautiful. As we were on the 34th floor we had an impressive view of the Strip and the airport. The bed was comfortable and I slept like a baby (I normally never sleep well away from my own bed). We had breakfast at the Italian-American restaurant in the casino and the service was impeccable and swift, and the food was good. We didn´t try any of the other hotel services but all staff we were in contact with were very courteous. Our fare was very good too : about 70$/night/room .. unbeatable for what we received. I am looking forward to coming back to the NY NY and show it to my partner in October when I come back.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed there many times”
Reviews.Author: buf04
Reviews.Content: We have been to Vegas many times and stayed at Mandalay, Luxor, Excalibur, Aladdin (now Planet Hollywood) . At NYNY we stayed 3 times and it was always great . I have to say that we always had a Marquis Suite so I don't know how it is with a standard bedroom. To book a Marquis Suite you have to call the hotel because you can't do it via their website (anyway once we were able to book it via expedia). The Marquis is a very nice room with Jacuzzi in the corner of the bedroom. You have a sitting area with couch, two chairs then a round table with other chairs. You have the safe, and then what my husband and I think is great is the Bose Wave stereo. The suite is very quiet you never hear noise from the outsite. We didn't hear the rollercoaster even if we could see it from our windows. The view from the marquis suite is not so great because if you have the strip view you will see the rollercoaster and also the windows are small at NYNY. Not floor to ceiling windows as you have at Mandalay or Planet Hollywood. The pool is very small and we never went there. The casino is cute but we used to go to Excalibur or MGM casinos. The Fornaio Backery is great to breakfast or also to eat some Panini (sandwich) during the day. We tried the Caprese Panino (Mozzarella, Tomatos and Oregano). There are also 2 Starbucks inside the NYNY. Next time we go to Vegas we will stay at another hotel just because we like to change but it's sure we will go to NYNY again someday. Check my pics .. I uploaded 2 different Marquis from 2 different trips. :-) one is on the 10th floor the other one is on the 36th floor

Reviews.Title: “Stayed twice now & would stay again”
Reviews.Author: pongosmum
Reviews.Content: I can't think of anything bad to say about this hotel - we've stayed twice and both times haven't had a thing to complain about. Looking at some of the reviews, maybe we were just lucky - but next time we go to Vegas, I'll be on-line booking this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “NY NY Vegas”
Reviews.Author: kcashmore
Reviews.Content: Great Rooms ! Casino crowded.. They offer free rooms to me all the time. I like the rooms but you can hear every noise in the hallway. Im not a fan of the casino.. Never been ot the pools. None the less its a nice hotel but i opt for other places if i have free offers

Reviews.Title: “There are alot better hotels in Vegas to stay at than NYNY”
Reviews.Author: parkoSydney
Reviews.Content: Booked NYNY on their website and received a followup email stating the tariff was going to be more that double what my printed confirmation was for a strip view room. I challenged them and they agreed we had the right to the room at the price I received from the online booking, however when we got to our room our "view" was totally obscured by a large advertisement on the outside glass. When our room wasnt made up 1 day & I rang housekeeping, the female I spoke to rudely told me we left our Do Not Distrub sign on - which we hadnt! And to top everything off we received a phone call at 12.30 while we were asleep from the front desk saying someone was there to see me. I didnt go downstairs but investigated with the manager the next morning only to be told that they had no record & someone was probably trying to scam us! As a mother travelling with her children this DID not make me feel very happy with the hotel as the phone caller had addressed me by name & the hotel itself were the only people in town who knew we were staying there - I hadnt completed anything in Vegas that gave my hotel details. not happy at all that it happened but less still with the attitude of management

Reviews.Title: “Nice for the price!!!”
Reviews.Author: Marley2563
Reviews.Content: This is the 2nd time my husband & I have stayed at the NY-NY. The 1st time was approx. 4-5 years ago. Loved it then and was surprised to see how different the casino was from a few years ago. I guess it was recently remodeled and looks fabulous!!! I know this hotel is popular with the young crowd, but there's a great mix of all ages here. We checked in early Monday morning about 10am and our room was available then. The time it took to check in was minimal. However, the time it took to sign up for a players card was ridiculous! They have 2 older gentleman working behind the counter who can't type faster than 2 words per minute. Extremely slow. Most all of the staff we encountered were friendly. The workers who work for "Tahiti Village" timeshare were quite annoying. They're the ones constantly bugging you with free tickets to shows or dinner. After the expierence we had from taking the so called tour, I'd like to advise everyone who's not truly interested in buying a 50K 1 week timeshare to by pass this 3 hour tour. I can see how people get pressured into buying something they cannot afford. Our room was clean and quiet. Never heard any noises from the room next door. The bed was comfortable but the pillows were awful!!! They were small, thin and hard. We had a spa room that was very nice. We used the safe in the room. Wish they had a coffee maker in the room. We ate at Gallaghers Steak House. They keep it very dark, so dark I could not read the menu. The food was good although very pricey. I ordered the surf and turf- $85.00. That's all you get, everything is ala carte. A glass of Merlot-$8.00. A shrimp cocktail in which you get 3 large shrimp- $16.00. Had we not had a gift certificate to eat there, we probably would not have just because of the cost. Each restaraunt has a menu posted outside so you can easily view the items they have along with the prices. We did eat at the America, good food, decent prices. One evening I had the steak and crab legs for $15.00 that included a salad, potato and steamed veggies!!! It was delicious and a great value. Had the breakfast buffet at Chin-Chins, very good. The casino slots were very tight. Didn't see anyone hitting anything of substance. The tables weren't busy. We participated in the black jack tourney (1st time for both in a tourney) and took 2nd and 3rd place. That was fun for only a $20 entry fee. The best and funnest bar at NY NY is the Bar at Times Square!!! What a blast. It's the sing along with the dueling piano guys. If you get there early enough, you won't have to pay the $10 cover. You can still watch the fun and hear the great music from outside of the bar, but the atmosphere inside and participating with everyone is by far one of the best times we had. A must do.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms as expected, hotel better than average!”
Reviews.Author: flowerd2004
Reviews.Content: Stayed at NYNY January 18th-22nd with my boyfriend and his father. We tipped the front desk attendant and were upgraded one room category and had a nice corner room with a view of the roller coaster and strip. Having been to Vegas before and through a number of different properties, I was immediately impressed by the selection of restaurants in this hotel. Most places only seem to have a few options and most shut down late at night, but NYNY did not disappoint. In addition, it had a wide range of choices for any budget instead of all pricey options. Even the room service prices were incredibly reasonable by Vegas standards. Location on the strip was good and being able to easily walk to Luxor and MGM Grand was nice. We rented a car during this trip and found the self parking here was MUCH better than several other hotels we parked at (Planet Hollywood, Palazzo). Perhaps the best part about NYNY is the great club scene. Rok was a fun club and Studio 54 and LAX are a short walk too. If you don't want to dance all night there's also a piano bar that was packed every night and looked like a good time. On the flip side, don't bother shopping here.... head to Miracle Mile, Caesars or Fashion Show Mall instead as the shops at NYNY are minimal. Overall rating is a 4, although value for the price is wonderful at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Las Vegas amazing ... Loved New York New York.”
Reviews.Author: Dinkystar
Reviews.Content: Las Vegas has to be among the 'must go' destinations in the world and how the New York, New York lived up to expectations. My girlfriend and I stayed in a Jacuzzi room and I would recommend this upgrade for sure. The room was huge (like everything in Vegas !) and the hotel and Casino is set out in a village theme, with loads of eating / drinking opportunities for all ages/nationalities. The pool was amazing and chilled with music playing, though the drinks were slightly pricey there, they were big and worth it ! We are giving a review here about Vegas in general, a few pointers to pick the right location and things not to miss. Get on the right hand side of the plane from the UK when checking in, the window view coming through the desert into Vegas with the Canyon on you're right is amazing for those of you, like us, scared of taking a helicopter at a later stage of the holiday ! The *New York New York * is opposite the MGM Grand and a perfect place to start off your journey down the famous strip ! We went into every Hotel/Casino - Hooters is off the strip but close enough to walk to, it's one for the lads - say no more ! A short cab ride to the Hard Rock - worth a visit. The Luxor, Excalibur and Mandalay Bay were behind us and to be honest a little too far out for our liking and not as good as the *New York New York.* Heading up the strip the Harley Davidson Cafe is a place you've gotta go to, the food is out of this world and if you like motorbikes and the rock n roll years it's the place for you. The Water Show outside Bellagio's is an experience to die for, incredible isn't the word. Caesars Palace is huge, and has a nightclub (Pure) and a fantastic bar (Pussycat Room) with world class barmen doing tricks galore. Along with the Venetian (Probably in our opinion the best hotel in the strip) and Mirage, these hotels are exceptional, bang in the the middle and in a great location to save on cab fares ! We watched three shows, the Phantom of the Opera in the Venetian has to be the pick, truly sensational, get in the first ten rows for an amazing experience. Shoot "Downtown " about a 20 dollar cab ride, but catch the Stratosphere on the way, at the very end of the strip it's a great Hotel/Casino. If you are a Poker Player in Vegas for the first time, the tables are welcoming and you feel comfortable playing against the best. The Imperial Palace, centre of the strip, is also a good poker choice for the novice. The Stratosphere has a revolving restaurant (Top of the World) go there at night time the view is mind blowing - Vegas Lights from one end of the strip to the other. For the nut-jobs it has a ride that shoots you off the very top of the hotel at it's peak, 900 feet above everything in Vegas ! Downtown has cheaper game play than the strip, the Golden Nugget and Four Queens are the best Casino's. The must go show to go to is "Defending the Caveman" in the Nugget. Either if you are in a relationship going nowhere, or like us one forever, you will find it funny and true to every couple's everyday life, it is also famed for sorting out sexual troubles, it will save you from those councelling sessions for sure ! The light show " Downtown" was one of the highlights of our stay, Music and lights, won't spoil it for you - just go ! For first time slot players, play "Wheel of Fortune" be warned you will get hooked ! We saw the "O" by Cirque du Soleil in Bellagio's, not really for us, but can understand the enjoyment in some people's faces and work put into the whole show - so professional. The Cabs have a free Vegas guide, make sure you pick one up. Keep to the main streets, tip the waitresses a dollar when playing in the casino's and your drinks will be plenty and will keep on coming ! As for shopping, "Las Vegas Premium Outlets" is the place to go, damn hot ( touching 100 !) but the prices are cheap for designer gear ! Bit further along from the Stratosphere - again a cab ride from the strip. As *New York New York *goes, for atmosphere, customer service, rooms, food and the Vegas experience it's a fantastic choice. A truly wonderful hotel and casino. The American breakfast bar/diner is fab. "Mon Ami Gabi "close to the Paris hotel is a fantastic Parisian - style restaurant. Next time we go ( one five day trip to Vegas isn't enough !) we are looking at a more Central Location, like the Mirage or the beautiful Venetian, but in the *New York New York * we will one day return !

Reviews.Title: “Awful experience...”
Reviews.Author: diazfranco
Reviews.Content: the location is awesome. The room was not clean, and there was an awful smell coming out of the bathroom. We called the front desk and 2 hours later somebody showed up to clean...

Reviews.Title: “Place to party...”
Reviews.Author: joeskier
Reviews.Content: For all young couples who want to get away and let it all go! My g/f and I go to Vegas once a year and stay at the NY NY every time. We love being around the younger crowd and enjoy the ROK and Coyote Ugly bars. This location is great, on the further south end, yet close to most places. The rooms were plenty big and service was outstanding. We slept later into the day and when we would leave the room I would just call and our room would be clean with in the afternoon. Go if you are young and want to kick it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, nicer slots”
Reviews.Author: Smackersmith
Reviews.Content: My GF and I decided to get married in Vegas and we decided that we would stay at New York New York. The reason for this was that we wanted to stay in one of 'Mega Resorts' and it was a hip place for two 24 year olds. The room was nice, comfy bed, nice bathroom and a safe. The only bad thing was the view, the chain lift of the roller coaster and the Project City Centre building site. The view wasn't really a problem as we would rather be on the strip than looking at it from our room. When we arrived we decided to have our bags taken by the bell hops to our room once we had checked in. This was the best thing as it took us 25 minutes to find the registration desk. Once we finally got there, the staff were friendly. Not being a huge gambler, I stuck to the penny slots (won 174 dollars) and $5 black jack. If you are a novice like me I would suggest watching a few hands and try to find a nice dealer. The hotel has lots of bars and food places all which looked nice. The only places we tried was the ESPN sports bar (get there early when NFL is on otherwise you wont get a seat) and small bar near the escalators which go down to the csino. Although a bit pricey, it was still good. All in all I would stay at NYNY agin as it has a great location in reffrence to the airport and other hotels including the monorail station at MGM.

Reviews.Title: “NYNY Is Great!”
Reviews.Author: Philch1
Reviews.Content: I booked on the hotel website 8 months in advance, and checked again 10 days before leaving the UK and noticed there was a much better offer available. I cancelled the original booking for no charge, and re-booked for the better offer which saved us $250 over 5 nights. We arrived at about 4pm on New Year’s Eve, and check in took less than 10 minutes. We stayed in the New Yorker tower, in a Park Avenue room overlooking the roller coaster and facing the strip. I was concerned about noise from the roller coaster, but apart from the occasional scream, I didn’t really hear it. It stops at 11pm, except at the weekend when it stays open until midnight. I was very surprised that hotel guests still have to pay $14 for 1 ride – at that price I didn’t think it was worth it. We were disappointed that the room did not have any tea or coffee making facilities – we really thought a 4 star hotel should offer this, but we were told to call room service instead (obviously for a charge)! The room was a good size, although starting to show its age. The carpet had some stains by the window, and if you pulled the curtains back you could see the wallpaper was peeling away and the plaster was crumbling.
