The safe is built into the wall, and is very small. You could not put a laptop or SLR camera inside. We had just enough space for our passports, wallets and mobile phones. The room had a large CRT telly with about 30 channels. The beds were very comfortable. There was a good all-you-can-eat breakfast buffet at one of the casino restaurants, and the America restaurant had an all-day breakfast menu with most items $8 to $12. There is no buffet for an evening meal, but you can easily walk to the MGM Grand or Luxor, which both have an evening buffet. This was my first trip to Vegas and overall I was very impressed. Although the NY NY is at the bottom end of the strip, there is a bus that stops outside the MGM Grand, and goes all the way to the other end. It is only $5 for a 24 hour pass. My only other disappointment was that the pool was closed for the winter period, and there was no inside pool, but apparently no Vegas hotel does.

Reviews.Title: “Don't let the bad reviews keep you from staying here!”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaTreehugger
Reviews.Content: Went to Vegas for the NFR and cowgirl daughter's 21rst birthday. Was skeptical after reading negative reviews, but got a decent rate and decided to go for it. We haven't anything bad to say about our hotel experience. The staff were super friendly, actually exceptional considering the amount of people they deal with and check-in was a breeze. We asked for adjoining rooms or as close as possible and staff worked with us, we were one room away from each other! I couldn't believe it! Hotel elevators and casino were easy to navigate. We stayed three days in Park Ave view rooms (view is really the roof of casino and roller coaster which wasn't operating) Room was tastefully decorated, clean and roomy especially the incredible bathroom. As far as the casino, I had not been to Vegas for years and was shocked at the prices of everything from a beer to a Nathan's dog. Cocktail service was sketchy at best at the slots. Slots were not loose and tables are $$$. We watched the Steelers win at the ESPN zone which was fun but again overly expensive. Had it not been raining/snowing I think we would have went elsewhere for our gambling and dining, especially since NYNY is centrally located. We were also disppointed with the removal of the "Central Park" trees and the bizarre construction of the middle of the casino floor, very very tacky looking.

Reviews.Title: “Good for families”
Reviews.Author: fyona
Reviews.Content: This was a good hotel for families, room were adequate, not huge, food choice great and plenty for the kids to do. Its huge bur good value for LV.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: OzzyExplorer
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 5 nights and it was fantastic! The rooms are very clean, the service was amazing and the location is perfect. The casino area is smaller then the MGM but still enough casino to have loads of fun. We loved the NY-NY!

Reviews.Title: “Dream (Match) Come to Life”
Reviews.Author: geezy
Reviews.Content: I love Manny Pacquiao and saw him fight live two times in '08. Here was my opportunity to see him for a third time since he was showing up in Vegas again to fight Oscar De La Hoya. Although tickets were sold out the day they were released, I was fortunate enough to get them less than a week before the actual fight. Prior to deciding to get the tickets I had to find a place to stay for my girl and myself. After weeks and weeks of research, I decided NY NY was the best deal in town. Since the fight was at the MGM Grand, the location was close enough to walk (a bridge length) and at the same time save some money compared to the surrounding hotels on the strip and the MGM itself. My girl and I stayed for 2 days in the Skyline room accommodation and were very pleased to say the least. Our room had nice views including the roller coaster facing MGM. The bed, pillows and sheets were pretty comfortable. Good size room with ample space in the bathroom is all we could ask for. However, the casino itself in my opinion is not my favorite. I'm not a big gambler so I don't really care, but what stood out in my mind was the relatively small size of the layout of the casino and especially all the smoking going on which irritated me greatly. I'm fortunate and grateful that NY NY had affordable rooms available during this exciting weekend event. Had they not, I probably would not have been motivated to locate fight tickets and been able to attend and witness the beat down of De La Hoya by my main man and idol, Manny "Pac-Man" Pacquiao! Yee!

Reviews.Title: “A disappointing stay at NYNY Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ECexpat
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to take advantage of Travelocity's Vegas packages and spend 2 nights at New York - New York. We've stayed in Vegas before, at Excalibur. In the past, we walked through NYNY's casino and were impressed with the air filtration, but not this time. We booked a Park Avenue room, and upon check in, we easily upgraded a non-smoking Spa Suite room. The upgrade cost was $55 for the weeknight (Thurs, 1/1) and $90 for the weekend night (Fri, 1/2). Our room was in the New Yorker tower. We were surprised there was not a staff member asking to see your room key like Excalibur has before accessing the elevators. Our room was tastefully decorated with a clean spa tub. However, a significant amount of the grout in the shower was black with mildew and in a few spots appeared to be damaged due improper repair or so badly damaged from mildew and mold it appeared to be rotten. It made me wish I brought flip flops to wear in the shower. There were knobs missing from the chest of drawers and the picture quality from the satellite TV was poor. What is the point of a large flat screen TV if the picture quality or reception is bad. The casino's air quality was poor. We ended up gambling in Excalibur, Luxor, and Mandalay Bay instead. Our dinner at Nine Fine Irishmen was great. We've never been disappointed with Nine Fine Irishmen's food or service. On both mornings around 8:00 am, we were awakened by groups on people shouting in the hallways. Upon checking out, we reported the mildew and received a $20 dollar credit for each night. In the future, we'll stay at Mandalay and only visit NYNY for dinner at Nine Fine Irishmen.

Reviews.Title: “Once again we love NYNY”
Reviews.Author: kajunkel
Reviews.Content: This was our 6th trip to Las Vegas and our 4th stay at NYNY. As a point of reference we have also stayed at the Mirage and the Aladdin (now Planet Holleywood). New York New York still remains our favorite. As a sidenote, we had a free hotel room offered to us at Hooters Casino. Two days prior to the trip we decided not to chance a new hotel that was not directly on the strip and paid to stay at NYNY. What a great choice! We checked out the room we would have had at Hooters (ok but not what we would want on a trip to Vegas). Check in was easy. We had an offer through the Players Club which gave us great rates and a Park Avenue Deluxe room. I asked for a room with a good strip view and we got it. We were at the corner of the hotel with a view of the strip, the airport, and the mountains in the distance. Loved it. Our room was just as I remembered, comfortable, fairly contemporary, and clean. That's all we need in Vegas. We played mostly at NYNY because we really like the vibe there. Everything seems to be laid back. Our drinks were comped everytime we sat down at a table or machine. And service was fast. (We are tippers-so this might account for the fast and attentive service-we usually tip a dollar a drink) I mention this because we had a bad experience at the Mirage-we found the Mirage to be impressive but not our style. I can't describe it other than we sit at 10 dollar tables and play 25 cent machines. We are not high rollers and were treated as such. On the other hand we always feel comfortable and taken care of at NYNY. We ate at both ESPN Zone, Americana, and Gonzales y Gonzales. All of our meals were good. My husband is a big sports bettor so ESPN Zone works out GREAT for watching the games. The food is good, not great, but its a sports bar what can you expect. Americana is a great choice for breakfast. Once again food was good and service was excellent. Gonzales y Gonzales was really good and the margaritas were GREAT. Our favorite new touch to the hotel is the circular bar in the middle of the casino. The bartenders were great and there was always a seat available for video poker. I think this casino/hotel is great if you want a laid back, fun, young environment. If you want the wow factor, this is not the casino for you. My parent are travelling to Vegas this month, we booked them at the Wynn (thats more there style). As for us, NYNY is perfect for a relaxing fun trip.

Reviews.Title: “A really nice hotel. I would definitely stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: calif0rnia
Reviews.Content: We stayed in an upgraded room which was quite large. My only complaint was that the bed was covered with an old fashioned bedspread that had probably been used again and again. Other than that, the room was very clean, the mattress, very comfortable. The bathroom was modern and large. The problem for some guests might be that the room overlooked the rollercoaster. The noise of the rollercoaster was not the problem but the screams of the riders could be heard. The rollercoaster did not stop running until 12:00 p.m. so if you are a light sleeper, it might be a problem. It was not for us.

Reviews.Title: “Decent, but much better options. Very rude staff, uncomfortable astmosphere.”
Reviews.Author: muppetx
Reviews.Content: We stayed a couple nights at the New York, New York after I recieved a promotion from being a member of the playersclub. We usually stay at other MGM properties, but figured we would give the New York, New York a shot as the casino and hotel do have a funky young feel to it. However, there are very clear warnings that go along with this hotel that did sour the experience; First; Check-in/out. The front desk in this hotel is woefully under-staffed and very inefficient. There were long lines when we checked in and out. The hotel check-in is also visible from the casino and it did not seem that our experience was any different than most peoples (even at odd times of the day!). The most glaring example was a very large line at 7am one morning. Staff: I was quite shocked by the rudeness of the staff in the hotel and the casino. Maybe they take the New York theme a bit too far? there is no reason to be overtly rude to people. Some examples were being completely ignored for drink service (one time we actually asked for drinks and were dismissed by the waitress with I'll get around to you' - she never did come back after several hours.. Other examples were people getting chewed out at the front desk and playersclub for legit errors (from what I observed waiting in the obscenely long lines). Food: There are several food options in the Hotel, All of them incredibly over-priced (even with the 20% off coupons that they dish out!). None of them very appetizing. Avoid the ESPN Zone, completely smoke and mirrors place - it was one of the worst restaurants I have ever had the displeasure of eating in. Frozen burgers, really? Thats just lazy, cheap and stupid (esp for $15!). Rooms: Decent and well decorated rooms, but not terribly clean.. mold rampant in the bathroom. Looked as if it was a very cheap build, grout falling out, mouldy silicon interface of the tub. Sink counter-tops not installed properly. We had to request a new room after the first night as they put us directly beside the elevator shaft - don't bother accepting this room if you can help it, you won't sleep. They didn't really question us too hard when we asked for a new room, a few others in line were asking for the same reason. I guess the desk staff is used to it. Value: Well, unless they give you the room extremely cheap or for free I would suggest staying elsewhere. We don't vacation to feel uncomfortable. The Monte Carlo is a much better option and usually a comparable price.. although an older and more subdued crowd there.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the New York, New York”
Reviews.Author: fiftyish
Reviews.Content: Daughter wanted to see Las Vegas for her 21st birthday, so I did alot of research before choosing the New York, New York. I was glad I made the right decision. Getting to the hotel from the airport was easy - a five minute taxi ride. We arrived at 10:30 AM Pacific Time so I was a little concerned about not being able to check in for a few hours, but no sooner did we get out of the cab that a bellman came over, tagged our luggage, and held it for us until our room was ready and we could call to bring it up. Checking in at that hour, there wasn't anyone at the registration desk so we checked in right away. I asked for a roll a way bed as we had three people in the room and the queen size beds weren't going to big enough for three people. Since we booked our plane and hotel reservations through US Airways, there was no charge for the rollaway and the registration clerk ordered it for us. We did not have to wait for our room to be ready and after we grabbed a quick bite to eat at the American Restaurant, we checked out our room and by then the rollaway had already arrived. After placing the call for our luggage it took no more than 5 minutes for it to arrive at our room. The staff was very friendly and accommodating. The ambience of the hotel was overwhelming. The American Restaurant wasn't so great so we ate there just once. We at twice at the Chin, Chin Cafe, like their chinese food and their prices were reasonable. We also ate there for breakfast. The night of my daughter's birthday we splurged at Gallagher's. Although the food was excellent, it was very pricey. The village eateries, which had an array of eaterys (Starbucks, Ben & Jerry's, fish place, dessert eatery, Nathan's hotdogs) was picturesque with tables set up all throughout which made it appear that you were eating at outdoor cafes. You couldn't hear the noise from the casino, so it was a good place to escape the noise, smoke and music if you wanted to. The roller coaster was OK, not the best ride I ever had, very bumpy. The shoulder harness should be replaced with over the head/chest harness like other roller coasters and the headrest was not cushioned. My shoulder's and neck hurt for three days after I rode the ride. I wouldn't ride it again. Alot of archade games for the kids on the second for those kids who under 21 - something to keep them busy. Hotel is across the street from the MGM Grand where you can catch the monorail. This hotel is conveniently located.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Views, Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: tietack
Reviews.Content: Check in was a breeze. We got there about 7 at night, and we waited like 3 minutes in line. Even though the rate I booked was under the "Room Upgrades through 2009 Free" program, I tried the $20 trick to make sure we got a better room. The person checking us in declined the tip, and gave us the upgrade. And boy what an upgrade! Yeah, it was just to the next room size, 400 sq feet total, but the view was incredible - we had a corner room, 20th floor, with a view of the strip and the airport - and the sunrise, when we cared to get up that early (or stayed up that late!). The bed was as comfortable as the Temperpedic we have at home. Yeah, we had to tip multiple times for baggage service - once to the person taking bags from the car, and once to the person bringing them up to the room. But hey, that's Vegas. Just about everyone we talked to there was knowledgeable. When we accidentally kept the "Do Not Disturb" sign on the room one night, there was a message on our phone when we got back late offering to get us fresh towels, which was also excellent. While the Casino is as big as most of the others in Vegas hotels, it was easy to navigate. Never got lost, and it was easy to find the restaurants within. And the rate was less than the Motel 6 down the road. An excellent deal in our book!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it...would recommend to anyone under 40....”
Reviews.Author: tk1978
Reviews.Content: Great stay. NY NY has something for everyone. Good food, great bars and helpful staff...I would definately recommend the Bar at Times Square - drinks are expensive but worth every penny for the atmosphere...

Reviews.Title: “NYNY left something to be desired”
Reviews.Author: Peaches1317
Reviews.Content: Before we arrived at the hotel, the players club informed us as long as we played, they would comp our food and drink. My husband and I brought what we could afford budget wise due to the economy and played blackjack the entire time. The last day, my husband went to the players club and was informed we would not be comped anything. As it turns out, they do not start to comp you until you have spent $1000 gambling. Not only had we spent most of our time in the hotels when the card was applicable, but we made sure to eat there as well - for no reason! So the deal is that if you have money and don't need the comps, that is when you get reimbursed. It is very disappointing to see a business run like that. Most of the dealers that we had in the hotel were rude and rarely smiled despite us trying to get them to joke with us. One actually made me feel downright uncomfortable so we left the table. The gaming area was incredibly small compared to all the other hotels. The good things I can say the room we had was nice, though our friends' was run down. Gallegher's is a very good restuarant and the bartenders at The Bar at Times Square were excellent. That being said, we will not be going back to that hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: rxqueen123
Reviews.Content: We got a great deal when we booked it through the hotel's website. We were upgraded to a Park Ave Deluxe room with 2 free drink vouchers, 2-for-1 rollercoaster ride and other offers. The room had two queen beds that were very comfortable. The bathroom had a small fridge with ice maker hidden under the sink. The shower's water pressure was the best! Both the room and bathroom were very clean. The service was magnificent. The pool area wasn't big enough. We weren't able to use our drink vouchers at the poolside bar, even though we were told that we were able to. We went on the rollercoaster late at night. It was a great experience. The food/restaurants there are great. Overall, I had a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Cool hotel”
Reviews.Author: Suite3
Reviews.Content: There was a good buzz about the hotel, loved the walkways connecting it to the MGM and the Excalibur, made exploring easier! Stayed in one of the players suites, huge room, only had a view of the carpark, but we didnt spend much time looking out the window! The hotel is slightly old, but it wouldn't put me off this place. The food court was great, the pizza slices are to die for! The best thing about the hotel however was the dueling pianos at the bar at time square. this was one of the highlights of our stay, i cant express just how much fun it was! Those guys are so talented and great entertainers! just be prepared to bring some cash if you want to get your song played!! And dont let the $15 charge to sit down put u off - stand for free, makes dancing easier!!

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time!”
Reviews.Author: pushrhymes
Reviews.Content: Stayed here Nov 30 to Dec 3rd and loved every minute of it. We arrived quite early in the morning, around 10am, and a room was ready and prepared for us. The room was clean, quiet and had a nice view of the Rollercoaster, which was kind of fun. The bathroom was pretty big and the shower was great and the bed was super comfortable. We got a good deal on the room and loved the location, and could catch a bus on the other side of the pedestrian bridge by the MGM. The casino/gambling isn't top notch but there are so many casinos to gamble at, that it more than sufficed. I was looking to play some poker, and just walked across the street to the MGM and played in their poker room, as it's nice to switch it up from Casino to Casino anyway. Check out was easy, the "food court" area downstairs had plenty to offer at all hours of the day and overall the experience was great. I would definitely recommend it if you're looking for good place to stay in Vegas that is close to everything you need.

Reviews.Title: “Okay I guess”
Reviews.Author: canucks0707
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel from Dec 4 - 7 2008. When we got in, right away we smelled the smokiness inside..blah. Check in wasn't a problem. Our room was okay but our bathroom was small. Our 1st I checked out our hotel....that was it as I mainly went out on the Las Vegas Strip. It was a busy since there was the Rodeo event plus the De la Hoya - Pacquiao fight at MGM Grand (next door to NY NY Hotel). The walls were "paper thin" as we can hear our neighbors. Plus also some people was so loud out on the hallway waking us up at 3am in the morning, but hey it's Vegas! Overall we may go back to NY NY for the price...but prefer to find a better hotel.

Reviews.Title: “NY NY - Take It Or Leave It”
Reviews.Author: MavOhio
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at NY NY from November 26th thru Novemebr 29th. Check-In was a breeze....our plane landed us a bit before 11:00am and we were at the hotel by 12:00. They did have a room ready for us...standard/king. I asked for a strip view and they wanted to charge me $15 per day. I told the clerk that the mountains are just fine for me to look at...who goes to LV for a view, anyways. The room was nice...nothing too special. The bed was comfortable and the room was clean. The only problem, there was no happy medium to the temperature...it was either cold or hot. One morning, we could hear our neighbors very clearly, I thought they were in our room, but we were leaving to go onto the strip, so it was not too bothersome...but be advised, walls are thin. I was a bit disappointed with the casino itself. The table games were great...friendly dealers, good minimums, etc. However, I enjoy playing the slots as well and their slots were not special. No fun games...I like Elvis, Wheel of Fortune, Top Dollar, etc. It all seemed the same and nothing to WOW me. Other casinos, however, had the same table games and better slots, so I went elsewhere the majority of the time...Monte Carlo had $5 table limits and better slots. As for the little restaurants in NY NY, nothing to write home about. The pizza shop was disgusting...the bottom of my supreme slice was so greasy that my pizza was actually soggy. Left a bad taste in my mouth to say the least. Nathans was much better for that quick bite to eat. DO NOT eat at the pretzel shop upstairs for a snack unless you have a taste for cardboard. We were disappointed on Thanksgiving...no buffet or good specials at NY NY. We walked over to MC and ate at CAFE for a great turkey dinner. I cashed in some points for a free dinner. The food there was yummy!!!! When are stay was over, check-out was simple. I requested a later check-out and they granted me a noon check-out instead of 11:00am. All in all, NY NY was okay...I have stayed better, I have stayed worse. I think that NY NY is losing their pizazz from the very beginning of their opening...they are going downhill. I hope they can pick it back up because I used to enjoy it!

Reviews.Title: “New York New York 1st anniversary in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: ronishia11368
Reviews.Content: I was very skeptical about staying at this hotel because the reviews were so random. I must say that it was a nice experience. There was nothing extra special or extra horrible. The room that we had was the Park Ave Deluxe room and they said they upgraded us to a better view. I must say that the room was a lot smaller then I was use to but we made due. We had a really nice view of the MGM and the roller coaster. The staff was rather pleasant and I loved the pizza shop in the hotel. The roller coaster ride was AWESOME! As a native New Yorker I thought it was a cute rendition of the city. Vegas was wonderful and the hotel was just cool nothing to write home about. The room was clean the bed was not hard and room service was rather quick.

Reviews.Title: “Sept trip to Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: kentucky2008
Reviews.Content: Stayed the middle of Sept for two nights at New York New York. Unfortunately the lobby construction did create a high noise factor which detracted from the gambling experience. The staff was polite when there was a misunderstanding about our on-line booking and we were granted our Strip View Room. The roller coaster did not disturb our sleep. Also spent one night on Treasure Island. The beds were wonderful. Great View. Ana from New York checked us in. I had read a bad review about her attitude but she was very courteous to us. Great experience at Treasure Island. We enjoyed their casino the most. TI breakfast buffet was delicious.

Reviews.Title: “Lower end hotel”
Reviews.Author: catch2222
Reviews.Content: This is hotel 3 of 4 for the week. We stayed at 3 others just so we could see the whole strip and experience different things through the week. We arrived early here, and after the long walk to the hotel from the parkade we were able to check in earlier. Upon check in the desk staff pushed to spend the extra 20 a night for the bigger room, it was definitely not worth it. The room was almost too big, and not worth the money. The whole floor smelled bad, and just didn't appear to be even dusted. The beds were good enough to sleep on, and the shower was quite tiny, just don't look at the vent in the shower, as ours was really disgusting as it was packed and I mean literally packed with dust. The shower didn't drain all that well, neither did the sink. The food was horribly over priced here, and wasn't all that good. We ended up walking to the Luxor and the Excalibur, and for all being owned by the same company. The other 2 hotels were amazing, the Excalibur had a great food court, so did the Luxor. The shopping was better in the other 2 hotels, and for some reason as pushy as the time share people are down there, they seemed to be even worse at the new york new york. It's a good location but I would never stay there again, I would stay at the Excalibur as it's not that much more. The location was ok, we walked across to the MGM grand to catch the monorail, which is a great value by the way. And we did the strip that way it's much easier and felt safer too. We got off and walked to the Bellagio and watched the fountains, and began the half an hour walk back to the new york new york, it really didn't look that far! Gambling there was a waste of time, 3 of us lost over 60 bucks in 15 minutes, ON PENNY MACHINES. We had much more fun at the Luxor, or even Caesars palace. All in all, this hotel was not worth the money. It was old, It was dirty, and just plain boring. There was not a lot to do at this hotel, there wasn't as much shopping as there was in the Excalibur or the Luxor. The only thing I can recommend is if you stay here, walk across to the MGM and look at the lions, they are amazing.

Reviews.Title: “New York New York - Nice, But No "Vibe"”
Reviews.Author: B.Hart
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently returned from a four-night stay at New York New York Hotel to celebrate my birthday. We stayed from November 17th to November 21st and although this was our tenth trip to Vegas, this was our first stay at NYNY. From worst to best, the other hotels we've stayed at have been - Circus Circus, Bally's, Planet Hollywood, Treasure Island, Mirage, and Venetian. Among those hotels, I would have to place NYNY between Bally's and Planet Hollywood. The look of NYNY was quite impressive, but I found the over-all vibe somewhat lacking. More on that later. The hotel is designed with a mixture of 1920's art deco and modern New York style, but the combination works. The valet area where the taxi dropped us off looked like the grand entrance to a 1920's hotel. The front desk is located only a short walk from the valet entrance and the front desk personnel, as well as the valet, were very friendly. We booked the 5th Avenue Deluxe package that gave us a free upgrade from a standard Skyline room to a Park Avenue Deluxe room and believe me, the room looked just as nice as it did on the website. The hotel rooms are divided among four towers - the Century tower, the Empire tower, the Chrysler tower, and the New Yorker tower which is where we stayed. Each tower has it's own bank of elevators with about ten elevators in each bank serving certain floors. The result is a very short wait for elevators going up, or coming down. The halls to the rooms look as if you are in an apartment building. The smaller the last two digits of your room number are, the further you are from the elevator. We were in room 1408 so we were pretty far. The room itself, although kind of small, was very nice and cozy. It felt more like an apartment than a hotel room. The room had a king-size bed, two cushioned chairs, an ottoman, a marble table, two bedside tables with lamps, an iHome radio with iPod dock (The radio won't work with the iPhone), a writing desk and chair with a large mirror and lamp, an additional lamp in the corner, and a large armoire with closet space on each side which holds the iron and ironing board and three large drawers. The armoire also holds a 32" T.V., but it's not a flat screen like many other hotels are upgrading to. The bathroom is all marble with a shower/tub combo with sliding glass frosted doors. The bathroom wasn't that big, and the water pressure left something to be desired, but it was nice all the same. Some rooms have foyers like ours did and some don't. We had a free safe on the wall in our foyer. You punch in a four-digit code and you can use it as much as you want. The safe won't fit anything big, but it works for small valuables. The room we were in had a wall of windows on the south side facing Flamingo Ave, and on the east side facing Las Vegas Blvd. The armoire was in front of the east windows though, but that was okay we still had nice views and lots of sunlight in the morning and lots of neon light at night. We also had a direct view of the roller coaster a couple hundred yards away, but the noise level was barely a whisper. As nice as the room was, we did encounter a few problems. The comforter on our bed had some questionable stains and hair on the underside. We called housekeeping and not only did they change the comforter, but they changed all the sheets as well. The housekeeper told us that they change the sheets after each guest, but not the comforter, but they will if the new guest requests it. We also had a burned-out light in our armoire, and our iron didn't work. Both problems, along with the comforter situation, were handled quickly and very professionally. The comfort of the bed was okay, not bad - not great. It felt like a regular bed, nothing like the bed at TI which is the best bed I ever slept in. Our package, along with the free upgrade, also included two free drinks redeemable at Nine Fine Irishmen pub, or Pour 24, the 24-hour bar on the mezzanine level, a 2 for 1 ticket for the roller coaster, discounted spa treatment, and a 2 for 1 breakfast on the patio of the Italian restaurant Il Fornaio. The coupon is for your entree only. Not for sides or beverages. We ordered French toast and it was delicious. They do great coffee, eggs, and bacon as well. They are definitely worth a try. Although we didn't swim, we visited the pool which is open until early December. The pool is very small and under the shadow and noise of the roller coaster. Not relaxing at all without much sun. When I said earlier that NYNY lacks a "vibe", I meant that there's not much to keep you there. It's nice walking through the recreation of the neighborhoods, but they've taken out most of Central Park to replace it with a casino bar which, as of this writing, is still under construction. Their shopping is virtually non-existent consisting of a few souvenir shops, a watch shop and one "upscale" clothing store that looks just like another souvenir shop, and you can find equal or better food choices at other hotels. There is no buffet although the Asian themed Chin Chin has a daily breakfast buffet. The bars like Nine Fine Irishmen and the dueling piano bar have live music, but you have to buy two drinks in the afternoon, and at night they become just another pretentious spot with doormen and a cover. The Coney Island arcade is cool, but if you're not a kid or if video games and cheap prizes for tickets aren't your thing then you won't care. The casino is not well organized, and the sports book is tiny. They also have time-share and rental property sellers at practically each entrance - inside the hotel. We've all seen them by other hotels, but to have them inside the hotel jumping you coming and going is very annoying. One thing I can say though, is that during the time we were there the weather was amazing (sunny and warm every day - cooler at night) and the crowds were incredibly thin with hardly any kids around. The lines for the clubs were so short that your chances of getting in were very good. In fact, they were practically begging for people to come in. Check-out was very quick, in fact, you can check out through your t.v. and drop your key off at the key deposit by the elevators, but only if you haven't incurred any in room charges. Check-out is normally 11:00 a.m., but if you need an extra hour you can call the front desk and request a 12 noon check-out for no extra charge. Like I said earlier, NYNY is a very nice hotel and you should try it, for the right price, but aside from the fact that my wife and I don't like to visit the same hotel too many times anyway, I can't really see returning to NYNY when there are other more exciting hotel choices. By the way, if you are looking for some entertainment and food choices, you can't go wrong with these - For burgers In N Out Burger is the only way to go. They have the best burgers I ever tasted and I visit them every time I visit Vegas. They are far less expensive than the over-rated Fatburger but many,many times better. Also , you may not believe this but although Circus Circus is hardly one of the best hotels in Vegas, they have the absolute best steakhouse. The steakhouse in Circus Circus has been voted the best many times and when you eat there you will see why. They have the best atmosphere, the best service, and the best food. Many steakhouses are a la carte meaning you have to purchase your entree, salad, potato, and vegetable separately, but here you get all that, including bread, with the purchase of your steak. I can't begin to describe how delicious every morsel of food was, but if you love steak try the Steakhouse at Circus Circus. Also if you are a fan of magic you would do well to check out the Steve Wyrick show at Planet Hollywood. I've seen Lance Burton four times and I've loved it each time. Lance has an endearing, engaging, fun personality and fast paced show perfectly suited to his classic magic and illusions. I've also seen David Copperfield, and for all his amazing tricks, I found his show slow, dull, and his personality felt as if he was phoning it in. Steve Wyrick is a mixture of the two. He combined Lance's personality with David Copperfield's amazing illusions. Steve's tricks, though, I felt were better than both of them. His theater is so intimate that every seat was a good seat and even though his show was hardly filled to capacity, he acted as if he were playing to a full house. Simply put, he was amazing. Check him out. I hope you enjoyed my review, I tried to be as thorough as possible, but as with any review just use it as a guideline but you can never really know until you experience it yourself. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “New York, New York, city that never sleeps!”
Reviews.Author: maddox
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I decided to get away for a Thanksgiving holiday. We both really enjoyed our 3 night stay here. We upgraded to the Broadway room for only $20 extra per night. Our room was in the NY Tower with 6 gigantic windows that lined the whole side of our room. Wonderful view! Plenty of options if you want to grab a quick bite-NY Pretzel, Nathans, Pizza (yummy, stick to the thin crust), 2 Starbucks (one is open 24 hrs), Mexican and Irish fare, and much more. We ate dinner at the famous Gallaghers (since 1927 in NYC). It was delicious! You wouldn't even of thought you were in a casino. Do not miss the Times Square Bar with the dueling pianos...I've been to places like this before (Pat O'briens) and they don't hold a candle to the excitement here. True professionals! I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Good service, room middle of the road”
Reviews.Author: lone_palm
Reviews.Content: Stayed 10/23 and 10/24. Park Avenue Room Service was good, from valet staff to front desk staff to others we encountered. Likes - The room was clean - iPod dock clock radio - Comfortable bed Liked less: - Room was not near the elevator, as with most of these large resorts. However, because of the design of the hotel I felt like I kept walking around corners until eventually I found my room. It was a bit disorienting - 18 floors up and the view out the right side of my window was another part of the hotel. Not much to see - Bathroom - little bit dated and worn, but still clean - No hotel buffet, only in one of the restaurants - food was good but small selection for the price by Vegas strip standards Would stay here again if the price is right. Did find that since most of what we like to do is further up the strip, we ended up walking a lot just to go back to the hotel room for a rest...

Reviews.Title: “I HOPE TO SEE EVERYTHING NEX TIME”
Reviews.Author: chapincito
Reviews.Content: We couldn't pick a better place to stay in Vegas; there is so much to see and enjoy at New York New York...from our window we watched the sunrise above the montains just before crashing after partying all night. I am sure every room has a great view. The Zumanity Show was awesome too!! The only little thing I have to share that perhaps it's not so good, is the fact that the only restricted floor is the 36th. floor; all other floors can be accessed by anyone and being Vegas, that was a surprise to me. I am sure they have great security but, in the mean time, who knows what could happen to any drunk person trying to make it to the hotel room...may be I'm not so used to be away from L.A. huh? Anyways, it is a great place and I look forward to staying there the next time I visit Vegas....

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel in a Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Mukmuks
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. We were part of a group celebrating a 40th birthday party and 10 couples attended and stayed at this hotel. Overall the hotel was clean, no need to nit pick as you dont spend much time in the room anyways. The staff was friendly, not out-going, but friendly and the options for dining and entertainment were fulfilling. The dueling pianos were fun, while the ESPN Sportszone was always happening with the college and NFL games going. The gaming area I would say, could use a pick me up (Blah). Not much excitement, with the exception of the sports book and its location next to the Zone. Club Rok, none of us ever made it in, but we heard it was nice and a place to see/be for late hours. We did however enjoy a nice meal @ Galaghers and further enjoyed sitting outside on the patio @ the Nine Fine Irishmen Pub/Snug. You wouldn't even know there is an outside patio. Previously we seen Zumanity, very cool and sassy show. The location of the hotel is about 15-30 minutes from other casinos and attractions. We made it a point to stop @ Harrahs Carnival court and O'Sheas. Both offer different levels of entertainment, while O'Sheas is more of a bar / casino and Carnvial Court is an outdoor area with shops / bar / stage / bands etc. In closing, New York - New York is nice, not elaborate(Venitian), but adequate for a fun stay in Las Vegas and I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Always something going on”
Reviews.Author: eastsro
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights 11/20-11/21 and had a great time....my wife and I play alot so we built up a lot of table comps quickly...make sure you use them before you leave....they expire when you leave. We ate at Gallaghers Steak House and liked it and then tried the ESPN Zone for lunch and it was so-so, the wait for food to come out was too long and the wings were raw....but again it was paid for with comps so I didn't get too mad. The location is great for seeing the rest of the strip....all in all a good couple of nights

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for the money”
Reviews.Author: Prashanth C
Reviews.Content: NYNY is a very good value for your money, to sum it up. Read more: I actually booked the price for $130 a night, bur a day before I was supposed to check-in, I went online and saw that the price was showing $100. I called them and asked if they would honor the new price and they did, which is great. We checked in Satday afternoon, and the only minus i saw was that out of 15 check-in counters, 5 were open which is ridiculous. The wait was about 20 minutes, but that's ok. The rooms are very neat, very contemporary and spacious. We got a Park Avenue Strip View and it was awesome. Linens were clean and comfortable, and there is nothing to complain about the room. Only minus I felt was there was no Internet access in the room. In this day and age, you'd kind of expect this to be free. There's no place in the hotel to take printouts for free, atleast to take printouts of tickets etc. Other than that, great stay, and very good value for money !!!

Reviews.Title: “Some good points, some bad points”
Reviews.Author: BCMck
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the NY NY as part of our honeymoon in late October 2008. Having been to Vegas before we picked the NY NY as we knew it was central on the strip and from walking through had numerous options for dining etc. Plus we wanted to see Zumanity, so we figured this was a good place to stay. The positives - its central to all on the strip. The theatre has Zumanity which is an interesting and quite funny Cirque Du Soleil show. The rooms are big, clean and comfortable. The bed was huge which you need after a day walking the strip. The negatives - the hotel staff were really disinterested when serving us. alot of the little food places downstairs never seemed to be open and the staff in them where fairly rude. The famous bar with dueling pianos was somehting we really wanted to do, but there was a $10US cover charge, just to sit in the bar - I think they would make enough from drinks etc that they wouldnt need to charge that. When we checked out we explicitly told the front desk person that we were checking out but going back to our room to get our bags. When we went back upstairs our keycard wouldnt work and we were told that we would have to call security. After another couple of "where are you?" phone calls we were finally let back into the room by a very ubrupt and rude security person and we felt like we had troubled them even though it was there mistake. This also caused us to miss our shuttle bus to the airport. Overall, the hotel is in a good spot and does have some very good points. But the staff were a very big let down and really spoilt the experience.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: cheshirepen
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights to get the " Las Vegas experience". Hated Las Vegas but were glad we went to see for ourselves. Hotel very comfortable. Good sized room and bathroom (although we had better elsewhere for the money) but it was clean. No fridge in room - presumably they want you to buy your drinks downstairs!! Iron and ironing board in room. We had an upgrade to Park Avenue deluxe room which had a view of the strip and the airport. This hotel is at one end of the strip so it is a long way to the other end if you want to see the Freemont area. We ate dinners and breakfasts in the hotel restaurants. Food fine but very busy on our second night (a Monday) and we had some difficulty getting a table. Several fast food outlets if you want that sort of thing. Valet parking efficient. Overall a good option if you don't want to go over the top with price to stay at the Bellagio.

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your money”
Reviews.Author: mrsmclovin47
Reviews.Content: Wouldn'r recommend this hotel..to many other nice hotels at the same price. When we arrived and were told prior to arriving to check in at VIP, when attemping to check in I was told sorry VIP is closed..basically go wait with everyone else....ok no problem. Then they didn't have the rooms we booked available. Finally got settled in and went to play on the tables, the asian dealer asked my son for ID which he provided then she threw it back at him and landed on the carpet....totally rude so we didn't gamble at the hotel for the 7 days that we were thier. Good luck trying to find a chair at the pool if u don't get their by 8:00 am..they have this massive hotel with one tiny pool and a roller coaster zipping around over your head. I called management to express my concerns regarding are stay considering it wasn't a cheap holiday. I spoke with the director of the hotel and she basically told me she would address my concerns with staff...no offer of come back and we will try to get are act together....I thought we might get a comp dinner or show to take the sour taste out of are mouths, but nothing. I understand things go wrong but... when you save and only have one holiday a year and it's not cheap u except it to be better...special in Vegas. So in turn I would never recommend this hotel to anyone. Cheers,

Reviews.Title: “Short Stay at NYNY”
Reviews.Author: Brewbaker
Reviews.Content: Since I don't gamble, I am not really a Las Vegas person. However, my wife was attending a brief sorority reunion at the New York New York in Las Vegas, and basically demanded that I come along. New York New York seems to be fairly typical of the huge Strip hotels - thousands of rooms, numerous restaurants and shops, and a casino. Las Vegas appears to be hurting financially right now (Fall 08). We were upgraded to a 2nd tier room for the basic price and given some free and 2-for-1 coupons. Several locals said business is way down the last 6 months, so hotels may be hurting for business with all those rooms to fill. The room was nice enough, with a comfortable bed. There were a few chintzy touches - the shower doors didn't work properly and the television receives surprisingly few channels, but there were no major problems. Staying at the NYNY is probably similar to staying at any of the other big Strip hotels, so shop around.

Reviews.Title: “Could have been better”
Reviews.Author: ditzydi_2000
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed there for our honeymoon. Like some previous reviews have mentioned, the basic room is super small. We were upgraded because on our first morning there we were woken up by some construction. That's right...some of the other more recent reviews have mentioned construction. Well it looks like a year later they're still at it. They still required hotel guests to leave a credit card number to use their internet. I can't believe a huge casino still charges for internet use. Get with the program. Needless to say we did not hang out at our casino for very long. We ventured out and about more than we were in the room. Oh yeah...steer clear of their roller coaster. The shoulder rests left indentions and popped some veins in my husband's shoulders that were bright red for a week after he rode the thing.

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: catmachine
Reviews.Content: We stayed at NYNY 3 nights mid Oct, in a double queen bed room for 2 couples. Arrived in early afternoon, and we had booked a non smoking, but they only had a smoking room, so we took it, rather than wait. Thankfully, the room didn't smell, as I am really sensitive to smoke!! Room size was great, with good sized beds and bathroom. However, by this stage, for the money we were spending in 4-5 star hotels, I was getting a little tired of showers over baths, and this is something I would research a little better for next trip. These configurations, especially when old, are terrible - they have very limited adjustments(pressure/temp) and the spray type can sometimes be uncomfortable...not good when your paying top dollar. This was the 3rd leg of our trip, from LA, SAN FRAN. We were booked in to get married at Stratosphere on the last day, and this turned out to be a great experience for an informal type ceremony. The hotel is located at the southern end of strip, which makes for some lengthy walking if you want to explore the 'newer' looking casino's. Not to say NYNY looks overly old itself. However, be prepared for the imposing, rude and extremely annoying sidewalk antics of people attempting to hand out 'escort /prostitute services literature. I found this really awkward, walking up and down the strip with my fiance/wife, and my friends. On the 1st night, when walking back to our hotel, one of these guys said something in Spanish, of course, to my partners sister. I couldn't help myself and swore at him. He heard me, and we almost got into a fight, when the lights changed, he kicked me and ran off. I would have been hesitant to retaliate, with so many of them there. This left a foul taste in my mouth about Vegas generally, and that confirmed to me I would never come back. However, next day upon a cancelled trip to the canyon, because of a mix up, I used the Hotel gym - for an additional 18USD!!!, (GREAT GYM THOUGH) and had a mini bucks night out - blackjack at Caesars Palace with pussycat doll dancers! I don't gamble - first time player, and I won 130 BUCKS - I was very happy!!! The girls went to Cirque show and absolutely loved it! That evening we all ate togethr inside Venetian. This was fantastic - beautiful interior - my favourite, and a variety of 'normal' priced restaurants. I found it very hard, walking through other casino's, to find a well priced eatery. The Venetian however, was at the opposite end of the strip to NYNY, and thus I would aim to stay here, if I went back. America,good priced eatery in NYNY, as was Rainforest in MGM across the road. There was even an Australian I think 'Outback' restaurant which was open late down the strip which was good. Ate lunch at Stratosphere Top of the world before wedding and it was really nice, and great value...you'd pay similar anywhere on the strip and here you are on a revolving restaurant high in the sky - brilliant! After the ceremony etc I booked us in at PANEVINO near the airport, with a great view of the strip. For a lovely meal, treat yourself to this place, an excellent, after wedding dinner!! The Mirage was pretty cool on the inside, and would like to see their wildlife habitats if we returned. If only the local authorities stepped in and got rid of those annoying literature/ticket dispensers!!! Oh, my partner and friend went on the roller coaster on the last night and said it was a buzz! Gym at cost of 18 dollars is a bit cheeky, would be good to know that up front, and also internet minimum of 5 dollars too. Overall, a nice establishment, but I preffered the other end of the strip and thus would either stay at that end, or look into the Marriott properties, which the cab driver told us are great, off the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Loved New York New York”
Reviews.Author: sweetleese
Reviews.Content: What an experience! I will definately stay there again next year. The hotel staff was top notch. Even the housekeeping employees were so polite and friendly. There was plenty to do and lots of restaurants to choose from. If you do end up staying there, you have got to eat at Gallager's steakhouse. DELICIOUS! It was my first time in Las Vegas and I am so happy to be fortunate enough to stay at New York New York!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel on the strip”
Reviews.Author: Hinney
Reviews.Content: The hotel was allright - nothing fancy. It is right on the strip, the room was big enough, but it could use a better cleaning. Service staff was good. After all I would say it is a little bit too much money for what you get...

Reviews.Title: “Fun at New York New York”
Reviews.Author: scq7
Reviews.Content: We booked our room through vegas.com for 3 nights for a rate we considered good value. The room was a decent size and the amenities nice (although a fridge would have been useful). The location of the hotel is convenient for accessing the Strip. The restaurants in the hotel/casino are pricey and the quality varies from venue to venue. The roller coaster was great fun! Staff were friendly and helpful. Overall a fun place to stay in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, nice upgrade!”
Reviews.Author: writetosfa
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the NY NY in May 2008. It was very nice - the casino is great - but I still preferred the MGM across the street. The first night we stayed in the basic room - and it was soooooooo small! I wasn't very happy, but they would not upgrade us at all. The second night, we used our points to upgrade to the Ziggarat Suite. This suite was bigger than some apartments I have been in! The windows were tinted green, which was different - but kinda cool. The bed was amazing! The jacuzzi was a 4 person tub and came with bath beads - so great! We got slippers and bathrobes - and chocolate cherries at turndown service time. The restaurants in the casino were okay - a little pricey - but thats not uncommon in Vegas. We ate at the pizza place and the ESPN Zone - both were pretty good. But, if you want a great buffet - go next door to the Exalibur - it was great and a decent price. We also got a free breakfast at the MGM which was awesome as well! I would definitely go back to Vegas - but I think I would stay at the MGM over the NY NY. I really would like to try out the Venetian, Mirage or the Wynn. Those are mid-strip and close to all the action. The NYNY & MGM are about a 5-10 min walk to the middle of the strip which isn't bad at all!

Reviews.Title: “Yes, I was surprised that...”
Reviews.Author: tanya4
Reviews.Content: ....I was surprised that I actually enjoyed my stay. After reading a few not so great reviews, I was pleasantly surprised with our visit to NY NY. We stayed on the 6th floor in the New Yorker Tower (which is a great location by the way!) Awesome view of the air conditioners (LOL). The room was dark, but tastefully decorated. Not as old as I thought it would be. No stains, no dings in the wall, no shower mildew. Pretty nice. We had dinner at Gallagers and Il Fornaio (sp) and had lunch at America. All were decent. There is some construction going on right in the center of the casino, not a big space, but, it does make you walk around. Hopefully they are adding a nice sit down lounge area. Most of the changes that they have made to the resort/casino are good. However there really is no place just to lounge, sit back and relax. Not a lot of energy in the place! Overall a great stay - easy access to all that there is on the South Strip!

Reviews.Title: “We had a brilliant time”
Reviews.Author: Roslyn138
Reviews.Content: Had looked at all the reviews on Trip Advisor for Vegas prior to booking, We were not disappointed - had contacted the hotel regarding upgrading - special occasion - all dealt with. Checking-in very swift and very customer focused. Got a room with a strip view - clean, good size, suited us well. OK the television didn't have many channels , and there is no tea/ coffee facilities in the room - but who is going to stay in their room when there is so much to see and do. We booked Mama Mia , and Barry Manilow - great evenings, but the highlight was the Grand Canyon trip with Sundance helicopter company. Picked up from the hotel in a limo - smooth ride in the chopper, right mix of commentary and chat by the pilot - and then a picnic on the canyon floor - and if that wasn't enough -the final flight back along the strip. Some quick tips. Use the deuce bus system - great value - and you see all the sights on $5 for 24 hours Must go and see the Fremont Street experience Buffets at the Monty Carlo great value

Reviews.Title: “Fun place to stay”
Reviews.Author: MinnesotaKaren
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Vegas, and my friend came in from France for the trip. I booked this through a travel agent and really had no idea what to expect, but was told that this a good value for the money -- not the absolute cream of the crop, but decent. I would have to agree. Our room in the New York Tower was average -- not great, but clean and warm. Just a little bit worn and not new. I was surprised there wasn't a mini-bar in it. The view was great, we overlooked the strip. The people of the hotel were top-notch, everyone was friendly, smiling and helpful. This included the staff during check-in and check-out, the people at the Zumanity box office, and the casino people who were quick to help when a machine malfunctioned and didn't give me my $9 winnings. :) The location was great. One complaint is that we were given a 2 for 1 coupon at Il Fornaio restaurant for patio breakfast before 10:30am. It turns out there are TWO Il Fornaio's in the hotel. We stood in line at the wrong one for a time, and when we got the the RIGHT one at 10:33, the man said it was too late for breakfast and wouldn't serve us. He was actually quite rude, the only person we encountered like that during our trip. The live music at the Times Square Bar was a gas, and there was a 24-hr restaurant which we made use of a couple of times, All in all, I'd definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time”
Reviews.Author: Merisa23
Reviews.Content: My husband, My Godmother, Mother and I stayed at NYNY from October 6th to October 10th. The hotel was great my husband and I had a spa suite for the first three nights and the Park Avenue room with premium view for the last night. The Spa suite was great it was spacious and had a great view of the strip we really enjoyed the Jacuzzi in the room it was very nice to relax after walking the strip all day long. The Park Avenue room was okay it also had a nice view but it was a little small and the TV wasn’t great. Checking in was very easy and smooth we stayed in the Century tower and it was a great location. We ordered room service a few times and we all thought it was very good even with the high prices. We didn’t really eat that much but the ESPN Zone was pretty cool the baseball games on Friday night. They were very fast and the food was okit was a little pricey. We also tried the America restaurant this was a great restaurant the food wasn’t that expensive and they give you huge portions and they have a huge variety to chose from. The casino was very nice it was a little on the small side with the construction going on but it wasn’t too crowded and the staff was very friendly. Rok night club was really cool and we didn’t go to the Times Square bar but every time we walked by seemed like everyone was having a blast. We went to check out the roller coaster and it was 16.00 bucks to ride it kind of pricey if you ask me and just beware if you are in some of the rooms you can hear the roller coaster and the people yelling on the roller coaster late at night. I would say the only downfall for this hotel was the pool area it was way to small and you had to get out there really close to 10am when they opened or you wouldn’t get a seat and the sun doesn’t come over the pool until about noon. Check out was great and our flight didn’t leave until 1130pm so they held our bags for us and got them within seconds when we had to leave to get to the airport. Oh and one last thing I wouldn’t suggest taking the bus it was terrible. If you have any questions please feel free to email me at [-].

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay at New York New york”
Reviews.Author: MissT25
Reviews.Content: We have just stayed here for 10days on the 15th sept 08 and loved every second. There were 4 of us aged between 22 and 28 and there was plenty for all of us to do. Check in was quick and although there is some construction in the main entrance this didn't matter at all. All the staff were polite and helpful. Our rooms were on the 4th floor and were both very clean, maid service was excellent, clean towels every day This was our first time in Vegas and to be honest i think this hotel is in one of the better locations along the strip. You have the MGM opposite as well as the Bellagio up the street and a 24hour pharmacy(which to us from England is a 24hour supermarket)next door. The only problem is picking where to eat in the evenings as there are so many to choose from in all the hotels and if you are anything like me and my partner you don't want to feel uncomfortable in a posh restaurant. i would recommend the American Diner near reception in NYNY as they have so many different dishes you can never have the same thing twice. Will be coming back here again on our next Holiday to Vegas!!

Reviews.Title: “I guess it was just OK”
Reviews.Author: Alberta travel view
Reviews.Content: I'll start out by saying were are in the wrong age group to enjoy this hotel. We saw very few other 50 year olds here. I would imagine it would be a fun place to party but our party days are long over. We were offered a free three night stay. The room was to be newly refurbished.........which it certainly was not. The room itself was OK. Very dark and not too special in any way, but OK. They tried to sell us an upgrade, but we didn't care to. The food court is cool, and the food rather tasty. I just didn't find anything I could get excited about. Everything was just...............OK. I need to say the pool area was small and far form OK. It seemed dirty to me. We were spoiled by staying at the treasure island hotel last time. I much prefer the Monte Carlo to New York .

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!!!”
Reviews.Author: crc1983
Reviews.Content: We have just got back from a weeks stay at this hotel. We had the best time ever! I went with my partner, we are 25 & 29 and it was a perfect hotel for our age. The entertainment was great. We like a drink so this hotel was the place to be. The rooms were basic but contempory and perfect for what we needed it for. I only have one complaint about this hotel and that is the pool area. For a hotel with 2000 rooms the pool area is very small and because of the where the sun rose the pool did not get sunshine until 12noon and then it was lost again by 4pm. Obviously there is so much to do other than sunbathe but as a sun worshipper myself i would have preffered to be able to sunbathe for longer. Apart from that we had the best time ever!

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for.”
Reviews.Author: Curlisue
Reviews.Content: I stayed at New York New York Casino for 6 nights when travelling to the USA for business and had an enjoyable stay. Check-in was pretty swift, but we did arrive on Sunday afternoon. I noticed that during peak times (Thurs/Fri) the arrivals line was pretty long. I stayed in rm 2963 in the New Yorker Towers. The room was spacious, with two queen sized beds, a sitting area/desk and the bathroom was also quite spacious. When I arrived the room was clean and tidy. The view from my window was of the Monte Carlo and traffic, but it was a quiet at night. The only negative to this room is that no tea/coffee facilities are provided in the room, you have to purchase this from one of the various cafe's/restaurants in the casino. The casino has a variety of eateries so you will never be without food! The only negative is that smoking is allowed in all casinos, so for a non-smoker it did at times get a little overbearing, particularly when over populated. The location of this hotel is really what you pay for. Conveniently located at the good end of the strip, you are close to MGM, Paris, PH Casino, Bellagio etc. There is a Walgreens a short walk away and the "Coke Bottle" building where you can purchase half price tickets for many of the shows.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad”
Reviews.Author: calgal81
Reviews.Content: Spent the night before my wedding day here as well as our wedding night. Room I stayed in for the day before the wedding was not bad. Not a great view but I did get to see the people on the roller coasters funny faces as they flew by. My husband and I got a marquis spa suite (I think that was what it was called) for the night of the wedding. Wasn't that impressed to be honest with you. The whirlpool tub was awesome but the air conditioner didn't even work. We got to our room at about 11:00 p.m. and dropped off some of our things and headed to the casino. We returned at about 3:00 a.m. before we noticed the A/C wasn't working. It was a HOT night and not due to our first night as man and wife either. Room was huge but seemed rather empty and the couch was a rather dingy. Not worth the money my parents forked out to give us a spa suite. I loved the times square area of this hotel was pretty neat and had many different little restaurants to visit. All in all our stay was about a 3.5

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: Lewis6203
Reviews.Content: Our first stay in Vegas, we were expecting razzle-dazzle and a fantastic room. But, you get what you pay for and at $89 per night it wasn't that bad deal in hindsight. There was a problem was with check-in which took 1.5 hours of sitting around in an un-serviced room calling the front desk/housekeeping to figure out. The bed was clean and comfortable and once housekeeping figured out that the room was occupied there was no problem with room-servicing. The room was really dark, and although the view wasn't bad (on to the MGM Grand/Excalibur corner) there was some noise from outside - not as we expected from the roller coaster, but from the Excalibur and (possibly) the ads running on the walkway to the MGM Grand and traffic. It wasn't a huge problem - earplugs help - but this was on the 15th floor and we weren't expecting it! The cafes and bars within the hotel were okay though Gallaghers and Il Fornaio were pricey. Chin-Chin deserves special mention - we ate dinner and breakfast here and were impressed with both. The casino was a disappointment. There was some construction work going on in the middle of it which was boarded off, so it was perhaps smaller than usual, but if you want poker and a little more atmosphere out of your casino, try the MGM Grand over the walkway. We rarely used the casino at NYNY. On the whole it was a fun stay, because Vegas is fun. But we weren't blown away by New York New York and wouldn't rush to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “NY-NY, what a wonder town!”
Reviews.Author: mannymanbo
Reviews.Content: This was our first experience at NYNY and we heard a few comments that were less then flattering. So, we arrived saturday about 1PM. Check in was quick, efficient and friendly. We were extremley pleased with our room (which we didn't upgrade). It had new fixtures, nice furniture, very clean and the king size bed and pillows were great! Now the room wasn't real big, but it was just fine for us. The house keeping department was really good. Every morning, our room was prepared earlier and everything was very clean! We ate at several restaurants, Gallighers, American Cafe, Pizza shop (I forget the name), Starbucks and all were quick, friendly and high quality. We hung out at the pool two days and loved it. It did get crowded on Sunday, but on Tuesday it had a moderate crowd. The only issue with the pool was with three drunk fellows, that security quickly removed from the pool! Nice Work! Check out was just as smooth as check in. We even liked the gaming! Needless to say, I give this place 5 stars! We can't wait to go back next year!

Reviews.Title: “Very average”
Reviews.Author: PopsBen
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because it was central to most things on the strip and the rooms looked basic on the website which we didn't mind as we presumed we wouldn't be in the room much anyway. The room was clean and sizeable and generally speaking the hotel is ok. The only gripes would be that we had a 30-minute wait to check in and that the pool area no-where nearly accommodated the amount of guests staying at this hotel. Also, when we booked, there was no mention of the works that were going on right in the middle of the ground floor casino. All-in-all this hotel is just very average but cost effective for what you get and well situated.

Reviews.Title: “New York New York is Great Fun”
Reviews.Author: Yoko8
Reviews.Content: New York New York is great fun. We arrived around five and checked in with no problems. Although we passed check in at three another day and the queue seemed really long. We were offered an upgrade on the day and the room was really good. There was a jacuzzi in the room!! We could hear the roller coaster but this wasn't too bad. The casino itself is nice, far friendlier than a lot of other casinos and the Nine Fine Irishmen is a good spot as is Times Square. Dualling Piano's are hilarious. The pool area is nice, but can get a bit shaded early on and towards the evening - mid afternoon is the best time to go!

Reviews.Title: “Insulted in Elevator of NYNY Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Crystal S
Reviews.Content: Stayed at NYNY Hotel because for the price it is a decent hotel. I go to Las Vegas occasionally without my husband to play poker while he goes on business trips back east. Because there is NO poker room at NYNY hotel, I had to cross over the bridge to MGM to play poker. On my way back up to my room around 10:00 p.m. I was solicited for sex in the NYNY elevator. I was quite shocked since I am 51 years old and DO NOT look like a prostitute. I did not know whether to be disgusted or complimented--the idea that anyone would solicit a grandmother of 7 was weird, to say the least. I would never stay there again, just because of this incident.

Reviews.Title: “average hotel..”
Reviews.Author: missyleeCork
Reviews.Content: stayed in Ny,Ny for 3nights. Booked a park avenue room which was dark,dusty & not really nice! Upgraded to a spa room ($90 extra p/n) and this was much better :)... There was building work in the middle of the casino when i was there but to be honest you would not notice it... Location was ok..... Not bad but would much prefer the venetian or bellagio..

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay at the NYNY”
Reviews.Author: RandomTraveler_8
Reviews.Content: Stayed here from 9/24 -/9/29. This was the fourth hotel we stayed it during a 12 day Las Vegas/LA/Las Vegas trip and we were not disappointed. We received an email offer and got a super rate of $49/night for weekday and $79/weekend which is unheard of for a Strip hotel. Check in on 9/24 was a breeze and we received the exact king non smoking room we requested. We stayed on the 27th floor of the Century tower. The noise of the roller coaster was not really an issue since we were well above it, but I could see where it might be loud if you had a lower floor. The room was clean and the bed was comfortable. One thing we really noticed about the NYNY that is different from all other LV hotels was how quiet the room is. The hallways are not a straight linelike in most hotels. There are twists and turns that follow the unique shape of the building and this tends to makes sounds in the hallway not travel so far. Also, I noticed that the doors to the rooms don't slam like in other hotels which was nice. We visited the pool a couple of times and it was ok, but nothing spectacular. We don't like sitting in the sun, so were actually happy that the pool is shaded for a lot of the time. Call us crazy. I could see where the pool would get very crowded at other times of the year though. There is not a lot of room for chairs and it does look like it would be cramped. We like the location of the NYNY on the Strip because it is easy to walk over the bridges to MGM, Excalibur or Tropicana. There is still work being done in the casino. They have torn out the old replica Cnetral Park that used to be in the center of the casino floor and are still working on it. We didn't really care too much about this since we don't tend to stay in any one casino very long anyway. Checkout was a breeze and without incident. Overall, I would stay at the NYNY again, especially if we received such a great room deal.

Reviews.Title: “Super”
Reviews.Author: BE-Pieter
Reviews.Content: We went there for 3 nights. Rooms were big and comfortable. Very clean... Beds matras was soft. Only internet was payable, disappointing for this kind of hotel. Casino was fun and the new nightclub ROK was fun, fun fun!!! Breakfast was not what we expected. No buffet service what we were told.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: bluegirl52
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel for 4 nights from 11 September. We arrived to find our room was not ready but were told to return at 3.00 when it would be. When we returned at the designated time the room was ready. Had a Broadway Deluxe room overlooking the MGM on 12th floor. Had no problem with any noise from outside or other guests. The room was spacious, clean with enough storage space and a huge tv - which we did not use as there were better things to do. Only had breakfast in the hotel - Il Fornio where the coffee and toasted sandwiches were fantastic. The hotel does not have a large shopping malls as others further along the strip have but this to me was an advantage as it reduced the number of people visiting the hotel. The customer services guy we spoke to was always willing to help us plan our days with advice on the best way to get to off strip locations. One tip if you are into Pinball then you must visit the Pinball Museum where you will find lots of different machines of different ages which you can still play! Did not play the tables here as for an amateur the minimum bet on the table was too high but would recommend the TI where the mins are lower. Also as there was no queue at check in in the evening I would recommend settling your account the night before you leave to avoid the queues in the morining. For a reasonable hotel in a great location this is the place to stay

Reviews.Title: “new york new year”
Reviews.Author: joel76
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for New Year after several other visits to New York, Room was comparable to other places we had paid less for at other times of year. I think other places have better lower bet tables early in the evening without such high mins, particularly TI if you are on he strip. Las Vegas though just you don't love it ! We went to the palms on NYE would thoroughly recommend it both drinks package, view and experience.

Reviews.Title: “Would Stay Again”
Reviews.Author: OregonDuckgirly
Reviews.Content: Even though its almost been a year since I've been there. I have to say I really enjoyed New York-New York. I still talk about it today. I would love to go again. Everyone was so nice and willing to go out of their way to help us. The only down of the hotel was we all wanted our rooms together, but our room was at the VERY end of the hall way and our other friends were on a flower below us at the other end of the hallway..not together. But still had a great time!

Reviews.Title: “good for the price!”
Reviews.Author: dod10
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 6 days, 5 nights in September and thoroughly enjoyed ourselves. While it's not a luxury hotel like the Bellagio or Caesar's, it's definitely a good deal! The location is great, right across from the MGM Grand and it's facade is beautiful, with a replica of the Brooklyn Bridge, Statue of Liberty and the New York City skyline. The roller coaster was fun although a bit of a rocky ride. We booked through vegas.com and got upgraded to a nicer room with a bunch of coupons (e.g. 2 for 1 breakfast at Il Fornaio, 2 for 1 roller coaster rides, 2 free cocktails, etc.). The rooms were clean and fairly spacious, with a beautiful marble bathroom, comfortable beds and plenty of down pillows. The only complaint about the room was that there was no fan in the bathroom, so the mirror always fogged up after a shower. We were also missing basic amenities (shampoo, soap, etc.) when we checked in, but a quick call to housekeeping solved the problem, and it never happened again during our stay. We also got fresh towels every day, even though we didn't request it. Although I appreciated this touch, I was slightly bothered by the fact that my attempt to be environmental was ignored by the staff; perhaps the daily tip made him/her want to go the extra mile? The casino was small in comparison to some of the other hotels and there was still a lot of construction noise as they were finishing up Rok nightclub at the start of our visit, but that quickly cleared up halfway through our trip. The restaurants were interesting enough although the pizza place was very disorganized (it took 40 minutes for us to get a pizza), but the Chinese breakfast buffet was good value for the cost. There was a great margarita bar upstairs with plenty of different flavours to choose from but the shopping was very limited, as was expected from a relatively small-scale hotel like NYNY. It's connected to the MGM via walkway, so it's location is quite convenient, as you can catch the Monorail from the MGM to take you to most points of interest along the strip. Since we booked our trip with airfare plus hotel, it's hard to say how much the hotel itself cost, but it felt like a pretty good deal, in comparison to some other hotels we were looking at. Especially given it's location, it's definitely a good deal, as you can pay less to stay there but still be nearby to the other big name hotels. We would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great time. Worth a visit.”
Reviews.Author: Shuffs
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Vegas and had high hopes. We weren't disappointed. NYNY is pretty spectacular, especially from the outside. Its a replica of NY City, with skyscrapers, a mini Brooklyn Bridge and their very own Statue of Liberty. Inside is a large casino and a food court replicating the streets of NY City. There's plenty to eat if you like fast food (i.e. pizzas, bagels, burgers etc). The food was very good, especially the pastrami bagels from the deli. There are some restaurants in the hotel. We tried the Italian (nothing special) and Gallagher's steak house. Be warned, the steaks here are HUGE!!!! There were six of us. None of us were able to eat a whole rib-eye ($35 each). Do the sensible thing, share one. We visted other hotels on the strip - Venitian, Paris, Mirage, MGM Grand, Mandalay Bay - and discovered that their malls, casinos and food courts were bigger and, probably, better. But there was something very comforting and relaxing about NYNY. The room we had (Park Avenue) was bigger than we expected and very clean. It had everything we needed. NYNY is at the south end of the strip. Its quite a walk to the hotels and sights further up the strip, especially in the 100 degree heat we experienced. If you need to travel north, we recommend using the Deuce, the 24-hour bus service that runs the length of the strip. Its only $5 for a 24-hour unlimited pass. Sights to take in when you're in Vegas - the Grand Canyon (a must), the Bellagio fountains, the baby lions and dolphin at the Mirage, the light shown at Fremont Street (Downtown). All in all, you'll hopefully find NYNY a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “mini manhattan”
Reviews.Author: cammis
