Reviews.Content: This is a quite silly remake of Manhattan in the city of big cheese. First thing that meets us is a guy that insists on taking out suitcases and we dont really have time to think and answer before they are on his trolley and he walks off. He gave us a ref. ticket and hinted for some tip which he of course got. We got to the check in which went smooth but it took ages since there was a very long cue.We got to our room and then had to call someone to get our suitcases, he was quick and another 5 bucks was thrown out the window. Unless you have a looot of luggage that service is kind of pointless and I felt that I was hassled to agree to it. Anyways, the room was really nice. It was a huge bed and this was a corner room as well so we got two views which was nice. The room was in Art Deco style, typical Manhattan. Really nice. I recommend the Il Fornaio (Italian restaurant). Nice food and good service! We had breakfast in the room.The food was a little late but at least it was hot and nothing was missing! We dint have time to do the roller coaster, but it looked really cool. Overall it was good!

Reviews.Title: “New York New York so good...”
Reviews.Author: Brooksies1
Reviews.Content: NEW YORK, NEW YORK, SO GOOD…. Stayed here for 2 nights on 3 & 4th Sept. We were staying in Anaheim, California for a fortnight and decided we’d love to see Vegas for our first time. The hotel was huge, as are all hotels in Vegas. It had it’s own casino of course!, pool area with 3 jacuzzi’s open from 9 – 6pm. There was a poolside bar, complimentary sun-beds, comp. towels. There was a rollercoaster running around the hotel, although this cost $14 per rider!!, very expensive for a family! There was a huge variety of small take out eating place all set within a New York street, and there was a bar which had a great atmosphere with live music, this was always very busy. Ample elevators. Rooms very nice and comfortable. Check in/out very easy. Can’t say a lot more as it was a brief visit but would recommend based on visiting some of the other hotels on the strip and feeling that this hotel had the best atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for this First Time Visitor”
Reviews.Author: PinPal
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights at NYNY and didn't have any problems. The room was clean. The bathroom was very nice and the shower was great. My one problem with it was the bed was hard as a rock! We had 2 queen beds and both were hard. However, after tiring ourselves out in Vegas, we pretty much fell asleep quickly. We ate at Chin Chin's for breakfast 2 days. It was a buffet with eggs, bacon, sausage and then a few Chinese elements - egg rolls, pot stickers, fried rice and bbq pork. It was petty good. We had a late dinner at America one night. It was okay but a bit overpriced. We had a slice of pizza late at night by the casino - it was terrible! The casino was great except if you were near the bar with the singing idiots. Then it was loud and obnoxious. The drink service was pretty good. We had a great stay here and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Biggest Steak ever”
Reviews.Author: Schofit
Reviews.Content: Loved the hotel. Stayed on a stag trip to Vegas. Staff helpful and lots of good bars and bonus....I won in the casino. But the best thing is the steak - in Gallagher's Steakhouse....huge and tasty, I like a big steak but cheap, large and tasty what more can a meat lover want. The rooms were cool even had a hot tub in my room. Only down side was the view from my room but I did not spend to much time in it anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel we've stayed in”
Reviews.Author: 2CatsMom
Reviews.Content: We stayed here back in 2003 so my memories might be a bit rusty but overall it was a very pleasant place to stay. New York New York is conveniently located on the south end of the strip, within a short (10 minutes or less) drive from the airport. For reference, the MGM Grand is across the street to the east and Excalibur and the Luxor are the next block south. The outside of the hotel has the very cool Manhattan skyline motif and a replica of the Brooklyn Bridge on the east side. Our room was very spacious and clean, complete with a hot tub. The bathroom was stylish (with just a shower, no tub but that's probably due to the fact there was already the Jacuzzi) and an in-room safe was provided. We had a great view to the northwest and could see the Palms across the highway as well as the Monte Carlo just to the north of us. Our room was directly above the swimming pool and the Manhattan Express roller coaster ran pretty close to our window. The swimming pool area was very nice, kept clean and orderly. There were several different depth areas and mini waterfalls. Desk and room service personnel were friendly and helpful. We did not do much gambling but there are plenty of other amenities, including several nice sit-down restaurants (we had Chinese one night and Italian another, both very good), nightclubs, bars, a Starbucks, souvenir shops and a Coney Island style arcade area for the kids. The elevators were very fast and taxi service was readily available. Overall this was probably the nicest and most luxurious hotel I have ever stayed in. It would be high on my list for reconsideration if I take another trip to Vegas anytime soon.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Snowgurl0
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel. The price is great and there's a lot to do in the hotel. I can spend more money gambling instead of paying for a room. THey just finished remodeling the rooms so we had a clean, and modern room. And soft beds and sheets too. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Close to the Airport”
Reviews.Author: pontiacgirl
Reviews.Content: This hotel and casino is a great location to pick if you want a one close to the airport. It is located across the street from Excalibur and MGM. The rooms are nice and spacious; we had a basic room in the New York tower with 2 queen beds since this was just a stopover for our family before heading to the airport the next day. Our view from our window was seeing the roller coaster over and over again. If we were staying longer we probably would have upgraded to at least a view of the strip. We gambled a little to pass the time and walked around the shops inside the casino which were nice. We did find the service from the bellman to be a little slow. We checked out early the next morning and called for service but after 20 minutes they still hadn't come. We decided to take the luggage down ourselves. The valet service was great and I'd recommend letting them park your car; you scan your claim check and the car was brought to us in less than 10 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Overall very good”
Reviews.Author: u9537503
Reviews.Content: This was our fifth time in Vegas and we have stayed in many different hotels up and down the strip. NYNY was always one of our favorite casinos so we thought it was time to stay in the hotel. We were there for 10 days all together and overall we thought the hotel was excellent. We upgraded to a larger room for an extra $10 a night providing more floor space which was very good. The room was well kept and clean, the bed was exceptionally comfortable especially after the long flight to Las Vegas. And anyway who wants to spend hours in their room when in Vegas. There were a couple of problems with the hotel, firstly the staff were either brilliant or distracted. There was nothing in between. But you get this in a lot of hotels so not too much of a real problem. The construction is loud at the moment, but only seems to happen in the mornings on week days. During the afternoon and weekends all construction seems to stop which is nice. We also used the pool, comments on the sun not getting there till late are true, but it does get sun. The rollercoaster is a bit of a distraction while at the pool, but easily ignored. We actually hired a cabana for a day which was very good and would recommend for the price. Finally we never heard the rollercoaster whilst in our rooms, or the construction. I would look to stay at this hotel again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “First Time in New York”
Reviews.Author: travelanddance
Reviews.Content: The trip to Vegas was a mother/daughter (45/21) birthday trip. We enjoyed staying at New York, New York. The rooms and staff were great. However, please be aware that there is construction going on in the casino which you have to walk around. It can be distracting when playing the slots. We loved the restuarants and eating areas in the hotel also. The only disappointment about the hotel was the pool area; it's very small.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel / Great Time”
Reviews.Author: Stella_72
Reviews.Content: Where do I begin? This hotel was an excellent part of our Wedding/Honeymoon/Vacation! The hotel is the coolest looking one one the strip. Location is EXCELLENT!!! The service was outstanding without a doubt. We were allowed an early check in and they even gave us a "bigger" room. We were married on Sunday at another chapel and switched rooms because for our wedding night we wanted a jacuzzi suite. They let us have a late checkout on our room and had our suite ready for us right after the wedding. We did have issues with the elevator as others mentioned however, I went back to my room, called front desk and was told that if they weren't working @ the time my limo was supposed to be there they would send up securtiy and escort us down the staff elevators. They went above and beyond to please us! Coyote Ugly was a great time, little expensive on the drinks but fun! The Casino was always packed and the shops and hotels were wonderful. Our Park Ave room was very nice and roomy with a beautiful view of the strip. We stayed in this room for 2 nights. Our Marquee suite was the best room I've stayed at in my life! The room was HUGE, beautiful and the jacuzzi was a nice treat after all the Vegas walking! :-) The price was right for the strip. I would stay here again for sure. Thank you NY NY for a memorable honeymoon

Reviews.Title: “get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: pettaspagna
Reviews.Content: The hotel is extremely nice, as all the hotels on the strip. Position is perfect. Nothing except sleeping is included, as it usually happens in all hotels in las vegas, because they want you to spend money somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Fun at New York New York”
Reviews.Author: smartelek
Reviews.Content: NY NY is a fun place to stay in Las Vegas. Day and night, the casino, restaurants and mezzanine are alive with people having a good time. The evenings provided live music from two of the venues as you stroll through the "city streets" of NY NY. Grab a sidewalk table and a cup of coffee and just watch the world go by - your feet will appreciate the break. Check-in was quick and efficient. The construction in the casino was evident but not obtrusive. The waitresses in the casino were friendly and worked hard to insure all guests were served. The standard room was more than adequate, clean and quiet. The layout of the hotel was easy to navigate and, thankfully, didn't have those endless walks from the room to the elevator to the casino to the exit that other hotels in Las Vegas may have. The location of NY NY afforded easy access to the hotels on the southern end of the Strip.

Reviews.Title: “ok”
Reviews.Author: fancypants2008
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the 27th floor of the Century Tower. Great view facing the strip (ask for room 2724 if possible) Overall a good experience at the NYNY. The only real problem we has was the elevator. WOW, it literally took us 20 minutes to catch an elevator on check out Sunday. I think several elevators were down. I realize that this was probably the BUSIEST days to check out, but at the same time since they know this I thought they should've at least forseen this problem. As a customer, I can't really be sure what the problem was, maybe a part hadnt come in yet, I dont know. 2nd complaint, we received room keys to an already occupied room...my poor fiance had to lug our stuff all the way back down to the lobby. These were my only issues with the hotel. Other than that, I give them props for having decent air to breathe. I stayed at the MGM before in a nonsmoking room/floor and it might as well have been smoking. This hotel is much more ventilated than others on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “A bit on the tired side of things”
Reviews.Author: kazuo
Reviews.Content: Spent 8/8/08 at this hotel on the 19th floor. I don't want to make this review into a complaint list, so I'll start with the good. The best thing about this hotel is the price. We payed $124/night for a weekend, which is very acceptable for Las Vegas. The room was quiet, clean, and average in styling. Here are the downsides: first, they placed us in a smoking room, though we requested a non-smoking room. The hotel explained that the non-smoking rooms were all taken by 6pm, and we could be moved the next night. Second, the beds were lumpy, worn, and bowed on the sides. The pillows were cotton filled and also under par. Third, the elevator brokedown on Sunday mid-morning. People waited for up to 30 minutes for an elevator. Some people walked 19 floors down. I took a packed elevator up, so I could go down. If you get a good rate and don't plan on sleeping much (which is common for vegas), take NYNY.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: PJRC-Seniors
Reviews.Content: We had 2 nights here during our 16 day holiday. Was concerned after reading some reviews, but the room was such a good price we took the risk. Hotel offered free self parking. Check in was prompt and efficient. Room spacious, nice decor, good condition located in Empire block. Dissappointed with lobby, no 'wow' factor, was expecting more, but not sure what, as it was our first visit to Vegas. Mini New Yorks streets O.K., our teenagers loved it and rode the rollercoaster. Had a couple of meals and they were good value.

Reviews.Title: “New York Hotel Review”
Reviews.Author: partyvegas
Reviews.Content: We had booked our long awaited vacation and where excited once again about visiting Vegas. We have been going there for 15 years sometimes twice a year just for fun. The hotels we like to Patronize are MGM, New York, New York, Paris...which are all sister properties. You can use your players card and get points at all of their properties. Our preferable place to stay is MGM but the rates they gave us at New York seemed to be much better. My husband asked for a strip view room, and a King bed. When we arrived we where given a tiny little room with 2 double beds in the corner of the hotel without a strip view. When we walked in the room it smelled of smoke and it looked as if a cat or dog had bounced on the bed leaving the bed in a disarray and the bedspread had snags all over it . I was flabberghasted. We went to to get another room and it was even smokier smelling than the last. So, once again we drug our luggage down and they finally got us another room. It took an hour just to get a room. Front desk people where apologetic and finally ended up giving us a decent room. This is the 2nd time we had booked a room and specifically asked for what we wanted and got there and got a real dive of a room. My husband is with the Casino Club and he called them and they said you have to talk to front desk. They didn't even act as if they cared. This hotel has gone downhill in the last 2 years and gone downhill fast. We gambled a lot using our cards and they didn't give us one single thing! Years ago they used to give us free meals and souvenirs..Not anymore my friend. No need to say...we have been going there for years but will not patronize this property anymore. Next time I think we'll stay at Hard Rock across the street from MGM. We had a blast at that hotel on the day we left and wow...talk about hospitality!!! We where impressed. When we signed up for the Players Club there we got free play and souvenirs and discounts for the food! WOW! I definitely recommend Hard Rock ..we are going to stay there next time. Have fun...and enjoy Vegas! We love it!

Reviews.Title: “Great Time, Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Stappers
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the NYNY in April 2008, as a couple, based on reviews on this site and the look of the hotel. It was our first visit to Vegas and needless to say we weren't disappointed by it either. Cab from the airport was about $15 I think and less than ten minutes. Check in was superb, no-one in the queue and upgraded to a room with a strip view for $10 per night which was well worth it. It was a corner room looking out over MGM/Excaliber and the roller coaster (Which wasn't noisy). The room was a good size (but with two queen size beds instead of a king) and was in good condition. The casino itself was be upgraded while we were there so some areas were out of bounds but was still a pretty good size. The restaurants in NYNY were excellent and everything that was needed was there. Nine fine Irishman was OK though a bit pricey for drinks. Bar at Times square was excellent and you don’t need to go in to sample the atmosphere. The roller coaster was excellent and could ride all day for a little over the cost of one ride ticket. Pool area was OK if a little cramped. They get as many loungers in as they can as long as you’re there relatively early (Opens at 10AM) then you’ll get a lounger but is very busy in the afternoon. Most of the pool was in the shade when it opened, when we were there, but that didn’t last long. The hotel has an excellent spot on the strip. The walkways linking NYNY with MGM and Excaliber were really handy and spent most of our time in these casinos. Hooters and Tropicana were just across the road aswell with lower gambling limits. Bellagio was a 10 minute walk up the strip and down to Mandalay bay was 10 minutes (Or 2 hours if you walk through Excaliber as we found it pretty confusing inside) . There’s a monorail from Excaliber to Mandalay Bay aswell. We sampled a Grand Canyon flight and coming back over the strip at night was excellent. Stratosphere was well worth it for the thrill rides which are more daunting than they look ($35ish for unlimited rides for a day). Fremont Street was excellent and would seriously consider staying there next time as seemed really relaxed and a lot friendlier than the casinos. We also drove out to Hoover damn which was well worth the visit and really interesting and had a boat ride on lake mead afterwards. All in all it was a superb choice of hotel and Vegas couldn’t have lived up to expectations and more. Will be back for more and would consider staying at NYNY again if looking for a hotel on the strip though Excaliber really does seem value for money aswell. If you’re looking for a great pool then its better to look elsewhere but if you want a compact hotel that not sprawling like some others then its well worth considering.

Reviews.Title: “Best USA Holiday ever by a mile, YEAH !!”
Reviews.Author: LiverpoolDave
Reviews.Content: We travelled as a family,two 39yr olds and 2 kids , aged 13 and 17 and have been to vegas before on a 2 day stopover 5 yrs ago so knew what to expect,more heat that you can handle and a strange attitude to kids,no probs with them walking thru the casino behind you as long as they don't stop and look. We booked a flydrive with Direct Hols,which meant the dreaded Thomas cook flight and it did not disapoint in disapointing us , it was dreadful but a necessary evil if you want fly direct from Manchester. The car hire depot I had to use,Dollar,was a 90 min wait for a car , after 10hrs in that tube it was almost too much , but being told at the window tha the premium insurance package I had bought off Mytravel did not cover me for theft of the vehicle was laughable,I mean how can you buy car ins. but not be covered for the thing being stolen? Mow down a few peds,smash into a ferrari, hey no probs , but if its stolen you owe us $25,000. Anyway it was only an extra $5 a day to get covered,but you get the picture,impressed I was not. The hotel itself is fantastic,in our opinion easily the best for families on the strip.We went with the view that we were not going to gamble,it was a family hol and it worked well,there is so much to see and do it is unbelievable but you cannt enjoy it if you want to get out and drink and gamble with the kids in tow,they just will not allow it and we spoke to a couple of famillies in the airport coming home who hated it , Spain for them next year so its not for everyone. We had a broadway suite in the new york tower booked direct with NyNy , room 1753 and it was brill , the coaster was right outside our window but was fine, it starts at 10.30am and stops at about 11pm but isnt intrusive,its those Crazy Americans hollering and shouting on their way to and from the lifts at 3 in the morning that are a nuisance, why they feel the need to holler and ' Yeah' at the top of their voices when they are in a group will never make sense to me, there is always one ' your the man ' or ' get in the hole !! ' guy in every group, no matter how loud the place is , right on John will always make himself heard, he just has to be louder than anyone else.. Felt safe as houses in the hotel, the strip itself is brill also, walked up and down the damn thing every day and never had a dodgy moment , everyone is so nice its untrue,not like Florida were locals are either not interested in chit chat or just cannot plain understand you and then you get the false ' have a nice day ', in Vegas just about everyone we encountered was just nice and genuine, no falseness or attitude, must be the weather, which never seems to drop below 100 deg.in July no matter what time it is . The bus up and down the strip is good as there are roadworks at the mo,$2 one way and $1 for the kids,sit back and let the bus do the walking for you as the strip gets real busy . The Monorail is better if it goes where you are going but to find it is like an episode of Indiana Jones, the MGM opposite has one somewhere but it is the largest hotel in the world and it is a long way to the station at the back of the hotel.When it gets busy at weekends it is almost impossible to get to and from it without losing the will to live. We drove o the shopping centres ( Premium outlets and Fashion show mall ) with no probs and they are great,lots to see and do and we also drove to the Hoover Dam and took the tour,you must get there by 9am to miss the crowds and it is about a 40 min drive,it was Awsome man and well worth the $11 entrance.We also took in Mamma Mia at the Mandalay Bay ( free tram from Excalibur gets you there in no time ) and it was the best night of my life to date . Also went to the Star Trek Experience at the Hilton , kids loved it , wife was terrified of the Borg who was walking around . Pool at the NyNy is great but ice cold,get there early and get beds around the edges as the sun comes on the pool at 10.45 in the far left corner and is just about bearable until 12.30, my watch had the temp. in the sun at 133 deg at 11.30am and by this time the pool area is full of crazy locals hollering and having a good time, beer in the pool? no probs , anything goes here. My wife smokes and found nirvana in Vegas , you can smoke just about anywhere, no need to go outside for a fag, just sit at a machine and smoke yourself silly, no stress for me and shes happy as punch. Want to smoke in your room ? no probs sir. The food at the hotel was great and varied, Gallaghers was really expensive, the Italian also , the Mexican was awful slop . Our fav was the ESPN bar , great food, great Tv and great vibes. All in all the hotel was just the best , we tripped out to every hotel on the strip in our week ( to keep the kids active and we were in bed at 9 each night knackered but happy, every hotel appears to be just around the corner but isn't, must be the desert air) up to the Sahara and every time we were grateful to get back to the gold ole NyNy , the expensive hotels are nice but exactly that,the Venetian and Caesers and Bellagio are take your breath away good, the cheaper ones are a little tatty and seem to cater for the serious gamblers, the NyNy, Luxor and MGM seem to attract the Shows crowd and site-seeres and are a lot nicer vibes wise for it, my fav was the Mandalay Bay, it had an edge to it due to the House of Blues and Mamma Mia crowds and would be my choice if I win the lotto. All in all we cannot wait to go back and will defo stay at the NyNy without hesitation, it is just so easy to do what you want to , from the free easy access self parking to the great pool ( get your beer from the shop for $3 not the pool bar at $7 ) , the lovely decor, great bars, great vibe and if you want to I am sure the gambling is great also, maybe next time when our kids are older . The only dissapointment was coming home , the airport is rubbish . Us non Americans have terminal2 to ourselves and it is tiny and has no shops to speak off , get all your snacks and bits and bobs beforehand , cigs are ok @ $55 for 400 and Jack D is $27 a litre,Smirnoff is $16 a litre. Flight home was awful . Looking to go back next year for 2 weeks to do it all again , if you have ever been to a good Blackpool or London or Manchester hotel dont worry about staying here , it is 50 times better than anything they have to offer , it is that good. The end.

Reviews.Title: “Had better elsewhere in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: mike_22101
Reviews.Content: We were not that impressed with this hotel. Our first experience was ringing prior to our arrival just to get an idea of the cost of a taxi from the Las Vegas airport. The surly receptionist refused to even give her best guess! "i dont know" was the best she could offer - unbelievable I thought. The greeting at reception was formal and lack any warmth - offered to get an upgrade so long as I paid for it and then no mini bar in the room!. When we tried to get a diet coke from the vending machine on the floor it wouldnt work and ringing to get some help was of no use - " we dont control vending machines sir - thats another company.. you can get room service to bring you a diet coke for US$10!!. Forget it! The rooms were ok but the service leaves alot to be desired.

Reviews.Title: “Exciting Place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Rogerdob
Reviews.Content: I hate Las Vegas. However, I had to stay there and New York, New York was the most acceptable to me. It is in a good location...across the street from the MGM Grand, the Tropicana, the Excaliber, and a little away from the heart of the strip. The room was great. However, the pool area is congested during the day...I wish they would get a bigger pool. The roller coaser, as is everything, is way overpriced. ($14 to ride the coaster!). The restaurants in the building, as in every Las Vegas hotels are pretentious and way overpriced. We went out of the hotel for dinner and ate across the street at a reasonably priced Mexican restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “NY - NY Vegas - Nice Stay - First Time In Vegas”
Reviews.Author: staffo
Reviews.Content: It was our first time in Vegas and we were from England. We chose NY NY because of the balance of price and reviews on Trip Advisor. It was a good choice. We stayed for three nights in the last week of June 2008, in a Park Avenue upgrade at $89.95 a night. Here's a quick summary :- Plus points :- Room - very nice, we were about 17 floors up (sorry, forgot room number now!). Good size, nice decor, good condition. Comfortable beds. Bathroom - No complaints, good condition. Safety - Felt very safe in that part of hotel. Whole hotel felt safe. Corridors were very quiet. Plus it has an in-room safe for valuables. Pool - Not too busy, despite it being 103 outside ! Bit of a walk/elevator to pool but no real problem. Lobby - Quick check-in no delay, staff polite but more business-like than friendly. No real probs with that. General - Casino area had some building work going on but it did not cause a major problem. Hotel still looked in good condition despite this. Much classier than Excalibur. Eating - Only used the hotel for late night quick snacks. Fine for this, pizza etc and not too expensive. Minus points Room - reserved non-smoking, didn't get one. BUT, couldn't smell smoke in room. No problem there. General view of Vegas as a first time Brit ! :- It's HOT, crowded, it'll wear you out. You'll walk for miles, I got blisters on my blisters ! But, you've got to do it. The Duece is practical but way too crowded, only use it for short runs if you can avoid it. The Monorail is luxury compared to it, but is not practical as you have to battle through casinos to get to it from the Strip. If you are not a real gambler, three nights is more than enough. We did a day bus trip to the Grand Canyon and still saw enough of Vegas to keep us happy. Final summing up on hotel, NY NY is a lot better than you would expect from some reviews and other websites. They don't rip you off, I expected lots of extras and apart from the roller-coaster there are no extras.

Reviews.Title: “Good time in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: FakeMinPin
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights for my husbands 50th birthday. Had a great time. The room was large and clean. We stayed on the 16th floor in the New York Tower. We really enjoyed the irish pub and the steak house.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great stay at NY, NY”
Reviews.Author: Bazza13
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel for 3 days July 17-20. Met up with some good friends from Vancouver who were celebrating a suprise 40th birthday party. I should note that there were 3 families who all had seperate rooms in the hotel at various places. All of us had the same opinion of the place, and all agreed that we would stay again. The other couples had standard twin rooms, while we opted for the deluxe room at an average rate of 159.00 a night, (The best rate I could find for any of the newer on strip hotels). We were not charged for an extra cot (we were there with the two kids). I would opt for the larger room if you are travelling as a family. Even with the cot, we had room to spare. Our room (and the other couples) was actually a non smoking room. (something rare in Vegas). I would rate the room in good shape, everything worked well. I would rate it above average for the middle of the road hotels in Vegas I have stayed at. I have to admit I was a bit worried about previous reviews of construction and roller coaster noise. I (nor the others) heard nothing of the roller coaster, nor did any of us hear jack hammers from the construction in the casino, which was really a non event. The casino had some tarping up, and maybe a few less games, but it did not ruin our fun one little bit. Found the staff at the hotel 1st rate in being friendly, helpful & going out of their way to help our stay be a good one. On checkout, the bell desk was a bit behind and we actgually received a phone call from the bell desk manager who appoligized for our slight wait. Our kids loved the hotel for its variety of food. I will stay at NY, NY in the future.

Reviews.Title: “SUPERB!!”
Reviews.Author: DebbieLondon
Reviews.Content: Just arrived back from New York New York tired and sad. Tired as we had a wonderful non-stop time and sad we are home. The hotel is superb and in a great location to walk the strip from one end to the other. We stayed in the Century Tower on the 24th floor in a Spa Delux room that was huge, spotless, and everything you could ask for. It was located at the first drop on the roller coaster but noise was never a problem. Housekeeping came every day and do a wonderful job. The hotel was under some construction which did not bother us at all, I no it did others but the noise was mainly in the morning and who spends all day every day in the one casino in Las Vegas?? Apart from this minor hiccup the hotel was perfect, lively, great eating places (American-Superb and wonderful staff). The pool was very small and busy and would have been a bit off putting if we had, had the time to go there but we were too busy enjoying all LV has to offer. The helicopter tour to the Canyon with Sundance was amazing and worth every penny. This was my first time in LV and will no way be my last, but will go for 2 weeks next time instead of one, to be able to rest a bit more in that HEAT!!

Reviews.Title: “won,t be coming back”
Reviews.Author: degema
Reviews.Content: we stayed at NY NY for a period of 5 days. It was not one of the best hotels we have sytayed at over many years travelling in the USA. The room whic we up graded too had a FOUL DRAIN SMELL IN THE BATH ROOM, WHICH WAS REPORTED on a few occassions to the hotel staff. the ventilation system in the bathroom DUMPED smoke fumes from the smoking rooms. this was verified by the maintenance engineer.The pool area was dirty, with the pool towels grey,& thread bare. Again the offending drain smell was evident. Staff in the American resteraunt were far from helpfull, but still looking for there tip. Venture outside on to the sidewalk, and get confronted by a group of Mexicans, Soliciting for Call Girls. This lowers the tone of the area, and shows this end of the Strip for what it is TACKY. God knows what families with children think about this. We wont be coming back to Vegas or NY NY

Reviews.Title: “Lovin' NY in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Tara1986
Reviews.Content: I just returned home from a 3 night stay at the New York New York in Las Vegas. This hotel was amazing. My friend and I stayed in a 5 Ave suite which is a standard hotel room. The decor was very modern and classy. The shower was beautiful marble. The room definitely exceeded the actually cost. The staff at the hotel was very accomodating and always had a smile on their faces followed by a simple hello. This hotel is in a great location and has great night life including Coyote Ugly. There was no buffet at this hotel however there was 24 hour room service and the price was not too bad. I thought that roller coaster would be an inconvenience as our room looked directly at it. However the hours of operation were great for those going to be at a decent time or those sleeping in from a late night before. I would recommend this hotel to anyone and definitely stay again my next visit to LAS.

Reviews.Title: “Loved New York New York”
Reviews.Author: blondchick777
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at many hotels in Las Vegas, and there will definitely be a return visit to New York New York. Check-in was pleasant and quick and the room was spacious and clean. We stayed in the Empire Tower which was just a quick jaunt to the pool; did not have to walk through casino to get to the pool, just got off the elevators, turned right and went out the door. However, for all you sun lovers, the pool opens at 9:00 a.m., but with all of the tall buildings surrounding it, it does not get full sun until after around 11:00 or so. It also is a bit noisy at times because the rollercoaster is above. Our first night there was a long one and we slept in. In the early afternoon we received a call from Housekeeping asking when we wanted our room cleaned. We told them after 5:00 and they responded that it would not be a problem. This hotel has a large variety of restaurants that are open late. In particular, there is a place where you can get a slice of pizza or a whole pie and they are open until 3:00 a.m. The American restaurant is open 24 hours and they have breakfast, lunch and dinner specials. There is also a great place for hot italian sausage. You will not go hungry at this hotel - there is a restaurant for about every taste imaginable. There is an Irish bar in this hotel with dualing pianos at night which draws a large crowd. The entertainment is a lot of fun and interactive. This bar also closes at 3:00 a.m. There was quite a long line to check our at 11:00 a.m., but the line moved very quickly due to the large number of staff members on duty. We did not wait longer than 10 minutes to check out. All in all, New York New York is a great place to stay when visiting Sin City!

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable Place to Stay on the Vegas Strip”
Reviews.Author: MiskyB
Reviews.Content: Pros: -Good location on the Vegas strip. You can easily walk or catch a bus to other casinos and attractions. -Clean, comfortable rooms -Reasonable prices -The hotel has an enjoyable theme and style -Interesting people-watching -$10.00 in Starbucks credit and slot machine play with each room Cons: -No king beds were available, although we requested this in our reservation four months ago. -Loud jackhammering in the lobby/casino area in the wee morning hours. Our room was not affected, but the noise made it impossible to spend time in the casino. -They nickel and dime you for everything (use of the pool, workout room, etc). I know this is a common Vegas practice, but it is lame nonetheless. -Views from the rooms are hit-or-miss...we had a wonderful strip view from one room, and a nasty view of the roof from another room of the same cost.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Modern”
Reviews.Author: NikkiandAndy
Reviews.Content: A bit worried when we booked this but hotel was clean and the rooms were suprisingly modern. We paid a little bit more and took advantage of an offer with a strip view room. The only downsides are that checking in was a nightmare. Tried 3 times to check in, but no room available. When we tried the 3rd time it was well after check in time and they were still fobbing us off but we insisted and eventually got a room. The other annoying point was that there is no trolleys available to get luggage from your car. They'll help you once you are in the casino but by then you've hauled it for 10-15 minutes from the car park so there is little point givining it to someone else you're going to have to tip to move it. Overall, a nice room - clean, modern, good facilities but would be nice to have a fridge.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate but not excellemt..”
Reviews.Author: Sunshine01Woking
Reviews.Content: Reasonable location, and relatively fine hotel, but if you want to spend lots of time by the pool, note that it is shaded until 11am, and is quite cramped, with loud music and the roller coaster going by every few minutes. The casino is quite dark, and there was renovation work going on whilst we were there. The room was nice, we had a park view room, which was comfortable with no problems. When we checked out there was a very long queue, so would advise using key drop. All in all, ok for the money, but would recommend shopping around depending on what you're looking for. If you want to spend all day by the pool, perhaps consider a different hotel. Reasonable for the money paid.

Reviews.Title: “Loved NYNY”
Reviews.Author: shelley99
Reviews.Content: I stayed at NYNY from 29 june for 7 nights with my boyfriend, we are 27 and 25, last yr we stayed at Mirage and my BF decided to stay here this year and we wasnt disappointed, although the Mirage was more luxurious, the ny ny was more geared for us, lots of facilites and entertainment venues. The location is good, not too far from anywhere, directly opposite the MGM and you can walk through excal to luxor to mandaley bay too from just across the road. We had a Park avenue deluxe room overlooking the strip, we paid $35pp for the whole week to upgrade, our room was cleaned everyday and was a good size, plenty of space, we were on 18th floor. Pool area was small but adequate for short time spent there. Some people on here made remarks regarding the construction work, we didnt find it affected anything, didnt hear any noise, especially from the rooms!, put it this way, I didnt realise their was work until day 4 when we walked by it!! tell me somewhere in Vegas there is no construction work going on!! Its a fun hotel, we had absolutely no problems at all, would definately stay here again, although I do like going to different hotels, to be honest I dont think it matters where you stay in Vegas, its just a room. while we were there, we watched Carrott Top who was hilarious, bought half price tickets and thoroughly enjoyed it, also Legends in Concert, where our UK friend was starring as Dusty Springfield, she was amazing and also went to see the Divine Miss Midler, outstanding show!!, she was great, if you like her, you must go watch her. All in all we had a fabulous 2nd time in vegas, not as rushed as the first time we went, I would love to go back and would recommend the NYNY.

Reviews.Title: “Just alright...”
Reviews.Author: M0ntrealc0uple
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the NYNY from June 30th until July 4th... I have to say that the service in general was quite good... we asked for an upgrade and were given a Park Avenue Delux room for a small daily fee ($15)... Our room was very nice and very clean... (and we are REALLY picky)... That being said, I don't think I would stay there a second time. In this category and price range, the Mandalay Bay is a much better choice in terms of the hotel itself and the grounds... A big drawback of the hotel is that the pool at NYNY does not see the sun until noon and is not great to begin with in comparison to other hotels. Also, the casino is undergoing some renovations so we never even played a slot machine there! As for the famous rollercoaster - it passed right below our window, but it didn't bother us at all! Mind you, we woke up very early and came back very late - so we were rarely in our room when the roller coaster was running... The restaurants did not seem as refined as the restaurants we went to at Mandalay Bay, MGM, the Bellaggio and at Caesars... Actually, the ambiance did not even come close....They were just not inviting whatsoever for us...We did have a few breakfast at America and Il Fornaio and they were good. Next time we go (this was our first Vegas experience) we will be staying at Mandalay Bay or the Bellaggio... In short, I think this hotel is suitable for families who are looking for a theme park-style hotel or for rowdier twenty-somethings...I agree with a previous reviewer who mentioned that the clientele is somewhat less distinguished (in general) than some of the other hotels close by. Not horrible, but regretted booking here. An ok place to sleep for us, but nothing more.

Reviews.Title: “loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: happytraveller028
Reviews.Content: Arrived back 06 July, after reading some of the reviews we were a bit worried about staying at this hotel, but can honestly say we had a fantastic time. We were in the New Yorker Tower and had particularly asked for a non smoking room on a high floor (after reading a previous review about the noise), we were put on 32nd floor with fantastic views of the strip and the airport. Check in was smooth and we found our room no problem. Our room was cleaned daily, it was spacious and beds comfy. Ok some of the staff had left their smiles at home but they were efficient and polite. There is building work going on in the main area but being on a high floor we weren't disturbed, and the casino/bar areas are noisy but again being on a high floor we had no problems whatsoever. We'd definitely recommend this hotel but would recommend asking for a high floor. The prices in the hotel were dearer than other hotels on the strip though.

Reviews.Title: “Stay AWAY!!”
Reviews.Author: tjoniak
Reviews.Content: It was a great stay, if you like construction in the casino (think Jackhammers, cement saws, and heavy equipment) and a crowded pool (very small, very shaded). when we checked in, we were told no king beds were available, despite paying for an upgraded room to get one. We stayed one horrid night in a saggy queen bed with a direct sight and sound spectacular of the damned roller coaster - so much for a nap to get acclimated to the time zone. Clank, clank, clank, rush rush, scream.... We changed to a king bed on a higher floor the second and third nights, while the room was better, there are serious elevator concerns with the century tower - we waited a minimum of four minutes to get an elevator each time we left the room, and once it was eight minutes. That may not seem like much, but stand in a dark vestibule waiting for an elevator for eight minutes - it is endless. The spa, while the services were nice, was completely inadequate - for women, if you wanted a hot tub you have to pay $45 for a 30 minute soak - no hot tub or jacuzzi in the facility. The ceilings were low, there was no changing facility, lockers were in a hallway to treatment rooms, so you could change in the hall. My husband said the men's spa had a similar set up, but they had a hot tub for their usage. Odd. My husband and I travel to vegas a couple of times each year, to get some much needed r&r and "grown up time". This hotel was one to avoid at all costs. We left it feeling frustrated and insulted by the lack of service and consideration, and the lousy facilities. I had a great time with my husband, and we made the best of it, but shouldn't vegas be about enjoying yourself, not trying to overcome crappy accomodations? We'll head back to mirage or mandalay, lesson learned.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad Just Not Enough Video Poker bars to sit at”
Reviews.Author: pappy5791
Reviews.Content: It was a pretty nice hotel. The Mexican Resturaunt was very good. My bed was very comfortable,but it is a walk to the Unirail....I think that is what is is called. A long walk through MGM and very limited video poker machines. We sat at the same bar every night which became very boring at the NYNY. I used to live in las Vegas and they have gotten very expensive...no more cocktail waitresses and no more excitement when someone hits the slot machines..if they do. Vegas isn't what it used to be...to many kids...that is what Disneyland is for...so to Vegas for what it was...the fun is over,no cocktail waitresses no jackpots on the slots and no comps and the buffets are the same slop they gave over 20 yrs ago just a lot more money. I will come back again since I had a lot of great memories of this town,but for what it is worth keep your kids home

Reviews.Title: “New York New York Hotel sucks!”
Reviews.Author: Ldy2thdoc60
Reviews.Content: I am outraged by my experience with New York New York Hotel. I booked a room for three nights through Expedia. When I got there, construction was going on from 4am in the morning, and no room was uneffected by the noise. After learning this on my arrival, I chose a different hotel. Neither New York New York or Expedia would give me a full refund. They charged me a penalty of one night, even though I didn't stay there, and tired from the flight, had to drive around in the heat looking for a vacant hotel. It was a big hassle. The attitude of Maria Castillo, head on New York New York was appalling with no regard to customer service. Never stay at that hotel! The rooms are dives. The hotel is noisy, dirty, very smokey, and sleazy looking. I blame Expedia as well for not knowing about such a major construction project at a well known hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs!!”
Reviews.Author: lawera
Reviews.Content: Awful experience, terrible manager services. We went through 3 rooms. First one smelled like smoking room, which we did not ask for . Second one with BED BUGS... We got bites all over Oour legs. The security came to take pictures from it.. And the 3RD room Bed bugs and "MICE [--]" inside the bed. Total lack of CLEANLESS... DO NOT STAY THERE. WE COULD NOT GET MONEY BACK SINCE WE PAY TROUGH EXPEDIA. MANAGERS TOTALLY HELPLESS. I live in mexico (PUERTO VALLARTA) and I know what a maneger should do to keep a client happy. The hotel offer 5DLL coupon, which I REJECT. I just ask for a nice clean bed in another one of their hotels from the same rate I pay. DO NOT SAY HERE!! WE HAD TO SLEEP WITH OUR JEANS ON AND BUG SPRAY!!

Reviews.Title: “Stay somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: desmo333
Reviews.Content: Prelude- Stayed at the New York, New York between June 29th and July 3rd and am writing this review from the ESPN Zone that offers FREE wi-fi rather than the $14 a day wi-fi the hotel 'provides'. I had to use the hotel wi-fi one day because of an early morning business emergency when ESPN Zone was not open. The wi-fi service charged my credit card 4 times prompting a call from my credit card fraud prevention department. I routinely stay in Las Vegas at least 6 times a year and usually stay at an MGM/ Mirage hotel and this one is by far the worst of that bunch. The Good- The housekeeping staff is fantastic. They do not bother you if you have a do not disturb sign on the door until 2pm when they give you a courtesy call to let you know you may have your room cleaned any time 24 hours a day! The room, although dated and with a view of the roof was at least clean. The Bad- I booked through Expedia and afterward found hotel specials for the package I booked at $75, offered for only $64. They also had a special offer at $75 that included an upgraded strip view, free cocktails and restaurant discounts for the same $75 fee I paid. The hotel refused to offer me these same incentives. I even mentioned that this was my first stay (and my last) to the hotel staff and the room they elected to impress me with was vintage 1978 at best. I was even surprised the shag carpet had been replaced with the stained, sticky retread that was in there. The 20" TV failed to work most of the time, producing snow for most of my visit. There is no coffee pot in the room and though they provide an ice bucket, there is no ice machine to be found anywhere. Not even a mini bar is in the room which is surprising since they are obviously charging for everything but the smoky air you inhale. The Ugly- The hotel clientele consists mainly of drunk smoking guys walking around in wife beater tee shirts drinking low quality american beer. This is amazing considering you can cross the street to MGM Grand and see a much higher quality clientele in what is an amazingly updated older hotel. The noise in the rooms is atrocious. Daily, it sounded as if people were moving heavy furniture around the adjoining rooms. For several days I thought the roller coaster passed through my room but it was just lack of any sound proofing. The hotel is more casino than hotel and everywhere you go you can here the slot machines going and going and going. The worst was that the hotel staff really didn't seem to care at all about the inconveniences of their hotel. They were just nice enough to keep them from losing their job. Overview- If you are looking at staying somewhere cheap (I don't mean inexpensive, I mean CHEAP) and don't mind sleeping in a casino... this is for you. If you want to feel special or pampered at all then look at the SIgnature where they have it down to an art for only about double the NY, NY prices! I cannot say enough positive things about the NY, NY restaurants. Sirrico's pizza has lines out the door until 3am because it is fantastic! The ESPN Zone is a great respite from the noise for sports lovers! Il Fornaio and Gallagher's are also top quality eating establishments. You just don't have to stay at the NY, NY to enjoy these gems. I would love for NY, NY to offer me a casino invited guest pass to stay at their hotel. Perhaps I could exchange it for some cash to someone less informed so I can stay at a place of quality. Will not ever be back to stay, even if FREE!

Reviews.Title: “Good on a budget”
Reviews.Author: keenishere
Reviews.Content: New York - New York is in a great location towards the southern tip of the strip and has a huge casino and several cool bars (notably Coyote Ugly). We chose it because we wanted to stay on the strip but not pay Bellagio / Wynn prices, and to be honest we would have felt out of place in those Joints...the atmosphere was great in NY - NY, very chilled and friendly, whereas others felt less so. Room was great, large enough, clean etc. and it suited us (3 26yr olds) down to the ground in terms of price (not too expensive), gambling (laid back and $10 min tables - not $1,000!) and food and drink (loads to choose from, Coyote Ugly was great fun). I wouldn't hesitate to book again if I was with mates...I might stretch the purse strings and stay in the Bellagio / Wynn / Caesars if with a girlfriend as those places are magical, but for what it is...New York - New York does the trick.

Reviews.Title: “great stay at the NY NY”
Reviews.Author: CanadaWorldtraveller
Reviews.Content: my friend and i came to las vegas in june for 3 nights to see Elton john's red piano and we stayed at the NY NY. Check in was very fast and efficient. finding our room was easier than i tought. the room was decent and convenient. nothing luxurious but comfortable and spacious. but what i liked the most about the New York New York is the casino floor with its restaurants and bars made to look like ny streets... i loved it

Reviews.Title: “The Best Place To Stay In Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Kimberley86
Reviews.Content: Had a great time in the new york new york hotel. Check in was quick, however we requested a non-smoking room and they gave us a smoking room. They said we could have a non-smoking room for an extra $5 a night but we chose to stay in the smoking room, it didn't smell of smoke so it was fine. In my opinion, new york new york has the best casino. Its not the biggest but it has everything u need and its layed out very well. The only thing that was annoying about the hotel is its location. Its a bit out of the way so be prepared to do alot of walking.

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel, mediocre overall”
Reviews.Author: DaisyKatt2
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 4 nights at NYNY. It was Ok -- we didn't have a bad experience, but we weren't wowed either. We tried to check in at 2:30pm but were told to come back at 3pm. When we returned at 3pm, they only had rooms available that didn't match our request. In the end, we didn't check-in until 5pm. They happily stored our bags while we gambled away our money while waiting. Noteworthy: - The rooms are spacious and clean. Not luxurious, but you get what you pay for. - The pool area is small... we reserved a cabana but we could have got away with going down ~ 9am to on day of for half the price. - Currently, there is construction going on in the middle of the gaming floor. There is an unsightly black tarp hanging in the middle of the room. One day we noticed that they were working and making noise, but otherwise it didn't effect us. - We booked the rooms online and got the Strip View promo. Our room on the 22nd floor had a view of Mandalay Bay, etc. and we could not hear the rollercoaster. - We enjoyed the Krispy Kreme onsite and Il Fornaio had wonderful lattes and croissants. - There are no poker tables at this casino resort. That was shocking to us! Overall, the hotel was good and we really enjoyed Vegas. With so much to do, you don't need to stay in a fabulous hotel to have a good time.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Stay”
Reviews.Author: harmonicatski
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had an awesome time in Las Vegas and a good part of that was the terrific suite we had at NYNY. Everything was first class al the way, clean room, great view, great staff and amenities, awesome pool. Would stay here again for sure. John & Betsy Washington

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: sharon1969
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in New York New York for our first wedding anniversary. We had been to Vegas before and always said that we wanted to stay there at some point. Unfortunately, this was a big mistake. We got mixed up with the fantastic atmosphere in the casino/entertainment area of the property and simply figured it would carry on through the actual hotel. Wrong. The rooms are very small, outdated, and not the cleanest. The towels were very grey and smelled strongly of bleach. Strip views aren't the greatest, and the rollercoaster can be annoying. The walk to the rooms can take forever and to get to the front desk you must venture through the casino area - it isn't separate like in most hotels. The pool is very small and is not located in a convenient area. It also receives a great deal of shade from the building. We went to the Spa on our first day and were very disappointed. We had to walk through the workout area in our robes to get to where our massages were to take place. Then it was very hard to relax as all we could hear were people in the weight room dropping the weights. We were impressed by room service. The food was good, reasonably priced (if there is such a thing when dealing with room service), and didn't take long to come. Also, the valet staff were very friendly and helpful. We ate at a few of the restaurants and they were good. However, they didn't stay open late enough. The Bar at Times Square is fantastic - a must see and enjoy! All in all, for the price it wasn't worth it. They either have to update their rooms and service, or lower their room rates.

Reviews.Title: “A Pleasant Surprise”
Reviews.Author: gotarheels
Reviews.Content: We stayed at NYNY for two nights at the beginning of June '08. I am a pretty heavy player at MGM properties and get room comps but had never stayed at NYNY because the noise level on the casino floor is too much for me. I also suspected that the rumble of the roller coaster would be heard from the rooms. Happily, that was not the case. The casino is still loud if you're near the bar area, but the walled-off construction area in the center of the casino actually blocks much of that out. Our room was very nicely appointed but on the small side. We had two queen beds that were very comfortable with good sheets. Rooms at Luxor, Mandalay, Excalibur and Monte Carlo are all bigger. Doesn't matter too much to me as I spend little time in the room. Staff was pleasant and accommodating...maid service was good. Drink service in the casino is far above average. I was pleased overall.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best.”
Reviews.Author: atomzero
Reviews.Content: NYNY was a fine hotel. If I were staying in Vegas again, I would definitely consider this hotel over others. I like the floor layout of NYNY better than most of the other hotels, the restauratns were excellent and of a good variety. The room was excellent and a good value. Many of the other hotels were labyrinthine in layout compared to NYNY.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Ok location”
Reviews.Author: l0vet0travel3
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the NYNY from June 1st - June 6th and had a great time during my stay. We arrived at Mccarran Airport at 7am and checked into the hotel at 9:30 am where we were given our room number and told to call around 2 to see if it was ready. After driving around and visiting off-strip casinos we went back and it was ready. The check-in lady was very nice and assured us we would have a nice room facing the strip and decided not to upgrade from the Park Ave to the Broadway as the room wasn't as nice. The room was great, in the New Yorker tower room 1758 we had views from Planet Hollywood to Mandalay Bay and the rollercoaster below us. The rollercoaster did not bother us at all as other reviewers have said, if anything it is neat to watch if you are even in your room long enough to check it out as we weren't in there much. The first night we were there, the hotel and casino lost its AC and the room and casino was hot so we gambled late at the Monte Carlo. However, upon checkout we were comped the first nights stay for the inconvenience. Excellent service. *Negatives - worsed smelling casino not from smoke but we felt they were really going for the New York Smell of dirty sewage. Once we were down there for abit, the smell wore off but once you get off the elevator it is horrid. Also, Broadway burger had bad customer service and not so good food. The comps for playing Blackjack at $10-15/hand for 8 hours a day for 3 days at their property was bad. They told me you needed to play at $25/hand to get rated so luckily I played the slots too there with no luck but got all food comped. *Positives - great service, excellent housekeeping, rooms were spotless and modern with great views at night time. Close to monorail station, southstrip casinos. *Recommendations - Get a rental car if you plan to go places but don't get the extra insurance and it is dirt cheap. Gamble downtown, it is more fun drinks are faster/better and your money lasts alot longer. Also they have $3 and $5 blackjack all over. Eat at Binions Ranch Steakhouse (business casual) to take in an amazing view from the 26th floor. Great Steak and price. Also I always go to Ellis Island to get the awesome steak dinner and Homemade microbrew for $5.95. And lastly, get players cards everywhere you go, between 3 of us at Wynn, we signed up spun a wheel and got 2 free $37 buffets and 2 $10 free-play. Amazing food at the Wynn Buffet. Overall I enjoyed the NYNY and could not beat the price I got from playing there last year but when I go back in October I want to be closer to the centre strip where the action & fun happens such as O'sheas, Flamingo and Bill's Gamblin Hall or the Nugget Downtown where we spent the majority of the time. Total Hotel Cost - $246 for 4 nights & $148 roundtrip from Spirit Air from Detroit. Yes, Vegas is still very affordable.

Reviews.Title: “Appalling standard of customer care”
Reviews.Author: Little_Me_2006
Reviews.Content: I arrived after travelling for 27 hours to be told no record of my reservation was on file. I was then old to go to a payphone and phone the agents I booked with. They pointed out this was across the casino. So I had to carry my suitcase, hand luggage and purse through a busy casino to a pay phone. (The day after I noted there are four phones situated just around the corner from reception) The phone is question was so quiet I couldnt hear the person on other line. I shouted my problem down the line to them and hoped they heard me! I finally managed to get back to the recpetion to be told nothing had come through yet. Two hours later it did. Not before a very unfriendly woman had told me "too bad we are all booked up for tonight!" You would think a single female would get priority in such circumstances. I checked into my room, only to be told I needed to change rooms the day after. They said they would call me between 1 and 3 pm to organise this. I went out for the morning and waited for my call. It didnt arrive until 5pm! What a waste of a day. Other problems included: Dry cleaning not delivered on time, The block on my internet and phone wasnt removed for two days. Unfriendly staff An unusaul scum in the swimming pool area, which was also littered with rubbish. A terrible odour outside the New York tower. The rollercoaster running until all ours right outside my window. Then to top it off...... I arrived back on my final day to discover many items from my room had been taken, jewellery, gifts etc. I was reimbursed, but wasnt even apologised too. This hotel is a great dissapointment. It isnt even worth a visit. Shocking display of customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Intimidated”
Reviews.Author: Smaaaarty
Reviews.Content: I am disgusted at the way i was treated on the casino floor ,i was staying at Mandalay bay hotel and decided to visit New york New york for a game of blackjack and sat down and presented my players club card that i joined a few days before ,i was promptly told by a casino mid management woman that my card was only a temporary card and would not be accepted because my name was not printed on the card ,a few minutes later the pitt boss came over to me and explained that i needed to get my card updated i could not understand the big deal as when i played the slots all my name details and points showed clearly on the display,the point im getting was that i felt Intimidated and spoiled a good night .

Reviews.Title: “Overall, a good place to stay on the south strip”
Reviews.Author: Tresura
Reviews.Content: I'm writing a late review on a stay about a year ago at the New York New York. Overall, I enjoyed the stay there. The only negative in my opinion was the pool area. I found it to be average at best and certainly not on par with some hotels with similar rates. That being said, the pool was okay, and I would never tell anyone not to stay there just because of an average pool! The room was clean and spacious. The staff at the hotel was pleasant, and we enjoyed the inexpensive pizza and coffee shops in the "streets of new york" area. The location is also good, and it was not a far walk from many other casinos. I would stay at the New York New York again and recommend it to others. Viva Las Vegas!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: sighty
Reviews.Content: Just back from a 6 night stay at NYNY hotel and we had a fantastic time. The hotel has a great location on the strip with easy access to MGM Grand and from here you can get the monorail to many hotels. The rooms were recently renovated, quite tasteful and very clean. The starbucks and deli shop in the casino are perfect for a quick breakfast before heading out for the day and the Italian restaurant serves good food all day. Good fun in the evenings with the dualling pianos at The Times Square Bar, very lively and entertaining. The casino is smaller than many others on the strip but for the price, this hotel is a perfect base for exploring the strip. Vegas Rocks!

Reviews.Title: “Stayed here a few years ago and loved it, stayed here again and loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Muldr4Scly
Reviews.Content: As the title suggests, I stayed in this hotel a few years ago and thoroughly enjoyed my stay. Previously I travelled on my own so booked the basic cheapest room and was impressed with it. This time I booked a room with a friend for 4 nights in May so we decided to go all out for a more expensive room (Broadway). To be honest, I recall the room last time to be impressive so unless I was splitting the cost with someone, I would probably stay in the basic room (if finances were tight). I booked our room through Lastminute.com because they had a special offer of 2 complimentary cocktails, 2 for 1 roller coaster ride and booklet of discounts. Also the deal worked out cheaper than just booking the room on the New York, New York website. When I checked in I had to show my printed booking as the receptionist didn't realise I had a special deal and was reluctant to get the special vouchers. The front desk were very friendly and we were able to change the checkout time on our last day to 1pm without any problems and at no additional cost. This hotel is centrally located being on the strip and near to the MGM, Caesar's, Bally's etc. I like the location of the hotel, nice rooms, fun rollercoaster, Italian restaurant and Zumanity show. I would stay here again, next time I am in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Just Got Back and Loved It”
Reviews.Author: sandym2907
Reviews.Content: We just are back from 4 nights at the New York, New York and we had a great time! We were in the Century Tower on the 18th floor, with a wonderful strip view. The room was very clean, newly decorated and with ample space for my husband and myself. The staff were friendly and the location was great. We had a rental car and the valet service was great as well. The pool area is small compared to other hotels, but we got out there by 10:30 a.m. and reserved two lounge chairs. It is shadey until about 11:30 a.m. or so. The pizza restaurant is to die for and we also went to the little coffee shop every morning. The price was right and I would definitely recommend this hotel to others. It's not as lavish as others on the strip, but neither is the price. I was a little worried after reading some of the reviews, but we had a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “great times”
Reviews.Author: claud4
Reviews.Content: this place is crazy fun ! the room was very nice and we had a great view of the strip from our window . the lobby was ALWAY busy , but we never had to wait for anything we needed ... the staff was on top of everything. good stuff.

Reviews.Title: “great location. I loved Vegas”
Reviews.Author: yesimawake
Reviews.Content: we stayed here in sep 2005. i booked the hotel and flights seperately and found it to be a lot cheaper. the hotel is located at the south end of the strip, just across the road from the MGM. The rooms are large and ours had 2 double beds, very clean and well laid out. You can eat in the many eateries in the hotels mocked up street section (it looks like a new york street) we ate many times in the Monte Carlo next door as the food was much better The drinks were expensive in the hotel and the waitress even apoligised before giving us the bill - never a good sign. we found a cheaper place to drink at the other end of the strip next to circus circus. there are a few different bars, restaurants, and a coney island arcade and the rollercoaster that goes around some of the outside of the hotel. The monorail is very quick and easy to use, there is a stop in the MGM over the road and it goes all the way up the strip behind the hotels and finishes at the las vegas Hilton. If your staying at the NY NY you can have a free shopping trip to the primm outlet mall, you can book you place at the MGM. next to the main lobby there is a stairwell which leads to a shopping arcade and the desk to book your ride is about half way along.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel as long as you can tolerate the check-in process”
Reviews.Author: DJO645
Reviews.Content: New York New York is a great hotel as long as you can tolerate the check-in process. My wife and I asked for Park Avenue overlooking the Strip with a King Size Bed. Since we asked for a certain room, the check policy was we need to wait until 3:00 p.m. to check-in. My experience is the front desk people are extremely rude and don't care about customer service. Even the management staff doesn't care so when you read the rest of the reviews, they are dead-on about check-in process. Once you get passed the check-in process, the Hotel in great. The food is great as well as the atmosphere. I recommend renting a Cabana for the day. The cheapest beer in town is Bill's casino (2 for 5 dollars) or go to the Monte Carlo Sports Book to get free beer. I also recommend seeing Nathan Burton at the Flamingo and the Vegas sign is 1.8 miles from Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed hotel & casino but room only okay...”
Reviews.Author: glendacc
Reviews.Content: Found a great deal on expedia.com for a long weekend in Vegas last January (to celebrate my birthday). Think we got direct flights from Indy and three nights hotel for about $400 each... Overall I loved the actual hotel/casino. In general we were able to find our way around pretty well, and I didn't get constantly lost like I did when I stayed in the Luxor. It was so easy to run up to the room and drop stuff off or grab something and then get back to playing, eating, drinking, etc... We gambled quite a bit in the casino, even did the free craps lesson, and really enjoyed that. The Village Eateries (sort of food court area) was really cute, like city streets, and not some loud, clanky open area like most food courts (such as in the airport or mall). The woman working the little coffee and bakery stand seemed a bit overwhelmed and you had to remind her a number of times of your entire order. Ate a really late dinner at Gonzalez Y Gonzalez--wasn't that good and the service was pretty poor (waited a looooong time for everything). Ate breakfast at America (there was some all you can eat pancake deal for $7 or $8--you can only eat two, maybe three though! They are huge, heavy, filling pancakes). The waitress at America was super friendly and quick with the coffee. Also ate breakfast one morning at Il Fornaio, which had good food and service, but a little pricey--think lunch or dinner there would be nicer, better option. There's a soft pretzel place, New York pretzel, on the mezzanine level--GREAT pretzels. Printed off and used a buy one, get one free coupon from vegas4locals.com (going to Vegas again next month and have already printed off a few of these coupons!). Nearly every day we saw someone handing out a coupon booklet sort of near our elevator bay (the New Yorker). Look for that as there were a few useful ones in it. Didn't wait too long to check in or out. There were however big issues in the hotel on the day of check out--there was no hot water for hours. We called down and said we'd be checking out late since we hadn't been able to shower and they didn't seem to mind. Check out was at 11:00 and by 1:00 there was still no hot water so we checked out anyway so we could experience a bit more Vegas before boarding the flight (flight wasn't until 5:00 or 6:00). Other than that morning waiting for the hot water to return, we spent very very little time in the room. The room was fine, but the bathroom was in need of some repairs (sink faucet was really loose, for example). The king size bed was super comfortable. Our room had a view of the Monte Carlo, which happened to be the same weekend it caught fire--had a perfect view of the unfortunate damage! Would've seen the actual fire had we been in our room at the time. The pool was closed for the winter (those of us in the Midwest often don't realize that it's not really hot in Vegas over the winter months!)

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: EHendrix
Reviews.Content: I just finished a week stay at the New York and had a great time. For those new to Las Vegas, the hotel is located right towards the beginning of the strip and is across the street from the Monorail that will run you up and down the strip (for a hefty fee). I got there early on Monday morning and although they didn't have any rooms available yet (it was 9am) they gave me an early check in. They gave me keys and everything, all I had to do when I came back later that afternoon is pick up any house phone and give them my name and they gave me a room number. I had a Skyline room, room 1564. The room is pleasantly big, with double beds, an entertainment center, small computer desk / table. Average shower and bathroom facilities. Plenty of room for all of my belongings and a wall safe was very helpful, although the safe is extremely small and will only hold small items, like an iPod, wallet, jewelry..etc. No laptop will fit so beware of bringing one. The only negative in the room was the television; it was about 10 years old and was a 19 inch. It looked rather odd in the large entertainment center and the remote didn't work very well....but this is Vegas after all and I didn't watch much TV except at night when trying to fall asleep. The Hotel is quite nice for the money ($80 per night on my stay). It's in good shape overall and has some nice things to do. The roller coaster is always fun, the arcade is nice for the kids. Definitely eat at Sirroco's Pizza. It's fantastic and I would have eaten there more than once if I could have. Do NOT eat the breakfast "buffet" under any circumstances. It has about 15 or 20 items total (counting the bread, fruit...etc). Other than eggs and bacon, everything else is "Oriental" breakfast and is not appetizing at all. For $13 I was very very unhappy. After getting screwed there once I went to the Paris hotel for breakfast (BEST buffet in town, hands down). I also went to the spa, which I'll review elsewhere but it was a good time also. Overall, a great stay (my 2nd one at the New York) and definitely worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “What a city !”
Reviews.Author: jeffcarBristol
Reviews.Content: Loved the location of NY NY get yourself a a deuce bus ticket and you cannot go wrong , Make sure you go to Fremount street its a great atmosphere and a lot cheaper to start off the night out . The hotel was very good , the piano bar does tend to play the same things though , also check out Big Elvis and Bills casino Great experience ,Will be back

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel,Great time”
Reviews.Author: KBearRN
Reviews.Content: My husband and I really enjoyed our stay at New York New York. We got a room upgrade (through an online special on their website) as well as vouchers for free drinks, breakfasts, and roller coaster rides. Our room was clean and comfortable and I enjoyed the decor. Had no view and room was near the roller coaster, but it surprisingly did not make enough noice to bother us. The hotel is not the most posh in Vegas, however, it is a great deal for the money. In comparison,I have stayed in Ceasar's Palace for more than double the price, and although the Casino was more impressive, I did not find the rooms that special. New York New York is in a good location and has some fun bars and eateries. I recommend the show Zoomanity-my husband and I enjoyed it. (if you are not offended by some nudity and adult humor!) Overall, had a great time and no complaints about our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive”
Reviews.Author: Contactpci
Reviews.Content: Ya gotta love it. Everything's larger than life in Vegas. Very plush, great service, outstanding atmosphere. You know they're out to take you at the casino (they did), but it's still a great place to be.

Reviews.Title: “An awesome experinece for our group”
Reviews.Author: AMATTA
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 4N/5D stay at the NY NY and have to say it was absolutely awesome!. We where a group of 20 people; all with casino interest. We contacted the casino marketing team ahead of time and they did the rest. Mrs. Marcia Perna is the best!!!, look her up in the NYNY website. She took care of our room reservations and our check in process. Imagine a group of 20 people arriving to the property at once and being in our rooms 10 minutes after arrival; this is how good and organized they were. The players club crew also went the extra mile! The VIP lounge was always staffed with eager to help you, natural large smile personell. The property is unique, the rooms are very nice and very well taken care of. You will find various options of restaurants, from a deli (great sandwiches!!!), a couple of strabucks, pizza, burgers and other "walk in, get your food" options to fine dine restaurants. The location you cant beat; surrounded by the Monte Carlo, MGM and the Excalibur you are well conected; bus stops (the deuce shuttle) at the NYNY and MGM, a free tram to the Mandalay located at the Excalibur and a train station located at the MGM. You make you way aroung the strip for $5 via the deuce shuttle or for $9 using the Vegas Monorail train. A $13 dolar taxi ride gets you to Las Vegas Outlets or to the Callaway Golf Center is that is what your looking for. For the all around Vegas Experience at a great price the New York New York is the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for the $”
Reviews.Author: city2country
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here between 5/22 & 5/24. It was our first time in Vegas and we were really looking forward to it. The hotel check in went smoothly and they were extremely friendly. The room was clean for the most part - other than one issue of my husband finding a band aid in the bed - ewwww!!!!! But as jet lagged as I was I was sleeping before he found it and didn't budge when he tried to wake me. Other than that the room was clean, spacious and comfortable. Don't know if I'd stay here again only because after seeing the other hotels in the area I'd like to try one of them instead.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay somewhere else if i went back to Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Tony_warks
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 5 Nights leaving Mon 2/6/08. The hotel is average. Caught a taxi from the airport, Check-In was nice and quick.
