Asked for a view of the strip and got a room looking at the MGM and Trpoicana junction on the 30th Floor, well away from the rollercoaster and excellent night views. There are 6 lifts to this particular floor! I was disappointed that there was no fridge or tea making facilities in the room otherwise it was fine. No DVD player but clean and confortable (especially the bed). I liked that you could leave the aircon on when you went out (doesn't rely on the swipe card to be inserted anywhere). For breakfast I would recommend Chin Chin. Great buffet choice and great value $26 for 2 adults. Casino area isn't much to look at after you've visited the other hotels which seem to be better presented, illuminated and more lively. Do the rollercoaster but be warned it is violent! My wife and I didn't feel the same for a couple of days afterwards. Next time i would choose to stay at places like, Belaggios, Ceasars Palace, The Venetian, The Wynn or Manadaly Bay. (MGM is huge but really crowded). The strip is massive. Everywhere seems close because you can see it, but OBJECTS APPEAR CLOSER THAN THEY ARE and you will get tired after a couple of days of some serious walking. Make use of the free Monorail between Excalibur and Manadalay Bay, get a 24hr ticket for the DEUCE bus (the only double decker buses on the strip) which just go up and down the strip at all hours for $5 each. Catch lots of cabs and take comfortable footwear. Most of the hotels have free shows so don't miss any. The Volcano at Mirage was being repaired and Treasure Island was cancelled 2 days running due to high winds. TOP ATTRACTION is the Belaggio Fountain outside the hotel. Also go on a Gondola in the Venetian ($15each). We saw a Magic show at The greek Isles Hotel, had VIP seats and were impressed by the magic acts. Too good to have any doubts about Magic. Excursions. We went in a Helicopter over the Hoover Dam, Grand Canyon and landed at a Cowboy Ranch where we went horse riding. On another day we went Rafting down 12 miles of the Colorado River from Hoover Dam through Black Canyon to Willowby Beach. The next day we went Extreme Sky Diving (our first Tandem jump) and this was like nothing we've ever done before. It was just beautiful and there is nothing to fear at all. Food. Eat what you like and where you like. We just kept it simple until we lost our appettites (might be the heat 32C). Night is still t-shirt weather. Nightlife. Has to be the best in the world. We had pre-paid Vegas Passports which gave us VIP access to all the nightclubs (about 25) and included the entrance fees. Do dress up though as i saw many people get turned away because of footwear. The best club (and most expensive) was VooDoo Rising at The Rio Hotel. It is on the 51st (and top) open air floor overlooking the whole of Las Vegas. The views were amazing, the music was excellent (choice of 3 rooms/music) and its clearly where the rich kids go to party. This club is a MUST!!! LAX in Luxor Hotel was also very good, as were RAIN at Palms (for the views) and PURE at Ceasars Palce for views/rooms and choice of music. We managed about 10 clubs in 3 nights. There is a lot of construction of new hotels taking place but it doesn't affect the visit. Enjoy Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Took my deposit, then sold my room to another guest”
Reviews.Author: IamOCall
Reviews.Content: I booked 8 rooms in the NY, NY for a convention, all rooms were paid using the same credit card, and in fact they took the 1st night stay on all rooms in advance. When we arrived, 7 rooms checked in successfully. However, my room was cancelled because my credit card 'was denied' according the the check-in lady. This of course after they already successfully charged my card and had the money in their account. I said, 'lets just fix this, please get me another room'. We'll, the hotel was sold out (they got paid 2x for my room now), and told me there was nothing to do. I asked if they could comp me a room next door, and they told me to hit the road. The were clear in their insinuation that I was obviously a deadbeat if my card was denied. I asked for the manager, 'they are not available at this time'. I spend several hours in line for check in, to pay for our rooms, and trying to reconcile the accounts. I now have our accountant spending hours trying to figure out if we got the credits we should have. Nobody can tell me even now why it happened. They really don't seem to care. Bottom line is, you probably won't have this problem, but you should be forewarned that they really have no interest in customer service, or ensuring a reasonable experience. I strongly suggest alternatives.

Reviews.Title: “Fun atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: steve1975l
Reviews.Content: New york New York Hotel & Casino is small compared to the others and is always busy like NY. There is some building work beneath Coyote Ugly which was being revealed the day we left. There is also a closed off area in the middle. All casino's are updating so don't let it put you off and we couldn't hear them working. Check in There was no check in queue when we arrived at 3:30pm. Other days we did see a long queues so I wonder if they got a shuttle and arrived all at once. I saw queues at other hotels too due to the number of guests. I have read the reviews on here before booking and the guy that found the soap made me laugh, why not call houskeeping to get them to re-clean the room as that's why they have a phone extenstion. Also someone couldn't find their room, try looking on the key card. I was given a map and pointed in the right direction as I left reception. In the tower there were 6 fast elevators so hardly waited at all. Luggage was brought up within minutes of getting into the room. Location NYNY is in a great position a bridge links it to the MGM and another one to the Excalibur. From the Excalibur you can walk through to the Luxor and Mandalay bay or use the free tram. There are some shops opposite to get water and food from. Rooms Our room was in the Newyorker tower 9th floor. We could see the roller coaster but could not hear it. It's opening/closing times seem to vary but our friends on the 4th floor couldn't hear it. Our room was a famly set up so had an adjoining door so we could hear next door easily, my only negative. The room has a wall safe, hairdryer and iron. Try the promotional code TAHITI for an upgrade from the basic room. Casino I don't gamble but our friends do and said that this hotel has good drinks service. We tried it one night and found it to be quick and a good selection. Restaurants We ate in the Italian one night and found it to be very good. It has plenty of snack places so plenty of choices. Use the voucher being handed out from near Chin Chin restaurant to get free hotdog. Don't use the American for breakfast as it is very expensive, use the buffet places in other casino's. Rainforest cafe at MGM was good. Bars Prices seem to vary on drinks from bar to bar. The nine fine Irishmen was $7.50 for a Guiness and not even a pint. It has live entertainment in the afternoons. Coyote Ugly was always packed as was the bar at Times Square so never went in there. Chin Chin bar was quieter and a good meeting point for us before heading out. The bar by reception near the main doors has the best coffee (better than starbucks) and was $2.50. Pool Now hear is the bad part of the hotel. The pool is freezing and small. The sunloungers are packed in. The pool area is in shade until 11am and you can hear the roller coaster every few minutes but music is playing drowning some of the screams out. Turn left out of the doors and get the loungers in the corner by the fire escape doors these are quieter and get the sun first. Water in the shop is $3 so buy it from the guys on the bridges outside for $1.

Reviews.Title: “Great Casino, great room, great view!”
Reviews.Author: cazuk11
Reviews.Content: I have visited Las Vegas every year for the past 4 years, staying somewhere different every time. This year, my husband and I chose the New York New York... what a great choice! We booked one of the rooms that had the bath in the room and there were windows on both sides. We had a view of the MGM Grand and Excalibur and were directly above the roller coaster. Although we could hear it, it didn't really matter. The room was great and big enough to live in it... I can't fault this hotel at all. The lines at check in were long, but no longer than any other hotel. The pool was busy, but no busier than any other hotel. There are loads of places to eat and drink. I loved the gaming area, and the waitresses are really nice and came round all the time no matter where you were playing. Don't forget to tip $1 per drink! I would stay here again, but I won't. I plan to stay in every hotel in Las Vegas so who know's where I'll end up next year, I hope it is as good as the New York New York though!

Reviews.Title: “If you like tacky and cheap...this is the place for you!”
Reviews.Author: Stephanie70
Reviews.Content: After booking a Spa Room online through the hotel we arrived to check-in and were told our debit card wasn't sufficient to "secure the Spa Room". They didn't have a problem debiting our checking account for the full amount of the room two weeks prior though. My 40 year old husband and my 38 year old self, professionals, who do not "steal things" and "overflow spas" were not trustworthy enough to rent the Spa Room without a credit card to protect the hotel. I didn't see the fine print when we booked the room. When I asked the assistant front desk manager to speak with her supervisor, she stated that there wasn't one. (Oookay!) When I said, "This is absurd," after she kept repeating herself, I was calm, did not raise my voice or curse, she simply said, "If you interrupt me again I will have you removed from the hotel." I am a first grade teacher. I am not one to make a scene in public. I was not being overbearing or particularly rude. This woman was doing the exact opposite of offering customer service. We chose the hotel only because we had tickets to see Zumanity and didn't want to have to stay somewhere else and take a cab, etc. (The show was hilarious by the way.) The room we were "allowed" to book was small, very stuffy, and the bed was the most uncomfortable bed I have ever slept in. The bedding was cheap and gross. The pillows were the worst. The used condom wrapper in the nitestand drawer was really great! The 2 and 3 year olds sitting at a table with their parents at 12:30 at night in a room full of drunk people and cigarette smoke in the lobby disgusted me. The entire hotel is just icky. After reading other reviews here we thought it would be a fine place to stay. My guess is that folks who found the hotel to be "awesome" or "fabulous" have never really stayed in a very nice hotel. Actually, I have stayed in much cheaper places, around the world and in the states that were much nicer and offered better service. If you enjoy cheap bedding, uncomfortable beds, overpriced everything and people throwing up in restroom stalls next to you in the lobby restrooms, well, this is your place!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, great pubs / eateries / restuarants”
Reviews.Author: uniquetravelbrisbane
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, across from Excalibur, MGM hotels, next to Monte carlo hotel. Reccommended transport around the strip - the Deuce bus$5 (24hr) pass up and down the strip. Make sure you go shopping at the las vegas premium outlets (north of the strip).

Reviews.Title: “Ok stay for people on a budget”
Reviews.Author: Blaize76
Reviews.Content: In Vegas you always get what you pay for. I purchased this stay from a third party website and was given a outdated room in the Chrysler building. The bed was hard, comforter stained with some bright yellow spots underneath. If you plan on spending your time seeing the sights and use your room only for sleeping then NY NY is great for you. If you appreciate amenities and small touches I would recommend staying somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel....ripped off on the view.”
Reviews.Author: StarsAboveUs
Reviews.Content: Stayed at NYNY May 11-15th. We waited in line for about 20mins..it was around 7pm on a sunday night and only 3 people working behind the desk. Checking out was about 15mins, but it was right at check out time so its understandable. Booked a Park Avenue Premium View Room....and there was nothing premium about it! Our room faced excalibur, tropicana and hooters..we expected to be facing the other way but were took excited to be in Vegas to care that much. The room was smaller then I expected, and the bathroom was mini(2 people in there at once was cramped, unless one was in the shower)...I'd compare the size of the room to a Motel 6 (compared to the size of a room at mgm where our friends were staying!). Any phone calls made from the room cost $1(even when using calling cards). The rollercoaster was right outside our room, it started around 9am, stopped around midnight. Wasnt too loud, though you could hear the occasional scream and the sound of the wheels on the track. I recommend keeping the bottom part of the window closed, it helps. Liked the casino...wheel of fortune slots were good to me. The Bar at Times Square was really fun, walked by it one night just past midnight, stopped to listen and then decided to go back the next night! Sirrico's Pizza was to die for, the sicilian style is the better one (square pieces) especially at 2am (they are open till 3). We also stopped at Nine Fine Irishman Pub around midnight and it too was fun with a real irish band! Bought beverages at the Grand Canyon Experience store across the street (have to take the overpass) by the m&m store, they had reasonable prices (for vegas!) and cheap souviners! I do like NYNY, and would stay here again if I was renting a car, but if not then I'd stay somewhere more to the middle of the strip like Planet Hollywood, Paris or Mirage, as it was a pain to take the bus down the strip, especially around dinner time (between 430-7) don't attempt it, you'll get stuck waiting for 2 or 3 buses to pass before there is standing room on one.

Reviews.Title: “Decent place to Stay and Play”
Reviews.Author: TheBigKahoona
Reviews.Content: I was comped these rooms, so the price was right. The room was nothing to get excited about nor to complain about. It was very clean but in need of updating. Too many brown colors and some funky looking stuffed headboard hanging on the wall. The bathroom was very nice and clean. I had brought my mother to the hotel to celebrate Mother's Day with her. I had asked for a room close to the elevator upon check in, due to my mother's mobility issues. Instead we were given a room that was one room away from the end of the hall. The Casino is being renovated and is one VERY NOISY place when the construction crew is working. They move throughout the Casino with wheelbarrows, tools and other assorted equipment. We spent most of our gambling time at other Casinos. No buffet here just a GREAT Food Court. Do not leave without trying the pizza at Sirrico's.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice rooms, good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: bzaoz01
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in Nov/Dec 07 for five nights in ``Park Avenue'' (basic) room. We had a view into the Monte Carlo carpark and the new casino construction site, but we weren't in Vegas for the view from the hotel window. Despite the roller coaster going past and the construction site, we didn't get woken up by any noise, and enjoyed being so close to other parts of the strip. Room was clean, comfortable, and rather bright (I thought), the casino and hotel were easy to navigate around and the food in the Mexican restuarant in the casino was great. Other food outlets pretty good as well. Felt safe and secure in their rooms, the service was good (check in took about 5 minutes), check out was a breeze. Might have been a bit of a trek to the carpark, but it is everywhere in Vegas so either shell out for the valet or just waddle along. I would definitely go back. We switched to the Luxor for five days after staying here, and I much preferred NYNY, primarily for the location and the fact it was easier to find your way around inside the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at New York New York”
Reviews.Author: rebers
Reviews.Content: Was in Vegas for just one night on business and decided to stay on the strip. I had never stayed at New York New York, but was very glad I did. Check in was very quick for a Friday night, and the front desk clerk was extremely professional and provided a ton of information. I stayed in a "Park Avenue" room which was very nice - great view of the strip. Bathroom was very large. No tub, only a shower but that was perfect for me. Overall, if you want to stay at this end of the strip, I would suggest NY NY.

Reviews.Title: “Better than Expected”
Reviews.Author: bqad_2003
Reviews.Content: Stayed at NYNY for 5 nights. After reading several reviews I was not sure what to expect. I found the staff to be polite and helpful. Check-in only took about 10 minutes, if that. I checked out via TV so that was extremely fast. I left our bags at the bell desk the last day after checking out and they were really fast, helpful and organized. Our room was nice and clean. Nothing spectacular, but for what we paid I thought it was above average. Beds were comfy. I didn't really like their towels, but that could be me just being picky. I was pleasantly surprised by the pool. Much better than what I expected. Not the biggest, but very peaceful and great drink service. Ate at a lot of restaurants in the hotel. I love the pizza place and the il fornio bakery was very good. I didn't like the America restaurant. Aside from that, we had a great stay and would definitely consider going back.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: onedohfan
Reviews.Content: The hotel sent me a special offer via email so I decided to give it a try. Strange to see how people's opinions differ so widely on the rooms. I guess it's just like the casino slots, you either get a good one or it just takes all your money. I was one of the lucky ones as far as the room goes. I was sure because I received a "special" offer, I would get one of the worst rooms. But I got a Park Avenue room on the 29th floor. The view was opposite of the strip but that doesn't bother me. It was still very pretty at night with all the city lights. And it's not like anyone sits and stares out of their window for their whole stay! It was nonsmoking (which I requested) but had 2 queen beds instead of king. No big deal. Nonsmoking was more important. It was a handicapped room so it was very spacious. It was very clean and the bathroom sparkled. No complaints about the room at all. Check in was a breeze. I was a little early for check in but they had a room ready. Only one person ahead of me in line. Check in clerk seemed a little taken aback that I requested a room away from the roller coaster, but was very polite about it and although I could see the roller coaster a few floors below my room, it was far enough away I could not hear it. All staff I came in contact with was exceptionally polite and helpful. It seems like only the people that complain about something, are the ones that get the rude service. As other reviewers have said, the slots are extremely tight there. I usually walk around and see how other gamblers are doing and other than a couple of exicited people winning a few hundred dollars, no big winners. Construction going on in the casino so it was very noisy at times. But there was a good variety of machines. I like using the pools at hotels where I stay but this was an exception. The hotel pool seems to be geared toward the young, trendy crowd. It was overcrowded and noisy. The only lounge chair I could find was right next to the rest rooms and there were loudspeakers right overhead blaring rock music. (Those days are way behind me!) People were packed in like sardines. Not relaxing at all. The only restaurant I tried was II Fornaio. Small bistro like atmosphere and they served a limited light menu. I had a tomato, basil, mozzarella sandwich on Italian bread. It was wonderful. A nice break from the usual hamburger and sub sandwich. And at $7 not a budget breaker for lunch. Check out was very easy and fast also. I had plenty of time so went down to the desk to get my receipt right away. No long lines and again very polite staff. Took my luggage to the bellman until my flight and had no problems whatever. A little slow getting the bags out, so don't run at the last minute and expect to get out fast. I enjoyed my stay and if another special offer comes along, I would consider it. But maybe not in summer since I don't like the crowded pool.

Reviews.Title: “Not very good”
Reviews.Author: Midlandbeau
Reviews.Content: Stayed in NYNY for 5 days our room overlooked the aircons and the carpark it was terrible and noisy ,so we asked to be moved to a room overlooking the strip bearing in mind we booked this hotel nearly 8 months prior.We were told that there was only a smoking room available we are both non smokers ,but in our desperation to be moved we accepted at an extra charge and moved I wished we hadn't.I never enjoyed my stay there, the casino is a maze I was fed up of continually getting lost .Getting to your room is also a major feat deciding which elevator to use for each block.I would definitely not use this hotel ever again.

Reviews.Title: “Not Great”
Reviews.Author: Lisa_J_B
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel a couple of years ago and got a great room for 2 nights...this time was a different story. We arrived after 20 hours of travelling, checked into our room to a view of a brick wall only a few feet from the window and practically no natural light whatsoever. (We'd paid extra on booking to upgrade from Skyline to a Park Avenue Deluxe). I picked up the phone to change rooms straight away. I was told there were no non-smoking rooms available until the next day. That was fine with us for one night. After the conversation I went to use the shower to find the previous guests' used soap on the side of the bath...nice. I also noticed a chocolate sweet on the bedroom floor - again, not ours! Next day we moved rooms at 3pm (breaking up our day to get back to the hotel to do this). The check in guy ignored my requests for an upgrade because of the inconvenience - he just kept saying ' this is a better room'. Could have been a language barrier...but no effort to apologise at all, even when I told him about our 'room gifts'. The new room had a nice view, but the cleanliness was lacking again and the tv remote didn't work. Went to use the pool - the water was freezing at 10am and there were bugs/flies floating on the surface. By this point, you begin to get irritated by the small things! The hotel is ok but the housekeeping is letting itself down, strange dripping stains on the back of the bathroom door, hairs stuck to the bathroom ceiling and bathroom vent coated in dust. Their attention to detail could be a lot better. The general furnishings are still in good condition and a little bit of TLC could make guest experiences a lot better. All in all its still a good place to stay with a good casino with great facilities and theming but if you're after luxury, head somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible customer service and rooms were dirty”
Reviews.Author: MitzieLee
Reviews.Content: There were not positives to this stay to start with so on with the negatives. We reserved two rooms at NY-NY for two nights, and paid an extra fee to have rooms with a Strip view. On arrival we waited in the check in line for about 20 minutes. The girl said our second room would not be ready for about 30 minutes. We asked if we would have to stand in line again and she said 'yes.' We complained about having this. There was no apology, no 'sorry, but that's our policy.' She was completely indifferent. We waited about an hour, went back and stood in line for around 30 minutes this time. The room was still not ready and we were told we would have to wait in line yet a third time. My husband complained again and said that we didn't want to waste the afternoon waiting to check in. They said they would reserve us a room close to the one room that we had, and that we could come back and check into the reserved room later that evening. Now 10 p.m. and waited in line again. The young guy practically called my husband a liar, saying that there was no way someone went against policy and reserved us a room. He was extremely rude. After asking to speak to a manager, who was also very unconcerned about our complaints, she finally (after much argument) did agree to give us $30 off the rate of one of the rooms for one night. (Upon checkout, we were told this was not recorded and we were not given the $30 off.) We finally got the second room and it was in a different tower and nowhere near the first room. ARRRRGHHH! This room had no view of the strip which we'd paid the extra money for. The first room had a slight view of the strip, about all you could see was the MGM across the street. I wish I had the names of the four people at the front desk that we dealt with. If ever treated like this again, I will be writing down names and dates for an official complaint!! As for the room itself, it was supposedly recently redecorated but it was very old. It was also dirty. I've attached a couple of pictures showing the dirty carpet and the nightstand which no one had thoroughly dusted in quite a long time. The pillowcases so rough I couldn't sleep on them. The bedspread had a hole in it and looked dirty. The rollercoaster was very noisy and kept us awake. The water in the bathroom sink also had an awful sulphur-like smell. I recommend paying less and staying at Circus Circus. The rooms are bigger, brighter, nicer and cleaner for less money. Or if you want awesome customer service and clean, gorgeous rooms, pay a little more and stay at the Bellagio. Even if you're staying in the cheapest rooms they have there, you will still be treated like royalty!! That's where I'll be staying from now on.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT ROOM! great location and service”
Reviews.Author: bren714
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a great weekend in Vegas and had a blast (like always). I was very impressed with the room we got at NYNY. It was very stylish, modern, and overall beautiful. I didnt want to leave. This site was extremely helpful because I had a budget so it helped me narrow down which hotels to chose from. It was between the Monte carlo, MGM and the NYNY.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Stay at the New York New York”
Reviews.Author: Lola0007
Reviews.Content: I stayed at NY NY in Las Vegas for four nights. This was our (my friend and I) first time in Vegas and couldn't have asked for a better experience. We will definitely be returning to Vegas and will most likely stay at NY NY again. Everything about the hotel was amazing... from the food, location, the people to the suites. Here are a few highlights of the hotel: - The food was amazing. We didn't think Vegas food would be that good but it really was. And really affordable. - The Service. The cleaning staff would always say hello and did a good job cleaning the suites. - Coyote Ugly. You HAVE to check out this place. We had so much fun here. - The Building. The building was spectacular. Everything inside was set up like the streets of new york. Great place to take pictures. - The Pool. There were always enough seats around the pool. Also had a great view of the back of the hotel with all the tall buildings. Now, here are a few things that I would have liked someone to tell me ahead of time... so I'll tell you: - They DO sell alcohol in the hotel! They sell bottles at the gift shop and at one of the koisks. - Now I don't know about the other rooms but our room did NOT have a mini fridge!!! Which was very important because we wanted to refrigerate our own alcohol and drinks. So we went over to wallgreens and bought a five dollar cooler... which helped but wasn't the greatest. - We visited during the week and there weren't as many young people as we had hoped. I recommend going over the weekend when the younger crowd is there... if that's what you are looking for. - For sun bathers - By the pool, the sun is blocked by the hotel up until about noon. So there's really no point on going earlier if you are looking to lay in the sun. We learned that after the first day and went around noon the next and still got a seat.

Reviews.Title: “New York New York In Vegas”
Reviews.Author: shellyt
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend anyone going to Las Vegas to stay at the NYNY hotel! We had a beautiful room with a view of the strip. The staff was helpful, & polite. Our room had a king size bed which was very comfortable. Room service was quick and inexpensive. The food at all the resturants in NYNY was to die for! Some places were a little pricey but like they say you get what you pay for!! I can't say enough good things about this hotel. We have decided that when we come back to Vegas that we will stay at NYNY again!

Reviews.Title: “Beware of this hotel”
Reviews.Author: KZKAT
Reviews.Content: We received a special offer from this hotel and we accepted. That was the beginning of the nightmare. As an invited guest, we were supposed to check in at the "invited guest check-in area. I told casino marketing that we would be arriving late, around 11 p.m. No problem, they are open until midnight. Well, upon arriving at NYNY at 11:10 p.m., the check-in was closed. We had to wait over 45 minutes for regular check-in. I asked the desk agent for a king, non-smoking and he smiled and handed me room keys - when we got to the room, it was in one of the original towers (even though I was told I would be in a recently renovated room), at the end of the hallway. The walk from the elevator was long - and a funny zig-zag type of hallway. Opened the door and the room was awful - 2 double beds with a table in the middle. As I was awake for about 22 hours by this time, I just wanted to go to bed. Bumped my head on the desk in between the beds - it cannot be moved and is attached to the wall. Next morning I went downstairs to ask about switching rooms. They wanted to upgrade us for an additional $70 per night! This after getting us there by offering a 3 night comped room package! After some haggling, we agreed to pay $45 night extra. This was a spa suite. Room wasn't ready and we had to check out in order to switch rooms. So we were without a room from 10:00 a.m. until 3:30 when the spa suite was ready! After spending one night in this room - dirty spa tub, something gross-looking around the drain in the shower - I told my husband we were leaving. Called TI and got comped for 3 nights. We immediately went down to the check-out. They never asked why - just a very indifferent attitude. Beware staying at this hotel. We are by no means picky people, but the rooms don't seem to be very clean. The attitude of the front desk staff is not very welcoming either. The place is very noisy, so if this is not what you like, avoid this hotel at all cost. We will never stay there again......

Reviews.Title: “Lively and Well Worth a Visit!”
Reviews.Author: jrob86
Reviews.Content: Just back from 5 night stay and couldn't have been better for fun, food and bars! Before going we had read reviews warning about renovations, long checkins and other issues, but that couldn't be further from the truth based on our visit! NyNy may be a little older than it's rivals and not to everyone's taste, but it doesn't show it's age and has a wide range of people that love it. It's restaurants and snack bars offer everything from fajitas to steak to fine italian, the bars are lively and very friendly. Coyote's is a must, even just to say you gave it a try, bar at times square is so lively and espn is good for any sports fan. Would recommend avoiding pour 24 though, apologies if it's what you like but we found it a little boring and not really in the NyNy style. There are few renovations going on at the moment, with a new bar being built and a small part of the casino floor closed, but it's doesn't have any major affect. The coaster looks amazing, we were disappointed to run out of time to ride it and it does cause a little noise in any room at the front of the building, though it stops at 11 or 12 and it's unlikely anyone going to vegas will be in bed by that time anyway! The staff were really friendly, with checkin taking no more than 5 mins on a saturday afternoon. So all and all, it's a great place for anyone that likes it lively and doesn't mind a little bit of crowded action, definately recommend a stay here!

Reviews.Title: “New York New York- a pretty good choice.”
Reviews.Author: gazm
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 9 night stay at the hotel which apart from a mysterious noise that recurred throughout was very good. At first I thought it was the roller coaster, then the airport or maybe the air conditioning but eventually gave up trying to identify the source. Check in was fairly quick and apart from the room being towards the end of the corridor it was fine. Housekeeping cleaned every day without fail and the housekeepers and any other staff encountered were friendly enough. The range of dining options was pretty good with ESPN always a favourite of mine. There was some construction work being carried out in the casino area but this caused no problems. I didnt gamble in the hotel too much as for most of the stay I couldnt find my favourite "starwars" penny slot ( a problem with most places visited- has it gone out of fashion) however this machine reappeared towards the end of the stay in a location other than I remembered so I did get the chance to lose some money there. Overall I was very happy with the choice given the very reasonable rate and free upgrade received for booking early. They also agreed to lower the rates when they fell prior to travelling so get extra points for that.

Reviews.Title: “Most fantastic place I've ever been!”
Reviews.Author: KingEdward7
Reviews.Content: Flew to Las Vegas on 31st March 2008, group of 9 adults with Virgin Atlantic from Gatwick airport. For 5 of us it was our first ever trip to Las Vegas and it is possibly the most amazing place we've ever been. They say Vegas is an adults play ground and it truly is. The hotel was fantastic, bed linens were changed every day upon your request along with towels. All the staff in the hotel were friendly and helpful, nothing was too much trouble. I loved Vegas and the hotel New York New York and will definitely be staying there on my next trip!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel - Crazy Housekeeping”
Reviews.Author: BizTravelDC
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights at NYNY from April 27 – 29. Check-in worked faster than my previous stays and the room was better than I thought, large, good TV, nice bathroom, with lighting in the shower. I traveled to this hotel on business. And not for a “conference,” (you, know, nudge nudge, wink, wink business, but actual work.) Gotta say, hotel is not geared to business travel (yeah, no kidding, I know). They charged for everything at the business center, and Internet access in the room. Cell phone coverage, in the rooms, was spotty. I anticipated that the guests on my hall would be loud and drunk (which would make me jealous that I am there to work) but the rooms was quiet. Major drawback? At 4 AM on April 28 they began to vacuum in front of my room. Not kidding. I ran to the door in my boxers and just opened it and asked “Are you insane?” The startled housekeeper scampered off with her vac in tow. I have stayed here before, so I chose not to eat here. The food is overpriced, and not very good. Gallagher’s steak is decent, but not for the money you pay. Go to Craftsteak in the MGM. I ate at the Burger Bar in Mandalay Bay and have been raving about the burgers since then. Go there too. I did not use the pool this time. I also drank at Pour 24 (I assume a nod to Store 24) and found the lack of Brooklyn Brown or any other Brooklyn brewery beer to be an abomination for a hotel that calls itself New York, New York. I also had a beer at Coyote Ugly, which I just think does not really capture the eseence of New York. The Irish Bar is much better. Finally . . . check out. Very slow for 8 AM. One person checking folks out. I would have done express check-out, but I needed a copy of my bill. It went slowly, and I had a slight verbal altercation with a guy in the check-in line, who thought he should go next when the lone agent said “Next for Check out please.” In sum, I do like this hotel. The rooms are very good. Wish I was not there for business, and I hope the housekeeping staff grows a brain.

Reviews.Title: “Just fine”
Reviews.Author: pols0019
Reviews.Content: We checked in at about noon on a Saturday - this was slow, we waited in line for about 10-15 minutes. We asked for a king room, non-smoking, with a view of the strip. A king room, non-smoking was not available for a while, but I asked a few more questions and one suddenly became available. Walking from the elevator to our room took forever - a long walk down a zig-zagging hallway. Once in the room, we were pleased with our view - we had a great view of MGM, Excalibur and the rollercoaster (which we could hear the rollercoaster and the people on it screaming). The room itself was above average. The bed was pretty comfortable, but the comforter was dated. The sitting area was nice and there was plenty of storage space in the armoir. The bathroom was nice, marble shower, however the lighting in the bathroom was poor. The reasons we did not care for the hotel; they do not have a poker room and also the pool area was not very impressive. The pool was shaded until after noon, which we like to sit in the sun, so this was a negative for us. Other than those few things, we thought the hotel was nice and the restaurants were really great.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, but not without small issues”
Reviews.Author: DJB11259
Reviews.Content: We just finished a four-night stay at NYNY. The pros: Four nights in an upgraded room for $212 (including two weekend nights) total, including taxes. (They had a two free weeknight, $99 per night weekend special). Outstanding valet parking staff. Very helpful housekepping guy brought soap and towels at 2 AM. All the staff we met was very helpful and courteous. Fun casino atmosphere. Room was very largem, with comfortable beds. First-class soap and shampoo in the bathrooms. Good location. Cons: Too smoky. We were in 13 casinos during the trip, and NYNY had among the smokiest initial smell. OK, every casino smells like smoke, but some have a heavier "first whiff" than others. Slot payouts were LAME beyond belief. I don't expect to win, but I can tell when my money's just being taken from me with no win bigger than a "cherry" or a few "bars." Expensive restaurants -- $14.95 for fish and chips with no sides at the America restaurant? Gimme a break! Also, restaurant service was slow, slow, slow. Casino was NOISY -- one of the loudest in Vegas. The "Big Apple Bar" disappeared since out last business, and there was construction on the main part of the casino floor.

Reviews.Title: “It's Just Like NYC! Overpriced and Rude!”
Reviews.Author: gobadgerzzz
Reviews.Content: I will never stay at this hotel again as I found the hotel staff, especially at check-in, to be incredibly rude. I checked in and received the keys to my room, but realized after I had walked away that the staff had not provided me with directions to my room. I had only walked a few steps away from the check in area when I turned around to ask for directions and assistance. I asked the first person I saw behind the counter if he could assist me, and I was absolutely stunned when he started to yell at me. At the top of his voice he yelled "excuse me maam but there are people who are waiting in line." I calmly explained that I had already been in line and had just been helped by the woman standing next to him, and that I just needed to be pointed in the direction of the elevators to the room. He waved me off and asked for the next people in line to come up. He just left me standing there...bags and keys in hand. I ended up heading to the back of the line in order to get directions to my room. Everyone in the line was just stunned and they graciously offered to let me cut ahead of them. I was fairly upset by the scene and decided I didn't want to have to deal with this rudeness, so I instead went and asked the shoe shine man for assistance. I have been to Vegas over 10 times, and never in my travels have I had this experience. It was just a terrible way to start my vacation, and the service just didn't get any better. Everything was overpriced, service at the restaurants was slow and with serious attitude (from the hostess to the waitstaff). I completed a comment card and mailed it to the management, hoping to get a reply, but nothing...In my opinion, their staff is trying and succeeding at giving their guests the complete New York City experience...overpriced and rude.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay at NY NY!”
Reviews.Author: Keetan
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4-19 to 4-23 and the overall experience was good. Quick check-in, fast elevators, clean rooms w/ great room service, and also a great food selection on the main floor. They could of used more shopping options to keep my wife busy and out of my wallet.

Reviews.Title: “BEST HOTEL EVER!!”
Reviews.Author: Gaston36
Reviews.Content: Were were in town for the National Finals Rodeo., first time to Vegas! Starting out I thought the stay would be terrible when Orbitz had my reservation under another name, thank goodness I had my paper work all in order. The reservation lady at the front desk at NYNY was OVER THE TOP nice! Acted as if it was no problem at all. We read about asking for upgrades, which we did, we were only booked for the Skyline and paid $300 even for 3 nights, with taxes, the reservation lady offered us the Marquis Suite for an addition $100 for the entire stay, needless to say we took her up on that offer. It wasn't ready yet (we arrived at 9 am on a Wednesday) so we went and gambled and came back a couple hours later and it was ready. It was unbelievable! As soon as we got to our room we called for our bags, they were immediately delivered, then our phone rings again and it was the front desk calling to be sure everything with the room is okay and to be sure our bags made it. I don't think I've ever had a front desk call just to make sure everything meets to our satisfaction. They were wonderful to say the least. We just ate on the run for the most part, we were too busy winning :). The pizza was great. I am not picky at all and neither is my husband, but he didn't like the breakfast buffet there at all, I didn't mind it though. We ordered room service one morning, it was awesome and the girl that delivered it was VERY nice. Gambling, we ended up winning about $6000.00... We mainly gambled at MGM (husband shoots craps, I play black jack and slots) we also gambled at NYNY, down town at Nugget and Binions and at Flamingo. We won big time at MGM, couldn't lose anything. at NYNY my husband did great, I did good at Black Jack but not slots at NYNY.... We preferred MGM... I had a real problem with one of the pit bosses at the craps tables at NYNY, real jerk. Only other problem I had was the girl behind the desk at the players card counter, she was a nasty girl... my husband had to go deal with her as I was getting very upset with her. Overall we LOVED NYNY and would stay there every time we go!!! I don't understand the negative reviews, I guess some people are just really picky but I couldn't find much to pick on at the hotel. (other than the two workers that needed more customer service manners, but that is solved by moving to another table/casino). TIP: The timeshare people - you just have to have fun with them! Every time we would pass by my husband would hollar at them just like they try to hollar at you to get your attention - he would laugh and then they would end up laughing. After the first day they remembered him and didn't bother us anymore, they would just smile and laugh..

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: little-del
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 7 nights and managed to get a great deal on the hotels website. This was my first visit to Vegas so i had visions of long check-in lines and busy elevators. We arrived at about 2pm, found there to be a line of about 30 people but we were checked in within ten min-great! Our accomodation packaged said we would get a free upgrde if available and yes we got upgraded to a park avenue delux strip view. Our elevators were next to reception and up to the 24th floor. The room was great we had a kingsize bed very comfy, in room safe and very clean bathroom and the decore was very modern. Our strip view was towards the mgm which was fine. The bathroom products smelled fab, there was a hairdyer also. The hotel itself is smaller compared to most of Vegas hotels but i liked that as we didnt get lost. There are 4 main restaurants all decent enough- loved the steak house. Avoid the Chin Chin breakfast buffet unless you want spring rolls for breakfast. The bars are good fun and as for gambling it all good. I would def stay here again as its clean and safe and fun. It is located at the south of the strip but within easy walking to everything else.

Reviews.Title: “Generic, Unimpressed, Mediocre, Rip Off”
Reviews.Author: ConnecticutTraveler2
Reviews.Content: We spent over $2100 for air and hotel and it was NOT worth it. The hotel was basically empty from Sun-Thurs--which was how long we stayed, and still we weren't even offered an upgrade. (Never in my life have I had to PAY for an upgrade at a Vegas hotel other than offering a tip. And yes, people, never pay for an upgrade. Even the booklet in the hotel room said to offer a tip for an upgrade--not pay for it). The food was alright, but there were no coffee makers in the rooms, a bottle of water is $4, drinks are $11, and everything else was way overpriced and just mediocre. (The mexican restaurant was decent.) The roller coaster is loud, construction was going on in the casino ALL day, and the vultures at each entrance hounded us to participate in their timeshare for "free" tickets. It was crass and fairly insulting. But mostly, my complaint is that the hotel was mediocre. The service was OK. We spent over 1K in gambling and 1K in food on top of it, and NOTHING was comped. What happened to the Las Vegas we used to know? Never again at an MGM resort. No wonder they're having layoffs AND Atlantic City was rated higher in hospitality. So sad.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Amazing (especially for a Bachelorette)”
Reviews.Author: WEGASGIRL
Reviews.Content: Absolutely amazing... we had five girls share two bedrooms and two bathrooms....... the adjoining rooms were such a blessing and added quite significantly to the trip. The hotel was fun, the people were great....loved the location and the bathroom was soo clean I could eat off the floor. This was a wicked hotel.....lots of noise, excitement and amazing service, I was so impressed by this hotel, id say its the best hotel i've been ever!!!!!!! The staff was amazing, had a few chances where the valet guys gave us preferential taxi service just cause they were so amazing........they let us bud in line because we were going to be late to miss our flight!! I' We are going back again in a few weeks and this is exactly where we are going to stay!!! The only two problems with this hotel was that the elevator was too far from the main entrance and because of the floor we were on, it constantly looked dark outside because it was covered by the "new york landscape"

Reviews.Title: “It was nice, but would stay somewhere else next visit”
Reviews.Author: excited2trav
Reviews.Content: This was my first time going to Las Vegas, and I had heard that NY, NY was a great hotel to stay at. In doing some research into the prices of all of the hotels in the area, this one seemed to be right in line with what we wanted to spend. I booked the trip through Travelocity.com and requested a non-smoking, skyline room. When we arrived to the hotel, the lady at the front desk told us that they were placing us in a smoking room because the non-smoking rooms were already taken. We were livid. We do not smoke, and do not want to be around smoke. My husband asked to speak with the manager (who looked like she was 18) and she politely explained that ALL of their non-smoking rooms were taken, but that she would try to move us the next day, and would upgrade our room to the next level up. The room we were in that first night was OK. Thankfully, the smoke smell wasn't that bad and we could tolerate the room. When we received the call the next morning to change rooms and upgrade, we were very disappointed to learn that the only "upgrade" they gave us was a strip room, but still the older (but newly decorated) room. We were hoping for the next room up. Overall, the hotel is nice, but is showing it's age compared to some of the newer and nicer hotels. I was seriously SHOCKED at how they try to get you every time you turn the corner - $15/day for internet access, and $20 just to use the on-site work out facility. If you have never been to Vegas before and want to stay on the strip for cheaper, then this is an OK place to stay. If you are looking for something nicer, and are willing to spend more $$, I'd recommend staying somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great Girls Weekend Get A Way”
Reviews.Author: MikkiD
Reviews.Content: Wonderful Hotel. We were walk ins (our original plans of staying at a friends house had been changed). The staff was polite, professional and took care of all our needs. One note of caution however. Ask the desk if your room is near the roller coaster. It runs until midnight and you can hear it, quite loudly in your room. We asked to be moved and the staff graciously placed us in a room on the other side of the roller coaster.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ga_Ma_Be
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the New York New York hotel just few days ago. At arrival, we had a problem with our rooms and as they did not have anymore the type of rooms we booked, they just upgraded us. We booked our rooms thru vegas.com which was a good deal. We were booked for 2 nights and wanted to stay another night, the price given by front desk was just 100$ more than the internet rate. When we asked why the price was so high, the girl at the front desk told us to book again thru internet if we wanted a better rate. So we did it... There are some good restaurant in the casino (il fornaio is very good). We also saw "Kà" by Cirque du Soleil at the MGM, and this show was so delightfull. We dreamt for 1 hour and half, it is just wonderfull.

Reviews.Title: “Great Atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: demtwins
Reviews.Content: Fifth Stay in Las Vegas but first stay in New York New York ... it didn't disappoint. The atmosphere in hotel and casino was terrific. It was St. Patrck's day weekend and the Nine Fine Irishment was hopping. Check in and Check out were fast and efficient. Staff were friendly and helpful and we had no complaints about our room. We stayed on the 26th floor in a Park Avenue room. We could see the roller coaster but really could not hear it. Only minor things to watch out for... There was some construction going on on the casino floor but that caused only minor inconvenience AND the decor in the room was a little dated. Other than that it was a perfect weekend getaway and we would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Superb!!”
Reviews.Author: WILLYONE
Reviews.Content: Having just returned from a ten night trip to Las Vegas, i thought i'd let fellow travellers have my thoughts on this hotel.. Well what can i say?....Just Superb! Arrived after a ten hour flight from Gatwick feeling tired but excited just needing to get checked in with the minimum of fuss..Got to registration to be greeted by a fairly long queue...not good i thought, but i did'nt need to worry...i was soon being checked in by a very pleasant and helpful woman..I was offered a strip view upgrade for $5 per night which i accepted willingly!!!! She gave me hotel plans/maps and pointed me in the direction of the lifts. Got to the room...very impressed...nice size, great view and a lovely bathroom, everything you'd want. During the whole trip the room cleaning was excellent, and the few times we saw them they were very friendly as well. The hotel itself is not as large as some of the other resort hotels..i think this helps a lot although it did get fairly crowded in the evening..this was also made worse by the kids being on spring break and the fact that it was Easter as well. But then again all the hotels in Vegas are busy in the evening are'nt they? We ate alot in 'America' NY-NY's themed restraunt, the staff in there are a credit to the hotel..very helpful and lovely people..they can't be faulted. Had a little win on the slots there as well...How often can you leave Vegas and actually be up on your gambling?..Nice!! All in all an excellent hotel, having been to Vegas a few times before and stayed in a few different ones, i think this is in my top two..the other being the Aladdin before it got took over by Planet Hollywood...not for the best from what i saw! I would highly recommend NY-NY to anyone, you dont just have to have kids to enjoy yoursef there. I will hopefully be going back in a couple of years time, and this hotel may just tempt me back again!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: slickenuf
Reviews.Content: So glad we read the reviews here at TripAdvisor. We definitely picked the right hotel for our 1st time in Vegas. There was a line to check in when we got there at 9:30 but it moved quickly. The room wouldn't be ready till 3:00, but a person came down the line asking if we would like our bags held till the room was ready. That made it easy to start looking around after checking in. The girl who checked us in was very friendly and helpful. The room was the cleanest hotel room we have ever been in. We had a view of the roller coaster, but you could only hear a scream now and then. Was very quite on our floor. Never heard anyone else coming or going. We were on the 11th floor. The elevators were really fast. Never waited more than a few seconds for one to come. The only thing we didn't care for is the front desk is right next to the casino. Other than that we loved the hotel and highly recommend it. When we checked out we were able to leave our bags, your van didn't come till 1:00, and that was another big bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant New York New York”
Reviews.Author: JohnoWirral
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the NYNY for seven nights in March 08, we arrived late at night having missed our iplanned nterconnecting flight in Chicago. Hotel had given up our reserved room and put us in another room on the 3rd floor, the room was good but the view was terrible, nothing to see but an AC unit and a brick wall. Spoke to the front desk and they moved us the next day to an identical room on the 24th floor with a great view, this room was also alot quieter and you couldn't hear the hotel roller coaster. We stayed in a Park Avenue Delux room in the Century Tower. The room has ecerything you would expect apart from a mini bar, but who needs a bar when the town is open 24/7. The room was very clean and the maids did a good job on a daily basis. The location of the hotel is perfect, next to the MGM Grand, Excalibur, Monti carlo and only a short (free) tram ride from the Luxor and Mandalay Bay. The Belargio, Paris and other mid strip hotels are only a 5 minute walk or 2 minutes on the MGM mono rail. Facilities in the hotel are excellent, good food, drink , shops and plenty of slots, tables etc. They do have a breakfast buffet but the choice is limited compared to the other strip hotels, far better to walf across the street to the MGM or the Belagio which had huge selections by comparison. Car Rental service is also available within the hotel (provided by Dollar), we booked a car for two days to travel to Hoover Dam & Grand Canyon and it was cheaper booking at the hotel rather than on X pedia. Parking at the hotel was simple, you don't need to use the Valet service as the self park is connected directly to the hotel. All in all this an very good hotel in an excellent location, it caters very well for all ages and we found the service of all staff to be excellent, the only limiting factor is the pool which is quite small (still very big by european standards) compared to the Belagio and Mandalay Bay, the service at the pool was good however and the drinks were ice cold. Don't be put off by any bad or sour reviews in connection with this hotel, this is a first class place to stay....

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: beachbum049
Reviews.Content: The staff at the hotel is very friendly! My friends and I went and shared a room with 2 queen beds, It was a clean room and the beds were comfy. NOTE: The walls are thin though!!!! Some of my friends heard noise through out the night-not the best place for a honeymoon:) Also beware if you stay in a room near the roller coaster, I can only imagine how noisy it would be! Best part of the hotel our view from our room! We were upgraded to a strip view, it was nice to look out and see the lights instead of a wall or parking lot. We would definetey stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay, but Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: gotonodj
Reviews.Content: We were staying with a group from my husband's company in Vegas for NASCAR weekend. I have never stayed at this hotel and wasn't sure that I would like it since I wasn't real impressed with it when walking through it in the past. But I was pleasantly surprised. My husband had a work truck, which needed to be driven into a special area of the garage for larger vehicles. He stopped and asked the valet attendant for directions to the garage. Immediately, a gentleman came over to the truck and opened the door and waited for me to get out so he could collect our luggage. I was a bit put off as I wasn't planning on getting out right there and wasn't prepared to have him start grabbing suitcases. One of the bags wasn't even closed, but he grabbed it anyway and put it on the cart. I felt a little bullied, and was worried that the contents of the bag would end up spilling out. Not a good way to start the stay at their hotel. Check in was a bit longer than usual because they wouldn't let us check into our room since the guy who booked both of the rooms hadn't arrived yet. Not a big deal, but a bit inconvenient. The woman checking us in was very friendly. We stayed in the Century Tower, on the 27th floor. The room was quite nice--large, with a king-sized bed. The windows overlooked the Monte Carlo and the construction site of the City Center, which was interesting to see from above since my husband's company had worked on the project. The windows were tinted a pink color, which took a little while to get used to. I'm not sure why they were tinted--maybe to help keep the heat down in the middle of summer? Anyway, it was a nice view. The room was very clean. And so was the bathroom. The bathroom itself was large, with a lighted, magnifying mirror. The shower pressure was good. My only complaint might have been the sliding door to the bathroom. I'd rather have one on hinges, but they were better than the awful doors in the bathrooms at The Orleans. Carpets were in good shape and I noticed no stains on either them or the bedspread. You could see the roller coaster rails outside the window, but I really didn't hear any noise, so that didn't bother me. In fact, we really didn't hear a lot of noise at all. But we were also not in the room much during the weekend. There was an ironing board and iron in the armoir, along with plenty of hangars and extra pillows. The tv was also in this same armoir. All electrical things were in working order and we had no real problems with the room safe. I didn't notice a refrigerator in the room. We didn't gamble while there, so I can't comment on the casino. However, one of the other couples we were with did quite well on the slots one night. There are plenty of places to get food. One evening, we dined at the Il Fornaio inside the casino and had a wonderful meal. Everyone commented on the good food that they served. We had no problem getting a table there; however, there was a line waiting by the time we left the restaurant about 8 or 9 p.m. The casino needs to do a better job of catering to the early morning crowds. We all got up early to head to the races and decided to meet down at the Starbucks at 6:30 a.m. When we got there, Starbucks wasn't open--not a good thing for all of us Seattle people who really need our coffee in the morning. We ended up going around the corner where you could actually get a Krispy Kreme donut and a beer if you wanted. My husband opted for their coffee, which he wasn't too impressed with. Quite a few others also came through to get their caffeine fix at Starbucks, only to find they didn't open till 7 a.m.--unheard of in "coffee country." They could have made a lot of money if they had opened earlier. I know other Starbucks in other casinos have been open in the earlier morning hours, so am not sure why they waited so long to start serving. Check out was easy and fast, but then we left very early to head back to Sedona. All in all, it was a pleasant stay. But then I didn't have to pay the hotel bill--I believe they charged about $225 per night, which included taxes. Way too high, in my personal opinion, but then the NASCAR races probably had something to do with the high hotel prices. I wouldn't have paid that if I had been taking care of the room myself. I'd rather spend my money elsewhere--we loved our room at the Rio and it was a lot cheaper and even larger in size. Another good thing I noticed while we were there is that I saw fewer children running around than in some of the other hotels. (May have been a fluke, though.) I sincerely think that parents with younger children should be spending their time entertaining their children off the strip--or in Disneyland. Getting a babysitter might be a novel idea..... Adults should have a place to go and play without having to worry about tripping over baby strollers in the casinos.....All in all, a nice stay, but a bit pricey for me.

Reviews.Title: “At the end of the strip”
Reviews.Author: stormiowa
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the NY, NY in March of 08 for 4 days. Not what we expected at all. The staff was not very helpful or friendly. Therefore, we did not spend any money anywhere there. It is located kind of on the end of the strip. For those of you who want to sight see, we suggest booking a motel in the middle. While you might pay more, it will be worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad choice for staying in Vegas...”
Reviews.Author: meli55a
Reviews.Content: Since we couldn't fit New York in our USA trip, we thought we'd compensate by staying at the New York, New York hotel whilst in Las Vegas. It's not the glitziest hotel on the block but in my opinion, you don't get as bored in this hotel (that is, if you're not focused on gambling). There is shopping you can do, walk around the streets of new york (take away food) or just hang out in the bar in the middle of the casino - the one that has everyone singing-a-long to every tune that 2 guys on a piano play (it's good to watch and has a great atmosphere). Our room was fine - clean and comfortable. We did upgrade to a suite, but the original was ok, jus a bit on the small side (King bed). I have to admit, I was a little worried about the noise the rollercoaster would make, but all you can here is the odd faint screams here and there. I think the rollercoaster runs from 11am daily. As for customer service, checking in and checking out was quite robotic, the lady at the tour desk could of been a little bit more helpful, she was quite cold and abrupt... Location wise, it's on one end of the strip so if you wanted to check out Wynn, Treasure Island, Stratosphere etc.. then set aside a few hours of walking or catch the monorail (starts from MGM which is across the road from NY NY). If you looking for a very plush hotel, with lots of glitz and glamour, then New York New York is not the hotel for you - it's a city within a city but very high on the fun factor :)

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing for Vegas Regular”
Reviews.Author: costaerik
Reviews.Content: I travel to Las Vegas several times a year and for a variety of events, and make it a point to try a different casino/ hotel each time. One hotel I will not return to is the New York New York. Several positives include the housekeeping staff and cleanliness, but the negatives outweigh them. I stayed in a Park Avenue room, and while clean, the shower head was an unmovable fixture with lousy stream. I don't spend much time in the room, but when I do, a shower is very important. Also, the bar area in the casino was not inviting, too loud, and too loud. (I know I repeated for emphasis). I spent more time gambling at the other casinos (MGM, Luxor, Belagio etc) because those environments were better and if you gamble in the Sports Book, you wil not like the spartan facility at NY NY. Ultimately, for all that Las Vegas has to offer, you are much better off staying somewhere you will enjoy, no matter the price.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: gab40
Reviews.Content: First time staying at NYNY. Stayed as an invited guest for NASCAR weekend. Check in was quick and welcoming by the staff. Room was very clean with a view of the roller coaster and the mountains. Did not hear much noise from the roller coaster only once in a while you would hear people yelling on the roller coaster as it went down. It did not bother us. We stayed in the Century tower so it was easy to get to our room.

Reviews.Title: “Great Casino”
Reviews.Author: TravellingMan37
Reviews.Content: Our Stay here was outstanding. Beatiful room, great show, great staff, over all very great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Seriously, how could you not like Vegas????”
Reviews.Author: Ausericanesian
Reviews.Content: Stayed at New York Hotel and Casino for a conference just after Thanksgiving. I arrived early (10:30am) unnanounced and the room was ready to go. Good start. It is hard to keep a real clear head in Vegas, actually hard to know whether it is night or day to be honest, but I walked away very impressed. The room was spacious and had a great view of the roller coaster and down the Strip. It was clean, well appointed, excellent toiletries. The elevators were a little walk and there was no signage to them (but I got lost several times on the floor, the place is just damn big!!!). I ate at several restaurants and had good meals every time. Check out was a breeze and they stored my bags until I was ready to leave that afternoon. I have not stayed at any other places in Vegas, but was very impressed with New York.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time at New York New York!”
Reviews.Author: swimfan923
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the New York New York in February 2008. I would highly recommend this hotel for both affordability and convenience. I booked a vacation package for two through a major airline, which included three nights at the New York New York, non-stop round-trip flights from Seattle, plus ground transportation, all for $296.00 per person. Check in was a breeze, and the staff were amazing. When we discovered our room hadn't been made up yet, a friendly and professional staff member immediately upgraded us to a larger and nicer suite. The room didn't overlook the strip, but we had a fabulous view of the city with mountains off in the distance. Absolutely lovely! There are a number of restaurants in the hotel itself, and something for every budget. You can get a hot dog for under $3.00, or a fabulous deli sandwich for about $8.00. The hotel has a lovely, reasonably priced Italian restaurant called Il Fornaio, and you can view their menu online. For breakfast, there is a coffee shop where you can get a large coffee and a scone for about $6.00 per person. The coffee shop also sells yogurt and fruit salad. For entertainment, there is even an Irish Pub on the premises. This hotel is right across the street from the MGM Grand, where you can catch the monorail if you decide you don't want to walk. An all-day pass is only $9.00 per person. There is also an inexpensive bus called the Duece that runs frequently up and down the strip and costs only $2.00 per person (exact change required). Taxis can be very expensive due to traffic congestion and a ride from one end of the strip to the other is about $15.00 dollars before tip. If you want to see a particular show in Vegas, you should purchase your tickets ahead of time. If you want to take your chances, however, you can get tickets for half price on the day of the performance, depending upon availability of course. There is a booth across the street, just up from the MGM. I found out about it in a magazine that was in our room. I would highly recommend this hotel for people of all ages. I would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Not that great! Give it a 3 star”
Reviews.Author: rvivian
Reviews.Content: Booked a room through casino marketing for $79 per night with an upgrade to a Park Avenue. Overall the room was updated and clean but extremely small. The casino was under a lot of construction and small compared to other casinos. Received invited guest checkin which took longer than the regular checkin. The from desk clerk who helped us was rude most likely because he was having computer problems. Security at this hotel is extremely light! Lots of hookers! No room key check at the elevators so there was a lot of riff-raff on our floor. Caught a couple having sex outside the elevator! Not a very secure or fun casino. The only positive was that drink service was excellent! Would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “It was fun!”
Reviews.Author: flyingscotsman2
Reviews.Content: I went there for a couple of nights just on my own, mainly to fly over the grand canyon. I wanted to go just to say I'd been in Las Vegas really so I stayed in this hotel. I was on the 33rd floor - that's the highest I've ever slept I think, other than being on a plane. The room was smaller than I expected but still ample. There was no mini bar. The windows in my room had a pink filter which was rather hideous but then I think you expect that in LV. I wouldn't go back, but enjoyed myself while I was there.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: paulandcarly
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved Las Vegas and the New York New York. Its in a great location at the beginning of the strip opposite the MGM and the monorail (use it cause your feet will hurt from all the wallking!). Staff were friendly, although they did try and get us to upgrade to a better room at $20 a night but we didnt bother - you only sleep there. Room looked out on the Monte Carlo and we could see the roller coaster but it wasnt noisy at all. The hotel was huge and we kept finding shops and restaurants that we hadnt seen before, plenty of restaurants, bars, starbucks in the hotel too. We did go in most of the hotels and compared to alot of them New York New York was one of the better ones. Taxis cheap, food cheap, shopping cheap which was great for xmas bargins. Will definatley be going back soon!

Reviews.Title: “First time, the atmosphere was by far the best at NYNY”
Reviews.Author: thehighplainsdrifter
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Vegas, and we booked NYNY mainly going by prices and X P E D I A reviews. The hotel itself was nice, it was pretty business like, it certainly wasn't oppulent or luxurious, but our standard room was exactly that, standard, clean, absolutely no bad points. The price was great and we definetly got excellent, excellent value. It was out of pool season when we were there, but the pool areas looked very appealing. The rollercoaster was good fun and was free, and we got a nice couple of upgrades and passess upon check in, just for asking. The casino was the best part of the experience, I try not to gamble too much, but the atmosphere was by far and away the BEST WE EXPERIENCED IN VEGAS. It was a very relaxed and informal atmosphere, with the authentic-ish Irish and NY themed pubs and bars. The piano bar is great entertainment. Sing a longs all night, a great atmosphere! The dealers were friendly and informative and keen to help, the service was top rate, and we didn't want or need for anything. The other casinos and hotels we visited felt very sterile and a bit uptight in comparision, we by no means did them all, but NYNY was the place to relax and have fun on and off the tables! Recommended to all!

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: luv2trvl90
Reviews.Content: Great Time..What a fabulous first time in vegas. the NYNY was great for those of us mid30's to mid 40's. Not to overwhelming of a casino..bars were great loved the bartenders at Gallaghers reat staff. Break room service the Best and very affordable! Room was spacious and clean. will be back.

Reviews.Title: “It's Vegas !”
Reviews.Author: Bertie748
Reviews.Content: This was our 4th time in Vegas and we just love it ! Our 1st time in NY NY. The rooms are very good, quite spacious and clean. Very dark though not much lighting. We had a room on the side of the roller coaster and heard it running all night. Not good ! On the other hand our friends were on the same side but higher up and heard nothing, so if you get to your room and look out onto the coaster, change rooms. Saying that I would recommend this hotel to others for the location but there are better ones.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Casino floor, Average rooms”
Reviews.Author: Robbo_City
Reviews.Content: Travelled with my fiance in April 2007. We both really like the casino/gaming floor itself and it has a really vibrant atmosphere. This casino certainly suits people in the 20's more than other age groups. Unfortunately the rooms were not as we would have expected. They were extremely basic and I would liken them to a travelodge. For the money you will pay there are much better options on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mmlc
Reviews.Content: Well, I have to start off by saying that this was my first trip to Las Vegas - so I’m not sure about the quality of this hotel compared to any others that are there. We arrived at this hotel at about 11:00 pm on a Tuesday night, and had no lines to check in. The man on the front desk seemed distracted, but it was no problem. We got out room, and what a walk that was! Our room was located at the opposite end of the hotel from the elevators on our floor. That was not enjoyable with all of our suitcases, and after a long day of walking, having to walk that far to our room. However, our room was wonderful. It was tastefully decorated, and very clean, had a nice window, with a great view of the mote carlo and the mountains. The roller coaster was visible from our room, but we could barely hear it at all, so that was not a problem for us. We rented a car for one day, and had no problem renting it, or parking it overnight so we could return it the next day. We did eat at the steakhouse one night, and while the meal was good, it was fairly expensive and very crowded, even on a Thursday night. We also ate at the Paris restaurant, and I would definitely recommend eating there instead. We also tried the America restaurant and the restaurant with the buffet in the morning, both were excellent, I would recommend these. Just a tip - there are VERY long lines at starbucks in the mornings, so if you’re planning on keeping a schedule, and want starbucks, get there early, you'll probably be waiting a while, or else you can try the coffee shop that is down the street, there are barley any lines there. Overall the trip was very enjoyable, and I had no problems with the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay”
Reviews.Author: jelijo
Reviews.Content: A Great Place to stay and truly family friendly. We went with our teenage daughter. The staff never made a fuss if she watched us gamble. However most of the time she was in the arcade which gave the parents time to do what they wanted in the casino. We asked for a refrigerator and presto it was delivered. When minor problems arose in the restaurant they immediately took it off the bill and in one case threw the bill away. So the staff are great and friendly. Not as spread out as other casinos but that also is a bonus. Who needs to spend hours walking around the resort looking for what you want? I would definitely stay there again and recommend it to everyone

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place To visit, But I won't stay again!”
Reviews.Author: KANRANGER
Reviews.Content: Arrival and check in ok, Room was small and bed had just been slept in, room service changed sheets, (I HOPE) and made bed, Was there 5 days (4 nights), gambled alot in evening, no wins, which is okay, but when you dump a grand into slots you should get more than (2) drinks, no kidding! I had to buy it from the beer vendor in front of the century elevators, maybe just bad timing, I really got tired of the people off the streets coming in and bumming whatever they could, could not relax at a machine without this happening, At 7:30 a.m. I was approached by (2) hookers in front of the century elevators, wanting to Know if I needed some company. Come On! This is supposed to A Classy Joint. Security needs to get their [--] together. Other than that, Food was great, service was ok, Nice place for singles wanting to party, and don't want to relax.

Reviews.Title: “Nice themed hotel but no poker room!”
Reviews.Author: shiptrip
Reviews.Content: I have been to Vegas probably 20 times in as many years. This was our first time to stay here. Got to LV on the 25th of January, the day the Monte Carlo burned. New York received some of the overflow from this hotel initiallay, but we did not check in until Sunday the 27th as we had reservations elsewhere the first two days. Worried about possibly crowed hotel conditions, we arrived from our first hotel on Sunday. Check in was very fast and the reservations clerk was very nice. Our room was what we booked-- a Park Avenue Strip View King Nonsmoking. These rooms have been recently rennovated and looked nice. Marble bath (albeit smallish). Nice new upholstered furniture, gray metalic wallpaper with an art deco style in keeping with the Century building theme. I don't usually like wallpaper in a hotel but it worked in this room. It added warmth to the room--that and the upholstered high headrest that was actually attached to the wall. I find the armoire a bit out of place with the other furnishings but overall I enjoyed our room on the 29th floor overlooking the tropicana, the airport, and part of Excallibur and the MGM. The bed was quite comfortable and I am a mattress junkie who has owned several very nice mattresses (currently own a high end 100% latex mattress which I absolutely love). The pillows were fairly good as well. I slept well and noise was generally not an issue in our room with the exception of hearing the dinging of the elevator occasionally as we were only a few rooms from the elevator. Still it really was not an issue. There did seem to be some water conservation issues in the hotel but they did not affect the upper floors.
