I have no idea if they were fire related from the Monte Carlo fire two days earlier. The only meal we ate here was at Il Fornaio for breakfast as we had a buy one get one coupon. The food was good, but not really outstanding in any way. It was typical hotel fare though they promote it as northern Italian. I imagine it probably is "more Italian" for lunch and dinner. Table game limits were 10 and up. Slots not big paying as I recall but small pots to be had. Actually a fairly easy casino to get around in. The Times Square Bar was not that busy on Sunday night so we did not want to pay the cover and additional fee for a table so instead of them getting our drink money, we just walked around. Had there been no cover, we would have gone in for a while and had a drink or two. The time we were there it was a "slow" time of year. Next weekend will be Superbowl though and it will be packed. Even so, the hotel casino was somewhat busy as it is smaller than most other big strip hotel casinos. I chose it for ambiance and just to experience this hotel from the inside, and I am glad I stayed here but have been to others and will likely stay elsewhere next time. No real complaints. I had fun--just been there done that and next stay will probably be Bellagio or the great big rooms in the PH which I have stayed in a number of times. Also I like to play poker and they have no poker room here unfortunately. There is one across the street at MGM that they directed me to but late at night I want to stick to my property. Overall nice for the money and would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Decent value for the price”
Reviews.Author: Tsnook
Reviews.Content: My husband, daughter and I stayed at New York/New York for just 1 night. Our room was a little dated, but clean and very large. We were near the top of the hotel, in the corner that overlooks the roller coaster. Of course it was loud (street/roller coaster noise) but nothing out of the ordinary for Vegas. Elevator access from room to ground level was fast, no major delays. Service was good, not exceptional. The casino itself is really dated in comparison to the others, but these hotels just can't keep up with the building of new (and incredible) casinos every year. There are plenty of places to eat at this hotel. If you want to save some cash, you can rely on this place for a clean, average hotel. For what you pay, I think this hotel is a good value. But if you want to stay in a high class hotel, I would suggest the Wynn or something in that caliber.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant stay!”
Reviews.Author: frankiemoo
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a four night stay in this hotel and the whole experience was fantastic! This was our second time in Las Vegas in about 6 months, we previously stayed in Circus Circus which we did not enjoy mainly due to it's location. We had a lovely Park Ave room, imacculately clean and decorated, lovely bathroom, huge tv, although a fridge would have been nice. We barely left the hotel all weekend. The casino was fun and the restaurants nice. 'America' is great for breakfast. Room service was fast but expensive. The location is good, walking distance to MGM, Excaliber etc. However it was a longer walk to the middle of the strip (Bellagio, Mirage etc.) It wasn't impossible, however there is a bus that runs up and down the strip which is handy. Staff were friendly enough and check in/out was v fast. We had a great view of MGM, rollercoaster and statue of liberty for no extra cost. On the last night we ugraded to a spa deluxe room which was beautiful. Huge, relaxing jacuzzi and massive tv, although view not as good! My tip is to definitely get a players card, build up your points and receive great food and drink vouchers! Definitely will return to this hotel, highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Not a place to stay in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Kellgab
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in Las Vegas at the New York New York Hotel in November. Everything had a price tag. Maybe we are just not use to things like that. They wanted us to pay $20.00 a day per person to use the exercise room. Like that was going to happen. To use the internet it was a $1.00 a minute. There wasn't a fridge in the room. You weren't allowed to have beer in your room unless you bought it from room service. In order to use the phone or room service you had to put a $50.00 deposit down at anytime. You would think with all the money it cost to stay there they would at least have a couple of coupons. Maybe for breakfast or something. The workers were always hounding you about something. That was everywhere you went. I guess it just wasn't our cup of tea. We did use the shuttle service that they had there. That was a joke. The guy driving the shuttle it was his first day and we had to get off because he was jerking the shuttle bus all the time and I was going to be sick. Next time I would stay off the strip and enjoy things much better. There was a few cool bars that we went to in our hotel and away. The dueling piano bar was awesome. A lot of fun really played the crowd. There was also a bar outside where the bartenders would entertain you. Throw bottles around and catch them. We would go back there.

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: Stephster81
Reviews.Content: Not as nice as expected. Casino floor is not that large. Food court area is expensive. Towards the end of the strip so it takes a while to get places. The Zumanity show was not that good. I recommend staying somewhere closer to the middle of the strip.

Reviews.Title: “wow what a place”
Reviews.Author: timmy123abc
Reviews.Content: really enjoyed my stay here and really would recommend it to anyone

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as expected”
Reviews.Author: Conner2dood
Reviews.Content: Not as good as MGM Confusing layout of elevators, drink machines on floor didnt work. Found empty bottles under table on check in but worst of all, in bathroom lighting was very dim and water never really got hot. I would not stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Best Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: roadrunners_beebeep
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and his brother/wife stayed at NY NY Jan 2-6th and we had a ball. It's a little city in a hotel. The room was clean and spacious; staff were friendly. It's at the end of the strip but not too far and the walk was great. A little store across the street provided beer and munchies for our room and the bus (The Deuce) was right there if we needed it. I recommend getting a daily pass $5 which will take you up/down the strip 24/7 and it will also take you to the Fremont St. Gotta go there..what a place. I'd definitely stay there again if I went back. We saw Beatles Love (great show...lots of goosebumps) and Cirque du Soleil O (unbelievable show).

Reviews.Title: “NY NY What a town!”
Reviews.Author: mjoanne760
Reviews.Content: My Fiancé and I had a fantastic 8 night stay in NY NY in mid December, for first time in Vegas & everything about the hotel was great. When we first arrived we asked for a room upgrade but unfortunately they were very busy and didn't have any spa rooms left for the duration of our stay. But when we got to our room (2626) we realized there was no need to upgrade as our room was very clean, tidy and spacious with a great view looking onto Excalibur, Tropicana & MGM, as shown in our pics. We ate at a few of the restaurants in NY NY that were very good, but we found Gallagher’s Steakhouse was out of this world. With Huge, Thick, Beautiful, Juicy steaks that were on display outside the restaurant in chillers, mmmmmm. My Fiancé really enjoyed ESPN Zone where he spent alot time while I was shopping and they serve some of the best salads we have ever tasted. We found the Casino floor to have a very nice friendly atmosphere, compared to some of the other hotel Casinos we visited. We went to see 2 shows while in Las Vegas, The Rat Pack is Back (at Greek Isles Hotel) which was fantastic and felt as if we were actually watching the original Frank, Dean, Sammy & Joey. We also went to see Monty Python's Spamalot (at Wynn), which again was great and well worth seeing. We used the Monorail alot to get about Las Vegas, which is found through MGM at the back of the strip and can get you near all major attractions & Hotels along the Strip. Overall we would highly recommend NY NY and we will definitely stay there when we return.

Reviews.Title: “Really like this hotel/casino”
Reviews.Author: beach bum in ohio
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Ny, NY Hotel Jan. 1, 08. This is not our first trip here but this is my first review on it. Once again, we had a great time here. Check in and out was quick and easy. Our room was updated and clean but a typical hotel room. nothing special. THe casino is the best part. It has trees spread throughout that break up the sea of slot machines. There's a cobblestone street where there are a few bars and restaurants, or stands to grab a quick bite to eat. They also have tables and chairs outside these places where you can sit and eat or just relax. The pizza place, where you just buy and go, is ok. It's a good place to grab something quick. The steakhouse is awesome! It's a sit-down restaurant where the food is a bit more expensive. They serve a lot of food too, so go in with an empty stomach. We also spent some time at 3 of the bars in the hotel. The Irish pub is a nice place to get away from the casino for a while. They have an Irish band in the evenings. The Bar at Times Square had a piano player that would play requested songs that everyone can sing along to. They charge $10 to get into this bar, but it's open air so you can just stay outside of it on the casino side and sing along with everyone else. THe Big Apple bar had a good rock band when we were there. It's free to walk in here. i checked out the prices in the spa and they were ridiculous. They charged $85 for a pedicure and $50 for manicure. You're better off having this done at home or finding a place off the strip where the locals go. If you have time, take the free tram to Mandalay Bay and have a drink at Mix. It's at the top of the hotel and has a great view of the strip. The bathrooms are very cool - they overlook the strip as well but no one can see you.

Reviews.Title: “great honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: brewcitygal
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the NYNY for our honeymoon back in june. neither me nor my husband had been to vegas before so we were both very excited. the minute we arrived in vegas, there's just this energy you cannot get from many places!!! when arriving at NYNY, we found ourselves in awe. beautiful details-this hotel, unlike some of the others, really carries it's theme throughout the whole hotel. check in was pretty smooth. we got upgraded with the help of a 20 and a friendly smile:) we had to wait for about 2 hours to be able to check in though. so we ordered a pizza from one of the restaurants and waited. we tried to make it to each of the bigger hotels along the strip during our week stay. so many awesome themes and displays. would we stay @ NYNY again?? probably not-BUT only because i would like to stay at a different hotel every time. the only other reason we would choose to stay somewhere else is the pool-it's pretty bad. a couple of friends we met down there were staying at the MGM. now that's a pool. for basically the same price-their room was bigger and the pool fantastic. lazy river, waterfalls... the pool @ the NYNY didn't get sun until after 12 noon. i usually like to get up at 9 to suntan-nothing like wearing off a hangover lounging in the sun:) hope this helps-just remember to go into your trip with reasonable expectations and you will be very happy

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service !!!”
Reviews.Author: michman
Reviews.Content: Had a great time at NYNY for the two nights that I stayed (Dec. 8th and 9th). I came into LAS on fight night (Hatton and Mayweather) early that Saturday morning. I took a taxi from the airport to the hotel which from now on I will do when visiting LAS. Checking into the hotel wasn't exactly quick. It took about 15-20 minutes, but once I was assisted it only took about 5 minutes and it was about noon time. I stayed in the Century rooms on the 21st floor and just outside my window was the drop off for the rollercoaster. I could faintly hear the screams. The room itself was beautiful. I requested a king size bed and a non-smoking room and my request was granted :-) This was the first time in a while that I was able to get a room that I wanted in all my recent travels. The room was very comfortable and "roomy." The bathroom was large. The only fault would be that there was approximately a half inch space at the bottom of the room door, but the floor was quiet so that wasn't a problem. The hotel and casino was festive and it seems that all the patrons were having a pleasant time. I played a few video poker games and the waitress kept the drinks coming including a bottle of water. The bar where the dueling pianos was very active with the "Brits" in town and I spent alot of time and money there. I ate at the American resturant and the food was average and pricey. I reviewed the video arcade which was large enough for children to have a good time as long as their stay at the hotel was short. If I decide to bring my son with me while he is still young (6 yrs-12), this wil be the hotel that I choose. The number one reason why I enjoyed my stay was the employees of the hotel. I must admit, there was service with a smile. I had booked the hotel before the fight was scheduled and when I found out that I was going to be in LAS on fight night I first wanted to know how much for a ticket which was way out of my league :-( However, I learned that MGM properties were showing the fight on close circuit television and would be selling tickets. I contacted NYNY through email and got a response from Mr. Esparza, the manager at the Race and Sport Book in the casino. He informed me that the hotel was showing the fight and he had tickets. I inquired about the cost and Mr. Esparza responded to me, FREE! When I arrived at the hotel and contacted Mr. Esparza and he had a ticket for me and I watched the fight. This really made my trip and I hope to contact the management of the hotel to inform them of my stay and that Mr. Esparza kept his word in having a ticket for me.

Reviews.Title: “A nice visit”
Reviews.Author: biberbunch
Reviews.Content: Nice and clean. We had a view of the hotel sign and the strip, which I was happy with. The hotel is a family destination which we weren't expecting. You can't walk anywhere without getting behind a stroller or little kids. The food choices are very kid friendly too. If I went back to Vegas with kids, we'd stay here. If it was just my husband and I, we'd select a different hotel. The hotel has great toiletries, but I didn't care for their pillows. They were like little marshmallows. A pillow makes all the difference in the world too me. I couldn't wait to return to my own bed.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room”
Reviews.Author: CaptainSunDevil
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights in the Spa Room. We enjoyed the room and the whirlpool spa. It can be noisy when being filled or running the jets, but is a great treat after spending the hours in Vegas. We had a room on the 17th floor, overlooking the pool (which was closed for the season - too cold outside anyways). We were towards the back of the hotel and could see the roller coaster. Not much noise from the strip or construction, as some of the reviewers have noted. There was no construction noise in the lobby while we stayed. There was a temporary (with wall murals) wall where they are building out the interiors of a new restaurant on the ground floor. You can tell only if you look hard for it. You can hear the roller coaster if you try, but it's easy to ignore or sleep through. Clean room, comfortable furniture, and good food on the ground floor. There is an in-room safe, which is great. There are no in-room coffee makers, but there are several coffee shops in the lobby/ casino/ shops. Great access to MGM and Excalibur, which is one reason we stayed here. We also noticed it is closer to the MGM casino than when we stayed at the MGM last visit (that place is huge). Check the rates, but the upgrade to the Spa room seems to be well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Experience”
Reviews.Author: balesbrowne
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights over a weekend having travelled from the Grand Canyon. We booked the Manhatten Night promotion which meant being upgraded to the Park Avenue rooms and getting lots of vouchers for free drinks etc. However on arrival for $10 more a night we upgraded to the Broadway rooms with views overlooking MGM and the Strip. Rooms were $225 a night which for a weekend came in more reasonable than many other hotels of this calibre. Rooms were very plush and clean. The casino we thought was much nicer than some and plenty of choice of restaurants. On the first night we ate at the ESPN restuarant which had fantastic food and a great experience. We also had breakfast at the American Restaurant which had a huge menu and great food. The swimming pool was nice with three Jacuzzi's but found the water to be quite cold as the hotel blocked the sun in the afternoon. Situation wise, we walked throughout our stay of Las Vegas and although it is quite a walk to get down to the bottom of the strip, found this was the only way to see all the hotels one by one and they are not to be missed. If we went back this would be one hotel we would definately consider staying in again!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: ironcross31
Reviews.Content: Prior to this trip, my husbnad and I had stayed at NYNY a total of three times and always loved it. This time we had a room in the Century Tower, which was just the right size, clean, modern, and faced the strip at no extra charge. However, our housekeeping service was terrible. Every day when we returned to the room, although the bed was made, it looked as if someone had been lying on it just prior to leaving the room. Our second day there, we returned to find we had no new shampoo, and we were out of it. We didn't find out until later, that the maid had left new shampoo on the sink behind the tissues instead of on the shelf in the shower stall (where we found it the first day). On more than one occasion, we came back to find dirty, empty plastic cups from the night before were still sitting on the nightstand. And finally, our third day there, we came back to the room to find a dirty feather duster lying on top of my husband's good clothes. The maid had apparently left it behind. We couldn't wait to get to Nine Fine Irishmen, because we always have a blast there. I ordered the Irish Breakfast, which was great, and my husband got the Lamb Stew. There was hardly any meat in his stew and for $14.00/bowl, I don't think it would have killed them to put a big pile of lamb in there. We decided to never eat there again. I also couldn't wait to play the slots and looked forward to playing the big, electronic ones, with all the bells and whistles. Well, those were few and far between, and ALWAYS crowded. But they have hundered of the old school "777" ones, that I find really boring. Since MGM Grand is part of NYNY's Player's Club, we spent most of our time (and money) there. I also hit big at MGM and we had a really great breakfast there. Forget breakfast at NYNY. Overall, NYNY seems to be going downhill, and it kills me because we used to love it there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Service”
Reviews.Author: Extremeboating
Reviews.Content: Let me start out by saying this casino and hotel is one of the best on the strip. Check - In was breeze, 5 minutes tops on a Saturday no less. I stayed in the century building and did not hear any noises from the roller coaster that I see on here a lot of people complain about. You can not please everybody. I had a non smoking Park Ave room. The rooms are not small, I consider them very spacious. The beds are very comfortable and the bathroom is very nice. You won't have any problems with the room. I also seen that a lot of people complained about the walk to the rooms........... your in Vegas there's a lot of walking involved, your not staying a the Hampton Inn. This is a hotel that has several different buildings as part of the hotel. Depending on what kind of room you get you have there are seperate entres for the elavators to get to your room. The breakfast buffet is excellent also. Parking at the casino is also very smooth. Talk about location........it could not be better. I don't know about you but I dont stick to one casino when I'm down there. I like to see a few of them and this property is in the middle of everything and all the good casinos. I travel to Vegas 3 times per year and this was my first stay at NY NY Casino, and this will be my destination every time I come down. Enjoy your trip!

Reviews.Title: “Good time at NYNY - maybe a 3.5...”
Reviews.Author: MichaelRinck
Reviews.Content: Just spent the weekend at NYNY (Dec. 21-23). My wife and I were in town for the Las Vegas Bowl and chose NYNY because we haven't stayed there before but always liked the Casino and the ESPN Zone. Pluses: We liked the variey of restaurants at the hotel. They pretty much covered all the bases and no matter what you were in the mood for you could find it there. We had a great lunch at the ESPN Zone and I had a field day with a booth facing 2 wall-size tv's along with our own 17 inch screen at the table that we could watch and listen to any game we wanted. We had some good pizza at one of the smaller restaurants and liked that atmosphere as well. We had a rate of $94/night directly through the hotel on one of their specials that also gave us a couple 2 for 1 deals and a starbucks credit and $10 in free-play. I'm not one for the slots but that $10 turned into $135 when I cashed out so their free play more than paid for one of our nights. I sign up for a lot of email specials from a bunch of places in Vegas but never before had it worked out this well. Minuses: The walls were incredibly thin. We were woken up at 7:30 AM on Saturday to a conversation in the next room that we could tell wasn't even in raised voices. And then on Sunday morning we could hear the housekeeping staff in the other room word for word also. And Vegas isn't exactly the type of place where you want to be woken up that early, especially if you've just gone to sleep... The location is on the south side of the strip and there is a lot of construction between the Monte Carlo and Bellagio so it feels kind of isolated from the center of the strip. But each hotel is kind of a world all its own so it wasn't that big of a deal although we drove down to Caesars to check out the shops and the fountains at Bellagio. One of the main reasons I've stayed away from NYNY was because I never liked the pool area. It seems kind of cramped in on the side of the hotel right off Tropicana. We chose to stay here in December when it was 40-50 degrees so it took that out of the equation but if you're coming here in warmer weather the pool isn't as nice as at MGM Grand or Mirage. Overall, we liked the hotel and the deal we got. The only real drawback was the thin walls which I've never really had a problem with anywhere else in Vegas except when people are really loud.

Reviews.Title: “So Great!!!”
Reviews.Author: sez_dee
Reviews.Content: Las Vegas was the highlight of my trip, it is the best place i have ever been and i think it would take a great place to top it. New York New York was so great, the rooms were lovely (we got a free upgrade on arrival). We had a view of behind the casino and it was fantastic, i didnt want to leave. I loved the free products in the bathroom, the soap was the nicest i have ever smelt. The hotel is so great, i would highly reccomend it. When i visit Vegas again i think i would stay at the MGM as i really enjoyed it there but if the price was right i would stay again at New York New York.

Reviews.Title: “The Battle of Stalingrad was quieter”
Reviews.Author: BrasilianBooty
Reviews.Content: Stayed here December 4-5. Not the worst hotel on The Strip but firmly in the bottom tier and sinking fast. PROS: (1) Check-in took less than 10 minutes. (2) Gonzalez Y Gonzalez restaurant was friendly and affordable ($27 for two Coronas and a full meal). (3) Room was decent (20th floor) with a great view of the Southern End of The Strip overlooking MGM Grand, The Tropicana, Hooters and mountains in the distance. CONS: (1) Weird hotel set-up with zig-zagging hallways, room keys that don’t always work, and junk (food & drinks) left in the halls. (2) Loud rollercoaster and helicopters outside the window until 11p.m. (3) No ice cream available at 2a.m. The front desk sent me on a wild ice cream chase up to Schrafft’s saying it was open but it wasn’t (I bet if I’d been Jerry Seinfeld or Celine Dion I’d have gotten some ice cream). (4) Pool closed. (5) LOUD jackhammers going at 7:30a.m. in the lobby/casino area with the dealers wearing masks from all the debris in the air. But the jackhammers weren’t just limited to New York New York. Everywhere you walk on The Strip there’s noisy, ugly construction and it’s like a war zone. The homeless are everywhere on the South End walkways begging for money; there’s an abundance of prostitutes out at 4a.m (the ones hanging around The Bellagio are better looking than the ones at New York New York but I guess you get what you pay for); there’s Mexicans accosting you with “hooker cards”; and there’s always annoying music blaring somewhere—like the depressing 9/11 song outside New York New York. In the end, stay at The Wynn or The Venetian (heavy security and no homeless or hookers in your face). A room there will cost you A LOT more but then you can make up for it by eating at $12 buffets and doing your gambling down at Casino Royale or somewhere off The Strip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Colszy
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 days during thanksgiving. With the exception that our skyline room needed a decor refresh (the rooms on the floor below had already been re-decorated), no complaints whatsoever about this hotel. Facilities are excellent and well managed although breakfast choices are not that extensive. If you are heading to see the Cirque du Soleil show in the hotel - be warned that it is more cabaret than acrobatics. If you anticipated more of the latter, it may be better to see one of the other Cirque de Soleil shows in hotels further up the Strip.

Reviews.Title: “Action packed!”
Reviews.Author: msvegasMinnesota
Reviews.Content: I booked my room through the players club for 4 days and 3 nights (Thurs-Sun), I was supposed to get a Spa Suite, but I didn't bring my major credit card and only had my Visa debit, I had to resort to a regular deluxe room, that turned out to be pretty nice, clean and comfortable, kinda small, but was also elegant! Bed was wonderful and the bathroom was very nice! The Casino was nice and gave you good playback on the slots! The ChinChin Restaurant (chinese) was EXCELLENT! Food was outstanding! But we also ate at America for breakfast and all I can say for them is UGGGGHHHH! The service was horrible and the food was not that great. Everything else with New York New York was exactly as I had hoped it would be! The Casino was extremely crowded on Friday and Saturday night, but it was okay, because their atmosphere was fun and lively! For the most part their staff was friendly and very helpful throughout my entire visit. All in all, I think New York New York is a nice hotel and I would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “very good”
Reviews.Author: AP007
Reviews.Content: This casino offers several advantages for a pretty good price. Its right at the center of the strip. A lot of major casinos are close by. Zumanity is performed inside the casino. I liked the room and service. Restaurant selection is pretty good as well. One minor complain is when I went downstairs to have breakfast, some construction was going on inside the casino and it was making lound annoying noise. But I guess that can happen anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: hamlin9
Reviews.Content: stayed here in october for 7 days and totally enjoyed our stay check in staff were very polite and asked if we needed help with our cases. we had a room on the 34th floor over looking the roller coaster and mgm, room was very clean and comfortable with a maid service every morning. this hotel also has some great places to eat weather its just a quick snack or a 3 course meal, the buffets are also very good value for money. spent alot of our time on the casino floor playing slots as the tables are very busy all day unless you wanna play at 3 in the morning. only negative is the location right at the bottom of the strip which takes a good hour or so to walk up but that would not stop me from staying here again. and if its shopping your after check out the fashion show mall all in all great hotel would deffinatly recomend

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Time”
Reviews.Author: goldfishlinds
Reviews.Content: A friend suggested we try this hotel as they had previously been to Las Vegas and stayed in a different hotel but spent most of their time in the New York New York Hotel. Our first impressions were "wow". The check in was very quick and we didn't have to que. We were asked if we would like to upgrade our room to a strip view and we are very glad we did. The view was amazing and we watched the sunrise on a few mornings. The hotel is in a great location and although at the end of the strip, it has great connecting bridges and pathways to the other hotels which you can then jump onto the monorail to get up and down the strip. There are too many good things to tell you about this hotel. It really has something for everyone and the roller coster is a definite must! The only downsides we found, were that it was quite noisy in the room, not from hotel noise, but from the streets, cars, music etc. However, if you’re travelling to Vegas you must already be aware that you are not in for a quiet time away, it is the city of the 24/7 lifestyle!! Also there was no bath in our room and after all that walking I really wanted to soak in the tub. And finally, there were no tea or coffee making facilities which would have been nice. Apart from those small things the hotel was amazing, with loads of different places to eat, drink and play.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel. Sad to leave!”
Reviews.Author: Invay
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the hotel the day after thanksgiving and was pleasantly surprised by the reasonable sized queue for check-in. At the desk was given an upgrade to a 23rd floor strip-view room, which would normally have been $10 per night but had been waived. The Park Av room was very good - the only minor niggle was the lack of minibar/kettle. The bathroom was okay sized (not palatial but fine) but the beds were ridiculously comfortable. Normally when returning from holiday I am looking forward to my own bed, but this time it was a strain to leave! Great view over MGM Grand, the rollercoaster could be heard but not a problem in any way. A really pleasant room to spend time in. The casino downstairs is smaller then the other big hotels but is friendly and sociable, especially if you go down in the early hours before retiring. Late at night as well, free drinks are brought around very regularly and the waitresses were very generous if tipped. Only really sampled food in the America cafe (perfectly adequate), Starbucks and an absolutely huge pizza ordered via room service.The bars looked lively (although disappointed that the dualling pianos are really just a karioke show complete with drum tracks. I was hoping for something with a more smoky, 'new york' feel. Anyway, its very easy to get to neighboring hotels via walkways to MGM and Excalibur. Overall I rate this hotel highly and would certainly stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Don't be Fooled, Stay Somewhere Else!!!”
Reviews.Author: Mindtrain
Reviews.Content: I booked the "Manhattan Nights" package off the internet, which was supposed to include a $10 voucher for Starbucks, $10 in free slot play, 2 free drinks at bars in the hotel, and 2 2 for 1 lunch coupons for the Nine Fine Irishmen pub. At check-in I was given some of these items, but not all of them. I had to return to check-in to get the rest of the coupons that she forgot to give me (and even then the clerk had to ask a manager for permission to give me the other items). The hallways you had to walk through to get to your room were ridiculous. I couldn't believe how poorly designed this hotel was. The room itself, Park Avenue, was a step below a room in the Luxor: dated, needing remodeling, and the bed was hard and the bathroom was ridiculously small. In addition to the problems mentioned above, I was never able to redeem my 10 in free slot play (it would never work and there were no instructions given to me on how to retrieve on the slot card -- and I have been an MGM slot card holder for over a year!!!). I then tried to go to lunch at Nine Fine Irishmen, where I have eaten before. I was told that as a single diner I could not use the 2 for 1 coupon given to me by the hotel as part of my booking package. This was after I was told by the host outside that she didn't know and that I should ask the bartender if they would honor the coupon. The bartender I asked said they would. I was then seated and my server informed me that they wouldn't accept the coupon. At that point I left the restaurant for good. This is unbelievably cheap and was completely alienating to someone who actually liked the restaurant and wanted to dine there. I won't ever spend any money at NYNY ever again. They couldn't even handle a simple coupon promotion properly. I have since complained in writing to NYNY. I received a response from the manager at Nine Fine Irishmen, which asked me to return anytime in the future for a free lunch (I declined and informed them that they really should honor the coupons for single diners as alienating repeat customers over $8 was not a very wise business decision). In short, this place is kind of hell hole. Kids everywhere, employees that don't care, endless hallways in the hotel filled with weird housekeeping carts and odd laundry rooms off each lengthy hallway section, etc. This is not a relaxing or even "nice" place to stay and they can't or won't even honor the promotions they use to get you to book your room. Lame.

Reviews.Title: “What happens in Vegas is shared on TripAdvisor”
Reviews.Author: LilRelly
Reviews.Content: I actually would give the New York New York Hotel 3.5 stars. I would say that it was a little above average. The Pros: Room was contemporary and clean with beautiful furniture and a powerful shower. Decor was cool with the rollercoaster running through the hotel - yes, kind tacky, but let's face it all of Vegas is pretty tacky. Staff were friendly and helpful. We had a problem with the safe in the room and it was fixed within an hour. Location was good. A little far down the strip, but has very close access to the monorail and the shuttle to Excalibor/Luxor/Manadlay Bay. Gallagher's Restaurant inside the hotel was amazing! I thought the steak was better than the one I had at the Wynn! Cons: No one came to help us with our bags upon check in - unimpressed with the lack of staff outside the hotel. SLOWEST Starbucks in the whole of North America. Computer system went down on Monday morning, check in and out was done manually.

Reviews.Title: “Always a Pleasure”
Reviews.Author: jph948
Reviews.Content: Located toward the center of the Strip, the NYNY is across from the MGM and minutes from Caesars and other famous hotels. If you like the city, it has many of the element of it's namesake. From the skyline view outside. to the inside reminders like Central Park and recreations of landmarks, it's cozy and homey. The many restaurants from the authentic deli to Italian to Irish, have good, relatively reasonably priced, food. And unlike the larger hotels, this one is easy to navigate. That's mostly because it has few shopping areas and therefore is smaller in size, than say the Venetian or MGM. The rooms are large and roomy with great views of the strip from the higher levels. We've stayed here several times. Our only negative comment would be the lack of refrig and coffee makers in the room. I suppose they want you away from the room and gambling instead. But there are plenty of Starbucks and coffee shops in the main area. Anyway, it's clean, well-kept and a quick cab ride to anywhere. FYI: The Manhattan Express roller coaster can be noisy and runs from 8am to 11 pm if your room overlooks it. Finally, for a fun adventure, take the Deuce bus down to Fremont street and wonder at the overhead screen.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: audreyalan
Reviews.Content: Got an awesome deal by booking directly with their website! Hotel was fun! Casino was great! Kids loved the arcade. I even went on the roller coster. Scary but soooo much fun!!! the hotel has so much choice to eat inside, ie, Starbucks, Delis, Pubs, Italian, Steakhouse, Bakery, etc...Definitely would go back! With the manager's special on the net, we got 10$ at Starbucks, 2 free drinks at a choice of 3 bars, a few 2 for 1 for the restaurants, but we didn't have time to use them.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: MarkSR
Reviews.Content: I stayed here earlier this month on my visit to Las Vegas. I orginally booked a Park Avenue room but was upgraded to a Broadway room upon check-in for no extra charge. It was well decorated, fabulous bathroom including a hot-tub. I was on the 40th floor so the rollercoaster was not a problem but it shuts down at 23:00 each night anyway. Staff were really polite and friendly; service was top notch anywhere I went. Didn't do a huge amount of gambling here but I did get craps lessons which take place every day at 11:00; I learned a lot from that and I went on to win a few dollars as a result.

Reviews.Title: “Great Fun Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tafftails
Reviews.Content: What a great place to stay. The Skyline rooms were large very clean with good size bathrooms. I found that they were clean on arrival and kept clean through our stay. There was no noise and it was quick and easy to check in. The pool was great and private unlike some of the hotels. The spa was amazing but a bit pricey. The casino was great but maybe not as visually stunning as some of higher priced hotels. Its located on the main drag and its easy to get to all the hotels from there. For its price range it was the best hotel on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing First Time in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: eminemly1
Reviews.Content: Recently went to Las Vegas for the first time with a friend and when deciding on a place to stay it was between NY NY and the MGM. When it came down to it I couldnt be happier in our decision to stay at NY NY. As soon as we got off the plane it was easy to get our luggage and find the shuttle (directly outside the doors of the airport) that took us to our hotel. They are not always the friendliest drivers so make sure you have your shuttle ticket out and ready to be checked by them. When arriving at NY NY we were greeted immediately by a bellman who took our bags for us and stored them until we were checked in. One slight problem was the computers were down at the time we tried to check in. They gave us a pretty broad range of time in which it may be up, so we decided to try out a restaurant for our lunch while we waited. We went to Nine Fine Irishmen right in the hotel and got to eat outside since it was gorgeous. After getting off of a 5 hour flight it was nice to just sit out and people watch. The food was great and the service was excellent. By the time lunch was finished we waited in the casino by check in and one good thing we noticed is that there are always cocktail waitresses offering drinks in the casino, you do not have to hunt them down. We were able to check in much earlier then expected. They did try to tell us the only had a smoking room available and would move us the next night, but I told them when booking we had noted we did not want smoking. Within 5 minutes they came back and had a non-smoking room available. So it helped to speak up, and they were extremely nice about it. Room was much bigger and cleaner than expected. The casino was a bit smokey but it didnt travel up into the rooms. Water pressure I didnt think was as bad as some have made it out to be in reviews. Although we were overlooking the highest part of the rollercoaster, right before the drop, it really was not loud at all. From previous reviews I was a bit worried, but glad to find you didnt even really notice it! It was actually a lot of fun to watch randomly when in the room, but your so busy with other stuff we were only there to sleep and get ready! While there went to Coyote Ugly which had awesome drink specials and free shots every 5 minutes it felt like. The staff was really nice and there was a lot of interaction. The Dueling Piano bar was very entertaining and we actually went 2 nights because its such a fun time. The bartenders are friendly and fun as well there. The Big Apple Bar which is right in the center of the casino is more of a Rock and Roll bar which was ok, but more of a place you went to sit and listen while drinking. We had discussed trying more of the well known clubs outside of NY NY but had so much fun where we were we didnt have time! The main village area had many food options that could please pretty much anyone and in the mornings it was nice because it you could have a good coffee and it wasnt as loud or busy. The detail of everything in NY NY is incredible. You feel like you are there, even down to how the walkways look like the cobblestone streets. Overall NY NY was amazing and was perfect for our first time in Vegas. I felt like I got the best of both worlds, in that I could have the true Vegas party experience but not feel so overwhelemd that I didn't enjoy it. It offered so much and so many different things. I am already trying to find time to go back, and I would definitely stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointed”
Reviews.Author: OklahomaGoSooners
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the New York, New York before and found it satisfactory but not this time. The king bed room was very small, but nicely decorated. The cleanliness was sub par, especially noticeable in the bathroom. The air quality of the hotel seems to be poorer than the other strip hotels we visited,(it smells like dirty ash trays.) But the real problem was the overall customer service. There were a few exceptions; the bell staff was adequate, but overall the staff was rude and of little help. The dealers were the worst I have encountered in over twenty years of visiting Vegas on a regular basis. The bartenders, the registration desk employees, the gambling card desk employees were some of the rudest people I have ever come across in a strip hotel. Even though I have recommended this hotel in the past, I won't stay there again and I would recommened the reader choose an alternate hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Can you say "Spa Upgrade"?”
Reviews.Author: beachdogger
Reviews.Content: We did a mid-week stay and NY-NY and we really enjoyed our stay. We had a fine dining night at the hotel's Gallegher steakhouse and we took our breakfasts in the urban-styled street food park. of the main hotel lobby. The food highlight for us was having our morning coffee at the small bistro tables after selecting from the croissants, breakfast rolls and artfully-created pastries which we ate while we discussing our plans for the day. But the best decision I made for this trip to Vegas, was asking the gal checking us in whether there were "any rooms with spas available?" For a $45 a night, we added an in-room jacuzzi tub with views to distant mountains out one window and The Strip out the other window--it made the trip. If you want to impress your gal you can spend $200 on a crappy bottle of champagne but if you really want a grateful gal; just toss some hotel shampoo in her hair and rub a dub dub until she purrs...rinse and repeat nightly. Yeah baby!

Reviews.Title: “Great Weekend at the New York New York”
Reviews.Author: melknauss
Reviews.Content: Our group stayed at the New York New York for a bachelorette/bachelor party weekend. From the beginning the service was great! We had three rooms and they got us checked in early and all the rooms right by eachother, two of which connected, a major plus!! The staff was always helpful which made the stay even better. Our rooms were great, very clean, and the beds were comfortable. I am normally very picky about hotel cleanliness, and this hotel certainly passed inspection. The only con about the hotel itself was the elevators got me a lttle confused the first day, and our rooms were at the end of the hall so it required a winding path to make to our room. The pool served its purpose for our trip. Our first day there we got to the pool around noon and had a good amount of sun in the chairs closest to the casino doors. We also sampled the food and beverages here, all of which where great! We asked before we left if there were any cabanas available for the next day and they said they weren't be sure if any would be available, because some are reserved for VIPs, but if we came down in the morning they would let us know. So on Saturday morning we went down and they were able to get us into a Cabana for the day at $150 including all the extras listed on their website. The cabana was nice because it had a TV for the guys in our group to watch football, and it was close to the pool so we didn't have any chairs in front of us! The only problem was by the time we got down our area was covered in shade for the rest of the day, which I didn't mind because it was still warm even in the shade. While it may not be as fancy as some of the other cabanas on the strip the staff was friendly and it was a great central location for a big group to meet up! The only real con with the pool was it was hard to get down to the pool by elevator because you had to swipe your card and for some reason it took everyone a long time to get the reader to actually read the card. The pool size wasn't huge, but you can tell that on the website, so if you are all about the size of the pool you should probably go to one of the hotels that has more pools. Otherwise the size isn't that big of a deal, and also means this area isn't as crowded as the mega pool complexes and we were actually able to order food in a timely manner. The spa was also great and the staff was wonderful. All in all the New York New York was a lot of fun and the staff really made the trip top of the line!

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected.............”
Reviews.Author: houndbear
Reviews.Content: Room was just so-so..the pool is hidden from the sun until around noon because of the tall buildings.Fitness center was 20.00 per day!!Ridiculous!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: livincountry
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I go to the NFR every year and stay at NY NY. We always get excellent service our room is always upgraded with no charge and they let us pick our room view for a small fee. They take care of making sure our tickets to the shows arrive on time and they are very well mannerd. We receive several comped drink's and the room is always clean and comfy. We wouldn't stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “great get-a-way for two”
Reviews.Author: slev
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at the New York hotel. It was clean and comfortable- the rooms were a little small. I appreciated the in-room safe and the view at night. The rollercoaster came by our room; but could not hear it which was nice and peaceful. The spa was able to book on the same day and was very hospitable and posh; but pricey. The Dueling Piano Bar is a must and great to have at the hotel you are staying at. We liked the New York vibe throughout the whole hotel and the bands off the casino floor were really good. We enjoyed having a Krispy Kream and a Starbucks at the hotel. Cyote Ugly was a smaller bar than anticipated; but fun. It is a great place to stay if you are planning to go to a show/club at the Luxor or to a concert at MGM.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: CheshireBuddie
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the NYNY with three friends for four nights over a weekend, our first time to Las Vegas. Due to close proximity of the airport to The Strip, the transfer took only about ten minutes and we were the first drop off which was good. We were allocated two twin rooms in the New Yorker tower, but on different floors. The rooms were spotlessly clean and in excellent condition. Bed was lovely and comfortable! Bathroom had shower screen over the bath which is far preferable to a curtain. My room on floor 11 looked over the rollercoaster as you might expect, but it was far away enough not to hear the screams too loudly. The food we had at the hotel was excellent - pizza and sandwiches from outlets in The Village, and breakfast and dinner at the Italian Restaurant - Il Fornaio - the service was excellent, and even though there was a queue on the Friday evening, we got a table within about 15 minutes and they even served us drinks fom the window while we were in the queue! The Nine Fine Irishmen pub was a handy place and you could sit outside if you wanted. Main course salads very small here though. The couple of downsides in my opinion - and this is true of all Vegas - the casino floors are so vast and confusing it's easy to get lost, so beware of your surroundings and landmarks or you won't have a clue where you are or how to get out. Also the lighting is very dim on the main casino floor as the ceiling is dark, as though it's night in New York. Overall, I was very satisfied with the hotel, and would recommend it to people wanting to stay in a fun rather than sophisticated environment.

Reviews.Title: “a good place for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: francesanne
Reviews.Content: New York New York is a good choice for a couple of nights in Las Vegas. If you can, leave the booking as late as possible as prices are considerably cheaper then - keep checking the hotel's website. . Also, certain nights give free vouchers and you can check these on the hotel's web site too. Our room was a good size and pleasant, food was fairly good at the large number of on site eateries. The location on The Strip was very convenient. Shop around when booking trips, we paid far too much for our heli ride over th Grand Canyon. There are great bagains at the out let malls.

Reviews.Title: “NYNY, a surburb in Sin City”
Reviews.Author: jillyaz
Reviews.Content: We arrived at NYNY on Thursday evening the 18th around 6p.m. Bellman took our baggage before we even paid the cab driver. Check in was a breeze, no line what so ever. We asked the desk clerk if there were any upgraded rooms, he offered us several but with a nightly upgrade fee. We did not do the slip him a $20 with the credit card, we just asked and told him it was our anniversary, still no luck. He brought a manager out who gave us the Marquis suite for an extra $30 a night. We gladly accepted. On the way to the room we were stopped by the timeshare sharks, we said no. In Mexico you can get up to $600 for your 90 minutes, here the max was $100, it wasn't worth our time. We got a drink from a bar in the Casino and went to our suite. Wow, the Marquis suite was wonderful. 700 sq feet including a hot tub. The room was very nice with a sitting area, armoir, bose stereo system, hot tub, marble tile, decent, but not spectacular bathroom. The thing that impressed us the most was the size of the room. It was very wide and spacious. The roller coaster was outside, not close and not too noisy. Upon arrival to our room, our luggage followed almost immediately with a remarkable young woman as our bellperson. She had been with NYNY since it opened and she was awesome. She knew everything about the hotel, amenities, sights to see, etc. She was in no rush to leave us, offering to answer any questions we had. We got unpacked and went out to dinner. We attempted to dine at Gallagers steakhouse but it was a long wait so we indulged at the bar, drink count, 1 double, 2 singles, went over to Gonzales Y Gonzales (recommended by our bell person). I had the chicken fajitas, hubby had the enchiladas, our food was very good. Coming from Arizona, we get good mexican food regularly and Gonzalez Y Gonzalez didn't disappoint. Their chips & salsa were great, great drinks, fun bartender and server. Hot tub was awesome. The water really pours out into this thing so it didn’t take long at all to fill it. The bell gal told us that the hot tub bath salts didn’t do much so we could add some shampoo – advice… don’t add more than about a teaspoon full. We had a lot of bubbles. Friday, slept til noon, had lunch at the Pizza place in NYNY, it was very good. Gambled a little, lost a little. Shopped at the Zumanity shop, not too impressive but too expensive. Also shopped at the other shops in NYNY for souveniers for the kids. Saturday morning – slept til noon again! Hubby went downstairs and got Krispee Kreme donuts and then we hit the casino and lunch at Nine Fine Irishmen. We had an excellent server, Amber. She took our free drink coupons, 4 of them and our buy one get one lunch free coupon. We enjoyed the musician who was entertaining. It was a very fun atmosphere. Of course it wouldn’t be Vegas if a dozen Elvis wig wearing guys didn’t come in drinking. We gambled a little and then wandered over to MGM grand. MGM was full of Parrotheads ready for the Jimmy Buffet concert. We only saw a couple that were really elaborate. We stopped over at Excalibur and then back to Mandalay Bay for drinks. I love how the casinos are connected with the walkways over the strip and by the tram. Taking the tram back to Mandalay Bay we still didn’t remember walking over there on Friday night LOL. Saturday evening was our night for Zumanity. We arrived half hour before showtime, got drinks and were seated. We had the couch seats and luckily they were not right up front they were back just a little bit. The couch seats up front were right in the center of attention for all of the performers and being one who doesn’t want to be the center of attention I was happy we were not! Hubby on the other hand would have loved to be part of the show. We really enjoyed Zumanity, it was a great performance and I would definitely recommend the couch seating. No better seats in the house. We had a wonderful trip in Vegas. I really feel like NYNY is a smaller hotel compared to some of the Vegas monsters so I thought it felt like a suburb in the middle of the strip. That was a good thing for us.

Reviews.Title: “Modern Room, Very Busy Hotel / Casino”
Reviews.Author: KayD
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 6 nights in a standard broadway room, which was really nice and modern, and of a high quality, (see pics below). The casino is really popular, especially at weekends and can be very busy at times, but it has a good vibe to it. Location wise, it's opposite MGM Grand but it's a bit of a walk up to Centre Strip where some of the more popular attraction are such as Bellagio Fountains, and the Mirage Volcano. We had no problems during our stay and found the staff very helpful and eager to please. We did go to see the Cirque du Soliel show "Zumanity" which although mildly entertaining, there was not very much 'Cirque' going on. The pool is very small and there was little room around it for loungers. It is also on the corner of the hotel and is very noisy from the two main roads and of course the rollercoaster. Not much relaxation going on there. Overall a pleasant lively hotel, but the pool lets it down - if thats your kind of think choose the Paris instead.

Reviews.Title: “Bargain deal.”
Reviews.Author: Charlie Sierra
Reviews.Content: Our short-notice trip to Las Vegas with an Expedia package cost less than round-trip airfare alone, with a room at New York New York thrown in, to boot. Normally we would have expected a tiny, noisy, inconvenient room using such a process, but NYNY gave us a great surprise. Two queen-sized beds on the 17th floor, overlooking the roller coaster which we never heard at night--maybe it doesn't run then. Great service, beautiful room, and I can only echo the comments of others in recommending this hotel for a stay in Adult Disneyland.

Reviews.Title: “great first vegas experience”
Reviews.Author: knitting_danica
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at NY, NY in August. It was our first time in Vegas. We found the hotel very easily and pulled right in to the free parking area. Check-in was speedy and efficient. We had requested a room with a king, and were a bit disappointed to find out that only rooms with queens were avaiable. However, the employee at the front desk was able to honor our request for a room away from the noise of the roller coaster. We were on the far end of the hotel on the 26th floor--Fantastic views of the strip. It was, however, quite a hike from the elevator! The room was tastefully decorated, immaculate and huge! Great toilitries! The beds were some of the most comfortable I have ever slept on. WE had a problem with our TV but we called down and that was serviced immediately. We took advantage of some of the vouchers we were given upon arrival and enjoyed breakfast at the Italian restuarant downstairs. In our two days in Vegas we went into about every casino and hotel and decided we were quite happy with our decision. The only other hotels we would consider for the next time around are the Mirage and Bellagio.

Reviews.Title: “good choice”
Reviews.Author: Stripeymule
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights at the New York New York, then went to the Canyon for a night, then stayed at the Luxor for a night. Would definately recommend the New York New York over the Luxor. The hotel was lovely and the casino had a good atmosphere and feel to it. Good choices of restaurants with varying prices. Rooms were clean and spacious. Rollercoster very good too!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Casiono.”
Reviews.Author: mwfloral
Reviews.Content: We had an offer for 3 free nights. Room was in the new yorker tower overlooking the roller coaster. We had a view of MGM Grand, Excaliber and Tropicana. Room was newly remodeled and nicely appointed. Room service was quick and very good. Bathroom was roomy, good shower. The noise outside from the roller coaster was minimal during the day, and non existant at night. Casino was great. We saw zumanity and it was definetily for an adult crowd. Not for the sqeemish. We ate at the mexican restaurant Gonzales Y Gonazales and it was our third time to eat there, and it was outstanding as usual.

Reviews.Title: “Great room”
Reviews.Author: AshaSilvermoon
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. The room we had was in the New Yorker tower and it was great. Large, clean, quiet and nicely decorated. (if you look at candid photo's others have posted our room was one of the rooms decorated in brown and cream) We had a view overlooking pool. There are loads of places to eat (Gallaghers was nice but quite pricey) The only downsides to this hotel is that the casino is fairly small and so too is the pool area it's also shaded most of the day. If you want a nice breakfast go in the chinese restaurant they do a buffet breakfast for $11, Cereals, french toast, eggs sausage etc. I would stay here again but if you are looking to spend a lot of time around the pool then book one of the others. MGM Grand or luxor have nice pools.

Reviews.Title: “Vegas sets the standard for hospitality”
Reviews.Author: z28r4cer
Reviews.Content: I recently have returned from my first trip to Las Vegas and I have to say I was quite pleased with this hotel. I had a corner room which had wall to wall windows with a magnificent view of the strip. The room was spacious, and the decor was above average. I agree with fellow writers, the bedding and the carpet did look aged, but perfectly acceptable and very clean. The bathroom and the shower was much larger than most hotel rooms also.

Reviews.Title: “Really Enjoyed Our Stay”
Reviews.Author: nickiwms
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a long weekend and was very happy with our stay. Arrived at 11 am ( a few hours before actual check in) and was able to check in right away. The line was not long when i got in it (granted, i did make a made dash after our shuttle came to a stop), but i only waited for 10 minutes. After i finished checking in, the line was 4 times longer than when i got there. The front desk staff was extremely friendly but not the quickest. I would say that when you get there, keep your eyes on the prize (the reception desk) and look around once your key is in hand. The room was nice, we had one of the Park Avenue Deluxe Rooms which was a step up from our booked standard room. Room decor as nice and i felt it met all our needs. It was clean, the sheets were cheap but bearable. The bathroom was adequate, however, i hated the shower tub combo with the sliding door. People talked about the coloring on the windows but i personally didn't mind it at all.. it reminded me of that cheap window tint but i liked not squinting when looking out at the strip. The TV was not a plasma like many of the other strip hotels have. There were a lot of kids at the hotel compared to our stay at TI. As we had our nanny stay with our boy in Chicago, dealing with all the whinny and tired kids was kindof annoying. I personally feel casino hotels are not kid friendly hotels however, people seemed to flock to this one with kids. The mexian restaurant was amazing and enjoyed the layout of the casino.. liked the feeling of different areas of manhattan brought to life with slot machines. This casino hotel is a great option for people not wanting to spend Bellagio dollars but wanting to be in the action.

Reviews.Title: “Needs a remodel”
Reviews.Author: Roaming_Again
Reviews.Content: We actually stayed at NYNY as we were going to see Zumanity. The Broadway room we were first given had one small window, with all view blocked by a cement piedment......the 2nd room was much better - larger and looked somewhat like the picture on the web site. But, these rooms need renovation BIG time. Mold in the bathroom tub with matching moldey smell......bed linens thread bare.....bedspread torn.......windows dirty.....and the room included some prior occupants dirty hair brush on the floor - in plain sight! The desk clerk who assigned us the first room had no idea what and where the different rooms in the hotel are located.....this is a big hotel, but the staff should have some awareness of the hotel rooms. The second clerk was very helpful. We will not stay a NYNY again with so many wonderful offerings on the strip in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Best Bed I've Ever Slept In - Rm# 2624”
Reviews.Author: Sweety727_2000
Reviews.Content: Hello All, My Fiance and I just returned from 4 nights at the New York, New York hotel in Las Vegas, and dare I say the best rest I've had in a long time, and that's hard to say for Vegas!! After much research on Trip Advisor I decided to try the New York Hotel for my first trip to Vegas, although not the priciest, it was fun and comfortable. Beginning with my room, when I got to the Check In desk, I asked the Concierge for a King Size Bed in a Non-smoking room away from the Roller Coaster (this hotel has a Roller Coaster that runs around the perimeter until from about 10am - 11pm everyday. We got Room #2624 in the Century tower, which was just outside the elevator's, so no endless walking for us and we were well above the noise of the Roller Coaster. My Fiance is picky about matresses when we go away and we have nothing but RAVE reviews about the comfort of our bed, it's better than the one we have at home! The room was clean, spacious and wonderfully modern. Only little glitch was the water pressure in the shower, but apparently all hotels have this problem, it was warm and did the job. This hotel takes up a whole City block and is at the beginning, Southern part of the Strip and attached to the MGM Grand (another great hotel) and the Excalibur. The interior casino was cute and reminiscent of New York, don't forget to try the Deli in the food court, the sandwiches are to die for!! This hotel has no Buffet, but we went over to the MGM's which was great. The BEST buffet we ate at was at the RIO Hotel, second best was the Spice Market Buffet at Planet Hollywood! We loved our trip and heeded all the warnings about walking, yes our feet were killing us. But we later learned to hop on the Monorail, or take the public transit for $2.00. We watched the KA show by Cirque Du Soliel (At MGM) and it blew our minds!! Best show on the strip!! As long as you ask for the things you want in a room, this hotel was AMAZING value for your dollar!! Cheers!

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: LensmanEngland
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 20th wedding anniversary end Sep/Beg Oct 2007. Check in around 3pm was very quick, slight mix up with booking,I had reserved spa room online but was allocated broadway room,soon sorted out though when my reservation number/online booking were shown to staff. Spa suite very nice! and spacious.A bit of a trek from lift to room but not too bad.We had roller coaster outside but absolutely no problem re noise,view not fantastic(back of hotel) but again you don't spend a huge amount of time in room so it wasn't a problem.Housekeeping and cleanliness of hotel excellent,Restaurants that we used were good value for money,especially America for 24hour food!, portions in Chinese very large so don't order loads!(very tasty though) Casino had a good atmosphere and not overly large with a couple of good bars,missing a poker room though :-( Hotel is in a good location for strip and staff very helpful, would stay again and would recommend

Reviews.Title: “Nine Fine Irishmen made this special”
Reviews.Author: JetBlue2
Reviews.Content: New York, New York was a default location while attending a medical meeting in Las Vegas. The meeting's host hotel, The Mandalay, was booked solid and we could not get in. Check-in and check-out at NY,NY was speedy and we were upgraded to a great suite. Service was excellent and the tram (across the street, via the skyway) made it a breeze to get to the Mandalay. We enjoyed this property immensely and will return. I particularly enjoyed stumbling on the Nine Fine Irishmen, a real Irish pub complete with six Irish beers, celtic music and Irish step-dancing. We enjoyed the ambiance, Irish Stew, and a Southwick brew. It had the look and feel of a real Irish pub...and I have been to Ireland. The Mandalay had a different feel to it and had many fewer people. NY,NY was lively, fun and was the place to be.

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Hotel Located in the Middle of the Strip”
Reviews.Author: MrEdnWilbur
Reviews.Content: We had a fun time in Vegas but only stayed for two nights. In hindsight we should have stayed at least three to four nights. On arrival, we had to fight thru crowds while towing our luggage because the lobby is too well integrated with the casino area. In comparison with MGM Grand and Bellagio, these two hotels have separate lobbies and elevators for their guests which slowed down traffic from the gaming area. I liked the room we were given because it was very spacious, newish-looking and clean. From the room, we could see the MGM Grand, Luxor and Mandalay Bay hotels. However we can also see and hear the roller coaster ride. So if you get room 1070 booked thru Expedia for $150 it is adviseable to buy ear plugs or pay for an upgrade. The housekeeping staff were very friendly and the desk staff were also helpful. The best part of this hotel is its location; right in the middle of the strip! So for those who want to be in the middle of the action, this is the hotel for you. But for those who want to stay in a more upscale hotel, go somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “2.5 star experience for this business traveler”
Reviews.Author: DenverDoug88
Reviews.Content: Was in Las Vegas for a convention and had booked a room through Priceline ($75/night) and ended up at NY-NY Hotel (room 550 in the NY Tower). Though Priceline listed this as a 4star property, my experience was ~2.5 stars (for a business traveler, not a casino person). The room was average cleanliness with some mold in the shower tiling. Maid service was incomplete (forgot soaps and towels one day). Instead of a desk to work on, there was a "cocktail table" nailed to the floor under the air conditioning vent. Bedding was slightly better than a 2star hotel but certainly not 4star. Overall experience was average (as in, not likely to return, even at a Priceline rate) UNTIL I had my credit card shut off due to a hotel error. It seems that they erroneously entered my checkout date and charged me for an extra 77 days ($3,800), twice. Needless to say my credit card company thought this was fraudulent activity and they shut off my credit (which certainly caught the wife's attention back home). The hotel ultimately found their error and credited back the large overcharge. Oh, and did I mention the roller coaster outside my room? Sounded like fun, late into the night...

Reviews.Title: “It does what it says on the tin!”
Reviews.Author: Jamie077
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 5 nights at the New York New York (25th - 30th september 2007) - it was our first visit to celebrate my big 50 birthday - and overall have no grumbles about our stay. Check in was quick and easy despite having to walk your way through the gaming machines with your cases etc to the reception desk and thereafter to the elevators. However, you quickly understand that this is how Vegas works! Our room had been described as an upgradeto a deluxe Park Avenue room. However, whereas it was fine, we didn't have the feelling of being upgraded. Our view was poor - away from the strip and facing west towards the Orleans hotel and a large car park. The room amenities were average. The bathroom no more than adequate, television restricted to tourism channels and American shows, no tea/coffee making facilites, only just sufficient wardrobe space but with a very useful room safe. However, we did not spend a great deal of time in the room - as there is simply so much to see and do in Vegas - and overall was it adequate for our purposes. we most ceratinly did not hear any noise in an evening. The pool area is at best average in comparison with the others we seen from views from the Monorail and visting other hotels. The buildings around the hotel means that it is in the shade in the morning and in the early evening, and perhaps this was reflected with it's 6pm closure. A ice making machine in the hotel corridor near our room (No. 1277) made up for the lack of a room fridge and ensured that ice cubes for the gin and tonics was always at hand. Despite no tea/coffee making facilities, a short morning visit to the Greenwich for our coffees ensured that my wife still enjoyed a morning coffee in bed. The entertanment in the casino was varied - with live bands and the duet pianists. Their sounds coupled with the cumulative noise of the slot machines and cheers from the tables, at times created a noise level that was a little high and uncomfortable if it is not your normal way. This was fairly typical of most hotels but Ny Ny was perhaps the noisest we expereinced and we found that the best way of coping with it was by joining in through playing the machines or listening to the entertainment. I must make a point of saying that I found the quality of the Guiness in the Nine Irishmen pub to be below standard. It lacked the quality of a true pint of the 'black stuff' and by way of observation on how it was poured and settled far too quickly, one is tempted to say that 'extra water' had been added to it. The Ny Ny roller coaster was fun - made you scream and shout - but was pricey at $14- albeit they tried to make up for their high prices by offering further rides at a reduced rate of $7. You should take time to quickly get your bearings around the hotel as there are several ways of entering/leaving the hotel and you can get a little disorientated until you become totally familiar with its layout. The NY NY is at the southern end of the strip but this is a problem. Transport is readily available if you do not wish to walk. We tried the Monorail - all day ticket at $9 - and also the Deuce bus - all day ticket at $5. The former was cleaner, quicker but you do need to walk through the MGM to get to it and this in itself takes time whereas the former did get very busy at times making it very slow. Found Neil Sedaka to be alive and well and thoroughly enjoyed his show at the Orleans very much indeed, with the half tickets obtained at the booth proving to be excellent value. Only eat snacks in the NY NY as we eat out at other hotel restuarantsas we constantly explored the Strip - such as the Tropicana, Baly's and the Rio. Food was plentiful and extremely good value. Check out was simple - and by completing a card from your room you simple deposited your key card in the apprpriate box near to the elevator. Highlights of Las Vegas included the Bellagio fountains ( they simple were amazing), the other free shows such as the Freemont street light show (Downtown), the erupting volcano(Mirage), the Pirate fight (TI), the Masquerade show (Rio), the moving statues (Forum Shops at Caesars palace) and the Rain Storm at the Mile Long Shops all provide a quality and Disney like theme to the Strip. The view from the Stratosphere Tower at sunset was also worthwhile. Our trip to the Grand Canyon - South Rim - was excellent and a refrshing break from Vegas itself. It gave another dimension to the holiday, enables us to see at close hand both the Canyon and Hoover Dam but also get a feel for the Nevada and Arizona countryside. Well worth the trip albeit it was a long day. Overall the New York New York did not appear to cater well for children, and was more suited to those adults who wanted to enjoy themselves in a party like way. It was not the best hotel we seen in terms of furnishings - unlike the Bellagio, Caesars Palace and the Paris - but it does what 'it says on the tin' and if you do your research beforehand then you will know what to expect and not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “horrible stay at NYNY hotel & casino”
Reviews.Author: Purplemonkey07
Reviews.Content: My husband & I went to Las Vegas in March of this year & got married & had an awesome time. Stayed at Stratosphere & was treated great & had no issues. We wanted to come back in 6 months to try & do everything else that we did not fit in the first time so we set it up for September but I chose NY NY this time since it was right in the heart of everything & I so wanted to stay here & ride the coaster & thought we would have a wonderful time at this hotel for our special day. On one of my nights there my husband & I were in the casino playing & having fun & I went to the restroom. I went into one of the stalls & thought I had locked my door. The door was opened by a housekeeper & she began saying loudly that I should of locked the door & that it was my fault. I wait to go out hoping she had left & when I came out she was still there with two friends. I walk by her to get to the sinks & she is in my face saying it was my fault, I should of had the door locked & I say to her at this point that I am going to have to get her name to tell her manager about this since I was very humiliated at this point. She then points at me & says hey everyone this is the girl I was talking about that did not lock her door & it was her fault that I opened the door. I overhear one of the other housekeepers saying to her you could of knocked & I also had several guests come up to me to say she is taking this way too far. Especially since I had not been upset with her or said anything to her to cause all of this. I got so upset & had never been treated like this before in my life. I was shaking like a leaf & tears are coming down my face as my husband & I head to the front desk to talk to someone about this. First I tell a clerk, then a front desk manager nicole, then they call a man up & I tell him then a supervisor jessica. They are all standing around me as I stand there crying & shaking. Here I am looking like I am the one that had done something wrong. They treated me as if I had done something wrong & acted as if they did not believe me. Then they say they are going to talk this housekeeper about this & asked me to complete a voluntary statement which took me three hours to sit & write it all out. I was so shaken up that my husband had to take me back to our room to calm down so we lost one of our nights that should of been filled with love, fun & romance & instead it was crying, shaking & being hurt & humiliated. Our special time was ruined, we lost one of our nights & I was humiliated by their staff. Then the management team acted as if they did not believe me. I was not treated with any respect or compassion which is all I wanted at that point, for someone to treat me like they cared & understood. Then they say to me they will give me an update on this review with this staff member & they do have my contact information to do so. We get back & no contact. I get a survey & I complete it & say yes please do contact me to discuss this & no one contacted me. I go online to the nyny website & I go onto the guest services contact information & ask someone to contact me & no contact. Then I sent an email to a director-cassie that I had been given an email address to & still no contact. This hotel is all about the service for their guests. Then a director-mark does contact me this past friday & he was nice to me but too little too late at this point. He asked me if he could take this up with someone in guest services on my behalf & have someone contact me this week. So today at work I get a call from kristine a director in guest relations, it was the most cold disrespectful call I have ever received. I would rather not have an apology if it is not sincere. So I get another slap in the face from the customer service from this hotel. I do want to come back to Vegas but have told everyone about my story that will listen to me so that noon else has to go through what i did & be hurt & humiliated as I did.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time”
Reviews.Author: bellalivonia
Reviews.Content: Stayed at NY NY September 25th for 3 nights. Had a great room (Broadway Deluxe) in the Century Tower, 19th floor. This was a corner room so had 2 large windows with views of MGM, Tropicana, Excalibur, etc. Had very good selection of restaurants and nightly entertainment. Will return.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable and fun”
Reviews.Author: kepLiverpool
Reviews.Content: Myself and four friends came for a week, this hotel was recommended as fun and casual. We had a great week couldn't fault it, the rooms where spacious clean, the staff helpful, bars lively, although the sun didn't arrive to the pool area until 10.30am it stayed all day. The rollercoaster is a must and once is enough!!!!!!!! It was great to see the bigger hotels but i'm glad we stayed somewhere less bling.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: Paul J
