Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for four nights at the begining of September 2007, apart from being put in a smokers room after requesting a non smoking room,(they moved us to a non smokers room the next day) our stay here was great. The staff were always helpful and the amenities were great. Being Non Gamblers, but just wanting the experience of staying in a casino on the strip, it was a real eye opener. I was abit concerned about staying here from other reviews I had read, but after staying here would have no problems recommending this hotel to others. We could see from our room that the pool was in shade most of the day, but we did not fly 11000 Kilometres to go swimming in a pool, so this did not affect our stay at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Will try somewhere else next time”
Reviews.Author: MariePoppins
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the New York New York from 3rd September until the 5th when i moved to the Bellagio for my wedding. Arrived a day later than planned to find the hotel trying to charge me for nights i had paid for with a money wire, although i had a reciept and emails to confirm this i had to stand (after a 24 hour delay in Gatwick) for 3/4 of an hour until i was in tears though sheer exaustion while a front desk man tried to find the payment he eventually found it but then tried to say the rate on my last night had gone up granted i had added the night later but was not informed of any changes in rate even after payment , the guy was trying his best (we recieved half price foodvouchers)but didnt seem to care i was very unwell, you would assume after such terrible treatment a free upgrade might be in order but no we didnt even get the king bed we had asked for despite being in Vegas to get married( when i complained later we were offered a new room but all i wanted was food then my bed ) so i would not stay here again on pure principle it was a horrid start to my wedding week in Vegas, My parents stayed at the same time as us and loved it but even without my bad experience i would choose another hotel further up the strip the Imperial Palace if on a budget or the Bellagio if you want to be spoiled.

Reviews.Title: “Better then last time! Would stay again.”
Reviews.Author: puddles027
Reviews.Content: About 3 years ago we stayed at NY NY, our out take on this property was horrible. If I wanted to be treated like I was in New York, I could drive 20 min. from my NJ home. Needless to say we tried other places. We stayed at Luxor (Hated it), The Mirage (to many kids), and Treasure Island (Loved it before they turned it into TI). This past trip we got a good deal for NYNY so we decided to deal with it and go. Well to our surprise Check in was a breeze (VIP Check In), the lady was very nice and when we asked for a non ajoining room, she switched us right away (bad experience at the Luxor with adjoining rooms). Our room was on an end, it was a park ave deluxe room. We were by the roller coasters top drop! We heard it ,but it didnt bother us. Water pressure was ok, shampoo was awsome. I brought earplugs this trip to Vegas because everywhere we stayed we never slept through the night....well this was a first!! We heard nothing, no people slamming doors, yelling, kids, it was great! The beds and pillows were quite comfy too. I enjoyed our room 1919. As for the casino well, it is very small and it gets sooo crowded at night. We ate alot at the America restaurant (food good, service needs work). We also ate at the Italian Restaurant (la Potillio ??) it was so good, you don't get alot of food for the money, but it was good fresh cooked food for 2 entees, drinks and 1 dessert it was about 47.00 (you decide) So after all this I was quite pleased with our second stay at NY NY. Parking was easy, it also worked out well because they are doing so much construction on the strip, this hotel really isnt in the middle of it. We would definitly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Experience”
Reviews.Author: joramrie1
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 2 week holiday in USA with the final 5 nights being spent in NY NY. Hotel was very nice. Check in was very quick and no problem. When we arrived at our upgraded Park Avenue room we could hear the roller coaster. We phoned down to the front desk and asked if there was a room available without any noise. This was no problem to them and they redirected us to another tower without even having to go back down to the desk. They reset the key locks automatically. The room they gave us was large with a lovely marble bathroom. We had a view of the strip and also the pool. I was a little disappointed in the size of the pool as we had previously stayed in the Luxor which had a few lovely pools to choose from. In the end up we didn't have time to use the pool so it didn't matter. The layout of the hotel is really nice. There are lots of restaurants or fast food outlets to choose from. I love sitting in the "streets of New York" eating. . I also liked being close to other hotels We spent some time at the Excalibur which was very nice too. Excalibur had more well known eating places like McDonalds and Pizza Hut. They also have a Krispy Kreme doughnut factory and the fresh doughnuts there are the best I have ever tasted. If you like doughnuts then I guarantee you will be addicted to these ones. We ate breakfast on our last day in NY NY in a beautiful restaurant beside the river. It was very nice. My daughter went on the roller coaster mainly because we had free tickets due to being upgraded on the website. She really enjoyed it but also said it threw you about a bit. Please check website before you book to see if there are any deals. We booked a Manhatten nights deal which gives you an free upgrade to park avenue rooms and various discount tickets for other places in the hotel. Our room had two queen size beds TV table and chair and was an adequate size for 3 adults. There is also a free safe (not very big) which was a bonus. The only thing I was not very happy with was there was no security guard on the lifts checking to see if you had a room key. Other hotels have security doing this which makes you feel safer. We questioned this with reception and they said there should be security on at night. In our 5 night stay we never once came across any security at the lifts despite retiring to our room at different times each night. In my experience in this hotel I would have no hesitation in recommending it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience at economical price”
Reviews.Author: LincolnLasVegas
Reviews.Content: I stayed two nights at NYNY and thought that it was a very solid property. Check-in at 10pm was quick and efficient and the front desk clerk was friendly and in a very good mood. My room in the century tower was the very last room at the end of a long turning hall way. Some may complain about this but I thought it was great. First, the hall way had character and gave you the feeling that you were in an actual hotel built before the days of Ramada or Hyatt. Second. I heard zero and i mean zero noise from the hall the entire time I was there. My view from the 28th floor was very good. I could see all four corners of the Tropicana/LV BlVD intersection. I also had a pretty nice view of planes landing and taking off from teh airport. The room was clean and the bathroom was adequate, probably onthe small side a little. No closet but there is an Armoire/entertainment stand with hanging space. The bed was comfortable and the linens were standard Hotel fare. I did order room service one night and it ws pretty good. What stood out was that it was extremely quick. No more than 15 minutes from the time I ordered. Prices were very reasonable for room service. I've stayed at a number of Vegas properties and to be honest NYNY would probably rank in the lower third of luxury, however i wouild say that it ranks in the upper third in value. If you are looking for a base of operations for a Vegas trip that will not break your budget, I think NYNY is a good choice. The hotel provides a clean comfortable room at a reasonable price and it does do in a decidedly fun environment.

Reviews.Title: “good view from empire tower”
Reviews.Author: cliveDerbyEngland
Reviews.Content: we arrived back in las vegas to stay the last night before flying back to england the next day.we had toured california and nevada.we stayed at the excalibur for the first three nights.we found excalibur fine and a good place for familys.i found the new york hotel fine but not so family friendly.thats not being critical it just means its more adult themed.anyway check in was efficient with hardly any wait.we was on the 43rd floor of empire tower.it had brilliant views especially from the elevator section windows.the wait for the elevator was not to bad considering we were on the 43rd floor.the rooms were spacious and well equipped and clean although it would have been nice to have a coffee maker.television did not seem to have very good signal either.plenty to do and see in this hotel as well like most in vegas.overall a good hotel.the value for money you get from the large hotels in las vegas is amazing.the new york hotel was the 2nd cheapest hotel of my trip.i stayed at 9 hotels.i recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel,not a city for kids”
Reviews.Author: dcar
Reviews.Content: My husband and 4 year old stayed at the New York New York May 13th-18th. I researched every hotel on the strip before going via trip advisor of course. I decided this was the best place for us in terms of cost and location on the strip. Check in was a breeze, the staff was courteous and the room was nice. It looked just like the hotel website. I also got a deal on the room because every few days I checked back on the website and the price of the room kept getting lower and lower. I would contact reservations each time and was able to save $180 for the whole 6day /5night stay. I am kind of leery of hotels, particularly the bedding considering all of the horror stories I have heard (bed bugs, blood, and other unmentionable body fluids). I checked the bed out first thing and noticed a spot on the comforter. I called housekeeping and within a short period of time they had the spread changed. The only thing I wished they paid more attention to in their cleaning efforts are the fabric covered headboards, which hold dust. I hit against one of them and was enveloped in a small of dust somewhat like Lynus on Charlie Brown. Overall the hotel experience was great. They have lots of eateries in the hotel ( a plus in my book). The problem I incurred was with the city itself. I know, I know it's called "sin city" but I traveled there once before in 2000 and it seemed as if the town had really started to take a turn towards families. Well, 7 years makes a big difference because this time around everything around was [-], butts, and beers. We had to shield my child's eyes several times. Thank God for her innocence she didn't know what was going on. All I can say is if you are thinking about taking your children, DON'T!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Time”
Reviews.Author: Amanda56
Reviews.Content: we stayed in the New York New York hotel from 04 Sept 2007 till 09 Sept 2007 our stay was very enjoyable and comfortable. the only thing that I would change is the decor off the hotel rooms, some are very dull and dark and need freshing up.

Reviews.Title: “Just what the doctor ordered”
Reviews.Author: kentuckygirl77
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the New York, New York Hotel and Casino for four nights and five days and enjoyed our stay incredibly! Checking in: We checked in during the buzz of a Friday evening, which was a bit stressful because we had to lug our luggage through the buzzing casino packed full of people. We arrived several hours late to stressful airline delays so it is recommended to check in between 10-4. Room: We stayed in a Park Ave. Queen, NS bed room with a few of the pool. At first we were put into a smoking 2 double bed room and straightened that out immediately. The smoking room smelled horrendous. Our room was much, much better. The room was very quiet. You could hear the roar of the roller coaster but it was pretty quiet and it stops running around 11 so that was no problem. The casino is nice and small compared to other hotel and casinos but it's a popular one because of Grenwich Village. However, I never had a problem finding games I wanted to play. Drinks are free and I never had a problem finding a server/them finding me. They do expect tips, of course. The food: very expensive and just okay. We ate in America, the only restaurant that stays open 24/7 and the food is what you would expect. I'd compare it to Denny's so it's fulfilling and decent but overpriced for the quality. Other than America, we ate in the Village a few times and it's what you'd expect from greasy fast food. It's slightly more affordable too. We mainly ate at other hotels. However, we didn't eat much because it was a scorching 115 degrees outside. The Pool: the pool is small for Vegas and you MUST get there by 10:30 a.m. to get a lounge chair period. It's a fun scene with mainly couples and small groups of adult friends. The few kids were mainly a little older and only fairly obnoxious. The drinks are expensive at $9/drink. So we learned to make our own in the hotel room and bring them down. We put the drinks in a canvas covered water bottle we bought at CVS down the street. It saved us lots of money! However, the first day we did drink from the pool bar and the drinks are very good and a large 16oz so if you have a decent budget go for it. The sun starts to peak over the large hotel structure at about 11 so you do get lots of very good sun there and wear sunscreen! It's a hot, hot, unforgiving sun! Overall, we really enjoyed our stay. We'd stay there again but there are so many great affordable hotels in Vegas, we would like to stay elsewhere just to diversify.

Reviews.Title: “Fun Atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: BCExplorer
Reviews.Content: The New York New York Casino is one of my favorite because of the atmosphere. The casino has a high roof giving the place an open spacious feeling. I enjoy the casino area and usually try to visit on every trip. We stayed at the New York New York hotel on one trip after winning two free nights accommodation in a slot tournament. I remember enjoying the stay. Because of the shape of the outer towers the hotel is arranged so it can be a bit confusing to find the right elevator to get to your room. If you need a quick bite to eat there are several restaurants and snack places done up like the streets of New York - There's even smoke rising up from the manhole covers. For entertainment check out the Dueling Pianos show or just sit close enough to hear. If you need a break from gambling Upstairs is a large arcade with a big selection of games. Or ride the coaster if you don't mind paying $12 per ride. not as classy as some of the other hotels such as the Bellagio - Visit the New York New York for a fun atmosphere and lots to do.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at NYNY”
Reviews.Author: task13
Reviews.Content: Stayed at NYNY for 3 nights arriving on Aug. 29. We had VIP check-in which was great because there was no line when we arrived at the hotel. It was noon and our Park Avenue rooms were ready on the 6th floor. There was a safe in the room which was very easy to use. The bed was very comfy and the tolietries were great. Shower had great water pressure, so we have no complaints with the room. The casino has such energy that you feel like you belong there. Make sure to get (and use) the "players card". Check back at the Players Club daily to see if you have any comps coming. Also, we were told to charge any meals we had at NYNY to our room, and also you can charge from Starbucks & Nathans located near the walkway to MGM. We ended up getting a $55 breakfast and our Friday night room charge ($129) comped. The breakfast buffet at Chin Chin's was very limited - but I must say what they had was very good. It's not your typical Las Vegas buffet - limited like I mentioned. We had a very good and very large lunch at ESPN Zone. For a late night snack try the pretzels at Nathan's - yum! Check out was easy - using the TV. Our flight home was in the afternoon so I asked room service for late check out and they said "no problem" and no charge. Just a warning - watch out for the time share people on the walkway level near Nathan's - they make it sound like they're giving you a free meal, but you have to attend a 2 hour meeting/tour that they will shuttle you to. We declined but they offered it every time we walked past. Just keep going and they'll leave you alone. All in all it was a great stay. The slots paid me for the 1st two days but then it went downhill the last two. Oh well, I didn't expect to win millions.

Reviews.Title: “Okay, but would not return again.”
Reviews.Author: mhoang
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at New York New York on numerous occasions when someone else booked it, but I would not book this hotel on my own. Checkout lines were relatively quick, so is the elevator. We've always been able to get rooms that connect via a side door since we have a big group. Housekeeping does not come on a set schedule - one day they came around 3 pm, the next day they came around 9 am - way too early. The rollercoaster that runs around the hotel can be heard faintly from our room - which does not bother me, but would perhaps bother a more sensitive person. The casino has a variety of restaurants and bars and is fun to walk around. America is a terrible restaurant to eat in, but the Chinese place Chin Chin is decent. However, expect their breakfast buffett to have long lines since the place is small. We tried on three separate occasions to go to the pool, but it was packed by 11 am. The pool is ridiculously small. On my last trip here, I found nearly twenty bed bug bites on my legs. I would not return here for that reason.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for our Elopement weekend!”
Reviews.Author: green_trees07
Reviews.Content: We got a great rate on a Jacuzzi suite on Travelocity. We checked right in and hit the town immediately. Our room was on the casino level, which I thought would be too noisy, but we never heard a thing! Perfectly quiet. We walked through the casino floor in our wedding attire to our elopement destination and everyone clapped and told us congratulations...it was really cool. We ordered room service a few times and it was excellent. Champagne and strawberries for breakfast is a MUST for any bride! Having the metro in the hotel was very helpful in exploring the strip, no need to kill yourself walking when you can ride, and save cab fare! Excellent time, the hotel staff was great and the room was always clean and peaceful. The bedding was nice and cozy and the bathroom was very spacious! Will book again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the NY NY”
Reviews.Author: jennifer1981
Reviews.Content: We just returned from an awesome trip in Vegas. We ( two couples in our mid twenties) stayed at the New York New York hotel and Casino from August 26th until the 30th. We arrived in Vegas early- about 10 am. The wait at the airport for a cab was about 25 minutes...and when we arrived at the hotel we figured we would have a big wait as well. To our surprise there were maybe two other people in front of us. We were going to ask front desk to hold our luggage for us while we went to check out the sights , because we were told by our travel agent we couldnt check in until 3. Luckily the lady working at front desk told us that two rooms side by side were ready for us right then. We were upgraded to park avenue rooms with king size beds rather than the regular rooms with 2 double beds. The rooms were very nice, clean and nicely decorated. The amenities in the bathroom were nice too. Lemon soap, orange ginger shampoo and conditioner and pomegranate body lotion. They all smelled so good. We enjoyed pizza downstairs, as well as nathans hot dogs and those big pretzels. There are plenty of places to eat at the hotel. The hotel is right across from MGM where you can easily hop on the monorail if you dont want to walk in the heat. We found that we were offered free drinks earlier in the day ( when we didnt really want to drink) and the waitresses didnt come around to us as much at night. This might be because we were just at the 25 cent slots and maybe they cater more to the bigger spenders. We did get drinks though and tipped a dollar a drink. I loved the Family feud slot machines. They were fun and I won back my gambling money and broke even for the trip! Other people have complained about the size of the pool...but I thought it was great. I dont really have anything to compare it to...but it was clean and nice and had a great bar. Try the strawberry daquiri's. YUM I think this hotel is perfect. It is in a great location...has great food...great rooms and a very reasonable price. I would return again in a heartbeat. ps) dont forget to try the rollercoaster. it was scary....not going to lie but it was FUN. be sure to get a 4 dollar off coupon. ( we got ours in a coupon book we got out of the taxi on the way from the airport!)

Reviews.Title: “Loved the room, exciting, "full on" casino”
Reviews.Author: traceandhilly
Reviews.Content: Entering the foyer of this casino excites and entices you. Besides the casino area, there is ample restaurants and fast food areas, easily accessed and found, not like all casinos at Vegas. The stage show Zumanity was not on the two nights we were here, being Monday and Tuesday so sadly were unable to see it although it certainly looks very worthwhile. The only problem we had was a tray of left over food and utensils left outside our neighbours room across the hall for over 24 hours. The rooms were always exceptionally made up every day, the chinese restaurant was a great valued breakfast buffet. Out of the many medium cost casinos on the strip, this is one of the better ones.

Reviews.Title: “NY NY Rocks!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: goonerific
Reviews.Content: we stayed in the NY NY for 5 nights from august 12th to 17th. it was our first time in vegas so we picked this hotel based on tripadvisor reviews and personal recommendation. we arrived late on sunday night,about 10.30 or thereabouts,check-in was quick,10 minutes waiting and then the fun really began. we had booked 2 spa deluxe rooms for us and our 2 friends,they said they had none available so they were upgrading us,1 room a marquis room and the other a ziggaraut room. how lucky were we,THE ROOMS WERE HUGE!!! both had jacuzzis,table and chairs,sofa,coffee table,desk,bose sound system and a huge bed. housekeeping was excellent,no complaints.we had a great stay,america restaurant was great for breakfast and a late snack,9 fine irishmen had great food even if the bar was a big irish cliche,the big apple bar was excellent,particularly the band. floor service in the casino was excellent and a good range of shops all around the hotel kept herself happy. the hotel is right near the airport so a 10 minute spin will have you there,was also handy for the helicopter trip we took out to the canyon.i would highly recommend the NY NY if you want a hotel with good rooms and a great atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation with the Kids”
Reviews.Author: fanwood35
Reviews.Content: We just got home from Las Vegas...Let me first say I was apprehensive about traveling there with my kids (ages 12 and 16)..We were booked to go to Cancun but because of the hurricanes we had to change our vacation at the last minute..We had a terrific time...NY NY was a great hotel to stay with children..The ESPN zone and the arcade were a plus..The pool was sufficient, though we did see hotels with much better....We saw a couple of shows, which we all enjoyed..Get the tickets at the half price ticket booth located directly across from NY NY.....The meals were terrific...Definitely check out Freemont Street for one night..It is lively and the children will enjoy the light show and street performers...If your kids like arcades and rollercoasters then Circus Circus is worth spending some time in...All in all we enjoyed our vacation and will go back...Next time we will probably stay in Mandalay Bay because the pool is gorgeous...NY NY is better for younger children because of the arcades, ESPN Zone and rollercoasters...On a scale of 1-10 we rated our LAS VEGAS Experience an 8 which is very high coming from the kids...We will definitely be going back in the near future.....

Reviews.Title: “Boring NY NY”
Reviews.Author: LuckyDogSJC
Reviews.Content: I get to Las Vegas about every six months. I recently stayed at the NY - NY Hotel and was pretty disappointed in the property. The rooms were OK but the windows were small and oddly placed because of the façade of the hotel. There are no remarkable restaurants, Zoomanity is a below average Cirque production, the pool was sad compared to other properties in Vegas, and the bars all felt like frat parties revisited. Other properties in Vegas have much more variety. The staff was fine and eveything was clean but it would not be hard to book a property that will deliver a more exciting Vegas experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: foodie758
Reviews.Content: We are frequent Vegas travelers and have stayed several places, but this is our favorite. The rooms are good size and always beautifully kept. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The cocktail waitresses remember you from trip to trip. The casino is easy to navigate and very comfortable. The location is very close to the airport and you can catch the monorail right across the street at the MGM which makes it easy to traverse the strip without having to walk in the heat. I highly recommend staying at this property.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay, good location”
Reviews.Author: JMtl
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the New York for 4 days in April. Got upgraded to a Broadway suite, which was spacious though outdated. We had to move rooms on the last night, since our entire floor was set for renovations. Other than that, the staff was friendly, the restaurant selection was good, and the pool area was very nice. Just down the strip, check out Mon Ami Gabi at the Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastically Cheap and Tacky Vegas Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dunas
Reviews.Content: Lets be honest, you go to Vegas and you get what you expect. Lots of huge corporate hotels with casinos attached. Thats exactly what you get. There is nothing understated about this place, loud, brash and in your face - and fun! Large rooms that are designed to get you to the gambling floor as soon as possible. basic and comfortable but nothing more. The bathrooms do the job they are there to perform, the beds are somewhere you sleep. Thats it. NYNY is a great place to stay to give you everything you want in Vegas. Good location at the top of the strip. Loud bars, Great gaming floor, themed decor and a variety of cheap places to eat. The roller coaster doesnt cause too much noise, and you get free drinks all day and all night. I had a great stay

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: delilah514
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last weekend for my Bachellorette Party. We had the Players Suite which was nice, but a bit smaller then I expected. Everything seemed a little cramped together in the room. The bathroom was way to small, not what you would expect from such a nice hotel. Not fun when trying to share with 5 other girls. The room was nicely decorated and had a nice radio system with good speakers. We also had a hot tub, which was fun to relax in at the end of the night. The hotel itself is nicely decorated as well. It has a fun atmosphere, but it gets extreamly crowed and hard to walk around at time. Very frustrating when the elavators are completely in the back and you have to try to navigate through tons of people with suit cases and other items when you arrive & leave. However this seems to be the trend in Vegas right now. They should seriously try putting entrances to the rooms in more convienent locations. The food is good here. The pizza by the slice was delicouis. Perfect for a late night snack before you head up for the night. The ESPN Zone was really nice as well. Tons of TV's to watch your favorite teams while you eat. Don't miss out on an alcoholic slushy drink from Coyote Ugly. You don't even have to go inside to get one. Just grab one and head on your way out to the strip to keep you cool in the hot Vegas sun.

Reviews.Title: “I'd gamble on staying here again”
Reviews.Author: david7star
Reviews.Content: We checked in on a Sunday afternoon........ this was manic very busy and should have been better. There was no where to park while I was trying to check in and when I entered the building I queued at the wrong place, it was not real obvious. This really but a dampener on things and took a while for me to recover. I later found out that Sunday was a big change over day and is very active. I have to give credit for the check-out as this was really quick and good. I like the fact that the hotel is not too big, unlike some its competition........... it is friendly and the bars and restaurants in the hotel are very good with nice food and good staff. We stayed as New Yorkers in the Metropolitan with views to the strip. The room had a great view, it was quiet and very clean. I liked this hotel it is not the most expensive in the area, but is a little more personal and friendly. If I return to Vegas I'll give it a go again.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great Stay - Loved the Pool”
Reviews.Author: adam_nwuk
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay at the New York New York hotel in July 2007. Stayed 5 nights and loved the place. The "America" restaurant had some great food and "Il Fornaio" baker had nice breakfast (Croissants etc.) and the "Il Fornaio" restaurant had nice italian food. The hotel had free parking in a large multi story car park and a great outdoor swimming pool and 3 Jacuzzis which my 2 year old daughter loved. Didn't try the Roller Coaster (no one else in family would dare to come on with me!) but it did look as though it would be great fun.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: belandseb
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night on our abbreviated trip to Vegas. We did a walk up since we did not make a reservation. The front desk was very friendly and helpful. The room rate we received was very reasonable for the Park Ave Deluxe. The hotel and casino had a nice NYC setting although it did feel strange walking through the Village. It felt more like a movie set rather than a entertainment spot. The room and bathroom were spotless. The bed and pillows were very comfortable. What more can you ask for?

Reviews.Title: “Loved the NYNY!”
Reviews.Author: mepenny
Reviews.Content: Stayed her with my husband for getaway trip to see the Osmonds reunion. Lovely hotel, very clean. Not as smoky as many other casinos. Nice room - they upgraded us just because we asked. Roller coaster was outside our window and was fun to watch. Couldn't hear it at all in the room. Ate at several of the restaurants. Fave was the Chin Chin breakfast buffet. Chinese food for breakfast - yeah! Of course, they had good old bacon and eggs too! Easy walk to all the other strip stuff. Great views from the second floor balconies and bridges. Avoid Coyote Ugly - it is not worth the wait. Not like other Coyote Ugly bars - very boring. Head for the dueling pianos or the Pub instead. Contrary to popular belief, VEGAS IS STILL NO PLACE FOR KIDS. Many ads on the strip and even in the room for adult shows and entertainment. Lots of smoke in the lobbies and casinos. The kids we saw looked miserable and so did their parents. LEAVE THE KIDS HOME and stay at NYNY!

Reviews.Title: “A great place for our honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: EllisFan14
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 days and 5 nights in Las Vegas for our honeymoon in the heat of August, 2006. New York, New York was a GREAT hotel. While we spent a lot of time out walking the Strip and exploring, we could always find something good to eat or drink at NY, NY. The staff was helpful and our room was very quiet and very comfortable. We were in the Chrysler Building Tower. We also saw Zumanity in the theatre downstairs. Two thumbs up as well! Make sure to get some Nathan's Hot Dogs and free shots for the ladies at Coyote Ugly. We also had fun shopping at the Harley shop! Our next trip back to Vegas we will definitely be staying here again!

Reviews.Title: “The Very Big Apple”
Reviews.Author: OptimistChester
Reviews.Content: Having never been to Las Vegas we had no idea what to expect by way of hotels, except that 'everything is always bigger in America', and boy, was that the case. Each hotel/casino on the Strip was like a small village- huge! and each one different in it's own way. The New York New York was individual in that inside were a great many fast food outlets in a design similar to the streets of Brooklyn. Italian and chinese restaurants,with waiter service alongside burger joints, pizza parlours and fish and chip counters,for self service, with tables and chairs set up outside for you to eat at. We used them on a couple of occasions but have to say that we preferred the MGM hotel opposite which had a 'grand buffet' at a really reasonable price and was extremely well presented. Outside the New York New York was a roller coaster which seemed to go most of the day and night - whether there was anyone on it or not! The pool area was very private and beautifully clean and had a lifeguard on watch at all times. Altogether it was a real bargain price for everything that it had to offer. If we went again though we would settle for the MGM as it was definitely more to our taste. If we could afford it though, The Venetian has got to be the best on the strip and anyone going there should go take a look.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our Stay”
Reviews.Author: Mo19
Reviews.Content: For a busy hotel in Las Vegas we found the NewYork-NewYork met our needs. The check in was efficient and quick and the room was exactely as described on the hotel's website. Considering the numbers staying at the hotel we were pleased with the cleanliness of it and pleasantly surprised that we could actually find a free pool side lounger when we wanted one. Travelling with teenagers we did not use the casino facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed in New York New York”
Reviews.Author: luvs2travel0812
Reviews.Content: My husband, and 2 girls (both 15 years old) and myself just got back from Vegas (stayed at the NY NY Aug 4 to Aug 7). We were somewhat disappointed with our stay. Our room was very small even though we upgraded to the Broadway 'model' and we had the roller coaster outside our room which runs til midnight and is quite loud (can hear the screaming outside our window). If you do stay there, I'd recommend asking for a room away from the roller coaster. We were also surprised how expensive it is to ride the rollercoaster (12.00 per ride) and there are no discounts if you stay in the hotel. I also was very surprised that in this day and age, in order to use our laptop in our room that we had to pay $13.00 per day to access their wireless hookup!! We vacation all over the US and rarely do we see hotels anymore that charge for internet access. I've never understood why hotels only include 3 towels in a bathroom for a room with 2 queen beds, so we had to request towels every day (when they cleaned our room, they'd replace with 3 towels again). We also requested pillows the first night (they were very flat and we all like 2 pillows each) and the housekeeping argued with us, claiming that 6 pillows were enough and we didn't need 2 more. I tried to explain that we all use 2 pillows each, and housekeeping became very beligerant and said they'd try to find more pillows but couldn't promise anything. We did finally get our pillows (an hour later). Overall, the hotel was very average and while some service was very good (the valet service and bellhop service was very accomodating and helpful), the rest was mediocre at best.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic”
Reviews.Author: singletraveller07
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the New York, New York with a female friend in December. For some reason they gave us a huge room - it had two double beds, a leather settee, two huge armchairs and a dining table. It was fantastic and only cost $110 per night. The room faced the back of the building, so we had no view of the strip but who cares? The room more than made up for the money I lost in the casino! Would recommend it

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Spa Room!”
Reviews.Author: orchidrose
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to Vegas so decided to visit another hotel on the strip and the New York New York one the vote this time. We had a deluxe Spa room on the 16th floor of the New Yorker Tower. Our room had it all really, decent view, oversized spa in the bedroom and a widescreen TV to match not to mention the bed! It was clean and it was nice to see previous guest had looked after the furniture. That or they replace it regularly as it was as new. Apart from a fridge, all the amenities were there with an ice bucket and machine not too far away. The hotel is currently undergoing some renovation work though this did not affect us at all as it is concentrating on the meeting centres. Check in line was long when we first arrived, even though it was close to midnight though we were seen to in no time at all. I have seen it peak at different times where they did not seem as lucky. The hotel is massive as they all are along the strip though after the third day, you soon know how to get back to your room without much difficulty! We unfortunately had an incident of theft from our room so do not have the attitude of thinking even the least value of items will not go missing. The safe is free – use it, though you cannot fit everything in there. Security responded quickly and assure me they will investigate the matter fully. In summary, a great hotel to lap up the Las Vegas experience.

Reviews.Title: “Not that great!”
Reviews.Author: sportsmomOregon
Reviews.Content: We (two couples/seperate rooms) stayed at the NY NY July 2-4, 2007. Our flight was early; we arrived at the hotel around 12 noon. The rooms they had "ready" were on the 11th floor with two beds. No thanks. The next available rooms were on seperate floors BUT they had one bed. Again, no thanks. So, (after a lot of research on TA) we requested to be above the 20th floor and both couples needed one bed, not two. Finally, there were two rooms in the Park Avenue Tower on the same floor (26th) with one bed in each, BUT they would not be ready until 1-3 pm. Okay! We'll take them. Checked our luggage with the bell desk and went to get lunch because the option of 'using' a room to change for some pool time was a no go. (Last year when we stayed at the Mirage ... they let us use a room to change clothes until our room was ready). We called to see if our rooms were ready around 2pm - nope. Our friends' room was finally available at about 3 pm, but not ours. So we all went to their room and had all the luggage brought up. An extra tip to the bellman with an explanation of the inconvenience of not having my room yet - prompted him to make a call. That was nice of him. Finally, by 4pm our room was ready. Both rooms were strip views, even though all you could see was the corner of the MGM and the roller coaster. Oh, we could see Hooters, Tropicana, and the Motel 6 though! I did not like the fact that our room had NO wash cloths. The whole time we were there the hotel was 'out'. ??? Who runs out of wash clothes? Have you ever tried to take a shower and use a hand towel in place of a wash cloth? Can you say HEAVY? I felt like i was camping. Not to mention, when I tried to hang my sopping hand towel on the shower bar it was so heavy it slipped right off into the tub. grrrrrrr. ewwwww. gross. That meant I had to get a NEW hand towel the next time I washed. Not fun. I had the housekeeping extension memorized. haha. The other issues I had with my room were that the bathroom is small and the tiolet is in the way. The door almost hits the front of the tiolet seat. Plus, the sink drained SLOW. gross again. We never used the pool but while eating breakfast at the America restaurant I noticed all the lounge chairs filled and people waiting for the sun to shine. The towers block the sun until noon. Who wants to hang out for 4 hours and wait for sunshine? Not me. If you like to lounge or swim, don't stay at this hotel. If you gamble at the NYNY, get a players card. Charge food to your room from the restaurants there because you most likely will earn comps and they will pay for your bill. We played some slots and won a little. Even though we booked our package through Costco instead of directly with the NYNY (which means there was no room charge on our account to comp) we should have charged food to our room when we ate at our hotel because we could have used our comps in that way. Instead, I was given a $20 voucher to use at Starbucks in the food court area and $80 for some sandwiches at the sandwich shop. Let's just say food and drinks were on us. We also bought lunch for a couple from TN who were in line behind us, because we had a voucher with the 'use it or lose it' motto. I'm sure if we had more time, we could have asked to use the comps in one of the many gift shops ... oh well. Over all, I will not stay at the NYNY again. It just wasn't that classy.

Reviews.Title: “New York New York what a wonderful town”
Reviews.Author: vgasdude
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the New York New York hotel and casino from July 30th through Aug 2nd and couldnt have been happier. We got there at 9am and by 12pm they were able to get us into our rooms. I had never stayed there and they gave me a rate based on play at other MGM properties for a player's suite. It was beautiful with a hot tub right in the room. We were there for my cousins bachelor party and since we wanted to be close to each other when we checked in they upgraded thier room to the next level so they were right next door. Everyone was really helpful during our stay and I would not hesitate to stay there again. No complaints whatsoever.

Reviews.Title: “Awsome”
Reviews.Author: BCASMEDIC
Reviews.Content: This place is a gas...... We loved spending our nights down in the casino and listining to all the great live music. The casino it like walking in Central Park. It was not smoky at all and hade great ventalation. Our Room was fantastic and huge!!!!!! we will be going back!!

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: Neierke
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel with the typical Las Vegas atmosphere. Liked it very much and canreally recommend it. Prices are reasonable. The only minor remark I can make is that you have to pay for your internet access. In all the hotels I visited in the US it was for free. In NYNY it costs $11 per day.

Reviews.Title: “Pros and cons”
Reviews.Author: balderdash
Reviews.Content: Pros-Rooms are nice. I don't think you need to upgrade to be satisfied with the basic room. Hotel setup is cool. It's a big hotel but not too big where you have to walk far to get where you want to you in the casino. Roller coaster is fun, and there is an arcade. The bars are also fun. Restaurants are good. The bakery is excellent, the deli is excellent, and the Irish place has slighly overpriced but very tasty food. The pizza place is very popular also, although I thought my slices of pizza were just ok. Cons-Sportsbook is small and not very fancy. I also had to wait on more than one occasion to place a bet. La Fornaio(Italian restaurant) was very average for breakfast. I think with a good rate, you will enjoy NY. Next time I visit LV, I will spend a lil more and stay at Bellagio, Caesars, or Madalay Bay

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Place/Great Rooms”
Reviews.Author: persiadors
Reviews.Content: Check in was very slow. We spent approx. 40 minutes in line. The rooms wee very spacious, clean, and the beds were very comfortable. Bathrooms were very small. The pianio bar downstairs was great....It was going stong every night...and the talent of these guys were awesome. Expect high prices of alcohol at this bar. Coyote Ugly was over rated. They were begging people to come in and giving free access. They played head banging music all night. Beers were pricy 6 bucks. the pizza shop was awesome, reasonable prices. ESPN Zone was the best place there. Great Food, and Decent Prices.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: BronxTraveleer
Reviews.Content: I expected more. I have stayed in many hotels in Las Vegas in the past 15 years and I expected more from New York, New York. We stayed there for a wknd. this past June and the pool area was TINY, the air smelled like sulfur and the view is of the parking garage. The area is so small that people were crowded onto rocks and steps. This was so surprising to me bc all of the pools I used (Mandalay, Flamingo, Excaliber, etc.) have been enormous and have had plenty of room for all visitors. The spa was also a HUGE disappointment. It was run down, cramped, mauve and not nearly as luxurious as their ad implied nor Mandalay Bay (so far my favorite hotel on the strip). During my massage I endured construction noises from another floor. The day after we left they were going to be remodeling the spa so maybe things will improve. In addition, as guests of the hotel I expect to get preferencial treatment at the bars and clubs. But no, we have to pay the cover to get into the Irish bar, and we were given no coupons or anything to get into the ubber popular Coyote Ugly. I won't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location and Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Beanoes
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in June and absolutely loved it - the room was modern, clean and stylish - I really could not fault it. The entertainment int the hotel is fantastic. To be honest this is a great hotel and the one and only negative comment I have is that the late night food service could be improved!!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with a relaxed atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: Brits_Abroad77
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Vegas (there for a friends wedding). We booked five nights through Expedia, which were good value, though our final night (a mix up with dates) we booked while we were there and this proved very expensive. The room (one up from the most basic) was great - nice decor, clean and good qaulity fixtures/fittings. We got a bath/shower (which we didn't at the Excalibur and our friends didn't at the Luxor) and the maid service was excellent; they seemed over efficient if anything, bringing new towels and soap etc whether we needed it or not. Compared to other hotels we experienced, the room was easy to find and the lifts (elevators) always came quickly and weren't cramped (compare this to the Pyramid rooms at the Luxor, where our friends seemed to spend most of their honeymoon waiting for an 'inclinator' and walking several miles to their room!). Check in was a bit slow due to queues, but this seemed the same at all hotels when a mjaor flight had just come in, and the staff were frinedly - we had a trainee guy who needed a little help with the systems but because he was friendly this didn't matter - even to two jet-lagged Brits. The Casino itself seemd a lot easier to navigate than most we visited, and the New York theme was fun and less tacky than most we saw. Restaurants were also generally good - the Italian for dinner and the Chinese for breakfast(!) been the best. The Mexican place wasn't that authentic and service at the America breakfast buffet was a bit slow and generally unfriendly (apart from a jolly guy called John who was really cool). Pirces were on a par with all other hotels we tried on the strip. Finally, the Nine Fine Irishman pub was probably the best bar we found in Vegas - less pretentious than most and with a terrace on the strip for the late evenings. The band seemed genuinely Irish and the choice of drinks was fine. The little old asian lady who was in there most nights appeared to love the dancing!

Reviews.Title: “NY NY - A Fantastic place to stay”
Reviews.Author: 1976cac
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 11 nights at the start of July. Had mixed feelings about staying here due to the reviews, but we needn't have been worried. Check-in was fast at 4.30pm on a Sunday, and we get upgraded tp a Broadway Deluxe room, at no extra cost. We also got offered a strip view room for an extra $100, but declined, we were more than happy to get the upgrade. The room was huge and very clean, had everything you could want. The only negative I would say is that the bathroom is a bit on the small side. Providing only one of you is in there it isn't a problem. The only small problem we had was that there was no towels at all in the room when we arrived, I called down to housekeeping and within 30 mins there was a knock at the door and plenty of towels. Our room was on the 8th floor and I was worried about the noise from the rollercoater, but apart from the odd scream from those who were riding it, it never bothered us. The room was about a 2 min walk from the lifts and we never had to wait long for one to arrive. We tried the America restaurant and also the mexican Gonzalez Y Gonzalez. America was ok, the service was a little slow. Gonzalez was fantastic, the service was quick and the food delicious. Had drinks at the Big Apple bar most evenings and also tried Nine Fine Irishmen for drinks, both were nice and service was quite quick. We had a bit of luck on the slot machines, there was plenty of them. All in all we had a really great time at NY NY, location was great next to Monte Carlo, Excaliber, Luxor and MGM and I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this to family and friends. Will hopefully stay here again when we return.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the Price”
Reviews.Author: Tim1212
Reviews.Content: My wife and I traveled to Las Vegas July 12-15 for a wedding outside of Las Vegas. When arriving at the hotel, the check in was slow, but we recieved the room we requested. It was nice, modern, clean, and comfortable. I ate at Gonzales y Gonzales for dinner the first night at the bachelor party, which was very good and reasonably priced. We then went to the Bar at Times Square, a dueling piano bar that got great reviews. I personally thought it was overrated and the drinks were pricey. Although everything in Las Vegas was pricey. The gamvling was fun. A won about $40 playing blackjack and then proceeded to loose it all at Excalibur. The second day was a pool day after having breakfast at Paris (great buffet). The pool was crowded by 11am with almost no sun. The buildings blocked the pool until 12-1pm. With that said we really enjoyed ourselves. It was hot, so we sat in the water the entire time. After the pool, we went upstairs changed for dinner and came back down to gamble at NYNY before leaving for dinner. My wife won $30 at back jack and she decided to walk away. We hopped in a cab and went over to the Rio Hotel for dinner at Buzio's. Great food and a nice atmosphere. After dinner we went back to the hotel, changed and walked to the Bellagio to see the fountains. That was a ton of fun, but it was too hot to walk. We gambled at the Bellagio and won $35 at Blackjack. Again, it was a ton of fun. Saturday was the wedding day, so we were gone all day, did nothing at the hotel. Paris brunch and the Venetian in the morning. Sunday we left for the airport. Our cab driver dropped us off at Baggage Claim, but we didn't know because we were first timers. Walked to Ticketing, Checked in, and thats when the terror began. The security line was soooo long. Over an hour. We almost missed out flight. Made it by minutes...

Reviews.Title: “Loved the New York New York”
Reviews.Author: kleithal
Reviews.Content: Spent eight nights here and had a lovely time staff were helpful, the rooms were out of this world and the amenities astounding. We got married at the little white chapel and the hotel went out their way to give us champagne and make the day special. The dualing pianists are excellent go early it is always busy. The entertainment in the big apple is also of the highest standard and their is food for all pallets. Give the hair salon a miss though. Excellent hotel for people of all ages

Reviews.Title: “Great place to visit while staying somewhere else...”
Reviews.Author: erldprl
Reviews.Content: I really expected more from this hotel. Check-in was a confused nightmare that took nearly 5 hours to resolve. Was in town for a convention and decided to stay a few more days here since it is one of the few Vegas hotels I had not stayed at yet. Most hotels here get you in a room so you can get to the casino floor as quickly as possible but that did not happen here. It seemed like the staff had already pleased their quota of one customer per day and weren't going to do that again until tomorrow. This problem alone would make me think twice about staying here again. The "Broadway" room was entirely average and despite the fact I am a guy I must admit the colors in the room were bad with strange shades of purple visible everywhere. Frankly I don't know if this is traditional NY colors or just bad taste. For what I subtract for the staff and room, I will in part give back to the casino and restaurants. It was always busy and at least a little exciting on the casino floor, if you like people watching. I hit the blackjack tables and lost my shirt, 2 pair of pants, belt, shoes, and lucky rabbits foot, but it wasn't that lucky for me or the rabbit huh? Not exactly my favorite place to gamble for obvious reasons. There are several good restaurants on the Casino level so finding something to eat was never a problem. The best I found was the small hot dog stand next to the piano bar. Their Chicago style dog was great -- strangely better than most Chicago dogs I have had in Chicago itself. The second best restaurant was Chin Chin Cafe which could reduce their portion size by half and still have stuffed customers waddling out after a meal. I have to say one of my former favorite restaurants seems to have declined in quality over the past couple of years which is Gonzalez Y Gonzalez. This used to be the best Tex-Mex in the area but now seems to be a bit too greasy, and overpriced. Went to Nine Fine Irishmen and it was reasonably good except the bar staff seemed distracted and somewhat lacking in reasonable people skills plus had no clue how to pour a Irish style Black and Tan. Considering the this is supposed to be an authentic Irish pub brought piece by piece from Ireland, I expected a little more. They only poured your typical run of the mill American style Black and Tan with 50% or more Guinness. Anyway I give this entire stay a very average rating could have been worse if it weren't for the overall atmosphere in the casino itself. It is a great place to visit while staying somewhere else on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: w0rldwidetraveller
Reviews.Content: Would definetly recomend this hotel the room was a nice size and clean. We had a view of the roller coaster going around the outside of the hotel but we could not hear it. The hotel has a good atmosphere and less formal than a lot of the other hotels and had lots of places to eat and good bars. The staff were helpful and in a good location and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “over price”
Reviews.Author: ellv
Reviews.Content: Last time I come to vegas and stay in New York New York. The room was small and motel 8 look alike, the 12 in tv had only 5 channels you could wacth, vending machines all were broken so you end up paying for overprice drinks, internet 12.99 per day, lunch about $100.00 for a family of 4, dinner $150.00 the arrogance of charging like we are in Monaco. The average person making an honest living will not be able to afford this place. They want to overcharge you for just about everything from the food to the internet to the drinks to the shuttle from the airport to the events. Someday they will notice when people stop coming to this place because of the prices. it is like they dont make enough with the losses of gambling from everybody in the slot machines. Which, by the way,are in favor of the hotel 100 to 1. So good luck with your gambling here, you are going to need it.

Reviews.Title: “Service Stinks!”
Reviews.Author: Suebelle757
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from spending a birthday/anniversary trip at the New York New York Hotel and Casino. The hotel is very nice and the room was very comfortable. Unfortunately the service doesn't compare. The first day the room was cleaned no towels were left in the bathroom. A call to housekeeping did prove profitable after about an hour. The next day the room was cleaned and again no towels. Several attempts of speaking to housekeeping including the manager (Cory) and three hours of waiting did not accomplish getting towels. With dinner plans to celebrate our 25th anniversary we had to shower and dry off with a t-shirt. Upon returning from dinner -- NO TOWELS! Another call to Cory the so called manager of housekeeping and another 45 minute wait towels finally arrived. The only appology we received was Cory stating I'm going to take care of this. Well I guess he did in his own time. It is truly unforunate that such a nice place would not care about their guests. I will not ever stay there again and do not recommend it to anyone unless your willing to take lots of T-shirts to dry with or your own towels!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NewDeep
Reviews.Content: Clean hotel. big rooms. Bathrooms are large and modern. FInding your room may be a bit of a challenge because the hallways are a maze but you will get use to it. Can be a good hotel for people going with children. There is an arcade where kids and those that are kids at heart can play. Pizza parlor downstairs is very good. Ben and Jerry is around the corner for a quick treat. If you are going to gamble and want to dring I think that the morning is the best time (about lunch time). The watriesses are very nice and they make the drinks (that are free) strong. By the time that 5pm comes around they can get a little testy. ***To save money *** sign up for their email list. You will get emails with promotion codes where you can get things like a Park Ave Room for $79 per night plus various coupons for the hotel. Like free drinks at Big Apple Bar and free ride on the in door roller coaster. Most of their promotions are also good on weekends. So its worth it. Zumanity is located in the hotel. Sometimes the hotel offers a special package (reduced rates on tickets) if you book your hotel room and buy tickets at the same time. Good show but dont bring kids. I would say no one under 17 or 18.

Reviews.Title: “Slightly disappointed”
Reviews.Author: ogradytom
Reviews.Content: Just back yesterday, July 4th, from a 3 night stay. We were offered an upgrade to a corner Broadway room with a view from the 37th floor for only $10 a night. Sounded great so we agreed. Broadway room was of an OK size, but the bathroom was a small closet. There was only 1 inch clearance between the door and the toilet...that's small. As far as the view goes, the windows were miniscule. At the Stratosphere 2 years ago the room with a view had a humungous window. At NY,NY the windows were tiny and made smaller by concrete ledges of some sort. At 6 feet tall I could barely look out the window, and my wife couldn't at all. The reason to stay is the food. We ate at Nine Fine Irishman, Il Fornaio and the American Cafe and loved them all. Had a inattentive waiter at Il Fornaiao, but that can happen anywhere. Room service and housekeeping were great. As it was our anniversary we ordered a bottle of champagne to be waiting for us in our room. Room service picked up on our room upgrade immediately and the champagne got to our room about the same time we did. Housekeeping was fairly quick when we called for an extra pillow. They initially told me there was supposed to be one in the room already, but there wasn't, so they brought 2 up. I was disappointed with the gaming as I never saw a table lower than $10 the whole stay. We opted to do our gaming at Excalibur across the road instead. Plenty of $5 tables there and a decent poker room. At Sunday, Monday and Tuesday rates the hotel gets 4 stars from me. At Friday and Saturday rates, the hotel gets 3.

Reviews.Title: “Pros and cons...”
Reviews.Author: jpocccoc
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 3 three- night stay at NY NY. While this is a very cool hotel, it may not be right for everyone... Pros- The hotel's theming is fun and location is good - a short walk from several other hotels, including MGM Grand, Monte Carlo, Excalibar, and Luxor. It has a variety of restaurants / bars. We really enjoyed the Bar at Times Square (dueling pianos - far better than the guys at Treasure Island). Lunch at the ESPN Zone was decent. Check-in was painless. Our Park Ave room was plenty big, and nicely decorated. We had a view of the pool and roller coaster. While others have complained of the noise from the coaster, we never heard it. Our friends stayed in a Broadway (upgraded) room, which, I didn't think was worth the extra money unless you have several people sleeping in one room and might need a roll-away bed. Service was generally good throughout the hotel. We were given coupons (some as part of our metro pkg, and others by time-share sales people that linger near the elavators) that included free drinks, coaster passes, and two-for-one meals. Cons- This hotel is by far the smokiest we visited on the strip. At times it was suffocating. Our supposedly non-smoking room reeked of smoke as well. The hotel is also very dark, and may not be appealing to everyone. Food and drink prices were outrageous. The America restaurant breakfast was about $10 for an Denny's -style $2.99 breakfast. I don't mind paying $10 for a martini if I'm at a nice bar, but I resent spending it on a watered-down screwdriver by the pool. The pool was the biggest disappointement. For a hotel this size, the pool is too small. We had to there by 11:00 in order to get chair, even though the sun didn't hit the area until an hour later. In addition, the pool is right next to a busy road, and though there is a a high wall, the road noise / smell was distracting. Ultimately, though we had a great time at NYNY, we found that we spent most of our time at other hotels, We ate lunch at Wolfgang Pucks (MGM- fabulous!), dinner / shopping at Caesars (great!), and two Cirque shows (Love and Mystere) at the Mirage and Treasure Island. Still, for about $100 a night NYNY is a bargain. We would consider staying here again, but if the rate was comparable, I would select an different property with a better pool.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort zone”
Reviews.Author: tykeeny
Reviews.Content: We visited Vegas from June 3 -7. This was our third time at NYNY and we love it. From the creek running through to the restaurants, the somewhat rude staff, and the great deal on our room ($139 for 700 sq ft w/ jacuzzi). I have toured almost all other properties and except for the Wynn, we will not stay elsewhere. While we were there they had a dust storm that caused everything except the strip (from our hotel room) to disappear. The last time we were there they had a lightning storm that we watched from our jacuzzi. I know, we suffer while there! Yes, vegas is a bright circus, and I would live there if I could afford it!

Reviews.Title: “Big Apple Shines ...”
Reviews.Author: beemerchick325
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a weekend in fabulous Las Vegas. Since my folks live there, we seldom stay at any of the hotels, but not this time! Because my husband was entertaining on business, we got the chance to try out one of the big-named hotels on the strip. Much to my excitement, I had fun scoping many of them out via Trip Advisor before settling on NYNY. From the moment we arrived, mid-afternoon on Friday, the check-in process went very smoothly. I had requested a view of the strip and that's exactly what we received ... it was a corner room, plus it was also recently renovated! The decor had a very metropolitan feel with dark brown and light blue hues used throughout. Very New Yorker-like! We were on the 26th floor and the view was spectacular! So much so, we kept the drapes wide open the entire stay and just enjoyed the glow of the lights all around us. Our room was above the roller coaster, but we were never bothered by the noise of it or the airport nearby. The hotel was running a special from June thru August, whereby we received 2 for 1 coupons to use during our stay for several different things ... the coaster ride (which we didn't use, but I gave our passes to two young boys who were just thrilled!), breakfast at Il Fornaio (which we ate at both mornings -- very yummy!), among other freebies. We did order room service late one night and was told it would be about 20-30 mins., but the food arrived within 15 -- very impressive and still hot, I might add! Prices were overall pretty reasonable given how expensive most everything is anywhere you go there. The bed was most comfy, the bathroom, lovely. The room was on the small side, but very clean and stylish, and again, it felt like something right out of NYC. All in all, we had a fantastic time at NYNY and we would definitely stay there again! Wish we could go back tomorrow :)

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Fun Casino”
Reviews.Author: pamelakay
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took our 21 yr old boys there for their birthday. We all really enjoyed it. We had Park Ave. rooms and really liked them. They were not small, average sized. They bathroom was quite large with a tub enclosure. They decor was "fifth avenue". Our room was near the roller coaster start/stop point, but it never bothered either of us. They boys overlooked the pool. The casino was lively with several bars with bands. The Big Apple bar is in the middle of the casino and had live music starting each afternoon. The table games usually had $10 min. and we never had to wait for a space. There are several resturants and one large food court area. Every thing we had was good. We ate at Gallagers (steak house), America and several of the fast places. The hotel, casino, food and other staff were all very friendly. We would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “NY NY Always a Good Time!!!!”
Reviews.Author: dox82
Reviews.Content: I visit Las Vegas 4-5 times a year and have been a loyal guest of NY NY the last year. Check-in is always a breeze and the overall layout of the casino is great. There is a wonderful mixture of table games and slots. This last trip was no exception to the norm. The staff is always very accomodating and helpful. The resturaunts are good with the exception of Gonzales y Gonzales. I will continue to stay and play here for years to come. Make sure you sign up for a players card, they took care of my room for the amount of play I racked up while I was there. This place is good for young couples and singles. My wife loves this place and will not consider any other property. NYNY is still the best.

Reviews.Title: “New York New York is a winner!”
Reviews.Author: shuksan
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights, June 18-20 after booking a Metropolitan promo package on the hotel's website. It's hard to find much to complain about. The package deal was very worthwhile: 2 free drinks, 2-for-1 breakfast at Il Fornaio, 2-for-1 lunch at Nine Fine Irishmen, and 2 passes on the roller coaster along with an upgrade to a Park Avenue room. All for the same price as the lowest available room without any promo. The coupons worked without hassle. The food and service surpassed expecations, especially at Nine Fine Irishmen with its handsome decor. We were continually amazed at the quality of service both at New York New York and throughout Vegas. One guy at the deli pizza place in NYNY was rude (a kind word for him.) He was memorable mainly for being unique. Our room was perfectly fine, though average-sized and lacking separate lights for each bed. There was also no exhaust fan in the bathroom. Water pressure? Ours was great though others on this board have complained. The fan on our A/C rattled horribly upon arrival. We called maintenance, and it was fixed within a couple of hours. Excellent! NYNY is clever and cool, the kind of hotel you'll find only in Vegas. Our major complaint: each night during prime time, the entire casino was overwhelmed by an extremely loud live rock band. The group was talented, but I question why a casino with this much size and attention to atmosphere should be dominated by just one kind of sound. We had a hard time finding anywhere to talk or even hear the slot machines.

Reviews.Title: “New York New York, Good Modest priced place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: wannagoto
Reviews.Content: My husband, myself and our two young adult children went to Las Vegas to celebrate our son's 21st birthday. We stayed at New York, New York, it was a financially reasonable place to stay, the room was adequate. We purchased it directly through the hotel and received an upgrade and received coupons for 2 free roller coaster rides, 2 free drinks, and 2 for 1 breakfast at Il Foranio, and another 2 for 1 coupon for the Irish restraunt on the premises. We arrived at 9 am and were allowed to check in early, which pleased us a great deal since it was 108 degrees out and wanted to sit by the pool. The pool was probably the most disappointing part of the hotel. It was small and over crowded. It was difficult to get a lounge chair. Highlights of the trip were eating dinner at Mon Ami Gabi in Paris across from the Bellagio Fountains and having a wonderful dinner with a wonderful view and attending a Roger Waters concert at MGM and going to Freemont Street to watch the light show.

Reviews.Title: “I Love New York New York”
Reviews.Author: CAROLTRAVELS4EVR
Reviews.Content: I'm a travel agent who took a group of friends to Las Vegas to celebrate our 21 year old kids b'days. We had a fabulous time. First time for all except me & my hubby. We stayed in the Park Avenue rooms w/views of the strip. Some were full view some were not--but good views overall. The lower numbered rooms (2616) are a little bit bigger than the higher numbers (2662). Be sure to ask for the 20th floor and up so the roller coaster isn't too loud. However, it usually closes down before you get to your room for the night (early a.m.) anyway! Other than the Poker Tour (saw all of the major players at the Rio--fun) there were no conventions in town so it wasn't too crowded. All of the staff from registration to casino to housekeeping were friendly and accomodating. Best food is at the ESPN sports center. 15 people--15 different orders--all of it was great, fresh & hot! The American Cafe is so-so. Walk to the Excalibur to catch the tram to Mandalay Bay & Luxor. Walk to MGM to purchase monorail tickets $8.00 cash--no credit cards--per person. Worth it in the 107 degree heat. Have exact $5.00 + 3 $1.00 bills--no change given. Takes you behind Bally's, Planet Hollywood etc where you can hop off--see the hotels--hop on and go to the next group of hotels. Was told the pool wasn't that cool--but it was. Small, but you meet everybody in the pool and lounging around the pool. Had more of a "country club" atmosphere to it than a gigantic party pool. We made our own fun and got everyone involved. This hotel attracts lots of newlyweds, young couples, groups of youngs guys and groups of young ladies with a small mix of families and older couples. Perfect weekend. Perfect hotel. And ask for late check out --till 1--then store your luggage after that if you have a late flight like we did. The Bell Service is quick, efficient and patient--even when our girls lost their claim ticket and went searching for 5 bags! Only glitch of the weekend. As an agent--I trust tripadvisor--above all other reviews. When I have a client requesting a hotel I'm not familiar with--I check out TA. They haven't let me down yet!!

Reviews.Title: “Won't be back”
Reviews.Author: pcryan5
Reviews.Content: Once again we booked a non smoking king size bed - confirmed the very day we were arriving - only to get the two double beds and the "check with us tomorrow" line. In order to get towels etc we had to call front desk and coordinate our outing schedule. This was on day 3 when house keeping was MIA for the first two days. enough is enough - there are better places and I will simply go there.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: ornella
Reviews.Content: Just spent 5 nights at NYNY. We had a Broadway room (707) with two queens. The room was big enough and clean. The beds were comfortable. If doing the pool is going to be a major part of your day, I would pick another hotel. Downstairs, the pool area is WAY too small for the size of this hotel. All the chairs are gone by 11:30. The pool itself was a good size. If you don't care about the pool, then the NYNY is a fun hotel with good rooms, comfortable beds, a lively casino and many food/entertainment options. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel”
Reviews.Author: GloriousGloria
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the NY NY for 10 nights from the 3rd of June 07. The Hotel has so much going on, usually when we have been in Vegas we have vistited buffetts (not the cheap ones ) mostly for meals. NY NY has so much variety we wanted to try the food in the hotel. There must have been about 20 different places to eat in there. The room was clean and the toiletries were replenished frequently. My only critisism of Vegas at the moment is that it is a building site ,on many of its sites building work puts you off walking to other hotels. Of course the Deuce bus is great value at $2.00 one way or $5.00 for 24 hours. The shopping is brilliant and a must for a shopaholic like me. I love Vegas and I love NY NY

Reviews.Title: “Loved NYNY!”
Reviews.Author: KiwiExplorers
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Vegas around 3pm on a Sunday, so expected there to be delays at check in but everything went very smoothly and no wait at all. We caught a shuttle from the airport, which took about 10 minutes to the hotel, for around $6US each. NYNY was crazy, loud and brilliant. We picked the hotel because we wanted the true Vegas experience, and were not disappointed! We booked a room online and once we found it (quite maze-like) were happy with the cleanliness and amenities. The room was small but not unusually so, and the bathroom was great. Downstairs, the Village was incredible- great place to get food and drinks until quite late in the night. We found Chin Chin really delicious for chinese food, and the many bars not bad for drink prices (around $6 for beer). There is a fantastic dueling piano bar and Irish Pub, that are fun, and the Italian restaurant was great for a late dinner. We ate at America for breakfast every morning, and it was fine- cheap and good. Zumanity was incredible and highly recommended, although is fairly risque so not for the kiddies! We also went to Ka, at MGM, while we were there and this was also goo- probably on a grander scale than Zumanity. Recommendations: Wander through MGM (biggest hotel in the world) with its amazing restaurants, live lion habitat, and great bars. We also drank at Paris, and found it be quite romantic and a nice change from NYNY. The Bellagio is amazing and the fountains are incredible, especially at night. ABSOLUTELY use the Duece Bus out the front of most hotels- $5US for 24 hours use, and its fantastic for getting out of the heat and saving your feet! Fashion Show Mall was brilliant and we did some fairly serious damage to the credit card there... Anyway, Vegas is huge, lound, brilliant and so much fun! The only downside to the hotel is the pool, as there is only one, it can get crowded and its nothing special- although the margaritas are great!

Reviews.Title: “Big Brash & Ok”
Reviews.Author: nodnyl11
Reviews.Content: BIG BRASH & OK for a long weekend. No problem in checking in or out. No delay Booked a spa deluxe room as celebrating 30th wedding anniversary, great room, terrible view overlooking the pool and motorways. Room had an adjoining door and next door's occupants were there for a conference so at 7 am every day they were constantly on cell phones and just too noisy ( SOME PEOPLE JUST DO NOT HAVE ANY CONSIDERATION FOR ANY ONE ELSE............but that's not the fault of the hotel.) Just remember to ensure you ask for a room without an adjoining door!. The pool was just too small for the numbers especially on the weekends when its full of 30 somethings letting off steam & the management should certainly restrict numbers. With no tea/coffee machines in room or any fridge or minibar this is a typical Vegas hotel wanting you out of your room & spending. Had great times in Cayote Ugly Bar and at Duelling Pianos but dissapointed that had to pay and sometimes queue to get in despite staying at the hotel.( No preferential treatment ) The staff at the Irish Bar were certainly the worst encountered on our visit to the US & gave a couldn't care less attitude but to be fair the draught Guiness served was as good as that in Dublin. Vegas must do's include getting a multi pass for the monorail, helicopter trip in the Grand Canyon, Barry Manilow ( not a fan, but he's there till 2008 in Hilton, great show, great value ), Drifters/ Platters/ Coasters GREAT GREAT show in the Sahara VEGAS STYLE. ( These shows are dying out so grab em while you can ). Visited Vegas 3 times, 1979, 1999 & now 2007 would not visit again as its now the US party place for the 30somethings on a weekend.

Reviews.Title: “The Juicy Apple of Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: hitmom
Reviews.Content: We had a group of 20 people staying at New York New York for our dad;s 70th Birthday June 7-11. Checking in went smooth and we were in a Players Suite within minutes. The suite was very large with a whirlpool tub. The room had several cool lamps all turned on but when you tried to turn them off it was very difficult. Others in our party said they actually had to unplug them. The whole time we were there we had excellent maid service. We reserved a private room at the Italian restaurant which was very nice for privacy and roasting our dad. The down side was the food was really horrible. We had a pre made menu that must have come from another kitchen because the food looked good that the rest of the place was getting. We all went to Coyote Ugly after a 30 minute wait for the bill. The line was a mile long but we had free passes. Of course we had to pay $40 to not stand in that line and get right in. The place was way too crowded and loud for the majority of the party. The next day we rented a cabana at the pool. That was the only way to go with a large group of people. We walked in the pool area and every chair was taken but the 4 padded ones right in front of our cabana. The cabana came with snacks, drinks, sun tan oil, a t.v.,a changing area and lots of shade. The people that didn't want sun sat in the cabana. Many were gambling but came out to visit and have a drink. It was like having our own party area. We ate at the mexican place that night and I would say it was pretty good with good service. We all went to the Love show at the Mirage that night and it was fantastic.
