We had the very last row in the theater but it didn't make a difference - Go if you can! We enjoyed gambling late at night and watching all the people walk through. Had good luck at craps and on the Monte Carlo slot machines. The next day we ate lunch at the Dam resaturant at the Hooters Casino (within walking distance). The portions were "Dam Big" especially the nachos and tasty too. Gambling was much cheaper and we all won money. I think we bet less in the beginning and worked our way up to big money!!! We went to the Palm to eat dinner at The Nine. Excellent food and atmosphere but we really paid big bucks. We saw Keshawn Johnson and he was nice enough to come over and take a picture with dad for his birthday. Some of us went up to the Ghost Bar and the view was breath taking. The music was good and the people watching was the best. The bars in New York New York were always crowded and busy so if you don't want to travel around to other casinos you would still have fun. We ordered room service twice for breakfast. The food, presentation, and promptness were all perfect. We left the hotel sadly because we had a fantastic time and came home with cash!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: aussieinturkey
Reviews.Content: Check in (and any dealings with reception) was always fast and polite. As were the porter service. The elevator set up seemed abit ridicolus and i would hate to see my mum and dad navigating their way around to try and find their room! Restaurants within the hotel were adequate, plenty of range and prices in line with outside. Housekeeping usually took 3-4 calls to acctually come to you room, if they actually came.....

Reviews.Title: “Wife wants to go back !!”
Reviews.Author: leedylan1998
Reviews.Content: We went to Vegas for a wedding and the whole party was booked into the NYNY. Despite arriving at various times, the whole party were allocated rooms on the same floor and within a block of around 20 rooms so good start. The various facilities in the hotel are excellent. Times Square, Coyote Ugly, Irish Bar, Restaurants Galore and the lovely Big Apple bar with live entertainment. Its quite incredible really. Im writing this review having since visited Vegas again and stayed in the Bellagio, and i would say of the 2, NYNY gets both mine and my wives vote. Rooms were standard with everything you need considering it really only is a place to sleep for 6 hours a night(if your lucky). Not that there is noise or anything, but i swear rooms in Vegas are pumped with oxygen as you just constantly feel awake. This hotel would be good for families as it has the arcades and the roller coaster rides though i do have to say i wouldnt take my kids to Vegas full stop. Its an adults place for me. If you are looking for excellent value for money then this is the place to go.

Reviews.Title: “Great Food”
Reviews.Author: dpoli
Reviews.Content: We booked the "Manhattan Nights" package for 3 nights via the hotel website. We paid $90 per night ( exclusive of tax) for a Park Avenue room, 2 free drinks, 2 for 1 dining at Il Fornaio and Nine Fine Irishmen, 2 roller coaster passes, and $20 spa coupon (usable only upon spending $100). The check in line was rather long but moved quickly--10 minutes or so. When we were assigned our room, we were informed that the only non-smoking king bedded room available was a handicapped accessible room. This was booked 3 months in advance--how could they not have a room? Rather than waste time, we accepted room 3225 in the Century tower. The room was average size, comfortably furnished.It had a king bed, desk and chair, table and chair, and flat screen TV. There was no closet--instead, the armoire held your clothes. The linens and bed were very comfortable. The safe was too small to hold a laptop, and they charged $11.99 for internet access. The marble bathroom was large, but had one sink and no where to put your personal things (other than the counter). The lighting was poor, but the lighted makeup mirror was a nice touch. The soaps and shampoo were very nice, but there was no shower gel. As others have stated, there is no coffee set up or minibar--I guess they want you to spend $5 at Starbucks. We did have a problem--the temperature of the room. The room was way too hot. Maintenance came and "bled" the system. That helped for a few hours, but it was very uncomfortable to sleep. They never did solve the problem. As others have stated, we found the casino to be overly smoky. For that reason, we did not play at NYNY very much. We had great meals at Gallagher's and Il Fornaio. Because the portions are so huge, we asked about sharing a dinner and were informed that they were happy to accomodate us. Not only did we have more than enough to eat by sharing, we also saved a ton of money. NYNY does NOT have a concierge. They also wanted to charge us $10 to print boarding passes via their business center. Overall, NYNY is a nice hotel. But for our next stay in Vegas, we intend to book the Venetian.

Reviews.Title: “Loved NYNY - So glad we Stayed!”
Reviews.Author: renauerc
Reviews.Content: After reading some of these reviews I was nervous about our May 25-28 stay at NYNY - I worried for absolutely nothing. We arrived on Friday morning about 9:30 am - there was NO line at check-in, we walked right up to a friendly hotel worker. She checked us in with no problem - we asked for a room on a high floor - got 21st in the Century tower. We had also got a corner room with a view of the MGM Grand on one side and Excalibur on the other - so great!!! I thought the room was great - nicely furnished, comfortable bed, lots of room . I guess teh water pressure was a little weak, but I wouldn't have noticed if I hadn't read other reviews about it first. The rollercoaster was barely noticeable, not anywhere near enough to even warrant a comment. Restaurants - We had breakfast at the American Diner (open 24 hours) and Il Fornaio. Both were excellent - about $10 each for breakfast. We had pizza from the pizza joint at like 1 am - there was a long line but it moved fast. We also watched the Pistons game at the ESPN zone and had appetizers. ESPN was Ok - I probably wouldn't recommend it though. Location - Great! Right in the middle of it all! Casino - We don't really gamble and didn't have a lot of luck but we visited almost all of the casinos and really liked the vibe at NYNY. I didn't catch teh wave of smoke that some people commented on - obviously there were a lot of smokers but no worse than anywhere else. Pool - Ok but not anything special. Crowded pretty much all day - but fun. Other - My only other complaint is that the line for the elevator was loooonnngg - sometimes as much as 5 minutes. Overall I would definetly recommend this hotel and would stay again. Had such a fun vacation!!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Front Desk Service almost ruined our anniversary! (Bumped Down)”
Reviews.Author: married_traveler
Reviews.Content: For our first anniversary, my husband and I decided to check out Vegas and booked an air-hotel package. We were booked for the New Yorker Deluxe suite at NYNY. This is one up from the standard room. When we arrived, the front desk clerk confirmed with us that we were booked for the NY Deluxe Suite which includes a flat screen TV and is slightly better than their standard room. All the room descriptions were laid out in front of us to read. She began typing away at her terminal and said they are overbooked and had to check with her manager to see if they have a room for us. What?? This is a hotel with over 2000 rooms and was she trying to tell us there wasn't one available? I explained that this is our first time in Vegas and our first anniversary hoping that she would take this into consideration and possibly find us a room or even upgrade us to an even better room. When she came back, we were told that the only rooms available were a smoking room and a handicapped room. It was as if she was trying to convince us to settle for some other room. She even said if we are not happy to call back and they'll switch our room. When we arrived at the room, we realized she actually bumped us DOWN!!! We ended up with the standard room (no flat screen TV and a connecting door to another room). Definitely NOT WHAT WE PAID FOR since our reservation stated the New Yorker Deluxe Suite. My husband called the front desk and complained without any success. When my husband asked what could they offer to compensate us, they had nothing to offer - not even a free breakfast! So I took over the phone and basically told the front desk clerk that they have officially ruined my anniversary...I was almost in tears. He said he couldn't do anything but that I could speak to his manager about it. So I did! I explained everything to his manager, and he said that housekeeping just finished cleaning a non-smoking New Yorker Deluxe Suite. How convenient...right? The funny thing is that on our flight back, we overheard another passenger recounting a similar story! Make sure you fight for what you've paid for.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good accomodation”
Reviews.Author: cebe
Reviews.Content: The NY NY is right on the Strip, walking distance to all other major hotels and casinos. The rooms are good sized, clean, and overall quiet. Only if you go to bed early then you might ask for a room not facing the rollercoaster. Food choice and quality in the hotel is OK.

Reviews.Title: “Upgrade to the Spa Room!! Wow!!!”
Reviews.Author: Cakey77
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to Las Vegas and we decided to upgrade our room to the Spa Room and it was amazing. There was a massive jacuzzi in the corner of the bedroom which is fantastic after a full day shopping and exploring the sites Vegas has to offer. The hotel itself is fantastic and has so much going on, you would never be bored. There are lots of places to eat to chose from, we ate at the Mexican and the Chinese and both meals were lovely. I would recommend this hotel and definately upgrade to he spa room - well worth it!!

Reviews.Title: “So-Much-Fun”
Reviews.Author: nerdgirl76
Reviews.Content: A little late in submitting this review! This was my first trip to Las Vegas and I did not know what to expect...WOW! Everything is SO BIG!!! We stayed at the NY NY for 4 nights and I really have no complaints-other then the long walk from hotel room to the elevators! The casino/hotel itself is super fun. Nine Fine Irishmen had some super fantastic food SERIOUSLY, the best pot roast I have had in a long time! We spent most of our days walking around the all the casinos and had an awesome time, but really, be prepared to walk a lot. Yikes! Also, whatever you do-do not eat the hot dogs from 7-11 at 5 in the morning, they will not be good to you. Over-all, the hotel was great and Vegas is just too much fun! Can not wait to go back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Above average for Vegas, but tacky like most”
Reviews.Author: musicman34
Reviews.Content: The rooms are decent, the staff is polite and the parking is free. But there are glitches. 1) When I checked in they said they had no record of Expedia requesting a king size bed non-smoking room. (After the trip, Expedia sent me the document they sent the hotel and that request is there). They charged me an extra 10 bucks a night as a result. 2) The roller coaster is noisy. It wasn't bad in my hotel room. But at the pool you hear the noise and the screams. It's not exactly something you want to hear while you're closing your eyes or reading a book. 3) The pool has no lanes for swimmers. It's just a wading pool. 4) There is no coffee maker in the room. 5) There was a whore looking for customers at the elevator when I went down to get my coffee at 7 AM. It's a typical Vegas kind of place, a little better than most actually. If you're a business traveller, I'd say spend 50 bucks more a night and go across the street to the MGM. It's slightly less tacky.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Holiday”
Reviews.Author: ScotlandGinger
Reviews.Content: Stayed in NYNY for 7 nights at the start of May and had a ball. Nice comfortable rooms and a good size. We had a good room with a strip view and the rollercoaster wasn't too noisy. Hotel is well located on the strip but you will still do a lot of walking - take very comfy shoes/trainers. The Irish bar in the hotel was good but please make sure you take ID with you, I was there to celebrate my 30th Birthday but was always asked for photo ID before being allowed any alcohol. Casino is good in NYNY, roulette is addictive!! Vegas is excellent, so much to see and do. Would recommend the helicopter night flight down the strip and paying a visit to the buffet restaurants at both the Mirage and Mandalay Bay hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Liked the NY-NY!”
Reviews.Author: MustLoveDogz
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the NY-NY from May 12-15. This was our second visit to Vegas together and my fourth (previous stays at Tropicana, Flamingo, Luxor). We were booked for a Park Avenue room. Upon arrival at 10am, our room was not ready but our request for a non-smoking king room was met. A room was ready for us at 11am and even though we were told a strip-view would cost us $15 more per night, we were given it for free! The bell desk stored our bags for the hour we had to wait for a room. We arrived in our 20th floor room which had a good view of the Excalibur, Tropicana, MGM and the airport. The room was standard in size and had nice furnishings. The bathroom was a bit dark, but had nice toiletries in it. The room had a post in the corner of it, which blocked one of the 4 windows. I got the impression that each room was fairly unique in size/layout, which is sort of neat. The lights from outside are bright, but the curtains cover them very well. The AC works really well. The casino is small by comparison to other major strip casinos. We enjoyed it just the same. We played some tables games as well as slots but did not walk away big winners. What little we won, we ended up losing anyway. I played enough to get a t-shirt, but nothing more from the player’s club. We ate at Gonzales Y Gonzales, Il Fornaio, America, Nine Fine Irishmen and a few of the fast food places. All were good, but the value was best at the first three. We would recommend all four. Alcoholic beverages were very expensive (beer was over $5 and mixed drinks were almost $10). The Big Apple Bar featured a live band each night. We saw Wild Child, which was a pretty good cover band of 80’s and 90’s music. The band can be heard throughout the casino, but the view is best inside the bar. Service was good, but as stated earlier, drinks were pricey (two Miller Lites were $11.50 plus tip). As other reviews stated, the pool was our one disappointment. It is small and sunlight doesn’t reach it until noon. I laid out there one day for about an hour, which was nice, but I had to time it well to make it that way. The roller coaster’s first big drop is very close to the pool, so loud screams are heard every few minutes. There are a lot of folks trying to hand you “free” tickets as you enter the casino from the MGM and Excalibur walkways. We gave them a firm “no thanks” and were left alone. Check-out was very quick and everything went as planned. We will consider staying here again if we can get a good deal. However, because we like to stay at new places and because the pool was so small, we may stay elsewhere for our next trip. We would recommend that other folks try it since it is such a unique experience!

Reviews.Title: “A Lot of Action”
Reviews.Author: Dushan29
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed a full week here. It's an excellent location on the South Strip not far from other major hotels. We arrived after 9 P.M., and check in was easy with no long wait. Our room was clean, and we got two queen-sized beds on the 8th floor. The hotel staff was courteous and helpful. The hotel has plenty of restaurants as well as some fast food joints. There is no question that the hotel restaurants and casinos are crowded much of the time. If you've grown up in a big city, you would probably not have a problem with this, however, some people might think it a turnoff. If you're single, this might be the place for you as there is quite a bit of action at some bars with plenty of music. For a family with kids, there is a video game parlor as well as the roller coaster. We're slot players, and what we won, we lost. It's difficult to sustain a winning slot machine. Nevertheless, we had fun, and we set a limit on our losses. However, we did visit other casinos, and we got to see one magic show at the Tropicana. We also booked a one day bus trip to the Grand Canyon, and we visited their latest attraction, the SkyWalk. It's a little bit scary looking down, and some people got a sense of vertigo. We would be pleased to stay at this hotel again, however, we like to try different hotels each year.

Reviews.Title: “New York New York was great”
Reviews.Author: mattwilcox11
Reviews.Content: The Hotel its self was great! This was our first visit to Las Vegas and it was a great location to be at. We had MGM Grand, Mandalay Bay, Tropicana, Excalaber, and Luxor all really close to us. Ny,Ny had a real "fun" vibe to it. The room wasn't anything special but we didn't spend a whole lot of time there. Staff was friendly for the most part. We had a couple bad dealers late at night/early in the morning. They just acted like they didn't want to be there. Other than that it was great. Lots of food close by. Has a pool but not a very good one. I would stay there again for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: filibelle29
Reviews.Content: It was the first time I went to LV with my bf. The room was bigger than I expected, amenities nice, the bed very comfy and the view amazing. The only thing I was disapointted in was the fact that there was no turn down service... The F&B outlets were nice and offered lots of choices, abit expensive though, I guess it was just LV! If I go back to LV, I would go somewhere else though, just to discover other crazy hotels

Reviews.Title: “Good times at the NY-NY”
Reviews.Author: TheDoorman
Reviews.Content: Had a nice stay. There is a lot of walking, it's a big place. But we didn't mind. Gambled a little and the casino was very nice and we enjoyed excellent service. I was in a Broadway Deluxe, a corner room and it was huge. There were some weird nooks and crannies in the room. Seems like that and the large size compared to the other Broadway Deluxe rooms was due to it being a corner. Water pressure was so-so, but the bathroom was nice. Bed was comfortable. Not the greatest view (overlooked the roof) but the room was nice. I've heard some people say the floodlights from the roof of the hotel bothered them. If you work the curtains right, you can't see your hand in front of your face. Food was good. Chin-Chin breakfast buffet was adequate and we ate and drank at America a couple of times. I would stay there again. The price you pay for the room is directly related to how busy Vegas is that week or weekend. We were there the week leading up to the DeLaHoya-Merriweather fight and the Kentucky Derby. In my opinion, the rooms were still reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it in LV”
Reviews.Author: R0adTrip
Reviews.Content: Thoroughly enjoyed my stay. Used the Manhattan Nights upgrade, room was well decorated, clean and hospitable. Location convenient and amenities great.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and amenities”
Reviews.Author: airplanegeek
Reviews.Content: Chose NYNY for its location and value. Always check for promotions on hotel websites. I booked promotion rate directly through hotel which was $10 less than just booking a room. Promotion included room upgrade, 2 roller coaster passes, 2 for 1 breakfast, 2 for 1 lunch, and 2 free drinks at one of the bars. That's quite the deal! Room and bathroom were clean and spacious. Bed was comfy, but what bed isn't when finally laying down at 4am? Windows do not open, but there is a small vent to open for outside air. We were on the 10th floor facing the roller coaster, Tropicana, and airport. I regret not asking for a higher floor--10th floor was only about 5 floors above casino roof (room 1042). Casino floor is layed out great with a wide variety of eateries. When you're done losing quarters, head to the enormous arcade for a change of pace. The roller coaster is $12.50/person or about $25 for an all-day pass. It's a great ride and there was no line on our Tuesday afternoon visit. We checked out at 11am, but our flight wasn't until 10pm. Wish we would've thought to ask someone about lockers. FYI, they're on the same floor as the arcade and roller coaster. Wearing your backpack all day is not cool.

Reviews.Title: “Just like New York - and that's not good!”
Reviews.Author: JSF.IN.UK
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel for the last night of our honeymoon. True New York style in Vegas. Rude gum chewing staff, dirty and expensive restaurants, too many low end eateries selling junk food, noisy, over-crowded, room keys that stopped working, valet parking that took forever to get the car. Just like the real thing! It also must have the smallest pool of any Vegas hotel which being so close to the building means no sun until around noon and all sunbeds taken. On the plus side, the large room with jacuzzi was fabulous and the roller coaster was great fun. There are many better hotels in Vegas and this is not a place we would return to.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you need at one hotel (almost)”
Reviews.Author: swirlyturtle
Reviews.Content: First trip to Vegas ever for a girls' weekend and stayed at New York New York based on internet deals and reviews... and we loved it! Service was friendly, had a blast at the piano bar, screamed our lungs out (in a good way) on the roller coaster, and enjoyed a delicious, reasonably priced meal (and a massive margarita) at Gonzales y Gonzales. The main floor of the hotel is set up to look like NY city streets and had a great, friendly vibe. We saw the sights at the other casinos on the strip, but it was always nice to come back to NY NY. It had almost everything right there. Only negatives are: 1.) there really isn't any shopping in the hotel other than cheap souvenir shops, and 2.) the tall hotel blocks the sun by the pool area until about noon. The pool area gets very busy, and you have to go early to get a good chair (or a chair at all), but you end up sitting in the shade for an hour waiting for the sun to move beyond the building. All in all, the positives far outweighed the negatives and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the roller coaster!”
Reviews.Author: SmallBoatCruiser
Reviews.Content: I spent a few days in Las Vegas for a conference at the Mandalay Bay. I'm not a gambler, Vegas-type of person but appreciated the chance to see it once. All the fake, cheesy stuff is a hoot! The room was nice--with a view of a section of the roller coaster and the back of Lady Liberty's head! Il Fornaio (spelling?) bakery was wonderful and that restaurant was very good. Gallagher's steak house was good but over-priced. But, they're not alone in that--everything seemed over-priced. The indoor, New York village stuff was fun but got old after the first couple of days. Staff were helpful -- I had to get some medical attention while there (broken toe) and they were very helpful and pleasant about it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: FloridaSheTraveler
Reviews.Content: Because the front desk is right in the middle of the casino, checking in and out with baggage is kind of a hassle. The line doesn't always stay organized, but it moved pretty quickly. Our room was standard and our window faced the back side of the hotel, so our highlight was an occasional glimpse at the passing roller coaster. The room was large and the bathroom was very nice and modern. This was my first time in Vegas and I thought the hotel was perfect. There is a lot of activity with bars, restaurants and clubs (plus a roller coaster). I felt that the 24-7 feel of Vegas was really strong in this hotel (I've been in others since that feel a little dead). Location is good, it is at the end of the strip, but you're within short walking distance to 4 or 5 other casinos. When you come out of this hotel, you're right on the strip. You can take a walkway straight over to MGM, Tropicana and the Luxor.

Reviews.Title: “We loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: OlafR
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel after reviewing prices and reviews of a couple of strip hotels and were not disappointed. We booked one double-room for our two kids with strip view and one other to the back which was cheaper. We told them both must be at least on the same floor as we are a family. The check-in lady started telling us she has no such rooms on the same floor. After a short discussion and asking the manager we got two strip-view rooms on the same floor. Good service. Both rooms were standard 4star. clean. relatively spacious. nothing to complain. We particularly liked this hotel for its theme which is NY and how this was implemented.

Reviews.Title: “A Lot Bettter than Expected”
Reviews.Author: Robnieka
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel from April 15-18th 2007 and had a really good time. Don't believe all of the negative reviews. Below is my unbiased opinion. Positives: The checkin was really quick. There was no line and we were in our room within a few minutes. We stayed in the Park Avenue tower and the room was adequate. I don't think the hotel is on the same level with the Wynn, Mirage or Venitian in terms of the room size and decor, but its much better than a lot of other hotels on the strip (think Excalibor, Bally's). I liked that the casino was loud. We went over to the MGM and it was so boring that we ran back to New York. I went to a lot of different casinos but this one seemed to have the best slots. There were plenty of restaurants to choose from and there always seemed to be something going on. Negatives: When we arrived there were room service carts of dirty dishes outside rooms. This was 3:00pm. The next morning those same carts were still there except someone had covered them with linen. Room service could have done a much better job of taking care of this. Also, beware of Gallaghers Steakhouse. The hotel advertises it as its best restaurant. The food isn't bad, but the service is terrible. First this is an upscale restaurant. We had 5:15 reservations. When we first arrived we had soup and salad within 10 minutes. At about 6:10pm we had yet to get the main entree. By this time the restaurant is crowded and everyone that came after us is already eating. When we asked what was taking our order so long the manager tells us that we should have had our food twenty mintues earlier. We then told him that we were leaving b/c we were trying to catch a show. Instead of apologizing for the restaurants mistake he gives us a $35 bill for the soup and salad.

Reviews.Title: “New York New York!”
Reviews.Author: kikira
Reviews.Content: wow! What a place. First time in Vegas and was not disappointed. This hotel needs to be seen to be believed. The rooms were perfectly sufficient for what we wanted. The facilites on site were amazing. Rollercoaster, pubs, casino, coyote ugly bar, magic...u name it! Would definitly recommend this hotel to anybody travelling to Vegas

Reviews.Title: “A Fine Hotel”
Reviews.Author: pretagreg
Reviews.Content: Our room was apparently a standard room, perhaps even their least-fancy. Your basic hotel room, for a 4-star hotel. All the normal things you would expect, hair dryer, iron and ironing board, large TV, wired and wireless Internet (at $12 per day extra). The room safe was absurdly small, not even large enough to hold a normal laptop computer. There appears to be four towers, each with their own elevators, although the layout is somewhat confusing. Probably more expensive rooms had more exclusive elevators or something - we had to walk a *really* long distance from the elevator to our room (which was, admittedly, at the very end of the absurdly long corridor). My wife said we were eight blocks from the elevator, and that is not much of an exaggeration. The tradeoff is that it was completely silent - no noise in the hallway, or from above. Good news for non-smokers - Nevada now has very strict no smoking rules in place, which made the majority of the public areas breathable. Unfortunately, they still allow smoking in the casino itself, but compared to previous trips, this was an acceptable compromise. It was easy to get to most eating areas without clogging our lungs in the process. The only thing to be careful of now is the time-share sales folk, who station themselves at a strategic choke point where it is hard to avoid them. That is pretty much the case in any casino we visited. NYNY has a good selection of cheap eateries, and several nice ones as well. The casino seemed as good as any other. Check in and out was fast and efficient. They had a large arcade, and of course a great looking roller coaster which we were not brave enough to try ourselves, although the people riding it sure seemed to be having fun. This place compares well to other nice hotels on the strip (better than TI, about the same as Paris, less good than Venetian). Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “NY NY - Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: ABostonTraveler
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Las Vegas on March 31st and stayed at Bally's the first night mainly because of the better Saturday night rate ($159 on their website). We moved to NY NY the morning of April 1st where we booked a room on their website for 3 nights and were given a rate of $99 per night with an upgrade through their 5th Avenue promotion. I did a lot of research and read a lot of reviews before booking. NY NY did not disappoint. We were on the 21st floor of the Century Tower (Room 2170). Great views of the strip. The hotel is centrally located and offers relatively easy access to many of the surrounding casinos. The tables and slots were not as friendly as some of the other casinos and some of the dealers needed a personality transplant, but overall the experience was a very positive one. I would definitely recommend you travel during off-peak when rates are lower and there are no major conventions in town.

Reviews.Title: “Loved NY NY LV”
Reviews.Author: Amyo2
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at NY NY Vegas - we traveled with 2 other couples and had a blast. Danced all night at Coyote Ugly & rested pool side all day. The only downside was the towers covering the sun for the earlier part of the day.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Casino! No regrets!”
Reviews.Author: design51
Reviews.Content: I think that this hotel was wonderful. I REALLY feel that they have the BEST casino of all.... The casino is sooo much fun, and is so lively all the time. The other casinos were so boring that we would go to, and we always wanted to go back to our hotel casino! Definitely the best! The rooms are nice, I am a pretty picky person, and I was not unhappy with the room- It was clean (thats very important to me), and it was very nice too. I am an interior designer, and I believe we stayed in the Park Avenue room which is just what a typical contemporary room looks like in Manhattan- very clean lined, simplistic,nothing spectacular, but still very nice .The inside of the hotel where the casino is, is really unbelievable they way that they replicate the city, they even installed pot holes that smoke comes out of! Everything really amazed me when I walked through the hotel, how much thought was put into everything in their casino. The ONE thing I don't recommend is their roller coaster- it was one of the worst experiences of my life- no joke! It was terrible and scary and painful and please do not go on it! I love all roller coasters, I go on them all, and this one was horrible. Great hotel, and I was so happy I chose to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “New york New york and nascar weekend.”
Reviews.Author: empey
Reviews.Content: Spent Mar 7-Mar 14 in Las vegas. Stayed at New York New York. Room was great. Very clean, very quiet. The beds were very comfortable(most comfortable hotel bed that I have ever slept in) Well worth the money. Restaurants. We ate at most of the restaurants (at New york New york)over the week we were there. Nine Fine Irishmen( second best meal of the week) Gallagher's Steak house was OK but nothing spectacular. Il Fornaio Best meal of the week. If you love Italian food, this is the place to go. The Nascar Race was wonderful. Something you want to do at least once. The weather was phenomenal. The LVMS is a primo sports venue. We booked the hotel race package through Premiere Sports and have nothing but GOOD to say about them The entire process was straightforward and painless. Chad went above and beyond helping us book things. Overall the entire trip was great. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid the New York-New York”
Reviews.Author: ODU2K1
Reviews.Content: I was a guest in your hotel from September 25th – 29th, 2003. I had very high hopes upon arrival that started taking hits immediately when I arrived at the check in desk. I had reserved a non-smoking Broadway Deluxe room. When I tried to check in I was informed that a non-smoking Broadway Deluxe was not available and that I was going to be put in a smoking room. This is a large problem being that the package I paid for included a Broadway Deluxe non-smoking room. I down graded to a Skyline room for one night with the guarantee of being moved the next day by the manager on duty. I had to push to get something in way of compensation for this downgrade and inconvenience. The most the manager was willing to offer me was two drink coupons per person. While it was a nice token the fact that I had to push to get it diminished the good will value. I was moved the next day but I had to move my luggage myself down one tower through the casino and into my new room. In addition to the difficulty I had with my room I also had an unpleasant experience in the casino. I found the blackjack dealers to be rather rude and unfriendly. The slot attendants were few and far between and not once was I asked if I would like a drink while playing the slots or blackjack. I had a much better experience at your sister hotel across the street. The casinos personal at the MGM Grand were much nicer and really seemed to value by business at their casino. The bright spots of your hotel were the staff in the restaurants and housekeeping. Your housekeepers kept my room very clean and were always done when came back from breakfast. The restaurant staff was particularly good. The Friday night of my stay (September 26th) my party of seven had a great meal and time at Gonzalez Y Gonzalez. Lisa was our server and she was amazing. She not only handeled my large group of people with ease but she was lot of fun too. The Sunday (September 28th) of my stay my party of five enjoyed lunch at the ESPN Zone during the Redskins game. Chris was our server and he was great at well. Not only did he take care of us during the game but he also managed to pick up a few bars of “Hail To The Redskins” with me.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: clees
Reviews.Content: Rooms are stunning, Food was great, lots of choices, Personnel went out of thier way to be helpful

Reviews.Title: “This place is so much fun!”
Reviews.Author: goldnchief
Reviews.Content: This was my 5th and my husband's 4th trip to Las Vegas. We have stayed at a different place each time. So far, New York New York is our favorite. We stayed in a basic Park Avenue room with two queen beds. The room was average in size with a really nice newly renovated bathroom. My husband couldn't say enough about the shower! The beds were very comfortable. The staff from the casino pit bosses to the cleaning crew to the restuarant servers were always polite and friendly. The breakfast at the America restaurant was delicious (dinner was just okay). ESPN zone was a lot of fun with good sports-bar food, and the mexican restaurant was amazing. The casino is just fun! There is a dueling piano bar that is the place to be from 8pm-5am. My husband played lots of roulette (without having to make numerous trips to the ATM ;) ). Even though we like to stay in different places, we both agreed that we would really think about staying here again and again. Like you may read in other reviews -- it does smell like fresh apples.

Reviews.Title: “2006 great time with soon to be wife”
Reviews.Author: csully123
Reviews.Content: we went to vegas in april of 06 had a wonder time. i would reccomend the frst thing that you do after you check in is sign up for the points program...wow we brought a ton of money figuring between gambling and eating we would be spending a lot...end up gambling so much we were able to eat ever night there (7nights) in the hotel for free even had some points left over for next time. also i have see some that say there pool is kinda smal but we thought it was perfect size our 2nd to last day there we decided to stay at the pool so we bought there pool side package, which include two nice reclining chairs, a large bucket of snacks, several towels and some drinks...this is the way to go when sitting by the pool all day. One thing i think i wasnt impressed with was we choose to have a limo pick us up at the airport and i found that if your plan lands late as ours did then its not worth the money for the limo...the drivers have set times when they have to be places to our drive very quickly drove us to the hotel in about a 10min time frame....take a cab theres plenty. we will be going back towards the end of the year and might stay at the new york again or accross the street at the mgm.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and room, bustling casino”
Reviews.Author: callt
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the New York tower on the 16th floor for three nights. I booked the Skyline room (the least expensive), but this room had the more modern furnishings and marble bath, so I think we were upgraded to the Park Avenue Deluxe. The room was on the small side, but it was very nice. Check-in on a Saturday at noon took about five minutes. The hotel staff was very pleasant and helpful each time we needed any kind of service. We visited many other hotel/casinos while we were in Las Vegas and New York, New York seemed to be one of the most loud and crowded casinos. If you're looking for something a little less busy, you may want to consider some of the other hotels. The Luxor and Monte Carlo seemed to offer a little bit more breathing room in the same general price category. It's very easy to get to several other hotels from this one. You can use the short walkway over to the Excalibur. And from there you can get on a free tram that will take you to Luxor or Mandalay Bay. We did this on two separate days and it was nice to get away from the crowds at New York, New York. You're also right across from the MGM and next to the Monte Carlo. All in all, if you want to be in a hotel that has a lot of action I would definitely recommend New York, New York.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KeenTraveler84
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the New York New York Hotel for three nights. We got a great deal direct through their website and got the “Manhattan nights” deal so got a Park Avenue room upgrade along with some free drinks, 2-4-1 breakfast/lunch, Spa passes and rollercoaster tickets. We cued at check in for about 10minutes which isn’t bad for Vegas, and the staff were all very friendly. The room was nice and clean, the bathroom was very standard and nothing special. The room was a bout a 5min walk from the elevators but this didn’t really bother us. For the money it was a nice room. See attached Pictures. There are so many restaurants to choose from all at reasonable prices and the atmosphere at this Hotel is great, very lively and entertaining. The Hotel is in a good location with MGM being opposite, Luxor, Excalibur and Mandalay Bay (linked by a tram from Excalibur) all being close by. It is a bit of a walk from the main Hotels on the strip such as the Bellagio, Casears Palace and so on but there are plenty of transport options. I would recommend the Deuce because although the monorail skips the traffic you have to walk miles to get to the monorail station at the Hotel's as the stations are usually at the back of the Hotels. Also the Deuce is a lot cheaper. For the money it was a great hotel but if I go back to Vegas I would probably stay at another Hotel such as the MGM Grand or the Luxor.

Reviews.Title: “apple of our eyes”
Reviews.Author: togetherathon
Reviews.Content: My partner and i suprised my parents with a pre christmas trip to las vegas.We had heard great reviews from our co-workers in the airline industry on the new york new york.When we arrived we were very glad we had chosen it. All four of our necks were sore from trying to take in all the sights on the journey from car park to reception desk. Check in was quick and easy and the lady behind the desk was friendly and showed us on the hotel map the way to our rooms as the hotel is really THAT big. Our room was nice,clean,furnished with everything you need for your stay.My parents were equally happy with their room. Despite the vast amounts of guests and tourists around none of us were disturbed during the night by noise. You could easily spend your whole holiday exploring the hotel it is massive and has a huge selection of eating/drinking places. It really is worth a visit and all four of us recommend it to anyone who wants to viva los vegas.

Reviews.Title: “The most fun we have had on vacation!”
Reviews.Author: SpringChickenChicago
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Vegas during the Nascar races, which did make things a little busy, but over all we had one of the best experiences. We arrived at NY NY at noon and was greeted by a very friendly and helpful bell boy. Because check in is at 4pm he took our luggage for us and brought it to our room once we checked in. Our first impression of the hotel and staff was very pleasing. We had lunch at Gonzales Y Gonzales which had the very best shrimp tacos we ever had! Then we had a cocktail at the Big Apple Bar and relaxed until it was time to check in. The only issue we had was that the front desk was a bit on the shady side. We checked in at 3:30 and the receptionist was not very experienced. We had reservations for a Broadway deluxe, non-smoking-king room, but was told that the computer showed smoking with two queen beds. I had called the hotel a month prior to this vacation just to confirm that our reservation was indeeded what I had requested and it was. ( I read a review on Trip Advisor on NY NY and that check in was a issue ). So I was not happy with the service and greeting at the check-in desk. We settled for a Non-smoking w/Two queens. The hotel did return $32 to us because of the mistake. The rooms are ok.....nothing too fancy, but the beds are the most comfortable! The rest of the hotel was awesome. I would recommend NY NY to young couples looking to have fun in Vegas! Just a warning...don't take your first impression of the hotel from the check-in desk.

Reviews.Title: “So average they named it twice!”
Reviews.Author: -=BigDUK=-
Reviews.Content: We stayed from 22 Feb to 1 Mar this year. Booked direct through their website and got the “Manhattan nights” deal so got a Park Avenue room upgrade along with some free drinks, 2-4-1 breakfast/lunch, Spa passes and rollercoaster tickets. The check in was fine, queue wasn’t bad, we’d arrived early but got a room no problem. Loved the apple smell every where!! Room was on the 33rd floor and was spacious, clean, well maintained and modern (was a wheelchair accessible room and was equipped with the usual rails and bating seat in bathroom and there was plenty of space to manoeuvre through out). It was fairly quite, no rollercoaster noise. Got woke up once by noisy neighbours but nothing unexpected (we did have an adjoining door) especially on a Saturday night. The views weren’t too bad either the temp control was a bit rubbish but nothing unbearable. We ate at Gallagher’s, Gonzalez Y Gonzalez, America, Il Fornaio and some of the Village Eateries. The Surf and Turf at Gallaghers was great and never had a bad meal at any of the restaurants, the service in America was a bit slow but every where else it was spot on and the waiter/ress were helpful. Had a drink in Nine Fine Irishmen, they had a decent selection of draught beer and was nice place to drink, the bands at the Big Apple bar were good to watch too. The roller coaster was loads of fun, had to tell my girlfriend about the ride as she had her eyes shut all the way round, the Coney Island amusements were a welcome break from the slots, with enough to keep any (big!) kid entertained. Only scored 3* as there wasn’t anything that jumped out as extraordinary. It exactly what we expected from any hotel, I was going to give it 4* just for the novelty of the New York theme! I’d recommend it to anyone one, but with so much choice, I’d probably try somewhere else next time.

Reviews.Title: “NY-NY Hotel and Casino”
Reviews.Author: Kimmy629
Reviews.Content: First time staying here - really enjoyed the hotel and casino. The staff was very friendly and helpful, room was clean and kept that way our entire stay. We had one concern with a broken showerhead, but it was fixed very quickly. The casino had lot's to offer and there were more than enough places to eat. Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Good Bang for you buck!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: jt650
Reviews.Content: Me and my girlfriend wanted to go to Vegas for spring break and we found that the new york new york gave a reasonable price for its location. For 3 nights, we spent 359(us) tax included which was one of the better price. the aladdin cost around 130 more and we were gald we did not go cause it was all under construction and it looked like hell to go in and out. The new york new york was fun....restaurants inside resembled those found in new york, the room was very nice, the bathroom was amazing however there was no water pressure in the shower. also we were right across the street from the mgm grand, the excalibur and a 10-15 min walk to the mirage,teasure island and all the others. the area was extremly safe and we had a blast.......the one thing i am super happy about, is that we were going to stay at the stratosphere cause it was cheap, yet we read a review and it said the area was a bit shaddy, so we asked the taxi driver about the stratosphere on the way to the new york new york and he even said taxi drivers wont pick people up at night in that area, unless they were close to the hotel and where cameras can see them.....also the stratosphere is extremly far from the major strip, it is the last hotel and extremly far from the airport aswell. all in all if we go back new york new york would be in the top 5 in our list..........would like to try the belagio but it sooooo expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special”
Reviews.Author: kenCalgary
Reviews.Content: We decided on this hotel because of its location and what was available. It was a nice hotel, but when in Vegas, how much time do you actually spend in the room ????? When we booked the room, we specified a room connected to our friends that was non smoking and king bed if possible. We were intially in a smoking room on another floor. The best they could do was a room with double beds on the same floor. The room was nothing special. Clean and comfortable. All we needed for the amount of time we spent in it.Not too happy, but not that concerned. As far as I am concerned, not a big enough issue to ruin the vacation. What I did not like was the fact that there were two rude 20 something people smoking in the only servicable elevator. No real way to control this. The casino I found to be very smoky compared to others. was it worth the money ? not really but I am sure the other hotels cost around the same and have their problems too. All hotels in Vegas are overpriced. The staff was very helpful so that made a difference.

Reviews.Title: “Dusty Bunny Haven”
Reviews.Author: piepie123
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my family in September 2006 and the casino was very nice looking, but the service and room was terrible. We payed extra money to stay here than at monte carlo because they said we would get a fridge, but when we got there they said you had to pay $40 for a fridge and it was a "first come first serve basis." Our room was dirty, the safe was broke, you could see clumps and what seemed like miles of dust in the vents, and the maids were very very rude people. And it was confusing trying to get around from elevator to elevator.

Reviews.Title: “A Little Overpriced, but Still Good”
Reviews.Author: vegasnut72
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the NYNY in my first trip to Vegas. I liked the hotel a lot. Positives- Location, in-room safe, nice rooms, friendly staff, everything is centralized, rooms aren't far from check-in. Negatives- Small sportsbook and don't expect comps. I really enjoyed my stay at the NYNY, but I will not likely stay again. There are nice places to stay for the same amount or less like the Monte Carlo right next door or Treasure Island. There are so many nice hotels, I'll stay somewhere else and visit the NYNY.

Reviews.Title: “A real diamond”
Reviews.Author: repb9
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel after reading the great reviews on here about the party theme. We got a further $20 per night discount due to being the armed forces. The rooms are pretty much like any other hotel and where presented to a good standard we did not encounter any problems with lack of water pressure or poor standard of towels like others have reported on here. The rooms where clean and beds made on a daily basis anyway you get the picture. Overall great rooms clean and as described. There was always something happening in our hotel never a dull moment, it was great unlike other hotels visited on the strip seemed some what quiter. The Duelling piano bar which is in the hotel, was one of our nightly haunts, really good atmosphere in there with spirits priced around $8 each, great bar with great lively music, a must. Then there is Coyote ugly bar another must, not as good as the Pianos although they have good deals on during happy hour. Gallagher's which is a Steak house in the hotel, the steaks are out of this world, priced around $40 they are to die for, you really have to try one! Over all people, this hotel was great to stay at, if you want to know anything more about this place just drop me an e mail.

Reviews.Title: “loved new york new york”
Reviews.Author: audia
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel from 3rd feb until the 8th and couldnt really say a bad word about it. We arrived at half past eight on a sat nite and check in took about 2 mins and the staff were really friendly. Asked if there were any upgrades and they said no so we put our name down for one. When we got to the room it was really nice and big, we were on the fifth floor and you could hear the rollercoaster but it wasnt too bad. The next day we were told that we cud have a room we went down for the key and they said to pay when we check out. We went to our room which was on the 12th floor in a spa suite, it was really big but behind the bathroom door there was a dirty towel and papers. We got into the spa and within 2 mins the fone rang and asked us to cum down and pay for the upgrade we said we wud be down in half an hour and then got into the tub and the fone rang again asking for the same thing!!! The hotel was lovely and smelt like apples. The only bad things i would say wud be the dirty towel, the long track from the lift to our room and that the hotel is abit too far from all the action. We were so tired of walking but all in all i would recommend it!!!

Reviews.Title: “What a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: redimp
Reviews.Content: Arrived in lv Saturday afternoon 20.01 to a cool but sunny day.Found a taxi no problem who took us to nyny without any problems of the tunnel ( read so much about it, wish i'd seen it). Check in was smooth and got the non smoking rooms i had e-mailed for with out any problems.The room ( two double beds ) was great . Not the best view i've ever seen but i didn't spend much time looking out the window.The hotel itself was great, from the polite staff to the great food in all the restaurants.I would have no second thoughts on using this hotel again it was just brilliant.If you have any questions on the hotel or lv please e-mail me..........buzzer.bee@ntlworld.com

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed NYNY”
Reviews.Author: Mr&MrsHinMN
Reviews.Content: We stayed at NYNY from Jan. 28th through Feb. 1st, 2007. The cab ride from the airport was $12 including tip. We arrived at the hotel about 9 am and there was only one person checking in ahead of us. At check in we were offered an upgrade of $15 per night for a room with a view of the stirp. We took it. We stayed in the Empire Tower in room 3412 in a Park Avenue Deluxe room. We had a view of Excalibur, Tropicana, the airport and mountains beyond and MGM. For us, it was worth the extra $15 per night. The view was really amazing at night. The room was recently remodeled. King size bed, 2 nice living room type chairs, an ottoman, a desk and upholstered desk chair, nightstands on both sides of the bed, and a huge armoire with the TV inside. There was also a padded suitcase rack next to the armoire. All furniture was in very good shape and contemporary. The bathroom was all marble tile and had glass doors. There was a pull-out make-up mirror and hairdryer mounted on the wall. Great water pressure and plenty of hot water. Fresh towels every day. Now, about the roller coaster. We vented the windows for fresh air and could hear the roller coaster, but it's only open from 11 am to 11pm (Sunday-Thursday), so we were hardly in our room while it was operating. If we closed the windows, we could barely hear it. It didn't bother us at all. The hotel decor is fantastic. It really looks like NY inside and out. When you enter the hotel, it smells like apples. The door handles are the shape of the Statute of Liberty torch. In the casual dining area, it looks like SoHo village, and other NY areas, complete with laundry hanging overhead, fire escape ladders, and steam coming out the manhole covers. We had margaritas at the Mexican place and sat at the bar. Great service, friendly bartenders, and great margaritas. We had coffee every day from Starbucks which tasted just like it did at home. We also ate at the Fish and Chips place, the 24 hour place called America, and had a small breakfast wtih fruit and pastries at the Il Fornino Cafe. All of them had good food and great service. No complaints. We spent one night at The Bar at Times Square to see the dueling pianos. The piano music starts at 8 pm. It cost $15 per person to sit at a table, but standing in the bar area was free. We paid to sit at a table and were glad we did. We stayed for 4 hours so it was worth it. The waitress told us the cost of drinks increased after 8 pm. Two rum and cokes before 8pm were $12.50, after 8pm, the same 2 drinks were $14.50. Since we knew about it, it was okay with us. Just before 8pm, the waitress came over and asked if we wanted another round before the price went up, which we thought was really nice of her and not expected. The musicians were fantastic and I can't rave enough about how much fun it was. We loved our stay at NYNY and would not hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Room is great, Casino is not..”
Reviews.Author: chad2001
Reviews.Content: The room we had at the NY-NY hotel and casino was great, relatively small (by Vegas standard) but was modern, extremely clean and quiet. It would probably feel cramped if we had 4 people sharing the room, it was fine for just the 2 of us. Valet parking was efficient, we never had to wait for more than 10 minutes for our car. The casino, however, felt very crowded and smoky. The air ventilation system at the casino level did not seem to be working well.

Reviews.Title: “okay, but not great”
Reviews.Author: happytxtraveler
Reviews.Content: Spent one comped night at NYNY after staying at MGM Grand for three nights. Can't complain much about a free room, but I will say there is a distinct step down in the quality of furnishings and finishes from MGM to NYNY. We stayed in a Broadway Deluxe room. Bathroom was small. Bed was not terribly comfortable. Staff at check-in was very nice. Enjoyed the casino very much, particularly rapid roulette. Great fun. Ate at Gonzales y Gonzales. Food was okay. Service adequate if a little slow. I would say the quality of the room was on par with a La Quinta or Holiday Inn. Nothing special, but not horrible either.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome place to stay”
Reviews.Author: AngelCanada
Reviews.Content: New York New York was awesome. Great food, fun place to hang out. The rooms were nice and clean. I loved all the little cafes to eat at. Great way to save a bit of money because Vegas can be quiet expensive. The pool was quiet small, did not like it very much. Also Coyote Ugly is a total rip off. $20 per person to get in and there is no seating and you get in to trouble if you stand to close to the bar and it is very crowded in there. Not worth the money. Better to chose some other bar to go to. Ghost bar at the Palms was awesome, great music and great view. Also Cirque de Soleil was in our hotel, but ran out of time to go see it. Will go next time though.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room..Great Rate....Priceless!!!”
Reviews.Author: JKBOPB
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 01/13-01/17/07 in Las Vegas. Originally planned the trip to stay for four nights at the Orleans based upon reviews on Trip Advisor (# 6 Best Place). While this is not entirely untrue the Orleans is great if you want a big room, easy to find your way in casino, and serious gamblers with very few frills at a really good price that is the place to stay (see Review on Orleans). We on the other hand felt the crowd and hotel did not match our expectations. We were there for getaway/romance/gambling/good meals and long walks on the strip. We decided to move to New York New York and had no trouble doing so with the assistance of great people in reservations at both the Orleans and NYNY. Since we booked directly with the hotel and it was not the High Season we were pleasantly surprised at the amount and type of rooms available to us for an average of $79 to $149 per night. We decided to go with the NYNY in a Spa Deluxe room in the Empire Tower on the 34th floor overlooking the mountains to the west. Great sunsets and a wonderful view. This room was above the Roller Coaster and was $129.00 per night (USD). It came with an extra large hot tub in the room, a king bed and the effect of 4 single windows that gave it a "Penthouse/Condo" feel. The mirrors that form the backsplash to the spa tub only enhanced the feeling of extra space in an already large room. There was a private two- person shower and toilet and a sink/closet combination behind the wall. The room/decor/carpet and appointments were clean, fashionable and eclectic. All in all the room was more than we could have hoped for at the last minute. The room was not readily available at 10:00 am but this is to be expected. We stored our bags with the bell desk and went about our day returning at 5:00 p.m. The room was ready and the bags brought to us within 5-10 minutes of calling. Room was cleaned upon our return each day no matter what time we left and what time we returned. All we had to do was put out the Privacy Please sign and we never so much as heard a peep from our hallway. It was very quiet and private. The service throughout the hotel and property, including the restaurants, shopping and staff were all very pleasant and professional. We were left wanting for nothing. The location is ideal and gives you access to 5 hotels with almost no outside walking needed by the use of footbridges and the connectivity of the Excalibur/Luxor/ Mandalay Bay. This was ideal as the weather was full sun for four days but 35 degrees (the coldest snap they have had in years in Vegas...the TV was referring to it as the Freeze of 2007). The dueling pianos was the best and a can't miss good time for those into singing and partying. The IL Formato restaurant was very nice Italian dining but the portions were small but moderately priced. Order your food with that in mind. Two Starbucks at both entrances and a few shops for items of need and gifts. If you are looking for shopping in a big way you need to look at the Venetian, Belaggio, Wynn and Caesars' Palace. We heard from friends who recently visited that the Delicatessen is really good but we ran out of time before we tried it. The pastrami sandwich is supposed to be "out of this world". If the Casino was smoky you would not have noticed. Very high ceilings and pumped in fragrance seemed to give each casino hotel a fresh, themed smell particular to each venue. All in all we were very impressed with the entire NYNY experience and feel that if you are a couple looking to get away for romance/time alone with nice meals and long walks with shopping and sightseeing Las Vegas is a very inexpensive option, even if you do not gamble. If you do gamble Vegas is your MECCA and if you are looking for activity, shows, party bars, non-stop action and great people watching then Vegas has something for everyone. We spent 5 days 4 nights in very nice hotels, roundtrip airfare, dinners and 1 show with some minor amounts of "try your luck" gambling and we spent $900-$1,000 total. A bargain for a quick getaway to reconnect with your spouse and to get away from the office. NOTE: For Families Vegas is a double-edged sword. On the one hand it is very exciting and lots to see during the day. Shopping and shows, food and walking seem to be the rule of the day but at night the families looked out of place on the strip with small children. We even noted a few brave people who mentioned the "insanity" of having your young children on the strip at midnight. Families with small children do not want to go in for the night at sunset but the kids are not allowed in the casinos and there are not many other options available and no viable options to utilize for the service of a "trusted" sitter type service. Better choice is to travel without the kids if "grandma" is available or to slant your day in favor of getting up earlier in the morning and turning in early for bed to take advantage of the daylight hours.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Experience Ever”
Reviews.Author: UCONN_Fan
Reviews.Content: When I read these horrible reviews, I usually brush them off as being written by someone who would find something wrong no matter what. I’m not that person. I’ve been traveling for over 30 years and have never been treated as badly as I was last weekend at New York New York. Because my wife and I were celebrating our anniversary we decided to stay on the strip in a luxury hotel. We reserved a three night stay in a king non-smoking room. At check-in we were told that there were only rooms with two queen beds left and they were all on smoking floors. The gentleman checking in assured us that it would only be for one night and there was nothing he could do. He told me that they give out the non-smoking rooms based on the time you check in and once there gone you are forced to take what’s left. He informed me that even though you specifically reserve a non-smoking room, there are no guarantees – read the fine print. After discussing moving us to another MGM property and other options (all impossible to do) for about 20 minutes, my wife asked to see a manager. When she informed him that she had health issues and would not stay in a smoking room, they miraculously found a non-smoking room on the 4th floor. It was not the type of room we paid for, but we were assured that if we stopped down in the morning we would be moved to an upgraded room for the remainder of our stay. The hallways on the fourth floor were worn and dingy and the room was reminiscent of a 1960’s motel. The carpeting was worn, the safe didn’t work and there was no remote control for the TV. The beds were very soft and uncomfortable and the view was of the side of the next building over. It was a horrible experience to say the least. When we went down the next morning and found the check-in clerk to move rooms, he informed us that he did have rooms to move us to, but he could not upgrade us to the next level of room (Broadway or a suite) because again they were all sold out. We indicated that we basically stayed in the broom closet for the previous night (he agreed with our description) and were promised an upgrade the next day. He politely said there was nothing he could do because everything was sold out. We asked him why he promised us something the night before that he now could not deliver. He did not have an answer so we asked to speak with a manager. What a mistake! He told us the manager’s name was Angela Turner, but I never was able verify. She came over and immediately started asking me questions like I was on trial. I explained the situation and she told me there was nothing she could do and she didn’t understand why we were upset. I told her that we expected a certain level of amenities in a 4 star hotel and we were placed in an inferior room. Her response was: “What give you the impression this is a 4 star hotel? It doesn’t say that on our web site does it?” She kept asking me what was wrong with the room knowing full well that they put us there as a last resort. She refused to do anything but explain to me why I was wrong. After about ten minutes of listening to her talk down to me we decided to just check out and move to another hotel. We went down the street to the Venetian and were treated like royalty. Other than the room the rest of the place was just ok. It doesn’t compare to places like the Venetian, Bellagio, MGM, Paris, Caesar’s etc. It is dark and smoky and hard to navigate through. I’d definitely move down the strip and stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “okay but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: libstar
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights, however two would have been enough. The rooms were adequate but nothing special. Would choose somewhere further down the strip next time. We had asked for a quiet room and it certainly was not noisy. A long queue to check in but it moved reasonably fast, impersonal service. But I guess this is to be expected in such a large hotel. The plug in the sink didn't work properly, but didn't think we would have got much support if we complained. Rooms a good size, but nothing special and uncomfortable pillows.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing stay at the NYNY Hotel and Casino”
Reviews.Author: Love2TravelWDM
Reviews.Content: We just got home from a 3 night stay at the New York New York Hotel and Casino. It was a very disappointing experience. We had reserved a non-smoking room with a king size bed. What we got was a smoking room with 2 double sized beds about 500 ft away from the only elevator that went to that floor. I woke up with a headache from smelling the smoky pillow all night so we requested a room change the next day. They had us move ourselves to a tiny room where only one person could walk around the room at a time. There was no table in the room and only one chair so we couldn't order room service. My husband had a conference so I brought my laptop so I could do some work from the room while he was away. However, the internet connection was so slow (and I tried 100 times within 3 days from both rooms) I was never able to download or upload anything to my work. I thought since I can't work I'll go have a manicure/pedicure. The pedicure chair was basically a folding chair up on a platform. Very uncomfortable and awkward and not a pleasant relaxing experience. The towel bar in the bathroom fell off when my husband hung his towel up the first day and there were remnants of a previous hotel guest in the bathroom. The floor hallways were so long that there were 2 ice/vending machine locations per floor. However, both water/pop vending machines on our floor were "Out of Order", very unfortunate when it's 5am and you want a drink of water and you don't want to go hunting on another floor for some water in your pajamas. I would highly recommend you consider another hotel if you are going to Vegas for business or pleasure. Also, we left our kids at home but I wouldn't recommend bringing children as there is nothing there for them to do.

Reviews.Title: “Not very pleasant!”
Reviews.Author: LvVegas
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night banck in November, the room we got was showing many signs of wear and tear, also small room, and non smoking with a very strong cigarrette smell. The elevators and the walk to the room also had a not very pleasant smell. I didn't like this hotel at all.

Reviews.Title: “Great weekend”
Reviews.Author: PK6
Reviews.Content: We booked 3 rooms for 5 women for a weekend stay from January 5-7. Check-in was efficient--much better than my stay at the Venetian a few months ago. We all stayed in the New Yorker Tower--Broadway Deluxe rooms. They were very spacious and well-appointed. The rooms were much nicer than I had expected for $169 per night. While my favorite hotel in Vegas is still Mandalay Bay, I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel. There were only 2 issues we had with the hotel: the heavy smoking most everywhere (yuck) and the Pepsi (we're Coke drinkers). We ate at the Italian and the Irish and Mexican restaurants. The food was great at all 3--especially the Irish restaurant. We especially enjoyed the music in the Apple Bar and the Irish Restaurant--fantastic entertainment. A few of our friends won money in the casino--a few hundred dollars. I'm not a gambler but enjoyed walking through the casino and the "neighborhoods" of New York. The location is perfect--we walked many miles up and down the strip, but we were close to everything we needed (including McDonalds for our beloved Coke). We're very happy with our decision to have stayed at New York/New York and would do it again for a fun weekend in a very pleasant setting with good food and entertainment.

Reviews.Title: “Just ok”
Reviews.Author: ayvc
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a deluxe room with a view of the rollercoaster/strip. Checking in was extremely slow with very few front desk clerks to assist the mass of people in line. Rooms were average, the bathroom was quite nice. The TV is very old and our remote didn't work half the time thus we couldn't check out via the TV. Our maid service was unpredictable, on one night our room wasn't cleaned until 5 pm and we had been out of the room the entire day. A minor inconvenience but we had to ask the manager to schedule a time for it to be cleaned because the maid forgot. The restaurants are good but the America restaurant service is extremely slow no matter what time of day it is. You get seated right away but the server is no rush to take or bring your order. Our major complaint is the time share sharks at the hotel. You can't walk to your room without being harassed several times a day. My suggestion is don't walk as a couple and you won't be targeted. I would stay at another MGM property on our next trip, the casino is pretty but didn't pay out well.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: cynlouhoo
Reviews.Content: This was a welcome change from the Excalibur, which we had to stay in for New Years Eve. The room at NYNY was supposedly a Park Avenue room, but we never were really sure if it was. It was a little on the small side, but the large bathroom/vanity area made up for that. The bed was VERY comfortable and the bathroom products were of a high quality--very nice. The TV was also nice....And, while we didn't pay for a view, we at least had a half decent one. The windows were quite small, but I realize that is part of the theme (new york office buidling). I think we were in the Chrysler building. Lots to do at the hotel and our fave restaurant (that we tried anyway) was Chin Chin's. The frozen Daquiri's outside of Coyote Ugly's was also a fave place. Of course the coaster was awesome too....not to be missed if you are into coasters. The only complaint I have...which probably relates to most Vegas hotels, is the high levels of smoke we were exposed to as non-smokers. Even though we had a non-smoking room, there was smoke in the halls, so we had very little fresh air.

Reviews.Title: “Ok but not great”
Reviews.Author: Gototoro
Reviews.Content: The hotel is ok overall. My complain would be that it takes too much time to walk from the elevator to the room. Parking is also quite a bit of walk from the main level. Our first room was HUGE in size but I think it is too big and the room seems empty without a lot of furniture. The 2nd room we had was in the right size and the decor was great. Just the shower was a bit slow... Anyway, no major complaints for the price we pay. We had the specials from the hotel for 79 & 99 a night. They have some good coupons for 2 for 1 breakfast and free roller coaster rides.

Reviews.Title: “Disapointed”
Reviews.Author: adscotland
Reviews.Content: Dec 14th 2006. We stayed in Park Ave Deluxe Room, which was great and have no complaints with the maid service, but some of the bar staffs attitude within this casino/hotel is not what I expected. They were arogant, unplesant and could not make their mind up what price 2 vodkas & coke was. In the piano bar, on the left hand side of the bar I was charged $2.00 more than on the right hand side of the bar (only 10 feet away). We asked for a dash of coke in our drinks and were told that they could not regulate the coke for a dash but would make the drink a double and then filled the glass up with coke anyway. If you make a telephone call do not use your room phone as the hotel charges 55% ontop of the telephone service provider. When I spoke to the reception regarding the price of the call, they said 55% was quite a reasonable charge, when I said I thought it was excessive he said they were cheaper than most of the European Hotels, which I can quite assure you they are not!

Reviews.Title: “cheap hotel”
Reviews.Author: collegemom2011
Reviews.Content: We had an "upgraded" room. It was bad. The linens and towels were very worn looking and seemed to be cheap ones. Our non-smoking room had a chair in it that was worn and had what appeared to be a singe mark on it. The bathroom had a broken hook on the door. We paid an extra $30 per night since we had a teenager with us, but they couldn't leave us any extra towels. We also had to listen to the roller coaster run all day and night until midnight. The restaurants were okay on food, but bad on service. After 11, nothing but a fast food pizza place was open. Good location on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “This is a really great hotel on the strip”
Reviews.Author: msp132
Reviews.Content: This was my third time to Vegas and first at NYNY Hotel. It was an extremely positive experience. Excellent location for travel up and down the strip and to and from the airport is 5 minutes. We had the Park Avenue Deluxe room (an upgrade you can usually get from a promotion they regularly offer) and it was spacious and comfortable. Furnishings were simple and modern, bathroom was fine (nothing special, but defnitely not bad at all) and the toiletries were spa-like. Gambling here is comfortable, too. Many tables were $10-$15, so we didn't feel compelled to leave as often as we might have if we were gambling at, say, the Bellagio or Venetian (with higher table minimums). Most of the dealers were very friendly, making it fun to pass the time (and lose money!). The restaurants here are pretty good, too. Eat breakfast at Il Fornaio for amazingly good Italian coffee and really good food. Nine Fine Irishmen is also good -- we had a coupon and were surprised by how yummy it was (above average bar food). America is fine for breakfast, too -- good bagel and lox at a reasonable price. We also ate at Chin Chin, which was not bad either -- but if you're looking for Asian, you're probably better off leaving the premises. The most disappointing food here is the fast food pizza across from the Bar at Times Square. Mediocre -- don't waste your time unless you're drunk and hungry (and nothing else is open). Speaking of the Bar at Times Square, dueling pianos are a fun act -- especially if you DON'T get stuck with the guys who will only play "requests" -- which is anything with $$ attached (and they prefer $20 bills). Even if you do place a "request," it doesn't guarantee airtime for your song. The show can be A LOT of fun, but they really can kill the mood if they spend half their time begging for $$. If you see the bald piano player and his partner at the pianos, stick around and watch -- they're worth it. The roller coaster is great -- maybe not worth the $12 though. Look for coupons or a freebie with your room booking.

Reviews.Title: “first time to vegas in 20+ years”
Reviews.Author: jon160
Reviews.Content: We had not been to Vegas in 20+ years. We weren't sure where to stay. We read the reviews, and picked NewYork, NewYork. It was a very good choice. We're 53, and we were joined by our 2 daughters, ages 21 and 24. Perfect location. In the center of everything. We ate at the Deli, the main 24-hour restaurant, America, and at an Irish restaurant, Nine Irish Fishermen, all on site. Each meal was excellent, and well-priced. What we found that we hadn't seen in ohter reviews: Valet service and parking was free. Both Walgreens and CVS have 24-hour stores within 2 blocks. (how many times would I have wanted to know this, in advance) I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Four 21 year old girls - we loved NYNY”
Reviews.Author: stacylynn008
Reviews.Content: We booked through an online travel site and got it for 70 bucks a night. Our room was good size, had plenty of places to put our stuff. It was in the "century tower" We rode the roller coaster - probably not worth the 12.50 but it was still fun. The village eateries gaves us a good choice of food to pick from - but we ate at other places as well- We went to coyote ugly and thought it was VERY small and overated - we would not have gone if we wouldn't have had the free passes. Their gifts shops were nice. Staff was nice as well - they even got us a humidifier so we could deal with the dry air. Overall it was perfect for our girls trip.

Reviews.Title: “Another nice stay at NYNY”
Reviews.Author: MTCSS
Reviews.Content: We like to stay at New York New York when we come to Vegas. This was a last minute trip and had no problems getting a room for the weekend. Check in was a breeze and the receptionist was very friendly and helpful. The room was in the Century tower but the elevator was in the New Yorker tower so it was a small hike from the elevator to the room on the 17th floor. The view from the room overlooked airport, roller coaster, MGM Grand and Tropicana. The roller coaster was not a problem for us. The room with a king was just right for us. The bathroom was smaller than usual, the door almost smacking the toilet when you walk in. The room and bathroom were very clean. The room included a wall safe and Internet for a steep fee. The bathroom toiletries included bar soap, shampoo, conditioner and hand lotion from their Spa. The one thing I wish they had in the rooms here would be a coffee maker.
