But then that would take away from their Room Service business.

Reviews.Title: “Viva Las Vegas!!!!”
Reviews.Author: KEITH TRAVEL AGENT
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at the New York New York at the end of November. The reception area was crowded but incredibly quick and efficient. We managed to get on a higher floor. It is true that the rooms are on the smaller side, but they have everything you need and our room was very clean. We had a view of the MGM Grand and the Tropicana opposite. The casino is very unusual with trees and a New York theme which is very impressive. We even won on the slots!!! which paid for our entire stay. All in all, we had a great time, and found that for the price, the hotel was more than good enough. We paid $79 a night which was a bargain.!!

Reviews.Title: “It's just a scam to get you there”
Reviews.Author: coolmom45
Reviews.Content: I received a postcard from them for three free nights in a spa suite and was told one was available so I booked it. But when we arrived we were told we were downgraded to a lower room because there were other people (who were high rollers) that wanted that room. I told them how unfair that was and we were there for my birthday (which we were) and that we booked this trip based on these reservations(which we did). The room we were given was just mediocre and I never intend on staying there again. The TV went off and on and there was no coffee maker. MGM is much nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty disappointing”
Reviews.Author: traveler987654321
Reviews.Content: The NYNY hotel has a nice themed casino, but the room I got was rather sub-par. The pillows were lumpy, the bedding cheap and crappy - the room was no better quality than a Day's Inn or something along those lines. The elevators were scattered throughout the casino, so I had to walk all the way around the casino floor just to get to my elevator. Also, the TV was small and all the way across the room (the room was big, but for no reason). I tried to check out in the morning on the TV, but the service was unavailable, so I had to go downstairs and wait in line. If I went back to Vegas, I would try a different hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Theme Hotel for "Disney" type experience, but....”
Reviews.Author: stilldancingat40
Reviews.Content: New York New York is a theme hotel. It is probably the most "Disney" type hotel on the strip with its real life like NY city streets and atmoshpere. The front desk was very pleasant as well as the hotel employees and cleaning staff. The rooms were extremely clean!! For the money, it was very pleasant and a great value!. However, if you are looking for a more elegant atmosphere, this is not the place. It is a more 20 something hotel that has lots going on in evening entertainment, but lacks the special level of service that is reserved for more elegant hotels. Next time, I would choose to stay at Bellagio or Ceasar's Palace a bit up the strip and a bit more sophisticated. I would not think twice about staying at NY NY if a theme hotel is what I wanted.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed with the Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KRS1971
Reviews.Content: Myself and two friends stayed at NY NY over Thanksgiving weekend in 2005. It took forever to check into the room. I was also disappointed with how dark the rooms were and how difficult it was to even find the elevators that took us to our rooms. Would not stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice getaway”
Reviews.Author: Taylor622
Reviews.Content: Need a quick getaway from the hassle of work, the hotel offered a deal that I couldn't refuse. Upgraded room a couple of drinks and admission to the Spa all for $70 dollars. Not a bad deal! Checked in Tuesday before Thanksgiving, no lines was done in less than 10 minutes. Upgrade my room to a Park Avenue Deluxe which was very nice and clean. Dinner that night was at ESPN Sports Zone which had the basketball games on that I wanted. Ended up at the The Bar at Times Square witch was a blast listen dueling pianos. The next morning went down to the Fitness center and had a nice workout. Fitness Center is a bit small but had good equipment and some free wieghts. Men locker room was great and relaxing. Check out was a breeze. All and all this was a great deal to get away, would highly suggest this hotel for a short getaway.

Reviews.Title: “This was great!”
Reviews.Author: adventurejane
Reviews.Content: We travelled to Las Vegas from Australia during November and our travel agent booked us in at New York New York. We had no idea what to expect. The place is big, glitzy, loud and busy. It was fun, full of life and we really enjoyed ourselves. Our room was small with a view of the roller coaster but it was fine. The bed was very comfortable. While we never actually had a meal at the hotel, I can highly recommend the pizza shop opposite the duelling piano bar for the 3am munchies!! The piano bar was always filled with people having a great time. The slots were fun and as good as any other casino we went too. While I was there I had my hair done at their salon for the Celine Dion concert. The staff were lovely and I was very pleased with the results. The great thing about this hotel is the location as well. It's just across the road from the MGM so if you want to take the monorail it's very easy. I found most of the places we liked were within walking distance of the NY NY so it was very handy. There's also a great pharmacy and convenience store a little way up the road and it's nice and close to the half price ticket coke bottle. The Duce bus is also just across the road, although we found it took forever to get up the strip on it. The monorail, while more expensive, was much better. I would like to try staying somewhere else next time just for a different experience but if you are looking for a nice hotel in a great location then you won't go wrong.

Reviews.Title: “Hated NYNY!!!”
Reviews.Author: macan_keren
Reviews.Content: ok, here goes.... 1. they gave us a room, far far from the elevator, at the farthest end, corner room next to exit stairs... i thought its ok, since we will be busy and just back to room to sleep...and i thought it will be quiet for less or no foot traffic..wow, i was wrong... around 3-4am, we were awaken from noise, its weird, we heard construction noise from the ceiling (above us), someone was hammering at regular interval ... wtf..who's dumb enough to give permission to work at those hours? can't they wait??? ppl were sleeping!!! plus, we can also heard the scream from the ppl in roller coaster, its a distance sound, but we could heard it..and its annoying...not just the scream, but the sound of the rail as well, the sound of the coaster riding up the rail...its sucks! 2. we complained in the morning, and we asked for a new room, we talked to one of the maid, and the maid suggested to sleep at lower levels..and we got lower level rooms... the room is a bit smaller, but I dont care as long as I can get a good nite sleep... and this time, its all ok, no sound, no hammering, no screaming, no rail sound, but in the morning when we were ready to check out with the TV... I followed the chk out instruction "...press MENU at your TV remote...", I grab the TV remote, and scream..."WTF, where's the damn MENU button???" yeah, they FORGOT to change the remote, our TV remote is still the original remote instead of the modified one... I am Las Vegas regulars, I stayed at most of the resorts there (Luxor, Venetian, Paris, MGM, Monte Carlo, Lady Luck, CircusCircus)... even CircusCircus has the right remote!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay and will return!”
Reviews.Author: nicmo9702
Reviews.Content: We have honestly never been happier with our stay in Vegas. We have stayed at Excalibur, Luxor, MGM, and Bally's and by far this was our favorite place to stay. We will certainly return to this hotel. We had a Park Ave room on the 15th floor and it was very nice, clean, and comfortable. We never had a problem hearing any neighbors or the roller coaster outside. I did hear it a few times in the day while we were briefly in our room but that is about it. Our room was made up in a timely fashion each day and the staff was very personable. We simply loved the environment, location, and there is so much to do! We loved the band ChickRock at the Big Apple Bar, had the finest dinner at IL Forniao, and a fun time at Nine Fine Irshimen. We will be returning to see Zumanity soon. The kids/adult area/game room or arcade was one of the nicest we have seen in Vegas. We always visit Bellagio and Ceaser's Palace for shopping and dining and it is quite a trek although the positive is that it is on the same side of the street. M&Ms world and Coca- Cola world is right across the street. we alos like the fact that we can gamble at NYNY, cross the bridge and be at MGM Grand or cross the bridge the other way and be at Excalibur.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: WellandGlos
Reviews.Content: Booked a four night stay at New York New York, Arrived at hotel a little early, well 2.30pm, was told by check in room was not ready but....if we waited a bit longer we could have smoking rooms, slightly annoying as we had just had an 11 hour flight!.. our party said no to smoking rooms as we had booked non smoking, we had to wait another hour but was upgraded to park avenue rooms. Room was very nice, clean, view of the roller coaster, didn't hear any noice from roller coaster. Staff were friendly. Good location, went to MGM grand most mornings for breakfast as its just across the road. Piano bar was great in our hotel. Would definateley stay in New York, New York again.

Reviews.Title: “Will stay at NYNY Las Vegas again!”
Reviews.Author: WestChesterGirl
Reviews.Content: This was our 3rd trip to LV - our 1st stay at NYNY. We arrived at 1:00 and was in our room by 1:15 (they say check-in time is 3:00). They offered us an upgrade to our Park Ave Room - for an add'l A$15.00 per night we could stay higher in the hotel with a strip view - we took the offer. The staff was very helpful and friendly. Room was clean with all the necessary amenities. Did not hear any noise at all from the Roller Coaster. Signed up for the Players Card that is good in at least 10 other casinos. When we checked out our cards we earned some $ back and our breakfast at the MGM Rainforest Cafe (charged to our room) was comped off our final bill. Was considering staying someone different on our 4th trip but probably will stay at NYNY again!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at New York New York”
Reviews.Author: farmer's wifey
Reviews.Content: We were four ladies in a regular room. A bit crowded but we were so busy were seldom there. Th e hotel's employee's were all very friendly and helpful. No complaint's there. Our check-in was prompt. Good eating places and nice atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: murphygreen
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived we loved this hotel. Check in was fast but they were out of non smoking rooms in the Skyline and I thought here we go! But to our surprise they upgraded us to a Park Avenue at the same price. The room was great and the view was wonderful too. We were on the corner with a veiw of MGM and Excaliber, and of the airport. My husband loves watching planes. It was very clean and the bathroom a good size. They also supply you with very good soaps and shampoos.The casino was very lively and full of young people. They were having a great time. The slots let us play and payed us fairily well (we came home with money and I call that winning). WE ate twice at Nine Fine Irishmen and both times were very good. We also ate at the Italian restaurant and it was also good. The pool was closed the day before we arrived and that was a bit dissappointing. We did lots of walking and saw Streisand and also Phantom of the Opera. We enjoyed both shows. When we checked out our comps payed for food and gift shop purchases. We would recommend this hotel to anyone going to Las Vegas. We have stayed at alot of the hotels on the strip and this was one of the best.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again.....”
Reviews.Author: PinkMrsJ
Reviews.Content: We had visitors in from England and took them to Vegas and having seen the impressive sight of NYNY previously, decided to give it a whirl. The central location was amazing and the inside was spectacular. It was clean and the facilities were nicely placed. However, the staff were not up to speed on the working of policies and there was contuinally a line for the front desk. The majority of staff were well trained but the minority ruined the whole operation. Which in itself was a shame. The desk manager eventually became involved and whilst apologies were made, the damage had been done. We would never recommend this hotel to anyone, there is better places on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Start spreading the news”
Reviews.Author: bryzo
Reviews.Content: What a place! Having been to vegas a couple of times and stayed at a few of the upper end hotels (money wise) it was great to come here and ENJOY. I cannot think of another reason to come to vegas and this is the enjoyment center of the enjoyment capital of the World. Like New York it is brash, fun, vibrant and as friendly as you can get in a place like Vegas. Check in is Quick. We got to stay in the Chrysler Building (can't do that in New York) all art decor. Fair sized room overlooking MGM and The Statue of Liberty. Everything in New York is in the hotel. Fast foods, Classy Italian and steak restaurants. Piano Bar bouncing till 02-00 as was the Irish bar and the stage overlooking the casino. Unlike some of the more classy hotels the casino is not to overpowering, nothing outshines the big apple. Look for the manhole with steam coming out and the John Lennon memorial as you walk through Central Park. Add Coney Island and Cayote Ugly and a dentists convention ( it was like an Osmond family reunion - all those teeth!) If you want fun come here. If you do not want fun why are you in Vegas in the first place???? Down side of Vegas over the last 10 years to many shops. less new theme hotels more shopping. My daughter was in heaven. Catch Vegas quick it is changing. 40 construction sites in the quickest growing city in America

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel will stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Sherer
Reviews.Content: stayed here for a week and had a great time.. vegas first timers got a bit of s shock to see the casino as soon as we got in was expecting that to be off to the back somewhere but soon got used to this after seeing a few other casinos .. when we got there was a slight queue for check in but this went down quickly and was hardly any wait at all our room was 2 queen beds which was fine.. had plenty of room and we didn't spend much time there apart from when we were asleep. as has been noted the hotel does smell of apples which seemed a nice touch to me.. pool area is a bit smaller than some but this was ok for us.. pool does shut down in Nov but you can still sunbath out there ate at Gallaghers and while I had a nice meal others in our party didn't have the greatest steaks and the service could have been a bit better.. had a cheaper meal at the ESPN which was fine.. it's billed as a cheaper place and we got what we expected.. still good food and quick in and out service but that was fine as we were off to a show that night the America was nice to sit round and finish the day off with a few beers.. Bar at Times Square and Nine Fine Ireshmen were also really good but just a bit too crowded for the type of trip we were on

Reviews.Title: “Loved New York, Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: John_Byars
Reviews.Content: I spent 5 days/4 nights in Las Vegas at the New York New York Hotel/ Casino and loved every minute of it. The staff there were very helpful, polite and tourist friendly. The shops and restaurants carried appropriate items and menu choices, even though some things seemed high in price. Even so, just choose whatever your budget calls for, and you'll be happy with your selection. The rooms were nice and clean, and stocked appropriately. I paid about $1000 for the hotel, roundtrip airfare for 2, transfer to/from airport and all taxes through an AAA trip advisor. I believe that there are better deals to be found through other venues. Las Vegas is my kind of city -- a 24/7 lively, energetic, fun-filled experience that I recommend to everyone. I plan to come back soon during this Detroit winter season and plan to share all the fun with my family and friends, hopefully every year! John Byars Garden City, MI

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay!”
Reviews.Author: Traci14
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel over Labor Day weekend. We were comped our 3 night stay. Check in was great. We arrived at the hotel around 11:30 and received a room right away. I asked for a lower floor and did receive one. We did not hear any noise from the roller coaster. The room was plain but very clean. We spent our mornings at the pool each day, The pool is small. Also, there is no sun until 12:00. The casino was crazy. Very busy and rowdy. Not too many restaurants to choice trom. We would stay here again if we were comped.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Tmac01
Reviews.Content: Coming from Australia we had a great stay at NY NY in August. Had a little problem with our reservation when we arrived but that was soon sorted out by one of the helpful staff. Rooms were great as was the view, we had no problems with cleanliness. Lots to do, rollercoaster was fun as to were the different bars and restaurants. Definately recommend it to others. Location on strip really good too. Krispy Kremes in the casino were the best!

Reviews.Title: “Great fun at NY-NY”
Reviews.Author: wanderer365
Reviews.Content: We stayed at NY-NY for two nights on our arrival in USA for a road trip and are really glad we chose it. The hotel is really good fun - and it is great to wander around. The pool was quiet, the restaurants were good and we thought it was a great base for exploring the strip. We enjoyed visiting the other hotels, but were glad we were staying at NY-NY.

Reviews.Title: “A great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Aussie064
Reviews.Content: This was our 3rd visit to Las Vegas, the last in 1997, and the first stay at New York - New York. Our room was fabulous, we had a Broadway Deluxe in the Century Tower. Plenty of room which was ideal for our 3 night stay. Bathroom was roomy, and although there is no fridge, an ice machine is just around the corner. Like any of the Vegas properties, staff could be a tad friendlier, but we had no complaints. Would recommend this hotel and would definitley stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Times”
Reviews.Author: Kong1981
Reviews.Content: My fiancee and I wanted a quick getaway from our busy schedules. What better way than to go to Sin City! I have been to Vegas many times and have lodged at a different hotel each time; The Mirage, Ballys, Luxor, Stratosphere, and most recently the New York New York. After reading several reviews, I must admit, I was somewhat skeptical about booking at the New York. If people are going to pay $180+ a night for a room, the least I would expect is above average ratings across the board. As far as other reviews, we had a good experience. First off, as more than few have noted, the check in desk is average at best. After many visits, every hotel, EXCEPT the New York New York has OFFERED room upgrades along with complimentary ticket booklets with freebies. Don't get me wrong, the check in desk was not rude, however, they were far from overtly courteous and accomadating as every other hotel Ive stayed at. No free tickets for the rollercoaster, nor the buffet, nor $10 match play blackjack coupons, ZIPPO! Not that we expected anything for free, but c'mon, at least a kind gesture of some sort would have been appreciated. The player reward card desk was just as dull. As for the smell everyone noted, there is a scent. It wasnt overpowering, but defintely noticeable. If you are sensitive to odors, beware. It kinda smelled like a mix of grandmas potpourri and a hint of apple cider. Only in the hallways though, not in the room. We booked the Spa Deluxe (Jacuzzi tub in room) and were on the 30th floor. Im not sure which tower it is in, BUT I can defintely see that if you are sensitive to noise, the roller coaster might pose a problem if you are on any floor below the 30th. We had a nice view of the rollercoaster, and you could hear a slight rumble as it operated, and in the morning I could hear it as it clicked up to its first dropping point. Didnt bother my fiancee and I, but if you are a light sleeper, be wary of lower level floors. The room was very very spacious and everything was clean and orderly. We always lift up the blankets and inspect the sheets for any hairs or stains, no complaints. The jacuzzi tub was clean as well. Not recommended for more than 2! Im an athletic 5'10 220lb, she a comfy 5'3 125lb, and we took up the whole tub. So if you and your spouse/girlfriend are bigger, you are going to be squished like sardines. The jets are relaxing, nothing impressive, but still relaxing. All it took was some incense and a bottle of Grey Goose and it was smooth sailing. Bring your own bubble bath, AND DONT POUR TOO MUCH! Wait a while, when the jets turn on, it agitates the bubbles and amplifies them by 5. I got a little crazy as I wanted instant bubbles and we had a small overflow of bubbles, had to drain and restart the tub. No big mess, just fair warning. This type of room is perfect for a couple, like ourselves, looking for a little R & R for a weekend. Didnt expect over the top 5 star quality, but was very pleased with the layout/comfy factor. We checked in at 3pm, and I promptly put the do not disturb sign on our door. 20 mins into unpacking, housekeeping came by, KNOCKED on the door! I answered. She was very nice and said she was just making sure. Hmm, wonder if I didnt answer the door and I were in the shower, fiancee changing into an outfit, the possibilites are endless? The bed was average, pillows horrible (every hotel pillow is, unless you are in the penthouse suites, I recommend bringin 1 of your own). The shower was in a separate area, good water pressure. The sink/grooming area was also seperate, the drain made a funny noise (a gulping sound) when draining, but only for 30 seconds or so, then it dissappeared. Again, no biggie for us, may be for others who want absolute perfection. Closet space was small, but we were only there for 2 days so it was fine. Everyone overpacks anyway, especially the ladies. With her overpacking we still had some room to spare in the grooming/closet area. As far as the actual casino in the hotel, this is definetly not a place for laid back people as we are. It is a very crowded, loud, and a somewhat obnoxious scene. Very large layout, can be confusing at times.The ambience is impressive, one of the coolest hotels Ive been in. Not luxurious, not WOW (like the Ceasers), but very cool. Minimum $10 blackjack/roulette (thats everywhere now!) Im a late night guy, and really only eat twice a day. Two buffets in one day would kill me, so we prefer ot eat a heavy breakfast buffet (You have to go to Cafe Lago in the Ceasers Hotel, its the bomb! $16 per person for fresh, clean, excellent food). Snack on a little something mid day, and have a quick fix at night. The America restaraunt in the New York is a perfect spot for anyone looking for some good, freshly prepared food, after a day of drinking and gambling late night. Stays open all night (Many buffets close at 10pm), food was good for the price (You wont feel like crap like you just ate 10 Taco Bell tacos). We went there both late nights, around 11pm-midnight, and was blown away at the quality for such a late night eatery, in Vegas. I got the philly steak sandwich ($10) with fries, SLAMMIN! For the price and quality you cant beat it. Dinner for two, with a beer and tip, $40. Trust me, its a steal. We are reg. people who just like to have a good time, and New York New York Spa Deluxe Room gave us just that. We prefer gambling at the Imperial Palace, more of our type of crowd. Low key, orginal folks just hanging out without the intimadating luxuries/fancies of other hotels that might scare people off otherwise. Their happy hour there is the bomb! 2 for 1 drinks 4p-7p, and they werent small/ watered down! TWO Hennesey and cokes for $5, cant get any better than that (Do yourself a favor, buy your first two mixed drinks to get a good buzz going, then let the girls bring you rounds of Coronas/Heiniekens for a $1. Dont even bother with the cheap, watered down, mini mix drinks they bring you. You cant mess up a good import beer) Would we go back again? Perhaps, but first we want to check out the MGM grand, we heard it gives the New York a run for its money. Booked on vegas.com, hands down the best internet deals for vegas. Better than expedia/travelocity/priceline. Two roundtrip tixs from San Diego, 3 days/2nights at NYNY with jacuzzi in room, $580. Hopefully the tips/review will clear up any misconceptions that some may have.

Reviews.Title: “Good Spot to Stay”
Reviews.Author: racheliz
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took a mini-vacation from October 25-27 at NYNY. Check in was very quick and we got our requested non-smoking room. I also asked for a room as high as possible and landed on the 29th floor...didn't hear the roller coaster once. We were not pushed to upgrade and we stayed in the Park Avenue Deluxe. The room was average size, but well decorated. Everyone on staff was very courteous and prompt. We ate breakfast at Il Fornaio...wonderful. WE did lunch at Nine Fine Irishman and it was so-so, big servings however. My husband tried to get into ESPN Zone just to check it out, but there was a $10 spending limit just to sit down so he hit the gift shop instead. We never had a wait to get a cab and were relatively lucky in the casino. A couple words of note...the monorail station is across the street in the MGM Grand...a great way to save your feet or get to shows quickly. Get used to cigarette smoke...people can pretty much smoke anywhere they please...including the restuarants. Also, be prepared to be hasseled into Tahiti Village time shares. I was a little offended these people were allowed to set up shop right in the middle of the hotel. We must have been approaced 5 times in the first hour. We were also offered "call girl cards" and heavy drugs just outside the doors going to the MGM overpass. WE quickly became skilled at ignoring people. Overall, I would recommend the NYNY. It was a good location and a good bargain for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Not what we had hoped for”
Reviews.Author: Sport28461
Reviews.Content: Just got back from NYNY last night. The hotel was horrible. We had booked 3 rooms with the hotel directly but when we got there the names on the rooms were wrong and the check in clerks were clueless as how to fix it, they kept wanting to give us a higher rate because they were changing our reservations. We finally after about 2 hours of trying to check in to be told there were no rooms availbale were "upgraded" to a Park Avenue Room - that was a joke, the room was dark and just not what we were expecting, our view was of the roof and roller coaster. The towels were not big enough to wrap around yourself when you get out of the shower and not very absorbent. The hotel itself was very smoky and poor air quality. It seemed like they were trying to cover the smoke with air freshener. We were not impressed wth the hotel at all and will not be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved New York, New York”
Reviews.Author: CarlandJoanne
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed at this hotel October 12 thru October 15th, 2006. From check-in which was fast and courteous & throughout the trip, the stay was a wonderful experience. We were offered an excellent deal to stay for the nights we reserved and our room was clean, nicely appointed and well taken care of by both houskeeping and the hotel itself. We were furnished daily with clean towels and amenities and the beds were both comfortable and spacious. We would definitly recommend New York New York to other visitors and would stay there again. jolomb@msn.com

Reviews.Title: “The best on the Strip!”
Reviews.Author: dsbfjW
Reviews.Content: It wasn't a great start. Be aware of the scam - they will offer you an upgrade for only $x, if you then decline this, they will inform you that your room won't be ready for a couple of hours and would you therefore like to upgrade, if you still decline, they miraculously find a room available - not impressed. Our room was on the lowest possible floor so therefore absolutely no view, it may be best to request a higher floor. The room was nicely decorated if not a little small. The hotel was very good, especially for restaurants, we loved the Chinese resturant and the atmosphere in the casino area etc is less claustrophobic, as they've brought the 'outside in' so to speak, by recreating New York . The rollercoaster on the roof is great fun, take a ride! Looking at all the other hotels on The Strip I would definitely recommend this one over all others and it was good value.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Stay at a Professionally Run Resort & Casino”
Reviews.Author: Sirengirl
Reviews.Content: First off I have to elaborate on the previous 2 reviews so I can straighten a few things out. The 'smell' in the hotel is not carpet freshener, it is their signature scent and it is 'APPLES' (get it? the 'Big Apple'?). All the casinos have their own signature fragrance and it is there from the moment you walk thru the door - I found it lovely actually. Secondly, I'm not sure where that woman was gambling who didn't get the free drinks, but as long as I was at any machine, I didn't pay for a thing, except to tip the waitress, which is customary if you want her to come back again. The hotel itself was busy while we were there, but all the staff was outstanding and totally went out of their way for us with any request. I must also say that the local people and bus/cab drivers were also extremely nice and helpful people. My mother was taking the bus back to Freemont at 1:00 a.m. and the bus driver actually made his stop at her hotel door and waited for her to get inside before leaving the curb - how nice is that?? I do have to agree with a previous review of Zumanity though - it wasn't great. I was expecting the 'wow factor' from a Cirque show and I mostly got 'shock value' - and I'm no prude! It had a few really good laughs, but mostly it wasn't worth $100 per ticket. However.... please please take my advice and go see Celine Dion's "A New Day" at Caesar's Palace - WOW WOW WOW! Now that was a show worth every penny of it's ticket price. All in all, our trip to Vegas was good and we really liked NYNY and would definitely stay there again. I thought the details like the steam coming up through the fake manhole covers in the Soho shopping/eating area were fantastic. Nine Fine Irishmen was great and the food was top-notch. We didn't go into the Times Square bar cuz it was always packed at night, but we watched and listened to the dueling pianos from outside and it seemed like a lot of fun was going on in there. Ditto went for Coyote Ugly, just didn't have the time to check it out fully. I liked the fact that NYNY was one of the smaller hotels, it made it seem kind of 'homey' when coming back from a long day on the strip. We had a Park Avenue room and I found it very clean and comfortable. We had a King Feather Bed and I wanted to take it home with me I slept so good in it. Room temperature control was always perfect. We did have a view of the strip and rollercoaster, but we rarely heard it - it ran from 10:30 a.m. to 10:30 p.m., but c'mon people, whose really sleeping during those times??? If you can bash this hotel after staying there, then either you were grumpy after losing on the slots, jetlagged, or just don't know how to have a good time.... after all - this is Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Not for people with ashtma or sensitive to odors”
Reviews.Author: priceless9
Reviews.Content: We stayed at New York, New York, last week, We had no problems with our reservations, they were great, check in was fast, and check out a breeze. The hotel itsself, is nice, the only problem was the smell. I think they were using some kind of carpet freshner. As soon as you walk into the Hotel, it hits you with a strong, perfume smell. I have ashtma, and am sensitive to some fragrances, which triggers my asthma.. I suggest that if anyone has allergies, or is sensitive to smells, don't go into this hotel. In every other aspect, this Hotel is very nice, the resturants are great, they have a wonderful piano bar and friendly staff. The rooms are very small, and not as nice as some of the other Hotels, maid service was nothing to rave about.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special”
Reviews.Author: dan81
Reviews.Content: just returned from a week at the NY NY nothing great to say about the hotel really apart from it was really expensive to have a drink in there compaired to most other hotels... also in most others if u r playing the machines around the bar they give you free drinks but not in this hotel they just give you a discount on them! MGM across the way was a much better hotel i will deffo be stoppin there on my next visit staff could not do enough for you there, although staff at NY NY were friendly most didnt speak english! it was $12.50 to ride the roller coaster and you dont even get a discount for staying at the hotel they could at least give you 1 FREE ride after all its not a cheap hotel. also COTYE UGLY BAR is well over rated its NOT worth a visit i would say its full off old woman dancing on the bar making a show of themselves... but if you are in to that well its the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Something of a Disappointment at the End of a Long Trip”
Reviews.Author: Simbut
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Las Vegas with high hopes of NYNY. Walking into a Vegas Casino for the first time (especially one as big as this) was an overwhelming experience. Reception and Check-In were great: we had booked direct on a special promotion offering us a "stylish" Park Avenue Deluxe uprgrade. Imagine the disappointment when we opened the door to find a dark and gloomy average-sized room. OK, it has some nice art deco touches but this felt like a pretty unremarkable hotel room, let alone an upgrade. However, 26 floors up, we had a pretty good view (tip: you need to be above the 20th floor in this place if you don't want to watch people rushing past your window on a roller-coaster for 12 hours a day!). The biggest surprise was that there was no coffee-making facility in the room - clearly they expect you to go down to the casino to eat and drink - but it felt like a pretty mean omission for a 'deluxe room'. The restaurants and bars were pretty good and we took in the Zumanity Show. Perhaps it was us Brits who are more broad-minded than others, but most of the show seemed like little more than an excuse to wave sex toys around, to use four-letter words and to have the occasional bit of stripping. It all seemed like it was trying far to hard to be sensational. Ask yourself: just how sexy is it to see a few breasts and buttocks and a lot of other people trying to be sexy in flesh-coloured body stockings! Not very sexy if you ask me!! The highlights of the show were the trapeze/circus act based stuff (with the exception of the very boring "bondage" routine). Cirque du Soleil should stick to what they do best.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Marquis Suite”
Reviews.Author: georgegoesabroad
Reviews.Content: I thought the room was very spacious, with 700 square feet over just around 400 for a regular room. We booked this room especially because of the spa tub in the room. The bed was very comfortable, and this suite had plenty of seating space as you will see in the photos. We were in the Empire Tower on the 15th floor. Ask for strip view if possible and as high as available to get a good view. The food was just ok though with only one late nite option for the wee hour hungers. Staff was very friendly, with our maid service top notch. I've stayed at several different hotels in Vegas, but this was the first one where our maid wiped down and arranged everything each day. So of course I tipped her well, AND she could actually understand the English language!! I would say the only negative thing about my stay would have to be the delay in getting my room. I could not check in until after 5 pm and there are only 34 Marquis rooms in the whole hotel, so I certainly shouldn't have had to wait that long. I DID make a suggestion that a step should be placed in front of the spa tub, since it was difficult for a short person like myself to get in and out with ease. But it still was awesome as you will see by the photos, it has a uinque faucet also. I would highly recommend the NYNY Marquis suite,but cannot say anything about their regular rooms. One last note, I don't think the machines were very loose, at least not for us ( I mainly play video poker)

Reviews.Title: “Stay at the Other End of the Strip”
Reviews.Author: justjennifer
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the NYNY was our first visit to Las Vegas, and well, we were rather disappointed. It felt like it was a "Disney-fied" Vegas for families with children. I would recommend paying a visit to this hotel-casino to enjoy the theme and decor, but I wouldn't recommend staying here. It's pretty easy to navigate your way around (restaurants on the left and back if you're facing the escalators to "Coney Island" and shopping to the back and right)--slots/games in middle. The elevators don't all go to the same places or floors so listen carefully to where the clerk tells you "your" elevator is (Empire or Century Tower, A or B elevators, etc.). The Spa is in the Empire Tower (but avoid far right elevator or you won't end up there), so be prepared to walk back through the lobby after your treatment if your room isn't in the Empire Tower). I don't know if it's because we have a bevy of wonderful restaurants here in the DFW area that we frequent, but the eateries at NYNY were pretty lackluster. We dined at ChinChin, Nine Fine Irishmen, Coney Island-Nathan's Hotdogs, America Cafe, Il Fornaio, the deli downstairs, and Gonzalez y Gonzalez. For the money we paid, the food was extremely mediocre. Wolfgang Puck's across the street at the MGM was very, very good (especially the chocolate souffle), and Tsunami inside the Venetian was also a very good choice. TAO inside the Venetian was our first choice that day, but we didn't realize that they were only open for dinner (it was lunchtime when we arrived), so we'll have to try it next visit. Also, stay away from the Aladdin Spice Market Buffet--also mediocre. A traveling tip: the NYNY hotel does NOT have an airport check-in as advertised on the map signs at the airport. They didn't renew their contact last year. We found this out after standing in line at the MGM check-in (which is where they were supposed to be). Check in at NYNY was pretty quick, but the clerk's greeting was perfunctory, at best. Our room was on the 27th floor and had a nice view of the Tropicana and Excalibur (we toured these--a little dated and the latter was easy to get lost in). Our room (a Park Avenue room) was nicely furnished, but extremely small. The glowing "night-light"buttons on the bottom of each lamp was helpful navigating your way around the room at night (saving a bump into furniture on your way back from the bathroom). The tub/commode area was of a good size--not cramped at all like the rest of the room. Our room was very clean--we ran into the maid once as we were leaving--she kept our room in great condition. We had one day where the outside hallway a/c vent was buzzing very loudly (we had a corner room), but they fixed it that afternoon. The location of NYNY was ok, but the things we most enjoyed doing were at the other end of the strip so we either walked or took a cab. We were in town for late Sun- early Thursday morn, so we weren't able to check out some of the shows (most play on Sun, Mon, and Thursday it seems) like Zumanity or Folies. The Spa/Salon at NYNY was comparable in terms of service (but more expensive) to what I've experienced here in the Dallas area. However, on Monday night we had the most fun at The Mirage (the Beatles LOVE was fantastic!! We sat on the sixth or seventh row, but people above us also had a good view) and we also enjoyed ourselves on Wednesday at The Venetian (the palazzo area with gondola rides and gelateria--try both). The gondola ride was a lot of fun and our gondolier was very personable and had a wonderful voice. There were a great variety of shops if you enjoy shopping (for real or "window" shopping). The Bellagio (not too far down the road) was enjoyable to walk through--the lobby ceiling sculpture and the conservatory. The decor made me think of something you might see in a James Bond film. We didn't actually feel like we were in Las Vegas until we hit this end of the strip--there was so much more to see and do. It wasn't until we headed to this end of the strip that we actually contemplated coming back to Las Vegas again--perhaps to to stay at The Mirage, Paris, Treasure Island, or at The Venetian for a splurge. For Newbies--Cab Fare is about $10 bucks from airport and up/down the strip. Save a bit of money by eating a sandwich at Subway (or something of the like) instead of wasting money on mediocre buffet or cafe food in the casinos. Bring good walking shoes. After we got home we calculated the distance between the hotels we walked, so we probably walked 6-10 miles during our stay. Helicopters-this was unexpected....it sounded a little like a war zone with the many that flew over giving tours--I doubt that it was unique to our end of the strip or room location, but if you take a nap during the day (or are a late sleeper) you'll hear them frequently, so you might bring some earplugs. The roller coaster was on our side of the building as well, but we rarely heard it (or the screams of the people on it).

Reviews.Title: “"start spreadin' the news"”
Reviews.Author: Vegas_Dolly
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are frequent visitors to Las Vegas. we live in the Desert Southwest, so flying or driving to Vegas is easy for us..and we try and visit 2 or more times a year. Our stays are at times short...2 days, but we've done 4 and 5 days also. we hesitated booking at NY,NY, I guess just us being inside shopping and a little gambling...and the outside view, well, it did not appear to us to be "homey or cozy" feeling. we plan to retire to the Las Vegas area, so when we stay, we feel more at home there than anywhere. I found a package on the hotel website that I couldn't pass up and we needed a stress reliever...so a couple days in Vegas does it for us. I booked it, and much to our surprise and delight...we LOVED NY,NY. The staff, beginning with the check in associates was wonderful, friendly and most accomodating to the housekeeping staff, to the technicians that repair and fix things...was wonderful. Our TV remote did not work, and a technician was at our room in less that 10 minutes to reprogram a new one. I call THAT customer service. Our room was large and comfortable and spotless. We ate at Il Forniao and Nine Fine Irishmen and food in both facilities was top notch. I reccomend both. we've also enjoyed Tavern at Time Square too and loved the dueling pianos...NOT to be missed whether you stay there or not. go early, get a table and sing your hearts out...is is an evening not to be missed. we are already looking to book our traditional before Christmas trip...to celebrate our anniversary..and sure will choose NY,NY. I am in the process of writing letters to New York, New York management and also management of the restuarants to compliment the staff and service..it is always easy to complain, but it is nice for the staff to get a compliment and pat on the back from whomever their department head or manager is. hey...start spreadin' the news and stay at New York, New York...

Reviews.Title: “Not to be missed!”
Reviews.Author: Emgem33
Reviews.Content: Well, what can I say!!! The NY NY hotel is Fab! I fell in love the minute we walked through the door... The check-in staff were lovely, and very kindly switch our room to the 27th floor. The view of the strip at night was breathtaking. We opted for a Jacuzzi Spa room, which was definatley worth every penny! The hotel is like nothing I have ever seen in my life. The shops, the bars, the resturants and the casino are amazing. All the staff are friendly and helpful, the bed was sooooo comfortable and the room was massive! After exploring all the other fabulous hotels on the strip during our stay, I have no regrets choosing the NY NY! We loved our trip so much we are returning in Januray! Going to try the Luxor this time, so i'll let you all know what I think when I get back.... hopefully it will not let us down!

Reviews.Title: “New York Was Fantastic, Clean, Great Location, Loved It”
Reviews.Author: holly_913
Reviews.Content: We got a great deal on this hotel b/c Im an Airline Employee. First off, to give you some of our travel back ground, we are frequent travellers, who have stayed in 3-5 Star hotels. We got an amazing price, and wended up getting an upgrade to a suite with a Strip view for nothing....what a great deal. the room was large and had everything we needed OTHER than a in room coffee maker (we stayed last time at THEhotel at Mandalay Bay and they has a coffee maker). In room iron and ironing board, soap, mouthwash etc.... the hand lotion is to dye for. had no problem with water pressure or hot water, everything worked great. t was good to. easy to use. beds were really comfortable, and trust me, being a flight attendant, I stay in tons of different hotel beds and these were good, with nice feather pillows, didnt really eat that the hotel (other than americas cafe, and it was good food and service). were not big gambers...... mainly in vegas for shopping..... rented a car, drove to Primm, wasnt too bad but i found the best deals at the Primum outlets and the fashion show mall (ie: MACYS------if you go to the CUstomer Service desk at Macy andd show them that your canadian (ie: drivers lisence) they give you a 11%discount card that you can use as much as you want for 4 days)...then sign up for the credit card and save another 10% We found the bellaigo fountains amazing, the mirage volcano was nice, but short and found the sierns of TI kinda trashy, but worth the watch....well it was lame actually. as for buffets we really liked the one at Monte Carlo...dinner was 17.95 a person and was fresh and really good with a lot of selcetion....we also eat at the TI Treasure Island one, for 20.95 a person for dinner, and WE didnt like it at all, food was cold, not that good, so the next night we went back to Monte Carlo. We found having a car was a nice touch....all hotels on the strip have free parking, so we just usally valleted and paid a tip, notmuch at all to have someone bring your car to you, as the free parking is usally a hike. it was also nice to be able to go places on your time and not have to wait for a bus etc.... it was also nice to go see things off the strip....found a great walmart and ihop. as for saftey, im safriad of my own shadow and I had not one feeling of being unsafe in vegas,,,,not even downtown on Freemont (which is a MUST SEE AT NIGHT TOO) the duece is a bus (public bus) thats 2.00 for one ride, or 5.00 for a all day pass....bus doesnt give change...just like the buses in your hometown...dont know how many people i heard argue with the bus driver...anyways, there not too bad, it seems like we always got on the really crowded bussses. not a bad way to get around, but i dound after one day on the bus, then getting our car, it seemed like it was sent from god...the bus is public so it gets pretty full and you may not be able to get on the bus you want. well if you have anymore questions or concers, please email me at holly_913@hotmail.com with the subject LAS VEGAS

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: concept5123
Reviews.Content: all i can say it is a great place i loved the feeling of being in a big city when i was just in a hotel it was great i loved the candy apples from the road side vendor (in the hotel) i just blew my mind great rolor coaster its just a great place to stay

Reviews.Title: “amazing!!!”
Reviews.Author: SBR
Reviews.Content: This is an amazing hotel,I would'nt hesitate to recommend it.The rooms are a good size (park avenue room),there is a great selection of restaurants & they way that the inside replicates new york is great! e.g time square & grand central station.....I would definatley stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Deedumans
Reviews.Content: I had to go to Vegas on business and was booked into the NY NY as an affordable option. I was very pleasantly surprised...room was very large and clean, with two comfortable beds, nice bath products and a deeper than usual bathtub. I accidentally locked myself out of my room and security was there within 3 minutes to let me back in. Service was good all around, and there are lots of reasonable food options on the ground floor (Il Forniaio, Fish Frye, NY Style Deli) which makes it a good choice for families...I grabbed breakfast and took it back to my room and it was delicious and reasonable! The ground floor dining area is particularly cute with it's mock Greenwich Village feel and it seemed to be less smoky than a lot of the other casinos. Plus, it's affordable...my room was $129 a night, but I saw offers for as low as $79 online right before I left. Two small reasons I couldn't give it give stars: 1) the 20 minute check in line was a bit wearing...I guess a plane had just landed. 2) A Caveat to put your privacy sign up or the maids will knock and then quickly enter at about 8:30am to check your room, make beds, etc. so if you don't want them bugging you, put up the privacy sign..otherwise, a great choice!

Reviews.Title: “Better Bring the Checkbook and Credit Cards!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: kt1980_98
Reviews.Content: Sept. 13th to the 16th 06. We arrived and it was great and fast check in. The hotel was very clean and up to date. Which was good. We had a deluxe room in the New Yorker Tower room 1636. Our view was a big post so that stunk. No complaints though how much are you in your room? No coffee pot nor fridge. Paid $2.75 for a small coffee at the local coffee shop in the hotel, was not even Starbucks. When I realized the prices I then got coffee from Starbucks instead. I paid $12.95 for a bagel and a small coffee. The pool was small and shade till around 11:00a. a 16oz. Miller Lite at the pool was $6.00. Rip OFF!! We went across the street and bought a 12 pack of Bud Light for $18.00 which was much cheaper. I paid $9.00 for a Smirnoff Raspberry and 7up and very small cups. So the alcohol prices were very disappointing. I gambled alot at the slots and my husband played craps not once were we ever offered a cocktail. Cocktail Waitress' were hard to find. I would of tipped well so they would remember us if I could ever find one. Oh yea and had three hotel keys for 3 nights. They kept demaganizing (sp?)This was our first time to Vegas so I really have nothing to compare to this could be just the prices....We are all inclusive travelers so our complaints may not be right.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic NY NY - Why the bad reviews?”
Reviews.Author: Matt&Tracey2006
Reviews.Content: Myself and my girlfriend returned from the NY NY on the 04.09.2006 and can say this is one of the best hotels we have stayed. Location: Ideally placed on the 'Strip' - the monorail is across the road in the MGM and the Deuce stops just abit further up passed Denney's on the other side of the road. Hotel itself: The whole place is buzzing all the time, the casino was really good in comparison to others we used and had a host of entertainment around it. The Big Apple bar had a live band each night and the Duelling Piano's was good fun. Plenty of places to eat also, we ate in America and Chin Chin (be warned don't order to much in this restaurant as the portions are HUGE!!). We also ate @ Smith & Wollensky's and Top of the World whilst in Vegas and would recommend them also, we had breakfast in Denny's each morning as it was only a short walk from the hotel (great value for money) We were very suprised by our room, we stayed in the New Yorker Tower and although a long walk from the elevator the room was exceptional. Nice & Comfy bed, good clean bathroom and good facilities (Iron & Board, TV etc). We spent some time in the majority of the hotels on the strip and can say that the only other place we would consider going to is the Venetian as this is a beautiful hotel. After fulfilling a life long ambition to visit Sincity, we are so pleased we chose the NY NY as words can't describe the jaw dropping effect this hotel had on us when we arrived on our first day. We will be returning next September!!!.

Reviews.Title: “The Big Apple has it all!”
Reviews.Author: Eddexx
Reviews.Content: We spent a few days here as well as the next door Monte Carlo Hotel. The NYNY is a big, brash noisy hotel which specialises in sports and sporting events. The Casino area is large and very busy and the sports area is noisy and bursting with life, people of all ages (well, over 21) watching the football, racing etc. There are also a couple of excellent bars including the Big Apple Bar where they always have a band playing at night (2 x bacardi cokes = $11 plus $2 tip) There's also the Nine Fine Irishmen pub and the top-of-the-lungs 'Bar at Times Square' which simply blasts away the night with live music, loud singalongs and lots of fun. We love eating at the NYNY especially Fultons Fish Shop where you can get Jumbo Shrimp, fries and a Pepsi 'Meal Deal' for two people for $18. Then choose a fabulous pastry from the shop as you finish your drink. There are lots of super shops selling every imaginable thing to eat, drink, wear or show off in. You can cross the handy walkway to the MGM (not impressed) or the Excalibur (big and great for kids) and catch the tramway (monorail) to the Luxor and the Mandalay Bay. All in all if you want a quiet holiday give this place a miss but if you love nightlife - there's Coyote Ugly nightclub for swingers too and plenty of 'young' entertainment here or you can even catch a ride on the Manhattan Express roller coaster (do it on an empty stomach). Yeh take a bite of the Big Apple.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent time in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: viva_las_vegas1
Reviews.Content: My friends and I just returned home from a 5 day stay at the NYNY Hotel & Casino. What a wonderful place to stay! We loved the look of the hotel on the inside and outside. The layout of the casino was well thought out! The drink service at the casino was the best we'd found. The front desk attendants, bell hops, housekeepers and waitresses were all very friendly! The room was very nice and clean, beds very comfy! Our room had excellent views of both the strip and the lovely mountains. We loved the Big Apple Bar....there was a live band every night! We reccommend the Nine Fine Irishmen restaurant....excellent food & service. Only a couple minor complaints....the pool is too small & it's hard to find a seat and several of the smaller food shops close too early in the night. There's only one restaurant in the hotel open 24/7...the America restaurant. This restaurant is probably most comparable to a Denny's restaurant. Also, the rollercoaster is a must! This is definitely a place I'd return to again! Thanks for the gresat stay New York, New York!!

Reviews.Title: “would definitely go back!”
Reviews.Author: jennifrp
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at NY, NY for 2 nights. Check in was very easy, the hotel had tons of great restuarants and places to get a quick bite to eat at all hours of the day or night. They did a great job at capturing the ambience of a little piece of NY city. The rooms were very clean, staff was friendly. The drinks were a bit pricey, but that's expected with the nicer hotels. Zumanity was an incredible show, I highly recommend going! We'd definitely come back again.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: gem30
Reviews.Content: enjoyed my stay in this hotel. All the hotels in Las Vegas are similar - very big and busy with lots to do!! On arrival we were up-graded to a slightly bigger room than we had booked which was nice, clean and had plenty of space. i had read reviews about the check in ques being long but the reception desk was fully staffed and they did their job as quickly as possible! Because the reception is on the casino floor there is plenty to keep you occupied while you wait. all the staff were friendly and went out of their way to help. the rooms were cleaned daily and bedding could be changed as often as you requested (to help the environment you are asked to place a card on your pillow when you want the bedding changed.) the only down side to this hotel is the poolside is slightly small and in July was busy, also the way the hotel is situated the poolside doesnt get the sun until 12pm by which time it is over 100 degrees and roasting! also the rollercoaster goes over the pool so for the first couple of days that can be noisy but by the end of 2 weeks i didnt notice the noise. there is a great childrens bit in the hotel with loads to keep them occupied! Because the hotel is part of the group that owns TI you can get into the VIP section for the nightly pirate show if you show your room key which is a bonus as this gets really busy every night!! loved this hotel and would stay again

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased...”
Reviews.Author: Johnzalez
Reviews.Content: For the price, which was very reasonable, we were quite pleasantly surprised. Our room was nicely decorated, clean and comfortable. Check in was very easy and fast, and the staff was extrememly friendly and helpful. We loved the NY, NY casino and had a great time at the Nine Fine Irishmen pub... they had a fantastic authentic Irish band. If you stay at NY/NY and like dancing you must check it out. All in all, this hotel and casino went well beyond our expectations for a Las Vegas strip location in this price range. We'll definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best experience”
Reviews.Author: Mbwlewis
Reviews.Content: Stayed at NYNY for 2 nights (28/29 Aug). I booked the hotel directly via the website. I used the "Manhattan Nights" upgrade package to a PARK AVENUE and requested a non-smoking room with a king bed. On arrival at 6:30pm I was told that there were no non-smoking rooms avaliable - and that there were also no king beds. I was outraged and the clerk offered me an upgrade to a Spa Suite for $35 per night. I decided to take the upgrade. We opened our Spa Suite door, and were taken back with the size of the room... 500sq ft. However, it appears someone forgot the furniture for this room. There was a bed, small TV unit, 2 desk chairs and a spabath. NO sofa, no table - very odd. It also has a view of the parking lot and the back of the rollercoaster. As i was unimpressed with the room (esp for $35 extra a night) i returned to the front desk and asked to "see" a Park Avenue smoking room I walked into room 1930 and was almost physically ill from the stench of smoke and ciggarettes. I smoke, and cannot describe the foul smell from the room. I decided to stay in the Spa suite for one night. I asked the hotel reception if they were able to confirm a non-smoking room for the second night - which they were.... so on day 2 we moved to 2472, which is a lovely Park Avenue room with views of the strip. MUCH BETTER! Overall I was most disappointed that a hotel of this size was unable to provide a non-smoking room, and that they were not able to offer a suitable alternative. Other than the room problems, the hotel is great fun to be in. I'd suggest it for a 21-32yr old bracket on you're 1st vegas trip. But if i go to Vegas again I'd stay at Caesars or Bellagio.

Reviews.Title: “average”
Reviews.Author: chocs1
Reviews.Content: the first room we were given overlooked the side of the monte carlo construction. at 7am on our first morning we were woken my the construction noise. we complained to front desk who agreed to move us and gave us $50 in compensation. what was disapointing was they didnt inform us on the hotel booking or when we checked in that construction work was going on next door and was clearly audible from the right side of the hotel. to catch up on sleep we then went for a cat nap later that morning. we left the do not disturb sign on the door but later found out this means nothing to the hotel staff. the chambermaid knocked on the door , when we didnt respond, she rang the room and then had her manager open the room door. i was later told this was hotel policy to check all rooms, and that the do not disturb sign was ignored after 230pm. this seems slightly contradictory for a hotel which is 24/7 in a city that never sleeps. we experienced other minor problems in our stay and the front desk staff were far from easy to deal with. you are just on of thousand guests- very impersonal and no care for customer service. the plus side is the rooms are nicely decorated and generally clean (the first room was an expection as the draws etc...were very dusty and the bathroom had also not been cleaned properly hairs were left from previous guest in sink etc..) the location is ok - further down strip so if want somewhere central would recommended somewhere like paris or caesers or bellagio

Reviews.Title: “Loved the NY NY”
Reviews.Author: operman1
Reviews.Content: New York New York Hotel was a great stay for me since this was the first time I hit Las Vegas. The adult show, Zumanity, was hilarious as the audience got involved in the action. The hotel was like going to New York and even had a couple of Nathans hot dogs venues. I did not hear any noise from the roller coaster there as others have complained about so I do not know what they are talking about. Service at the hotel was great and the personnel were very friendly and accommodating. I would definitely go there again when I go to Las Vegas again.

Reviews.Title: “Irish view of new york hotel...August 20th 2006”
Reviews.Author: mattmanireland
Reviews.Content: I moved 3 times before choosing this hotel!. Its easy peasy to cross over to 4 other of the larger and best hotels via a walk way from new york(excalbour, MGM, Luxor, cant think of the other one). The room was great. I had a great view, toliet and shower very clean, good air con., safe in room, loads of free TV stations(and ones you can buy). This hotel is really great for the price. The only thing was bad was the resturant in it. Well all of them with the exception of the mexician(all within the hotel complex). Food took ages, was luke warm.In fact they gave us a free meal cause it took so long.So all good but go else where for food. The Irish pub(9 fine irish men) within the hotel is very good. great band there(did not try the food there), but the beer is great!! Yes, I would stay there again, unless I got a better deal on the MGM! On that note, on the night before I went back to Ireland, I put 10 dollers on number 4 on the roulette table and it came up! 350 dollers I won. So I tried it again on another table. yes, 10 dollers on number 4 and guess what!! it came up again! Now thats luck! Hotel paid for!! thanks new york new york! Pool is good, the roller coaster goes over it! great buzz!! Ill be back. (in november hopefully!!). matthew Byrne, [--]

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, dark, drab hotels rooms. Not worth the price.”
Reviews.Author: NatalieCFitz
Reviews.Content: First off rooms are VERY worn out. We were so excited to stay in a spa suite. The spa/Jacuzzi tub was dirty. The carpet was dirty, the sofa and bed spread was worn out. The interior was dark and drab. We asked for a non-smoking room, but the entire room smelt like smoke. The bathroom is horrible, the sink was literally right next to the toilet. Horrible! Service was ok. Not great. Check in line was so long. Be prepared to wait for 20 minutes. The casino isn’t that great either. If you like slots, there are much better slot machines at the other hotels. I would never stay here again. It is not worth the price and you leave feeling ripped off.

Reviews.Title: “So Good They Named It Twice”
Reviews.Author: Ammohunk
Reviews.Content: I went with my brother and 4 friends for a week in June for my stag/bachelor week. Fantastic. I showed my military ID on check in and they upgraded all our rooms for free. Plus we got vouchers for free rides on Manhattan Express, half price breakfast and lunch etc. The "upgraded" rooms were nice but on the 3rd floor and one of the rooms looked out onto a massive steel girder and concrete. Think I would like to have seen our original rooms first. (I've stayed in a nicer standard room at the TI). That aside we loved our week, the pool is a little disappointing (in the shade until midday) but NYNY staff were very helpful and friendly. I would highly recommend the eggs Benedict in Il Fornaio restaurant and anything in Nine Fine Irishmen. The Big Apple bar is also great with a band performing at intervals through the night. Don’t bother with Coyote Ugly, even though we had VIP tickets the doormen said we could skip the queue if we tipped them and then you get inside to find you drink from plastic cups and an annoying teenager is stood on the bar trying to make you "partay" to thrash metal! As an aside I've "partayed" with my American military colleagues on many occasions and they always talk a good "partay" but rarely impress us Brits. Plus you just celebrate so "differently", shall we just leave it there? We didn’t gamble much but when we did NYNY's casino was a pleasant experience, there is just so much happening there. The Times Square bar is also cool, with duelling pianos but believe it or not the best beer is to be had in ESPN Zone and not Nine Fine Irishmen (NFI). Massive jugs of Stella for 7 bucks. Also didn’t appreciate being asked to pay a cover into NFI on the weekend! Come on guys I’m staying in the hotel, surely that counts for something? I don’t know what else to say really, Vegas is my favourite place on earth, except for Tao in The Venetian. If queuing for an hour (again even though we had VIP passes) to get into a pitch black cave full of thrash metal and then being told we could only come in if we sit at a table for a 2 drink minimum which entitled us to buy only $375 bottles of vodka then deal me out! WORST NIGHTCLUB IVE BEEN IN, IN ALL MY TRAVELS AROUND THE WORLD! No matter how old you are go to Ghost in The Palms hotel one night, the view from the 51st floor balcony is AWESOME and you simply must do the Grand Canyon Helicopter trip. JAW DROPPING, especially with Papillon who can land in the Canyon. Also the Hoover Dam is only 40 minutes drive away so its well worth hiring a car and driving yourself there instead of taking an all day excursion. NYNY was spot on for a bunch of stags, maybe not so for couples or older groups with children but then again where in Vegas is? I would stay again if the deal was amazing (very cheap) but generally I like to try different hotels on each visit. Thanks again to all at NYNY overall it was an unforgettable week.

Reviews.Title: “You have to Stay at Least Once”
Reviews.Author: lasvegaschick
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed here a few times. We go to Vegas quite frequently so we have a lot of knowledge of other comparable hotels on the strip to compare to. This hotel is one of our favorites and we have always enjoyed our stay. There is lots in the way of entertainment, besides gambling. Fun piano bar, nice lounge with live music, great shows and bars and the atmosphere is fun and youthful. Their steakhouse is excellent -- be prepared for a long wait though. The hotel can sometimes be a little pricey for our budget, just depending on the date and day of week. Casino gambling is also a little on the high side. You wont find $5 tables here. The minimums are usually $10-$15. The pool is less than impressive and wish they would have put a little more effort into the design (for those who like to spend some time poolside as I do). There is only one, relatively small pool as compared to other hotels and one jacuzzi so it can get crowded very quickly. No cabanas available to rent, but they do have towel service. Overall, a great hotel and you'll be sure to enjoy your stay!

Reviews.Title: “Always great”
Reviews.Author: AlMaddern
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the NYNY a couple of times and it's a great hotel. This trip was with my family and frankly I think I should have stayed closer to the middle of the Strip. It was insanely hot (~105') and the kids cooked in the walk down to Paris. NYNY always seem to offer you ultra cheap room upgrades when you check in so it's worth getting a cheaper room and upgrading when you get there. We were offered an upgrade of two room classes for $5 a night. Stay away from lower levels where the rollercoaster stays running until well past midnight. The pool is great but can get very busy during the heat of the day. Cheap WiFi and LAN available for business users The bars in the hotel are great although their food is quite poor. The restaurants are amazing though, especially the steak house which with it's crazy sized steaks. Room service pizza is some of the best in the world. Get in to see Rita Rudner before she leaves for Harrah's at the end of August. She's the funniest women on the planet. We used a local babysitting service (found on the web) which was quite expensive but very professional. In general though Vegas is not a place for small children, the cities policy is that children should be seen and not heard. A lot of adults actually ignore children who talk to them.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Shell100
Reviews.Content: Just arrived back from our stay in New York New York! Fantastic hotel, staff were friendly and helpful, good range of entertainment and The Bar at Times Square....brilliant night out! i would say that this hotel is best for under 30's, has a great, lively party atmosphere, just what we were looking for!

Reviews.Title: “Exciting Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Nellrose
Reviews.Content: It was my first visit to Las Vegas. I spent 4 wonderful days with my boyfriend. We stayed at the New York New York hotel. It is very clean and the staff very gently .I strongly recommend it . I thought Las Vegas was only for gambling and was going to be boring. I was so wrong. Read about all the amenities before you go. I found each hotel on the strip completely amazing. So much luxury!!!!. If I knew before my trip, I would have stayed at Luxor because I love Egyptian culture. The night life is terrific, but we were so tired of walking the whole day that we were at bed before midnight . The only thing I dislike at Las Vegas was the shrimps and the crabs at buffets. They taste as not well cooked and so simple. Use the monorail , it is cheap and takes you everywhere. Try to dinner at one of the luxury restaurants one night and pick one show per night , too. You will enjoy them. I saw Splash .It was very good. Also we took the Neon and lights tour which took us for all the sin city and stop at Rio Hotel, Riviera and Freemont street to whatch free shows. They are great. I wish I can go for a second or third time to see Celine Dion , Elthon John, Barry Manilow and Tom Jones!!!! And believe me , Las Vegas is a real SIN CITY!!!!

Reviews.Title: “I Love New York New York”
Reviews.Author: tvcamguy
Reviews.Content: WOW! What an incredible place......from check-in to check-out, it was a GREAT experience.......this is my first time to stay at NYNY, and it definately will not be my last! Where do I start? The check-in line was very long, but it moved incredibly fast.....but still, a little wait in this place is okay, there is so much to look at.......!!!!!......I got an offer in the mail offering me 3 nights comped.....so, I took them up on the offer....not expecting much......BOY! did I underestimate them......they upgraded my comped room to a Players Suite.....HOLY COW!!!.....it was FANTASTIC!!!.......700 square feet......two queen beds.....a huge bathroom, with extra nice soaps and stuff.....but the highlight was the HUGE hot tub......right in the room!.....what a treat........and it worked great, especially after a long day on the strip........the bed was very comfy......it had many down-filled pillows that were GREAT!.......it also had two TVs......one by the beds....and one in the sitting area....which had a couch and two tables...... The casino is fantastic......lots of friendly dealers at the tables......the slots are great, as well.....there are a lot of 98% payback slots in this joint......you'll play forever on $5 bucks, but it will eventually take it ALL! so, be careful.......the best ones are the Family Feud machines, they are fun and do payout A LOT!........ Food: Had a great Mexican food meal at Gonzalez Y Gonzales.....I live in Texas, and I know good Mexican food.......and this place has good Mexican food.......the breakfast buffet at Chin Chin, is terrific........and reasonably priced........ Funny story: A friend of mine came back to the room after losing all of his money for the day on the slots, on his way up he put $2 bucks in the the Pepsi vending machine, and the machine took his money.....I laughed VERY hard about that.....even the vending machine took his money HA HA HA HA HA!!!!! Well, it wasn't very funny to him.....so to make peace, I went down to the front desk.....explained the problem......and 10 minutes later room service was knocking on our door, with 4 cans of Pepsi for him......what a CLASSY place......I love this place!!!!! Bottomline: There's nothing bad I can say about NYNY.....friendly employees from all aspects.....make sure you join the Players Club, because I don't gamble too much, and they still sent me a 3 nights comped room invitation......take advantage of it!.......stay at NYNY, and you will not be sorry!

Reviews.Title: “Great room at the NYNY”
Reviews.Author: WITrekker
Reviews.Content: I stayed at NYNY from July 26-29 because of a free room offer I received last spring - Wednesday and Thursday nights were free, Friday was about $90. I've read varying reports about the rooms and, while I often ate meals and gambled at NYNY, I had no idea what to expect once I actually stayed there. Well, it was just fabulous - my room was in a corner of the Century or Empire Tower (between the two, I think) and was huge, with windows on two sides and one of the most comfortable hotel beds I've ever slept in. (Surprisingly to me, one of the other comfortable beds was at the Excalibur.) The bathroom was big and bright and I had an extremely generous supply of towels each day - in fact, I was a little puzzled at the way they'd leave the old towels but then add three or four new ones. I wonder how many would eventually have collected in the room, but I'm not complaining. The soap and shampoo were very nice there too. It was also one of the QUIETEST rooms I've ever stayed in, at least in Las Vegas - again sort of surprisingly, the Excalibur also had a quiet room, but my three experiences in the Luxor weren't that great, noise-wise. I had no trouble finding the elevators since they were right near the registration desk. I thought the furnishings were all fairly new and so was the hallway carpeting - basicaly, I felt very happily surprised at the quality of the experience. The room temperature was absolutely perfect for me - it was abnout 110 outside but I never felt too hot, or too cold, in the room. People who like a "cooler" room might have been disappointed but I found it just fine. I wasn't lucky at all at the slot machines, and I have to wonder if maybe that Player's Card isn't such a great deal after all when they basically recouped the cost of my "free" room - all with my cooperation, of course, but still... I thought briefly about not using the card, but then I'd also be less likely to get another of those comped room offers, and I'd certainly stay there again. I've always felt comfortable at NYNY even though I usually stayed somewhere next door, so it was nice to finally experience more of the place for myself. I visited Hoover Dam this trip and was glad I did - it's like an alien planet out there, to someone from the Midwest. I also love the Mirage and hope to stay there someday, and of course I found Excalibur and even Luxor perfectly fine too (and I prefer the southern location on the Strip.) But now I'm pretty likely going to stay again at NYNY - I can't think of a single thing I wasn't happy with, and when I did want to try other restaurants or other casinos, they're a short walk away. One final note - I visited the Star Trek Expereience again on this visit, and finally realized that I can get half price tickets with absolutely no trouble at the ticket booth near the Coca Cola museum right across the street. And I was about to pay almost $40 for the same thing - it's a nice attraction but I'm so glad I saved the extra money.

Reviews.Title: “First Vegas experience”
Reviews.Author: Drdavid
Reviews.Content: Stayed here July 14th -17th,my first time in Vegas.Arrived hot and flustered from death valley and the jaw dropping first sight of the Strip.Valet parking was fabulous and is one of the USA's best inventions.Check in was quick ,no queue,upgraded one level of room for £10.00 per night.Room was pretty basic but clean and fine for our needs.Stayed in Century Towewr level with the rollercoaster, there was no noise. Initially the casino floor/theme area was impressive but I soon got fed up with the confusing layout which I know is common to all LV hotels but seemed worse here. Had a few beers in the Irish bar which was ok ,ate buffet at the Bellagio and MGM(which was better and no queue) NYNY has a great house band "Phoenix" if you like classic rock make sure to see them in the bar area. location is good for monorail and tram access(v important) I think next time I go I'd pick a less themed hotel, but was quite happy with NYNY as an introduction to Vegas

Reviews.Title: “The NY Hotel is OK”
Reviews.Author: viaum
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews I wasn't sure if we made the right decision booking this hotel. Upon arrival check in was very very quick. We bought the "Manhattan Special" and were promesed to get an upgrade on our room. If what we got was the "up graded room" then I imagine the regular room isn't that great. Our room was OK, I thought it was quite small and there was not enought room for two big suitcases. The room was clean, the bed was great. we DID NOT hear the roller coaster even though we could see it through our window. The only thing we hated was the location of our room, even though we had a Strip View, we had to walk A LOT to get to it, and when I say a lot it was!! We didn't eat at the hotel so I can't tell you about the food. The slot machines where ok. The thing we liked the best about this hotel was the piano show at The Bar. Those guys are amazing and we had a great time going there. Staff was helpful and over all I liked it but probabliy would try a different hotel on our next trip to Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “it was ok i guess...”
Reviews.Author: athanasae
