Reviews.Content: I stayed at the New York New York with my boyfriend July 11-14. It wasn't bad, but it wasn't really worth the money either. We were much happier and more comfortable at the Sahara. There were a LOT of families wandering around NYNY, which was annoying and a little inappropriate. I hope when I have children, I'm not compelled to bring them to a city where you can gamble, drink all night and buy prostitutes. Not good parenting. Anyway, I booked the room through expedia, and we received a double queen instead of king room. We chose not to complain about that (we can easily fit in a queen), but the view (or lack thereof) from the window was a joke. Really. We actually laughed. The window was frosted, except for the top foot or so, which was blocked by a wall anyway. The bathrooms were not what was depicted on the NYNY website. They were much smaller. However, once again, we didn't complain because we didn't intend to be in the room much. We didn't spend much time at NYNY gambling because of all the children, and also because the craps tables were consistently set at $15 minimums. We actually went down to TI and the Mirage and spent most of our time gambling there. The maid service was slightly below average. We ate at Chin Chin, which was good, and the service was wonderful. Same with Nine Fine Irishmen. The bars were lame and not really interesting for people between the ages of 24-35. And we're not even really nightclub people. Summary: NYNY is a family/older people casino, and they charge too much for an average time. Next time I want to spend that kind of money, I'll stay at Mandalay Bay or the Mirage.

Reviews.Title: “I love NY”
Reviews.Author: foxywood3
Reviews.Content: Stayed and played at NYNY from July 11 thu 16. I loved my corner room, it was huge and clean,with spectacular views out of many windows. I was in the Century Tower on the 23rd floor. I really liked the line of bath products they use, wonderful scents like grapefruit and pomegranate etc. The staff was quite friendly and pleasant everwhere, from the hotel to the casino to the folks at Scirocco's pizza working their butts off and remaining professional and attentive when dealing with the drunks at 2 am on a Fri night. The hotel overall seems to me to have a NY in the 70's, Studio 54 type of theme, the house band is great, lots of 70's and 80's rock, however you will hear the same songs each night, lots of BON JOVI, but it does seem to be what the crowd wants. The dueling pianos are very good also, again, lots of 70's and 80's music. One thing out of place and quite unenjoyable to me was the music at the pool, I just don't understand why they broke away from the 70's and 80's theme and played HIP HOP at the pool, especially in the morning, 9 am, when 90% of the patrons were 40's, 50's, 60's easy listening kinda folks. It is NOT the HARD ROCK! It definitely felt like the music was chosen by and for the very young pool staff and not the bleary-eyed patrons. The food in the America Cafe was very good. I wish I had gone to Starbucks, I did not like the room service coffee or the coffee at Il Fornaio's, it was bitter. I will return! Great location on the Strip too, oh and I had a view of the rollercoaster, one of the big hills, very fun, a little disconcerting though to often look out and see empty cars making their practice runs, that was a little creepy, you have been warned! Note to regular Las Vegas Forum readers, this was written by foxywood3.

Reviews.Title: “"I Like My Jacuzzi/Shower Tub Without Hair!"”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Vegas, for a one night trip. It was for a birthday so I reserved a King Bed Jacuzzi Room, in the EMPIRE TOWER. I will do the positves first: 1) The location is ideal if you don't want to a ton of walking, as it is central to MGM, EXCALIBUR, LUXOR, MANDALAY BAY, a short tram will get ya too all big hotels. Even if you have to walk, its not too bad, as long the temp isn't above 100. I chose this hotel, for its location and the deal I got on the room, as well as the Casino. The Casino is def. for the younger crowd. However, I still saw some older folks, the reason I say its for the younger crowd is due to the tight feel of the casino. Everything is scrunched together. But if you don't mind walking in a crowded Casino, then it will work for you. The SLOTS are a BIT looser then other big casinos on the strip. My FAVORITE GAMES are the MIN $1 tables, the $1 DICE GAME by the main elevators near the STRIP entrance, and the SPIN FOR RICHES wheel located on the left side of the main PIT. THESE were AWESOME if you are like me, and want to play with chips but don't want to lose everything ni 5 mins. Its pretty much like playing $1 slots, but you get the thrill of playing at a table with chips. I noticed they have the wheel game all over the strip big casinos, the Belligio has the game for a $2 min, however, I won the most on the NY NY game, and lost the most on the Belligio game. Anyway, back to more positives, we didn't do any of the resturants here except the little eateries. That is another plus to this hotel, there are a lot of cheap places to eat if you don't want to spend an arm and a leg. They have Nathen Hot Dogs, and a NY style pizza place, which were both good cheap eats. TRY the MARGARITAS @ Gonzales Y Gonzales, they are GREAT!!! Also, the AMERICAN Cafe is really good for the money, about $8-15 bucks for dinner. Average Cafe/Grill prices, but good food, oh and its 24 HOURS. NOW for the negative: If you are a clean freak, or just don't want to see nasty things in your shower or Jacuzzi, then ya might want to skip STAYING @ the NY NY and just enjoy the CASINO. We found two GOBS OF HAIR on the shower wall, and also a bit in the Jacuzzi Tub. GROSSS! It was obvious, Housekeeping had Not cleaned the shower or Jacuzzi, also the floor of the shower had mildew/mold, and there was no shower matt supplied, which again was GROSS. Honestly, I am not that picky of a person, Im NO CLEAN FREAK. But I do have a thing about HAIR iin the SHOWER, and that was JUST NASTY!!!! The jacuzzi was big though, too bad it was DIRTY :( ALSO, the elevators that took us up to our room, we were on the 32nd floor, TOTALLY SWAYED BACK AND FORTH. So much so that I had to grab hold of the railing. I'm scared of heights, so that freaked me out, we used all three elevators and THEY ALL DID IT. It totally felt like they were hanging on a loose wire. NOT GOOD. :( OVERALL: Skip staying at the NY NY, and just visit and enjoy the cheap eats, and GOOD MARGARITAS! Jacuzzi King Room in EMPIRE TOWER : $158, booked on NY NY website. PS -- TRY THE MANDALAY BAY BUFFET, IF YOU LIKE CRAB LEGS AND SHRIMP!!! DELICIOUS AND GREAT VALUE FOR $25 BUCKS!!!! ALSO, IVE STAYED @ MANDALAY BEFORE, SO SPEND $30 OR 50 BUCKS MORE, AND STAY THERE!

Reviews.Title: “I loved New York New York”
Reviews.Author: hipechic
Reviews.Content: I stayed at New York New York for five days at the end of June, 2006. Our first room was the Park Avenue Deluxe and then we were moved to a suite. The suite was fabulous with a great view of the strip, the roller coaster and Las Vegas. The staff was courteous and the check-in people were more than accomodating in moving us to a larger room. There were many places to eat that were reasonable and I really enjoyed the dueling pianos in the bar. I gambled every day I was there and the slots were most favorable to me. I enjoyed the New York theme, the atmosphere and the staff. I have stayed several times in Vegas and have also been to MGM and the Venetian. I highly recommend New York New York when you visit Vegas. I can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel stay.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My best friend, her boyfriend and I just came back from a weekend in Vegas. They chose the hotel and I did my tripadvisor lookup just to see what I was going to expect. Everything was perfect, from the room size to the detailed décor and you can basically do anything in the hotel. Great dinning, shops, slots & tables, bars, shows, plenty of drinks, a spa and there are 2 starbucks open 24 hours for all of us coffee lovers. Make sure to get reservations at 9 fine irish men, we were celebrating my friends 21st Bday and their desserts were extremely good! Room service was always on time and the guest services were always quite helpful. Thank you for everything. Will definitely come back. "And for those people that say that this is not a family friendly hotel… to start out what are you doing bringing your kids to Vegas?, go to Disneyland instead or just don’t bring the kids. End of story".

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay again at NYNY casino”
Reviews.Author: lynettemo
Reviews.Content: Went to Vegas to get married and we stayed at New York New York. Would not stay there again. Checked in at 8:00pm. By that time they had given all the smoking rooms away which I had requested when booking. Asked for a room with a view, didn't have that either in the type of room we requested which was a spa suite. Very frustrated upon check in. Room was nice though, very big. Entire staff there just seemed happy to do as little as they could to complete their job. Not rude just not overly friendly. Then, came home and found out some friends had champagne & fruit sent to our room on our wedding night.....or at least they ordered and paid for it. We NEVER received it. Not sure what the deal is there. Again more of the hotel not willing to attempt to go any beyond the minimum.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4 night stay at New York, New York. This was my first trip to Las Vegas and I found this hotel to be extremely suitable. Check-in was very easy and staff very helpful. We stayed in the New Yorker building in a basic room. It was a decent size with a big bathroom. We had a view of the MGM Grand and part of the roller coaster. Noice from the roller coaster was never a problem. You could hear it running and some screams but was very muffled. Our room had a clogged drain and once we told the front desk it was fixed by the time we returned to our room. The casino was a good size and usually pretty busy. I had never had any problems finding tables to play at. I read alot of reviews before leaving regarding the size of the pool and was a bit nervous about what to expect but it was fine. It was a little on the small side but not a problem. Just with anything else if you get there early you can get the seat and place that you like best. It is true that there isn't any direct sun at the pool until about 11am but this was welcomed. In the summer heat, it was nice having a couple hours to relax in the shade and then enjoy the sun. The pool drink/food service was also great-no complaints there. If my husband and I had any complaint, it was the food choices in the hotel. We were a bit disappointed in options for a quick snack. We ate at Broadway Burger and thought it was terrible. The restaurant America was great for breakfast and not too expensive. The nightlife seemed to always be busy. This hotel also looked great from the outside. As far as themed hotels go I think this was the best. I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great except for the rooms”
Reviews.Author: lewisnval
Reviews.Content: Stayes there at the end of last month. We had a great time. We were able to check in early. The only problem we had was with the room. We upgraded and received the skyline with a view room. It was very small, yes i know your there only to sleep but still. The rooms across from us and next to us had people coming and going. Every time there was a knock on the door we thought someone was at our door. THIN WALLS. Other than that, another nice hotel in las vegas. We received a great rate on the rooms. Also the coyote bar is not like the other ones, the movie or the show that was on cmt. We were not impressed at all. Save your money.....

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel for Party People!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel for young party people going to Vegas for the sights/sounds/activities/gambling. It's pretty decent for families, too. They have a cool arcade fo the kids and an unbelievable roller coaster that anyone in Vegas has to try once. We stayed on the 30th floor which swayed so if you have motion sickness ask for a lower floor. The eleveators to the various towers can get confusing so write down the directions before you get too drunk. NY-NY is farther south from the big-ticket casinos (Caesers, Venetian, Bellagio, Treasure Island) so you'll have to walk pretty far, get a cab or rent a car. I wouldn't recommend walking in the summer. It was a really good hotel with great views. Plus...it's NEW YORK man!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, pushy housekeeping”
Reviews.Author: camarsh2
Reviews.Content: We JUST returned from Las Vegas we really enjoyed New York New York. We visited most of the other casinos there, and it's very unique. The sides of the hotel are meant to look like apartment buildings or small shops in New York. Most of the other hotels did not have such a detailed interior. It's also unique in the fact that there's a lot of places you can get something quick to eat. There's pretzel, hot dog, and pizza vendors, to name a few, so you have options outside of the restaurants. The room was very nice, and the hotel was very clean. As with any hotel in Vegas, get to the pool early to get chairs. My only complaint is housekeeping. Every morning, they would knock, and even though we'd shout at them to not enter, most of the time they would. Even when we had a "Do Not Disturb" sign on the handle, they'd STILL knock and ask when we'd be finished. Of course, it goes without saying everything is wildly expensive. Getting the bellboy to take your luggage is $15 a trip, and food and drinks are very expensive as well. The casino itself is typically very busy at almost all hours of the day, compared to other casions we visited.

Reviews.Title: “A good, fun hotel - ideal for families”
Reviews.Author: Kramax
Reviews.Content: I spent 4 nights at New York, New York in late May 2006. I only stayed here as my fav hotel MGM Grand was booked out. I was pleasantly surprised by the quick and friendly check in (several hours early from an international flight). I had a Park Avenue Deluxe room with the roller coaster outside, but the noise was not noticeable, as has been mentioned in other reviews. The NY theme is great and there is a friendly atmosphere. I found all the staff to be very friendly and talkative. The cleanliness was A1, no complaints. The decor in the rooms appears dated, but I think they are meant to be a bit New York 1970's style?! Regardless, I had no complaints. The halls were quiet and I could not hear the neighbours, and my floor appeared fully booked. The hotel was always busy in the public areas and it seemed to be a popular gaming place and the whole NY theme seems to pull visitors in. I would stay at this hotel again, though still prefer the MGM Grand as first choice. New York, New York is well placed on the Strip and has lift access to the Strip pavement right outside the door and a walkway to the opposite side of the Strip also outside the door. A great benefit on hot days. I would highly recommend this hotel to families and to anyone who has never been to NY. NY is my favourite city and this place really captures the NY feeling.

Reviews.Title: “ABSOLUTELY AMAZING - WORDS CANNOT DESCRIBE”
Reviews.Author: Mellonie
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from the New York New York Hotel & Casino after having stayed there from 14 to 21 June 2006. After having read some of the negative reviews we were, to say the least, a bit worried. We need not have been though. Everything about the experience was amazing. We were situated on the 33rd floor of the Chrysler Building and had a fantastic view of the Strip. We could see the rollercoaster from our room, but could not hear it when we went to bed. We rode the rollercoaster and it was brilliant. We ate in the America restaurant, the Chinese restaurant and Gallaghers. All were really good, but Gallaghers was probably the best restaurant I have ever eaten in. We both had steaks and they were cooked to perfection. Our room was spotless, the beds were changed every day and ample towels were provided. We were even provided with mouthwash, shampoo, conditioner, body lotion, soap, etc. The actual casino is huge but we had great fun and even won over $1,500. We went in the Irish bar, Big Apple bar and the bar at Times Square and all were excellent. The staff were very friendly and could not do enough for you. We walked the entire Strip from our hotel all the way down to Fremont to watch the lazer light display which certainly is a sight to behold. All the hotels appear to be excellent in standard. The Bellagio, Venetian and Wynns are probably the most upmarket and we did feel that these were probably a little too posh for our liking. The Mirage is an excellent hotel with the dolphins, tigers, panthers, etc. Amazing! We watched two shows. A Neil Diamond tribute and a Beatles tribute. All I can say is that it seemed as if we were watching the real thing. Very professional. All in all this was a holiday I will never forget. We had fun by the bucket load and will definately return in the future. Please do not be put off by the negative reviews. We love nice hotels and the New York New York is at the top of our list of the best hotels we have stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Would visit the casino again, but NEVER the hotel.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights at the New York New York Hotel Casino last week. A group of 12 of us checked in at 10 a.m. Since check-in isn't until 3 p.m., only two of the rooms were ready. Fine by us...no complaints there. Once I dropped my stuff off in the room, I noticed the toilet wasn't working correctly. It was backed up and we had to call maintainence to come fix it. We also had no remote control for the TV, and the TV constantly "blinked", and shot lines of static and buzzed. Utilizing the shower was an experience, as there was barely any water pressure and the water trickled out of the shower head. After a few hard hours of boozing and gambling, a good nap would've been appreciated. However, my bed in the room was tilted...I kid you not. Although not visible to the naked eye, it was leaning to the right so hard you could easily have rolled off the bed. The pool is also very small...but does provide ample shade in the afternoon. I had visited the shops and casino at New York New York and will do so again, as there is alot to do, but I'll never stay at the hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “A good place to stay but could be more child friendly.”
Reviews.Author: Johnnooz
Reviews.Content: First trip to Las vegas with my wife, daughter and her family (who had a separate room). The negatives first - not child friendly my daughter had an 18 month old infant and there was no means in the room to heat food for child, no bar fridge to keep bottle cold. No coffee making facilities. Room was noisy on Memorial weekend with lots of young people running up and down hall. My wife said the roller coaster kept her awake till midnight most nights but it didn' bother me. I thought the noise was muffled. No the plusses - room was clean and housekeeping efficient and unotrusive. Hotel was well located to other attractions and its theme was unique, most of the others seemed a bit boring compared with the vibe of this place. Some others such as Bellagio and Mandalay Bay were classier but we thought overall this was good value but not outstanding. There is a wide choice of restaraunt/takeaway and the Italian is great for breakfast. Saw Celine Dion which was a fabulous performance. Highly recommended. Other recommended attractions - Stratosphere Tower (use monorail), when going to tower go to GMH car testing circuit a blast for petrol heads driving Corvette and 500H.P. Cadillac!, Bellagio dancing fountain, neon light in old downtown Vegas. Vegas was fantastic and we plan to return, the 15 hour flight is worth it. We are not gamblers but the sights, lights and shows are amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Know thy neighbor”
Reviews.Author: RBG81601
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights, Saturday and Sunday, at this hotel. Both nights those in the room next to us seemed to be in our room. We were booked into an adjoining room, the sort meant for groups who want to be together in separate rooms with the convenience of a private door between the rooms. This is great when you know your neighbors, otherwise it is miserable. We literally could hear their conversations, their TV, and their loud drunken return to the room at 3am. In addition we could hear, and feel, the roller coaster from 10am to midnight. Neither was beneficial to trying to sleep. Also, the furnace / AC in the room would belch out this horrible odor unless kept at the very coldest setting. And the tub in the bathroom would not drain so either a fast shower was necessary or a half-time break in the middle so the thing could drain. So overall the room was not enjoyable. The hotel itself, however, is great. Loads of fun. So my suggestion to you reading this is stay somewhere else like MGM Grand across the street and walk over to enjoy all things New York, New York but the rooms!

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your time!”
Reviews.Author: DivaTraveler
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I spent a few days in Las Vegas celebrating his birthday. We had a wonderful time in Vegas but did not enjoy your stay at the New York New York. We checked-in to the hotel at 9 pm and went straight to our room with the intention of relaxing and ordering room service. Well to our dismay, there was no room service menu in the room and we were starving! So we called the front desk and requested a menu which took 30 minutes for them to deliver followed by another 30 minutes for the food. The menu was very limited so I ordered a cheeseburger medium well and was sent up the dryest overcooked burger I have had in a long time. My boyfriend, ordered a ruben on toasted rye and the toast was burnt! Do not order room service, it is not worth it! The room we stayed in with a jacuzzi was spacious, however, the layout of the room was not effiicent and decorated very sparse. The hotel really looks like it needs a face lift. In no way does it comes near to capturing, in the slightest way, the essence of the real New York city, so why bother staying there? We certainly won't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, always something to do”
Reviews.Author: mesheysplace
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have been to vegas many times, he used to live there for five years. But this time, we stayed at the New York New York Hotel and Casino and I must say it was a very pleasant experience. From the helpful concierge to the many activities inside the hotel itself, there is always something to do. They are home to A-list shows such as Zumanity, a production by Cirque de Soleil, and Rita Rudner's comedy. I saw zumanity and must say it wasn't half as good as other cirque de soleil shows I've seen. The NY NY has over ten different restaurants and cafe's to serve everyone's appetite. One of their restaurants, American something?, is open 24 hours, so you needn't starve. Also, if you're going to stay here, get a 50-minute swedish couples massage. The Spa itself isn't much to brag about, but the massage in itself is worth every penny. My husband and I had one and we were dizzy with arousal and serenity by the end of the session. Oh! Also, don't forget to ride the Manhatten Express for the thrill of your life. The peak of the roller coaster gives you a view all the way down the strip before you plunge down at 60MPH. Great ride! The pool wasn't too appealing, however, as it there was only one, compared to most other hotels that boast 3 pools or more. Also, the pool closed at 6pm, which I found to be ridiculously early. The room was comfortable but I think NY NY needs to revamp their rooms a little bit. They're a little too dark and gloomy for my taste. But don't get me wrong, the beds are very comfortable, we slept like babies. No noise from other rooms or the hallway was heard at any time. You can look forward to a restful night's sleep here. Overall though, you definately get your moneys worth here. I'd stay there again, but if I can spare some extra money next time, I think I'll try somewhere a little higher in the budget, like the Bellagio.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel will be very good or quite disappointing depending on what you are looking for. As far as themes go, this has to be the best on the strip. The rooms are decent, the entire hotel is very clean and the service was great. However the sportsbook is the worst on the strip, the pool is small, very crowded and in the shade until noon! You hav to pay $20 to work out in their small workout facility and is a little disconnected from the rest of the strip.

Reviews.Title: “No No New York New York”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Check in at this hotel was difficult. There was a huge line up and it took almost 30 minutes to get to the front desk. This was a Sunday afternoon by the way. We where not given clear direction how to get to our room and we got lost. After trying two different elevators we finally found our rooms. We where disappointed with our room We where in the Yorker tower and the room was clean but not very inviting. Right outside our window was the famous roller coaster ride but we did not have any problem with noise.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay- Good value”
Reviews.Author: bmaartcop
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4 night stay. All in all our stay was enjoyable. Clean , well appointed room. Fair price $89 per night . The hotel is alive with non stop action. Piano bar is a must. 9 fine irishmen has live entertainment but pours a 12 oz Pint of Guiness. Only a loyal Guiness drinker would notice. The pool is small for a large hotel but service at the pool is good ( food and drink). 3 large hot tubs are a plus. The pool hours are 9am - 6pm. Only problem is that there is no exhuast in the bathrooms. One hot shower and your in a steam room. Not a big problem, just odd. Have fun.

Reviews.Title: “We too loved the NewYorkNew York”
Reviews.Author: grannykay11
Reviews.Content: We only stayed 2 days but we were very happy with both the accomodations (Manhatten Nights promo at $89.99 per night) and the cleanliness. I work for another hotel chain and am quite critical about things. We tried several of the Greenwich Village area food places and were happy with the prices, quanity and quality. We also ate at Il Fornio and it was excellent. Didn't do a lot of gambling-just a few slots and came home about even . The only thing I didn't care for was the distance our room was from the elevators especially after a long day. We are in our 60s and our daughter and son-in-law in 20s all had a good time. The reviews I read about Las Vegas before we went helped make our trip easier and better . Thanks everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Vegas for the first time this past March. We loved it. However, we did not love this hotel. When we got there, they told us that our hotel reservation didn't start until the next day, and the woman told us that we could book a room for $70. While we were trying to figure out what was going on (it was 2 AM), a man came out and was like, what's the problem. We explained what was going on, and he typed in the computer, and said, no your reservation doesn't start until tomorrow, sorry. So, even though we had already paid for the room for that night, we were like, we'll deal with this tomorrow, we'll pay the $70 for the room for tonight. The man was then a real jerk, and the woman started typing in our info, and the man was like, "sorry we're completely full. you'll have to go somewhere else" I started to cry. The man didn't offer to help at all, he just told us to call whomever we booked through. So my husband called travelocity (we were booked through), and they told us that we should have a room there, but if they weren't giving us one to go to a different hotel and send them the bill. So we went back up there to talk to them again, and the man was like, sorry. come back at 7am, we'll have a room ready for you. He didn't give us any infomation. So I asked him, do you have any ideas where there might be an open room? and he was like, no. I said, could you call for us? we have luggage and we don't just wanna wander around the city..., so he said fine...came back a minute later and told us there was a room at hooters. so we walked there and they were very pleasant. Then we came back to NY NY in the morning to check in, and they were like, you can't check in until 3, sorry. and i explained what happened, and the woman got her manager, and the manager told us to try at 1, but they would hold our baggage for us. They were not very nice. When we finally got our room, (we had paid for a two room upgrade from the basic - and we had friends in the basic room and one room up..) the room wasnt very nice. it was very old looking, the bed was not comfortable. I saw my friend's basic room, and our's was the EXACT same thing, just a smidge bigger. Our other friend's room (1 room upgrade) was much nicer than ours. In conclusion, I would never go here again unless it were free. There are sooo many really neat hotels in better locations - such as the Aladdin and the Paris, and obviously the Belagio and such.

Reviews.Title: “Buzzing”
Reviews.Author: WIWOL92
Reviews.Content: The rooms at the New York New York are much in size and amenities as at any 4/5 star hotel, clean, and as worth their cost as at any other hotel in Vegas. We had no wait at check in before being given our room on the 28th floor of 'the Chrysler', but there were some longer lines during the weekend (Easter/spring holiday). The room was quiet, well equipped and perfectly satisfactory for our stay. The roller coaster could be heard if we remained silent and the TV was off, but I have suffered many elevators in other hotels around the world that were much more intrusive with their noise and this aspect caused us no difficulty. The main attraction of the hotel is, however, on the ground floor, which is made to represent the neighbourhoods of New York. We spent some time exploring all the hotel/casinos on the Strip and, although there were others that were plusher, more palatial and even those full of shops (who goes to Vegas to shop!?) , none had any 'atmosphere' about them. The only one that had any buzz to it was the New York and it seemed to be always popular. Who wants to gamble in solitude? The only down-point was perhaps the lack of an up-market restaurant, but with the MGM at the other end of the bridge over the Strip, where's the problem? Otherwise, there were numerous food outlets, although some seemed to close ridiculously early. However, the main one was open 24/7 which was handy for an early breakfast when we took a flight to the Grand Canyon. In sum, a good hotel in an excellent location for a break in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Checking out of this place was the best time I ever had during my stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We arrived on a Monday in the afternoon and the line to check in to the hotel was very long and after a tiring flight that’s the last thing you want to see. The room was one of their "Park Avenue Deluxe" rooms which was small for the amount of money. My experience at this hotel and with their rude casino staff had to be the worst. Every dealer I encountered had the most awful attitude. One of their blackjack dealers was continuously yawning as she dealt the cards.....rude, rude, rude! I also caught her when she miscounted my cards and took away my money! I would not recommend this hotel to anyone who is looking to have a pleasant stay. Look elsewhere!

Reviews.Title: “No Problems, GREAT PLACE!”
Reviews.Author: MTJK
Reviews.Content: We stayed at NYNY for 3 days and 2 nights just last weekend. We had a great time and were pleased with the energy and excitement of the hotel/casino. I know everything has been thoroughly reviewed, so I thought I would just touch on some things I found important. CASINO-very active and exciting, great cocktail waitresses POOL-really small, crowded and nothing exciting ROOMS-clean, comfortable (great beds!) and spacious (we stayed in the Spa Tower) NINE FINE IRISHMEN-nice bartenders, good snakebites (beer and cidar) GONZALEZ Y GONZALEZ-average food and slow service STAFF-helpful and kind, quite welcoming All in all NYNY is easily #1 as far as theming goes, if you're not staying here, it would still be fun to check it out. :)

Reviews.Title: “For location, this is really hard to beat”
Reviews.Author: IanCarlisle
Reviews.Content: After reading many of the reviews on Tripadvisor, we were a little anxious when we touched down in Las Vegas. We shouldn't have worried, New York New York was everything we wanted from our hotel and more. Location, rooms, atmosphere, casino, bars, food. All were very good. We wanted a hotel which was 'us'. Something not too high brow and quite lively. We certainly got it. At check in we were offered an upgrade, but were surprised to find that it was free, as we were on our honeymoon. Unlike most reviewers, our walk to the room was all of 40 metres. We ended up on the 31st floor of the Empire State Building. Speaking of rooms, one thing has to be pointed out to readers. It does not matter where you stay in this hotel, you WILL here the roller coaster when it is going. But hey, it doesn't start until 10.30am. The room itself was clean, spacious and had a decent view. The food offerings were not great, with no high end restaurants. We reckoned that the best food was in Nine Fine Irishmen. Spent all of 2 minutes in the bar at times square. It was just not our thing. Sounded better just sitting at the bar outside rather than being inside! For our food we went down the strip to Mandalay Bay, but with 6 hotels (approx 50+ restaurants within walking distance, we weren't stuck for somewhere to eat. Rita Rudner we had never heard off, and so we gave her a miss, went to see Lance Burton next door instead, which was excellent. Would also recommend Legends at the Imperial Palace. Very cheesy, but brilliant. Would we stay here again? Yes. Would it be our first choice? Probably not, there were other hotels we walked through that we thought would be better for us on a second visit.

Reviews.Title: “Fine if your under 30”
Reviews.Author: AshRiverGal
Reviews.Content: Recently spent 3 nites at NYNY Las Vegas and we couldn't get out of there soon enough. My friend and I won the trip thru her work and was looking forward to a great room and casino. Well, the room was smallish and a bit dirty (sheets had stains and on pillowcase too--had to check if the bed sheets really were changed from last guest!!). No room book to tell us about amenities at hotel or restaurants. We were told at check in we had an upgraded room and if our room was an upgrade, you couold have fooled us! As the days went on we were really sick of it...very crowded in the casino and shops area with lots of "20something kids" (we are in our 40s)...probably cause the hotel is moderate in price they can more afford this hotel than more elegant ones down the strip. We have previously stayed at TI and Mirage and would go back there in a heartbeat and avoid "kiddyland". There was even vomit smell in the elevator Saturday nite...no surprise since we observed many of the partiers vomiting into plastic bags on the tram to Mandalay Bay and headed back to NYNY for the nite (it was 2:30am). Now, if we were in that age bracket the place was hopping...the bars and nitelife were booming. Sadly we were not looking for this and next time would stay elsewhere with a bit more class and nicer rooms. Again, probably not a good fit for us but great for the younger crowd.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: lllttves
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a week at the New York New York and it was excellent. We couldn’t believe the size of it standing from the street outside, our hotel was definitely one of the best looking!! Check-in was really quick and easy, we were thinking of upgrading as we got married out there, but when we saw how nice our room was we didn’t bother. We weren’t expecting much from the room due to previous reviews we had read, but we couldn’t believe how big and modern it was. We had two queen size beds which fitted in the room easily, also two of the most comfy chairs ever!! The bathroom was a nice size with a very powerful shower. We had a view of the roller coaster and the back of the statue of liberty which was ok (to be honest we didn’t really spend much time in our room looking out of the window), we couldn’t really hear much noise from the roller coaster either. For our first night we ate in the America restaurant which was ok but then again it isn’t really expensive so we didn’t expect anything much, then again the foot long hot dog we had at 5am after partying at Studio 54 all night went down a treat!! We ate in the Italian for our wedding meal and we couldn’t fault it. There were ten of us in total so we didn’t think service would be great but it was and they really looked after us well. We also ate in the Mexican on our last night and that was brilliant too (I would recommend the chicken fajitas). We drank in the Irish bar which was always busy and they have live music some nights too. The bar at times square was always packed with a big queue outside but it sounded really fun and lively with the duelling pianos!!! All in all we couldn’t fault the hotel and would definitely go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Had A Great Time at New York-New York!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was my wife's and my first trip to Las Vegas, so we have no previous experience with which to comapare NY-NY with the other hotels on the strip. However, we did visit 20 different hotels (at the very least walked through the lobby, casino, shopping mall, etc.) and NY-NY compared favorably with all of them, although each has their own personality and attractions. We stayed in the Park Avenue Deluxe room and it was suprisingly spacious and comfortable (MUCH more so than the hotel room we had in Manhattan near Timnes Square). The roller coaster ran outside our window but the noise from the coaster and it's screaming patrons only enhanced our appreciation of this experience. We ate at several of the restaurants in NY-NY and found them quite satisfactory. The only disappointment was the night before our departure we wanted to just cruise the "streets" of New York and have a brat or other specialty from one of the small places, but they closed at 10:00. I thought New York never closed! The staff was always courteous, even when just passing in the hallway or lobby. We found it a little confusing to navigate the ground floor which includes restaurants, casino, bars, etc., but the logic is to get you to walk through the casino and drop a quarter here and there in the slots. Strategy worked! I would recommend New York-New York as a mid-price option for your Las Vegas experience. Have Fun!

Reviews.Title: “Average Vegas hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Everybody raves about the hotels in Vegas, but unless you stay at Bellagio, THE Hotel, or Wynn, they are all the same theme hotels with average rooms and casinos. Stayed at NY NY having not been enthralled with MGM a couple of years ago. Reception was packed when we arrived and they looked to be struggling to find rooms. Upgraded to a spa suite for a nominal additional charge. Room was fine, but a great corner view and high up (33rd penthouse floor). The review is right, things do close early, particularly the food. When we got home form the bar at about 1am, NOTHING was open, no bars, not even a snack bar and the vacuums were all out on the carpets...NY, the city that never sleeps??? I think not. Went to see Zumanity....loved it! Thought it was hilarious. Went to the pool, felt a bit like a sardine...how many chairs can they cram on a patio? So, if you get a good deal, stay here, if not, look for a great deal somewhere else. Oh, and don't eat or drink in the hotel unless you get a coupon...the prices are ridiculous!

Reviews.Title: “Everything you could want from vegas”
Reviews.Author: sleepmonster
Reviews.Content: When in Las Vegas what we wanted was something over the top, near the other Strip hotels, as well the basic requirements for something clean with good service. New York New York more than fulfilled these, the whole New York theme was hilarious and we had a great time. There are plenty of restaurants and bars within the hotel, so you could either spend all your time there or move between hotels as we did. The room was very nice, smart, elegant bathroom, we were in the Park Avenue level of room in the Chrysler Tower. Don't expect any extras thrown in free as you might in other parts of the country. We called maintenance for one small problem (safe didn't work) which was fixed immediately. We don't gamble much so can't comment on casino. You can walk out to the strip and see all the other hotels etc easily. It is at one end of the Strip and don't underestimate the distances - it's a long walk to cover the whole lot. We got the one-day bus pass but the bus moves very slowly in the busiest parts. Breakfast buffet at Bellagio was also marvellous - only time I've had pickled herrings for breakfast I think.

Reviews.Title: “Food Service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The food venders 'roll up the carpet' very early. When we returned to the hotel after an early show the only options were pizza, Nathens hot dogs and the (ho-hum) America. Skip the in-house Asian restaurant breakfast buffet, with its dirty dishes, and go to the Bellagio. Good beds, quiet room, and accomodating staff.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at New York New York back in October of 2005. The room was great, comfortable bed, beautiful bathroom. Didn't get a room with a view but wasn't a big deal. We were hardly in the room. The staff was helpful, restaurants were great. We almost never left the hotel cause we were so happy with staying there to gamble, shop and eat. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel with good dining options”
Reviews.Author: BlushPell
Reviews.Content: Just had a recent stay at the NY NY Hotel and Casino with my fiancee, brother and a friend. We had stayed two previous nights at another hotel and booked the NY NY for two additionals nights because we had got a good deal for the rooms with some perks. $99 a night with 2 for 1 breakfast and lunch, 2 free drinks, 2 free rollercoaster passes, 2 free spa passes and a Park Avenue upgraded room. This hotel is clean and the staff we encountered were for the most part friendly and helpful. The slot machines were probably some of the tightest around, didn't gamble here much because of that. The Park Avenue upgrade room was newer with a view of MGM across the street and the rollercoaster below. The bed was comfortable but the room was very small. There was not a whole lot of extras either(there just wasn't room). I did hear the rollercoaster like other reviewers had mentioned. It was a little weird at first, but I was hardly in the room when it was running(a lot of late nights, or should I say early mornings). If you are worried ask for a room in the back of the hotel, my brother didn't hear a thing and that is where he stayed.(no view of the strip however) The breakfast at Il Fornaio was very good(went twice, we asked for another coupon..nicely). We also ate at Gonzalez y Gonzalez...excellent and HUGE portions. The 1800 Jose Cuervo margaridas were some of the best I have had! All in all this is a good average hotel. The dining options are a bonus when your feet are tired just from walking too much and you don't want to travel far to get something to eat or drink. The casino is a little like having a bunch of slot machines inside of a Universal Studios set. Personally I would stay here if I got a good price on the room but if you are paying a lot then I would look somewhere else where you could get a little more room for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Great casino, great time”
Reviews.Author: robbielou2
Reviews.Content: Stayed at NYNY for 4 days this month. The room was clean, we would have liked a view but with all the conventions in town that was out of the question. The casino is a blast and full of energy, we went into every casino on the strip and it was definately the best!! ESPN Zone has the best staff and atmosphere, we had a great time!!! The bistro has coffee and treats to die for, the piano bar was entertaining through out the whole casino. We will absolutely stay there again, only next time we will insist on a view.

Reviews.Title: “We'd go back!”
Reviews.Author: 23march96
Reviews.Content: We would definately go back to NYNY Las Vegas! The staff was very friendly and accomodating (with 1 exception!) Check in was very quick and easy and check out was even easier. Our room was great! It was on the 30th floor with a great view of the Mountains! Dispite other reviews I have read, it was very quiet. The room was cleaned promptly each day. Loved the atmosphere of the hotel itself. Although, would not recommend the breakfast buffet at Chin Chin's. You would be better off to head to another hotel for that! We did eat at "America's" and got great burgers...huge!!! The only annoying thing about NYNY, and any hotel you enter in Vegas, is the folks trying to rope you into looking at a time share. The first day we didn't know any better and thought that the guy was just being friendly by handing us a coupon booklet. He told us he could give us free show tickets. When we started looking, he started talking about the timeshare. We told him we weren't interested, he quickly dismissed us and went on to the next unsuspecting couple. P.S....They do target couples. Never rode the roller coaster....too scared!! All in all, it was a great trip and we would definately go back!!!

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel”
Reviews.Author: MacToo
Reviews.Content: We read the reviews on Trip Advisor, and wisely asked for rooms away from the street. The very obliging desk clerk gave us one of the top floors. Outstanding beds!! All the usual top of the line amenities. The Manhattan Nights package is a real deal, with a lot of coupons that are real money savers. Reserve directly with the hotel for the best deal. One caution about Zumanity. The stage action is on the platform that extends out into the audience - the front edge. We were in front row seats next to the stage - but on the back end where nothing happened!! It would have been better to be 2 or 3 rows back at the front of the platform. This is a top of the line hotel. Our only complaint was lack of in-room coffee service, which I understand is true in all MGM properties - a major deficiency from my perspective.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for !”
Reviews.Author: Peter&Juli
Reviews.Content: My wife and i have just got back from a 5 night stay at the NY NY. Overall we had a great time but this hotel doesnt match up with the big boys in terms of qaulity. The room was fine, clean and comfortable yet the bathroom was dissapointing and room service very slow. I think you get what you pay for here and despite the free upgrade we were a little disappointed with room package as a whole. Having said that the view from the room was great , the casino was fun and i would recommend the NY NY as a base if you on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at New York, New York Hotel and Casino.What an excellent choice. We actually chose it because of the reviews from this web site. Very clean and quiet rooms. Very easy to get around. Nice restaurants inside also. Easy walking distance to many of the other sites and shopping. Would definitely go back. Visited Red Rock Canyon and Valley of Fire while out there. Beautiful scenery and beautiful photos. DSC Virginia Beach, VA

Reviews.Title: “friendly and definitively OK”
Reviews.Author: klar0
Reviews.Content: I spent 3 nights at nyny and i can say it could be the best hotel in vegus after a comparison price/value. i had the spa room, with a clean, fantastic bathtube into the room (and also into the batroom), many space, an enormous king size bed. perfect. the hotel offers a lot of services, and a very relaxing pool. the atmosphere is friendly, and this is definitively the aspect that i prefer if i look to other place like venetian, or paris or bellagio or MGM. i stayed there two times and they tried both to make me ask an upgrade (by paying the difference) by saying that i had to wait to have the room iu booked. just be patient.

Reviews.Title: “Ok, but not for what we paid”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our view was on the 10th floor, cement roofs and the roller coaster that ran until 11:00 p.m.(Hey,I'm an old lady)It had No coffee Pots, No laundry facilities ($7.00 to wash my jeans?)Pool was very far from us. It was always crowded & busy downstairs. They never gave us enough towels (called 3 times). The hair dryer only ran on low. The attitude of the girl at the desk was very unprofessional. She told me to take a cab to the landry mat. (Hey, I like to wash clothes each day.) The next time I called I wanted to talk with someone else and she said "Is this about the lugguge?" and I said "No, it's about your attitude." The wallpaper was ripped and the room very small for $174.00 per night! When we checked out I wrote all the greviences down and the clerk just said "He would like into all that later." There were only 2 couple behind us and no other desk clerks at 6:15 a.m. As we left the hotel one of the elevators was very dirty with food or whatever? When I go back I won't be staying at the New York New York. Maryjane, Dundee, IL

Reviews.Title: “Hoppin' Town”
Reviews.Author: javarai
Reviews.Content: We stayed at New York, New York Hotel and Casino December 22-25 and had a great time, in general. This had been our third trip to Vegas fifth hotel. Our previous stays were Viva Las Vegas, Bally's, Golden Nugget, and Bellagio. We have always enjoyed visiting New York New York for the atmosphere and decided it was time to give it a try. Firstly, the rooms are just normal rooms. They were comfortable and clean, and adequately sized. There was nothing super special about our room, but we did not stay in an upgraded room at all. Leaving the room it was easy to get to the restaurants and casino and street. You just have to remember when you walk off the elevator which tower you are in, so you can return to the right elevator later. I mainly gamble penny and nickel slots and was ahead by a small amount most of the time, and then eventually lost that. I expect that from gambling. We liked the simple America restaurant and the Italian restaurant within. We both liked the walk up bars throughout the village and the free drink service was pretty darn good. I would recommend New York New York and will likely stay there again someday. The location was great for me because the airport is close, without battling traffic and I had never explored south strip as much as central strip. I won't make it THE hotel for me because I am still interested in trying a different one each time.

Reviews.Title: “They got it right!”
Reviews.Author: Islander001
Reviews.Content: We have just stayed at New York New York for my spouse's business meetings! This hotel REALLY just keeps trying until they get it right! They deserve kudos for never giving up. When we arrived, we were told that no non-smoking rooms with any sort of view were available... however, upon entering the assigned [smoking] room, it was SO smoke saturated that we realized we could not stay there, and called to the desk, which instantly re assigned us, by changing the electronic key, to another room non-smoking with a north view. (I should add that Las Vegas is the US's last "Smokers Paradise"... most hotels have more smoking than non-smoking rooms, and the linens and sheets, etc., in the smoking room were perfectly fresh, but with carpet, drapes and padded headboards, upholstered chairs, etc., it still smelled like a 'smoker'.) That evening, at bedtime, it became apparent that the room had suffered a minor structural problem in that the wall had settled slightly between it and the room next door, causing a crack which allowed the TV and light from the other room to come in! Again we called... the concierge called the very amiable people in the other room, who obligingly doused their lights and TV -- my spouse had a very early meeting the next day. Next morning, New York New York arranged to move us yet again, and later that day and for the remainder of our stay we were in a lovely, large east-and-south views room, and at least 3-4 staff members called to make sure our final move was satisfactory and apologize. An extremely obliging bellman even moved our luggage and garments on hangers so that I needn't re pack. Hotel location and all the staff were quite good... the hotel has easy access to both the monorail system and the southern Strip tram system. The casino is a good deal less smoky than some, perhaps due to the very high ceilings, and we found the restaurant Nine Fine Irishmen an excellent place to take a guest the first night -- we were seated in a little 'snug' just off the upstairs bar very reminiscent of pubs in the UK, but we understand the whole thing was built and moved whole from Ireland. As all of the conference meals were catered and included, we did not eat in the hotel otherwise. This is not The Venetian or the Four Seasons or Bellagio, but is definitely a step up from many of the other Casino-Hotels, and their effort on our behalf should earn them four stars!

Reviews.Title: “Review of the "Player's Suite"”
Reviews.Author: toddnath
Reviews.Content: The common areas of this hotel have been described in great detail so I will focus solely on our room. We stayed in a room called the 'Player's Suite' which was the second nicest suite they offer. It was one of the nicest Vegas rooms I had ever stayed in. The 700 sq/ft L-Shaped room is complete with clover-shaped spa tub large enough to fit two comfortably and up to four in close quarters. The only downside was that the jets were at the bottom of the tub so there was no direct massage on my back. The highlight of the room was the Bose sound system -- Far and away the best stereo system I have ever seen in a hotel room. It came with a cd/dvd player, two overhead speakers which could be positioned to face any part of the room, and a subwoofer to provide that extra bass kick. We were playing the stereo pretty loud inside the room but it was barely audible to those walking down the hall. Another nice feature was the small fridge. So much better than those lousy honor bars where if you touch an item it's instantly billed to your room. We stopped off at a convenience store on the way in from the airport and stocked up on water, soda, and some adult libations. The bathroom was small but adequate. The water pressure was poor and the toilet seat would not stay up. The living area was more than adequate with a sofa-bed, coffee table and large TV. Adjacent to that was a large four-person dining table. There were also a couple of nice chairs which rocked back and forth. All in all it was a great room and it was priced around the same as a standard room at the Venetian or Caesars Palace. If you're looking for a high quality suite without the high quality price tag, I highly recommend the Player's Suite at NYNY. P.S. - The rollarcoaster was right outside our window and it never once was a noise issue.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place - nice price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 night stay at the NYNY. We had booked their Manhattan Nights package, which upgraded us to the Broadway deluxe rooms. It also gave us 2 for 1 coupons for a lunch and a breakfast, some free cocktails, free ride on the rollercoaster and spa admission. They were nice little freebies. The front desk did a nice job keeping our party together up on the 27th floor of the Chrysler Tower. Our room was a corner room right near the elevator. We had a view looking out towards Red Rock and the side windows looked up the strip towards the Bellagio fountains. I had no issues with cleanliness of the room. It was in good shape when we arrived and housekeeping kept it that way. The casino area was nice. It wasn't very crowded on Wednesday and Thursday but by Friday, it got crowded. I could see how that could be an issue. The Big Apple Bar was a fun place to hang out. All in all, we enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Skyline looks like NYC but service isn't up to NYC standards.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just got back from las vegas and we stayed at NY NY first ,then at Paris. We booked and paid for our room 6 weeks ago but when we arrived we were stuck in a smoking twin bed room. I asked them right away when we got the room if it was non smoking but they said it was only a preference and that they would switch our room the next day without any problems. Because we arrived around 11pm and didn't have any other choice there we stayed in the smokey room. The room had some garbage still in it like some doritos crumbs around the bed and an empty can of mint chewing tobacco on the floor. the next day we tried to get into our promised non smoking king sized bed room but we got jerked around for the day. First it was no problem, then call back between 1-3, then wait till 4:30pm. we had dinner reservations at 5pm and the hotel would only hold the room (if they actually had one for us) until 6pm, what a joke considering we prepaid for our rooms AND they were happily checking people in ALL DAY. Good thing we had only booked 2 nights there, we were much happier with our beautiful non smoking room at the Paris. We did like the hotel ammenities and had a few cayote ugly slushies helped alot. there's a starbucks onsite which was great considering most of the NY NY food sources close up early. We've been to NYC a few times and here's a few things they totally missed: Pizza - their nyc pizza place was crap. I didn't see any doughy puffy pizza in NYC. black and white cookies - i was stunned that i couldn't find any B+W cookies on the premisis, luckily for me ceasers had them as well as the mirage had them in the deli's! So if you're considering NY NY you better call them first and get them to somehow secure you the room you paid for.

Reviews.Title: “NYNY is ok”
Reviews.Author: FSUBooster
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at the NYNY in mid March. The window from our 4th floor room provided us a great view of the roof and roller coaster tracks and not much else. The room was clean and well maintained while we were there. We did hear the roller coaster running all night long (We wondered how many people RODE the coaster all night long)...that was a drag. The piano bar and big apple bar were fun. Coyote Ugly was a disappointment. The one in Ybor City (Tampa) is much more fun. All in all, it was good value. Not top end but not a dive. The roller coaster, however, was a nuisance.

Reviews.Title: “Dive Overrated”
Reviews.Author: jimtippy
Reviews.Content: First we checked in, the room I had booked a Broadway Deluxe with a King Size Bed and Non-Smoking Room was not available. The clerk was very rude with you can have a Park Place which is a cheaper room and not as big, but since you pre-paid you won't get a credit or anything to compensate for the difference. He said I expected too much to have a king size room and a non-smoking room in Las Vegas. I accepted the room since I was dead tired, the room was nothing to write home about small and non-descript. The next day we headed out and came back to the room at around 4 pm the room had been cleaned, I cleaned housekeeping and they stated the would have the room clean by 7 pm and ledt again and return at 1030 pm and the room still wasn't cleaned. I called again, and was advised they had my request. I was told they would clean the room by 11pm. I went out and when I returned they had made a meager effort at cleaning the room, I wouldn't recommend this overpriced dump to anyone.......

Reviews.Title: “Great Place for a Family Vacation”
Reviews.Author: bigboy61455
Reviews.Content: Good Value: I got a very decent deal with AmericaWest Package; only costs $50 a day, started from Sunday. Average size room but very comfortable. Got variety of shampoos and lotions which I like even better than those in Bellagio. Moreover, you can enjoy very reasonable buffet and all bf, lunch, dinner by just taking a nearest elevator down from your room. If you want fine dining, it is also available, of course. Game room is also there for kids and teenagers while parents are enjoying casino. Free music available nightly too (quite rare in Vegas). I mean with a band and vocalists. You may enjoy some free piano music at Bellagio though. Coyote and Duelling Piano (actually electronic pianos placed in frame of grand pianos) are popular places for college kids. So very convenient for all ages. Excellent Housekeeping: Most of them are Hispanics and very hard working. They won't ever knock your door even if you don't put any sign outside. Once you are out, they will clean your room real quick. Very organized. Pros: as described, value, very clean. You can easily reach to all restaurants without needing to use your GPS or map. ONE OF THE EASIEST PLACE IN VEGAS to find a place to eat without cursing "maze" like casino machines found in most of the hotels. Cons: pool is not available in winter although you can enjoy in Bellagio year round, although both are owned by MGM group. ? More than 10 years old now.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the NY NY Hotel for 3 nights at the end of January 2006. This was part of a trip where we also went to New York and then Hawaii to get married. Although this was a reverse honeymoon, we didn't feel we got particularly special treatment. We had booked a Park Avenue room, no spa and we did have views of the MGM Grand, Excalibur etc. The room was a little dated, but the bathroom had granite finishes (unfortunately bath water pressure and heat was lacking). We checked in at midnight and the lines were quite long. The reservations person was pleasant but took a while to find a room that had 1 bed for us. Then he explained the directions to the room. We were in the Empire Tower and it was the longest corridor i have ever seen and a bit of a pain. We got to the room and he had written room 1404 on the card slip so after trying to open it and waking someone up we started to take the looong walk back to reception. I noticed halfway back that the printed slip said 1401. Besides this hiccup, it was good. We only at the pizza joint (no problem), the buffet (buffet was not very good value) but the American diner was yummy. Times Square bar was cool and always busy. We would recommend getting the complimentary MGM card for players points here if you are going to gamble there or at any of the other affiliated hotels. Loved Las Vegas generally and although the experience wasn't terrible, we would probably try another hotel next time. Not bad value for money and we didn't have rollercoaster noise.

Reviews.Title: “Great, fun party hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: dwillar
Reviews.Content: Several friends, couples and singles, all Vegas veterans, stayed at NYNY for 4-5 days the beginning of March. We had a blast! The Times Square Bar with dueling pianos is fabulous!!! Must do! Our single girlfriend had 6 men singing "You've Lost that Loving Feeling" to her and enjoyed every second of it. It is a ton of laughs. The rollercoaster is a blast too! The table games are good, I won money on single-deck blackjack, and many of our friends won money on slots. Zumanity is great, great show, fun and very sexy, if you aren't a prude! Take your wife & girlfriend! There is a wide variety of dining options from quick service Village Restaurants (pizza, fish, burgers, asia, etc.), to Chinese, ESPNZone (very good), to fine Italian (excellent), to great steak (missed that one, very expensive, heard it was good), mexican (pretty good), to average American (it's OK). Several bars to choose from including dueling pinaos, live band, to lounging or Coyote Ugly (yes, it's packed). Rooms were very clean and nice but not Bellagio of course. The location on the Stip is good for walking to other resorts so we saw the Bellagio fountain show 4 times and checked out most of the big resorts on the strip. Good central location. The spa was nice but a little expensive. Well, all spas in Vegas are expensive. Services were good but the workout area was not impressive. We had friends with us who usually do cheaper resorts in Vegas and they enjoyed NYNY but said they'd go back to the lesser places to save money next time. We liked NYNY better than MGM just beacuse we liked the style, and much better than (off-stip) Orleans or Tuscany. BTW, we spent an aftternoon and evening downtown and really enjoyed the cheaper tables and light show. Check it out if you can find time. We had a great time and will return to NYNY-LV for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel directly on The Strip”
Reviews.Author: appleleena
Reviews.Content: I'm an extremely picky traveler (worked in the hotel business for years) and I loved this hotel. It's basically one of those super large hotels that you don't have to leave to have fun. Check-in was fast and friendly; the bellstaff very helpful (use them you don't want to haul your luggage across the big casino and they drop off your luggage in about 15 minutes); the 'standard' room was much larger than I expected and very clean; the food was good in the restaurants; and the noise level from the roller coaster outside was minimal to non-exsistent. The only 'bad' things I can say about the hotel is that the concierge staff weren't very helpful with recommendations for clubs (but I think "Carol" just had an attitude); I had an issue with my tub not draining (but engineering came and fixed the tub in a fast and friendly manner so it was a non-issue); and housekeeping still calls to see if you want your room serviced even when you have a 'do not disturb' sign on the door. (which is stupid of them and annoying) The view from my room sucked but I didn't care. Who sits in their room looking out the window? Also, if you order room service expect it to take at least 45 minutes as they are always busy! But the food is very good and the waiters were extremely nice and beyond professional. Coyote Ugly is way overrated but the Big Apple Bar is a lot of fun with live music (the band "Chicks that Rock" was great) and the dueling piano bar is a blast. I paid an average of $240 a night and have no regrets at all.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My Dad and I stayed at New York New York March 7-11 2006. We prefer the Mirage or Bellagio out of the MGM-Mirage resorts but could not find a room for our desired week. New York New York has a great atmosphere with the ESPN Zone, Village Eateries and other restaurants. The casino is a little loud for my preference, and the American Cafe (24 hour cafe) has slow service. We had a strip view room and it was very comfortable (no noise). The room was clean, room service and housekeeping was excellent and you could not even notice the rollarcoaster outside. Request a strip view room. The pool was closed but I glanced outside and it looked very attractive. Even though we prefer other hotels in the MGM-Mirage ownership group, NYNY is a nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “not worth it”
Reviews.Author: duluthearl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel March 1-3. After the usual pitch to upgrade our room ,which we refused, we were given a small room at the end of a corridor, room 1483. While the room was clean and Ok it didn't exceed rooms found in budget hotels. For example there was no bathroom vent. The hotel was very noisy with a lot of activity and extremely noisy with loud music in the evenings. Not a place for older people. We had a breakfast buffet at Chin Chin and we was medicore, especially considering it was higher priced than many others. I would recommend another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: BlacknGoldtraveler
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a weekend at NY, NY hotel. First the bad, very long walks from the elevator to the rooms. Drink prices are through the roof in every bar. ($7/8 a beer). We dropped at least $500 at the casino on our players cards and was offered no comps. (none yet anyhow). The good, rooms were great, very clean. You CAN hear the coaster but it's very faint. An average TV volume level will cover it. The Casino has a nice "outdoor" feeling to it with alot of trees. The entire place was very clean. Most dealers were friendly. All in all, a little pricey for us, but it was a visit on a weekend. I would definitely stay there again if I went during the week when rates are lower. If I do another weekend trip, I would stay at Sam's Town. My advice, if your in the casino but not gambling, buy beer at the little shop in SOHO village located on the Casino floor.

Reviews.Title: “Super casino host!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 days, were disappointed in the slot payoffs but other than that it was great!!! It was like being in the big apple. A casino host (Chase) tracked us down and told us if we need ANYTHING to just let her know. Also explained there are 5 other hotels we could use our players card and comp meals. We charged all our meals to our room and when we went to check out our casino host had already written everything off as comps and we owed nothing!!! Plus since we weren't catching a flight until 10 that night they gave us another $100 voucher for meals that day! We would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as last year”
Reviews.Author: ducs
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at New York, New Hork Hotel and Casino in Las Vegas Thanksgiving week 2004 and had such an enjoyable experience, we decided to stay there again February 14 through 17, 2006. However, it was a very different experience this time. After confirming that we would receive an upgraded Park Avenue room that was 400 square feet with a king bed, we received the standard room, smaller than 400 square feet with two beds. I called the front desk to complain and they said they would move us the next day. I called again with the same result after about an hour. We couldn't get into any of the nicer restaurants in the hotel the first night despite having tried to make reservations early in the afternoon, but that was probably because it was Valentine's Day. The television did not have good reception. We also did not receive the comps that came with the room upon check-in and had to go back to the front desk the next day and ask for them. The next day, the front desk called and said our new room was ready and I should go down to the front desk and get the new keys and move. They did not offer to have the bellman come and help me with the luggage. I had to request a bellman as I was alone and could not handle all the bags. The second room was larger and had a king bed, but was missing one of the upholstered chairs in the sitting area, the handle for the cold water in the bathrom sink was broken, and the wand fell off the drapes the first time I used it and never was repaired despite my requesting the repair. Despite all the problems with the rooms, the Il Fornaio restaurant was excellent and reasonably priced for several meals and the clubs in the hotel were lively and enjoyable. Next time, I am going to try a different hotel in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “bright lights larger than life”
Reviews.Author: crusty
Reviews.Content: My husband and I was on our honeymoon and was very pleased to find we could check in from the airport to save time so as soon as we got to the hotel we could go straight to the room. Inside the lobby area absolutely impressive and a wide range of restaurants inside although one of them called america their service was below par in the end we didnt have desert as we had already been there too long.Unfortunately we didnt have chance to try all the restaurants but the other ones we did they were excellent. We also went to a show at another hotel call 'O'which was a must, another must is a day trip to the Grand Canyon with a helicopter trip to the bottom with a short boat ride absolutely breathtaking.

Reviews.Title: “Whats all the fuss about?”
Reviews.Author: mj05dgv
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from the NY NY, and am wondering what all the dreadful reviews are about. This was our first time in Vegas so spent time looking at the other hotels. When we arrived at the NY NY, the reception staff could not have been more helpful. We were given a complimentary upgrade on the room without asking. We were given advice on the shows (both thishotel and others) and where the best places to eat were. In fact all the staff we dealt with could not have been friendlier. The room was in the NY tower, and yes, we did hear the rollercoaster and the helicopters, but to be honest the amount of time we spent in the room was so minimal that this did not cause any problems. Even after beng given an upgrade on the room we were still disappointed. The view was of Excalibre (cheap good buffet in there) and the rollercoaster. Also it was a long walk to the lifts so you had to make sure you did not forget anything in the room. The room was smaller than expected and was disappointed to find that there was no coffee/tea making facilities. If you went down to starbucks for a coffee for the room it was cold before you got back!!!! The hotel itself was great. The casino was a little cramped compared to others, but leaving this aside the theme was excellent and the whole place spotless. I agree with another reviewer about the piano bar, it was good funbut my advice if you do not want to get crushed and pay over inflated prices for drinks is to stand or sit outside (preferably next to a slot machine then you dont pay for drinks) where you can still see the pianists and join in the fun. C ugly was packed older men on holiday. Not really a good place to be. Book a week in advance if you want to eat in nine fine irishmen as it is very popular with local people. Yes there are nicer hotels in Vegas, if you want to pay nice prices, but on the whole the NY NY is well worth the money and you are guaranteed a good time. Make your own mind up. I personally felt uncomfortable in the Bellagio, not a place to relax.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: hockeyfanx2
Reviews.Content: I visit Vegas 1-2 times a year and this was the 1st time staying @ New York. I was very excited considering this was a 4 star hotel. That excitement quickly turned to disappointment. When we checked into the hotel the clerk at the front desk said that they didn't have the King bed we requested so they would move us to room with a view the next day at no additional charge. When I got to the room she had given us for the night I noticed that it was a skyline room and I had paid extra for the park avenue deluxe, which is about 150 - 200 square feet bigger. I called the front desk to complain and was told basically that they didn't have the room I had pre-paid and that was because of the late check-in. I explained that I had pre-paid the night so the time of check-in shouldn't matter. Not only that but the clerk who had originally checked us in never explained that we wouldn't be getting the room we paid extra for. Housekeeping was horrible. Our room was never cleaned before 3:00 p.m. and one day housekeeping actually called to see if we would like our room cleaned. The roller coaster drove me crazy. Every 5-10 minutes I could hear loud screams. When I complained at the end of my stay the manager, Mr. Freeman was very rude. He didn't even offer an appology. If your looking for friendly customer oriented service I would look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “All True - Some Good / Some not so”
Reviews.Author: zebeach
Reviews.Content: We went to New York / New York with a group of 12 so we had 6 rooms in all in various parts of the hotel. It seemed like someone in the group expeienced at least one of the problems that I have seen as themes in the various reviews. Check-In 3 rooms got upgraded just by asking. 1 room got just what we had reserved. 1 room got given smoking and told they could move the next day (they keep the room since it was not noticable) 1 room / couple insisted on non-smoking and got told they would have to "downgrade" or pay $75 more per night since they next upgrade room was not open. Well after some very load complaining they suddenly found a room for them in the same slight upgrade / non-smoking the other 3 had gotten. It was really small but non-smoking. What kind of stupid front desk person actually tells somebody they are going to be downgraded. If she had just put them in the downgraded room they would probably have never known. Noise I am really hard of hearing so I thought ... no problem ... well all the nights at 4-6 am I could lay in my bed and actually hear clearly the people next door talking. Because of this site I had brought ear plugs that both my husband and I then put on. Rooms Considering we all had the same reservations and no one paid for an upgrade we had a huge variety of room sizes and locations. So I would say if you don't like your room just ask for a different one. Some people had a small one near the elevator. Some bigger at the end of the hall (but no view). One couple even had a corner window with a strip view. Food Nine Fine Irishmen was a hit with our whole group. It was a little strange that the poor girl could not split our bill but could charge whatever amount we wanted to 12 different things. Tons of work for her. Next time we will do that differently. I think someone in our group ended up here each night at some point. We also loved the quick service pizza on the main level and the Nathan's famous hot dogs up by the kiddie games. Try the Philly! Look for coupon's on the internet for buy one item get one free. 2 different groups ate at the America restaurant. Nothing really special although the club sandwich was really good. Service was OK. We loved the "Food Court" concept of the whole place and it made grabbing a bit really easy. Kids After returning to Vegas after not having been for about 15 years I can say Don't bring your kids to Vegas. You cannot walk down the street without seeing something you might just rather not have your kids think of as "normal" The Nude factor is huge ... That being said if you do have to bring kids New York New York would be a good place to stay. They have lots of places to eat and shop without going into the casino.
