There is a game area with arcade games and they could get to MGM and see the lions without being outside much. But the pool although closed when we were there looks to be a boring and small. Games / Slots etc. We had some fun at the slots but mainly gambled at cheaper places down the strip. Casino Royale was a favorite (fun craps and blackjack Split). Getting around The new Duece bus was the best deal $5 for riding all day. Just don't try to get anywhere in a hurry since they are driving on the strip which is not fast at all. Would we stay there again? With so many places to stay in Vegas our group will probably try another place down near Mirage or Treasure Island since there are more places to go in a more concentrated area but we did enjoy the New York / New York.

Reviews.Title: “New York state of mind”
Reviews.Author: keoweegirl
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 5 day trip to vegas. Stayed at the New York basically because the other members in our party got their rooms free. We were assigned a queen room after requesting a king but got to switch to a king the next day. Most of the rooms face the roller coaster but incredibly enough as stated in previous review's the noise isn't an issue. The sound from the coaster is more of a hum than anything. The layout of the hotel is confusing even after 5 days I wasn't sure how to quickly navigate. We received the online special "Manhattan Nights" which included 4-5 free coupons for things as free drinks,spa admission,free coaster rides. We utilized all freebies and really enjoyed them. The location in regards to the strip is good. You can walk to the MGM monorail and for a fee get to the farthest end of the strip. Also a free monorail to Mandalay Bay or Luxor. We did walk to the Belagio and Paris casino's.

Reviews.Title: “Good service”
Reviews.Author: williamtwo
Reviews.Content: I stayed at NY, NY on Jan 8 - 9th in rm #2931 (Park Aven Deluxe category) in the Century tower. I had stayed at the Hilton Grand Vacations on Karen over the past weekend, but decided to stay one more night after finding a $20 room deal on hotels. I read other reviews and requested a room near the elevator which is a great tip!! Room was small but pleasant and clean. It had a good view of the side of the Bellagio - fountain not viewable however. I liked my stay there since the staff was friendly at checkin & check out, and did there best to accommodate my requests. Room express checkout was not available if you request a late checkout. I requested a late check out at 5pm, which was $30 extra, and was fine with me since I would working from the room. Internet access was easy to use and starts 24 hours from when you logon, not like other hotels that goes from Noon to Noon. I would stay there again for the friendly staff and close proximity to Excalibur, Aladdin (great buffet) and Tropicana. Never stay at the Excalibur - rooms too small, but good place to gamble since drinks come often when playing blackjack.

Reviews.Title: “Very Sub-Par Hotel”
Reviews.Author: pkmgolf
Reviews.Content: This is the worst "nice" hotel on the trip! The Tropicana is a nicer hotel minus the outdated colors. No amenities in the rooms!!! Not worth the money stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “crap!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: this place s----!!! bar is always empty and i didnt win here once!!! not only was c-ugly dead it was full of only guys. i dont know about you but i dont want to hang out at a bar with 30 other guys and only 4 bartenders never again

Reviews.Title: “Favorite Strip Property”
Reviews.Author: jersey72
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here numerous times and never had a bad experience. This is by far my favorite location on the strip (a view shared by my wife, brothers, and several friends.) There's a handful of conflicting reviews here, and I want to touch on what you get (and DON'T get) at this hotel. Rooms: The rooms to tend towards the smaller size. Whenever I've checked in, I'm always nice to the counter person, and always at least get a view of the strip (which is all I really care about in a Vegas room). The TV is small, but of course why would anyone sit in their room to watch TV when they're in Vegas? I've never heard a lot of noise from the roller coaster; I've heard a lot more from either the AC or the copters flying overhead. Casino: I don't play slots, so I can't comment on those. I have seen people post that they slots don't pay out; do remember they call it gambling for a reason. ;-) It's easy to at least find $10 tables, and the occassional $5 table (although those are rare.) The casino is fairly small compared to a lot of the others, which I like because it's easy for me to sneak away to the bathroom or to grab a bite to eat. They don't have a poker room, which is my only complaint. (There are rumors they will open one, but we'll see what happens.) Pool: Terrible. I don't go to Vegas for the pool, so this doesn't bother me at all. If you want a pool, stay at the Flamingo or someplace else. Coyote Ugly: Unless 100 guys trying to ogle 6 girls is your idea of a good time, skip this place. it's packed, the drinks are overpriced, and the atmosphere isn't what I would call fun. Nine Fine Irishmen: Love this bar. Good food, good Guiness, good service. Not to be missed. ESPN Zone: Makes up for their very small sportsbook. Make your bet outside, then go inside and watch the game. Great fun. Times Square Bar: I love dueling pianos, so I love this place. We spent the majority of our 2005NYE at this bar. (To the random girl my brother and I seranaded on NYE, I apologize.) ;-) Quick Bites: All over the place. The best thing to do is to go upstairs to Nathan's. It's a pain to get to, so it's often pretty empty there (even when the rest of the place is packed), and you get to have Nathan's (the best hot dog in the world.) The pizza joint is OK (works if you're drunk). Basically, NYNY, just like any other location in Vegas, caters to a specific crowd. If you're looking to have a good time in a small casino, this is your place.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, WILL stay there again next time!!”
Reviews.Author: Splitty
Reviews.Content: Ok, I just returned on Saturday, Feb. 5th and I must say, all the reviews that put this place down are garbage. We stayed in a normal room in the Century Tower, rm 2631 and it was just avg. It wasn't bad but but it wasn't luxury either. Like many people say though, you don't go to Vegas to hang out in your room. As for people saying that their are kids running all over the place, I think I saw 2 kids underage the entire trip in this hotel. The layout of the casino is awesome. By far my fav. of all the casino's we visited this trip. I played a lot of Black Jack and for the most part, the dealers were very friendly and funny. One dealer by the name of Robert made our time playing there excellent. I did lose all my money by the end of the trip, but I guess that's to be expected. We played BJ at TI, MGM, Luxor, and of course NYNY. The dealers at these hotels were pathetic, especially at TI. I will never drop another dollar in that hotel. MGM and TI are supposed to accept the player card that we get at NYNY but those two hotels wouldn't even take down your info if you didn't bet $25 or more a hand. And they were't friendly about letting you know it either. They were snotty and kinda laughing when I ONLY place a $15 bet for my first hand. At the NYNY, they accept player cards if you are even $5 a hand. What they do there is just keep track of your avg bet over how long you play there. Best advice, use your player card everytime you drop a dollar into the slot or play a hand of something at the tables, then charge all your food to your room. At the end, go to the players desk and ask what comps you got. We got all our food covered plus $20 cash back. Nice little perk at the end of a trip. Another thing, people always complain on here about the rollercoaster being to loud, or hearing the hellicopters flying over head...cry me a river! We had the start of the rollercoaster right out our window and could barely hear it and I watched hellicopters fly overhead all the time, but didn't hear them either. My summary, if your stuck up and snotty, don't stay here...if you want to have fun and don't care for the Bellagio elegance stay here for sure! I will be back to this hotel. If anyone wants to email me with questions, feel free... www.gaz42@telus.net

Reviews.Title: “My anniverary”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were here celebrating our 10 year anniversary. We arrived at 8:00AM. Check in was at 3, but we were told to check back in a couple of hours. We were asked if we would like to upgrade to a Marquis spa suite for 50.00 per night so we agreed. WOW!! it was perfect, not huge, but very nice. We were in our sweet by 11:30AM. The hotel staff was great, the room was clean. I read reviews telling me to use my players card. I did and I built up points. I went to the players club once I reached 1,000. They comped all of the meals for the rest of our stay. I am no high roller. I think I spent about 700.00 in 3 days, but my points rose to 3500. They comped 400.00 in meals for us. So my advice is use the card for slots!!! We saw Zumanity, it was very good, but beware it is not for everyone. It was very sexual, and erotic. Don't bring your elderly parents to see it. All in all I can't wait to go back, I had a great anniversary. I loved everything about it.

Reviews.Title: “FInally a bed not as hard as a rock”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed in a double double room on the roller coaster side of the building on the 18th floor. We had absolutely no noise issues from the roller coaster the four days we were there. The beds were much better than other hotels I have slept on along the Strip. They were firm but had a softness to them that let you sleep exceptionally well. The only negative is the door locks/latches. They work fine but they are noiser than most when used. You could hear people's door latches closing in the corridor in the evenings. Overall I would stay there again next time I am in Vegas. Location is good, room rates fair for the strip and the beds fantastic....

Reviews.Title: “very pleasant experience”
Reviews.Author: katwoman1
Reviews.Content: we were in las vegas because my husband's office had a business get together there. I was left fending for myself 90% of the time. I had planned to do a lot of sight seeing because I really hate losing when gambling. I spent almost my entire spare time during the 3 days gambling because the people at the crap and blackjack tables made it so relaxing and enjoyable. I knew the basic rules, but they made me feel right at home and answered any remaining questions I had. I thank them for making my stay a fun filled vacation. The registration line was all of about 5 mins and the same with checkout. The room was of average size, no particular pretty view other than the roller coaster, but I barely heard it. We had a nonsmoking floor of which it truly was (a definite plus). The bed was just right, not too hard or soft, great sleeping. We didn't eat in the restaurants here so can give no opinion. All in all a great time. would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “2nd visit not as great as the first”
Reviews.Author: Amber12478
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed at NYNY in June '05 to scope out the wedding opportunites for our December 2005 wedding. In June, the NYNY was TERRIFIC...in December...not so much. I thought the place was a little dirtier and less friendly, but perhaps that was because of the greater number of people.

Reviews.Title: “Viva Las Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: dani1982
Reviews.Content: My father took me to vegas for my 21st birthday in May of 2004 and it was absolutely amazing. We arrived at 9 am and they got us a room immediately. The rooms were very clean and the maid service was wonderful. Bathroom was large and the beds were very comfortable. We ate dinner at Il Fornaio and it was great. Also went to quite a few buffets and very nice restaurants in the Venitian. The best part was you had the 'fast food' type of eateries so you can grab and run to do as you please. We saw Danny Gans(Mirage) and he was well worth the money. He stopped once to take a sip of water and that was it. We also saw the Legends show at the Imperial Palace and that was a riot especially when Elvis came up to me and started serenading me. My dad really got a kick out of that one! The last night was a blast we were up till 530 am gambling, drinking, andpacking then had to get on a tour bus to go see hover dam (great experience, must see) needless to say my first experience in vegas was wonderful and i'm glad to share it with my father(Thank you pa I love you!) Second vegas experience was in August of 2004 my boyfriend got comped a 4 night stay at NYNY w/limo, spa, the works. We arrived and they picked us up in a limo(see photo.) We went to the vip area where there was a younger man helping us and giving us great info. I'm not a huge bar person so i have to comments on that. The casino waitstaff was wonderful. They brought me any kind of drink I wanted(even when sitting at the penny slots) and they were quick too. Our room was clean, tidy and spacious. I don't see why there are so many complaints about them if you don't buy a suite then don't expect a room the size of a suite! As for the roller coaster (you can see in the photos outside my bedroom window) they were not loud at all. I heard people scream from them probably twice and that's because the vent was open in the room, there was no tv/shower going and I was being perfectly quite. They must have read my mind because there was extra pillows in the closet! We left in the morning(7am) and came back around 11am and the beds were made, trash taken out, empty/dirty glasses taken/replaced, fresh towels, more toiletpaper& tissue, etc. Absolutley great! Trip 3 August 2005 for a friends birthday. Had to stay at NYNY again because they are so good to us. Checked in and upgraded our room for a nominal fee. Didn't like the first one and they were quick to get us into a new room and deeply apologized. If I could post movie images I would but this view was breathtaking. You could see all the way down the strip and the bellagio fountains were wonderful at night especially. We went down to the Wynn casino and it was like a replica of Bellagio and Caesars Palace. Again things were clean & tidy the only issue we had this time was there was a 'party' going on in the room next to us. It lasted 5 min, security came up escorted people out and actually came and sat upstairs for about 1/2 hour to make sure they weren't getting rowdy again. Trust me I appreciated it. First time I went downtown and loved the show, taxi was expensive but worth it because it took you 15-20 min to get down there instead of the 2 hours it took our friends because they took the bus. The light show was good. I really did not want to leave the hotel this time we pretty much ate and gambled here nightly. We got 'take out' and ate in our room (while watching the Bellagio fountains). All in all The NYNY Hotel & Casino is an wonderful place. I will probably only stay there on all of my trips to vegas (and we go at least once a year.) If you have any other questions or want to view more photos please email me at dbianculli82@yahoo.com

Reviews.Title: “Very Lively - Great for 30something's who love nightlife”
Reviews.Author: justinpike
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in Vegas once before at TI so I can only draw comparisons between these two. Las Vegas Airport says you can check-in there for NYNY but that has now stopped, a minor issue as check-in was about average - not quick, but not the hour quoted in another review. We booked via ----- and were surprised to find they class the Park Ave Deluxe as 'standard' The room was a good size, but we decided not to pay the extra $75 for a room with a strip view ($75 for 5 nights) and got a room over looking the parking lot. However, how often does anyone look at of the window apart from the check the weather (Oh look it's sunny again). We had the roller coaster right outside but we could not hear it - either we are deaf or the rooms we were in are better soundproofed, I won't say it was a quiet room but nothing to really bother us. So far, so good - now come the moans. Room Service - Don't bother. We paid $22 for a cup of tea and a coffee, it took 45mins to arrive and we paid cash. They then tried to add it to out bill on check out. Not good The bars are wonderful in NYNY but, and here is where I compare it to TI, there is no bar where you can just sit and have a drink and relax for a few after about 8pm. Times Sq has dueling pianos, Big Apple has live bands and NFI is just always packed. As the title says 'great for 30somethings who enjoy a lively night'. TI has a nice seated area with great service, NYNY is lacking here. Overall that is my only real moan and it is not a major issue. With the addition of one 'quieter' bar i would never look to stay anywhere else but NYNY.

Reviews.Title: “Not sure how to rate it...”
Reviews.Author: Shortypots
Reviews.Content: I guess I am rating these guys lower than I normally would because they made us switch rooms in the middle of a 4nt stay. We made our reservations originally via Expedia, well, we decided to extend our vacation by a couple of days and Expedia couldn't find availability in the hotel, but yet when we called the hotel directly, it was not a problem, or so we thought. They told us it would be a back to back reservation and it would not be a problem. We arrived and they told us again that it would not be a problem. Well, we got to our room and loved it! We were told that the rooms tend to be small and this one most certainly was not!!! The view was incredible too. We were on a corner so we got the strip view as well as one toward Excalibur. Well, on our second night, after we had been out walking all day on the strip, I decided to call down to the front desk to ensure that there was nothing we needed to do for the next day. They told us again it was not a problem, and that we would need our keys recoded, but we could do that anytime the next day. Great! Off to sleep I went, until the phone rang just moments later. Turns out the room they had us in was blocked off for the next two days for "deep cleaning" whatever that is, but for the inconvenience they were going to upgrade us to the Park Avenue rooms (we were only booked in Skyline Deluxe). So, after being out all day and it was now 10:30pm, we had to pack up and move. Then they took us to a room that was so small, we could barely fit our luggage in there, and this was supposed to be an upgrade? I felt sorry for the poor bellperson, he almost had to carry our stuff to multiple rooms, but instead we asked if all the rooms were like this in the category, and he said they were. So down to the front desk we went. We finally spoke with a manager, and he upgraded us to the top type of room they had. It was the type of room they reserve for the winners in the casino, however, he did mention that there was no view. In fact, the view was so bad that they kept the blinds closed all day and night. But, there was one benefit... we got one heck of a hottub, which we used immediately as we got settled into the room at 11:30pm, when we had a tour picking us up at 7 am the next morning. So in short, if they had not messed up and we had stayed in our original room, I would probably rate this hotel a 4 because it was a great room with a great view. But, due to the issues, and seeing the the normal size rooms, I can't go any higher than a 3. On other notes, we checked out the pool, but since it was December, we didn't actually go in it, but it looked nice. They had some cabanas there that you can rent that have fans and refrigerators in them to keep cool on the hot summer days. Nice little feature. I must also say that the breakfast at Il Fornaio was incredible, you gotta try the french toast. The pizza at the pizza place was ok, not as good as true NY style pizza. Although, one major benefit of staying at NY NY, was that you got to enjoy Nathan's hot dogs! We also checked out the Nine Fine Irishmen restaurant, and really enjoyed it. We tried the spinach and crab dib and boy was it yummy.

Reviews.Title: “The Real Truth about NY-NY”
Reviews.Author: jimnick
Reviews.Content: As anyone who has read my reviews knows I approach them from a real perspective. I travel 200,000 miles a year and have stayed every where in evey country. You get what you pay for based on where you are and what you want. NYNY is a solid B Hotel a 3+ stars a good clean fun place. It is also priced at $65 to $150 which is at the low end of the strip. You get a larger than normal strip room the more you pay. For $150 you get a monster, hot tub in the middle of the 600 square foot room. For $79 you get a nice 3-400 sq ft. room. This is a good room for vegas, huge for london sizes and small for Scottsdale, you judge by where you are. The advantages are the hotel delivers what it advertises, check in is reasonable comnpared to the MGM or Ceasars and horrible compared to the Mayfair in London. It is a smaller hotel and that has the advantage of easy to get around, no one gets lost and the restaurants are not jammed. The food options are great from a deli with $9 sandwiches to a good steak place with $35 steaks. Il Fornaio is a good upscale italian chain for all three meals. What you do not get is any thing like a spa. The pool is closed in the winter and small in the summer. The workout room looks like what you would expect in Paris, a few machines in a basement with no view or look and feel. I could not do a massage there as the rooms are on top of the workout and each other. So go some where else if you want to do anything other than a tread mill. Specifics to know. Rooms face the strip and the suburbs if this is a big issue ask. The rollercoaster goes around 3 sides of the hotel and runs from 11-11 except on weekends till midnight. Good soundproofing but if this is an issue ask to move. The people are very helpful and move people around like chips on a table. So go expecting a reasonably priced smaller hotel with a few issues and you will love it. It could be worse you could stay at the new Wynn hotel for $400 and be dissapointed. Jim Melillo

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Newyork Newyork”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Newyork Newyork for 3 nights. This is in Las vegas, It is the most beautifull hotel ever in the vegas strip. I will post some pics see it for yourself. At night and day it looks awesome. It is basically a miniature manhattan downtown. This is a hotel and a casino in the basement. All the buildings exactly resemble the Manhattan downtown, even the Twin Towers!!. nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “New York New York --- Forgetaboutit!!”
Reviews.Author: elvisguitarman
Reviews.Content: We stayed at New York New York from 12/17 - 12/21/05 - and was very disappointed with the overall experience that we had. Prior to booking, I had read online that the roller coaster is noisy. When I booked my reservation, I made a request for a room AWAY from the noise of the rollercoaster. At check-in, I again requested a room AWAY from the roller coaster. I was assured that my "Park Avenue" room on the 14th floor in the New York Tower was very quiet. The room was small and unimpressive. About 15 minutes after settling into my room, I heard a loud "whoosh" and people screaming. I looked out my window to see the roller coaster going right by my window. I called the front desk, and was told I could do a room change in the morning. We could not sleep until the ride closed at about 12:30 am. After changing to the Century Tower on the 18th, we went to our room on the 24th floor. The "Broadway Deluxe" was bigger and better than the last one, and, it was a free upgrade from the desk for the previous problems. During the night, at about 3:00 am, we were awoke to the sound of several large "thuds" that shook the bed. We thought someone was physically fighting in the next room. In the morning, I found out that it's a room filled with machines and elevators used by employees. On the 19th, housekeeping finally arrived at about 5:00 pm to make up the room. We asked them to come back at about 6:00 pm when we would be out of the room for the night. When we got back at 10:30 pm, the room was still not made up. I called "Cindy" in housekeeping and was told they would be 'right up'. We left for a snack and returned at 12:00 am. The room had not been touched. I again called "Cindy" in housekeeping to find out what the problem was. I was again told they would 'be right up.' I told them I was NOT going to wait any longer. I called the front desk, and complained to the night manager. On the 20th, the room was finally made up, but, the maid took the comforter leaving just sheets and a blanket. At about 4:00 am, we felt really cold because the comforter was gone. A very nice way to get some good sleep before leaving early to go to the airport at 7:30 am.... NOT !!! I used the Spa - very average... a couple of treadmills, bikes, weight machines, and free weights --- nothing to brag about. NYNY looks quite nice on the inside and is a fine place to visit, but NOT to stay. There is no buffet; the America Restaurant was good, the pizza place was bad. The slot machines did not pay out at all ... Upon checkout, we told the clerk how our stay with them REALLY was. We were told the manager would be told about it, contact us, and try to "make things right." I sent this to the management of the hotel over a week ago -- and received no response. On a 1-10 scale .... a generous 4. Start spreading the news ...The Luxor is soooo much better.

Reviews.Title: “New York New York - Manhatten Nights Special = A-O.K!”
Reviews.Author: highlandsally
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the NY NY Hotel on Dec. 19-20-21 year 2005. We purchased the Manhatten Nights special. We enjoyed our Park Plaza Room. It was smaller than we are used too in Canada but (use too in downtown "Real" New York), nicely appointed and very clean. King Bed was good and bathroom spotless. View of rollar coaster ride but no noise to complain about! (We are in our late 50's and not deaf yet!")The 2 for 1 breakfast at the Italian Restaurant was great eggs benedict! The 2 for 1 lunch at "Nine Fine Irishmen" was changed to 2 for 1 dinner as it was undergoing some reno's. That meant a savings of $26.00 for us on the 2 for 1 dinner. Dinner was nice, hot and tasty (but have had better!). The floor show was also included. The Live Irish Show was worth the difference alone in dinner. A good over all menu and did not note much food left on plates around us! The wait staff were "fun" loveing people and very attentive. Our bottle of wine was not out of sight $$$$ and was also good! The roller coaster rides, we did not do! Want two free tickkets? Just ask! For supper one night, we bought a full pizza at the in-house pizza store and enjoyed a bottle of wine from across the street at the mini mart and had enough pizza left for breakfast. It was a Sician sausage and pepporoni pizza and was as good as we have had in travels in Italy. NY NY was excellant value for the Canadian dollar and we would stay there again but there are also some other hotel's that look exciting as well! It is at a great location! location! location! for fun and we aren't gambler's. Time's Square Bar is most fun as well as show's in the area. Shop around for 2-1 Nathan's hotdog coupon's and Ben and Jerry coupons and have a "Heck of a good time!" From Highlandsally

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband & I went during the x-mas break (Dec. 22-25). It was our first time in Vegas. Check in was pretty easy - no line-up. We got a room with a view of the strip & close to the elevator (at no extra charge and we didn't even ask for it). It was pretty funny when we came in (we arrived at 5:30PM), the room was pretty dark and we had trouble finding the light switches (you have to turn on the lamps to get light - but it was all good). The room itself was big enough for us and had a safe to put your passports/important documents. As for the complaints regarding the rollercoaster, we never really noticed the noise(it stops at 11PM, by the way, for those of you who are worried). We were mostly on the go - we didn't really eat at the restaurants there except for a late night meal at AMERICA - we got a steak & crab leg dinner for $14.95 -it was pretty good. My suggestions are that you sign up for a Player's Card - you get cash back on the money you spend at NYNY,MGM Grand & Bellagio. Also, check out time is at 11AM, try to make it down to the lobby at least by 10:30. We checked out by 10:30, we put our stuff into the car and came back for breakfast and when we returned, the line up was soooOoo long! Thank God we checked out early! I would stay at this hotel again and would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Save Your Money”
Reviews.Author: rankim7524
Reviews.Content: We thought we were in luck when we first checked in; We arrived very early but decided to get checked in and beat the rush that occurs later in the day. I had requested a standard room with a king size bed, I was shocked when I was told that none were available. The clerk was very friendly though and immediately offered us an upgrade to a nicer room with a king bed and a view of the strip “for only $15.00 more per night”. The room we were given had a very nice view of the strip and a king size bed as promised, but no room for anything else. We had not expected a cracker box for the upgraded price and we can only wonder what the standard room we were supposed to have gotten was like. We decided to make the best of things and headed down to the casino, now I can tell you from experience if you don’t believe you’re in the desert, play at this hotels casino, (not a drop to drink). Cocktail waitresses were scarce if you could find one at all; of course you can always pay for your drink at the bar. After an hour and a half of play and totally parched, we headed downtown where the drinks are as plentiful as the Vegas lights, and they are served by a very friendly hostess staff. I wish I could say the same about the staff at New York New York. With the exception of the Desk Clerk and the Condo people trying to sell you something every five minutes, we found the staff to be very rude and unaccommodating. If you want to eat there I would recommend staying clear of the pizza place in “The Village Eateries” unless you want to add insult to injury (bad service but the food was far worse). To sum things up, save your money for a hotel that is willing to give you a little better service, this hotel is not up to the task.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time!”
Reviews.Author: jkkrum
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and another couple stayed at The New York, New York December 2-6. After reading the other reviews, we knew our first stop should be to the Players Club booth and sign up for cards. We continued to use these cards in the casino at The New York, New York and The MGM which was just a quick walk away. At the end of our stay we went to check-out and showed the gal our cards. After calling in our points, she ended up comping over $500.00 of our stay. We only had to pay for one night! Wow! It was a nice treat after losing so much money gambling! The dealers, wait staff (minus one slow waiter at the ESPN zone) were all very nice and helpful! We had a wonderful trip and will definitely come back. We usually stay at The Mirage, but felt there was a much younger crowd and fun vibe at The New York, New York.

Reviews.Title: “I want to be a part of it... New York... New York!!”
Reviews.Author: becbec123
Reviews.Content: NYNY is a fantastic hotel. The location is good as you are very central to the strip. The theme goes all the way through the hotel and casino right down to the style of the bathroom. I would thoroughly recommend the New Yprk Times bar with the Duelling Pianos, they were absolutley fantastic, we had a great night. The roller coaster almost beats the Stratosphere ones, fantastic place and won't cost you a fortune!

Reviews.Title: “New York New York ---- so-so”
Reviews.Author: DMKArkansas
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 4 nights in June. We got a decent rate offer from the players club -- paid $79/nt with free upgrade to Park Avenue deluxe room. Rooms were okay, kind of small, but quiet. The pool was a disappointment-- very plain, but clean. Closed early though. Rooms seemed very far away from the elevators. Front desk staff were okay -- not friendly, not unfriendly. Some restaurant staff seemed arrogant. The location was great. Would not pay $79 to stay here again, even though that's a good rate. I would rather move down to the Flamingo for that price, with their better pool and hopefully friendlier attitude.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the NY NY for a long weekend, visiting from the UK. We found the hotel to be really good throughout, staff at check-in were excellent and efficient- with none of the queues I saw at other hotels over the weekend. The room was fine- not amazing but fine and big enough, we had a view at the back of the hotel over the rollercoaster but could not hear it unless we really tried. The main thing about NYNY is the attention to the theme; the casino looks fantastic and although not the biggest I feel it was the best on the Strip for appearance and atmosphere. The Times Square bar was always full and the piano players made it an enjoyable place. We also ate in the America restaurant- efficent and excellent. I agree with comments elsewhere that the hotel is lively and I am sure that quieter hotels exist even in Vegas, but if you are going for the weekend and want somewhere that just sums up Las Vegas, is full of character, has a great location then I would recommend NYNY!

Reviews.Title: “Great weekend getaway!”
Reviews.Author: Craps_Shooter18
Reviews.Content: The New York New York was an awesome place to spend the long veterans day weekend. The room was fairly spacious, however they could not provide us with a king sized bed as we had requested, and the TV was pretty small. The bathroom was also very spacious and beatiful with marble floors and countertops. The casino is not as large as the casinos at many of the other resorts, however it is very easy to walk across the short bridge to the MGM or to the Excalibur if you want to be in a larger casino. The monorail also has a station within the MGM which is just across the street, incase you want to visit a resort further down the strip. As for the noise, it did not bother myself or my girlfriend at all. We only heard the roller coaster once, and it was at 3 in the afternoon. We got room service the first morning we were there and it was excellent. They brought us up a huge fresh fruit tray and a large pot of coffee very quickly after we had ordered it. The America restaurant also has great food, try the rueben, it was huge! This hotel has many good late-night dining spots as well that serve items such as pizza and hot dogs and sandwiches; there is nothing better than coming back from a long night of drinking to a slice of pizza. We were also impressed with the drinks to go from Coyote Ugly. A few of those and you're feeling pretty good. I would probably stay at the NY NY again, but I would have to agree that it is the type of hotel that you don't want to spend more than a few nights at.

Reviews.Title: “Not for the faint hearted”
Reviews.Author: mini-chippers
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel with 4 other friends for a wedding. The bride and groom stayed in the Aladdin. We have previously stayed in the Luxor which I would rate better than the NYNY. The main problem with the hotel was the noise, I know all casino hotels are noisy but this place has no place to chill. It is a bit like a stag do in Blackpool every evening! Its a great place for a few nights but for a week like we had you need another holiday when you get home. Having said that the Staff were great, food excellent and good value and location is good, oposite the MGM Grand and next to Excalibur. We did take the upgrade we were offered on arrival, the room was very chic but half the size of our freinds who did not upgrade but their room was more 80's than boutique! Overall a fantastic hotel if you are only there for 2 or 3 nights.

Reviews.Title: “Love Vegas, New York...OK!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just returned home from a weekend at the New York, New York. The hotel has a wonderful theme, and they pay attention to a lot of the little details. The rooms are pretty standard for what you get on the strip at that price, the bathrooms are a little boring and the shower pressure was not very good. We were able to check in immediately, and the line though pretty long moved quickly. We had an issue when we tried to get into our room at the end of the night, our keys no longer worked, as they thought they had changed our room. They told us we would have to wait an hour for someone to bring us new keys, so we went down to the desk where they issued new keys, only to get up to the room and not have them work...again. Finally after telling us they had reissued our room (with our luggage in it...nothing was taken though)...they gave us correct keys and we had no further problems. It was rather inconvienient but could happen anywhere, I just felt that the hotel did not deal with it very well, as it took an hour to finally get into our room (with us going up and down the elevators) and they would not compensate us for our time and trouble. The location the hotel is south strip, and though there are some nice hotels nearby, it is quite a walk to get to any of the shopping hotels. I have been to Vegas many times, and find that if you like to get out and spend time in other hotels, this one was not as convienient as the hotels mid-strip in a similar price range. Overall the hotel was fine, but I probably would not return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in many hotels in Las Vegas from the cheap and cheerful (Excalibur, Statosphere, Imperial Palace etc) to the top of the range (Bellagio). New York New York sits perfectly in the middle and I think its great value for money. The rooms were a good size, very clean and smartly decorated. This isn't a 5 star hotel, but as they're not charging 5 star prices then its to be expected! I would say anyone staying here will feel they're getting value for money and can expect a very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Keep an open mind!”
Reviews.Author: UkNicky
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 8 hectic nights in Vegas staying at NY NY, read many conflicting reports on the hotel prior to going so we went with an open mind. Arrived at check in 2 hours early, no queues, received OK but told our rooms were not ready and that they could not guarantee non smoking rooms as requested, however, we were given the option of upgrading our rooms for an additional $15 per room per night( plus tax, remember everything is plus tax! ), available immediately. Had a bit of banter with the clerk and in the end we ended up paying the extra for one room and being comped for the other, result already and only in Vegas for 10 mins!! We spent time in the hotel and casino, ate and drank in the American Diner restaurant, Nine Fine Irishmen, Chinese Restaurant ( breakfast buffet available here with a Chinese theme, different but nice!! ) Mexican, Piano Bar and the various take away sandwich and burger bars and never had cause for complaint. Rooms were cleaned with clean sheets and towels every day and we had a view overlooking the strip, MGM and the rollercoaster, yes it went straight past our window but it was about 150 yards away, the AC fan and the endless stream of overhead choppers made more noise than the coaster so don't be put off by that. The lifts worked fine and after day one you got your bearings and no you don't need a packed lunch to get to your room! OK the pool is not Olympic sized but plenty big enough for a swim and it has at least 3 spa pools to relax in. Yes the Bellagio has got thicker carpets but at this level of hotel all in all the NY NY has got everything you need, staff we came into contact with were friendly, good location, plenty of entertainment and eating/drinking options, can't say whether the tables or slots were looser than anywhere else because I lost money wherever I went but I had a blast doing it!

Reviews.Title: “Above average, no problems!”
Reviews.Author: wblosangeles
Reviews.Content: Stayed on Sunday, Nov. 13, slow time for Vegas. Had a room on the 25th floor of the Chrysler tower, room was nice! It was small, as stated earlier, but for one person it was fine. I was north of the roller coaster, so I could hear it, but it wasn't a distraction. Staff was nice, Alison at check-in upgraded me with no problem, very attentive and polite. Lots of things to do and see in this casino, interesting and novel setup. Didn't have hot water problem, or any problem at all, as earlier reviews have stated. I'd recommend it...it only cost me $79 on Sunday, and no annoying "resort fees" or "service fees" like some other hotels. Not five-star, but more than adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Worst nightmare”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had upgrade our room to find that it was worst than to have regular room . we had room at one end building and elevator was wrapped around the other side. our tv beep and beep and didnt change channel . got service twice . no hot water when we went to shower . we were moved to another room only higher up with still no hot water and we got lock out room six time we complain but they would not refund my money ,they gave us late check out instead. big deal. would not recommend even to my worst enemy.

Reviews.Title: “Poor hotel staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a lot of potential to be one of the best hotel/casinos around, if it wasn't for the hotel staff. If I wanted to be picky, I'd start by saying the showers were way too weak. I had to stand within a foot of the forward wall to get wet. That could've been just my room though. Who knows? Other than that, There were really no other small complaints. Everything was nice, clean, and modern. As far as the hotel staff goes, look out! They couldn't have been more rude, unless they'd have cursed at me. It took 3 trips downstairs to have my phone turned on b/c each time they messed up/forgot something and then acted as if it was my fault for not knowing everything I needed to get it turned on. I called for laundry service and they asked if I was coming downstairs so that they wouldn't have to make the trip. On every interaction with the staff, they were rude and unfriendly. The people that worked for the restaurants and other shops within the casino were extremely friendly though. The hotel staff alone is responsible for the 2 star rating. Minus them, it would be a great place, but their rudeness overcomes all the other good things. It was that bad!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rich1516
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here on our first trip to Vegas. We really enjoyed our stay and would definitely stay at the NYNY again. The casino was great, we did a lot of our gambling here. Very wide spread of table limits. Could easily find a $5 blackjack table. The sportsbook is definitely lacking. Very little seating area, and difficult to see TVs when you are sitting. Luckily, right next to it is the ESPN zone. We ate here twice and loved the food and service. Although, if you're going on Sunday for the NFL games, go early. We had to wait close to 3 hours for a table, which wasn't a problem since they had plenty of booze. Coyote Ugly was kind of slow the night we went in there, but seems to be a really fun bar. We're going to try it again next time we go.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but Can't compete with Vegas 5 stars”
Reviews.Author: fauberte
Reviews.Content: Let's make something clear, place this hotel in Little Rock, Arkansas or Winnipeg, Manitoba and you have a five stars hotel. Unfortunately for Las Vegas, New York/New York isn't in the same league as the Vegas superstars. First, they charge first rate for an average room. If you like to sit by the pool and enjoy the sun, you will be in for a huge deception. The pool is very small in Vegas terminology, few places to relax, the pool location against the Sun isn't there and the staff is, let's say, rude and don't want you there. Also, You can't find a buffet restaurant in there. As I like to eat like there is no end in the morning, I went across the street in order the get a Buffet at MGM or Monte Carlo. Also, the lounge bar is small and full of hookers. The rest of the hotel is fine. Location is great and parking facilities are easy to reach. I've been to others Mammoth in the Vegas area and unfortunately, Ny/Ny isn't in the top five but still a respectable hotel, if you don't like to swim,,,

Reviews.Title: “Loved NY NY Hotel”
Reviews.Author: izeize
Reviews.Content: About 20 of us stayed here for my husbands 30 b-day in June 2005. The rooms are nice, clean and modern ( I guess this depends on the building you stay in). The casino is a little small but I actually liked it because you did not have to walk through a giant casino when returing back from a late night out. The pool area is fun with the roller coaster passing by above. The Americas restaurant has great food. Didnt care for Coyote Ugly, typical bar with more men than women. Studio 54 across the bridge at MGM is awsome, we had a blast! Ghost Bar at the Palms is cool, great view of Vegas from the outdoor deck/patio. B-day dinner was at SAMBA Brazillian Steakhouse at the Mirage. They provided great service, the food was awesome and they created a custom cake for the b-day boy all I did was email a photo of what I wanted and they made it happen, very inexpensive !Overall we had a great stay at NY NY for a great price. Would definetley recommend it!!

Reviews.Title: “Poor compared to other hotels on strip”
Reviews.Author: Multanion
Reviews.Content: NYNY was an average hotel in a good location on the strip. The casino section of the hotel was a lot grottier than others on the strip. The selection of restaurants and bars were nice, Overall if I went back to Vegas I would definetly stay in Caesars palace - best hotel on the strip

Reviews.Title: “Excellenet Hotel !”
Reviews.Author: Fazeyboy
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at New York, New York between Sept 19th – Sept 26th 2005 . Our stay was excellent, and have nothing bad to say about the hotel. Everything is summarised below:> Check in :> Checked in at the hotel rather than the airport, the queue was very small and took between 2-3 minutes to be served. Once at the counter I asked politely “If there were any upgrades available today” The young lady then checked her system and showed us what upgrades were available. The end result was we paid $15+tax per night ($114.45 Total for week) to be upgraded to a Broadway Room. I also asked if there were any free vouchers for the Roller coaster, she said no. No harm in asking Room :> The room we upgraded to was very nice, clean and a fair size. The view we had was not too bad, not the best but ok. We were on the 24th floor facing “The Orleans” hotel looking towards the incline of the coaster and facing the rear of the Monte Carlo. As for hearing the rollercoaster, we could very rarely hear it. The coaster starts at 11am and stops at 11pm. We were out before 11 every morning and very rarely returned before 11pm. The only time we heard it was when we came back late afternoon to get changed for the evening, even then it was a very feint noise. Elevators:> I can’t understand all the fuss about walking a few minutes from the elevators to the room, the distance to our room was 2 minutes at the very most. All the hotels in Vegas are massive and I would imagine this to be a problem in every hotel. Facilities/Restaurants :> We ate at 2 of the main restaurants; America and Il Fornia. America was very nice and reasonably priced. Il Fornai was a nice restaurant, pleasant atmosphere, nice food but my girlfriend and I thought it was a bit overpriced for what you got. As for the rest of the facilities NY-NY has to offer they are excellent. Plenty of choice for food on the go, Starbucks an excellent choice for breakfast in the morning, other include hot dogs, Krispy Kreme, Burgers, Pizza. The hotel caters for various types of food. Pool :> As previous posts suggest the pool is very small compared to others we saw whilst walking through the hotels. If you want a couple of hours to chill out by the pool then it is fine. The majority, if not all of the pool gets the sun, its just the sun lounge area which only get 25-50%. The pool staff are friendly and frequently come around and ask you for drinks. As stated in other posts, the pool is not NY-NY strong point, but for the amount of time you spend in the pool it is adequate. Location :> The location of NY-NY is ok, but not the best. It has easy access to various Monorails, a FREE one in Monte-Carlo which runs to the Bellagio, another FREE one at Excalibur which goes to Mandalay Bay Via Luxor. Plus there is a pay per ride monorail at the MGM which runs all the way down the strip. Overall this hotel is excellent and I would recommend it to anyone. I would stay in the this hotel again, but on our next visit will look to stay in a more central location, Paris, Bally’s, Bellagio.

Reviews.Title: “NY NY ROCKED - Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mahwah
Reviews.Content: Just returned home from an extended weekend in Rockin Las Vegas! NY NY hotel was awesome. I NEVER heard the roller coaster from my room - never! We stayed in a Broadway room in the Chrysler Tower. I was all set to upgrade upon arrival and decided to see room first before making decision. We stayed right where we were - room was perfect. 28th floor, two Queen beds, very large extended sitting area near window overlooking pool, and bathroom was gorgeous (all marble, deep/DEEP bathtub). The pool was beautiful, hot tubs were great. I've stayed at the Mirage on a previous visit and this hotel beat out the Mirage (by FAR!). Right outside the elevator was a perfect little coffee shop, quick trip downstairs and breakfast was taken care of (coffee, bagel, muffin, etc). At the Mirage, it took 35 mintutes to get a cup of coffee (only one coffee shop, clear across casino - near D.Gans theater, line was 50 people deep). NY NY hotel was awesome (period). Anyway, stop worring about the rooms and get out on the town! Vegas is where it's happening (for sure!). One giant party from sunup to sunup. Some of the best entertainment is FREE! Bellagio fountains, Sirens of TI, Ceasar's pool, not to mention some of the most amazing casino's you'll ever see. We ran into Robin Williams at MGM - nice guy - held the door for me :) One of the best BAR's in Vegas we just happend to stumble upon - it was just outside Harrah's. The Carousel Bar in the middle of the afternoon was one of the highlights of our trip. The Bartenders are a HOOT, not to mention talented (major bottle juggling, and funny, funny entertainment). Hint, don't pick up your cell phone, or the bartenders will leap over the bar and blow sports whistles into your phone :) There's always a BAND playing during the middle of the day and the dancing FREE. Great Party! Bring your comfortable walking shoes, and enjoy the sights while walking the strip - out in the open - with your beer, or famous test tube cocktail. You can't NOT have fun! Enjoy!!!

Reviews.Title: “Bad food at the NY NY”
Reviews.Author: mikelargo
Reviews.Content: Well, My girlfriend and I were in Las Vegas 9-21 for 4 nights The room at NY NY was great. Nice view. The pool was ok. Kind of small. The Casino was fun and we won at the sports book!! The first day we got in about 4pm. We had Rita rendner tickets for 630PM ( the show was good. I think my girlfriend enjoyed more than me. Allot of female jokes. Before our show we went to the Chin Chin Cafe. We ordered WON TON soup, KUNG PAO CHICKEN and MONGOLIAN BEEF. The service was good but the food was average. No better than our corner Chinese restaurant, but the bill was about $60 with 2 drinks. I would pass one this place. The next day, We lunch at the Il Fornaio for lunch. We had to wait at our table for about 10 minutes before a waiter came. I could tell that our server had no interest in our table. We finally got our water about half the way thru our meal.It . We really like fresh pasta when we can find it. We ordered the fresh pasta dish with a pesto sauce they had a featured item for that day (I forget the name). Well it was supposed to be stuffed with duck It was like a paste. I took one bite and told my girlfriend that it tasted like dog food.(I know I tried it when I was 6 years old)LOL. We made it about half the way thru and decided we will wait for dinner time. We had a hard time finding our waiter to give us our bill. When we were leaving we spoke to the manager. He invited us back for a free lunch the next day. I thought this was a good gesture. We went on our way and both had the burpies for about 3 hours. That night we ate at the MGM steak house. We had Kobe skirt steak. It was great. Really nice place. When we got back from dinner, we wanted desert. We could have had ice cream, but opted to stop at the Gallagher's Steakhouse( in the NY NY hotel). We figured we would order desert and take back to our room . The only thing that looked god was this toffee brownie with ice cream on the side.($8,50) We got it back to the room and we had about a postage stamp size brownie with allot of butter sauces on it. Kind of gross. Well it was supposed to come with Ice cream on the side and it didn't. Really disappointed now Anyway the rooms are nice but I wouldn't eat at any of the restaurants if I were you .

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in Sept and loved the NY NY. When we checked in, the type of room we had reserved were all booked, so they upgraded us for free which we were more than happy about. We had a fantastic large room with excellent facilties. The hotel itself was fantastic, we loved all the restaurants and bars. This is a really lively hotel and is definitely a must for young people staying in Vegas. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: birky
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a short stay at New York New York. This is the second time this year we have stayed there and absolutely loved it. It is not as elegant as some of the other hotels in Vegas but it is comfortable and not stuffy. The restaurants are great and the rooms are huge. I am a room "snob" and this totally meets my criteria. I will continue to stay here as long as nothing changes.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: thecatsmother
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from NYNY in Las Vegas. Got a great deal on the rooms, Park Avenue rooms which have been recently upgraded and were very smart. Beautiful bathrooms although the water pressure was not very strong which spoilt the shower somewhat. Couldn't fault the housekeeping staff who were friendly and hardworking as were the casino staff. Service in the America restaurant dissapointing although the food, when it eventually arrived was excellent. Don't miss the Bar at Times square, go early, be prepared to wait for the show and enjoy!! Vegas was wonderful as always. Other recommendations include Margaritaville at the Flamingo, Shark reef at Mandalay Bay and a trip to the Hoover dam. We hired a car and did it independently. Well worth the trip, really good day out!!

Reviews.Title: “new york was ok”
Reviews.Author: kevin22
Reviews.Content: myself and partner arrived here with no luggage as it was still in paris, the staff tried to get to it to us as quick as they could[2 DAYS LATER IT ARRIVED} overall the hotel is cool the sports bar is exellant always go for a large beer u might only need 4 and jet lag sets in, the dealers on the blackjack tables are very helpfull, the food places arnt that good but the bronx for breakfast is ok, theres a place just outside that does an excellant breakfast, very well located to see other hotels, u must see the star treak experence at the hilton amasing and i aint not much of a fan The roller coaster wasnt noisey at all, rooms where what u would expect at any marriot hotel in britian pretty good

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelbug25
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a trip to Las Vegas. My best friend and I wanted to have a girls' weekend out and decided to stay at the NYNY. We chose it mainly for the price (not too expensive, on the strip). We arrived at 12pm, and they did not have a clean room ready for us yet since check in is usually a 3pm. We checked our bags and decided to have lunch at Il Fornaio, a really good Italian restaurant for any meal and reasonably priced for Vegas. By the time we were done with lunch around 1:30pm, our room was ready. We had a room with a view of the MGM Grand, and just above the rollercoaster in the New Yorker tower. The room was very clean, nicely decorated, and the beds were comfortable. A few minutes after we got to the room someone came to check if everything was okay and if there was anything we needed. In general we didn't spend much time in the room, so the noise from the rollercoaster was not really an issue. On the downside, the tram was not working, so we had to walk to the Monte Carlo to get on the tram to the Bellagio. However, there is a pedestrian walkway from NYNY to the MGM where there is a monorail station. Also, the location was not really central on the strip, so we had to walk or take a cab to get to other places. The casino was small, and we had much better luck at MGM and Treasure Island. The 24-hour diner America was not very good for after hours eating. In all the NYNY was an average hotel. It would appeal more to the under 30 crowd. We had an overall good experience, and will most likely try a different hotel next time.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing too good/bad to say...”
Reviews.Author: BRI_G_I
Reviews.Content: Checked in to NYNY on Sept. 22nd, out September 25th. No problem with check-in, we had 3 rooms and got them all together (1102, 1103 and 1109) and non-smoking. Didn't ask for any other offers/upgrades. Only 1101 is farther from the elevator though, so if walking bothers you it's not so good. Can't really understand why people complain about walking to the elevators...the hotel has 1000's of room, it's going to take a while to get to some of them. Initial room condition was very good. All three rooms were queen/queen, clean and reasonably spacious for 2 large bags and room to spread out, unpack hanging clothes for 2 people and still be in the room. The bathroom was smaller than it needed to be but clean and decently stocked. Daily maid service comes at the entirely bizarre hour of 8:30am. Make sure you put your DND sign out when you go to sleep. Service was good each day and the DND sign was obeyed. Ate at ESPN Zone once, reasonable food, good selection of TVs to watch. Our particular waiter had no interest in clearing our table for 7 of dishes until after dinner (he told us as much!) and we were left with quite a stack of plates and glasses. I didn't have the chance to try any of the other restaurants in the hotel, choosing instead to eat at Picasso and Aureole for dinner and trying several buffets for other meals. I've never been to Vegas before and wasn't sure what to expect of the casinos. After walking to as many hotels as possible, NYNY was below average in terms of slots and table games. We had one extremely bad experience at a blackjack table. There was an empty beer bottle left on the table (no idea why it wasn't removed). 6 of us sat down with approx. $1000 at a $10 table. We asked the dealer if he could clear the table, he said he wasn't allowed to remove it but asked the pit boss to help take care of it. The pit boss came over, smirked, said it was fine where it was and walked away. The dealer was stunned and the 6 of us picked up our money and walked away. That was our only bad table experience. Other than that everything was positive with table games. Drink service, even at the 5 cent slots was extremely good. I was served 6 drinks in 90 minutes playing $20 in a 5 cent slot. No reason to pay for a drink, ever....just tip the waitresses for bringing you all those free drinks. Other than that 1 pit boss, I only witnessed staff working hard to make guests feel comfortable. The atmosphere in the bars/restaurants at night is very lively and fun, with tons of people milling about. Especially so outside the dualin pianos show. Very fun to listen to. The pool is not lavish but it's a pool and you can take a nice break in the afternoon sun to cool off. There's 3 hot tubs, I think, behind the pool. Between the fake NY skyline and the parking garage, however, you don't get much sun. If you are used to the sunshine, then not so great, if you're used to 60 degree temperatures in September like I am, 95 in the shade is nothing to complain about!! Went on a tour of the spa but had to cancel my appointment. Smallish spa but clean and well stocked. Overall a good experience for a first trip to Las Vegas. I can recommend this hotel as a clean, fun hotel in a good location on the strip. Walkway to Excalibur lets you on the tram to Luxor and Mandalay and walkway to MGM gives you access to the monorail and the rest of the strip. A short walk to Monte Carlo gives you a tram to Bellagio. It's all very convenient. I could easily go back to this hotel and wouldn't hesitate to recommend it to others. It's not the best and doesn't claim to be but for something as large and absurd as it is, it does a good job and gives you no reason to complain.

Reviews.Title: “a classy touch!”
Reviews.Author: Elvisgirl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a short trip to vegas and we stayed at NyNy for 3 nites and when we checked in my husband asked if we could up grade and they were nice and checked into that for us and came back and said they could upgrade us to a pent house suit for $80 more a nite, not bad we thought and went with it. When we walked into the room, WOW!. We feel in love with the bathroom. There was two sink counters a seperate shower with bench, a jacuzzi tub with mirrors all around. They go above and beyound when it came to the toilettries. Sham/cond., lotion, shoe horn, sewing kit, cotton balls, bar soap, spa crystals for jacuzzi and bath scrubber did I mention the terri cloth robs and slippers! I was in heaven but wait it gets better at nite when retuning to our room they had turned down our beds and but a box of chocolates on our pillows every nite. This was the life, for 3 days we felt like royalty. As far as the casino not so lucky gambling. My husband was looking forward to the ESPN game zone but it was closed sat and sun for private parties. Times square is fun ,always a crowd. We would stay here again. Just a side note if you like the out doors and will have a rental in vegas drive out to Red Rock Canyon. It's about a 30min drive and it not like anything you've seen before. We've gone a few times now and it's like going the first time everytime. It's amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as it was, but still great”
Reviews.Author: buffgirl73
Reviews.Content: This is the third time we've stayed at the NY NY in two years and as you can gather we quite like it!!!! This time we were in the Chrysler Tower in a Broadway Deluxe Room. The room was quite a lot larger than our first stay in a standard room and smaller than the suite that we had at New Year. It was good a great size with a large seating area although the bathroom was quite dinky! These rooms are good value for money ($109 - $169 during Labor Day weekend) but they haven't yet been refurbished which is why I think they're cheaper than some of the smaller redecorated rooms. The service in the NY was as good as usual and the variety of entertainment pretty good. One big complaint would be that on weekends ALL of the tables in the Bar at Time Square are reserved (for who I'm not sure). In theory this is OK but we were in there on a Friday night and half of them stayed vacant all night, what a waste!!!!!! The room service is always good and there is always something to and somewhere to eat with the restaurants and fast food outlets being varied. Finally made it on to the rollercoaster this time and it was worth it (especially if you get a coupon as it's not cheap!). According to locals Vegas wasn't as busy over Labor Day as it normally is but you would never have guessed it from the NY NY. It was teaming and that is something I am used to now. It seems to be the busiest hotel in vegas (probably because it is smaller than some of the other big ones) so if you don't like slow moving crowds, don't stay here on a holiday weekend. Apart from that it does offer you a taste of NY in Vegas and is worth a visit. We're going to try somewhere else next time though, maybe Rome...... in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “The rooms are very nice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the NYNY for 3 nights and 4 days and had a wonderful time. The service and atmosphere was great. The only issue I had was that my room seemed to be a mile walk from the elevator. I stayed on the 24th floor, my room facing MGM Grand, and my room was the last on the floor. We passed a couple of stairways to get to my room, which was good to know in case of a fire. I feel that with so many rooms on a floor there should have been at least two separate banks of elevators. I was able to take the walkway from NYNY to Excalibur, then the tram to the Luxor and Mandalay Bay. Also NYNY is across the street from MGM and is within walking distance to the Bellagio and Cesars Palace. Attractions: Took an indoor gondola ride at the Venetian and it was wonderful. I do not recommend the breakfast buffet at the Excalibur. It was horrible! The pancakes and french toast were hard, the eggs were also hard. Very disappointed and will not recommend this buffet to anyone. Had the gourmet dinner buffet Friday night at the Bellagio. It was expensive, but it was worth it. I have been to Vegas before and I saw Gladys Knight's show and it was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, too far down the strip...”
Reviews.Author: jahnnyboy
Reviews.Content: For our second trip to Vegas in 2005, we decided on a smaller hotel (we were at the Luxor in Feb 2005). We saw this hotel/casino the last time and liked the looks of it and the ambience. We booked the trip. I called the hotel 2 weeks before we were to arrive to check our room and they had us in a smoking room away from the strip - not what I had asked for. "We can change that for you, but there will be a processing fee." Nope, I thought I would just deal with it when I got to Vegas. Arriving at the hotel was easy. You're dropped off within feet from the check in desk - which is nice. I proceeded to check in and they still had us with a smoking room. I showed them my voucher which stated non-smoking - strip view, so the girl made the change and we were on our way. We were lucky that our tower was close by the desk, some of the tower elevators are clear across the casino - quite a hike! We got to the room and I think it was the same one that I originally was given (smoking and away from the strip) - back down we went and back into line. The front desk person (same one) was a bit bewildered when we got there. "Sir, that is a non-smoking room and on the strip" Well, it wasn't. I demanded an upgrade and after 30 mins of the girl checking with someone, eventually she came back and said "Sir, we can put you in our Park Avenue room for an additional $10/night" - What the heck, I was tired and wanted to unload my luggage. The room in comparison to the original room we were to get was worth the extra $10. Newly renovated, very nice, with a view of MGM, Tropicanna, and Excalibur, plus the airport. If you looked down, you saw the rollercoaster wizzing by - which despite being on the 14th floor, you heard continuously. The bed was amazing and the housecleaning was superb. Check out was a breeze. Would I stay here again, well maybe - the only problem with this hotel is it's location on the strip - it's too far down from where the action is. Albiet the casino here and at MGM were generous to us, it's a bit of a walk to get up to Caeser's, Bellagio, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Mother & Daughter hit Vegas, Baby, Yeah!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a week in Las Vegas - my first visit. Wow, we had an amazing time! Stayed at the NY - NY which worked out really well for us - I would loved to have stayed at the Bellagio but seriously, how much time do you spend in your hotel when in Vegas?! The rooms were spacious and clean, we were in Century Tower so our view was tinted pink but we still had a view of the rollercoaster and the Excalibur end of the Strip. My requirements were a) Clean b) Safe c) Location and d) Good cheap breakfasts / coffee and they were all met. They have really great selection of little places to eat, including a 24 hour Americana place which had amazing breakfasts. The Trolley Bus (very cheap) stops at NY-NY and the monorail is accessible from MGM Grand (connected via a walkway) My top tip for Vegas: Plan, plan, plan. Read books and websites like this one and decide what you want to see. We weren't really into the whole drinking/gambling thing and so wanted to see what else the city had to offer. And we had a fantastic time. Here are a few things we did that I would recommend: - Sushi at the Coral Lounge at Mandalay Bay - Tournament of Kings at Excalibur. No cutlery and plenty of hunky knights made for a great dinner show! - Lions at MGM Grand - Secret Garden at the Mirage (White Tigers & dolphins) - Take a Gondola (inside for families, outside for romantics) at the Venetian and dont miss St Marks Square - Shop at Forum Shops at Caesars Palace. Dont miss the free shows at the fountains at either end! Also check out Fashion Show Mall. - Fountain show at Bellagio - We didnt see Cirque de Soleil, but if you havent seen them before, check them out. Theres several different ones in Vegas at the moment. We saw Splash! for a bit of authentic Vegas and it was hilarious. - Helicopter flight over the Strip at night - Day trip out to the Grand Canyon (we went with Pink Jeep Tours - highly recommended) - Sirens of TI (hint: if you are staying at an MGM propert, you get VIP seating for this show!) - Volcano eruption at The Mirage Favourite place to eat: Prime at the Bellagio. Worth it for the truffle mashed potato alone. Have cocktails on the terrace first overlooking the fountains at Fontana. Extra Hint: We moved to the Montelago Village area for 3 days at the end of our trip to recover. 20 minutes by taxi and you're in a whole new world. We stayed at the Hyatt Regency and it was just beautiful. Amazing restaurants and two huge pool areas, lovely rooms and helpful staff. Go to the Montelago Village one night and sample the wine & food platters at Sunset & Vines. Bliss.

Reviews.Title: “Different”
Reviews.Author: TaylorRawles
Reviews.Content: Great location but be weary that this is a big hotel (aren't they all in Vegas). It's very impressive and a good theme. The room we had was huge. The beds comfortable. The bathroom of a decent standard. The decor and fittings were not at all bad. However..... Checking in was reasonably painless unless you have an odd request. My partner can't use lifts due to her claustrophobia. We emailed ahead to ensure we had a low floor room with stair case access. Unfortunately, the woman who checked us in had a Tony Blair smile and never grasped what we were saying. Eventually she discovered that the building had stairs (!) and that a key was required to access them. She didn't know where the stairs were though nor did anyone else it seemed. Eventually we were shown to some doors which indeed contained stairs but only to the 2nd floor! We needed to get to the 4th floor. After much toing and froing, and then by chance, we established we'd been sent up the wrong stairs. It worried us that in the event of a fire/emergency would the staff know what to do? Remember, they didn't even know they had stairs!! Il Fornaio don't understand that us Brits require milk with our hot tea. They needed constant chasing for it. The milk did arrive but it's just hassle when all you want is a drink with your breakfast. A minor bit of trivia. The rest of the stay was good and the bellmen were exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “Not What I Expected”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After months of planning our first Las Vegas vacation (and frequently going to TripAdvisor to see what people thought), my boyfriend and I have just come back. We decided on New York New York because of comments on this website like "caters to a young crowd" (we're both newly 21), and it's great location. We should have known that we weren't going to have a lot of luck there, hey, it's Vegas! But, we did think that getting a jacuzzi suite would guarantee a good stay; we were wrong. I have posted pictures of our view, it was the side of a wall. So, first piece of advice, ask for a view, if you don't, they won't give you one. One thing I had read about was that you could rent a refrigerator, it is $30 a day to do so. We stayed for 6 nights and wanted cold water (bought at CVS down the street) to take with us for the day and at night after walking around. Upon check-in, the woman waived that fee, we believe because we had such a terrible room. Other things that went wrong with the room: our comforter was filled with rips (with all the money they make they can't get a new comforter?), our soap and shampoo were not restocked when they needed to be (I think it's stupid to change them everyday, but when there is no soap left, please restock without me asking, we obviously used it), it then took them a while to bring it up as we were both waiting to take a shower after being out all day and rushing to get to a dinner reservation, and on the second to last day we randomly got bubble bath for our jacuzzi, why hadn't we gotten it all along? Now, I know we could have gotten money off our very overpriced room, but my boyfriend and I are not really complainers. We were going to when we checked out, but the woman checking us out didn't even ask us how our stay was! She didn't give us a chance to complain. We should have at least had the opportunity! If you are looking for a place to be close to great bars and don't care about a strip view or fancy room, this is your place. If you are looking for a little more than your average hotel, stay somewhere else. On our next trip to Vegas, we will be staying somewhere else. Other comments on Vegas: Fiore Steakhouse at the Rio- Very nice, good steak, wonderful wait staff, not THAT overpriced ($90 for 2 entrees, 2 sides), and they give you a stool for your purse, which I thought was a nice touch. Catch Penn & Teller after dinner, after 30 years together they've perfected that show. It was great and the tickets are really reasonable. Alize at the top of the Palms- BEAUTIFUL VIEW, I didn't love the chicken that I got, but my boyfriend LOVED his steak. Wait staff of 4 with wonderful suggestions for wine, the chocolate cake is AMAZING, order it. Just be prepared to spend at least $150 for two, we don't get soup, salad, appetizers, or coffee, so that was just the entrees, half a bottle of wine (they don't sell by the glass), and chocolate cake. Neros at Caesars- really good food but if you want to sit inside instead of in the walkway to the casino, you need to be in the smoking area. Which didn't make sense to me being that we were in the hallway practically of the casino where people smoke. Tell me how that makes sense? Anyway, really good food, nice wait staff, they don't give you a basket of bread though. They must have a bread shortage or something because they give you each a piece of bread and don't restock when you're clearly done. It was odd. This cost us about $120 with tip for 2 entrees, 1 side, and 2 cocktails. Go see Celine Dion after dinner, it was amazing, and amazingly overpriced! Onda at Mirage- my boyfriend had some sort of seafood plate, he absolutely loved it. I had chicken parmagiana, it was fantastic (to let you know, my boyfriend's parents are from Italy and her food is hard to beat!). Not overpriced by Vegas standards, I believe it was $100-120 for our two salads, two entrees, a glass of wine, and a cocktail. We saw Ray Romano after, he was hysterical! And just a note from a NYer, don't eat the pizza at the NY NY hotel! It is not NY style pizza, it was the worst pizza I ever had in my life! Don't let them trick you into thinking that's what pizza is supposed to taste like, come to NY and visit a Mom & Pop shop in Little Italy, only then can you say you've had NY pizza! Also- go visit the Grand Canyon! Just make sure you don't mind being the only one not in a private tour and/or speaking English! Other than that, the view is amazing :) Take a ride on a Gondola, you might want to go indoors. We did the outdoor one, it was about 5 minutes long for $25 for the two of us. I think the one inside is longer, it's at least more expensive if it's not. Well, I hope I hope you out when deciding on places to eat, shows to see, and where to stay!

Reviews.Title: “hotel ok vacation from hell”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: las vegas: new york -new york: ''nice hotel!''date: August 23,2005 reviewewr: A TRIPAdvisor Member, new york city We have just returned from a 4-days three nights at the new york new york. the Hotel is nice and we did experienced such incredible service from the staff. the room that we had was on the 15th floor room 1548, it was facing the strip and the roller coaster. the roller coaster was not a problem we hardly notice it or heard any noise from it. the room was very clean. our problem begain when my freind became ill. We had to call in the doctor that the hotel uses which cost us 400.00 dollars, than he had to be transported to the ER, this was the frist night. the ER was at least 5 miles from the hotel,which ment that both nights I had to pay for me to get back to the hotel plus pay for my friend , because they would admit him each time for fluids , then they would release him afterI was back at the hotel. security was great they did a very good job on securring our room. we spent more money getting back from the hospital than on anything. I say this because my friend ended back in the ER on the third night, which we had to call the security again for them to lock out the room so that nobodycould go into it. they also arranged to call the ambulace and the ems. they were just great! So my vacation ended with me not getting a chance to play the slots or visting any off the other places. But I would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Las Vegas Hotel of its kind.”
Reviews.Author: Purpleguardog
