Reviews.Content: Like all Las Vegas hotels you walk straight into acres of slot machines. The reception staff were helpful and the room was spacious and clean. Everything worked very efficiently, from the valet service to the bellhop. Plenty of restaurants in the hotel itself.

Reviews.Title: “Had a WONDERFUL experience!”
Reviews.Author: lovinglifeGeorgia
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at NY NY and would without hesitation stay again. My husband made the remark that this is the first time he would rather stay on a vacation then go home! NY NY has great restaurants, it is centrally located on the strip, the room service is on time and friendly, the view from our room on the 30th floor was amazing! We rode the rollar coaster, ate and drank, and enjoyed the sites and gambling. We acutally won $500.00 on the Elvis slots! And there was a whole lot of shakin going on!!!! The rooms were quiet and clean. I was pleased when a security guard stopped and asked to see our room key in front of the elevators. The atmosphere was wonderful and a good reflection of New York City. As previoulsy stated we will stay at NY NY again. We are in the process of planning a trip for next year with the only difference being adding a few additional days!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Sam66Uk
Reviews.Content: Great location, good facilities, average service. No problems except the extremely poor service at a couple of the in hotel restaurants - a shame because the food was very good. Oh, and the mouldy ceiling above the shower in our room - not what you would expect from a 4* hotel. Still 4 out of 5, the room was larger than we hoped with very good views of the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy but fun, good value”
Reviews.Author: powell_power
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights in July 05. It was refreshing that not everything centred around the casino eg bars, restaurants as in Bellagio for example. Small pool but lots of places to eat. Avoid the shockingly bad Italian restaurant inside though! After a while the gloomy light and constant noise of slot machines becomes irritating. Otherwise a good, novelty place to stay in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Stay somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: ejwatts
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the NY/NY from Aug15-Aug19. We stayed there in 1997 when it first opened and loved it. Since then we've stayed at TI but thought this year we would go back to NY/NY. We were so sorry that we did. Our room was not the cleanest I've been at. The hotel itself was dirty, the carpets were stained and the entire hotel smelled like a bowling alley, like stale smoke. The food in the Restaurants were overpriced and very low quality. We ate at Nathan's for a quick lunch and they got our order wrong twice. Then they thought it was funny to talk in Spanish while I stood there as they laughed. I did like the Casino, it was fun to gamble here but the casino smelled so stale that we didn't stay there much to gamble. Staff were impatient and rude. The front desk was a snooty couldn't be bothered, rude individual. I wish I would have read a review like this before I went. With all the choices you have on the strip all around the same price, please don't go here. Go to TI, impeccable rooms, friendly staff, great smelling casino (smells like coconut)!!

Reviews.Title: “Best Place in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I would have to say this was the best hotel in Vegas. This is the place to go if you want to stay up all night and party, or ride the roller coaster. This is not the place to stay if you want a really fancy room. Their rooms were nice, but nothing to "wow" about them. Another great thing about New York -New York is it's great for kids. They have a large arcade (that needs some employes) and it also has one of the best roller coasters I've been on. And the best reason to stay here, because it is the most "alive" hotel in Vegas. We were walking around the Excalibur, Luxor, MGM, and Mandaly Bay late at night, and it was dead quite. There wasn't anything opened at Luxor or Mandaly, and nothing was busy at Excalibur, and MGM, it was just "dead." It was like walking into a cemetery. But when we walked into New York-New York, it was "ALIVE." The "streets" were busy, live music was playing, and it wasn't dead. It was alot of fun staying at New York-New York. It is the Greatest City in Las Vegas, and it has some cheap rates too. The only thing they need to work on, it their pool, but your not going to stay at New York-New York just for the pool, are you?

Reviews.Title: “Better then I ever imagined!”
Reviews.Author: minnysmom
Reviews.Content: What a great time my husband and I had at New York New York! We stayed from Aug 11 through the 14th. Every day was a pleasure. Check-in was immediate. I did see small lines at the desk at times, but that was on Friday and Saturday nights when the whole place was very busy with weekenders. Still they seemed to move quickly. We stayed in the Empire Tower, #3414 - our elvator was right around the corner from the check-in desk - very easy to access. The evelvators were never a problem (as far as waiting for them) as the elevators bypassed all floors until #30. Our room was absolutely fine and we had a great view. Some folks have complained of the size and lighting....I could admit that the size was a bit small, but hardly tiny or cramped in any way. Lighting was fine as well. Loved the ginger/orange bath products, unfortunately, the spa was out of the lotion so I wasn't able to purchase any, but I WILL be checking back! Maid service...awesome -I made our bed daily thinking they'd not have to change the sheets each day...but they did anyway on the very comfortable bed! I agree whole-heartedly with the very recent review that the casino is terrific in that you get the 'lay of the land' quickly! That, to me, is great. We visited several other hotels during our stay just to say we saw them and some were just so gigantic! I always would comment upon exiting them that I liked our hotel better. The service people at New York New York were so entirly great! EVERYONE one was polite, courteous, always wishing us 'Good Luck!". And lucky we were! I think we were luckier than most folks have aright to be in Vegas! Our winnings practically paid for the whole vacation! And all winnings were at NYNY save for one slot jackpot at MGM - but they're a sister hotel so that's good! Make sure to sign up for a players card! We were comped dinner at ESPN and America plus we got the free t-shirts! While I'm on the restaurants, let me say that all food we had at NYNY was great. We had an appetizer, lunch and a dinner at ESPN - all different days - all great. I reccomend the bbq'd chicken breast dinner (on garlic mashed potatoes with onion straws on top!)- one of the best dinners I have ever had!! Had Mexican Lasagna at Gonzales Y Gonzales, very good and breakfast at America on our last morning was very fine with an awesome waitress. Two other breakfasts were at the MGM Grand Buffet - a great price ($12.99!) for fabulous choices of many, many wonderful foods. We did do the Carnival World Buffet at Rio for one dinner as we'd had heard lots about it...this thing is too big to be terrific. Must be over 100 yards long. My huband said his first choices of food were cold by the time he found our table to eat them (he got lost twice trying to find our table!)The eateries in the 'streets of NY' were very nicely done....treat yourself to a fabulous sweet at the pastry shop! We happened upon the Bar at Times Square just as the two dueling piano guys were starting up one afternoon.....this was a hoot! They were as fun as I'd read about..very interactive, funny and talented. The evening 'show' gets packed (standing room only), so if you're able to get in on the afternoon session, do it! Awesome place to be entertained! We never 'did' the pool - it was way to hot to lay out - but stepped out to the pool deck to see that it was better than many have said. It aint Mandalay Bay or Cesars....but if you just need a dip, what does it matter? All in all we had a fantastic time! I'd like to come during the week next time as I like the casino a little less crowded. Thursday night was perfect, Friday was certainly busier, but by Saturday, it was really hoppin'....still a ton of fun, but I'd rather not dodge folks so much - that's just me. I can't say enough good things about this hotel or about our stay - 'perfect' doesn't even quite measure up to what we experienced. Would I stay again? I can hardy wait! But I'll have to!

Reviews.Title: “Beware of the timeshare people!”
Reviews.Author: Hard_to_please
Reviews.Content: All and all the hotel was ok. BUT...ugh the time shtare people. We were actually interested in getting some information. But they play games and have to follow their program and not answer your questions. They promise 2 hours and we had to get special approval to leave after 2 plus hours. As for the tikets they give you...Buy your own! They promise average seats and deliver balcony..row Z!!! When confronted, the sales rep (who was an alright guy!) called the manager. He checked and said ..that they are mezzanine and that the rows go to ZZ...WRONG! They were the worse seats in the house!! They were balcony and not mezzanine and there were only 6 rows behind us!! As for the rollar coaster...do not do it. We love coasters and have done them all across the country. Here...your head shakes to the point of a headache and the shoulder harness causes bruising!! No wonder there is no line on it!! Well.......as far as going to the managers manger...his answer was "sorry". If they can't promise what they deliver and do not know their product from the get go...I would be VERY HESITANT to buy into this time share. And I sell real estate for a living!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very basic, no frills”
Reviews.Author: bargainhunter_kids
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just came back from Las Vegs and stayed at the New York, New York Hotel and Casino. Upon our arrival from the airport we couldn't even find the check in desk because you had to snake your way through the slot machines to the desk. There was no direct path like other hotels. The staff was very nice and helpful and we were in a upgraded room for three nights. The room was smaller than average and fine but not anything great. There was no coffee maker in the room and outlets were very few. We did have a great view of the mountains from the 31st floor. I will say that Vegas is not a place for children. I have three children and I will not be taking them to Vegas. It is just too difficult to avoid the sex, girls and adult oriented themes. Of course the Bellagio Hotel is wonderful although I was not in the rooms. I also spent some time in the Aladdin Hotel and it seemed very nice inside.

Reviews.Title: “A fun hotel in a crazy place!!”
Reviews.Author: travelmadgal
Reviews.Content: Vegas is a crazy place to go on vacation to, so you may as well go crazy too and stay in a hotel with a rollercoaster ride! I stayed in NYNY with my boyfriend for three nights and loved it! The casino is a good size and most importantly easy to navigate. Anyone who has been lost in Caesars palace will understand how nice it is to know the lay of the land! We ate in the Italian restuarant and have to say the food was delicious as good as Italy!! The Italian sausage pasta was to die for!! The bars are fun too but they get really busy late a night. We went to Coyote Ugly before 9 and had a drink, when we left they stamped our hand which meant that we could go back there hours later and skip the queue and the cover charge. The rollercoaster is a must - if you do it once you'll realise why people scream on it ;-)

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: 1Eggy1
Reviews.Content: After staying at the Luxor and the Aladdin previously a lot of time was spent at the NY NY enjoying the bars and casino therefore it made sense to book in on our next visit, big mistake, on checking in the reception staff were very unhelpful, and then like everybody else we experienced problems using the elevators, great security idea but not if the technology does not work, we next went to the pool area, this is very small in vegas standards, of course I knew the hotel had a roller coster around it, but what a ridiculous idea to have the noisiest part of the roller coater, the part where it climbs overlooking the pool, the screaming you can cope with, also badly designed because it is always in the shade due to the towers. If you like to relax at the pool go to the MGM across the road. We booked in for 4 nights and checked out after two, when we did check out the staff didn't care, didn't ask why and were not interested in the comment form I had taken th trouble to fill in. We checked into the Treasure Island which is the most fabulous hotel I have stayed in and the one we have booked when we come back in October this year. If you want to stay in Vegas and enjoy the nightlife in the NY NY stay at the MGM or Luxor.

Reviews.Title: “Kind of Medium-sized Apple...”
Reviews.Author: mithu1974
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed here for 5 nights - got an upgrade to Park Avenue Deluxe room which is well worth it, got a corner room with an excellent view over to MGM opposite and Mandalay to the side. The check-in was quick and efficient (express check-out very much appreciated and should be standard in all major hotel chains) The toiletries included were excellent, however the house staff could have been a tad quicker at renewing them when running low, I had to write a note for them! But they were quick and helpful to sort out a problem with the curtain rail in our room. The in-hotel entertainment was very good (Coyote Ugly was a big fave of ours) - and the food outlets we tried were all of a high standard. I would rate the location of this hotel very highly with easy access to all the nearby resorts. Casino-wise, I'd still rate the Mandalay and Monte Carlo higher

Reviews.Title: “Do not use valet!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Do not park your car in valet, ours was stolen from the underground parking structure because the hotels policy allows your car to be left with the windows down and the keys left in the ignition. This happened on july 12 and we are still fighting with the casino to replace our vehicle which was destroyed while on the casino property. Anybody interested in the rest of the story feel free to contact me. Ralpz64@yahoo.com

Reviews.Title: “Just a Decent hotel, not an Impressive hotel.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at NYNY last month. I was never impressed nor dissaticified with the hotel during my stay. The front desk agent felt like a car sales person who tried talk me down to upgrade my room to a suite that would have cost me additional $60 per night. With that $60, I'd rather stay at other hotels like MandalayBay. I managed to refuse the offer and sticked with the orginal plan at newly rennvated Park Avenue Room. The key didn't work when I got to my room. I called the front desk through the intercom and was told either wait 15 minutes or come down to get a new key. So I had to leave all my baggages and most importantly my girlfriend at "dim", not fancy looking hallway. That was only trouble we had throughout our stay at NYNY. The room was very tiny while the bathroom was decent size. I think kingbed room has smaller room than queenbeds room, but has bigger bathroom. A/C, Shower, Lights, and etcs. all wroked fine. Room's decor was ok, nothing fancy or luxurious. Bathroom had a marble tiles, but could tell it was cheap marbles. Nothing was dirty or worn out, but wouldn't say everything was extremely clean(hotel is aging). I booked the room through their website and got a promotional deal that was $79 per night which includes 2 for 1 breakfast, 2 free roller coaster tickets, and spa coupons(which I never used) if you called that a bargain. Overall, I would say NYNY is just a Decent, above average Hotel. Nothing fancy or impressive. My girlfriend was little dissapointed, because she was spoiled by our previous stay at THEhotel at MandalayBay. THEhotel at MandalayBay is the place to be if you wanna impress someone or looking for something really nice. Remember, You get what you pay for. The best part of our stay at NYNY was winning money at slot machines and a valet guy remembered our names throughout the stay. Maybe I will return next time when me and my boys go there to gamble, party all night and save $$ on rooms. But not with my girlfriend again.

Reviews.Title: “OK, decent hotel but will not stay again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at NYNY for five nights beginning July 21. I had gotten a good deal in the mail ($59 weekday/$119 weekend), so I decided to stay here in lieu of the MGM Grand. I was in a deluxe room (Century Tower) and the rooms had been upgraded since my last stay about 3 three years ago. Good: The room is average - nothing too fancy. my wife loved the bath products, and housekeeping was fast and friendly. We were on the 24th floor, and even with a full elevator it was efficient. The casino is fine, but the sportsbook is mediocre. I played most of the week at the MGM Grand, as they accept the same comp card, the sportsbook is wonderful, and they have a great selection of slots. Not so good: Even with all the lights on, the room remains dim. There was a sizable tear in the carpet near the bed, and the bath towels were almost as thin as paper towels. Our walk from the elevator to the room was unbearable, so many twists and turns before we would reach the room. Drink service at the slots was awful - at times it would be over a half hour before someone would stop by. It never used to be this way, which is upsetting. Lots of kids here, and the pool is small and crowded. So my final verdict is - unless you get a decent rate to stay here, there are much better choices. I would stay at MGM Grand over NYNY in a heartbeat, as even though MGM is much more expansive, the hotel exudes a little more class. I end up staying at these properties because of the "casino rates" I get, but next time I might pony up for a nicer hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Good rate for room type, $99 weekend rate, included discount passes for breakfast and lunch at the casino's various restaurants. Very quiet room, good TV, everything worked. Nice view. Checkout caught error in our favor with free workout/spa pass. Good choices for entertainment beyond gambling, ESPN Zone, 2 arcades, roller coaster. A fun destination. Close to the monorail station across the street at the MGM Grand.

Reviews.Title: “Great Entertainment”
Reviews.Author: Fudbeer
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel Staff are really friendly nothing to much trouble. Spa I found superb they do a 3 day pass sorry cant remember the price but it was not to expensive and it allows you to use the gym whenever you want Gym has all the usual machines a bit small but it was never busy also has a sauna. Food caters to just about every taste they have a selection of fast food outlets as well as a well respected Steak Restraunt and a chinese restraunt. They also have some great coffee bars including Starbucks and a smothie bar great for a drink after my early morning jog sorry I am a bit of a keep fit junkee:) Bars this is where it wins hands down in my eyes. Have to say that coyote ugly was my least favorite bit to ott for my liking. The dualing pianos has long been my favorite bar in vegas it really is a great atmosphere I started going there many years ago and it was nowehere near as busy then but although I think it is a little bit a victim of its own success it still rocks. However the best bar for me this year was the irish bar. nine fine irishmen I am not usually a fan of irish bars but this one really is superb. They have an awesome irish group playing and you can not help but enjoy it its not to loud and they do all the traditional Irish stuff.Do not be put off if you dont usually like irish music i did not see anyone in there not having a good time. You can also sit outside and enjoy a drink/food and watch life go by on the strip. If im honest most casino bars bore me to death but NY NY really do make an effort in this area. All the bars are of course open very late. The casino is a bit smaller than some but how many machines do you need to take your money. Check in They sent us to the wrong lift and they are a little hard to find but because of this they gave us a free upgrade without asking!

Reviews.Title: “Lots of fun, comfortable beds, terrible view”
Reviews.Author: jbird5150
Reviews.Content: Stayed at NYNY 7/18-7/22 and had few complaints. Tried to check in at the airport--only one person ahead of us-- but was informed that they could only give out smoking rooms there (we had requested non-smoking) so we went directly to the hotel. Waited maybe 10 minutes but check-in was very quick. Requested upgrade, but no dice. Had a Park Avenue Deluxe room in the Chrysler Tower on the 31st floor with a spectacular view of a spotlight and piece of the building. Very disappointed, since I had requested a strip view. Room was comfortable and pretty typical for something with 2 queen size beds. Bathroom was spacious enough, with marble tile and a glass enclosed shower/tub, but would have preferred 2 sinks. Casino is smaller than most but high ceilings help with smokey air. Help was basically friendly with a few exceptions. $10 minimums at night, a few $5 BJ tables during the day, but they were 6 to 5. Ate breakfast at America Cafe and lunch at Gonzalez y Gonzalez--both very tasty. Also got a slice from the pizza place (forget the name) and highly recommend it. NYNY has a very hip, happenin' vibe and it shows in the nightlife. The Bar at Times Square is always hopping at night with the dueling pianos--lots of fun and singing along. The Big Apple Bar is more cushy and laid back, with couches and an R&B band. You can actually carry on a conversation in there. The rowdiest of all is Coyote Ugly, a southern style saloon where the waitresses (and female patrons) dance on the bar and pour free shots into drunk men's mouths. A truly wild time if that's what you're up for. If not, go for the dueling piano bar. Other fun things to consider in NYNY are the rollercoaster and the ESPNZone. Make sure and get your free $20 voucher at the ESPN website before you go--an INCREDIBLE value! All in all, we had a great time at NYNY. It was conveniently connected via walkway to the MGM Grand, which means quick (if you can call a 1-1/2 mile trek through the MGM casino quick) access to the monorail. Also connected via overhead walkway to Excalibur, which has a free tram to Luxor and Mandalay Bay, as well as a short jaunt to Monte Carlo on the other side, which has a free tram to Bellagio. The only real gripe I had was our view. Next time, we'll probably try another hotel (we always try some place new) but we'll definitely be hitting NYNY for the happenin' nightlife!

Reviews.Title: “Fair and busy”
Reviews.Author: tourguy
Reviews.Content: Here is the deal. If you have not been to vegas before - stay closer to the middle of the strip. The NYNY is at what they call the south end. Which means you have to walk, taxi or monorail to another hotel for a show or just to explore. If you stay at Alladin, Ballys, Flamingo you would be in the "action" for the same price. The Hotel is clean, my room was fine, just like any other hotel. Nothing special or a standout. This is a HUGE family hotel in light of the kids video arcade there - so kids are all around. But then again in vegas these days - there are kids everywhere. I saw a baby in a carriage next to the slot machine its mother was playing. I HIGHLY reccommend the Gladys Knight show at the Flamigo. She is simply Amazing. The best show I saw in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “disappointment”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Check in was simple at the airport. We paid for the hotel's shuttle service which was to include bell hop service of our baggage to our room so that we could get off the shuttle and go play. When we got off the shuttle, our bags were left on the curb for us to take to our rooms. Our room was extremely dark and the desk lights bulb was out. I don't think it would have helped anyway. The first day that we were staying, house keeping came banging on our door as if there was a fire. Before I could get to the door they walked right in and we had the do not disturb sign on the door! And, to make it worse, they did it again the next afternoon! My spa experience went well, but when I went to the salon, I heard the manicurists fighting over whose turn it was to take a client. I was then told there would be a 20 minute wait for my scheduled appointment, which I heard was because the person who "lost" and had to take me as a client wanted to take a break first. When my nails were finally done, they kicked me out without allowing me to dry my nails. I could not believe what a waste of money that place was. I would not recommend staying in this hotel unless you plan on never being in your room or using any of their services.

Reviews.Title: “Greattttttttttt fun”
Reviews.Author: captspock16
Reviews.Content: This is a Great fun Hotel we had VIP Check in got a great offer through my email join the mirage player club Got a Spa Delux room for 40.00 Payed 99.00 plus 40.00 they gave a 2-1 breakfast 20.00 free at Nine fine Irshman 2 free Roller coaster passes my wife won 80.00 on a nickel slot only playing for 15 min great pool great Hotel can't wait to go back in Jan

Reviews.Title: “There are better”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had gotten a good price so we stayed here. I wouldn't stay again. Even though we got a non-smoking room, the place reeked of smoke everywhere. Very poor ventilation system. The check-in person was very friendly and went very smooth. The rooms are dark though and it was very crowded. The slot machines didn't seem to hit very much either. Overall, I'd stay somewhere else next time. Been to Monte Carlo and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Solid Hotel, very fun Casino”
Reviews.Author: JHokie
Reviews.Content: This is my second stay at NY NY and had a fabulous time. The rooms are average for Vegas but I had gotten a pretty good deal so no complaint there. Staff was very friendly and handled any request immediately. Several people went above and beyond the call of duty such as one of the bartenders who took the time to call another restaurant (not an MGM property) to book me a reservation. The casino area and restaurant/ bar scene is great. Tons of casual dining (cheap) such as pizza and sandwich shops up to a few upscale places. Gallagher's steakhouse was fabulous. Request Sam as your waiter. He'll take care of you. Dueling Pinao bar and Irish pub are two of the other highlights plus it's location on the southern end of the strip was convenient. If you are looking for upscale lodging then Bellagio or Wynn are better choices but for a good time, NY NY is hard to beat.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were at New York New York June 5 - 9th. Friends had already booked their trip and was not looking forward to staying at NYNY, last trip stayed at the Monte Carlo which we had really enjoyed. Were were pleasantly surprised with our stay at NY NY. Stayed in the Park Avenue free upgrade. Room was nice. We had a group of 13 of us staying at the hotel so saw a lot of different rooms. Some were in the Broadway suite rooms which are bigger than Park Avenue but both were nice. Elevators were no problem (in the New York Tower) Loved the location. Can easily go to Excalibur, MGM & Tropicana. Tram at the Monte Carlo is free and takes you down the strip. Saves some walking. Pool was small and nothing special. Food was good went down for coffee each morning at the Grenwich Coffee place. Great coffee. Starbucks is upstairs to. Had breakfast a few mornings next door at the Excalibur buffet. Lots of variety huge seating area. Great deal for $10.00. A must is to see "O" at Bellagio worth every penny at 150.00 a ticket. Loved it! Will definately go again. Monte Carlo was very nice if you are looking for a very quite, clean hotel, but enjoyed the atmosphere at NY NY. Rollercoaster was never a problem enjoyed watching it. Great stay in Vegas can not wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding performance by Staff”
Reviews.Author: Manny735
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife and 2 friends flew in on July 01 2005 from Vancouver BC,arrived at New York New York at about 315 pm,waited at check in for 3 minutes,I was greeted my a blonde women in her late 20's and I must say in my 8 years working in the customer service field I have not come across such great service..from beginning to end superb service.After that it was smooth sailing...we were upgraded without requesting to the newly renovated tower with flat screen TV's,newer decor,food was good..didnt gamble much...heres some advice if you want to win go to the MGM and play the slots their...only one small complaint one night we ate at the Americas restaurant and one of my guest ordered a steak well done and once it arrived it was still blue..they happily took it off the bill. Last words..excellent customer service..fun atmoshere..I have been to Vegas 6 times..stayed at Luxor,TI,Aladdin and also the MGM..by far my best stay.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely love this Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at NYNY in September 2004 with my girlfriend. We are both from England and it was our first trip to Las Vegas. I cannot think of anything bad I could say about this Hotel, our room while one of the budget rooms was large, clean and had the most amazing view. Every single member of staff was extremely helpful, from the chamber maids to the cocktail waitresses who by the way are so pretty and kept supplying me with cocktails :-). I had heard that the pool was not the best around but i found it to be good enough for me. I will be coming back to this Hotel again in the future (hopefully this year!) Highly recommended Mike T Brighton, England

Reviews.Title: “So good they named it twice!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: On arrival at Mcarran Airport it is possible to avoid loads of hassle and checkin for the hotel before you collect your bags at the MGM ticket & front desk (before you leave baggage collection behind the carousels). However it is cheaper to pickup a cab at $7.00 than use the hotel shuttle bus at $14.00 a head which will be offered to you. New York New York is a trendy, modern hotel with a variety of accommodation in replica towers.We stayed in Century tower on 29th floor with amazing views over the airport and Mandalay Bay hotel but it did sway during a day of high winds! This is probably a place for 20-30 somethings with great restaurants, themed casino like a backset of a film and the rollercoaster which hurtles round the hotel did not disturb us at all but that could be because we were so high up. The breakfast selections are amazing, there is a steak house, delis etc and Coyote Ugly is a wild bar for the young set in an evening after 10pm! I would revisit any time but allow plenty of energy for walking up the strip to Caesars, Bellagio etc as its about a 2-3 mile walk from here. There are various monorails which link hotels but would recommend the 301 or 302 bus running up and down the strip as cheap and frequent and you can see all the sights........

Reviews.Title: “Married in Vegas and Stayed at Fabulous NY NY”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Vegas to get married, and we were more than pleased with our 4 nights at NYNY. Our room was super quiet, even though we could see the hotel's rollercoaster from our window (which was fun to watch). The hotel had fast (the fastest we've had in Vegas) check-in, and automated check out through the TV, so that part was a breeze. We were also there on the busiest time of year (Christmas and New Year), but we had plenty of room to walk through the casino, and the restaruants were not a long wait. We ate at ESPN Zone, which had good hamburgers and their beers are probably the cheapest in the hotel. We also ate at a restaruant with an American theme (can't remember the name), and it had awesome food and was fairly priced. Nine Fine Irishman was the best bar. It has great Irish bands and dancers. So, there is really something for everyone. There is also a huge arcade upstairs for kids, and it was well supervised and safe. Coney Island Eatery was next to the arcade with great hotdogs, pizza, and icecream. This hotel is sort of at the end of the group of fun hotels on the strip, but we never got bored, and there is a tram that will take you right across the street and to the other casinos. Very fun for families and for people that want to gamble and have fun!! We will stay here from now on!! P.S. Check expedia - we stayed for $69/night.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel. Great Service!”
Reviews.Author: tsmith7549
Reviews.Content: Our recent trip to Las Vegas included staying at NY NY Hotel. The room was spectacular and overall service was great. We ate and drank at most all of the resturants and bars. Food, drinks and service were very good. For sports, nightlife and eating you don't every have to leave the hotel. We watched the game at the best sports bar, ESPN Zone and listened to the best Irish music at Nine Fine Irishmen.

Reviews.Title: “New York, New York”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Las Vegas exceeded our expectations. We loved the NYNY hotel. Our room was basic but very clean and in good working order. What we loved about the hotel was the streetscape - we could go down for a meal or drink at anytime at a restaurant or cafe, or grab something and enjoy it at a table street side. The variety of places to eat and drink was great, and the informal dining to our liking. Lots to do within the hotel - dueling piano bar, coyote ugly, the roller coaster, the Coney Island upstairs in addition to the gambling. Hotel guests at this hotel were younger than most we visited along the strip - not the senior crowd of chain smokers we encountered at some of the other hotels. Would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: digger
Reviews.Content: We asked and were given an upgraded Park Avenue Deluxe room by a very helpful and pleasant young man at check in. Our room, though small, was beautifully decorated, very clean and had a great bathroom area. The bed was very comfortable. The room darkening shades were great since our room faced east. We we in the Century Tower and never heard the roller coaster, or anything else for that matter, besides the planes from the airport nearby. We didn't try any of the restaurants or the pool because we were never in our hotel long enough. (We preferred to gamble downtown as we are low rollers.) The one time we did play black jack at NYNY, I noticed the tables were very crowded together. The atmosphere in the casino area is fun and I loved the obvious NY theme. Overall we enjoyed our stay at NY NY. We might stay closer to mid strip next time on a monorail stop. But would highly recommend NY NY for those who like the southern Strip area.

Reviews.Title: “Staff were great and friendly”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just went to Las Vegas for a week trip and for the first time and stayed in the New York New York. The staff people were wonderful! We decided to stay in a spa room for a couple days and then switch back. However, policy states that we could not do that, but the staff graciously accepted their errors. For the whole trip, they only charged one day upgrade to the spa room and gave the spa room for us for the price of a normal suite rooms for the rest of the week! The hotel was very nice and was one of the more upscaled hotels. There was only one slight problem, one night, we decided to eat out in the hotel and chose a cute little Italian restruant, but the food was nasty and overpriced! Def. if you stay here do not eat at the Italian restruant because the atmosphere is good, but the food is not good at all. A very low class Italian meal. Other than that, the hotel was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Swanky New York”
Reviews.Author: wollam11
Reviews.Content: We went to New York New York expecting a nicer hotel than most and got exactly what we expected. Our room was a step up from standard, with a view of the roller coaster and MGM Grand, in the Century Tower. While adequately sized, I can't imagine how anyone could be comfortable in something smaller. The resturaunts were ridiculously priced and the food courts weren't much better. What made New York New York worth the price of admission is the staff and amenities. We requested an additional two dozen hangers and got 'em! I asked for a late check out and got it (they didn't even try to negotiate us out of the request)! And upon getting a drink at the Lobby Bar, and kinda cringing at the price, the bartender told me how I could get a free drink (put $10 in the video poker and cash out before you spend even a dollar), I was very happy. Spend no more than $20 and get free drinks your entire stay! I also joined the Players Club while I was there and, upon returning home, got e-mails offering rates as little as $19 a night upon my next trip (and, as I said, I only lost like $20 my entire trip). What a deal! Eat elsewhere, but I highly recommend the rooms and the staff at NYNY.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room-Comfy, Clean, and Quiet”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed in NY NY on June 8th and 9th. Upon airport check in, asked to be upgraded from the small Skyline room to the Park Avenue and was granted the upgrade with a smile. The taxi line at Mc Carran was unbelievablely long, but upon walking into our adjoining rooms, we felt right at home. The room was spacious and the decor was very modern and soothing. We hit the pool and this was the only downside to NYNY. The deepest part of the pool was 4 ft. deep. The size was very small. This definately isn't the hotel that you come to if you are looking for a tropical retreat or pool relaxation time. A quick dip is all you really want to do....but it fit the bill this time as my husband and I were here with friends and they didn't want to swim. The hotel is great, but next time we will stay mid-strip due to the pool and the dancing choices. Coyote Ugly is definately for guys on a bachelor party or 21 year olds. We did visit Rum Jungle in Mandalay Bay for dinner and had the Argentinian Skirt Steak- the BEST!!! Also visited Il Fornaio and had a good breakfast in the hotel before departing.

Reviews.Title: “nyny----food review......thumbs up!”
Reviews.Author: bigneddy
Reviews.Content: 4 of us went to nyny to go to a wedding at mgm grand. so- we spent alot of time at both places....and personally--- i loved the nyny compared to it. mgm=stuffy,dark,low ceilings.... nyny=opposite. lets break it down: room: standard,,, and while kinda small, was nice and had a huge stand up shower without a tub. me and my lady enjoyed this, especially after some red bulls and vodkas.anyway.......room was fine, and the sound of the coaster actually reminded me of the ocean,,,, food:really good, for the most part.. AMERICA(or whatever)average food, but priced normally,,,pretty good b-b-q pizza with carmelized onions. IL FORNAIO PANETTERIA- awesome coffee, brownies ,, and you have to get the grilled croissant with cheese and bacon for breakfast.....$4 and delic. perfect for a quick breakfast when your on the run. IL FORNAIO-my wife had dinner there with some friends and said the pasta was better than average. we had breakfast there, and i had manzo salmistrato con uova affogate:italian corned beef hash,poached eggs, and polenta w/gorganzola.....loved it. NINE FINE IRISHMEN:awful lunch, never got one of our meals,,,,ever. waiter blaming kitchen,,, manager blaming waiter. who cares,,, bring the food.GALLAGHERS:best steak i've ever had....hands down. trust me. cooked perfectly, and waiter was the consummate professional. when asking around locals for the best steak on the strip, most said this place and i know why. pricey? yup....do it again??yup. finally--for a great lunch , go to the DELI IN THE VILLAGE: and get a fat---- sandwich including potato salad and a pickle for about $6.75. starbucks, and nathans hotdogs,,,,speak for themselves. also--look for the blonde selling t-shirts outside coyote ugly----in a town of hotties,,,,she was the hottest,,,,,hands down,,,,you'll know her when you see her.... out............

Reviews.Title: “Ny Ny Didn't want to leave!”
Reviews.Author: Actionjcksn5
Reviews.Content: We stayed at NY NY June 6th-10th and had a great time!! We asked for an upgrade at check in and were upgraded to a jacuzzi room in the Empire tower. The room was very clean and very spacious. The hotel staff was very helpful. The casino is actually the only one we won money in...I hit the 1000 on the Wheel of Fortune slot 3 times and my fiance couldn't lose!! We had a great time and can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, But there are nicer”
Reviews.Author: SarahBelle
Reviews.Content: I just got back from staying in the New York New York hotel. I was in vegas visiting family and only stayed for one night. I booked the Ziggurat Suit, the biggest suit you can get, but I stayed on a sunday night, and it was only $240, so if anyone is in the same situation all the hotels are cheaper on sunday nights. When i first arrived the look of the hotel is a little dark, not the usual bright lights of most casinos, the line at the check in desk was short, but i was checking in a little late. The man who helped us check in was very nice, and it was very quick. I had requested a smoking room through expedia, and he said he didn't know, so he gave us the room keys, and we went all the way up. and all the way on the other side of the hotel, to the room that wasn't ours. So back down we went, when the man that helped us saw us comming he waved us over, apoligized and gave us the room we had booked, plus vouchers for food, drinks and the roller coaster. Our room was huge, the bathroom was nice, there were nice pictures on the wall and very clean. That night we went to the wynn hotel to meet up with some friends, if you want to stay in any hotel stay at the Wynn or Mandalay Bay. The Wynn is luxury but more for an older crowd, and the Mandalay Bay is beautiful and more for a younger crowd, to stay in that is. Just a warning, the New York New York hotel's casino has slightly different rules than other places, like at the blackjack table, the dealer informed us of these, im not sure if other tables are different. There was a different vibe about the NY NY, it was a little dim, and there wasn't as much of the fun atmosphere. I guess its also hard being from NY to look at a replica, but it just wasn't up to par. I give the rooms of this hotel a 4, and the atmosphere of this hotel a 3. Also if you go to Las Vegas you MUST see Mystere, zumanity isn't half as good as Mystere, the show was just amazing, it plays in the Treasure Island, it is a must see. hope this helped

Reviews.Title: “so little time too much to do”
Reviews.Author: zoebaby
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at New York New York for 7 nights in May and loved every minute of our stay. This is our 2nd time to las vegas in 12 months and it was even better the 2nd time round. We had a fantastic taxi driver from the airport to the hotel he was a Texan and was very funny and very forthcoming with tips for while we were in las vegas.We arrived at the hotel quite tired as our flight was 10 hours long so were delighted with the service of the check in staff there was no line when we got there which was great and the guy who served us offered us advice on what shows were on at the moment at the hotel and what activities we could do he also offered us an upgrade for $15 dollars without us even having to ask this took us from a standard room up to a large kingsize suite in the Empire Tower on the 39 floor with a strip view.The room was very clean and large with windows down 2 sides the views were fantastic we could see the airport the strip and the surrounding mountains some still with snow on the top.There was a service attendant already assigned to our room and within an hour had come to check that everything in the room was alright this was a really nice touch.We ordered room service a couple of times which arrived within the allocated time both times and was hot and very tasty. The staff who delivered it were very friendly. We ate at a couple of the restaurants and we had breakfast at the greenwich village bakery every morning which is in the hotel the baked goods were outstanding and the cappacino was alot better than starbucks.We went to see Zumanity and it was fantastic the women who show you to your seats were hilarious and the show was very sexy some of the moves the acrobats did were amazing. The only bad night we had was at Gallaghers steak restaurant we kept having things taken off our table and then brought back after we had asked for them to be brought back such as the bread and the water. we waited about an hour for our main meal to be brought to us and then noticed that the table next to us who had only been sat for about 20 mins were bought there main straght after ours Half way through the meal a lady asked if we wanted our picture taken and she was very in your face about the pictures so we said yes and she had us make some strange poses so we decided not to have the photos.At the end of the meal she came over with the developed photos and I said I would go to the atm to get some money just to get away from her she said shall I come with you I said its ok I know where it is this is were I lost my patience with her and walked away and didnt come back.This is not want I want when I am in a restaurant. This is the only bad thing I have to say about New York New York and cannot wait to come back FANTASTIC!!

Reviews.Title: “Upgrades are worth it”
Reviews.Author: TANYA66
Reviews.Content: My Dad paid to upgrade us when we checked in so we had adjoining suites in the Chrysler building on a high floor. When we checked out the other rooms they were tiny if you wanted a king bed rather than two queens and the roller coaster noise was almost unbearable. So its definately the luck of the draw or worth upgrading. The above average rating I give is really only because of the suite. The staff on the front desk were rude alot of the time and we ended up getting our Pizza for free because it took so long for them to prepare at the take out but the restaurant where we had steak was great. I think the staff rely too much on the fact that people want to stay at a themed hotel and if they don't start being more courteous and polite they might find that service counts!!

Reviews.Title: “Best of the best”
Reviews.Author: tminton
Reviews.Content: If you like the themed hotels!. This place is great and very lively which was exactly what we wanted. If you are going to relax then go next door to the Monte Carlo. I read the reviews for all the hotels and I have to say that I didn't see what all the nay sayers saw. Sure, some were a little older but to say they were nasty is wrong. NYNY was a great stay. Spa room was wonderful and I never heard the rollercoaster. I guess some people are super light sleepers. Hotel staff was superb and we checked in at 9:00 am. By 12:00 our room was ready and our bags had already been delivered. If you are going on a package deal then I would go to the hotel direct. Eventhough they are part of the MGM group, they are still a separate hotel and the airport help is MGM people. We had to go to the NYNY desk to get any coupons and wait anyway. Just a suggestion. We had no problem with the elevators and staff was very helpful. Something I didn't know, be prepared to lay down a credit card # for $100 a night for incedentals like food charged to your room and so forth. They won't charge you if you don't use but it covers them. I had no problems with it. Actually, NYNY desk charges $100 a night and the airport check in charged me $50 a night. Be ready! Also being a rookie, before you check out, go back to the players club desk where you get your card and they will give you a voucher for part of your bill based on your play. Then go check out! Have a great time. Email me if you have any specifics

Reviews.Title: “FORGET about Cabanas, but enjoy nonetheless”
Reviews.Author: Chicagobound7
Reviews.Content: RE: CABANAS: Read a review about how great the cabanas were so I tried to make a reservation before arriving. Never got a live person, only voice mail. I couldn't get anyone to call me back after two calls, so I left a message for the manager. Manager called me back wanting some clariying questions then never called me back as well. When I got to NYNY I called to see if I had a reservation --no one called me back. When I actually made it to the pool I found out that I did not have a reservation and wasn't even on the waiting list, but that I could check back the next day to see if any were available. At that point I said FORGET IT. RE: Room. Booked under a deal w/ the Players Club $69 (plus tax) a night (week night). Upgraded to next type of room for free (same square footage). In addition they did not charge us for the rollaway bed or refrigerator we requested. Was a little crowded but that was probably because we had three women, tons of luggage, two queen beds and a rollaway bed. So little hard to get around the room. BUT room was VERY quiet. Never heard anyone outside the room, or in the rooms next to us. Had no problem with maid service and bed was very comfy. CASINO: Ended up staying at this hotel because last time we were in Vegas ended up gambling all the time in this hotel. Soo I like the casino even tho' we didn't win anything. In fact we lost enough at NYNY that they comped one nights lodging. MUST JOIN PLAYERS CLUB. POOL: Seemed kinda small, but pool staff are great (save the cabana incident) and was able to get chairs easily when we got to the pool by 11:30. Cabanas didn't seem that great for $$-- they raised the price for Memorial Day weekend to $200! And they only had 6 for the whole pool! Couldn't get the waitress to take our food order to save our lives--even tho we asked the drink waitress TWICE to ask her to come by. OVERALL: Will go again for the price-- can't beat the value and the location of the hotel is AWESOME.

Reviews.Title: “The Big Sour Apple”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had a horrible experience at the New York, New York in Las Vegas. The rooms were small and pool is smaller. Out of all the hotels in Las Vegas, New York, New York is the last place I will stay when I return. When I first arrived with my girlfriend (It was her first time) the toilet was broken. We had a long trip to Vegas and this was a very unwelcome surprise. Then after already being sour I found a big cockroach underneath the curtains in the hotel room. Now I have been to Vegas seven times and I have always found the rooms to be spectacularly clean and elegant and between broken toilets and gigantic bugs crawling around our hotel room I was turned off. Then we went to the pool. What pool! The pool is smaller than the the two pools I have at my apartment complex. Tucked behind the hotels the pool is in the shade until about twelve noon in May. There are no seats and the pool is filthy. What a terrible way to attract those who enjoy the beautiful pools that line the Vegas strip hotels. On top of everything the gameplay at New York, New York is awful. What rude dealers and pit bosses. I was carded every table I went to and not just carded, I was given an attitude by every dealer. Just do you job and try to fake the fact that you hate doing it. It was an unpleasant experience that I just walked away from. I ended up playing very little at the New York, New York and I was happy to give other hotels my money. It is too expensive and very unfriendly and if I had to do it all over again I would steer completely clear of New York, New York in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Best Party Place on the Strip.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just got back from the NY NY Hotel and Casino. What a great place, I had the time of my life and would definately stay there again. The pool was a little small compaired to the other resorts and I didn't like the Casino as much as the others. I'd say MGM had the best casino! (Well best Odds!!) The Mirage pool area was breath taking. I am 24 yrs old and say that NY NY had the best party atmosphere, it was a young crowd mostly and was perfect if you like to party to the wee hours like myself. All the bars are pretty much centrally located plus they have two bars that are 24hrs, The Big Apple and The America. It was a great time to bar hop and then hit up Coyote Ugly's late night when the crowd was lively. There was a lot of walking but they had FREE trams one that goes from Excalibur to Mandalay Bay on one side and another one that went from the Monte Carlo to the Bellagio on the other side. They had a Monarail in the MGM that basically went down the other side of the strip but it cost money. All and All I had a wonderful time, if your young and never been definately check out NY NY and The Hard Rock, both are great party places. I didn't sleep much but have to say the Bed's are very very comfortable as soon as I put my head on the pillow I was fast asleep. The Roller Coaster wasn't loud at all, the flying by Helicopter Tours are much louder, and Los Angeles people are Rude, I am from Boston and they say we are rude, they take the cake on that one!! LA people should stay in LA!!!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Since it was my first time to Vegas, I didn't know what to expect. But once we arrived at the New York, New York Hotel, I knew we were in safe hands. We received help with our luggage and only had to wait in line for 5 minutes to check in. The staff was really nice to us and everyone else. The rooms were very clean and luxurious. I think the whole privacy thing, where you can only go to certain areas with your key, is great. (I don't want some bum roaming the halls...) Our view was great, which overlooked the pool and if you looked up, you could see the roller coaster. (Our travel agent had to specifically ask for a good view. Do this or else you'll get crap.) The only bad thing about being near the roller coaster was that even at late hours of the night, they run the thing. So, say around 11pm you want to end the night early--you can't because some cart full of girls comes screaming by. Oh well, I guess you could take it. I did. Room service was great. There is internet on the tv, which I thought was cool, and the room was plenty big. If you never make it out of the hotel, I wouldn't blame you. There is so much to do just a few floors down from your room that you don't ever have to leave. First off, there's gambling, as usual, so that's a given. But the restaurant choices are endless. I recommend Nathan's hotdogs if you're on the go. It is upstairs by the gaming area. There is a small pizza joint on the main level and they are so quick and serve the most delicious food. There is one tavern that we always passed by, and everyone inside was always singing and having a great time. (Sober? No. Drunk? Yes.) The shopping is great too. You can visit the NYNY gift shop and they price everything reasonably. I recommend the "I heart NYNY" shirts--the ladies will love them! The pool was also great. They serve towels to everyone just as if they were royalty. Also, Rita Rudner is featured at the hotel, and it looked like a good show. Overall, NYNY hotel is one great place. It's not just some smokey joint on the strip. It's a very lively, entertaining, and just plain fun place to stay. Please go here because you'll have many great memories. Bring the kids too, because there's the roller coaster and game area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I made my first trip to Vegas in May 2005 and stayed at the New York, New York hotel. It was a top class hotel at a reasonable price. In fact, there was plenty to do to keep you busy right in that hotel without going to any other ones for those who have handicapped people traveling or do not want to do a lot of walking. Food was excellent, with a top rated restaurant, a chinese restaurant and then a little simulated village within the hotel with other food vendor/restaurants, which I found excellent. They have a really nice pool setup for just relaxing and their staff was excellent. I highly recommend this hotel for your stay and it is also situated where you can easily get to other hotels. Lastly, they have a fantastic display outside which is dedicated to the fallen firemen from the Sept. 11th disaster. It's located near the boats along the sidewalk and had T-shirts from the fire company's that were there on the 11th.

Reviews.Title: “Fun, mid-range hotel”
Reviews.Author: octopussy
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here for eight nights in April. Considering we were staying for a long period we thought we might manage to be upgraded but sadly not. We did pay for an upgrade but it wasn't worth the money. It's a fun place to stay - the bars were always busy - but the casino isn't the best. We'd choose a different hotel next time.

Reviews.Title: “Wow!”
Reviews.Author: Jayszee
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 4 days at NYNY in Las Vegas. Great hotel ! Staff is really friendly, ambiance inside the casino is awesome. You feel like you're strolling along in Greenwich Village, cross the river (yes, river), and then you're in Central Park ! Cool design and lighting. Room was clean & comfy - bathroom was up-to-date, too. Rode the coaster - bumpy, but fun ! Laughed the whole way....Don't forget to check out the dualing piano players in the Times Square Bar. It gets crowded around 12am, but the music and fun is good. The closest monorail station is across the street at the MGM Grand. It's a 15 minute walk for sure. Everything that everyone tells you is "across the street" is farther than you think. A "walk" from the north end of the strip (Treasure Island) down to Mandalay Bay will take at least 45 minutes. Whew ! Use the monorail.....buy a 3-day pass. Save your feet. Bring bandaids, water, sunscreen. Thank-You Vegas !!

Reviews.Title: “rude,rude,rude”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: horrible cocktail service.i sat at a slot machine with several hundred to burn but not wanting to put a whole hundred in i decided to go get some change. i saw a cocktail waitress as i was about to leave for change and asked for a drink.she barked at me that drinks were for playing customers only as i tried to explain my change pursuit she scoffed and walked away. also as i was playing 3.5.7 poker the pit boss stood behind the dealer giving me and him dirty looks and scolding the dealer harshly when he made a mistake. one good note is that 9 fine irishmen is great food.

Reviews.Title: “New York, New York was just fine for us”
Reviews.Author: iluvtravel
Reviews.Content: Last weekend, our group of 6 adults celebrated a member's 50th birthday in Vegas and were booked into the New York, New York Hotel & Casino. I was a bit concerned when I read some unpleasant reports about the hotel on Trip Advisor, and almost asked the booking agent to change our hotel. I was even more concerned when I e-mailed a few general questions to the hotel concierge and received no reply. However, I am pleased to report that our trip was highly satisfactory. The check-in process was very quick and uneventful, the rooms were quiet, spacious, and well-maintained and all of the employees were polite and helpful. At one point, my room key became de-magnetized and would not work, but a gentleman at the front desk was very helpful and friendly and made a new key for me right away. Our group ate at two different places (Il Fornaio for breakfast and in a Village Eateries deli for lunch). Both restaurants provided tasty food at reasonable prices. The hotel is located on the southern end of the Strip (near MGM Grand, Excalibur and the Luxor), but everything on the Strip is so close together I never felt like we were too far from anything. We had dinner at the Paris (5-10 minute walk), and saw the Blue Man Group at the Luxor (10 minute walk). We also dined in the Venetian (15 minute walk). So unless you have some physical limitations, the NY NY Hotel location should not present a problem. It is not as opulent as the Bellagio or the Wynn, but it also doesn't command the room rates of the Bellagio or Wynn. I highly recommend the NY NY Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “No Comps - Comfortable beds”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Myself and 15 salesmen won an incentive to LV and we decided to stay at the NY/NY. Most of us are avid gamblers and liked the amount of tables but comps were nowhere to be found. After playing $50 hands for the 1st 15 hours, I was not even offered breakfast (Bobby the pit boss is an absolute idiot). Most of our group often bet on games and the sports book is a joke, almost as if it was an afterthought during construction. There are local sports bars in our hometown that have more seating and TV's. After the 2nd night we did our gambling at the Wynn, this place is unbelievable, I was comp'd (4) dinners after playing only (2) hours! Gallaghers food was marginal but Smith & Lewinski's (one block down) was one of the best steaks I have ever had. If you want to lay by the pool, you better find a palm to grease, my sister has a bigger pool.

Reviews.Title: “Great but not so Great”
Reviews.Author: sandyandkevin
Reviews.Content: My mother, daughter and I stayed at the NewYork NewYork April6-10th. We were put in a room on the 10th floor and it was furthest from the elevator. I requested a room change and they did come through with one the next day A+ We really enjoy going to the pool however the pool is inbetween the tall buildings and the roller coaster is above it. The sun didn't start to get near the pool till 11:00 am. They have very strict rules on how you can set your lounge chairs and will not hesitate to let you know about it ! the pool was adequate but not what I would expect for a hotel of this size. C... We had a cabana for Mother's Day and we could not have asked for better service ! Our hostess was Chelsea and I would be sure to ask for her again if I were to go back. For $125.00 we had 4 padded chaise lounges and the cabana with a table and chairs, a loaded refridgerator (non alcoholic) and a huge basket of fruit and snacks. there's a fan in the cabana and also a telephone, a changing area, a radio and a television. When we tipped our hostess, she was so surprised to get $50.00. (I don't think people tip much out there.)A+ We had a small problem with getting towels for our room. There were 3 of us in the room and we were only getting 2 of everything ( apparently the front desk does not relay info to the help ) C. The hotel operator was rude ! I am not used to someone being a smart mouth and that is exactly what she was ! ( I thought the customer came first !) D. The food at the hotel was great ! We went to the deli (can't say enough for this !) sandwiches piled high with a side of potato salad and a pickle. Very reasonable. A+ The American restaurant had a great dinner deal for $14.95 ( steak, crablegs, salad, potato and vegetable ) A. My daughter went to the mexican restaurant and said it was excellant ! A+ Chin Chin has a breakfast buffet (limited foods) It was OK -C As for the crowds and noise, yes there are crowds and noise but there are also several areas that are pleasant. The noise is limited to certain hours of the night and people are having FUN ! If you don't want the noise, stay away from the bars ! We had no problems sleeping. A The room was nice but nothing special. We had a Broadway room and it was a good size but seems that they could use a desk in there or something ! It was clean ! B Service on the floor (beverage) was great at times and then not so great at others. C The card keys they give you are real tricky. I had to ride the elevators a couple times because I didn't punch in my floor number in time ! Also, they have a separate elevator for the pool. We got tired of the key card game and opted to go across the lobby to the pool doors there. (I don't recommend this unless you have some clothes over your swimwear) Keys- C-. My worst problems came when I went to check out and that was with the operator (Sandy) She was quite rude and I did not appreciate that at all. That was when I decided I would not be going back there to stay ! We had a lot of great times and it was a GREAT MOTHER'S DAY !

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at NY/NY”
Reviews.Author: nyjet51
Reviews.Content: We stayed at New York New York for 5 nights and our stay was great. Myra at the front desk was the sweetest person we came across on our trip. We opted to upgrade our room for an aditional $15 a night which was so worth it. We had a fantastic view from our 3 large windows on the 19th floor. The keycards in the elevators gave us no problems and we felt it was a good security feature. The room service and nathans hotdogs were both good but we didn't really eat at the hotel much. We didn't use the spa, gym or pool so I can't coment on any of those things although I am sure they are nice. The casino has a good atmosphere and enough free drinks to make loosing your shirt at the craps table a little less painfull. The only complaint I can think of is that I had a few friends staying at the Riviera and made quite a few calls to their hotel, when we checked out I was given a bill of $23 for phone use that I was unaware of. I would recomend asking when you check in how the phone charges work to avoid this happening to you. I didn't raise a stink about it and gladly paid the bill, what is $23 bucks when I was loosing hundreds a day gambling. Overall this is a great hotel with a very friendly and helpfull staff and I look forward to staying at NY/NY again in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: New York, New York is one of the best hotels you will ever stay at. The rooms are nice. I had a suite with a Jacuzzi in it, it was wonderful. The decor was great. The service from the restaraunts to the front desk was friendly and helpful. I can not say enough wonderful things. There was nothing wrong with my entire stay here it was perfect from start to finish.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here!!”
Reviews.Author: kggp
Reviews.Content: When we got to the hotel they gave us the option to upgrade our room to delux w/view for an extra charge. We agreed! That was pointless!!!! The Delux room was tiny. It was smaller than any STANDARD rooms we ever stayed at in Vegas in other hotels. The bathroom was smaller than bathrooms in MOTELS. To get to the shower or the toilet we had to close the door other wise it was UNACCESSABLE AT ALL!!! The view we were told about was: Part of Excalibur Hotel and the bottom part of the rollercoster. That was it. I called the maid for more towels. It took them 30 min and 3 calls to get them. The room service menu was limited and not so great. My husband wanted crab cakes. But for them to make it you have to order 25 pc. The restaurants were not good either. I would eat else where. We saw Rita Rudner. I would suggest it for an older crowed (50+). Funny at times but not worth $63/person. Overall our stay was not good. We would never come back to this hotel. Venician is it for us!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed NY, NY”
Reviews.Author: 8seastars
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the NY NY this March (27th-31st) for the first time and we really enjoyed it. We tried the airport check-in and although it was quick and the staff friendly, we were told that we had to pick up our "package perks" at the front desk of the actual hotel. We had booked the Irresistible Package and didn't end up using much from it except the free roller coaster passes, but we did enjoy the Park Avenue Deluxe room that was included. Once we got to the hotel we went right to the room, and were disappointed to find that our view included a nice view of a wall. We headed to the front desk and were given another room and our package perks. Our second room had a nice view of the Tropicana and Excalibur - we were pleased. The room was clean and we always had plenty of linens. The bathroom was large with plenty of counter space. The bed was super comfortable. To get to and from your room you must use your key cards on the elevator and we had trouble with this many times, having to swipe our card multiple times before being able to select our floor. Almost every time we were in the elevator people were complaining about this, some saying they had to return to the desk to get new cards in order for them to work in the elevator. The Manhatten Express was a good ride, but crowded. The lines were long, but moved fairly quickly. Time of day did not seem to be a factor in how long the lines were, as we checked back several times hoping they might be shorter. We ate at the pizza place a couple of times for lunch and it was very good, but of course lines were long. We also ate at Gonzalez Y Gonzalez, the mexican place, and weren't that impressed. It was average at best. We did most of our gambling at the MGM and had much better luck there, especially with the slots. There is easy access to the monorail from the MGM if you don't want to walk, as it is quite a walk to the other end of the strip. Overall, NY NY is a good value for the money, and we are considering staying there again later this year.

Reviews.Title: “Great Trip!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a weekend stay (Thur-Mon) Apr 28-May 2, 2005 and really enjoyed this hotel. We have gambled there before, but it was nice to roll upstairs after hitting all this hotel offers and the adjacent hotels so near its site. The rooms were not too small as others have said and I loved the decor--very modern with some added touches like lights that are dim when you first put them on and grow brighter over approx. 5 minutes. It was nice when people in your room come and go at different times of the night/morning. Our party stayed in two rooms on the 23rd and 28th floor of the Century Tower taking recommendations from this board to sit above the rollercoaster. Noticed no problems or noise from these heights and the views were excellent from both rooms. The odd room nos. in this tower faced the mountain side of Vegas (surprisingly beautiful at night with a side view of Bellagio/Paris strip) and the even numbered rooms faced the strip with a great view of the statue of Liberty and Tropicana, etc... The bars and fast food/sidewalk food was excellent here. The pizza is really good and the fries at Nathans. The Nine Fine Irishmen bar was a blast with a great band Sunday night and the middle piano bar seemed to be the hot spot every night of our stay with the crowds. You could listen to the music while you gambled outside. We rented a car and parking was easy and convenient. Overall, I tend to like the hotels where when you gamble the atmosphere makes you feel like your outside like New York New York or the Paris. The high ceilings, sidewalks, water streams, corner stores make you feel less confined. The only negatives--the elevator room key security system is odd. Other hotels only require you to show your room key to security to board the elevators. This hotel makes you put your key in a slot which was somewhat tempermental and didn't always connect before you and the other people on the elevator were able to press their floors. The Mexican restaurant at the hotel was only average--I would drive or taxi to Cozy Mels on Flamingo--much nicer! Also, the pool has great service but is somewhat small and less grand. Overall, great hotel that I would visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible food....I made the same mistake twice!”
Reviews.Author: crickerpicker
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we've made the mistake of going to New York New York for dinner. This time we tried the Tex-Mex place. Ordinary is an overstatement! This hotel caters to a young crowd , many of whom don't know the difference between eating good food and just filling their bellies. This Mexican restaurant was the pits. It was overpriced and the food is better at Taco Bell. Service was also lacking. What a shame NY NY can't get it together. Last year we went to Nine Fine Irishmen and the food there was waaaaay overpriced and not very good. C'mon, NYNY.......improve your food and you'll get some middle aged people to come. Maybe that's not what you want, but they have money. The atmosphere is nice, slots were tight. We won't waste our time at NY NY next time we visit Vegas ........too many other good places to eat.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lirwin13
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the New York-New York for two nights - April 16 - 18, 2005. It was a long walk from the parking garage to the casino through the arcade (especially with luggage) then to the room. I had requested a non-smoking king room, but there were none available, so I was given 2 queen beds with a Strip view. The room felt very small and tight. I was at the end of the hallway, and it felt very claustrophobic. The room was very dark, not a lot of natural light (smaller tinted windows) and not many lamps either. The glasses in the bathroom were dirty on the inside. The hotel is at the South end of the Strip, across from MGM Grand, so expect a long walk if you're headed anywhere mid-strip or further. For the price paid (extremely high for Vegas), I didn't feel it was a good value for the money. Consider other hotels (Paris Las Vegas, Venetian, etc.).

Reviews.Title: “I loved NY-NY”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was in Las Vegas April 20-24 and I can say that NY-NY was great! I loved how upbeat the hotel was compared to the other hotels and casinos we visited, it really did feel like we were in NY! It was obvious that NY-NY caters to the younger tourist (i am 25). It wasn't as classy and elegant as say The Venetian or Bellagio, but it wasnt meant to be! I had a great time at the spa, my massage was wonderful. I didnt care for the Italian restuarant but my friends and I actually did enjoy the Asian food at Chin-Chin! I noticed some others didnt care for it much.!There are so many places to grab a quick bite as well. I had great chicken soup from the deli, wonderful pizza from the small pizza place and a great fruit tart from the pastry stand. They food at the La Salsa in the Luxor was nasty!! Don't do it! The buffet across at the MGM was excellent! The staff was pleasant and the rooms were great, housekeeping always did a great job.

Reviews.Title: “Won't Stay There Again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the NY NY Casino (4/16-4/21/05). Our stay was okay. The location was good, would have preferred to be more centrally located on the strip, but this was fine. We found the casino itself to be dark, and very, very smokey. The pool area was okay. Very plain. Definitely overcrowded. Unless you were there when the door opened, you couldn't get a chair to relax in, instead we received a towel and had to lay on cement steps to enjoy the sun and pool. Guest services and the staff at the registration desk were not helpful. They weren't helpful with show tickets, nor taking credit card information so when you visited anywhere on the property you can charge items to your room. I'm glad I visited, but wish I only vistited and didn't stay there. It was just okay.

Reviews.Title: “Another great weekend at NY NY!”
Reviews.Author: edleo13
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at New York - New York Hotel and Casino for the second time on the weekend of Saturday, April 9th, 2005. We were in town for the Jimmy Buffett show at the MGM Grand Garden. As with our prior visit, we booked the cheapest room (Skyline) and because of the timing of when we showed up, we were upgraded to a Park Avenue room. Although we were on a low floor (room 716 in New Yorker Tower) facing the roller coaster, we never heard any noise during typical sleeping hours and actually enjoyed the view of the Tropicana and Excalibur. The Park Avenue rooms are very nice as they have been recently redone. The in room safe is especially convenient for storing valuables. One another plus of NY NY is that you can check in for both it and the MGM Grand at the airport. We like NY NY for weekend trips as it is very convenient to/from the airport (no dealing with Strip traffic) and features a very lively environment. The Times Square bar features great dueling piano players, playing classic rock songs while the crowd sings along. Plus, it is very convenient to the MGM Grand, which has a plethora of restaurants and hosts the Strip's southern-most monorail stop. Speaking of the monorail, this was our first trip where it has been fully functional. It REALLY opens up the Strip for easy transit. We bought the 24 hour pass for $10/person and made our way all the way down to the Sahara and back, stopping at every stop along the way. After the concert Saturday night, we jumped back on the monorail and within 10 minutes were at Harrah's, where they now host a $9.99 late night buffett. On Sunday morning, we checked out the Dishes buffett (new) in Treasure Island. This buffett is similar to Cravings at the Mirage, but offers slightly different dishses (i.e. extensive barbeque section). Dishes also offers a made to order salad and pasta stations that I really liked. In summary, another great Vegas trip and another great stay at NY NY. Bag check on Sunday morning was fast & easy, as was pick up that afternoon. We'll definitely be back at the NY NY.

Reviews.Title: “They set their own price of their Starbucks store”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A grande drip was $3.17. Upon checking with starbucks, the hotel operated the store themselves and can set their own pricing.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at the NYNY”
Reviews.Author: janedoe
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the NYNY April 10-14... used the Airport check-in which was great as there were no lineups and we had our room key within 5 minutes. Our room was a Park Avenue Deluxe, 21st floor in Century tower with a view of the Strip. We could barely hear the roller coaster when it was operating as well. The room was a decent size and spotless. The staff were all extremely polite and our maid even came over and introduced herself to us as we were entering the room. We ate at America late in the evening and while the wait for our food was a little long, it was very good, hot and unbelievable huge portions. There is also a bakery that had amazing croisssants. We ate in the "food court area" at the deli and pizza place and again prices were reasonable, food quality very good.
