Great entertainment at the duelling pianos bar and great place to people watch as well. The slots were tight but easily racked up points on the Players Card and got a free t-shirt. The only negative thing I can think of about the hotel is the requirement to use your room key to access your floor in the elevator. As much as I think the security feature is terrific, the card readers were working intermittantly and there were times where we were in a full elevator, going nowhere or up or town the tower unable to get off at our floor. I have stayed at the MGM, Flamingo, the old Aladdin and Treasure Island and would definately make this hotel my first choice again

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Went for eight days at the beginning of April with my girlfriend and we both had a great time, customer service was fantastic, it was fun, buzzing and full of life. The key cards for hotel rooms and elevators can be temperamental but no where near as bad as reviewed below. The choices of food from the restaurants is very diverse, and there is some great live music on offer at the big apple bar. One point of caution though...do not go to the Chinese "Chin Chin" restaurant, terrible service, high prices and awful food! Do try Gonzalez Y Gonzalez Mexican restaurant, wonderful food, service and prices! Would love to go back again to NYNY!

Reviews.Title: “Okay - but not great”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in late March 2005 - booked two online packages (one for us and another for the couple we were travelling with) in late November. Requested King beds and adjoining rooms - called in November to confirm and was told no problem - neither request was accomodated when we arrived (and the front desk staff certainly weren't helpful), probably should have pushed it, but our flight was late and we were tired! Check In lineup was long and staff not particulary friendly, in fact bordered on rude. This was my 3rd trip to Vegas, stayed a Bally's before and will stay there next time. NYNY was an experience, but it's really busy and crowded. View of the strip from our room was awesome - roller coaster a little noisy, but it shuts down @ midnight! Room was average. Overall - an okay stay, but certainly not spectacular!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel. The view was fantastic. Although we could hear people screaming on the roller coaster all the time, it didn't bother us much, instead, it was more like something unique a/b the NYNY. There are several restaurants in the hotel but we didn't get to try them all. I wouldn't recommend the Chinese restaurant, cant' remember the name, but it's located near the elevators, right behind the Italian restaurant. It's not Chinese food, or i don't even know what they serve, noodles with no tastes. Beside that, this hotel is great, will definitely come bak.

Reviews.Title: “No problems here - very nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Can't find fault with our stay, check in was immediate, no queuing and the same for checking out. The room and bathroom were very clean. Key use in lifts didn't cause us any problems and seemed to work every time, maybe we were lucky during our 3 days ?? Car parking was no problem a very short walk over a connecting bridge to the hotel, didn't bother with Valet service. Rollercoaster didn't cause us any problems on the 26th floor, we couldn't hear it - as this was a worry from all the other reviews ! Only problem was finding the right set of lifts for our tower when we first arrived as the directions given were very vague and not sign posted. Hotel had everything we needed and close to all the other main hotels.

Reviews.Title: “BE SURE AND PLAY HERE”
Reviews.Author: twety
Reviews.Content: Last Nov. we stayed Downtown but played all the big hotels on the strip. The NICEST hotel for WALK IN'S is the N.Y. N.Y.-- We asked where we could sign up for the players card and the Gentleman not only explained but took us there. As there was a line he got up TEMPORARY cards to use and then trade in LATER for the real card. This saved a lot of time for us. We also earned enough points for a free T shirt and we were there about 3 hours. There is so much to see that even if you don't gamble, it's well worth the time to go in and look around. They had the friendliest people on the floor helping people. The only other hotel we got this kind of service from was the FITZGERALD Downtown. Love downtown, especially if you don't want to spend hours walking on the strip. The light show is fantistic. Try not to miss it. We thought it compartd to the fountains and the Volcano.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't go again”
Reviews.Author: srizzuto
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in several strip hotels in Vegas, and been inside most of them, and was rather disappointed in New York. It is not all that big, compared to say, MGM, Venetian, Bellagio, etc. There weren't many appealing restaurant choices (comparitively), and room service was not very good. The room (a Broadway upgrade) was pretty nice, 30th (top) floor in the Century tower, which is closest to the check in desk. It had a view of the strip, mostly the MGM lion. Our biggest gripe was that the valet service will not take a call-ahead to get your car ready for you. You have to go down and swipe your ticket bar code and then just wait. There is no personal interaction until the person brings your car up. It's very impersonal, until it's time for a tip. The clientele in here was scary. There were several drunk and disorderly people that scared me. I got off the elevator at one time just to get on another one that didn't have crazy drunk guys on it. My husband got stuck in one elevator with a lady who thought it was funny to push all the buttons because she was drunk, she explained.

Reviews.Title: “NewYork NewYork...a name worth repeating over again.”
Reviews.Author: CasaNovaAction
Reviews.Content: Don't let anyone fool you, this place is a great place to stay at. My girlfriend and I just got back last week from Lost Wages...er, I mean Las Vegas and while we may not have won downstairs, we hit the jackpot in the rooms and hotel. Too much to tell yet my advice would be that anyone who gets a room at NewYork NewYork should stay on the 25th floor or higher. Sure you will hear very slightly the roller coaster outside yet it closes early so that it does not disturb its occupants. The suite we stayed on was on the 35th floor with a fantastic vew of the city. My girlfriend was amazed at how great the city looked during the day and night. The rooms were very clean yet my advice is to always request a room that is non-smoking if possible. Service was great and very helpful. We checked out many other hotels near NewYork NewYork yet our hotel perhaps was the best on the block due to the fact that the hotel seemed more 'real' as opposed to the others that try to glamour their decour with outragous designs and themes. NewYork had a very nice interior area, nice pool area even though it was not deep and a great second floor filled with video games and a huge arcade for the kiddies, in other words it had something for everyone. I will probably only stay at NYNY from now on due to its location and amenities and good service.

Reviews.Title: “Overall, great hotel! Pros and Cons”
Reviews.Author: AnywhereButOhio
Reviews.Content: Overall I'd say that NY NY was great. We knew a lot going in because we stayed at Luxor last year and spent a lot of time hanging out at NY NY. We booked early (in late fall) for our 5 day trip on March 30th. We booked the Irresistable Package. That included a Park Ave Deluxe room upgrade, 2 for 1 breakfast at the Italian restaurant, 2 fitness center passes, and 2 free roller coaster rides. The room decor was very nice! Real modern and New Yorkie. Nice woods, metals, marble bathroom floors and counters, flat screen TV, etc. We ended up on the 33rd floor with strip view (of Excalibur, Luxor, Mandalay Bay). As always we love the casino in Central Park, you have to convince yourself that you're INSIDE. With all the cafes and restaurants - the food possiblities seem endless. Now for the downside. Our room was right next to the elevators. Though not loud, we could still hear them. The elevators were horrible. You have ride a certain one to get to the high floors. To push the button for your floor, you HAVE to swipe your room card - which worked maybe 10% of the time. So you end up going to a few different floors until someone gets on and their card works (most people's cards didn't work either). Maybe it was just the 33rd floor, but there was a constant beeping sound outside our room somewhere - almost like a whine. We searched for the source, but couldn't find it. In fact everywhere we went on our floor to look, we could still hear it - very odd! My theory is that maybe it was a washer or dryer with a squeaky drum, but it went on 24 hrs a day. We couldn't switch rooms cause the hotel was full. For the most part the hotel stay was great. Afterall, how much are you really in the room? When you are, it's just to sleep. And you're so tired and/or intoxicated that you could sleep anywhere. I would definitely recommend NY NY. Especially to 20 or 30 somethings like us. It's young, fun and busy - just like it's namesake!

Reviews.Title: “Love That New York, New York!”
Reviews.Author: chatter-box2go
Reviews.Content: I stayed overnight on the 23rd of March at the NY, NY Hotel & Casino & loved every moment of it. The staff was helpful & friendly. My room was clean with a very nice view. The slot machine's were pretty loose. The only negative was when I purchased a fried catfish dinner at a place called "Fulton's"! It was not cooked fully on the inside, other than that, the casino was jammin'. I would not hesitate to pay them another visit in the near future!

Reviews.Title: “A fun Vibrant upbeat Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Allanbhoy
Reviews.Content: Well, we walked in and just had to take a moment to take it all in. This truly was a city within a city. The atmosphere grabbed us and didn't let go. Our check in was painless and efficient, i opted to upgrade to a 29th storey room with a fantastic view and that was exactly what i got. The room was the park avenue, and came with a great TV, a super comfy bed and nice deco. All the staff were very friendly, and i can vouch for the food in Chin Chin, but not for the service in IL Fornaio. Plenty to see and do, the Casino floor was alive with action and the atmosphere was great. Recommended to all.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel--Best Vegas experience yet!!”
Reviews.Author: Daschmo
Reviews.Content: We spent an incredible 5 days at this hotel. Checking in took all of 5 minutes. Our upgraded room on the 34th floor of the Empire tower was decorated sophisticatedly art deco, giving it a very Manhattan upper class flair. Our room was huge, the beds were firm and comfortable, and it seemed like the bed pillows came in several densities to suit any comfort level. Our room was impecably clean upon arrival, with an abundance of fluffy towels and toiletry items. Overall, our accomodations far surpassed any hotels I'd stayed in before in Las Vegas and anywhere else. We loved the feeling of NY energy that is so well recreated in this city within a city. The hotel restaurants we dined in--The American Grill (?) and Gonzalez Y Gonzalez were excellent. Menu offerings are as diverse here as they are in the city. You will find prices reasonable. That part amazed me. Coyote Ugly was a happening night spot. We scheduled shows to see headliners elsewhere but would love to have seen Rita Rudner at the NY NY as well. Located a bit south on the Strip, I found the NY NY to be perfectly in the center of the excitement. I will long remember this hotel experience as my very best in five Vegas vacations. We'll definitely stay there again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Gave it a bad start....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I recently went to NYNY for a night stay on March 14, 2005. We decided to hotel-hop and picked NYNY because of the package offer and our Zumanity show. We made our reservations a month prior to our vacation, and booked it for $206 and change that clearly states that we were getting a package. Upon arrival, the lady was extremely rude to us. The lady asked us if we would like to be upgrade for 20 dollars more, and I said what floor would that be, and she said, 24th. I declined to stay on any floors that have the number 4 due to superstition. She said the only room that was available at that time was a room on 5th floor that is really far away from the elevator. However, she said a lot of things about having an upgrade, I asked her if that wasn't on the 24th floor and she gave me a nod. I said, "sure", afterwards. After all the paperwork is done, I saw that it was on the 24th floor, I didn't want to take it. She ripped up paper in front of my face fiercely, and she placed us on the room that is on the 5th floor, without asking us if we would to stay in a "Smoking" room, as an option. I was quite upset. When I asked her about our package, she said that we weren't book for a package, which EVEN upset me EVEN MORE! I spoke to the manager, and she gave us an attitude problem. We literally had to argue with her for a good 30 minutes and then she gave us our complimentary tickets to the rollar coaster ride (which was worth $25). The only good thing that came out of this was the proximity to the airport [cheaper on taxi] and ESPN Zone! They give out lotion, shampoo, conditioner, and mouth wash as their complimentaries. I didn't really like the design of the room, it was quite dark.

Reviews.Title: “Pool service was great, nice rooms minus the food smells”
Reviews.Author: CoolMadre
Reviews.Content: We stayed there during a very busy convention week (also attending the convention), so I think the crowds were heavier than normal. While the lobby/casino was always crowded and loud, it rang true of what comes to mind when thinking of the real NYC. I loved the pool area - it was clean and the staff was eager to please. It got crowded towards mid-afternoon. It's best to arrive early. Loved the location - easy to access the tram at MGM or to catch a taxi with the help of the valet. Elevators were very quick - we never had to wait more than a minute. My only complaint was that our room must have been right above one of the restaurants. I woke up every morning to food smells floating up, some of which were not smells I want to smell (one morning it was the smell of burnt food - I thought we were on fire!) The odor never left the room completely and it got a little sickening. The roller coaster was right outside our window, but we never really heard it, which is a plus. Internet access was cumbersome at best. We would probably stay there again if the price is right, but will likely try another hotel first.

Reviews.Title: “Loud & confusion everywhere everywhere!”
Reviews.Author: KRSTucson_Az
Reviews.Content: Usually spend one weekend per month in Vegas, tried them all except NewYork-New York so just spent 2 nights there. Least favorite of ALL Vegas properties! Horrible service,Loud-Loud- Loud and just a feeling of being in a confused maze of people. I will say the rooms are adequate and the one BEST feature is they have the most confortable beds in Vegas. That said, the rest is downhill. The view from the room was a direct view of the air conditioners, electrical & outside flood lights. Directly over that was the roller coaster and a beautiful side view of the parking lot. Rude & totally confused check in, they could care less. We came away with ears still ringing and an ADHD feeling. I would not recommend this property to anyone! There is a WONDERFUL resort with full serives ( best in Vegas) just a walkway across the street. Be prepared for CONFUSION in all areas if you stay at New York- New-York! K & C Oro Valley, AZ

Reviews.Title: “Stay away -- stay FAR, FAR away!!”
Reviews.Author: LovinLasVegas
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the New York New York for four nights and had a terrible experience there. There was nothing luxurious about the hotel at all. It almost seemed to have some sort of a western theme with an abstract print of deep reds, oranges and yellows on the bedspread. The biggest problem, though, was the staff. They were all so rude, especially the ones at the front desk. All the members in my party joked that they must have gotten their staff from New York! Not only did they not care about us, but they had horrible attitudes and never smiled. They were not willing to accommodate any of our wishes, and believe me, we didn't ask for much (an extra hour before check-out, etc.). We tried not to let it ruin our vacation, so we spent most of our time gambling at Harrah's casino and also walking down the strip, touring the other hotels. This was the first time I went to Vegas (I have since gone twice more) and the first and last time staying at New York, New York. If you are looking for a stylish hotel with a relaxing atmosphere and good customer service (not to mention comps), I suggest staying at Treasure Island. I have stayed there once (and will be staying there again this summer) before and fell in love with the place. The price is the same (possibly cheaper) and it is well worth the luxury experience.

Reviews.Title: “Fun and young!!”
Reviews.Author: tomatoholly
Reviews.Content: I recently traveled to Las Vegas with 4 other girls for a girls' week-end. We wanted a cheap trip, and we wanted to stay on the strip. NY, NY was among the cheaper on the strip and it looked nice, so we gave it a try. I thought the hotel was clean, fun, and different. They had one area that was designed to look like the streets of NY complete with a pizza place. We tried to eat at the steakhouse on a Friday night, and we made the mistake of not making reservations. They told us a 3 hour wait, so we headed to ESPN zone and had a great meal, plus the waiters were cute. We ended up eating there twice and had 2 great meals. We upgraded to the park place rooms, b/c we could get adjoining that way. It was definitely worth the money. We could see the roller coaster right outside of our room, and never heard it. The rooms were tastefully decorated and clean. No complaints here. Overall, it was a great stay for the money.

Reviews.Title: “New York - New York Hotel was wonderful - stay there!”
Reviews.Author: Ellestar
Reviews.Content: We paid $99 for a standard room which included (because we booked online at the NYNY site) 2 free roller coaster passes, 2 for 1 breakfast and a few other nice freebies. When we arrived I asked if any upgrades were available and for $40 they put us in one of the nicest suites I've ever been in. Unfortunately the toliet broke so they upgraded us again (this time for free) to a penthouse suite - talk about luxury. This was easily a $1000 room (or more) that I got for $139. 2 person jacuzzi in the room, marbel bath, etc. etc. But the view from the room was unbelievable. We could completely see the strip and see the fountains at the Bellagio. I would highly recommend this hotel as they do take care of their guests! I've attached a copy of the view from our room to this email - this was taken with my small $100 digital camera so you can imagine how wonderful it was if this inexpensive camera caputures this picture. Stay there, you will no regret your decision.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay again!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights in December (18 & 19). Loved the atmosphere, also was upgraded to a deluxe room (Park Avenue), thought the room and the service was great!! Also saw the Zumanity show, would recommend it. Very enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “We love the NY NY!”
Reviews.Author: OnTheGoGirl00
Reviews.Content: We stayed at NY NY on our 4 day vacation to Vegas for the Nascar race. This was by far the best hotel we have stayed at in all of our trips to Vegas. We had an early arrival and were given a room immediately upon checking in, which was about 9:30 a.m. Check in was quick and easy we only waited in line for a few minutes. Staff was also very courteous & helpful showing us how to get around the hotel. Even the maids were the first to say hello when you passed in the halls. Our room was very clean and quiet. Throughout the weekend we very seldom heard any people in the hallways. The beds were the most comfortable beds we've ever slept on in a hotel. The bathroom was fairly large and spotless. Our room was a long walk from the elevators, but with a hotel that size it was expected. After all the great food we ate all weekend, we were glad to have the exercise! We were on the 8th floor and had a view of the pool and roller coaster. Roller coaster did not seem as loud as other reviews have said, but it could've just been our location. We were never bothered by it. We did very little gambling here but when we did we always came out ahead. In the little time we spent in the casino, there were always plenty of coctail waitresses coming by to see if we needed anything. We didn't visit any clubs or bars in the hotel, though we did visit others while we were on the strip. We ate at several of the restaurants at NY NY and they were all excellent. Many different varieties, something for everyone. Sometimes there was a wait, but it was a very busy weekend so it was to be expected and our wait time was never long. Check out was very quick and easy. Many different options were available to do so. We were sad to leave sunny, beautiful Las Vegas and NY NY! We will definately stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Good Not Great”
Reviews.Author: hjs19712003
Reviews.Content: I really should give it a 3.75 star rating but since I can't, I'll just say it was better than 3 but not quite 4 stars so I'm going to be conservative and say 3. Anyway, rule # 1 here, nobody will offer you anything. Ask for it and you will get it but don't expect any free offers or help with anything. Almost like a real New York "attitude". I booked the "Irresistable Package" online and didn't get any of my "free perk certificates" when I checked in at the airport (check in there if you can). I had to go to the front desk the next morning and ask for all of my free coupons. We did the roller coaster, good, not great but it was free with the package. Used the spa/gym, once again, good not great and NO WAY IN H*LL I would pay $20 a day if I didn't have the passes for free ($25 for non-hotel guests, ouch!). Gym is small but backroom showers were some of the best I've ever used. Pool is good, not great, lounge chairs fill up by about 1030, get there early if you can. Casino is good, not great, kind of small but the blackjack tables were very kind to me, slots weren't. Restaurants are good, not great (see a pattern here...?) and of course, over priced like everything else in Vegas. Bar at Times Square is cool but $20 for two mixed drinks, ouch again. Get to Coyote Ugly by 8pm if you don't want to wait in line (or pay a cover). Upgraded Park Ave "Deluxe Room" seemed like a normal room to me, I'd hate to have a regular room. No complaints with the room, well above Motel 6 but not close to a Ritz-Carlton, just nothing special. Oh by the way, I requested a top or high floor with a view when I called to confirm the reservation and got an 11th floor room with a view of the pool/parking garage. Room # was 1101 which means it is 700' from the elevator (furthest one away). Request a room number between 30 and 70 if you don't want to walk too far to the elevator. Go online and study the layout of the bottom two floors so you don't walk around lost your first two days like everyone else. I am dead serious when I say you should study the layout of the hotel for at least an hour before you arrive, nothing is well marked. Went to see the "Zumanity" show in the theatre, I've never been to a show like that and am not considered a "theatre" kind of guy but it was actually worth the $85 per ticket. If you are going to see it, there is nudity and profanity, you have to be 18 to get in and of an open mind or you won't like it. Book your tickets as far out as possible (I think you can do it via there website or call their box office) and spend as much as you can afford, you'll be glad you did. Food, service, tv selection at ESPN was actually very good. I'd stay there again but I'd rather try somewhere else first.

Reviews.Title: “Not to be missed!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: cara16
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in august 2004 and still talking about it! Checked in at airport in las vegas which was very convenient. My boyfriend had a broken ankle and was on crutches. Our room was upgraded - apparently the room type we had booked was full but I really think the receptionist was more sympathetic to my boyfriend's misfortune! The shuttle bus driver radioed ahead for a wheelchair on arrival which was so considerate and my boyfriend was allowed free use of the wheelchair for 24 hrs. Our "upgraded" room was fantastic - we had a jacuzzi right there in the hotel room! The hotel's location is brilliant - right at the top of the strip. The food and entertainment in the hotel was great, something to suit everyone's pocket. We were able to rent out the wheelchair for the remainder of our stay which was a real plus in the humidity of Las Vegas. The hotel and staff are brilliant and it's great value for money. I can't recommend a stay here highly enough!

Reviews.Title: “New York New York is a winner with me”
Reviews.Author: vacationsalot
Reviews.Content: I would like to say, New York, New York is the best service you will get in Las Vegas, NV. Great people, Great room, Free upgrades for no reason. Clean rooms, great atmosphere. You should definalty stay there, or at least make sure to see it. Good luck with your Las Vegas hotel hunt!!!

Reviews.Title: “An absolute must!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at NY NY on our most recent visit to Vegas. This was by far the best hotel we have stayed at. On our previous visits to Vegas we stayed at Paris LV, Bellmont, Riveria, & one time on Freemont street just for the experience. Food was exceptional (mexican yummy). Club was fun. Service was outstanding. Location is great! We were given a room immediately upon checking in (10:00 a.m.), our room was clean and quiet (rooms in Paris were not sound proof). The hotel is exceptionaly clean. We did specify that we would like a room away from the Roller coaster to avoid the noise (the room overlooked a parking garage with very limited view which was alright as I need my sleep). We didn't win anything on the slots but I haven't during any of my visits to Vegas. I absolutely love this place. Next visit -- the Sahara.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good....”
Reviews.Author: apple_pie_guy
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed in the Empire Tower for 4 nights. Not bad stay, room was clean, though was alitte dark at times, due to low wattage bulbs. Was travelling on business and went to use 'High Speed Internet' service for $10.99/24hrs....well it was everything but high speed!!!! Only purchased it for one day. Not only was it slow, but the cable connection came from the back of the TV cabinet, which wouldn't reach the desk. I know that most people are not thinking of high speed access but more on the shows and gambling of Vegas, but when you are travelling on business and for the number of trade shows & conferences that the city hosts, it would help. Would definitely stay again. ps. Make sure you have comfortable shoes for walking, you will do lots of it.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible service..poor interaction from management”
Reviews.Author: s029jmm
Reviews.Content: Problems started from the beginning, front desk booked us into smoking rooms after I made it very clear before our arrival and at the desk that we needed non-smoking due to allergies. The 3rd night, I requested the beds to be changed over since we accidently left the door sign on the previous day. Late night housekeeping took 45 minutes to deliver sheets..they wouldnt change the bedding but they would give these to us. I told the housekeeping manager (that is what she called herself, but she lacked any management skill) and she told me that they were understaffed and didnt have time to deal with our problem. She did tell us that we were welcome to use the new sheets and change our own bed. The next day we had a 1PM checkout time but housekeeping knocked and keyed in twice before 8:30 AM!

Reviews.Title: “From New York and Loved it.”
Reviews.Author: Valerie1948
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel in August because of an e-mail promotion. (79.00 plus two for one breakfast and free drinks at their bar) I have to say that I loved the hotel. The rooms were beautiful and the casino gave me some playing time which is all I ask for. Was comped three meals there. I would have given it an excellent review except for checkout which was very confusing for the staff. Would definitely stay there again. I have been to Vegas 12 times and aside from the Venetian, was one of the best hotels. Being from New York it definitely looked like Manhattan. Incredible. Don't miss the Zumanity show. 85.00 ticket when you book directly from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at NYNY 2/2 through 2/6. Checkin was easy, (we did it at the airport MGM desk) If you can do it there...do it. Checkin lines at hotel look long. Overall stay was pretty good. Room was nice and clean but there was a constant odd smell in the bathroom coming from the sink, but nothing major. Valet parking was better here than most of the other hotels we valet parked at (fast and friendly). We tended to go elseware for enterrainment though. Not really a selection of clubs here. (but who just stays in there hotel anyway) Caters to all age groups. Would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The Vegas”
Reviews.Author: princessj96
Reviews.Content: After a long drive from LA it was nice to see the bright lights of LV on the horizon, and it was also nice to have plenty of parking spaces on the same level as the hotel entrance! Thought it was a bit odd having to walk through the casino with cases but all the same it meant that you couldn't wait to get stuck into them slot machines! The check-in was fast, was a bit taken back when she gave me a map on how to get to the lifts! The walk from lifts to room was long but I didn't mind. The room was spacey with everything you needed to make you feel comfortable, the jacuzzi in the room was great and you couldn't hear a thing from rooms on either side meaning you can use the jacuzzi at 3am if you wanted to (we did!). If your like me and base a hotel on the bathroom, then dont worry this bathroom was great, clean and spacious. We had a great view on the strip & rollercoster, was especially great at night when all the lights were on and the bed was so comfortable. The casino its self was a good size, very well laid with all the shops restaurants and bars you didn't really have to go out at all. All in all I have no complaints about this hotel, it was a great two days in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Vegas!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Vegas, Jan. 21- 24, and we loved New York New York Hotel. The casino is different than all the others, you can only see so many slot machines. The food was good at all the restaurants. Although the bars, big apple and times square, weren't for 20- year olds, mostly older crowds in there. And expensive, only get free drinks while playing the nickel slots. And use a concierge service such as vegashotspots.com. They get you into any club with cover included as well as lime transportation. They can also get you into a vip section at any club of your choice. Really recommend Rain and ghostbar.

Reviews.Title: “New York New York Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in New York New York hotel bcos they were offering 2 SPA tickets. When we went to the SPA, it is nothing more then bunch of bathrooms. I was so shocked after seeing the SPA. How difficult is that to maintain a SPA? There is a small souna, 2 bathroom and a sitting room...thats it. Sinks were not clean at all. I guess they had one SPA and they built a wall to seprate them between men and women. So both SPA has differnt things. I guess thats why they do not have a picture of their SPA on any website. Anyways...it SUCKS....if anybody is looking for staying in New York New York bcos they are offering 2 SPA (worth of 40$?????) you better change your mind.

Reviews.Title: “Get what you pay for.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the NY NY from 1/23 to the 27th. I guess you get what you pay for. I got a really good on-line deal. Upon check-in I was asked to "upgrade" (for a cost) to a bigger room. For $25.00 extra a night I could of had a bigger room or for $60.00 a night I could of had a Jacuzzi suite. I turned them down and got my Tower Room on the 12th floor. When I was handed my key card I was informed I had two queens but I had booked a king bed. I was informed that a king was "not guaranteed". That was the first I had heard of that. I should of pressed the point - but I was tired from travel. My room had a huge dark stain on the carpet, the shower dripped, the tub didn't drain properly, so you were standing in water when you showered. The wardrobe doors didn't close tight, so the automatic light was on unless you proped the doors shut. Even though I tipped the maids, two days in a row I was left without washcloths (I must not of tipped them enough). The first time we called down and after 12 rings, called again, 15 rings later we contacted housekeeping to have wash clothes brought up. We didn't bother the second time. The first night the rollercoaster was loud, but it didn't bother me that much - it sounded like thunder. Then it was shut down for the rest of the week. But considering the price - the experiance wasn't that horrid. I just expected more. The rest of the attractions in the hotel seemed very over priced. As for staff - it was pretty non-existant. Next time I'll pay the price and stay at an upper scale hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay and play”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were at NYNY 21-24 January. The room we had was a Park Avenue Deluxe on the 16th floor. We had the king size bed. The bed was extremely comfortable. The room was small but nice for the weekend. We were near the beginning of the roller coaster and I couldn't hear it at all. Service was great. People were very nice. Lots of stuff going on during the weekend. We went in to check out Coyote Ugly before they started charging to get in. There were lots of people there by 8:00 ready to have fun.

Reviews.Title: “NYNY was very entertaining and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: ejmma
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at NYNY Dec. 22-26, 2004. We bought the Irresistible Package, the lady at the front desk gave us extra coupons for the RollerCoaster and she added coupons for hotdogs and alcohol. The exterior of this hotel was probably one of the most beautifully designed hotel. We've never been to NYNY, this hotel gave us a taste of what it might look like. The Park Avenue Deluxe room did seem a little small, but very comfortable. Our bed was nice a firm. Pillows very fluffy. Bathroom very nicely decorated, bigger than the average hotel bathroom. The shower had a nice gentle all-over stream to it, I found it relaxing. The room had self-control heater and air conditioner. The TV had about 25-30 channels with WebTV, PPV, and view your room bill. The staff through out the hotel was very nice and accomodating. PUBS AT NYNY: At Coyote Ugly, it is a very small bar - standing room only! No tables or chairs to sit to casually enjoy the atmosphere. In my experience there, I got tired of standing and found my energy drain, we just left, as other customers did. The Big Apple, very nice for casual drinking. However, the bar staff didn't seem to personal or in the mood to work, they didn't smile or chit-chat. The bar has a stage performance each night, we enjoyed that. The Timesquare! A very entertaining crowd-pleasing bar. We enjoyed the duelling pianos. The performers bring the crowd in to sing, yell, participate, all in playing your favourite tunes for a price. Very very enjoyable. Arrive early to grab a table. ROLLERCOASTER: My husband went on this rollercoaster, he found it very uncomfortable and a rough ride, he found his head hit the side pads a lot. This rollercoaster is rated in the top-10 of USA, my husband strongly disagreed, as he is a rollercoaster ride enthusiast. NATHANS HOTDOGS: a part of our free coupons...blahhh! The taste of these famous NYNY hotdogs were very very bland. If these are really NYNY and USA's favourite hotdogs, OMG! Please come to Canada and try our juicy-meaty hotdogs. RITA RUDNER SHOW: OMG! Rita was absolutely hilarious! She had my husband and I laughing from beginning to end! A must see show, while you are in LV. Our tummies were sore the next day from all the hard laughing! CASINO: We didn't gamble that much, we might have spent $20 in slots and $40 in BJ. We played mainly the .05 cent slots, lost what we put in instantly. A staff member later shared that the .05 are the biggest revenue earners of all the casino games, I can see that being true. HOTEL SURROUNDINGS: NYNY is connected, by way of pedestrian bridges to 3 other hotels. MGM, Tropicanna, and I forgot the other one. MGM is a very well decorated hotel, it offered more shopping and fast-food restuarants. You can connect to the monorail at MGM, to hit the other end of the strip. Across the street from NYNY is a Denny's restuarant, M&M store, Coke Cola store, a kid-amusement arcade park. Would we stay there again? Ya I think so, the price was very very reasonable compared to other strip big-attractive strip hotels. We also might consider MGM Grand.

Reviews.Title: “Will be back!”
Reviews.Author: K-Train007
Reviews.Content: Myself and 3 girlfriends stayed here 11th - 15th November 2004 and loved every minute of our stay. We had a room on the 12th floor and it was more than could be expected for the price we paid - we were impressed. Would definitely recommend the Irish bar - they serve Stella but it's nothing like ours! The entertainment in the Big Apple bar is definitely worth going to see - the group there were fantastic. We ate in the hotel restaurants and had no complaints - the food was fine. It was one big party for us as we made the most of the 4 days we had but we managed to see a lot of the other hotels and of course we took the helicopter ride to the Canyon - well worth the money. We also got round a few of the shopping malls and made the most of buying clothes up to half price cheaper than they are here in the UK. I would have no hesitation to stay here again and hope to do so in the future.

Reviews.Title: “not spectacular but not bad”
Reviews.Author: cynic
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 2 night stay at the NYNY. We got an internet deal that included a free upgrade to a Park Avenue room, spa passes, 2-for1 Il Fornaio patio breakfasts (which is pretty good but stops serving breakfast at 10:30 AM), $10 match play, and roller coaster passes. Check-in at the airport was fast and easy. We received a 28th floor non-smoking, 2 queen room in the Chrysler tower. Getting to the room from the main entrance was kinda a hassle because our elevators were on the opposite side of the casino from the front near the Zumanity entrance, but that also meant that we had a side exit right by our elevators that was really convenient when you wanted to walk to the other casinos. You just can't catch a shuttle or a taxi there or easily get to the pedestrian bridge to MGM. Also, it didn't seem like any of the rooms were that far away from the elevator because each tower had it's own. The elevators were also very fast. The layout of the NYNY did seem to be even more confusing than the average Las Vegas casino and was kinda cramped and not well marked. The room itself was on the smallish side but nice and clean. There was none of that smoky smell you sometimes get even in non-smoking rooms. We never once heard the roller coaster that a lot of people are complaining about. We did, however, hear our neighbors cell phone conversation loud and clear because the walls are very thin. Oddly enough, we only ever heard him when he was on his cell, so maybe he just talks excessively loudly. The airconditioner worked, but it seemed like it made the side of the room that it was on cold while the other side remained stuffy so it was hard to settle on a setting that everyone would like. The armoire was fairly small and there was no other place to put your clothes. The bathroom was marble-tiled with a shower/tub with a sliding door and was very clean though also small. Unfortunately, the shower pressure left much to be desired. The maid service seemed good, though I was annoyed when she woke me up at 9am after partying all night to see if she could clean the room. I guess I should have used a Do Not Disturb sign. Also, if you want your sheets changed you have to make sure to leave that card on the bed otherwise they'll just make the bed. The rest of the hotel was adequate. My friend really enjoyed the spa and her massage. The quick service food places were just passable, but I did enjoy the Il Fornaio breakfast. We didn't go to either of the bars, but one with the dueling pianos was usually packed at night. Instead of spending most of our time in the NYNY, we ending up going to some other casinos to eat or club. The location of NYNY was really good for that. It shares a pedestrian bridge with the MGM which has some great restaurants and clubs and you can catch the monorail there. We also didn't think the walk to the Bellagio was that bad. All in all, I'd stay there again if it was a good deal, but I think that next time I'll try the MGM which seemed nicer.

Reviews.Title: “What's with the elevator stink?”
Reviews.Author: svenology
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed Jan. 7 through 9. After checking in we went to the elevators and noticed a sewer smell that stayed there the entire stay at both elevator banks and in the elevators themselves. Not a huge deal but it sets a tone. Went up to our room and it hadn't been cleaned yet. Went back down and got a new room. Other than that I found the food decent and the people nice. The slots are tight and we had better luck at other casinos. Coyote Ugly was fun if only to watch the not-so-fit female patrons dance on the bar. With so many hotels to choose from we'll try something different next time. Hopefully stank-free.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Time at New Years”
Reviews.Author: Mark_London
Reviews.Content: Visted the NYNY from Dec 28th to Jan 1st. They upgraded us upon arrival to a Broadway Deluxe room. We were on the 37th floor in the Empire Tower with views of the strip. The room was much larger than normal as it was a corner room and adapted for wheelchair users. We were pleased with the room, though they need to remodel. When we arrived in Vegas the rain poured down like I've never seen it (and I'm from England!) By 2am the rain was so strong that water started to penetrate the windows of the room. We called the front desk at about 3am and maintenance came up to the room and dried the carpets. They didnt have another room to move us to, so gave us a $25 room credit instead. Apart from this one incident, we had a great stay. The slots were tight and we ended up going over to the MGM where I won $2000 on a top dollar slot. Would definitely stay at the NYNY again.

Reviews.Title: “Would never stay again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed four nights beginning 30 Dec 04. Customer service was non existent. Paid over $400 plus a night and the towels looked liked they were used at a car wash. I specifically asked if they had a health club. They do but its $20 a day and it closes at 7:00 pm. To access the $10.99 a day high speed internet is inconvenient. The cable comes out of the back of the TV and it doesn't reach the desk. You have to sit in a chair with your lap top in front of the TV. We were constantly given bad information about restaurants and times they were opened. Would absolutely never consider staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time”
Reviews.Author: hitraveler76
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the New York New York for three days in December. It was our second time in Las Vegas. The first time we stayed at Harrah's and it was nice, but NYNY was much more fun! Our room was big, the bathroom was enormous and we couldn't even the roller coaster right outside of our window. The use of a card key to operate the elevator is annoying and half of the time ours didn't even work. The roller coaster is one of the best I've ever been on. Nathan's reminded my husband of his native New York, although the rest of the place didn't really. He LOVED the Bar at Times Square and the dueling pianos, could have spent all night every night there! NYNY definitely gets my approval, I'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “worst night out of 150 in vegas”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: went weekend before Chirstmas for an alleged 4 nights. Have stayed in Suites before and had no porblems. They gave us a much smaller suite and it was at the end end of the hall. There only one elavator section and it was not close. I tried to up or down grade room and on this slow weekend they would not help. I talked to at least 4 supervisors. Finally we switched to the Rio for the next three nights and actually got a better deal. I was suprised of the we don't care about our customers additude.

Reviews.Title: “Very good overall”
Reviews.Author: John-L24
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last year on Business (not for the gambling). Good sized rooms, well furnished, tho slight noise from the roller coaster. All in all, very acceptable considering the incredibly low cost of the room. Irish bar is very good, the steak restaurant is excellent. Didn't bother with any of the buffet type places. Staff extremely helpful when your correspondent became temporarily disoriented after too many margarita's! The only real issues I had were the continual hassle from "working girls" when returning to my room late at night (after 2:00AM) and the somewhat gloomy atmosphere in the lobby area in the mornings.

Reviews.Title: “Very satisfied”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay this past Monday thru Wednesday very much. Newly refurbished rooms were very nice and pretty roomy also. Very comfortable beds and THE BEST SHOWER EVER. Only complaint was that our room was a LONG way from the elevator, definitely ask for a room close to the elevator or get your walking shoes on. Check in and check out were very easy although we were there mid-week. Great place for the kids as it is central to a other hotels and attractions. Make sure to try the pizza place and deli here also.

Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: barbadosLondon
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Marquis room & it was GREAT....it,s the second time i,ve stayed at ny,ny and i shall do so again...........FANTASTIC STAFF & no win me a car in your face.......THANKS GUYS

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ericm315
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at the airport, we had a very easy check in before we even arrived at the hotel (Very good option)..Take advantage of this. When we arrived at New York New York, I asked for a room upgrade, and was told by a female clerk "We do not give any free upgrades"!! I was suprised, and decided to go spend my money at other casino's since the hotel could not upgrade me on an "off" week. But otherthan that, the hotel is amazing, lt has lots of restaurants to choose from. The roller coaster is fun and very scary. Lots to do for children, with a giant gameroom, bumper cars, laser tag, etc. Get your walking shoes on, because you will do lots of walking on the strip. The other hotels are interesting to walk through. Go on the Eiffel Tower at Paris, very nice view of the strip and mountains. Took trip to Red Rock, booked through New York New York, very nice trip, definetely recommended. The guide "Adam" was pleasant, informative, and great to be around. Had a massage at the spa, which was nice. I will return to New York New York the next time I go to Las Vegas, hopefully they will upgrade me if I go again.

Reviews.Title: “NYNY is awesome”
Reviews.Author: PASSPORTSTAMPS
Reviews.Content: i have stayed here 4 times..awesome location..nice casino..espn sportszone..stayed in players suite with 2 queen beds/hottub/2tvs/view of mountains...definitely perfect for anyone..if you are a guy you will love it no matter what...coyote ugly is small but a lot of hot women...you cant go wrong at this hotel..

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Before booking we reviewed Trip Advisor and were unsure of what to expect but after arriving we experienced nothing but the most pleasant and helpful staff we have ever experienced and everything and more of what we hoped to enjoy on our stay. It is very reasonably priced for a good Strip hotel and is centrally located for access to the other hotels and attractions and we will indeed stay there from now on. FYI: Do not miss Red Rock Canyon (20 miles) and at a minimum go on the scenic drive and if the weather (and your body) allows, go on a few of the trails. You cannot imagine that this tranquil and completely natural beauty is located 1/2 hour from surreal Las Vegas with all of the hustling and bustling that goes on.

Reviews.Title: “NY NY Hotel & Casino”
Reviews.Author: jowenm
Reviews.Content: I had already booked the NY NY via EXPEDIA.. (whole other review), but then began receiving very inticing emails from NYNY. So I figured the $25 cancellation fee would be worth it, so I decided to take advantage of the specials.. There were two internet only special (one sent in an email, and an other on the webstie), when I clicked on the link in the email- the booking engine was not calculating the refrenced special,.. ) so I decided to use the special on the website itself.. it referenced a $79 Per night charge (including free upgrade of your room) as well daily passes and other 'bonuses'. The calender dates was the 'portal' into the special, and when I clicked on my check in date, it provided room choices.. all the same price.. (can I pick any one at this point???) and the price was $5.00 more .. (taxes???) - and my confirmation made no reference to the bonuses.. I had to call to confirm I had actually gotten this special... I called and they couldn't explain the difference in price, just saying the package may not have been available. but they did ensure I got the correct room (to reflect the 'upgrade') I checked in at the airport.. here's a hint.. check in first then go get you luggage.. it's quick and easy.. so convienent. It is down on the luggage claim area.. all the way to the right. The room was nice.. really nothing to complain about. We were on the 34th floor, so the roller coaster was no issue, but the helicopters 'buzzing' the Statue of Liberty were a bit distracting. We had a great view- looked down on the statue. I had to go to the check in desk to get my passes. The B1G1F breakfast was still expensive... too fancy for a breakfast.. I didn't get to ride the roller coaster, but the passes are good til the end of next year.. so next time.. The elevator, required you to swipe your card to pick a floor. Both my husband and my's room key wasn't too effective at this. There was time.. the elevator actually started to ascend stopped at 30- someone got on, and then we all rode down to the lobby together.. pretty frustrating. The casino was tight.. didn't win at all on the slots. Had better luck elsewhere. Went across the street - to see LaFemme @ MGM Grand- be sure to tell them you are staying at NYNY if you are paying for the tickets. you get $10 off. This show was okay.. a little 'spacey' for me.. The opening scene of Rockette-like dancers nearly naked.. not just topless, marching with large bearskin (think Castle Guards) and boots.. kind of 'artsy'. but it is the Art of Nudity Excellent chorography.. The premise is this is an exact replica fo the Crazy Horse in France (then why isn't this show at the Paris?) .. Saw We Will Rock You @ the Paris- OUTSTANDING.. if you are from the generation that grew up on Queen... (graduating high school in the mid-to late 80's) You absolutely must see this show.. it was worth every cent. I live in NY and have never left a Broadway show saying "I wanna see that again!". I will see this again but next time I have to sit in the back row- so I can dance.. I just wanted to dance and sing.. it was so amazing.. really. Sat in the Killer Queen section.. excelletn. They had some 'creative' changes to lyrics updating to be more technological sound in the new millenium, but other than that AMAZING.

Reviews.Title: “The greatest city in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Starcaster9
Reviews.Content: I arrived exhausted to the great NYNY at 1:45 am on Sunday 11/21/04. I didn't know where to find the check-in desk so I asked one of the casino floor walkers and she very kindly directed me where to find it. The woman working at the front desk was ULTRA helpful, very sweet and courteous. She gave me all kinds of information and useful tips, ect. She even gave me a few extra goodies to go with the package I purchased online! Thank you, thank you! The room was totally wonderful! Very contemporary and it had a great view. The bathroom was very swanky and they gave you lotion, shampoo, conditioner and mouthwash! Handy dandy, indeed! The view was spectacular as well! Right across from the MGM grand and the strip was almost fully visable. The room was quiet and just GREAT! Don't worry too much about the noise from the rollercoaster (which is quite a ride!!!) -- unless you go to sleep at 6:00 pm then it MIGHT be a problem. There were food options a plenty and the wait staff at all of them were prompt and pleasant. The Cirque Du Soleil show was great! The music was out of this world and the acts were hot and steamy! (To make it even better, I won enough money to get the most expensive seat with ONE spin on a $.50 Wheel of Fortune slot machine! Also, the cashiers in the casino were always busy but each time I went to cash in my winnings (I won almost $400 in one day) they did it with a smile, wished me luck and told me to have a good day). The show rocked the house! I would see it again and again. If you ask for a room far from the elevator, it will be quite far from the elevator! I requested one of these rooms and next time I will not do that. It was a fairly good hike each time. My only complaint is about the FOUR DOLLAR room service delivery fee. The prices on the menu were quite high without it! But the pizza I ordered was excellent and it lasted me almost three whole days. One other small complaint -- I went two days without having my room cleaned. I did stay in my room in the morning, until about 9:30 and when I got back at almost 5, my room was still not cleaned. I don't mind a whole lot, because they have 2,024 rooms to clean but it was less service than I'd expected. In all the stay was a 9.8/10. Great prices for a major strip casino, especially with the extras I got booking online. I just can't wait to return to the NYNY with my entire family next time! Thank you so much!

Reviews.Title: “pretty good choice...”
Reviews.Author: ambi
Reviews.Content: While I had a good time at NYNY during my stay earlier this month,I really didnt feel that it compared to TI for example-which is in a similar price range. Room were small but nicely set out.The heavy glaze and fairly small window makes it a bit claustrophobic but who really stays in their hotel room much anyway:) The staff were all really kind and helpful.ESPN zone and the piano bar are awesome. The one thing that really annoyed me about this hotel was the casino.Its so hard to navigate and the atmosphere doesnt really do much except encourage you to leave.Which luckily enough is easy due to the fantastic location! I stand by the fact that for the price-you would be better off with TI- but this is still a good choice and a fun vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Had the best time ever~~”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I loved NYNY I just got back and we cannot wait till we can go again. We played in the casino quite a bit as well as the other properties on the players card. We had 4 out of our 5 nights comped as well as meals.. and we did play but not that much. The hotel was very clean and friendly. Zumanity wasnt that good for the price not worth it.. food was excellent and a 24 hr Starbucks is awsome. We will be going back next year ...forsure!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews about NY-NY, I was somewhat skepitical about staying at this hotel. I was very pleasantly surprised with a quick check in, clear instructions to the elevator and my room, not to mention a spectacular view. Room was immaculate and was cleaned every day. Would recommend this hotel and casino to anyone travelling to Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “"1st Time stay and happy"”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a stay at New York-New York and I can't see why some people to complain about this Hotel. Apart for when we booked into the Hotel at 1.30am, to find they didn't have a 3 bed room available, when everything had been confrimed 2 months in advance, they certainly fixed it up the next day. We stayed for 1 week and had a great experience We had a view of the strip on the 14th floor and this was was really great. The staff were very helpful and the rooms were very clean and kept clean everyday. I highly recommend this Hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Class Act all the Way!”
Reviews.Author: DJ_here
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Las Vegas stay at New York New York. Arrived at noon, checked in with no waiting in line. Hotel stay was part of an Expedia.ca package so standard room expected. At check in I mentioned I would like a room, high up with a view of the strip. No problem, received an upgraded room on the 30th floor, no additional charge. That level of customer service was abundant throughout our stay. Casino hosts, retail staff, service staff, every NYNY staff person we encountered gave us 100% plus service and attention. Our room was extremely clean and well appointed. The beds were very comfortable. Housekeeping service was prompt and excellent. In room safe. Never had to wait for elevators and security was high. Food and service was great at America and Il Fornaio restaurants, as well as misc. "Village Eateries" we tried. More than enough choices for everyone. All public and retail areas were very clean and well presented. Had no problems finding my way around in the hotel but can be confusing if you do not pay attention to the layout. Overheard other guest complaining about getting around within the hotel. Check out the dueling pianos in the Bar at Times Square, not to be missed. Signed up for their "casino" card and was pleasantly surprised at the value this was. Only played the slots and 90% of play was on the quarter slots. They were hot! Comps were great considering I only acquired about 1400 points. Didn't have to use my gambling budget this visit, my NYNY winnings carried me for slot play in all the other casinos I visited. The Casino was well ventilated, not nearly as smokey as others. Drink service was top-notch, a small tip the first time guaranteed frequent service wherever I moved about in the casino. Lots of change booths available. Ashtrays and areas around the slots were kept clean, never encountered litter left behind anywhere during my visit. Looking forward to the next visit to this hotel and casino.

Reviews.Title: “Las Vegas New York, New York Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GerryandFred
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at New York, New York from Monday, Oct 25, 2004 to Friday, Oct 29, 2004. We were a little leery about staying there after reading some of the reviews but when offered 2 free nights we decided to stay there. From the moment we checked in at the VIP counter to when we left everything was great. The employees were very friendly and helpful. Our room was large and very clean. The maid, casino dealers, wait staff, drink hostesses and every one else could not have been friendlier. We also ate our evening meals at the restaurants and ate lunch at the casino food court. Every meal was enjoyable. We are looking forward to staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great 2nd time around!”
Reviews.Author: meathwoman
Reviews.Content: I stayed at NYNY before, and this time around was just a good. We had a room on the 17th floor (I had asked for a Strip view and was accommodated) in the Crysler Tower. The only problem was that we used the pool alot and it took about 10-15 mins to walk from our room down to the pool area. I would definately ask for a room near the pool next time. The pool area is nice, but can get cramped and crowded in the afternoon we had a hard time getting sun chairs. The atmosphere is nice and relaxing with music in the background. The Irish pub is fun and the food there is lovely we ate there 2 nights. Checkout was a little slow but that is because we had to check out at 6am (to get a helicopter flight to the Grand Canyon) and there was only one girl on the check out desk. Apart from that would definately stay at the hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Experience”
Reviews.Author: Chellejaya
Reviews.Content: This hotel was so much fun. I had a great time on the Manhatton Rollercoaster in my wedding dress. Rooms are huge (we were lucky to have booked a Jacuzzi suite... its a must), clean and the most fantastic views. I loved every minute.

Reviews.Title: “Cool enough!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great atmosphere! Room size was very nice. Nice choice of restaurants. Staff was very friendly. The Bar at Times Square was a blast (dueling piano's)- much better than Coyote Ugly! Easy enough to get elsewhere if you desire - avg cab is $8-10. Would stay there again. Roller coaster can be annoying if you plan on staying in your room all day!! It ends about 10-11 P.M. way before most people get back to their rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Cold hotel.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I expected a lot more of this hotel. I felt it was too cold, without a true personality. The rollercoaster rumbles your room, which are small and unkind. Stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “NY NY is great!”
Reviews.Author: hppyphntm
Reviews.Content: Ive stayed at NY NY the last two times I was in Vegas, its a great place, rooms are clean and a pretty good size for Vegas, the elevators are confusing at first but after a while you get the hang of them, The casino is great, the atmosphere there is so fun. I ate at Nine Fine Irishmen and Chin-Chin and both of the were awesome, NY NY was an all around great experience for me both times.

Reviews.Title: “good but not excellent!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hey, we've stayed in lots of 1st class hotels in all over the globe. The NYNY is good but not excellent! The casino is the best in Vegas as far as atmosphere and design! Slots are all the same, all over! We got an upgrade to the PArk Avenue Rooms at the top level of the New York Tower, which was really cool, cause you could see Vegas (not the Strip) at night from the 34th floor through huge windows..... hehe.... Room was big but little equipment, small TV, nice marvel floor and bath. Valet service was slow..... We had a Vette, that should go faster. Don't bother to visit the Coyote Ugly Bar unless you really want to pay 10 bucks to see girls (not the ones on the posters) standing on a bar...... no! Location is cool, but you have a car anyways! Stayed there and enjoyed it, but the we stayed in the Venetian..... THAT is Excellent! Ben&Laura

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Very impressed with NY NY. It was my first time staying at this hotel, but my husband is a frequent visitor to Las Vegas and prefers NY NY above others. Our room was a 4th floor suite and was very spacious, clean, comfortable and had a jacuzzi. We utulized room service 3 days in a row for breakfast and received our meals quickly each time. Food was excellent. Had several spa treatments - including the swedish massage and body cuisine with John, a NY NY facial with Terri and a spray on tan with Sarah - all superb and very relaxing. One complaint, the Regis hair salon could use improvement. I had a manicure and pedicure and was highly disappointed - the salon was unclean, very small and not relaxing at all. I was stuck in a backroom with no ambiance at all. Had dinner at Fornaio and Gallaghers - both meals were exceptional. Will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Best in Las vegas”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I go to las vegas three times a year have stayed at many resorts but N.Y N.Y is the best by far and I will stay there from now on until something better comes along.

Reviews.Title: “Good bars but stay next door”
Reviews.Author: Beth502
Reviews.Content: Just got back from the NY-NY. On the plus side the casino staff were nice and friendly and the cocktails and beers kept coming just for tips even when playing the 1c slots! The Nine fine irishman pub had good bands and an excellent atmosphere and the bar at times square with its dualling pianos and drunken sing songs was a good laugh. The room we had was nice but we stayed at the excaliber last year and the room was just as good but about half the price. The pool doesnt get the sun until the afternoon and the roller coaster is a bit of a rip off at $12.95 a go (even if youre staying there!). When the casino got busy the minimum bets all went up and we couldnt find anything for less than $10 a hand. I would suggest staying at the Excaliber which is right next door and connected by a walk way and using the bars in the NY-NY. Youll save yourself some money, get the same standard of room and can still enjoy the facilities that the NY-NY has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Okay for what I paid”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at New York-New York 20-24 September. I had received an offer for theHotel at the Mandalay Bay and my father had received an offer at New York-New York. I booked my room at theHotel and gave it to him while I took his room at New York-New York. There is no comparison between the two hotels in amenities, size and decor of the rooms, the layout and decor of the casinos, and other features, but, of course, the rate at theHotel was about twice as high as the rate at New York-New York. For the $69 per night that I paid at New York-New York I can't complain. The room did remind me more of a motel room than a hotel room, but it was clean. As other reviewers have mentioned, I found the room rather dark, and that would have been a problem had I been in the room more to read or watch TV. On the plus side, I found the assortment of bath products very good, particularly the soaps. Other positives include vibrant, fun feel of the casino. One striking negative was that I found that it was very confusing to find the elevators to the rooms from the casino. I would find myself wandering aimlessly at times looking for them. You need landmarks to find landmarks. This should be noted especially for elderly visitors. Would I stay here again? I doubt it because there are so many hotels in LV that I still would like to try. With a good rate, maybe, I suppose. But that rate of $69 per night was just about what New York-New York is worth.

Reviews.Title: “nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: ATC-ZOB
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the NYNY hotel from 9/28/04 to 10/02/04 and stayed in one of the newly remodeled Broadway rooms. Very nice, neutral colors and seemed larger than average. 27" flat screen tv, plenty of closet and drawer space and the bathroom has also been remodeled. Tub now has a glass door enclosure instead of a cheap curtain. Ate at Nine Fine Irishman and that wasn't much to write about but the America Cafe has good food at a reasonable price and Gonzaley & Gonzaley was excellent also. Went to see Rita Rudner and she was worth the money too. Very funny and fresh material. Great time!!

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely go back to New York New York”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Have just got back from a 5 night stay at New York New York and had a wonderful time. That was my first time in Vegas but I would definitely go back and quite happily stay at NY NY again. Check in was quick and easy and the receptionist was very friendly. The rooms were spacious and tidy and cleaned everyday but to be honest we didn't spend a great deal of time in them. Loved the Nine Fine Irishman bar and went to Coyote Ugly one night but was a bit disappointed as it wasn't the greatest atmosphere. Had a wonderful meal at PF Changs in the Aladdin. It was really nice to sit outside on the balcony overlooking the strip. I would definitely recommend going to the Ghost bar at Palms, the view from the balcony was amazing as long as you are not afraid of heights!!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Stay”
Reviews.Author: eldercruser
Reviews.Content: We stayed in one of the renovated Park View rooms in mid-September. Very comfortable and quiet. We found hotel employees to be very pleasant and helpful - much more so than previous visits. Breakfast at the Il Fornaio terrace restaurant was excellent. Plenty of room at the pool as well.

Reviews.Title: “All that sparkle...a little frustrating.”
Reviews.Author: bmam
Reviews.Content: After an eye opening drive along the strip, finding a park and getting through reception we were ready to find our room, unpack and have a drink! Whoops.....our rooms were wrong. Wrong type of rooms and miles away from each other. Back down to reception with all our luggage for a new room. Ah...that was better a gorgeous king bed in a Park Avenue room. Fantastic view from the rooms and very comfortable. New York New York had great facilities and you could spend hours just looking around and enjoying the New York streets. Went to MGM Grand Buffet for breakfast.....fantastic! Aladdin for Buffet Dinner too which was also sensational!

Reviews.Title: “loved the new rok new york”
Reviews.Author: mofo_phill
Reviews.Content: awesome time....great location, clean rooms, fun casino...not one bad thing to say! would definetly go back.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: First of all, we are not first time Las Vegas visitors. I was very disappointed in the front desk service in this day of customer service orientation. There was a terrible odor at the "short end" of the pool and the music is targeted towards a different age group than the majority of those at the pool ( very annoying). There should be a timer added to the in-room T.V., along with the air conditioning unit being loud and rattling. The casino area should add "street signs" like all others, to indicate the locations or directions toward attractions, shops etc. We had late departure time and I had contacted the Hotel several times re: the possibilty of extended hours. I was given more than a glimmer of hope, only to find that morning, I was out on the street at 11:00am awaiting a 11:00pm departure.

Reviews.Title: “great air in new york”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: we were booked in the cancun resort las vegas (see review) and left despite being offered a free room. (told them to give it to the homeless) and we went to the new york. the room was a decent rate a great room (w/jacuzzi) the staff friendly. The best part was the gaming tables were avail. and drinks were replaced before they were empty. we went to a wedding at the luxor and visited several other casinos all were smokey and we could not wait each day to get back to the new york... the place has the best climate and air inside of everywhere we went. *we went to the excalibur and couldn't get a drink for 2 hours of gaming despite the pitboss trying too. the lady at the jewelry store ignored my wife and the cashier told us everyone was napping. my wife and her girlfriend agreed we would ONLY stay at the New York next time. although the two girls I was with did think we should have been comp'd because every table we sat at would soon become alive and full of people.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the NY NY for five nights August 22-29. The rate I got on the internet (directly on the hotel website) was fabulous at $79/nt which included several bonuses (a free ride on the roller coaster, spa passes, one room upgrade and 2 for 1 meals). When we checked in the front desk person was nice and cordial but when they warn you that the room may be a little far from the elevator listen to them! It was at least a two and a half minute walk from the elevator to our room! At the end of the day that's the last thing my feet needed!!! The room was okay (Park Avenue deluxe). Nothing special-and small. Last year we stayed in the Aladin where the rooms were big enough to be called suites! Also, the room is very dark (dark decor). Houskeeping was good-the housekeeping manager was a lovely woman that was very nice about getting me extra soaps (that smelled great)...etc. (shout out to her!) Now on to the pool...the pool area isn't very large but more than that it's very noisy with loud music and NOT really relaxing. The roller coaster goes right nearby and you CONSTANTLY hear the roller coaster and people screaming on it. Other than that I didn't hear the roller coaster from our room as other ppl complained about but it was annoying at the pool area. The location of the hotel is so-so. It's a little further down the strip (across from the MGM) and it's a little bit of a walk if you're walking say to the Venetian or the Bellagio. All in all, there were positive parts to the hotel-the valets were helpful and nice. They have a great system where they scan your car in and you just scan your ticket when you need your car to be brought up. It's up in mere minutes (as opposed to other hotels where you can wait for 20+ minutes to get your car); also, if you are taking a day trip to any of the parks or Grand Canyon the valet has a printed paper with directions to most of these places (just remember to ask them for it!) Being from New York we really got a kick out of the different parts of New York portrayed. And I think that kids would really like this hotel. All in all, I can't complain with the great rate we got but I wouldn't stay here again as there are much nicer and less crowded/noisier hotels on the strip. (The reason we didn't stay in the Aladin again was because I had heard they were changing ownership and didn't want to stay somewhere like that in case of a problem I felt I would have had no recourse.)

Reviews.Title: “loved new york new york!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: just return from the new york new york and i must say me and my wife really enjoyed it!! this was our first time to las vegas and hopefully not our last time!! the hotel is very nice and is in a good location!! all the anemities were nice and all the restaurants were very good with a lot of variety!! i really like to watch sports and the espn zone bar & restaurant is really nice and the food there is good!! i think it has something like 165 tvs inside it!!! we also liked the nine fine irishmen bar & restaurant!! it had a realistic ireland theme to it and they have live bands every night that play good irish music!!! like i said before the property is in a great location, mgm is across the street, the luxor & excalibur are across the street too!! the bellagio resort is a few minutes up the street and they put on a great show in front with the water show! i would highly recommend this place to anyone!!! all the newer hotels in vegas are very very nice, if we do go back we will try another hotel out because they all have so much to offer!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful vacation place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at NYNY from 8/17 thru 8/22 and celebrated our 25th anniversay there. The room was beautiful, the staff was great. We ate at all the restaurants and were very satisfied [especially Galaghers Steak House]. would do it again in a heartbeat!!!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid it like the plague”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We didn't stay here, but after visiting the casino and one of their shows I never will. The casino staff was scarce, not helpful and down right rude at times. Very inexperienced personel running the place. If gamin I'd recommend either the Bellagio or the Paris Zumanity: An ok show but not even worth the $65 we paid for the cabaret seats which aren't bad at all. You'll only miss a brief amount of the show sitting here and save a ton of $. The ushers were horrible and were congregating and talking the back of the theatre creating a huge distraction for those sitting in the rear of the show. The rooms are pricey and I doubt they are as nice as the rooms at the Paris where we stayed. Avoid the NY NY

Reviews.Title: “New York New York was great”
Reviews.Author: jenninmoline
Reviews.Content: Would've stayed longer at NY if we could have! Great hotel with COMFORTABLE rooms...bed was all comfort and the towels were the softest of any hotel I have ever been to. Excellent staff..very attentive... We stayed on weekdays when the price was $79 per night...I would not pay the $179 for weekends.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room, Bad Food”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just returned from NY NY Las vegas and I had a great time. Our room was absolutely beautiful. We had the deluxe jacuzzi suite and everything about it was great. The bed was so comfortable and the pillows were very nice. I was a little nervous because I read complaints about the roller coaster but I hardly ever heard it. Some advice, dont eat at the fast food thai place or the hot dog place next to it. Both were really gross. Everything else was perfect. Try Diego's if you like authentic mexican. Its a new restaurant at the MGM.

Reviews.Title: “Much better places to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I'm from L.A. and I go to Vegas 10 times a year. This was my first and last time at NYNY. It's much too noisy and the food was horrible. The place is just too crowded and the rooms are so dark that you can't read in them.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Birthday Stay NYNY Style!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Zion13
Reviews.Content: Stayed at NYNY Aug. 10-13, 2004. Was disappointed I couldnt use the airport check-in (arrived too early) but the line at the hotel was very quick. The Jacuzzi room we had was beautiful, spacious and immaculate. No noise whatsoever. The airconditioner never really got cold enough but this was easily overlooked.
