First time Ive actually lost money in Vegas but I knew the slots and Video Poker were tight ahead of time. Drinks were swift and served with a smile (much thanks to Sweet Lydia!!!!). Chin Chins was good but not great and the ESPN Zone food is seriously overpriced and just average. Only bad point would have to be their insistence on no late check-outs. You cant even pay an extra fee. Most hotels have no problems with it or will give it as a comp. But got engaged on my Bday so I will have fond memories of NYNY. Next stop will be Ceasars.....

Reviews.Title: “enjoyed the stay here”
Reviews.Author: choogirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights and we really enjoyed it. We had never been to vegas before and it was strange entering the hotel and finding yourself straight in a casino but the check in only took a few minutes. We had the rollarcoaster going by our room but we never heard it once. The room was very clean-the only thing that we didnt like was that the pool wasnt deep at all and we were really looking forward to going swimming. It was good value for the price

Reviews.Title: “Don't even bother”
Reviews.Author: Canadianknowitall
Reviews.Content: We were curious to stay here as the last time we came to Vegas we played here one afternoon and had a lot of fun. Our play generated an invitation to stay two complimentary nights so we decided to give it a try. Poor fools we.When we checked in the clerk could not have been more disinterested in his job. Once giving us the keys we spent ten minutes figuring out where our tower was. After asking three people we finally figured it out. Once inside our room we heard a rushing noise and screams.Staring at us through the hotel window was a fully operational roller coaster that flew past with people on it screaming their heads off. I called the front desk who informed us that the coaster did not shut down until midnight. I didn't bother asking what time it began at as I demanded that we be moved to another room immediately or we would check out. We were given a suite on a much higher floor which was very nice and out of sight and sound of the crazy coaster. What we didn't count on was the busy traffic in the hallway outside at all hours of the night with people banging their doors as they came in or left. We were there on a saturday night and the place is truly deafening. We couldn't wait to check out the next day and move to the Bellagio, which was superb (and heavenly quiet) as usual.

Reviews.Title: “Great way to celebrate a special occassion!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful 40th birthday. We stayed at the New York New York and traveled to the different casino's along the strip and downtown. I highly recommend the New York New York to anyone. The price was reasonable and far cleaner than others we visited. We wen to Gallagher's restraunt for my birthday celebration and it appeared to be a little spendy, but the amount of food given more than made up for it. Two could eat off of one meal. The New York New York was the only casino we won any money at each night. Zumanity was a kick. We also went to the Comedy Improv at Harrah's and laughed until we cried. This was my first experience in Las Vegas. I have nothing but good to say......I can't wait to do it again!!

Reviews.Title: “BEST TIME IN VEGAS WINNING $2950”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: 3 friends and I stood at the NYNY from aug 2-6. We are all 21 and had the time of our lives. Upon check-in we got upgraded 2 levels for free. Our room was immacualte and clean, with incrdible views of the mountains and other nearby hotels. The rollercoaster was also visible from the window, which was kind of cool. Whoever complains about noise from the rollercoaster, must have ears of an eagle because we could not hear it AT ALL!! Considering I won $2950 playing craps, ( see Maria, very nice sitcklady), and my other buddy won $600 with the 2 ladies breaking even, we did very well. The room was thoroughly cleaned everyday, with new linens and towels, soaps, lotions, etc. All in all, this was a perfect hotel, with great service, and perhaps one of the most comfortable casinos (along with PARIS). We were comp'ed rooms for our next trip to Vegas, and we will be def. coming here every year from now on.

Reviews.Title: “HAD A GREAT TIME AT NY NY!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We didn't stay at the NY NY because of the reviews we heard of on how loud it is due to the roller coaster. We did visit about 5 times during our visit. This looks so much like New York. We also went with friends, who enjoyed it too. The food was good. We had the best soft pretzels we ever had. That is a must do. There is something for everyone here at NY NY. Our teen aged daughter and her friends liked the arcade. They also liked the rollercoaster, and thought that was neat. Everone working there was so kind. Can't wait to come back!

Reviews.Title: “Best Gaming and Great Rooms!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at NY-NY about ten times over the past two years, and we haven't been disappointed yet! If something isn't to your liking, ask for it to be changed. They have always done their best to please. Our room was large, with two queen size beds, a spa tub, and sitting area with a couch and two chairs. The view from our multiple windows looked toward the Monte Carlo, the desert, and down the strip towards the fountains at Bellagio. Each day our rooms were promptly cleaned, and the hotel even arranged for us to see Elton John's performance at Caesar's. But the best part was the gaming....Sat down at a dollar slot machine when I first arrived, and hit a $1,000 jackpot within my first three pulls. Each day we had good luck, and as we were leaving the casino to go the airport, played a quarter machine and hit $1,500 on the way out. Don't leave without eating at Il Fornaio, and Chin-Chins. Excellent food, great atmosphere, wonderful time. We LOVE NY-NY.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading all the bad reviews I was kind of nervous upon staying at the New York New York. But boy those people were wrong!! The New York New York was a great hotel for the entire family. From China Town to Little Italy there are tons of great restuarants and shops just like in New York City. The entire second floor is modeled after Conney Island and has numerous games for teens and kids. When we got there we were upgraded and our room was wonderful. Two queen beds, a big tv, a huge bathroom, and a view of the pool and the beautiful mountains. I have to admit that it is a long walk to the Venetian but its not that bad. Just make sure you wear the right shoes. Because we were guests at the hotel we recieved free rides on the roller coaster, money for gambelling, free tickets to the Fashion outlets, and a free day at the spa. You can not beat that. I would definitely come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights. Could not believe how SMALL the rooms are. There are only 2 drawers to put your clothes in. Had to leave my clothes in my suitcase the entire trip. Hotel is extremely noisey. I know that you're in Vegas, but in the past we have always stayed at the Mirage and that's were I intend on staying from now on. The casino is very dark and dreary. It did have a New York effect, however very depressing. You cannot compare this place to the Mirage. Would never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “New York New York Casino”
Reviews.Author: Ontarion
Reviews.Content: Went to Las Vegas July 5-9. 2004. First time we booked with Expedia, but not first time in Las Vegas. Flight went without a hitch. Flew into McCarran International airport (not the charter airport) Unfortunately arrived at the casino at 3 am our time so I asked for a quiet room. We got a large double-queen-sized room on the fifth floor -- it was quite a walk from the elevators....anything above 7th floor needed your room key card to operate the elevator. The pool area was small, with the pool being VERY shallow (3-4 feet). Eating in the casino was expensive ($33 US for a steak dinner at Galagher's), although hubby said that a hamburger was reasonable. Went to Zumanity (Mystere was better). July is their summer months and it was hot -- but dry (so drank lots of bottled water) -- loved the weather, but a hat and sunscreen were needed. Went to a time-share presentation and wasted a 1/2 day, but got something to eat and a 'free' show (Steve Wyrick's magic at Aladin) -- the theatre for Steve Wyrick was TERRIBLE, we could not see, but Steve used the audience in many of his magic performances. I had more trouble finding the room/tower than I had getting around the casino. Spent lots of money (which we expected) on gambling and won some back. All in all it was a great trip -- but I hated the travelling times. The monorails will be operational soon, but it will cost. We were quite entertained by the driver on the trolley, but it is a bumpy, noisy ride. Las Vegas is always changing, so there were additions since we were last there

Reviews.Title: “Next best thing”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews, I was a bit anxious about our upcoming 6-night stay at the hotel. We stayed on the fifth floor in the New York New York tower, with full exposure to the roller coaster. We could hear it occassionally, but it was not as noisy as some of the other postings lead you to believe. As for the rollercoaster riders - we did not hear any screaming. In general, the room was very nice and the bed was comfortable! The food was good, but the service was just so-so and sometimes it was pretty slow. There definitely was some attitude at the front desk. Unfortunately, you have to be persistent to get anything changed. But all-in-all, it was a lot of fun and we enjoyed the pool and the gambling.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy New York, New York Hotel & Casino!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at New York, New York hotel and casino and have to say we were extremely disappointed. Our biggest complaint was that with the roller coaster that circles their hotel and past the guest rooms it is EXTREMELY noisy. Starting early in the morning until late at night you hear vibrating and noise like a train, then swoosh, then screams every 5 minutes!! Right past our room!! We couldn't get any rest on our vacation and asked to be moved. The customer service manager was less than co-operative but finally moved us to a room that was actually worse. Not only did it still have the roller coater noise but because of the dance club across the street at MGM we had rap music and bass shaking the room until 4:30am every night. It literally sounded like the person next door was having a huge party. When we explained this to the manager she was extremely rude and said she wasn't moving us again and if we didn't like it we could leave the hotel. After speaking with other staff it seems customer service is frustrated dealing with the noise complaints all the time because of the poorly built hotel. I have been to Las Vegas 12 times and have never had any problems at any of the other hotels with noise ever. Stay at a different hotel. There are so many MUCH nicer ones to choose from!!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT TIME !!!”
Reviews.Author: pwr1658
Reviews.Content: Love it !! I stayed at NY NY July 12-16 & had a great time. After reading some of the reviews I was not sure how things would go, but all went fine. I used the airport check-in & it saved a lot of time. Had a room on 27th floor looking at the strip & airport. Food was good at all the hotel restaurants I tried & service was good also. Also tried the Monorail. Was a great way to get a round in the summer heat . I got the day pass so I could get off & on as much as I wanted from morning till midnight. Got more done in one day then I did all week !!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved NY NY!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading mixed reviews about this hotel, I was a bit reluctant to stay at NY NY. We arrived on Wednesday evening before the July 4th weekend. There was no line to check in. We requested that our room be high up and we were on the 21st floor of the Century tower in a Park Avenue room (which we requested). The room was right near the elevator which was good. The room was really nice. It had modern decor with marble bath room and entry way. The king size bed was comfortable and so was the pollows (which you got extra in the closet). I see what they say about the lighting but they are committed to saving energy and so they gradually get brighter the longer you leave them on. I personally think that's neat. The vanity could have been a bit larger to store all your toiletries. There was enough closet space and drawer space for all our clothes and shoes. Although we didn't watch TV hardly the channels available were not that great. It could have had MTV, HBO, or something like that. The view was of the north end of the strip (Excalibur, Luxor, and Mandalay Bay). You could barely hear the roller coaster. When we did sleep it was like babies. Dinner choices were great. We ate at Gallager's steak house. I had the fillet mingon and my husband had the prime rib. He said it was the best he's had. I though mine was excellent. We had steaks and split a large side of lenaise potatoes and a desert and our bill came to $86. It was WELL worth it. The other choices for dinner looked good although we didn't eat there. There is an Italian place and a Mexican place. Informal choices were pizza, hot dogs, hamburgers, and the Fulton Fish Fry had excellent fish and chips (yum). The casino was a bit small compared to some hotels but it was big enough for us. We played a lot of $5 black jack and I played the $5 roulette. Our luck was on and off. The hotel has two convienient walkways to the MGM and to the Excalibur. We took the one to Excalibur often to get to the Luxor. The Luxor has a good poker room which we played at a lot. We never had to wait for maid service, our room was always cleaned. We didn't have to ask for anything except a wake up call which was right on time. When you call the front desk they automatically know your name which makes you feel important. For check out they have a convienant express check out on the TV and a drop box for keys by the elevators. This is only if you leave a credit card for incidentals. Over all I really enjoyed the hotel and would stay there again. I think when people arrive on busy days like Friday or Saturday they have to expect a line at check in. Also, it's Vegas and it brings out the crazy in people and so if you hear some people being loud and crazy in the hotel then you can't expect anything less.

Reviews.Title: “Just an average place- Don't expect much!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: There are much nicer places to stay in L.V. for the same money. I was a bit disappointed because I used priceline and got stuck for $145 night when I could have called the hotel direct and paid less. The room was small and lighting is terrible if you are a reader. T.V. selection was also limited. I checked in at the airport and found it helpful in order to avoid long lines. The staff at the front desk did help out with directions to places we wanted to go. I signed up for the players club and spent about 5-6 hours on the tables- I was only given a comp of 9.93 which may buy a coffee and roll. I have had better gambling comps in Reno not to mention the Blackjack payout is only 3 to 2 for single deck. It was a very average place to stay and the hotel doesn't go out of the way to try and keep the guests in their hotel to gamble. Drink service at the tables was very slow. It wouldn't be a place that I would go back to.

Reviews.Title: “A great experience....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The 2nd part of our recent US trip saw us driving the long 9 hours from San Francisco to Las Vegas. We had booked the NY NY this time having spent a large proportion of our time there in 2002, previously we had stayed at the excellent Luxor. Once again we were a little concerned having read a number of negative reviews on this website, but in the end we worried for nothing. This was an excellent experience and one I would recommend to anyone going to Vegas. The check in was completely hassle free which was a good thing after such a long car journey. The front desk staff were helpful and advised us accordingly of lift locations etc. We also got an excellent colour map of the hotel, which we were extremely grateful for on a number of "lost" occasions. We arrived in our room slightly confused and hassled by looking for room 404 in New Yorker Tower and finding room 404 was in Empire State. We thought we were in the wrong tower, however having checked with a member of housekeeping we were informed otherwise. A little confusing but not a major problem. Room was large, with an excellent king size bed. The bathroom area was superb, spotlessly clean and a nice size. There were lots of towels, face cloths etc. We looked out on the strip, albeit with a roller coaster blocking some of it. We didn't really hear the roller coaster at all unlike a lot of reviews on here. As for the ride, too bumpy but worth a go. As for the hotel itself, it really is one fun experience. The food options are excellent ESPN, Gonzalez y Gozalez and the 24 hour America are all very good. We also sampled the craic in Nine Fine Irishmen although we didn't eat there (wish we had the food looked divine). We won big on the 25c slots, came away with wins of $180 and $360. I found the slots quite loose and certainly came away up from our gambling experiences. Yes, NY NY is a little crowded, but so are most of the Vegas hotels. Take your time and wander around, is there really any rush? Only real problem during the whole 7 nights were that the repairs to our air con (a little under-powered) and safe (still locked from previous occupant) were not done as requested.Apart from that I couldn't fault the NY NY at all and would certainly consider a return trip in the future.

Reviews.Title: “High Expectations”
Reviews.Author: gailrick
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the New York New York hotel from the 10th - 14th June 2004. I have very high expectations of hotels as I work in a 5 star hotel, of a very big worldwide hotel chain. I was not sure what to expect after reading a lot of negative comments on your site. We arrived at 2.00pm on a Tuesday afternoon, and there was a very small wait to check in. We found the receptionist to be very pleasant, polite and professional. We were given a room in the Empire State Building on the 39th floor. Our room overlooked the strip and the rollercoaster. We found the room to be very spacious and clean. We could hear the noise from the rollercoaster, but no big deal or bother to us. The four nights we stayed were amazing, the room was cleaned immaculately every day. The restaurants we ate at were excellent, great service (with a smile) and very tasty food. To us the whole hotel was of a top standard, the location excellent, and all staff I dealt with were very professional, I could not fault anything in the hotel. We have decided to go back to Vegas again next year, even though we have to come all the way from New Zealand, and we will definately be staying at the New York New York again. Gail and Rick Curwood. New Zealand

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from New York New York and were sadly disappointed. I would never, ever stay there again and would highly remcommend that you not waste your money. The desk clerk was so disinterested and bored it was like pulling teeth to get any information out of her. She asked if I would like to keep a credit card open for charges to the room and I said no as we generally pay cash for everything-however they had our credit card information as we did charge the room to the card. She falied to inform me that without the imprint of the card the PHONE WOULD NOT DIAL OUT NOR WOULD THE TV WORK. (Cheap, cheap, cheap). We were there on business as well as pleasure and after several failed attempts to connect my laptop I called the front desk to report my phone was unable to dial out. A recording answered the front desk phone and I was kept on hold for over 15 minutes. The front desk clerk was also short and curt. I also reported that our air conditioner seemed to be not working. Our travel alarm has a thermometer on it and the room never went below 84 degrees the entire three days we were there. He informed me that was the correct temperature. We were quite uncomfortable at times-especially at night. The room itself was dirty. The trash had not been emptied when we arrived and there was food and drinks left in the ice maker from the previous guests. (There is an ice maker under the counter in the bathroom. It opens inches away from the side of the toilet. You must put the ice bucket or glass right up next to the toilet in order to fill it with ice...most unappealing.) Our bed had a hole in the sheet the size of a quarter. When I attempted to place the card on the bed asking for new sheets I had to pry it off the nightstand, as it was stuck there by some goo that originated heaven knows where. We stayed in a Broadway Suite. The size of the room was fine but overall, our stay there was most unpleasant. We go to Vegas at least twice a year and we have never been unhappy with any of our accomodations. We always stay on the strip but none of our favorite places were available when I was trying to make reservations. Everyone was sold out but we had tickets for a concert. I should have been suspiciouis when NYNY was the only place with rooms available.

Reviews.Title: “No Problemo”
Reviews.Author: Dublin18Calling
Reviews.Content: From 27 April to May 4 I stayed at NYNY & I am very glad I did. Had thought of going to the Nugget for about 300 dollars less but boy I am glad I picked NYNY. The Nugget is 4 to 5 miles down the road from the middle of the strip & there is no way you would walk it in 90 degree heat plus saved on bus/taxis. Checked in at Airport to avoid possible queues. Finding correct room was a slight problem as you have to walk through casino to get to the lifts. My only complaint is that the lighting in the room was not adequate but this was not enough to give 4 instead of 5 star rating. The maid who cleaned the spotless room+bathroom (from the Phillipines) was a real lady. I gave tip+kiss like a real Irishman would. Because of the heat I only had 1 meal a day & lost 10 to 12 pounds in 7 days. Drank a lot of water - go to Excalibur for breakfast but be aware that trying to find your way out from Excalibur to NYNY is very difficult even though it is next door - there are no signs to it. If you are going to gamble my advice is DO NOT. I do gamble here in Ireland but soon found out the truth here in VegasThe odds are stacked MASSIVELY in favour of the house. Only saw one guy winning anything of consequence. Go to shows+hotels instead. Best Shows I saw were Mamma Mia(went x2), Tom Jones, Lord of the Dance & Rat Pack Tribute - worst value were Mystere & Bottoms Up. You have not lived until you go to Vegas. I will probably stay in MGM next time but only because I like variety. NYNY will not let you down & people upset by noise from the Roller Coaster must be one step from the grave lol.

Reviews.Title: “How suite it is!”
Reviews.Author: VesperGirl
Reviews.Content: I checked in really late and got a free upgrade to a suite. Had the works- living area, dining area, jacuzzi, bose system, free minibar etc... was totally spoiled. The hotel itself is very nice, lots of food choices, very crowded every night, so be patient or go elsewhere for food. The roller coaster was sort of annoying, but got use to it... Wasn't that close to the hotel rooms, but you could still hear it. Then again, all of vegas is noisey and you really don't go there to 'relax'... just drink and gamble!

Reviews.Title: “NYNY - Impressive!”
Reviews.Author: vineweevil
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the NYNY for 5 nights (May 6th-10th). The exterior of the hotel is quite impressive and having been to New York city itself was suprised at the quality of the statue of liberty reproduction. We forgot to use the check-in service at the airport, but there was no Queue to speak of at hotel check-in. (Arrived 3:00 on Thursday. The room was reasonably large which was unexpected after reading reviews and looked as though it had been recently refurbished in a very modern style. The bed was very comfortable and the maid service was good. The eateries were in a themed 'village' setting and there was a fair choice, my only complaint here was that the layout was a little confusing (Maybe this was planned!), as was the casino layout - after staying there for five days we still hadn't got our sense of barings. The tables and slots area had a friendly atmosphere and we still managed to find $5 blackjack tables on the weekend, which could not be said of many casino's. Finally the location I felt was great. There may have been a bit more atmosphere outside the casino's further down the strip, but I actually found a wee bit of peace and quiet where we were, also made good use of walkways to Excalibur and MGM. Would definatley go back.

Reviews.Title: “Plesantly surprised after reading bad reviews!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a great stay at NY NY! I had read all of the reviews on trip advisor before coming and can say I was very nervous! Let me first say that we arrived on a Sunday and stayed 4 nights. It may make a difference if you stay during the week. When we arrived at the casino we were happy to see there were few people in the check in line. We waited not even 5 minutes. One thing I was worried about was our room we reserved. I had read one review that they give you first available and do not honor your reservation. This proved to be true! We had reserved a skyline king. We were with a group of people and all wanted to be on the same floor. We did not end up with a king bed but two doubles. This was ok though because we got a broadway deluxe room for the same price as the smaller skyline rooms. I did not complain because we were on the same floor as our friends. The roller coaster was right outside our window but I never heard it. It only runs to 11pm at night. If you are in Vegas and you are in your room before 11pm your missing the parties before they even begin! Sure they do not have coffee pots in the rooms but there are about four different places to get coffee in the morning. If you go to Vegas you should expect to pay for everything! The pool was smaller but very nice. We were there every day. It opens at 10 am but does not get full sun until around 12 noon. You can rent a cabana for $100.00 a day. Before you say how expensive that is let me tell you what is included! The cabana has a changing room, tv, refrigerator (stocked with juices, pop, ice water), fruit basket (enough fruit for 12 people), all the chips, pretzels you want, ice bucket, towels, lounge chairs and rafts for the pool. We had four couples, everyone had a chair. It cost us $25 per couple. The rafts alone were $7.50 by them self. I think it was worth it for the money you would have spent on food and pop. We ate at Gallagers Steak house. It is very much worth it for the money you spend there. It was they best prime rib I have ever had! The piano bar is way to small but very entertaining. If you plan on going arrive a couple hours ahead to get a seat. The slots were tight but aren't they everywhere? The casino is smaller than average but very cool with outside atmosphere feel. We had great dealers and everyone in our group did well. We did not have to wait to sit at a table at any time. Remember we were there during the week. We all got to sit and play together also. ( 4 girls ) The drink service was outstanding! Did not wait too long on drinks. I think they cater more to the tables then the slots. You do get better service when you tip. I tip I learned was that you can order doubles if you get mixed drinks. I have been to Vegas many times and this was the first time I did not want to leave our hotel and casino. We had an excellent time and would stay there again!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “New York in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: buffgirl73
Reviews.Content: For myself and my husband this is a perfect marriage our two favourite US cities mixed together! The NY NY is definitely not the most plush of the hotels (Bellagio anyone?) and not the most bling (Venitian) but we felt really at home. It's a great 4 star with all the amenties that you would expect from one. Although the casino is not the biggest it seemed to have some of the best slots and they kept us amused for hours!! The NY influence seemed to be pretty spot on (albeit the touristy side) and the staff were friendly and courteous. The food was great and not too pricey and we loved Coyote Ugly (I know it's cliched but that's what Vegas is all about isn't it?). All in all we were sad to leave and are going back again this year, I did like the look of the Venetian and the rooms look fab but I felt really at home in the NY NY so we can't see any reason to change.

Reviews.Title: “Pot-luck with the rooms but other than that a good choice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The problem with all the theme Vegas hotels is that they are all so vast and impersonal, and New York New York is no exception. If you can get over that, the place is quite enjoyable.Good points - Great choice of food and drink places within the hotel / casino itself- Casino has a less "stiff-necked" feel to it than in many similar hotels- Staff were generally friendly - for example, arranged free repair of a pair of glasses- Furniture in rooms was OKBad points- One of the rooms our party stayed in was right by an air-con unit on a roof and was quite noisy- Rooms need a little bit of redecorating - the same room above had some graffiti- The Mexican restaurant on the grounds is poorSee how far under rack rate you can get and make sure you check the room you're getting, two of ours were great, one poor - other than that it's recommended, and the rollercoaster is fantastic, if pricey.

Reviews.Title: “Everything here was reasonable.....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I found nothing to be outstanding about NY NY hotel. However, the general atmosphere of the place was good, the staff were average ( not great but not bad either) The food was ok for typical american fare. The location of the hotel on the strip wasnt bad (the walk to the Bellagio hotel is a little further than you think) I would have preferred to stay a little more north, around the mirage, harrahs, caesers palace etc... The size of our room was a pleasant suprise but our view was dissapointing, nothing but roof and rollercoaster, and the room lighting got no better than 'dim' making reading or writing very difficult. All in all it was satisfactory for your buck.

Reviews.Title: “9 Fine Irishmen WAY overpriced and toooo noisy”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We went to the pub Nine Fine Irishmen expecting something special after reading about it. We were sadly disappointed to say the least. The music was ear-shattering for such a small place and the food was way over-priced. Fish and chips was $17.99 and that's all you got.....some french fries and 2 small pieces of mediocre fish. You can get the same thing in the Fulton Fish Market in the food area of the casino for $5.99. I bet it's just as good and probably better. I had the $24.99 rib eye steak. Got a piece of meat and a potato.....nothing else. Waitress didn't even bring bread until after we reminded her 3 times. Service was noticeably poor. The food certainly wasn't worth the price they were charging. I've been an Irish music fan for 25 years and never heard such awful noise in my life! You had to actually scream to say anything to your partner. And they never took a break the whole time we were there. We were also stashed into a back table with no view of anything or anyone. I wouldn't recommend Nine Fine Irishmen to anyone. There are better and cheaper places to go.The whole of NYNY was too crowded, too noisy with the roller coaster screaming by every few minutes. I wouldn't stay there, EVER!

Reviews.Title: “NYNY for Business? Naaaah!”
Reviews.Author: marais
Reviews.Content: Had to attend a business conference there. It started at the convenient airport check-in: "I have to work, do you have a room away from the roller coaster?" "Oh yes, I have a high-floor room for you." What I got was a room on the 23rd floor directly across from the peak of the first incline of the roller coaster...every 5 minutes, screams. During one conference call I held the phone up to the window to share the experience. The room was not well lit, basic furnishings with no desk, had to pull the table over to the TV because that was where the wired broadband cable was. The greatest sin of all: NO in-room coffee! I was trudging through the casino at 3AM (6AM my time zone) to the outrageously priced Starbucks for my wake-up potion. Actually, it was not hard to keep to my Eastern time zone schedule because in the adjoining room a group of energetic young guys held a daily party from 2AM to 6AM. (For their sake, the morning of my departure I thoughtfully set my clock radio to loud Tejano music and alarm for 10AM.) I got in a long line to enter the pool area, and once the pool opened, hardly a place to crash and cabanas cost $$. There were some plusses: room was clean (or seemed so in the dim light), bathroom very nice, several decent food outlets (the Mexican place in the food court gets special mention), and a few diversions for a non-gambler like the oxygen bar with back and scalp massage ($17 for 15 mins, including canula). Go here to party, get jazzed, don't sleep, have an exuberant time---but don't go here for business, and if you have to stay here for a conference, bring a coffeemaker and some earplugs.

Reviews.Title: “Too Crowded and Noisy for the price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was so excited about staying at NYNY, as I love the real NYNY! Their website made it look like such a nice and lavish hotel so I had no problem with the price of the rooms. I was disappointed when I got there. We paid for a jacuzzi suite. The room and bathroom were VERY nice and talk about clean! The problem was the plumbing. Everytime the neighbors turned on their shower, jacuzzi, or whatever we could hear it VERY LOUD right by our bed. It didn't help that they wanted to jacuzzi at about 3:00 every morning. And yes we could also hear the rollercoaster. The rooms are very dark and not lit well at all which drove me crazy, felt like I was in a cave. Other than those things I would give the room an A+. We did not want to change rooms due to the fact that we had already fully unpacked for 7 days before we realized the problem. The casino was really nice but to me just too packed to enjoy. Too many people. Every time a machine would have a "problem" and the light would come on, it would take forever for the attendant to come. Could not even think about getting into the bars. Did make it into coyote ugly which was a total joke. Absolutely nothing like the movie. No where to even sit. $10 cover charge to see some sleezy girls dancing on the bar. It was like a big room where they herded cattle into. The coyote ugly frozen drink bar outside of the actual bar itself was wonderful. Also the walkways going over the roads to the other hotels were VERY convenient. Restaurant variety had a lot to be desired. We ended up eating at the Monticarlo buffet every day. Very yummy! Entertainment at their back bars was satisfactory, but I would highly recommend the Aladdin for bar entertainment. Pool area was too small and shaded. I did write a letter to the management about my likes/dislikes and heard absolutely nothing back. Oh and also got a smoking room instead of non-smoking which I've heard happens a lot there. All in all I liked NYNY, but I will not be staying there again. More of a party place to visit and have fun at for a short while instead the place where you are actually staying. My next stay will be at the Monticarlo or Mandalay Bay for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Top of the Heap New York New York”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading some mixed reviews on Trip Advisor I was a little concerned about staying at New York New York. My concerns were for nothing--we LOVED it there. The staff was very friendly and helpful, the rooms were fine, the noise from the roller coaster was not a problem at all. The food from the village area was excellent and the restaurants were fantastic. I won quite a bit while gaming there and we LOVED the Zumanity show playing there. We can't wait to go back. The only problem we found was the pool area. It was a bit shady and small in comparison to the other hotels I've stayed at. But next time I'll know to go earlier or in the afternoon.

Reviews.Title: “good youthful atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My only complaint is that the pool is blocked from early morning sun by the hotel towers. I am sure it was to avoid road noise, or to keep it cooler in summer, but it is a bummer when I want to get up early and lay by the pool. Much too chilly in the early am of spring or fall. I love the rollercoaster, but I think a free ride should be included with your roomstay. I know I would pay to go again. The room had abit overwhelming decor, but it was all new and room was spacious. Didn't win a thing on the slots there, but if the price was good, or I was going with teenagers I'd go stay here again. Good activities for teens with the roller coaster and the chocolate tour accross the street as well as the midway at the excalibur nearby and some affordable eating areas.

Reviews.Title: “Liked NY,NY”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: First time to Las Vegas. Got a package deal that included staying at NY,NY. Hotel was very nice. Check in went fast and smooth. Once we got use to the crowds it was easy to find the Chrysler Bldg. where our room was located. As a matter of fact, my husband discovered if we came and went through the back door when we left the casino, we were right by our elevators and we didn't have to walk thru the crowds each time we came and went. The roller coaster was magnificent but we could not hear any noise from the coaster where our room was located. The room was very clean and nice. There was a card in the room that stated that our room would not have the bed linens changed each day during our stay unless we specifically ask for it (I bet a lot of people don't even notice this card). This is supposedly an environmental issue. We played the slots and did not win anything. The slots were tight. As a matter of fact, during our 2 day stay we gambled at many of the casinos slots and saw very few winners.

Reviews.Title: “Drink service in casino could use some improvement”
Reviews.Author: DavidHanna
Reviews.Content: First off, I want to emphasize that I have not stayed in this hotel; however, on my last trip to Las Vegas I did spend some time in the casino. I liked the decor of the casino at NYNY--it was fun, innovative, and memorable. However, the drink service leaves a lot to be desired. For example, my Dad played a 25-cent slot for about 1 and 1/2 hours and wasn't even offered a single drink. I found that rather annoying, particularly since he's a senior citizen. In contrast, when he played a .25-cent video poker machine at the Bellagio, the waitress couldn't bring drinks fast enough. For that matter, she even brought me at least three Coronas in an hour's time, and I wasn't even playing anything. NYNY might be able to learn a few things in customer service from the Bellagio, it seems, another MGM property.

Reviews.Title: “so so....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The place is ok....nothing special, the casino is an awkward layout, the pool and deck area is way to small for a hotel of this size., and the sports book area is ridiculously small. The mall area is mildy entertaining, the room is ok, but fo rthe same money, there aer much better options, mirage, MGM, TI, Aladdin, etc. Not bad for an evening out, but stay somewhere else unless you are geting a really cheap deal.

Reviews.Title: “Half-baked Big Apple”
Reviews.Author: timelvis
Reviews.Content: Staying at New York-New York is like getting this really neat package for your birthday that has elaborate wrapping and ribbons and bows, but when you open it up you find socks and underwear. Not fancy socks and underwear, either. Okay, I think the target market for New York-New York is probably under 25 and not looking for much in a hotel room other than a bed and bathtub. And that's about all the hotel offers, an uninspired room with no frills...no in-room coffee, no cable, no water pressure and (at least in my experience) limited housekeeping. After the second night there, they neglected to make up the room. When I called at 6 p.m. to request service, they assured me it would be taken care of. When I returned from dinner and gambling at 10:30 p.m., it still hadn't been cleaned. I gave up and settled in for the evening. At a quarter to midnight housekeeping called and asked if I still wanted my room made up. And avoid the overpriced spa. The masseuse talked through the entire massage. I came away from the massage more stressed than when I'd arrived. The pool is small, crowded and uninspired in a city that takes pride in elaborate pools and amenities. The roller coaster is a nice novelty until you've heard it scream by your window for the 20th time. Okay, I did like the casino. What imagination they neglected in designing the rooms, they made up for in the casino. And the Nine Fine Irishman restaurant and pub was amazing. The food and service were top notch. Overall, there are much nicer hotels in Las Vegas that offer value and amenities.

Reviews.Title: “The New York Reality Experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: First of all, I didn't stay here. It started out when we entered their parking garage to park our car. Security wanted to see ID from my friend, who was driving the car. Odd...no other parking garage required this. I wanted to express my disgust with the service my friends and I received at the America's Cafe at the NYNY. It was a late night restaurant where we ordered close to midnite. We were immediately seated, received our menus, and ordered our drinks. That was the good part. The part where it started to go downhill started with us ordering for our food. One of my friends wanted to exclude coleslaw from an order, but was curtly told that they don't exclude coleslaw from orders and if he didn't want to eat it, he didn't have to eat it. We thought nothing of it. My friend had ordered a well-done burger, my other friend ordered a hot dog, and I ordered a sandwich. Thirty minutes later, I inquired about our food. Our waiter had explained that because my friend had ordered a well-done burger, it takes time. Well, my other friend ordered a hot dog and I ordered a sandwich. Did that also require that the service take long for that? Well, it could have stopped there, but the waiter continued on. Our waiter decided to tell us that if we go to other restaurants, it will take just as long everywhere else. C'mon, our waiter could have given my other friend her food and mine first, and then my other friend his food. We immediately got up and told him we were leaving. He then said, "well go ahead then". We left. As soon as I left, I couldn't leave well enough alone, so I spoke to the manager. He apologized profusely for the service. We were so upset with the service, we went somewhere else. If this is what it's really like in New York City, then I don't want any part of it.

Reviews.Title: “NY, NY is a terrible casino!!!”
Reviews.Author: jdlieberman
Reviews.Content: Accomidations were quite comfortable. The casino is terrible. I had many problems with comps and they were not attended to properly. I would never recommend gambling in this casino.

Reviews.Title: “Should be called Bay Area Bay area...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here, BEWARE. Ask for a room AWAY from the roller coaster......i thought i was back home in the bay area and we were having an earthquake.....Not bad for 219.00 per night.....NOT. Room was small and cramped.....would not recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Ok but not great...would probably stay again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at NY, NY in December 2003 the week before Christmas. We stayed in a spa room in the Empire tower that we got on an awesome promotion over the internet. NY, NY is an ok hotel...it was pretty clean except for some nasty looking brownish black stuff on one of the window sills (looked like dried blood)...and the wallpaper above the windows was really falling off. The rest of the room was clean though. The room was very spacious and the hot tub was great! One thing that bothered us was that noise from the hallway sounded almost like it was in the room and you could hear people in neighboring rooms...water running, muffled voices, tv, etc. I don't gamble but my husband lost more money in the NY, NY casino than at any other casino in Vegas. He won nothing there at all...playing primarily slots...so gamble at your own risk. Overall NY, NY was ok and we would probably stay there again, but we have stayed in much nicer accomodations.

Reviews.Title: “Great if you like timeshare salespeople”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I thought this was a four star hotel. The room was nice and clean, but so are Super 8s. Had a nice view of the roof. Played in the consino for hours...PERKS?...no one even brought us drinks. The biggest complaint is they have timeshare salespeople by the elevators so you are harassed each time you atempt to go to or leave your room. HOW TACKY! Nice for kids, but if you are over 21 stay away.

Reviews.Title: “NewYork NewYork”
Reviews.Author: mads335
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last October for 6 nights. Never been to Las Vegas and upon arriving at the hotel was absolutely amazed!! No queue for check in, very quick. Room was located in the last building which was a bit of a trek of a walk to the room - and although the room wasn't quite upto to what the website said - however was still good quality. Great location , amazing casino's , shops, cafe's etc in the actual hotel. Pool was Ok, jacuzzi baths were boiling hot!!! Lack of a bar around the pool though.Good location, breakfast Ok, but other places better. Did quick checkout by dropping room key and card into box, glad we did as queue to check out was enormous. Overall may stay there again but would definitely go back to Vegas- FANTASTIC!!

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last April at the start of our Honeymoon. After a 27 hour journey actually to reach the hotel we arrived at 9pm to find a queue to check in. They said they would "upgrade" our room because it was our honeymoon (which had been pre arranged anyway by our travel agent!) The room we were given was HUGE but had a view of the parking lot and the a/c vents! As we were staying for a week we immediatly called the front desk for another room. They told us nothing was available for 4 hours. We just couldn't wait that long to sleep and went to bed. The next morning at about 5am we called them again requesting a room transfer they advised us to contact them after 4pm. I was not prepared to wait and went straight to the desk to ask for a room transfer. After a bit of humming and hawing the receptionist managed to get us a room on the 32nd floor which it has to be said was a fantastic alternative lokking right onto the strip. The rollercoaster (The Manhattan Express REALLY isn't a worry at all!) We did read reviews of trouble at the check in and our experience held this to be true. The rest of the stay was largely enjoyable. The walk with your cases at 9pm through a crowded noisey casino is a challenge! The pool is lovely but noisey because of the Roller coaster. The proximity to the other hotels around is great. We were a little dissapointed in the breakfast buffet served in the chinese restaurant, the breakfast at MGM was better.

Reviews.Title: “adorable hotel-great food 1-18-04 to 1-22-04”
Reviews.Author: sandrita
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Vegas. This hotel was so attractive. Felt like we were on a Disney themed property. Ck.- in was easy. Walk to elevator was long, but if you follow the outline on floor (like a sidewalk), you will not get lost. We had spacious jacuzzi suite and was done up in art deco style...not fancy but nice and very comfortable bed. No noise at all between walls. Bathroom was all marble in black, beige and white. Roller coaster outside was not bothersome at all. We loved the atmosphere at this hotel. Casino on ground floor has 3 story ceilings and you feel like you are in Central Park, with glittering trees all around you...very little smoke and not claustrophobic at all. Noise factor was very low too. Restaurant food was very good. It was hard to decide where to eat. We saw the Zumanity Show one night and it was just fantastic. I liked the fact that you could step outside and take sky bridge over to MGM Hotel very easily. We ate buffet breakfast over there, since NYNY does not have a buffet. I think NYNY is a great hotel for younger people...has great night life and has great urban feel. Seniors will find lobby confusing when tryting to get to elevators and rooms. It can be a long walk from your elevator to your room in many cases. Other than that, I would recommend it to any one. Great experience.

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: boolou
Reviews.Content: stayed jan 15-18. requested rooms nearby as i was traveling with my ellderly parent. staff were very helpful put us in adjoining rooms. graet rooms tight slots but it is vegas. highly recommend papillion helicopter LC-1 tour of the grand canyon

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous stay! Want to go back!!”
Reviews.Author: mrsg
Reviews.Content: Our third trip to Vegas, we stayed at NYNY. Got a great deal with air/hotel. Can't say enough good about the hotel. Such an ambiance - an air of fun, so much to do. Great location, too. Near everything. Were on the 21 floor and could see the first hill of the Manhattan Express roller coaster from our room. Very exciting. Ate at Il Fornaio and it was great. Even bought a recipe book of their breads! Slot attendants very helpful when I had a question. Stay there! You won't regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I would rate this a very nice hotel. The rooms we had were large and very clean. We had 8 guys down for the trip and they gave us two rooms which conected and two cots. The layout of the place can be a bit confusing and if you play poker this is not the hotel to do it at (they have only 3 card) - but no matter what everyone says, this hotel is on the strip (the front entrance is on a side street but the side entrance is on the strip and alows you to take in the sites and gamble everywhere. Not a very young crowd, but I think the walls were well insulated b/c we did not get a single complaint and there was some very loud mornings coming home. The food downstairs was a overpriced (but so is everything else in Vegas) and the lady at the pizza shop wouldnt sell us a pie at 3:02am b/c they stoped selling them at 3am - pretty silly but oh well. Definately take a walk down to the Belagio and take in the water show and then the buffet. Also fun, there is a Country Western bar in a hotel off the strip somewhere that has an electronic bull you can ride - if its your thing this place can be really fun - also they have a contest for women to ride the bull in their underwear - what a town. Enjoy, be careful crossong the streets and dont plan on staying for more than 3 days - it gets old and tiring. Solid hotel choice for the right rate.

Reviews.Title: “I highly recomend NY NY”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: New York,New York was fabulas. I will never stay anywhere else! Fun casino, wonderful atmosphere, clean room, and good service! You get a 20 on a 1 to 10 scale!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: It was a great stay. At night they had security to keep anyone who was not a guest out of the hotel part. Only bad thing was that the Century tower was very far from the elevator and the slots suck. VIVA LAS VEGAS

Reviews.Title: “FABULOUS NEW YORK NEW YORK”
Reviews.Author: TDBJR
Reviews.Content: We arrived to a fabulous room in one of the towers. There were only 4 rooms on our floor and we never saw or heard anyone. We had a great view overlooking the fountains at the Bellagio. The only problem was when we checked in very early in the morning on Dec. 26 they gave the impression they didn't have any rooms even though I had prepaid my reservation. They tried to give me a room with one bed but I insisted on what I reserved a two bedroom non-smoking and did eventually get that. Would stay here again. Enjoyed it tremendously.

Reviews.Title: “New York, New York Hotel (Las Vegas ) New Years Eve”
Reviews.Author: JohnLIrvine
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the Las Vegas main airport on Monday December 29th 2003. Was able to check in and get room keys for our stay at New York New York hotel right at the airport along with our round trip transportation for $12 pp., and we found no long lines or waits. As we were checking out of the casion/resort we found out it is necessary to call the transporation company direct to arrange for a pick up, as the casino does not do this even though they may imply that they do. The stay was very pleasant, room was a n/s king, very quiet (even on New Year's). We were on the 18th floor of which the entire floor was non smoking. Too bad the rest of the casino wasn't. We ate at 3 of in-house restaurants, all very good. Only down side is finding liquor to buy(by the bottle). Best selection (if any) was at the Excalibur across the street.

Reviews.Title: “great time in NYNY casino”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were having a great time in NYNY Hotel, from Dec 03 to 05, checking at the MGM counter LAS airport, get complimentary upgrade to Delux Broadway room due to 25-year wedding anniversary. The room is fairly large and clean. stayed at 34 floor had a fabulous view of sunset. In the morning at the Nathan's breakfast buffet for 2 for 1 coupon special, price is quite reasonable. Lunch portion was a little on the meager side after all the walking around the strip. Be sure to buy a $5.00 dollars 24 hours CAT bus pass to ride around the strip and downtown if you want to save some money. We also took a free tour/side trip to Laughlin and got free lunch buffet in Colorado Belle Casino. If you have one free day in Vegas, this trip does warrant it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Sub-Par Service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Quick and Dirty:Location: Excellent Rooms: Sufficient, Unless you plan on spending all your time in them Table Games: Average...most $10 min. Slots: Tight. Not the place for slot-only players Entertainment: Excellent Restaurants: Slightly better-than-average Drinks: $5.00 - $7.50 each Hospitality: Poor Comps: Like Pulling Teeth My Rating: 4.5 out of 10 My Advice: A Must-See, but don't stay there.Allow me to preface my remarks by saying that I will readily admit my wife and I are not by any stretch of the imagination what could be considered high rollers, nor do we expect to vacation in Las Vegas for free. However, we do expect that when we present a casino with an aggregate sum in excess of $7500 of combined wagering in blackjack, craps, and slot play over the course of 3½ days, the casino should be capable of accurately identifying and tracking our betting history, and should assume a proactive approach in acknowledging and rewarding its customers in exchange for a near-exclusive opportunity at winning their wagers.Although 80% of our gambling time was spent on table games, it appears as though the New York-New York had difficulty tracking our play. After three days of play, when we finally asked if it was possible to receive a comp for breakfast, we were told all comps were handled by the Players Club booth.The reception to our request at the Players Club booth was nothing less than insulting. Although we did ultimately receive an approximate $65 credit on our room bill, we were made to feel as though we were the groveling poor begging for alms we didnt deserve. The representatives conduct was arrogant and reprehensible. When we first asked if it was possible to receive a comp for our play, he asked condescendingly, Well, what did you have in mind? My wife looked at me and innocently asked, What are our options? Upon hearing her simple question, he theatrically rolled his eyes, threw his hands in the air, and proclaimed, Lady, a comp is a comp! What do you want? I wish I were exaggerating, but sadly I am not.So disenfranchised were we with the whole New York-New York experience that our last two days were spent paying taxi fare to conduct the remainder of our gambling downtown.I will close by saying that after only approximately 5 hours of blackjack play at a downtown casino my wife and I were graciously rewarded with free dinner passes, and near the end of our second day we were offered free lodging in the event we choose to stay there on our next tripand all of this provided without us needing to ask.The New York-New York is a nice Theme Hotel/Casino to visit, but do yourself a favor and stay/gamble somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Stay!!”
Reviews.Author: bigeasy41
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the NYNY for the first time a few weeks ago. It was a great place to stay. It was the perfect location as it is within walking distance to most of the casino hotels and priced moderately. The casino area with all of the restaurants and bars is our favorite as there seems to always be something exciting happening. Gallaghers has a great steak, and the ESPN SportsZone has some amazing appetizers. When we checked in we had to do a little room switching because we payed a little extra for a strip view but we couldn't see the strip because of the room location. They moved us immediately to a very nice room, albeit it was quite small. This was no issue as there was only two of us anyways. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Service/Overpriced Il Fornaio Cucin Restaurant”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: With reservations to see "Zumanity" at NYNY in August, 2003, we made dinner reservations two hours before at Il Fornaio, in the hotel. This was a bad choice. We were nearly late for the show after waiting for a table and then receiving one burned meal, which the waiter did not care to change. Only when the manager came was the dish redone. For the price, we were disappointed in the food and especially the service.

HotelInfo.Name: New York - New York Hotel and Casino
